Chapter 1170: Realms Connected and Transformed

During his 119th reincarnation, Heavenly Physician had told Li Fan, who was disguised as the successor of Heavenly Judgment, that upon reaching the Dao Integration realm, cultivation techniques became less important.

What truly mattered was the comprehension of world essence and the workings of the Heavenly Dao.

However, without the heaven-blessed talent of Mr. Bai or the Dharma-Preachers, how could an ordinary person like Li Fan comprehend such profound and abstruse Great Daos?

Even though Li Fan could indirectly understand them through continuous reincarnations, by borrowing the insights of the geniuses of the Xuanhuang Realm and various fortuitous encounters, it was still not as effective as his own personal and direct experience.

The discovery that worlds could be "insect-transformed" opened up new avenues of thought for Li Fan.

"I can sense that after the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven was insect-transformed, my dominant consciousness within it became like my previous mastery over the Spirit Wood Realm. My own being has become the Heavenly Dao..."

"What could be easier than comprehending oneself through oneself?"

"Although the world's laws might deviate slightly after insect transformation, it can still serve as a reference. And with the aid of Return to Truth, I can continuously restart, giving me ample opportunities for trial and error."

"Excellent."

The main body pondered and slowly planned for the future.

The perspective shifted back to Holy Emperor Li Ping.

After completely subduing the insect-transformed Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, Li Ping looked at the colossal entity beneath his feet and fell into deep thought.

His original plan was to use this grotto-heaven as a breeding ground for mutated Spirit Qi, to be released all at once in a future battle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance, completely altering the battlefield environment and catching them off guard.

But now, this insect-transformed Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven seemed to have even greater potential uses.

Li Ping’s heart stirred, and outside the grotto-heaven, the mutated Spirit Qi evolved into nine thick, black tentacles that reached out towards the Great Qi pocket world.

Compared to the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, the Great Qi pocket world was like an ant beneath a giant's foot.

Under Li Ping's deliberate guidance, the Great Myriad Spirits Formation and the Sacred Dynasty's destiny collectively cleared their protective stances, allowing the nine tentacles to easily and deeply embed themselves within the pocket world.

Then, they wrapped around it a few times from the outside.

"Move!"

The giant formed by the Sacred Dynasty's destiny stood atop the insect-transformed Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven and grunted.

The grotto-heaven rumbled, as if it had suddenly come alive. It began to slowly move into the depths of the void, far away from the Xuanhuang Realm.

The nine tentacles acted like chains, tethering the Great Qi pocket world as they advanced together.

"Using the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven as a reference point, the current speed of movement in the void is relatively slow. However, from a cultivator's perspective, it feels very fast, almost a bit quicker than a Soul Transformation cultivator flying at full speed."

Li Ping felt the ever-increasing distance from the Xuanhuang Realm and nodded slightly.

Even though Li Ping had made the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi practically impregnable, with defenses like the Sky-Patrolling Arrow and the Great Myriad Spirits Formation, there was one issue that could not be avoided.

That was the Great Qi pocket world being too close to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Without strategic depth, if its exact location were discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, it could be ambushed and trapped, putting them in a dire predicament.

But if it were hidden more deeply...

For thousands of years, the World-Cracking Whale herds had tirelessly carved out the void.

This had created an excellent environment for concealment.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance has records regarding the pocket worlds relocated by mortals in the past."

"However, when they lock onto the location and attempt to attack, they will discover that the pocket world has turned into empty void. I imagine they will be quite astonished."

"Indeed, perhaps even setting up a series of deadly formations in the original location of the Great Qi pocket world, waiting for the Myriad Immortals Alliance to fall into a trap. Hehehe..."

In an instant, countless schemes flooded Li Ping's mind.

The slow, overall movement of the pocket world did not attract the attention of the citizens within the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi.

Even the nine black tentacles deeply embedded in the world were only noticed by a few individuals, including Sun Erlang.

However, upon learning that it was the work of Holy Emperor Li Ping, they could only lament his divine power.

"Fellow Daoist, where are you planning to drag this world to..."

Outside the world, in the void.

Having received Li Ping's help and recovered somewhat, Daoist Bai Hua, upon sensing the unusual movement of the world, quickly flew out to investigate.

What she saw was the scene of the insect-transformed Five Elements Grotto-heaven, with its nine tentacles pulling the pocket world forward at great speed.

Even though she considered herself well-traveled and knowledgeable, she was currently awestruck by what she witnessed.

"Why must there be a destination?"

Li Ping dispelled his giant avatar, reverting to his normal form, and said calmly.

The recent actions had consumed some of the dynasty's destiny, but with the Sacred Dynasty's current and ever-growing prosperity, it would be recovered within half a year.

"Fellow Daoist, do you think a fixed defensive pass or a ship drifting on a river is harder to breach?" Li Ping asked with a subtle tone.

Daoist Bai Hua instantly understood Li Ping's meaning and nodded, "Indeed. Constantly shifting its position in the void, making it impossible to even pinpoint its location, let alone launch a siege. Your move, Fellow Daoist, is truly brilliant."

She praised him heartily.

"However, there is still one drawback currently."

"What?"

"With only the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven dragging it, the speed of movement in the void is still too slow."

Daoist Bai Hua suddenly had an ominous premonition.

"Therefore, I will have to trouble Daoist Bai Hua to make a few more trips."

Li Ping turned his head and spoke earnestly.

"I have several other suitable targets. Though their scale is not comparable to the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, they are still serviceable. After you bring them all here, I will use formations to connect them, and our forward momentum will increase severalfold."

Recalling the tragic experience of transporting the Five Elements Grotto-heaven previously, and looking at the specific information of over a dozen grotto-heavens sent by Li Ping, Daoist Bai Hua felt dizzy, her future seeming dim.

"Hehe, rest assured, Fellow Daoist. You have worked so diligently for the Sacred Dynasty, and I will naturally not treat you unfairly." Li Ping smiled and pointed his finger in the air.

A golden, swimming dragon instantly appeared before Daoist Bai Hua.

"Is this? Myriad Spirits Nectar?" Daoist Bai Hua exclaimed.

"Uh, no. It's just some condensed cultivation." After a moment, Daoist Bai Hua felt a slight disappointment.

"Hehe, Essence of Primal Force can only be condensed by True Immortals, how could I possibly master it? However, this refined Primal Force should compensate for some of the damage you sustained while transporting the grotto-heavens," Li Ping said plainly.

The Primal Force that formed the golden dragon was naturally gathered by the citizens of Great Qi practicing the Enlightenment Spiritual Essence Technique. It was a level below Essence of Primal Force, a pure cultivation without attributes.

Daoist Bai Hua held back for a moment before opening her mouth and swallowing the golden dragon.

She instantly refined it, not only healing her old injuries but also making her dark golden, glazed physique even more solid.

"Thank you for your assistance, Fellow Daoist."

There will be another chapter around 12:30.

Chapter 1171

"However, I see that the Primordial Force you've given me seems to be..."

"More advanced?" Daoist Bai Hua carefully chose his words and slowly asked.

Li Ping naturally would not tell Bai Hua that the reason for the Primordial Force's superior effect was an attempt to elevate it into Essence of Primal Force by leveraging the power of widespread faith.

However, all current attempts had ended in failure. After all, even the power abandoned by True Immortals surpassed mortal strength and was not easily controlled.

"It's just your illusion, Daoist brother. How are you feeling? If you're mostly recovered, let's be on our way." Li Ping said indifferently.

Daoist Bai Hua chuckled awkwardly. He had no other choice and could only sigh and bid farewell before departing.

"After ensuring the absolute safety of our main base, we can consider conquering other pocket worlds."

"Knowing the specific locations of each pocket world, we can even infiltrate them first and then move their entrances to the void near Great Qi."

"Spirit Wood, the Empire..."

"And the Nether Realm."

Just as Emperor Li Ping returned to the Emperor's throne and sat contemplating the future direction of the Sacred Dynasty, his disciple Sun Erlang requested an audience.

"Uh, Master. About an item that was fished up from the Fishing Pond before..." Sun Erlang appeared somewhat uneasy.

"Speak freely."

Then, Sun Erlang recounted the entire affair. It turned out that after the last fishing competition, most of the anglers who received rewards were absorbed into various agencies of the Sacred Dynasty. Among them was a middle-aged man named Quan Ruochu, whom Sun Erlang took a liking to and brought under his wing.

What Quan Ruochu had fished up from the Fishing Pond was a white ball of light. Li Ping had personally examined it at the time; it was a common item called "Azure Orchid Dark Flower," so he hadn't paid it much attention.

However, according to Sun Erlang, this Azure Orchid Dark Flower, which appeared to be at most of Nascent Soul tier quality, had displayed abilities completely contrary to reason after being meticulously cultivated by Quan Ruochu for some time.

"This Quan Ruochu, though middle-aged, has achieved nothing. His parents are deceased, and he has no wife or descendants. His only loves in life are fishing and tending to flowers. He has a calm disposition and no ambition. Therefore, after fishing up the white ball of light, he wasn't too disheartened. In fact, he took a greater liking to the Azure Orchid Dark Flower than to other treasures."

"Originally, he thought the Azure Orchid Dark Flower would grow like a normal flower, with soil providing nourishment and Spirit Qi sustaining it. But after planting it, no matter how carefully Quan Ruochu tended to it, it remained listless and on the verge of wilting. In his eagerness to save the Azure Orchid Dark Flower, Quan Ruochu actually did something incomprehensible," Sun Erlang said in a low voice, bowing his head to recount the story to the Sacred Emperor.

"He actually planted the Azure Orchid Dark Flower on himself! Using his own body as soil and nourishing it with his vital blood..."

"In just a few days, he transformed from a relatively robust man into a gaunt skeleton, barely breathing! But he still didn't give up, intending to use his last drops of lifeblood to nurture it."

"When I couldn't find him for several days and went to his place to look for him, this was the scene I witnessed." Sun Erlang's voice was somber. "I wanted to directly eradicate this demonic flower, but Quan Ruochu threatened to stake his life on it, saying that if the flower died, he would die too..."

"Also, considering this was a treasure bestowed by Master, I hesitated and didn't act. But seeing Quan Ruochu's body growing weaker and weaker, and death not far away, I ultimately couldn't stand by and do nothing."

The moment Sun Erlang spoke, Li Ping had already pinpointed Quan Ruochu's location and carefully examined his condition. It was, after all, just a blue ball of light without any particularly profound qualities, and he understood it immediately upon inspection.

After Sun Erlang finished speaking, Li Ping shook his head and said with a chilling tone, "Erlang, you have disappointed me greatly."

Sun Erlang's body trembled slightly, and his head bowed even lower to the ground. "A commander should lead the entire army, not be swayed by personal emotions or those of a small portion, even if it's dozens or hundreds of people."

"Since you first became my disciple, this is the first time you've actively sought me out, isn't it? And it's just for this matter?"

After a long silence, Sun Erlang said hoarsely, "Master, please see reason. If he were to die instantly, perhaps I would remain unmoved. But to watch someone I know slowly have their life drained away, to wither and die... my heart truly cannot remain calm."

"I humbly request Master's punishment."

Li Ping's voice boomed like divine thunder from the heavens, echoing throughout the Sacred Emperor's throne chamber. "My disappointment in you stems not only from your indecisiveness but also from your inability to distinguish right from wrong. A demonic flower..."

"Go back and take another careful look!"

Li Ping waved his hand, expelling Sun Erlang. Sun Erlang's heart tightened at first, then, as if understanding something, he rushed to Quan Ruochu's dwelling with great joy.

Guided by his Master's words, Sun Erlang observed more carefully and finally discovered the secret of the Azure Orchid Dark Flower. Although it appeared to be constantly devouring Quan Ruochu's vital blood, it was simultaneously differentiating a strand of miraculous power to sustain the flame of Quan Ruochu's life, preventing it from being extinguished.

As it lingered between life and death, the Azure Orchid Dark Flower flourished. At the same time, Quan Ruochu began a complete transformation.

"His sliver of hope for survival was entirely tied to this Azure Orchid Dark Flower. If I had rashly cut it down then, it would have resulted in the death of both flower and man. I nearly made a grave mistake!" Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a sense of lingering fear.

He sealed the entrance, forbidding any outsiders from disturbing it. At the same time, he moved a miniature [Heaven and Earth Furnace] nearby to ensure the surrounding Spirit Qi concentration. After completing these tasks, Sun Erlang finally breathed a sigh of relief.

"It's all thanks to Master's guidance," he said with relief. However, Sun Erlang was unaware that while the Azure Orchid Dark Flower had indeed protected a sliver of Quan Ruochu's vital pulse, it was not out of gratitude for his planting. It was merely the survival instinct of lacking a new host. Furthermore, Quan Ruochu, with his Qi Refining cultivation, could not withstand the Azure Orchid Dark Flower's unrestrained absorption. His complete death was only a matter of time, without external help. The reason he appeared to be recovering was purely because Sacred Emperor Li Ping had lent a hand.

"Whether it is right or evil, whether it is right or wrong."

"Until the final outcome is reached, no one can judge correctly."

"Only by moving forward step by step, reaching the end, can one vindicate themselves."

"The process... does not matter."

Sacred Emperor Li Ping sat on the Emperor's throne, his thoughts subtly fluctuating.

...

In an area within the endless white mist, amidst a certain labyrinth:

"What... how many frozen corpses are there here?"

Shang Shaojun, who had been led into the Gate of Life and Death Great Formation by the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, exclaimed in horror at the sight before him.

— I took a look and unexpectedly reached the target for rewarded requests? My boss is confused! I can only reluctantly earn this money tomorrow.

Chapter 1172: Yin Yang Pearls of Deathly Thoughts

As the commander of the Azure Profound Army, Young Master Shang had suppressed the Chizha Abyss for a century. Even when facing the terrifying tide of world-destroying demonic sounds, he remained composed.

But now, he genuinely felt a bone-chilling terror he hadn't experienced in a long time.

There were simply too many deceased cultivators in this frozen sea.

Young Master Shang could hardly imagine where all these cultivators came from.

He suspected that the number of cultivators buried here might even surpass that of the entire Xuanhuang Realm!

Li Fan, the Sacred Embryo, feigned shock at the scene, his body trembling slightly, his face etched with horror.

"Young Master, do not act rashly. Caution is paramount," he said after a moment, seemingly recovering his senses and trying to calm Young Master Shang.

Young Master Shang’s expression remained grim. He continuously scanned his surroundings, as if some unknown enemy lurked nearby.

"Something… feels wrong here. Did you hear anything?" Young Master Shang transmitted telepathically.

"A sound? What sound?" Sacred Embryo Li Fan asked with genuine surprise, as this was not an act.

Young Master Shang’s face darkened. "Perhaps it’s because I spent too long in the Chizha Abyss, making me sensitive to all sounds. Ever since I arrived in this desolate region, I've been hearing a faint, persistent whisper. It comes and goes. Didn't you hear it?"

Sacred Embryo Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

This was not his first time here.

He had even guided various cultivators to this place before.

But none of them, unlike Young Master Shang, had claimed to hear inexplicable sounds in this deathly silent frozen sea.

A different thought sparked in his mind. Sacred Embryo Li Fan spoke with solemnity, "Young Master, what do you think? This place must involve immense secrets. However, delving deeper will undoubtedly entail great risks. Should we leave now while we are undetected, or investigate further?"

Young Master Shang did not immediately answer Li Fan. Instead, he tilted his ear, as if discerning the faint sounds he heard.

After a moment, he transmitted telepathically, "Brother Li, follow me. I have a premonition that tracing the source of this sound might unlock some of the mysteries of this place."

Sacred Embryo Li Fan nodded slightly. His sword shadow unsheathed, guarding them both.

"Let’s proceed with caution."

The two traversed the endless frozen sea.

Li Fan was already intimately familiar with the overall structure of the Gate of Life and Death Great Formation.

However, since he was pretending this was his first time here, he did not expose the fact that Young Master Shang was leading them in circles within the formation, but silently followed behind.

But as Young Master Shang stubbornly pressed forward in a particular direction, Sacred Embryo Li Fan also noticed subtle changes occurring around them.

These changes had even eluded his analysis with the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc and had been overlooked by him.

"There’s a hidden change within the Great Formation? It truly lives up to its reputation as a formation capable of achieving Longevity." Li Fan marveled inwardly.

They continued to advance.

It felt like they were treading water, yet the ice-sealed coffins in the surrounding dead sea continuously rotated around them.

The deeper they went, the faster the scenery spun.

"Brother Li, be careful. It seems the source of the sound is just ahead!" Young Master Shang's voice carried a hint of tension.

As if passing through a narrow spatial-temporal tunnel, their surroundings blurred into overlapping lines due to the rapid movement.

Upon breaking through the end of the tunnel, countless circles converged into a single point.

Then, they exploded into view with a sudden expanse.

The scenery dramatically opened up.

However, the air around them grew even colder.

It even made Sacred Embryo Li Fan and Young Master Shang feel stiff with cold.

"Hoo…"

They stimulated the Spirit Qi within their bodies, attempting to dispel the biting chill.

The two carefully scanned their surroundings.

It appeared to be the interior of a silver-white sphere of light. Beyond a blurred boundary, there was nothing within.

Looking back in the direction they came from, their pupils suddenly contracted.

Floating peacefully in the air were small spheres resembling Yin Yang symbols, continuously spinning.

From their dim interiors, Sacred Embryo Li Fan could faintly sense the aura of the dead silent frozen sea they had just left.

And inside this white sphere of light, there were eight more of these Yin Yang spheres!

A total of nine, arranged in a peculiar formation.

Young Master Shang swallowed hard with difficulty.

Just the number of deceased within a single Yin Yang sphere was uncountable.

If this number were multiplied by nine…

The two exchanged glances, each seeing the terror reflected in the other's eyes.

They even became cautious in their telepathic exchanges, lest they disturb the nine Yin Yang spheres before them.

"Young Master, the sound you heard earlier…"

"It's gone. As soon as we entered here, it abruptly stopped and vanished. Wait…" Young Master Shang suddenly froze, turning to look in the direction opposite the Yin Yang spheres.

Sacred Embryo Li Fan followed his gaze but saw nothing.

"Careful," Young Master Shang whispered, then remained motionless, his body rigid and his aura suddenly becoming incredibly faint.

Only then did Sacred Embryo Li Fan sense an invisible presence that had descended upon this space.

*Thump!* *Thump!* *Thump!*

Though there was no concrete sound, the heavy footsteps seemed to resound directly in Li Fan's heart.

The presence drew nearer.

It paid no heed to the two intruders, proceeding directly towards the vicinity of the nine Yin Yang pearls.

*Hoo…*

A soft sighing sound echoed.

The space around the Yin Yang pearls rippled and distorted.

As if being boiled in hot water, the Yin and Yang portions of the nine small spheres rotated more distinctly, revolving around each other.

And Young Master Shang and Li Fan clearly saw wisps of frozen corpses entering the nine Yin Yang pearls as this unknown entity exhaled.

The entire bizarre process did not last long.

The oppressive footsteps gradually faded away, and the silver-white space slowly returned to normal.

The nine Yin Yang pearls slowly settled, growing tranquil once more.

After a long while, the two finally exchanged telepathic messages.

"What was that just now?"

"A sense of impending doom prickled my entire body, my spiritual intuition screamed warnings. It felt as if disaster was imminent… Such a feeling, even a Heavenly Venerate of Longevity might not be able to inspire it, right?"

After a few brief sentences, an oppressive silence enveloped them.

"The sounds I heard earlier were likely the echoes of that unknown entity's footsteps here," Young Master Shang speculated. "Even though it has left, the reverberations linger."

"The countless frozen corpses within the Yin Yang pearls seem to be the work of that being. But I still cannot understand, where did it obtain so many bodies? And what lies beyond this silver-white space?"

Sacred Embryo Li Fan had no answers to these questions.

He had initially believed this was merely the dojo of the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth. He never imagined that in this life, by sheer accident, he would uncover deeper secrets hidden behind it.

Chapter 1173: Immortal Vow Body

Previously, Li Fan had harbored doubts about the countless corpses within the Gate of Life and Death Great Formation. There were too many inexplicable aspects. Firstly, the sheer number was astonishing. Secondly, all the corpses were remarkably well-preserved, unlike those left behind by world-ending calamities.

"I had originally suspected that the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth might be another guise of the Heavenly Physician. Now, it seems..." Reflecting on the terrifying, formless monster he had just encountered, Li Fan questioned his own judgment. "What is the connection between that monster and the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth?"

Li Fan had met the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth before. During the 119th life, a figure with a white mist body had suddenly appeared and instantly slain three Dharma-Preachers. However, the matter had been dropped after the Heavenly Venerate of Doctrine Transmitter intervened. "Doctrine Transmitter, Heavenly Physician, Rebirth. There must be some connection between these three."

"But that formless monster just now..." A myriad of thoughts flashed through the mind of the Holy Embryo Li Fan.

"Brother Li, for safety’s sake, let’s leave here first," Young Master Shang’s words interrupted his reverie. The two retraced their steps and returned to the Yin-Yang Pearl. This time, however, they reappeared not in the Sea of Death, but on the Sea of Life, facing it. The wind on the sea was also blowing uniformly towards the exit of the delimited realm.

"Is this… a gesture of dismissal?" They exchanged a look, both surprised. Not daring to linger any longer, they hastily left through the exit.

"Hoo." Upon leaving the delimited realm of life and death and returning to the white mist, Young Master Shang did not feel relief from having escaped a near-death experience. Instead, he became somewhat dejected. "The Xuanhuang Realm hides too many secrets. The formless entity we encountered today is undoubtedly as powerful as that mysterious figure who reshapes worlds. Even if the Heavenly Venerate were to return, can he truly eradicate everything?"

Having witnessed too many things beyond his comprehension in a short period, Young Master Shang had fallen into a state of confusion.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan immediately changed the subject. "What do you think of that formless entity, Young Master Shang?"

"It doesn't seem like a cultivator. Otherwise, it wouldn't have ignored us. It’s more like some kind of entity with a fixed mission..."

"A monster?" Young Master Shang finally managed to utter the word after a long pause. "But even as a monster, it’s an existence that completely overwhelms us. How ironic that I, who have guarded the Chizha Abyss for hundreds of years, achieved great success in my divine arts, and considered myself second to none in the Xuanhuang Realm among those below the Longevity Realm. Yet, in just over a year of traveling with Brother Li, I have encountered so many terrifying and awe-inspiring existences. I now realize how limited my perspective was before."

Li Fan consoled him, "It’s not that you aren’t strong, Young Master Shang. It’s just that these old monsters have hidden themselves too deeply."

After a moment of contemplation, the Holy Embryo Li Fan asked, "Do you feel disheartened, Young Master Shang?"

"Not at all. As the saying goes, when a nation is about to fall, strange things will emerge. The more chaos there is, the more it proves that the Xuanhuang Realm is terminally ill." After a brief period of low spirits, Young Master Shang’s demeanor suddenly became impassioned. "However, with just the two of us, it’s difficult to change all this. We need allies." Young Master Shang said earnestly.

"I had that thought originally. But finding someone trustworthy and capable is difficult..." the Holy Embryo Li Fan sighed.

Young Master Shang's eyes gleamed as he looked beyond the white mist. "I do have a few candidates in mind."

"Let's go back first. Our travels during this period have at least provided us with some evidence. We have at least a seventy percent chance of convincing them," Young Master Shang explained to Li Fan as they flew through the white mist.

"First, Young Master Proclivity. Brother Li, have you heard of him?"

"Although he is only at the Soul Transformation cultivation level now, his strength is absolutely no less than mine. He is proficient in all laws and complete in all martial arts, possessing a vast reservoir of knowledge. He is truly a top prodigy of the Xuanhuang Realm. More importantly, he is absolutely loyal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance! If we can persuade him to join us, it might even bring additional surprises."

"There is also Ji Hongdao. He is a rare genius in formations in this era. If not for his less advantageous seniority and background, I believe he could contend for the position of chief of the Hall of Strategic Formations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance! Besides formations, he is also skilled in artifact refinement…” Young Master Shang rattled off name after name, all familiar to Li Fan.

“Uh, actually, there is one more person who might be worth considering. However…” Young Master Shang hesitated. “This individual’s background is not simple, and he is involved too deeply. Bringing him in might not be a good thing.” Without further ado, Young Master Shang continued, “Although he appears to be just a mischievous child, he is terrifyingly strong in actual combat. Even I, at the Dao Integration realm, may not be able to force out his full strength. But his sanity is not entirely clear; as soon as he sees someone, he insists on spar­ring with them…”

Li Fan instantly understood who Young Master Shang was referring to. It was likely the Martial Fanatic Son, ** Martial Fanatic Son, a reincarnation from Senior Brother Zhang Qianmo. Li Fan had once used extremely high-level access of the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s origin to search for information about the Martial Fanatic Son. The internal assessment within the Myriad Immortals Alliance deemed him to be the essence of heaven and earth descended into human form. Although he possessed a human body, his behavior, habits, and way of thinking were not like those of a human. Instead, he was more like a materialized rule, akin to the essence of heaven and earth.

The Martial Fanatic Son was not unbeatable, but his learning ability was terrifyingly fast. Any move used against him during a spar would be immediately learned by him. The Myriad Immortals Alliance had even attempted to capture him for detailed study. However, he could repeatedly vanish into thin air under the watchful eyes of many and strict supervision. The next time he appeared, he would already be thousands of miles away. Moreover, he had no recollection of being captured previously.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance had even dispatched several Dao Integration cultivators to join forces and kill him. The Martial Fanatic Son’s remains vanished without a trace. Yet, not long after, he reappeared in the world alive and well, having also learned some of the divine abilities of those Dao Integration cultivators.

Given such a troublesome existence, and since he merely sought out people for sparring quietly without harming the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s safety, the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters decided to merely monitor him strictly and not interfere further. Li Fan speculated that the Martial Fanatic Son’s extraordinary abilities might be related to Senior Brother Zhang’s Vow Manifestation Body. The Vow Manifestation Body integrated with heaven and earth, becoming almost a part of the heavenly laws. It was no wonder he was mistaken for the essence of heaven and earth.

As for whether the Martial Fanatic Son had any connection to Senior Brother Zhang… the two extremely similar faces said it all.

"Young Master Shang, you don’t need to worry too much. We should welcome everyone who comes and accept as many as possible. After all, if what we intend to do fails..."

"I fear the Myriad Immortals Alliance will have no place for us in the future," the Holy Embryo Li Fan said with a smile.

Young Master Shang was first slightly taken aback, then nodded. "Then let us visit them one by one!"

Chapter 1174: A Heavenly Venerate's Sudden Message

"Young Master, was the First Proclivity born from the **Era**?"

On the road to the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Star Pivot Plain, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan finally voiced the question that had long gnawed at him.

Young Master Shang paused, seemingly unfazed that Li Fan knew classified Alliance secrets related to the **Era**. He replied in a low voice, "Yes and no."

"From what I know, the Alliance did indeed cultivate a group of death warriors using the **Era**. However, those individuals were not truly born and raised in the Xuanhuang Realm; they lacked a certain spark of spirituality."

"Although they all displayed astonishing talent during the era simulations, their actual performance in the Xuanhuang Realm was far below expectations. They were quite suitable as fearless cannon fodder, but not for important tasks." Young Master Shang shook his head slightly.

"However, the Alliance later found a way to improve them. Brother Li, do you know that each Doctrine Transmitter has their own exclusive pocket world?"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan replied, "I have heard whispers of it."

"Each Doctrine Transmitter dedicates a portion of their subordinate pocket world to jointly form a **Primordial Great Realm**. It's said to be a truly brutal chaotic world where, every hundred years, the beings within undergo a complete purge. Only those who receive the collective praise of the Dharma-Preachers within that century can survive."

"Brother Li, you must understand, the beings in the **Primordial Great Realm** are either meticulously selected consciousnesses and souls from the **Era**, or peerless prodigies from the Dharma-Preachers' respective worlds. To stand out in such an environment... their capabilities are unimaginable."

Young Master Shang's tone grew solemn. "That is the origin of the First Proclivity."

"From the **Era** to the **Primordial Great Realm**, the First Proclivity emerged step by step, eventually earning the favor of the Dharma-Preachers. He was granted a body reshaped by a supreme treasure left by a Heavenly Venerate. Moreover, due to their deep trust, he was specially permitted to retain his past experiences and memories. Even though he doesn't hold any specific position within the Alliance, no one dares to look down on him."

"To speak of him in such a way, this First Proclivity is truly legendary," the Sacred Embryo Li Fan remarked with a sigh after hearing Young Master Shang's explanation.

But then, a hint of confusion surfaced. "Someone like that, and we're just going to approach him directly... Don't you fear he'll just tie us up and hand us over to the Dharma-Preachers?"

Young Master Shang burst into laughter. "Brother Li worries too much. Setting aside the fact that I once adventured with the First Proclivity and we have a decent relationship; the reason he is so trusted by the Dharma-Preachers is precisely because, since his creation, his soul has been permanently imprinted with loyalty to the Alliance. The more experiences he gains, the stronger he becomes, and the deeper this imprint grows."

"He told me this himself. He doesn't care about it at all; rather, he considers it a great honor. Aren't we doing everything for the Myriad Immortals Alliance? If he knew that the Alliance harbors many hidden conspiracies, he definitely wouldn't stand idly by. Given his nature, he might even personally investigate to verify our claims," Young Master Shang said with confidence.

However, things did not go as smoothly as planned.

"What? The First Proclivity isn't here?"

"We had an appointment!"

Outside the Proclivity's residence, Young Master Shang and Li Fan were stopped.

Young Master Shang's expression darkened, and his aura as a Dao Integration cultivator surged.

The two guards at the entrance, though pale, maintained their composure and explained, "Your pardon, sir. Our master received an urgent secret order from the Alliance and departed hastily. The matter was urgent, so he didn't even have time to inform you..."

Young Master Shang attempted to contact the First Proclivity again using a communication talisman. As expected, there was no response.

Exchanging a glance with Li Fan, knowing they couldn't force the issue, he could only let out a cold snort and give up.

"I believe it's not that the First Proclivity deliberately avoided us, but that there is indeed something important," Li Fan whispered.

"Mmm. I know the First Proclivity's character; he wouldn't deliberately make excuses. I just don't know what has happened in the Alliance. If the First Proclivity was urgently summoned, this matter must be significant," Young Master Shang murmured.

Their first target thwarted, the two planned to go to Ji Hongdao in Tianyu Prefecture.

Unexpectedly, Ji Hongdao had also been transferred away by an appointment.

The two exchanged bewildered looks and decided to temporarily abandon their search for people.

"Something's not right. Let me find someone to inquire about it," Young Master Shang's brows furrowed.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's divine sense, hidden within the Immeasurable Mirror, had already begun to act stealthily.

He silently pilfered a Heavenly Profound Mirror from the Sun family, activating the Immeasurable Mirror to probe its information.

As expected, the Heavenly Profound Mirror was already aware of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's unusual activity.

However, the result of this discovery left Li Fan somewhat astonished.

"A message from the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate: there may be some minor tremors in the Xuanhuang Realm recently, and the Alliance needs to prepare countermeasures in advance."

"This..."

"Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance was established, this is only the few times the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate has personally communicated. The Dharma-Preachers are treating this with extreme importance..."

Breaking off the Immeasurable Mirror's probe and offering it some comfort, Li Fan fell into deep thought.

He was unsure if the event of a "Heavenly Venerate's Message" had occurred in his previous reincarnations.

However, a slight upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm was something that had absolutely not happened in the many lifetimes Li Fan had experienced.

"The Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate specifically sent a message to instruct, indicating that this impending upheaval will not be minor. If caught off guard without preparation, it might even cause widespread panic."

"But the Doctrine Transmitter only sent a message and did not return in person, which suggests this upheaval will not truly cause catastrophic damage to the Xuanhuang Realm..."

"The upheaval predicted by the Doctrine Transmitter is expected to occur in about a month. By then, we'll know if this is a unique event of this lifetime."

...

Meanwhile, Young Master Shang had also obtained his results from his inquiries.

Naturally, it wasn't as detailed as what Li Fan had obtained from the Heavenly Profound Mirror, but it was largely the same.

"The entire Myriad Immortals Alliance, from top to bottom, has been mobilized. It's likely that relevant orders will soon reach the Eternal Immortal Bastion..."

"Brother Li, what do you think?"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan pondered for a moment, then said, "What you and I wish to accomplish is not a task that can be completed in a day or two. Since the entire Xuanhuang Realm is about to face a crisis, let's first focus on preparing to deal with it."

"The Azure Profound Army cannot be without a leader, and the Chizha Abyss might become restless again. Why don't we return to the Eternal Immortal Bastion and observe the situation?"

Li Fan's suggestion was approved by Young Master Shang.

The two then hastily concluded their journey and returned to Immortal City Broken Palm.

Gazing into the distance at the tranquil, profound Chizha Abyss, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's mind conjured the figure he had seen at the bottom of the Chizha Abyss earlier.

"Perhaps the special nature of this lifetime is related to my minor actions?"

Li Fan frowned slightly, a touch of confusion in his expression.

Chapter 1175: Doubt Amidst the Starry Sea

“Perhaps” could be removed. If the Xuanhuang Realm were to experience a widespread upheaval, then it would be almost certain that it was caused by some action of Li Fan in this life.

“The root of the Xuanhuang Realm’s tremors must originate from the Immortal Ruins’ suction.”

“The key lies here. By what merit or virtue could I possibly influence the Immortal Ruins?”

The scenes Li Fan had experienced in this life flashed rapidly before his eyes. After eliminating all impossible options, Li Fan was left with a few suspects.

The mysterious figure in the Chizha Abyss who re-implanted world fragments. The intangible entity in the Death-Life Delimited Realm that collected cultivators’ corpses. And… the relocation and movement of the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven.

With Li Fan’s current strength, whether in his main body or his clones, he was unable to alter the Immortal Ruins in the slightest. However, his actions could influence or change the destinies of powerful entities capable of shaking the Immortal Ruins, thereby causing a deviation.

“It’s only a little over a month, I might as well wait patiently.”

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan remained silent. While the Myriad Immortals Alliance was in a state of emergency preparedness, the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi was no different. Not long ago, an imperial decree was issued stating that the Sacred Emperor would test his divine abilities in the void outside the Great Qi. This might cause minor tremors, which was a normal phenomenon and no cause for alarm.

The citizens of the Great Qi, their current worship of the Sacred Emperor having reached near-fanatical levels, naturally accepted whatever he said. Upon hearing this, the populace not only felt no tension or fear but instead looked forward with anticipation to the power of the Sacred Emperor’s divine abilities.

In the secret chamber beneath the Sacred Emperor’s throne, Senior Yin and Li Ping faced each other.

“The little ones you sent me last time indeed possess great talent. Some are even smarter than I imagined. Two of them have already succeeded in the ‘Self-Inherent Foundation’ with my guidance. The others should not be far behind.”

“If one accepts from the beginning that ‘Self-Inherent Foundation’ is the only and most correct method, it indeed greatly aids in smooth cultivation.”

Senior Yin first summarized his recent achievements, then changed the topic: “I have been feeling rather unsettled recently. I heard you are going to test some divine abilities? Try to stay far away, don’t ruin this pocket world.”

“I rather like it here,” Senior Yin said calmly.

Li Ping nodded in agreement, but his mind was churning: “Senior Yin is a world spirit, parasitically existing within the Xuanhuang Realm. Even he vaguely senses something. It seems the Xuanhuang Realm is truly facing some tribulation.”

Time slowly passed amidst universal anticipation. And, unbeknownst to anyone, over a hundred stone puppets quietly flew into the sky above the Xuanhuang Realm. At the edge of the world, a single step would plunge one into the void. They were still within the Xuanhuang Realm’s boundaries, not yet being sucked away by the Immortal Ruins’ pull. Yet, they could observe the entire macroscopic view of the Xuanhuang Realm from a high vantage point. These puppets were, of course, created by Li Ping. They had no other special purpose other than to observe and record this event of the Xuanhuang Realm’s upheaval. The puppets floated silently in the air, awaiting the arrival of the fated event.

As the day predicted by the Dharma-Preachers drew nearer, one day, Li Fan’s main body in the Dharma Deduction space, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan outside the Chizha Abyss, Li Fan’s divine soul, the clone within the Immeasurable Mirror, and the Sacred Emperor Li Ping in the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi all felt a sudden premonition simultaneously. They all looked up at the sky.

In the era of the Heavenly Mysteries Spirit Locking Array, Ji Hongdao had once instantly killed cultivators in a province, using a mutual destruction technique to force the Longevity Realm’s Heavenly Venerate Yi Xin to retreat to the Five Elders Council. At that time, because a large number of cultivators were suddenly removed as anchors, the Xuanhuang Realm felt a sudden lightness. It vibrated and roared. All life within it sensed this, as if facing impending doom, on the verge of death and destruction in the next moment. Li Fan had personally experienced this sensation then. Now, that feeling was hundreds of times stronger.

BOOM! Without any warning, the Xuanhuang Realm began to shake violently. It was as if a giant was violently tearing the entire world apart with its bare hands. Rifts appeared from all corners of the earth and rapidly spread outwards. In an instant, the once flat terrain became riddled with scars. Countless mountain ranges split open, some even collapsing entirely and plunging into the newly formed abysses.

If what happened on the surface was not enough to instill fear in cultivators living in suspended cities, then the subsequent changes to the Misty White Mist barrier made all cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm tremble uncontrollably. The Misty White Mist barrier, which stretched across the land and seemed unchanging, actually began to curve and fracture. The mist overflowed from its original fixed area and spread outwards. Wherever it passed, it devoured the lifespan of all living beings. The boundaries of the provinces thus changed.

And through the eyes of the hundreds of puppets high in the sky, Li Fan saw it even more clearly. The Essence-Devouring Mist, as if attracted by something outside the Xuanhuang Realm, surged forward. However, due to some restraining force, the mist could not leave the Xuanhuang Realm. It was this tug-of-war between the two forces that caused the mist barrier to break.

The world underwent drastic changes, and the Spirit Qi consequently became violent. Li Fan clearly saw below in the Xuanhuang Realm, storms, flames, lightning, floods… all sorts of disasters suddenly descended. Fueled by the chaotic Spirit Qi, they were hundreds or even thousands of times more powerful than usual. And the Xuanhuang Realm’s shaking did not stop. This catastrophe seemed to be far more prolonged than imagined.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators finally took action. They flew out from their various suspended cities, calming the rampant Spirit Qi and attempting to repair the anomalies caused by the Xuanhuang Realm’s violent shaking. In the midst of the earth-shattering tremors, they moved with great difficulty. However, there was no fatal danger. Merely the world’s upheaval would inevitably cause unrestrainable fear in the beings within it. The vast majority of cultivators could only blank their minds and pray for the disaster to pass quickly. Beyond that, they could do nothing.

Li Fan had witnessed true world-ending scenes. This minor upheaval was nothing compared to the Immortal Ruins’ immortals destroying the Xuanhuang Realm in an instant. Therefore, he was able to observe calmly, unhindered by the celestial changes.

“Strange…”

“The source of the suction causing this world-shaking tremor…”

A sudden sense of disharmony struck Li Fan’s mind. With a thought, the hundred stone puppets at the edge of the world drifted away from the boundary and into the endless void. Without the Xuanhuang Realm’s protection, the puppets were affected by the strong suction and uncontrollably moved in a certain direction. However, as their speed of moving away from the Xuanhuang Realm increased, Li Fan also confirmed the anomaly he had perceived. The suction that caused the Xuanhuang Realm’s massive tremor did not, in fact, come from the Immortal Ruins. It came from the depths of the pitch-black starry sea!

Chapter 1176: Intention to Venture into the Deep Void

The stone puppets, after drifting away from the Xuanhuang Realm and heading into the depths of space, lost contact with Li Fan. However, the shock caused by the facts they observed had not ceased for him.

"How could it be from the depths of the Uttermost Dark Star Sea?"

"Could it be that another Starving Immortal exists there?!"

Li Fan was filled with immense shock. In the Dharma Deduction Jade space, his main consciousness had to actively circulate the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation to suppress his astonishment and prevent any outward signs of abnormality. For Li Fan, such an occurrence had not happened in a very long time.

The tremors of the Xuanhuang Realm continued. Yet, as time passed, the amplitude of the shaking was noticeably diminishing. This inexplicable disaster was receding. But the storm of thoughts in Li Fan's mind had only just begun.

"The suction from the Immortal Ruins was generated by that skeletal immortal comprehending the True Immortal Script named [Hunger]. His state of meditating and forgetting himself in the Dao has had a destructive impact on this region of space..."

"But the True Immortal Script is not something only one person can comprehend. The anomaly in the Xuanhuang Realm's Source Dao State is suspected to be Grand Master Tiandu deciphering the mysteries of the Hunger Script Technique."

"This Azure Nether upheaval now presents two possibilities. First, it was not the [Hunger] Script Technique that caused the disaster, but the consequences of an entity of similar tier. Only the power of a True Immortal could inflict such a violent impact upon the Xuanhuang Realm."

"But this would mean that an unknown being with True Immortal power is still hidden within the Uttermost Dark Star Sea. This..." Li Fan felt a chill.

"The second possibility is that a survivor in the star sea, perhaps even a Doctrine Transmitter, is also comprehending the Hunger Script Technique. They might have recently achieved a breakthrough, thus causing this disturbance. Heavenly Venerate Doctrine Transmitter was able to send back news in advance, making this possibility quite high."

"However, neither speculation can explain the most crucial point: why has this world undergone such a transformation?"

The Dao-Melting Stone flickered, replaying the experiences of this life repeatedly. Yet, it could not pinpoint what event had caused such a significant deviation.

"Whether it's a True Immortal or an entity capable of comprehending the Hunger Script Technique, my actions in this life should not have been significant enough to influence them."

"Yet, all of this has still happened."

Li Fan remained silent. This was the natural consequence of reaching a certain level of power; even unintentional actions could affect the outside world, even altering the destinies of others. Variables beget further variables, an endless chain leading to unforeseen consequences.

"My main body has been within the Dharma Deduction Jade space, so it can be excluded. The clone, Li Ping, has only been causing trouble in the Great Qi pocket world. Even moving the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven is nowhere near enough to cause such a massive deviation. It must be the Holy Embryo's travels that have caused issues."

After much deliberation, Li Fan eventually pinpointed the source of the deviation to the mysterious figure at the bottom of the Chizha Abyss and the formless entity in the Rebirth Delimited Realm.

"These two, one collects world fragments, the other collects cultivator corpses. They have most likely been active in the Uttermost Dark Star Sea for most of their time."

"Due to the Holy Embryo's interference, their activities have deviated from the previous cycle of reincarnation. This is what led to the Azure Nether upheaval..."

"What else is hidden in the Uttermost Dark Star Sea?" At this moment, a hint of curiosity resurfaced in Li Fan's mind. He had previously assumed that only the Xuanhuang Realm remained in the Uttermost Dark Star Sea. Beyond the Xuanhuang Realm lay only fragmented worlds adrift in a dead silence. Now, it seemed there were still unknown secrets hidden there.

"Indeed. I have always had a question: in what form do the fragmented remnants of cultivation worlds exist in the Uttermost Dark Star Sea? Under the influence of the Immortal Ruins' suction, even complete cultivation worlds inevitably fall towards the Immortal Ruins. These fragments should not have been able to resist and would have long been devoured by the Immortal Ruins."

"However, judging from how the Xuanhuang Realm has been patched up continuously, and from what Han Zhong saw in the Eye of the Tian Beast, there are still a large number of fragmented worlds in the Uttermost Dark Star Sea. In ways I do not yet understand..."

Sensing the intermittent tremors of the Xuanhuang Realm, a flash of inspiration struck Li Fan.

"That's right! Previously, due to the influence of the Immortal Ruins' suction, I couldn't leave the Xuanhuang Realm to explore the Uttermost Dark Star Sea. But now, because of this inexplicable suction from the depths of the Uttermost Dark Star Sea, perhaps..."

"There is no time to delay. The tremors are about to cease, and I do not have much time left."

In the Immortal City Broken Palm. During the Xuanhuang Realm's upheaval, even the Chizha Abyss had become much quieter, emitting no extraneous sounds. The Azure Profound Army, who had guarded the abyss for a century and withstood the terrifying tide of demonic sounds, were now pale-faced and trembling at the sight of this true cosmic terror. If not for the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation previously taught by the Holy Embryo Li Fan, many of them would have succumbed to their repressed negative emotions, losing their minds and becoming utterly insane.

Let alone the ordinary Azure Profound Army soldiers, even the leader of the Azure Profound Army, the Dao Integration cultivator Shang Shaojun, who had been forewarned of the Azure Nether upheaval, was somewhat dazed in the face of such a world-ending catastrophe.

"I never imagined that the vast Xuanhuang Realm could be like a small boat on a stormy river, constantly in danger of capsizing," Shang Shaojun said with a bitter tone.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan, however, had no time to comfort him.

"Young Master Shaojun, quickly help me with something."

"What?" Shang Shaojun could not react immediately, looking bewildered.

"Help me prepare these items, as quickly as possible." After transmitting a list of supplies to Shang Shaojun, the Holy Embryo Li Fan's expression became solemn as he looked up at the Xuanhuang Realm's sky.

"Gathering these supplies should not be a problem. Most of them are available in the Eternal Immortal Bastion. But Brother Li, what do you need these things for?" Shang Shaojun followed the gaze of the Holy Embryo Li Fan.

"Such immense power, making the entire world seem as fragile as a toy. Young Master Shaojun, aren't you curious?" The Holy Embryo Li Fan's eyes were resolute, even showing a hint of madness.

"I wish to fly out of the Xuanhuang Realm, trace the origin, and uncover the truth!" he declared with conviction.

"Absolutely not! Outside the Xuanhuang Realm lies..." Shang Shaojun's expression changed, and he adamantly tried to dissuade him. He stopped halfway, inexplicably.

"Hahaha, Young Master Shaojun, are you about to say the words 'Immortal Ruins'?" Shang Shaojun was utterly shocked, looking at the Holy Embryo Li Fan with disbelief.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan did not explain how he knew this top secret. Instead, he waved his hand, his expression serious, "Precisely because the Immortal Ruins exist, now is the perfect, rare opportunity!"

"Brother Li, what exactly are you..." Shang Shaojun was filled with doubt and uncertainty.

"Does Young Master Shaojun perhaps believe that the Immortal Ruins are the culprit behind this catastrophe?" Li Fan retorted.

Chapter 1177

"Utterly mistaken!" Before Young Master Shang could reply, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan coldly refuted him.

"The source of this power is not close by. It is from the depths of the starry sea!"

"Ah?"

Li Fan's words startled Young Master Shang.

"I know you don't believe me, Young Master. But it's alright. Once I successfully break free from the shackles of the Immortal Ruins and fly out of the Xuanhuang Realm, you will know I was right!"

"I beseech Young Master to lend me a hand!" The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, with a solemn expression, bowed deeply.

Young Master Shang dared not accept such a gesture and quickly stopped him.

"Brother Li, why the formality? It's just a matter of some resources. With our friendship, it's as simple as a word."

"Yan Huan!" Young Master Shang called his trusted subordinate forward and instructed him to handle the matter.

"Don't worry, everything will be ready in three days at most."

"Too slow! A heaven-sent opportunity that will not come again. One day!" The Sacred Embryo Li Fan said without politeness.

Young Master Shang pondered for a moment, then gritted his teeth, "Alright! One day it is!"

He then seemed to transmit a message, giving some final instructions. After finishing, he turned to Li Fan, hesitating to speak.

"Young Master, whatever you wish to say, please do."

"Brother Li, are you truly going to..." Young Master Shang still seemed disbelieving.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan smiled slightly and elaborated on his deduction: "The immense power causing this Azure Nether upheaval originates from the depths of space. it is entirely different from the pull of the Immortal Ruins that has always attracted the Xuanhuang Realm."

"In the past, recklessly flying out of the Xuanhuang Realm without the world's protection would mean certain death, not just for us Dao Integration cultivators, but even for ordinary Longevity Realm cultivators. Perhaps only beings as powerful as Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerates could barely resist. But things are different now..."

In front of Li Fan, a pool of water suddenly appeared. In the center of the water, a colossal vortex spun rapidly, its currents turbulent, devouring everything around it. The Sacred Embryo Li Fan gently pointed a finger. Outside this vortex, another of equal scale appeared. The forces of the two vortices interfered with each other, and the direction of the water flow became unstable.

Young Master Shang instantly understood Li Fan's meaning.

"However, this is all your speculation, Brother Li, right? What if you're wrong..."

"To hear the Dao in the morning and die in the evening is enough." The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's face was calm, showing no fear.

"If I miss this rare opportunity, I will regret it for the rest of my life, even if I survive."

"That is why I must go." Li Fan's tone was resolute.

"I want to see what kind of existence possesses such immense power." Light shone in his eyes.

Young Master Shang fell silent.

The efficiency of the Azure Profound Army's operations was trustworthy. In a single day, all the materials Li Fan required had been prepared.

"Beyond the starry sea is fraught with peril. Brother Li, aren't you making more preparations? You intend to traverse the void with just these?" Young Master Shang muttered to himself.

"If there were enough time, I would naturally forge a sturdy flying ship. But time does not permit, does it? I can only make do with the Alliance's Mortal-Crossing Boat as a substitute."

The Mortal-Crossing Boat was currently the only designated flying artifact of the Alliance for traveling to and from the Misty White Mist Lost Region. In the 114th epoch, Li Fan had taken this boat with Ji Hongdao to the Chizha Abyss. The Mortal-Crossing Boat was forged from numerous rare materials and possessed many defensive formations. The entire Eternal Immortal Bastion had only two of them. That one was contributed indicated Young Master Shang's genuine loyalty.

"However, as long as I can endure the most intense clash point between the two forces outside the Xuanhuang Realm, there should be no danger." The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, seizing the last moments, modified the Mortal-Crossing Boat.

There was one more point he had not explicitly mentioned. The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's greatest reliance for traversing the starry sea was not any external object, but his own Foundation Establishment Oddity, the Heaven Oddity of the Black Sword! As a materialized law, the Black Sword was far more indestructible than most things in the Xuanhuang Realm. Furthermore, unlike ordinary protective materials that would gradually be damaged, the Black Sword could be continuously "tempered" by external forces, making its adaptability stronger.

"It's also thanks to the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's new methods. Even if I discard my physical body, as long as the law of the sword remains, I can survive in the void."

While full of confidence, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan also considered various unforeseen circumstances he might encounter after flying out of the Xuanhuang Realm. For example... The law of the Heaven Oddity of the Black Sword was the virtualization of the sword dao law of the Xuanhuang Realm. If he left the Xuanhuang Realm without its support, would its strength immediately falter, becoming incredibly weak? Moreover, the Heavenly Physician had once mentioned that outside the Xuanhuang Realm, in the void, there was a need to be wary of a certain "illness." Li Fan had also observed this illness on Han Zhong. It was a dark decay that infected the divine soul. Even the Infinite Void and Formation Method, used to repair the divine soul, offered no relief. The Sacred Embryo Li Fan did not expect to be immune to this illness but hoped to use abundant precious materials that nourished the divine soul to extend his time in the void.

Another day passed in a flash. The tremors of the Xuanhuang Realm were visibly subsiding. The cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm displayed expressions of relief, as if having survived a great calamity. Many still harbored fear, lest this terrifying disaster descend again. Outside the Chizha Abyss, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan was all prepared. The Mortal-Crossing Boat had undergone a complete transformation from its original appearance. Li Fan bade farewell to the Azure Profound Army members and slowly walked into the flying boat.

Watching Li Fan's receding back, Young Master Shang hesitated to speak. An impulse even surged within him to accompany Li Fan, to break free from the Xuanhuang Realm and explore the secrets behind that immense power. As a cultivator, how could he not be curious about power at that level? However... he was not a solitary man. He had too many concerns. Young Master Shang suddenly felt a pang of envy for the figure on the Mortal-Crossing Boat.

"Young Master, are you thinking of casting aside life and death with me at this moment?" As if reading his mind, the figure suddenly transmitted a message before departing. Without waiting for Young Master Shang's reply, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan smiled and said, "That won't do."

Young Master Shang was slightly taken aback. "Young Master, don't forget, there are still hidden conspirators plotting ill within the Xuanhuang Realm."

"If both of us leave, wouldn't that allow those villains to succeed?"

"I thought you'd forgotten about this matter in the blink of an eye," Young Master Shang grumbled inwardly.

The Mortal-Crossing Boat slowly ascended. The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's voice echoed in Young Master Shang's ears, "The future of the Xuanhuang Realm and the Myriad Immortals Alliance rests on you, Young Master."

"If I am fortunate enough to survive this ordeal, I will definitely return to aid you!"

Young Master Shang followed the Mortal-Crossing Boat all the way, leaving the Misty White Mist, and watched it disappear into the horizon. A sense of loss filled his heart. Although his acquaintance with Li Fan was brief, he was deeply impressed by Li Fan's strength and demeanor.

"Live well." Young Master Shang silently thought to himself.

Chapter 1178: White Day Sword Star Appears

After performing for Young Master Shang, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan turned his attention to observing the changes outside the Mortal-Crossing Boat.

At this moment, the Mortal-Crossing Boat had flown to the edge of the world.

The entire Xuanhuang Realm lay beneath, fully visible.

Li Fan had once observed the Xuanhuang Realm from such a perspective. However, back then, the Xuanhuang Realm, just as he had seen in the long-distance teleportation array, was covered by a hazy yellow light, appearing like a large sphere of light. The details of the world within, and the scenery on the ground, were completely indiscernible.

But now, influenced by the immense gravitational pull from the depths of the star sea, a portion of that faint yellow light had been peeled away.

Revealing the true appearance of the world hidden beneath.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan saw the distorted white mist barrier, and…

"A monster stitched together from severed limbs and flesh."

This thought immediately leaped into Li Fan's mind.

Even from the highest heavens, subtle differences between regions could still be discerned. While beings between provinces might find it difficult to distinguish, observing from outside the Xuanhuang Realm, such disharmony was immediately apparent.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan quickly snapped out of his brief daze.

The Mortal-Crossing Boat emitted creaking sounds, a sign of the intense external pressure it was enduring.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan felt no fear. He paid no mind to it and even increased the speed of the Mortal-Crossing Boat.

Upon completely detaching from the Xuanhuang Realm, he felt the surroundings suddenly grow dark.

As if at dusk, the sun had instantly set below the horizon.

Darkness, cold, silence…

All sorts of sensations surged into the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's heart.

The Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation automatically activated, shielding Li Fan from these negative emotions.

"What I learned through images and puppets was indeed different from personal experience."

"Neither the synchronized senses of the puppets nor the lingering influence within the Medicine King Cauldron compares to the reality of this moment."

As the Sacred Embryo Li Fan was thinking this, he suddenly turned his head.

In that brief instant, an inexplicable sense of insecurity arose within him. It felt as though something would suddenly appear from behind and deliver a fatal blow. Even though his divine sense scan clearly indicated no danger behind him, his heart urged him repeatedly to turn around and look for himself.

Only after finally confirming that there was no imagined crisis did the peculiar feeling in his heart slowly subside.

The Mortal-Crossing Boat, which had previously been making faint creaking sounds, was now making loud groaning noises.

As if countless ancient ferocious beasts were constantly battering the hull, cracks began to appear on the boat.

The inscribed formations also began to show signs of shattering.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, however, was already prepared to abandon the boat.

Ninety-nine sword shadows suddenly appeared around him, swirling and continuously cutting out a buffer zone of absolute space.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's body slowly withered, losing its fleshy hue and taking on a strange metallic sheen.

Although the immense force from the depths of the star sea had indeed affected the suction of the Immortal Ruins to a certain extent.

However, the Immortal Ruins were, after all, on their home turf, and some time had passed since the anomaly occurred, greatly diminishing the weakened unknown power of the star sea.

Therefore, the Mortal-Crossing Boat did not drift towards the depths of the star sea like the stone puppets previously deployed.

Instead, it inevitably began to fall towards the Immortal Ruins.

However…

Whether it was the curvature of its altered trajectory or the magnitude of its speed change.

They were vastly different from Li Fan's active charge into the Immortal Ruins with the Medicine King Cauldron previously.

"My guess was indeed correct! This is truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to escape the Xuanhuang Realm!"

Seeing that the Mortal-Crossing Boat was about to completely shatter, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan no longer hesitated.

"All Swords, As I Am!" Behind him, the shadowy figures of thousands of rusty swords from the Sword Tomb faintly appeared, and moments later, these sword shadows all merged into his body.

The pitch-black void surrounding the Mortal-Crossing Boat was illuminated, and a dazzling white light erupted from Li Fan's body.

Completely engulfing him.

Man and sword became one.

Then, a brilliant sword light, as if cleaving the heavens and earth, was instantly unleashed.

The Mortal-Crossing Boat was swallowed by the sword light, disappearing without a trace.

The white sword light, however, turned away from the Immortal Ruins and resolutely headed towards the depths of the star sea!

This sword light was truly too bright, too dazzling.

It even caused a white day star, capable of rivaling the celestial sun, to appear in the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm below.

At this moment, countless cultivators turned their gaze towards Li Fan's location.

And Young Master Shang, in particular, was instantly lost in a daze, a sense of loss filling his heart.

The sword light was peerless, advancing at great speed.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan felt the restraints of the Immortal Ruins diminishing.

The reason for such smooth progress, besides his transformation into the Black Sword Heaven Oddity and unleashing that ultimate sword strike, was more importantly the influence of that mysterious power from the depths of the star sea.

Outside the Xuanhuang Realm, without the interference of the world's various laws.

He could thus more clearly feel the remaining forces in the void.

"Unlike the eternal suction of the Immortal Ruins, this star sea force is like a tide, intermittent and vast."

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan felt waves of immense power surge towards him, even giving him the illusion of being on a small boat, drifting with the waves in a stormy sea.

"Huh? Is that the stone puppet I placed earlier up ahead?"

Not long after advancing through the void, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan once again felt the previously severed telepathic connection.

But what made Li Fan's heart skip a beat was that not all the puppets were still intact.

At least a third of the puppets had disappeared for unknown reasons!

"It's possible they, unfortunately, failed to break free from the shackles of the Immortal Ruins."

"But it's also possible…"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan was accelerating towards the puppets' location.

But suddenly, he subconsciously slowed down.

Because just now, one more puppet among the remaining seventy-four had vanished for no reason!

Right under his senses, under his surveillance! It had vanished mysteriously!

And Li Fan had no idea how that puppet had disappeared!

"Indeed, the Dark Abyss Star Sea is fraught with peril."

A chill inexplicably rose in the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's heart.

Controlling his flight speed, he sent the remaining seventy-three puppets to take the lead, while Li Fan followed far behind.

And subsequently, the puppets that occasionally disappeared without warning served to enlighten Li Fan about the treacherousness of the Dark Abyss Star Sea's void.

As more puppets vanished, Li Fan gradually regained his composure.

"These puppets don't seem to have been attacked by some unknown entity, but rather, the places they passed through are not right."

"There…"

"Even space itself no longer exists. There is only pure emptiness."

"It's like black, bottomless pits on a flat road; if you step into one carelessly, there's no trace of you, alive or dead."

As Li Fan was pondering this, another puppet disappeared.

Only sixty-one remained.

Chapter 1179: Time Discrepancy Within and Without

Li Fan had no idea what the consequences would be if he fell into these voids, nor was there any way to detect their presence. He could only resort to a desperate measure: continuing to send the remaining stone puppets to scout ahead while he himself avoided the paths where the puppets had inexplicably vanished.

As the number of stone puppets dwindled, Li Fan’s heart sank. At this rate of attrition, he feared he would never reach the depths of the Star Sea in this lifetime. However, the catastrophe Li Fan worried about did not occur. When only thirty-three puppets remained, after a long period of flight through the void, the sudden disappearances ceased.

“It seems these voids are not scattered throughout the Dark Star Sea, but are densely clustered in a specific region.”

“Beyond the Xuanhuang Realm?” Li Fan, the Sacred Embryo, mused thoughtfully.

With the thirty-three puppets leading the way, Li Fan’s transformed sword light followed behind, gradually increasing his speed as he advanced into the unknown, pitch-black expanse ahead.

“This is going smoother than I anticipated.”

“I’ve already traveled a considerable distance from the Xuanhuang Realm, yet this sword Dao manifestation of mine, born from the Xuanhuang Realm, doesn’t feel any weaker in power.”

“This is quite interesting.”

Under normal circumstances, without the support of the world’s power, the various laws adrift outside the world would inevitably be weakened to some extent. Yet, this reduction was nowhere to be seen.

Even…

The sword Dao, which had reached its limit in the Xuanhuang Realm and could not be advanced further no matter how much he comprehended, seemed to have its bottleneck loosen after spending a short while in the void. Even though the talent of this Sacred Embryo was not particularly outstanding, he felt thoughts and insights pouring in uncontrollably, as if he had suddenly transformed into some peerless genius.

A strong urge to abandon everything and dedicate all his energy to comprehending the Dao surged within the Sacred Embryo Li Fan. However, he forcefully suppressed it by circulating the Immortal Heart Incantation. This abnormal phenomenon led Li Fan’s thoughts to wander.

“Does the entire Dark Star Sea actually share a single set of laws?”

“The sword Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm is but a part of the common sword Dao of the entire Star Sea.”

“Outside the world, in the void, one can glimpse a broader horizon, and the upper limit is invisibly expanded…”

“As expected, a place where danger and opportunity coexist.”

“It’s likely that the Heavenly Physician and the Doctrine Transmitter often venture into the Dark Star Sea for this very reason.”

Thinking of the Heavenly Physician and the Doctrine Transmitter, Li Fan’s heart grew more somber. In such a short time, he had already gained such remarkable insights. It was hard to imagine what level of attainment those two, who had lived in the Star Sea for thousands of years, must have reached.

The Heavenly Physician’s advice was indeed golden. Even though he had cautiously prepared for the "disease" of the void, it had still befallen Sacred Embryo Li Fan without any warning.

Just as Li Fan was reveling in the joy of his impending breakthrough in sword Dao comprehension, a strange sense of weakness suddenly surged into his heart. Upon examining himself, a black dot indeed appeared within his divine soul. This black dot was like an invader, occupying his original divine soul. No matter how many soul-protecting treasures he had consumed, they could not halt its intrusion, and his methods for nourishing the divine soul were also ineffective.

“The upper limit of my divine soul’s strength has decreased, not that the divine soul itself is damaged.” Sacred Embryo Li Fan said grimly. Fortunately, the black dot was not spreading too quickly, allowing Li Fan to take appropriate countermeasures.

Within his divine soul, a sword shadow appeared. With a flash of brilliant light, it directly severed the portion of his divine soul occupied by the black dot! As the divine soul was split, Sacred Embryo Li Fan’s sword body was also instantly bisected. The part not invaded by the black dot suddenly accelerated, fleeing from its original position. The infected half, however, stopped its advance.

He sat cross-legged in the void, concentrating his mind on comprehending the strange blackness within his weakened divine soul. The pain of splitting his divine soul was indescribable. Even with the Immortal Heart Incantation’s enhancement, Sacred Embryo Li Fan felt his vision darken, nearly passing out. A sense of weakness, even more profound than that caused by the black dot’s invasion, surged into him. He ignored the pain and frailty. He quickly absorbed the essence of the soul-nourishing treasures he had previously refined. Without the suppression of the black dot, Sacred Embryo Li Fan’s clean divine soul slowly began to grow stronger again.

“This is akin to scraping bone to heal a wound,” Li Fan remarked with a sigh. It was only because of the new cultivation methods, their peculiar nature, the indestructible foundation of his cultivation, and the unbroken state of his physical body, combined with his foundation built upon the Azure Nether sword Dao, that he could afford to recklessly sever his own divine soul without immediately becoming senile.

“Unfortunately, without the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven and the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation, relying on external means is ultimately not a long-term solution.”

“With each severance, I become a little weaker than before.”

“…”

“I hope I can last until the depths of the Star Sea,” Li Fan closed his eyes, temporarily clearing his mind of all distractions to heal the wounds to his divine soul.

Meanwhile, the other half of his divine soul, infected by the black dot and left behind in the void, had met its ultimate end. It was a more despairing and terrifying conclusion than dying of old age. It was like a mortal succumbing to Alzheimer’s; the half that was originally comprehending the black dot’s presence began to think slower and slower. Its mind became increasingly dull, and even the actions it intended to perform required long deliberation. Even synchronized consciousness from other parts of his body seemed to be blocked by layers, making comprehension impossible. Ultimately, it completely entered a state of mental stillness, becoming utterly desolate, just like his divine soul.

…

“It’s like this very Dark Star Sea.”

In the Xuanhuang Realm, within the Dharma Deduction space, Li Fan’s main body received the visual information transmitted by his Sacred Embryo and inwardly recoiled. What troubled him was not the intangible voids or the black dot plague in the Star Sea, but the time difference between his main body and the Sacred Embryo.

The Sacred Embryo, embodying himself as a sword and leveraging the power of the Star Sea, had already traveled a considerable distance from the Xuanhuang Realm. Therefore, Li Fan was able to discover that the flow of time between the Xuanhuang Realm and the depths of the Dark Star Sea… was out of sync.

“It seems we are still affected by the Immortal Ruins.”

“Even if it’s not as terrifying as the edges of the Immortal Ruins, where millennia pass in an instant, the flow of time here is still slower than in other parts of the Dark Star Sea.”

“Currently, it’s roughly a one-to-two ratio.”

“And as the Sacred Embryo continues to travel further, this ratio is likely to increase.”

Li Fan’s thoughts began to expand.

“The Dark Star Sea within the The Great Barriers is inevitably affected by the Immortal Ruins to varying degrees.”

“Does this mean that the flow of time inside and outside the The Great Barriers is also different?”

“Is it possible that tens of thousands of years have passed in the Xuanhuang Realm since the catastrophe of the ancient Immortal Path’s severance?”

“But outside the The Great Barriers, in reality…”
