“Has more time already passed?”

As this thought crossed his mind, Li Fan’s eyes involuntarily closed, concealing the faint glint within them.

Chapter 1180: Star Sea Wanderer

(Minor revisions have been made to the end of the previous chapter. Those who read it early should reread it.)

Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council were in confrontation, and various technologies were not developing slowly with endless new methods emerging, this period of rapid development actually lasted for less than three thousand years. Since the great tribulation of the severed immortal path, for tens of thousands of years, the Xuanhuang Realm has been in a state of mutual slaughter and conflict for the vast majority of the time. Civilization regressed instead of progressing.

"If my guess is true, I can hardly imagine what kind of gap would exist between the civilizations inside and outside the The Great Barriers."

A closed civilization, believing itself to be the strongest nation in the world. Then one day, the passage to the outside world is suddenly broken open. Faced with the military might of an enemy that is far ahead by several eras, there is no power to resist, and it is quickly conquered and destroyed. Such events are not uncommon in the history of civilization's development.

Let alone before my transmigration, even now, there are still some pocket worlds that have lost contact with the Xuanhuang Realm and have forgotten the existence of cultivators. They have established prosperous mortal powers, and their glories are recorded in great detail by historians. However, merely one cultivator at the Foundation Establishment stage is enough to easily annihilate the so-called 'prosperous dynasty.'

Li Fan's goal all along has been transcendence and longevity. For this, he has undergone countless reincarnations, all to carve out a path in the Xuanhuang Realm, a place fraught with crisis and impending doom. Ultimately, he intends to leave this dark star sea and head to the outside of the The Great Barriers. But at this moment, the speculation about a possible civilization beyond the The Great Barriers made Li Fan inwardly tremble.

"If a cultivation civilization truly exists and has developed for so many years, it might have mastered power comparable to True Immortals. It might even be able to influence Return to Truth to some extent..."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, his thoughts churning. However, he did not feel fear. Return to Truth was his greatest trump card. The ability to rewind time and again, bringing back memories and experiences to a fixed anchor point, meant that even if the world beyond the The Great Barriers was ten thousand years ahead, he could simply bridge the gap through a few reincarnations.

"I just need to be careful. Until the situation is clarified, I absolutely will not go out in person or use my Sacred Embryo. Prudence above all else!"

"I am not afraid of the monsters that might exist beyond the The Great Barriers, but I fear that there might be nothing outside the The Great Barriers."

...

In the pitch-black void, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, transformed into a sword light, followed closely behind twenty-nine puppets. It had only been slightly more than half a year since he breached the world and departed from the Xuanhuang Realm. From the perspective of the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, he had already been away from the Xuanhuang Realm for a full ten years.

The disparity in time flow intensified as they delved deeper into the star sea. It recently reached its peak, an awe-inspiring fifty to one. But as the Sacred Embryo Li Fan continued to advance, the time difference between his location and the Xuanhuang Realm slowly began to converge again. From fifty to one, it gradually decreased to ten to one, not much different from when he first left the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan knew this was because he was slowly approaching another colossal power source that warped the flow of time.

"The star sea is vast. Even with the aid of this unknown great power, which increased my speed a hundredfold beyond the limit of flying within the Xuanhuang Realm, it still took this long to reach my destination," the Sacred Embryo Li Fan sighed slightly.

During these ten years, he had severed his divine soul more than three hundred times. From a peak state, where he could almost rival a Dao Integration cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm, he was now reduced to the strength of a normal mortal. The suffering he endured was something Li Fan, with his tenacious will, never wished to experience again. Fortunately, in the last few years, perhaps because his strength had weakened to a very feeble state, the infection frequency of the black spots also significantly decreased. Moreover, through the insights gained from over three hundred severances, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan had developed some strategies to cope with this mysterious plague.

"Although I still haven't figured out the principle of its appearance, I can be sure that these black spots are related to the cultivation world that has been destroyed and vanished in this dark star sea."

If any one of these three hundred-plus split souls infected by the black spots alone was not enough for Li Fan to sense anything, then the accumulation of all these withered and dead souls, which he had left behind in the dark star sea, allowed Li Fan to find their commonality. After appearing to be completely dormant, they did not remain in place. Instead, they silently flowed towards different parts of the dark star sea. Their mode of movement was quite mystical; it was not normal movement in space, but more like water droplets naturally rolling from a higher place to a lower one, rapidly traversing the dark star sea. Upon reaching their destinations, they would sequentially and permanently disappear from Li Fan's senses.

"Those locations, in the depths of the star sea between the Xuanhuang Realm and here, seem to overlap with the 'voids' I have passed through." The Sacred Embryo Li Fan looked back, gazing silently.

"It seems that the incredible phenomena in the dark star sea might all be interconnected."

"Then what is the cause of this star sea's power, comparable to the Immortal Ruins? Why did I not sense it at all when I was in the Xuanhuang Realm, and it only suddenly erupted recently?"

Filled with doubt, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan became increasingly curious about the unknown road ahead.

"Hmm?"

While lost in thought, he suddenly became alert and looked forward. The illusion of being watched emerged once more. And this time, it was far more intense than anything he had experienced in the past ten years, making the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's hair stand on end and his heart pound wildly. It was as if something terrifying existed in the darkness ahead!

Li Fan's mind stirred. He first controlled a stone puppet, sending it crashing towards the source of the sensed danger. Immediately after, a sword light was unleashed from a distance. The stone puppet seemed to collide with something, emitting a dull thud. Then, the puppet disappeared from Li Fan's senses. Affected by the weakening of his divine soul, the sword light Li Fan unleashed was far less dazzling than when he first left the Xuanhuang Realm, but it still illuminated the surrounding darkness. A pair of enormous eyes suddenly appeared from the darkness, staring intently at Li Fan. At the same time, a withered, large hand, materialized out of nowhere, reaching for the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, about to snatch him into its palm!

"Damn it!"

After navigating the dark void for over ten years without encountering any other living beings besides himself, Li Fan's heart leaped and his scalp tingled at this sudden encounter with such a terrifying existence! Instinctively, countless sword shadows flew out. Whether it was due to his weakened strength or the monster being too powerful, these sword shadows, capable of splitting mountains and parting seas in the Xuanhuang Realm, caused no damage whatsoever. As he was about to fall completely into the monster's grasp, Li Fan prepared to fight to the death.

But soon, he noticed something was wrong. The giant, withered humanoid form in front of him... possessed no trace of life. Its movements and expression remained frozen in a single pose.

Today, there is only one chapter.

Chapter 1181

“Dead?” Li Fan, still shaken, immediately breathed a sigh of relief.

But the thread of danger still lingering in his heart told him things were not so simple.

As expected, after the several sword lights generated by the Holy Embryo Li Fan touched the corpse ahead, they vanished into the darkness like extinguished candles.

There was no collision roar from beginning to end.

The huge, withered corpse seemed to be a primordial beast hidden in the void, devouring all that dared to approach it.

A spell illuminated the surrounding space once more.

This time, it could be seen more clearly.

The desiccated corpse looked much like a normal human, except for its colossal size.

It stood over thirty feet tall, and its palm alone was larger than Li Fan.

Having drifted in this void for a long time, its clothes had long since rotted away.

However, a closer inspection made the Holy Embryo Li Fan’s heart tremble even more: this mummified corpse…

seemed to be a newborn infant.

Its sparse hair, its teeth not yet grown.

A trinket resembling a longevity lock hung around its neck, and a rotten red string was tied to its ankle.

Its fearful, outstretched posture was like that of a frightened child desperately seeking its parents.

“An infant form, and so enormous. I can hardly imagine its size when grown.”

Li Fan suddenly thought of the Eternal Immortal Bastion beyond the Chizha Abyss.

That fortress in the white mist was also known as Immortal City Broken Palm, because the entire bastion was built from a colossal, ancient Heaven Venerate’s severed palm that floated out of the white mist.

“Perhaps there is some connection between the two,” Li Fan mused inwardly.

After all, he had not seen any records in the Xuanhuang Realm detailing such primordial behemoths.

Although the giant was dead, a sinister, mysterious power still emanated from its body, threatening to drag everything around it down.

“This mysterious power must be the culprit behind its death and the source of my extreme unease.”

The Holy Embryo Li Fan pondered for a moment, a look of determination flashing in his eyes.

Even though he no longer wanted to try, he swung a sword at his divine soul, severing a spiritual manifestation.

“Ah…”

With his divine soul severely weakened, his ability to endure pain plummeted. Li Fan couldn't bear it and let out a pained cry.

His face turned pale, and he gasped for breath.

Without hesitation, he bypassed the giant mummy before him and continued to advance into the depths of the star sea.

The spiritual manifestation left behind, after recovering for a brief moment, voluntarily floated forward and made contact.

As the saying goes, knowing yourself and your enemy ensures victory in a hundred battles. It was foreseeable that the Dark Star Sea would be a place Li Fan would need to venture into for a considerable time. Therefore, rather than blindly avoiding the dangers within, it was better to take the initiative and probe their reality.

In any case, with his main body far away in the Xuanhuang Realm and Return to Truth as a fallback, he had nothing to fear from any unbearable consequences.

Upon being severed, and still some distance from the mummified giant, his vision went black.

He completely lost perception of the outside world.

His consciousness remained, but it felt like being locked in a prison, surrounded by absolute, eternal darkness.

There was no sound, no light, no passage of time.

It was as if he was the only one left in the world.

Even his connection to his Holy Embryo and main body felt increasingly distant and dim.

Meanwhile, Li Fan’s Holy Embryo and main body experienced something peculiar.

Although that spiritual manifestation was a part of himself, the sense of unfamiliarity grew stronger.

More importantly, the boundless loneliness that enveloped the spiritual manifestation began to slowly erode him through the connection between his main body and the manifestation. It was then that Li Fan realized that after being enveloped by darkness, the manifestation’s state seemed to be permanently fixed.

It was as if it had solidified, incapable of any action.

It couldn't even commit suicide.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan’s expression changed slightly, and he sent several sword lights towards the manifestation’s location.

He wanted to sever the connection between the manifestation and himself.

But it was all in vain.

Just like his previous sword lights that touched the mummified giant, all attacks disappeared without a sound.

After several attempts, he had to give up.

Frowning slightly, he sensed the extent of the encroaching boundless loneliness and felt slightly relieved.

The distance in space still played a role in limiting this extremely bizarre existence.

The erosion on his main body was slow.

Based on the current situation, it would not threaten his divine soul’s safety for a hundred years.

However, for the Holy Embryo, being so close, the situation was not optimistic.

It was estimated that he would only last about thirty days before succumbing.

The units of time here were absolute time experienced by each.

“But, as I continuously distance myself, the situation will gradually improve.”

“Although it cannot be avoided, I can gain enough time. As long as I can witness the true face of the power that caused this Azure Nether disturbance, I will not mind dying.”

“Moreover, the primary reason the main body senses the spiritual manifestation is through me. If I disappear, the main body will be safe.”

With this thought, the Holy Embryo Li Fan no longer divided his attention. He controlled the remaining stone puppet and sped towards the depths of the star sea at full throttle.

While flying rapidly, he also pondered the mysterious power that had enveloped the mummified giant and that he had just encountered.

The mysterious power was encroaching upon Li Fan, and Li Fan was using this opportunity to observe it.

“This feeling is not unfamiliar.”

A flash of inspiration struck the Holy Embryo Li Fan, and he already had a guess in mind.

“True Immortal Sigils! Another True Immortal Sigils!”

According to Daoist Bai Hua’s account, the calamities encountered by various realms in the Dark Star Sea were different.

Some were 【Nothingness】, some were 【Chaos】, some were 【Starvation】…

And what the Holy Embryo Li Fan encountered in the void now was clearly another True Immortal Sigils that caused widespread calamity.

“Is it 【Loneliness】? Or perhaps 【Solitude】?”

Li Fan could not know the truth without seeing the actual True Immortal Sigils.

He could only speculate based on the external manifestations of the True Immortal Sigils’s power.

“True Immortal Sigilss wreak havoc across realms. Although it is likely not the true entity, but merely a copied existence, it has still brought devastating disaster to countless cultivation worlds in this starscape.”

“Among these True Immortal Sigilss, the character 【Starvation】 is particularly close to the Great Dao of the Immortal Ruins’ immortals. It gave him inspiration, and he sat in meditation in the ruins of the immortal realm passage, attempting to comprehend the true meaning of the character 【Starvation】.”

“For him, it might have been a momentary epiphany. But it led to the terrifying existence of the Immortal Ruins, plunging the entire starscape into ruin…”

“This is the power of 【Immortals】 above the mortal realm.”

The Holy Embryo’s thoughts surged.

“And now, not far ahead, there exists a being comparable to the power of the Immortal Ruins’ immortals.”

“What could it be?”

One more chapter before 12:30 AM

Chapter 1182

Comparing the rate of time flow with the Xuanhuang Realm, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan could roughly judge the distance to his destination.

When the time flow ratio between the two sides gradually dropped to three to one, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan knew that the unknown being he was seeking was just ahead.

On his path forward, besides the desiccated giant corpse, he encountered other remnants from the ancient, ruined Cultivation World. These included, but were not limited to, the corpses of cultivators and the ruins of buildings.

Li Fan even found some magic artifacts that cultivators had once used. However, having floated in the void for too long, they had all lost their spiritual essence and were unusable.

Yet, judging by the craftsmanship and their external features, these artifacts originated from various different Cultivation Worlds.

These "junk" items, like refuse, seemed to be unaffected by the subtle balance achieved between two forces in the void. They were not drawn towards the Immortal Ruins, nor were they pulled into the depths of the star sea. Instead, they silently remained in this place, as if forgotten by the entire world.

The further he advanced, the more such debris filled the void. Each piece was a testament to the existence of different Cultivation Worlds in the past.

Uncertain if these remnants were still imbued with the power of True Immortal Sigils, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan dared not touch them. He merely controlled his puppet and sword body, constantly evading them. This inevitably slowed his progress.

"Fortunately, my guess was correct. The closer I get to that great power of the star sea, the weaker the 'Solitude' technique's influence on me becomes."

"I have temporarily escaped the danger of being consumed."

However…

The power of True Immortal Sigils was not to be underestimated. Although he hadn't been completely eroded, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan still sensed various changes in his actions and thoughts. For instance, thoughts of isolation and seclusion would arise in his mind without reason. Furthermore, the Black Sword Oddity of the Myriad Immortals, which formed the foundation of his cultivation, had developed a subtle estrangement from him.

In secular terms, this was an inconceivable matter. After all, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan had absorbed it and made it a part of his own Dao foundation; they were essentially one. As the person was the sword, and the sword was the person. Yet, the power of True Immortal Sigils could forcibly revert this fusion.

"A complete and utter solitary individual?"

"Loneliness?"

An unsettling feeling began to surface in the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's heart. Would this power of solitude affect his main body and his "Return to Truth"? Although "Return to Truth" possessed a sufficiently high status, his main body's current strength was still unsatisfactory. Even the slightest possibility was a risk Li Fan could not afford.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan slowly began to make a decision. "Even if it means wasting this opportunity for exploration, I cannot let the power of solitude affect my main body. Before any signs appear, I will end my own life."

With this thought, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan swallowed the last of his soul-nourishing treasures and activated the Soul Burning Art. His speed abruptly increased, allowing him to rapidly weave through the gaps between the debris scattered throughout the void.

These relics from ancient Cultivation Worlds formed an endless ocean, seemingly without end. The nurturing energy within him was almost depleted, yet he still hadn't managed to break free from the expanse of this sea.

"These miscellaneous items can be preserved…"

"Then, perhaps the remnants of past Cultivation Worlds can also be preserved in a relatively intact state?"

As he drifted amidst this ocean of relics, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan suddenly recalled the actions of the Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, who had transported world fragments from the star sea to mend the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Who's there?"

Just as he was lost in thought, Li Fan's heart suddenly tightened, as he sensed a divine sense lock onto him from the void!

He let out a loud shout, looking towards the source of the lock. The sensation vanished instantly. He only saw a blurred figure flickering rapidly and disappearing into the darkness.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, with a somber expression, arrived at the location where the figure had previously appeared.

"Not some mysterious and eerie existence, but a living person?"

"In this ultimate dark star sea, besides the Xuanhuang Realm, are there other Cultivation Civilizations that have survived?"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan was immensely shocked. Not only because of the aura of the figure he sensed, but also because the other party had deliberately left behind a message. To Li Fan, it seemed somewhat peculiar, a trace of divine sense that only cultivators could leave, and it was not obvious.

"Bing San, Seven Days Shuò?"

"Jiu?"

Li Fan looked at these short phrases, sinking into contemplation.

"It must be some kind of code. But this common script of the cultivation world... it's definitely a surviving cultivator."

Although he hadn't yet encountered the great power of the star sea that caused the Xuanhuang Realm's tremors, knowing that other civilizations still existed in the star sea was of great significance to Li Fan.

"For so many years, to survive in this ultimate dark star sea, besides possessing sufficient resources for survival, the most crucial factor is the ability to resist the pull of the Immortal Ruins. This location, situated at a subtle point of balance between the two forces, has created a safe zone."

"This also implies…"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's gaze flickered. Looking at the divine sense message left by the unknown cultivator, he was very cautious and did not reply.

"The great power of the star sea, capable of rivaling the Immortal Ruins, did not suddenly appear recently."

"It's just that due to some change, it has suddenly intensified its outbreak, thus being sensed by the Xuanhuang Realm, which is far outside the Immortal Ruins."

"..."

The figures of the Immortal Ruins and the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate reappeared in Li Fan's vision. These two had traveled extensively in the ultimate dark star sea for a long time and would undoubtedly have known about this.

"Interesting."

Due to the power of solitude, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's heart had grown somewhat cold. Upon learning of this new spark of civilization, it began to stir once more. However, Li Fan forcefully suppressed it.

"Even if I haven't made contact yet, surviving in such a harsh environment clearly indicates they are not easy to get along with."

"Moreover, the laws in the ultimate dark star sea are more complete than those in the Xuanhuang Realm. The upper limit is higher. These people have been here for so long…"

"Their strength should not be underestimated."

However, Li Fan did not feel any concern for the Xuanhuang Realm. The Xuanhuang Realm was teeming with monsters and was further bolstered by the New Law of the Doctrine Transmitter. In contrast, this sea of ruins was barren. If a conflict were to erupt between the two sides, the Xuanhuang Realm would undoubtedly crush them.

"Perhaps I'm overthinking it. Given the immense distance, without a fortunate coincidence, even encountering each other would be a luxury."

Temporarily casting aside the thought of a caged battle between the two surviving civilizations in the ultimate dark star sea, Li Fan's immediate problem was his dwindling time. Should he continue further into the sea of ruins to search for the source of the star sea's great power, or should he attempt to make contact with the civilization here?

Without excessive deliberation, after a brief period of contemplation, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan made his decision. He chose the latter.

"They have lived here for a long time and must have a deeper understanding of that great power of the star sea."

"Rather than blindly rushing about like a headless fly, it's better to seek knowledge from others."

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan's eyes flickered.

Chapter 1183: The Depths of the Forgotten Sea Hide Secrets

Though he had already decided to seek information about the power of the starry sea from this other surviving civilization, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan did not recklessly rush forward.

After all, he had traversed more than half of the deepest starry sea, constantly severing his divine soul to resist the corruption of the void's black spot disease, which had greatly weakened his strength. If his attempt to gather information failed and he was instead captured by the other party, wouldn't that be a colossal joke?

"Since a civilization can survive here, there should be methods to avoid the various strange corruptions in the void. I will first go into hiding, slowly recover my strength, and then make my plans."

In an instant, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan had made his decision. He first touched a point between his eyebrows, establishing a restriction within his already extremely frail divine soul. If there was any sign of trouble, he could self-destruct, and his soul would instantly scatter and vanish.

Afterward, Li Fan concealed his figure and began to explore this sea of forgotten remnants. He did not follow the suspicious figure he had encountered earlier, fearing it might be a trap to lure him deeper. Instead, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan chose a different direction and turned to explore further.

"This void is fraught with danger. If there are cultivators hiding, they must need protection through formations and restrictions. I only need to find these traces, and I can follow the clues. My mastery of formations is generations ahead of the Xuanhuang Realm; here, I should be unrivaled."

This was Li Fan's initial thought. However, after searching for more than ten days in the sea of forgotten remnants, he found no trace of any civilization using formations or restrictions. He hadn't even sensed a sliver of life. This made the Sacred Embryo Li Fan begin to doubt if the ethereal figure he had encountered earlier was just his imagination. But he did not give up easily, like a patient hunter, he remained hidden in the shadows, waiting for his prey to appear.

Seventeen more days passed, and he finally had a breakthrough. He discovered a small team of three cultivators, clad in strange armor, walking back-to-back with great caution. The way they appeared was also quite astonishing to Li Fan. The silent, dead remnants floating in the void shifted position, and then a passage appeared out of thin air. After the three emerged, the dead remnants returned to their original positions, and the passage's entrance closed.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, surveying his surroundings and observing all the surrounding cultivator remnants. A moment later, he came to a sudden realization.

"Brilliant! It's not isolated formations, but rather modifications made on the basis of these naturally floating remnants, almost completely integrated with the surrounding environment."

"And more importantly..."

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan slowly approached these floating remnants.

"These items from the destroyed cultivation world are, more or less, tainted with the power of True Immortal Sigilss. This forms a natural defense, capable of maximizing the shielding of cultivators' divine senses from perception. This is why I searched so diligently but still couldn't find their hiding place..." Li Fan instantly understood.

In reality, the exquisiteness of the formation was mediocre. However, after being mixed with and infused with the power of those True Immortal Sigilss that caused the destruction of various realms, its level suddenly ascended by more than one tier. Even with Li Fan's current mastery of formations, he had no good method to break it.

Of course, if he were to disregard the potential side effects of these remnants and forcibly break the formation, he could do it. However, doing so would go against his plan of lurking and gathering information. Li Fan glanced at the entrance of the hidden passage and finally gave up the idea of forcing his way in. Instead, he followed behind the three cultivators, carefully observing them.

Aside from their peculiar armor, the three cultivators looked no different from the inhabitants of the Xuanhuang Realm. Their outing this time seemed to be to search for supplies in this sea of forgotten remnants. However, the items they were looking for seemed strange to Li Fan. There appeared to be no commonality; they targeted everything from broken magic artifact fragments to pieces of architectural ruins, and even some cultivator's skeletal remains. They did not directly store them in storage rings but instead tied them together with a black rope and dragged them behind them.

"This scene..." Li Fan was slightly stunned. It reminded him of how the Dharma-Preachers transported fragments of worlds in the void with golden chains. "Could there be a connection?"

Half a day later, after the remnants they dragged behind them had accumulated to more than twenty items, a disagreement arose among the three cultivators. However, they eventually abandoned their search under the leadership of the one in front. With their gathered goods, they turned and flew towards the passage entrance.

Seeing this, Li Fan stealthily followed them. The scope of their outing seemed to have a boundary; they had not ventured far from their hiding place. Soon, they arrived back at the hidden passage. One of the cultivators' armor suddenly began to flash with light in a rhythmic pattern. Li Fan sensed a subtle rhythmic fluctuation emanating from the armor. As if triggering a mechanism, the surrounding dead remnants shifted rapidly, and a circular entrance quietly appeared. The three cultivators, pulling their more than twenty items together, flew into it.

Li Fan, concealing his presence, intended to follow them in. Unexpectedly, as he reached the entrance of the passage, a piercing alarm suddenly blared. Li Fan's heart skipped a beat. He attached a spiritual manifestation he had prepared beforehand to one of the items. His main body, however, rapidly retreated backward. Because of the spiritual manifestation's presence, the alarm did not cease as the Sacred Embryo Li Fan retreated.

The three cultivators nervously scanned their surroundings. Finding no sign of an invading enemy, they turned their attention to the items they had collected this time. After a brief discussion, they separated these items and attempted to bring them in one by one. Ultimately, they found the one to which Li Fan's spiritual manifestation was attached. Instead of destroying it, they forcefully hurled it towards the depths of the sea of forgotten remnants. With the source of the threat gone, the warning sound stopped. The three then turned back.

Not far away, watching the passage entrance slowly close, Li Fan ultimately did not choose to force his way in. "Interesting. Their warning system could detect me." His eyes flickered, and he approached the discarded remnant. "As expected, there's something peculiar. On the surface, the influence of the True Immortal Sigilss remains. But in reality, the attached power is negligible." "After all this time, my frail spiritual manifestation has not been harmed..."

Recalling the spiritual manifestation back into his body, Li Fan casually picked up the remnant and observed it closely again. It appeared to be a flag-like magic artifact, but the flag itself had rotted, leaving only a bare flagpole. Its spiritual essence was lost, rendering it incapable of performing its original function. "Why are they collecting these things?"

Chapter 1184: Primal Force of Immortals

The material of this command banner artifact was also quite ordinary, holding no particular value for selection within this sea of relics.

"Could it be for the power of the True Immortal Sigils whose side effects have already faded?" Li Fan's heart stirred, and he immediately understood.

Gently stroking the command banner, he sensed a familiar aura. "The Chaos Seal…"

"It's just that as time flows, even the power of a True Immortal Sigils will eventually reach its end."

The complete character for "Chaos" instantly appeared in his mind. A moment later, the Saint Embryo Li Fan's hand holding the command banner stiffened slightly.

This was because he realized that just now, the last trace of power attached to the command banner had completely dissipated.

In its place, his own comprehension of the "The Chaos Seal" had subtly deepened!

This improvement was extremely minute. However, Li Fan's understanding of the character "Chaos" was still at the most basic level of imitation, so the change appeared relatively obvious. It was instantly captured by Li Fan.

"It can actually serve as material for comprehending the Dao?" The Saint Embryo Li Fan couldn't help but be a little shaken. He now looked at the countless floating relics in the area with a completely different gaze.

"However, it's regrettable that it seems only relics with the power of True Immortal Sigilss on the verge of dissipation can be used as nourishment for comprehending the Dao; otherwise, there's a risk of being harmed. The method to distinguish them…"

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's gaze shifted towards the hidden dwelling.

For the next half a year, Li Fan remained hidden in the darkness. Every time cultivators went out to collect relics, he would replicate his method. He would send out a divine manifestation attached to the collected relics.

One purpose was to study how the alarm was triggered, and the other was to acquire all enlightened relics containing True Immortal Sigilss.

In the Xuanhuang Realm, within the sea of consciousness of his main body, the Primordial Void Formation was analyzing the unknown formation with all its might.

Through his research on the eight obtained relics, the Saint Embryo Li Fan became even more certain of his judgment. The surviving civilizations in this Dark Abyss Star Sea collected these relics to study, and even utilize, the power of True Immortal Sigilss.

"They can actually distinguish the degree of this power…"

"It seems their strength here is not to be underestimated."

Of these eight relics, three came from "Chaos," and two from "Starvation." As for the remaining two, they were influenced by other, as yet unknown, True Immortal Sigilss.

Li Fan also discovered the differences within them. He had personally witnessed the original forms of the True Immortal Sigilss "Chaos" and "Starvation." Even if they were imitations written by unknown hands, he had still gained a general understanding of their origin. Therefore, he could smoothly absorb the residual power on the enlightened relics and use it as nourishment for comprehending the Dao.

The situation with the other two relics was completely different. Relying solely on the dissipating residual power, it was difficult even to sense their nature, let alone comprehend their essence. The efficiency of using them was tens of thousands of times less than that of "Chaos" and "Starvation"!

"This is the difference between going from top to bottom and from bottom to top. Knowing the true meaning of the True Immortal Sigils allows one to understand everything from a superior position."

"Whereas starting from ignorance, like a blind man touching an elephant, one must slowly explore and research…"

"It's as difficult as ascending to heaven! To attempt to explore the power of True Immortals with mortal strength…"

At the same time, Li Fan mused thoughtfully. "Not all cultivators have enough fortune to be fortunate enough to witness the true meaning of True Immortal Sigilss with their own eyes."

"The 'The Chaos Seal' is hidden within the Inverted Reflection Maze in the misty white fog, something ordinary people might never encounter in a lifetime. As for the 'Starvation Character Art,' it is inscribed on the Immortal Ruins! To see it is to die. If I hadn't possessed Return to Truth, I wouldn't have been able to master it."

"And the 'Nothingness' character art, I also discovered it by chance within a destroyed pocket world's golden skull…"

Li Fan looked at the unknown civilization hidden in the shadows, and a thought naturally arose. "As the saying goes, rare goods are precious. The value of these original true meanings in this civilization might be even higher than I imagined."

…

More than thirty days later, the Primordial Void Formation finally broke through the method of triggering the warning.

To be safe, the Saint Embryo Li Fan did not take the risk himself. Instead, he still used a divine manifestation to test. Over the past half-year, although he had cut off many divine souls, the area near the civilization's hidden location seemed to contain some peculiar power. It could resist all sorts of strange intrusions in the void, thus the Saint Embryo Li Fan's recovery speed was also very fast. Cutting off a divine manifestation only caused him a slight pain now.

The Primordial Void Formation was indeed trustworthy. This time, the relic attached by the divine manifestation successfully passed through the inspection and entered the interior of the passage. The sense of connection became much weaker, but he could still vaguely perceive the situation inside the hidden location.

The team of three collecting relics continued to drag the items forward with a black rope. After passing through three layers of passage defenses, they finally entered a safe zone. They eagerly took off their armor, complaining incessantly.

"There are fewer and fewer useful relics near the Immortal Boat. We only found this much this time…"

"For the next mission, we'll probably have to leave the safe zone."

"Have we been stationed here for a hundred years? I wonder why we haven't moved yet."

"I heard there was originally a plan to change our anchorage point, but a while ago…"

"Hush, it's better to discuss it less. Wu Xing was confined for ten years because of this matter." The three wisely avoided the topic.

Carrying their gains from this trip, they continued deeper into the hidden location.

"Immortal Boat?" Li Fan mused upon hearing their words.

After a stretch of narrow, dim passage, the view ahead suddenly opened up, revealing a valley of picturesque mountains and clear waters. A white-haired old man stood waiting for the three of them, holding a strange artifact resembling a book.

"Let me see what we have this time…" The old man's face was initially smiling, but it immediately turned grim when he saw the quantity of relics behind the three.

"Elder, please forgive us. Our luck was truly bad on this outing," the oldest-looking cultivator among the three said with a wry smile.

The old man shook his head and sighed. In the end, he didn't say much more. The book-like artifact in his hand emitted a beam of light, enveloping all the relics. As the beam retracted, it seemed the inspection of the relics was complete.

"Try to make up for it next time," the old man snorted. "You all know the situation with the Immortal Boat. If we have one or two fewer items each time, it might be alright in the short term. But if it goes on for too long, who will suffer in the end? All of us?"

The elder cultivator did not retort, only nodding repeatedly. "Take these relics to the 'Immortal Severing Tower'," the old man instructed.

Chapter 1185: The Dark Gold Three-Eyed Skull

The three cultivators were slightly stunned upon hearing the elder’s request.

“Elder Gou, this does not comply with the rules…”

“Hmm?” The elder coldly scrutinized them upon hearing this.

The three could only swallow their words.

Necessity dictated their actions. The elder cultivator cupped his hands and, after securing the remains, they left the valley.

On the way.

“Brother Zhao, the Immortal Ship’s laws clearly state that after collected remains from world destruction are found, they must be handed over to the Immortal Pivot, and those who violate this law shall be punished for treason. Now he’s ordering us to deliver them to the Immortal Severing Tower instead…”

“Exactly, everyone on the Immortal Ship knows that the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot are at odds. That old fellow wants to curry favor with the Immortal Severing Tower, so he’s not doing it himself and is just ordering us around. If anything goes wrong, we’ll definitely be held responsible.”

The elder cultivator, referred to as Brother Zhao, also had an unkind expression, but he did not participate in the complaining. Instead, he signaled with his eyes for the other two to shut up.

Afterward, he seemed to have transmitted some message silently, and only then did the two become obedient.

The three did not fly through the air but walked out of the valley step by step along a small path.

The scenery before them suddenly changed, as if they had returned to the starry void.

However, this void was not as cold and dead as the outer dark starry sea.

A gentle breeze blew from the void, bringing vitality.

Faintly, one could see colorful starlight flashing intermittently.

In stark contrast to this harmonious and warm scene was an incredibly bizarre sight: a colossal giant, standing tall in the void.

Its eyes were tightly shut, and its body was shriveled, like a zombie that had been dead for a long time.

Yet, its chest rose and fell continuously, and its breaths carried warm winds that blew in all directions.

If it were merely a dying giant, it would have been passable. However, what was horrifying was a thick branch extending from the giant’s mouth.

It grew upward stubbornly, forming a dense canopy.

Upon closer inspection, the giant’s entire body was pierced through by branches and twigs. The lower half of the giant’s body had even transformed into countless interwoven, thread-like roots.

They swayed with the wind from time to time, like living things.

This bizarre spectacle, whether it was a tree parasitizing a person or a person transforming into a tree, was something the three had long grown accustomed to. They merely sighed, "It seems this 'Dao Pursuer' giant is nearing its end. I wonder what else the Immortal Pivot can come up with.”

“The Immortal Severing Tower speaks better than it sings, claiming to completely solve the Immortal Ship’s energy problems. They’ve been saying this for so long, yet there have been no effective results.”

“Let’s wait and see. It is rumored that there has been a revolutionary breakthrough this time, otherwise that scoundrel elder wouldn’t have shown such sudden favor.”

…

The few chatted leisurely.

When they left the valley and soared into the void, a green luminescence suddenly appeared beneath their feet, forming an aerial path leading to another place.

There was no need to fly; this green path was already moving rapidly.

Upon reaching the void, the general appearance of the Immortal Ship finally came into view.

Floating continents, resembling a configuration of celestial bodies, were distributed throughout the area.

Giants, parasitized by strange trees, existed in the void.

From the giant trees, countless green thread-like paths extended, appearing and disappearing, connecting various continents.

Li Fan’s divine sense, hidden within the remains of world destruction, was secretly observing all of this.

This form of immortal cultivation civilization, so different from the Xuanhuang Realm, piqued his interest.

“Immortal Ship…”

“The ancestor of the Medicine King Sect, Sun Piao Miao, once ventured beyond the heavens and recorded information on eighteen immortal cultivation realms. Among them was a massive spaceship that drifted in the void, traveling between realms for trade. It was a world in itself, named the Mystic Merchant.”

“I wonder if it has any connection to this Immortal Ship.”

Li Fan then looked at the giant, whose life force was constantly being drawn out and dispersed into the surroundings, “Are they of the Dao Pursuer clan?”

The green, formless path moved extremely fast through the void. It didn’t take long for the group, including the cultivator surnamed Zhao, to arrive at what was called the Immortal Severing Tower.

It was a circular sphere of dark golden light.

Upon closer inspection, it was, surprisingly, also built upon the remains of a giant.

However, it was not a complete corpse this time, but a single, massive skull.

What shook Li Fan’s divine sense was that in the center of the skull, there was still an eyeball!

The eyeball had not lost its life force with the death of the skull.

It was just tightly shut, continuously rotating slightly.

A sense of danger, unbidden, arose in Li Fan’s heart. His divine sense immediately decided to escape from the world destruction remains it had possessed.

It remained in the void, not following the three into the Immortal Severing Tower.

His judgment was correct.

The enormous eyeball suddenly opened and scanned its surroundings. Finding no anomalies, it closed again.

Only then were the three cultivators, including the one surnamed Zhao, able to enter the Immortal Severing Tower.

Li Fan’s divine sense did not linger on the three-eyed skull but patiently waited for them to return outside the Immortal Severing Tower in the void.

“Dark gold skull, three eyes.”

“It’s very similar to the one I encountered when I discovered the Nothingness Script. Although this one on the Immortal Ship…”

“Seems a bit weaker?”

Bigger did not necessarily mean stronger.

The dark gold three-eyed skull Li Fan encountered before, even though its third eye was completely gone and it had purely become a cultivation medium for the gray mold of the Nothingness Script, still gave Li Fan an extremely dangerous feeling—as if it could resurrect at any moment. Therefore, Li Fan had always sealed it with Seven-Colored Divine Light, not daring to research it foolishly.

Although the three-eyed skull before him was much larger, and even its eyeball was alive, it gave Li Fan the distinct feeling that it was thoroughly dead and had no chance of revival.

This was an inexplicable intuition.

“I haven’t encountered many things outside the Xuanhuang Realm in my cycles of reincarnation, yet I’ve encountered almost all of them since arriving here.”

“It seems this Immortal Ship indeed has its peculiarities.”

“Without complete world resources, they would inevitably have to obtain sustenance from the dark starry sea, making the most of everything. It seems the foundation of this Immortal Ship might be far beyond my imagination…”

Li Fan’s thoughts raced, constantly calculating from where to make a breakthrough.

From the conversation of the three cultivators, he learned that the Immortal Ship seemed to be caught in a power struggle between the Immortal Pivot and the Immortal Severing Tower recently.

This situation was a welcome development for Li Fan, an outsider.

“Only in troubled waters can one fish. I need to find a way to stir up some chaos on this Immortal Ship.”

Not long after, the three cultivators, including the one surnamed Zhao, emerged from the Immortal Severing Tower.

Contrary to their disgruntled demeanor on arrival, this time they all wore joyous expressions, with uncontrollable excitement in their eyes.

Standing on the green, formless path, they only began to discuss heatedly once they reached the center of the void.

“I never expected the Immortal Severing Tower to actually find a way to utilize the power of world destruction!”

“There are endless remains in the void, so we really don’t have to worry about running out of energy anymore!”

“Now we can sit back and watch the show!”

Chapter 1186

"Yes, the Celestial Pivot Department has always disagreed with research into the power of world destruction, and has fiercely suppressed it for many years. Countless cultivators have become nourishment for the [Divine Tree] because of this. If they hadn't been completely unable to hold out in recent years, I don't think they would have compromised."

"Thinking about it this way, the Immortal Severing Tower made such significant progress in just over five hundred years. The Celestial Pivot Department has been in power for nearly ten thousand years and has achieved nothing. It has caused the Immortal Boat to deteriorate day by day. The Celestial Pivot Department truly deserves to die."

"The sky of the Immortal Boat is about to change. We brothers should make plans early. Perhaps we can seize this opportunity to shed our criminal status..."

The three exchanged glances, seeing the ambition in each other's eyes.

However, their hushed whispers ceased in the empty, uninhabited space.

When they returned to their original valley, they became silent and appeared resentful.

After reporting to Elder Gou, they settled down in a wooden house in the valley.

A total of one hundred cultivators resided there.

Periodically, some of them would venture out of the Immortal Boat to collect relics of world destruction.

The people of the Immortal Boat seemed extremely afraid of the outside Primordial Star Sea, appearing anxious and uneasy before each mission.

The task of collecting relics indeed had a high mortality rate.

It wasn't that they suffered actual harm in the outer sea of the Immortal Boat, but rather that each excursion seemed to significantly shorten the lifespans of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants.

This cultivator surnamed Zhao, Zhao Tianjiang, had visibly deeper wrinkles on his face after two such excursions.

"No wonder I don't see many young cultivators here; they're all middle-aged and elderly," Li Fan realized, suddenly enlightened.

The hundred or so people in the valley did not cultivate on a daily basis.

Apart from undertaking the task of collecting relics, they had nothing else to do.

From their daily conversations, Li Fan gathered a large amount of information about the Immortal Boat.

This valley was called the [Valley of Suppressed Crimes] by them, a place of exile for cultivators who had violated the Immortal Boat's laws but whose crimes were not severe enough for death.

Collecting relics of world destruction was a way to atone for their sins.

Once they had made amends for their crimes, they could leave this place and return to a normal life.

Through their hopeful words, Li Fan glimpsed the daily lives of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants.

All matters, large and small, on the Immortal Boat were managed by the [Celestial Pivot Department].

Ordinary inhabitants of the Immortal Boat did not have to worry about survival; the Celestial Pivot Department provided a fixed amount of survival resources annually.

However, these were merely enough to sustain life.

The Immortal Boat strictly controlled its total population and the number of cultivators.

Not only was reproduction subject to approval, but cultivation slots were also strictly limited.

Besides obtaining cultivation qualifications through a lottery, one could also earn them by making outstanding contributions to the Immortal Boat, such as by salvaging relics of world destruction.

In this Valley of Suppressed Crimes, the vast majority of people had no cultivation.

That was why they harbored such great fear of venturing outside.

As mortals, they could move freely and remain immortal in the Primordial Star Sea because of the specially made Immortal Armor from the Celestial Pivot Department they wore during their missions.

Besides ensuring their safety, this armor could also identify which relics were qualified for exchange as merit points.

As for the exact purpose of the Celestial Pivot Department's acquisition of these relics of world destruction...

The common folk of the Immortal Boat naturally had no idea.

..."It seems that this Immortal Boat is even more fragmented than the Xuanhuang Realm."

"There is limited information to be gathered by staying here. I need to find a way to leave this place."

The power of his divine sense was currently too weak to withstand any significant expenditure.

It was almost impossible for him to traverse the void of the Immortal Boat on his own.

The invisible green path in the void only appeared when permitted; any attempt to approach the void without authorization would result in a fatal fall, turning them into nourishment for the Immortal Boat.

Therefore, Li Fan's divine sense had been lying dormant, waiting for an opportunity. However, instead of an opportunity, he awaited a catastrophe.

The cause was that Zhao Tianjiang and the two other cultivators he was lurking near suddenly fell ill.

Initially, Zhao Tianjiang thought he was just tired and stayed in bed for several days.

Later, he found he could no longer sleep, and his body began to itch, making him restless.

Zhao Tianjiang seemed to recall something, and boundless fear surged into his eyes.

However, he did not mention this to others.

He even suppressed his discomfort, showed himself to others several times, and proactively applied to go out and collect relics.

Later, as he began to cough uncontrollably and black spots appeared on his skin, Zhao Tianjiang hid in his room and refused to come out.

He held a jade token-like artifact, doing something unknown.

Afterward, blood began to flow from all his orifices, and the scent of blood spread, finally making the situation impossible to conceal.

"Alas. There isn't much time left. It's best to send him back to reunite with his family."

"Truly, fate is unpredictable. Old Zhao was the fittest among us, yet he couldn't escape contracting the void's mysterious illness."

"He even hid his condition for a time, just to earn more merit points for young Zhao before he died..."

The crowd sighed, showing expressions of shared misfortune.

Elder Gou, however, showed no emotional fluctuation. He merely handled the matter professionally and sent Zhao Tianjiang away.

Soon, the Immortal Boat sent someone to replace Zhao Tianjiang in the Valley of Suppressed Crimes.

After Zhao Tianjiang's death, the other two cultivators with whom he had been associated soon began to show symptoms and tragically died.

In the Valley of Suppressed Crimes, everyone lamented their bad luck.

However, only Li Fan knew that their successive deaths from the so-called void's mysterious illness were likely due to his divine sense lurking nearby for an extended period.

"The bodies of these Immortal Boat inhabitants..."

"Are so fragile. They cannot even withstand a trace of void aura carried by my divine sense. If my true body were to enter, wouldn't I be a destructive source of contagion?"

Li Fan was speechless.

He hadn't intended to take the lives of the three. It was simply that he had traversed a large portion of the Primordial Star Sea and remained in the void for too long.

His divine soul had likely been tainted by some mysterious power from the void.

Although his divine soul was resilient and immune to these strange powers, these fragile Immortal Boat inhabitants might not be.

In the Valley of Suppressed Crimes, time seemed to pass like ten years, unchanging.

The entire Immortal Boat felt like stagnant water, devoid of any ripple.

The opportunity Li Fan's divine sense had been waiting for never arrived.

Until this day...

Elder Gou, who was usually stern and unsmiling, suddenly changed his demeanor.

He summoned all the personnel in the Valley of Suppressed Crimes.

They were all led out of the valley, seemingly to await the arrival of some important figure.

The valley dwellers were filled with trepidation, while Li Fan's divine sense sensed a powerful aura rapidly approaching from afar.

"Dao Integration stage?"

"More than that. But it doesn't have the oppressive feel of the Longevity Realm."

"Hmm? And it's mixed with a trace of the power of True Immortal Sigils?"

Chapter 1187: Solo Infiltration of the Immortal Boat

"It's the character 'Starvation'…"

Li Fan's divine sense made a quick judgment based on the subtle fluctuations emanating from the Dao Integration cultivator on the immortal boat not far away.

He did not approach closely, but instead observed from within the wooden house.

"Elder Yan…" Elder Gou, who usually maintained a stern expression, was now bowing and fawning.

The people in the valley grumbled inwardly but dared not show it, even lowering their heads and avoiding direct eye contact with the Dao Integration cultivator before them. After all, in the eyes of mortals, Dao Integration cultivators were almost indistinguishable from legendary immortals.

"Gou Liang, I heard that five people died consecutively in the Valley of Suppressed Crimes not long ago?" Elder Yan asked in a deep voice.

Gou Liang trembled, quickly replying, "Yes, that is true. It was merely bad luck for those few sinners. They only went out to work two or three times before their conditions worsened and they died. The Valley of Suppressed Crimes itself encountered no disturbances…"

"Hmph! What luck…" A cold glint flashed in Elder Yan's eyes, without further explanation.

His immense divine sense instantly enveloped the entire Valley of Suppressed Crimes.

"As expected, this place has been contaminated."

Elder Yan's expression turned grim. A speck of starlight appeared at his fingertip, and he pointed it remotely towards Li Fan's divine sense, the residential area of the Valley of Suppressed Crimes.

Endless light and heat destroyed everything within the range.

…

Outside the immortal boat.

Li Fan's nascent soul, hidden and comprehending in seclusion, slightly raised his head.

"As expected of a civilization that has survived for so long in the Sea of Utter Darkness, they are so cautious."

"It seems that to infiltrate, I must first solve the problem of being a major source of contagion. Otherwise, no matter how well I hide, if people around me start dying in large numbers, I will be exposed."

"My divine soul has been in the Sea of Utter Darkness for too long. The accumulation is too great, and it's difficult to recover. I must branch off a wisp of divine sense to infiltrate. With the previous experience, I can do it like this…"

For the next two full months, no one from the immortal boat ventured out to collect world-destroying relics.

However, they clearly could not abandon the nearly endless relics outside.

Thus, Li Fan finally waited for a new collection team.

Following the previous experience, Li Fan's divine sense mixed in with the relics and entered the immortal boat.

However, this time, the immortal boat's handling of the relics was noticeably more cautious. When dealing with the relics, the immortal boat cultivators consistently wore armor. After transporting the relics to a sealed space, a vague talisman phantom appeared above the space after they left.

"What is this…"

The talisman emitted a faint radiance, illuminating the dozen or so relics below.

Li Fan's divine sense, though bathed in the light, was unaffected.

He merely watched as the power of the True Immortal Sigils, about to dissipate from the surrounding relics, was absorbed by the talisman phantom above through the illusory light.

Li Fan's divine sense even felt that the various mysterious powers surrounding him were being absorbed by the talisman.

It did not take long for the powers attached to the dozen or so relics to completely disappear, turning them into worthless junk in the star sea.

The talisman's faint light flickered and departed from the space.

"The extent to which the immortal boat utilizes the power of the True Immortal Sigils is even higher than I imagined."

The space was completely sealed, and Li Fan's divine sense could not escape. However, he was not in a hurry.

Someone would surely come to deal with the remaining "rubbish."

Just as Li Fan had predicted, two days later, two Qi Refining cultivators entered, led by a Foundation Establishment cultivator.

"Move all these things onto the boat."

"Be careful. Although the world-destroying power of these things is gone, they are still genuine old relics. To have survived in the star sea for so long means their materials themselves are extraordinary. Take them all to the Star Forging Workshop. Perhaps they can be repurposed," instructed the Foundation Establishment cultivator.

The two Qi Refining cultivators were only about fifteen or sixteen years old, appearing quite inexperienced.

Li Fan's divine sense pondered for a moment and attached itself to one of them.

Following the three, they left the sealed space and took a small flying boat to the so-called Star Forging Workshop.

It was a sealed, annular building constructed from an unknown white metal.

In the center of the ring was a scorching fireball.

The terrifying heat waves constantly churning on the surface of the fireball spoke of the immense energy contained within.

Vaguely, one could see wisps of flame being drawn into a small hole in the annular building.

The one responsible for reception in the Star Forging Workshop was not of ordinary human appearance.

Instead, it was a strange being, half-human and half-beast, entirely scarlet, with two horns on its head and a long tail dragging behind it.

The three seemed quite fearful of it. After placing their items down, they hastily piloted the flying boat away.

After much effort, they finally returned to their residence.

It was located in the Academy of Proving the Dao.

It was a separate continent floating in the void.

The academy soared high, piercing the clouds.

They arrived at the lower levels of the academy to report back to their master.

The master of the three was a Nascent Soul cultivator named Zhao Wuji, who was already white-haired.

Upon seeing the three return, he put away the book-like magic artifact he was reading and asked with a kindly expression, "Have you handled everything?"

The three bowed their heads and replied, "Reporting to Master, everything has been properly handled."

"Do you know why I asked you to make this special trip?" Zhao Wuji asked again.

The three were stunned, unsure how to answer.

"Not long ago, the Valley of Suppressed Crimes was razed to the ground. The survivors were all taken away and isolated for observation. It is said that the incident was caused by improper relic collection by the group from the Valley of Suppressed Crimes, leading to the spread of 'world-destroying power.'"

"Heh heh…"

"This procedure was established by the Immortal Pivot Department, and it has always been this way for the past thousand years. Even if there were occasional slip-ups, they never caused such significant trouble. This time, however, it has caused such a commotion." Zhao Wuji paused abruptly.

At this moment, the Foundation Establishment cultivator among the three suddenly realized, "Master means that the Immortal Severing Tower is using this opportunity to make trouble?"

"Indeed," Zhao Wuji said with an expression of a wise teacher, "Not just the Valley of Suppressed Crimes. From now on, all areas within the immortal boat controlled by the Immortal Pivot Department will face attacks from the Immortal Severing Tower."

"The Immortal Pivot Department has held power for too long, and those who covet leadership of the immortal boat have waited for too long." Zhao Wuji sighed softly.

Zhao Wuji's three disciples reacted differently upon hearing this.

The Foundation Establishment disciple's eyes darted around, seemingly contemplating something.

One of the two Qi Refining disciples lowered his head, diligently pondering his master's words.

As for the other, the one possessed by Li Fan's divine sense, he appeared completely unconcerned.

His mind wandered far away, as if in a daze.

Chapter 1188

"Zhao Xian!" Zhao Wuji let out a cold snort.

Zhao Xian immediately snapped back to attention.

"Explain to me, what does the dispute between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department have to do with us being assigned this task?" Zhao Wuji asked, narrowing his eyes.

"Master is both showing his stance and offering goodwill. This is the first time the Immortal Severing Tower has collected relics after taking over the Valley of Suppressed Crimes. Everyone is watching. They want to see how the Immortal Severing Tower's new methods fare against the traditional methods of the Immortal Pivot Department. Sending away useless relics for recycling... this was a trivial matter that Master insisted we personally handle. It not only shows Master's attitude to the Immortal Severing Tower but also explains to the observing forces outside..." Zhao Xian said weakly.

Zhao Wuji nodded repeatedly, quite satisfied with Zhao Xian's analysis. However, seeing the indifferent expression on his face, he couldn't help but get angry. Just as he was about to say something, Zhao Xian interrupted him, "Master, I truly don't understand. The Immortal Boat is already in this state, why can't we unite instead of fighting each other to the death?"

Zhao Wuji's expression changed, and he waved his hand to prevent his disciple's voice from leaking out.

"You ungrateful disciple..."

"Am I wrong?" Zhao Xian threw his head back, showing no fear.

Zhao Wuji suddenly produced a ruler, raising it high as if to strike Zhao Xian's head. But in the end, he did not strike with full force.

"Xian'er, you don't understand."

"This Mystic Immortal Boat must have, and can only have, one helmsman. The tragic events of many years ago have already shown the terrifying consequences of a disunified supreme decision-making body," Zhao Wuji sighed.

Zhao Xian's expression also turned somber upon hearing this, and he no longer argued.

"You may all go," Zhao Wuji suddenly lost interest.

"Don't go out for the time being. Stay and cultivate in the Academy. Since Master has already taken a side, all we need to do now is wait for them to determine the victor. Even if the Immortal Severing Tower truly loses, the Immortal Pivot Department wouldn't dare do anything to our Academy of Proving the Dao. At most, they would just reduce our material allocation."

The three disciples obeyed and left, returning to their respective residences.

The Academy of Proving the Dao had a rather imposing name. However, Zhao Xian's residence was excessively simple. It barely resembled the dwelling of a cultivator, merely a single room barely large enough to live in. The only commendable aspect was that the concentration of Spirit Qi within the room was significantly higher than in other parts of the Immortal Boat. It was sufficient for cultivation below the Golden Core stage.

Closing the door and skillfully activating the magical formations to seal it, a spark of excitement flashed in Zhao Xian's eyes. He rummaged under his bed and retrieved a book-like magical artifact. Just as he was about to use it, he suddenly fell asleep.

Li Fan's divine sense slowly manifested. He took the book-like magical artifact from Zhao Xian.

"Hmm... it's similar to the Heavenly Profound Mirror. It connects to the Immortal Boat's information network and can also be used to exchange contribution points within the Academy for corresponding resources. However, it's limited to within the Academy of Proving the Dao and cannot connect to other regions of the Immortal Boat."

Li Fan shook his head and tossed the so-called "Myriad Insights Record" aside. Then, he transformed into a wisp of green smoke and infiltrated Zhao Xian's consciousness. For a mere Qi Refining stage youth, how could he resist Li Fan's intrusion? In a short while, all of Zhao Xian's secrets, from childhood to the present, were laid bare before Li Fan.

Although Zhao Xian shared the surname Zhao with Zhao Wuji, they were not related by blood. Zhao Wuji showed Zhao Xian considerable favor entirely because of Zhao Xian's "good cultivation talent." Having only been at the Academy of Proving the Dao for a year, he had already reached the late Qi Refining stage. While this cultivation speed was insignificant in the Xuanhuang Realm, it was considered outstanding on the Immortal Boat.

The cultivation resources on the Immortal Boat were limited. Even the Academy of Proving the Dao lived frugally, prioritizing only those disciples with exceptional talent. Every three academic years, there was a system of elimination. Those who fell behind in progress had to leave the Academy, either returning home to become a rogue cultivator or accepting an appointment from the Immortal Pivot Department to serve various posts on the Immortal Boat. It was this brutal elimination system that allowed the Academy of Proving the Dao to maintain its advantage and vitality.

It wasn't just disciples who were eliminated; Nascent Soul stage cultivators like Zhao Wuji also faced immense pressure. If the disciples they taught performed poorly, it indicated a lack of teaching talent. If they didn't have strong backing, they would be removed from their teaching positions and assigned other potentially dangerous duties. This was precisely why the atmosphere within the Academy of Proving the Dao was so oppressive. Everyone lived in uncertainty, not knowing when they might be forced to leave.

However, Zhao Xian was an exception. Perhaps due to his nature, he didn't have a strong attachment to remaining at the Academy of Proving the Dao. He even showed little enthusiasm for cultivation. Others assumed that his late Qi Refining stage in just one year was the result of arduous training. Only he knew that it was the outcome of his sporadic efforts, having put in very little energy. Zhao Xian's greatest interest lay in searching the Myriad Insights Record for odd tales and anecdotes. He was filled with curiosity about the origins of the Immortal Boat, everything about the ancient cultivation world, and the boundless starry sea beyond the Immortal Boat...

Li Fan carefully read through his experiences over the past year, not only from the "Myriad Insights Record" but also from inquiries made to senior members of the Academy.

"In ancient times, the Immortal Boat was once intact. However, due to a sudden tribulation of annihilation from the Star Sea Realm and internal strife, the Immortal Boat was fractured into two halves."

"One was named 'Xuan,' and the other was named 'Shang.'"

"This current vessel is the Xuan Immortal Boat."

Li Fan paused, then continued reading.

"For a long time after the Immortal Boat fractured, it drifted in the Star Sea in a chaotic era of complete loss of control."

"The population plummeted during that time, with nearly nine-tenths perishing."

"It wasn't until the Immortal Boat finally stabilized that it appeared in this sea of relics."

"It has never left since..."

"Although it could transfer within a small range, it was powerless to break free from the powerful restraints of the forces outside the relics."

Li Fan fell into deep thought as he observed the Immortal Boat dwellers' names for that pull.

"'Distant Stellar Force'?"

"What is the meaning of 'distant'?"

Zhao Xian, being only a Qi Refining cultivator, knew this much only because he had pestered and badgered his seniors at the Academy. The origin of the Distant Stellar Force was indeed beyond his knowledge. Li Fan had to temporarily set aside his questions and begin contemplating his next plan. The strength of a mere divine sense was too weak. He needed to bring in the Sacred Embryo to have enough room to maneuver. The only issue to resolve was the residual power of the True Immortal Sigils. Li Fan immediately thought of the talisman previously used by the Immortal Severing Tower.

Chapter 1189: Primordial Golden Core Achieved (Combined Chapter)

"That talisman seems to be able to absorb the power of wandering True Immortal Sigilss. It should be usable as a cover."

"However, this was the method used during the first appearance of the Immortal Severing Tower. Even here in the Academy of Proving the Dao, known as the source of Immortal Boat Dao methods, there are no related records."

Li Fan's split consciousness's gaze fell upon the sleeping Zhao Xian.

"The Profound Immortal Boat has a strict hierarchical system. Many people never even leave their continent in their entire lives. A sturdy fortress still needs to be breached from within."

His split consciousness gently tapped Zhao Xian's forehead.

In a daze, Zhao Xian seemed to have a very long dream.

In his dream, the conflict between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department dragged on without a decisive winner. The struggle intensified, and their methods became increasingly extreme. Ultimately, it led to a devastating catastrophe. The Immortal Boat plunged into the depths of the Sea of Remnants, vanishing into nothingness. No one on board survived, including Zhao Xian himself.

Awakening from the nightmare, the normally optimistic and open-minded Zhao Xian was shaken for a long time, his face pale.

This was because the dream was too realistic. Zhao Xian could still remember certain details from his dream with absolute clarity, leading him to believe he had somehow returned to the past.

"In the dream, ten years later, an Immortal Boat salvage team discovered a supreme treasure called the 'Method-Derivation Jade' in the Sea of Remnants. It could deduce different cultivation techniques every moment and even deduce them based on specific conditions. To determine ownership of the Method-Derivation Jade, the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department engaged in a fierce battle. In the end, it was temporarily entrusted to our Academy of Proving the Dao for safekeeping. Although the Academy gained an unimaginable number of cultivation techniques during this period, it also sowed the seeds for future calamities."

"As an elite disciple of the Academy, I was fortunate enough to study a portion of these cultivation techniques in my dream."

"'Sea Stabilizing Divine Sword'..."

Zhao Xian instinctively circulated the cultivation content from his dream.

A moment later, his expression drastically changed.

"How is this possible?"

Zhao Xian recalled even more profound cultivation technique contents.

"Great Kang Geng Gold Sword Qi," "Heavenly Emperor's Qi Codex," "Two Energies Spirit-Illuminating Primordial Annihilation Technique," "Boundless Heavenly Axis Spirit Severing Art"...

Generations-shattering, peerless supreme techniques appeared one after another in his mind.

Every word and phrase was crystal clear.

The circulation of vital energy brought about by mentally reciting these cultivation techniques also made Zhao Xian realize that these were not mere figments of his imagination. They were genuine supreme divine techniques!

"These cultivation techniques, let alone me, not even anyone in the entire Academy of Proving the Dao could deduce them..."

Zhao Xian's heart pounded.

"Could it be that I truly returned from the future to the past?"

For a full half-day, Zhao Xian could not come to terms with this reality. No matter how hard he racked his brain, he couldn't figure out why such an extraordinary event had happened to him.

Since he couldn't figure it out, he stopped thinking about it.

Zhao Xian's thoughts quickly focused on the Immortal Boat’s doomed fate in his dream.

"If that is true..."

"I must change all of this," Zhao Xian clenched his hands instinctively.

Having experienced too many cruel events in his dream, the young Zhao Xian had become much more composed. He didn't habitually search the 'Myriad Insights Record' for solutions, as he knew that all his statements and browsing history there were under the surveillance of the Academy of Proving the Dao.

"The Immortal Boat's demise is too horrifying. I cannot tell anyone, not even my Master. I absolutely must not let the Academy of Proving the Dao, an organization that will be completely destroyed in the future struggle, know about this. Otherwise, no one can guarantee they won't take more extreme actions, or even cause the Immortal Boat to be destroyed prematurely."

Zhao Xian paced back and forth in his room, his mind racing. Since experiencing the great dream, he felt as though his thinking had become much more agile.

"Master was right, the Immortal Boat must have, and can only have, one helmsman. But the conflict between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department is irreconcilable. If we let them fight each other, the Immortal Boat's destruction is inevitable."

"The best method is to cut the Gordian knot, and in a short period, allow one side to gain a decisive advantage."

Zhao Xian's eyes flickered. "Although the memories of some personnel and details from the dream have become blurry, the memories of future cultivation techniques and secret arts are extremely clear. With the advantage of this information, which is decades ahead of its time, I am confident I can help one side unify the Immortal Boat. As for who to help..."

After calmly recalling the actions of the two major organizations in his dream and their governing philosophies, Zhao Xian ultimately decided to choose the Immortal Severing Tower.

"Now, the Immortal Severing Tower is just beginning to show its might, and it is in great need of people. If I display even a little talent, I can easily infiltrate it."

"My current strength is still too weak, and I need to improve as quickly as possible. Fortunately, I now have too many miraculous cultivation techniques in my mind."

"As long as I have enough resources, breaking through two major realms within a year is not a problem."

Zhao Xian closed his eyes and meditated, ready to shock the Academy of Proving the Dao after emerging from seclusion.

He did not notice that beside him, a faint, almost imperceptible figure was gazing at him.

This figure, of course, was Li Fan's split consciousness.

"Without the restriction of 'Incompatibility of Laws,' countless cultivation techniques I've seen before can exert their maximum value here."

"Compared to the perilous Xuanhuang Realm, this Immortal Boat is truly a paradise."

Li Fan, who was constantly constrained in the Xuanhuang Realm, now reveled in the feeling of being able to fully utilize his unparalleled skills while causing a stir on the Profound Immortal Boat.

...

After traversing more than half of the star sea, encountering the Profound Immortal Boat civilization hidden within the Sea of Remnants, and finally finding a breakthrough to infiltrate and lie dormant.

This entire process took Li Fan's Sacred Embryo about a year.

Due to the differing flow rates in various regions of the star sea, in the Xuanhuang Realm, less than half a year had actually passed.

In half a year, the Myriad Immortals Alliance had recovered from the great upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The distorted white mist barriers in the heavens and earth had all returned to their original state.

The cultivators' memories of that disaster had also gradually blurred. Everything seemed to have returned to its starting point.

And in the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, a pocket world affiliated with the Xuanhuang Realm, the changes over the past six months could be described as breathtaking.

"Breathtaking" was not just an adjective. It was a real celestial phenomenon that appeared in the sky of the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, rivaling the sun and moon.

Centered around five hazy halos, more and more shining stars appeared.

They were clearly visible even during the day.

And at night, they completely overshadowed the original starlight of Great Qi.

According to popular legend, the five halos symbolized the Sacred Emperor's five personal disciples.

The stars that appeared in succession around the halos represented the many outstanding talents emerging in Great Qi.

This legend was not baseless but had sufficient evidence.

Just three days ago, all the citizens of Great Qi witnessed a shining star near the celestial halos suddenly erupt with a light thousands of times brighter than usual.
