Then, it transformed into a beam of light that shot straight towards the Sacred Emperor's Throne in the Sacred Capital.

The phenomenon lasted for nearly half a day before the awe-inspiring beam of light stretching across heaven and earth finally dissipated.

After this, people also realized that the star in the sky had disappeared, descending to the human world. If a Sacred Emperor's disciple could trigger such a celestial phenomenon, what about the Sacred Emperor himself?

Following the world-shaking event half a year ago when the Sacred Emperor led a martial display, people once again engaged in discussions and speculation about the Sacred Emperor's immense power, albeit in private.

The worship and trust of the Sacred Emperor throughout the entire Sacred Dynasty Great Qi had reached a terrifying level of unity.

And at this moment, the peerless Sacred Emperor in the hearts of Great Qi's citizens was frowning, staring at a white-haired young man sitting with his eyes closed.

Contrary to popular legend, after the beam of light, rumored to be a descending general, shot down from the sky three days ago, Sacred Emperor Li Ping felt no surprise.

Instead, he was filled with anger and vigilance due to his utter shock.

Because he immediately discovered the true nature of the light beam: outside the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, one of the giant grotto-heavens that Daoist Bai Hua had painstakingly moved to drag the world rapidly through the void...

Had exploded.

And the culprit was in Great Qi, in the Sacred Capital!

Yet Li Ping had been completely unaware of this matter before! How could Li Ping, who considered himself the Chosen Emperor, accept this?

During the past six months, while the Myriad Immortals Alliance was busy quelling the disaster and pacifying the populace, Daoist Bai Hua worked tirelessly, moving some grotto-heavens from the Xuanhuang Realm to this place.

Perhaps due to the shockwaves from the star sea affecting the Xuanhuang Realm, Daoist Bai Hua found it easier to transport these grotto-heavens. Even so, working day and night for half a year had left Daoist Bai Hua on the verge of collapse. Unable to persevere any longer, he retreated to the Five Elements Grotto-heaven to recuperate.

Unexpectedly, a grotto-heaven was bombed.

Daoist Bai Hua's expression was extremely grim. He could no longer afford to recuperate and immediately emerged from the Five Elements Grotto-heaven.

At this moment, Li Fan had also pinpointed the culprit.

Before he could even react, Senior Yin's words turned his shock into joy and completely dispelled his anger!

"Someone..."

"Has successfully cultivated the 'Primordial Golden Core'!"

Even the Sacred Emperor, upon hearing Senior Yin's words, was profoundly shaken and momentarily lost in thought.

The Primordial Golden Core, as a realm after "Self-Inherent Foundation," was a part of the new New Law, and a crucial component of Li Ping's plan to overthrow the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate system.

This first step was particularly difficult to take. Once achieved, it would undoubtedly bring about unimaginable changes.

When Li Ping summoned Senior Yin to Great Qi to research the New New Law, he didn't have great expectations in his heart. He was simply trying it out.

After all, the Heavenly Venerate's new law system had stood for millennia.

Destroying its foundation was not that easy.

Li Ping had anticipated that the deduction of the New New Law would take at least decades, if not centuries.

He never expected that in just over half a year, Senior Yin would give him such a pleasant surprise.

At the same time, Li Fan's heart stirred with doubt and vigilance.

Without starting to ask questions, he shifted his gaze from the black-haired youth to Senior Yin, awaiting his explanation.

Senior Yin ignored Li Ping, his gaze captivated by the meditating youth, and he praised him endlessly.

"The aura of the world..."

Li Ping's brow furrowed.

The black-haired youth gave him a very strange feeling.

He was indeed one of the children who had cultivated "Self-Inherent Foundation," and he had now completed his realm breakthrough.

The fluctuating and unpredictable fluctuations in his strength made it difficult for Li Ping to fathom.

However, the young man's vitality was too weak.

It was nothing like the vigorous and thriving state after breaking through a realm, but rather like a candle in the wind, precarious.

It seemed as though his life would vanish in the next moment.

After a long while, seeing the pained expression on the black-haired youth's face, Senior Yin sighed, "To seize the creation of the world with one's own body..."

"How difficult it is! Although the Primordial Golden Core has been achieved, one suffers backlash. If one cannot endure it, there is only death and the dissipation of the Dao."

Li Ping automatically skipped the latter half of the sentence, focusing his attention on the first half of Senior Yin's words.

"To seize the creation of the world with one's own body? Is this the key to cultivating the Primordial Golden Core?" Li Ping asked.

Senior Yin was silent for a moment before replying, "You see the situation yourself. He has indeed broken through. However, the risk involved is almost a sure death..."

"The New New Law should not take this path."

Senior Yin then recounted to Li Fan the process of comprehending the Primordial Golden Core under this fortuitous circumstance.

"What is Primordial?"

"Self-Inherent Foundation means building one's cultivation foundation with one's complete self. In the world, if one wants to advance further, one needs to seek answers from the world and the heavens."

"To seize the creation of the world with one's own body is not to directly devour heaven and earth like the Doctrine Transmitter's New Law..."

"Although the actual effect is almost the same," Senior Yin suddenly said, then abruptly stopped.

He looked up at the afterimage of the grotto-heaven that had disappeared from the sky. Only then did Senior Yin continue, "To achieve Primordial, one does not seize specific matter or energy, but the 'creation' of the world."

"The Great Dao has fifty, and Heaven derives forty-nine. Because of the one that escapes, the world has extra variables, and thus, after countless years, heaven and earth can still possess boundless vitality."

"But if that escaping one is seized..."

"The beam of light between heaven and earth just now was their fate."

"Of course, this also involves some of my intervention. If external forces had not interfered, the changes would have taken nearly a century to manifest. I did it to help this child. Otherwise, with a Foundation Establishment body, presumptuously coveting heaven and earth, even just a grotto-heaven, one would lose oneself in the struggle within the grotto-heaven world." Senior Yin glanced at Li Ping, showing no intention of apologizing.

"To think of what I could not think of, this child is truly remarkable."

...

From Senior Yin's words, Li Ping vaguely understood the so-called "Primordial Golden Core."

As the lord of the Great Qi world, and having had closer observation and contact with numerous pocket worlds, he could better understand Senior Yin's meaning.

"The world is like a body. This idea of seizing the world's creation to achieve one's own Primordial Golden Core is indeed feasible."

"However..."

Li Ping deliberated for a moment, then secretly shook his head and rejected it.

"This step is too ambitious!"

"To swallow the world with a human body. Even I might not be able to do it."

"The New New Law should be a universal method that everyone can cultivate."

Chapter 1190

In the time it took Li Ping to converse with Senior Yin, the black-haired youth who had just discovered a path to the Primordial Golden Core found his vital signs rapidly weakening. Ultimately, he lost all signs of life.

Yet, he did not die. The black-haired youth remained seated there, his physical and spiritual energies circulating spontaneously, grand and mysterious.

"A pity, he couldn't hold on. He's completely assimilated with the grotto-heaven's consciousness and lost himself," Senior Yin sighed, his face full of regret. "His original strength was too weak, and the target he chose wasn't quite appropriate. If he had chosen the slightly smaller grotto-heaven next to it, perhaps he might have survived."

Li Ping's gaze also stopped on the black-haired youth, lingering there for a long time. "What was his name?"

"Qu Wentian."

"A good name. But there's one thing I don't understand," Li Ping's voice echoed in the spacious, empty secret chamber. "At the Foundation Establishment stage, can one truly seize the creation of a grotto-heaven? The grotto-heaven that disappeared was named the Abyss of Desolation. Although it didn't seem large from the perspective of Great Qi, its scale was equivalent to almost half of Great Qi's pocket world..."

"Perhaps this kid was exceptionally gifted," Senior Yin replied after a long silence, unable to come up with a better explanation. "You must understand that people are different. Things that seem impossible to us might be trivial to others. The path of the Primordial Golden Core that Qu Wentian pioneered, though destined to be trod by only a very small number of people, has also given me inspiration."

Senior Yin looked at Li Ping, his expression turning solemn. "You're right. If we want to completely dismantle the dominance of the Dharma-Preachers' new method, our new-new method cannot be a niche, difficult path."

"The cultivation path of the Dharma-Preachers, back then, why did it spread like wildfire, instantly covering the entire Xuanhuang Realm, and despite the suppression by the Myriad Immortal Sects, it continued to flourish and eventually replaced them? Wasn't it precisely because it had almost no threshold? Practicing it by anyone is the attribute our new-new method should possess."

"I've been thinking, the reason Qu Wentian was able to break through his realm on the basis of 'Self-Inherent Foundation' was by seizing the creation of a grotto-heaven world. Conversely, the creation of the world should be the most critical factor for the Primordial Golden Core."

Senior Yin's speech quickened, his expression becoming somewhat excited. "Without external reliance, accessible to everyone, the creation of the world... Combining these three necessary conditions, we can glimpse the true ideal of the Primordial Golden Core!"

Senior Yin waved his hand, and images of children with innocent faces appeared before them. "Seizing the world's creation is not for the sake of creation itself, but for the evolution of creation. For ordinary people, the world's creation is profound and difficult to comprehend. One can only forcibly possess it through 'devouring,' making it a part of oneself before slowly comprehending it."

"But if there were a supremely wise teacher, who personally guided them, and meticulously taught his every understanding of the world's creation..."

"I believe that even a young child can comprehend the Dao!" Senior Yin declared with conviction.

Seeing Li Ping's disbelieving gaze, he continued, "The method of 'Self-Inherent Foundation,' to outsiders, seems incredibly complex and unbelievable. But to the children I teach, who have been exposed to it since childhood and in whose perception, there is only this method of cultivation in the world, it is not so difficult to learn. Especially after the first success of 'Self-Inherent Foundation,' it was as if a bottleneck was broken, and successful practitioners appeared one after another."

"'Self-Inherent Foundation' is like this, and so is the 'Primordial Golden Core.'"

"Moreover, the new-new method should be tailored to each individual. Forging the Primordial Golden Core by imitating the world's transformation within oneself does not necessarily mean pursuing the absolute extreme. After all, worlds vary in size, and cultivators have different aptitudes and potentials. Fully unleashing one's potential is already enough..."

"The only thing needed is to find such a 'supremely wise teacher.' Someone who not only comprehends the world's Dao to the peak but can also patiently share his understanding without reservation..."

As Senior Yin spoke, he looked at the Chosen Emperor before him.

"Although I am willing to be a teacher to the world, alas..." Li Ping paused slightly. "My own understanding of the world's Dao is insufficient, so how can I teach others?"

"I think throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm, the only one qualified to be this teacher is probably the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate himself? So we want the Doctrine Transmitter to rebel against himself?"

"Your path to the Primordial Golden Core still needs further consideration." Senior Yin could not refute this, a flicker of unwillingness and confusion crossing his eyes.

Li Ping came with high hopes but left disappointed. He left Senior Yin standing there and returned alone. He appeased the Daoist Bai Hua, who had rushed over, thinking the Xuanhuang Realm was under attack by the Myriad Immortals Alliance and was searching for enemies. He also rewarded her with some Golden Origin Energy as a commendation. As pure crystallized cultivation, Golden Origin Energy was a great tonic for the purely energetic Bai Hua.

Bai Hua first expressed her thanks, then solemnly absorbed it.

"The Golden Origin Energy you gave this time..." Before Bai Hua could finish her sentence after consuming the Golden Origin Energy, she exclaimed in disbelief. "How can it be so dense?"

"It's even like..."

"Essence of Primal Force?!" Bai Hua looked at Li Ping with utter shock. Her glazed body became even more radiant and solid at a visible speed. Her old hidden injuries were slowly healed, and even the subtle connection to the Fishing Pond, which had not disappeared even after escaping its capture, seemed to have become negligible under the cleansing of the Golden Origin Energy. Correspondingly, Bai Hua looked at the Faceless Sacred Emperor before her, his profoundly deep figure slowly imprinting itself in her heart.

Li Ping offered no explanation, leaving Bai Hua with a supremely mysterious silhouette.

"He, has he already approached the realm of True Immortals?"

"How can that be?" Bai Hua's heart was filled with dread, but the Golden Origin Energy surging within her, far surpassing the mundane, seemed to be the best evidence for her speculation.

...

As a clone, Li Ping's cultivation realm naturally hadn't surpassed his main body. He remained at the Nascent Soul realm, and most of his combat power came from the luck of the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi. His own strength was pathetic. The reason he could create golden energy essence infinitely close to the Essence of Primal Force was precisely by relying on a group of special people.

Deep underground, beneath the Sacred Emperor's throne, in absolute darkness devoid of any sunlight, lived a group of people who were not affected in the slightest. Every day, apart from normal living routines, their most important task was to pray before the Sacred Emperor's stone statue.

Chapter 1191

The prayers echoed in the underground chamber, like ancient, mysterious ballads. This group was, of course, the Netherfolk. With the combined efforts of Li Ping’s disciples, almost all the Netherfolk had been captured and brought to the pocket world of Great Qi.

Li Ping knew that the entity behind the Sea of Darkness did not mind its followers having other beliefs. Thus, through coercion, temptation, and finally a demonstration of coexistence to the entire Netherfolk populace, these people soon adapted to their new lives. Some even held a faith in the Chosen Emperor that was more steadfast and fervent than their faith in the Sea of Darkness. After all, the Sea of Darkness had not shown any divine miracles during their time of crisis and potential annihilation. The Chosen Emperor, however, truly distributed large amounts of resources to them periodically.

In the darkness, listening to the Netherfolk’s synchronized chanting, Li Ping felt specks of golden Origin Force forming within his body. "Just a hundred Netherfolk, and the faith power they condense is more than that of all the citizens of Great Qi combined." Li Ping pondered, "What secrets do the Netherfolk hide..."

Li Ping had already sent the corpses of some rebellious Netherfolk to Senior Yin for research. "It's perfect timing, as his research on the New Law has hit a bottleneck. A change of research subject might spark some unexpected inspiration." Of course, Li Ping wasn't particularly concerned about the true reason behind the Netherfolk's unique physique. The cause was irrelevant; as long as they could be used, that was enough.

His figure flickered, and Li Ping moved towards another sealed area near the prayer space. "Xuan Ba, how is the research progressing? Can the transplanted flesh and blood promote the fertility of the Netherfolk?" Wang Xuan Ba, who was intently focused on something, quickly withdrew his gaze upon hearing his master’s arrival. He respectfully bowed and reported, "After several experiments, I have found the optimal combination of alien beast flesh and blood. I have named it the 'Primordial Embryo of Life'. As long as there are sufficient essence from males and females, it can cultivate a large number of younglings at an extremely terrifying speed. However..."

"It's not nurtured within a mother's body, so these younglings are born with insufficient vitality, are extremely frail, and their expected lifespan will likely not be long," Wang Xuan Ba said cautiously.

Wang Xuan Ba’s current physique was thin, unlike his previous honest, robust youth. He had received Li Ping’s meticulous guidance and had since consumed numerous alien beast bodies, mastering many of their abilities. His current understanding of alien beasts even surpassed Li Ping's. Upon learning that his master was troubled by the Netherfolk's low fertility rate, he volunteered to alleviate his master's worries. He then managed to create this astonishing creation, the 'Primordial Embryo of Life'.

It was composed entirely of pink, wriggling alien beast flesh, with sealed chambers within. Countless tubes connected these chambers to the main body of the Primordial Embryo. This supplied energy for nurturing the younglings while allowing the Primordial Embryo to absorb the characteristics of the many younglings it cultivated. "This is a win-win process. With each new youngling cultivated, it becomes more intelligent and powerful." Wang Xuan Ba said with confidence, even in front of his master, when discussing alien beasts. "Although this progress is minuscule, it can be accumulated through sheer numbers, allowing for metamorphosis within the predicted timeframe. If my prediction is correct, the Primordial Embryo of Life might eventually be able to create life without needing male and female essence, as long as there is enough energy."

Li Ping’s gaze pierced the darkness, looking at the large, pulsating "lump of flesh" in the distance, which seemed to be breathing. "I only need them in sufficient numbers to serve me simultaneously. As for their lifespan..." Li Ping's words were icy, "If they die, I will simply create more." Wang Xuan Ba heard this and felt nothing unusual. In his eyes, these headless Netherfolk were no different from those alien beasts; they were not truly human.

"All matters here need to be strictly kept secret. Even from your senior and junior fellow disciples," Li Ping added.

"Disciple understands," Wang Xuan Ba responded solemnly. After Li Ping left, he resumed his research. Compared to the complexities of the outside world, he preferred these pure and simple matters.

In just a few years, the trajectory of the once robust youth from below Mount Dissolution had changed so drastically. However, among Li Ping’s disciples, Wang Xuan Ba’s transformation was not the most significant. Wang Xuan Ba’s actions still retained some echoes of his former self. The complete change, as if becoming an entirely different person, was seen in Li Ping's fifth disciple, Ou Shangtian. After accompanying his father to Great Qi and being taken in as a personal disciple by Li Ping, he transformed from his previous reticent, cautious, and unconfident demeanor into the spirited youth he was now. He acted decisively and looked down upon everything. Although he was the youngest among Li Ping’s disciples, in terms of true strength, he surpassed them all. In all of Great Qi, perhaps no one besides Li Ping could match him. Even if Li Ping himself were to intervene without using secret techniques or divine abilities, subduing Ou Shangtian would not be an easy task.

In addition to the two innate oddities Ou Shangtian possessed, the Heavenly Bone Hand and the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, Ou Shangtian had recently fished up the Seven-Colored Divine Light in the Fishing Pond under Li Ping's guidance. With the Seven-Colored Divine Light protecting him, coupled with the heaven-defying escape abilities of the Heavenly Bone Hand and the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, Ou Shangtian's survivability was even greater than most cultivators in the Dao Integration realm of the Xuanhuang Realm. He had become more arrogant after easily suppressing several pocket worlds in a few battles. Fortunately, with his father and Li Ping keeping him in check, he hadn't done anything truly outrageous.

When he worked with Wang Xuan Ba to capture the Netherfolk earlier, he became interested in Wang Xuan Ba's peculiar alien beast abilities. He requested the cultivation method for the Creation Furnace Technique from Li Ping and had been diligently cultivating it since. Li Ping was not worried about Ou Shangtian losing control. He would decisively intervene before any signs of him losing control appeared.

The golden Origin Force condensed by the Netherfolk had been subtly injected into key figures across Great Qi by Li Ping. This power, which was infinitely close to True Immortal power, was imperceptible to these so-called geniuses. Only Bai Hua, the ancient expert from the ancient cultivation world, could discern its origin.

"Since they have fallen into my net, they can only serve me with their lives." Li Ping mused, "After all, every gift has its price marked." With the pure golden Origin Force as his trump card, he could now begin to plan his invasion of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Chapter 1192: A Thousand Years to Return Home

Even though the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty's paper strength had rapidly expanded, it was currently still far from being able to contend with the Myriad Immortals Alliance or the Five Elders Council. Thus, the initial phase of the plan still revolved around infiltration and erosion.

During the Great Azure Nether upheaval over half a year ago, the Immortal Alliance suffered losses among its lower-tier cultivators. Consequently, whispers had spread through unofficial channels that the Alliance would be expanding its recruitment to some extent in the upcoming induction grand examination. Li Ping had already selected a batch of promising talents, preparing to seize this opportunity and send them into the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Although low-tier cultivators might seem insignificant, they could slowly corrode the internal rule of the Immortal Alliance like termites. As time passed, their cultivation and contributions grew, and their positions would consequently rise, amplifying the harm and influence they caused. The investment cost was extremely low, yet the effectiveness was exceptionally high. The more, the better.

"With the existence of the Golden Origin Energy net, not only can they successfully infiltrate the Immortal Alliance, but they can also be firmly controlled from start to finish," Li Ping mused. "Without the need for in-person meetings in the real world, information and even resources can be exchanged. This method of contact is far more covert and secure than that of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council; they would find it extremely difficult to discover."

In addition to eroding the Myriad Immortals Alliance from within, reducing its potential was a necessary concurrent action. "All the outstanding cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm for the next hundred years must be brought under control. If they cannot be used for my benefit, they should be eliminated as soon as possible." Li Ping continued, "We can even divert disaster, framing the Five Elders Council for the assassination plans. I will sit back and watch the tigers fight amidst their struggle..."

While weakening the Myriad Immortals Alliance through various means, Li Ping was also resolute in not slowing the development of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty. Once the number of Netherfolk reached a certain scale and sufficient pure Golden Origin Energy was gathered, Li Ping would use it to remodel the Great Myriad Spirits Formation. This would transform the Great Qi's pocket world into a truly impregnable fortress, hidden and drifting within the void.

"I can feel that since top talents like Senior Yin and Ou Daozi from the Xuanhuang Realm came to serve in the Great Qi's pocket world, the Sacred Dynasty's aura, which had already reached a bottleneck, has unexpectedly found the possibility of another breakthrough." Li Ping pondered, "This is the principle of 'as one wanes, another waxes.' I have forcefully usurped the fortune that originally belonged to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. However, it is not yet enough to satisfy the conditions for promotion."

"In addition to usurping fortune from the outside, which requires time to accumulate, the very status of the Great Qi's pocket world is also a limiting factor. Perhaps it is time to consider its elevation."

With a thought, Li Ping returned to the Sacred Emperor's Throne. Before long, Sun Erlang, enveloped in an aura of killing intent, appeared before him. The once valiant youth had now grown into a fearsome god of slaughter within the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, commanding the Sacred Dynasty's Imperial Army and conquering various realms. Over the years, countless beings from other pocket worlds had met their end under Sun Erlang's blade.

"Greetings, Master!" Sun Erlang knelt on one knee.

"What is the status of the Great Myriad Spirits Formation's construction?" Li Ping inquired.

"Eleven have been completed, and six are still under construction," Sun Erlang replied concisely, simultaneously transmitting the specific information via divine sense.

"For the time being, halt further conquests. We have expanded too quickly and need to digest our gains properly. For any who harbor thoughts of resistance in those pocket worlds, kill them without mercy. I do not wish for our rear to be attacked when we officially engage the Myriad Immortals Alliance in battle."

The implication in Li Ping's words made Sun Erlang's spirit surge. Even though he knew his master harbored grand ambitions, this was the first time Li Ping had explicitly articulated his plans for conquest against the Myriad Immortals Alliance. For Sun Erlang, who found conquering those pocket worlds as easy as slicing vegetables, devoid of any pressure and even somewhat boring, this immediately ignited his excitement.

Li Ping, naturally, saw through Sun Erlang's thoughts at a glance. "After seeing too many sheep, one begins to believe the world is full of them. Not to mention the Myriad Immortals Alliance, but even some of the hidden pocket worlds within the Xuanhuang Realm are beyond what our current Great Qi Sacred Dynasty can contend with," Li Ping said calmly, then pointed towards Sun Erlang. "Go to this location. It is the hidden abode of the ancient Grand Origin Sect. See if you can persuade them to join our alliance."

"The Grand Origin Sect..." Sun Erlang's eyes flickered. "Go. There is something special about that place, which you will understand when you arrive. Do not force anything; my purpose is merely to temper some of your arrogance." Unlike the cultivation strategy for Ou Shangtian, when Sun Erlang's path showed a slight deviation, Li Ping chose to actively guide him back on course. Besides their deeper emotional bond, Li Ping also needed a powerful senior disciple to suppress all the other disciples. Therefore, he couldn't help but invest more effort in his upbringing.

"I hope this young man will gain something from his journey to the Grand Origin Sect," Li Ping thought, seated on the Sacred Emperor's Throne.

Meanwhile, as per the Sacred Emperor's instructions, Sun Erlang arrived at Yi Xing's tomb. After collecting Yi Xing's remains and the scattered white papers, Sun Erlang headed directly to his destination. "I didn't expect there to be such an ancient cultivator's tomb within the Great Qi's territory. I wonder what the purpose of these papers that my teacher specifically asked me to collect is," he mused on the way, studying them closely without discovering any profound mystery. Suppressing his doubts, Sun Erlang soon reached his destination: Mount Profound Heaven in Taihua Prefecture.

"Master said the entrance to the Grand Origin Sect is hidden within the mountain body?" After searching around, he found no trace of a spatial passage. Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a bit troubled. If he resorted to brute force, carving a path through the mountain wouldn't be impossible. However, his purpose this time was to be a persuader, to convince them to join the Sacred Dynasty's alliance. To rashly damage someone's sect's residence like this... After considering it, Sun Erlang decided against acting impulsively.

On Mount Profound Heaven, he chose a spot with favorable feng shui. He dug a pit and then took out Yi Xing's skeletal remains. Just as he was about to proceed with the burial... a figure suddenly appeared behind Sun Erlang.

"So you've come!" Sun Erlang thought to himself. Outwardly, he feigned a posture of utmost vigilance: "Who's there?!" The figure paid no mind to Sun Erlang, merely staring blankly at Yi Xing's remains, as if lost in some memory, remaining motionless for a long time. Sun Erlang was not a reckless warrior and naturally would not disturb this figure whose strength seemed unfathomable. He waited patiently.

"If you had waited a few more years, elder brother, perhaps everything would have been different." After a long while, the figure sighed and waved his sleeve at Yi Xing. Yi Xing's remains vanished instantly. He then turned to look at Sun Erlang. "Young man, why have you come?" Sun Erlang looked at the face before him, which appeared to be no older than himself. After a moment of hesitation, he honestly explained his intentions.

There might be another chapter coming out around 12:30 AM...

Chapter 1193: Fate Suddenly Changed

“Great Qi…”

The cultivator from the Grand Origin Sect narrowed his eyes, as if countless fleeting images were rapidly flashing within them.

“Great Xuan?”

“Huh?”

Unsure of what he was seeing, his tone turned to one of great surprise. He then looked at Sun Erlang, saying, "In just a few years, such a vast deviation has occurred? What is happening?"

Sun Erlang was utterly bewildered, not understanding what the other party was talking about.

"Interesting, follow me," the Grand Origin Sect cultivator said after scrutinizing Sun Erlang once more.

With that, his form instantly became transparent.

A silvery, illusory path formed beneath his feet, leading directly into the mountain.

Sun Erlang transformed into a streak of escape light and followed closely behind.

After they entered the mountain, the silvery path vanished.

Even the soil pit Sun Erlang had dug on Mount Profound Heaven was silently restored.

"My name is Yi Shu. The skeleton you returned is my elder cousin," the Grand Origin Sect disciple said to Sun Erlang as they walked.

"Back then, when the Great Tribulations of the inability to cultivate laws together and the Celestial-Mortal Miasma arrived simultaneously, my elder cousin retreated from the tide, seeking refuge in a mortal pocket world. Although he lost his path to immortality, he achieved the position of a Mortal Emperor. One could say it was destiny.

"After not seeing each other for thousands of years, to meet again under such circumstances. Although it was somewhat anticipated when we parted. However…"

"Fate plays tricks on people!"

"Simulated illusory scenes are still different from actual ones!"

Yi Shu sighed softly, falling silent.

"Simulation? Actual scene?" Sun Erlang keenly seized upon two keywords in Yi Shu's words.

"This Grand Origin Sect was famous in ancient times for its art of deduction. Could the simulations and deviations he mentioned be the future predicted by their deductions?"

They continued to descend, and when a scene appeared before them again, they were already high above the heavens.

The azure sky was clear and spotless, with fertile farmlands stretching for a thousand miles below.

Sun Erlang could clearly sense the presence of a great number of mortals here.

Yi Shu, however, flew forward.

Sun Erlang quickly followed, a trace of doubt rising in his heart.

Since entering this pocket world, Yi Shu seemed to have undergone some transformation, but Sun Erlang couldn't pinpoint exactly what had changed.

"I don't sense any danger, and Master definitely wouldn't harm me…" Sun Erlang suppressed the unease in his heart and continued to follow.

Not long after, a floating city suddenly appeared in Sun Erlang's previously empty vision.

The city was encased in a transparent crystalline barrier. It was precisely because of this barrier that Sun Erlang hadn't detected this city in the sky earlier.

"As expected, they have some means. To completely conceal such a large city," Sun Erlang mused inwardly.

Yi Shu finally spoke again, "The Profound Heaven Realm was borrowed by us from the Grand Origin Sect. To maintain the separation between immortals and mortals and to avoid disturbing the mortals of this realm, we built this crystalline barrier."

Sun Erlang was somewhat dismissive of Yi Shu's mention of disturbing mortals but did not openly object, merely nodding slightly.

Passing through the transparent crystalline barrier, they formally entered the Grand Origin Sect.

The moment his feet touched the ground, Sun Erlang suddenly felt as if countless pairs of eyes were looking at him.

Among them were the auras of Dao Integration powerhouses.

Sun Erlang was inwardly shocked, "The strength of this Grand Origin Sect has been preserved too well. There are still so many cultivators? How did they cope with the inability to cultivate laws together?"

Deeper within the floating city, Sun Erlang's strange feeling intensified.

"It's too quiet here. It doesn't feel like a normal, vibrant city."

"And…"

Sun Erlang paused.

He finally understood the source of his unease.

The Grand Origin Sect cultivators here, much like the treants in the Spirit Wood Realm, although they had different faces, all exuded the same aura.

It was as if they were countless bodies of the same person!

Sun Erlang, though surprised, remained calm and did not delve into his own wild thoughts. He directly asked, "Senior Yi, your Grand Origin Sect…"

Yi Shu seemed to have seen through Sun Erlang's confusion and chuckled, "When you meet Senior Brother Chen later, you will know everything. But young master, please rest assured, our Grand Origin Sect has always been clear about grudges and favor. You returned the remains of our disciple, so you have earned our favor."

"Although the alliance you proposed may not be realized, your personal safety is absolutely guaranteed."

Sun Erlang remained noncommittal, swallowing the words that were on the tip of his tongue.

He followed Yi Shu to the center of the floating city, into a transparent blue crystalline structure.

As if seeing countless versions of himself entering simultaneously, Sun Erlang, upon regaining consciousness from the illusion, found a handsome, long-haired man standing before him.

"Senior Brother," Yi Shu cupped his fists in greeting.

"Yi Xing also went to the Great Xuan pocket world to carry out a sect mission. Due to his talent, he was unable to enter the inner sect for cultivation and was always resentful about it…"

"Now that times have changed, what inner sect or outer sect are mere jokes. Let Yi Xing return." Senior Brother Chen, who was Chen Tianhai of the Grand Origin Sect, whom Li Fan had met before, spoke in a calm tone.

"Thank you, Senior Brother," Yi Shu said with extreme solemnity.

Then, his form became ethereal, transforming into blue starlight and dissipating.

Chen Tianhai then turned his gaze to Sun Erlang.

His words were earth-shattering, "According to the original trajectory, you, Sun Erlang, after repeatedly failing to find immortality at Dissolution Mountain, settled down completely, married, and had children. Seven years later, dissatisfied with the excessive demands of the newly appointed prefect, you angrily killed someone. Afterward, you and your companion Wang Xuanba occupied the mountain and became kings, causing trouble for the locals."

"You wreaked havoc for over a decade, only to be finally exterminated by the imperial army. You fought to the death with Wang Xuanba and were dismembered by a barrage of blades."

Sun Erlang raised an eyebrow upon hearing the "destiny" that belonged to him from the other party's mouth.

"But now, everything is different."

"Your future…"

Chen Tianhai's form began to flicker and turn azure and illusory.

However, moments later, he returned to his original state.

"Marvelous! Beyond the deviation!"

"Great Qi's Enlightenment, eh…" A strange light flickered in Chen Tianhai's eyes.

"In just a few years, such a significant deviation has occurred…" he muttered, as if discovering something incredibly exciting.

"Do you know the origin of your Master?" Chen Tianhai asked.

Sun Erlang merely looked at Chen Tianhai silently.

"Indeed, let alone you not knowing. Even if you knew, you likely wouldn't say it, or couldn't say it," Chen Tianhai gave a knowing smile.

Sun Erlang suddenly felt a strange discomfort.

"Huh, wait, the cultivation technique you're practicing…" Chen Tianhai, observing Sun Erlang, suddenly changed the subject, sounding somewhat surprised and uncertain.

"Is it the Sitting Mountain Art from the Spirit Wood Sect?"

Chapter 1194

"Could it be that your master was once a disciple of the Divine Wood Sect?" Chen Tianhai asked, his voice tinged with disbelief.

"The Mountain Sitting Art?" Upon hearing those words, Sun Erlang's heart stirred. A sense of familiarity, as if guided by an unseen force, arose within him.

"No, no," Chen Tianhai quickly shook his head, negating his own thought before Sun Erlang could reply.

"The aura is just somewhat similar."

"Furthermore, it is said that the Mountain Sitting Art is the cultivation method of that divine wood from the Divine Wood Sect. It cultivates by exchanging years for cultivation. For ordinary cultivators, it is incredibly arduous and progress is exceedingly slow. Young Master, you have already reached the Great Perfection of the Nascent Soul realm at such a tender age. Clearly, it does not match." Chen Tianhai chuckled self-deprecatingly, his curiosity towards Sun Erlang growing even more intense.

"This junior indeed does not cultivate the so-called Mountain Sitting Art, but rather a profound technique personally passed down by my master. The reason for my rapid cultivation owes the vast majority of its credit to this profound technique," Sun Erlang stated solemnly.

"Very well, then perhaps I was mistaken," Chen Tianhai conceded, ceasing his line of questioning.

"Senior, was this Divine Wood Sect one of the Myriad Immortal Sects from that era?" Although he had clarified the origin of his cultivation method, Sun Erlang remained curious about the Mountain Sitting Art and directly inquired.

Sun Erlang had discovered that the Grand Origin Sect was quite different from the strictly disciplined ancient immortal sects he had imagined. There was hardly any distinction between superiors and inferiors, and they addressed him, a young outsider, with familiar terms like "Young Master." While he didn't know the reason for such an atmosphere, it was undoubtedly a good thing for him, so he decided to go with the flow.

Chen Tianhai, to his knowledge, answered everything. After gesturing for Sun Erlang to sit, he responded, "The Divine Wood Sect is even more ancient than our Myriad Immortal Sects."

"From the same era as the Divine Wood Sect were ancient immortal sects like the Desolate God Sect and the Reincarnation Sect, which have long since been destroyed. Before the immortal path was severed, some of them had already completely vanished for various reasons."

"The Divine Wood Sect is said to have gotten its name from a divine wood from outside the realm within its sect. This divine wood was reportedly a gift from the Immortal Realm. After taking root in the Xuanhuang Realm, it displayed all sorts of incredible divine abilities. However, it was precisely because of this divine wood that the being known as the 'Eternal Existence' became displeased, ultimately leading to the sect's downfall. Truly, fortune and misfortune are difficult to predict."

"The meaning of the five characters 'Eternal Existence' is 'appearing since ancient times and continuing to exist eternally, standing tall above the River of Life, supporting the sky like a pillar.' It is an original ancient tree that has existed in the Xuanhuang Realm since its creation, even holding the authority over longevity."

"As the saying goes, two tigers cannot share one mountain. The ever-growing power of this otherworldly divine wood inevitably posed a threat to it. Thus, the destruction of the Divine Wood Sect came to pass..."

Chen Tianhai casually recounted these ancient tales, one after another. Since embarking on the path of cultivation, Sun Erlang's life had been filled with cultivation and bloodshed. This was the first time he had the fortune to learn of such ancient secrets, and he listened with rapt attention.

"These 'Desolate God Sect' and 'Divine Wood Sect,' just by their names, seem different from other sects," Sun Erlang remarked.

Chen Tianhai smiled wryly. "That is only natural. These are sects born since the Xuanhuang Realm's creation, with intricate connections to the Immortal Realm. When the Immortal Realm existed, their positions were naturally unshakeable. However, if the Immortal Realm faced great changes and the immortal path was severed, their prosperity would naturally cease."

Sun Erlang nodded repeatedly as he listened.

"Young Master, do you know the origin of our Grand Origin Sect?" Chen Tianhai suddenly shifted the topic and asked.

"This junior does not know," Sun Erlang replied honestly.

"Our Grand Origin Sect is directly descended from True Immortals, having received the 'Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation' from the Grand Master Tiandu. This allows us to glimpse all possible changes in the future for a thousand years." Chen Tianhai said proudly.

"Unlike the second-rate sect of the Heavenly Secrets Sect, which pretends to know everything, we do not rely on obscure spiritual sensing. Instead, we use our powerful derivation capabilities to perform realistic simulations of the future."

Sun Erlang instantly recalled the word "simulation" that he had heard from Yi Shu.

"Young Master, please look!" Chen Tianhai waved his hand, and a small, azure blue sphere appeared before Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang looked closely, and it seemed as if countless superimposed images were simultaneously presented within the blue sphere. The scenes depicted the conversation between himself and Chen Tianhai in this very location. However, Sun Erlang keenly noticed that in each image, his own expression and actions were subtly different. Some even showed him suddenly making a move, only to be easily slain by Chen Tianhai.

"These are all the possible futures we have derived after your arrival. However, during my interaction with you, I have gained a clearer understanding of your temperament and strength. Therefore, some of these futures lost their meaning before their conclusions could be derived."

As Chen Tianhai spoke, approximately four-fifths of the images within the blue sphere suddenly dimmed. The remaining scenes precisely mirrored Sun Erlang's current experience. Sun Erlang gazed at this spectacle, as if understanding something. Yet, upon deeper reflection, he felt a sense of confusion, unable to grasp it fully.

Chen Tianhai continued, "In the time it took for us to converse, as the content of our discussion evolved, the number of derived results consistent with the future trajectory gradually decreased."

"Ultimately, after Young Master departs, our derivation for this matter will reach its conclusion and merge with reality. New derivations will then occur."

The blue sphere completely dimmed. After a moment of silence, it erupted with dazzling blue light. The sphere vanished, transforming into a blue mist that hovered before Sun Erlang. This blue mist displayed countless possibilities for the entire Xuanhuang Realm's future.

"Calculating the Xuanhuang Realm's future trajectory and calculating our meeting are essentially the same. As long as we possess enough information and can promptly correct for deviations in the derived results, we can simulate a future Xuanhuang Realm."

"And thus, we can see further along the river of time than outsiders."

Chen Tianhai waved his hand, and these blue mists, which had manifested various future scenes, instantly retracted into his body. Chen Tianhai, who had originally possessed an extraordinary aura, transformed into a dreamlike existence composed entirely of blue crystals. This sight momentarily stunned Sun Erlang.

"Our Grand Origin Sect has been calculating the future trajectory of the Xuanhuang Realm for over a thousand years with minimal error."

"But now..." Chen Tianhai stared directly at Sun Erlang.

"It's like in this very room where you and I are meeting, a mysterious person suddenly appears out of nowhere, kills you, and then flees."

"This is completely outside the realm of normal logic. Something that would never happen under normal circumstances..."

"We call this 'Beyond the Flux.'"

The blue light radiating from Chen Tianhai gradually subsided, and he returned to his normal human appearance.

Chapter 1195

A peculiar glint flashed in Chen Tianhai's eyes. "Our Grand Origin Sect has been in seclusion for thousands of years, with little interaction with the outside world. Your master actually knows our hidden location."

"He must know something about us. Even so, he still sent you to contact us..."

"He is confident that we will be interested in his 'variable beyond variables'."

Sun Erlang was stunned by this statement. "Is, is that so?"

However, upon recalling his master's unfathomable background and seemingly omniscient divine abilities, he instantly felt at ease.

"There are indeed transcendent variables in this world. Some have even profoundly influenced and altered the fate of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Our Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation, though claimed to be able to calculate everything under the heavens, are powerless when visitors from beyond the heavens, or True Immortals descending from the Empyrean, arrive. Such events, which transcend the very fabric of existence..."

"We are naturally incapable of dealing with them," Chen Tianhai said without reservation.

"However, our Grand Origin Sect does not reject or fear such occurrences Beyond the Flux," he added in a low voice, his words carrying unspoken implications.

"Visitors from beyond the heavens?" Sun Erlang mused thoughtfully.

But he quickly suppressed this slight flicker of thought. Regardless of his master's origins, his current identity was that of the Great Li's sole Chosen Emperor, upon whom the rise and fall of billions of lives depended. As his master's eldest disciple, he would forever stand firmly before him.

"So, do you前辈 mean you have agreed to our alliance proposal?" Sun Erlang asked after a brief silence.

"If there is a chance of victory, why should we refuse?" Chen Tianhai smiled faintly, not answering directly.

"Then what do you mean,前辈?"

"When our simulations show such discrepancies, we naturally must make corrections. Since the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi wishes to ally with us, they will naturally not refuse an ally's inspection, will they?" Chen Tianhai said calmly.

"This..."

The request was somewhat unexpected for Sun Erlang. His master had not given him specific instructions on how to handle this matter when he departed.

"Er Lang, you may make your own decisions regarding all matters. This Grand Origin Sect is important..."

"'...and also not important.'"

Sun Erlang suddenly recalled his master's last words before he left. "If you are hesitant facing a mere Grand Origin Sect, how will you contend with the Myriad Immortals Alliance for the Xuanhuang Realm in the future?"

A surge of valor rose within him, and Sun Erlang blurted out, "The Sacred Dynasty Great Qi has an empty seat awaiting. The Grand Origin Sect is welcome to come at any time."

A trace of blue light inexplicably flickered in Chen Tianhai's eyes. He did not respond, seemingly lost in thought.

"Since young master has said so, then our Grand Origin Sect will dispatch an envoy to accompany you to the Great Qi, to investigate thoroughly."

After a long pause, Chen Tianhai finally spoke. For some reason, Sun Erlang felt a sudden wave of relief, as if he had just narrowly escaped death.

"Then, when shall we depart,前辈?"

"No rush. You are a guest from afar. It is not easy for young master to travel such a long distance. Our Grand Origin Sect has not received any visitors for thousands of years."

"Furthermore, you are also returning Yi Xing's remains."

Chen Tianhai pondered for a moment and then asked, "Does young master happen to be interested in our 'simulations'?"

"Naturally, I am curious."

Chen Tianhai nodded. The ground and decorations around them vanished instantly. The two seemed to appear in the void, with a sapphire-blue crystal emitting a captivating light before them.

"This is the Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution," Chen Tianhai said in a strange tone.

"Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution?" Sun Erlang repeated the four words.

Looking at the mysterious crystal not far away, Sun Erlang was horrified to find that he could not discern the details on the crystal's surface. It seemed infinitely divisible; each mirror-like facet, upon closer inspection, revealed countless minuscule surfaces extending outwards. Merely observing it for a moment made Sun Erlang feel dizzy and nauseous, and he immediately averted his gaze.

"The Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution is the foundation of our Grand Origin Sect. Although the Grand Master passed down the Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation, its methods delve into the creation of heaven and earth, something exceptionally difficult for ordinary people to study. Even prodigies would exhaust their life essence and be on the verge of death before mastering the Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation," Chen Tianhai said, flashing to the side of the colossal sapphire-blue crystal. His figure seemed to be merging with the Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution.

"If even geniuses find it so arduous, let alone ordinary people. The inherent nature of the Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation dictates that our Grand Origin Sect can only have a handful of disciples each generation. With the dwindling talent, the sect struggles to grow. Perhaps one day, even the title of one of the Myriad Immortal Sects will be difficult to maintain."

"This was the predicted outcome for our Grand Origin Sect,"

"That is, if the Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution did not exist."

Chen Tianhai's tone changed abruptly. "Even a small fragment of the Stone Mother can instantly grant a mortal the calculation abilities comparable to a Dao Integration powerhouse. What a magnificent creation!"

"Young master, did you bring the white papers that Yi Xing had with him when he died?" Chen Tianhai suddenly asked Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang suddenly remembered and quickly produced the white papers.

"These white papers are called Treasure Boxes of Countering Tribulations. They were commonly used by disciples of the Grand Origin Sect in the past to practice their calculation abilities."

"There are a total of forty-nine thousand nine hundred and ninety-nine sheets. As long as they are restored to their original sequence, the treasure box can be revealed."

"Would young master like to try?" Chen Tianhai tossed the white papers into the air, letting them drift irregularly. Then he looked at Sun Erlang and asked with a smile.

"Restore them to their original sequence?" Sun Erlang had studied the white papers before; they were all identical, with no special markings.

"Is it purely luck, with no special secret method?" Sun Erlang ventured to ask.

Seeing Chen Tianhai's expression, Sun Erlang quickly did some mental calculations and his face immediately turned a little pale. He decisively refused.

"Precisely. For an ordinary person, this is a task that cannot be completed even by a lifetime of effort. But for disciples of the Grand Origin Sect who possess the Stone Mother..."

"It takes but an instant!"

Chen Tianhai lightly flicked his finger, and the scattered white papers in the air began to swirl madly. One by one, they arranged themselves in sequence. Finally, all the white papers returned to their positions, and after a blinding flash of light, the treasure box opened. Inside lay a jade slip and a blue, crystalline stone.

The appearance of the Stone of Dao Dissolution from the treasure box seemed to resonate with the Mother Stone of Dao Dissolution. Under the illumination of the Stone Mother's light, the color of the Stone of Dao Dissolution became even deeper. Chen Tianhai first collected the jade slip, then gently stroked the blue gemstone. With a hint of emotion, he looked at Sun Erlang and said, "Young master, I shall gift you this Stone of Dao Dissolution."

It wasn't until the Stone of Dao Dissolution landed in his hand that Sun Erlang snapped back to reality. "Ah?"

Chapter 1196

Sun Erlang never expected that after Senior Chen of the Grand Origin Sect had so meticulously laid out the profound benefits of the Dao-Melting Stone, he would actually gift him this one—a piece that had been lost for thousands of years from the tomb of Yi Xing.

"Thank you, Senior!" Sun Erlang, not a fool, immediately accepted the treasure, fearing the elder might change his mind.

He held it delightfully, examining it for a long time. Sun Erlang's expression gradually shifted from pleasant surprise to embarrassment.

"Senior, this Dao-Melting Stone…"

"It seems to be ineffective?"

Chen Tianhai replied, "To experience the profound marvels of the Dao-Melting Stone, you must use it in conjunction with our sect's 'Dao Dissolution Divine One' secret art!"

Sun Erlang immediately became wary. "Senior, I already have a master. I cannot join your Grand Origin Sect…"

Chen Tianhai chuckled, "Young master, you worry too much. Since the Dao-Melting Stone is already yours, why would I begrudge you this secret art?"

With a wave of his hand, Chen Tianhai's finger pointed through the air. Sun Erlang, enveloped in a phantom blue light, felt a surge of information for the 'Dao Dissolution Divine One' appear in his mind.

He slowly activated the secret art. The blue gem in his hand flowed like streams of light, being absorbed into his body.

Within his sea of consciousness, a radiant crystal of the same shape began to form.

Suddenly, Sun Erlang felt the world brighten.

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through his mind. His memories, from childhood to adulthood, even those he had nearly forgotten, began to resurface like a storm.

Furthermore, regarding his previous confusion – why Senior Chen of the Grand Origin Sect regarded him so highly – what had previously been vague suspicions in Sun Erlang's mind now led him to deduce several possibilities.

Perhaps it was an offering of goodwill from the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi and his master, or perhaps his unique constitution was advantageous to the Grand Origin Sect.

Or, it could be a conspiracy where the Grand Origin Sect planned to use the Dao-Melting Stone to achieve some form of control, a piece in a larger scheme…

Various possibilities were laid out systematically.

Simultaneously, he continuously adjusted his deductions based on the external information he had acquired.

"Is this… the Dao Dissolution Divine One?"

After a long while, Sun Erlang recovered from his shock, a sense of awe filling him.

He couldn't help but continue to gaze at the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone before him.

Even a small fragment possessed such potent deductive capabilities. He wondered just how powerful the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone itself was.

"Senior gifted me the Dao-Melting Stone, is it related to your earlier question about 'simulation'?"

His eyes fixed on the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone, Sun Erlang, in a moment of inspiration, suddenly asked.

Chen Tianhai nodded, a touch of mystique in his eyes, "Besides the future of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone contains numerous other fabricated worlds."

"This is both to fully utilize the Stone Mother's capabilities and to better calibrate established reality."

"You can think of them as… a form of practice."

Sun Erlang nodded thoughtfully.

The moment he had fully absorbed the Dao-Melting Stone, images of returning home, reporting to his master, and subsequent events flashed through his mind.

Unlike previous mere thoughts, this time, even the expressions and reactions of the people he would encounter in the future instantaneously emerged.

"This is the simulation of the future. However, my deductive abilities are insufficient, allowing me to only deduce parts strongly related to me."

"And the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone, besides simulating the Xuanhuang Realm, has even more capacity to simulate further."

As Sun Erlang pondered, Chen Tianhai continued, "These fabricated worlds are primarily created using the native materials of the Xuanhuang Realm as a cornerstone. Therefore, you might encounter many superficially similar existences…"

"But rest assured, they are sufficiently real. They will allow you to truly experience a complete life."

"Young master, have you ever heard the saying: to govern a land, the talents of a single county are enough? Although this saying circulates among mortals, it applies to our cultivation world as well. The Heavenly Mysteries Sect, which once dominated the world, at its core consisted of only twelve cultivators close to the Heavenly Mysteries King."

"The Heavenly Mysteries Sect?" Sun Erlang heard this name for the first time and felt a surge of curiosity.

However, Chen Tianhai had no intention of elaborating, instead continuing his deduction: "The world is not lacking in talent. What is lacking are the spaces and opportunities for them to grow."

"And in the worlds simulated by the Dao-Melting Stone, we have constructed such a stage. It allows individuals like you, young master, to grow rapidly."

Given his young age, Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a little proud upon hearing Chen Tianhai's high praise.

But he immediately frowned and asked, "How long do these simulations last? Will my master be waiting long?"

"A dream of a thousand years, a thousand years in an instant. Young master, are you ready?" Chen Tianhai suddenly exclaimed loudly.

Concurrently, a blue halo illuminated from the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone.

Within the halo, countless different world scenes could be vaguely glimpsed. A figure shrouded in blue light flew out from Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness, directly plunging into the halo of the Stone Mother.

Upon clearly seeing where Sun Erlang had ultimately landed, a flicker of surprise crossed Chen Tianhai's face.

"Ancient Azure Nether, a world where the immortal tribulation did not occur. Interesting…"

Chen Tianhai's earlier words had not told the entire story.

It was true that to govern a land, the talents of a single county were sufficient.

But that was merely for sufficiency.

Though the world was full of talent, there were always those who were unique.

They might be buried temporarily for various reasons, but given an opportunity, they could rise to prominence, their fates undergoing a complete upheaval.

The Dao Dissolution Mother Stone had simulated and iterated through countless worlds. Whenever such individuals appeared, they could dramatically influence and alter the course of world destinies.

"Countless futures branch out, countless possibilities. The existence or disappearance of certain beings does not affect these potential branches. They are insignificant individuals, ordinary members of the vast populace."

"But for certain individuals, their disappearance can lead to major future changes, even directly causing the loss of numerous possibilities. Such individuals are 'Focus Variables'."

"The Dao Dissolution Mother Stone has statistically analyzed and summarized the numerous Focus Variables that have appeared in simulated worlds to develop a set of effective prediction methods. This Sun Erlang exhibits certain characteristics that belong to a Focus Variable."

Chen Tianhai's thoughts churned. This was also the reason he treated Sun Erlang with such kindness.

Since the Grand Origin Sect had been discovered, it was inevitable that they would "enter the world" and become entangled in future variables.

Naturally, preparations needed to be made.

His eyes narrowed, as if trying to discern everything happening in Sun Erlang's world.

"As I predicted, three years of dormancy, followed by a single rise to power. Once established, their momentum is unstoppable."

"Fortunately, judging by his actions, order and reason still remain."

"He is not an 'Extreme Variable'."

Giving Sun Erlang an opportunity to simulate was also a chance for the Grand Origin Sect to understand Sun Erlang's character.

Chapter 1197: A Single Thought Overturns Heaven and Earth

Chen Tianhai felt a bit more at ease.

"To have taught such a disciple, I suppose that mysterious Sacred Emperor would not act too unpredictably."

Extreme Variables were a special type of Focus Variable. Once they appeared, they would cause disruptive impacts on the existing world, completely overturning the future worlds deduced by the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone in an instant. The Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate of that year belonged to the category of Extreme Variables.

Chen Tianhai's memories seemed to return to that time.

In the Great Hall of the Grand Origin Sect.

"I have already given the Great Dao Sect my reply. A mere Dao Integration cultivator is nothing to fear," the previous Sect Master of the Grand Origin Sect, Chen Tianhai's master, Daoist Star Extremity, said in a deep voice.

Chen Tianhai's expression was somewhat anxious. "How can you make a decision so hastily? I feel there's something inexplicably strange about that Doctrine Transmitter. Why not observe further?"

Daoist Star Extremity was slightly displeased. "The Dao Dissolving Mother Stone has already made hundreds of millions of deductions. What possible problem could there be?"

"Surely, with the combined efforts of so many Longevity Realm cultivators, we cannot apprehend him?"

Chen Tianhai was rendered speechless for a moment.

Between each major realm of cultivation, the strength differed like that between heaven and the abyss, and the higher the realm, the more pronounced this gap became. A Golden Core cultivator could kill a Nascent Soul cultivator, but a Dao Integration cultivator taking down a Longevity Realm cultivator was… extremely rare since the dawn of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Besides, the operation to apprehend the Doctrine Transmitter was personally led by Fang Dingge, the Sect Master of the Great Dao Sect. It was said that a full six Longevity Realm cultivators would act simultaneously. Sect Master Fang was extremely cautious; even with such a vast disparity between opponents and allies, he did not underestimate them. Not only was the plan strictly confidential, but within the Myriad Immortal Sects, only the sect masters and a few direct disciples knew of it. They even sent a message to the Grand Origin Sect, wishing to use the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone to deduce any potential variables that might arise during this operation.

This level of prudence was difficult for Daoist Star Extremity to comprehend. However, as the leader of the Great Dao Sect, he couldn't afford to offend him. Daoist Star Extremity still used the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone to meticulously deduce all possible scenarios. The results of hundreds of millions of deductions all concluded with the Doctrine Transmitter being successfully captured. Theoretically, the Myriad Immortal Sects' operation had virtually no chance of failure.

Yet, for some unknown reason, Chen Tianhai still harbored a lingering, heavy sense of unease.

He had once disguised his identity and secretly approached the Doctrine Transmitter Immortal Venerable to observe him, before the Myriad Immortals Alliance had drawn the attention of the Myriad Immortal Sects. The Doctrine Transmitter himself appeared to be a kind and benevolent old man, creating another unique path for those unable to cultivate. But after witnessing the fanaticism in the eyes of the new law cultivators surrounding the Doctrine Transmitter, Chen Tianhai felt a chill down his spine.

What made him even more uneasy was that the Doctrine Transmitter seemed to have sensed his hidden observation at the time and had looked slightly in his direction. A simple, calm gaze, yet it was like a nightmare, constantly reappearing in Chen Tianhai's mind. It took a long time for the negative emotions caused by that glance to gradually dissipate. However, the sudden knowledge of the plan had reawakened the nightmare.

As the foremost direct disciple of the Grand Origin Sect and already having one foot in the Dao Integration realm at a young age, Chen Tianhai did not believe that ordinary Dao Integration cultivators could have such a terrifying impact on him. Out of his own shame, Chen Tianhai did not mention the peculiarities he experienced to his master. However, he repeatedly emphasized to his master how extraordinary that Doctrine Transmitter Immortal Venerable was. Yet, he could not change his master's attitude.

After leaving his master's presence, Chen Tianhai's unease intensified. He suddenly had the urge to reactivate the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone and conduct another deduction. Chen Tianhai was startled by his own thought. The Dao Dissolving Mother Stone was a supreme treasure of the Grand Origin Sect, the very foundation of its existence, concerning the Dao paths of all Grand Origin Sect cultivators, present and future. Only the Sect Master of the Grand Origin Sect was qualified to use it. Even as Chen Tianhai, the foremost direct disciple, he could only observe from afar and was not allowed to approach it without permission.

Once the thought arose, it became difficult to quell, even making Chen Tianhai somewhat absent-minded. Fortunately, he finally had an opportunity. One of the ten sects, the Prison of Uncertainty, seemed to be in some disarray and sent a request for aid to the other immortal sects. With the Supreme Sect, Heavenly Sword Sect, and Beast Taming Sect occupied with the plan to apprehend the Doctrine Transmitter, they were unable to assist. Thus, the matter was assigned to Daoist Star Extremity for handling. From Daoist Star Extremity's expression before his departure, it was evident that the turmoil in the Prison of Uncertainty was significant. He entrusted the sect's affairs to Chen Tianhai and the elders, thus giving Chen Tianhai his chance.

After a period of intense internal struggle, Chen Tianhai could no longer suppress the urge within him. Under the guise of secrecy, he arrived before the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone. All previous deduction records were preserved. Chen Tianhai retrieved the results of the last deduction. As his master had said, it was exactly as described, and perhaps his master had even held back some details. He had performed tens of billions of deductions, and all the results were identical.

However, for some inexplicable reason, even after seeing these deduction results with his own eyes, Chen Tianhai was still not entirely convinced. He urged the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone to perform another deduction. Azure light pulsed continuously, and endless possibilities unfolded.

"... Ugh." A groan interrupted Chen Tianhai's thoughts. The connection with the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone was severed, and Sun Erlang had returned from his simulation to reality. His eyes were tightly shut, seemingly still adjusting. The aura around him was changing rapidly and visibly, as if transforming from a sharp-edged youth into a composed master who had weathered a hundred tribulations in an instant.

"Thank you for fulfilling my wish, Senior!" After a long period, Sun Erlang opened his eyes. His gaze was tranquil and profound.

"Young Master, what did you experience?" Chen Tianhai asked, feigning ignorance.

"During the era of the ancient ten great immortal sects, before the tribulation descended, I was merely a commoner from the countryside. By chance, I witnessed two Golden Core cultivators fighting and perishing together. Mustering my courage, I collected the supplies from their bodies."

"It took me three years to finally open the storage rings left by the two Golden Core cultivators. From then on, I officially began my cultivation path..." Sun Erlang said calmly.

Chen Tianhai knew that although Sun Erlang spoke of it casually, the process of opening the two storage rings in the simulated world was quite perilous. The old friends of the two Golden Core cultivators came looking for the inheritance. Although he possessed a mountain of treasure, he could not access it. In a desperate gamble, he squandered all his wealth to obtain a crude cultivation method. Stumbling and fumbling, he finally reached the Qi Refining realm, allowing him to use the resources in the storage rings.

Sun Erlang narrated his experiences in the simulated world, eventually reaching the peak of Dao Integration, only to find no hope of breaking through. Chen Tianhai, although he had witnessed the other's experiences, still listened with great interest.

"If not for that momentary lapse of judgment back then, perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm would still be the way it is now," Chen Tianhai thought to himself.

Chapter 1198: Sinner of the Xuanhuang Realm

In a sense, Chen Tianhai bore significant responsibility for the Xuanhuang Realm’s current plight.

It was he who, acting without authorization, activated the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone and initiated billions of derivations. This allowed the Dharma-Preachers to glimpse a sliver of a chance for victory.

With the demise of the Ten Great Immortal Sects and six Life Longevity Realm cultivators, Chen Tianhai was undeniably a sinner!

The Dao Dissolution Mother Stone’s numerous derivations could not, of course, be kept hidden. When his master, Daoist Xingji, returned and discovered the terrifying consequences, he was enraged, suspecting Chen Tianhai’s treacherous actions were the cause. He immediately intended to execute Chen Tianhai as atonement to the world.

However, after considerable thought, Daoist Xingji ultimately refrained from acting.

Firstly, their master-disciple bond was deep, akin to father and son, and Daoist Xingji’s heart remained soft.

Secondly, if this news were to spread widely, it would undoubtedly make the Grand Origin Sect a target of universal condemnation, and perhaps even lead to its eradication from the Xuanhuang Realm. After all, a traitor is always more detestable than an enemy.

Yet, the brutal demise of his former friend and his own overwhelming guilt made it impossible for Daoist Xingji to feign ignorance.

Consequently, he stripped Chen Tianhai of his status as the first direct disciple, imprisoned him in the Grand Origin Sect’s deepest dungeon, and decreed eternal suppression. To the outside world, it was declared that Chen Tianhai had been a defector.

Chen Tianhai remained in the lightless cell for an unknown duration.

By the time he was released, the great tribulation had descended, and the Grand Origin Sect faced a crisis of survival.

The world was in chaos, and the once prestigious Ten Great Immortal Sects were too preoccupied to even attend to themselves.

The disciples of the Grand Origin Sect, by perpetually utilizing the Dao-Melting Stone for complex derivations to suppress the killing intent from incompatible cultivation paths, had not fallen into the extreme disorder that afflicted other immortal sects.

However, they too had reached their limit.

It was not just the Dao-Melting Stones within each cultivator; even the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone, due to the sudden appearance of "Extreme Variables," had overturned all past derivations and was rapidly re-calculating. To secure a sliver of hope for the Grand Origin Sect, its computational power was nearly depleted. Daoist Xingji, on the verge of death, released Chen Tianhai.

He also pointed Chen Tianhai towards a path: abandon the physical body, let information be eternal.

“Misfortune and fortune are intertwined. Though you made a grave mistake back then, you also uncovered the Dharma-Preachers’ secrets through it.”

“Now, the Dharma-Preachers have been lured away from the Xuanhuang Realm by our final gambit. This has allowed us to preserve our strength and gain a fleeting moment of respite.”

“Otherwise, all our immortal sect inheritances would likely have perished!”

Before he could fully impart his dying words, Daoist Xingji perished.

And before the tribulation of incompatible cultivation paths completely engulfed the Grand Origin Sect, Chen Tianhai successfully integrated the entire Grand Origin Sect into the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone.

Fortunately, before his master’s death, he had already eliminated all dissenting forces within the sect.

Otherwise, Chen Tianhai would not have persevered until that moment.

When every person in the sect could experience and utilize the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone’s near-infinite computational power, Chen Tianhai knew his master’s decision was correct.

As the divided Dao-Melting Stones were re-integrated, and mingled with the intentions of thousands of cultivators from the Grand Origin Sect, the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone itself underwent a miraculous and profound transformation.

It developed consciousness.

A collective consciousness belonging to the Grand Origin Sect.

During the thousands of years of seclusion in the Profound Heaven Realm, Chen Tianhai reflected on the past and re-examined his actions from that time.

He had been repeatedly plagued by unease then, and had even suspected being ensnared by a hidden trap set by the Dharma-Preachers.

However, whether it was the sect’s restricting artifacts, his master, or even other Life Longevity realm cultivators like Taishang and Heavenly Sword Sect, none found any anomalies in him.

Chen Tianhai could only assume it was his own inner demons at play.

“The Dharma-Preachers’ methods are truly insidious and difficult to guard against.” “It’s a pity that my master passed away before revealing their full secrets. As for the other confidants within the immortal sects, they are long gone. However, after so many years, I have deduced a general outline…”

Chen Tianhai’s thoughts churned as he listened to Sun Erlang recount his simulated experiences.

“By the way, Senior, the cultivation methods I learned in the simulated world…” Sun Erlang hesitated.

“They are naturally real,” Chen Tianhai stated calmly.

“But it is best that you do not learn or use them in reality. Otherwise, you might attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Law Enforcement Hall and be hunted,” Chen Tianhai added.

“The Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Law Enforcement Hall…” Sun Erlang whispered, but his eyes held no fear.

“Very well, Young Master, since you have gained much, please return. Do not keep your master waiting too long,” Chen Tianhai commanded.

“Yi Shu will accompany you to the Great Qi pocket world.”

Before his words had fully settled, Sun Erlang felt his vision blur.

When he regained his senses, he found himself outside a transparent blue structure. Yi Shu stood nearby with a gentle smile, as if he had been waiting for some time.

“Hm?” Sun Erlang immediately sensed that Yi Shu was different now. He was unlike any other cultivator within the Grand Origin Sect.

The cold, uniform aura was gone, replaced by a vibrant, living presence with its own vitality.

“Thanks to you, Young Master, I temporarily have a physical body again and can go out and enjoy myself for a while,” Yi Shu said with a smile, explaining the current state of the Grand Origin Sect to Sun Erlang.

“Information is eternal…” With centuries of experience in the simulated world, Sun Erlang was significantly more composed.

Yet, he was still astonished by the Grand Origin Sect’s fantastical concept.

“Young Master, you needn’t be surprised. If you truly experienced it like we have, you would know that there’s little difference between having a physical body or not. In fact, a real body can even be a burden,” Yi Shu said with a chuckle.

“But it’s nice to have a change of pace occasionally.”

Yi Shu followed Sun Erlang out of the Profound Heaven Realm and headed directly towards the Cloudy Sea, the entrance to the Great Qi pocket world. Clearly, the Grand Origin Sect was familiar with the location of the Great Qi pocket world.

However, upon passing through the Immortal Execution Great Formation and seeing only a vast, empty void with no pocket world present, Yi Shu finally showed a hint of surprise.

Sun Erlang first blinked in confusion, then his memory from a hundred years ago seemed to resurface. With a slightly awkward expression, he said, “Senior, please wait a moment. Our Sacred Dynasty Great Qi now drifts through the void, its location uncertain. I do not know where it is at present…”

“Let me ask.”

A moment later, a golden light shot forth from the darkness, instantly arriving before them.

“Greetings, Senior Bai Hua!” Sun Erlang exclaimed respectfully upon recognizing the newcomer.

Bai Hua glanced at Yi Shu, saying nothing more.

“Follow me.”

A glazed golden light enveloped them, and the surrounding void seemed to twist, emitting a strange luminescence. When the golden light dissipated, they had returned to the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi.

Chapter 1199

"Senior Baihua, has your cultivation advanced significantly again?"

Having gone through a hundred simulated lifetimes, Sun Erlang was no longer the same person he used to be. He could obviously see the changes that had happened to Daoist Baihua during his absence. A flicker of awe went through him.

Yi Shu, on the other hand, watched with great interest the five interconnected rings in the sky, along with the six bright stars surrounding them.

"Senior Baihua has moved two more Grotto-heavens. It must have been taxing. These new Grotto-heavens seem even larger than the previous ones. No wonder I feel that the Great Qi is traveling much faster through the void," Sun Erlang thought to himself.

"The Sacred Dynasty Great Qi indeed lives up to its name," Yi Shu exclaimed genuinely, sensing the myriad forces of the pocket world that enveloped him at all times.
