"I believe that in no more than fifty years, such earth-shattering changes could occur in what is merely a mortal world. I've become truly curious about your master, young sir."

Daoist Baihua eyed Yi Shu again inexplicably, but did not speak. He merely let out a cold snort. After bringing the two to the Sacred Emperor's Throne, she left directly.

Sun Erlang's heart trembled as he looked at the towering, mountain-like figure seated above. He had initially thought that after experiencing so many realistic worlds in the simulation and witnessing the most powerful Longevity Realm cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Sects, he would be more at ease when facing his master upon his return. But at this moment, Sun Erlang knew he was mistaken.

When facing a cultivator of the Longevity Realm, Sun Erlang felt the pressure of the disparity in cultivation, the coercion of the strong upon the weak. However, when facing his master, the Faceless Sacred Emperor of the Great Qi, the reason Sun Erlang's body, mind, and even soul trembled uncontrollably was the unfathomable mystery of the Faceless Sacred Emperor and… a natural condescension, as if a higher being was looking down upon a lower one.

"Master, I have returned," Sun Erlang said, kneeling on one knee as he always did.

Yi Shu, however, cupped his fists slightly.

"It's good that you're back. It seems this trip has been quite fruitful," the Faceless Sacred Emperor, Li Ping, said, his voice echoing in the vast, high Sacred Emperor's Throne hall.

Sun Erlang recounted his experiences in detail, leaving nothing out. After listening to Sun Erlang's report, Li Ping then said to Yi Shu, "Since the Grand Origin Sect is so polite, we shouldn't be negligent either. For this period, you shall lead him around the Sacred Dynasty."

"Feel free to go anywhere. You can take him wherever he wishes to see."

Sun Erlang was slightly stunned, then quickly said, "This disciple understands."

"Go on then." The emperor had no intention of conversing with Yi Shu.

Although Yi Shu was an embodiment of the Grand Origin Sect's collective consciousness, he also possessed his own will and temper. He tilted his head slightly, looked at the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated above, and cupped his fists again. The emperor did not utter another word until Yi Shu left the Sacred Emperor's Throne.

"Seeing is believing. After you've explored, Senior, you will naturally have your answers," Sun Erlang quickly explained, trying to ease any potential awkwardness.

"Very well, let me see what is so special about this place," Yi Shu replied with a smile. However, his smile seemed different from before.

When Yi Shu saw that almost everyone in the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi was cultivating the same technique, a hint of surprise flashed in his eyes. When he saw the Immortal Spirit Towers placed casually throughout the Sacred Dynasty, constantly releasing Spirit Qi outwards, Yi Shu's smile gradually disappeared. After observing the Great Myriad Spirits Formation of Heaven and Earth that connected the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi with other pocket worlds, Yi Shu's expression turned to shock and disbelief.

"Young sir, do you know…" Yi Shu stopped himself mid-sentence.

Sun Erlang thought the other party was simply amazed by the scene in the Sacred Dynasty. Seeing that he hadn't finished his sentence, Sun Erlang didn't press further.

Next, Sun Erlang took Yi Shu to visit some important places in the Sacred Dynasty, such as Wang Xuanba's exotic beast breeding base and the site where the Sky-Patrolling Arrows were forged. As they walked, Yi Shu became increasingly silent, with deep confusion and doubt flashing across his eyes from time to time.

Seeing Yi Shu's expression, Sun Erlang, who had been constantly shocked within the Grand Origin Sect before, felt a sense of satisfaction and secret pride.

"Senior Yi, is there anything else you wish to see?"

Yi Shu did not respond for a moment. He gazed into the distance, as if trying to take in the entire magical pocket world.

"If you hadn't told me you intended to counterattack the Xuanhuang Realm, I would have almost thought this was some hidden secret realm of the Myriad Immortals Alliance," Yi Shu said suddenly after a long pause. "Apart from the number of cultivators and top-tier experts, you indeed have the qualifications to challenge the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"However, based on what I've seen so far, it's still not enough to form an alliance with our Grand Origin Sect," Yi Shu concluded. "The waters of the Myriad Immortals Alliance are much deeper than they appear," Yi Shu said meaningfully.

Sun Erlang did not show any displeasure at Yi Shu's reaction. Instead, he nodded slightly, deep in thought. After some thought, Sun Erlang finally led Yi Shu to the space beneath the Sacred Emperor's Throne, where Senior Yin was located.

He didn't meet Senior Yin in person. However, just by looking at the dozens of young children cultivating there, many of whom had already reached Foundation Establishment at a tender age, Yi Shu finally showed a trace of discomposure.

"This…" With his discerning eye, he instantly recognized the uniqueness of these Foundation Establishment children. "How is this possible?"

At that moment, in the Profound Heaven Realm, everyone in the Grand Origin Sect cast their gaze towards the Great Qi pocket world. Even the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone, which was constantly radiating a blue glow, seemed to pause momentarily.

"Not long ago, a young boy, building upon the foundation of 'Self-Inherent Foundation,' took it a step further and forged a Primordial Golden Core," Sun Erlang said softly.

"Self-Inherent Foundation?!" Yi Shu froze upon hearing this phrase. It wasn't a description; his thoughts had truly come to a standstill. Sun Erlang, who possessed the Dao-Melting Stone, immediately recognized this as the ultimate expression of the Dao-Melting Stone's computational power.

"Impossible!" Yi Shu blurted out after a long silence. The children who were diligently cultivating and pondering in this area all looked towards Yi Shu. Displeasure lingered in their eyes. Under Senior Yin's tutelage, they had been taught from a young age to detest the word "impossible."

Yi Shu realized his lapse in composure and coughed lightly to cover it up. He walked slowly towards a delicately carved female child and observed her carefully. The more he looked, the more astonished he became. Sun Erlang saw Yi Shu's hand clench uncontrollably.

"Beyond the variables? Beyond the variables?"

"No, this isn't Beyond the Fluxs, this is…" Yi Shu abruptly looked up, as if meeting the gaze of the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated in the Sacred Emperor's Throne. "The Azure Nether Tribulation Passer?!"

Chapter 1200

Years ago, when first learning of the Guiding Tribulation Sect's theories, Yi Shu, like most cultivators of the Grand Origin Sect, scoffed at them.

When calamity struck, why not actively seek a solution, but instead choose to be a coward and place hope in some ethereal destined savior? It was a variable with no basis and utterly unpredictable.

However, the Guiding Tribulation Sect, as one of the Myriad Immortal Sects and inheriting the teachings of Grand Master Tiandu, had existed since the ancient epochs. For it to have endured for so many years indicated it indeed held some special reasoning.

It was just that outsiders couldn't perceive its profound mysteries.

Today, upon arriving at the Sacred Dynasty Enlightenment, which seemed to have suddenly sprung from a crack in the stones, Yi Shu witnessed technologies that could rival the Myriad Immortals Alliance's highest standards. Furthermore, there was a new cultivation method, utterly different from the current practice, capable of completely subverting the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's foundation in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Yi Shu's mind instantly recalled the words of the Guiding Tribulation Sect from years past.

At that time, as the great tribulation began to manifest, the core members of the Myriad Immortal Sects convened to discuss possible countermeasures.

Each sect offered its opinions, but only the Guiding Tribulation Sect's attitude was utterly passive.

"Esteemed sirs, calamity is unavoidable. If it could be averted through mere struggle, what would it be called a calamity?" the sect master of the Guiding Tribulation Sect, Lu Chengheng, said, his gaze fixed downwards, his demeanor detached as if it concerned him not.

"Is this why your Guiding Tribulation Sect places those 'World-Observing Divine Eyes' everywhere?"

Xiahou Yan, the master of the Prison of Uncertainty, known for his volatile temper, retorted with a scowl.

"Xiahou, you misunderstand. This is a necessary method to await the appearance of the 'Azure Nether Tribulation Passer'," Lu Chengheng stated calmly.

"Nonsense about an Azure Nether Tribulation Passer! When calamity descends, all beings perish. If everyone dies, where will this savior possibly emerge from?" Xiahou was on the verge of spouting profanities.

"Are you questioning the Grand Master's legacy?" Lu Chengheng's single sentence rendered Xiahou Yan speechless.

"And are there not still yourselves?" Lu Chengheng smiled and added meaningfully, "The Xuanhuang Realm is not so easily destroyed. If there is any cultivation world in this sea of stars that can endure until the very end, it must be ours, the Azure Nether."

The leaders of the ten sects heard this and none offered any objection.

After a brief silence, perhaps to appease them, Lu Chengheng provided a concise explanation: "The doctrine of tribulation passage is not baseless. Great epochs of calamity, life, and death are merely a part of the cycle of heaven and earth. Even the great tribulation of the Immortal Realm may not be beyond the calculations of True Immortals."

"You all live in constant dread, yet observe the Grand Master. Has He shown even a trace of concern?"

Xuan Ji, the supreme leader of the Supreme Sect, who had remained silent, finally spoke: "The Grand Master's cultivation is profound, capable of walking on level ground even within the Immortal Ruins. Calamities that cause the destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm do not concern Him at all. But we cannot say the same. Brother Lu, I will not obstruct your choice to withdraw from the world. However, when facing calamity, you cannot abstain from contributing any effort."

Meeting everyone's converged gaze, Lu Chengheng finally nodded, compromising.

However, Lu Chengheng's final sentence plunged everyone present into silence once more.

"One day, you will all understand that our Guiding Tribulation Sect was right."

At this moment, spanning millennia, Yi Shu's body, embodying the collective consciousness of the Grand Origin Sect, suddenly recalled Lu Chengheng's words.

After a rudimentary understanding of the "Self-Inherent Foundation" principle, the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone incorporated this variable into its future projections for the Xuanhuang Realm.

The previously clear future, as if struck by a chaotic storm, became indistinct and blurred.

Even with the Stone Mother's current, almost divine, computational power, it became momentarily lost.

The Grand Origin Sect had also attempted to deduce the possibility of a new cultivation method that could subvert the existing doctrine.

But...

Creating something from nothing was not the same as projecting the future based on existing data.

The Dao Dissolution Mother Stone only judged that such a possibility existed, but the probability was exceedingly small.

It was even smaller than the probability of the Doctrine Transmitter surviving the siege by those in the Longevity Realm in the past.

Besides the inherent difficulty of creating the new cultivation method itself, there was also the matter of the Doctrine Transmitter's pervasive influence over the Xuanhuang Realm.

Just as cultivators would gradually forget the calamities of the Xuanhuang Realm and blindly ignore the topographical changes that had occurred over thousands of years,

deducing the new cultivation method was not merely the ultimate expression of one's own creativity.

It was also a struggle against the Doctrine Transmitter's influence.

Thus, in the deductions of the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone, which was fully aware of the current strength of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, the probability of the new cultivation method emerging was infinitely close to zero.

Yet, things that far exceeded the scope of deduction had inexplicably happened.

In a corner of the Xuanhuang Realm, adrift in the void and yet unknown to anyone, within a recently established power…

The new cultivation method had not only quietly emerged but had even progressed to the Golden Core stage!

This was truly earth-shattering, causing the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone's projections to momentarily stutter.

Because, based on all known factors, it could not find a reason for the new cultivation method to manifest at this particular point in time.

The only explanation was something outside the norm, something not accounted for in the variables: the Azure Nether Tribulation Passer.

The ten sects had privately discussed the Azure Nether Tribulation Passer.

They had reached a near-universal conclusion: if such a Tribulation Passer truly existed, they would either be from outside the Xuanhuang Realm or a reincarnation of a powerful individual.

A native cultivator who rose to power solely through their own efforts, capable of averting world-ending disaster…

It was utterly impossible.

No matter how prodigious their talent, it would not suffice.

The environment of the Xuanhuang Realm could no longer cultivate the foundation needed to oppose the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate.

"What is the origin of this Faceless Sacred Emperor of the Sacred Dynasty Enlightenment?"

At this moment, Yi Shu, or rather, the Grand Origin Sect, harbored no more contempt.

Instead, they regarded the Sacred Dynasty Enlightenment as an equal, perhaps even a force of higher standing.

Furthermore, they were genuinely considering the possibility of forming an alliance with the Sacred Dynasty Enlightenment.

As one of the former rulers of the Xuanhuang Realm, now compressed into a mere small pocket world by the Myriad Immortals Alliance under the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, it was impossible for the Grand Origin Sect to harbor no resentment.

Even though they no longer required territory or resources, the loss of what they once possessed remained as a lingering nightmare in the consciousness of the Grand Origin Sect.

"The Great Dao Sect, the Supreme Sect, and others, though outwardly resisting the Myriad Immortals Alliance, have in reality long since colluded with them, becoming no different from the Doctrine Transmitter's lackeys."

"But, perhaps like us, they have not entirely surrendered. What they lack is merely an opportunity."

The emergence of the Sacred Dynasty Enlightenment, especially the appearance of the new cultivation method, offered the Grand Origin Sect a glimmer of hope.

However, being a sect that had survived the ancient calamities,

they approached any decision concerning their fate with extreme caution.

Chapter 1201: The Future of Dao Dissolution

Yi Shu slowly recovered from his shock, still not voicing his stance. However, his actions had already changed. He had initially planned to observe briefly and then return, but now he had requested to stay for a longer period of observation from Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang appeared troubled. "I cannot make this decision on my own. I must ask my master for instructions."

Yi Shu nodded. "I believe your master will agree."

As expected, the Faceless Sacred Emperor agreed to the Tai Origin Sect's request to remain. However, there was a condition.

"To help the cultivators of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty grow rapidly through [Simulation]?"

Yi Shu hesitated for a moment.

"My master said that even if the Tai Origin Sect didn't help with this, he has other methods, though they would be more troublesome. The Tai Origin Sect's core focus is still on deducing the future of the Xuanhuang Realm. Until the ultimate outcome is determined, my master agrees for your Tai Origin Sect to maintain a degree of neutrality. Consider it a form of transaction," Sun Erlang relayed Li Ping's exact words.

Yi Shu fell silent for a moment. After discussion with the Tai Origin Sect and the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone, he finally agreed. For the Tai Origin Sect, running more simulations was merely making use of idle computing power. It offered a potential future path, making it a worthwhile endeavor. Just as some cultivators had chosen to flee before the calamity arrived, the Myriad Immortal Sects never placed all their hopes on a single basket.

From then on, the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty gained an observer. Apart from the Sacred Emperor's throne, the areas inhabited by the Netherfolk, and the Fishing Pond in the Xuanhuang Realm, Yi Shu could observe freely without restriction. Li Ping was not worried about this. The Great Qi Sacred Dynasty was blessed by destiny, and with the further refinement of the Great Myriad Spirits Formation, Yi Shu's every move was within his grasp. Even the life and death of Yi Shu's current physical body were subject to his will.

Meanwhile, in the distant Xuanhuang Realm, someone was already setting their sights on the Tai Origin Sect.

"Although I have no intention of harming others, I must leave a failsafe."

"The Tai Origin Sect has abandoned physical existence and collectively resides within the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone. Their information is indeed immortal. They could even escape the terrifying calamity when the immortal ruins' immortals could destroy the world with a glance. But..."

"As the saying goes, there are specialists in every field!"

In the Dharma Deduction space, Li Fan appeared to be meditating. In truth, his thoughts were churning. Immortal information was impervious to physical means and even ordinary immortal arts. However, data corruption might prove effective. To Li Fan's knowledge, no such method existed in the current traditions of the Xuanhuang Realm. His idea stemmed from the mysterious [Profound Origin Spirit Array]. This composite of nine immortal-grade great formations possessed unimaginable power, capable of recreating the elements of earth, fire, water, and wind in the void and creating new worlds. Fortunately, with the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc and a series of coincidences, Li Fan had gained an initial understanding of three of them: Starry Enigma, Myriad Spirits Returning to Numbers; Desolate Falling, Empty Chamber Blooming Flowers; and Boundless Unity, Primordial Square. Among these, the Starry Enigma, Myriad Spirits Returning to Numbers great formation possessed the mystical ability to digitize and arbitrarily transform everything within its domain.

"Although this is only theoretical, and the material requirements make it impossible to set up the formation at present, it's fortunate that the Tai Origin Sect lacks a physical form. Pure information, on the other hand, is more likely to reveal flaws."

"If Primordial Square and Myriad Spirits Returning to Numbers were to cooperate..."

In his sea of consciousness, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, with the computational power of the Dao-Melting Stone, was rapidly deducing a new form of formation. Over the past six months, Li Fan's spiritual manifestation had roughly completed the analysis of the Primordial Square formation within the Immeasurable Mirror. After some repairs by his spiritual manifestation, the damaged Immeasurable Mirror's capabilities had significantly increased, at the corresponding cost of his spiritual manifestation weakening further. However, Li Fan was not worried. Sun Luyuan had been delaying the task assigned by the mirror controller [Fu], and his deliberate perfunctory actions had not gone unnoticed by the other party. The pressure on him was increasing, and it might not be long before he had to yield and once again use the Immeasurable Mirror to attempt to spy on the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Sensing the information from his spiritual manifestation, Li Ping, Li Fan was now contemplating something else: the origin of the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone. The Tai Origin Sect should not have possessed the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone when they initially inherited the legacy of Grand Master Tiandu. It was only later that they acquired this treasure from some unknown source, which transformed the Tai Origin Sect's cultivation methods from being suitable only for a select few to being cultivable by everyone, solidifying the Tai Origin Sect's position among the ten sects.

"There are many treasures in the Xuanhuang Realm capable of deduction, such as the Immeasurable Mirror. Although damaged, it can still predict some future events. However, the miraculous abilities of the Immeasurable Mirror and even the Heavenly Profound Mirror are more likely due to the crafting of immortal-level power; they are considered 'artifacts'."

"The Dao Dissolving Mother Stone, however, is more like a pure 'object'."

"A legendary heavenly treasure of rare materials... Although the Xuanhuang Realm is vast, it doesn't seem like a place that could naturally give birth to such a divine object."

Li Fan suddenly recalled a lost piece of information he had heard from someone from the Guiding Tribulation Sect. An alien star fell into the Xuanhuang Realm, causing all Spirit Qi in the realm to fail.

"Could it be that this Dao Dissolving Mother Stone also originated from beyond the stars?" Li Fan could not help but speculate. But this was merely a guess. Only if he could infiltrate the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone one day would he truly know the answer.

"The Mother Stone deduces the future purely through its own immense computing power. Even so, it has reached a certain extreme, demonstrating its powerful calculation capabilities. If it were further enhanced with external aids, optimizing its deduction methods, one can only imagine what it could achieve." For instance, the Dao-Melting Stone in Li Fan's sea of consciousness, despite being upgraded to high-grade through several fusions, struggled to deduce formations independently, let alone immortal-grade great formations; even the [Gate of Life and Death Great Formation] was a challenge. Similarly, if the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc were used alone, it was merely a mortal object and would find it difficult to deduce immortal-grade great formations. However, with both working together, the situation would be vastly different.

"Complementary and mutually beneficial." This harmonious scene made Li Fan marvel at the possibilities. If the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone were paired with something like the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, and not just for formations, what a spectacle it would be. The techniques of the Dharma Deduction Art, the future predictions of the Immeasurable Mirror... If these were combined with the terrifying computing power of the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone, they would undergo a qualitative change. It could even be repeatedly superimposed on the already transcendent Dao Dissolving Mother Stone through constant reincarnation in each life, pushing it to an unimaginable level. The assistance of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc in Li Fan's reincarnation was undeniable. If other elements were added... it made Li Fan's heart pound with excitement.

"Perhaps the path to breaking through this predicament lies within."

"A treasure is before me; it all depends on how I strategize." Li Fan's eyes gleamed.

Chapter 1202: Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall

The Mother of Dao-Melting Stone was, after all, a being that had survived the cataclysmic destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan did not dare to underestimate it.

"There's no need to rush success. In this life, I will be an absolutely reliable partner, earning the trust of the Grand Origin Sect, and thus discovering more hidden information about them."

"As for myself, I will first perfect this data pollution formation. If there's an opportunity, I'll test it out on a small scale and see the results."

The Dharma Deduction space provided Li Fan with ample safe time, free from external disturbances. Apart from occasional encounters with the little loli's stubbornness, it was quite leisurely. The mutual exchanges between the three guarding elders became increasingly infrequent, each engrossed in their own world.

However, one day, a peculiar group of individuals arrived in the Dharma Deduction space. Without the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao, yet with special permission from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, they entered this place, led by the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall.

Hua Yueye, usually somewhat languid, seemed to become tense. He repeatedly greeted them, saying, "Greetings, Elder Xu."

Li Fan sensed that not only were the other two guardians affected, but even the usually carefree and fearless little loli of the Dharma Deduction space had become more restrained. As he bowed along with them, Li Fan looked at the white-haired elder before him, who appeared to be blind, and the information about this Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall flashed through his mind.

"Xu Yuanxian has served as the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall for over three thousand years. Though he appears approachable on the surface, he is actually eccentric, rigid, and adheres to the Myriad Immortals Alliance's system to a dogmatic degree, showing no mercy. Even when Dharma-Preachers occasionally come seeking to break the rules, he will not allow it. He is valued by Doctrine Transmitter Jiang, and though some other Dharma-Preachers dislike him, they are powerless against him."

"Since he can hold the position of Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall, Xu Yuanxian's own strength is unfathomable, far beyond ordinary cultivators at the Dao Integration realm. The Myriad Immortals Alliance's only recorded instance of killing a Dao Integration cultivator and retrieving leaked cultivation methods was when this person acted. It was swift and decisive, not even giving the onlookers time to react."

Xu Yuanxian stated the purpose of his visit: "The Myriad Immortals Alliance's Great Trials has only recently concluded. These young ones are among the cream of the crop. The Doctrine Transmitter Council has specially approved them to utilize the Dharma Deduction space for a chance to deduce a Dao Integration-level cultivation method."

"What?"

"How could this be?!"

The three guardians and the little loli of the Dharma Deduction space were all quite surprised. The little loli pouted, about to complain. Upon seeing Xu Yuanxian's expression, however, she cautiously swallowed her words.

Li Fan reacted the fastest, nodding and saying, "Please, Chief Elder, present the Council's Dharma Seal." He remained serious, not being perfunctory just because the other party was his superior.

Xu Yuanxian was also very cooperative and displayed a Dharma Seal. Feeling the aura of the Dharma-Preachers surrounding it, Li Fan carefully verified the information within before giving a nod to indicate the check had passed. Postponing the cultivators who were originally waiting for deduction, Li Fan arranged for the Dharma Deduction space to first handle the tasks of these newly appointed Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators. There were a total of sixteen individuals, varying in age and cultivation realm. The giant Dharma Deduction light sphere continuously spun as the little loli, with a grumpy expression, carried out the deduction work.

While this group waited in line for their cultivation methods to be deduced, Li Fan, with some curiosity, transmitted his voice to Xu Yuanxian: "Chief Elder, forgive my poor eyesight, but these cultivators... do not seem to possess particularly exceptional talent. Why is the Myriad Immortals Alliance showing them such favor?"

His voice transmission did not avoid the other two guardians, who also wore expressions of curiosity. However, all they received in return was silence. Xu Yuanxian remained silent, as if he had not heard Li Fan's voice transmission at all. The two guardians wisely averted their gaze. Li Fan did not press further, and an awkward silence fell over the ritual.

It wasn't until all sixteen individuals had collectively completed their cultivation method deductions and were about to depart that Xu Yuanxian suddenly responded.

"This question, I also wish I knew the answer to."

"But there are too many unknown things in the world; there's no need to understand everything. Just do your own job well."

"Since the Doctrine Transmitter Council has decided this, they must have their reasons. We subordinates should simply obey orders."

The three guardians all bowed slightly, indicating they had understood. It was only after Xu Yuanxian had completely left the Dharma Deduction space that they dared to communicate amongst themselves.

"Chief Elder is truly as rigidly conventional as his reputation suggests."

"Fellow Daoist Sun reacted very quickly this time. The Chief Elder likes it when you handle things according to the rules. It's said that you've already caught his eye, and in five hundred years, when you leave here, he'll choose you as the next Chief Elder." Hua Yueye teased.

Li Fan ignored their jests, first reporting this special utilization of the Dharma Deduction space as per regulations. Then, he calmly stated, "The position of Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall is like being imprisoned, even more so than our current job. I have no interest in it."

"I still have a beloved wife at home waiting for me to return." His statement, half-true and half-false, elicited laughter from the two guardians.

This incident was merely a minor interlude during their duties of guarding the Dharma Deduction space. Soon, they all cast it aside. Of course, except for Li Fan. Because… among those sixteen individuals was a mole planted by the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi within the Myriad Immortals Alliance. His name was Yang Fei. Li Fan recognized him, but he did not recognize Li Fan. However, this did not diminish Li Fan's sense of vigilance. The Myriad Immortals Alliance never did anything meaningless. The fact that these sixteen newly recruited cultivators received such preferential treatment made it difficult for Li Fan not to suspect some conspiracy behind it.

"Could it be like the previous 'Immortal Chosen' incident, where they were sacrifices to awaken the power within the statues left by Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate in various places? No, that's not right. If they were sacrifices, they were destined to die. There would be no need to waste the computational power of the Dharma Deduction space..." Li Fan keenly sensed the abnormality behind this.

Meanwhile, in the underground secret chamber of the Sun family, his Nascent Soul clone had finally found a suitable opportunity. Sun Luyuan arrived at the secret chamber again, his eyes bloodshot. With a struggling expression, he finally took out a small Heavenly Profound Mirror. Then, using his own blood essence, he nourished Sun Luoyao within the Immeasurable Mirror while explaining, "The pressure from above is too great. Forgive me, brother."

"I originally thought I could refuse to obey until death. But looking at all the faces of the Sun family..." Sun Luoyao transformed into a shadowy figure and appeared, following Li Fan's clone's instructions, he comforted, "Brother, I understand. It's fine, leave it to me." Sun Luyuan trembled slightly, clenching his fists so tightly that his fingernails dug deep into his flesh. At this moment, the information about the 'Sacred Dynasty Great Qi' he had previously found resurfaced in his mind.

"Perhaps, I can try to contact them."

"Being a dog for a lifetime also carries the risk of being beheaded at any moment. Perhaps this Great Qi can actually give me some pleasant surprises?"

The Immeasurable Mirror, pretending to be searching in the Heavenly Profound Mirror for information related to the Heavenly Profound Mirror's clone, was actually investigating the reason why those sixteen cultivators were treated so favorably.

Chapter 1203: A Secret Meeting in the Star Sea

This was clearly a top-secret matter of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

It was hidden so deeply that even after repairing a portion of the Primordial Square formation, the Immeasurable Mirror had an extremely difficult time finding it.

Furthermore, they had to be wary of being discovered by the Heavenly Profound Mirror. Amidst the continuous search, the Immeasurable Mirror was gradually becoming over-burdened.

The mirror body began to shake violently, and faint cracks appeared on its surface.

Sun Luyuan watched with bloodshot eyes, having wanted to put away the Heavenly Profound Mirror several times.

However, the firm conviction transmitted by Sun Luyao always stopped him.

"Brother, I can still hold on a little longer."

"I've found clues, I can't give up now!"

"Brother, I've got this!"

Listening to Sun Luyao's voice, filled with almost uncontrollable pain, Sun Luyuan's resolve soon became firm.

Time seemed to stretch on unusually long. Sun Luyuan felt as if he were on thorns, his heart twisting.

Besides worrying that his brother wouldn't be able to hold on and everything would be lost, he was also concerned about being discovered by the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Finally, the Immeasurable Mirror voluntarily disconnected the devouring black light.

That peculiar small mirror could no longer maintain its levitation and fell to the ground with a clang.

Sun Luyuan hurried to take out spare vital blood to infuse it.

After a while, the Immeasurable Mirror slowly recovered a little.

"How...?" Sun Luyuan almost didn't dare to ask.

"Brother, I have not failed you."

Fortunately, his brother had not disappointed him. The moment he heard these four words, Sun Luyuan felt a great sense of relief.

After reviewing the top-secret information his brother had gathered, his expression kept changing.

"Fu's suspicion was correct. Cang has indeed been controlled."

"Weidu..."

"It seems that within the Mirror Controller's circle, things are more complicated than we imagined," Sun Luyao's shadowy figure said weakly. "Brother, our Sun family is still too weak. If we are not careful, we will be torn to shreds."

"Don't worry. Leave the rest to me," Sun Luyuan said in a deep voice.

"Oh, and brother. Can you leave the Heavenly Profound Mirror here this time?" Just as he was about to leave, he suddenly heard Sun Luyao say this.

Sun Luyuan couldn't help but hesitate.

"Don't worry, brother. I haven't lost control. In fact, after several recent extreme explorations, for some reason, my control over the Immeasurable Mirror has deepened. I want to try a few more times when I have the spare capacity, so I can become more proficient in the future..."

In the end, Sun Luyuan was persuaded by his brother's sincere words.

Moreover, his brother's condition was indeed much better than when he had lost control after the previous exploration.

So, after repeatedly reminding him a few times, he left the Heavenly Profound Mirror behind.

Not long after Sun Luyuan hurriedly departed.

A phantom figure emerged from the Immeasurable Mirror and entered the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

A moment later, a series of lights flickered. A large amount of materials that nourished the divine soul was purchased.

Li Fan's clone greedily devoured them, and his previously weak condition quickly reversed.

With the origin of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, he could steal a large amount of resources through the small mirror without anyone noticing.

At this time, Sun Luyao's figure also floated out.

He looked at Li Fan with fear.

These divine soul nourishment treasures were useless to him.

But the casual guidance from this great being allowed him to fuse more smoothly with the Immeasurable Mirror.

One must know that this was something he and his brother had painstakingly tried to do for hundreds of years without success.

The terrifying nature of this great being was undeniable.

In Sun Luyao's eyes, he was far more terrifying than any Mirror Controller, and his submission seemed justified.

"Brother, you can understand me, right?" Sun Luyao thought to himself.

The intense pain he had displayed in front of Sun Luyuan earlier was, of course, all an act.

Although there were some twists and turns, they managed to get through it without any danger.

However, he didn't quite understand the information that great being had painstakingly gathered.

"Sixteen cultivators, summoned by the Dharma-Preachers, leaving the Xuanhuang Realm and heading beyond the heavens."

To Sun Luyao, this was not particularly strange.

But to Li Fan, it held a completely different meaning.

While his clone was slowly recovering, Li Fan was also contemplating this matter.

"The Dharma-Preachers are actually summoning cultivators to leave the Xuanhuang Realm for the first time?"

"What is going on?"

"With his strength, even if these sixteen people were cultivated into the Dao Integration realm by the Myriad Immortals Alliance in a short time, they would still be like ants."

"And they weren't selected from the existing Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

Li Fan recalled the spy he had arranged, Yang Fei.

There seemed to be nothing special about him.

Li Fan wasn't worried that Yang Fei would expose him if he actually encountered the Dharma-Preachers, because he himself didn't even know he was a spy for the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

This was because Yang Fei was indeed a cultivator of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, but before participating in the Great Trials, he had met a few friends who were well-researched in the Great Trials and had bet on a few correct questions.

"It can be confirmed that the reason for summoning these sixteen cultivators to the Dharma-Preachers is definitely related to the 'Distant Stellar Force' that is disturbing the Xuanhuang Realm."

"I just don't know what the Dharma-Preachers encountered that required these sixteen cultivators?"

"Moreover, the Distant Stellar Force near the Immortal Ruins has now disappeared. I don't know how this group left the Xuanhuang Realm?"

This matter was too secretive, and even the Heavenly Profound Mirror had little record of it.

"It's a pity that my Sacred Embryo is on the other side of the star sea, otherwise, I could have followed them and investigated."

Thinking of this, Li Fan's thoughts suddenly paused slightly.

He suddenly thought that the purpose of the Dharma-Preachers in the Darkest Star Sea was to collect fragments of various cultivation realms.

And the location of the Sacred Embryo was the sea of remnants where all the遗物 from cultivators in the star sea were attracted and gathered due to that mysterious Distant Stellar Force.

"Since the remnants are gathered, are the fragments of cultivation realms also gathered?"

"Beyond the Sea of Remnants, is there another sea of fragmented realms?"

On the other side of the star sea, Li Fan's Sacred Embryo, hidden and lurking outside the Mystic Immortal Boat, suddenly opened its eyes.

His gaze seemed to pierce through the endless ruins and darkness, looking towards the depths of the Sea of Remnants.

"Could it be that I am now very close to the Dharma-Preachers?"

Li Fan couldn't help but think so.

"If my guess is correct, then if I wait here, I might be able to wait for the sixteen cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"Thinking further, the Dharma-Preachers, such a powerful existence, has wandered in the Darkest Star Sea for thousands of years. They must be aware of the Immortal Boat civilization hidden here. Perhaps there has already been interaction between the two sides."

"It's just that the Immortal Boats may not know the true identity of the Dharma-Preachers."

Although the information currently available indicated that the Immortal Boat civilization seemed incredibly weak, being able to survive for tens of thousands of years in the Darkest Star Sea and even dabble in the power of True Immortal Script...

The Immortal Boats' top-tier power was definitely not to be underestimated.

"Zhao Xian's strength is too low, and he knows very little about the past of the Immortal Boats."

"It seems some 'pulling the sprouts to help them grow' is needed."

wWW▪▪c○

Chapter 1204

Floating in the star sea for ten thousand years, despite not experiencing a civilizational collapse, the cultivation theories of the Mystic Immortal Boat had made no progress whatsoever.

All the myriad realms they visited were in ruins, with only destructive remnants of True Immortal Sigils echoing in the star sea. Like living off the land, the Mystic Immortal Boat poured all their future hopes into researching this great power. As for other aspects…

Compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, which had suffered countless tribulations, they were far inferior.

At the very least, under the extreme circumstances where techniques could not be cultivated simultaneously, the myriad wondrous methods born in the Xuanhuang Realm were, in the eyes of the Mystic Immortal Boat cultivators, all worthy of resounding praise.

With the cultivation library of the Myriad Immortals Alliance as their foundation, Li Fan's split soul quickly found a cultivation method most suitable for Zhao Xian. Of course, from Zhao Xian's own perspective, this was a part of the vast number of techniques that the future Academy of Proving the Dao would deduce through the Dharma Deduction Jade.

"Spirit-God Harmonious Unity Technique. A divine technique still suitable for cultivators even in conditions of extreme resource scarcity. It allows for perfect coordination of divine sense and Spirit Qi; whichever is stronger can be converted to empower the weaker."

"Within the Academy, the supply of Spirit Qi is extremely limited. It's already the limit to promote me to the Golden Core stage. To advance any further is impossible. However, I can use secret arts that increase divine sense power to drive the increase in Spirit Qi…"

"In the Academy's exchange catalog, the value of the items needed to perform these secret arts is far less than spirit stones."

Zhao Xian, who had been struggling with a bottleneck, suddenly had an inspiration and recalled more from that strange dream of the future. Grateful for the spark of insight, he immediately spent all his accumulated contribution points to exchange for the materials needed to refine his divine sense.

Black God Glue, Ancient Crimson Paste, Spirit Nurturing Amber…

These common calming and spirit-strengthening sundries from the Immortal Boat were heated by Zhao Xian, roasted, and melted into crystalline liquids. Then, like a great whale absorbing water, the liquid flowed ceaselessly into his sea of consciousness.

The scorching heat wave almost instantly threatened to incinerate Zhao Xian's divine sense.

After a brief moment of blankness, Zhao Xian found that he had somehow adapted to the intense heat. At the same time, the strength of his divine sense began to increase visibly.

"This is truly a supreme profound method!" Zhao Xian exclaimed inwardly.

However, little did Zhao Xian know, the reason his fragile Qi Refining stage divine sense could survive such intense refinement was entirely due to Li Fan's split soul.

In fact, most of the effects of the precious materials, after being refined into paste, were absorbed and refined by Li Fan's split soul. After all, Zhao Xian only had the cultivation of late Qi Refining; even a mere sliver was enough to steadily improve his divine sense.

When Zhao Xian emerged from his cultivation, he felt that his divine sense strength had nearly tripled compared to before. It had already reached the level of mid-Foundation Establishment.

Compared to this "immense" divine sense power, his Spirit Qi cultivation seemed rather weak.

It felt like a giant wielding a toy body.

Zhao Xian suppressed the overwhelming joy in his heart and quickly circulated the "Spirit-God Harmonious Unity Technique." An invisible grinding mill seemed to appear in his sea of consciousness, crushing the power of his divine sense and transforming it into pure energy to nourish Zhao Xian's body.

Without absorbing any Spirit Qi, Zhao Xian's cultivation progressed at a terrifying speed.

Finally, after three days, Zhao Xian's divine sense and Spirit Qi balanced at the early Foundation Establishment stage.

"I've successfully achieved Foundation Establishment just like this?"

Zhao Xian, regaining his senses, looked at his hands in disbelief.

"This breakthrough was too easy; I didn't feel any inner demons or bottlenecks like my Master and the elders at the Academy spoke of."

"After achieving Foundation Establishment, my authority within the Academy has also increased significantly. I can exchange for more resources, and my cultivation will likely progress even faster than before…"

After all, he was just a young man. Fantasizing about the future, Zhao Xian could not suppress his excitement.

Ultimately, the vision of the Immortal Boat's demise from his future dream pulled him back to reality.

"The road ahead is long, and I still have a great distance to travel. I must not become complacent."

Zhao Xian was contemplating how to better utilize his "foresight" to rapidly ascend in status.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's split soul was savoring the scene of Zhao Xian's breakthrough.

Zhao Xian had not truly encountered an obstacle to his breakthrough; it had been blocked by Li Fan.

"That ripple that appeared out of nowhere, directly targeting my heart."

"It was not True Immortal Sigils. It was the Heavenly Dao of the star sea…"

At this moment, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, outside the Mystic Immortal Boat, suddenly had a premonition.

His body came into direct contact with this space filled with a deathly silence. During his journey across the Darkest Star Sea, Li Fan had already understood that this Darkest Star Sea actually shared a basic set of principles with the Xuanhuang Realm. Its upper limit was even slightly higher than that of the Xuanhuang Realm.

His sword dao, which had reached its limit in the Xuanhuang Realm, had unknowingly broken through its original bottleneck and reached new heights during his voyage through the star sea.

The bottleneck that manifested as "Heaven's Calamity" in the Xuanhuang Realm had a different form of existence in this Darkest Star Sea.

"It persuades one to return to the mortal path, leading to utter despair. Even a mere breakthrough to complete Qi Refining possesses such power. If I had not experienced so much, and my heart were not exceptionally resilient…"

"I might have had to use the Immortal Heart Incantation to resolve it," the Sacred Embryo Li Fan mused with a solemn heart.

Within the illusions cloaked by that intangible ripple, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan seemed to witness a scene of achieving a breakthrough, enduring countless hardships, and ultimately perishing due to various calamities.

No matter how hard he tried, he could not escape the end of failure.

"Better to return to the Dao, return to the Dao…"

The obsession echoed like demonic sounds in his sea of consciousness, urging him to abandon cultivation.

"The Heavenly Dao of this Darkest Star Sea is quite interesting. It bears some resemblance to the ancient inner demons recorded in the texts of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"By observing a leopard through a tube, one can grasp its entirety. Although this star sea has been shattered by the power of True Immortal Sigils, its fundamental underlying operations are still intact."

Li Fan pondered continuously, his vision suddenly opening up, as if he were seeing a wider world beyond the Azure Nether, a world shrouded outside it.

Even though this world was broken and incomplete, it offered Li Fan new avenues for comprehending the principles of the world.

He recalled the contents of the Heavenly Physician's "Book of Heaven Mending" once more.

"If the Xuanhuang Realm's situation is like a terminal illness, a stitched-together monster possessed by another, then this Darkest Star Sea is long dead, its body crushed by immense force, with only residual fragments remaining…"

"The Xuanhuang Realm can still be salvaged, but this Darkest Star Sea is beyond saving."

"Of course, this is from the perspective of the Heavenly Physician when compiling the 'Book of Heaven Mending.'"

Chapter 1205: Power to Break the Star Sea Path

"The only thing we can do is dissect and analyze these world remnants, perhaps inferring the state of this Ultimate Dark Star Sea in its prime."

"However, beings that are several levels higher than the ordinary Azure Nether cultivation world… even their corpses can yield immense benefits."

The aura emanating from the Sacred Embryo Li Fan suddenly shifted.

It was like magma erupting, and his already Soul Transformation peak cultivation expanded severalfold in an instant.

It was a pity that the Sacred Embryo still couldn't escape the limitations of the connection between the clone and the main body.

It was as if an invisible shackle existed, forcefully suppressing the surging aura.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan grunted, and spat out a mouthful of blood.

Within the black sword's evolved pocket world inside his body, countless black fissures appeared, as if on the verge of destruction.

But the Sacred Embryo Li Fan's eyes were filled with excitement instead.

"The heavens and earth are incomplete, the principles of the Dao are weakened."

"As expected, in this Ultimate Dark Star Sea, a clone can potentially surpass the main body in cultivation realm!"

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan savored the overwhelming surge of power from that instant.

It was like a brute force, forcibly breaking the shackles of heaven and earth.

"The ultimate driving force for me to break through is still lacking. I was halfway to success, but instead suffered a backlash."

"If I had accumulated a bit more, I could have made a concerted effort and directly broken through that shackle."

Li Fan suddenly recalled the scene where his clone, while cultivating the Great Technique of Devouring Heaven and Consuming Earth, had forcefully broken through the bottleneck of *Heaven's Calamity* previously.

"This is what is called *breaking the Dao with power*. In a normal great world, without being a True Immortal, one simply doesn't possess such immense power. But the Ultimate Dark Star Sea is incomplete, and the requirements are greatly reduced."

"After my clone forcefully broke the bottleneck of *Heaven's Calamity* before, it was counterattacked by the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, that colossal palm. Here in the Ultimate Dark Star Sea, even such a backlash might not occur."

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, just like Zhao Xian moments ago, felt an immense joy of sudden enlightenment.

"From one to ten thousand. Since this inherent principle of the Dao can be broken, can others also be achieved?"

"When one whale falls, all things are born. The demise of the Star Sea, for the surviving cultivators, might be an unprecedented opportunity that comes once in billions of years."

"His ability to transmit the Dao and display such extraordinary power, beyond that of ordinary cultivators, aside from the fact that all New Law cultivators in the Azure Nether world are his foundation, is possibly related to this."

"Having stayed in the Star Sea for ten thousand years, he has likely already reached an unimaginable proximity to the legendary Immortals."

...

The Sacred Embryo's enlightenment in the Ultimate Dark Star Sea had a profound impact on Li Fan's main body as well.

The incomplete nature of the Star Sea Great World, which paradoxically benefited cultivators, caused his aura to involuntarily ripple slightly.

This drew the attention of Hua Yueye and Zhang Xu, two Dao Integration elders.

"Friend Sun?"

"It's nothing, I just remembered my beloved wife at home and my mind wandered for a moment," Li Fan said with a hint of shame.

The two guardians exchanged a strange glance and nodded, expressing their understanding.

To stabilize his mind, Li Fan's main body forcefully suppressed the urge to rush out of the Azure Nether world.

"Opportunities and crises have always coexisted."

"While the current Ultimate Dark Star Sea is a sacred land for cultivation for cultivators, there is no doubt that it is also fraught with peril."

"If it weren't for the Sacred Embryo's foundation built upon *Heavenly Wonders*, he would have likely perished long ago. Facing the myriad strange phenomena in the Star Sea, even my Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven's evolved world could not have sustained him for long."

The invisible void in the dark abyss, and the deadly black plague…

Any one of these was not something Li Fan could currently deal with.

"It's the same if I gain insight through the Sacred Embryo," Li Fan could only console himself.

"The sixteen Dao Integration cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, if they leave the Azure Nether world, should also be able to gradually discover this secret."

"It's just unknown if they can return alive?"

Li Fan held a pessimistic view regarding the fate of these sixteen individuals.

In the eyes of those who transmitted the Dao, cultivators from the Azure Nether world were undoubtedly mere tools.

This summons was likely no different in outcome.

"However, I might be able to find a way to learn how to fly out of the Azure Nether world without the reverberating stellar force."

"The appearance of the reverberating stellar force this time was purely accidental. There's no guarantee it can be replicated in the future. Since I already know the importance of the Ultimate Dark Star Sea, how could I miss this opportunity?"

"Even if this is a top-secret at present and I can't get information, after a few decades, or when the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty threatens the Myriad Immortals Alliance and a war breaks out between them, such secrets will be overlooked and easier to inquire about."

...

Despite saying this, Li Fan remained constantly aware of the sixteen individuals.

Through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, the divine sense left in the Sun family could already maintain its form with stability. As the divine sense's strength recovered, Sun Luyao, within the Immeasurable Mirror, also grew stronger daily, and his fusion with the Immeasurable Mirror became more apparent.

One day, while spying through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, Sun Luyao suddenly mustered the courage and said to Li Fan, "Senior, I seem to sense the location of another Immeasurable Mirror fragment."

"Perhaps after absorbing it, the Immeasurable Mirror's capabilities will be further enhanced."

Previously, the brothers of the Sun family had searched almost the entire territory of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and found a fragment that indeed brought about a qualitative change in the Immeasurable Mirror. If it could recover even more, it might truly bring Li Fan a pleasant surprise.

However, Li Fan's divine sense feigned deafness.

He patiently finished his scrying through the Heavenly Profound Mirror and still found no information about the sixteen people conscripted by the Dao Transmitters.

Only then did he coldly look at Sun Luyao, "What location?"

Sun Luyao cautiously transmitted the sensed information.

"Oh?"

Upon seeing the location pointed out by Sun Luyao, Li Fan's divine sense couldn't help but feel a bit surprised.

It was located within the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven, on the border of Stone Province.

The ruins of the Heavenly Secrets Sect, and the entrance to the Spirit Wood World, were all in these continuous underground caves.

"I know."

Li Fan's divine sense replied blandly, showing no intention of going to search.

Sun Luyao dared not ask further.

Seven days later, Sun Luyuan returned to the secret chamber. After receiving Li Fan's permission, Sun Luyao eagerly reiterated the matter.

In stark contrast to Li Fan's indifference, Sun Luyuan was overjoyed.

"If we can find another fragment, perhaps you won't have to suffer so much!"

Sun Luyao nodded in agreement.

"By the way, Brother, what was that old fellow Fu's reaction when he found out about the divine sense of the Heavenly Profound Mirror?" Sun Luyao asked again.

Sun Luyuan frowned upon hearing this. "The birth of a human clone from the Heavenly Profound Mirror is a matter of great importance that requires careful planning. I can understand his temporary inaction. However, it's strange, ever since our last meeting, I haven't been able to contact him."

"Can't contact him?"

"Not just Fu, I can't even enter the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters temporarily, as if something extremely important is happening."

Chapter 1206: Boundless Dust-Covered

“It’s truly strange, to think that even an urgent matter like the Heavenly Profound Mirror possibly transforming into a human clone and escaping has been set aside…”

“If I could still make one-sided contact with the outside, I would almost believe the Myriad Immortals Alliance has already fallen,” Sun Luyuan said with a frown.

Sun Luoyao feigned surprise: “Something like that happened? I didn’t detect anything related to it in the Heavenly Profound Mirror?”

The two brothers exchanged glances.

Sun Luoyao said doubtfully: “I don’t know if my probing failed, or if the Myriad Immortals Alliance is even concealing this from the Heavenly Profound Mirror itself?”

“The Alliance Headquarters is an independent space within the Heavenly Profound Mirror. If one wanted to shield the Mirror’s perception, it would likely require the joint effort of the Dharma-Preachers Council and the Mirror Controller…” Sun Luyuan's expression grew solemn, as if remembering something.

“The Alliance Headquarters is inside the Heavenly Profound Mirror?” Sun Luoyao was unaware of this and was startled.

Sun Luyuan collected himself and nodded, but did not explain much.

“It’s fortunate for us that that old fellow Fu is tied up. Let’s seize this opportunity to go find that Boundless Mirror fragment you sensed.”

“Okay, Brother.” Sun Luoyao naturally had no objections.

“I had originally wanted to take you to the Blood Pool for nourishment during this rare interlude. We’ll have to wait until we return,” Sun Luyuan said with a slight shake of his head.

The Blood Pool was a secret location in the Sun family, containing the vital essence blood donated by direct descendants of the family.

Processed with secret arts, its effects were even better than that of Sun Luyuan, a close relative’s, vital essence.

However, collecting vital essence blood from family disciples could not be done too frequently, as it would surely arouse suspicion. Therefore, it took a considerable amount of time to accumulate enough for nourishment.

Sun Luoyao had tasted its effects a few times before and found it somewhat beneficial.

But…

“Compared to the methods of our ancestors, it’s far inferior.”

The nourishment from family vital essence blood ultimately served to strengthen the power of Sun Luoyao’s residual soul.

The stronger one's own power, the easier it was to erode the Boundless Mirror.

As for Li Fan, he had directly presented the method for controlling the Boundless Mirror before him.

Not only did he no longer need to use brute force to erode it, but even the damaged and chaotic Boundless Mirror showed signs of slow recovery, no longer causing him the same pain when facing it.

Though he thought this, he still had to maintain appearances.

He put on a look of slight regret.

Sun Luyuan saw it and comforted him, “Let’s see if this outing goes smoothly. If we return quickly, there will still be plenty of time.”

After saying this, Sun Luyuan returned and made some preparations.

When he reappeared in the secret chamber, he had taken on the appearance of a junior from the Sun family.

This was Sun Luyuan’s usual disguise.

“Let’s go.”

Putting the Boundless Mirror into his embrace, Sun Luyuan quietly left the Sun family and headed towards Stone Province.

Perhaps due to its damaged and unstable nature, the Boundless Mirror could not be used with teleportation arrays, forcing them to travel by physical flight.

Fortunately, this distance was not too far for a Dao Integration cultivator, and they soon arrived at the entrance of the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven.

Following Sun Luoyao’s senses, they delved deeper into the underground cave.

When they encountered dead ends, they forcibly broke through, getting closer to their destination.

“This cursed place.” The deeper they went, the harder the cave walls became. Sun Luyuan even started to struggle.

“Brother, we’re almost there.” Sun Luoyao felt the familiar aura ahead and couldn’t help but feel excited.

Perhaps it was because they had been too deep underground before, affecting his senses. It was only upon truly arriving here that he realized this fragment might be larger than he had imagined.

“Hmm?! Someone behind us?”

Just when they were separated from the Boundless Mirror fragment by a single wall, Sun Luyuan’s expression suddenly changed, and he stopped.

“We’re being tracked, how annoying.”

Sun Luyuan reacted quickly, swiftly changing his direction and continuing to delve deeper into the cave. He accelerated abruptly, his figure instantly disappearing into the maze-like passages.

Two cultivators dressed in blue robes appeared, their expressions grim.

“Damn it, he still detected us.”

“It seems this Sun Luyuan’s cultivation has advanced again.”

“It doesn’t matter, we’ve already sealed the entrance. He can’t escape.”

…

However, these two unaware, deeper within the cave, Sun Luyuan had already used the Boundless Mirror to see their every move.

“Tianquan Prefecture, the Chen family.”

Sun Luyuan snorted coldly.

He had long been aware of the various petty schemes of the Chen family from the Medicine Hall, who had always coveted the Boundless Mirror.

However, the other party still had some foundation, and there was no reason to act before they made a concrete move.

“They actually came to my doorstep, giving me an opportunity.”

A plan instantly formed in Sun Luyuan’s mind.

He revealed his aura, luring the two from the Chen family deeper underground.

Then, he quietly concealed himself and quickly returned to the location of the Boundless Mirror fragment.

Boom!

He opened a sealed cave, and Sun Luyuan quickly located the fragment.

This seemed to be the ruins of an ancient sect, and the Boundless Mirror fragment had been fused into another mirror-like magic artifact.

It was a pity that this sect had long since been destroyed, and this mirror-like magic artifact, like a treasure covered in dust, had been buried underground for thousands of years.

Knowing it was not a place to linger, Sun Luyuan did not have time to examine it closely and took it.

Then, he no longer bothered to hide, even burning his vital essence, unleashing his full strength in an instant.

Within moments, he had rushed to the exit of the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven.

The two cultivators guarding the entrance were caught off guard and momentarily unable to resist. Sun Luyuan managed to break through.

“Chen family! If I don’t avenge this, I’m no human!”

Though not injured, Sun Luyuan suddenly spat out a mouthful of blood, his aura rapidly weakening.

His voice boomed like thunder, echoing in the skies of Stone Province for a long time.

Then, Sun Luyuan transformed into an escape light and flew towards the center of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

All that was left were the two Chen family cultivators, who were somewhat bewildered.

When the two Dao Integration cultivators, who had been lured away, finally arrived from within the cave, they finally understood.

“We’re in trouble.” The four exchanged glances, their expressions grim.

Since the matter had been exposed, they could not openly pursue him.

“This operation failed, the Sun family will likely completely sever ties with us. We should return as soon as possible to discuss how to deal with this.”

“Hmph, at worst, we’ll abandon this Immortal Artifact and expose this matter directly. I don’t believe that his little Sun family can protect this Immortal Artifact!”

The four Chen family cultivators disappeared one after another.

In Stone Province, Sun Luyuan’s angry roar began to draw discussion.

A ripple of an incident gradually spread.

At the same time, Sun Luyuan had already returned home.

He went straight to the underground secret chamber and took out the Boundless Mirror.

Just one chapter today… I’m too tired after returning from a business trip.

Chapter 1207

On the way, Sun Luyuan could clearly feel the restless stirring of the Boundless Mirror in his embrace and hear the familiar, uncontrolled roars of his younger brother, Sun Luyao. He suppressed them forcefully until they returned to safety before releasing him.

"Brother, give it to me quickly! I can't take it anymore!"

The mirror's surface shook violently, and the shadowy figure of Sun Luyao, like smoke, seemed to be buffeted by a hurricane, distorting and flickering.

"Calm down!"

Sun Luyuan grunted, expertly sacrificing a drop of his own vital blood to quell his brother's frenzy. Only then did he retrieve the mirror he had taken from the ruins of the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven.

The same origin and aura indicated that the main body of the mirror was a fragment of the Boundless Mirror, but it had been reforged into a separate magical artifact. Sun Luyuan carefully broke the remaining restrictions on the mirror before tossing it to his brother.

With the restraints gone, the dark tendrils greedily floated above the mirror. A beam of dim light erupted from Sun Luyao's mouth, corroding the ancient treasure. As the mirror slowly vanished into the black light, the somewhat old and damaged Boundless Mirror in which Sun Luyao resided began to change at a visible rate. The traces of age gradually disappeared, and the ancient feel was replaced by a sense of weathered resilience. The surface of the Boundless Mirror pulsed with a luster that sent shivers down Sun Luyuan's spine, even making him momentarily tense.

"Is this the power of an immortal artifact..." he mused, his anticipation for his brother's performance after awakening from this assimilation growing.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's soul clone, the true master of the Boundless Mirror hidden within, witnessed the transformation of the Boundless Mirror more directly. Or rather, its restoration. The once incomplete Great Formation of Boundless Unity and Primordial Square was gradually being mended. As if it had found its core, an indescribable, wondrous power flowed out from the formation like a gentle stream, nourishing the worn-out body of the Boundless Mirror. This was why, in the eyes of outsiders, the immortal artifact appeared rejuvenated in an instant.

Li Fan's soul clone also benefited from this process, transforming from a soul clone into a spiritual soul. Li Fan even felt that if he continued to absorb the energy within the Boundless Mirror, his soul clone could eventually surpass his own divine soul! After all, Li Fan's cultivation journey had been one step at a time, with an incredibly solid foundation. Not to mention the theoretical accumulation from his numerous reincarnations, the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven and the Azure Nether Birth and Death Mutation were the very essence of the Xuanhuang Realm. Yet, the pinnacle of the Dao Integration realm achieved on this foundation could be matched by the energy within this broken mirror! Even if it was only in terms of his spiritual soul, Li Fan was greatly shocked. He echoed Sun Luyuan's sentiment: "Is this the might of an immortal artifact?"

The energy surging from the Boundless Mirror seemed to embody order and vitality. However, just as Li Fan thought it would completely repair the Boundless Mirror, the mirror uncontrollably fell to the ground. The mirror's surface projected an image, engulfing the underground chamber. The scene flickered rapidly. The prophetic images revealed within caused both Sun Luyuan and Li Fan's hearts to tremble violently. The peaceful Xuanhuang Realm was engulfed in war. Cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance clashed with an unknown force. Arrows of light, flying everywhere, caused earth-shattering explosions wherever they struck. A golden, radiant giant fought fiercely with a black-haired, bare-chested man. Their powers warped and broke the very white mist barrier of the heavens and earth. Even more shocking was the presence of an figure standing above everyone else on the battlefield, clad in black imperial robes, whose face was indiscernible. Opposite him, another figure was equally indistinct.

*Boom!*

As if pushed to its limit, the projected images from the Boundless Mirror distorted and converged. Then, a fierce white light erupted. After the light vanished, there was only a desolate, dark abyss.

*Chih!*

The surface of the Boundless Mirror, which had just shown signs of recovery, developed another crack. Sun Luyao let out a pained scream as his shadowy form was forcefully pulled back into the mirror.

"Brother!"

Sun Luyuan instantly snapped out of his shock, his expression changing. He reached for the Boundless Mirror. However, as he drew near, his hand felt as if scalded by intense flames, and he snatched it back. Sun Luyuan looked at his outstretched right hand with grimness. In a short time, it appeared to have aged thousands of years, its flesh shriveled and wrinkled. This was not merely physical. Sun Luyuan felt as if a part of his divine soul had truly passed through the ravages of time, making it impossible to return to its original state. If accidental contact was this severe, what about Li Fan's soul clone within the Boundless Mirror?

When Li Fan's soul clone, while shocked by the Boundless Mirror's self-prophesied future of the Xuanhuang Realm, had wanted to observe in detail, a fatal sense of crisis suddenly arose within him. He could no longer afford to bother with it. This annihilating power, hidden in the deepest part of the Boundless Mirror, had gone completely unnoticed by Li Fan's soul clone, who had essentially achieved mastery over it, until it erupted. It came so swiftly and explosively. As if it could erode even time, the Boundless Mirror, which had just recovered some energy from absorbing the fragment, instantly endured countless tribulations of wind and frost, becoming decayed once more. And the core of the Boundless Mirror, the Great Formation of Boundless Unity and Primordial Square, was like it had been swept by a gale, its once intact structure becoming damaged again. Li Fan's soul clone naturally could not escape unscathed. It was already a remnant soul, quickly becoming like a candle in the wind, on the verge of complete dissipation. Fortunately, firstly, he had already largely refined the Boundless Mirror through the Array Refining method, allowing him to merge with it and gain some resistance from its power. Secondly, at the critical moment when he sensed his soul clone was about to perish, Li Fan instinctively recited the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation. Although it couldn't recover what had been worn away, it greatly slowed the dissipation speed of his soul clone in the storm. After persevering for a long time, the terrifying calamity within the Boundless Mirror finally subsided. Li Fan sensed it had not disappeared but had retreated back into the depths of the Boundless Mirror, lying in wait again.

It was then that Sun Luyuan's anxious voice slowly reached him. "Brother, what's wrong?"

However, Sun Luyao, severely injured, lacked the strength to respond. Seeing this, Sun Luyuan reacted swiftly. He immediately took the Boundless Mirror into the Sun family's vital blood pool. Although called a vital blood pool, it did not carry any stench of blood. Instead, it was filled with the fragrance of rare heavenly treasures. The pool water was not blood-red but appeared like a colorful, dreamlike aurora, as if it were flowing light from the heavens. Submerged in it, Li Fan's aging soul clone began to feel some relief.

"Why was it consumed so quickly?" Sun Luyuan exclaimed in surprise at the speed at which the vital blood pool water changed color. However, he gritted his teeth and left, clearly intending to gather more vital blood.

Chapter 1208: Azure Nether Hides Danger

Li Fan, having narrowly escaped death, began to recall the terrifying power he had encountered within the Boundless Mirror.

“Was this the reason the Boundless Mirror was damaged?”

“The feeling it gave me was even greater than those True Immortal Sigils carvings.”

“Although all I’ve seen so far are imitations of True Immortal Sigils carvings, what was in the Boundless Mirror was merely residual aftershocks.”

“Could the calamity in the Immortal Realm be related to this?”

Despite his myriad curiosities, Li Fan decided not to delve deeper for the moment. Anything capable of destroying the Immortal Realm was certainly beyond his current capabilities.

“It was only a remnant within the Boundless Mirror; even if released, it could at most engulf a single city.”

“It might be of some use at a critical juncture,” Li Fan mused.

“No wonder such a magnificent immortal artifact ended up occupied by the remnant soul of a Foundation Establishment cultivator. That annihilating storm was truly too terrifying.”

“An immortal artifact that originally belonged to the Boundless Sect, located in the Xuanhuang Realm, underwent such a change…”

“Doesn’t that imply this calamity occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm?”

“The aftershocks alone could damage an immortal artifact. If it truly happened, there should be some traces left behind.”

Li Fan paused in his thoughts. He suddenly recalled two major events that had altered the course of history in the Xuanhuang Realm, which might be related. The first was the inexplicable disappearance of the Heavenly Mysteries King, Xuanyuan Hong. The second was the disappearance of six top Longevity realm cultivators who had previously cornered the Doctrine Transmitter, who at the time only had Dao Integration cultivation.

“These individuals’ cultivation had already reached the pinnacle of their era.”

“In the Xuanhuang Realm, ordinary things could not harm them. Unless…”

Li Fan’s heart stirred.

“A power that transcends the mundane.”

Li Fan then remembered the Grand Master Tiandu, who arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm after the Great Calamity and had remained in the Dao Origin State since getting injured, never moving.

“Was his arrival truly a coincidence?”

At this moment, a profound doubt arose in Li Fan’s heart. This incident also served as a wake-up call. Even though his perspective could now extend beyond the Xuanhuang Realm to the far reaches of the star sea, there were still beings within the Xuanhuang Realm that he could not see through and could not yet reach. No matter what he did, he had to be exceedingly cautious.

As his thoughts churned, Sun Luyuan returned in a hurry. He refined a large mass of vital blood with several other materials and added it to the blood pool. The previously dimmed pool water regained its brilliant glow. Li Fan was also concerned about the Boundless Mirror’s condition. It had almost regressed to its state before absorbing the fragments. However, it was now more complete, and Li Fan believed that once Sun Luyao awoke, his condition would improve to a certain extent. Moreover, Li Fan had briefly glimpsed a more complete Primordial Square Great Formation; even if it couldn’t be perfectly restored, some repairs should be possible.

Three days later, Sun Luyao, the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, finally briefly woke from his slumber.

“Brother, I need some things.”

After relaying the materials for repairing the formation, he fell unconscious again. Sun Luyuan looked at the list of materials his brother had sent and rushed to procure them.

During this time, fearing retaliation from a cornered Sun Luyuan, the Chen family of the Medicine Hall had been closely monitoring Sun Luyuan’s movements. However, Sun Luyuan seemed to have forgotten about the matter, coming and going as if busy with something urgent. This perplexed the Chen family. Furthermore, their backer, Doctrine Transmitter Chang of the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters, could not be contacted. Therefore, the Chen family chose to bide their time and observe the situation.

With Sun Luyuan’s relentless and cost-no-object gathering, the required materials were soon complete. Although it appeared that Sun Luyao absorbed them, it was actually Li Fan’s divine sense that acted. As the fragmented formation core was restored, the Boundless Mirror’s condition slowly stabilized.

Upon hearing about his brother’s ordeal, Sun Luyuan frowned deeply.

“Brother, do you still remember the ancient ruins where we found this mirror?”

Sun Luyao paused slightly.

“I previously thought that ruin was merely an ancient relic weathered by time. But now that you mention it…”

Sun Luyuan’s expression turned grim. “It seems that place was destroyed by the annihilating storm within the mirror…”

“Perhaps it was precisely because of its previous release that we brothers had an opportunity. Otherwise, with our cultivation at the time, how could we have subdued this mirror?”

Sun Luyao recalled the scenes from the past and slowly understood.

“That is possible. I remember that there was almost nothing of value left in the ruins back then. The only item that the Heavenly Profound Mirror recognized and gave a low recovery contribution for…”

“Rest well and recover. I will return to that ruin after some time to investigate. The entrance there is extremely hidden, and since only ruins remain, not much should have changed over the years. Perhaps there will be some discoveries,” Sun Luyuan said solemnly.

“Brother, be careful,” Sun Luyao cautioned, not trying to dissuade him.

“And the Chen family…” Sun Luyuan suddenly snorted. He recalled the scene inexplicably deduced by the Boundless Mirror earlier.

“That force locked in a fierce battle with the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to be the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty that my brother had investigated earlier.”

“This suggests that the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s prediction has some basis.”

“Both supreme artifacts have made such predictions…”

“It seems it’s time to try and make contact with them.” Sun Luyuan naturally wouldn’t approach them directly at first. After all, the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty had not yet openly declared hostility to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. He would send his trusted subordinate to investigate first before making any concrete decisions.

Compared to this, the Boundless Mirror, initially thought to be a supreme treasure but now a potential disaster waiting to erupt, caused Sun Luyuan more worry. His brother had become the spirit of the Boundless Mirror and could not possibly abandon it.

After making some preparations, Sun Luyuan decided to return to the former ruins first. His experience in the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven made Sun Luyuan realize that the Chen family was definitely still monitoring him in secret. To avoid unnecessary trouble, Sun Luyuan directly contacted an old friend.

Ji Hongdao!

“Old Ji, there’s something I need your help with…” Sun Luyuan contacted him through a spirit talisman.

Soon, Ji Hongdao arrived at the Sun family’s doorstep.

“Hahaha, Old Sun, the favor I owed you back then can finally be repaid,” Ji Hongdao said with a hearty laugh.
