“I heard you’ve recently had some conflict with the Chen family of the Medicine Hall?” Ji Hongdao lowered his voice as they entered the house.

“Yes, the treasure where Luyao resides, the Chen family somehow found out about it,” Sun Luyuan replied truthfully.

Ji Hongdao understood. “Don’t worry. Although they have a Doctrine Transmitter as their backer, and you have the Mirror Controller supporting you.”

“Now that their plan has been exposed, they definitely won’t dare to act rashly again for the time being.”

Sun Luyuan said gravely, “The villains’ end is near, but we cannot be too careful. For this upcoming trip, I will have to trouble you, brother.”

Chapter 1209: Immortal Sect Hidden Underground

"Don't worry, with me here, they won't dare to act presumptuously again," Ji Hongdao said proudly. "Even the Chen family wouldn't dare to offend both the Hall of Strategic Formations and the Law Enforcement Hall simultaneously."

Sun Luyuan clasped his fists. "Then I thank you first, Brother Ji."

"My destination this trip is Floating Light Prefecture and the Great Crevice."

A trace of surprise flashed in Ji Hongdao's eyes upon hearing this. He then reminded, "This journey might be a bit troublesome."

Seeing Sun Luyuan's puzzled look, he was taken aback. "What, you don't know? Because of the previous great upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Floating Light Great Crevice has been compressed and healed."

"The terrain has long been unrecognizable. To enter beneath the original crevice..."

Sun Luyuan's brow furrowed. After a long sigh, he said, "If that's the case, we can only do our best and leave the rest to fate."

Sun Luyuan, carrying the Immeasurable Mirror which had slightly recovered its energy, followed Ji Hongdao and they fled towards their destination. Their relationship was clearly extraordinary. On the way to the Floating Light Great Crevice, he explained the reason for his trip to Ji Hongdao in detail. Of course, he downplayed and concealed the specific power of the Devouring Calamity that the Immeasurable Mirror had suddenly unleashed.

"You suspect that the ruin where the Immeasurable Mirror was discovered was actually caused by the Immeasurable Mirror itself?" Not having personally witnessed that terrifying disaster, Ji Hongdao didn't think much of it, merely considering it something that could threaten Dao Integration cultivators.

"That's right. Since this is the origin of the Immeasurable Mirror, perhaps we can find a way to counter the Devouring Calamity of the Immeasurable Mirror. As long as we find some records, even failed attempts can serve as lessons learned..."

As they were chatting, both of their expressions suddenly turned grim. They had discovered a Dao Integration cultivator from the Chen family following them, as expected.

"It's Chen Ruoyu from the Chen family."

"Don't engage with him, just shake him off," Ji Hongdao transmitted.

A white halo enveloped them. Under the enhancement of a formation, their speed suddenly increased several times over. In the blink of an eye, they had disappeared into the horizon. Chen Ruoyu immediately accelerated to pursue them.

Moments later.

"Brother Ji, your Golden Cicada Sheds Its Shell technique is truly remarkable."

"Hmph, dealing with these meddling fools who only know how to refine pills is naturally no problem."

Two silhouettes suddenly appeared out of thin air and then fled in another direction.

After shaking off the Chen family's pursuit, they spent another half a day before finally arriving at the so-called Floating Light Prefecture Great Crevice. Sun Luyuan looked at a隆起的 long dragon-like mountain range on the ground, and his face twitched involuntarily.

"Does Brother Sun remember the specific location from back then?" Ji Hongdao asked.

Sun Luyuan recalled carefully. "I can only determine the general area. The rest depends on luck."

Just then, Sun Luyuan suddenly sensed a message from his brother. "Brother, get closer down. I seem to have a faint sensation."

Sun Luyuan was overjoyed. He flew around the mountain range, skirting the ground, and quickly pinpointed the location of the sensation.

"Wait."

Just as Sun Luyuan was about to force his way underground, Ji Hongdao stopped him. He took out a flying boat. "Let's go inside."

"Mortal-Crossing Boat?!" Sun Luyuan was somewhat surprised, and then unhesitatingly got in. The Mortal-Crossing Boat turned into a yellow light and slowly sank underground, melting into the earth like ice.

Looking at the constantly changing soil layers and the residual prohibition auras within the ruins, Sun Luyuan sighed, "Fortunately, I have your treasure, Brother Ji, otherwise it would have taken considerable effort."

Ji Hongdao nodded. "It's also a gift from Chief Lu. She's been at the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters recently and couldn't get away, so she asked me to run errands for her."

The Mortal-Crossing Boat continued its descent. The hull of the boat kept colliding with the buried objects in the earth. The surface of the boat emitted a red-orange glow, neutralizing the impact. Ji Hongdao occasionally formed hand seals and cast formations to increase the Mortal-Crossing Boat's defensive power.

"I wonder where this crevice originated from in ancient times for so many ruins to be buried here." Not only were there architectural ruins, but the deeper they went, the more they saw large piles of bones. They were from both humans and unknown giant creatures, which made even the experienced Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao inwardly astonished.

"Brother, it seems to be here!" At a depth of nearly three thousand feet underground, Sun Luyao finally spoke. The Mortal-Crossing Boat suddenly stopped. The pressure here was already immense, and the red halo around the Mortal-Crossing Boat continuously swirled, dissipating the external pressure. Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao looked around but couldn't find the ruin.

"The changes are too great; there's no trace of its former self. But the depth is indeed about right," Sun Luyuan said.

Ji Hongdao also surveyed the surroundings. "There seems to be something strange here!"

A circular formation disk flew out from his embrace, hovering above his head and projecting white light around them. Under the white light, Sun Luyuan indistinctly saw some dark golden characters flash by.

"There's still a formation remnant!" Sun Luyuan was surprised. Although he wasn't skilled in formations, he understood some basic principles.

"Brother, it seems we can enter here." Just as Ji Hongdao was using formations to scan the surroundings, trying to find the entrance, his brother Sun Luyao found it in advance. Ji Hongdao immediately used the formation disk to verify with its white light. As expected, in a place that seemed to be entirely hard rock, the golden characters appeared more frequently than before. Ji Hongdao closed his eyes and deduced. After the time it took to brew a cup of tea, he let out a low cry and pointed forward. As if a talisman paper was torn, countless golden characters shattered and scattered. The Mortal-Crossing Boat took the opportunity to fly in. The shattered characters showed signs of rejoining.

"Don't worry, this is a hidden formation that can absorb underground energy and operate automatically." Ji Hongdao said proudly, "Looking at its style, it's completely different from current ones. It should be quite old. I have completely grasped its structure and can enter and exit freely."

Sun Luyuan repeatedly flattered him, "It was truly the right decision to ask Brother Ji for help this time! Otherwise, just this formation alone would have troubled me for who knows how long. But it's a bit strange, my brother and I didn't encounter this formation when we came before..." Sun Luyuan suddenly became vigilant.

In the Immeasurable Mirror, listening to his brother's conversation with Ji Hongdao, Sun Luyao secretly glanced at the shadowy figure not far away and felt even more awe in his heart. It took Ji Hongdao a cup of tea to break the formation, but that senior... only needed a glance to find the entrance. That's right, he could sense this place not by any sensation, but entirely by the guidance of that senior.

Sensing Sun Luyao's mixture of respect and fear, Li Fan's divine sense didn't care. While Sun Luyuan and the two were still cautiously exploring, he had already used the Immeasurable Mirror to complete a full scan the moment he arrived at this ruin.

"One Beginning Sect?" Li Fan's tone was inexplicable.

Chapter 1210: The Great Mage's Bones

The One Beginning Sect, alongside the Heavenly Sword Sect and Great Dao Sect, was once one of the ten great immortal sects. However, its presence was considerably weaker. It was barely encountered in the Fallen Immortal Realm, and even in the present era, related records were difficult to find, as if it had vanished from the world. Apart from a chance mention by Senior Stone Slab, who revealed that the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven he used to achieve Nascent Soul was the handiwork of the One Beginning Sect, Li Fan had not learned much more about it.

Unexpectedly, traces of the One Beginning Sect were discovered here, three thousand feet beneath the Great Crevice. But they were merely traces. The entire ruin was devoid of any life. Besides a stone tablet in a collapsed building at the center of the ruins, faintly inscribed with the characters "One Beginning," nothing else in this place suggested the grandeur of the ancient ten great immortal sects.

"It seems the One Beginning Sect has fallen on hard times," Li Fan mused.

After inquiring with Sun Luyuan, he learned that this was indeed the ruin where they had previously discovered the Boundless Mirror. However, at that time, they had only explored a small portion of it. Now, for reasons unknown, the formations that separated the different areas had vanished, revealing the true extent of the One Beginning Sect.

"Boundless Unity, Primordial Square, Visible!" Li Fan's divine sense softly chanted.

Without a sound, the Boundless Mirror emitted an imperceptible faint light, instantly enveloping the entire One Beginning Sect ruin. The complete structural map of the ruins, including areas with residual Spirit Qi fluctuations, hidden chambers, and the danger level of each location, appeared in the Boundless Mirror. All of this was accomplished by the Boundless Mirror under Ji Hongdao's eyes, yet this formation master, who was among the top experts in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, detected nothing.

Li Fan's mind recalled the scene from his eleventh reincarnation, when he traveled from Cloudy Sea to Tianyu Prefecture to study formations, and Ji Hongdao personally taught thousands of talented formation masters of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Back then, he felt that even Huangfu Song's formation skills were beyond his reach. Yet, after only a dozen reincarnations, his formation mastery had reached a level that Ji Hongdao could not comprehend.

"I press forward in every life, while they remain stagnant," Li Fan thought. "The gap will only widen in the future."

He watched Sun Luyuan and his companion cautiously explore, shaking his head slightly. Lacking the patience to wait, he directly instructed Sun Luyuan to guide them to the only remaining valuable location in the One Beginning Sect.

"Brother Sun, be careful. The aura of the formations here is the most complete," Ji Hongdao warned, leading the way. Sun Luyuan felt a bit speechless but couldn't expose himself. They advanced with extreme caution, passing through formation-concealed walls into a secret chamber.

At the deepest part of the secret chamber stood two statues, one large and one small. The larger one was seated cross-legged on a cushion, holding a whisk. The smaller one stood behind it, with a smiling expression. These peculiar statues immediately captured their attention. They did not act rashly, observing them carefully.

"They seem to be just stone statues, with no hidden mechanisms," Ji Hongdao concluded after a long while. Sun Luyuan breathed a sigh of relief.

Meanwhile, within the Boundless Mirror, Li Fan glanced at the scene previously scanned and drawn by the Primordial Square formation, then looked at the secret chamber. His heart sank. "Can you see those two statues?" Li Fan asked Sun Luyuan. "Statues? What statues?" Sun Luyuan was taken aback, utterly bewildered.

"Tell your brother not to touch them," Li Fan commanded without explanation. Receiving Sun Luyuan's reminder, Sun Luyuan, trusting his brother, stopped Ji Hongdao from investigating further. "Brother, what danger lies in this thing?" However, he repeatedly examined the stone statues but could discern nothing unusual about them.

"I once came across records similar to these statues in ancient texts. They seem to be the origin of the ten sects' inheritance, the Great Mage Tiandu…" Sun Luyuan relayed Li Fan's assessment.

"Great Mage Tiandu?" Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao took a step back simultaneously. They had heard of this legendary figure. It was said he was at the Half-step True Immortal realm. Anyone who could be associated with a True Immortal inspired fear, especially the higher one's cultivation, the more they understood the gap between cultivators and True Immortals.

Within the Boundless Mirror, Li Fan's divine sense raced. He had suffered greatly from the Faceless True Immortal stone statue previously, spending six reincarnations to eliminate its influence on him. Although the Great Mage Tiandu was not on the same level as the Faceless True Immortal, he had left his mark on Li Fan in the past. He had to be cautious.

"It's reasonable for the One Beginning Sect's inheritance to come from the Great Mage Tiandu, and for the sect to display his stone statue."

"But…"

"The other nine immortal sects do not seem to have statues of the Great Mage Tiandu."

"Moreover, if one wishes to pay homage, it should be placed in a solemn, grand hall. Why would it be in a dark, underground secret chamber?" Li Fan's intuition told him something was amiss.

"The One Beginning Sect doesn't seem like upright individuals who deeply respect their masters. According to Senior Stone Slab's description, as early as the Great Tribulation of the Xuanhuang Realm began to manifest, they had already planned to cultivate the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, directly devour the Xuanhuang Realm, and create a new immortal cultivation world. It was only later that they were stopped."

"The one who stopped the One Beginning Sect was undoubtedly Mr. Bai."

"Before the Xuanhuang Realm and cultivators were completely in opposition, cultivators still revered the Heavenly Dao, which nurtured and raised them like parents. However, the One Beginning Sect did not hesitate to exploit the essence of heaven and earth, behaving no differently from cultivators of the New Law."

"Great Mage Tiandu…" Li Fan used the Primordial Square formation to scan the stone statue of the Great Mage Tiandu again. There was a large one and a small one. Legend had it that the seated figure imparted countless cultivation techniques and secret arts to the ten sects. But Li Fan's intuition told him that the standing attendant might be even more extraordinary.

Thus, the Primordial Square formation focused its attention on the smiling attendant statue. The faint light of the Boundless Mirror swept over the area where the stone statues were located repeatedly. With each scan, the image displayed in the Boundless Mirror slowly revealed some lines, but these lines also gradually disappeared with time. Li Fan narrowed his eyes and accelerated the scanning speed of the Boundless Mirror. The lines slowly began to accumulate again.

"Brother. Help me." Sun Luyuan, unable to bear the excessive strain, asked his brother for assistance. After receiving additional essence blood from Sun Luyuan, the Boundless Mirror finally managed to reveal the true nature of the stone statues in the secret chamber.

They were two bones. As if the flesh and blood of some creature had been stripped away, only these two remained.

Chapter 1211

In accordance with common sense, if these were merely ordinary remains, Li Fan should not have sensed any trace of life from them.

However, these two bones before him…

Made Li Fan’s heart suddenly clench, as if he were being watched by some unknown entity.

The stone statues formed by the bones seemed on the verge of coming alive, exuding a subtle, eerie aura.

Li Fan made a swift decision, immediately ceasing his observation with the Boundless Mirror.

The scene before him abruptly shifted.

The bones vanished, replaced by the two seemingly ordinary stone statues.

Only then did the sense of crisis in Li Fan’s heart gradually subside.

"Senior…" Sun Luyao, startled by the preceding events, appeared somewhat bewildered.

"Tell your brother to stay away from those two stone statues," Li Fan instructed calmly, though his mind was already in turmoil.

Were those two bones truly the remains of Grand Master Tiandu?

Judging by their appearance, they were most likely from Grand Master Tiandu.

But why would his bones be in the One Beginning Sect, despite him being a Half-Immortal?

"Could it be that he was so severely injured that his own bones were stolen by cultivators, and he was powerless to retrieve them?"

This thought flashed through Li Fan's mind.

But he quickly cast a huge doubt upon it himself.

Was that possible?

The power that enveloped the entire Yuandao Prefecture, capable of devouring ten years of time, suggested that the Grand Master had not yet perished.

Even with severe injuries, the might of a Half-Immortal was not something cultivators below that tier could contend with.

Let alone someone who had cultivated the ancient longevity path.

"Unless…"

"The Boundless Mirror."

Li Fan looked at Sun Luyao, who was cowering. This new spirit of the Boundless Mirror.

When the Sun brothers originally found the damaged Boundless Mirror, its Immortal Artifact Spirit was already missing, which allowed the two mortals to exploit the situation.

Judging by the Devouring Calamity that erupted from the Boundless Mirror not long ago, it seemed that the artifact spirit had dissipated during the confrontation with this calamity, causing the Boundless Mirror to be damaged.

"The Boundless Mirror is an ancient immortal artifact of the Xuanhuang Realm, bestowed upon the Boundless Sect by the Immortal Realm. Even if the Immortal Realm were to perish due to unspeakable calamities, it should not have affected the Boundless Mirror. Yet, this Devouring Calamity, which should not have appeared in the mortal realm, unfolded within the Boundless Mirror…"

Li Fan’s mind raced, recalling how the Holy Embryo’s spiritual manifestation had infiltrated the Mystic Immortal Boat beyond the sea of stars and simultaneously brought the formless calamity from the Dark Star Sea into it, resulting in the deaths of several cultivators.

"Spreading…"

"Beyond the Azure Nether…"

Throughout the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, the only known individual to have had contact with the Immortal Realm and come from beyond the Azure Nether was Grand Master Tiandu.

"It appears that both the Boundless Mirror and possibly the One Beginning Sect were affected by the Grand Master."

The past events here were too convoluted, and the clues he currently possessed were too few. Li Fan could only make such a conjecture.

"However, if this speculation is largely accurate, then perhaps the trouble with the Boundless Mirror can be resolved." Li Fan’s eyes gleamed.

Upon learning of the risks in this area, Ji Hongdao and Sun Luyuan had wisely chosen to temporarily leave the secret chamber.

However, their next course of action led to a slight disagreement.

"The remains of Grand Master Tiandu are no trivial matter. We should report this to the Myriad Immortals Alliance as soon as possible," Ji Hongdao stated sternly.

Sun Luyuan, however, strongly objected: "Brother Ji, you are being foolish! The Grand Master is rumored to be the master of the Myriad Immortal Sects. If this news reaches the Five Elders Council, they will undoubtedly try to seize it at all costs. A great war will be inevitable, leading to widespread suffering! Given the current state of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, can you guarantee this information won't leak?" Ji Hongdao was left speechless.

Sun Luyuan continued: "In the eyes of the Dharma-Preachers, who only regard Heavenly Venerates with importance…"

"They will likely show no reverence, even to the bones of a Half-Immortal. If it's taken to the Immortal Alliance, the outcome will be either being used for research or displayed in the Divine Treasure Museum for public viewing."

"Moreover, the Grand Master is a legendary Half-Immortal, and it's uncertain whether he has perished. If we desecrate these remains today, we might face his retribution in the future." Sun Luyuan concluded, his face filled with sincerity.

Ji Hongdao asked with some helplessness, "Then what do you suggest we do?"

"Leave it as it is," Sun Luyuan declared firmly.

"Brother Ji, think about it. Even if they are the bones of a Half-Immortal, what benefit can they bring us? With the New Law before us, even longevity is almost out of reach, let alone becoming an immortal!"

"Taking them might invite unimaginable future calamities without any tangible benefits. Why bother?"

…

In the end, Ji Hongdao was persuaded.

The fundamental reason was that these were merely two bones.

And they were the bones of a Half-Immortal who had not yet ascended.

As Sun Luyuan said, for Dao Integration cultivators like themselves, they were of little use.

Of course, if they were the remains of a true immortal, their choice would certainly be different.

"Although we won't take them for now, we cannot let others seize them. Brother Ji, your mastery of formations is unparalleled. Why not use your formations to completely seal this relic? Combined with the original protective formation, we can ensure absolute security." Sun Luyuan suggested again.

This was his way of declaring his stance.

Sun Luyuan was practically ignorant of formations. As long as Ji Hongdao set up a formation here, he wouldn't be able to secretly return and take the bones alone.

Ji Hongdao did not refuse and immediately began setting up a formation.

As the relic was sealed once more, on their way back, Sun Luyuan said in a wistful tone, "If either of us manages to achieve longevity, we can then bring out these remains to study them. Perhaps we can achieve further progress."

Ji Hongdao chuckled bitterly and shook his head, not taking it to heart.

If before reaching Dao Integration, when they were younger, they had harbored ambitions and the ideal of achieving longevity,

then now, at the Dao Integration realm, they had long since abandoned any hope of reaching longevity.

The four steps of Dao Integration were each more arduous than the last.

The more they understood, the more despair they felt.

They both fell silent.

After a long while, Sun Luyuan sighed, "I truly wonder what kind of world-shattering talent one must possess to succeed in defying the natural order."

"In our Myriad Immortals Alliance, over these many years, apart from the Heavenly Venerates, there has only been one such individual, and their whereabouts are unknown."

"If there were even one more, the situation of our Alliance would be vastly different."

"Tell me, on what basis does the Five Elders Council have five Longgevity experts? Do they truly possess higher talent than our Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, achieving what we cannot?"

This was also an unresolved doubt in the hearts of countless cultivators in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Hearing Sun Luyuan's lament, Ji Hongdao, as if recalling something, hesitated to speak.

"Brothers, is there anything we cannot discuss?" Sun Luyuan said playfully.

Chapter 1212

“Actually…” Ji Hongdao struggled for a moment, then transmitted his voice, “I only heard about it by chance and don’t know if it’s true. Brother Sun, just take it as a joke. However, it’s best not to spread this matter.”

After making his disclaimer, he continued with a slightly somber expression, “Actually, two of the five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council were originally members of our Myriad Immortals Alliance.”

“But for some reason…” Ji Hongdao shrugged.

Sun Luyuan heard this rumor for the first time, and was instantly astonished beyond measure. He wanted to ask more, but saw the other party make a gesture. Thus, he wisely did not press the matter further. After all, the event was too unbelievable.

Lost in thought, the two of them had already quietly returned to the Sun family.

“This trip was in vain. The problem with your brother possessing that mirror has not been resolved. What do you plan to do?” Ji Hongdao asked.

“We’ll take things one step at a time,” Sun Luyuan said helplessly. “However, Brother Ji, you also mentioned that the formation in those ruins is quite old. This indicates that my previous guess was likely wrong. After the disaster erupted within the Boundless Mirror, it might subside for a long time. At the very least, it seems my brother is safe for the time being.”

Ji Hongdao nodded upon hearing this. “I have official duties to attend to, so I will take my leave. If you need anything, contact me anytime.”

“Thank you, Brother Ji!” Sun Luyuan said gratefully.

“Ah, there’s no need for such politeness,” Ji Hongdao waved his hand. After a few more pleasantries, he transformed into an escape light and departed.

The expression on Sun Luyuan’s face gradually calmed. In reality, the reason he had prevented Ji Hongdao from reporting the discovery of the Grand Master’s remains was not only for the reason he stated, but also due to his own plans.

“If the news of the Grand Master’s remains truly ignites a great war between the two sides…” Dangerous glimmers flashed in Sun Luyuan’s eyes. “This might be an opportunity.”

“According to the deductions of the Boundless Mirror, even the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty could contend with a fully-powered Myriad Immortals Alliance. If they were to encounter one at the end of a great war, severely depleted…”

Sun Luyuan could never have imagined that he and someone else had reached the same conclusion.

After his initial shock subsided, this strategy surfaced in Li Fan’s mind. However, after careful consideration, he decided against using the Grand Master’s remains as a pawn. Introducing a Half-Immortal into the situation carried too high a risk. To achieve the same effect, Li Fan had many other alternatives. For instance, the matter of Eastern Extreme being refined into a puppet. Or, fabricating the news that the Myriad Immortals Alliance was hiding another Rebirth Heavenly Venerate on the verge of enlightenment. As long as Li Fan wished, he could incite a war in the Xuanhuang Realm at any time.

However…

Recalling the rumor Ji Hongdao had mentioned on the Mortal-Crossing Boat, Li Fan frowned slightly. “Two of the Five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council were originally members of the Myriad Immortals Alliance?”

“Yet they stand opposed to the Alliance…”

“Could it be because of the Eastern Extreme incident, a case of ‘the rabbits die, the foxes are saddened’?”

“Or perhaps, they knew that the Dharma-Preachers were dismembering and dividing the Xuanhuang Realm?”

The Myriad Immortals Alliance would naturally try every means to conceal such matters. Apart from the direct participants of that year, it would be extremely difficult to find any written records. Even with Li Fan’s countless reincarnations, he remained ignorant of this. Fortunately, once he knew, it would be easier to inquire about it.

While Li Fan was contemplating, Sun Luyuan’s conversation with Sun Luoyao had already concluded.

“Brother, is this method truly effective?”

“Brother, rest assured, it’s highly likely to work. This idea suddenly appeared after I saw the Grand Master of Tiandu. I surmise the Boundless Mirror has some connection with the Grand Master.” Sun Luoyao spoke with certainty.

“Alright, I’ll think of a way. But these Netherfolk, I’ve never heard of them before. I imagine they are a top secret of the Alliance. Obtaining them won’t be easy.” Sun Luyuan’s brow furrowed.

“Don’t worry, Brother. I should be able to hold on for a while longer,” Sun Luoyao said with a smile, comforting him.

Sun Luyuan sighed lightly and left the secret chamber directly.

Indeed, the method Li Fan had proposed to resolve the Devouring Calamity of the Boundless Mirror was inspired by his previous speculation. Diverting the disaster! Using an Immortal artifact, or something close to it, to lure out the hidden calamity within the Boundless Mirror. Li Fan surmised that the calamity, which had transferred from the Grand Master Tiandu to the Boundless Mirror, might be particularly sensitive to beings of the “Immortal” level. It might attack spontaneously upon sensing their presence, thereby transferring most of its power. Li Fan would naturally not use a true Half-Immortal artifact as bait, but he could create some items that possessed an aura of immortality. This would be achieved by using the condensed Primal Force Essence provided by the Netherfolk.

“With the Golden Primal Force Essence, coupled with the Boundless Unity Primordial Square formation, which is barely at the Immortal level, it should be possible to create a Half-Immortal artifact.”

“Even if it’s merely a facade, it should suffice.”

“Even if it fails, it doesn’t matter. It can be considered a test.”

Apart from the branch captured by the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, the Myriad Immortals Alliance still possessed a large number of Netherfolk. If they could find a way, with the Sun family’s status and connections, they should be able to procure some.

However, what truly worried Li Fan at the moment was the situation within the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. Ever since receiving the message from the Dharma-Preachers demanding that sixteen Dao Integration cultivators leave the Xuanhuang Realm, the Alliance headquarters had been in a state of lockdown. It was clearly brewing something.

“With the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s background, artificially boosting sixteen Dao Integration cultivators would be a simple matter.”

“There’s no need to be in such prolonged seclusion.”

“The only thing I can think of that warrants such cautious handling, fearing leakage…”

“Is a method to escape the Immortal Ruins and flee the Xuanhuang Realm!” A sharp glint appeared in Li Fan’s eyes. The reason why various factions in the Xuanhuang Realm were lying low was largely due to the existence of the Immortal Ruins. They had no way to escape. If they were to learn of a method to safely leave the Xuanhuang Realm, without knowing about the existence of the The Great Barrier, many would undoubtedly do so without hesitation. Just as it had happened in the Xuanhuang Realm thousands of years ago. “When disaster strikes, everyone flies for themselves!”

“Even the Myriad Immortals Alliance itself would have to consider whether anyone within the alliance would seize the opportunity to escape.”

“After all, they cannot possibly reveal the existence of the The Great Barrier to the public. Otherwise, the world would fall into utter chaos.”

With this thought, Li Fan once again utilized the Boundless Mirror to probe the Heavenly Profound Mirror. He had initially expected no results, as before. Unexpectedly, this time, he found some faint clues.

“Empty Light Flowing Crystals, acquire them urgently. Do not make a large fuss, use covert means. Once acquired, destroy them.”

“Empty Light Flowing Crystals.”

…

Three or four such messages circulated from the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters through the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Chapter 1213: The Immortal Alliance's High-Pressure Stance

"Empty Light Flowing Crystals?"

In an instant, Li Fan's mind conjured information related to it.

Empty Light Flowing Crystals were a type of silk-like solid crystal. They could float in the air, moving like flowing water, and emitted a dazzling, dreamlike multicolor glow. They were often mixed into magic artifacts by female cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm when forging them, causing the artifacts to release brilliant and dazzling light, both in their normal state and when activated.

But…

Other than looking good, they seemed to have no other use. Therefore, although their production was not high, their price remained at a moderate level of eight thousand contribution points each.

For such a seemingly flashy but impractical item, there were now people at the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters who, risking repercussions after the fact, were desperately trying to acquire them in advance.

Clearly, these Empty Light Flowing Crystals were likely related to the sixteen Dao Integration cultivators who were to leave the Xuanhuang Realm as a sign of their imminent departure.

In the Sun family's secret chamber, Li Fan used both the origin of the Heavenly Profound Mirror and the probing capabilities of the Boundless Mirror to investigate. He quickly detected subtle communications and transaction records related to this matter.

They operated very secretly and cautiously. Most of them would arrange matters through the Heavenly Profound Mirror and then conduct face-to-face transactions using standard spirit stones. Occasionally, when items were acquired through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, they would still list them afterward as if to sell them, ensuring that a certain quantity of Empty Light Flowing Crystals circulated in the Heavenly Profound Mirror market without significant price fluctuations. However, as they were repeatedly transferred, the vast majority of Empty Light Flowing Crystals on the market were gradually controlled by the same group of people. The so-called transactions were merely swapping hands.

"A decent method. Much more pleasing to the eye than my own crude market manipulation tactics," Li Fan praised, clicking his tongue. He then leveraged the power of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's origin to participate in the action. He possessed the ability to erase traces of information in the Heavenly Profound Mirror at any time, naturally not being as timid and hesitant as these shadowy rats. He began to sweep through the market with impunity, buying madly, disregarding any price, and offering prices that no one could refuse. He was like a colossal whale, stirring up a tempest in the Heavenly Profound Mirror's trading market.

Soon, the price of Empty Light Flowing Crystals skyrocketed, soaring directly upward. This anomaly naturally attracted the attention of more cultivators. Although they did not yet know the true purpose of the Empty Light Flowing Crystals, it did not stop them from following the trend and acquiring them.

Li Fan's clone, using a fabricated Heavenly Profound Mirror identity, soon received several messages from strangers.

"Who are you? Are you not afraid of death, acting so recklessly?"

"Brother, rein it in a bit. Don't make it so no one else can eat."

"Hmph, I advise you, hoarding is useless. Spit out what you've swallowed, and we can all survive together."

…

Li Fan replied to all these bothersome messages with a single sentence: "Very well, you've all exposed yourselves. Prepare to be purged!" Immediately thereafter, the cultivators on the other end fell silent. Upon further inquiry, many had inexplicably died within this brief period.

"They are so ruthless even to their own kind." "But they are all fools too."

Li Fan paid them no mind and continued his acquisition of Empty Light Flowing Crystals while toying with them. However, unfortunately, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's reaction this time was unusually swift.

"Senior, quick, stop!" Sun Luyao sent a warning.

Li Fan had already begun his "tail-cutting" operation. Empty Light Flowing Crystals were taken out from the small Heavenly Profound Mirror one by one, and then the fabricated identity information was directly erased. Li Fan's divine sense clone then unleashed a destructive black light, destroying the small Heavenly Profound Mirror directly.

At this moment, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's announcement finally arrived in the Heavenly Profound Mirror. It declared Empty Light Flowing Crystals to be prohibited items. The Myriad Immortals Alliance would be recycling all holdings from cultivators and urged everyone to cooperate. Any who insisted on obstructing this work would be accused of betraying the alliance and punished accordingly.

…

The news sent shockwaves through all four directions. This was arguably the strictest measure the Myriad Immortals Alliance had announced since its inception, and it was all for a small, previously almost ignored item like Empty Light Flowing Crystals. What profound mystery did this item hold that it warranted such a massive mobilization from the Myriad Immortals Alliance?

Those cultivators who were in possession of Empty Light Flowing Crystals but were unwilling to hand them over simply decomposed and studied them. But, as in the past, they found nothing. Suspicion and discussion brewed like a storm. The Myriad Immortals Alliance, however, showed no intention of explaining. Instead, they directly implemented more stringent measures of suppression. In the Heavenly Profound Mirror, any information related to Empty Light Flowing Crystals could no longer be found. Members within the Alliance system who dared to discuss Empty Light Flowing Crystals privately were immediately dismissed from their posts. Gatherings of non-Alliance cultivators discussing the matter would be monitored by the Martial Training Halls of various prefectures and warned. This high-pressure stance made it clear to cultivators everywhere that this time was different from the past; Empty Light Flowing Crystals had truly become a taboo topic.

The cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm valued their lives. For a time, the Myriad Immortals Alliance was like a clam before a cicada, silenced.

Voices could be suppressed, but how could the doubts and curiosity in their hearts be eternally quelled? The Myriad Immortals Alliance's control had not yet permeated the lives of every cultivator. Thus, in deep mountain cave dwellings far from the immortal cities of the prefectures, and in secret chambers heavily protected by prohibitions, discussions about Empty Light Flowing Crystals were still unavoidable.

However, all the Empty Light Flowing Crystals in the world had already been confiscated. They could only speculate based on their imaginations. It was not just speculation; even if they had the actual item in hand, it would be difficult to ascertain the true usage of Empty Light Flowing Crystals.

In the Sun family's secret chamber, Li Fan had even used the Boundless Mirror to meticulously analyze Empty Light Flowing Crystals, but he could not find any unique properties.

"It seems Empty Light Flowing Crystals are just a crucial component. There should be other steps involved." After expending over a hundred Empty Light Flowing Crystals, Li Fan reluctantly ceased his research for the time being.

"I can only wait until the Alliance completes the sixteen Dao Integration cultivators' departure from the Xuanhuang Realm before finding a way to inquire." "But I can make preparations for observation in advance."

The Sun family. Wu Ninglu, who was cultivating with her eyes closed, relying on the resources bestowed by Sun Luyuan, did not notice a dark shadow emerge from her storage ring. The dark shadow burrowed into her sea of consciousness and quickly took control of Wu Ninglu's body. This was a remnant soul Li Fan had left behind before entering the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Law Enforcement Hall. Compared to a lurking divine sense clone, this remnant soul's power was much greater. After its divine sense clone unleashed a sword strike, destroying the small Heavenly Profound Mirror and severing the lead for investigation, it fell into a weakened state again. However, this remnant soul, like a cultivator, could absorb Spirit Qi from heaven and earth to replenish its own consumption.

Chapter 1214: Purple Qi Enters the Starry Sky

"This clone was originally intended for the most critical moment," [Li Fan] mused. "But it seems I have no choice but to deploy it now."

Having infiltrated Wu Ninglu's side and gained intimate knowledge of her actions and decisions, [Li Fan’s] clone, controlling her body, found a pretext to leave the Sun family without arousing suspicion. Afterward, evading pursuit from the Chen family of the Medicine Hall, it arrived at a secluded, uninhabited spot in the wilderness. Using the surrounding materials, it began constructing stone puppets. [He] intended to dispatch these stone puppets to the fringes of the Xuanhuang Realm before the sixteen Dao Integration cultivators departed. This way, [he] could observe their escape methods up close. With [Li Fan’s] current mastery of formations, he was not worried about being detected by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"They say one cannot split themselves too thin, yet even with several splitting, it still feels insufficient," the clone sighed with a touch of helplessness.

Carefully calculating, the main body remained hidden within the Dharma Deduction space of the Law Enforcement Hall. The Sacred Embryo had journeyed to the far reaches of the star sea, probing the mysteries of the distant stellar force. The clone from the Boundless Mirror was too weak, its power insufficient… As for the Sacred Emperor clone, it had by sheer unfortunate coincidence been pulled into the Nether Realm by Senior Yin. Therefore, it was up to this hidden clone to act.

The situation in the Sea of Darkness aside for now, the day the Myriad Immortals Alliance completed its Doctrine Transmission task arrived sooner than [Li Fan] had anticipated. It was the thirty-third day after Empty Light Flowing Crystals were declared contraband. A brilliant rainbow suddenly appeared in the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm, as if it had absorbed all the colors in the world, twisting and disorienting. Like a streaking meteor, it pierced the firmament and soared away. In full view of everyone, the rainbow light tore through the Xuanhuang Realm’s sky. The myriad residual rays it left behind lingered for a long time, suffusing the heavens, persisting for days. For the next half-month, the Xuanhuang Realm’s sky remained a tapestry of multicolored, bizarre, and dreamlike hues. Some curious cultivators attempted to capture these scattered rainbow lights. To their surprise, these colors possessed a tangible form, capable of being collected and refined. Moreover, they imparted the characteristic of making objects emit seven-colored light. When they recalled the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s strict prohibitions and stern warnings against discussing Empty Light Flowing Crystals… the cultivators understood. This was Empty Light Flowing Crystals, used to forge the tools for leaving the realm.

The unveiling of this mystery did not cause any chaos. For the vast majority of cultivators, they were unaware of the existence of the Immortal Ruins, nor did they know that the Xuanhuang Realm was fundamentally incapable of escape. They only knew that communication between the Xuanhuang Realm and the outside world had been severed for a long time, and they speculated that the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s actions were to re-establish contact. But these people were not important. The important cultivators, upon understanding, began to harbor different thoughts. A current began to stir within the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Let us return to the moment the colorful rainbow departed the Xuanhuang Realm. Using the eyes of approximately one hundred stone puppets, [Li Fan] was able to observe the entire process of the rainbow light leaving the Xuanhuang Realm with remarkable clarity. The instant it left the Xuanhuang Realm, its trajectory, as predicted, suddenly deviated from a straight line, making a sharp turn. It curved towards the direction of the Immortal Ruins.However, it was not entirely drawn in. It was like a mass of dough being gradually stretched. Only a portion of the colorful rainbow’s light had its flight path forcibly altered by the suction of the Immortal Ruins. The remainder continued to speed away into the depths of the star sea with unwavering resolve. As the colorful rainbow advanced, more and more of its colors were drawn to and fell towards the Immortal Ruins. Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo… The disappearance of these colors caused the rainbow’s hue to gradually simplify. Ultimately, only a single strand of purple qi remained, flying alone into the unknown star sea. From the perspective of the Xuanhuang Realm below, it appeared as a single beam of light shooting into the star sea, split into various colors. It was a slightly peculiar phenomenon, unlikely to even spark significant discussion. But in [Li Fan’s] eyes, this scene was nothing short of miraculous.

"It actually resisted the suction of the Immortal Ruins?!"

"No, rather than resisting, it was more akin to delaying and dissolving it!"

"[It] released a portion of the suction it received, partially counteracting the force. Then, as layers were stripped away, it rapidly distanced itself from the Immortal Ruins, causing the pull to lessen. Countless precise calculations were required to achieve this feat! This was not a victory of pure strength, but a triumph of ‘skill’."

In [Li Fan’s] mind, the dynamic curves of the color separation replayed endlessly, seemingly containing infinite mysteries. The Dao-Melting Stone crystals spun rapidly, attempting to deduce and replicate it within his sea of consciousness. However, after the separation of the yellow light, he began to feel dizzy and could not persist. Regretfully, he had to cease his efforts.

"Is this the method conceived by the Doctrine Transmitter?"

"[It's] elegant." [Li Fan] could only offer those two words of evaluation. "Empty Light Flowing Crystals should only be for separating different hues. As for the original driving force for escaping the Xuanhuang Realm, it should still be those sixteen Dao Integration cultivators. With the Longevity Realm cultivators bound to the Xuanhuang Realm, unless they reach the level of a Doctrine Transmitter, they likely cannot leave easily. Dao Integration is already the highest combat power the Xuanhuang Realm can deploy. Although they were pushed prematurely by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, I can feel that the auras of those sixteen Dao Integration cultivators are not weak."

[Li Fan’s] thoughts churned. The scene of the colorful rainbow departing the Xuanhuang Realm had profoundly stimulated him. When someone easily accomplishes a goal that you have strived for a long time without success, people truly feel the gap in ability. "Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate is indeed not an ordinary being. But it matters not, as long as I grasp this method, when I return to Return to Truth… I will be ahead of him again."

…

In the great Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, Sun Erlang looked at Yi Shu with a strange expression. This senior had recently been speaking normally, then would suddenly freeze. If he had not personally witnessed the terrifying power of the Dao Dissolution Mother Stone and known that this was likely the Stone Mother utilizing computational power, Sun Erlang might have suspected him of suffering from some form of dementia. However, he was curious about what the Stone Mother was doing that affected even these fragmented bodies separated from the Grand Origin Sect. Having spent some time with Yi Shu and understanding the collective tempers of the Grand Origin Sect, he did not make baseless guesses and directly inquired. After a considerable pause, Yi Shu snapped back to himself.

"It’s nothing, I was just contemplating a method for escaping in certain extreme situations without abandoning the Stone Mother’s main body." Yi Shu explained to Sun Erlang, "Without achieving complete information immortality, losing the main body of the Dao-Melting Stone would have a significant impact on us."

"Extreme situations?" Having witnessed the Stone Mother’s might firsthand and having undergone tribulations in a simulated world, Sun Erlang found it difficult to imagine what kind of calamity would force the Stone Mother to flee in such a desperate manner.

Chapter 1215

“If that day truly comes, don’t forget to bring me along, senior,” Sun Erlang teased with a smile after a moment.

“No problem,” Yi Shu glanced at Sun Erlang and nodded in agreement.

Sun Erlang was instantly stunned.

“Your master isn't in the Great Qi pocket world recently? I can’t sense his presence,” Yi Shu shifted the topic, asking instead.

Sun Erlang frowned at this. “Yes. I don’t know where he’s gone. As far as I can recall, this is the first time he’s left the Sacred Dynasty.”

Yi Shu looked at the Sacred Emperor’s Throne, which seemed to be growing ever more imposing, his eyes flashing with countless images.

Below the Sacred Emperor’s Throne, within the secret chamber where the Netherfolk were being kept.

Over a thousand Netherfolk circled around, dancing and performing a mysterious ritual.

In the center of their encirclement, a pitch-black gateway that seemed to swallow all light stood prominently.

And passing through this mysterious, dark gateway led to the other side of the Xuanhuang Realm, into the Sea of Darkness.

Sacred Emperor Li Ping was currently within it.

He was accompanied by Senior Yin.

In the Sea of Darkness, sight, sound, and even divine sense lost their communicative properties.

Yet, Li Fan could still feel Senior Yin’s whispered words beside his ear.

It was as if some mystical power was directly attached to his skin, allowing for close-quarters communication.

Being in the Sea of Darkness, Li Ping was severed from the Sacred Dynasty’s fortune.

At this moment, his power was exceedingly weak. Any Soul Transformation cultivator from the Myriad Immortals Alliance could likely kill him with ease.

However, the Heavenly Mandate Sacred Emperor of the Sacred Dynasty, now within this strange dark realm, felt no fear.

This was because, within him, flowed a power that ordinary cultivators could not detect.

A golden, majestic force that seemed to transcend the mortal realm.

The Netherfolk cultivation plan was progressing smoothly.

It even bypassed the need for physical growth; upon birth, they were mature individuals with peak physical function.

While this resulted in a shortened lifespan, with an expected duration of only three to five years, as long as the flesh factories continuously produced, the scale and number of Netherfolk, loyal to the Sacred Emperor and praying for him, could be maintained.

After the Netherfolk population exceeded four digits, the daily generated Essence of Wish Power had reached a considerable level.

Under Li Ping’s deliberate manipulation and weaving, it had formed a colossal golden net centered around his heart.

The Essence of Origin Power flowed like an unending river. Now, even without using his cultivation, Sacred Emperor Li Ping could unleash various incredible divine abilities with a mere thought.

For instance, with a single thought, he could trace the origin of the Essence of Origin Power and instantly return to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, regardless of his location in the Xuanhuang Realm. Even if other powers interfered, it would at most delay his return; it could not completely prevent it.

Furthermore, when he was attacked, the golden net of Origin Power would spontaneously defend and counter-attack.

With the current scale and power of the golden net within him, Sacred Emperor Li Ping was confident that even a Longevity realm cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm could not keep him here.

Of course, this did not include the Dharma-Preachers.

This was the foundation of his daring to personally venture into the Sea of Darkness this time.

Through the power of Senior Yin’s world spirit, the two conversed, each speaking at a time.

“Don’t you feel the strangeness here?” Senior Yin’s voice was intermittent, his own true form nowhere to be found.

“It’s completely dark. Nothing else,” Sacred Emperor Li Ping replied in a deep voice.

“Ah, right. You’re different from me. It’s normal that you can’t hear these sounds. The hushed whispers of various eras and individuals from the Xuanhuang Realm are ebbing and flowing in this Sea of Darkness…”

With Senior Yin’s explanation, Li Ping finally understood what he meant by strangeness.

The Nether Realm was a collection of powers that had deviated from the Immortal Ruins’ influence.

These were originally part of the Xuanhuang Realm. Upon being drawn to the Nether Realm for some unknown reason, they had simultaneously brought along some “information.” This could be a sound, or a few images.

It could even be a complete divine sense.

Over time, suppressed by the power of this place, all of it had sunk into the Sea of Darkness.

“So, the Sea of Darkness is actually quite lively,” Li Ping mused thoughtfully.

“Not necessarily. The characteristics of this place dictate that all information must remain silent. I can only access these fragments of time by absorbing them. Didn’t you ask me why the Netherfolk have such special physiques? I think I know the answer now.”

As he spoke, Li Ping felt the darkness behind him surge.

Senior Yin had suddenly appeared.

In stark contrast to the gloom of this place, the small vortex-like presence around him allowed Li Fan to “see” him clearly.

“If we consider the Immortal Ruins’ power as an attraction, then the force maintaining the existence of the Nether Realm can be seen as a repulsion. This repulsive force is not always present like the Immortal Ruins’ attraction. Instead, it appears and washes over like the tides of the sea, in a rhythmic manner. The accumulation of this force over time has created this peculiar existence in the Xuanhuang Realm.”

Senior Yin’s tone was filled with awe.

Before, although he vaguely knew of this region’s existence, he had never systematically studied it.

This time, venturing deep inside, he was deeply impressed by the mystery of the Sea of Darkness.

“The attraction comes from outside the Xuanhuang Realm, while the repulsion originates from within the Xuanhuang Realm itself. However, it’s not from the Xuanhuang Realm’s world and heavens…”

Senior Yin fell silent for a moment, seemingly calculating something.

“If my guess is correct, this periodic, spontaneous repulsive force should be from the ancient Heavenly Mysteries Sect's [Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation]!”

Speaking of this formation, Senior Yin’s tone suddenly became somewhat subtle.

Certain unpleasant memories seemed to flash through his mind.

But he quickly suppressed this emotion, which stemmed from his inherent nature, and continued his analysis.

“So that’s how it is. Sky Crossing, Sky Crossing. If it cannot counter the Immortal Ruins' attraction that gave rise to the Darkest Star Sea, how can it float in the boundless sea of stars?”

“Compared to that, the golden chains’ method of capturing other worlds is more like salvaging resources and strengthening oneself, done as a secondary action.”

“Indeed, it is an unprecedented and grand formation in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm. It’s just a pity that the formation is now damaged. And if I’m not mistaken, every activation of the repulsive force in this Sea of Darkness also consumes the Xuanhuang Realm’s world and heavens as a price. In the past, the Xuanhuang Realm could capture other worlds to offset this cost.”

“But times have changed. Let alone supplying the dark repulsive force, the Xuanhuang Realm can barely protect itself.”

Senior Yin displayed a rare tone of schadenfreude.

Chapter 1216: The Truth of the Sky Crossing Array

"Ahem," Elder Yin coughed lightly as he felt Emperor Li Ping's gaze lock onto him.

"Alright, back to the main topic. Generating the dark repulsive force is an innate behavior of an array. Even if the array is damaged, it will still execute according to its original logic. This Sky Crossing Star Sea Array is truly remarkable. It must have begun searching for an alternative power source after losing its Azure Nether energy supply."

"The Netherfolk were born from this very reason."

"I presume you've already noticed, haven't you? The power that the Netherfolk pray for to be born can, to a certain extent, replace the supply from the Xuanhuang Realm's world..."

"I don't know how much you understand about array formations. Does this explanation make sense to you?"

As Elder Yin spoke, he noticed Emperor Li Ping's emotions seemed a bit peculiar. Thinking he had explained too obscurely and unclearly, he asked.

"I know a little. The Sky Crossing Star Sea Array was constructed by the Heavenly Mysteries King. If what you say is true, then this Sea of Darkness here, much like the array module that captures worlds in the star sea, is an important functional part of the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array." Li Ping deliberated.

"Indeed," Elder Yin nodded.

"Furthermore, based on my judgment, besides these two components and the overall control of the array, the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array should have other functions..."

"The principles of array formations are boundless and ever-flowing. The golden chains and the Sea of Darkness, by themselves, cannot form a complete array cycle. There indeed should be two other auxiliary array modules to ensure the array's operational efficiency reaches its peak."

Before Elder Yin could speak, he heard Emperor Li Ping already stating his deductions.

"It seems your attainments in array formations far surpass mine," Elder Yin said with a melancholic tone.

Li Ping did not reply but continued to ponder the missing parts of the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array. Simultaneously, he continued his exchange with Elder Yin without pause.

"If we consider the Xuanhuang Realm as a flying ship struggling near the vortex of the star sea, then in a sense, this place is the ship's power source?"

After a moment of thought, Elder Yin agreed.

"Then, if... I'm just saying 'if,' by providing sufficient energy to the Sea of Darkness, would it be possible to gradually break free from the vortex?" Emperor Li Ping's tone was peculiar as he slowly asked.

"...Theoretically, there's a possibility. I don't know the energy conversion efficiency of the Sea of Darkness. More likely, even if the entire Xuanhuang Realm were to be consumed, it might not be enough to move the Xuanhuang Realm even an inch. Moreover, I have a feeling that due to the recent decrease in the Netherfolk population, the energy supply to the Sea of Darkness has encountered problems again. Perhaps it has begun to trigger new methods of energy absorption." Elder Yin shook his head.

"I always feel a faint but persistent sense of crisis. We cannot be careless," Elder Yin's tone was solemn.

"However, haven't you recently brought forth a large number of Netherfolk? If the energy supply to the Sea of Darkness can be restored, perhaps this evolution can be stopped," Elder Yin suddenly said.

Emperor Li Ping of the Great Qi remained silent.

***

Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters.

Li Fan, who had recently failed in his attempt to decipher the colorful rainbow light, could not afford to rest and recover. He immediately resumed his deductions on the Xuanhuang Realm's [Sky Crossing Star Sea Array].

Li Fan recalled the scene from Mo Ru Bin's 119th life, where he mysteriously disappeared in the Sea of Darkness, leaving only an empty shell.

"So, the Sea of Darkness is also a part of the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array."

"At that time, Mo Ru Bin successfully obtained relevant information about the Heavenly Mysteries King through the Heavenly Profound Mirror and eventually went to the Sea of Darkness. It's uncertain if he truly perished, but his cultivation could have been directly absorbed by the Sea of Darkness and transformed into Azure Nether's motive energy."

"Whether he sacrificed himself with great love for the Xuanhuang Realm, or faked his death to escape, it is almost certain that the Heavenly Mysteries King, or at least matters closely related to him, should be hidden within the Sea of Darkness."

"Before, I thought this Sea of Darkness was purely a manifestation of anomalous power, so I couldn't do anything about it. But now I know it's a manifestation of array power..."

"Perhaps I *can* decipher it!"

Emperor Li Ping's various senses within the Sea of Darkness, and the scenes he witnessed in the 119th life, all flashed through Li Fan's mind.

The Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, empowered by the Dao-Melting Stone, let out a resonant hum. It was operating at its limits, a feat unseen before.

"No wonder when I asked the Heavenly Profound Mirror for the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array diagrams, it was evasive and even offered immortal-grade array diagrams to temporarily appease me. Now it seems this Sky Crossing Array is fundamentally an ultimate modification array for the Xuanhuang Realm, transforming it from a pure cultivation world into an eternal immortal ship capable of traversing the Immortal Ruins."

"If the array were not damaged, if there wasn't still a The Great Barrier outside the Immortal Ruins..."

"Perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm would have already broken free and traversed the star sea."

"Perhaps, when I asked the Heavenly Profound Mirror for the array diagrams of the Sky Crossing Star Sea Array, I inadvertently revealed a flaw. Given this array's importance, it's unlikely the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's Twelve Law Kings were unaware. And my attitude at the time was not that of someone who understood its significance; I treated it as just an ordinary array..."

Numerous thoughts flashed through Li Fan's mind simultaneously.

Time flowed by, the Dissolution Disc and the Dao-Melting Stone continuously flickered.

Feeling the familiar, increasingly intense tingling sensation between his brows, Li Fan frowned slightly. "It seems the complexity of this Sky Crossing Array is beyond my imagination. The information I have is too scarce. Even with three immortal-grade arrays as a foundation, forcefully deducing it is too much of a stretch. Even attempting to deduce a flaw in the Sea of Darkness is somewhat difficult."

"Moreover, does this array also have a way to prevent itself from being deciphered?"

Li Fan felt a tremor in his heart. Every time the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc approached a critical juncture in its deductions, a large portion of the array data inexplicably dissipated and vanished. It was as if some force, across time and space, was interfering.

Li Fan even suspected that if his main body weren't hidden within the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Dharma Deduction space, he might have been directly locked onto by this force, not just interfered with.

"Fortunately, after each deduction and restoration of the array, there's still some data retained. It's just a bit slower."

"Of course, it's best to maintain the current state of the Sea of Darkness without change."

***

As Li Fan's main consciousness churned, Emperor Li Ping's resolve also shifted abruptly.

"I wish to contend for the Xuanhuang Realm with the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and I would not stand idly by."

Chapter 1217: Another Ring of the Sky-Crossing Formation

"The Xuanhuang Realm is our only homeland, so naturally, we must protect it," Sacred Emperor Li Ping stated as if it were the most obvious thing.

"When we return, I will allocate a portion of the Netherfolk and allow them to return to the Sea of Darkness to regain their faith. Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance captured Netherfolk and caused an imbalance in the Nether World, the Sacred Dynasty will bear the responsibility."

"However..."

Li Ping gazed at the deep, dark ocean before him.

"Although the essence of primal force is vast, its quantity is ultimately limited. I wonder how many Netherfolk prayers, day and night, will be needed to restore the Sea of Darkness?"

Senior Yin was moved by Li Ping's attitude and, after a moment of thought, replied, "According to their leader, during their peak, their clan members' footprints covered the entire underground cave world. I estimate there were at least half a million..."

Li Ping said slowly, "It seems our approach to the Netherfolk needs to be improved bit by bit."

Senior Yin also nodded in agreement.

"Let's conclude this investigation for now. I have a feeling we've both gradually attracted the attention of this darkness."

"Agreed."

A golden light enveloped Li Ping's body, making him appear incredibly divine and majestic.

As the light rippled, it seemed as though space and time itself contorted.

In the next moment, Sacred Emperor Li Ping's figure vanished into thin air, returning to the Great Qi pocket world.

He hadn't used the portal created by the Netherfolk's sacrifices and prayers, but instead directly utilized the power of the immense net of primal force essence.

"Currently, the source of the primal force net is only in Great Qi. If, one day, Netherfolk in various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm pray to me, I can then use this connection to appear anywhere at will," Sacred Emperor Li Ping mused.

Having understood the significance of the Netherfolk, Li Ping summoned Wang Xuanba.

He conveyed his latest strategy regarding the Netherfolk. Besides continuing to increase the production of Netherfolk in the flesh factories, they would also simultaneously work to expand the normal Netherfolk population to achieve sustainable development.

"For these other Netherfolk, you must find ways to extend their lifespans."

Wang Xuanba, kneeling on one leg, listened to the Sacred Emperor's instructions. Though he didn't understand the reason for the sudden, drastic change in attitude, he loyally accepted the task.

After Wang Xuanba left, Li Ping then summoned Sun Erlang. He assigned him the mission of leading troops to conquer several underground worlds.

Sun Erlang, who had been idle for quite some time, happily accepted the order.

However, instead of dismissing him as he had Wang Xuanba, Li Ping continued to ask questions.

"How has Yi Shu of the Grand Origin Sect been performing recently?"

The Sacred Dynasty's fortune was tied to Li Ping. As the Chosen Emperor of Great Qi, he was naturally aware of everything happening within the Great Qi pocket world, yet he still asked intentionally.

Sun Erlang did not dare to hide anything and truthfully replied.

"I didn't expect the Grand Origin Sect to agree to your request," Li Ping's cold voice said emotionlessly, echoing in the Sacred Emperor's Seat.

"But it's fine. If, one day, the Sacred Dynasty falls, seeking refuge in the Grand Origin Sect would be a good outcome for you."

Sun Erlang was stunned, and his expression changed. "Master, how could the Sacred Dynasty..."

Li Ping then gave a rare laugh. "Where in the world is there absolute certainty of victory? What's wrong with having a backup plan? However, this applies only to you. Do not mention this to your juniors."

"You may go."

Sun Erlang departed in trepidation.

Li Ping sat alone on the empty Sacred Emperor's Seat. Although this exploration into the Nether World had only lasted a short while, it had caused significant turmoil in his mind.

"The Sky-Crossing Formation, the Fishing Pond..."

"My strength has already reached the 'half-step' peak of the Xuanhuang Realm. Yet, there are too many hidden oddities within the Xuanhuang Realm. The Myriad Immortals Alliance has ruled half the Xuanhuang Realm for so many years; their foundation must be even deeper than what is apparent."

"Moreover, the battle with the Myriad Immortals Alliance must not only be won but also concluded quickly. Otherwise, years of cultivator battles will inevitably cause irreversible damage to this land. It's already a patched-up, leaky boat; how can it withstand further turmoil?"

As the Chosen Emperor, he had many things to consider.

After deep thought, Li Ping's figure flickered, disappearing from the Great Qi pocket world.

The next moment he reappeared, he was within the Nine Mountains Province of the Xuanhuang Realm. Protected by the essence of primal force, he was now qualified to venture out occasionally without excessively worrying about his personal safety.

"Tian Beast."

Standing in mid-air, Li Ping sensed the chaotic, disordered space around him.

"If my guess is correct, the Tian Beast should be a part of the Sky-Crossing Formation."

"The Sea of Stars is fraught with danger. To succeed in crossing it, investigating the path ahead and avoiding dangers is also essential."

"The Eye of the Tian Beast..."

Vague images flashed through his mind. In an independent space called the Eye of the Tian Beast, outside the Xuanhuang Realm, one could seemingly observe even deeper reaches of the Sea of Stars compared to within the Xuanhuang Realm.

"It's a pity the Tian Beast is already dead. To find that unique space can only rely on chance. The vast Sea of Stars, with the constant influence of the Immortal Ruins' gravitational pull, makes it harder than finding a needle in a haystack."

"Three out of the four components of the Sky-Crossing Formation have revealed themselves. The last one remains elusive."

"..."

He shook his head slightly, suppressing his thoughts for the moment. Silently, Li Ping arrived at the headquarters of the Sect of Spiritual Primal.

The Sect of Spiritual Primal was the largest local power in the chaotic region of the Nine Mountains Province. Its disciples all cultivated the All Beings Spiritual Essence Technique. While seemingly breaking the rule of not cultivating multiple laws, they were actually tools for the sect leader to refine and absorb primal force's essence.

Easily bypassing various restrictions, guided by the scent of primal force, Li Ping arrived at Skilled Artisan Hermit's underground base. It was filled with all sorts of bizarre parts, and Skilled Artisan himself was busy working.

"Where exactly is it failing?"

"Primal force, essence of primal force – a difference of two words, yet a chasm apart!"

A puppet sculpted from golden primal force exploded into fragments with a bang, scattering shimmering light. It seemed the experiment had failed, and Skilled Artisan Hermit was quite annoyed.

"Come here!"

He turned and snorted at a female cultivator standing nearby. A leather whip suddenly appeared in his hand.

The female cultivator had a blank expression, her eyes lacking the usual liveliness of a normal person.

"It's not like it, not like it at all! Nothing like the real Shangguan!"

Seeing the female cultivator's appearance, Skilled Artisan grew even more agitated.

The leather whip was about to strike when he suddenly saw the figure of the Faceless Sacred Emperor in the secret chamber. As if a guilty secret had been exposed, Skilled Artisan's hand trembled, and the whip almost fell to the ground.

"Who are you?!" Skilled Artisan exclaimed angrily, looking at Li Ping.

In the secret chamber, the puppets, which had been lifeless moments before, suddenly came alive, fixating on Li Ping.

Chapter 1218: The Sacred Emperor Receives the Heavenly Mandate

Despite being surrounded, Li Ping showed no signs of panic.

These puppets were driven by primal force refined and extracted using the All Beings Spiritual Essence Technique.

The current Enlightenment Spiritual Essence Technique practiced by the populace of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty was a refined version of the All Beings Spiritual Essence Technique.

With just a glance, Li Ping discerned the method by which primal force influenced the puppets. The golden network of primal force within his body emitted invisible fluctuations.

The purity of the energy had infinitely approached the essence of primal force, exerting a natural suppression on the puppets manipulated by the Skilled Artisan.

In the blink of an eye, the dozens of puppets in the secret chamber, which had been menacingly watching them, were now toppling over, unable to stand.

This included the female puppet of Shangguan.

The Skilled Artisan’s expression instantly turned grim. Having dealt with primal force for most of his life, how could he not recognize the mysterious person before him’s method of influencing the puppets?

He had already abandoned the idea of a direct confrontation and began planning his escape, as well as how to abandon this body and be reborn from his memory backups.

Li Ping saw the shifting emotions on the Skilled Artisan's face and naturally saw through his petty intentions.

Leisurely, he revealed the locations where the Skilled Artisan had hidden several of his memory backups, one by one.

The Skilled Artisan’s mind reeled, and his shock became uncontrollable.

"Who exactly are you!" His voice even cracked from fear.

He could neither fight nor escape.

Since fleeing to this Xuanhuang Realm, the Skilled Artisan had never felt such despair.

"Fellow Daoist Skilled Artisan, please do not misunderstand. I have come to offer you an opportunity for fortune," Li Ping said slowly.

However, his slightly somber tone, combined with his indiscernible face, made his words utterly unconvincing.

The Skilled Artisan naturally did not believe him; in fact, his fear intensified.

The name "Skilled Artisan" was something he had never revealed to anyone else in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The world only knew him as the mysterious Lord of the Sect of Spiritual Primal.

Yet, here was a faceless, mysterious person who could not only reveal his origins but seemed to know everything about him!

The Skilled Artisan even began to wonder if there were other survivors from the Heavenly Mysteries Realm besides himself.

For a moment, the Skilled Artisan’s thoughts became chaotic. However, his jumbled thoughts vanished as a ball of shining golden light rose in Li Ping's hand.

“Primal Force… Essence?!”

“How is this possible!”

The Skilled Artisan exclaimed again, his face full of disbelief.

Before he could get a closer look, the golden sphere was put away by Li Ping.

"Fellow Daoist, are you not seeking the essence of primal force but unable to obtain it? I can teach you." This statement from Li Ping completely stunned the Skilled Artisan once more.

"Fellow Daoist, are you not wishing to recreate the Immortal-grade puppet [Ancestor]? I can also help you," Li Ping continued to speak at his own pace.

The Skilled Artisan was now somewhat numb from shock. He was no longer surprised that Li Ping knew of Ancestor's existence.

While feeling incredibly absurd, a sliver of hope also emerged in his heart.

What if the other party was telling the truth?

"What are your conditions?" the Skilled Artisan asked directly.

Li Ping chuckled, "Hearing is not as good as seeing. Fellow Daoist, please follow me first."

The Skilled Artisan followed behind Li Ping, traveling eastward from Nine Mountains Province to the depths of the Cloudy Sea.

Near an underwater volcano.

"Hmm?"

The Skilled Artisan gazed at the terrain. He vaguely sensed that a creature seemed to be slumbering within the earth vein fire below. Li Ping's next words confirmed his suspicion.

"You mean a puppet with complete self-awareness?" The Skilled Artisan sounded disbelieving.

"It is not a direct creation, but one that has become a puppet through a profound and wondrous method. It has been absorbing the power of the earth veins for thousands of years and has yet to complete its full transformation. If it is awakened rashly, its puppet body might be inherently insufficient. I brought you here to see if you have any solutions," Li Ping said calmly.

"Transforming oneself into an object?" The Skilled Artisan repeatedly savored the meaning of these four words.

Then, a beam of golden light shot from his eyes, sweeping across the continuous earth veins below.

After a long while, the golden light faded, and the Skilled Artisan nodded, "The puppet below, through thousands of years of continuous tempering by the earth fire, has indeed expanded its strength to an extent previously unimaginable. However, the intensity of the earth fire is limited. Even after absorbing for another thousand years, its strength is destined to be capped at the perfection of the Soul Transformation realm. It is impossible to advance further."

"And this earth fire formation was set up by it before it fell into slumber. After so long, the two have begun to show signs of merging. If it is easily modified, it might also wake it up."

"Unless..."

The Skilled Artisan pondered for a moment, then said thoughtfully, "Unless the earth fire that tempers this puppet itself changes."

"You know, this Azure Nether Heavenly Dao is extremely bizarre, with frequent drastic changes in the world. And earth fire is a manifestation of the power of the Heavenly Dao laws..."

"However, this opportunity is difficult to encounter," the Skilled Artisan said truthfully.

Li Ping slowly said, "I understand."

"As expected of a successor from the Heavenly Mysteries Realm. My original plan was to modify and sublimate the Earth Fire Origin Return Formation with rare heavenly treasures. But now that I think about it, your suggestion is better. To use the power of heaven and earth to recreate the universe..."

The Skilled Artisan was slightly taken aback, then emphasized again, "I said, this opportunity is difficult to encounter."

"Is that so?" Li Ping sneered.

"Fellow Daoist, observe my methods."

After making grand pronouncements, Li Ping closed his eyes and stood still.

The Skilled Artisan, thinking he was accumulating power to unleash some divine ability, focused his observation.

However, he waited for nearly half a day without any sign of movement.

If not for the faint aura of the essence of primal force still locking onto him, the Skilled Artisan would have taken the opportunity to slip away.

But circumstances were beyond his control. Since the other party remained silent, he could only continue to wait.

He waited for half a month.

It was only because the Skilled Artisan was a Master Craftsman with a steadfast temperament that he could barely endure it.

And in a place out of the Skilled Artisan's sight, within the pocket world of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

Those abducted netherfolk and the large number of netherfolk produced by the flesh and blood factories began to pray to the Sea of Darkness once more.

Perhaps it was because they were inherently created to provide power to the Sea of Darkness.

With little to no guidance, their praying efficiency was several times higher than praying to the Faceless Sacred Emperor.

A subtle influence began to manifest in the Xuanhuang Realm.

And the Faceless Sacred Emperor of Great Qi, standing in the depths of the Cloudy Sea, also silently perceived this change in the world.

Some things do not happen overnight but accumulate slowly.

Half a month later, when Li Ping sensed that the accumulation had finally surpassed a certain threshold...

"Transference of Heaven and Earth!"

The Faceless Sacred Emperor murmured softly, his towering figure gently gesturing towards the continuous earth vein fire below.

It seemed like a casual gesture, yet moments later, the Skilled Artisan, who had been observing, was shocked!

Chapter 1219: Molten Sun in Ink Flames

The Earth Vein Fire, which had originally reached its theoretical limit, suddenly began to burn more vigorously once again.

Blazing flames surged outward.

Cracks appeared on the ocean floor, and countless bubbles churned incessantly.

What shocked the Skilled Artisan was not these anomalies.
