It was another peculiar being, which, in his presence and amidst this earth fire, was quietly taking form.

Having been in the Xuanhuang Realm for so many years, he was no stranger to such an existence.

It had a name known to almost everyone: the Essence of Heaven and Earth!

As the materialized embodiment of the Xuanhuang Realm's laws, any cultivator who absorbed it could ascend to the heavens in a single step, reaching the Dao Integration realm.

The Essence of Heaven and Earth was an incredibly rare cultivation resource, and its appearance was completely unpredictable.

But now, the Essence of Heaven and Earth had taken shape under the gesture of this faceless mysterious person!

"This..."

As the Skilled Artisan perceived with disbelief and extreme shock, even more wondrous things occurred.

The Essence of Heaven and Earth, born from the earth fire, exhibited no unusual behavior.

Instead, it quietly catalyzed the earth fire. After the flames shifted from orange-yellow to pitch-black, it willingly threw itself into the Earth Fire Origin Return Formation!

It was clearly a self-sacrifice to provide a chance for the slumbering puppet within the formation to advance further!

The black fire leaped silently, and as the Earth Fire Origin Return Formation continuously operated, it fused into the colossal puppet's body buried underground.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

Continuous sounds of collapse and explosions echoed from beneath the ground.

These were signs of impurities within the puppet's body being smelted.

"The birth of this Essence of Heaven and Earth not only failed to attack the cultivator but also, according to that person's will, aided this underwater puppet?"

"How is this possible?"

As everyone knew, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm and the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm were irreconcilably opposed.

Upon seeing the Essence of Heaven and Earth, cultivators could not resist the urge to devour it.

And the Essence of Heaven and Earth showed no mercy to cultivators who dared to appear before them, killing them without hesitation.

But the scene unfolding before him completely shattered the Skilled Artisan's understanding.

"Even the Essence of Heaven and Earth listens to him so obediently... could it be that this person before me is an incarnation of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao?" the Skilled Artisan thought absurdly.

"The Essence of Heaven and Earth is born with a heavenly duty. This black flame before you is named Ink Flame. Its duty is to aid in the birth of a Dao Integration puppet..." Li Ping explained calmly.

He did not directly voice his subsequent thoughts: "The Transference of Heaven and Earth's Principles allows for the fabrication of Heavenly Dao's will, creating the Essence of Heaven and Earth out of thin air. However, that is all. Under normal circumstances, for the Essence of Heaven and Earth, which is inherently opposed to cultivators, to sacrifice itself to advance a cultivator..."

"This completely goes against the will of the Heavenly Dao, and under normal circumstances, it is impossible to achieve."

"However..."

"I am the incarnation of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao, and all my actions are for the sake of the Xuanhuang Realm and its beings!"

"Heaven and Earth will naturally assist me!"

Li Ping felt the subtle shift in the will of Heaven and Earth upon his being, ever since the Netherfolk, under his command, re-embraced their faith in the Sea of Darkness.

It was precisely due to the confluence of various factors that the Essence of Heaven and Earth that appeared this time was the extremely powerful Ink Flame.

That unsettling black flame even made Li Ping feel a sliver of danger.

Under the refining of the Ink Flame, the underwater puppet also progressed at an unimaginable speed.

"It won't be long before this puppet emerges."

"Although its realm is only Dao Integration, if we were to truly fight, I'm afraid I would be far from an opponent. And this is just the result of the mysterious person's casual gesture..." The Skilled Artisan quietly observed Li Ping again.

While feeling fear in his heart, he could not help but look forward more to the two favors the other party had mentioned.

"It seems he wasn't boasting..."

Li Ping and the Skilled Artisan waited for the puppet's emergence.

As the Ink Flame and the puppet continued to fuse, the surrounding ocean became increasingly turbulent.

However, Li Ping concealed it with a formation.

Otherwise, such anomalies would have long since attracted large numbers of cultivators to spectate.

Half a month later.

As if on its last breath, the undersea Earth Vein Fire was completely extinguished. The molten lava had cooled into black crystals.

Only the seabed remained shrouded in thick mist due to the high temperature.

The aura of the Ink Flame, the Essence of Heaven and Earth, had vanished entirely. In its place, a new, powerful aura emerged from the seabed.

The sense of danger in his heart made the Skilled Artisan instinctively move closer to Li Ping's position.

Suddenly, that aura vanished from the Skilled Artisan's perception.

The Skilled Artisan's expression changed drastically. A layer of silver-white armor materialized, protecting him.

A shadowy, dark figure quietly appeared beside them.

Its target was not the Skilled Artisan, but Li Ping, the Faceless Sacred Emperor of Great Qi!

The awakened True Yang was too vigilant. Sensing the two powerful auras nearby, it attacked them without a second word.

Facing the crisis and the attack from True Yang, Li Ping did not dodge.

He didn't even utilize the power of the essence of primal force for defense.

With a mere mental transmission, he roused the somewhat dazed True Yang, halting its rash action.

"True Yang, do you wish to avenge your master and senior brothers?"

True Yang's body trembled violently, revealing its true form. It stared intently at Li Ping.

Its appearance was still that of a child of about ten years old, just as it was before falling asleep.

However, its eyes occasionally betrayed a world-weariness completely unfitting for its age.

After calming down slightly, the scene of Li Ping helping it absorb the Essence of Heaven and Earth while it slept surfaced in its mind.

Knowing that its current strength was entirely due to the other party's assistance, the hostility in True Yang's heart gradually dissipated.

However, it still stared fixedly at Li Ping, awaiting an answer to his question.

"The perpetrators of the great war with the Xuanhuang Realm, which caused the deaths of countless sect cultivators, are still alive..."

"I intend to..."

Li Ping slowly transmitted his explanation.

True Yang listened quietly to the other party's plan, its aura fluctuating.

Then, it reined in its emotions and flew to Li Ping's side.

"This place is not suitable for lingering. Let's return first." Li Ping said.

He then looked at the Skilled Artisan: "Daoist friend, will you accompany us?"

Since True Yang's appearance, the Skilled Artisan's gaze had not left it.

"Do I have a choice but to come along..." the Skilled Artisan muttered inwardly and nodded in agreement.

It wasn't until the three of them traversed the void and arrived in the pocket world of Great Qi that the Skilled Artisan finally shifted his gaze away from True Yang.

The Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven led the way.

A total of nine grotto-heavens circled the pocket world of Great Qi,

providing the traction power for its movement through the void.

The Spirit Qi concentration in this mysterious pocket world was even higher than that of the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

It was as if an invisible force concealed it, making it impossible for even the Skilled Artisan to discern its details with his divine sense.

...

Just as the Skilled Artisan was once again plunged into shock.

An aura, blazing like a rainbow, rushed towards them, causing the Skilled Artisan's heart to lurch.

True Yang, who had remained silent, also became alert.

A cultivator in the Longevity Realm?

How is that possible?

Chapter 1220: Fishing Finally Yields a Treasure

Daoist Bai Hua arrived to report to Li Ping.

Of course, his primary purpose was to request Primal Force Essence.

After absorbing it several times and experiencing a dramatic leap in strength, Bai Hua had tasted its power and found it impossible to let go.

In truth, the Golden Origin Force created by the prayer rituals of the Netherfolk was still a slight distance from true Primal Force Essence.

However, for an ancient longevity practitioner like Bai Hua, being able to advance further was practically indistinguishable from reaching the true essence.

After greeting Li Ping, Bai Hua also noticed Qiao Gong and Tian Yang beside him.

Although Tian Yang appeared to be a young boy of a dozen years, the power contained within him made Bai Hua inwardly tremble.

As for Qiao Gong, Bai Hua sensed a familiar aura.

It was the aura of a cultivator from outside the Xuanhuang Realm.

After examining both of them carefully, Bai Hua said no more.

The Sacred Dynasty's Great Qi had gathered far too many peculiar individuals. He had long since grown accustomed to it.

This, in fact, was a good thing for him.

Having received Primal Force Essence from Li Ping, Bai Hua contentedly returned.

"Fellow Daoist, who is that?" Qiao Gong asked somewhat nervously.

"Daoist Bai Hua, formerly the Sect Master of the Heavenly Lotus Sect from the Myriad Abundance Realm," Li Ping introduced him concisely.

This simple sentence shocked Qiao Gong and also led him to speculate.

He was also an existence from another cultivation world, just like Li Ping. Then, were there more such individuals in this small world?

With this question in mind, Qiao Gong and Tian Yang, led by Li Ping, took a general tour of the Sacred Dynasty's Great Qi.

Both the Immortal Spirit Tower, which ceaselessly released Spirit Qi day and night, and the Sky-Patrolling Arrows that patrolled the heavens and guarded vigilantly, left the two astonished.

During their tour, the occasional encounter with unfathomable individuals further enlightened them: the Sacred Dynasty's Great Qi was indeed a place where hidden dragons and crouching tigers dwelled, and there were many existences like themselves.

Finally, they arrived within the Sacred Emperor's Throne.

Li Ping returned to his rightful position, looking down at the two, his voice echoing through the empty structure.

"Daoist Qiao Gong, I know your artifact refining skills are superb."

"I have some ideas for refining new types of puppets. You might find them useful."

Qiao Gong was quickly captivated by the schemes Li Ping displayed.

"Primal Force Essence, combined with Dao of Object Incarnation, and augmented by the artifact refining techniques of the Heavenly Mysteries Realm..."

"To create beings with their own consciousness, capable of rivaling Immortal-grade puppets."

The more Qiao Gong read, the more excited he became.

In his opinion, this plan was entirely feasible. In fact, many of its concepts aligned with his own long-held beliefs.

"I will specially carve out a space within the Great Qi's pocket world for your research."

"Tian Yang will also assist you," Li Ping continued. "First, refine some puppets to get a feel for it. Once you're confident, help Tian Yang with his modification."

Upon hearing this, Qiao Gong glanced at Tian Yang and suddenly understood.

"With Ink Flame as the foundation, and Primal Force Essence as an aid for sublimation..."

"Once perfected, his strength might not be inferior to an Azure Nether longevity cultivator!"

Thinking of how, in the future, true longevity, and even beings of a certain Immortal-grade, could be born from his hands, Qiao Gong couldn't help but feel immensely excited inwardly.

Shortly after completing the coordination with the related personnel of Great Qi, Qiao Gong impatiently began his work.

"All preparations are complete. The next step is to wait for the Medicine King Sect's people to return," Li Ping mused.

He had long since laid a comprehensive net. Once the Medicine King Cauldron returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, it would be directly drawn into the Great Qi's pocket world.

While elixirs might not significantly boost the overall strength of Great Qi, Li Ping possessed many malicious pill formulas capable of severely weakening cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor sat upon the Sacred Emperor's Throne, his mind reviewing all recent affairs of the Sacred Dynasty. Without him needing to personally oversee everything, everything was orderly and progressing steadily.

Knowing that the Sacred Emperor was constantly watching, no one dared to slacken.

After reviewing some minor matters, the Sacred Emperor's thoughts gradually calmed.

His form flickered, and in the next moment, he appeared in the dark secret chamber beneath the Sacred Emperor's Throne.

This place resembled an endless starry sky, with dozens of treasures floating like stars, emitting brilliant light.

The Sacred Dynasty's fishing competition had never stopped.

The treasures reeled in from the fishing pond were countless.

Li Ping had not broken his original vow.

All these treasures belonged to the individuals among the Sacred Dynasty's citizens.

Of course, for those who, due to their personal temperament or not understanding their specific use, did not require certain treasures, they could choose to submit them in exchange for other rewards.

Within this treasury were the treasures from the fishing pond that were still ownerless.

Li Ping was not particularly interested in most of them.

Only one item...

Li Ping extended his right hand, and Golden Origin Force Essence manifested.

One of the light clusters in the treasury reacted the fastest. Before any other light cluster could make a move, it had already arrived beside Li Ping.

It spun incessantly, as if trying to please him.

Within the light cluster, a tiny kitten could be vaguely seen, gazing expectantly at Li Ping.

Li Ping condensed the Primal Force Essence on his fingertip, and the little kitten instantly understood his intent.

It cheered and moved closer, licking Li Ping's finger.

"Neither beast nor artifact. The vast sea of stars is truly wondrous. To think such a creation even exists," Li Ping couldn't help but sigh inwardly.

This little kitten, seemingly harmless, was actually a threat.

When it approached, the massive net of Golden Origin Force within Li Ping's body sensed danger and automatically initiated its defenses.

Although it resembled a living creature, it emitted no life aura at all.

In fact, after it was fished up, it was initially just a statue in the shape of a kitten.

No matter how the lucky angler tried to test it, they couldn't find any use for this cat-shaped statue. Eventually, they grudgingly submitted it to the Sacred Dynasty in exchange for other rewards.

At first, even Li Ping hadn't noticed anything unusual about it.

Until one day, he suddenly realized that the treasures stored in the treasury had mysteriously decreased. Subsequently, after using Primal Force Essence to conduct an investigation, he finally apprehended the culprit.

The cat was merely one of its forms.

After eating its fill, it was about to lazily go to sleep when it felt Li Ping's telepathic message.

Despite its reluctance, considering its future meals, the little kitten let out a weak grumble.

After a flash of dark green light, the kitten transformed into a small box shape.

Strange images were engraved on the sides of the box.

Stars falling, and myriad beasts emerging from the earth.

In the sea of stars, countless massive ships stretched endlessly.

Two colossal humanoid figures faced each other, separated by a river of light in between.

...

Li Ping held the small square box and aimed it at one of the light clusters in the treasury.

One end of the box instantly emitted a faint green light.

It enveloped the light cluster.

Chapter 1221

A moment later, a beam of light shot out from the other end of the square box.

The small box shook violently, seemingly having expended a great deal of energy. Seeing this, Li Ping injected a little more Golden Origin Energy into it. Nourished, the square box slowly stabilized. Finally, the lights at both ends vanished, and an item identical to the previously enveloped light mass appeared in the Sacred Dynasty's treasury.

Li Ping took the two light masses in his hands and compared them carefully. Inside both light masses were identical swords, as if forged from ten-thousand-year-old ice, their blades emitting a glacial blue radiance.

“The Ten Thousand Year Ice Seal Sword is forged from the Core of Extreme Cold, an oddity that can cause an entire realm to freeze. If its chilling energy were fully released, it could instantly freeze an entire province of the Xuanhuang Realm. I believe even within the Myriad Immortals Alliance today, this sword would be a highly valuable treasure.”

“However…” Li Ping looked at the other Ten Thousand Year Ice Seal Sword in his hand. There was no discernible difference. “This square box managed to replicate it so easily.” Li Ping’s thoughts churned.

As Li Ping was pondering, the square box writhed and transformed back into the appearance of a small kitten. It seemed to have expended a considerable amount of energy and appeared listless. It let out a yawn and, unwilling to leave, curled up on Li Ping’s shoulder and fell into a deep sleep. It was clearly not faking; it even lost interest in the Golden Origin Energy Li Ping had sent.

Li Ping did not drive it away either. Such a treasure was best kept close. “Currently, it appears that when this treasure transforms into a square box, its function is replication. It can achieve perfect replication of items. This treasure seems to still be in its growth period; some things cannot be replicated yet. Moreover, each replication consumes a great deal of energy, requiring a period of rest and adjustment to recover. And this treasure doesn't just have the forms of a square box and a cat. It should have other transformations…”

Li Ping patted the sleeping kitten, which let out an unconscious mew in response. “Interesting.” “It was worth all my painstaking planning; the fishing pond has finally given me some surprises.” “Since its form when it appeared in the world was a cat statue, I shall call it the [Cat Treasure].”

When the Cat Treasure was first caught, it was merely an ordinary white light mass. But it was clear that a Cat Treasure with the ability to [replicate] could not possibly be of merely white quality. “Although it might be because it was not activated at first. But regardless, it managed to deceive even the Immortal Treasure Fishing Pond.” “The origin of this [Cat Treasure] is very unusual.” “It might even have come from beyond the The Great Barrier…”

Li Ping’s figure flickered, and he returned to the Sacred Emperor’s Throne. “This [Cat Treasure] will be a great help in my struggle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance.”

…

In the Sun family’s secret chamber.

Li Fan, his main body, and his other spiritual manifestations had already learned of the Cat Treasure’s existence. However, in this life, the Cat Treasure could exert its greatest value in the hands of the Sacred Emperor, so there was no rush to exchange it using the anchor point. “Moreover, it is still in its infancy. Its full potential needs further observation.” “Besides man-made magic artifacts, can it replicate Heavenly and Earthly Marvels of the Xuanhuang Realm, or even existences like the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc?” “If it can…” Li Fan pondered, realizing it would at most expedite his collection progress. Wasn't each of his Return to Truths equivalent to a replication of the entire world?

With this thought, Li Fan’s previously restless heart instantly calmed down. His thoughts returned to the Sun family.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters had lifted its lockdown. Sun Luoyao was summoned by the Mirror Controller Fu for a detailed interrogation. However, the seven-colored rainbow light that could escape the Xuanhuang Realm remained under the strictest secrecy protocols. Despite the dual scrutiny of the Heavenly Profound Mirror Core and the Boundless Mirror, nothing was detected.

Li Fan was not in a hurry. There were no leaks that couldn’t be plugged; even the strongest protective measures would eventually fail with the passage of time. All he had to do was wait patiently. Besides, he was not the only one interested in the seven-colored rainbow light within the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Using the Heavenly Profound Mirror, he could constantly monitor the Myriad Immortals Alliance. As long as they somehow discovered this secret, it would mean that Li Fan would know as well.

“Senior, can the method you mentioned to resolve the Devouring Calamity really work?” Sun Luoyao, who had always been deeply intimidated by Li Fan, suddenly asked. “It’s like this.” Before Li Fan could reply, Sun Luoyao quickly explained, “Recently, for some reason, strange images have been flashing through my mind. They are scenes I've never experienced before. After much thought, I believe they are most likely remnants left by that Devouring Calamity…”

At the hint from Li Fan’s spiritual manifestation, Sun Luoyao projected the images he had seen. The images were blurry, flickering rapidly. Li Fan could only see scenes where countless beings instantly turned to dust. And the methods those beings displayed on the brink of life and death… did not seem to be something ordinary cultivators could perform.

“Scenes of the Great Tribulation in the Immortal Realm,” Li Fan mused inwardly, but he did not show any heaviness in his voice. He coldly snorted, “Don’t scare yourself. Do you think you’re experiencing the true Devouring Calamity? It’s merely a remnant after being transmitted through countless channels.” “Rest assured, as long as your brother can find information about the Netherfolk, I have a ninety percent certainty I can help you expel it.” His confident tone immediately put Sun Luoyao at ease. In his eyes, the myriad methods displayed by this mysterious senior were likely not inferior to the legendary True Immortals.

Sun Luoyuan did not keep them waiting for long. Three days later, he quietly returned to the secret chamber. Unlike his previous somber demeanor, he returned this time with unconcealed joy. “Brother, have you found any clues about the Netherfolk?” Sun Luoyao asked. Sun Luoyuan shook his head, "That's still being investigated. I believe there will be clues soon." "Then you..." Sun Luoyuan lowered his voice, unable to hide his excitement. "This time, the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate communicated with the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and in passing, scanned the Alliance Headquarters. He issued relevant directives and made personnel adjustments." "That old fellow Fu, because his strength hasn't improved much over the years, seems to have been specifically criticized by the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate. He is extremely frightened and will be in seclusion for a long time, unable to bother with us." Sun Luoyao was also overjoyed to hear this. "By the way, did the Heavenly Venerate discover the matter of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's human clone during his inspection of the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" Sun Luoyao inquired. "That's unclear. However, from the current situation, it seems no discovery was made." "I have also been monitoring the Heavenly Profound Mirror's human clone, and there have been no abnormalities so far."

Chapter 1222: The Sun Family Welcomes the Sacred Embryo

Sun Luyuan remained silent for a moment, then whispered, "That Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, I plan to personally make contact."

"Hm?" Sun Luyao's eyes widened in surprise. He knew his elder brother intended to engage with the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, but previously, he had planned to send his loyal retainers to scout ahead. "Why the sudden change of heart?"

"Circumstances have changed," Sun Luyuan said with a grave expression. "Who knows how long that old geezer Fu will be in seclusion. I must use this rare period of freedom to make plans for both of us, and for the future of the Sun family."

Sun Luyuan's gaze turned sinister. "Originally, I was somewhat hesitant. But that seven-colored rainbow light that departed from the realm has made me completely give up. In the Myriad Immortals Alliance, we will always be merely tools to be used. Should a great calamity befall the Xuanhuang Realm someday, those Mirror Controllers and Dharma-Preachers will certainly not bring us along when they flee."

"The situation with Great Qi is different. It is said that no accomplishment is greater than following a rising power. By pledging allegiance before they have even established themselves, once they succeed, we will become Dharma-Preachers of Great Qi."

"Of course, ultimately, it depends on the strength of this Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi."

Sun Luyao nodded slightly. "However, this pocket world of Great Qi is exceptionally mysterious, with barely any trace of it even in the Heavenly Profound Mirror. Brother, how will you find them?"

Sun Luyuan smiled mysteriously. "I've invited a friend to help with deduction. While I haven't pinpointed the exact location, I have found the entrance to the pocket world. Once I see it firsthand, I'll know."

"Brother, won't it be dangerous?" Sun Luyao suddenly felt a wave of unease.

Sun Luyuan, however, was full of confidence. "Don't worry, with my strength, even if that Great Qi is a dragon's pool or a tiger's den, I can still retreat unharmed."

After comforting his brother, Sun Luyuan continued, "Oh, right, I have more good news. Ninglu has broken through. She's in the late Soul Transformation stage, and only a step away from Dao Integration."

"When she broke through, her aura was chaotic, which led me to detect another surge of life force hidden within her."

"She was carrying Lu'er's child before, but with some playful thoughts, she'd been sealing it with a secret technique," Sun Luyuan said with a half-smile.

Seeing his brother's somewhat strange look, Sun Luyuan spoke with seriousness. "I've already examined it, and it's undeniably of our Sun family bloodline. No matter what Ninglu's identity might be, as long as she can produce an offspring for our Sun family, it doesn't matter."

"I plan to have Ninglu temporarily seal the vitality of the fetus in her womb. She can give birth after she achieves Dao Integration," Sun Luyuan suddenly added.

"Lu'er's talent is already extraordinary, and Ninglu's aptitude is also quite acceptable. Their offspring will undoubtedly be the most anticipated among the younger generation of the Sun family."

"Cultivators, while absorbing the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, gain insight into the laws of heaven and earth. If the fetus in the mother's womb can synchronize its senses..."

Sun Luyuan's tone was filled with excitement. "Perhaps this little one's talent upon birth will not be inferior to any prodigy in the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Our Sun family will truly have a successor."

"Most importantly, we now have the strength to scheme for a piece of Heavenly and Earthly Essence for him."

When discussing the future of the Sun family, Sun Luyuan seemed to have endless words. His younger brother, Sun Luyao, also rarely sat quietly and listened with a smile.

"What a touching scene of brotherly affection." It wasn't until Sun Luyuan left that the mysterious shadowy elder's cackling laughter startled him awake. Sun Luyao then realized that he had already been forced to do many things for his elder brother.

"That little one from your Sun family... is quite interesting." Li Fan's divine sense suddenly sent a jolt of alarm through Sun Luyao.

"Don't worry, I'm not so desperate as to covet a child's body," Li Fan scoffed. "I have a technique called the Creation Furnace Technique, which can continuously excavate the potential of a physical body. Most importantly, it has no cultivation threshold, and can even be cultivated in the womb. I also have a technique called the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation, which can continuously strengthen one's divine soul through the power of the five elements' mutual generation and restraint..."

Li Fan's divine sense's brief words shook Sun Luyao to his core. "Although the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation requires supreme treasures of the five elements to assist in its cultivation, I believe that with your Sun family's current foundation, it shouldn't be too difficult for you."

"From the congenital fetal stage, tempering one's divine soul and physical body continuously. Furthermore, being able to sense the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao up close through the mother's body. Tch tch... I'm almost looking forward to seeing what kind of monster this little one will be when he's born," Li Fan's divine sense let out a sinister chuckle.

"Esteemed Elder... what are your conditions?" Sun Luyao was clearly tempted. However, he profoundly understood that there was no such thing as a free lunch in this world. He spoke in a deep voice, asking.

"Conditions?" To his surprise, Li Fan's divine sense let out a cold laugh. "Your Sun family is worthy of discussing conditions with me?" "Your entire clan has no more than three Dao Integration cultivators. I can destroy you with a flick of my finger."

Sun Luyao fell silent. "It's merely a whim, an experiment." Li Fan's divine sense's tone was wistful.

Li Fan was not lying. In fact, he knew more about the fetus in Wu Ninglu's womb than the two Sun brothers. Previously, when he was observing the seven-colored rainbow light that departed from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, his divine sense had borrowed Wu Ninglu's body to stealthily venture out and create some puppets. During the time he possessed her, Li Fan discovered that the fetus had faintly sensed his presence, sending him waves of instinctive "expulsion" thoughts. This piqued Li Fan's interest. He had a premonition that if this fetus could be successfully born, its future achievements would be extraordinary. Under normal circumstances, if this fetus were sealed and suppressed by its mother for too long, it would not be easy to survive smoothly. Even if it could barely be born, it would be fated to be congenitally deficient, let alone cultivate. However, with Li Fan's intervention in this world, it would welcome a brand new destiny.

While Li Fan's divine sense was acting as a prenatal tutor, Sun Luyuan had already found the entrance to the pocket world of Great Qi. The Array Breaking Jade Disk in his hand was constantly flashing, about to deduce the flaws in the formation here. This was a treasure he had specifically borrowed from Ji Hongdao. Although it was certainly not as effective as him arriving in person, it should be sufficient to break through ordinary protective formations. To his surprise, the Array Breaking Jade Disk acted as if it was broken, only flashing without yielding any results.

"This shouldn't be happening?" Sun Luyuan was bewildered. Holding the Array Breaking Jade Disk, he changed his position.

"You could have simply announced yourself. How could our Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi refuse anyone at our doorstep?" Just as Sun Luyuan was probing, a voice suddenly sounded in his ear. Sun Luyuan was startled and quickly put away the Array Breaking Jade Disk, warily looking in the direction of the voice.

He saw a rather handsome young man with his arms crossed, looking at him with a half-smile. "Young friend, may I ask who you are?" Although the other party only exuded Nascent Soul aura, the subtle malevolence emanating from him made Sun Luyuan hesitant to underestimate him.

Chapter 1223

The young man with an evil aura chuckled, "Just some nobody. But if you wish to visit our Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, I can introduce you."

Sun Luyuan pondered for a moment, then cupped his fists. "If that's the case, I'll trouble you, young friend."

The young man with an evil aura, who was Ou Shangtian, revealed a meaningful smile.

"Hold on tight."

With a cold shout, his figure instantly closed in and he placed his hand on Sun Luyuan's shoulder.

Sun Luyuan felt his vision blur, and the next moment he found himself in the endless void.

Ou Shangtian was already leading the way, speeding ahead. Sun Luyuan quickly followed.

"This young man's speed is astonishingly fast," Sun Luyuan thought with a jolt.

The seven-colored, brilliant light faintly emanating from around him stirred a sense of greed within him, reminiscent of when he faced the Heavenly and Earthly Essence.

Though he had been confident about this trip earlier, Sun Luyuan's state of mind was now somewhat unsettled. After flying aimlessly in the void for a while, a magnificent scene, as if hidden beneath the surface of water, suddenly appeared.

It was a colossal ball of light, its internal details indiscernible. Numerous stars circled the ball of light, shining brightly. Each star seemed to be a grotto-heaven world.

Even from a great distance, Sun Luyuan was awestruck by the sight before him.

"Is this the Great Qi pocket world?"

"How can a pocket world be this large?!"

As Sun Luyuan's heart churned with shock, he suddenly came to his senses. The young man who had been leading the way had, at some unknown point, vanished!

"Senior Bai Hua, I've caught a Dao Integration cultivator from the Myriad Immortals Alliance. He's acting sneakily, looks like he has ill intentions..."

He vaguely heard the young man's voice, seemingly coming from nowhere.

"Wait!"

Sun Luyuan's heart sank, sensing a bad omen, and he was about to shout an explanation.

The next moment, the scene before his eyes abruptly changed. The magnificent world and grotto-heavens vanished, replaced by a resplendent, pagoda-like palace.

His own body had been shrunk by dozens of times, to the size of an ant.

Each step leading to the palace was like a mountain peak.

The colossal size of everything filled his vision, causing Sun Luyuan to gasp for breath.

What was even more perplexing was that all his cultivation had inexplicably disappeared, leaving him like a complete mortal.

"An illusion?"

Sun Luyuan held his breath, attempting to clear all distracting thoughts from his mind. After a long while, his emotions calmed, and he opened his eyes again. However, the scene before him was still the grand palace, unchanged.

Even... Sun Luyuan was horrified to discover that his body seemed to have shrunk even further.

"This is... a formation?"

The thought flashed through Sun Luyuan's mind, and he quickly took out Ji Hongdao's Array Breaking Jade Disk again. As expected, the Array Breaking Jade Disk emitted a strong white light, flickering incessantly as it autonomously deduced and cracked the formation before him.

Just as Sun Luyuan waited with hope, the flickering frequency of the Array Breaking Jade Disk grew faster and faster. Eventually, as if it could no longer bear it and had reached its limit, cracks appeared on its surface. Then, it exploded with a bang, vanishing without a trace.

Sun Luyuan was stunned. When he borrowed this Array Breaking Jade Disk, Ji Hongdao had not mentioned that such a thing could happen. However, Sun Luyuan quickly reacted. The formation was simply too complex, far beyond what the Array Breaking Jade Disk could handle.

"If that's the case, I can only try to break the formation by brute force."

After waiting for a while longer, no other anomalies occurred within the formation except for his presence. Sun Luyuan took a deep breath, and a dark red phantom drifted out from above his head. The strongest move of a Dao Integration cultivator originated from the Heavenly and Earthly Essence they refined. Sun Luyuan's refined Heavenly and Earthly Essence was named [Blood Shadow].

The moment the Blood Shadow appeared, Sun Luyuan's body seemed to melt, dissolving strangely until only a layer of skin remained. It then fully merged into the blood-colored mass. Like gushing water, it surged upwards, following the towering steps within the formation, moving at a rapid pace.

Where the blood water flowed, the ground seemed to corrode, emitting sizzling sounds and leaving behind scorched marks. But soon, the palace steps were restored. The blood water flowed faster and faster, eventually transforming into a stream of crimson light. No longer needing to climb the stairs, it shot directly towards the highest point of the palace.

However, the palace itself underwent a corresponding change. The steps inexplicably multiplied, extending outward to both sides endlessly. Just as the two were in a stalemate, the rapidly advancing crimson shadow suddenly exploded. It transformed into a rain of blood, using the force of the explosion to disperse. Instead of stubbornly climbing, it fled in different directions within this space. Each drop of blood was like incredibly hot lava, capable of burning even space. Wherever it scattered, the formation space revealed numerous holes. The towering palace scenery began to tremble slightly. The phantom gradually shattered, and Sun Luyuan, transformed into blood water, slowly disappeared through these openings.

"I've escaped!" Sun Luyuan rejoiced inwardly. A killing intent filled his heart as he prepared to seek out the young man with the evil aura who had led him, but the voice that reached his ears struck him as if he had fallen into an ice cave.

"It was actually broken?"

"Now my master will punish me. I spent a good half-year diligently studying it, yet I couldn't even trap a mere Dao Integration cultivator..." The young man's voice, filled with extreme vexation, did not sound feigned.

"What do you mean? That formidable formation just now, was it set up by that young man? Not the defensive formation of this Sacred Dynasty Great Qi?" Sun Luyuan highly suspected he had misheard.

"Studied for half a year, what are you talking about? Could it be that he's still a novice? A formation that even the Array Breaking Jade Disk couldn't find a flaw in after deducing it to its limit, is that his half-year's achievement?" Sun Luyuan was dumbfounded.

"Your formation is actually quite good. It's just that your strength is too low. If he unleashed his blood fire to its fullest, I estimate that even a Dao Integration cultivator from the Xuanhuang Realm couldn't withstand it. It's understandable that your formation couldn't bear it."

"Focus on cultivation. In the Xuanhuang Realm, realm reigns supreme. Strange beasts and abilities, formations, are all merely auxiliary." A gentle female voice sounded beside the young man.

"Understood, Senior Bai Hua." The young man replied with some dejection.

Amidst a dazzling golden light, Sun Luyuan felt himself being locked onto by a gaze. The aura emanating from the other party sent Sun Luyuan into an ice cave.

"This is..."

"A Longevity Realm cultivator?" Sun Luyuan's mind went blank. He never imagined that upon arriving at the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, he would immediately encounter a Longevity Heavenly Venerate.

"Bai Hua? What kind of logic is this? I've never heard of it before?"

"Are you from the Myriad Immortals Alliance? What is your purpose in coming to our Sacred Dynasty?" Daoist Bai Hua asked calmly.

Invisible golden light had already enveloped Sun Luyuan. With a mere thought, she could turn this Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivator into glazed fragments, crushing him with ease. After all, so much Primal Force Essence was not gained for nothing.

Chapter 1224

Under the scrutiny of Hundred Flowers' questioning, Sun Luyuan found himself unable to respond. A dark golden, glazed light swirled around him, exuding a power that surpassed the Dao Integration realm. His spiritual senses screamed warnings, yet he dared not make the slightest move.

"Junior, junior..." Faced with Hundred Flowers' palpable killing intent, Sun Luyuan, usually eloquent, couldn't even utter a complete sentence. The term "Longevity Realm" was simply too distant for cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"Hmph, just as Young Master Tian said. Sneaky and with ill intentions from the start," a cold glint flashed in Daoist Hundred Flowers' eyes. The dark golden radiance encircling Sun Luyuan seemed to possess a life of its own, beginning to corrode him.

"Don't worry, with my strength, even if Great Qi is a dragon's pool or a tiger's den, I can still retreat with my life intact." For some reason, Sun Luyuan's boast to his younger brother before his departure echoed in his mind, filling him with a sense of absurdity.

"Could it be that I'm going to die here?" Just as Sun Luyuan despaired, ready to meet his end, a voice, like heavenly music, halted Daoist Hundred Flowers' actions.

"Bring him to me." Though the tone was calm, it carried an endless majesty. The wicked youth's expression shifted instantly, his mocking demeanor vanishing to be replaced by a respectful bow from afar. Daoist Hundred Flowers also reacted to the voice. The once aggressive glazed light transformed into several ropes, binding Sun Luyuan firmly.

Escorted by the two, Sun Luyuan was taken into the tallest, spire-like palace within Great Qi's pocket world. Inside the grand hall, the atmosphere was spacious and solemn. A figure sat enthroned above, shrouded in mysterious light that obscured their face from Sun Luyuan's view.

"Kneel!" the wicked youth commanded coldly. Sun Luyuan, a Dao Integration cultivator and a high-ranking official in the Law Enforcement Hall, was already at the apex of power within the Alliance, second only to Dharma-Preachers and Mirror Controllers. Yet, before the ruler of this pocket world, he knelt without hesitation, and decisively. One who could command Longevity Realm cultivators was far beyond anything a mere Dao Integration cultivator like himself could contend with.

"Greetings... Sacred Emperor," prompted by the wicked youth, Sun Luyuan stammered.

"Sun Luyuan," the Sacred Emperor spoke, revealing Sun Luyuan's name. With a few concise words, he laid bare Sun Luyuan's entire background, sending a chill through him. However, the Sacred Emperor's next words dispelled his fear and filled him with immense joy: "I already know your intentions. The Sacred Dynasty does not object to those within the Myriad Immortals Alliance who wish to pledge allegiance."

"It is always good to reduce bloodshed," the Sacred Emperor's voice echoed majestically within the palace. "As the first to pledge loyalty to the Sacred Dynasty, you deserve a reward." A cold, clear light emanated from the Sacred Emperor's side, darting towards Sun Luyuan and stopping steadily before him.

"Hiss..." An intense cold washed over Sun Luyuan, frosting his face. He urgently circulated his Spirit Qi to dispel the frigid aura. Peering closer, Sun Luyuan saw that it was a pale blue sword.

"This is the Ten Thousand Year Ice Seal Sword. Its internal cold energy, when activated, can instantly freeze an entire prefecture of the Xuanhuang Realm. While you possess the realm, your combat power is truly weak. You can escape, perhaps, but if you were to truly fight for your life, you might not even defeat a few of my disciples," the Sacred Emperor critiqued. Sun Luyuan dared not retort, merely nodding in agreement.

"This sword is for your self-defense," it was only after the Sacred Emperor spoke these words, under the somewhat displeased gaze of the wicked youth, that Sun Luyuan, as if in a dream, refined and accepted the Ten Thousand Year Ice Seal Sword. "Many thanks for the Sacred Emperor's grace," Sun Luyuan exclaimed in delight.

"Since you have joined our Sacred Dynasty, you must not waver. Tian'er, he is in your care." The wicked youth bowed, "Disciple understands."

"You may both leave," the Sacred Emperor dismissed them calmly. Hundred Flowers transformed into a streak of light and flew away first. Sun Luyuan followed Ouyang Tian, walking slowly behind him.

"You, come with me," Ouyang Tian remarked, sizing up Sun Luyuan with a cold snort.

"How should I address you?" Having received a benefit, Sun Luyuan, unconcerned by Ouyang Tian's attitude, asked with a thick-skinned smile.

"Call me General Ou," Ouyang Tian said without further ado. He first led Sun Luyuan into the Sacred Capital, to the Sacred Heart Palace. This grand hall, only slightly shorter than the Sacred Emperor's throne, gathered tens of thousands of citizens. Old and young alike, their faces were filled with piety as they prayed before a statue in the center of the hall. The statue's features were indistinct, but its form matched the Sacred Emperor Sun Luyuan had just seen. The Sacred Dynasty citizens praying here all possessed cultivation. However, Sun Luyuan's Dao Integration aura, which he had not deliberately concealed, had no effect on them. They gazed steadfastly at the Sacred Emperor's statue, their minds fully immersed. Their spiritual connection seemed to form a vast net, utterly unshakable by the mere might of a Dao Integration cultivator.

Ouyang Tian led Sun Luyuan forward, arriving at a secret chamber within the Sacred Heart Palace. Inside the room, several dozen of the Sacred Emperor's devout followers were kneeling. All of them had reached the Golden Core realm, and their faith in the Sacred Emperor was even more unwavering than those outside. A faceless statue of the Sacred Emperor stood in the chamber.

"You shall also take an oath and pray," Ouyang Tian instructed, transmitting a passage of an oath. Sun Luyuan naturally did not refuse. He knelt before the Sacred Emperor's statue, mimicking the posture of the other believers, and recited the words. As Sun Luyuan did so, he seemed to truly witness the Sacred Emperor's majestic and divine form. What truly startled him was the birth of an intangible force from the void, which gradually attached itself to him, connecting him with the Sacred Emperor. Sun Luyuan felt as if he were an insect caught in a spider's web, no longer struggling but sinking deeper and deeper.

"What kind of technique is this?" Sun Luyuan was horrified. Even Mirror Controllers required secret methods to control their subordinates. To achieve such profound control with just a few simple words was unheard of! But Sun Luyuan knew there was no turning back.

After he finished reciting the oath, Ouyang Tian's attitude improved considerably. Tilting his head as if listening to something, he said to Sun Luyuan, "Within your body, there is a restriction left by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. If you attempt to remove it without authorization, it may alert them. For now, let it remain."

"But rest assured, with the protection of my Master's power, this restriction will not harm you," Ouyang Tian's words reassured Sun Luyuan.

"Since you have joined our Sacred Dynasty, you cannot only receive benefits and do nothing. Here is a list..."

Chapter 1225

Sun Luyuan took the list and was greatly shocked.

Besides the outstanding disciples of the major families in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, there were also many cultivators holding key positions within the alliance.

Some were familiar to Sun Luyuan, but others held secret posts that even he was not fully aware of.

"All the people on this list, you should try to win them over," Ou Shangtian said.

"You don't need to put in too much effort. Just find an excuse, lure them..."

"Bring them over. Upon seeing the magnificent aura of our Sacred Dynasty, they will surely, like you, instantly see the error of their ways!"

"Don't be anxious. Take your time, to avoid revealing any flaws," Ou Shangtian continued.

"Every success will be counted towards your merit. Our Sacred Dynasty's treasury has many good things. Your 'Ice-Sealed Ten Thousand Year Sword' is not considered top-tier."

Ou Shangtian's words stirred Sun Luyuan's heart.

Although the Heavenly Profound Mirror also claimed to exchange anything, it was clear to everyone that true treasures were not obtainable through contribution points alone.

Either the merit level requirement was too high, or there were strict exchange conditions.

A divine sword like the one he held, capable of easily endangering the safety of an entire province, would at most be accessible to core members of institutions like the Martial Training Hall or the Garrison Department in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"Work hard," Ou Shangtian said, patting Sun Luyuan's shoulder with an air of seniority.

"You mustn't make me lose face in front of my master," he added with a meaningful tone.

Sun Luyuan nodded repeatedly.

Not daring to linger in the Sacred Dynasty, Sun Luyuan was soon dismissed.

Upon returning to the Xuanhuang Realm, Sun Luyuan felt as though he had experienced a bizarre dream.

Only the extremely cold sword within his dantian served as a reminder that this was not an illusion.

"Brother, you're back so quickly? How did it go?"

In the Sun family's secret chamber, his younger brother, Sun Luoyao, asked eagerly.

Sun Luyuan did not recount his embarrassing experiences, instead, he took out the Ice-Sealed Ten Thousand Year Sword.

"The foundation of the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty is even stronger than we imagined. They actually have cultivators of the Longevity realm presiding over them. As for the Sacred Emperor's cultivation, it's unfathomable; I couldn't see it at all."

"Such a treasure, and they just gave it away."

"Compared to them, the Myriad Immortals Alliance is truly nothing."

...

As Sun Luoyao listened to his brother's words, he heard a voice in his mind, that of Senior Illusion.

"See? Heh heh."

"Brother, no matter what decision you make, I will always support you," Sun Luoyao declared his stance with a complex expression.

Sun Luyuan, believing his brother was worried about an uncertain future, then comforted him at length.

After Sun Luyuan left the secret chamber, Sun Luoyao could no longer contain himself and asked, "Senior, how much do you know about this Great Qi Sacred Dynasty?"

This mysterious illusory figure had made accurate predictions about Sun Luyuan's trip to the Sacred Dynasty, implying he clearly understood the truth of the Sacred Dynasty.

Li Fan's divine sense, feigning thoughtfulness, pondered for a moment.

Then, in a grave tone, he replied, "Your Sun family's decision is a wise one. That Sacred Emperor of Great Qi possesses strength no less than mine."

"In the Xuanhuang Realm where doctrines are not transmitted, he is an invincible existence."

The implication of these words made Sun Luoyao's heart pound.

Even though he had already speculated about the mysterious illusory figure's strength, hearing it confirmed by him directly was still profoundly shocking.

"Do you know that the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm, like cultivators, has its own desires?"

"This Sacred Emperor might very well be the embodiment of the Xuanhuang Realm's good intentions, seeking to rectify the world that has been altered by the transmission of doctrines."

Upon hearing this, Sun Luoyao's heart trembled again. The embodiment of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao?

Such an origin was truly astonishing.

His thoughts descended into brief chaos. Shortly after, as if remembering something, Sun Luoyao asked, "The embodiment of good intentions? Do you mean that the Xuanhuang Realm also has an embodiment of evil intentions?"

Li Fan's divine sense remained silent, offering no response.

...

At the far end of the distant sea of stars.

Deep within the continuous sea of forgotten remnants, aboard the Mystic Merchant Boat.

Relying on the Spirit-God Harmonious Unity Technique, Zhao Xian's cultivation speed had advanced at an astonishing rate, breaking through the limitations of the Foundation Establishment realm.

He had successfully condensed a Golden Core.

The reverberations of his breakthrough to the Golden Core realm finally disturbed Zhao Xian's master, Zhao Wuji.

Upon discovering Zhao Xian's terrifying speed of progress, Zhao Wuji was not pleased but rather alarmed.

"Master, why?" Zhao Xian asked indignantly.

Zhao Wuji did not report Zhao Xian's successful breakthrough to the Academy. In fact, he actively suppressed and concealed it.

This naturally caused Zhao Xian great dissatisfaction. He felt impulsive enough to reveal everything he had seen in his dreams.

However, having experienced many things in his dreams, he knew that his master was trustworthy.

Taking a deep breath, he suppressed his anger and asked in a deep voice.

"It's too fast, Xian'er. You're cultivating far too quickly. If it were just late-stage Foundation Establishment, it would be fine, but to jump directly to the Golden Core realm..." Zhao Wuji's face was etched with worry.

Under Zhao Xian's persistent questioning, Zhao Wuji finally revealed the matter.

"Like you, true prodigies, though extremely rare in our Academy, have existed in the past. In my day, I had a senior sister."

"She was also exceptionally gifted, cultivating even faster than you, without any process of gradual accumulation. In just three years, she went from Qi Refining straight to the peak of the Golden Core realm."

"Naturally, it caused a stir in the Academy, and then..."

Upon hearing this, Zhao Xian's expression also turned somber.

He had never heard of such a figure existing in the Academy.

"Senior sister was conscripted. From then on, there was no news of her, and her fate is unknown," Zhao Wuji sighed.

"Conscripted? Conscripted where?" Zhao Xian was slightly taken aback.

The Immortal Boat had not seen any true battles for a long time.

He couldn't comprehend the word "conscripted" that his master used.

Zhao Wuji hesitated to speak.

Finally, under Zhao Xian's probing gaze, he first set up a restriction to seal off the area.

Then, he transmitted his voice, "Xian'er, do you know why our Academy of Proving the Dao holds such a distinguished position? Even the Immortal Pivot Department dares not offend us excessively?"

Zhao Xian, recalling what he had learned previously, replied, "Naturally, it's because our Academy of Proving the Dao is the source of cultivation methods for the Immortal Boat."

"Then, why is the Academy referred to as the 'Source of Cultivation Methods'?"

This question from Zhao Wuji indeed stumped Zhao Xian.

"Because our Academy provides the most crucial theoretical support for the Immortal Boat's survival after the great tribulation descended," Zhao Wuji stated seriously.

"The power of True Immortals that caused boundless catastrophe in the past, without absolute talent, ordinary cultivators could not comprehend it. Our Academy..."

"Has the most outstanding scholars in talent on the entire Immortal Boat."

"Talent, on the Immortal Boat, is also an extremely important resource. Regardless of whether these geniuses are willing or not, as soon as it is revealed, they will be tightly controlled."

"Moreover, after being stripped away, they will no longer belong to themselves."

Zhao Wuji's words sent a chill down Zhao Xian's spine.

Chapter 1226: New Methods in the Uttermost Dark Sea

Though Zhao Wuji did not explicitly state the method for stripping away innate talents, judging by the absence of those so-called prodigies from the Immortal Boat Academy in the public eye, their fates were likely grim.

More importantly, Zhao Xian had not encountered anything related to this in his dreams. This caused a flicker of uncontrollable unease in him, who believed he could foresee the future.

However, he was no longer a naive youth. A cold energy surged from his heart, quickly calming him. He thought rapidly, "Indeed, revealing my talent will attract the scrutiny of those in power at the Academy, and I might even lose my life. But crisis often walks hand-in-hand with opportunity."

"This is no longer a time when the Academy can have its way unchecked. The Mysterious Immortal Boat has met with a great upheaval. The Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department are fiercely vying for control of the Immortal Boat's future. I believe even the Academy of Proving the Dao must consider the impact of their struggle on the Immortal Boat's destiny."

"Talent is merely talent. As long as one can survive, there will never be a lack of geniuses."

Zhao Xian felt his thoughts were clearer than ever, as if something was guiding him, sifting through the numerous mixed clues to deduce the correct future.

"If I hesitate, the Immortal Boat will ultimately face destruction. Only by confronting the Immortal Boat's three major powers and seeking life amidst death can I lead the Immortal Boat to find a way to survive."

At this thought, the fear in Zhao Xian's eyes vanished completely. His previously disordered aura once again became steady.

Zhao Wuji looked at his disciple with astonishment, not understanding the change.

Zhao Xian took a deep breath and replied in a deep voice, "A petty man sacrifices himself for profit; a sage sacrifices himself for the world. I have received the Academy's grace, which has led me to where I am today. If my talent is useful to the Academy, then take it! What do I have to begrudge?"

"Conversely, if I were to cultivate in secret using the Academy's resources, would that not be ungrateful?"

These words were spoken with suchrighteousness and moral authority that Zhao Wuji was, for a moment, completely unable to refute him. He looked at the young disciple as if truly seeing him for the first time. Zhao Xian's sincere and resolute gaze even caused Zhao Wuji to feel a pang of shame.

The two faced each other in silence.

Ultimately, Zhao Wuji relented. "Very well. Since you possess such conviction, it makes me appear petty." Zhao Wuji sighed, a look of dejection on his face, and left.

Zhao Xian watched his master's receding back, a complex expression flashing across his face before disappearing.

"Immortal Boat, I must save it."

In his mind, this thought grew ever firmer.

Neither master nor disciple realized that the reason for Zhao Xian's stubbornness was not due to his noble character or unwavering faith. It was purely due to a clone hidden within his sea of consciousness.

"Interesting. I didn't expect the Academy of Proving the Dao to have a method of claiming others' talents as their own. It's worthy of a civilization that managed to survive the Uttermost Dark Sea. Indeed, it has its merits."

"Whether it's the secrets of the Academy of Proving the Dao, or the control over True Immortal Script by the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department, all of it is valuable to me. How could I possibly let this brat Zhao Xian back down? Moreover, with me here, it won't be so easy to harm him."

News of Zhao Xian's rapid breakthrough to the Golden Core stage spread throughout the Academy within three days. The Academy had not seen such a genius in a long time, and it was a time of approaching storms and brewing winds. Thus, with the instigation of certain interested parties, Zhao Xian's reputation quickly spread beyond the Academy, becoming increasingly exaggerated.

From barely breaking through to the Golden Core, he was said to have directly entered the Golden Core stage and perfected it in seven days. Finally, it escalated to the exaggerated claim of being half a step into the Nascent Soul realm. By this point, even those who knew the truth and tried to clarify were ineffective. Outsiders would simply interpret it as the Academy trying to conceal the existence of such an exceptional genius.

The Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department both sent people to inquire about Zhao Xian's background. Internally, the Academy had differing opinions on how to handle this cultivator, who appeared only once in several hundred years.

As the tide of events surged, Zhao Xian cleared his mind of all distractions. He safely hid in a secret chamber specially opened for him by the Academy, accelerating his cultivation as much as possible.

"I don't need to worry about the sufficiency of Spirit Qi. It feels so good. Is this the treatment for true disciples of the Academy?"

"Moreover, until a final decision is made regarding my handling, I can enjoy most of the Academy's resources for free."

His divine sense strength soared, transforming into his cultivation. As his realm improved, it in turn nourished his divine sense, causing it to grow stronger, forming a perfect cycle that allowed Zhao Xian's cultivation speed to reach an unimaginable level. Especially since there were no bottlenecks or hurdles present.

Zhao Xian felt his heart was as solid as a rock. No stray thoughts or inner demons could affect him in the slightest.

"Even in my dreams, I never cultivated this rapidly. Am I truly a genius?"

"Was my previous slow progress simply due to a lack of resources and not finding a suitable cultivation technique?" Zhao Xian couldn't help but ponder.

At this moment, the clone of Li Fan, who had been shielding him from all inner demons, was somewhat overextended. Even with the enhancement of the Immortal Heart Incantation, these prohibitory inner demons were not easy to deal with. The extreme illusory images he experienced, though he could maintain self-awareness, took considerable effort to escape from each time. Notably, the process of confronting inner demons seemed to be recorded, making the next encounter even stronger. It was only a divine sense clone, so some wear and tear was to be expected.

"It's imaginable how difficult it was for cultivators to ascend when the laws of the Uttermost Dark Sea had not yet shattered."

"No wonder the new methods could replace the old ones in the Xuanhuang Realm."

As he thought of this, a sudden idea surfaced in Li Fan's mind. The Uttermost Dark Sea could be seen as a magnified version of the Xuanhuang Realm, with higher law limits. It was merely shattered by the power of the True Immortal Script.

Since the new methods worked in the Xuanhuang Realm, did this mean they could also be practiced normally in this sea of stars?

"The corresponding requirements would need to be amplified to the level of the star sea…"

"Foundation Establishment Oddities, Golden Core methods, Nascent Soul Grotto-heavens, and so on, are all manifestations of world laws. The laws of the Uttermost Dark Sea are shattered, filled with the power of the True Immortal Script."

"Conversely, this True Immortal Script is the current manifestation of the Uttermost Dark Sea's laws."

A flash of inspiration struck Li Fan's mind, as if he had grasped a crucial clue.

"The Immortal Severing Tower cultivating using the True Immortal Script might be operating on the same principle as the new methods in the Xuanhuang Realm."

Chapter 1227: I Enter the True Immortal Path

"Is the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate related to this upstart, the Immortal Severing Tower?"

"What is his purpose in summoning sixteen Dao Integration cultivators to the Sea of Utmost Darkness?"

"Also, when I first arrived in this place, full of remnants' fragments, the cultivator I encountered... was not from the Mystic Immortal Boat. There should be another immortal cultivation civilization here. Is it the Merchant Immortal Boat, or something related to doctrine transmission?"

Li Fan's thoughts were disturbed by the violent energy fluctuations within Zhao Xian.

Above Zhao Xian's head, Spirit Qi formed a vortex and was being frantically channeled into his body.

And at his dantian, cracks appeared on his somewhat purplish Golden Core.

It was as if something was gestating within.

After two months of intense seclusion and cultivation, Zhao Xian broke through to the Nascent Soul realm!

However, this Nascent Soul...

was not the same as the image of a life-filled infant brimming with Dao charm that Li Fan had seen in the ancient texts of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Instead, it was a direct miniature replica of Zhao Xian himself.

It even appeared older than Zhao Xian in person.

Upon close observation, Li Fan discovered that the age manifested by the Nascent Soul seemed to hold a profound mystery.

"Is this predestined fate? Zhao Xian is limited by his innate capabilities from reaching the next realm. In other words, before the age for Nascent Soul manifestation is reached, Zhao Xian cannot break through to the Soul Transformation realm?"

After a long while, Li Fan vaguely formed a conjecture.

"Is this... an alternative bottleneck? I've never heard of anything like it in the records of the Xuanhuang Realm. I just don't know if this predetermined lifespan can be altered."

Zhao Xian, finally emerging from his seclusion, also discovered the abnormality of his Nascent Soul.

The rapid progress had caused his mental state to be slightly unstable, and it took him quite some time to accept this fact.

He privately sought out Zhao Wuji to inquire.

"What? You've formed your Nascent Soul?"

Zhao Wuji was not just shocked this time; he was somewhat terrified.

The Academy had not even concluded its discussion on how to handle Zhao Xian, who was at the Golden Core stage, and he had already reached the Nascent Soul realm!

Wouldn't all their previous discussions be rendered moot?

"How could this be?"

It was only when he saw the slightly aged miniature replica of Zhao Xian that had manifested from his body that Zhao Wuji finally believed him.

"Judging by your situation, you have hope of reaching Soul Transformation within ten years. This..."

Zhao Wuji stared blankly for a while, speechless.

"No, I cannot make this decision. I must directly inform the Palace Master." Zhao Wuji fled as if escaping, his posture appearing quite disheveled.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's clone took the opportunity to temporarily transfer to Zhao Wuji's body.

Zhao Xian would undoubtedly be subjected to strict scrutiny soon.

Li Fan was unsure of the strength of the Palace Master of the Proving Dao Academy, so it was best to avoid the immediate conflict.

Zhao Wuji reached the highest level of the Academy and pushed open the door.

Three white-haired old men were present, all looking at the agitated Zhao Wuji with surprise.

"Zhao Xian has formed his Nascent Soul."

This one sentence caused all three old men's expressions to shift slightly.

Just as Li Fan had anticipated, they could no longer bother with Zhao Wuji, who was trying to relay the message. They flickered and appeared beside Zhao Xian.

When Zhao Wuji saw Zhao Xian again, it was seven days later.

Although recently having formed his Nascent Soul, his aura had already stabilized completely.

"The Palace Master reviewed the recording of when you and I met. Because of my impassioned words, the Palace Master ultimately abandoned the original plan. Instead, she decided to cultivate me in earnest."

"Talented individuals are not rare. But talented individuals who are absolutely loyal are very rare," Zhao Xian said to Zhao Wuji.

Zhao Wuji recalled the events of the past few days and felt a sense of unreality.

"However, Master, what you said was not wrong. If I were still at the Golden Core stage, I would probably have been refined into a Dao Pill by now and swallowed by the Palace Master. Fortunately, I was a step faster and sought survival in the face of death. After all, the Palace Master is almost at her limit in age. The Academy also needs a successor." Zhao Xian transmitted his thoughts to Zhao Wuji.

"This is also the last time I will call you Master."

Zhao Wuji watched Zhao Xian's departing figure, feeling a sense of loss.

Li Fan's clone then transferred to Zhao Xian's body.

As the successor of the Academy, Zhao Xian's treatment underwent a drastic change compared to before.

Not only did he reside in the second highest level of the Academy, but he was also granted access to many secrets that were previously unattainable.

For instance, the true power system of the Mystic Immortal Boat.

A cultivator named [Yu Shuo], one of the three elders of the Academy, personally instructed Zhao Xian.

"Nascent Soul, Soul Transformation, Dao Integration. These realms are merely superficial."

"In the face of the pervasive True Immortal energy scattered across the star sea, they fundamentally have no difference."

"A higher level of power simply means one can survive a little longer."

"Those who are destined to die, will still die."

Seeing Zhao Xian in a state of confusion, his worldview severely impacted, Yu Shuo continued with a smile, "The reason our Proving Dao Academy is qualified to be named [Proving Dao] is that we were the first to find a method to avoid the harm of True Immortal power, and even utilize it."

"We call it the [Path Entering Method]."

"Path Entering Method?" Zhao Xian remained bewildered.

"Legend has it that every True Immortal possesses their own unique [Dao]. The Sea of Utmost Darkness we inhabit is filled with the unique powers of True Immortals. For a mortal body to avoid being influenced by True Immortals, one must enter the Dao with their body." As Yu Shuo spoke, his body underwent a strange transformation.

His face flickered inexplicably.

From an elder with a youthful appearance despite his white hair, he became a child who had not yet lost his childishness. Then, he suddenly became a passionate youth.

Not only his appearance but also his body and aura were constantly changing.

"Once you enter the True Immortal's Dao, you will not only be protected from harm but also largely immune to the power of other True Immortals in the star sea," Yu Shuo said proudly, returning to his original appearance.

"This is also the method adopted by the Immortal Pivot Department and the vast majority of the higher-ranking cultivators in the Immortal Boats."

After some thought, Zhao Xian astutely pointed out the key issue.

"Does the Path Entering Method have any flaws? Did the Immortal Severing Tower find a new way to utilize True Immortal power?"

Yu Shuo nodded, showing a look of approval, as if seeing his student's potential.

"True Immortal power is not something anyone can tamper with. For mortal cultivators to master it, it not only requires significant physical constitution and aptitude but also demands special resources and methods for gradual progress. If ordinary people are exposed to too much at once, it will only lead to death and the annihilation of their Dao."

"Elder Yu, do you mean the remnants of world-destroying artifacts?" Zhao Xian asked, suddenly recalling something.

"Indeed. And only remnants where the True Immortal's residual power is about to dissipate, making it the weakest, are the most effective."

"The reason the Immortal Severing Tower can contend with the Immortal Pivot Department in such a short time is said to be that they have found a method to absorb these world-destroying remnants harmlessly and perfectly," Yu Shuo said, his tone laced with disbelief.

Chapter 1228

"I've also met the cultivator from Severed Immortal Tower who, according to rumors, attained the Dao using the New Law. It's said he achieved his Dao in just three years, and his control over True Immortal power is no less than mine," Yu Shuo said with an unreadable tone.

"If that's the case, why do you seem to still have many doubts, Elder Yu?"

"Because all the cultivators at Severed Immortal Tower who are currently said to have [Attained the Dao] and have publicly revealed themselves, all control the same type of True Immortal power," Yu Shuo said, his voice tinged with a hint of melancholy.

"What does that prove?" Zhao Xian felt somewhat confused.

Yu Shuo glanced at Zhao Xian, his expression unreadable. After a long silence, he spoke very calmly, "Zhao Xian, you must remember. When dealing with True Immortal power, never let your guard down."

"The deeper you attain the Dao, the more dangerous you become yourself."

Yu Shuo did not explain directly, but uttered this seemingly unrelated statement.

"That's all for today's lesson. Next time, it will be Nangong's turn," Yu Shuo's figure, along with his voice, vanished.

Zhao Xian remained rooted to the spot, pondering Yu Shuo's last sentence.

A flash of inspiration struck him, and he instantly grasped the implication behind it.

"True Immortal power is like a net. While one can use the True Immortal net to call upon True Immortal power, the result is only to become more deeply entangled..."

Zhao Xian, having suddenly understood this principle, felt a chill that was like being doused with a basin of cold water in winter, making him shiver all over.

"If this is truly the case, then is our Proving Dao Academy, and even the entire Mystic Immortal Boat, already..."

But soon, Zhao Xian let out a bitter smile.

"We have no choice but to do this for survival. After all, survival is the foremost duty the Immortal Boat must maintain. Moreover, we have been wandering the sea of stars for so many years, only seeing the residual power of True Immortals, never their true forms. There are indeed risks, but for now, they can be disregarded."

At the same time, Zhao Xian also understood the peculiarity of Severed Immortal Tower that Yu Shuo mentioned.

In the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, various residual powers of True Immortals were mixed.

If they had truly mastered a method to harmlessly and perfectly absorb the remnants of broken worlds, then the manifestations of the Dao attained by the cultivators at Severed Immortal Tower should have displayed various different states.

After all, each person could only adapt to a different residual True Immortal power.

In the Utmost Darkness Star Sea, there were no less than five types of True Immortal power known to the Immortal Boat. The three top-ranked disciples of the Proving Dao Academy each had different paths of Dao attainment.

Yet, among the six Dao-attuned cultivators who had appeared at Severed Immortal Tower, the power they displayed was all the same.

This probability existed, but it was very small.

"Either the technique they mastered is only effective against a single type of True Immortal power."

"Or it's..."

A chill ran down Zhao Xian's spine, and he dared not think further.

His current mission from the Academy was to first stabilize his Nascent Soul cultivation, and then attempt to break through to the Soul Transformation realm.

Once he successfully reached the Soul Transformation realm, he would then begin to slowly try to [Attain the Dao].

"Attaining the Dao cannot be too early, nor can it be too late."

"If one comes into contact with True Immortal power too early, their frail divine soul and will would be almost incapable of resisting the immense and unparalleled power of a True Immortal. There's a high chance of directly transforming into a mad, deformed monster."

"And if it's too late..."

"The traditional Dao Integration realm, upon merging with the remnant Heavenly Dao laws of this star sea, will create intense repulsion with the Dao of True Immortals. The difficulty of [Attaining the Dao] would increase by more than severalfold."

These were the teachings of Nangong Lie, the Palace Master of the Proving Dao Academy, echoing in Zhao Xian's mind. "The Academy will not unduly pressure us for now. The urgent task is to improve your own strength as quickly as possible."

"Although the Infant Trapping Tribulation showed I won't break through until after fifty, the Palace Master said that the limitations of this shattered Heavenly Dao of the fragmented star sea are not absolute. With the Academy's foundation and the accumulations from my dreams, it's not difficult to defy fate and change destiny."

Zhao Xian was very confident about this.

In truth, many details of the future dream Zhao Xian had experienced initially had already diverged significantly from reality. Under normal circumstances, if Zhao Xian had been more meticulous, he should have noticed the irregularities long ago.

However, under the constant unseen influence of a certain entity, Zhao Xian had, consciously or unconsciously, overlooked these inconsistencies.

Let alone a mere Nascent Soul cultivator, even the three top-ranked disciples of the Proving Dao Academy on the Mystic Immortal Boat were likely no match for Li Fan's skill in manipulating people's hearts.

At this moment, Li Fan's spiritual manifestation was using Zhao Xian's privileges to extensively browse through the hidden knowledge of the Proving Dao Academy.

All records related to True Immortal power were hidden and inaccessible.

However, there was not much concealment regarding the history of the Mystic Immortal Boat.

It was consistent with what he had learned before: the Mystic Immortal Boat had indeed split from the original Immortal Boat, the [Mystic Merchant].

More detailed, however, was that the primary cause of the internal strife within the Immortal Boat was an outsider.

Despite being an outsider, this individual quickly gained the trust of more than half of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants.

They were even instigated to attempt crossing the invisible The Great Barrier that sealed off the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

At a critical juncture, an Immortal Boat cultivator named Cai Zhengjun, who later became the first Head of the Mystic Immortal Boat's Immortal Pivot Department, led a group to stop this suicidal behavior.

However, this ultimately led to conflict between the two factions, and the Immortal Boat broke apart.

Regarding that outsider, there were only a few brief mentions. Their true identity was already a mystery.

The Proving Dao Academy, however, had many detailed descriptions of the situation in the Utmost Darkness Star Sea.

In addition to the spatiotemporal charts recorded during the Mystic Immortal Boat's drift and escape over the years, the Immortal Boat had unique interpretations of the Sea of Remnants and the High Wall.

"Deeper within the Sea of Remnants, near the location of the invisible High Wall, lies the graveyard of worlds and the burial ground of the star sea. The terrifying suction force from the center of the star sea spans across the entire sea, only to be blocked by the High Wall. Over time, combined with the influence of the Wall's mysterious power, this suction force, like tides, becomes fixed, forming a reverse force field."

"The closer one gets to the High Wall, the stronger the suction force becomes. After dozens of expeditions, all ending in failure, the Immortal Boat has currently abandoned any further attempts to explore this area."

...

Li Fan was overjoyed to have unexpectedly found this report.

Perhaps due to its unique location, the Mystic Immortal Boat's understanding of the Utmost Darkness Star Sea's entirety was far superior to that of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Below the High Wall, tides locked, fragments of worlds?"

Li Fan's mind conjured an image of a desolate, lifeless scene with an endless expanse of broken worlds stretching across the horizon.

"If that's the case, then what I previously thought to be a existence comparable to the Immortal Ruins' suction force in the depths of the star sea was merely the reflection of the High Wall's suction force on the Utmost Darkness Star Sea?"

Although slightly disappointed, Li Fan was paradoxically relieved.

After all, as long as it wasn't another True Immortal, then everything was manageable.

"The invisible High Wall could completely block the power of the [Starvation] script and even cause it to converge in reverse."

"What kind of incredible and unfathomable power is this?"

Chapter 1229: All Prodigies Reach Golden Core

Li Fan had personally witnessed the true power of the The Hunger Seal in the Immortal Ruins. Thus, a sense of awe naturally arose in his heart towards the towering wall that could firmly contain the suction of the Star Sea. This was followed by an uncontrollable curiosity.
