“It’s a pity that the exploration of the other side of the Star Sea by the Mystic Immortal Boat ceased over two thousand years ago. With the passage of time and shifts in space, the maps recorded back then can only serve as references for me; they hold little practical value now.”

Li Fan then recalled the great upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm not long ago. “It seems the primary areas where the Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians frequent the Star Sea are around where the graveyard of world fragments is located.”

“Beneath the giant wall, something must have gone wrong. The normally stable tidal suction actually erupted inwards towards the darkest depths of the Star Sea.” Li Fan’s mind raced with possibilities. “The Doctrine Transmitter could notify the Myriad Immortals Alliance beforehand, indicating that this matter is undoubtedly connected to them. And the fact that they summoned sixteen Dao Integration cultivators here is very likely related to this as well.”

At this thought, Li Fan’s heart stirred. “If I wait here patiently, I might actually be able to catch that Seven-Colored Rainbow Light.”

“Based on the time it took me to traverse the Star Sea previously and calculating the flight speed of the Seven-Colored Rainbow Light…”

“If I truly encounter it, it will be within these few days.”

...

Having finished reading the most important sections, Li Fan began to organize his other significant gains. Not only could they help the Great Qi Dynasty’s uprising proceed more smoothly in this world, but they would also be of great assistance to Li Fan’s future reincarnations.

Among these, what was most important to Li Fan was the refinement of the Dao Pill. During the challenging early years after the Immortal Boat split, the Mystic Immortal Boat cultivators, facing extreme scarcity of resources, accumulated considerable experience in cannibalism. The prototype of the Dao Pill originated from that period. With limited resources, maximizing absorption efficiency became the most valued aspect for the Mystic Immortal Boat cultivators at that time.

The Dao Pill, a secret art of refining cultivators into pills, was a culmination of experience from the dark period of the Immortal Boat's history. It not only involved refining the memories and souls of other cultivators to make them one’s own, but even innate talent, temperament, and innate divine abilities could be integrated into oneself!

Of course, side effects were unavoidable. The stronger the raw material used to refine the Dao Pill, the more pronounced the side effects. If one’s own strength was insufficient and they forcefully consumed it, they might be unable to absorb its benefits and could suffer a backlash, becoming a neither-human-nor-ghost. In their madness, they would become unrecognizable, engaging in widespread slaughter.

Therefore, after the Mystic Immortal Boat gradually stabilized, this Dao Pill secret art became one of the Immortal Boat's forbidden techniques, known only to its innermost circle.

“It’s quite complicated,” Li Fan mused, thoroughly studying the entire refining process with a slight frown. The root of this secret art was still alchemy, which was not Li Fan’s forte. However, his formation mastery was already divine. The Dissolution Disc synchronized, analyzing, dissecting, and transforming each step into corresponding formations.

“As long as this formation is set up, the automatic refinement of Dao Pills can be achieved. It’s effortless and saves energy.”

“Although I don’t care much about innate divine abilities anymore, I have still mastered another special method. It’s also very effective for intimidating those so-called prodigies.”

“The only concern is whether this method will be effective in the Xuanhuang Realm.” The two ends of the Star Sea not only had different time flows, but the Mystic Immortal Boat was exposed to the chaotic and disordered darkest Star Sea, without the protection of world power. Li Fan couldn't be sure if the rules here would be the same as in the Xuanhuang Realm.

“If there’s an opportunity, I’ll try it and see.”

Apart from the Dao Pill, the only other thing that caught Li Fan’s attention was a method of communication that could minimize interference from the residual True Immortal power in the Star Sea. It was created by the second head of the Immortal Pivot Department and was named [Boundless]. Its principle was to generate a force with "resistance" properties against True Immortal remnants, based on the remaining Heavenly Dao attributes in the Star Sea. However, its drawbacks were also obvious. It required knowing the precise space-time coordinates of the target, and due to the pervasive suction of the darkest Star Sea, communication could often only be one-way, following the direction of the suction.

The Mystic Immortal Boat had almost no records of other survivors in the darkest Star Sea, so this Boundless communication method was not taken seriously. But to Li Fan, it could serve a different purpose.

Outside the Mystic Immortal Boat, in the Sea of Remnants, Li Fan, who was comprehending the Heavenly Dao of the darkest Star Sea in his Sacred Embryo form, suddenly opened his eyes. A hint of amusement flashed in his gaze as he immediately projected a silver ray towards the direction of the Xuanhuang Realm, which he had sensed.

“If cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm receive this message, their reactions should be quite interesting.” However, this was merely a whim of Li Fan’s at the moment. The Mystic Immortal Boat was too far from the Xuanhuang Realm and was too close to the Immortal Ruins. Li Fan was not at all confident that this Boundless transmission would successfully reach the Xuanhuang Realm. He was doing it just for fun.

The Sacred Embryo had reaped significant rewards from the Mystic Immortal Boat; after all, it was the accumulation of a civilization. Even if it wasn’t the absolute top-tier content, it was still incredibly valuable to Li Fan.

Shifting the perspective back to the Xuanhuang Realm, since returning with the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, Sun Luyuan had been extraordinarily busy. Although he hadn't visited all the prodigies on his list, he had, through his connections, investigated their general situations. Even though Ou Shangtian hadn't urged him about the matter of subversion, Sun Luyuan deeply understood that this was his first task after joining the Great Qi. He had to not only succeed but also do it brilliantly, flawlessly, and in a way that earned him praise.

After careful selection, Sun Luyuan quickly decided on the sacrificial object for his merit: the renowned Azure Void Fairy of the Myriad Immortals Alliance! The Azure Void Fairy was also at the Dao Integration realm. However, in the eyes of ordinary cultivators in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Azure Void was far more important than Sun Luyuan. This was not only because Azure Void herself was stunningly beautiful and acclaimed throughout the Myriad Immortals Alliance but also due to her accompanying Oddity, the Yin-Yang Jade.

Through the method of dual cultivation, the Azure Void Fairy could merge the sun-half of the Yin-Yang Jade with her Dao companion, thereby elevating her Dao companion's Foundation Establishment Oddity, Golden Core, Nascent Soul Grotto-heaven, and even their destined mutations. This was enough to elevate a mediocre individual to the status of a prodigy and further propel an exceptional prodigy to become an unparalleled existence that would shake the Xuanhuang Realm through the ages!

As early as the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty's return, Sun Luyuan had heard that several of the Great Qi Sacred Emperor's disciples currently had no Dao companions. If he could trick Azure Void over and arrange a marriage, it would not only make future subversion efforts easier by leveraging Azure Void's reputation but also bestow favor upon the Sacred Emperor's disciples. Wasn't this killing two birds with one stone? Sun Luyuan squinted, a plan already forming in his mind.

Chapter 1230

Azure Void Fairy, renowned for her unparalleled beauty, garnered numerous admirers within the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The extraordinary efficacy of the Yin-Yang Jade was enough to drive all cultivators in the world to madness.

Beyond her unique nature, Azure Void seemed to possess a hidden background. Whispers circulated among the higher echelons of the Alliance, suggesting that Azure Void was a treasured possession of a certain Doctrine Transmitter. Not only did she originate from a pocket world exclusively for Dharma-Preachers, but even the half of Heaven's Oddity within her was allegedly implanted, all for a future harvest.

As the saying goes, where there is smoke, there is fire. These rumors were not without basis. Azure Void’s Heavenly and Earthly Essence, "Azure Hue," which she used for Dao Integration, was one of the cultivation reserves nurtured by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. She had inexplicably used it for her breakthrough, yet the Alliance remained silent on the matter.

Furthermore, over thirty years ago, a cultivator surnamed Qin, newly ascended to Dao Integration, was smitten by Azure Void. His persistent pursuit proved futile, leading him to resort to a scheme of treachery to possess her forcefully. The outcome was not only his own demise but also the complete disappearance of his once-prominent Qin family, vanishing from existence.

Sun Luyuan felt no fear despite Azure Void's potentially special identity. Instead, his resolve to select her as a sacrifice was strengthened. He approached his brother, Sun Luyao, seeking to utilize the power of the Heavenly Profound Mirror to pinpoint her current location.

"Brother, aren't you afraid of…?" Sun Luyao questioned, some confusion in his voice.

"The current Myriad Immortals Alliance is completely unaware of the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi. I am merely inviting the world-famous Azure Void Fairy to a small pocket world with picturesque scenery within the Alliance's territory for a visit. What problem could that cause?" Sun Luyuan chuckled.

"A figure like Azure Void Fairy would never face mortal danger within the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi. You can rest assured about this."

Sun Luyuan harbored ulterior motives, which he did not disclose to his brother. In addition to appeasing the Sacred Dynasty, he intended to use the influence behind Azure Void Fairy to test the strength of Great Qi. While his previous visit to Great Qi had revealed the Sacred Dynasty’s power, a true test of strength was still needed.

"If I cannot even deal with one Doctrine Transmitter, how can I contend with the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" Sun Luyuan mused inwardly. He was unaware that his every action was being observed by the Sacred Emperor of Great Qi. His self-perceived secrecy was futile against Li Fan, who had experienced countless cycles of reincarnation.

"Azure Void Fairy." A surpassingly beautiful face materialized in Sacred Emperor Li Ping's mind. "Very well. My disciples are indeed of a certain age. If they can bear more prodigies for our Great Qi, it would be a joyous occasion." As for the power behind Azure Void, Li Ping did not particularly care. However, Sun Luyuan’s self-clever maneuvering earned him a special mark from Li Ping. "Today's actions will all be repaid." This minor matter was merely one of countless fleeting images that flashed through the mind of the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated upon his throne. It stirred no ripple in his heart.

Li Ping's primary focus was currently on the "Nether Realm" and the derivation of new techniques. Since dispatching a portion of the Netherfolk to fill the energy void in the Sea of Darkness, Li Ping felt an increasingly profound Heavenly Mandate from Azure Nether. Not long after assisting True Yang in achieving Dao Integration, the Heavenly and Earthly power he could influence and utilize was dozens of times greater than before. With greater control, a certain inexplicable urgency from Azure Nether's Heavenly Dao began to appear more frequently in Li Ping's mind. As the linchpin for the future of Great Qi's countless citizens, Li Ping would not act rashly.

Images from his Heavenly Dao perception flashed before his eyes: a desolate Gobi landscape, a vast expanse of grayness. In the center stood a towering stone mountain that seemed to connect heaven and earth. An old man sat atop the mountain, a coffin behind him. Though merely a perceived image, Li Ping could sense a decaying, malevolent aura emanating from the coffin, causing him a slight discomfort. “The sealed malevolent intent of the Xuanhuang Realm,” Li Ping understood the reason for Azure Nether's Heavenly Dao's incessant urging. A part of itself was sealed, severely weakening its power. After the Great Tribulation of "Incompatibility of Laws" thousands of years ago, it had been unable to unleash any means against cultivators. If this lost power could be recovered, perhaps the situation could turn around.

But… even across unimaginable distances, Li Ping seemed to sense the disquieting presence beneath the coffin lid. “If this malevolent intent is allowed to return, having been sealed and suppressed by cultivators for so many years, Azure Nether's Heavenly Dao will undoubtedly undergo extreme changes. This may not necessarily be a good thing for human cultivators, nor for the Xuanhuang Realm itself.” “However, replenishing the power of Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao is indeed a worthwhile endeavor.” Within moments, Sacred Emperor Li Ping made his decision. He would absorb this malevolent intent himself. Once he had reshaped the universe and returned to Azure Nether's Heavenly Dao, this power would naturally return to the Xuanhuang Realm. Before that, having this power in his hands was no different from it being in the hands of Azure Nether's Heavenly Dao.

Given Li Ping’s current strength, taming the Azure Nether malevolent intent carried some risk, especially considering the cultivator named Xu Ke guarding it could not be perceived as an ordinary individual. Therefore, Li Ping would not act rashly without complete preparation. He simply ignored Azure Nether's urging. When dealing with the power of a world, there was a worthy example within the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi: Senior Yin. As an incarnated remnant soul from another cultivation world, Senior Yin possessed extensive experience in battling world consciousness. However, there seemed to be some taboo involved. Li Ping’s several inquiries were met with rare silence and no response from Senior Yin. Fortunately, Li Ping was engrossed in researching potential breakthroughs for the new technique, so he did not press the matter. “The will of the world…” Without Senior Yin's assistance, Li Ping could only rely on himself to find a solution. In his memories, the Xuanhuang Realm still contained many remnants from other cultivation worlds that preserved their own consciousness. Perhaps by contacting them, he could gain something.

With this thought, Li Ping's figure flickered, and he arrived outside the entrance to Great Qi’s pocket world, the Cloudy Sea. His first sight was of the nascent Heavenly and Earthly Essence, Scarlet Flame, about to be born. As if sensing Li Ping's presence, the Scarlet Flame, still in its formative stage, conveyed a sense of confusion. Li Ping did not interfere with the progress of Scarlet Flame Burning Sea. He knew this was an indispensable process for remnants from other worlds to truly integrate into the Xuanhuang Realm.

Chapter 1231

Li Ping stood still, sensing the vast ocean beneath his feet and its unyielding will. Faced with a life-or-death crisis, any being would struggle with all its might. Li Ping also felt the ocean's fervent desire for survival. However, its survival was, in plain terms, "malice" to the Xuanhuang Realm. As Li Ping considered himself an avatar of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, he could not possibly side with the Cloudy Sea.

"Since you've come, surrender obediently," Li Ping's thought echoed. "There's no need for further pointless struggles." In an instant, his divine sense enveloped the entire Cloudy Sea Ocean. The scenes of tens of thousands of islands scattered throughout, along with the countless living beings residing within the sea, instantly appeared in Li Ping's mind.

Li Ping remained silent for a moment. "This is a necessary sacrifice." A resolute glint flashed in his eyes as threads of golden light emerged from him and dispersed into every corner of the Cloudy Sea. The power, approaching the essence of primal force, was undetectable by anyone in the Cloudy Sea, where the strongest cultivators were only at the Soul Transformation realm. In just a few breaths, the golden light permeated all regions of the Cloudy Sea, plunging deep into the ocean and reaching the seabed.

Beneath the Cloudy Sea, an unknown and violent tremor began to occur. If viewed from the sky, the entire ocean's surface would appear as if a giant net had formed, encapsulating this sea of blue vitality. Suddenly, dark clouds gathered in the sky. The previously calm sea surface erupted with fierce waves, even more violent than those during previous wind disasters. Some islands were capsized unexpectedly, while spiritual islands inhabited by cultivators were precariously perched amidst the storm.

Cultivators in the Cloudy Sea watched the changes in the heavens and earth with startled confusion. Those with keen spiritual senses felt a premonition of impending disaster and their expressions changed. Disregarding everything else, they immediately used the teleportation arrays on Myriad Immortals Island to flee the scene. Their actions caught the attention of a considerable number of people, and a small portion of cultivators chose to follow them. However, the vast majority scorned these "skittish and timid cowards," feeling completely at ease on Myriad Immortals Island as they watched the dramatic shifts in the Cloudy Sea's heavens and earth.

Li Ping paid no mind to the fleeing cultivators, nor did he concern himself with those who were merely observing. His target, from beginning to end, was solely the residual will of the Cloudy Sea. The golden giant net, invisible to ordinary cultivators, had sealed off the Cloudy Sea. The energy of the primal force essence accumulated and evolved within it, and a great formation was about to reveal its magnificence. The consciousness of the Cloudy Sea clearly felt the tightening grip of the golden giant net, and the induced waves grew more violent. To Li Ping, however, it was merely futile rage.

"How to annihilate a world's consciousness?" Li Ping mused as he constructed the formation. "I shall refine gods from all beings." He quickly conceived of this ultimate, malevolent formation. "A formation that can even obstruct True Immortals should be able to deal with a residual world consciousness without much issue."

"Countless meaningless distractions to assault..." As Li Ping laid out the formation, various strange visions began to appear inexplicably in the sky above the Cloudy Sea. They were distorted, despairing faces, wailing and flailing their arms, as if crying for help, or perhaps just involuntary screams of agony. More and more bizarre visages appeared on the sky, densely packed, filling nearly every corner of the field of vision. In the ears of the beings within the Cloudy Sea, only the howling of these demonic faces could be heard, nothing else.

"Ah!" Those with weak wills were quickly affected by these demonic faces, becoming equally despairing and insane. Those who managed to hold on soon fell into endless, terrifying nightmares. They vaguely perceived a black sun rising in the sky, a vision of utter destruction and overwhelming terror. Just like the despairing faces in the sky, they collectively experienced this unimaginable calamity.

The teleportation arrays on Myriad Immortals Island remained active. However, all cultivators who witnessed the myriad faces in the sky lost the ability to control their thoughts. Regardless of their cultivation level, from Qi Refining novices to the Island Lords at the Soul Transformation realm, all were affected. Despite their minds being filled with boundless despair, they could not muster the thought of escaping. It was important to remember that Li Ping's formation was not targeting them, the cultivators. To be merely caught in the repercussions led to such a state; one could imagine the brutal scene faced by the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea. The residual world consciousness of an entire province was simply incapable of resisting it. Amidst the continuous screams of billions of demonic faces, Li Ping felt the will of the Cloudy Sea dissipating. The towering waves gradually subsided, as if everything was passing and the sky would clear. But Li Ping knew that the Cloudy Sea, from this point forward, would never be the same.

The process of annihilating the Cloudy Sea's consciousness lasted for a full day. During this time, any cultivator who entered the Cloudy Sea's range was affected and plunged into terrifying illusions. However, as no large-scale loss of life occurred, the Myriad Immortals Alliance had not yet had time to react. The dark clouds in the sky dispersed, and the Cloudy Sea turned a clear, azure blue. It was eerily quiet.

Li Ping sensed the scattered will of the Cloudy Sea throughout the heavens and earth. The golden giant net slowly retracted, gathering the fragmented residual world will of the Cloudy Sea, now torn into myriad pieces, and drawing it back into himself. "Urk..." As Li Ping absorbed the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea, countless scenes began to flash through his mind. Even though he was accustomed to constantly monitoring every event within the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, the sheer volume of information between the two was on completely different scales.

In the vast ocean, humans were not the only existing beings. Beneath the calm surface, countless lives teemed with vitality. From Li Ping's subjective perspective, he would certainly not pay much attention to these creatures that lacked intelligence. However, at this moment, he was passively absorbing it. In the worldview of the world's will, these fish were no different from human cultivators. Li Ping endured the searing pain in his sea of consciousness and accepted all the information. It was as if he had consumed a great tonic, and the strength of his divine soul expanded like a balloon. Li Ping's divine soul was already quite resilient among cultivators, but during this rapid expansion, unavoidable cracks appeared. An ordinary cultivator facing such a situation would only face despair and await their soul's dissipation. But Li Ping was different. Possessing the Heavenly Emperor's Qi Codex, he not only used the billions of citizens of the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi as anchor points but also had the essence of primal force, which transcended the mundane, within him. Golden energy surged, mending the wounds in his divine soul while also serving as a supplement for its expansion. After the initial dangerous phase passed, Li Ping gradually adapted.

Chapter 1232

The pain ceased, followed by the rapid expansion of his divine soul.

The will of a world, even a remnant of a single province, was an absolute great supplement for a cultivator.

In the past, when Emperor Li Ping supervised and monitored numerous affairs within the Great Qi Dynasty, he still perceived and handled myriad trivial matters from a human perspective. But from now on, having absorbed the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea, Li Ping might also be able to survey every detail within the Sacred Dynasty from the overarching viewpoint of "the world itself."

After the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea perished, there was no wind for seven days.

Li Ping remained standing between the sea and the sky, waiting for the fusion to complete.

Even without deliberate effort, Li Ping, who had devoured the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea, could easily sense everything happening within it.

He saw that the cultivators, affected by the demonic faces, had overwhelmingly failed to recover from their madness after his divine abilities had subsided. After this calamity, not even one in a hundred cultivators remained normal.

He saw the Earthly Essence, Scarlet Flame, gathering in the sky. Due to the demise of the Cloudy Sea's consciousness, there was no longer a need for it to descend and burn the sea. The condensed power of laws silently dissipated.

He saw that in the center of the Cloudy Sea, the Cloud Water Heavenly Palace, whose restrictions had previously loosened and was about to reappear from its seal, flickered with a mysterious blue radiance before falling silent once more.

He also saw that the anomaly in the Cloudy Sea had attracted the attention of certain existences within the Xuanhuang Realm. Several colossal divine senses instantly descended and swept across the ocean. However, Li Ping now replaced the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea, perfectly integrated with the heavens and earth. The combined concealment of his formation and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao prevented Li Ping from being discovered.

...

Although he had managed to conceal himself for the moment, Li Ping's vague sense of crisis did not disappear.

"It seems this is no place to linger," Li Ping thought to himself, having completely absorbed and digested the consciousness of the Cloudy Sea.

However, before returning to the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, he had one more thing to do.

His figure flickered, and Li Ping instantly arrived at the seabed near the Cloudy Sea and Flowing Cloud Island.

Within a deep crevice on the seabed, a peculiar vortex existed.

In the center of the vortex, a pale blue bead emitted a faint glow.

"Azure Sea Pearl."

As part of the Cloudy Sea's consciousness's attempt to hedge its bets, the Azure Sea Pearl was the last path of survival it had prepared for itself.

Li Ping reached out, and the pale blue bead flew out of the seabed vortex, landing in his palm.

"Since it has already become part of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, let's completely sever its connection."

Golden energy enveloped the Azure Sea Pearl, and then he forcefully infused it.

When the light dissipated, the bead in Li Ping's hand had changed from pale blue to a deep azure.

However, it had lost its previous vivacity.

Li Ping had completely erased the last trace of the Cloudy Sea's faint will within the Azure Sea Pearl.

"From now on, the Azure Sea Pearl is just an Azure Sea Pearl, with no connection to the Cloudy Sea."

Li Ping did not put the bead away. Instead, he flicked his finger, randomly sending it flying towards a corner of the Cloudy Sea, awaiting a predestined person.

Having done all this, Li Ping finally left the ocean.

All the cultivators in this province had become imbeciles.

When the Myriad Immortals Alliance finally detected the anomaly in the Cloudy Sea, they were utterly enraged.

While they dispatched people to investigate, dealing with these dangerous, deranged cultivators became a difficult problem.

Finally, five Dao Integration cultivators joined forces to barely clean up the chaos in the Cloudy Sea.

Among these five was Sun Luyuan, the patriarch of the Sun family.

Previously, he had tried every method and finally contacted the Azure Void Fairy.

Sun Luyuan had thoroughly investigated the Azure Void Fairy's background. He knew she was simple-natured, quick to show her emotions, and very curious about novel things. Therefore, Sun Luyuan concocted a half-truthful, half-false story.

"I heard before that you once turned an ungrateful male cultivator into a dog and tormented him day and night?"

"That scene was truly unbearable to witness. Coincidentally, when I was traveling in a small world before, I encountered a similar scene. It also involved transforming criminals into monstrous beasts as a means of punishment..."

Sun Luyuan recounted some of his experiences in the Great Qi Dynasty.

"The emperor of this small world has the same idea as me? Interesting."

"And judging by your description, this small world's level of development is not ordinary..."

After a few casual mentions, the Azure Void Fairy was indeed intrigued.

She agreed to visit and explore with some other acquaintances from the Alliance if the opportunity arose in the future.

Seeing that his plan had succeeded, Sun Luyuan was overjoyed.

He even considered using the Azure Void Fairy's reputation to trick more outstanding talents from the Myriad Immortals Alliance this time.

Unexpectedly, before the plan could be implemented, a tragedy struck the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The deception plan had to be temporarily halted.

Originally, this mess in the Cloudy Sea had nothing to do with him.

However, Xu Yuanxian, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall, privately gave him a mission.

This forced Sun Luyuan to undertake the arduous journey.

"Clear Wind Hall. So this is it."

After subduing and rounding up all the deranged cultivators who attacked anyone they saw, Sun Luyuan entered this building on Myriad Immortals Island.

He did not sense any living beings inside.

When Sun Luyuan truly walked in and saw the state of the interior, his pupils suddenly constricted.

An old man lying on a wooden chair was entwined and fixed to the ground by tree root-like growths all over his body.

The old man was not completely dead, with a sliver of breath remaining. But in Sun Luyuan's eyes, he was no different from a dead person.

It was as if his divine soul had been completely devoured by these strange roots, leaving only an empty shell.

"This is the guardian Elder Xu spoke of from Clear Wind Hall. He had Nascent Soul cultivation, and he died so inexplicably."

Sun Luyuan shook his head slightly.

He moved his gaze away from the old man and scanned the interior of Clear Wind Hall.

Moments later, he discovered a hidden entrance.

Raising his guard, Sun Luyuan strode into the faint green crack.

A slightly spacious area.

"Thump! Thump! Thump..."

The sound of the ground shaking continuously echoed.

Sun Luyuan looked towards the source of the noise and saw a large tree that had grown two human-like legs.

It was running on the ground.

In the center of the tree trunk, there was a face that looked incredibly ancient.

At this moment, the tree's face was filled with boundless terror.

This large tree ran frantically and rapidly, constantly falling and getting up because its two legs were insufficient to support its body. Yet, it never stopped running.

It muttered to itself, "Once again, calamity has arrived. This terrifying sight, I never even saw in my father's most vicious curses!"

"But it never actually happened!"

"It's not real, it's not real!"

...

The treant spoke incoherently, its words contradictory, making it impossible to understand its meaning.

However, it was deeply trapped in its own delusion. Even when Sun Luyuan tried to communicate with it, it was futile.

"Ah Six has gone mad."

Just then, a clear female voice suddenly sounded beside Sun Luyuan's ear.

"Hmm?" Sun Luyuan was startled.

He had already thoroughly searched the area, and it seemed that besides the treant, there was no one else here.

But immediately, Sun Luyuan remembered the mission entrusted to him by Elder Xu.

He immediately spoke, "Could it be fellow Daoist Qing Feng?"

The female voice did not respond.

"I am here on behalf of Elder Xu to bring you back. According to him, this spirit wood has gone mad, and its internal passages cannot be used, so fellow Daoist Qing Feng is trapped here."

As Sun Luyuan spoke, he carefully observed his surroundings.

He wanted to confirm the location of "Qing Feng."

But even with his Dao Integration realm observation skills, he found nothing.

"Ah Six has gone mad." The female voice still did not respond directly, merely repeating this several times.

Sun Luyuan frowned slightly. Could it be that this female cultivator had also been affected by the demonic faces and gone mad?

"Ah Six and I were the closest. Now that it's mad, who will play with me anymore?"

The faint voice echoed in this small space, overlapping with the treant Ah Six's occasional mournful cries, sending a shiver down one's spine.

For some reason, Sun Luyuan felt the same sense of dread he had experienced while wandering in the Great Qi Dynasty.

"Fellow Daoist Qing Feng..." Sun Luyuan coughed lightly, steeling himself.

Although he did not know the relationship between this cultivator named Qing Feng and Elder Xu.

However, the fact that the usually rigid and unyielding Xu Yuanxian had made an exception to privately ask him was enough to indicate a deep connection between them.

Fortunately, things did not develop as Sun Luyuan had anticipated.

Qing Feng seemed to sob quietly for a moment, then finally emerged from her grief.

"So you were sent by Little Xu. So he hasn't forgotten me."

Qing Feng's simple sentence made Sun Luyuan's hair stand on end.

"Little Xu? Xu Yuanxian?"

Sun Luyuan almost suspected he had misheard.

Elder Xu had been the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall for over three thousand years, a true old monster.

This voice, sounding like a very young girl, called him Little Xu...

If she wasn't mad, then how old could she be?

Who exactly was this Qing Feng?

Countless thoughts flashed through Sun Luyuan's mind, but he dared not dwell on them. His expression became respectful.

He no longer dared to address her as "Fellow Daoist Qing Feng" and cautiously changed his tone, asking, "Senior, why do you not reveal yourself? Have I done something wrong?"

After a moment of silence in the space.

Qing Feng's somewhat strange voice sounded from behind Sun Luyuan.

"Haven't I always been here?"

"Oh, right. I forgot. Most people can't see me."

Qing Feng's words made Sun Luyuan break out in a cold sweat.

"Elder Xu said that he will send someone to deal with this mad spirit wood later. Please, temporarily come back with me." Sun Luyuan said hastily.

"Ah! That's great. I knew Ah Six could still be saved." Qing Feng said cheerfully, like a simple little girl, her mood instantly brightening.

"It's all because that scene of the end of the world wailing was too terrifying, it temporarily stunned it. If you hadn't come, it would have been a long time before anyone spoke to me."

Qing Feng's voice grew closer and closer to Sun Luyuan.

Wшw ¸¸￠o

Finally, it seemed to stop on his back.

"Alright. Then I'll listen to Little Xu and leave here temporarily."

"The aura here has changed; it's become uncomfortable."

Feeling the seemingly real weight on his back, Sun Luyuan's heart pounded. He wiped the cold sweat from his forehead.

"I can just leave now, can't I?" he asked tentatively.

"Yes, I'm already on your back."

Qing Feng's words confirmed Sun Luyuan's guess.

Sun Luyuan did not dare to delay and left the strange space directly.

The voice of the mad spirit wood continued to resound here.

"Shall we... return to the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters?" Sun Luyuan asked, flying rapidly as an escape light over the Cloudy Sea.

"Not there. It's uncomfortable there. Let's go to Luoyan Prefecture."

Qing Feng's mood seemed to have improved, and her tone was somewhat cheerful.

"Luoyan Prefecture?" Sun Luyuan nodded.

Elder Xu's mission was simply to have him pick up Qing Feng and settle her in a Clear Wind Hall in another prefecture.

Sun Luyuan did not hesitate and rushed towards Luoyan Prefecture.

Along the way, he also pondered the true identity of the person on his back.

With the Immortal Artifact Boundless Mirror at home, Sun Luyuan considered himself quite knowledgeable.

However, for a strange existence like Qing Feng, he had never heard of anything similar before.

He couldn't even gauge Qing Feng's strength.

Did Elder Xu send him on such a long journey just because he was worried she was trapped?

From this perspective, Qing Feng's strength should not be high.

But Qing Feng's peculiar wording and various strange behaviors made Sun Luyuan's scalp tingle.

It was clear that this formless and intangible existence named Qing Feng was by no means simple.

Sun Luyuan inwardly lamented and sped up his pace.

He just wanted to complete the mission as soon as possible and get rid of her.

Qing Feng remained silent the entire way.

And they were getting closer and closer to Luoyan Prefecture.

Just as he was about to be freed, a sudden remark from Qing Feng cast him into an ice cellar.

"You're getting a bit impatient."

"As expected, there are few people in the world who are good to me."

A chill rose from Sun Luyuan's heart.

Although Qing Feng said nothing further, his sense of unease grew stronger.

"What's not right?"

Sun Luyuan knew that a change was happening to him.

But he couldn't detect the specific details of the change.

It wasn't until Sun Luyuan arrived in Luoyan Prefecture and inadvertently glanced downwards that he suddenly realized.

He was very close to the ground at this moment.

A blazing sun shone directly overhead.

Yet, there was no shadow of him on the ground.

Sun Luyuan clearly knew that he had not cast any spells to conceal his form.

But his shadow had disappeared.

He listlessly extended his arms.

He seemed to be becoming illusory.

His existence was fading.

He was about to become formless and intangible like Qing Feng.

The change came too quickly, and Sun Luyuan didn't even feel fear.

His mind was a complete blank.

Just as Sun Luyuan felt that his connection with this world was growing weaker...

A fierce golden light erupted from within him.

Chapter 1233: The Heavenly Dao Bestows Immense Strength

Moments before.

Having absorbed the remnant world will of the Cloudy Sea and returned to the Great Qi pocket world, the Faceless Sacred Emperor finally gained a more concrete understanding of the changes within himself.

Previously, he had to dedicate his full attention to the myriad complex affairs of the Sacred Dynasty, leaving little free time for contemplation.

But now, without even using a third of his strength, Li Ping could effortlessly manage all matters, big and small, within the Sacred Dynasty.

Beyond the sheer quantitative growth of his divine soul, Li Ping also felt his senses becoming sharper.

He looked down upon this land and discovered the nascent consciousness of a pocket world, currently gestan in the process of world ascension. Before, the Great Qi pocket world operated purely on instinct, lacking the distinct "personified" characteristics of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. However, due to Li Ping’s continuous modifications to the Great Qi pocket world, it had met the fundamental conditions for self-awareness to emerge.

The birth of world will was a considerably long process. Li Ping estimated that, at the current normal pace, it would take at least a thousand years.

However, if Li Ping continued to promote the ascension of the Great Qi, this time would be correspondingly shortened.

The current state of the Great Qi pocket world was a direct result of Li Ping’s renovations. Furthermore, the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi’s fortune, now integrated with Li Ping's, had a profound, immeasurable influence on the pocket world, its ever-growing and unstoppable power subtly shaping it.

All cultivators are born and raised by heaven and earth. Yet, to Li Ping, the current Great Qi pocket world felt like his creation. The grace of re-creation was akin to that of the parents of heaven and earth…

Seated upon the Sacred Emperor's throne, profound and mysterious insights continuously surfaced in his mind.

These insights stemmed not only from his own thoughts and contemplations but also from the assistance of this very world.

Li Ping felt as though he had grasped something critically important.

However, at that very moment, his thoughts were inexplicably disrupted by a sudden premonition.

"Hmm?"

Upon investigation, Li Ping discovered that within the network of primal force essence he had established, a captured prey was showing signs of breaking free.

Subtle, peculiar fluctuations emanated from it, as if trying to escape the grasp of the golden net.

"Sun Luyuan?"

Li Ping still recalled this cultivator of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who had recently pledged allegiance to the Sacred Dynasty.

"Could it be that the Myriad Immortals Alliance has discovered him and intervened?" Li Ping couldn't help but wonder.

But he quickly sensed what was happening to Sun Luyuan.

"Huh?"

Li Ping's heart immediately grew heavy.

Using the primal force essence within Sun Luyuan as a conduit, Li Ping instantly arrived by his side.

Extending his hand, he placed it on Sun Luyuan's shoulder, and surging golden power continuously flowed into his body.

Shortly after, Sun Luyuan's body, which had begun to grow transparent, solidified once more.

"Thank you, Sacred Emperor, for saving my life." Sun Luyuan, recovering from the shock of what had just happened, said with a face full of lingering fear and gratitude.

Li Ping slowly withdrew his hand, but his senses remained connected to Sun Luyuan's back.

He could not directly observe the entity called "Qing Feng."

Not even by influencing Qing Feng's perception of the outside world.

"You're an interesting person."

If not for Qing Feng's voice suddenly sounding, Li Ping would have almost believed she was merely Sun Luyuan's hallucination.

It was hard to believe that there was still something within the Xuanhuang Realm that he, Li Ping, could not observe.

"What are you?"

There was no insult in his tone; Li Ping asked with genuine solemnity.

Sun Luyuan lowered his head, concealing the expression on his face.

Unexpectedly, Qing Feng did not get angry, "I'd like to know that myself."

"Unfortunately, I've forgotten," she said with regret.

"My memory isn't very good. Except for a few like Xiao Xu and Ah Liu, my impressions of others are rather vague…"

"What's your name?" Qing Feng asked.

"Li Ping," Li Ping replied curtly.

He sensed a presence similar to Senior Yin emanating from Qing Feng, yet subtly different.

"Perhaps I can help you remember." His intuition told him that the secret of this Qing Feng might be of great help in a future conflict with the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Thus, he offered his assistance.

"Heh heh, I feel like you don't have good intentions."

To his surprise, Qing Feng saw through him instantly.

"Indeed, there are few in this world who are good to me." Qing Feng's tone again became resentful and low.

The moment Li Ping heard this, the golden primal force within him surged spontaneously.

This was a sign that his body’s protective defenses had been triggered.

Since Qing Feng had chosen to make a move, Li Ping naturally would not hold back.

Behind him, the majestic phantom of the Sacred Dynasty suddenly appeared.

Golden light unceasingly streamed from the image of the Sacred Dynasty.

It formed a colossal hand, directly grasping the location where Qing Feng was.

Li Ping thought that since he could not observe her directly, he would simply seal off and take away the space she occupied, to study her slowly later.

However, this bizarre and elusive Qing Feng was not someone who could be subdued by such simple means.

The golden colossus returned to the phantom of the Sacred Dynasty, leaving behind only a black void – proof that a small pocket of space had completely vanished.

Yet, Qing Feng's voice still echoed from that void.

"You want to take me back?"

"Do you want to be with me forever? If so, why resist?"

"Ignorance." In response to Qing Feng, the Faceless Sacred Emperor emitted a cold snort.

On Li Ping's previously featureless face, faint, blurred facial features began to materialize.

But they did not resemble those of ordinary humans. They were more like the evolution of different energies.

Especially his eyes, which were silver-white vortexes, as brilliant as the starry river in the heavens.

"Heaven and Earth's might, bestowed upon me."

Li Ping's majestic voice boomed like thunder.

The sky of Luoyan Prefecture instantly changed, with clouds and wind swirling at his words.

"If you want to drag me down with you, you'd better have the weight for it!"

Sensing his incredibly close connection with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, Li Ping then released the protection of his golden primal force, allowing Qing Feng's strangely potent power to engulf him.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

Streaks of lightning flashed through the dense, dark clouds, and the earth trembled slightly.

Li Ping's body’s color momentarily faded.

But it quickly returned to normal.

On the other hand, Qing Feng was actually pulled out, revealing a blurred image!

"Found you!"

Two beams of light shot out from Li Ping's vortex-like eyes.

Like chains, they bound Qing Feng.

"Come out!"

Li Ping roared, and the golden colossus reappeared.

He grabbed the silver chains and pulled hard.

The previous small, mending black spatial void suddenly showed signs of violently collapsing outwards.

Chapter 1234: Ink Slaughter Severing Traces

As the space in Luoyan Prefecture of the Xuanhuang Realm continuously collapsed, Qing Feng was also slowly pulled forth, revealing its true form.

It was a willow tree with fluttering branches and leaves!

However, Qing Feng was clearly not an ordinary tree transformed. At first glance, it appeared to be a willow tree, but upon closer inspection, it integrated characteristics of many other trees.

After pulling out more than half of Qing Feng's true form, the silver chain stopped advancing, hovering in mid-air.

It seemed to have encountered immense resistance.

Despite its disheveled appearance, Qing Feng inexplicably felt no pain.

It kept muttering to itself, as if Li Ping's actions had indeed caused it to recall something.

"This place is..."

"What has happened over the years?"

"I am Qing Feng? No, no, that is the name the Void offered me. My original name was..."

"It was..."

"Tian..."

"Tian Yin?!"

A silver light also flew out from within the willow tree.

It shot directly towards Li Ping.

The speed of the silver light was incredibly fast; it arrived before Li Ping almost the instant it materialized.

It aimed directly at his head, the location of his sea of consciousness.

The golden primal force essence’s automatic defense was also unimaginably fast.

A shield appeared before Li Ping, colliding violently with the silver light.

There was no earth-shattering explosion; only the intense dissipation of their respective lights.

"Run?"

Concurrently, Li Ping faintly perceived a will conveyed by the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

It was a warning, urging him to flee quickly.

Li Ping's heart sank as he glanced ahead.

As the golden primal force essence slowly wore down the light, the true form of the radiant silver light was revealed.

It was a seemingly ordinary silver needle.

Even though the light enveloping it was gradually fading, the sense of threat it posed to Li Ping did not diminish in the least.

"Now, with the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao empowering me, I am practically half a Longevity Realm cultivator."

"Yet, I am engaged in a fierce struggle with a mere silver needle..."

Li Ping felt no dejection in his heart; instead, a hint of anger surfaced.

Along with the silver needle, an old and benevolent face appeared in Li Ping's mind.

"As expected, it has something to do with people from the Heavenly Law Realm."

"To sow chaos in Azure Nether, their crime deserves death!"

Li Ping's killing intent surged continuously.

However, he also knew that he was not yet a match for the Heavenly Physician and could only retreat for now.

He instantly loosened his grip on the silver chain in his hand, and Qing Feng, or rather, Tian Yin, her voice became gradually transparent again.

"Go."

Li Ping could no longer concern himself with her at this moment.

While fending off the silver needle's attack, Li Ping prepared to leave Luoyan Prefecture.

In this critical moment, he did not forget to bring Sun Luyuan, who was already completely stunned.

Enveloped by the golden primal force, Li Ping's figure also slowly faded.

The Heavenly Physician's silver needle did not pursue but returned to Tian Yin's body, suppressing her into the formless and intangible.

Before completely escaping, Li Ping vaguely heard a sigh echoing in the sky.

"Where has the distant Tian Yin fallen..."

"Where has the distant Tian Yin fallen."

After Li Ping completely disappeared from Luoyan Prefecture, the anomalous phenomena in the world did not cease.

Instead, they intensified.

Streams of lightning struck down madly, and the raging thunderous storm was like the end of the world.

Or rather, the end of the world had truly arrived.

For a figure as dark as ink had descended upon Luoyan Prefecture.

If Li Ping were here, he would undoubtedly recognize this familiar existence.

It was the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, Ink Slaughter!

As the ultimate world-ending method of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, it had decisively descended after Li Ping's departure.

Ink Slaughter first glanced in the direction Li Ping had departed.

Then, it transformed into ten thousand, and ten thousand into a hundred million.

Without any hesitation, it skillfully manifested endless inky darkness.

It was to completely purge Luoyan Prefecture.

With Ink Slaughter's descent, its spread this time was much faster than the sea-annihilation Ink Slaughter that Li Ping had previously experienced.

The cultivators of Luoyan Prefecture had no time to resist or flee.

In just the time it takes to brew a cup of tea, Luoyan Prefecture, which was originally somewhat desolate but possessed a semblance of life, had completely turned into nothingness.

The sudden appearance of Ink Slaughter had naturally alerted many hidden powerhouses within the Xuanhuang Realm.

But Luoyan Prefecture no longer existed at this moment.

Even if they wanted to find any clues, they were powerless.

The impact of Ink Slaughter's sudden annihilation of an entire prefecture had just begun.

In the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, within the Sacred Emperor's Throne.

Li Ping was seated, the residual power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao on his person allowing him to know what had transpired in Luoyan Prefecture.

He knew that this was an action taken by the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao to prevent being detected and tracked by the Heavenly Physician.

Furthermore, since Luoyan Prefecture was a remnant fragment of the Heavenly Law Realm, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao had cleared it decisively.

"That woman's name is Tian Yin?"

"Like the Heavenly Physician, she possesses the ability to peer into people's hearts."

"She is formless and intangible, hidden within the Xuanhuang Realm. Aside from her own ability, it might also be the enhancement of the Heavenly Physician's silver needle."

"Although her ultimate purpose is unknown, it is certainly not a good thing for the Xuanhuang Realm itself."

Although the encounter with the Heavenly Physician this time ended in failure, it did allow Li Ping to understand the gap between himself and the Heavenly Physician.

"The Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, or even stronger."

"It seems the path I must tread is still very long."

"However, the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao I borrowed this time is limited. After all, I only intended to subdue that woman. If it were a life-or-death struggle, the blessings of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao could have been tens of times greater."

"And my Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi still has limitless prospects."

"Moreover, the Fishing Pond is a supreme treasure; perhaps it can provide some pleasant surprises from beyond the The Great Barrier."

Walloping in self-pity was not Li Ping's style.

After a brief failure, he immediately began to summarize and seek solutions.

"But these alone are still somewhat insufficient."

Li Ping naturally thought of the sealed malevolence of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Having swallowed the lingering will of the Cloudy Sea this time, he had gained a clearer understanding of the power of world wills.

"If I could devour the Azure Nether malevolence..."

"The Azure Nether power would return to completeness, and I would undergo another qualitative transformation."

"It seems this matter must be put on the agenda."

...

While Li Ping was contemplating, Sun Luyuan was trembling, hiding beneath the Sacred Emperor's Throne, afraid to move.

Whether it was the Sacred Emperor before him, Tian Yin, or that silver needle, their performances had deeply shocked Sun Luyuan.

Even though he was also a Dao Integration cultivator, before them, he was like a child, completely powerless to resist.

"What do you think of that woman named Tian Yin?"

After a long while, the voice of the Chosen Emperor reached Sun Luyuan's ears.

Sun Luyuan shivered, his face showing a bitter expression.

Chapter 1235

"This... this..." Sun Luyuan stammered for a long time, unable to utter a single word.

Fortunately, Li Ping did not press him. With a wave of his hand, he sent a beam of golden light into Sun Luyuan's body and said calmly, "From now on, you probably won't be able to return to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Stay in our Sacred Dynasty for now."

"After some time, I will arrange for you to return to the Myriad Immortals Alliance under a different identity."

Sun Luyuan looked up at Li Ping blankly.

At this moment, Li Ping displayed the scene of Moksha's obliteration within Luoyan Prefecture to him. As endless fear surged in Sun Luyuan's heart, he suddenly understood the purpose of the golden light. It had clearly erased the mark the Myriad Immortals Alliance had left within him.

"That Heavenly Sound involves too many secrets. If we don't completely obliterate an entire prefecture, it's inevitable that people will follow the clues and track us down," Li Ping explained.

"Then our Sun family..." Sun Luyuan's expression changed drastically as he suddenly thought of something.

"That will depend on your luck. If Heavenly Sound tells the Myriad Immortals Alliance what happened to her, then the Sun family will definitely be implicated. They will completely vanish, and no one will be spared."

Li Ping's words turned Sun Luyuan's face ashen. However, he then shifted the topic, saying, "But you don't need to worry too much. Heavenly Sound is formless and intangible. If she doesn't reveal herself, the Myriad Immortals Alliance probably won't be able to find her. Heavenly Sound and the Myriad Immortals Alliance are not on the same side."

"Besides, although my attack before I left didn't destroy her, it did heavily injure her. Heavenly Sound's condition was already unstable. When she reappears and regains consciousness, she might not even remember us."

Even though Li Ping said this, he could not fully reassure Sun Luyuan. The veiled meaning in Li Ping's words was clear: there was another terrifying entity behind Heavenly Sound, one that even this unfathomable Sacred Emperor of Great Qi had to be wary of.

"Damn that Xu Yuanxian, for saying it was just a simple errand. I actually believed his lies..." Thinking about how he was inexplicably drawn into such a matter, not only were his original plans disrupted, but his entire family was also at risk, Sun Luyuan felt a surge of unnamable anger.

"This old scoundrel, like other high-ranking officials of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, is not a good person!" he cursed inwardly.

Recalling the various crises his family would face after his disappearance, Sun Luyuan's mind became a mess.

Just then, Li Ping spoke again.

"Actually, if you want to return without suspicion, there is a way. As long as you inform the Myriad Immortals Alliance of our existence, you probably won't be punished but will instead earn great merit."

Li Ping's voice echoed within the Sacred Emperor's Throne. Sun Luyuan's heart skipped a beat, and he quickly pledged his loyalty, "How could I betray the Sacred Emperor?"

Unexpectedly, Li Ping smiled. "I think you've misunderstood my meaning."

"Return to the Myriad Immortals Alliance and tell Xu Yuanxian the situation in Luoyan Prefecture and our Sacred Dynasty. This is an order."

"Ah?" Sun Luyuan was stunned. He couldn't understand why the Sacred Emperor would suddenly make such a contradictory and abrupt decision.

WWW ••￠O

"Could it be that he has already prepared for war with the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" Sun Luyuan thought to himself.

"When you meet Xu Yuanxian, say this..." Li Ping slowly transmitted his voice. Sun Luyuan's expression gradually became increasingly complex.

Not long after, under the escort of Daoist Bai Hua, Sun Luyuan quietly returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. He hurried to the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters.

Currently, the Alliance Headquarters was in a state of slight chaos due to the destruction of Luoyan Prefecture. However, at this moment, no one would have imagined that this matter had anything to do with Sun Luyuan, a Dao Integration cultivator from the Law Enforcement Hall. Thus, Sun Luyuan smoothly arrived at the Law Enforcement Hall headquarters and met Xu Yuanxian again.

"You're back? How did the matter I entrusted you with go?" Xu Yuanxian asked without even opening his eyes.

"Elder Xu, something big has happened." Sun Luyuan appeared extremely panicked, as if he wanted to speak but hesitated.

Xu Yuanxian suddenly opened his eyes. After waving his hand and setting up numerous restrictions, he said in a deep voice, "Don't panic, speak slowly and carefully."

Sun Luyuan took a deep breath. "I did as you instructed, Elder, and met Senior Qing Feng at Clear Wind Hall on Myriad Immortals Island."

"The Treant named Ah Liu has gone completely mad, and Senior Qing Feng is willing to leave with me. However, she doesn't want to come to the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters but wants to go to Luoyan Prefecture..."

Hearing the three words Sun Luyuan spoke, and recalling the recent catastrophe in Luoyan Prefecture, Xu Yuanxian's expression also changed slightly.

"Then what exactly happened in Luoyan Prefecture?!" he asked coldly, abandoning his usual composure.

"When I was about to bring Senior Qing Feng to her destination, she suddenly became dazed, saying, 'Truly, there are few in this world who are good to me...' Then I felt my body float as if I was about to completely disappear from this world," Sun Luyuan said, with lingering fear.

Xu Yuanxian clearly knew Qing Feng's habit and did not show surprise.

"Just when I felt I was about to die, a golden figure suddenly descended. Then..."

"He started fighting with Senior Qing Feng." Sun Luyuan projected the image of Li Ping's struggle with Qing Feng.

"The power of heaven and earth, bestowed upon me," the majestic voice in the image uttered softly. Xu Yuanxian watched the screen intently, his expression gradually becoming solemn. It was only when a silver needle appeared that he completely lost his composure. The image abruptly ended.

"The other senior took me away. When I returned, I found out that Luoyan Prefecture had been destroyed. And Senior Qing Feng had vanished..." Sun Luyuan feigned extreme panic.

"Elder Xu, what on earth is going on! What is Senior Qing Feng's identity?" he asked in return.

Xu Yuanxian did not answer. After frowning and contemplating for a moment, he said, "Do you know the name of the cultivator who saved you?"

Sun Luyuan nodded. "He called himself the Chosen Sacred Emperor. However, he didn't interact with me much and sent me back quickly."

"Oh, Elder Xu, the pocket world of that Chosen Sacred Emperor seemed a bit strange..." However, Xu Yuanxian did not pay attention to Sun Luyuan's latter remark, muttering instead, "The Chosen Sacred Emperor."

Sun Luyuan did not interrupt, patiently awaiting his reaction.

"Don't ask any more questions about this matter. Pretend it never happened," Xu Yuanxian suddenly said. Sun Luyuan was taken aback. It was not an act.

"Elder Xu..." Xu Yuanxian raised his hand, interrupting Sun Luyuan. "I was too careless. After so many years, I didn't expect things to have escalated to a point of irreconcilable conflict."

"I will find an opportunity to compensate you separately. But this matter must be kept confidential," Xu Yuanxian's cold gaze locked onto Sun Luyuan. Sun Luyuan shivered and quickly swore an oath in agreement.

"You may return for now. If there are any questions, I will contact you again."

"Remember what I said." Before leaving, Xu Yuanxian did not forget to reiterate.

He never expected that what he thought would be a perilous ordeal would be resolved so smoothly. Sun Luyuan felt a sense of relief, yet his heart was filled with disbelief.

"However, the old man's reaction was precisely within the Sacred Emperor's expectations."

"Irreconcilable conflict? What does that mean?" Sun Luyuan pondered endlessly. However, this unexpected twist of fate not only saved his life but also earned him a favor from Xu Yuanxian, which could be considered an unexpected joy. Sun Luyuan shook his head slightly, suppressing the gloom in his heart for the time being.

"Since I'm already at headquarters, why not go see Lu'er?" Sun Luyuan thought, and soon after, he entered the Dharma Deduction space.

Sun Ang seemed very surprised by his arrival, constantly asking questions. Sun Luyuan answered in detail.

"Poor Lu'er," Sun Ang said, which suddenly made Sun Luyuan feel a pang of guilt. He felt awkward to stay any longer and left in a hurry.

Sun Ang, who was also Li Fan, watched Sun Luyuan leave with a complex expression. The conversation between Sun Luyuan and Xu Yuanxian had naturally reached his ears without missing a word. The Sacred Emperor's sudden change of mind was also influenced by him.

"As expected, there are people within the Myriad Immortals Alliance who know the true situation of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Xuanhuang Realm is being dismembered, reformed, and merged."

"Xu Yuanxian is one of them, and so is Doctrine Transmitter Jiang. However, as subordinates of the Dharma-Preachers, they are undoubtedly on their side."

"They may have long anticipated the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's actions, but it is beyond their ability to handle, so they have chosen to stand by and watch..."

"After all, not everyone has the courage to stand up against the Dharma-Preachers. Even those few Longevity Heavenly Venerates from the Five Elders Council have allowed it to proceed." Li Fan snorted inwardly.

"However, I believe there will still be passionate individuals in the Xuanhuang Realm who will not let their spirits grow cold." Li Fan's mind flashed with the image of Young Master Shang.

"What is currently lacking is an opportunity to unite them."

"The Chosen Sacred Emperor..."

"He is now becoming somewhat befitting of his title." The Xuanhuang Realm's active release of Moksha this time, helping the Sacred Emperor's clone conceal its whereabouts, was something Li Fan had not anticipated.

"While this is partly due to the clone helping the Heavenly Dao through the Sea of Darkness and feeding back to it, it is more because the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao has been isolated and helpless for too long. Now that a Sacred Emperor has suddenly appeared, it is like grasping a last straw of hope."

"With all sorts of coincidences aligning, the evolution of this clone has indeed become quite interesting." Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his thoughts racing. Although the clone was still under his absolute control, during the period when Li Ping and Heavenly Sound were in conflict, with the enhancement of Golden Origin Energy and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, the clone's strength had subtly surpassed Li Fan's current level. This had caused its path of advancement to deviate slightly. It was like driving a car on a road; Li Fan could still firmly control all the car's functions, but the road itself had changed due to the car's own condition.

"However, this might not be a bad thing for me."

"The more assistance the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao provides, the more easily the bottom lines of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and even the Dharma-Preachers, can be exposed."

"And that Azure Nether Malevolence. It's time to investigate its origins as well." Li Fan's main body and the Sacred Emperor's clone simultaneously had this thought.

Not long after, Sun Erlang and Wang Xuanba arrived at the Sacred Emperor's Throne together.

"What is the current situation of the alien beast pocket world?" Li Ping first asked Sun Erlang.

"Reporting to Master. After personally witnessing the power of our Sacred Dynasty, especially the more advanced alien beast technology of Xuanba, the Imperial Daughter has agreed to unconditional allegiance."

"Currently, its combat power is being gradually integrated. Although the army there consists of mortals, after three to five years of modification, they can become our Sacred Dynasty's fighting force. Especially the numerous alien beasts, which will somewhat mitigate the shortage of resources in the Sacred Dynasty," Sun Erlang said solemnly.

"Indeed, our flesh and blood factories are projected to increase their efficiency by more than five times within three years. Moreover, the Imperial Daughter has her own unique insights into alien beast development technology, even more so than me!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed in praise.

After listening to their reports, Li Ping nodded slightly. Then, he informed them of the location of the Azure Nether Malevolence, which was Xu Ke's pocket world.

"You two, along with Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong, go there and see if you can invite Xu Ke back."

"Be respectful in your attitude."

Sun Erlang and Wang Xuanba exchanged glances. They had undertaken errands before, but this was the first time the Sacred Emperor had been so solemn. Without daring to delay, the two brothers took their leave from the Sacred Emperor and hurried to the Imperial Empire's pocket world.

They found Sage Master Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong.

"What? Xu Ke?"

"Are you sure you heard correctly?" Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong were stunned upon hearing their account. Then, Xiao Qing even lost her composure and tightly grasped Sun Erlang, repeatedly questioning him.

"If Master said so, it must be correct. Esteemed ones, will you accompany us?" Despite having a hundred doubts in their hearts, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong could not resist the longing of thousands of years. They immediately agreed. The four of them, accompanying each other, arrived at the entrance to that pocket world.

"This is..."

"The aura of the Beast Taming Sect's formation!" Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong exclaimed excitedly. The aura on their bodies became somewhat chaotic. Although the person they wished to see was right in front of them, they suddenly lacked the courage to take that final step. It was only at Sun Erlang's urging that they entered the pocket world.

In the lonely heaven and earth, an old man with white hair sat alone on a mountain peak.

"Xu Ke!" Xiao Qing's trembling voice rang out. The old man's body stiffened slightly, and then he slowly raised his head. Two figures, one green and one red, were rapidly approaching him.

The dust-covered memories of the past instantly flooded into his mind. The scenes from thousands of years ago reappeared before Xu Ke's eyes. However, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong still looked as they did then. As for him, Xu Ke, he was already old and frail. The three faced each other. They had countless words to say but did not know where to begin.

"Sun Erlang."

"Wang Xuanba."

"Greetings, Senior." It was two voices that inappropriately interrupted the reunion of the three.

Chapter 1236: Good and Evil Will Meet

“Who are you?”

Sun and Wang arrived with Little Qing and Little Red. For a moment, Xu Ke was disoriented, thinking they were his descendants. However, he quickly realized that a pocket world as lacking in spirit energy as this one could not possibly produce cultivators of such a realm. Xu Ke’s profound gaze immediately fell upon the two of them.

Sun Erlang, neither humble nor arrogant, cupped his hands and said, “We are here on behalf of my master to request an audience with senior.”

“Hm?” Xu Ke was surprised. He hadn’t expected anyone in this world to still remember him.

After Little Qing and Little Red transmitted their recent encounters within the empire, Xu Ke’s expression grew even more solemn. “Someone knows me and possesses such capabilities? Who could it be?” Various vague figures flashed through his mind, only to be eliminated one by one. He subtly glanced at the rotting wooden coffin behind him. Xu Ke had initially intended to refuse their invitation, but…

Xu Ke’s gaze lingered on Little Qing and Little Red for a moment before he sighed softly. They had come together with Qing and Hong, knowing his location. The implied threat was self-evident. Although he had avoided them for a thousand years, it was not without reason. Could he, Xu Ke, be someone who would disregard loyalty and affection and watch them fall into danger?

With this thought, Xu Ke shook his head slightly. “I can accompany you. However, I have a few conditions.”

Sun Erlang quickly replied, “Senior, please state them; there are no issues.”

“Firstly, one of you two must take my place and sit on this mountaintop. Until I return, no matter what happens, you cannot leave. To prevent any unforeseen circumstances, I will set up a restriction,” Xu Ke said slowly.

“This…” Hearing this peculiar request, Sun Erlang hesitated.

“No problem. I will take senior’s place here,” Wang Xuanba declared, patting his chest. Sun Erlang knew that after cultivating the technique passed down by his master, his sworn brother could transform into myriad forms, much like exotic beasts. Even if this current body were utterly destroyed, it wouldn’t have a significant impact. Thus, he did not object.

Xu Ke nodded and continued, “Secondly, after I leave this pocket world with you, no one is allowed within ten feet of me. Otherwise, do not blame this old man for being ruthless.” Xu Ke swept his gaze over Little Qing and Little Red as he emphasized his words, clearly including them within the “no one.”

Sun Erlang’s heart tightened, but he still nodded in agreement.

“And finally…” Xu Ke said to Little Qing and Little Red, “If you find anything amiss with me, kill me without any hesitation.” As he spoke, a palm-sized wooden sword appeared in Xu Ke’s hand. Xu Ke gestured, and the wooden sword flew to Little Qing’s hand.

Little Qing was completely stunned. However, seeing Xu Ke’s aged yet resolute face, so similar to how he looked when he had insisted on leaving the empire years ago, tears welled up in her eyes. She didn’t say anything more, and softly agreed.

“Okay.” Little Qing clutched the wooden sword tightly, simultaneously listening intently as Xu Ke transmitted its usage method to her.

Once everything was settled, Xu Ke looked at Sun and Wang. Sun Erlang and Wang Xuanba, seeing Xu Ke’s solemnity, dared not delay. “Does senior have any other instructions?”

“Please wait a moment and stand back a little further.” The two of them and the two beasts looked at each other, not understanding his intentions, but obediently flew far away from the jutting stone mountain where Xu Ke stood.

Xu Ke placed his right hand on the mountaintop and exerted a slight force. The stone mountain, the heavens and earth, and even the entire world, trembled slightly for an instant. It was as if sharp, venomous curses were cast, or perhaps it was just an illusion.

After the tremors subsided, the pocket world seemed different from before, though Sun Erlang and the others couldn’t pinpoint the exact change. Xu Ke slowly rose and looked at Wang Xuanba, stomping his right foot down. Wang Xuanba signaled Sun Erlang to relax, then flew to Xu Ke’s side.

“Sit down,” Xu Ke said, moving his foot. A deep indentation was revealed on the mountaintop. Wang Xuanba plopped down onto it.

“It might hurt a little, but you won’t die,” Xu Ke said as he flew into the air. The moment he left the vicinity of the towering stone mountain, Wang Xuanba let out a scream, as if an immensely heavy object had suddenly crushed him. His spine was pressed directly against the ground, and the sound of bones being ground and pulverized echoed incessantly.

“Xuanba?!” Sun Erlang exclaimed.

“I… I’m fine!” One hand reached out from his body, which had become a near-pancake of flesh. He weakly waved it at Sun Erlang. “It’s just… it really hurts.”

Xu Ke lightly pointed at Wang Xuanba. “Let’s go. I said he wouldn’t die.” Wang Xuanba’s pressure seemed to slightly lessen, and he was able to lift his head again. Sun Erlang took a deep breath and, without hesitation, led the way with Little Qing and Little Red. Xu Ke followed closely behind.

Sun Erlang, like Qing and Hong, secretly observed Xu Ke. When Xu Ke was sitting, the seemingly decaying coffin behind him was not particularly noticeable. But, whether it was Sun Erlang’s imagination or not, after leaving the pocket world, the coffin seemed to become more intact and slowly grew larger, as if… something was about to emerge from within. Coupled with Xu Ke’s earlier strange requests, Sun Erlang felt a growing sense of unease.

He also heard faint, inexplicable whispers. Just as Sun Erlang was about to listen closely, a chilling sensation surged through him, circulating spontaneously. The surrounding noise vanished instantly, replaced by Xu Ke’s low reminder: “Ignore those strange sounds.”

Sun Erlang broke out in a cold sweat. He considered himself to possess a strong will, having experienced another life in the simulated world of the Dao-Melting Stone at the Grand Origin Sect. Yet, hundreds of years of experience proved so vulnerable to those sinister whispers; he had almost succumbed. “If not for the Immortal Heart Incantation passed down by Master, I might have fallen.” “This Xu Ke…” Sun Erlang no longer dared to look at Xu Ke or the coffin behind him, focusing instead on quickening his pace.

Before long, after traversing a long stretch of void, the group arrived outside the pocket world of the Great Qi.

“Eh?” This time, the voice of surprise and uncertainty came from Xu Ke. Sun Erlang looked back and saw that, for some reason, the coffin behind Xu Ke had become dilapidated and smaller again, almost indistinguishable from its appearance in the world Xu Ke had just left.

Having been notified in advance, all citizens of the Great Qi had returned to their homes in the Sacred Capital. The vast city was empty, save for a straight, void path cleared for Xu Ke, leading directly to the Sacred Emperor’s Seat. “Master is already waiting for senior,” Sun Erlang said respectfully. There was no longer any need to lead the way. Ever since arriving here, Xu Ke had felt a pervasive, sun-like powerful presence enveloping the entire pocket world, far surpassing the ordinary Dao Integration realm. It even exerted a degree of suppression over the Azure Nether malevolent thought sealed within the coffin behind him. What made Xu Ke even more incredulous was that he vaguely sensed a familiar feeling from this aura. But… “How is it possible?” Xu Ke entered the Sacred Emperor's Seat with three parts doubt, three parts apprehension, and a sliver of unknown excitement.

Upon seeing the figure seated above, Xu Ke’s heart settled with relief, accompanied by a touch of disappointment. “I was overthinking. How could it be Mr. Bai, who is already dead?” Forcefully suppressing the stray thoughts in his mind, Xu Ke intently observed the legendary “Faceless Sacred Emperor” of Great Qi, or rather, the Chosen Emperor.

At the same time, Li Ping was also observing Xu Ke and the coffin behind him. Li Ping naturally saw more than Sun Erlang. He did not see decaying wood, but a faint, translucent, pale figure. The figure possessed the most beautiful face in the world, yet it was contorted with expressions of malice and evil. Li Ping sensed that the urging of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao had descended once more, and it was becoming increasingly intense. Simultaneously, the pale Azure Nether malevolent thought seemed to sense something. It suddenly raised its head, staring intently at Li Ping. Correspondingly, the coffin behind Xu Ke began to shake violently. Loud banging sounds echoed within the grand hall.

“You…” Xu Ke was suddenly alerted. He retreated rapidly, and a phantom image of a golden wheel appeared above his head. The golden wheel spun rapidly, and countless images of ferocious beasts and their roars emerged from it, attempting to suppress the shaking coffin. However, the struggle of the Azure Nether malevolent thought intensified as never before. Only when Li Ping, the Sacred Emperor, had a change of heart and activated the “Myriad Spirits, All Beings Refining the Soul” array within the Great Qi pocket world, obscuring the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, did the Azure Nether malevolent thought gradually quiet down, having lost its sense of its other half.

Meanwhile, Xu Ke, having tried and found himself unable to fly out no matter what, abandoned his futile efforts. He stared coldly at Li Ping. “Who exactly are you?” Xu Ke now understood that this Sacred Emperor was here for the sealed Azure Nether malevolent thought.

“Who am I…” Li Ping paused. “It doesn’t really matter. What’s important is that it’s time to return it to its rightful owner.”

Xu Ke’s expression changed drastically. “Return it to its rightful owner?”

“Mr. Bai failed to uphold Heaven’s decree back then and even sealed a portion of Heaven’s power. Now, I will rectify the anomalies and return the Dao to Heaven,” Li Ping’s voice, though not loud, echoed through the Sacred Emperor’s Seat. To Xu Ke’s ears, it was like a thunderclap.

“What did you say?!” Having lived for so long and witnessed many bizarre events, Xu Ke had never been so shocked. “Suppression is not as good as guidance. Sealing is only a temporary measure. The longer it is sealed, the fiercer the backlash when it breaks free. Did Mr. Bai not teach you this?” “How much longer can you hold on?” Li Ping didn’t give Xu Ke time to react, relentlessly shaking his mind. Cold sweat dripped from Xu Ke’s forehead. “You are…” he asked incredulously. “The Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate?” The moment these words were spoken, the air in the Sacred Emperor’s Seat seemed to freeze. After a brief silence, Li Ping chuckled softly. “No.” This answer clearly exceeded Xu Ke’s expectations, and he fell into a state of confusion. “After Mr. Bai’s betrayal, do you think the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao would still trust a cultivator?” Li Ping’s tone was strange. “I am not the Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate.” “I am the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.” As Li Ping spoke, he stood up from the Sacred Emperor’s Seat with a resounding movement. Instantly, his figure seemed to expand infinitely, like a colossal giant filling Xu Ke’s vision. Li Ping’s already formidable aura erupted and intensified further. The obscuring effect of the Myriad Spirits Array vanished, and Li Ping borrowed the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. And for his sealed other half, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao was unprecedentedly generous this time. A rift appeared faintly in the sky above the Great Qi pocket world, a sign that the entire world had been stretched to its limit. If not for the fact that Great Qi had been upgraded considerably by Li Ping’s management over the years, its upper limit far exceeding that of ordinary pocket worlds, it would have likely exploded right then.
