A vast consciousness swept back and forth within the blackened parts. Compared to before, there was a hint of surprise and uncertainty. Wang Xuanba knew this must be the consciousness of the ancient earth vein tree.

But it was destined to be futile. Before these mutated Dao One Insects fully burrowed and initiated their complete transformation, the ancient earth vein tree could not detect the contamination within its body.

"It knows something is wrong with its body but cannot find the cause. As the condition worsens, fear and despair accumulate. The best strategy is to attack the mind; my master's plan is truly brilliant," Wang Xuanba sneered, feeling the time was right, and then commanded mentally.

The surging tide of dark shadow insect swarms, which were rapidly expanding, instantly froze. The Dao One Insects fell into a deep sleep, lurking within the body of the ancient earth vein tree.

The yellow earth vein power continued to wash over, seemingly suppressing the shadows. However, the blackness did not disappear; it remained settled at the bottom of the yellow.

Viewed macroscopically, it resembled a faint, dim spot added to the Azure Nether earth veins.

"My master said that earth veins ultimately affect countless living beings on the surface, and even slight changes can cause landslides and crustal shifts. If not handled properly, it could even incur the hostility of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao..."

Wang Xuanba did indeed faintly sense a disturbance in the will of heaven and earth just now. However, as the Dao One Insects went dormant, this disturbance quickly vanished.

"Interesting," Wang Xuanba narrowed his eyes and cảm nhận sâu sắc (perceived deeply) for a moment.

Then, without delay, he hastened to the next earth vein node. His goal was to plant sixteen such dark spots within the body of the ancient Azure Nether earth vein tree.

The plan proceeded smoothly.

Except for the last few times when the increasingly uneasy ancient tree spontaneously triggered violent earth vein surges, causing him minor injuries, all other insect swarm shadows were perfectly placed.

Even as the ancient earth vein tree struggled, sensing its predicament, it was ultimately ineffectual. Instead, it caused the speed of the Dao One Insect swarm's diffusion within the earth veins to skyrocket, and the dark spot was noticeably larger than in other areas.

Half a month later, Wang Xuanba, having perfectly completed his mission, returned to the Sacred Capital.

In the Sacred Emperor's Throne Hall, several of Li Ping's disciples were already waiting.

Wang Xuanba was slightly surprised. These fellow disciples, each diligently cultivating according to their master's teachings, rarely had the chance to meet. Some, he had never even seen, only hearing that his master had taken them as disciples. He hadn't expected them all to gather today.

"It seems my master is finally making a major move," Wang Xuanba became somewhat excited.

He strode to the Sacred Emperor, knelt on one knee, and reported his mission progress.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor lightly waved his hand, helping Wang Xuanba to rise.

"Well done."

Wang Xuanba, who rarely heard praise from the Sacred Emperor, puffed out his chest.

"With sixteen swarms of Dao One Insects planted, the ancient earth vein tree is doomed. Which of you will subdue this tree for your master?" Li Ping then asked calmly.

All six disciples in the hall spoke in unison: "Your disciple is willing to share your master's burden!"

Li Ping looked at his disciples, all speaking with genuine sincerity, and nodded with satisfaction.

There were three men and three women among the six disciples.

They were Sun Erlang, Su Yuqing, Wang Xuanba, Lin Ling, Ou Shangtian, and the Dao page Liu Li.

The first five had been disciples of Li Ping for some time, meticulously trained. Dao page Liu Li, however, was a sudden decision made by Li Ping after discovering the miraculous nature of Cat Treasure.

Li Ping himself harbored no ill intentions, merely planning to nurture Liu Li and then use her special connection with the Fishing Pond to obtain more treasures from it. Li Ping's heart was sincere, and he frankly confessed his intentions. Dao page Liu Li, being highly sensitive to people's emotions, gradually accepted and grew accustomed to her master's presence after sensing Li Ping's frankness.

With Zhong Shentong constantly nagging her to obey the Sacred Emperor's orders, and Bai Hua Daoist occasionally giving Liu Li extra lessons, this young Dao page's progress was surprisingly the fastest among all the disciples.

Speaking of Zhong Shentong, since arriving in the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, he had completely settled into his preferred lifestyle of extreme relaxation. The continuously increasing Spirit Qi concentration in the Sacred Dynasty allowed him to live comfortably for several more decades without any cultivation breakthroughs, so he decided to completely slack off and stop cultivating.

With the Sacred Emperor's special permission, he spent his days contentedly casting his line in the Fishing Pond, truly living a life that others envied.

Returning to the Sacred Emperor's Throne Hall, the disciples were eager to face the Sacred Emperor's tasks.

Li Ping, however, had already made up his mind.

"Lin Ling, accompany Xuanba on this task. If the ancient tree is sensible, then so be it. But if it stubbornly resists..."

Li Ping smiled: "You may replace it."

Lin Ling, the wood spirit manifestation from the Spirit Wood Realm, having been enlightened by Li Ping, had been conquering other pocket worlds for the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty in this life. The palpable killing intent she exuded, without any concealment, made Lin Ling the most awe-inspiring existence among Li Ping's six disciples.

Li Ping entrusting the mission to her met no objection from the others.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor levitated a wheel-shaped magical artifact and bestowed it upon Lin Ling: "With this wheel, you can freely control the Dao One Insects. With the insects having reached such a critical stage, the ancient earth vein tree should have no room for resistance. However, be on guard against desperation tactics..."

After a few final instructions, Li Ping watched Lin Ling and Wang Xuanba depart from the Sacred Emperor's Throne Hall.

A brief silence fell upon the hall.

Ou Shangtian, mustering his courage, asked: "Master, that matter you mentioned earlier that you were going to entrust to me..."

Li Ping smiled slightly: "It will be soon. Prepare yourself."

The remaining three disciples also turned their gazes towards him.

Sun Erlang, as Li Ping's eldest disciple, had long been assisting in managing the affairs of the Sacred Dynasty. He knew his master had been planning for a long time, and this sudden move would surely not be for a single matter.

"Erlang," Li Ping said, as expected.

"Your disciple is here."

"Go to the Five Elders Council on my behalf."

Sun Erlang froze instantly.

He had anticipated many possible subsequent conquests but had never expected his master to send him to the Five Elders Council.

This name was unfamiliar to most people in the Sacred Dynasty. Sun Erlang had only learned a little about it from Yi Shu previously.

"Ask them if they know anything about what happened to the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate in those days."

Li Ping projected an image into Sun Erlang's mind.

"Eastern Extreme?" Sun Erlang had not heard this name before. But bearing the title of a Heavenly Venerate, his strength must be in the Longevity Realm.

Therefore, when Sun Erlang saw the image in his mind, even with his resolute "two-lifetime" mindset, he couldn't help but tremble all over.

Li Ping, unconcerned by Sun Erlang's reaction, accepted the instructions: "The Five Elders Council is different from the Myriad Immortals Alliance; Heavenly Venerate power encompasses the entire territory, governing through division. When you go there, proceed to the territory of the [True Heavenly Venerate]. As for the other Heavenly Venerates, do not provoke them..."

Sun Erlang firmly kept his master's instructions in mind.

Like Lin Ling, Sun Erlang also received a bestowed treasure before departing.

"With the Dao-Melting Stone in your possession, it is already your greatest treasure. Relying on external objects would be a deviation from the path," Li Ping said, slowly presenting a radiant, crystalline stone to Sun Erlang.

In his sea of consciousness, the Dao-Melting Stone suddenly emitted an unprecedented blue light, and a greedy, restless desire surged like a flood.

The longing from his soul compelled Sun Erlang, and he was unwilling and unable to suppress it.

"Another Dao-Melting Stone? And its quality is even better than the one in my sea of consciousness! At least mid-grade or higher." Sun Erlang was overjoyed.

Having accompanied Yi Shu of the Grand Origin Sect for a long time in the Sacred Dynasty, Sun Erlang understood the preciousness of Dao-Melting Stones in this world. Very few remained, and they were mostly occupied by cultivators with deep fortunes; outsiders could not find them. Yet now, his master was actually presenting him with a mid-grade one...

Sun Erlang immediately kowtowed to thank his master.

The joy in his heart directly dispelled the fear that had arisen from the matter of the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate.

"Absorb it slowly; the sublimation of the Dao-Melting Stone will lead to a comprehensive improvement of your abilities. Of course, to unleash the full potential of the Dao-Melting Stone, it might require the combination of other rare items."

Li Ping's imposing voice echoed in the hall: "The foundation of the Five Elders Council stems from the Myriad Immortal Sects of the past. They exist in name but not in reality, holding countless treasuries within. You may invite Yi Shu of the Grand Origin Sect to accompany you on this journey."

"I obey my master's command," Sun Erlang nodded and stepped away.

Among his disciples, Li Ping held the most special affection for Sun Erlang. This appointment, besides truly wanting to leverage external forces, was also because Li Ping vaguely sensed Sun Erlang's destined opportunities. This premonition was quite mysterious, not derived from known sufficient information, but rather like the intuition a cultivator experiences just before a breakthrough.

Dao page Liu Li, seeing her senior brothers and sisters receive treasures, couldn't help but look on with anticipation, her large eyes fixed on Li Ping.

Su Yuqing, however, was the most composed among them. Perhaps it was because the child in her belly had not yet been born.

Su Yuqing recalled her master's words previously: "The fetus you carry is, in fact, the manifestation of this small world's Heavenly Dao. This realm faces destruction, and thus seeks a sliver of hope through your body. However, even with the Heavenly Dao of the small world in your stead, you are still mortal, your body too frail. Even if you are fortunate enough to give birth to this child, she will struggle to grow, and you will die. Unless you cultivate with me..."

Since that day, Su Yuqing had accompanied him to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

As her cultivation realm increased, the weakness of her body gradually disappeared, and the fetus in her belly slept more peacefully.

However, her master had said that the stronger her cultivation was at the time of childbirth, the higher her daughter's future achievements would be. As a mother, Su Yuqing's instinctive drive for cultivation and realm advancement ranked first among the six disciples.

She harbored no particular strong desire for conquest or earning merit.

Li Ping's divine sense focused on the two individuals in the hall who had not yet been assigned specific tasks, remaining silent for a long time.

Sensing something, Dao page Liu Li's heart fluttered, and she directly lowered her head, retracting her expectant gaze.

"You two have compatible natures. Being together will be mutually beneficial. Moreover, due to your special physiques, you should not be exposed to excessive killing energy..."

"I have recently opened up a special small world. You two can help me there."

Hearing this, Dao page Liu Li's face immediately fell into a pout.

Perhaps it was because she was raised by Zhong Shentong that her disposition greatly resembled his. Without external force compelling her, she tended to be quite lax. Since Li Ping had taken her as a disciple, he naturally intended to correct this bad habit.

After Ou Shangtian departed, Liu Li and Su Yuqing followed Li Ping into the newly opened small world.

"Master Tiger, it's too dark here. Liu Li is a bit scared," Liu Li deliberately spoke with a lisp, sounding pitifully.

This was not Liu Li deliberately playing the victim, but rather this world was indeed different from ordinary small worlds; it lacked any trace of light. This was because Li Ping, along with Tianyang and Xu Ke, had jointly created this special world specifically for the Netherfolk.

"Yuqing, besides the darkness, do you sense any other differences here?" Li Ping asked gently, ignoring Liu Li's feigned distress.

The absolute darkness and serene silence caused the activity of Su Yuqing's unborn child to decrease, as if being hypnotized, gradually falling into slumber.

Su Yuqing, feeling her daughter's emotions, frowned after a moment and replied: "The Heavenly Dao of this small world... is incomplete? Or perhaps, there is none at all? To my eyes, it is merely a vast expanse of space. In my opinion, it doesn't even qualify as a world."

Su Yuqing's talent was indeed extraordinary; she sensed the anomaly here in moments.

Li Ping smiled: "You are only half correct. Initially, this place did have the consciousness of a small world's Heavenly Dao. Although very weak, it did exist."

Su Yuqing was stunned and was about to ask where the world's Heavenly Dao had gone.

Suddenly, a golden cube appeared before her. Blinding light illuminated the entire dark small world.

Upon sensing the somewhat familiar aura within the cube, Su Yuqing instinctively felt a surge of uncontrollable fear.

The fetus in her womb was startled awake and began to writhe restlessly.

This was because the golden cube contained the sealed consciousness of the world's Heavenly Dao, identical to her own essence!

"They all received gifts; you will not be without one," Li Ping said, naturally sensing Su Yuqing's fear.

"This place needs to be under my absolute control, and there is no need for the world's Heavenly Dao consciousness. Therefore, I stripped it away and sealed it."

"I am giving it to you now," Li Ping said calmly.

Chapter 1243: Drawing My Sword Against If Wood

The golden cube pulsed with brilliant light, and Li Ping's voice echoed for a long time in the pitch-black pocket world.

As the primal fear subsided, Su Yuqing felt an uncontrollable craving for the being sealed within the golden cube.

Even the fetus in her womb felt the same.

"In a sense, you are akin to the nascent Heavenly Dao of this world, which is still gestating and awakening. The method that I, your master, will impart to you, to slowly refine and absorb it, may be equivalent to several centuries of arduous cultivation."

As Li Ping's voice sounded again, a profound and wondrous technique also materialized in Su Yuqing's mind.

It seemed like a secret art, or perhaps a formation, or even a combination of both. It was incredibly profound, making it somewhat difficult for Su Yuqing to comprehend, even with her talent.

"This world holds significant meaning for me, your master, and for the entirety of Great Qi. After you devour and refine the Heavenly Dao consciousness of this world, you can then replace it and possess supreme authority within this pocket world. With your assistance in watching over this place, I can rest assured."

Only then did Su Yuqing suddenly understand as Li Ping spoke.

Although it was a laborious task, Su Yuqing was naturally a person of tranquil temperament, devoid of excessive worldly desires. Furthermore, cultivating by becoming the Heavenly Dao here would likely be the fastest way for her to cultivate, and it would also be immensely beneficial for her daughter.

"I respectfully obey my master's command," Su Yuqing took a deep breath.

"Master, I don't want to be here either! It's so dark here!" the Dao page, Liu Li, shook her head frantically.

Li Ping clearly would not indulge her.

Flicking his finger to tap Liu Li's forehead, Li Ping said sternly, "Light and darkness are two sides of the same coin. Without darkness, the existence of light loses its meaning. And vice versa. As a Glazed Wisdom Fruit, cultivation is effortless for you. But this is also your fatal flaw..."

Liu Li seemed to understand yet not understand, widening her eyes to listen. Her intuition told her that her rather terrifying master was not lying.

"Your progress is rapid, but compared to human cultivators, your upper limit is naturally restricted. To break through this limit, one must draw from the principles of 'Glazed' and the principles of 'Wisdom.' And from both of these, you can gain something here."

"You are the youngest among my disciples, so you won't be lacking in gifts."

Another ball of light appeared in Li Ping's hand. It was not a seal like the golden cube before, but a pure aggregation of energy.

The Dao page Liu Li subconsciously licked her lips, feeling as though her stomach had growled the moment she saw this ball of light.

She reached out to try and grasp it, but the ball of light was ethereal, not entering her palm. Liu Li was extremely annoyed, waving her hands continuously, but all was in vain.

With the most exquisite delicacy before her, yet unable to eat it, Liu Li was almost reduced to tears from sheer grievance.

"Master..." Liu Li looked up at Li Ping with wide, expectant eyes.

Li Ping smiled, "This mass of Primal Force Essence has two layers of restrictions attached by me. Only when you achieve any breakthrough in either wisdom or glaze will the restrictions be lifted."

"And after you break through your limits, this energy will also help you completely stabilize your new form after the transformation."

The Dao page Liu Li stared intently at the ball of Primal Force Essence and nodded vigorously.

"The Heavenly Dao is impartial, treating all beings as straw dogs. As you control this world, adhere to the principle of nature. You should remain aloof; for the events that occur among mortal lives, unless absolutely necessary, it is best not to personally intervene."

Li Ping's voice continued unabated, and his figure abruptly shattered, disappearing from this world.

Su Yuqing recalled her master's usual demeanor in front of the citizens of Great Qi and fell into deep thought.

"Netherfolk?" Su Yuqing began to examine the vast amounts of information her master had transmitted into her mind.

As for the Dao page Liu Li, she eagerly scanned her surroundings, anxious to find where the path to breaking through her limits lay, as her master had described.

...

Xuanhuang Realm.

Wang Xuanba had now returned to the underground of Yueyang Prefecture.

Lin Ling was with him.

Lin Ling idly played with the rotation artifact Li Ping had gifted her, appearing somewhat disinterested in the mission to subdue the Earth Vein Ancient Tree.

"Junior Sister, can we begin now?" Wang Xuanba, somewhat intimidated by his serious-faced junior sister, asked cautiously.

"No rush, let's wait a little longer," Lin Ling shook her head.

"Wait? Wait for what?" Wang Xuanba was somewhat taken aback.

From his senses, many of the sixteen dormant insect swarms had already awakened from their seals and were beginning to stir.

"Master said to give it a chance. If it remains stubborn, it won't be too late to act then," Lin Ling frowned, still explaining patiently.

"Then I'll listen to Junior Sister," Wang Xuanba said with a grin.

The two stood silently in the earth veins for nearly half a day. Suddenly, Wang Xuanba once again sensed the immense consciousness of the Earth Vein Ancient Tree sweeping past them.

However, unlike before, this time the Earth Vein Ancient Tree did not directly ignore them but lingered for a long time.

Wang Xuanba caught a glimpse of Lin Ling putting away the rotation artifact in her hand, her expression becoming serious.

It seemed she was communicating with someone.

Wang Xuanba did not disturb their conversation, though his heartstrings were already taut. As long as Lin Ling conveyed a thought, he would cooperate to unleash all the Dao One insect swarms.

Initially, Lin Ling seemed to be having a normal conversation with the Earth Vein Ancient Tree, even showing a slight smile on her face at times.

But without any warning, Lin Ling's complexion suddenly changed.

With a stern brow, she exclaimed, "I spoke with you openly just now because I considered you my kin. Why then do you speak such wild words, advising me to rebel?!"

"The methods of my master are not something that a mere decaying ancient tree like you can fathom!"

Wang Xuanba received Lin Ling's telepathic message, also letting out a cold laugh. He then awakened the dormant insect swarms in this location, beneath Yueyang Prefecture.

Like black shadows from a breached dam, they surged forward, unstoppable, flowing like an unbridled torrent.

Visibly, the surrounding yellow earth veins were instantly dyed black. A sharp, explosive sound faintly emanated from underground, only to be drowned out by the surging swarm of insects.

"How does it feel to lose a tentacle?" Lin Ling's eyes glinted with killing intent.

"It would be easy for me to sever a thousand or a hundred of your tentacles."

Wang Xuanba, understanding her intent, cooperated by awakening fifteen more insect swarms, while still controlling them as a deterrent.

The entire Xuanhuang Realm trembled almost imperceptibly. This was due to the Earth Vein Ancient Tree's fear causing the overall earth vein flow to go haywire.

The illusionary figure of a hunched old man appeared before Wang Xuanba and Lin Ling.

He looked at Lin Ling with a terrified expression. Simultaneously, his voice carried a hint of anger as he questioned, "I offered my genuine good intentions, why do you harm me?!"

Wang Xuanba scrutinized the rather lewd-looking old man before him, finding it difficult to associate him with the legendary ancient tree that controlled the earth veins of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Facing the Earth Vein Ancient Tree's accusation, Lin Ling merely scoffed, "Good intentions? I have followed my master for only a few years, and not only did I successfully transform from a ignorant and weak consciousness into a physical form, but I have also achieved my current considerable cultivation."

"How long have you been cultivating? To kill you is but a matter of a single thought!" Lin Ling's cold gaze locked onto the Earth Vein Ancient Tree, the rotation artifact behind her suddenly appearing and spinning incessantly.

The insect swarms within the earth veins seemed to sense something, responding in unison with greater agitation. Even without collectively breaking free from their seals, those fifteen shadowy masses suddenly grew by a considerable margin.

"Let's talk things out properly, let's talk things out," the hunched old man stammered in panic.

Lin Ling ignored him, continuing her aggressive onslaught, "Your Mother Tree is not my Mother Tree. Your so-called 'abandoning darkness for light' is, in my eyes, ruining my Dao path!"

"Those who obstruct my Dao shall face unending enmity!" Lin Ling roared. Wang Xuanba chuckled and, as if on cue, released the restraint on another swarm of insects.

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree's expression drastically changed. Before it could even speak, one of its legs seemed to be suddenly broken, causing its entire form to lose balance and stumble to the ground.

"Misunderstanding! It is truly a misunderstanding! The Mother Tree is the source of all life in the world, not just for us wood spirits, but even for humans..."

Before the Earth Vein Ancient Tree could finish speaking, it was interrupted by the explosion of another swarm of insects. This time, it was another leg. The hunched old man looked up in distress, his panic evident.

"The source of all life in the world? Where is it now?" Lin Ling's words were filled with disdain.

"Even if what you say is true, so what?"

Lin Ling strode forward, walking in front of the Earth Vein Ancient Tree.

"Compared to my master..."

"You are nothing but mere trash!"

Lin Ling stomped her foot fiercely on the Earth Vein Ancient Tree.

The illusory old man let out a wail. Although some of its body had been eroded by the Dao One insects, even with its remaining strength, it should not have been completely unable to resist. But the Earth Vein Ancient Tree did not struggle.

Because the old man knew that what this young kinsman before him was saying was not untrue.

"What are these things..." the Earth Vein Ancient Tree outwardly seemed to have completely submitted, yet in secret, it was attempting to neutralize the bizarre black energy.

But this power was utterly unlike anything it had ever known in the Xuanhuang Realm, leaving it completely helpless.

"If several disciples possess such methods, then their master must be an extraordinary being. Could it be some ancient mighty figure from antiquity? We have no enmity, so why would they suddenly attack me? Could it be to target..." The Earth Vein Ancient Tree was filled with doubt, countless thoughts flashing through its mind.

Lin Ling did not give the Earth Vein Ancient Tree much time to ponder.

"The wise submit to circumstances. Given that we are both wood spirits, I will grant you an opportunity. Submit to our Sacred Dynasty Great Qi!"

"Otherwise, I shall reluctantly take your place as the Earth Vein Ancient Tree!" Lin Ling said coldly, her killing intent palpable.

As she spoke, verdant green roots extended from her lower body, like countless tentacles, surging into the torrent of black insects.

Pure greenness spread from Lin Ling's lower limbs, rapidly dyeing the blackness green.

Now in control of the imitation Beast Transformation Wheel, Lin Ling had merged with the insect swarm. She was the swarm, and the swarm was her.

Wherever the black torrent of Dao One passed, it became a place where her will reached, becoming a part of her body.

If, previously, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree had a chance to reclaim the bodies infiltrated by the Dao One insects—if it could find a method to exterminate all the Dao One insects and then continuously flush them with the power of the earth veins.

But now, the part occupied by Lin Ling...

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree's face slowly turned extremely pale.

It had completely lost the perception of a part of its own body. It even felt that beside its original body, there was now an ill-intentioned existence.

Ready to swallow the remaining part of it at any moment!

This feeling was truly chilling, further confirming that Lin Ling's words were not unfounded.

Time was running out...

This thought flashed through the Earth Vein Ancient Tree's mind.

However, pledging allegiance to this so-called Sacred Dynasty Great Qi meant betraying its father.

If Wood's sinister face suddenly appeared before the Earth Vein Ancient Tree, causing the tree to tremble involuntarily.

The desire to surrender that had initially surfaced instantly vanished.

Just as the Earth Vein Ancient Tree was caught in indecision, it faintly sensed a peculiar intention from Lin Ling.

"Hmm?"

After carefully savoring it, and recalling If Wood's increasingly frenzied demeanor recently, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree finally made a decision.

"This old one..."

Lin Ling glanced at it slightly. The Earth Vein Ancient Tree paused and changed its words, "I, am willing to surrender to the Sacred Dynasty."

Wang Xuanba eyed the ancient tree with suspicion. Lin Ling, however, instructed, "Then come with us to meet Master."

Giving it no room to refuse.

Sensing the still menacing insect swarms within its body, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree could only reluctantly agree.

Its form solidified from illusion to reality, appearing rather disheveled.

It followed obediently behind Wang Xuanba and Lin Ling.

There were no particular incidents along the way, and they arrived within Great Qi's pocket world.

The unfathomable auras emanating from various places made the ancient tree tread on thin ice, trembling with apprehension.

If both disciples could subdue it so completely, then the Sacred Emperor of Great Qi was even more so.

Within the Sacred Emperor's Throne, the ancient tree's submission was, needless to say, absolute.

Apart from falling into the Sacred Emperor's golden web of Primal Force, losing its freedom of mind and body, and becoming a slave of Great Qi, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree also revealed everything it knew about If Wood.

Ultimately, it managed to save its own life.

The Sacred Dynasty thus officially gained the method to find If Wood's true form.

"Sacred Emperor on high, I have today revealed my father's aura, and he will surely sense it soon. Therefore, the key to success lies in speed." Having chosen to surrender, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree surrendered thoroughly and actively offered advice to Li Ping.

"You speak truly. Thus, I am already on my way."

Li Ping's voice came from above, but what astonished the Earth Vein Ancient Tree was that the Faceless Sacred Emperor's figure was slowly fading and disappearing.

And it hadn't even detected when he had left.

"The Sacred Emperor's strength is indeed unfathomable, even surpassing Father..."

"Hmph, that old madman is in for a treat now."

For some reason, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree began to anticipate it.

Meanwhile, outside the Sacred Emperor's Throne,

Wang Xuanba looked at Lin Ling, wanting to speak but hesitating.

"Just say what you want to say. If you keep looking at me like that, I'm afraid I'll be unable to resist drawing my sword."

Lin Ling's sudden words startled Wang Xuanba.

Scratching his head, Wang Xuanba looked at his junior sister. No longer hesitating, he asked, "Just now, at the critical moment of persuading the Earth Vein Ancient Tree to surrender, did Junior Sister say something to it?"

Lin Ling wore an expression of disdain, as if this was a trivial question.

"I merely told it that if it surrendered, I could form an alliance with it."

Chapter 1244

“Indeed, the identity of fellow kin is quite useful. I didn’t expect it to agree on the spot just because I casually mentioned it.”

“What?” Hearing Lin Ling's answer, Wang Xuanba’s expression changed.

“Alliance with that old thing? Junior Sister, are you serious?”

Bowing before the Earthly Vein Ancient Tree, Wang Xuanba felt a sense of disdain.

“It was merely a deceptive tactic. An alliance…”

“Does it deserve that?” Lin Ling’s tone was plain, yet the profound disregard in her words was evident.

“Now that it has joined the Sacred Dynasty, could it possibly go back on its word? If it dares to mention that before me…” Lin Ling coldly snorted.

Wang Xuanba was instantly stunned.

He, who had always placed some importance on promises, found it difficult to accept Lin Ling openly reneging on hers.

Seeing this, Lin Ling’s expression softened, and she smiled, “Senior Brother, in warfare, there are no absolute rules.”

“Towards enemies, if one were to strictly adhere to their words, wouldn’t that be considered foolish?”

Wang Xuanba was speechless.

“Besides, Senior Brother, do you remember what Master instructed us before we went to see the Earthly Vein Ancient Tree?” Lin Ling asked again.

“Of course, I remember. Master said that if the Ancient Tree remained stubborn, Junior Sister could replace it,” Wang Xuanba recalled.

“The Earthly Vein Ancient Tree, its name is quite imposing. I had some expectations initially, but after seeing its appearance with my own eyes, I was only left with disappointment,” Lin Ling’s answer surprised Wang Xuanba.

“Weak, too weak. The greatest strength of the Earthly Vein Ancient Tree is the unity of its body with the Earthly Veins of the Xuanhuang Realm, allowing it to utilize the power of the Earthly Veins flowing throughout the Azure Nether. This is its characteristic and its advantage, but it also determines the upper limit for the Earthly Vein Tree. Furthermore, the Earthly Vein Ancient Tree’s body is too large; in the eyes of truly powerful individuals, it is riddled with flaws,” Lin Ling shook her head slightly.

“My dream is to become a figure like Master. If I were to truly become that so-called Earthly Vein Tree, although my strength would indeed leap forward in the short term, my future prospects would be completely cut off. I’m not that foolish.”

“I can only deceive that old thing into continuing its duties.”

Lin Ling rolled her eyes at Wang Xuanba, “Senior Brother, what kind of person do you think I am?”

Wang Xuanba gradually came to his senses, sheepishly rubbing his head and immediately apologizing, “I underestimated you, Junior Sister.”

He looked back at the Earthly Vein Ancient Tree within the Sacred Emperor's Seat and agreed, “Ancient treasures of the Xuanhuang Realm, though powerful, merely borrow the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. If the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao is strong, they naturally flourish. But if, like today, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao is trampled underfoot by figures like the Dharma-Preachers, they can only cling to existence, hiding in dark corners reminiscing about past glory.”

“I didn’t expect Senior Brother to be such a scholar. You speak so eloquently,” Lin Ling’s words, unsure if they were genuine praise or a subtle form of retribution, sarcasm, or mockery.

“I didn’t think so deeply; I simply wanted to become stronger.”

“Enough said, I’m going to cultivate. After swallowing some of that old thing’s body this time, I’ve indeed gained some benefits. If only I had been more ruthless and swallowed more back then,” Lin Ling’s voice, tinged with regret, echoed in Wang Xuanba’s ears.

A moment later, her figure slowly faded, her presence vanishing with it.

Wang Xuanba chuckled wryly, chiding himself for worrying too much.

…

In the Xuanhuang Realm, Tianyu Prefecture.

A renowned scenic spot of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

A chasm stretching for hundreds of miles meandered across the land, resembling a black scar.

Even before approaching, one could faintly sense the endless chill emanating from the rift.

The closer one got to the rift, the more rapidly the temperature dropped.

Even Golden Core cultivators found it difficult to endure the extreme cold for extended periods, unable to linger.

From the bottom of the rift’s abyss, faint azure light would periodically erupt.

This was the frigid, freezing air.

However, if one stood at the edge of the rift and looked down, they could see that within this icy abyss, countless lotus flowers composed of flames bloomed.

These were not cold flames but indeed fiery lotus blossoms.

Cold and heat, entirely contradictory, yet intertwined. In this icy abyss, they manifested simultaneously.

Li Ping, the Faceless Sacred Emperor of the Great Qi, suddenly appeared outside this wondrous scene of icy abyss and fiery lotuses.

Like the countless tourists who frequented this place, he stood quietly, gazing downwards.

“Spiritual essence converges, and creation is wondrous,”

After a long while, Li Ping couldn't help but sigh inwardly.

In his eyes, the scene here was actually different from what ordinary cultivators perceived.

The blue icy abyss, in reality, exuded a deep deathly aura.

It was pitch-black, suffocating.

And the blazing red fiery lotuses were pure white, radiating a vigorous life force.

What appeared to be the intertwining of cold and heat here was, in fact…

“Black abyss, white flowers; abyss of death, flowers of life.”

Li Ping stepped forward, his foot finding no purchase, and his figure rapidly plummeted into the black abyss.

However, his disappearance went unnoticed by the surrounding cultivators.

At this moment, from Li Ping's perspective, the surrounding scenery abruptly stretched and distorted.

Although the white flowers of life seemed not too far away, Li Ping had been falling for a long time, yet he had not grown any closer to them.

The entire space of the black abyss, as Li Ping descended, expanded and extended infinitely.

This brought with it a gradually increasing concentration of deathly aura.

Feeling the attempts of the surrounding deathly aura to contaminate him, Li Ping sneered inwardly, but he paid it little mind.

For an ordinary cultivator, even one at the Dao Integration realm, their lifespan would be significantly reduced under the influence of this black deathly aura.

But he, Li Ping, was the embodiment of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, a part of the Azure Nether laws. How could he, even an uncontrolled part, be harmed by it?

Since forcibly devouring the Azure Nether Malevolent Thoughts, Li Ping indeed felt that the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao seemed to have become somewhat distant.

However, Li Ping was confident that this was merely the innate reaction of the Heavenly Dao after devouring the malevolent thoughts.

After some time passed, the bond between him and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao would ultimately be restored to normalcy.

At present, although they were in a period of weak connection, it was not something that the deathly aura here could shake.

As expected, even without any protective measures, Sacred Emperor Li Ping was like an indestructible entity; the black deathly aura merely swirled around him.

It found no opening to penetrate.

Li Ping’s gaze penetrated the dense deathly aura, directly at the hundred flowers of life below.

“The boundary between life and death, the source of all spirits.”

“The Xuanhuang Realm has become this way, yet it merely hides in this secret place, clinging to survival…”

“What use are you!”

A killing intent surged from Li Ping, abruptly pushing back the deathly aura around him.

“Retreat!”

Li Ping let out a low roar, and the layers of deathly aura beneath him actually split open, creating a passage.

The space no longer extended, and Li Ping’s body floated, instantly passing through.

A dense surge of life force washed over him, the white flowers of life now within arm's reach.

The black clouds of death, circling above, lingered, refusing to dissipate.

Facing the profuse life force, Li Ping's heart was suddenly filled with a trace of solemnity.

Compared to pure deathly aura, an abundance of useless life force was, in fact, more like a lethal poison.

Because life force, in its essence, was a beneficial state.

As the embodiment of the Heavenly Dao, Li Ping could naturally enjoy the favor of heaven and earth.

He wondered how many years had passed since a cultivator not repelled by the world had come here.

The accumulated life force of thousands of years by the black abyss and white flowers now seemed to have finally found an outlet, surging madly towards Li Ping.

Even though he consciously tried to obstruct it, he could not withstand the sheer abundance of life force here.

A small portion inevitably flowed into Li Ping's body.

Life force did indeed bring certain benefits.

But Li Ping was not a cultivator who relied solely on his own cultivation to reach the Longevity Realm.

Essence of Primal Force, Sacred Dynasty's destiny, Heavenly Dao's blessings…

It was the combination of various forces that had forged his current strength, comparable to the Longevity Realm.

Li Ping’s current state had long since reached a balance with his advancement.

Now, this balance was slowly being broken as the endless life force poured in.

Li Ping’s hair, as if alive, began to grow wildly.

In just an instant, it spread to his ankles.

His body swelled in kind.

Ten feet, twenty feet…

With the creaking of his bones, in a few breaths, Li Ping transformed into a thirty-foot giant.

While it added to his majesty, it was not a good thing for the current Li Ping.

Frowning slightly, he made every effort to convert and absorb the surging life force.

However, the rate of shrinking was far slower than the rate of growth.

While maintaining the balance of various forces within his body, Li Ping observed his surroundings, searching for a method to enter Ruo Mu's hiding place.

Since devouring the Azure Nether Malevolent Thoughts, there was little in the Xuanhuang Realm that could escape his notice.

Even if the memories of the malevolent thoughts were somewhat blurred, as long as he saw it with his own eyes, he would be able to sense it again quickly.

With a flicker of movement, Sacred Emperor Li Ping vanished into the depths of the black abyss.

Deprived of a target for its outpouring, the life force immediately became somewhat lost. The white flowers swayed slightly, only able to draw the life force back.

In a world filled with a strange aura, like withered, faded yellow leaves.

Li Ping, with his nearly fifty-foot-tall body, suddenly appeared within it.

The boundless life force he carried poured out from within him and spread around.

But in this peculiar environment, it seemed unable to propagate.

Soon, like autumn leaves falling, it transformed into withered yellow solids and drifted from the air.

The unwanted life force found an outlet, and Li Ping gradually expelled the culprit that had caused the imbalance from his body.

His physique slowly began to shrink.

However, due to the change in his internal balance during that brief period, some details of his body did not revert but instead became part of his physical characteristics.

For instance, his height stabilized at thirty-three feet, his ink-black hair cascading to his waist.

His physique also became more robust, with explosive strength contained beneath his golden robes.

Li Ping did not pay particular attention to these changes.

They were merely external appearances; he could revert to his original form at any time if he wished.

At this moment, his attention was focused on this peculiar place.

The scent of decay flowing here even made him feel somewhat uncomfortable.

What drew his attention even more was the center of this place.

A towering tree, yet completely withered and covered in spots, stood silently.

Li Ping, the thirty-foot giant, was like an ant at the foot of the colossal tree.

Its withered branches were densely laden with countless cultivators.

Like fruits hanging from a tree.

They all had their eyes closed, their faces displaying bizarre, contented expressions.

Li Ping’s gaze swept across, and besides this withered ancient tree, he found no other figures.

“So, only the main body is here…”

Li Ping knew that Ruo Mu also had a manifestation that often lured cultivators to this place, turning them into Golden Core fruits to vent its inner resentment.

It seemed to be out at the moment.

Li Ping was not in a hurry and continued to meticulously observe this space.

On the towering trunk, faint, deep carvings could be seen, as if it had suffered a fatal wound.

Li Ping narrowed his eyes, attempting to awaken the connection between this celestial being and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

However, perhaps due to the encroachment of the withered state, Li Ping’s call received no response at all.

Instead, it provoked the ancient tree's spontaneous defense.

Speckled withered yellow, following the tree's veins, began to erode from the ground beneath Li Ping's feet.

Li Ping deliberately lowered his defenses, absorbing a trace of the withered yellow into his body.

He wrapped it in the Essence of Golden Origin Force to prevent its spread and then observed it closely.

Although the power of the withered yellow was peculiar, it could not break the seal of the Essence of Origin Force.

From this withered yellow power, Li Ping not only sensed the usual sense of aging.

He also sensed what seemed to be the decay of the entire world.

It was as if heaven was about to collapse, with a palpable sense of decline that could not be reversed.

“This is…”

“The world is heading towards ruin.”

Countless scenes flashed through his mind: depictions of various prefectures in the Xuanhuang Realm suffering countless calamities due to the decay of heaven and earth.

But Li Ping knew that in reality, these prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm had not experienced the events that should have occurred.

“Ruo Mu is the source of all spirits in the Xuanhuang Realm; to a certain extent, it reflects the vitality of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Now that Ruo Mu has become like this, yet the Xuanhuang Realm still appears vibrant…”

Li Ping frowned slightly.

Soon, he understood the reason.

“Without the injection of external life force, the Xuanhuang Realm would undoubtedly decay in sync with Ruo Mu.”

“The source of this life force is…”

“The remnants of other cultivation realms that were devoured.”

“Although they were dismembered, during the fusion process, the remaining life force was also extracted from those cultivation realm fragments.”

“And thus, the Azure Nether was reborn…”

Li Ping mused.

“This surgery was indeed exceptionally ingenious.”

As the embodiment of the Heavenly Dao, and nominally the victim, Li Ping couldn't help but express his heartfelt admiration upon realizing what had truly occurred over these millennia.

“Life and death are impermanent. Birth and death are impermanent.”

“I was originally an existence that controlled life and death, yet now I have fallen into such a state.”

“The world is abandoning me; how can I not resent it…”

As Li Ping was contemplating, a strange voice suddenly sounded from behind him, without a trace of warning.

Li Ping knew that the owner of the voice was Ruo Mu.

Chapter 1245

"Heaven and Earth have the Ruo Tree, consuming life and longevity day and night."

"Life and death have no reincarnation, only longevity remains..."

Li Ping was not startled by the sudden appearance of the Ruo Tree. Instead, he slowly recited these words as he turned around, facing the Ruo Tree, the most ancient tree in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Ruo Tree scrutinized the Faceless Sacred Emperor, a flicker of confusion in its ancient eyes.

Li Ping's next words, however, caused the lines on the Ruo Tree's face to deepen into a frown.

"Your creation was bestowed by Heaven and Earth. Without the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's favor, the so-called [Eternal Existence] would merely be an ordinary great tree."

"The Heavenly Dao is in peril, yet you do not rise to its defense, merely clinging to life in this world..."

"You betrayed the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao first, not the other way around." Li Ping's words were devoid of sympathy, his mockery direct.

The Ruo Tree's ancient visage froze, unmoving.

Nearby, the Ruo Tree's main body, an ancient tree, rustled its leaves and branches. The countless cultivator fruits hanging from it swayed in response.

"Rise to its defense? The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao has been suppressed, what could I have done? Conversely, you, a cultivator, devour the Heavenly Dao to cultivate. Do you not find your words laughable?" The Ruo Tree gazed at Li Ping for a long time, unable to discern his true nature.

However, cultivators of the world were all fundamentally similar.

Coupled with the subtle Aura of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao clinging to Li Ping, the Ruo Tree made its judgment and retorted.

Yet, it merely exchanged verbal barbs, refraining from direct action.

This was not because the Ruo Tree had a sudden change of heart or improved its temper, but rather...

It was utterly outmatched.

Though not outwardly expressed, the Ruo Tree's spiritual senses were screaming warnings. As the most ancient spiritual entity in existence, its intuition had reached a point of profound mystery, almost allowing it to glimpse future possibilities.

The Ruo Tree was certain that if it were to fight this uninvited guest, it would be the one to perish.

The oppressive aura emanating from Li Ping, even stronger than that of any Longevity Realm cultivator it had encountered, further solidified its conviction.

Indeed, the Ruo Tree was now in a state of terminal decline, greatly damaged. However, it was still alive.

It had no intention of seeking its own demise.

"What wrong have I done in reclaiming my own possessions?" Li Ping no longer suppressed his aura, releasing the suppressed Azure Nether Malevolent Intent he had devoured.

"What is this?!" The Ruo Tree's heart trembled violently.

It could naturally distinguish between the fragmented laws absorbed by cultivators and the complete Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

But how was this possible?

"Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate?" The thought flashed through the Ruo Tree's mind, but it was quickly dismissed.

Even with most of its power lost, its deep connection to the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao remained. If a new Great Heavenly Venerate had succeeded, it would not have been unaware.

"Reclaiming one's possessions... could it be the Heavenly Dao itself?" The Ruo Tree thought, finding it hard to believe.

This speculation was indeed incredible, yet it was the most plausible explanation.

While it couldn't be definitively confirmed, this did not prevent the Ruo Tree's attitude from shifting dramatically.

"What brings you here?"

Li Ping, as a matter of course, revealed his intention to reclaim the Ruo Tree's power.

Without waiting for the Ruo Tree's reaction, Li Ping changed the subject: "When the Heavenly Dao faced danger, the ancient entities of Azure Nether stood by, indifferent. Therefore, the Heavenly Dao instinctively began to repossess your powers."

"Although external forces aided the Heavenly Dao's recovery, this process of reacquisition did not cease. Everything is predetermined, as one sows, so shall one reap. You have no cause for resentment."

"I am here to bring about a complete end."

Li Ping's gaze returned to the towering, decaying ancient tree.

And the countless Golden Core cultivators trapped upon it.

"However, it seems you have not been entirely inactive. Even if it was merely a drop in the ocean, you did contribute."

A majestic golden force erupted from Li Ping.

A colossal golden palm appeared instantly near the Ruo Tree's main body, gently plucking one of the cultivator fruits from the treetop.

With a gentle squeeze, the cultivator's body turned to ash, leaving behind only an incomplete Golden Core suspended in mid-air.

Li Ping's action of plucking his "fruit" did not cause the Ruo Tree's emotions to fluctuate in the slightest.

Only a flicker of vindictive satisfaction flashed through its eyes instinctively.

"Do you believe the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm today are at fault?"

The Empty Chamber Blooming Flowers space fell silent for a moment, then Li Ping suddenly asked.

"More than at fault! I wish I could turn all these ungrateful wretches into fruits, to suffer for eternity." The Ruo Tree finally responded with bared teeth.

"While cultivators in the world may indeed have their shortcomings, the root of their conflict with Heaven and Earth is the fundamental issue." Li Ping spoke calmly.

"Why do cultivators devour Heaven and consume Earth? It's simply because they have no other path. The origin of all this stems from that Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate."

Li Ping's voice echoed, and the Ruo Tree involuntarily fell silent.

Everyone understood this logic.

But what could be done?

The Doctrine Transmitter, who defied the laws of Heaven and Earth, was too powerful, to the point that the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao itself was unable to resist, let alone the beings within the Xuanhuang Realm.

"I wish to set things right, to slay the Doctrine Transmitter, and return the Dao to Heaven."

"Are you willing to assist me?"

Li Ping's cold voice reached the Ruo Tree's ears.

If anyone else had said this to the Ruo Tree, it would have simply chuckled and turned them into a fruit, hanging them from the highest branch to mock them day and night.

However, it was the potential embodiment of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao who made such a grand pronouncement...

This left the Ruo Tree momentarily unsure how to respond.

The Ruo Tree knew that if it refused, a fierce battle was inevitable.

Setting aside the question of who was stronger or weaker, simply by the fact that this was its main body's location, any destructive repercussions from a battle here...

Even if it won, it would undoubtedly be severely wounded, hastening its complete ruin.

Yet, being subdued by a single word left the Ruo Tree with a hundred degrees of unwillingness.

"Your decline, aside from your inherent injuries, is also related to the disruption of the Heavenly Dao's flow."

"If you pledge allegiance to me..."

Li Ping stepped forward, his form shattering. Empowered by the golden light enveloping him, his three-zhang-three-chi body instantly expanded tens of thousands of times, becoming almost as large as the Ruo Tree's main body.

He placed one hand on the Ruo Tree's trunk.

"Boom!"

In the Ruo Tree's space, a vortex suddenly appeared in the dim, dead sky.

A reflection of the Xuanhuang Realm emerged within the vortex.

A greenish aura was drawn out from the vortex, slowly drifting towards the withered and aged Ruo Tree.

"This..."

The Ruo Tree excitedly straightened its hunched back, its eyes filled with surprise and disbelief.

It felt the Heavenly Dao's favor, which had slowly waned over thousands of years, returning to it for the first time!

Li Ping was right. Its entire creation was derived from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's bestowed favor.

Without the Heavenly Dao's nourishment, it was like a tree without roots, water without a source, slowly drying up and entering a state of chronic death.

But at this moment, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, unprecedentedly, poured a sliver of its power back into it.

Even though it was not the Life and Death power it was accustomed to, it still stirred its emotions and breathed new life into it.

The withered Ruo Tree's main body, from top to bottom, trembled with great force.

Many cultivator fruits fell from above as a result, smashing into pieces. Only fragmented Golden Cores, gleaming with various lights, remained lying quietly on the ground.

Wisps of green emerged from the Ruo Tree's body.

Several tender green sprouts then appeared on the branches, and the entire ancient tree's aura transformed.

Just as the Ruo Tree was luxuriating in the surge of vital energy it had not felt for a long time...

The golden giant, Li Ping's transformed form, suddenly removed its hand from the tree trunk.

The vortex above the Ruo Tree abruptly vanished.

The heavenly green energy simultaneously dissipated like bubbles, turning into speckled green light that scattered in the wind, yet did not land on the Ruo Tree.

"No!"

Amidst the Ruo Tree's mournful cry, the newly born tender sprouts instantly withered and died.

They gently drifted down from the treetop.

"I want more!"

"Give it to me quickly!"

The Ruo Tree's elder avatar erupted with earth-shattering ferocity.

It glared malevolently at Li Ping.

Then, upon seeing Li Ping's featureless face and his bone-chilling aura, the Ruo Tree immediately calmed down.

Its fierce expression froze on its face, refraining from any further action.

Li Ping merely gazed at it calmly.

The scene became eerily silent for a moment.

Until a withered yellow leaf, falling perfectly above Li Ping, was gently caught by his outstretched hand.

Li Ping broke the silence, continuing the words he had not finished: "As you have seen and experienced."

"If you can find your way back and stand with me again, it is not impossible to return to your ancient peak."

The Ruo Tree's expression was clearly wavering.

After struggling for thousands of years, enduring untold torment, it had finally savored a moment of youthful vitality. To ask it to give that up now...

How could it possibly do so?

"I know that in ancient times, you suffered severe injuries, and a large portion of your core power was stolen by cultivators."

"But the current Azure Nether Heavenly Dao is not what it used to be."

"If you can regain your full authority, you will undoubtedly be stronger than before." Li Ping continued.

"I will give you one month to consider."

"I will return then."

Li Ping did not push the Ruo Tree too hard, making a swift decision.

Only leaving these words behind, he vanished without a trace.

This was the Ruo Tree's domain, yet it couldn't even detect how Li Ping had departed.

Without the intruder, the space reverted to the deathly silence it had maintained for thousands of years.

The Ruo Tree squinted, constantly savoring the taste of vitality it had just experienced.

Comparing it to its current state, a sense of profound loss welled up within it.

...

In the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi.

Within the Sacred Emperor's Seat, Li Ping, upon his return, immediately issued a sacred decree.

He would allocate more Netherfolk to the Sea of Darkness, using it to appease the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

"My actions have had some impact by forcibly channeling power from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao to the Ruo Tree in its current state."

"Even if it was just that sliver..."

"Besides the temporary void caused by devouring the Azure Nether Malevolent Intent, it is also related to the Ruo Tree's identity."

"After all, in the eyes of the Heavenly Dao, these ancient entities of Azure Nether are no different from traitors." Li Ping mused.

This operation was not entirely in vain.

The Ruo Tree, having tasted the sweetness, would certainly not refuse Li Ping's request.

It just needed some time to make its decision.

As for why he didn't choose to forcibly act, like with the Azure Nether Malevolent Intent, and simply devour it directly...

Li Ping had his reservations.

"Unlike the Azure Nether Malevolent Intent, which was separately extracted and sealed for a long time, the Ruo Tree, though dilapidated, has existed since the dawn of Azure Nether."

"The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao created it, and it became an integral part of the Xuanhuang Realm. If its favor was naturally withdrawn by the Heavenly Dao, leading to its decay and death, perhaps it could have avoided turmoil."

"But if I rashly devoured it, firstly, it would alert other Longevity Realm powerhouses in this realm."

"Secondly, the anomaly in the Xuanhuang Realm might be detected by the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, who is far away across the sea of stars."

Li Ping did not concern himself with those five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council.

However, he had to consider the existence of the Doctrine Transmitter and Heavenly Physician.

"It is not yet time to truly confront them."

"I will wait a little longer."

Li Ping possessed ample patience.

He believed that within a month, the Ruo Tree would proactively contact him.

Until then, he needed to try and mend some of his relationships with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

Various existences that provoked the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao reappeared in Li Ping's mind.

...

Nine Mountains Province.

On the border between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council.

Sun Erlang effortlessly passed through the defenses of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's border and entered the territory of the Five Elders Council.

"The treasure passed down by my master is indeed wondrous. This Myriad Immortals Alliance formation was broken almost instantly."

Sun Erlang carefully examined his surroundings.

"It seems no different from the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"However, my master said that this entire region is covered by the Heavenly Venerate's Counter-Law energy, so it's best to keep a low profile."

A simplified map appeared in his mind. Sun Erlang, after a moment of orientation, concealed his form and sped away. Following the instructions of the Faceless Sacred Emperor, he headed directly towards the Land of Truth.

"I wonder, how exactly does one meet this [True Heavenly Venerate]?" Sun Erlang pondered as he flew.

With the aura concealment provided by the formation and secret techniques passed down by Li Ping, no one could detect him along the way.

As he neared the Land of Truth, a nearby anomaly caught Sun Erlang's attention, forcing him to slow down.

A colossal flying boat, possessing a somewhat unreal quality, suddenly materialized in the sky.

From the flying boat, over ten cultivators clad in armor emerged in unison.

They wielded strange magic artifacts and were shouting loudly.

"This is it, quickly! We can't let other squads get there first!"

They landed above a patch of jungle and their magic artifacts simultaneously unleashed beams of light of different colors.

The beams locked onto a large, pure white ape that suddenly appeared in the jungle, letting out a sky-shattering roar.

Sun Erlang's pupils constricted.

This monstrous beast was hidden so skillfully that he hadn't sensed any trace of it before.

Moreover, even now, while the great ape was locked in fierce combat with the squad of cultivators, Sun Erlang couldn't sense any life aura from the beast.

Chapter 1246: Genesis of the Fruit Tree

Sun Erlang observed covertly as the cultivators from the Five Elders Council engaged in battle with the giant ape. A sense of solemnity gradually welled up in his heart.

"So strong..."

This was his assessment of the group of cultivators before him.

There were no Spirit Qi fluctuations, and the destructive range of their moves was confined to a specific space. Sun Erlang couldn't perceive their exact cultivation levels. However, judging solely by their coordinated combat and their composure in facing various dangers, their combat proficiency was unlike anything he had ever witnessed. Even when accounting for the encounters he had in the simulated world of the Dao-Melting Stone, this group of cultivators remained exceptionally top-tier.

What surprised Sun Erlang even more were their offensive and healing methods. Besides various magical artifacts, this group of cultivators occasionally used peculiar items. For instance, books, wine cups, and even necklaces. These items seemed to provide buffs to their allies while inflicting various negative effects on the giant ape. Furthermore, their healing speed was astonishingly fast. Newly developed cultivators, who housed their souls within grotto-heavens, needed at least a few breaths of time to regenerate after their physical bodies were destroyed. Yet, these individuals would recover instantaneously with a flash of white light, no matter how severe their injuries. One moment they were on the verge of death from the giant ape's attack, and the next, bathed in white light, they were as lively as ever.

Even with its tough hide and thick skin, the giant ape couldn't withstand such a sustained drain. It fought stubbornly, showing no signs of retreat. It battled until its very last breath, finally collapsing with a thud. The moment the giant ape died, it transformed into a dazzling golden light that surged into the cultivators who had slain it.

The group erupted in cheers.

"The boss that spawned this time was really tanky. Good thing we brought enough supplies, or we'd have definitely failed."

"We got a decent amount of combat experience. I'm close to breaking through to the next realm."

"It's a shame that its [Snow Ape Saint Armor] from the compendium didn't drop. Otherwise, we would have really struck it rich this time."

Upon hearing that, the rest of the team voiced their agreement and sighed. Sun Erlang, however, listened to their utterly incomprehensible words with a subtle expression.

"Let's go, there's nothing good around here anymore. Let's return to the Land of Bliss first."

"This Xuanhuang Realm really isn't a place for people to stay. If it weren't for the mission requirements, I wouldn't want to come here at all."

The cultivators filed into the ship hovering in the sky, chattering amongst themselves. The ship was enveloped in a multicolored light and, as if teleporting, vanished from the sky. Sun Erlang stared at the spot where they had departed, his Dao-Melting Stone in his mind replaying the recorded footage.

"Land of Bliss..."

"It should be within the territory of that Carefree Heavenly Venerate. It seems to be quite different from other places in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"They actually call the Xuanhuang Realm 'not a place for people to stay'... Interesting."

"This matter should probably be reported to my Master."

Sun Erlang thought this to himself but did not pursue the peculiar ship. Adhering to the mission assigned by his Master, he continued his journey toward the Land of Truth.

Three days later, after passing through a white mist barrier, Sun Erlang distinctly felt a change in the world around him.

"The region I was in earlier belonged to the Human Way Heavenly Realm. As for here, it should be the Land of Truth."

Sun Erlang knew that within the Land of Truth, under the dominion of the Heavenly Venerate's principles and laws, no cultivator could weave falsehoods. Therefore, he became even more careful and cautious. It was his first time here, and everything felt unfamiliar. Sun Erlang decided to scout the situation first before seeking a way to meet the Heavenly Venerate.

Compared to the Human Way Heavenly Realm, the Land of Truth appeared more peaceful. He rarely saw patrolling cultivators of the Five Elders Council. The boundary between mortals and cultivators within its borders was not particularly distinct. He could see them living together in the same cities from afar.

"Those are indeed mortals, without any cultivation. It seems the power of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma has been suppressed here."

After careful observation, Sun Erlang reached this conclusion. What made him feel even more novel was that status was not determined by cultivation level. He could even witness a young Golden Core cultivator respectfully bowing to an elderly mortal. It truly made him marvel.

He observed in secret for three days. Although he gained a general understanding of the customs and traditions of the Land of Truth, he still hadn't found a suitable breakthrough point.

"I can't just shout on the street that I'm here to see the True Heavenly Venerate, can I?"

Just as Sun Erlang was at a loss, he suddenly discovered a few outsiders who were like him.

"People from the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" Sun Erlang narrowed his eyes. After trailing them and eavesdropping for a while, Sun Erlang understood. These four cultivators were captives from the conflict between the Five Elders Council and the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and were currently in a probationary period as assimilated individuals. Their freedom was not restricted, and they were allowed to travel within the three regions of the Five Elders Council, excluding the Land of Bliss.

"Brother Xu, what do you think of the Five Elders Council compared to the Immortal Alliance?"

They were all dressed in conspicuous, uniform pale green robes resembling prison attire. One of them, a middle-aged man with a long beard, asked his companion. The cultivator named Xu seemed to be recovering from a serious injury, his face pale. He coughed lightly and replied, "Compared to the Immortal Alliance, it is indeed much more free and casual."

"Although we had to sign that soul contract, back in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, even without such a contract, we couldn't refuse any orders from the Alliance, could we? To me, there's no real difference."

Another young cultivator chimed in, "Moreover, once you sign the contract here, you lack nothing in terms of cultivation techniques and resources. As long as your talent is sufficient, there's endless room for development, and no one will hinder or suppress you. Unlike that Myriad Immortals Alliance, hmph..."

Although the long-bearded man's expression was somewhat unpleasant, he couldn't help but agree with their points.

"It seems Brother Wang Yang still harbors fantasies about the Myriad Immortals Alliance!" The cultivator named Xu sneered upon seeing Wang Yang's expression.

"Do you remember the Myriad Immortals Alliance? Does the Myriad Immortals Alliance remember you? I've never heard of any cultivator who was captured by the Five Elders Council and managed to escape back to the Immortal Alliance. Besides, even if you were lucky enough to escape, the Myriad Immortals Alliance would likely treat you as a spy and arrest you on the spot."

Wang Yang's expression shifted between gloom and clearness, but in the end, he could only sigh, unable to refute. The four of them fell into an awkward silence.

"Oh, right. When that elder introduced us to the situation of the Five Elders Council earlier, he mentioned that cultivators in each region here have a chance to directly meet the Heavenly Venerate. I wonder if it's true." The young cultivator spoke up to ease the tension.

"You can rest assured on that, Brother Zhang. I've inquired about it before, and it's absolutely true. However, the methods to meet the Heavenly Venerate in each place vary, and without exception, they are all extremely difficult. Only unparalleled prodigies can accomplish them."

"For example, in the One Heart Immortal Sect, those who achieve twenty consecutive victories in duels within the sect, and are unmatched, have a very high probability of being summoned before the One Heart Heavenly Venerate."

"And here, in the Land of Truth, it is said that as long as you sit under the True Fruit Tree and meditate on the Dao, the longer you persist, the greater your chance of receiving guidance from the Heavenly Venerate," the cultivator named Xu explained volubly.

"I've also attempted the test of the True Fruit Tree..." the cultivator named Xu said, deliberately pausing. As he watched the others' gazes converge on him, he continued, "Difficult! Difficult! Difficult!"

"As you all know, there are no lies in the Land of Truth. And the test of the True Fruit Tree is to weave as many lies as possible!" The cultivator named Xu's expression turned peculiar. "Sitting beneath the fruit, one becomes an omnipotent creator deity. You need to conjure something from nothing, fabricating a virtual, alternate world. The richer the details of the world, and the more realistic it is, the longer you can endure the fruit's scrutiny."

"Wait..." Wang Yang interrupted the cultivator named Xu, his brow furrowing. "Are there any restrictions on weaving worlds? Otherwise, wouldn't it be easy to substitute the unique aspects of the pocket worlds within the Xuanhuang Realm?"

The cultivator named Xu shook his head, "At the very least, pocket worlds that truly exist within the Xuanhuang Realm cannot be manifested in the fruit's illusion. It's a bit like... " He pondered for a moment and slowly said, "It's a bit like the Incompatibility of Laws. Mimicking a world by copying it will cause it to vanish the moment it takes shape. Only completely fabricated worlds can exist stably and withstand the fruit's test. It's a bit esoteric to describe in words, but you'll understand once you experience it yourself."

"Even if we ultimately cannot meet the True Heavenly Venerate, meditating under the True Fruit Tree is a great opportunity for us cultivators. Weaver worlds involves countless Daos. It is extremely difficult for a cultivator to do so with their own power. During the test, one relies more on the power of the fruit tree. It's like borrowing the Heavenly Venerate's brush to help us paint..." The cultivator named Xu's expression became distant, as if reminiscing about that magical experience.

"What is the purpose of the Heavenly Venerate doing this?" Wang Yang asked, frowning slightly.

The cultivator named Xu sneered, "Purpose? Why bother thinking about that? I only know that completing the test will not only result in no losses but also a high chance of comprehending the Dao and breaking through. Such a good thing, if it were in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, only a select few could enjoy it. But here, in the Five Elders Council, everyone has a chance to try."

"This True Fruit Tree sprouts from illusion and blooms in every city. Anyone interested can sit and meditate beneath the tree."

"This time, the fruit's blooming seems to be not far off. You can all experience it yourselves. If it weren't for the fact that each person only gets one chance in their lifetime, I would definitely try the opportunity of creation again," the cultivator named Xu said with a hint of regret. The other three had various expressions.

And Sun Erlang, who was eavesdropping from afar, narrowed his eyes.

"Such a coincidence? Just when I was dozing off, someone delivers a pillow? Could it be that I've been discovered? Is this some kind of conspiracy?" This thought flashed through Sun Erlang's mind first.

"No, it's probably because Master knew in advance that there are methods to directly meet the Heavenly Venerates in various regions of the Five Elders Council, which is why he sent me on this errand. Otherwise, under normal circumstances, what opportunity would an outsider cultivator have to see the highest ruler in the Longevity Realm?" Sun Erlang pondered for a moment and suddenly understood.

"The True Fruit, huh?" A thought flickered in Sun Erlang's mind. He had the Dao-Melting Stone in his mind, as well as his experiences in the simulated world reliving another life. Participating in this so-called creation under the fruit tree should give him some advantage.

"Let's try it first. If it doesn't work, then I'll think of other methods." With his plan settled, Sun Erlang patiently waited.

More than twenty days passed. One day, the peaceful city suddenly became somewhat chaotic. On the ground, a shadow rapidly spread from the center of the city, enveloping the entire city. Then, a lush, verdant tree sprang up from the shadow, appearing both real and illusory. On its branches, many tender, dewy fruits hung, captivating anyone who gazed upon them.

"The True Fruit Tree has appeared. It will remain for seven days and seven nights. All living beings within the territory can comprehend the Dao beneath the tree."

*Ding!*

A crisp bell chime echoed, spreading into the distance. The clear sound came from the sky, appearing in everyone's ears.

"Thank you, Heavenly Venerate, for your grace!" Countless living beings within the Land of Truth bowed in gratitude. Three times they chanted, their voices lingering. After the ceremonial rites concluded, cultivators began to walk under the True Fruit Tree's shadow, sitting with their eyes closed. The city instantly became very quiet, as if out of fear of disturbing the cultivators undergoing the trial.

The group of assimilated Myriad Immortals Alliance members that Sun Erlang had met earlier also slowly walked towards the True Fruit Tree. Sun Erlang quickly followed. Along the way, he didn't encounter any checks. The Heavenly Venerate's words that all living beings could try were indeed not empty boasts. Arriving beneath the tree's canopy, Sun Erlang even saw not just humans, but also some flying insects and beasts occupying a spot under the tree's shade. This peculiar scene made Sun Erlang feel a sense of emotion.

"It is said that the ancient Sages taught without discrimination. Not only humans, but all living beings in the world could receive their teachings. This True Heavenly Venerate, in a way, has that same spirit."

Sun Erlang, like the others, sat down on the ground. He closed his eyes. In an instant, Sun Erlang felt the world around him disappear. The faint rustling sounds that had been present in the city were now completely absent. Although his eyes were closed, Sun Erlang felt as if he had opened them. Before him was a vast expanse of white nothingness.

"Create a world..." Numerous rule-based information appeared in Sun Erlang's mind.

"First, the general outline of the world." Sun Erlang then proceeded to set it up according to the simulated world he had experienced in the Dao-Melting Stone. The blank world then gained color. However, to his surprise, as the world was about to take shape, it collapsed like a sandcastle, crumbling to pieces. It returned to blankness once more.

"Even a world adapted from the Xuanhuang Realm isn't acceptable?"

"A completely fictional world?" Sun Erlang couldn't help but frown slightly. However, an idea suddenly flashed in his mind. He recalled a world his Master had used as an example when teaching him. Instantly, an idea formed in his mind.

"The Immortal Path is hidden, only the material exists forever."

Chapter 1247

"The supernatural powers in the world have all vanished. A mortal's lifespan reaching a hundred years is the limit."

"However, humanity's eternal pursuit of the Dao remains unchanged."

"By studying, dissecting, and utilizing the laws, even mortals can unleash astonishing power."

...

A sphere suddenly appeared in the blank world before Sun Erlang.

The sphere rotated, and countless black dots representing humanity on its surface moved at an extreme speed.

Initially, the structures on the ground were only slightly over three meters high, but as time rapidly passed, more and more skyscrapers rose.

Soon after, even flying vehicles appeared amidst the clouds.

Sun Erlang, while weaving the world envisioned in his mind, recalled his master's teachings.

"The predicament of the Xuanhuang Realm is, in essence, the same as these worlds without supernatural powers. Ancient texts often speak of the eternal Immortal Path. This might be true."

"The so-called 'Immortals' are those who have exhausted the principles of the Dao and applied it to its absolute extreme. They stand at the pinnacle of all living beings, on par with the Dao, looking down upon all sentient life, immortal and undying."

"But what if the 'Dao' itself were to change?"

"The Dao is still the Dao. However, those who cannot adapt to the changed Dao will inevitably face extinction."

"Those who cannot harmonize with the Dao are no longer worthy of being called Immortals. They will fall."

"Among the vast multitude of beings, new 'Dao Users' will always emerge. The power they wield will also grow stronger."

"Becoming the new 'Immortals'."

...

At that time, the Faceless Sacred Emperor's words were enigmatic. Not only Sun Erlang, but none of the other direct disciples of the Sacred Emperor could comprehend his meaning.

However, at this moment, by the power of the Return to Truth Fruit, he was fortunate enough to experience the taste of a creator.

Sun Erlang looked at the world he had created before him and suddenly felt a realization. In that spherical world, after countless years of natural evolution, a race that resonated with the Dao of his created world would eventually emerge. They would discover the ultimate secrets of the world that other beings could not perceive, and thus become the so-called 'Dao Users' of that world.

*Boom!*

Sun Erlang's vision shifted rapidly, descending onto the sphere he had created. Within an ordinary building, a young scholar was frowning in thought under a lamp. Written across the blackboard before him were complex formulas and diagrams.

"No, no, no..."

"Where did it go wrong? Why are my calculated results so far off from the actual trajectory of movement?"

"It's as if some force is restraining us, preventing us from leaving this planet."

The scholar painfully tugged at his hair, then suddenly looked up at the window. In the pitch-black night, his gaze seemed to meet Sun Erlang's.

...

Sun Erlang's vision blurred, and the scene shattered. When he regained his senses, he was surprised to find that on the sphere, some spaceships were already attempting to breach the "world's boundaries."
