However, outside the world, Sun Erlang had not yet created anything; it remained empty. They would naturally not succeed.

Sun Erlang's thoughts turned rapidly, and he began to create a new map. The white space gradually darkened. In the starry expanse, besides the initial planet, thousands of other planets began to appear. The map's scope expanded more than a hundred thousandfold, and Sun Erlang's Dao-Melting Stone began to strain. To reduce the workload, Sun Erlang set most of these planets to be desolate, devoid of life, filled with an absolute stillness. Furthermore, to prevent the inhabitants of the original planet from expanding too quickly, he spaced each planet far apart—so far that without the power of longevity, it would take nearly a lifetime for any individual to cross between them.

...

With immense effort, Sun Erlang barely managed to save the world that was on the verge of collapse. However, before he could refine and expand the star map, the world became precarious again. After investigating, Sun Erlang realized that the indigenous people had begun to doubt the reality of their world. This was not only because they couldn't fly out of the world but also because they had observed the countless planets in the starscape that they hadn't seen before. These planets seemed to have appeared out of nowhere, shattering their understanding.

"One must not establish rules crudely, but rather root the phenomena of all things in the fundamental principles of the world."

This thought suddenly surfaced in Sun Erlang's mind. Soon after, he made the corresponding adjustments. Afterward, during another persistent attempt by the natives, one spaceship actually succeeded in breaking free from the planet's restraint and entered the starscape. The humans aboard discovered that outside the planet, there was a blue halo. It was this halo that interfered with observations from within the planet and prevented their previous attempts to break free. This was a groundbreaking discovery! After experiencing a life-or-death crisis, this spaceship finally returned to the surface and announced this discovery to the public.

And then, the scholars on the planet, after incorporating the star ring as a variable into their calculations, finally achieved a temporary consistency between theory and practice. The people cheered, welcoming the dawn of a new era. They also regarded the members of the first spaceship to fly into space as heroes. With this successful precedent, the inhabitants of the planet, previously suppressed, experienced a surge in their development speed. Fortunately, by this time, Sun Erlang had largely depicted the desolate starscape. Moreover, due to the vastness of the starscape he created, he temporarily stabilized these natives using space and time. But Sun Erlang knew this was merely a temporary measure. Sooner or later, they would perceive the abnormality of this starscape.

"If one does not wish to be discovered, one must continue to expand the starscape."

"And the rate of expansion must outpace the speed of these small beings' exploration."

His macroscopic perspective was raised tens of thousands of times higher. Endless nebulae and star rivers were born outside the darkness. The Dao-Melting Stone was already operating at its absolute limit.

"As the saying goes, 'touching one part affects the whole.' Every object in the starscape is interconnected."

"It's not simply a matter of adding them later; one must also consider the impact of their appearance on the original planet."

"..."

After contemplation, Sun Erlang felt that the Dao-Melting Stone was on the verge of collapse. So, with a resolute heart, he crudely used the span of space to minimize these impacts.

"By the time these small beings notice something is wrong, it will likely be a long time from now."

The natives continued to progress rapidly. They studied the star ring and invented the 'Reverse Flow Boat,' which could exert a counteracting force using the star ring's restraint. It was like a slingshot, launching the spaceship at high speed. Although they couldn't turn back, it greatly accelerated the natives' exploration of the starscape.

"This is too fast?" Sun Erlang stared dumbfounded as the first Reverse Flow Boat continuously accelerated by leveraging the power of star rings on passing planets, heading towards the fringes of the starscape.

"No..." Sun Erlang pondered for a moment, guiding a meteor, altering its trajectory, and sending it crashing towards the Reverse Flow Boat. To his surprise, the people on the flying vessel narrowly dodged it.

His vision flashed, and the scene from the Reverse Flow Boat appeared before Sun Erlang.

"Sir, thanks to you! Otherwise, we would have been annihilated this time!"

A stern, middle-aged man with a long beard said, without relaxing his vigilance: "This piece of debris is rather peculiar. The starscape is so vast, yet it happened to encounter us..."

"Maintain vigilance! Don't let your guard down!"

...

Hearing the words of these mortals, Sun Erlang felt a flush of shame. His actions had indeed been somewhat clumsy. However, he quickly thought of a way to rectify it. Sun Erlang gently pointed towards the planet closest to the Reverse Flow Boat. Not long after, it spectacularly disintegrated, transforming into countless fragments that rained down like a torrential storm upon the Reverse Flow Boat. Good fortune favors the bold, but not twice. With such a dense cluster of debris, and guided with such precision, the Reverse Flow Boat had no chance of survival. In the collision, it turned into a ball of flame and vanished into the starscape.

However, a single accident could not dampen the natives' curiosity about the starscape. Subsequently, increasingly larger and more advanced Reverse Flow Boats flew out from the original planet, exploring in all directions. Although he desperately wanted to destroy these flying ships using his old method, Sun Erlang knew that his previous actions had already shaken the rules of this creation game. If he continued to intervene directly, this world would collapse even faster. Thus, Sun Erlang had to find another solution. He looked at the countless spaceships bouncing off the star rings and soon had an idea. With a thought, the star ring on the original planet underwent a subtle, unnoticed change.

It took the natives a full year to realize something was wrong. The planet was experiencing extreme weather, breaking all records. Cold snaps and droughts swept across the land, causing crop failures and even a slight decrease in the native birth rate. The mortals sensed that something was amiss and gathered the planet's most elite scholars to investigate the cause of these disasters. They eventually concluded that while the star ring bound them, preventing them from venturing into the starscape, it also served as a protective shield, isolating the planet from the extreme environments of the starscape. In recent years, due to the overuse of the star ring's elastic force, the ring had undergone a minute shrinkage. Although this shrinkage was negligible to the star ring itself, the planet's fragile ecosystem could not withstand its impact. After intense discussions, the native mortals temporarily abandoned their plan to explore the starscape. The Reverse Flow Boats were sealed away henceforth.

"This should buy more time," Sun Erlang exhaled in relief. "I wonder how much time has passed in the real world outside." He looked at the galaxy he had personally sculpted, his expression becoming somewhat wistful. Time flew by. In the blink of an eye, another century passed on the original planet. Starting from the third decade, flying ships began to approach the star ring for sampling and research. In the fifth decade, through the unremitting efforts of all the mortals, they finally discovered a method to repair the star ring's damage. Sun Erlang witnessed these mortals replicate the star ring's power in their laboratories, and his mind was profoundly shaken, with countless thoughts surging through him.

"The power of the star ring originates from the foundational laws of the world I created."

"But these mortals are also manifestations of the world's laws. As part of the world, they have the capacity to explore the world's fundamental origins..."

"Because they truly exist, they can study and utilize it..."

Changes continued on the original planet. After multiple trials, the mortals confirmed the effectiveness of repairing the star ring. Long suppressed, they could no longer be contained. An unprecedented era of exploration had arrived. Countless Reverse Flow Boats once again departed from the original planet, venturing into the boundless starscape. In the seventh decade, the mortals invented a method of long-distance travel that did not rely on the star ring's elasticity but solely on a star ring power furnace. From then on, the natives officially achieved two-way travel within the starscape. From the eighth decade to the hundredth year, the mortals entered a new era of exploring and colonizing the starscape. At this point, Sun Erlang knew that the exposure of his fabricated world was only a matter of time. Watching the countless mortals still sacrificing themselves for this cause, Sun Erlang inexplicably felt a peculiar emotion arise within him. He stopped trying to expand the boundaries of the starscape and instead silently watched as the footprints of the mortals reached the edge of their world.

Five hundred years later.

When a Reverse Flow Boat of peculiar design finally reached the fringes of the starscape, the world before Sun Erlang violently shook.

*Boom!*

Like exploding stars, it erupted in brilliant light, then vanished.

However, Sun Erlang did not return to the real world. The scene before him was still blank.

"Hmm?" Sun Erlang was surprised. He looked around, unsure of what had happened.

"Do you think there was anything wrong with that world just now?" A voice suddenly sounded from behind Sun Erlang. Sun Erlang's heart leaped, and he immediately turned his head. He saw a Daoist with long eyebrows and white hair, holding a whisk, smiling as he observed him.

"This is..." Sun Erlang vaguely guessed the person's identity and, mustering his courage, tentatively said, "Greetings, Heavenly Venerate."

The Daoist did not reply, still gazing at Sun Erlang with a smile. Sun Erlang pondered for a moment, recalling the civilization of the mortals on the original planet. After a while, he suddenly realized, "There were indeed some anomalies. The mortals on that planet..."

"They were too united."

"There were no major wars or infighting. When the planet faced crises, they could always set aside their differences and work together to resolve them."

"..."

"Compared to the current situation in the Xuanhuang Realm, it's truly unbelievable," Sun Erlang shook his head.

The Daoist nodded, then asked again, "That's one point. Anything else?"

"Anything else?" Sun Erlang frowned slightly.

"Their obsession with exploring the starscape was somewhat excessive."

"Even after facing multiple dangers, they never gave up. Even the highest echelons of the entire planet shared the same conviction..." Sun Erlang looked at the Daoist. "This is perhaps unimaginable in the real world."

Chapter 1248

Hearing Sun Erlang's words, the white-haired Daoist smiled faintly.

"Indeed, everyone possesses their own independent personality and thoughts. When disaster strikes, scattering like birds is a primal instinct of life. Forcing everyone to be of one heart and mind is quite difficult. The various events that have occurred throughout the history of the Xuanhuang Realm clearly illustrate this point."

The white-haired Daoist gently waved his horsetail whisk, and countless scenes instantly appeared in the pure white space before Sun Erlang's eyes.

Black shadows, representing the apocalypse, floated above the Xuanhuang Realm, poised to descend at any moment. Yet, regarding how to face this calamity, the various sects and factions within the Xuanhuang Realm still held different attitudes.

There were those determined to abandon the realm and flee, those who chose to act like timid turtles, and those who strove tirelessly to rally everyone together.

There were even those who took advantage of the chaos to satisfy their selfish desires.

The beings depicted in the scenes lacked specific forms, all replaced by faceless little figures. However, the absurd farces unfolding were incredibly real.

"But this is the Xuanhuang Realm of the past."

The white-haired Daoist waved his horsetail whisk again, and the scenes abruptly changed.

"United as one heart, with firm will defying destiny, freely joining divine power, carefreely without fear, a single word settles the nine cauldrons..."

Accompanied by the words of the True Heavenly Venerate, Sun Erlang beheld the details of human life within the territories of the Five Elders Council.

"How does this compare to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, in your opinion?" the True Heavenly Venerate asked.

"Naturally, it is far superior to the Myriad Immortals Alliance," Sun Erlang replied without hesitation.

He immediately added, "It's just a pity that all of this is built upon the boundless divine abilities of the five Heavenly Venerates. Everything is as ephemeral as flowers reflected in water or the moon in a mirror. If, one day, one of these five Heavenly Venerates were to suddenly meet misfortune, this seemingly beautiful scene would instantly collapse."

On the territory of the Five Elders Council, discussing the potential demise of Heavenly Venerates so openly, this elder with white hair, who was likely the True Heavenly Venerate, showed no anger.

Instead, he nodded in agreement, "What you've said holds some truth, yet it also lacks it."

Sun Erlang's expression faltered slightly. He cupped his hands and said solemnly, "May the Heavenly Venerate impart wisdom."

"The reason what you say has merit is that, from the perspective of ordinary cultivators from outside, it is indeed so. The order here is born from the five Heavenly Venerates. If the Heavenly Venerates were to perish, the order would vanish."

"As for why it lacks reason, it's because you haven't understood the true meaning of the Longevity Realm in this world."

The True Heavenly Venerate stroked his beard and said slowly, "To defy the principles of heaven and earth, and thus prove longevity."

"After cultivators defy the principles, they naturally become a part of the world's principles, just like this sunlight, the water droplets, the air; together they constitute the very fabric of the 'World' itself."

"Humans are not isolated individuals. To deny the existence of the Longevity Realm and then discuss the cultivators under its influence is also meaningless."

Sun Erlang did not fully comprehend the True Heavenly Venerate's words. To him, it seemed more like a form of sophistry. However, the Longevity Heavenly Venerate, existing at the apex of this world, would clearly not engage in a petty verbal argument with a junior like him.

Sun Erlang furrowed his brow and pondered diligently. After a long while, he spoke thoughtfully, "We are discussing the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm. That is the fundamental premise. And the Longevity Heavenly Venerates have already become an inseparable part of the Xuanhuang Realm, therefore..."

"No." Sun Erlang suddenly grew alert. "The key point is, your power does not seem to cover the entire Xuanhuang Realm? It is confined to this particular area."

The True Heavenly Venerate asked, "Have you perceived the presence of Carefree Heavenly Venerate's divine power?"

Sun Erlang nodded. "Of course, I am aware of it."

"As fellow beings in the Longevity Realm, Carefree's strength is not much greater than that of the rest of us. What he can achieve..."

"We can naturally also achieve it," the True Heavenly Venerate said slowly.

Upon hearing this, Sun Erlang's initial reaction was disbelief. Then, as he pondered, his expression gradually became serious.

"Then why?" he couldn't help but ask.

"Naturally, the time has not yet come," the white-haired Daoist chuckled softly and waved his horsetail whisk again. The world of the white Return to Truth Fruit gradually faded. The True Heavenly Venerate's figure also began to blur.

"Heavenly Venerate!" At this moment, Sun Erlang suddenly remembered his master's instructions and quickly called out, "Does the Heavenly Venerate know of the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate's matter?"

"You will see," the white space exploded. Thousands of light streams erupted together, blossoming in Sun Erlang's mind.

He returned to the real world, but Sun Erlang was still immersed in the images conveyed by the True Heavenly Venerate.

"Defy the principles of heaven and earth again? Are you mad? You have already reached this point, only a step away from defying principles and proving longevity. Why do this?" A younger Daoist, his expression full of confusion and his speech impassioned, asked.

"Longevity? It is merely transforming oneself into the Dao," the figure opposite him, whose face could not be seen, spoke with considerable disdain for the 'Longevity Realm.' He continued, "If not for that existence, our transformation into Dao for longevity would be harmless. But the entire cultivation system is built upon this framework that he created..."

"Star Vast, do you know what the consequences will be?" The younger Daoist remained silent.

"The Xuanhuang Realm is being reborn amidst destruction. This is the only thing he currently cares about. Someone achieving longevity is of no consequence to him. In fact, he even hopes for a Longevity Realm that aligns with his wishes, do you know why?" The younger Daoist continued to lower his head, silent.

"Your talents are no less than mine, how can you not understand? It's merely clinging to a sliver of hope."

"Let me be direct. One day, when the Xuanhuang Realm ushers in its rebirth and completes its transformation, the so-called Longevity Heavenly Venerates will completely become a part of the new world's Heavenly Dao... living a fate worse than death, or rather, a fate indifferent to life and death."

"They are merely tools for reshaping the world," the blurry figure sneered.

"This is merely your delusion, your conjecture..." After a long while, the younger Daoist weakly retorted.

The blurry figure, however, ignored him and continued, "I refuse to believe it! I must contend with him!"

"To defy the principles of heaven and earth, and thus prove longevity. This is the foundation of his Dao, but it is also his greatest flaw. If I can defy his principles again, I can instantly steal all his creations and replace him..."

"Eastern Extreme! You..." The younger Daoist frantically looked around, fearing that such heaven-defying words would be overheard.

The blurry figure, however, was filled with ambition and eyes brimming with aspirations.

"Star Vast, do not be nervous. On this path, I am not alone," the Eastern Extreme suddenly said, trying to comfort him.

"Within the Celestial-Mortal Miasma lie the mysteries of defying heaven and earth again. It originates from the previous Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate who passed away..."

"I have some clues recently. As long as..."

*Boom!*

Before the Eastern Extreme could finish, the image suddenly shattered. When his vision cleared again, it was still the Eastern Extreme's figure. However... the Eastern Extreme, who was originally full of pride and vigor, now appeared extremely strange. His head was lowered, his body was naked. His long hair was scattered, and countless threads extended from his body into the void beyond sight.

"Eastern Extreme!" This horrifying scene, accompanied by the True Heavenly Venerate's exclamation, suddenly shattered and vanished.

...

"What is this?" Sun Erlang's mind was profoundly shaken. Although the dialogue was brief, the secrets revealed were all earth-shattering. Sun Erlang first scanned his surroundings, realizing that not much time had passed since he entered the creation illusion of the Return to Truth Fruit. Other cultivators were still there, meditating and undergoing trials. However, Sun Erlang had no intention of staying any longer. He had to return as quickly as possible to convey what he had seen and heard to his master. Fortunately, the attention of the cultivators in the city was solely focused on the 'prodigies' still lingering in the illusion. As for Sun Erlang, a 'failure,' he garnered little attention. He quietly left the city and headed directly for the entrance to the Great Qi pocket world. While flying, Sun Erlang's thoughts raced.

"The True Heavenly Venerate had long discovered my presence?"

"Therefore, he appeared in the illusion to meet me."

"They already knew of the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate's predicament, and coincidentally, I was here on my master's orders, so they used me to convey these scenes to my master..."

"What deeper meaning does this hold?" Even though Sun Erlang considered himself experienced, facing truths that involved the Xuanhuang Realm's deepest secrets, he could barely contain himself. Sun Erlang couldn't help but quicken his pace.

...

In fact, he did not need to return to the Great Qi pocket world himself. Using the golden net woven from the Essence of Primal Force, the Faceless Sacred Emperor had already synchronized with everything that happened to him the moment he entered the true illusion. Similarly, the True Heavenly Venerate was not truly speaking to a junior cultivator like Sun Erlang, who had not yet reached the Dao Integration realm. He was communicating with the Faceless Sacred Emperor.

Li Ping meticulously replayed the scenes transmitted by the True Heavenly Venerate. At the same time, the latter's meaningful words echoed continuously.

"Tools for transmitting the Dao and reshaping a new world?"

"It seems they have some self-awareness. Seeing my emergence and their struggle against the doctrine transmitters, they are subtly expressing goodwill..."

"However, I cannot fully trust them." Li Ping let out a cold snort. The five Heavenly Venerates did indeed transform themselves into Dao, but faced with the pressure from the doctrine transmitters, Li Ping did not believe they would simply wait idly and do nothing after all these years.

"Carefree Bliss, forming its own world."

"The Land of Truth, deriving countless worlds."

"As for the others, they mostly adopt the attitude of watching a tiger fight from the mountainside."

"And those truly driven to desperation, like the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao today, will eagerly seize any glimmer of hope."

Li Ping's thoughts were calm, unaffected by the somewhat terrifying images conveyed by the True Heavenly Venerate.

"But the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate's words, that the mystery of defying heaven and earth again is hidden within the Celestial-Mortal Miasma... perhaps that is true."

"The Eastern Extreme's Cleansing Spiritual Pool, similar to the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation, can dissolve the principles defied by Su Bai."

"Defying heaven and earth again..." Li Ping pondered these words.

"We cannot place all our hopes on it, but it is not without merit as a way to shake the power of the doctrine transmitters."

With this thought, Li Ping's figure flickered, and he arrived around Senior Yin. Xu Ke was also present. They were observing a little girl who looked like a delicate porcelain doll, both marveling at her.

Seeing Li Ping's arrival, Senior Yin spoke first, "You've arrived just in time. Come quickly and take a look at this little one."

The aura of the Sacred Emperor's majesty and his faceless appearance made the little girl somewhat nervous. However, she still mustered her courage and gazed directly at Li Ping.

Li Ping's divine sense swept through the little girl's body, and he was slightly taken aback. He transmitted a message, "Did they not say that they all cultivate the New Law?"

"How is it that this little child cultivates the doctrine transmitter's method?" Xu Ke answered the question with great emotion. "Sacred Emperor, please do not misunderstand. No one here has taught her a cultivation method; she figured it out herself."

"Furthermore, among this batch of children, she is not the only one like this." Senior Yin's tone was also somewhat peculiar. "As the saying goes, when driven to desperation, one finds a new path. They could not establish their Dao Foundation with us, and seeing their companions constantly improving, in their desperation, they instinctively stumbled upon another path to cultivation."

"To avoid affecting those little ones cultivating the New Heart Dao Method, we have to take them away."

The Faceless Sacred Emperor remained silent upon hearing this. This time, the Essence of Primal Force surged, observing the specific conditions within these young children.

"This is not a coincidence."

"The doctrine transmitter's method has already become a part of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao."

"Just like naturally existing paths in the world, even if one's eyes are covered, they will instinctively walk onto this path."

Li Ping recalled the scene in the world created by Sun Erlang not long ago.

"This is the Azure Nether's 'Dao.' The supreme Dao, even the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao itself, cannot escape its influence."

"Following its Dao, one can prove to be supreme within the realm, which is Longevity."

"Defying the Dao..."

"It's either you die, or I die."

Li Ping's mind conjured the Eastern Extreme's strange body, resembling that of a puppet. But Li Ping felt no fear or hesitation.

"Su Bai and Eastern Extreme will lose..."

"But that does not mean I will!"

"Although the doctrine transmitters are powerful, they are not insurmountable." Li Ping's train of thought had not wavered from the beginning.

"To successfully defy the Dao, one must either redefine its principles, thus disrupting its roots."

"Or, use strength to overpower, to break the deadlock. The Dao of the doctrine transmitters is indeed supreme in the Xuanhuang Realm. However, there is not only one Xuanhuang Realm in existence. Outside the world, there is the sea of stars. Beyond the sea of stars, there are The Great Barriers..."

As Li Ping's thoughts churned, he informed Senior Yin and Xu Ke of his intentions.

"Celestial-Mortal Miasma?" Senior Yin found it strange that Li Ping suddenly brought up this subject of his previous research.

"Mr. Bai paid with his life to successfully defy the principles. Because he was deeply favored by the Heavenly Dao, the greater the entanglement, the greater the backlash. Ultimately, he could not escape and returned his Dao to heaven..." Senior Yin explained.

"Since it was already defying principles, why could it be dissipated?"

"Does this not mean that each process of expelling the Celestial-Mortal Miasma is equivalent to defying heaven and earth again?" Li Ping asked calmly. This was indeed a question Senior Yin had never considered before, leaving him stunned.

Chapter 1249: Mr. Bai's Gift

"Reason against reason, reason against reason..."

"Could it be like this?"

Senior Yin was stunned for a long time, then couldn't stop trembling in place.

Xu Ke's aged face was also filled with emotion. "No wonder Mr. Bai always told me to just wait back then."

"Besides the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm descending to save itself, there are also countless mortals who have continuously embarked on the path of cultivation. The process of cultivation is the process of reversing the principles of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma. After thousands of years, it has accumulated day by day..."

The Faceless Sacred Emperor's voice was distant. "Counterintuitively, removing the Celestial-Mortal Miasma, something that seems so simple to cultivators, the initial steps and prerequisites for cultivation are essentially the same as the ultimate goal of cultivation: proving the Dao and achieving longevity."

"Both are about going against the principles of heaven and earth."

As soon as these words were spoken, complex emotions flashed in the eyes of Senior Yin and Xu Ke.

Senior Yin said, "If the Heavenly Venerate of Reason against Reason were still alive, it would not have been this easy for mortals in the Xuanhuang Realm to go against the principles of heaven and earth and embark on the path of cultivation. But precisely because Mr. Bai has already perished, the restrictions of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma's principles have been greatly weakened."

Li Ping interjected, "Moreover, there is also the Eastern Extreme Heavenly Venerate, who unraveled the mysteries of this place. With the so-called Body Cleansing Spiritual Pool Array, the difficulty of reversing reason was further reduced."

Xu Ke's lips moved, and after a long pause, he managed to say with difficulty, "When I last saw Mr. Bai, I saw the death wish in his heart. I haven't been able to let go of it all these years, but now, perhaps I understand a little."

Senior Yin fell into a trance of muttering again. "The world is going against the principles of heaven and earth, but to put it bluntly, this is still within the cultivation system of doctrine transmission. Even if we know this, what's the use?"

"There must be something we haven't thought of..."

Li Ping said with certainty, "The answer should be within the Celestial-Mortal Miasma. If we are talking about research on the Celestial-Mortal Miasma, perhaps no one in the Xuanhuang Realm today knows it better than you. I'm afraid I'll have to trouble you again, fellow Daoist."

"Although there are no longer mortals containing the Celestial-Mortal Miasma within the Great Qi, it is not difficult to find some from those conquered pocket worlds for research. I will have people cooperate with you fully," Li Ping said to Senior Yin.

"Rest assured, Sacred Emperor." Senior Yin suddenly became excited.

...

Meanwhile.

In the space of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Dharma Deduction Jade.

After the Sacred Embryo saw the Great Wall of Broken Realms, Li Fan's calm heart was once again stirred by ripples.

“Going against the principles of heaven and earth? The Celestial-Mortal Miasma…”

Li Fan suddenly recalled his experience of removing the Celestial-Mortal Miasma in the Body Cleansing Spiritual Pool Array on Glazed Island.

The lava-like hot pool water ravaged his consciousness. Even with a firm will, he eventually fell into a state of ignorance.

His mind went blank, and he acted purely on instinct.

Before entering the spiritual pool, Li Fan, who had been practicing the Azure Nether Heart Clearing Incantation day and night, instinctively operated the technique again.

Just as he completely removed the miasma from his body, Li Fan inexplicably comprehended an advanced and sublimated version of the Azure Nether Heart Clearing Incantation.

The Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation.

Later, it became the current Azure Nether Immortal Heart Incantation. This technique had helped Li Fan immensely on his journey.

"The pain in the Body Cleansing Spiritual Pool is unbearable for ordinary people. Most would likely fall into a coma directly. Even if they could remain conscious, in this extreme pain, there would be no room for any other distracting thoughts."

"Carrying the soul and embracing unity, clearing the profound reflections, imitating nature..."

With his eyes closed, a flash of inspiration struck Li Fan's mind.

"When man is united with the Dao. Instinctive actions under ignorance are precisely what is closest to the Dao. This may be why so many mortals in the world can successfully remove the Celestial-Mortal Miasma and reverse the principles of heaven and earth."

"However, in reality, this is not a complete reversal of reason. The fact that there was no qualitative leap in strength after removing the Celestial-Mortal Miasma proves this."

Li Fan pondered thoughtfully.

"Firstly, it's because the Celestial-Mortal Miasma was not completely removed by one's own strength, and secondly..."

The Dao-Melting Stone in his mind flashed, and Li Fan recalled the fleeting insights from that moment, savoring them repeatedly.

He mused, "When the Celestial-Mortal Miasma was finally removed..."

"It was as if it disappeared on its own."

"It was as if it sensed my operation of the Azure Nether Heart Clearing Incantation and spontaneously transformed into the Heart Refining Incantation."

"Did it trigger some condition?"

Li Fan then recalled the image of Dongji's life transmitted by the True Heavenly Venerate.

"The secret of reversing the principles of heaven and earth lies hidden within the Celestial-Mortal Miasma."

In Li Fan's eyes, he seemed to see countless mortals breaking through the shackles of immortals and mortals over the past thousands of years, reversing the laws and embarking on the path of cultivation.

"The birth of every cultivator has undergone a process similar to reversing the principles of heaven and earth."

"Even if they themselves were unaware, this did indeed happen."

"Reversing the principles of heaven and earth is equivalent to directly confronting the doctrine transmission and completely overturning the cultivation system he personally shaped. Even prodigies like Mr. Bai and Dongji ended in failure, which shows the immense difficulty. But..."

Li Fan suddenly had an epiphany.

He recalled the process of his own simulated reincarnations.

"The process of every mortal combating the Celestial-Mortal Miasma can be seen as a simulation of reversing the principles of heaven and earth."

"The strength of one person may have its limits. The strength of tens of millions of people also has its limits."

"But the strength of tens of millions of people over an eternity is inexhaustible and cannot be extinguished."

"In the face of such immense power, the overturning of the new law of doctrine transmission is only a matter of time..."

Li Fan's heart trembled. "The Myriad Spirits and All Beings Refining the Soul is shaking the immortal force that transcends the mortal world with pure quantity."

"Endless beings, eternally defying the laws, magnify the advantage of quantity on the timescale, achieving a qualitative leap from quantitative change..."

"As long as there are still existences in the Xuanhuang Realm who refuse to accept their mortal fate, this method will continue to be passed down."

Li Fan's thoughts raced, and he felt an even greater sense of admiration for Mr. Bai, who had created such a wondrous method.

Ignoring the limits of lifespan, his methods were still effective after his death, spanning the river of time and influencing years later.

Unlike Li Fan, who possessed the treasure of Return to Truth, this was the limit achievable by ordinary mortal cultivators.

Of course, for Li Fan, this did not hold much reference value.

What Mr. Bai needed thousands of years and countless cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm to accomplish, Li Fan could achieve through constant Return to Truth.

But this did not prevent Li Fan from reaping the fruits of Mr. Bai's labor.

"In my opinion, the secret of reversing the principles of heaven and earth hidden within the Celestial-Mortal Miasma is the insights of countless cultivators over the years when they removed the Celestial-Mortal Miasma."

"All of them were recorded and preserved."

"If one could absorb these simulated experiences of reversing the principles of heaven and earth time and time again..."

Li Fan prided himself on being able to see through most treasures in the Xuanhuang Realm, even the Cat Treasure from beyond the The Great Barrier. However, he had to admit that after perceiving these countless experiences of reversing reason, his heart was moved.

Unlike magic artifacts, this gift package of experience was something that could directly enhance Li Fan's divine soul and essence.

It was enough to significantly shorten the gap between him and doctrinal transmitters and Heavenly Physicians.

Although it was a one-time occurrence, it was of great significance to Li Fan, and the sooner it was discovered, the better.

"At the very least, it will save me three lifetimes of reincarnation."

Li Fan calculated in his heart.

"So, where did Mr. Bai hide this gift package?"

"Is it in the Fallen Immortal Mirror, or is it within the power of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma? Does it require special conditions to be triggered?"

If he hadn't decided to adopt a passive stance of observing the tigers fight this life, Li Fan would have wished his main body could personally investigate.

However, years of experience allowed him to suppress this impulse.

"With Senior Yin and Xu Ke working diligently to research it, it will definitely be more efficient than me fumbling around blindly."

"If they know, it's equivalent to me knowing. It's all mine in the end, so there's no need to rush."

"I also get to see the weight of this gift package. After the Sacred Emperor's clone absorbs it, can it truly shake the doctrine transmission?"

"Heh heh heh, it does make me a little expectant."

Li Fan, who had been in seclusion in the Dharma Deduction space for a long time, felt a surge of excitement at this moment.

...

The perspective shifted back to the Sacred Emperor's clone.

Unraveling the mysteries of Mr. Bai's legacy was not something that could be accomplished in a day or two.

Before that, the agreed-upon time between Li Ping and Ruo Mu had arrived.

The Sacred Emperor once again arrived outside the Black Abyss of White Flowers.

He did not act carelessly due to his absolute advantage, lest Ruo Mu desperately lash out. The Essence of Primal Force was silently deployed as a protective layer around him.

Then, Li Ping stepped back into the space of the Man-Consuming Longevity.

Perhaps it was due to Li Ping's nourishment last time, or perhaps Ruo Mu himself saw hope.

In the once dead and despairing withered yellow space, Li Ping now felt faint traces of vitality.

Although extremely weak, the appearance of this vitality, which should not have existed, already explained certain problems.

Li Ping also discovered something different from before.

Those cultivators hanging on Ruo Mu's branches...

They had all disappeared.

"Greetings, Sacred Emperor."

The old Daoist priest appeared before Li Ping with a beaming smile.

Ruo Mu noticed the direction of his gaze. Before Li Ping could ask, he voluntarily explained, "Since I have decided to pledge my allegiance to you, I naturally have to make some changes. It is good to get rid of such powerless rage as before."

"You know, after seeing so many of these human fruits, I've actually gotten a bit tired of them."

Li Ping said calmly, "Where are they now?"

Ruo Mu chuckled, "Naturally, I've returned them to heaven."

Saying that, Ruo Mu handed over a leaf.

The leaf was yellowish-green, and upon closer inspection, it contained a universe within. It held piles of Golden Cores of various kinds.

These Golden Cores looked like they were dissolving, incomplete.

Li Ping could vaguely see the appearance of the Heavenly and Earthly Marvels within the cores.

"I was originally a spiritual object of heaven and earth, holding the scepter of life and death of the Azure Nether. Although the scepter is gradually being reclaimed, my connection with heaven and earth has never been broken."

Ruo Mu glanced at Li Ping and then continued, "Through my absorption and transformation, the power of heaven and earth that was encroached upon by cultivators can be returned to heaven and earth more quickly."

"Please see, I haven't embezzled anything."

Li Ping withdrew his gaze from the leaf. "I believe you are not that foolish. Compared to my reward, these are utterly insignificant."

Ruo Mu nodded repeatedly in agreement.

"Come here." Li Ping suddenly called out.

The old Daoist priest hesitated for a moment, then gradually walked to the front of the Faceless Sacred Emperor.

Compared to Li Ping's massive body of over ten meters, the hunched Daoist priest looked like an infant.

Li Ping gently placed his palm on Ruo Mu's head.

Boom!

The scene before Ruo Mu's eyes instantly shattered.

In an instant, he seemed to have left the space of the Man-Consuming Longevity.

He arrived in an endless starry sky of darkness.

Golden vortices, like a galaxy, revolved majestically.

And in the center of the galaxy, the majestic figure of the Faceless Sacred Emperor could be faintly seen.

That powerful and sacred aura seemed to surpass even the Heavenly Dao of the Azure Nether that Ruo Mu was familiar with.

As one of the oldest beings in the Xuanhuang Realm, Ruo Mu naturally knew the meaning of this power.

The last bit of dissatisfaction in his heart slowly disappeared.

Ruo Mu revealed his true form, no longer an ugly old Daoist priest, but a withered, seemingly malnourished sapling.

In the face of the vast golden vortex galaxy, it was like an ant.

Its leaves swayed gently, a sign of Ruo Mu's submission.

The figure of the Faceless Sacred Emperor rapidly expanded, instantly filling Ruo Mu's entire vision.

The golden galaxy also exploded with a bang.

Endless starlight submerged Ruo Mu.

When Ruo Mu woke from the illusion, Li Ping's figure had already disappeared.

"Wait patiently."

"When you are needed, you will be summoned."

Only Li Ping's voice continued to echo in his mind.

And Li Ping's promise was not broken.

Ruo Mu clearly felt that the bond between him and the Xuanhuang Realm was slowly recovering.

Although returning to his peak condition was impossible, there was still hope.

And...

Ruo Mu looked at his palm.

Besides the original green leaf, there was now a small green bottle, which had appeared at some unknown time.

Clearly, it was left by the Faceless Sacred Emperor before he departed.

A set of forbidden manipulation techniques naturally appeared in his mind. Following suit, Ruo Mu opened the small green bottle.

A pure surge of vitality emerged from the green bottle.

Although it could not compare to the nourishment from the Heavenly Dao of the Azure Nether itself, for Ruo Mu in his current state, it was undoubtedly a great tonic.

Ruo Mu greedily swallowed all the vitality in the green bottle.

He reluctantly stopped only when not a single drop could be poured out.

However, Ruo Mu sensed that the vitality in this small green bottle had not completely disappeared.

It was slowly regenerating on its own.

What surprised Ruo Mu even more was that the generation of this vitality did not draw any energy from the outside.

It was as if the vitality was completely derived from the green bottle itself.

"Truly a good treasure."

Ruo Mu smacked his lips ungracefully.

"It doesn't seem to be an item from the Xuanhuang Realm..."

Ruo Mu pondered for a moment, then chuckled.

"Why worry about it so much? As long as there's something to eat and drink."

"It can't be worse than before, right?"

Only after losing what he once had did he understand its preciousness.

If anyone dared to snatch these things away again...

Even if they were a doctrine transmitter, he, Ruo Mu, would dare to take a bite.

Chapter 1250

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree was also ensnared within the net of Primal Force Essence woven by the Faceless Sacred Emperor.

Therefore, when the Tree of Illusory Wood surrendered, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree felt a subtle premonition. It couldn't ascertain its meaning, but a growing unease filled its heart.

"We are all subordinates of the Sacred Emperor now, protected by His might. Does He dare do anything to me?" the ancient tree mused, attempting to comfort itself.

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree knew with certainty that only the Sacred Emperor could preserve its life.

The more useful it was to the Sacred Dynasty, the safer it would be.

Thus, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree was eager to prove its worth to the Sacred Emperor.

Alas, since its arrival in the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, it felt as though it had been forgotten. No one actively sought it out.

Even the task of sorting out the earth veins of the Great Qi pocket worlds, which it had been assigned, had not been inspected.

This left the Earth Vein Ancient Tree quite dejected.

However, on this day, the opportunity for the ancient tree to perform, which it so eagerly awaited, finally presented itself.

The visitor was none other than the Sacred Emperor's fifth disciple, Ou Shangtian.

"Is this the diagram of the Xuanhuang Realm's earth vein flow?" Ou Shangtian asked, pointing to the image before him.

The diagram was a dense network, like a great underground web, extending to every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm. It pulsed and contracted like the veins in a human body, appearing rather bizarre.

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree nodded. "Honorable Young Master sees clearly."

Ou Shangtian seemed pleased by the ancient tree's flattery and readily accepted the title of "Honorable Young Master."

"I heard Senior Sister Lin Ling say that when traveling along the earth vein flows, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm naturally conceals them, making them difficult for ordinary people to detect. Is this true?" Ou Shangtian inquired further.

"Indeed," the Earth Vein Ancient Tree replied, extending a withered branch. "Honorable Young Master, please observe."

Ou Shangtian felt the power of the earth vein flow within the branch and frowned slightly. "It doesn't seem like much. How can it hide from others' senses?"

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree smiled faintly. "Honorable Young Master, you must understand that gathering sand can build a high tower, and dripping water can form a great river. While a single flow of earth vein power may seem insignificant, when the entire network of earth vein flows in the Xuanhuang Realm converges, it is truly a mighty force, akin to the power of thunder."

"Ultimately, the circulation of earth veins is a vital component of the Xuanhuang Realm's normal operation. I merely hold the reins of its flow. Compared to the overarching principles of the Xuanhuang Realm, ordinary cultivators are like ants, and it is only natural for them to be overlooked."

Ou Shangtian stared blankly at the diagram of the earth vein flow, lost in thought.

After a long while, he snapped back to attention, returning the withered branch. "Coincidentally, I am currently on a mission assigned by my Master, and I may need your assistance."

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree had been waiting for this very moment and was overjoyed. "Honorable Young Master, please command me. I will undoubtedly assist with all my heart."

"There is a senior in the Xuanhuang Realm with unfathomable strength, who carries a stone slab with him... Do you know of such a person?" Ou Shangtian asked, looking at the Earth Vein Ancient Tree.

The Earth Vein Ancient Tree's expression shifted abruptly, its previous eagerness vanishing in an instant.

It stared at Ou Shangtian in disbelief, and after a long pause, tentatively asked, "Honorable Young Master, is the Sacred Dynasty planning to make a move against Senior Stone Slab?"

"If I may be so bold, that Stone Slab is a True Longevity Realm expert, and has attained the Dao many years ago..."

Ou Shangtian waved his hand impatiently. "I am well aware of the strength of this 'Stone Slab.' Longevity Realm, you say! Compared to my Master, it is nothing!"

"Rest assured, my role is merely to lure him to a specific location."

Hearing Ou Shangtian's words, the Earth Vein Ancient Tree breathed a slight sigh of relief.

The mysterious Faceless Sacred Emperor, who could subdue its father, should have no trouble dealing with this Stone Slab.

The ancient tree felt a surge of excitement. "Honorable Young Master, how do you require my cooperation?"

Ou Shangtian explained the detailed plan. The ancient tree pondered for a moment, then nodded, stating it was not a significant issue.

"There is no time to delay. After I meet with my Master, I will depart immediately."

The ancient tree replied, "My true form remains within the Xuanhuang Realm. As long as Honorable Young Master summons me, I can manifest at any time."

Ou Shangtian hurried into the Sacred Emperor’s Throne.

When he emerged, the anxious expression on his face had completely vanished.

"I possess the Heavenly Bone Hand, and the Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light protects my body. Furthermore, I have been awarded a treasure by my Master. I have also studied formations for a considerable time..."

"As long as I can lure him to Fishing Pond, the mission will be complete. It should not be a major issue."

"However, Fishing Pond is a sacred land of our Sacred Dynasty. Why would Master instruct me to lure a great enemy there? Is he not afraid of any unforeseen accidents?"

Ou Shangtian could not fathom the reason.

Ultimately, he dismissed his doubts and left the Great Qi pocket world, heading directly for the Nine Mountains Province of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Utilizing the surging earth vein flow, it took him barely the time to brew a cup of tea to arrive within the Nine Mountains Province.

Ou Shangtian experimented and indeed found that the spatial laws here were somewhat chaotic and fragile.

If he were to recklessly employ teleportation, there was a high probability of tearing space and being sucked into the spatial turbulence, lost forever.

"However, flight is not an issue. These nine mountain peaks may challenge ordinary cultivators, but they pose no obstacle to me, who possesses the Seven-Colored Divine Light."

With this thought, Ou Shangtian deliberately manipulated the Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light to form a protective aura around his body. It radiated its own rhythm like the great sun in the heavens.

With a slight mental command, armor that also emitted a seven-colored sheen materialized on Ou Shangtian.

His Master's voice echoed in Ou Shangtian's ears: "This item is called the Flowing Light Armor. It is forged from the Nine Heavens' Thunderbolt and the Morning Crimson Neon. Upon donning it, your flight speed can rival that of lightning, and it can ignore most offensive techniques..."

Ou Shangtian tested it.

Gazing towards the summit of the mountain range ahead, in a mere blink, he found himself at the mountain's peak.

"So fast!?" Ou Shangtian, the one who initiated this, was also inwardly shocked.

With the dual enhancement of the Flowing Light Armor and the Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light, his speed had reached an unimaginable level.

Even with such a conspicuous display, radiating seven-colored light as he flew through the sky, the cultivators of the entire Nine Mountains Province could not detect him due to his sheer speed.

This included the Dao Integration guardians of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Ou Shangtian was cautious at first, but upon confirming that he was undetectable, he gradually relaxed.

He even felt a sense of exhilaration, as if he could do anything he pleased.

"Exhilarating! Truly exhilarating!"

He had flown back and forth across the vast Nine Mountains Province several times in the span of a few breaths. The feeling of lightning-like speed made Ou Shangtian somewhat intoxicated.

At the same time, he couldn't help but feel confused. "By simply flying like this, will that Stone Slab be lured out?"

"Is it really that mystical? If I'm this fast, won't he be unable to find me?"

"Should I slow down and try?"

Just as Ou Shangtian's thoughts began to wander, an inexplicable sense of crisis suddenly arose within him.

An image suddenly flashed in his mind.

The world abruptly darkened.

It was as if an invisible constraint bound him, preventing him from escaping the darkness no matter how he flew.

In despair, his body slowly began to fall towards the center of the darkness.

"!"

Ou Shangtian's heart trembled violently.

He knew this was the spontaneous warning of the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, another innate wondrous object besides his Heavenly Bone Hand.

"What the hell is that? The Stone Slab?" The scene he foresaw sent a chill down Ou Shangtian's spine. Acting decisively, he detonated a Formation Crown he had prepared for a long time.

Instantly, countless formations were laid out, surrounding Ou Shangtian in the center.

The illusory vision from the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths then slowly dissipated.

However, the sense of crisis in Ou Shangtian's heart did not diminish. As the one who laid the formations, he could clearly feel that the hundreds of thousands of formations he had painstakingly arranged were vanishing at an incredible speed.

Yet, he had not seen the one breaking the formations from beginning to end, as if something was silently devouring them.

The horror in his heart intensified. While the protective formations were still active, Ou Shangtian threw out several more Formation Crowns.

Layer upon layer of formations unfolded, and a shadowy figure slowly began to reveal itself.

Ou Shangtian dared not look further.

"Earth Veins!"

He cried out inwardly, and Ou Shangtian shot straight down from the sky into the earth.

He vanished in an instant.

The myriad formations he left behind were strangely compressed into solid, book-page-like entities, all slowly drifting towards the figure that had suddenly appeared.

The figure gradually revealed its true form: a scholar, with a stone slab conspicuously placed on his back.

Each time he received a book page and finished reading it. The page would disappear from his hand, glowing faintly, and then seemed to be imprinted onto the stone slab.

The scholar did not rush to pursue the escaping Ou Shangtian. Instead, he unhurriedly finished reading all the pages in his hand.

The originally calm expression on his face gradually creased into a frown.

"Xuanhuang Realm, when did formations develop to this extent?"

"That light of the world..."

"Could it be an outsider?"

All the pages in his hand disappeared. The scholar looked towards the direction Ou Shangtian had sensed.

"Such speed. And he even has the Earth Vein Ancient Tree as an ally..."

The scholar sifted through the recent records on the stone slab.

He found no relevant entries.

"There are more and more itinerant regions. Even the so-called all-knowing stone slab is eventually becoming less all-knowing."

"You were right, Carefree. There is no such thing as eternity. This applies to Immortals, and even the power we Longevity Realm cultivators pride ourselves on."

Although this matter clearly exuded an aura of conspiracy, designed to lure him to a specific location.

Yet, the Stone Slab felt no fear.

Instead, his curiosity was piqued.

He took a step forward, and in the next moment, he arrived at the location where Ou Shangtian had been.

However, Ou Shangtian, as if he had prepared for this, had already entered the earth veins one step ahead.

The earth vein flow roared and churned, making it impossible even for the Stone Slab to locate an ant within it.

But the Stone Slab was not in a hurry, knowing that the other party would inevitably reappear. Thus, he merely waited in place.

"Interesting. It seems the mastermind behind this has some understanding of me."

Not angered by being toyed with, a faint smile appeared on the Stone Slab's face.

Thus, the Stone Slab was gradually drawn to a tranquil mountain Taoist temple.

Ou Shangtian stopped fleeing and respectfully stood behind a majestic figure.

The Stone Slab's gaze shifted from Ou Shangtian to the figure.

After observing for a moment, the smile on the Stone Slab's lips finally vanished.

It was replaced by a look of confusion and solemnity.

The person before him felt both somewhat familiar and generated a sense of danger.

"I cannot sense the aura of Dao Integration with Self. Is he not in the Longevity Realm? Or, like me, is he an ancient method Longevity cultivator?" the Stone Slab mused internally.

"Does it not tire you to just stand there? Come in and sit," Li Ping said actively, breaking the tense atmosphere of confrontation during their brief standoff.

It wasn't like the meeting of enemies, but rather like old friends greeting each other familiarly.

The Stone Slab felt a sense of strangeness in his heart.

Nonetheless, he softly replied, "Alright."

He followed Li Ping into the Taoist temple below.

Passing through the temple, Li Ping did not stop but continued to a pond behind the temple.

"Fellow Daoist, how long have you carried this stone slab on your back?" Li Ping asked.

The Stone Slab was slightly taken aback, then answered without concealment, "Thirty-six thousand nine hundred and forty-two years."

"Thirty-six thousand nine hundred and forty-two years," Li Ping repeated the number.

"It sounds like a very long time. But it is merely over thirty thousand years. Compared to the lifespan of the Xuanhuang Realm, it is insignificant. Let alone the sea of stars beyond the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Ping said with a sigh.

The Stone Slab echoed, "Yes, thirty thousand years have passed in an instant. Perhaps it is nothing to the world itself. But for an ordinary person like me, it feels like a very long time."

"Ordinary person..." Ou Shangtian muttered softly at this point.

Li Ping smiled. "Shangtian, do not be impolite. Esteemed Senior is correct; he is indeed just an ordinary person."

Ou Shangtian dared not disobey the Sacred Emperor and quickly bowed to apologize to the Stone Slab.

However, the Stone Slab did not bother with him, fixing his gaze directly on Li Ping. "You... seem to know me very well?"

Li Ping did not admit it. "It is merely that I can empathize with you."

"I am also just an ordinary person, merely bearing a destined mission."

Ou Shangtian, upon hearing this, buried his head lower, fearing he might reveal even the slightest abnormality.

The Stone Slab, however, appeared lost in thought, continuously studying Li Ping.

His tall physique was unlike that of cultivators in the ordinary sense.

The several auras that entwined and attached to him were also incredibly profound, making the Stone Slab hesitant to underestimate him.

"Fellow Daoist, why have you led me here? Is it simply to chat for a while?" Finally, the Stone Slab asked all his questions, ending their subtle sparring.

"I am here to help you find release," Li Ping said in a deep voice.

These straightforward words caused Ou Shangtian to raise his head, a flicker of excitement in his eyes.

The Stone Slab's eyes narrowed, and he became wary.

"It seems, Fellow Daoist, you have misunderstood me. I genuinely wish to help you find release," Li Ping's tone revealed a hint of disappointment.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor gestured around them.

"Could it be that you have not noticed anything amiss here?"

Upon hearing this, the Stone Slab's attention shifted from the Faceless Sacred Emperor to his surroundings.

He surveyed the area, and finally, his gaze settled upon the calm small pond.

Chapter 1251

The pond appeared unremarkable, yet a primal instinct told the Stone Slab that a secret lay hidden within. He slowly approached its edge, his reflection in the clear water causing him a moment of surprise. Shaking his head, he changed his appearance in an instant.

"I'm rather curious about what you originally looked like," the Faceless Sacred Emperor, Li Ping, said from behind him.

"Heh heh, I can barely remember myself," the Stone Slab replied with a self-deprecating smile. He then turned his attention back to the pond, studying it intently. The water was shallow, offering a clear view, but after a long time, he found no trace of its mystery, beginning to doubt his own judgment. He glanced at Li Ping.

Li Ping, understanding his confusion without explanation, asked with veiled meaning, "Before the great calamity of the Xuanhuang Realm, numerous Immortal Treasures existed. Now, after over ten thousand years, these treasures have long since vanished. The existence of Immortal Artifacts has become a legend, rarely mentioned even in casual conversations among cultivators."

He paused, then continued, "Daoist friend, do you know their whereabouts?"

The Stone Slab's expression remained unchanged. "Immortal Artifacts? I've never cared about..." His voice trailed off as if he had realized something. He abruptly looked back at the fishing pond. After a moment of contemplation, his appearance shifted again.

Now clad in a straw cloak and holding a fishing basket, the Stone Slab, disguised as an old fisherman, appeared before Li Ping. With a flash of green light in his hand, the fisherman-like Stone Slab cast his fishing rod. In the next instant, his body froze rigid. Without reeling in his line, the Stone Slab remained motionless, as if encased in ice. After a long while, he took a step back, withdrawing from the illusory scene before him.

"What was that?" the Stone Slab asked, staring directly at Li Ping.

"What was what?" the Sacred Emperor feigned ignorance.

"The fish pond? The starry sky?" the Stone Slab pressed.

Li Ping slowly shook his head. "That was the 'Bait'."

"'Bait'?" The Stone Slab was momentarily bewildered.

"The angler is also the one being fished," Li Ping stated, his tone sharp. "Even if you saw all the treasures in the star-filled expanse, you remained unmoved. But if it concerns your path to liberation, can you still remain so calm?" Li Ping's voice was filled with a subtle resonance.

The Stone Slab had lived in the Xuanhuang Realm for an immeasurable time and witnessed countless events. After hearing Li Ping's words and pondering for a moment, he quickly grasped his meaning.

"The immortal path is severed, and the outer star sea of the Xuanhuang Realm must surely be a ruin. Unless..." A flash of understanding crossed the Stone Slab's eyes.

"What, you wish to go out and see?" Li Ping inquired.

The Stone Slab denied it. "All matters under heaven are much the same. What difference would other worlds make? I only wish to shed this heavy stone on my back and finally sleep soundly." His attention returned to the fishing pond. "I don't know when this thing arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm, but I am certain it was after the great calamity. More precisely, it was after the reappearance of the Dharma-Preachers and the establishment of the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

The Sacred Emperor elaborated, "In other words, this fishing pond was likely transplanted into the Xuanhuang Realm along with fragments of other cultivation worlds."

"That seems to be the case... However, treasures of the immortal path transcend our understanding, so I cannot be entirely certain," the Stone Slab said cautiously.

"When you mentioned the path to liberation, were you suggesting I take this 'bait'?" The Stone Slab looked at the Sacred Emperor with a peculiar expression.

Li Ping replied calmly, "Precisely. Don't you find yourself in immense pain? You are one with the Genesis Stone Slab. Throughout the world, I believe only an Immortal Treasure with power exceeding the limits of the cultivation world could separate you from the Stone Slab."

He continued, "As for what fate awaits after being 'fished' by the power behind this pond, that is beyond my guarantee."

The Stone Slab felt an urge to ask why Li Ping, with whom he had no enmity, would seek to harm him. However, the words remained unspoken. It was clear that this Faceless Venerable harbored no ill intentions, otherwise, he would not have revealed his entire plan so openly. On the contrary, the Stone Slab found the person before him quite candid. Furthermore, a familiar aura emanating from Li Ping inexplicably provided him with a sense of peace.

"I am merely weary of living and wish to cast off this burden. I do not wish to die," the Stone Slab politely declined the Sacred Emperor's offer.

"If you are merely troubled by the ceaseless influx of information from the Genesis Stone Slab, then the matter is easily resolved," Li Ping finally revealed his true intention.

"Oh?" The Stone Slab's eyes clearly conveyed suspicion.

"Do you recognize this object?" Li Ping extended his hand, and a brilliant blue crystal floated serenely in his palm.

"A Dao-Melting Stone, I know of them. Are you suggesting..." The Stone Slab shook his head. "To be frank, Daoist friend, I have tried various methods to alleviate this pain. I even attempted the Dao Dissolution Divine One secret art of the Grand Origin Sect. However, the Genesis Stone Slab is an embodiment of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's authority. The Heavenly Dao, being high and aloof, disdains all things. After merging with me, it could not tolerate anything else..."

"That was in the past. Things are different now," Li Ping interrupted.

The Stone Slab blinked in surprise. "Moreover, I can help you."

As he spoke these words, the aura emanating from the Faceless Sacred Emperor shifted. Above the Daoist temple, clouds gathered, and a peculiar rhythm manifested from nowhere, resonating with the Sacred Emperor. The familiar, intimate feeling within the Stone Slab's heart intensified.

"You are?!" Even after tens of thousands of years of existence, he couldn't help but exclaim in shock. "The Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate?!"

However, he quickly dismissed the thought. "No, that's impossible. And..." The Stone Slab looked up at the sky, his expression shifting from shock to solemnity. The authority wielded by the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate was independent of, yet somehow above, the Genesis Stone Slab. Although his deeds were recorded, they were only brief notations, vague outlines at best. Yet, the aura the Stone Slab sensed from the Faceless Sacred Emperor was distinctly different from that of the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate as recorded.

"The Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate wielded the Heaven's Net Dao. Although closely connected to the Heavenly Dao, it was more like a separate entity. However, with some form of enhancement, they could manipulate the laws of the Heavenly Dao as if it were their own limb. But this individual before me..." A thought inexplicably arose in the Stone Slab's mind.

"A manifestation of the Heavenly Dao?" Though almost unbelievable, it was the most logical explanation.

Li Ping seemed to sense the Stone Slab's thoughts and ceased displaying his connection to the Heavenly Dao. He offered no direct explanation, instead returning to the conversation. "With the Dao-Melting Stone to help you share and sort through the events occurring in the Xuanhuang Realm, you should find some relief."

"But the Dao-Melting Stone alone is not enough." The Stone Slab's gaze sharpened, awaiting the rest of his words.

"The Guiding Tribulation Sect, you are no stranger to them, are you?" Li Ping asked.

Upon hearing those words, the Stone Slab's expression soured slightly.

"The Guiding Tribulation Sect's World-Observing Divine Eye possesses a similar miraculous effect to the Genesis Stone Slab. Coupled with the endless paper figures, their Book of Tribulation Passage can also record everything it monitors," Li Ping explained. "The Book of Tribulation Passage, combined with the Dao-Melting Stone, should be enough to offset the side effects of the Genesis Stone Slab. As for the rest, I believe your tens of thousands of years of cultivated willpower should be sufficient to handle it," the Faceless Sacred Emperor stated calmly.

The Stone Slab fell silent, contemplating the feasibility of Li Ping's suggestion.

"Firstly, the quality of this Dao-Melting Stone you possess is somewhat insufficient..." the Stone Slab began after a moment.

"No matter, I can find a better one," the Sacred Emperor readily replied.

The Stone Slab paused, then continued. "Secondly, the Guiding Tribulation Sect angered the Dharma-Preachers back then. Their entire sect was sealed and went into hiding, their whereabouts unknown. Due to their cultivation method, the 'Eternal Calamity,' they can even interfere with the perception of heaven and earth. Furthermore, it was the Dharma-Preachers themselves who acted..."

"I know where they are hidden," the Sacred Emperor said indifferently.

The Stone Slab was stunned. "It seems this individual is even more formidable than I imagined."

With Li Ping having said so much, the Stone Slab saw no reason to hesitate further. "I request your assistance, Daoist friend." He said this with sincerity.

Li Ping had been waiting for this very sentence. "Follow me."

His figure flickered, and in an instant, he appeared at the horizon. The Stone Slab followed close behind, leaving behind a bewildered Ouyang Tian. He had heard nothing of the conversation between the Sacred Emperor and the Stone Slab. Since Li Ping had pointed to the fishing pond, Ouyang Tian had lost all perception of the two powerful individuals. It was only now, as they departed one after another, that he could see them.

"Didn't Master intend to deal with that Stone Slab? Why aren't they fighting?"

"Could it be that they've joined us in the Sacred Dynasty, just like that Earth Vein Ancient Tree?" Ouyang Tian felt a bad premonition.

At that moment, Li Ping and the Stone Slab had arrived outside the Guiding Tribulation Sect's location, at the Dharma-Preachers' sealing point. Watching Li Ping skillfully dissolve the Dharma-Preachers' seal, the Stone Slab's doubts grew.

"This is a seal left by the Dharma-Preachers. Even a manifestation of the Heavenly Dao shouldn't be able to break it so easily."

"Or perhaps, after all these years, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao has recovered enough to contend with the Dharma-Preachers?"

Li Ping paid no mind to the Stone Slab's thoughts, leading him directly into the Guiding Tribulation Sect. Ascending and descending mountains, through endlessly repeating courtyards... everything rapidly shifted before their eyes, until finally, the main hall of the Guiding Tribulation Sect appeared before them.

"Enter."

The Stone Slab followed Li Ping inside, confirming that this was indeed the former location of the Guiding Tribulation Sect. He could sense countless paper figures, seemingly alive and dead, hidden within the gloomy main hall.

"They were one of the Myriad Immortal Sects of the Xuanhuang Realm, enjoying the cultivation resources generated by this realm. Yet, when the calamity struck, they chose to hide and escape. Truly, like those so-called World-Observing Divine Eyes, they are parasites upon the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Ping's words were cold and merciless in their condemnation.

The Stone Slab narrowed his eyes, neither agreeing nor disagreeing.

"'Eternal Calamity,' cultivating through the world's calamities. This is inherently a technique that brings harm to heaven and earth. If there were prosperity and no calamities, these individuals would likely stir trouble and create them. Such a sect should have been exterminated long ago," Li Ping continued.

As if hearing the Sacred Emperor's words, a cold wind inexplicably began to blow through the sinister main hall.

"They thought they could escape everything by transforming into paper figures..." A golden chain emerged from the Sacred Emperor's body. Silently, it shot into the darkness of the main hall. As if stirring mist, the darkness within the Guiding Tribulation Sect's main hall rippled like water. The Stone Slab observed the golden chain with a hint of surprise in his eyes. Then, a phantom image of a golden vortex slowly formed within Li Ping. Thousands of chains whizzed out, following the direction of the vortex's rotation.

*Bang, bang...* Reaching the darkness, they made muffled sounds as if colliding with something. The Sacred Emperor's aura was so potent that even the Stone Slab had to step back temporarily. The Stone Slab secretly marveled, "This individual's strength is considerably greater than the ordinary 'Longevity Realm.'"

"And..."

"It seems to be more than just the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao."

Creaking sounds echoed throughout the hall. As the golden vortex nebula within the Sacred Emperor's body reversed, the golden chains retracted. It was as if something in the darkness was bound by the chains, being forcibly pulled out. If ordinary cultivators were to witness this scene, they would surely be terrified. However, the Stone Slab felt an unusual excitement.

When a paper figure with a look of terror emerged from the darkness, the Stone Slab's eyebrows subtly rose. "It's these guys!" The paper figure flailed wildly, attempting to struggle. The chain binding him erupted with a dazzling light, and the paper figure instantly withered as if struck by lightning. Terror, coupled with listlessness, could somehow manifest on its blank paper face in several different expressions, which was quite peculiar.

Li Ping reached out and firmly grasped the paper figure in his palm. Around the Sacred Emperor, thousands of golden chains danced, and more and more paper figures were dragged out of the darkness by him. The main hall began to shake unstably, and the entire Guiding Tribulation Mountain seemed to be on the verge of collapse.

"Hmph!" Li Ping stomped his foot forcefully, and a golden ring of light spread outward from beneath his feet. The space, on the verge of shattering, froze as if encased in ice. Li Ping lowered his head, his grip on the paper figure tightening. With a slight exertion of force, a wail suddenly emanated from the paper figure.

"Daoist friend, be gentle, please be gentle..."

"We have no enmity, why inflict such cruelty?!" The paper figure ceased playing dead and quickly pleaded.

"Daoist friend? You dare address me as such?!" Li Ping's tone was filled with disdain as he tightened his grip slightly. Simultaneously, the thousands of golden chains around him emitted brilliant light. In the main hall, the paper figures' cries of pain rose in unison.

"Venerable, spare us, Venerable, spare us!" The situation was dire, and the paper figures finally stopped their bravado, pleading repeatedly. Li Ping did not stop immediately. The vortex nebula continued to rotate, retracting the chains. After gathering all the paper figures of the Guiding Tribulation Sect into one place, he ceased the torment.

"This is the renowned Guiding Tribulation Sect of ancient times?" Li Ping stared at the pile of paper figures before him and said in a deep voice.

"They are not so renowned..."

"But it was merely to survive." Among the paper figures' wails, one voice stood out, quite unique.

Chapter 1252: The Truth Behind the Doctrine Transmitter

The Sacred Emperor’s golden chains stirred slightly, and one of the paper figures was pulled before Li Ping. Unlike the others, this paper figure showed little fear. Instead, it seemed listless and weak. Its thick eyebrows were furrowed, giving it a somewhat amusing appearance.

“Desire for survival?”

“If the skin is gone, where can the fur attach? If the Xuanhuang Realm is destroyed, where will you live!” the Sacred Emperor said coldly.

The thick-browed paper figure gave a wry smile, “Our Guiding Tribulation Sect is of modest strength. If the Xuanhuang Realm is truly destroyed, we will have no choice but to accept it. We can only resign ourselves to fate.”

“Could it be that Your Excellency blames the mortals of this world for not stepping forward to save the Xuanhuang Realm? One can only do as much as their abilities allow…”

Li Ping did not argue with the paper figure from the Guiding Tribulation Sect. The golden chains tightened slightly again. “Silvertongued and sharp-witted, unrepentant even when facing death.”

The golden light gradually condensed, starting from the thickness of a chain and slowly shrinking to the fineness of a thread. It began to wrap around the thick-browed paper figure in circles. The other captured paper figures cried out in abject terror. However, the thick-browed paper figure sat as if in formal attire, its expression turning solemn. It chanted words: “Time turns to emptiness, tribulations are eternal. Through a hundred lives and a thousand tribulations, melt my golden body…”

For the first time, the Sacred Emperor’s golden origin energy, which had always been invincible, lost its effect. Li Ping felt the power he had exerted on the thick-browed paper figure being masterfully dissolved by an invisible force. It was even absorbed by the figure, becoming a part of its foundation. The golden threads slowly dissolved. The thick-browed paper figure remained unmoved. The color of the paper figure gradually shifted from an old, off-white to a brilliant gold, nearing the exquisiteness of the origin energy itself.

The Stone Slab, which had been observing all along, suddenly became serious. “Fellow Daoist, be careful. This is precisely the Guiding Tribulation Sect’s ultimate technique, [Eternal Tribulation World]. It can transform the power of all worldly tribulations into sustenance for one’s cultivation.”

Li Ping sneered, “Just a turtle hiding in its shell. You wish to borrow my power to cultivate? Then I shall satisfy you!”

Dazzling golden light, like raging flames, erupted from the Sacred Emperor. The light and fire blazed, illuminating the entire space of the Guiding Tribulation Sect in a golden hue. The golden flames, as if solidified, flowed along the remaining chains and were poured into the paper figure’s golden body. The other paper figures, not the primary target and merely caught in the periphery, let out earth-shattering wails as if being scorched by inferno. One could imagine the immense pressure the golden-bodied paper figure endured. It seemed distorted, as if about to melt, but the thick-browed paper figure remained unmoved, its expression serene.

This scene secretly alarmed the Stone Slab. Even though they could not discern their original appearances after transforming into paper figures, to remain calm and unharmed under the Sacred Emperor’s might was rare, even within the Guiding Tribulation Sect in its prime. The Stone Slab was guessing the identity of the thick-browed paper figure.

Meanwhile, the Faceless Sacred Emperor did not lessen his torment of the Guiding Tribulation Sect’s paper figures. The golden flames burned ever more fiercely. While they did not completely incinerate the paper figures, they slowly coated them with an indelible golden layer. Especially the thick-browed paper figure, enveloped by the flames, its golden light grew more conspicuous.

“You wish to avoid the world and escape disaster, but I will not allow it!”

“The Xuanhuang Realm is in peril, and you all bear responsibility!”

The Sacred Emperor’s voice thundered, and the exquisite origin energy erupted. It shone into every corner of the space, its brilliance so intense that even the Stone Slab had to close its eyes to avoid it. When the light receded, the darkness in the Great Hall of the Guiding Tribulation Sect had completely vanished. The uncomfortable, gloomy aura was no longer present. The paper figures, freed from the chains, fell to the ground in disarray. Compared to before, they seemed to possess a bit more vitality. As for the leading thick-browed paper figure, it had directly transformed into a “little golden man.”

The golden man still had a listless, dejected demeanor. He sighed, “Your Excellency has wasted so much exquisite origin energy on us useless individuals; it is truly a waste of divine resources!”

“It’s not worth it!”

Li Ping said sternly, “If all matters in the world were decided by pure rationality, the Xuanhuang Realm would have been destroyed long ago! And you would not be here to chatter!”

Before his words had even finished, a large “X” appeared on the golden paper man’s face, sealing his mouth. Immediately after, the rest of the paper figures also had them appear. The Great Hall of the Guiding Tribulation Sect, which had been like a bustling marketplace, fell silent in an instant.
