“Fellow Daoist Yijue?” At this moment, the Stone Slab looked at the golden paper figure and asked tentatively. The golden paper figure could not speak, but it winked at the Stone Slab. It was unclear whether this was an acknowledgment or a denial.

The two of them had no time for pleasantries. The space, no longer supported by the exquisite origin energy, began to become unstable.

“Let’s get out first.”

Li Ping, with the Stone Slab and a group of paper figures who had lost their individuality, flashed out of the Guiding Tribulation Sect. The ancient immortal sect, suppressed by the doctrine transmitter's seal, now revealed its true appearance.

A book, opened in the center. Inside, there were no words—only relief carvings of mountains and empty architectural scenes. As the book naturally turned its pages, the depicted appearances changed. However, they were all in silhouette, looking comical and strange.

Li Ping’s massive hand grasped the Book of Guiding Tribulation. The mountains and rivers within were instantly bathed in a golden hue.

“Collect!”

The Sacred Emperor bellowed. The densely packed paper figures, including the little golden man with thick eyebrows, flew uncontrollably into the Book of Guiding Tribulation.

*Bang!*

Li Ping pressed his right hand down, closing the book. All anomalies instantly vanished.

“This place should not be lingered in. Although my method of breaking the doctrine transmitter’s restriction was ingenious, and I restored the restriction while breaking it, I cannot guarantee that this anomaly will not be discovered by the doctrine transmitters.”

“Follow me.”

Li Ping said sternly, his figure disappearing from this sealed space. The Stone Slab followed the Sacred Emperor through the Xuanhuang Realm’s spatial passage and arrived in an endless void. At their speed, they traveled in the void for quite some time before sensing the presence of a world ahead.

“That is…” Stone Slab was slightly taken aback.

“The Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven of the One Beginning Sect? It’s here. Does this mean that the Longevity Realm cultivator who controlled the Grotto-heaven back then…”

As Stone Slab was pondering, Bai Hua had already flown to greet them. After a brief pause, her gaze lingering on Stone Slab, Bai Hua transmitted something to Li Ping. Li Ping nodded slightly. Then, Bai Hua nodded to Stone Slab as a signal before flying back into the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven.

“This is where I recuperate. Fellow Daoist, what do you think of it compared to the original Xuanhuang Realm?” Li Ping brought Stone Slab into the Great Qi pocket realm. At a sweep of his divine sense, the general appearance of the pocket realm appeared in Stone Slab’s mind. Even though some areas were veiled by a mysterious force, preventing him from knowing everything, what was revealed on the surface greatly shocked Stone Slab. Although the claim of the Creation Stone Slab recording all things under heaven had become somewhat inaccurate, he still knew about everything that happened in the Xuanhuang Realm’s territories. However, compared to this Great Qi pocket realm… it was as if centuries had passed, an entire era. The intricacies within were beyond even his comprehension. Furthermore, he sensed the aura of old acquaintances here, such as the Earth Vein Ancient Tree and that disciple from the Beast Taming Sect.

Following them to the Sacred Emperor’s seat, Stone Slab’s shock gradually subsided.

“I have carried this Stone Slab for so many years, thinking that all worldly affairs were within my knowledge. I never expected that what I see and hear today would make me realize that the matters of the world have long surpassed my expectations…” Stone Slab said with a hint of melancholy.

“Fellow Daoist, there is no need to be dejected. Constant change and progress are the true way. If the world stagnates for thousands of years…”

“Wouldn’t that make us seem incompetent?” Li Ping smiled slightly. Stone Slab was momentarily at a loss for words. His interactions with this “Heavenly Dao Incarnation” had been too shocking. Compared to the scenes he was witnessing now, the Xuanhuang Realm in his mind was like a stage play, a false image purely performed for him! This made Stone Slab feel a sense of desolation.

“I knew long ago that the Five Elders Council, the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and even other supreme experts in the Xuanhuang Realm, anyone who knew of the existence of this Stone Slab behind me, would try to avoid its recording. But I never expected that the truth of the world would develop to this extent…”

Li Ping vaguely discerned Stone Slab’s thoughts and said slowly, “The Xuanhuang Realm is the last refuge in the Darkest Star Sea. The original Xuanhuang Realm, other world fragments, survivors of the Star Sea, all represent forces beyond the The Great Barriers…”

“Everything has converged here. The complexity of its form is such that not to mention you, Fellow Daoist, even the Dharma-Preachers and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao itself cannot grasp it all.”

“Indeed…” Stone Slab sighed and nodded. He thought again of the fishing pond he had seen earlier. In the Xuanhuang Realm, how many such hidden treasures were there? He, an ancient remnant of the Xuanhuang Realm, was finally experiencing a sense of being out of sync with the times.

“People and things have changed, the stories are no longer the same.” A long time ago, the scenes from the original Xuanhuang Realm flashed through Stone Slab’s mind, causing him to be slightly dazed. It was the Sacred Emperor’s voice that interrupted him.

“The integration of all realms is a foregone conclusion. A battle between me and the Doctrine Transmitter is inevitable. However, regardless of who wins or loses, it will not change the fact that the Xuanhuang Realm will be reborn from its decay.”

Li Ping did not mention solving Stone Slab’s mental overload but suddenly said this. Stone Slab’s thoughts gathered as he looked intently at Li Ping.

“The key issue lies in the new orthodoxy of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Does Fellow Daoist know the details of the Doctrine Transmitter?” Li Ping’s divine sense locked onto Stone Slab and asked in a deep voice.

Stone Slab pondered for a moment and replied, “When the Doctrine Transmitter first appeared, our Myriad Immortal Sects investigated. This person is indeed a cultivator native to the Xuanhuang Realm. His life story from childhood to adulthood is clear and recorded.”

“The Doctrine Transmitter’s name is Xuanyuan Tuo. He grew up in the countryside. Because he was frail and sickly in his youth, his parents gave him the nickname ‘Gou Dan’ (Stupid Egg).”

“Before the age of fifty, his life followed the path of an ordinary farmer. It was only after he turned fifty-one that he suddenly attained enlightenment and rose to prominence.”

“Because of this, the Myriad Immortal Sects’ initial investigations could not uncover his origins. He truly achieved enlightenment suddenly.” Stone Slab recounted slowly. Scenes from that year also appeared in the Sacred Emperor’s seat.

“…‘Xuanyuan Tuo.’ Li Ping looked at the image of a somewhat simple and foolish youth, who gradually transformed into a taciturn middle-aged farmer, and then into a white-haired elder. ‘It is indeed possible for a mortal to attain enlightenment overnight, but it usually happens at a young age. The evolution of the Doctrine Transmitter, like this, is more typical when one is nearing the end of their lifespan…’”

“It is truly perplexing and raises suspicions,” Li Ping commented. Stone Slab nodded, “The Ten Sects suspected this at the time as well. However, we used secret techniques and Heavenly Dao verification to confirm that there was no instance of soul-snatching or an outsider impersonating him. But the Doctrine Transmitter is indeed extraordinarily mysterious, as if possessing innate knowledge. When several Longevity Realm cultivators from the Ten Sects attacked him, he still managed to resolve it with some unknown method. From then on, he completely surpassed our control. Perhaps, if the Ten Sects had unleashed their full power back then, the outcome might have been different…” Stone Slab said with a sigh.

Silence descended upon the Great Hall. After a long while, Li Ping suddenly asked, “Heavenly Dao verification… What if the method of identity theft surpassed the Heavenly Dao?”

Stone Slab was stunned. At first glance, this statement seemed nonsensical. But as Stone Slab thought about it, it was precisely because the Ten Sects had placed too much faith in their methods that they reached this conclusion of unwavering belief for thousands of years.

“At this point, what is the use of investigating the Doctrine Transmitter’s origins?” After a brief moment of disappointment, the thought arose in Stone Slab’s mind. With a sense of confusion, he looked at the Sacred Emperor again.

The Sacred Emperor’s voice, like thunder, echoed through the Great Hall. “As I said before, the key to the new Xuanhuang Realm lies in the concept of orthodoxy.”

“It’s like a new body pieced together from severed limbs; who becomes the brain is very important.”

“Currently, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao still considers itself the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. But soon, that may not be the case…” Li Ping’s tone was melancholic. Stone Slab knew he was a Heavenly Dao Incarnation and would not speak without reason, his expression changing. “Fellow Daoist, please elaborate.”

“The events recorded on your Stone Slab, you observe them all from an outsider’s perspective. However, with the merging of worlds, memories are like personal experiences, blurring the line between illusion and reality. Over time, one loses the distinction between the fabricated and the true, the self and the other.”

“Especially…” Li Ping’s gaze shifted towards the Xuanhuang Realm, millions of miles away.

“The Heavenly Dao is currently weak, and its resistance is minimal.”

“If, one day, the residual wills of the Heavenly Daos of all realms flood in like a collapsing dam…”

“I fear the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao would be unable to withstand it at first, going mad and losing its identity.” Li Ping’s tone carried a hint of self-mockery.

“After that, if someone were to guide and erode it with a more complete Heavenly Dao will, they could replace the heavens and earth, changing the orthodoxy of the Azure Nether. At that time, even though it would still be called the Xuanhuang Realm, from the inside out, it would no longer be the original Azure Nether.”

Stone Slab fell into deep thought upon hearing this. The target of the Sacred Emperor’s words was clearly the Doctrine Transmitter.

Chapter 1253

"As the saying goes, under a toppled nest, no egg remains intact. If the Xuanhuang Realm is no longer the Xuanhuang Realm, then beings like you, Daoist friend, who rely on it for existence, will likely face a reckoning."

"Even longevity within this realm will be inescapable," the Faceless Sacred Emperor concluded with certainty.

As Li Ping finished speaking, a sense of dread naturally arose in the Stone Slab's heart, as if its spiritual intuition echoed Li Ping’s pronouncement.

"This is something I've never considered before. I wonder what the other Longevity individuals are thinking. We haven't interacted for many years." After a long period of contemplation, the Stone Slab spoke.

Li Ping sneered, "Those few are still planning to sit back and watch the tigers fight."

"But it matters not. Maintaining neutrality is also fine. They were never part of my plan's considerations anyway."

The Stone Slab bypassed the topic. "So, Daoist friend, you're saying the key is maintaining the Azure Nether's legitimacy."

"How can this be achieved? Furthermore, if what you say is true, any unusual actions on our part would be detected and stopped by the Dharma-Preachers..."

Li Ping remained silent for a long while, offering no reply. Then, he suddenly said, "Allow me to first help you resolve the trouble caused by the Stone Slab behind you."

The Stone Slab understood that within the Sacred Emperor’s heart, it was not yet a being to whom he could reveal all his plans. Thus, it did not press further, cupping its hands in thanks, "In that case, I thank you in advance, Daoist friend. If it doesn't work, it's of no consequence."

"Once I act, there is no reason for failure," the Sacred Emperor's words left the Stone Slab speechless.

*Crack!*

The Book of Tribulation Passage was tossed onto the grand hall floor by Li Ping. Its pages, as if moved by an unseen wind, flipped rapidly. Gilded paper figures emerged from the book, arraying themselves like soldiers, one after another. Leading them was naturally the short, golden figure with thick eyebrows.

It was unclear what method the Sacred Emperor had employed, but in less than half a day of suppression, they seemed to have undergone a complete transformation compared to when they first emerged from the Gate of Tribulation. The Stone Slab's gaze focused on the paper figures of the Gate of Tribulation.

Li Ping, however, sensed an anomaly from Mao Bao in the Sacred Dynasty's treasury. As if discovering something incredibly interesting, it flickered to Li Ping's side. Standing on Li Ping's shoulder, it affectionately nuzzled his head, its eyes fixed intently on the paper figures below.

An inexplicable atmosphere instantly enveloped the Sacred Emperor's throne hall. The paper figures, which had been shaking their heads and making small movements, instantly froze like ice sculptures. They dared not move. The leading little golden figure even began circulating the technique of [Eternal Calamity World]. However, the golden light emanating from its body flickered like a candle in the wind, appearing on the verge of collapse.

One must know that even when facing the Sacred Emperor's forceful refinement of the entire Gate of Tribulation, the entire sect had not shown such fear. But now, they were like creatures encountering their natural predator.

The Stone Slab, which had been closely observing the paper figures of the Gate of Tribulation, naturally noticed the anomaly in the hall. It looked towards the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated above, filled with uncertainty. Li Ping, gauging the Stone Slab's expression, deduced that it had not discovered Mao Bao on his shoulder.

He glanced imperceptibly at the restless Mao Bao. The Sacred Emperor's mind flashed with countless thoughts. *It's not seeing "food" and wanting to hunt; it's pure curiosity.* *The entirety of the Gate of Tribulation, though unable to see Mao Bao, instinctively sensed an inescapable, fatal tribulation due to their cultivation methods. It's interesting that they are so afraid.* *Mao Bao, outside the The Great Barrier...*

Li Ping sent a wisp of golden Primal Force to placate the restless Mao Bao. After surveying the paper figures below, Mao Bao seemed to suddenly lose interest. After licking some Primal Force from Li Ping, it reappeared and returned to the Sacred Dynasty's treasury to rest.

The eerie atmosphere in the hall gradually returned to normal. No one took the initiative to mention the strange occurrence within the hall. However, the entire Gate of Tribulation, from scattered villagers, had transformed into a battle-hardened army, moving according to the Sacred Emperor's will.

The thick-browed little golden figure, having received Li Ping's permission, glanced at the Stone Slab and explained, "The Genesis Stone Slab connects to the fundamental laws of the Xuanhuang Realm. It's like the rings of a tree, spontaneously and actively recording everything that happens in the Xuanhuang Realm every moment."

"Given the realm's magnitude, let alone tens of thousands of years, even a hundred thousand or a million years of events, both large and small, are all contained within it. However, when all of this must be borne by a human..."

"It is naturally agonizing." The little golden figure cupped its hands towards Li Ping, "Actually, Daoist Master, resolving this matter is quite simple. First, increase its carrying capacity. Second, create a buffer."

The leader of the Gate of Tribulation feigned complete unfamiliarity with the Stone Slab and beckoned towards the Book of Tribulation Passage. As the pages turned, countless scenes recorded by the [World-Observing Divine Eye] flashed across its surface.

"Our Gate of Tribulation, like the Genesis Stone Slab, has supervised the Xuanhuang Realm to a certain extent over the years. However, unlike it, none of us directly accessed this massive amount of information. Instead, we first recorded and preserved them, and then divided the work for review. While one person's strength would be insufficient, a sect's strength would allow for ease."

The little golden figure looked at the Stone Slab again, "If you were alone, and wished to alleviate or even escape the burden of the Stone Slab, you would need external assistance. It was difficult before due to the Heavenly Dao's exclusion, but with the Daoist Master's help now, I believe it shouldn't be a significant problem."

From the phrasing and expression of the little golden figure, the Stone Slab was even more convinced that this was the former acting sect master of the Gate of Tribulation, the Daoist Yi Jue. However, since the other party refused to admit it, it could only pretend not to recognize him.

After Yi Jue finished speaking, Li Ping finally spoke to the Stone Slab, "Daoist friend, please wait for me for a moment." With that, the Sacred Emperor's figure vanished from the Sacred Emperor's throne. His aura could not even be sensed within the entire pocket world of Great Qi. Only a group of paper figures from the Gate of Tribulation and the standing Stone Slab remained in the hall.

The Stone Slab looked at Yi Jue, wanting to speak but hesitating. "Since we have pledged allegiance to the Daoist Master, all past matters are like passing clouds and should not be mentioned again," Yi Jue stated, not meeting its gaze. "Of course, if you were like us, as colleagues, perhaps a closer relationship would be permissible." This attitude in dealing with things was strikingly similar to Yi Jue’s demeanor from the past. The Stone Slab nodded slightly, indicating it understood the reasoning behind his words.

"In the Doctrine Transmitter's sealed space, even facing the golden flame refinement, our Gate of Tribulation did not feel much fear. This is because we never sensed a true, unavoidable tribulation."

"But just now, in this hall... we felt an unprecedented, terrifying catastrophe. Be careful, that person is not simple..." Yi Jue's voice, barely perceptible, reached the Stone Slab, causing its heart to constrict. It wanted to chat more with him, but the little golden figure refused to respond.

Meanwhile, the Faceless Sacred Emperor, Li Ping, returned to the hall after a brief absence. "This Dao-Melting Stone's quality should be sufficient." He tossed a blue crystal towards the Stone Slab.

"Your Excellency, this is a High-Grade Dao-Melting Stone, perfectly suitable for use as a recording buffer," Yi Jue of the Gate of Tribulation eagerly interjected before the Stone Slab could respond.

"Actually, a Mid-Grade would suffice. Using a High-Grade is a bit wasteful," the little golden figure's tone was even somewhat fawning.

The Stone Slab, seeing this, shook its head slightly and reached out to grasp the Dao-Melting Stone before it. It attempted to integrate it, and indeed, compared to before, the situation was vastly different. The Heavenly Dao's repulsive force within its body had weakened significantly. Moreover, with the influx of Heavenly Dao energy from above, the repulsion was becoming increasingly faint.

"Touch it with the divine, integrate it with calculation."

"Unity of object and self, Dao Dissolution Divine One..." The Stone Slab silently recited the secret art of the Grand Origin Sect. The blue crystal disappeared like ice melting into water, gradually absorbed into its sea of consciousness. The entire process went smoothly.

Just as only the final tip of the Dao-Melting Stone remained exposed, the anomaly above in the hollow space caught the Stone Slab's attention.

"What is that..." Golden-yellow light beams began to fly out from the end of the black passage. Initially, only a few dozen flew out together, but gradually, the yellow light in the passage increased. Thousands upon thousands, like swarms of dancing bees, densely packed. The yellow light also carried an aura that, while not threatening, made the Stone Slab feel immensely uncomfortable.

The sky full of yellow light continuously flew towards the Sacred Emperor. Li Ping reached out and caught them one by one. The Stone Slab then discovered that these beams of light were, in fact, paper figures with bizarre expressions. Unlike the lifelike ones from the Gate of Tribulation, these were purely paper. They exuded an aura of decay, and even without direct sight, the paper figures seemed to stare intently at the Stone Slab, causing irritation.

"World-Observing Divine Eye?" After a moment of stunned silence, the Stone Slab suddenly understood.

"This item is harmful to the world and beneficial to none, so it must be reclaimed," Li Ping said indifferently.

"Didn't the Gate of Tribulation say it couldn't be recovered once implanted? Back then, we..." The Stone Slab seemed to recall something, its voice laced with astonishment, and it couldn't help but look towards Daoist Yi Jue.

That Daoist Yi Jue acted as if he hadn't seen the Stone Slab's gaze, merely saying respectfully to the Sacred Emperor, "Although the World-Observing Divine Eye is somewhat dilapidated, it can be reused after being re-forged. The raw materials for this item come from beyond the heavens, and our Gate of Tribulation doesn't have much left. Such a precious and rare item, we originally planned to recover it after overcoming the tribulation. This is merely bringing it forward."

...

Watching Yi Jue's composed and self-assured expression, the Stone Slab suppressed the urge to teach him a lesson.

"It's not bad for occasionally scouting enemy positions, but if they were everywhere, it would be unnecessary." Li Ping commented lightly, sensing the increased affinity with the Azure Nether following the removal of the World-Observing Divine Eyes.

"Your teachings are wise," Daoist Yi Jue of the Gate of Tribulation responded with a smile.

The Stone Slab simply stopped looking at the two of them and focused on integrating the Dao-Melting Stone. As the Dao-Melting Stone completely vanished externally, a radiant crystal appeared in its sea of consciousness. The countless overwhelming scenes seemed to momentarily freeze. Then, they surged madly into the Dao-Melting Stone. Simultaneously, Daoist Yi Jue's voice resonated continuously. It was the Gate of Tribulation's proprietary method for storing and recording information about heaven and earth.

Chapter 1254

The Stone Slab understood the exquisite chanting and, within its sea of consciousness, materialized numerous miniature versions of itself. The descending holographic records from the Genesis Stone Slabs were then channeled into these sub-entities. The effect was instantaneous, bringing the Stone Slab a sense of relief it hadn't felt in ages.

"This is merely a buffer," it mused. "To completely resolve my hidden worries, I need to store the information."

As its thoughts moved, the thousands of miniature sub-entities expanded, integrating directly into the Dao-Melting Stone. The originally azure crystal transformed into a miniature version of the Stone Slab itself under its control. Through the eyes of these Dao-Melting Stone Slabs, untold billions of other stone slabs could be seen, arranged in intersecting patterns, like a mirror reflecting an endless expanse.

"I’ve already squeezed this Dao-Melting Stone’s computational power to its limit," the Stone Slab marveled internally. "It truly is a Heaven and Earth Oddity. Even a single high-grade one can effortlessly accommodate the information from the Genesis Stone Slabs…"

"Furthermore, I still control this recorded data. After being sorted and analyzed by the countless sub-entities of the Dao-Melting Stone, I can find what I need much faster than before."

With the hidden danger eliminated, it didn't immediately rise. Instead, it savored a moment of peace it hadn't experienced in tens of thousands of years. No longer were its sea of consciousness constantly filled with endless images and noises. Its mind was a blank slate, almost evoking an urge to shed tears.

After a long while, the Stone Slab finally stood and bowed respectfully to the Sacred Emperor before it. "Thank you, Fellow Daoist, for this second chance at life!"

"It was merely a small gesture," the Sacred Emperor replied, though he accepted the thanks gracefully. Leaving the center of the formation, he waved his hand, and the void above was concealed by a mysterious aura. Back in the Sacred Emperor's Seat, Li Ping spoke candidly, "Although I’ve helped you resolve the issue of scattered information, Stone Slab, I will not use this as a bargaining chip to demand anything from you. Whether you choose to act or not is entirely up to your own heart."

The Stone Slab could tell the Sacred Emperor was speaking sincerely, and he was deeply moved. "I and the Xuanhuang Realm share a common destiny," he stated directly. "In the past, I was tormented by endless pain, and thus had little interest in the mundane world. But now that I am free, I will naturally not stand idly by."

Li Ping merely nodded slightly at the Stone Slab's assurance and did not bring up the "Azure Nether Orthodoxy" plan again. Instead, he inquired about something else. "What are your thoughts on the Grand Master Tiandu? If I were to clash with the Dharma-Preachers, would he intervene?"

This question brought a hint of peculiarity to the expressions of the Stone Slab and Yi Jue. Seeing that Yi Jue did not intend to speak, the Stone Slab answered, "To my knowledge, the Grand Master has been recuperating in the skies above Dao Origin State all these years. External matters… would likely not attract his attention."

The Stone Slab glanced at Yi Jue. "When the Myriad Immortal Sects were pushed to the brink by the great tribulation, they sought the Grand Master's help more than once, but could never gain an audience. After leaving Heavenly Capital, there was never another opportunity to return." The Stone Slab's tone held a hint of wistfulness.

"Heavenly Mysteries King, his character is indeed exceptional," the Sacred Emperor commented indifferently. "You ten sects, driven by selfish desires, colluded with an outsider, the Grand Master, to destroy the Heavenly Mysteries Sect. You can be considered as helping a tiger to harm others."

The Stone Slab chuckled wryly, offering no defense. Yi Jue Daoist, however, remained impassive. "Sacred Emperor, you are correct. The events of that year were indeed a misjudgment by the ten sects. But all of that has passed like smoke in the wind. Those who instigated it are long gone. As for Heavenly Mysteries King…"

"He and the Grand Master would have had a confrontation regardless. Even without our ten sects, it would have happened. Furthermore, according to those who experienced it firsthand, Heavenly Mysteries King's disappearance was quite peculiar, and not entirely the Grand Master's doing."

"With Heavenly Mysteries King gone, the Heavenly Mysteries Sect was merely a scattered mess. It was only natural for the ten sects to inherit its authority. During the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's era, they oppressed cultivators too severely. After the ten sects took power, they adopted a policy of recuperation, and various smaller sects ushered in a period of rare peace." Yi Jue spoke not to excuse the ten sects, but to state simple facts.

The Stone Slab cooperated and projected images of those past events into the Sacred Emperor's Seat. Li Ping nodded slightly as he watched the scenes flash by. After a moment of silence, Li Ping said, "The Grand Master is subtly beyond this realm. While the possibility of his involvement is low, we cannot be too careless."

The Stone Slab and Yi Jue blinked, surprised that Li Ping had not changed his intentions. "However, I have my own methods, so you need not worry."

"What do you two know about the current Myriad Immortals Alliance?" Li Ping changed the subject again.

The Stone Slab pondered for a moment and then shook his head slightly. "The Alliance Headquarters is located within the space of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, forming its own realm, shielded from the Genesis Stone Slabs’ perception. Although I have recorded the yearly scenery of some of the Alliance's territories, I know very little about their core secrets."

"However, the highest echelons of the Alliance, the Dharma-Preachers, are all survivors from the Xuanhuang Realm. I have their information, but it's only up to the point before they retreated into the Heavenly Profound Mirror."

"Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance was re-established, they've been gathering resources from the Xuanhuang Realm to replenish their own exclusive world. Moreover, with the empowerment of the Doctrine Transmitter's secret treasures, their strength must be vastly different from back then. The information I provide can only serve as a reference," the Stone Slab said solemnly.

A blue point of light, containing a wealth of visual information, slowly flew towards the Sacred Emperor. Absorbing it, countless images instantly appeared in Li Ping's mind. "This is enough," he said in a deep voice.

Just then, Yi Jue Daoist cleared his throat. "Regarding the scenery within the Alliance Headquarters… Our Guiding Tribulation Sect has some insight."

"Oh?" This time, even the Stone Slab seemed surprised. "That's not right, Yi Jue. When your entire sect was suppressed by the Dharma-Preachers, the current Myriad Immortals Alliance didn't even exist, did it?"

Sensing the Stone Slab's skeptical gaze, the Golden Figure of Yi Jue smiled faintly. "This was a matter of fortunate coincidence. When the Alliance Headquarters was being built, a space containing a World-Observing Divine Eye was excavated and implanted into the Alliance Headquarters' space."

"Although it's not a core, vital location, over the years, we’ve managed to witness some events. We're not entirely in the dark." As Yi Jue spoke, he flipped through the Book of Tribulation Passage as if presenting a treasure. Shifting light coalesced into a page, which slowly floated towards Li Ping. Li Ping absorbed the page and quickly scanned the recorded images.

After a long while, "Are there any World-Observing Divine Eyes still in existence in the Xuanhuang Realm that I cannot sense?" the Sacred Emperor asked, not with praise but with this question. Yi Jue Daoist quickly replied, "Apart from the special circumstances of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's isolation, all other divine eyes have been retrieved by the Sacred Emperor."

"However…" the Daoist hesitated.

"Speak freely."

"Those original locations where the World-Observing Divine Eyes were placed, although the divine eyes have been retrieved, because they resided there for so long, the space itself has been imbued with some of the divine eyes' characteristics."

Upon hearing this, the Stone Slab's expression turned serious. Yi Jue continued, "This means our Guiding Tribulation Sect can still perceive events happening near those 'points of contact.' However, the effect is not as good as direct observation by a divine eye." As if to prove his point, Yi Jue flipped through the Book of Tribulation Passage, projecting countless images recorded from different points. The range was smaller than that controlled by the World-Observing Divine Eye, and the images were blurry. However, as Yi Jue stated, only the performance had degraded; the crucial "monitoring" function remained.

"Yi Jue, what is the origin of this World-Observing Divine Eye?" The Stone Slab pondered for a moment, appearing shocked, and voiced the doubt in Li Ping's mind. After all, the fact that a divine eye could alter the very nature of the space it occupied was not as simple as it seemed. If one were to be precise, it could even be considered a form of "defiance of natural principles."

Yi Jue Daoist did not conceal anything. "Years ago, when the Heavenly Sword Sect forged the World-Breaking Divine Weapon, they shattered the void and shook the Xuanhuang Realm. I went to the ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect to investigate."

"That rift in space was shattered, leading to an unknown destination. Any ordinary cultivator who rashly entered would surely perish. However, our Guiding Tribulation Sect's 'Eternal Calamity' could offer temporary protection within." The expression in the Stone Slab’s eyes became vivid.

"However, I ventured into the rift at the risk of my life, following the aura of the World-Breaking Divine Weapon. I delved deep, wanting to confirm if the Heavenly Sword Sect had succeeded… Unfortunately, the rift recovered faster than I imagined. A power I had never seen before, not belonging to the Xuanhuang Realm, was actively mending the wound. The trace of the World-Breaking Divine Weapon was lost, and I had reached my limit, so I had no choice but to return in frustration…"

"This World-Observing Divine Eye… was forged using that power I collected within the rift." Yi Jue Daoist's words abruptly stopped. However, the scene he described caused the other two in the hall to fall into deep thought.

The Stone Slab suddenly understood. "So, this World-Observing Divine Eye was not intentionally forged into this form by your sect. It is a manifestation of its inherent power?"

Yi Jue Daoist nodded. "Otherwise, how could our Guiding Tribulation Sect suddenly possess a method that even the Dharma-Preachers cannot counter?"

A profound silence fell upon the Sacred Emperor's Seat. In Li Ping's perception, the little Golden Figure from the Guiding Tribulation Sect was not lying. This meant the implications of his words were chilling. Did this imply that even higher-level powers, similar to the World-Observing Divine Eye, were monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm? And what kind of existence lay behind it all? Was it beyond the The Great Barrier, or…?

The Stone Slab suddenly remembered something, and its expression changed. However, it stopped before speaking. Li Ping naturally detected the Stone Slab's abnormality but merely locked onto it with his divine sense, not speaking proactively. The Stone Slab understood Li Ping's concern and waved its hand. "Fellow Daoist, you misunderstand."

"I just suddenly recalled a legend about the origin of the Xuanhuang Realm. It was information I stumbled upon in the deepest layers of the Genesis Stone Slabs, dating back at least hundreds of thousands of years."

Upon hearing this, Li Ping and the entire collection of paper figures from the Guiding Tribulation Sect became attentive. The Stone Slab frowned, recalling as it spoke, "Before the tribulation descended and during the era when the immortal path flourished, our Xuanhuang Realm was somewhat unique amidst the boundless starry sky. In addition to more frequent exchanges with the Upper Realm and possessing numerous immortal artifacts, our Xuanhuang Realm had beings known as 'Great Heavenly Venerates.'"

"You must understand, once cultivators transcend, they generally lose all contact with the lower realm. However, these Great Heavenly Venerates could not only contact the Upper Realm but also summon items from the Immortal Realm to the Azure Nether."

"Furthermore, within the Xuanhuang Realm, the Great Heavenly Venerates held significant authority, far beyond the reach of ordinary cultivators…" Here, the Stone Slab looked at Li Ping. Li Ping shook his head slightly. "I have no memory of this."

The Stone Slab was unfazed and continued, "However, the Great Heavenly Venerates of that era were different from what we recognize today. Their cultivation and strength were not necessarily high; it was more like a…… 'title'." The Stone Slab paused for a moment before uttering these two words. "Like an official position conferred by the Upper Realm. As long as one received recognition from the Upper Realm, even a mortal without an ounce of strength could hold the title of Great Heavenly Venerate."

"It is entirely different now. Without absolute strength, one cannot gain the recognition of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, and thus cannot achieve the position of Great Heavenly Venerate. I do not know when the difference between these two states arose. What I want to say is…"

"The power that simulated the World-Observing Divine Eye in the rift may not necessarily come from beyond the starry sea. Perhaps it is a characteristic inherent to the Xuanhuang Realm itself." The Stone Slab glanced at Li Ping again. This viewpoint caused Yi Jue from the Guiding Tribulation Sect to bow his head in thought.

"The Great Heavenly Venerates of the past, able to control the world with mortal bodies, likely relied on a power similar to that hidden deep within the Azure Nether, akin to the World-Observing Divine Eye. However, at some point, the connection of this power with the Xuanhuang Realm was severed for unknown reasons." The Stone Slab's words echoed in the Sacred Emperor's Seat. This ancient secret, discussed here, was entirely unknown to Li Ping prior to this moment.

"Before the severance of the immortal path, changes must have occurred within the Xuanhuang Realm that ordinary cultivators could not detect," Li Ping said in a deep voice.

"It is merely my speculation. My intention is that we need not worry too much about powers from beyond the starry sea. Even if there is external interference, given that the Xuanhuang Realm has existed for so many years and they have not appeared…" "It seems they are out of reach here." The Stone Slab said softly.

"I agree," Yi Jue Daoist chimed in, his demeanor returning to its usual unflustered state. "Our immediate concern is the threat posed by the Dharma-Preachers. As for these other matters…" Li Ping concluded.

"While we should not be overly concerned, we must still be vigilant." The Sacred Emperor's words, echoing his sentiment when discussing the Grand Master Tiandu, left Yi Jue and the Stone Slab bewildered.

"I have my own methods, so you need not worry."

Chapter 1255

The Sacred Emperor’s words were not empty promises.

Neither the Grand Master Tiandu nor those secretly monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm could have transcended the realm of Immortals.

Although Li Ping was currently only at the Longevity realm within the Xuanhuang Realm, as the manifestation of the Heavenly Dao in this land where too many strange events had occurred, he held the means to annihilate everything and use it as leverage.

Li Ping needed time to sort through the spoils obtained from the Stone Slab and the Guiding Tribulation Sect.

He put away the Book of Guiding Tribulation, suppressing it within the treasure vault. He then granted the Stone Slab a rare period of leisure, allowing it to disguise itself as a mortal and wander the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Ping himself first arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Floating Light Prefecture, Great Crevice.

Deep underground.

Disregarding the superficial protective formations around him, Li Ping arrived in the depths of the ruined vestiges.

Here, he sensed the lingering presence of two terrifying powers, even causing him a hint of unease.

One stemmed from the two statues, or perhaps two sets of remains, within the ruins.

The second originated from the ruins of the One Beginning Sect itself.

“The hidden worries I harbored can all be resolved here,” Li Ping mused inwardly, gazing at the long-desolate yet seemingly recently annihilated ruins.

Without using the power of the golden primal force essence, he silently chanted, “Cat Treasure.”

At that moment, Cat Treasure was in the treasure vault beneath the Sacred Emperor’s throne, playfully nudging the trembling Book of Guiding Tribulation with its paw. Sensing Li Ping’s summons, its form on top of the book did not vanish, but another, smaller feline body materialized on Li Ping’s shoulder.

“Meow~”

Cat Treasure chirped, indicating its response.

“Take everything here away,” Li Ping patted its head.

Cat Treasure glanced at the One Beginning Sect ruins, a flicker of disdain in its eyes. However, it did not disobey Li Ping’s command.

Its form instantly became ethereal, like data in a blue light, and Cat Treasure opened its mouth slightly.

A blue starlight expanded, enveloping the entire underground ruin.

After Cat Treasure returned to its original form, the place where the One Beginning Sect ruins once stood, including its structures, formations, space, and everything within, vanished completely.

Only pure void remained.

Cat Treasure yawned, looking somewhat listless.

The One Beginning Sect ruins were not directly destroyed but completely absorbed into Cat Treasure’s “stomach.” With a mere thought from Li Ping, it could be released again.

In fact, with Li Ping’s current strength, he could have accomplished the task of spatial severance and transfer on his own.

The reason he had Cat Treasure act was twofold: firstly, to prevent his own primal force essence from disturbing the Devouring Calamity that lingered in the ruins.

Secondly…

It was to test the nature of Cat Treasure’s power.

“Not only were the remains of the Grand Master Tiandu unfazed, but even the Devouring Calamity, highly sensitive to the power of Immortals, showed no reaction.”

“Although Cat Treasure is not an Immortal Artifact, it seems to be following an entirely different and distinct path.”

The experiences of his disciple Sun Erlang in the Land of Truth replayed in Li Ping’s mind.

…

Just as the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, under the operations of the great Faceless Sacred Emperor, grew increasingly powerful.

Li Fan, the Sacred Embryo, far away in another part of the star sea, also experienced a bountiful harvest.

On this day, the reverberating stellar force originating from an invisible The Great Barrier erupted once more.

Hiding within the broken realm of the Great Wall, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan could faintly feel the slight tremors of the surrounding worlds.

The tremors from different fragments merged and harmonized, condensing into a peculiar power that resisted the vast immortal force capable of easily destroying star seas.

Influenced by the reverberating stellar force, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan’s body was involuntarily drawn towards the The Great Barrier. However, his eyes held no trace of the bewilderment and panic from their first encounter.

Instead, he was immersed in the joy of comprehending the Dao.

“The reverberating stellar force is a remnant of True Immortal power.”

“And the broken realm of the Great Wall is the corpse of the mortal cultivation world. Although the cultivation world was no match for immortal power when it was alive, after death, they could unite to jointly resist it.”

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan’s eyes grew brighter. “This is the Dao of the entire Darkest Star Sea spontaneously evolving.”

“It is no longer exists as what was called a lower realm when the Immortal Realm still stood. Instead, it is a new Dao lineage reborn from destruction.”

“The destruction of the Immortal Realm, regardless of the reason, signifies that the Immortal Realm had deviated from the most fundamental Dao of the world. The surviving Darkest Star Sea, by instinct, is slowly evolving towards this fundamental Dao.”

“As one rises, the other declines. This is also why the broken realm of the Great Wall can contend with the power of True Immortal Sigils. The Darkest Star Sea has far from completed this sublimation, but if it is given enough time…”

“Perhaps this Darkest Star Sea within this The Great Barrier could evolve into something comparable to the former Immortal Realm.”

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan seemed to have a sudden realization. In his perception, the overall rhythm of the Great Wall of Broken Realms became clearer and brighter, like a resonant song.

His speed towards the invisible The Great Barrier gradually slowed down.

“A day of enlightenment here is equivalent to a hundred years in the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“In this sense, calling this place the ‘Immortal Realm’ would not be wrong.”

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan’s body finally came to a complete halt, floating within the fragments of various worlds.

A streak of sword light slashed backward, and he then flew in the opposite direction.

Strangely, the sword light he unleashed, after flying a straight distance, changed its original direction.

It flew towards the nearest fragmented world.

After locking onto its target, it accelerated, like a silvery-white spider silk, and firmly embedded itself.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan moved continuously in the direction opposite to the The Great Barrier, stepping out from the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

What he left behind were countless sword light threads that slowly faded into the darkness.

“With the Great Wall of Broken Realms as an anchor, I no longer need to worry about being sucked in by the The Great Barrier. I can also traverse the star sea at a faster speed.”

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan transformed into an invisible beam of light and rapidly returned towards his Mystic Immortal Boat.

The strand of divine sense he had left behind previously was no longer sufficient to handle the increasingly complex situation. It was time for him to make an appearance.

…

Both the clone and the Sacred Embryo had accumulated strength for a long time.

Meanwhile, the contingency Li Fan had left with the Sun family also reached its time for incubation.

Sun Luyuan looked at Wu Ninglu solemnly, instructing her on the various precautions to take during her Dao Integration process.

Wu Ninglu merely nodded reflexively, her attention largely focused on the bound Heavenly and Earthly Essence nearby.

The Heavenly and Earthly Essence: White Silk.

As light as smoke, like flowing light, with no physical form, yet magnificently beautiful, emitting a captivating glow that entranced cultivators.

“This is one of our Sun family’s inheritances. Originally intended as compensation for Sun Ang, I painstakingly searched for it. I didn’t expect him to achieve Dao Integration through his own fortune later…”

“Now that Lu’er is on duty in the Law Enforcement Hall, this Heavenly and Earthly Essence, as compensation, rightfully belongs to you.”

“If you achieve Dao Integration, it will also greatly benefit the fetus in your womb,” Sun Luchang said, though his expression betrayed him.

It wasn't until Sun Luyuan let out a cold snort that he grudgingly restrained himself somewhat.

In the Sun family, Sun Luyuan was still the one in charge.

“Lu’er, you may proceed. We will protect you,” Sun Luyuan said sternly.

Wu Ninglu looked at the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family, her excitement evident.

After lurking in the Sun family for so long, it was finally time for a bountiful harvest.

Although this harvest deviated somewhat from her original objective, then again…

“If I become a Dao Integration cultivator, why should I still have to look at their faces? The world is vast; where can I not go? Moreover, formally joining the Sun family is not an unwise decision.”

“Including us husband and wife, five Dao Integration cultivators in one family. Even in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, we would be considered a top-tier influential clan.”

Wu Ninglu’s heart pounded with excitement, and she almost lost her focus, nearly being struck by the White Silk’s mesmerizing, illusory light. “Lu’er, focus your mind!”

Fortunately, the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family acted promptly, neutralizing the attack.

Wu Ninglu immediately dared not slacken, her mind becoming resolute as she earnestly dealt with the Heavenly and Earthly Essence before her.

Although the White Silk’s attack was not particularly powerful, its mesmerizing illusory light was truly troublesome.

It not only caused physical damage but also eroded the mental state of the cultivators it struck.

Even if all the illusory light attacks were dodged, prolonged entanglement could inevitably lead to a series of illusions within the white light’s embrace.

However, the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family had been preparing for a long time. The burning of an incense stick dispersed all the illusions before Wu Ninglu’s eyes.

Furthermore, they possessed specialized magic artifacts designed to counter the White Silk’s illusory light.

Even though Wu Ninglu and the White Silk were vastly different in strength, the latter was eventually slowly worn down to death.

Seeing the Heavenly and Earthly Essence on its last breath, and her path to Dao Integration within reach, Wu Ninglu’s heart overflowed with joy.

“So this is how so many young Dao Integration cultivators in the Myriad Immortals Alliance came to be! With this kind of treatment, even a pig could achieve Dao Integration!”

“To think I genuinely believed they were some kind of peerless geniuses before…”

As Wu Ninglu pondered this, the sharp blade in her hand finally pierced the body of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, White Silk.

*Boom!*

A fierce radiance erupted from the opponent’s body. Wu Ninglu felt an extremely powerful force transferring into her continuously.

“Is this what Dao Integration feels like?”

Wu Ninglu’s eyes were filled with infatuation, unable to break free.

As she was lost in this powerful sensation she had never experienced before, she didn’t even notice that the fetus in her womb was also sharing this power.

Li Fan’s divine sense, attached to the fetus, was not satisfied with the quality of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, White Silk.

“It’s still a bit weak. Not to mention comparing it to Black Slaughter, even compared to Scarlet Flame, it’s inferior.”

“Perhaps I can help out a bit.”

Li Fan’s divine sense watched the power of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence surge into the fetus. He also split off a portion of his own and channeled it in.

This strand of divine sense was but a minuscule fragment, negligible to Li Fan.

However, for the unborn fetus, it was a great tonic, especially since Li Fan’s strand of divine sense contained countless insights into the principles of the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth.

Intertwined with the origin of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, White Silk, it was devoured by the fetus.

The most direct consequence was that the instantly strengthened fetus began to compete with its mother for resources.

“Hm?” Wu Ninglu was not foolish; she eventually discovered the anomaly within her body.

Though she was a mother, when it came to the fruits of Dao Integration, would she willingly cede them?

Thus, Wu Ninglu instinctively began to contend with the fetus for the ownership of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence’s origin.

However…

Wu Ninglu soon discovered with horror that she was unable to snatch it from this unfilial offspring!

“This is bad. If this continues…” Wu Ninglu’s expression changed. After only a moment’s hesitation, she made up her mind.

Just as she was about to make a decisive move and end the life of the fetus in her womb,

“What are you doing!” Sun Luyuan’s roar interrupted her action.

Wu Ninglu then stared in astonishment as her body instantly lost control.

After all, she had not yet achieved Dao Integration, how could she be a match for the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family?!

Wu Ninglu could not speak, and could only use her expression to plead for help from Sun Luyuan.

But Sun Luyuan, along with Sun Luchang and Sun Lujiu, did not care about her life or death.

Their eyes were fixed solely on the fetus within her belly.

The three of them ignored Wu Ninglu and discussed amongst themselves.

“Eldest Brother, have you ever heard of such an anomaly?”

“A being with an innate constitution, seizing the creation of heaven and earth. This child’s future achievements are limitless!”

“If possible, he might even be born a Dao Integration cultivator!”

“It’s worth a try. Even if he doesn’t succeed, being born at the Soul Transformation realm is assured.”

“Excellent, excellent! Our Sun family has gained another peerless prodigy.”

The three Sun family members’ eyes gleamed.

Hearing their conversation, Wu Ninglu’s heart turned utterly cold.

But since it had come to this, she had no room for regret.

Feeling the power continuously draining away, yet concentrated in her abdomen.

In this paradoxical situation, Wu Ninglu’s consciousness gradually faded.

…

The Heavenly and Earthly Essence, White Silk, perished.

The maternal body, Wu Ninglu, died and her Dao vanished.

Only a fetus remained in the arena, born from its mother’s body.

It cried neither sound nor fuss, one finger pointing to the sky, the other to the earth.

It looked calmly at the three Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family.

Sun Luyuan and the others rejoiced.

“This little one doesn’t seem to have a name yet?”

“Yes, I was planning to ask him when we visit Lu’er next time.”

“No need to ask him! Although he is his son, he is even more so the descendant of our Sun family. As elders, can’t we make the decision?”

“I think his name should be Sun Wei. Born a Dao Integration cultivator, he will surely enhance our Sun family’s prestige.”

“Base and vulgar! Utterly base and vulgar! I think he should be named…”

The few of them showed no sorrow at Wu Ninglu’s passing.

They were merely overjoyed, surrounding the Sun family's peerless prodigy.

The infant, who had just been born, looked at his mother’s corpse, a flicker of sadness in his eyes.

…

A pitch-black space.

“I…”

“Am I dead?”

“Where is this place?”

After an immensely long slumber, a consciousness finally revived.

First, there was a moment of confusion, then all the memories of her past life rapidly surfaced in her mind.

A surging torrent of resentment arose.

“The Sun family!”

“And that damned son of a bitch!”

“Kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill…”

Her mind could no longer contain anything else, only the will for revenge remained.

“Do you wish to retaliate against them?”

Just then, a voice suddenly sounded in Wu Ninglu’s ear.

“Who?”

Wu Ninglu jolted awake, looking around with intense hatred.

Chapter 1256

In the darkness surrounding Wu Ninglu, there was only blackness, and she couldn't pinpoint the source of the voice.

The voice, however, cackled incessantly, taunting her.

“Get out!” Wu Ninglu screamed in a frenzy.

Her tormentor ignored her, instead illuminating the darkness with a series of images.

As Wu Ninglu watched, her resentment burned hotter.

These were scenes of the Sun family's prodigy, Sun Tianci, born with Dao integration, shaking the world. Families from the Myriad Immortals Alliance had sent delegations to congratulate him.

Even her own family, the Chen family of the Medicine Hall, had dispatched an envoy to offer congratulations, despite their prior falling out with the Sun family. It was said that one shouldn’t refuse a smiling face, and in deference to the newborn Sun Tianci, the gift was graciously accepted.

As for Wu Ninglu herself, the birth mother of Sun Tianci, who had mysteriously disappeared, no one paid her any mind.

…

“All this glory, all this praise, should have been mine!”

The stark contrast in their circumstances struck Wu Ninglu in the darkness, driving her further into madness.

She wept and wailed, like a tormented ghost.

At this moment, the voice spoke again.

“You…”

“Do you wish for revenge?”

Wu Ninglu instinctively wanted to curse, but the dwindling remnants of her reason urged her to calm down.

Without hesitation, she replied, “I do! Esteemed senior, save me!”

“Hahahaha!”

A wave of mad laughter echoed from the darkness. “Your body and soul have vanished from this world, leaving only a wisp of divine consciousness. Even if you could be resurrected, how could you possibly contend with the five Dao integration cultivators of the Sun family?”

Wu Ninglu’s mind went blank at his words.

Indeed, it wasn’t just her current state. Even if she were to successfully absorb the Heaven and Earth Essence and achieve Dao integration herself, how could she, alone, stand against the ascendant and burgeoning Sun family?

Despair washed over Wu Ninglu. Then, abruptly, she recalled that the senior who had rescued her from the presence of three Dao integration cultivators couldn't possibly be toying with her.

The reason for his words…

Wu Ninglu suddenly understood.

“I implore you, senior, to teach me! Whether I succeed or fail, I am willing to serve as a horse or a servant, to tend to your needs!”

Wu Ninglu gritted her teeth.

“Hmph, you are merely a lingering trace of consciousness, clinging to existence. Do you think I need your consent to control you?”

A powerful pressure enveloped Wu Ninglu. In her terror and suffocating dread, she felt her cautious will on the verge of complete annihilation.

Her thoughts grew weaker and weaker, and Wu Ninglu was filled with despair.

Just then, the suffocating pressure around her inexplicably vanished.

“Fortunately, you are not entirely foolish.”

The voice, like a celestial melody, echoed in her ear again.

Simultaneously, a profoundly esoteric text appeared in her mind:

The Three Disasters Hundred Tribulations Divine Illumination Method.

A supreme divine art capable of creating ten thousand ghosts with a single thought, bridging the gap in cultivator numbers.

Wu Ninglu devoured every word with an insatiable hunger.

“The Sun family, the Sun family…”

Fueled by her desperate desire for revenge, a fearsome intent began to gesture. In her mind, the first malevolent spirit, exuding an aura of intense wrath, slowly began to gestate.

Li Fan, his divine sense observing this transformation from the shadows, nodded slightly.

Even though the Sun family's Saint was, in a sense, one he had personally nurtured, it did not prevent him from creating a natural nemesis for them.

As for when this future peerless fiend, reduced to naught but vengeful desire, would be unleashed, or even *if* she would be.

All of that remained uncertain.

This was merely a contingency he had casually arranged.

“In this world, all preparations are complete. Now, we need only await the unfolding of the grand play.”

“Considering the Saint Emperor’s personality and the current balance of power, the first clash between the two sides should not be too long in coming.”

…

Three months later, the first confrontation between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance erupted in a manner no one could have foreseen.

The catalyst for the conflict was a sword light that descended from beyond the heavens.

On that day, golden light streaked across the firmament like a rainbow.

Far beyond the sea of stars, beneath a towering wall, a Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat navigated through tribulations.

Sixteen characters shone brilliantly within a seven-colored rainbow that could be seen throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

It appeared to be a peculiar form of information dissemination, and even when some in the Myriad Immortals Alliance attempted to erase it, their efforts were futile.

The rainbow of light simply remained in the sky for seven days before slowly fading.

However, the shockwaves generated by those sixteen characters had far from subsided.

In fact, they were escalating.

At Chizha Abyss, Immortal City Broken Palm.

Young Master Shang, recalling the sixteen characters, fell into a daze.

“I knew he wasn’t dead. Beyond the sea of stars, beneath the towering wall…”

“Has he truly gone this far?”

The image of Li Fan, the Sacred Embryo, with his elegant and carefree demeanor, reappeared in Young Master Shang’s mind, stirring a sense of wistful remembrance and a faint pang of loss.

“Beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“If only I had abandoned everything and accompanied him then, what kind of scene would unfold before me now?”

After a long period of stunned silence, Young Master Shang finally turned his attention to the important matters at hand.

He began sending messages to First Young Master Proclivity, Ji Hongdao, and others.

“Have you seen the rainbow of light in the sky these past few days? That was the White-Robed Sword Immortal I spoke of before. You all said I was exaggerating, but what do you say now?”

With his satisfaction at having successfully shown off, Young Master Shang proceeded to check the quantity of Empty Sky Crystals in his personal vault.

Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance had long since classified it as a prohibited item, most of the major families within the alliance still possessed some, hidden away.

Previously, it had been largely forgotten, but with the appearance of the seven-day rainbow of light, Empty Sky Crystals had once again reappeared in the public eye.

The world knew not how Li Fan, the Sacred Embryo, had left the Xuanhuang Realm.

Therefore, instinctive speculation arose that he had employed the same method as the sixteen Dao integration cultivators who had departed before.

The sixteen Dao integration cultivators had ventured deep into the sea of stars for reasons unknown, but the information conveyed by the rainbow of light was clear.

Beyond the sea of stars, in a place called a towering wall, was a Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat.

This Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat possessed a supreme method capable of traversing tribulations!

These mere sixteen characters captivated countless cultivators, stirring their hearts and minds, leaving them restless and unable to help themselves.

The brilliance of Li Fan’s message lay in its ambiguity.

It fully exploited the initiative of the Azure Nether cultivators, making their imagined Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat even more mysterious.

Some cultivators even scoured ancient texts, discovering records of the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat.

“They can travel and trade between realms. So many years have passed, it's clearly far more developed than our arduous Xuanhuang Realm!”

“Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat, just hearing the name makes one yearn.”

“Do you think that rainbow of light earlier was…”

“Be careful with your words, fellow Daoist!”

Regardless of the truth, Empty Sky Crystals had undeniably become the most coveted item in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Despite the Alliance reiterating its prohibition, it could not stop the private hoarding of Empty Sky Crystals by the various families.

After all, so many cultivators were doing so this time.

It had reached a point where the law could not punish everyone.

Thus, they could only make an example of low-level cultivators without backing, to issue a feeble warning.

In fact, even the higher echelons of the Alliance had begun to express differing opinions.

The Sun Family.

Sun Luyuan returned to the Boundless Mirror secret chamber, his brow furrowed with worry.

“Brother, are you concerned about the recent uproar caused by the rainbow light message?” asked Sun Luyao, the spirit of the Boundless Mirror.

“Alas, it's more than that. The problem is the immense scope of this matter. Even the Mirror Controller Fu, who was undergoing secluded cultivation as punishment for transmitting forbidden knowledge, has emerged early. He even inquired about Tianci. That old man…” Sun Luyuan muttered resentfully.

“His intention is that while the Doctrine Transmitter Jiang is suppressing things for now, the matter has become too significant. All cultivators in the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance now wish to know the situation beyond the Xuanhuang Realm, in the sea of stars. If no explanation is given, it could destabilize the foundations of the Alliance. Yet, the Heavenly Venerate has been out of contact since his last transmission…”

“To stabilize the situation, the Alliance plans to announce to the world soon that they will forge another Empty Sky Rainbow, and fly out of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Piloting the rainbow light requires cultivators at the Dao integration realm. Our Sun family has been too prominent recently, with five Dao integration cultivators known throughout the Myriad Immortals Alliance. I fear that if they do seek suitable cultivators to venture into space, our Sun family will not be able to escape.”

“Truly, blessings and misfortunes are unpredictable. If only I had known that Tianci’s innate Dao integration would be so widely publicized. It was our oversight, a moment of clouded judgment.” Sun Luyuan sighed.

Sun Luyao, the Boundless Mirror spirit, also frowned, finding the situation difficult.

“Based on the clues I've gathered from within the Heavenly Profound Mirror, the space beyond the stars is likely fraught with peril. Even with the previous precedent of the Empty Sky Rainbow, this journey is fraught with uncertainty. If they truly arrange for our Sun family’s Dao integration cultivators to go, we must be prepared for sacrifice.” After a long silence, he said gravely.

“We have discussed it among ourselves. This matter is likely unavoidable. If the decree is issued, Lu Chang will go. I only fear…”

Sun Luyuan paused, his voice suddenly much lower: “I fear that more than one member of our Sun family will be arranged to go.”

The underground chamber fell silent.

“Brother, I have a clever plan.”

At this moment, Sun Luyao suddenly suggested.

“Hmm?”

Sun Luyuan listened intently, his eyes brightening.

Not long after, rumors began to circulate in various parts of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The high-level officials of the Myriad Immortals Alliance had agreed to a plan to forge another batch of Empty Sky Crystals. This time, perhaps more cultivators would be able to leave the Xuanhuang Realm and venture into space.

However, the specific quotas for cultivators were likely already divided among the upper echelons and pre-determined. Some powerful families even secured more than one.

This earth-shattering revelation spread like wildfire.

Cultivators were outraged, filled with righteous anger.

The space beyond the stars—what immense opportunities and fortunes lay there!

And they were simply dividing it up as they pleased?

Without any consideration for the feelings of the grassroots Dao integration cultivators diligently maintaining order in the various prefectures.

Although the Alliance quickly denied the rumors, as long as the list remained undecided, the storm stirred by this matter would not subside.

Even some Dao integration cultivators who had not returned to the Alliance Headquarters for many years had, for the first time, returned to seek an answer.

As for the Alliance's repeated emphasis on the potential fatal dangers of venturing into space, and the slim chance of a safe return, these were dismissed as excuses by those enraged.

They had their own retorts.

When one hears the Dao in the morning, one can die content in the evening. What fear do mere dangers hold?

Who among them had achieved Dao integration without overcoming myriad challenges?

To be trapped in the Xuanhuang Realm for a lifetime, only to die in the sea of stars, would be without regret.

The Dao integration cultivators guarding the various prefectures were the cornerstones of the Alliance’s rule.

Now united, even the Dharma-Preachers found themselves in a difficult situation.

After careful deliberation, they finally provided a response.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance would indeed reconsider the selection of candidates, striving for fairness, justice, and public trust.

With the direct assurance from the Dharma-Preachers, the assembled Dao integration cultivators departed the Alliance Headquarters.

However, this also solidified the rumors that the Alliance intended to forge another Empty Sky Rainbow.

Instantly, cultivators within the Alliance began to discuss the matter in private.

With the first instance, there would undoubtedly be a second, and the Myriad Immortals Alliance's exploration of space would not cease.

Although they might not achieve Dao integration in this lifetime, Empty Sky Crystals were still something within their reach.

If they couldn't savor the feast, they could at least drink the broth.

In the underground market, the price of Empty Sky Crystals soared again. As soon as one appeared, it would be snatched up instantly, regardless of the cost.

Some clever individuals, however, had already begun to venture into various secret realms and pocket worlds, digging them up inch by inch in search of Empty Sky Crystals.

The Sacred Dynasty, Great Qi.

Within the Sacred Emperor's throne, Li Ping's disciples were assembled.

They were already aware of the commotion in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

However, in the Sacred Dynasty, all matters were decided by the Saint Emperor’s word.

Without Li Ping’s command, they could only act as if the matter had not occurred.

“Master, regarding that Empty Sky Crystal, should we get involved?”

“Leaving the Xuanhuang Realm and exploring the unknown sea of stars sounds exciting,” asked Ou Shangtian, the boldest among them with a smile.

“Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance wishes to court disaster, let them. The more Dao integration cultivators they send out, the better it will be for us,” the Saint Emperor stated indifferently, his words dictating the direction of the matter.

Ou Shangtian showed a hint of regret on his face.

However, the others pondered the meaning behind the Saint Emperor’s words.

“From now on, you must maintain strict vigilance and be prepared for battle at all times.”

The Saint Emperor's next words invigorated them.

Sun Erlang nodded. “Those Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators are acting like lunatics, searching everywhere in the various pocket worlds for that Empty Sky Crystal. Our Sacred Dynasty is fine, they won’t find us. Most importantly, those numerous subordinate pocket worlds that we have already conquered…”

Li Ping said, “Temporarily avoid direct confrontation, but there’s no need to deliberately evade them.”

“When you act, be decisive. Do not reveal any information related to the Sacred Dynasty.”

The Saint Emperor's words made his disciples eager to act.

“Sun Erlang.”

“Your disciple is here.”

“Yi Shu has been with us long enough. You will accompany him back to the Grand Origin Sect,” the Saint Emperor said calmly.

“Your disciple obeys.” Sun Erlang bowed his head in assent.

Chapter 1257

The Sacred Emperor's intention was clear. The Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance were on the brink of war, and it was time for the Grand Origin Sect to make its final decision. When Sun Erlang found Yi Shu in the Sacred Capital, he was already prepared and waiting with a smile.

"Young Master, shall we depart?"

Sun Erlang was not one to be shy. He cupped his hands, and the two headed directly for the Grand Origin Sect.

"Senior, during your time in our Sacred Dynasty, did you gain any particular insights?" Sun Erlang asked tentatively on their return journey.

Yi Shu smiled. "The scenery of the Sacred Dynasty is different from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and even more so from the Xuanhuang Realm's myriad eons. We have benefited greatly. The sect has now reached a consensus and has also received the approval of the Mother Stone. You will know when the time comes."

"Oh, and this time, you might even have the chance to meet the Mother Stone."

Yi Shu's words stirred something within Sun Erlang. Wanting to glean more inside information from him, Yi Shu changed the topic and began discussing his recent experiences in Great Qi.

"The common folk of the Sacred Dynasty are well-fed and clothed, thus they have a higher pursuit of spiritual matters. Although their cultivation realms and strength are ordinary, some of their ideas are truly fascinating. I have befriended a scholar who has written a book of strange tales. It describes what would happen in the Xuanhuang Realm if there were no Dharma-Preachers..."

Sun Erlang was slightly taken aback and then heard Yi Shu continue, "Unlike the simulated worlds you have experienced, although the Dharma-Preachers are not apparent in that novel, calamities still descend and plague the Xuanhuang Realm. Three venerables rise from humble beginnings, achieving the power to sweep across the land and contend for dominance. One teaches and nurtures the populace, becoming the 'Teacher of Heaven and Earth.' One, with the pure and noble virtue of a sage, makes those around him willingly submit, forming an unshakeable alliance. This is the 'Sacred Sage of the Human Realm.' One, with infinite might, establishes an immortal dynasty on earth. Wherever their armies point, all things submit. This is the 'Great Profound Immortal Emperor'..."

As Yi Shu spoke, Sun Erlang's expression became subtly complex.

"The three venerables fought fiercely, battling for hundreds of years without a clear victor. The details within, while derived with personal effort and thus somewhat rough and not meticulously scrutinized, are nonetheless very interesting and novel..."

Sun Erlang couldn't help but ask, "So, in the end, who won?"

"This 'Chronicle of the Three States of Azure Nether' is not yet finished. Before the author could complete it, his doorstep was mobbed. Everyone claimed he was disrespectful to the Sacred Emperor and demanded to teach him a lesson. Although the Sacred Dynasty's officials did not intervene directly, as the 'Chronicle' began to feature some mistakes made by the Great Profound Immortal Emperor, the controversy only grew, nearly resulting in a death."

"That scholar dared not write any further. The plot has stalled, and I don't know who the final winner is." Yi Shu said with a half-smile.

Sun Erlang coughed lightly. "After I return, I will send those people away and let him write his book in peace. It's just a book of strange tales, why would my master tolerate such a thing?"

Yi Shu hinted, "While the Sacred Emperor may not care, the people of the Sacred Dynasty may not necessarily think the same."

Sun Erlang was about to argue further when they had already arrived within the Grand Origin Sect's territory.

Inside the floating city within the crystalline barrier in the sky, Sun Erlang stepped in once more. Unlike the last time, the cultivators he encountered along the way greeted him with smiles. It was as if they were all very familiar with him. Sun Erlang naturally knew that the Grand Origin Sect shared information, essentially functioning as a single entity. However, this feeling of them knowing him while he knew nothing of their backgrounds still made him feel somewhat awkward.

Fortunately, the journey was not long. Soon, Sun Erlang arrived at the core of the Grand Origin Sect and met Chen Tianhai. Chen Tianhai was holding a scroll and reading it intently. Yi Shu did not enter.

"Greetings, Senior."

Sun Erlang bowed. Chen Tianhai remained unmoved, as if he hadn't heard him. After a long silence, Chen Tianhai finally spoke, getting straight to the point. "The Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance are about to go to war. It is time for the Grand Origin Sect to make its final stance..."

"We will not assist either side."

This answer was quite unexpected for Sun Erlang, and he was stunned. Had they not even made a pretense of support? While remaining neutral and observing the conflict might ensure temporary peace, they would undoubtedly face severe repercussions once everything settled down. Logically, the Grand Origin Sect should not have made such an unwise decision.

Sun Erlang looked at Chen Tianhai with great confusion.

"The reason we made this decision, in addition to the Mother Stone's tens of thousands of deductions that consistently yielded a near-average victor..."

"More importantly, we have decided to temporarily leave the Xuanhuang Realm." Chen Tianhai said, his words shocking.

"What?!" Sun Erlang froze.

"Is it because of the 'Empty Bright Rainbow Light' that has been causing such a stir recently?" Sun Erlang asked.

"Yes and no. In fact, the Grand Origin Sect had long intended to venture into the starry expanse. However, the starry sea is perilous and had always been indefinitely postponed. But that sword message that crossed the starry sea has made us change our minds." Chen Tianhai smiled slightly.

"The sword message illuminated the Azure Nether sky for seven days. During that time, we conducted a thorough analysis and achieved some minor gains. Since the sword message could cross the starry sea, our Grand Origin Sect can trace its origin and follow its path back to its source." Chen Tianhai said with confidence.

"Beyond the starry sea, beneath the The Great Barrier, it is truly a place to yearn for," Chen Tianhai sighed. Sun Erlang also seemed to feel the collective will of the entire Grand Origin Sect.

Knowing that this matter could no longer be stopped, Sun Erlang's thoughts raced, wanting to return quickly and inform his master.

"Young Master, there is no need to rush. This is likely our last meeting for an unknown amount of time. Why not meet the Mother Stone?" Chen Tianhai suggested, looking at Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang hesitated for a moment, but finally nodded. The moment he agreed, the surrounding room vanished, as if he were in the starry sea, surrounded by darkness. Only a brilliant blue light emanated from the depths of the darkness, transforming into a slender line, speeding through the star sea.

The moment he saw this blue line, Sun Erlang's heart had a realization. This was the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone. The original Dao-Melting Stone.

"I was not originally an item of the Xuanhuang Realm. By chance, while traversing the starry sea, I arrived in this world." A voice appeared in Sun Erlang's mind. The communication was not through his five senses or divine sense, but directly through the resonance of the Dao-Melting Stone crystals within Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness.

Sun Erlang's expression turned solemn, showing his respect. The Mother Stone continued its narrative, "Where I came from is no longer traceable. However, where I am going has an answer." The Mother Stone's words sent a tremor through Sun Erlang's mind.

"Where you are going? What do you mean, Mother Stone?"

"Beyond the starry sea is not the true beyond, but merely a corner of the land. If not for the The Great Barrier obstructing it, I would have departed ten thousand years ago. Furthermore, after being fragmented and divided, I lost the ability to traverse the stars. Thus, I could only give up, and so many years have passed in a blink."

The scene before Sun Erlang suddenly changed. The blue line, which had been flying straight through the star sea, inexplicably changed direction and plunged towards the Xuanhuang Realm. Discovered by cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Grand Origin Sect, with its assistance, leaped to become a renowned sect in the world. The fragmented object, unable to return, was no more. Unexpectedly, the Xuanhuang Realm underwent a great change, and calamities descended. To resist the tribulation of "Incompatibility of Laws," the cultivators of the Grand Origin Sect voluntarily merged with the Dao-Melting Stone. Information remained, and the Dao-Melting Stone reappeared. After tens of thousands of years of merging and separating, the Dao-Melting Stone had returned to its original state when it first arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm.

...Scene after scene flashed by, shaking Sun Erlang's heart. He couldn't help but ask, "Senior, you have been in the Xuanhuang Realm for so long and are virtually omniscient. As long as you remain in the Xuanhuang Realm, not being harmed by tribulations is not just an empty saying. Why insist on leaving? Beyond the starry sea, there are too many variables and unknowns.
