Even you, Senior, likely do not have absolute certainty of survival, right?"

"Why must I go? The answer to this question is the same as why you cultivators must cultivate." The Mother Stone's words left Sun Erlang speechless.

"The Great Barrier blocks the starry sea, but some things cannot be stopped by it," the Dao Dissolving Mother Stone's tone was profound. There was a sense of confusion, yet also an inexplicable confidence.

"Little friend, you don't need to think too much. I am merely planning to go and take a look first. If we truly cannot cross the The Great Barrier, we might very well return. As for the reason for meeting you this time..."

The illusory blue line before Sun Erlang's eyes suddenly became solid, as if real, and shot towards Sun Erlang's head. Before he could react, Sun Erlang was struck by the blue ray. Sun Erlang checked his body but felt no abnormalities. Only the Dao-Melting Stone crystals in his sea of consciousness seemed to have changed slightly.

"Little friend, no need to be nervous. It's just leaving a mark, lest we cannot find our way back when we decide to return in the future."

"Of course, we will not treat you unfairly. Concentrate your mind..." As the Mother Stone's words accompanied the synchronized pulses of the Dao-Melting Stone, countless images flooded into Sun Erlang's senses, almost completely overwhelming his sea of consciousness. He quickly composed himself and slowed down the reception of the images. These numerous scenes depicted the Sacred Dynasty in a bitter struggle, suffering heavy casualties. Some showed the Sacred Dynasty achieving successive victories, with the Myriad Immortals Alliance merely surviving in the Four Central Prefectures. Without exception, all were events that had not yet occurred in the real world.

"These are all the products of my deductions. Consider them as a reference." Sun Erlang felt a sense of relief and hurriedly thanked the Mother Stone.

"However, I must warn you, do not place too much faith in these deductions."

"This Xuanhuang Realm is like a bottomless pond. If the water is calm, every ripple on the surface can be deduced. But if the ferocious beasts at the bottom rise and stir things up..."

"The deductions of the ripples will inevitably deviate greatly from reality. Your Master will surely understand this principle."

"So, in reality, whether our Grand Origin Sect is here or not will not change much."

The Dao Dissolving Mother Stone's voice still echoed in his ears. Sun Erlang, having regained his senses, found himself outside the Grand Origin Sect. The crystalline barrier, which had been barely noticeable before, was now covered in a mysterious blue light. The entire Grand Origin Sect had become increasingly transparent, as if it could disappear from this world at any moment.

"Young Master, you must live well."

"Otherwise, our Grand Origin Sect will not be able to find its way home," Yi Shu's voice, with a hint of a smile, reached him. It was as if it were an illusion. While he was stunned, the floating heavenly city before him had completely vanished from Sun Erlang's perception.

"To leave just like that, it's too fast," Sun Erlang muttered to himself, feeling a sense of loss. He stood there for a long time before returning to report the matter in detail to his master.

Looking at the Faceless Sacred Emperor sitting above, silent, Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a little nervous. The Sacred Emperor's next words, however, made him pause in surprise.

"What mark? That was merely the Mother Stone's jest. The Dao Dissolving Divine Stone is an unparalleled wondrous item. That rainbow sword message, even I, for a time, could not fully comprehend it, yet she deciphered it in such a short period..."

"If she can trace its origin and traverse the starry sea, how could she not find her way?"

"Master, then what exactly..." Sun Erlang was a little confused. "The profound sensation I felt when the blue line collided with the Dao-Melting Stone in my sea of consciousness was indeed real."

The Sacred Emperor, with a rare smile, said, "It is your fortune, young one."

"Strictly speaking, all Dao-Melting Stones in the world are merely fragments separated from the Mother Stone. Although cultivators can claim them as their own through the Dao Dissolution Divine One technique, fragments are still fragments. Even the supreme-grade Dao-Melting Stones are inferior to the Mother Stone. However, the blue ray the Mother Stone cast upon you has been like turning stone into gold..." The Sacred Emperor's tone was peculiar. "Although its quality is currently only high-grade, it has been ennobled and possesses infinite potential for the future."

"Given time, it might even become a second Mother Stone."

"This..." Sun Erlang was stunned, not expecting that the other party would leave such great fortune for him after departing.

"No need to overthink it. Everyone has their own fortune; perhaps the Mother Stone merely found you pleasing to the eye," the Sacred Emperor said indifferently.

"Yes..." Although Sun Erlang replied this way, his expression indicated that he was still struggling to adapt.

"Oh, right. Master, those tens of thousands of deduction results from the Mother Stone..."

"After you calm down, analyze them and report them."

"As you command, Master." Sun Erlang, somewhat lost in thought, left the Sacred Emperor's throne. Unknowingly, he arrived at the scholar who had written the "Chronicle of the Three States of Azure Nether," as mentioned by Yi Shu.

Outside the scholar's residence, a crowd was still gathered. Although they were not making excessive moves, they were watching the exit with greedy eyes, as if the scholar inside had an unquenchable hatred for them. Upon seeing Sun Erlang, their faces lit up, and they eagerly stepped forward, wanting to recount the scholar's perceived transgressions. However, Sun Erlang interrupted them with a slight frown. The crowd, understanding, dispersed.

Sun Erlang strode into the house. The scholar was heavily intoxicated. Sun Erlang picked up the manuscript on the table and began to read.

Chapter 1258

The handwriting was extremely rough, with large sections smudged and crossed out.

Still, Sun Erlang could grasp the general outline.

The Immortal Dynasty ruled by Emperor Taixuan grew increasingly powerful, with talents emerging endlessly. In its conflicts with the other two nations, it repeatedly achieved victory.

The Teacher of Heaven and Earth and the Sacred Sage of the Human Realm had no choice but to join forces to confront the might of Taixuan...

This plot was clearly not what the scholar truly intended.

Not only was the writing and choice of words much weaker than before, but even the attitude towards writing was perfunctory. Perhaps unable to bear it any longer, the scholar, before reaching the end, no longer wished to write. He spent his days drinking himself into a stupor, living in a daze.

Sun Erlang was not surprised by this outcome.

In the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, the symbols of Emperor Taixuan and the Faceless Sacred Emperor were too similar. If they suffered even a slight setback in the plot, the scholar would be denounced by thousands. Under such real-world pressure, Emperor Taixuan could only be eternally successful in the storyline. Over time, his strength far surpassed that of the other two sages.

However, Sun Erlang was curious about what the scholar's original intended plot direction was.

With a thought, Sun Erlang sent a sliver of his divine sense into the scholar's sea of consciousness.

Before long, amidst the many杂乱 thoughts, he found the content related to "Chronicle of the Three States of Azure Nether."

It had to be said, the scholar was, after all, a native-born subject of the Sacred Dynasty. Years of basking in the Sacred Emperor's grace had instilled a subconscious reverence for him. His predicted ending was that Emperor Taixuan, after overcoming all sorts of difficulties, would suppress the other two victors one by one, thus unifying the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, there were failures and setbacks along the way, and at times he was even pushed to the brink of desperation, his life hanging by a thread.

Sun Erlang had to admit that compared to the modified version seen in reality, the scholar's original plot arrangement in his mind was more dramatic and gripping.

"As the saying goes, 'writing is like viewing mountains, not liking flatness.' In comparison, the version outside is as bland as chewing wax."

Although Sun Erlang thought this way, the content of this book involved his own master, so he dared not act on his own.

He flashed back to the Sacred Emperor's Seat and reported the matter to Li Ping.

It was merely a small matter, yet for some reason, it caused the Sacred Emperor to fall into a long silence.

"Emperor Taixuan is me, the Sacred Sage of the Human Realm is me, and the Teacher of Heaven and Earth is also me."

Finally, the Sacred Emperor slowly uttered a sentence that echoed in the cold Sacred Emperor's Seat.

Sun Erlang was first stunned, then suddenly enlightened.

He left with a joyful expression.

However, Li Ping's normally unshakable state of mind was, for the first time, stirred by an unquenchable ripple due to this matter.

He perhaps understood why, after establishing the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Doctrine Transmitter had always remained aloof from worldly affairs and unseen by the public.

...

In the Vast Marsh Realm.

Zhang Ming, a Golden Core cultivator tasked with guarding this realm for the Sacred Dynasty, suddenly received a report from his subordinate.

It seemed some unwelcome guests from the Myriad Immortals Alliance had intruded into this pocket world.

"Three Nascent Souls, seven Golden Cores."

Zhang Ming's brows furrowed tightly.

Although he had immediately sent a request for reinforcements to the Sacred Dynasty, the anxiety in his heart could not be calmed when he thought of the large vein of "Empty Light Flowing Crystals" that had just been discovered here.

"This Vast Marsh Realm is not large, and the aura carried by the Empty Light Flowing Crystals is very unique. Even with my array talismans to slightly conceal it, I fear it will be difficult to escape their detection."

"It seems this battle is unavoidable."

Zhang Ming quickly assessed the strength he could mobilize.

Including himself, he had a maximum of five Golden Cores.

The disparity in strength was clear, and defeat was predetermined.

If he chose to retreat, the Sacred Dynasty would not impose any severe punishment.

However, the pride of being a soldier of Great Qi destined Zhang Ming to not retreat without even the courage to fight.

Zhang Ming decisively unleashed the only "Sky Shading Talisman."

As the name suggested, the Sky Shading Talisman could conceal heavenly secrets.

As everyone knew, after a cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm perished, celestial phenomena would descend from the sky. The life story of the fallen cultivator, and even the specific cause of death, would be displayed in great detail on the celestial screen.

Under normal circumstances, it was fine. But in a life-or-death battle like today, any casualties on either side would be instantly transmitted, greatly increasing the difficulty of combat.

However, with the "Sky Shading Talisman," the situation could be reversed, even turning it into a favorable combat condition.

The Sky Shading Talisman not only concealed the celestial phenomena of cultivator deaths, but it could also precisely identify friend and foe, treating them differently.

If our side killed enemy cultivators, no strange phenomena would occur. But if our cultivators were killed, strange phenomena would still descend, serving as a warning.

Although the specific principles behind the talisman's effectiveness were unknown, there was no doubt that this single Sky Shading Talisman could shift the balance of victory by one point.

"This single talisman is not enough."

Zhang Ming looked at a small white jade arrow in his embrace.

"It's a shame that given our squad's seniority, we can only apply for one Army-Destroying Arrow each time we go out."

"If we could get more, let alone these Nascent Soul cultivators, I wouldn't fear even Soul Transformation cultivators."

The Army-Destroying Arrow was a weakened version of the Sacred Dynasty's Sky-Patrolling Arrow.

Although weakened, it could inflict devastating damage on cultivators of the Nascent Soul realm and below.

Furthermore, it came with tracking and aura-locking functions; once targeted, escape was impossible.

"There's only this one; it needs to be utilized to the maximum."

Soon, Zhang Ming had an idea.

"Fu Ge!"

"Yes, sir!" A mid-stage Golden Core cultivator in earth-yellow attire, subordinate to Zhang Ming, immediately responded.

"Use the 'Flowing Power Talisman' to transport these Empty Light Flowing Crystals to this underground location," Zhang Ming indicated the specific spot on the map.

Fu Ge did not hesitate, taking the storage ring handed over by Zhang Ming.

With a flash of yellow light, he disappeared from the surface.

The storage ring contained all they had mined, representing only a small portion of this giant ore vein.

However, if it were detonated and guided specially, the dispersed aura would be enough to attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators on the surface.

"Bing San!"

"You will set up formations along the path to obstruct them. Remember, don't make it too easy for them, but don't deploy those killing formations either."

A middle-aged man with a yellowish complexion saluted and departed.

...

Zhang Ming methodically completed the deployment of his forces in a short time.

However, even with their unique skills, they were still stretched thin in the face of absolute power disparity.

The plan encountered an unexpected hitch in the very first step.

Those Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators were not ordinary individuals. The one responsible for luring them to the ambush site was named Qiu Di.

Among this team, Qiu Di's escape techniques were particularly outstanding.

Unexpectedly, just as they made contact, and before he could even use his escape technique, he was trapped by a white-robed man among the Myriad Immortals Alliance group, who unleashed a Grotto-heaven Domain.

This Grotto-heaven Domain was quite peculiar; it did not manifest specific phenomena but simply emitted a white halo that suppressed Qiu Di.

After trying various methods and seeing no hope of escape, Qiu Di resolutely detonated himself, ending his own life.

Sensing the disappearance of his subordinate's life force, Zhang Ming's heart ached, and he clenched his fists.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators clearly did not expect their opponent to be so resolute. They committed suicide at the slightest disagreement.

The atmosphere suddenly became bizarre.

"Wait, Brother Lin Bai, something is not right!"

After a moment, someone among them reacted.

"Why is there no sign of death?"

"Is it a feigned death?"

"Doesn't seem like it, their soul has truly been annihilated."

Lin Bai's expression turned serious. He looked up at the sky.

Soon after, his face turned grim: "Be careful, someone has concealed the heavenly secrets."

Although he gave this warning, the others not only did not fear but became extremely excited.

"Concealing heavenly secrets? For such an unremarkable pocket world, such a method is being used. It seems there's a secret!"

"We've run around for nothing in several places, and now we're finally going to gain something."

"Even if it's not Empty Light Flowing Crystals, if we can uncover the secret of this place, perhaps it will be a worthwhile trip."

...

As everyone was discussing, they suddenly felt the ground tremble slightly.

Simultaneously, a familiar aura emanated from underground.

"This is..."

The group was first stunned.

Then, their faces filled with disbelief: "It really is Empty Light Flowing Crystals?"

In their senses, besides the diffused aroma of flowing crystals, there seemed to be several figures rapidly flying away from the spot of the underground vibration.

"They realize they can no longer hide and want to escape?"

The group subconsciously thought this.

Although they really wanted to investigate directly, they were still somewhat cautious and did not act rashly. Instead, they all looked at Lin Bai.

Lin Bai pondered for a moment and quickly made a decision.

"Let's split into two groups. Brother Qian, you take three people to pursue the escaping cultivators. The rest will follow me."

Without further ado, the Myriad Immortals Alliance group quickly split into four, heading towards the horizon.

Lin Bai, however, led the team towards the place where the aura of the underground Empty Light Flowing Crystals emanated.

Along the way, although there were some formations blocking their path, they were easily broken.

"These formations were set up by at least Nascent Soul formation masters."

"And many of these formations, I've never seen before. Interesting..."

The group grew more excited.

They soon arrived at their destination.

A giant cavity left by an explosion, where fragments of Empty Light Flowing Crystals could still be vaguely seen.

"Damn it! How ruthless, they actually destroyed it!"

"What a waste! The price of a fist-sized flowing crystal has already risen to fifty thousand contribution points! There's demand but no supply!"

"There are still many fragments, pick them up quickly, don't waste them!"

...

Originally, the Myriad Immortals Alliance group had some organization.

However, upon seeing the fragments of Empty Light Flowing Crystals scattered everywhere, their greed was ignited, and they could no longer hold back.

They scrambled and flew into the void.

Although Lin Bai was also somewhat tempted, he habitually observed his surroundings first.

After seemingly detecting no danger, he also flew into the cavity.

"Strange, this doesn't look like the original underground mine for the flowing crystals. Could it be a warehouse they collected and stored them in..."

Lin Bai picked up a small piece of flowing crystal, and this thought surfaced in his mind.

Just then, his expression suddenly changed.

A small white jade arrow, at some unknown time, silently shot from the dark depths underground towards the several people in the cavity.

"Careful!" Lin Bai exclaimed instinctively.

He unleashed his Grotto-heaven Domain to its fullest extent, and deployed hundreds of command flags to assist himself.

However, the white jade arrow was even faster than expected.

A dazzling sphere of light was born underground.

In an instant, it engulfed all the cultivators in the cavity.

Even their Grotto-heavens completely dissipated.

Not far away, watching the deaths of the Myriad Immortals Alliance members, Zhang Ming felt no emotional fluctuation.

"Brother Qiu Di, rest in peace."

Without any lingering, Zhang Ming quickly headed towards the subordinates who were acting as decoys.

Compared to their side, their situation was quite tragic.

Without powerful weapons like the Army-Destroying Arrow, they could only hinder their pursuers with minor tricks. They were quickly overtaken by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

They were caught in a desperate struggle.

By the time Zhang Ming led his group to them, only two were desperately holding on.

The cultivator surnamed Qian from the Myriad Immortals Alliance was still trying to persuade them: "Fellow Daoists, why go to such lengths? They are merely external possessions, how can they compare to your own lives? We certainly have no intention of taking your lives..."

While saying this, the offensive of his hand did not weaken in the slightest.

The armor on Zhang Ming's body erupted with a crimson glow.

Transforming into a red line, he charged directly towards the cultivator surnamed Qian.

"Brother Qian, be careful!"

Due to the vast disparity in strength, even with the protection of the battle armor, it was insufficient to bridge the gap between Golden Core and Nascent Soul.

He was still dodged by the opponent.

Failing in his sneak attack, he was instead heavily wounded by the opponent.

The glow of the armor suddenly dimmed.

"Hmm? What kind of protective magical artifact is this? It has no cracks after taking my full-power strike?"

The cultivator surnamed Qian's tone was filled with astonishment, mixed with a trace of greed.

"It seems we are destined to die here,"

Zhang Ming thought to himself.

However, he had no regrets.

He had held them off for so long; the Sacred Dynasty's reinforcements should arrive soon.

Before the giant vein of Empty Light Flowing Crystals was discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the Sacred Dynasty could reclaim this place.

"After I die, my family will be proud of me."

"Perhaps, I might even receive personal commendation from the Sacred Emperor."

Zhang Ming's heart was filled with peace. Facing the opposing Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, he said with a cold tone: "Soul Burning!"

The few subordinates who heard this did not hesitate.

As their divine souls burned, their previously weakened auras suddenly erupted once more.

"You're insane?!" The Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators screamed in disbelief.

For these doomed individuals, they saw no need to confront them head-on.

Even with an overwhelming power advantage, the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators focused on avoiding damage and evading.

The cultivation boost effect from Soul Burning gradually disappeared.

Zhang Ming and the others finally reached the end of their lives.

Just as their consciousness was about to dissipate, Zhang Ming seemed to see a familiar figure.

"General Sun?"

Zhang Ming felt a sense of peace.

Boundless golden light enveloped him.

Zhang Ming seemed to see the great Faceless Sacred Emperor on a swirling galaxy.

...

Sun Erlang gathered the remnants of Zhang Ming and the others' consciousness, then looked at the Myriad Immortals Alliance members.

Infinite killing intent instantly enveloped them.

A moment later, the Myriad Immortals Alliance members became escorts for the Sacred Dynasty's warriors.

Sun Erlang's gaze turned to the silent sky, and with a thought, he pointed towards the sky.

The celestial phenomena of death slowly appeared.

However, it was fabricated, completely contrary to the truth, with false information about their demise.

Chapter 1259: One Man Becomes an Army

In the sky of the Vast Marsh Realm, an anomaly instantly appeared, depicting the demise of a member of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

“Nascent Soul cultivator Lin Bai, cultivated for one hundred and sixty-five years…”

“While fighting for the Empty Flowing Crystals in the Vast Marsh Realm, he was ambushed by Qian Sheng, Qian Ming, and Qian Su, and died after being severely wounded.”

“His life extinguished and his Dao dissipated, returning to the heavens!”

…

Clearly, he had been killed by a vanguard squad of the Sacred Dynasty. Yet, the cause of death displayed in the sky was a conflict with the “Qian family.”

This was Sun Erlang’s first time using the Heaven-Usurping Talisman, and its effect seemed quite good.

Sun Erlang meticulously recorded the scene in the sky with a projection stone, a cold glint flashing in his eyes.

He then followed Zhang Ming’s dying message and found the Empty Flowing Crystal ore vein.

He carefully extracted it entirely. Afterward, he deliberately scattered some residual debris that had fallen from the main ore vein to various locations in the Vast Marsh Realm. Finally, he erased all traces of the struggle.

Having done all this, Sun Erlang quietly departed.

Much later, the heavenly secrets of the Vast Marsh Realm that had been concealed and tampered with slowly returned to normal.

In the Myriad Immortals Alliance, in Yueyang Prefecture, the Qian family.

Qian Wanling, the Qian family patriarch and a cultivator at the peak of the Soul Transformation realm, wore a grim expression. Standing below him were Qian Sheng, Qian Ming, Qian Su, and others, who were still somewhat clueless.

“Tell me about the good deeds you’ve done.”

“What good deeds?” Qian Sheng was stunned on the spot.

“Elder Brother, why did you suddenly summon us, and with such an expression? What’s wrong?” Qian Su was also confused.

Qian Wanling slammed the table: “Still hiding it! The Lin family has already come knocking! Lin Bai was the successor the Lin family had high hopes for, and you killed him like this. How can they let this go?! Empty Flowing Crystals are good things, but you need to be alive to enjoy them!”

“Greed has blinded you! Utterly foolish!”

The Qian family patriarch glared at his brothers, his eyes practically spitting fire. If not for the bond of blood, he would have liked to kill them all with a single palm strike then and there.

“Wait a moment!” Qian Ming suddenly realized, his expression changing drastically. He hastily asked, “What Lin Bai? What Empty Flowing Crystals? Elder Brother, you must have made a mistake, right? We killed Lin Bai? What a joke!”

Seeing that they still refused to admit it, Qian Wanling’s heart was filled with extreme disappointment. “To think you’d hide this even from me for the sake of Empty Flowing Crystals? Fine! Fine! Fine!”

Enraged, Qian Wanling immediately took out a recording stone and projected the anomaly of demise from the Vast Marsh Realm.

Looking at the heavenly phenomenon before them, the three Qian brothers were dumbfounded.

“That’s not right, Elder Brother! We really didn’t do this!”

“Someone framed us! Elder Brother, you must believe us!”

After a brief moment of shock, the three brothers cried out in unison, protesting their innocence.

Qian Wanling stared intently at them but found no flaws in their expressions that suggested any pretense.

“The acting skills of these imbeciles aren’t good enough for this. Could it be…”

At this point, even Qian Wanling began to hesitate.

“Then where were you all during that time?”

Qian Sheng and the others hesitated.

However, under their elder brother’s murderous gaze, they had no choice but to tell the truth.

“That day, we were in a small building by Lake Yueyang, absorbing solar energy to cultivate. Suddenly, we sensed an anomaly in a nearby earth vein, as if some treasure was about to appear. So, we went to investigate. Unexpectedly, as soon as we arrived, the power of the earth vein suddenly surged. We were swept into the earth vein, lost control, and were unable to stop ourselves…”

“We only managed to escape recently,” Qian Sheng recounted everything.

Seeing his elder brother Qian Wanling’s increasingly gloomy gaze, he quickly added, “Really. If you don’t believe me, look. Because we were immersed in the earth vein for such a long time, the Spirit Qi within my body is unavoidably tainted with a strong scent of the earth vein.”

Qian Wanling scanned the three of them and indeed found clear traces of contamination by the earth vein’s power.

He then fell silent.

The three Qian brothers thought their elder brother still didn’t believe them and prepared to continue arguing.

But then they heard Qian Wanling sigh deeply, “Even if I believe you, what of it? Will the Lin family believe it? Will the world believe it?”

“The scene recorded by this recording stone has been authenticated; it’s not fake.”

“Moreover, it involves the treasure of the Empty Flowing Crystals…”

“Our Qian family is in trouble.”

Qian Sheng also slowly came to his senses, his eyes brimming with rage, “Who went to such lengths to frame us!”

Qian Ming’s eyes were even redder. “Don’t worry, Elder Brother, we won’t implicate the family.”

Saying this, he turned to leave.

“You scoundrel! Do you want to die by going out now?!”

He was reprimanded by Qian Wanling and stopped.

Looking at his three brothers’ wronged and angry expressions, Qian Wanling sighed again.

Finally, he made a decision as the family patriarch. “As things stand, being misunderstood is unavoidable.”

“We can only report this matter to Lord Fan Li first…”

Fan Li was a Dao Integration cultivator guarding Yueyang Prefecture. He usually disliked staying in Yueyang Celestial City and had built a small building by Lake Yueyang to live in.

“I will make the trip myself. You three remember to stay at home and do not go out.”

Qian Wanling earnestly instructed, then disguised his appearance and left through a secret passage at home.

The three of them were left behind, bewildered and helpless.

Not long after, Fan Li, who was resting in his small building by Yueyang Lake, frowned upon hearing Qian Wanling’s account.

At this moment, Lin Yufei, the patriarch of the Lin family, also arrived.

“Lord Fan, you must seek justice for our Lin family in this matter!”

The Lin family’s informants stationed outside the small building by Yueyang Lake immediately notified Lin Yufei upon seeing Qian Wanling’s appearance.

Lin Yufei arrived in a hurry. Looking at Qian Wanling sitting upright in the small building, he did not hide the killing intent in his eyes.

“Your Qian family is truly presumptuous! You treat the laws of the Myriad Immortals Alliance as nothing!”

“Brother Lin, please calm your anger. This matter involves someone framing us,” Qian Wanling said with a wry smile and an apology.

“Framing?! Is the celestial announcement of the anomaly false? Is the image recorded by the recording stone fake?!”

It was better not to say it. To Lin Yufei, Qian Wanling’s words sounded like shirking responsibility and arguing, and he became furious.

He was about to attack on the spot.

“Quiet.”

Fan Li snorted coldly, suppressing the combative behavior of the two.

He then carefully examined the images in the recording stone, his brow furrowed.

The images were not fake.

But he had indeed sensed the anomaly of the earth vein some time ago.

The Qian family wouldn’t dare use such a ridiculous excuse to deceive him.

What exactly was going on?

For a moment, Fan Li felt a headache coming on.

He knew that if this matter was not handled properly, it could easily become known throughout the world.

“You two, come with me to this Vast Marsh Realm.”

Fan Li said in a deep voice.

…

However, even with Fan Li’s personal visit, he was ultimately unable to determine the truth from the residual clues in the Vast Marsh Realm.

It was true that a large amount of Empty Flowing Crystal residue was found there.

“Old thief Qian, Lord Fan personally performed a spell to recreate the celestial anomaly of demise. You saw it with your own eyes, what else do you have to say?”

“Brother Lin, is it possible that this celestial anomaly is fake…”

“Nonsense! From today onwards, our Lin family and your Qian family are mortal enemies!”

Seeing that the hatred had not only failed to be resolved but had deepened, Fan Li felt a headache.

He looked up at the sky of the Vast Marsh Realm.

“The Heavenly Dao… has changed again?”

Upon returning to Yueyang Prefecture, after several tests and verifications from various sources, Fan Li confirmed that the celestial anomaly of a cultivator’s demise was still effective.

However, he still had some doubts, and Qian Wanling consistently insisted that the three sons of the Qian family were framed. After Fan Li personally interrogated them with his divine soul, he was certain that they were not the murderers.

Helpless, Fan Li had no choice but to report the matter to the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters.

What he didn't know was that this was already the second similar report the Myriad Immortals Alliance had received. However, due to the inherent operational reasons of the Alliance’s system, such matters had not yet attracted the attention of the true higher-ups of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Without anyone noticing, the seeds of chaos had been sown.

In the Great Qi.

Sun Erlang, after compiling the information gathered by various spies from the Sacred Dynasty, was very satisfied with the effect of the Heaven-Usurping Talisman.

Because over the past thousands of years, the accuracy of the celestial anomaly of a cultivator’s demise had been precisely verified. The cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who had formed a fixed mindset, would naturally not suddenly suspect it.

“However, it can only be used for extraordinary circumstances. If used too often, it will lose its effectiveness.”

“It must be used at crucial junctures.”

Sun Erlang shook his head.

He had truthfully reported the heroic sacrifice of Zhang Ming’s team to the Sacred Emperor.

The Sacred Emperor, in a rare display, proclaimed this matter to the entire world and, above Sacred Capital City, used his immense power to create a floating divine palace.

The divine palace gleamed with golden light, suspended high in the nine heavens. From any corner of the Great Qi, one could see the divine palace’s brilliant radiance, like a great sun in the sky.

The Sacred Emperor declared that all soldiers who sacrificed for the Sacred Dynasty would have their statues formed in the divine palace after death. Though their physical bodies were lost, they could live forever as heroic spirits.

The golden light radiating from Zhang Ming and the others' illusory figures, which flew out from the floating divine palace, confirmed the Sacred Emperor’s words.

The citizens of the Great Qi rejoiced at the Sacred Emperor’s divine grace, and their fear of death slowly transformed into fanaticism for entering the floating divine palace and becoming immortal heroic spirits.

Sun Erlang knew that the so-called heroic spirits were likely traces of divine will preserved by his master, manifested from a wisp of residual thought. Although it was still a far cry from true eternal life and immortality, it was still a method of salvation after death. Rather than their souls being scattered and completely annihilated, leaving even the slightest trace in the world was better than nothing.

However, for Sun Erlang, minimizing the sacrifices of soldiers was the proper path.

He arrived at the secret location where the Sacred Dynasty forged their conquest weapons. The Army-Destroying Arrow and the Heaven-Usurping Talisman both originated from here.

“Greetings, Senior Qiaogong.”

Sun Erlang spoke to Qiaogong, who was busy at work.

Qiaogong did not reply, fully engrossed in watching a black puppet rapidly flickering in the space before him.

Sun Erlang didn’t mind and also looked at the puppet.

“Such speed.”

The black puppet kept teleporting, its movements erratic, even evading Sun Erlang’s divine sense.

“Slow! Still too slow!”

“The supply of Primal Force is limited. To unleash the full potential of mass-produced models is still somewhat strenuous.”

Qiaogong said with deep regret.

“Youngster Sun, go up and spar with it.”

Qiaogong suddenly said.

Sun Erlang nodded and instantly moved to the testing grounds.

The black puppet stopped its rapid movements and, instead, launched a full-power assault on Sun Erlang.

It had two main attack methods: one was a black death ray sprayed out, emanating an aura of annihilation. The other was to detonate the array modules and use customized formations to trap and injure enemies.

It was almost capable of fighting an ordinary Nascent Soul peak cultivator, but clearly, it couldn’t even scratch Sun Erlang.

While effortlessly dodging the black puppet’s attacks, Sun Erlang flicked out several blue light spheres. The spheres transformed into different trajectories, accurately locking onto and hitting the black puppet.

A faint glow flashed across the puppet’s body, and it actually absorbed Sun Erlang’s techniques.

“Kid, you didn’t see this last time you were here.”

“This move is called reciprocity, or ‘giving back what you received.’”

As Qiaogong said this, faint blue light emanated from the black puppet. Those blue light spheres were actually reflected back.

“This is just one puppet. The advantage of mass-produced models lies in their numbers.”

As Qiaogong spoke, dozens more puppets appeared in the testing space in the blink of an eye.

In the fight against them, Sun Erlang discovered that these puppets seemed to act as a single unit. Not only did they cooperate well, subtly forming an array, but any single puppet among them could concentrate and reflect the attacks absorbed by the entire group.

Even with Sun Erlang’s considerable strength, facing over thirty puppets without resorting to his killing moves, he began to feel overwhelmed.

He called a halt to the test and returned to Qiaogong’s side.

“Senior Qiaogong, how many of this type of mass-produced puppet can be deployed at once?”

Qiaogong shrugged. “Kid, this is a Sacred Dynasty secret. Even if you’re the Sacred Emperor’s personal disciple, I can’t tell you too much detail.”

Sun Erlang was speechless.

Qiaogong laughed heartily. “Just kidding.”

“Sacred Army Puppets,” they are in groups of fifty and require the manipulation of special cultivators to unleash their maximum combat power. “Killing a Soul Transformation cultivator should be no problem.”

A gleam flashed in Sun Erlang’s eyes upon hearing this.

“Is there a limit to the number of Sacred Army Puppets that can be controlled?”

“Limit?” Qiaogong was slightly taken aback, then understood.

“You want to try?”

Sun Erlang nodded.

Qiaogong pondered for a moment and handed over a black jade disk.

“Don’t push yourself.”

Sun Erlang took the disk, and in his sea of consciousness, he instantly saw an image of thousands of black puppets standing in perfect formation. His thoughts seemed to be a thread, connecting to all these puppets. Each puppet seemed to possess its own consciousness. After connecting, Sun Erlang’s own divine soul felt as if it were tethered by a heavy object, becoming somewhat ponderous. However, this allowed him to control the puppets as if they were extensions of his own limbs.

Sun Erlang adapted to the feeling of controlling the puppets’ bodies, and with a thought, one of the puppets flew into the testing grounds. It began speed and attack experiments.

After a period of adaptation, Sun Erlang felt that the burden on his divine soul had become negligible. He then began connecting to other puppets.

Next, the third puppet, the tenth, the fiftieth…

Under Qiaogong’s increasingly astonished gaze, the total number of puppets controlled by Sun Erlang exceeded one hundred. And judging by his expression, he still seemed to be in control.

“You kid…”

“Not bad!”

Qiaogong suddenly had a brilliant idea. “If you were to control the Sacred Army Puppets alone, would the effect be even better?”

Chapter 1260: Pointing Swords at the Myriad Immortals Alliance

Sun Erlang did not reply to Skilled Artisan’s words, for his limit far surpassed that.

One hundred, two hundred, five hundred…

Only when the number of black puppets surging into the testing ground exceeded a thousand did Sun Erlang stop further conscription, to the astonishment of Skilled Artisan.

Over a thousand black puppets battled each other, their distinct combat styles making it impossible to discern that a single person was manipulating them from behind.

Even after achieving this, Sun Erlang still had the energy to chat with Skilled Artisan.

“Mister speaks too highly of me. I am the Sacred Emperor's chief disciple. In the future, I will conquer the Myriad Immortals Alliance and serve as a marshal, not merely a general. Furthermore, although these puppets are powerful…”

“I am not weak either.”

Sun Erlang’s tone was filled with confidence. “Manipulating these puppets can be left to my subordinates. I refuse to believe that the Sacred Army puppets crafted by Mister can possibly outnumber our Sacred Dynasty’s soldiers?”

Skilled Artisan waved his hand, speaking with disdain, “No, no, no, you’ve misunderstood, my boy. I wasn’t referring to these ordinary Sacred Army puppets. I meant this kind…”

As he spoke, with flashes of black light, the thousand or so puppets summoned by Sun Erlang successively vanished from the testing ground.

A spatial rift appeared in their place, and a colossal puppet, resplendent with golden light like the Hall of Divine Spirits in the Sacred Dynasty’s sky, descended.

A mysterious and majestic aura swept through the entire training ground.

The surrounding seals creaked and groaned under the immense impact, as if they would shatter at any moment.

The golden puppet’s eyes fixed on Sun Erlang, like a deity gazing upon the mortal world, cold and emotionless.

Being locked onto, Sun Erlang experienced an illusion as if he were facing his master.

“This is…”

Sun Erlang glanced at Skilled Artisan with surprise.

Skilled Artisan said, not without pride, “This is a powerful puppet that represents my highest craftsmanship. The black Sacred Army puppets earlier were merely common goods, mere consumables in warfare.”

“Think about it, would I readily let you test genuinely high-end items without any preparation?”

Sun Erlang felt a bit awkward upon hearing this, but his attention quickly returned to the golden puppet silently standing before him.

“Mister, how is this puppet’s strength?”

Skilled Artisan stated proudly, “I don’t mean to discourage you, Sun boy. Although you are the Sacred Emperor’s eldest disciple, if we were to truly fight, you might not be this puppet’s match.”

Sun Erlang’s eyes narrowed, but he did not voice any objection.

Skilled Artisan continued, “This puppet is different from the mass-produced ones. Each one is personally crafted by me, and by the Sacred Emperor…”

Skilled Artisan paused. “Heh heh, suffice it to say, you just need to know that this golden puppet is extremely precious. Even with the entire Sacred Dynasty’s might, we couldn’t craft more than ten of them.”

“Similarly, its control requirements are greatly increased. I was still troubled about where to find suitable individuals to pilot them. I didn’t expect you, my boy, to have such hidden talents…”

“Since you can simultaneously control over a thousand mass-produced puppets, controlling five golden puppets should not be an issue.”

“Such a huge difference?” Sun Erlang frowned.

“Heh heh, you’ll know once you try.” Skilled Artisan inserted a golden sphere into Sun Erlang’s sea of consciousness.

*Boom!*

The scene before him shattered, as if he had instantly traveled from the testing ground to an endless, dark sea of stars.

Ahead of him, two colossal, vermilion-gold spheres emitted heat and light.

Sun Erlang was unconsciously drawn closer, and only then did he realize they were the golden puppet's eyes!

His consciousness was instantly absorbed. When Sun Erlang regained his senses, he stared at his own hands dazedly.

He could no longer feel his original body.

His current form had somehow become that of the golden puppet.

And…

Sun Erlang could clearly feel a surging, unknown power flowing and circulating within him.

“This is…”

As he stood in a daze, Skilled Artisan's voice came to his ear, “I will teleport you to the outer void of the Great Qi’s pocket world, into a special hunting ground. There, you can freely test this puppet body.”

The surrounding space warped, and Sun Erlang instantly found himself in a dark void.

He could faintly see the scene of the Sacred Dynasty, surrounded by numerous pocket worlds in the distance.

“Roar!”

A silver-scaled giant python, thousands of feet long, suddenly emerged from nowhere, opening its cavernous maw.

In the next instant, it was about to swallow the golden puppet controlled by Sun Erlang whole.

However, Sun Erlang did not attempt any defense. He merely let the puppet’s surface emit a faint luster.

The silver-scaled python ignited as if by flames, turning to ash in agony and dying in pain.

The python's death was like a stone dropped into a pond, creating ripples.

Over a hundred unknown ferocious beasts emerged from the darkness, seemingly devoid of any reason, and attacked Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang could clearly feel that each of these ferocious beasts, specially cultivated by the Sacred Dynasty, possessed a strength no less than that of a Nascent Soul cultivator.

But facing their encirclement…

Sun Erlang extended his left hand, flicking it as if playing a zither, caressing it lightly.

The space rippled.

The ferocious beasts, which were previously emanating murderous intent, still held the expressions they had in life. Their bodies, however, were instantly torn into countless fragments, falling like rain.

“Power of Law.”

“Law of Space.”

Sun Erlang quietly looked at his left hand, a clear realization dawning in his heart.

As this moment of enlightenment struck, he felt as if a figure was hidden within him.

“Essence of Heaven and Earth?”

Even after unleashing such a killing blow, Sun Erlang, while piloting the golden puppet, felt no fatigue.

The energy contained within the puppet seemed inexhaustible.

“A puppet stronger than Dao Integration?”

Sun Erlang was certain that the seemingly effortless move he had just made would be enough to heavily wound a Dao Integration cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm.

And this was far from the golden puppet’s functional limit.

“No wonder Mister Skilled Artisan said I am not its match.”

While his heart was filled with indescribable shock, Sun Erlang also felt a sense of loss.

As the Sacred Emperor's chief disciple, he enjoyed countless resources. He even had the fortuitous encounter from the Grand Origin Sect…

To think that in the end, he wasn’t even as good as a casually crafted puppet?

Then what was the meaning of his cultivation?

While he was lost in thought, the golden puppet's form flickered, and it returned to the testing ground.

Sun Erlang also detached from the puppet's body, returning to his own self.

Weak.

An extreme sense of contrast immediately surged within Sun Erlang.

“Heh heh, you’re feeling discouraged, aren’t you, my boy? Actually, there’s no need.”

“The resources we spent on the golden puppets, if piled up, could have nurtured a normal cultivator all the way to Dao Integration.”

Skilled Artisan patted Sun Erlang’s shoulder, “You must have felt it too; each puppet contains the power of the Essence of Heaven and Earth. With such an Essence of Heaven and Earth as its core, these puppets are like fish in water when fighting in the Xuanhuang Realm environment, gaining nearly a third of their battle strength enhancement.”

“Furthermore, if the same person manipulates multiple puppets…”

Skilled Artisan's tone suddenly became excited. “The puppets can even lend each other the law power of their respective Essences of Heaven and Earth!”

“Their burst combat power in a short time can multiply several times over!”

Sun Erlang looked at the golden, majestic puppet standing back in the testing space like a deity, silent.

“There will inevitably be a war between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the future. What truly determines the course of the war is high-end combat power. How many Dao Integration cultivators does the Myriad Immortals Alliance have? At least nearly a thousand. And how many disciples does the Sacred Emperor have?”

“Moreover, you are all still too young compared to those veteran Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. You might not gain an advantage. You can’t expect the Sacred Emperor to step in personally to deal with these Dao Integration cultivators, can you?” Skilled Artisan said with a faint sigh.

“At the highest realm, whoever reveals themselves first means they reveal their weakness first. Boy, you need to be mentally prepared. The Sacred Emperor might not easily intervene in the upcoming war.” Sun Erlang nodded. “I understand this principle, of course.”

“With these golden puppets, we can significantly narrow the gap in power between us. Sun boy, do you want to give it a try?” Skilled Artisan asked.

“As long as you can control three of them simultaneously, annihilating a Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivator will be a piece of cake,” Skilled Artisan guaranteed.

Sun Erlang slowly nodded.

…

Within the Sacred Emperor’s Seat.

The conversation between the eldest disciple and Skilled Artisan naturally did not escape the Sacred Emperor’s notice.

The golden puppets, with Essence of Primal Force and the Azure Nether Essence of Heaven and Earth as their core, transformed the mundane into the miraculous. Using pure resources, they had successfully created puppets capable of crushing Dao Integration battle strength.

The inspiration for this naturally came from True Yang.

In fact, True Yang, with the modification of golden primal force and Skilled Artisan’s craft, had already surpassed Dao Integration, reaching the Longevity Realm. And…

He was not far from reaching the limit of the mortal realm.

However, regretfully, there seemed to be some kind of celestial bar. True Yang’s own progress experience could not be applied to other puppets.

Even with entirely identical crafting blueprints, the subsequent puppets were weaker than True Yang by an entire major realm.

Aside from True Yang’s special circumstances of transforming into a puppet, Li Ping speculated that there were more profound reasons involved.

“The first to tread a path exhausts its Dao. Similar to how the Unnamed True Immortal attained his Dao, his path cannot be trespassed upon. This is also the case for these puppets.”

“However, the restrictions seem even more stringent.”

Still, with True Yang and these current golden puppets assisting, Li Ping was quite satisfied.

War, in essence, was a competition of whose trump cards were more numerous.

Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance was unfathomable, his own readily available resources were not few.

Moreover, there was one point Skilled Artisan had misunderstood.

“True powerhouses do not lack weaknesses.”

“Rather, they are not afraid of others targeting their weaknesses.”

He would not always hide behind during this war against the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Otherwise, how could he live up to the title of Sacred Emperor?

“Dharma-Preachers.”

Li Ping sat calmly, but his gaze pierced through the heavens, reaching beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

In his hand, he toyed with a dazzling, seven-colored crystal.

Empty Light Flowing Crystals.

Through the sensory recording of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, Li Ping had already gained a preliminary grasp of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's rainbow light escape technique.

He decided to borrow the puppet’s body and journey to the depths of the star sea before the war began.

Not to engage in conflict with the Dharma-Preachers prematurely, but to comprehend the Dao in the star sea.

“In this war, I will surely win.”

The Sacred Emperor's belief had never wavered.

…

Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Within the Dharma Deduction space.

Sensing the faint intention transmitted by his clone, Li Fan nodded slightly.

Although as the Sacred Emperor's strength grew increasingly profound, his own perception of him weakened, the general direction of the Sacred Emperor’s actions remained steadily on course.

Coupled with the contingency plans he had left behind, Li Fan was not worried about things going awry.

Moreover, as long as the objective of forcing out the Dharma-Preachers’ purpose was achieved.

As for other matters…

A single thought of reflection, all is illusory.

Having sat in the Dharma Deduction space for such a long time, continuously gaining insights from the Sacred Emperor and the Sacred Embryo, Li Fan himself had benefited greatly.

Especially in touching the higher-level laws that surpassed the Xuanhuang Realm's limit at the other end of the star sea, Li Fan had gained thoughts on the path ahead.

“Although under the constraints of the New Law, one can still find alternative paths.”

“The Doctrine Transmitter system is reliant on the Xuanhuang Realm itself. If one were to start anew in the starry heavens, they could escape these restrictions.”

“However, doing so would mean not receiving the Azure Nether's aid. There are pros and cons. Furthermore, resources in the starry heavens are scarce, and achieving anything substantial might require reliance on the Mystic Immortal Boat.”

“And that invisible The Great Barrier.”

“It seems to be a power entirely different from the Dark Abyss star sea system. However, it can restrain the power of True Immortals, so its might is unimaginable. If one could learn from it, it might serve as a surprise tactic in future battles with the Dharma-Preachers.”

“My only concern is…”

Li Fan frowned slightly. “The Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physician left the Xuanhuang Realm much earlier than I did. Their talents must also surpass mine.”

“They must have already discovered all these insights that I am currently uncovering.”

“Therefore, the so-called advantage… is not an advantage at all.”

“…”

“It seems only by fighting an actual battle can we truly know their capabilities.”

It must be said that with each reincarnation, the veil of mystery surrounding the Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physician had gradually been lifted. From being someone Li Fan initially avoided at all costs, he now increasingly desired to test them.

Perhaps the day he truly defeats them was not far off.

Li Fan then thought of the cat treasure found by the Sacred Emperor’s clone.

If there was anything in this world he particularly cared about, it was the treasures outside the The Great Barrier that he hadn't managed to fish out before.

“The angler is also being fished…”

A peculiar gleam flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

The special performance of the cat treasure by the entire Guiding Tribulation Sect made Li Fan ponder many things.

However, at present, it was still speculation.

The Sacred Emperor's clone had also sensed this anomaly.

The reason for going to the One Beginning Sect to collect the Devouring Calamity and the Grand Master's skeletal remains was precisely due to this consideration.

…

While Li Fan was contemplating, the peaceful Dharma Deduction space was suddenly broken.

Someone had come to visit.

It was Sun Luyuan, from the Sun family.

“Lu'er, good news, good news!”

After greeting the other two Dao Integration realm guardians, Sun Luyuan said to Li Fan.

“I know.”

Li Fan’s reaction made Sun Luyuan slightly taken aback.

“Through bloodline connection, how could I not know.”

“How is Ningjiu?” Li Fan asked, suppressing a smile at the corner of his mouth.

Sun Luyuan sighed softly. “Ningjiu has unfortunately passed away. However, the fetus is unharmed. This is why I’ve come to see you so late; I was afraid you wouldn’t be able to accept it.”

Sun Luyuan changed the subject. “Do you know how extraordinary that infant is? Born with Dao Integration…”

Chapter 1261

"The cat treasure's triple transformation," chapter 1261.

Sun Luyuan spoke incessantly, while Li Fan seemed unable to shake off his shock and grief from learning that his beloved wife had perished.

"It is fate, destiny. No wonder I felt uneasy for so long recently."

"Trapped here, I couldn't even see her one last time," Li Fan said with sorrow.

"My son, does he have a name yet?"

Sun Luyuan said with a composed expression, "Sun Tianci. Ninglu personally named our son before she died."

After a brief silence, Li Fan said with a mixture of grief and relief, "Tianci… a good name."

After discussing Sun Tianci, Sun Luyuan's expression gradually turned serious as he spoke of important matters.

"Your eldest uncle, Sun Lucheng, is leaving."

Sun Luyuan simply recounted how a sword light appeared in the sky, bringing news from the Xuan Shang Immortal Boat from beyond the sea of stars.

Li Fan was somewhat surprised, "In that case, traveling far beyond the star-filled sky is not a good thing at all. Can it be declined?"

Sun Luyuan shook his head, "The current situation is that the higher families in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who know the truth, are avoiding it like the plague, while the lower-level Dao Integration cultivators, who are unaware of the situation, are scrambling to go. To have more scapegoats, they naturally won't tell them the truth of the matter. It's truly ironic."

"Although Uncle is a Dao Integration cultivator, he has grown accustomed to a peaceful life these years. I'm afraid…" Li Fan said with some worry.

"If I weren't stationed here and unable to leave, I would definitely go in Uncle's place beyond the starry sky."

Li Fan's words were decisive, fitting the image Sun Ang had previously displayed.

Sun Luyuan did not doubt him, merely showing displeasure. "Our Sun family is gaining too much attention, guarding the Dharma Deduction Jade, traveling beyond the starry sky… these arrangements are hard to say are not a deliberate attempt by the Myriad Immortals Alliance to suppress us."

"Don't think too much about it. Just live here at ease."

Without revealing to Li Fan that the Sun family had already pledged allegiance to the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, Sun Luyuan only cautioned Li Fan to prioritize stability in all matters.

"I've already spoken to Elder Xu."

"Perhaps you won't have to stay the full three hundred years to achieve your goal and get out." Sun Luyuan said before departing.

"The family head has been thoughtful." Li Fan said gratefully.

"Right, I've been meditating here for several years, summarizing my lifelong learning, and I've had some gains."

"Perhaps the family head could pass this chapter, 'Upright Dharma Elevation,' to Tianci for me."

As he spoke, an ordinary-looking text appeared in Sun Luyuan's mind.

He glanced at it, finding nothing particularly special. It was merely a common method for refining the heart and strengthening the will.

Sun Luyuan nodded and immediately agreed. Then, he took his leave.

Only after Sun Luyuan's figure disappeared did Li Fan sneer inwardly, "A hundred years. It's questionable whether the Xuanhuang Realm can even survive that long."

However, he knew that the Myriad Immortals Alliance was secretly monitoring this place, so he didn't dwell on it, the thought merely a fleeting flash in his mind. As for the 'Upright Dharma Elevation,' it was a seed planted for Sun Tianci's future rise.

Li Fan looked at the Dharma Deduction Jade, which was again showing signs of slackening and pretending to be lazy, and couldn't help but painstakingly urge and admonish it again.

…

Sacred Dynasty Great Qi.

Sacred Dynasty Secret Weapon Testing Ground.

Li Ping, along with Qiao Gong, watched Sun Erlang as he strenuously operated the third Sacred Punishment Divine Puppet.

Sacred Punishment Divine Puppet was the name Li Ping gave to the golden puppet, distinguishing it from the ordinary Sacred Army Puppets.

"Young Sun indeed has extraordinary talent and terrifying adaptability. He's already gotten the hang of the third divine puppet so quickly. It's possible he could control all our reserve divine puppets," Qiao Gong praised heartily.

"Compared to him, everyone in my Sect of Spiritual Primal is just trash."

"Speaking of which, you've been in the Sacred Dynasty all this time. Is everything alright with the Sect of Spiritual Primal in Nine Mountains Province?" Li Ping asked casually, his gaze fixed on Sun Erlang in the testing ground, sweat continuously dripping from his forehead.

Qiao Gong waved his hand, "In Nine Mountains Province, my puppets are overseeing things. Those fools are always cowering before me, afraid to even look up. How could they possibly discern the truth?"

Here, Qiao Gong paused. "However, if my calculations are correct, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's tax collector should be arriving soon. Perhaps I'll have to go back then."

Li Ping knew that Qiao Gong was collecting a large amount of Origin Force in Nine Mountains Province through the All Beings Spiritual Essence Technique, with the permission of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The price was to hand over a portion of it. A significant portion.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance shouldn't be lacking in expendable materials. Why are they so particularly concerned about your share?" Li Ping asked.

Qiao Gong was unfazed. "Who knows? Perhaps they find it inconvenient to get their hands dirty with such despicable deeds themselves."

"However…" Qiao Gong seemed to recall something. "Now that you mention it, I do remember. When that Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy came before, he casually mentioned that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had a large internal deficit, so they had to cut costs."

"I even teased him then, saying that the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed wealthy, but was actually penniless."

Li Ping fell into thought upon hearing this.

"Origin Force, it's just pure, ownerless cultivation. Normal cultivators don't need it…"

"Interesting."

"When the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy comes this time, I'll meet him on your behalf," Li Ping decided.

"Excellent, excellent." Qiao Gong, unable to extricate himself, couldn't be happier. He immediately relayed all the details of their previous meetings to Li Ping.

"Right, how's the puppet body I asked you to prepare?"

Qiao Gong showed a proud expression and clapped his hands. Instantly, a featureless body appeared before Li Ping. Unlike the Sacred Emperor's colossal stature of thirty-three feet, this featureless body was only human-sized. However, it was a perfectly scaled miniature, almost identical to Li Ping in appearance. If the Sacred Emperor were too suspicious, he might even accuse Qiao Gong of disrespect. But now, he merely stared at the puppet body with interest, somewhat surprised. "It's actually a real flesh and blood body?"

Qiao Gong nodded. "Yes. Didn't you say you wanted to use it to travel to the starry sky? The star sea is full of dangers, and there are some anomalies that only a real flesh and blood body can sense. I suffered greatly before coming to the Xuanhuang Realm."

A hint of heartache flashed in Qiao Gong's eyes, and then he continued to introduce it to the Sacred Emperor. "I referenced the True Yang's Dao of Object Incarnation and your precious disciple's flesh and blood cultivation techniques."

"This flesh and blood puppet's cultivation potential is not something to expect, but it has complete sensory capabilities. And like the Sacred Army Divine Puppets, it can integrate the Essence of Heaven and Earth and the Essence of Origin Force into itself. Although its strength will be somewhat reduced due to the limitations of its inherently frail body, with its Dao Integration strength, as long as it's cautious, it should be fine for self-preservation in the star sea," Qiao Gong said very cautiously. "As long as it doesn't encounter those strange calamities in the void."

The Sacred Emperor nodded. A speck of golden light flew from his fingertip, infusing into the flesh and blood puppet before him. A feeling akin to having a clone, like moving one's own arm, arose in his heart. The Sacred Emperor carefully experienced these familiar yet unfamiliar sensations, and a sliver of realization dawned upon him.

"I'll take this body with me."

With a flash of golden light, the Sacred Emperor and the flesh and blood puppet body disappeared together. Qiao Gong refocused his attention on Sun Erlang in the testing ground.

In the Sacred Dynasty's treasury.

The Sacred Emperor, avoiding Qiao Gong, was modifying the puppet body. His journey to the starry sky this time was for enlightenment. He still had some requirements for the qualities of the body he would possess. What Qiao Gong couldn't do… didn't mean the Sacred Emperor couldn't.

He gently placed his hand on the puppet's head, and the Azure Nether Heavenly Mandate slowly flowed into it. Suddenly… the Sacred Emperor felt a sense of déjà vu surge in his heart, and his movements paused slightly. After a moment of contemplation, he suppressed this anomaly. The originally stiff shell of the body gradually became lively. As various heavenly materials and earthly treasures in the Sacred Dynasty's treasury were refined into liquid by the Essence of Origin Force and integrated into the puppet's body, it became increasingly translucent and fragrant. Even Mao Bao, who had been sleeping, was attracted. It suddenly awoke and looked around. Upon discovering that the source of the fragrance was the body Li Ping was refining, a trace of disappointment flashed in its eyes. Just as it was about to fall asleep again, it received instructions from the Sacred Emperor. Mao Bao reluctantly shook its head, but ultimately, unable to resist the temptation of the promise of Essence of Origin Force, it let out a lazy meow. Then, with a leap, it transformed into a blue, transparent glass-like enclosure, enveloping the body Li Ping was refining. Wisps of blue light emanated from the container. After drifting for a moment, they all burrowed into the puppet's body. At this moment, Li Ping actually had a trace of consciousness attached to the puppet's body, and thus could personally feel the specific changes occurring after it bathed in the blue light. "Flesh and blood recombination, sublimation of life form. Even without cultivation, the strength of this body surpasses that of a Nascent Soul stage cultivator in the Xuanhuang Realm." "And…" The Sacred Emperor carefully sensed the difference between this body and his original one. He couldn't yet understand the consequences of these differences, but he was almost certain that these differences were created to cope with some special circumstances. As the blue light cover continued to modify it, a flicker of realization also flashed through Li Ping's mind. He could even use Mao Bao's function to infuse the abilities of the creatures Mao Bao had previously absorbed and mimicked into this body, turning them into innate divine abilities of the body. However, this was, after all, an artificially created body. Doing so might lead to unpredictable changes. The abilities Mao Bao currently possessed were all dispensable to Li Ping. With his departure for the star sea imminent, Li Ping decided not to go to unnecessary trouble. He could try it slowly in the future. The blue light cover grew dimmer and dimmer, and finally, the light completely dissipated. Mao Bao looked as if it had fought a three-day battle, its face haggard, and even its once lustrous fur appeared somewhat yellowed. Li Ping fed it a large mouthful of golden Essence of Origin Force, and only then did Mao Bao contentedly fall into a deep sleep. "Item replication, creature mimicry, this is Mao Bao's third function." "Marrow washing and body transformation. Truly remarkable!" Li Ping exclaimed. The puppet body had awakened from its sublimation. Li Ping sensed this body, finding it even more suitable for his divine soul than his original body. "Why not directly switch bodies?" A thought uncontrollably surged from the depths of his mind, but it was instantly suppressed by the Sacred Emperor. Mao Bao's marrow washing and body transformation function was not a one-time thing. If the effect on the puppet body was so good, it would naturally be no different on his original body. Time was still early, and there would be plenty of opportunities. Li Ping focused his consciousness on the puppet body, beginning to adapt and attempt to manipulate it.

…

Half a month later.

Before the puppet body could fly out of the Xuanhuang Realm, it first received a transmission from Qiao Gong. The Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy was about to arrive at the Sect of Spiritual Primal in Nine Mountains Province. Li Ping's body instantly flashed with golden light, transforming into the appearance of Hermit Qiao Gong. He silently appeared within the Sect of Spiritual Primal headquarters, awaiting the arrival of the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy. Meanwhile, the puppet body left by Qiao Gong had already prepared a large amount of collected Origin Force. Li Ping naturally disdained such low-quality energy. Not to mention comparison with the Essence of Origin Force, even compared to the Origin Force formed by the cultivation of the Spiritual Essence Technique by the citizens of the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, it was far inferior. However, the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy, after inspecting it, was overjoyed.

"The quality of this submission seems to have improved significantly?"

"The sect leader is thoughtful," the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy praised, carefully collecting the sphere of light containing the Origin Force. Li Ping, imitating Qiao Gong's tone, replied with a smile, "I recently learned a profound technique that can invisibly clear away the complex thoughts of the disciples, allowing them to devote more time to cultivating their techniques."

The Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy's eyes brightened. "There's such a divine technique?"

"What? Does the envoy have an interest?" Li Ping asked.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy looked somewhat embarrassed. "The Myriad Immortals Alliance has recently faced an even greater deficit. If it's convenient for the sect leader…"

Li Ping waved his hand. "It's nothing, just a minor skill. If the envoy is interested, I'll tell you about it."

"With a mind free of distractions, one resides in their own divinity. Immune to all methods, touching the profound…" Li Ping chanted, reciting the profound technique directly. The Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy was overjoyed and listened intently. He failed to notice that his mind was slowly sinking as he followed the gentle chanting. When the Myriad Immortals Alliance envoy's eyes became vacant and completely stupefied, Li Ping smiled slightly and flicked a speck of golden light into the envoy's sea of consciousness. As expected, there was protection from the Myriad Immortals Alliance's restrictions. But under the silent infiltration of the Essence of Origin Force, the defenses were like paper, silently breached. Soon, Li Ping found the information he wanted in the envoy's mind.

"The power of myriad cultivators, condensed into a penetrating spear."

"Directly reaching the depths of the Azure Nether, the Endless Sea of Darkness…"

"As expected."

Li Ping had always been curious about how the Myriad Immortals Alliance found and maintained the entrance to the Sea of Darkness. According to the confessions of the Netherfolk, the passage carved by the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the Sea of Darkness had a significant difference from the passages opened by the Netherfolk's traditional methods. Perhaps it was due to a lack of complete trust in the Netherfolk, or perhaps the Myriad Immortals Alliance wanted to firmly control the passage to the Sea of Darkness. In any case, the Myriad Immortals Alliance devised a method to directly break through the passage between the Xuanhuang Realm and the Sea of Darkness using highly condensed Origin Force.

"It is precisely because the Myriad Immortals Alliance has been covetous of the Nether Realm that the power of the Sea of Darkness has been constantly shrinking."

"It seems it's time to sever some of their tentacles first."

Chapter 1262: The Essence of the Star Sea

The secrets of the Nether Realm were among the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s highest classified information. Even the envoy, known as Jia Su, had only a rudimentary understanding of it. To avoid alerting his quarry, Li Ping refrained from delving deeper into the envoy’s mind.

As Jia Su gradually regained consciousness, he remained blissfully unaware that the secrets within his mind had already been thoroughly scrutinized by the person before him. He instead praised, “Your divine technique, Sect Leader, is truly extraordinary. Even I, upon reading it, unconsciously fell into a state of self-forgetfulness.”

Li Ping chuckled, “It would be wonderful if it could be of use to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. However, could we perhaps renegotiate the annual proportion of Primal Force that must be submitted?”

Before Li Ping could finish his sentence, the envoy’s expression shifted slightly. He spoke earnestly, “Sect Leader, everything can be discussed. But the responsibilities to the Myriad Immortals Alliance are not to be taken lightly.” The envoy hesitated, then lowered his voice. “To be honest, originally, the higher-ups intended to collect even more…”

Seeing Li Ping's darkening expression, which hinted at an impending outburst, the envoy quickly tried to placate him. “But Sect Leader, you have merit now, don’t you? I will try to speak on your behalf, and perhaps some of it can be reduced…” Without waiting for Li Ping to react, the envoy hastily took his leave.

The Sacred Emperor’s (Li Ping) look of anger slowly subsided, replaced by an profound calmness. He left a puppet to continue guarding the Sect of Spiritual Primal members, while Li Ping returned to the Sacred Dynasty.

The profound technique he had left for the Myriad Immortals Alliance was indeed a high-grade method for better developing the Primal Force within cultivators, and he had left no hidden traps. After all, given the involvement of the Sea of Darkness, the Myriad Immortals Alliance would undoubtedly be cautious and verify it repeatedly. Li Ping had transmitted this method to them simply because, as its creator, he could roughly sense the locations of the cultivators who practiced it. He could even sense the Primal Force they cultivated under its enhancement.

The Sea of Darkness was an endless, abyssal blackness that consumed everything. Even the Netherfolk only ventured within familiar territories. To locate the "Piercing Spear" that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had driven into the Sea of Darkness, a certain method was indeed required.

However, it would take some time for this method to be widely adopted. Li Ping first decided to continue his unfinished plan of using the puppet body for Enlightenment beyond the Xuanhuang Realm. After weeks of final refinement, the puppet body now perfectly met the Sacred Emperor’s requirements. Even when his consciousness descended upon it, the instinctive urge to switch bodies grew stronger, almost overwhelmingly so. Li Ping consequently reduced the frequency with which he experimented on this puppet body.

The abundant Empty Light Flowing Crystals collected from the Vast Marsh Realm were sufficient for him to break free from the Immortal Ruins’ gravitational pull and successfully depart the Xuanhuang Realm. Without informing anyone, under the concealment of formations and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao’s aura, the rainbow light silently ascended towards the heavens. In an instant, it reached the edge of the world.

Deprived of the Xuanhuang Realm’s protection, the immense suction from the Immortal Ruins caused Li Ping’s expression to shift. Knowing of the existence of True Immortal power and personally experiencing it were two entirely different matters. Only when truly facing the vast and immense divine might of True Immortals could one comprehend their own insignificance. Even he, the Sacred Emperor, who was currently among the most powerful beings in the Xuanhuang Realm, felt this truth.

“The path is long and arduous,” the Sacred Emperor sighed inwardly, releasing particles of rainbow light one by one to counteract the Immortal Ruins’ pull. The puppet body, however, rapidly fled in the opposite direction.

The light of the Xuanhuang Realm gradually dimmed, leaving only darkness in its surroundings. Unlike the blackness of the Sea of Darkness, the star sea was one of utter, absolute silence. And… even though there seemed to be nothing ahead, the Sacred Emperor instinctively sensed that danger awaited him. He decisively altered his course, circumventing that area.

From then on, whenever any rampaging residual Immortal power in the Abyssal Sea threatened him, he seemed to possess precognition, evading it in advance. It was as if he had traversed this star sea before. The Sacred Emperor’s puppet body narrowed its eyes, continuing deeper into the Abyssal Sea, guided by an unseen intuition. He could already sense that the upper limit of laws in this star sea was higher than that of the Xuanhuang Realm. However, his destination was not the foot of the The Great Barrier mentioned in the sword light’s transmission. Instead, it was the place within this Abyssal Sea where new, higher laws were being gestured. There, the efficiency of Enlightenment would be the highest.

The rainbow light traversed rapidly, as if time had ceased to flow. The Sacred Emperor gradually let go of his preconceived guidance, instead following the mysterious rhythm that surged inexplicably in the silent star sea, altering his direction of advance. It was as if he were truly at sea, finding the turbulent currents beneath the calm surface. His speed suddenly increased exponentially, covering millions of miles in an instant. The surrounding immense forces tore at him; even the rainbow light protecting him shattered under the unknown, immense strain. Li Ping remained focused, disregarding the crisis of his impending demise, and quietly absorbed the profound changes in his surroundings, unlike anything he had witnessed in the Xuanhuang Realm.

“Destruction and rebirth.”

”The beings of the Xuanhuang Realm see this silent expanse of stars as the Abyssal Sea. But unknown to them, vitality is slowly reviving within it. It is, however, still in its most nascent stage. And the entire process is so slow that from a human perspective, it is destined to be extremely difficult to perceive. This has nothing to do with comprehension; it is purely a difference dictated by different scales and different life forms…”

“However…”

A peculiar rhythm slowly awakened within the Sacred Emperor’s puppet body. It was the unique aura of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao! That’s right, this time the Sacred Emperor had secretly sent the puppet body out of the Xuanhuang Realm for Enlightenment without informing anyone in the Sacred Dynasty. But how could it possibly hide from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao? At its insistent demand, and with a resolve of no return, it had split off a thread of consciousness and attached it to the puppet body, leaving the Xuanhuang Realm with it and venturing into the depths of the star sea.

Unlike his purpose some years ago, this time the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao had come to “learn the Dao”! Before its destruction, the Abyssal Sea’s upper limit of laws had already surpassed the Xuanhuang Realm’s. Although the Xuanhuang Realm had survived to this day, its inherent strength had not been elevated over the long passage of time. Even after absorbing numerous fragments of cultivation worlds, though they were occupied by cultivators, its overall strength had modestly increased. In contrast, the nascent Dao principles being gestured in the Abyssal Sea were naturally of a higher caliber than those of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Undoubtedly… for the Xuanhuang Realm, observing these nascent forms in the Abyssal Sea was also a great opportunity. Previously, there was neither a trustworthy cultivator to serve as a vessel nor a method to escape the Immortal Ruins’ pull. Thus, even though the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao had this intention, it could not implement it. But this time, with the Celestial Mandated Sacred Emperor’s existence, everything changed. Li Ping had completely handed over control of the puppet body to the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. He himself was merely an observer, feeling and comprehending. This simple act was something few other cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm could achieve. Like a child who had been confined indoors for a long time seeing a breathtaking vista, Li Ping felt a sense of exultation, excitement, and fervent anticipation from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao… along with a gradually brightening Abyssal Sea.

To say it was brightening might be an exaggeration. It was merely occasional, scattered specks of light. But in this originally pitch-black, silent star sea, they were remarkably conspicuous.
