The puppet body seemed to vanish, and the perspective abruptly zoomed in countless times. The center of the entire Abyssal Sea, not in a spatial sense but in a vital sense, appeared before Li Ping. It was like a faintly beating heart, weak yet undoubtedly representing life, hope, and the future. The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao and Li Ping had arrived at the foot of this heart. They greedily seized and absorbed the rejuvenating power of the star sea that radiated outward from its beats. Instantly, countless images flooded Li Ping's mind. He saw worlds being destroyed, star seas churning and sinking. He saw flourishing life, receiving the favor of the heavens. He also saw terrifying shadows, like monstrous beasts, lurking in the darkness, ready to pounce at any moment…

Amidst these countless complexities of change and constancy, the Abyssal Sea, after its destruction, remained stable and persistent, attempting to burst forth with new life. This was undoubtedly the origin Dao of this star sea, and it was a concept that could bring tears to one’s eyes due to its unwavering persistence. Unable to withstand the star sea’s vast and pure origin Dao intent, the puppet body began to disintegrate inch by inch. However, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's consciousness and Li Ping felt no worry or fear in their hearts.

“Compared to the entire Abyssal Sea, what are the tribulations the Xuanhuang Realm has suffered?”

“If the star sea can recover from its own destruction, the Xuanhuang Realm will surely do the same.”

The two of them, taking advantage of this last opportunity, imprinted as many insights as possible into their memories. Li Ping also understood that the Abyssal Sea's origin Dao intent was not something he could currently fathom. His current comprehension was akin to a blind person touching an elephant—only perceiving a tiny fraction of what he wanted and was able to perceive. Nevertheless, this minuscule part, insignificant to the entire star sea, held immense meaning for them.

Just as the puppet body was about to completely disintegrate and vanish, the nascent consciousness of the recovering star sea seemed to detect the presence of Li Ping and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. It cast a thread of attention towards them. However, it was clear that the fragile puppet body was insufficient to withstand this immense, unparalleled power. It was annihilated within the vast force. Yet, before his consciousness disappeared, Li Ping, with the help of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, saw a fleeting, blurry image. It appeared and vanished so quickly that Li Ping couldn’t ascertain if it was a hallucination. The immortal path had crumbled, the star sea had been shattered, and calamity had spread. A figure, whose face and details were indistinct, grew fainter and fainter, eventually vanishing completely. Only his light laughter echoed in the star sea where calamity was about to spread. “What does it concern me…” “What does it concern me…” “Hahahaha…”

Boom!

The Sacred Emperor was suddenly jolted back to reality. With a muffled groan, he spat out a mouthful of golden blood. The sleeping Cat Treasure’s head shot up and it swiftly flew to the still-floating blood, devouring it directly. “Meow! Meow meow!” It then seemed to fear Li Ping’s scolding and let out a few fawning meows. Li Ping, circulating his golden Primal Force to slowly heal his internal injuries, did not dwell on the incident with Cat Treasure. All his thoughts were focused on the image he had just seen. “That figure…” The Sacred Emperor felt a deep solemnity. Someone that the star sea, even in its rebirth from destruction, could not forget must not be an ordinary individual. Merely existing in his mind for a short while caused Li Ping to feel a subtle sense of impending danger. He was instantly startled and slowly forced himself to stop thinking about it. But soon, the Sacred Emperor realized he was worrying unnecessarily. For even if he didn't intentionally try to forget, the memory of that figure was slowly fading uncontrollably. “This situation…” “It’s not yet the legendary realm of the Nameless True Immortal, but it seems to be just a step away.” The Sacred Emperor savored the meaning the newly born star sea seemed to convey in that instant. “If I’m not mistaken, the prime culprit behind the numerous calamities plaguing the star sea is likely this individual…” The Sacred Emperor frowned slightly, desperately trying to capture the disappearing memory in his mind. Eventually, most of the details faded. Only the four words, “What does it concern me,” remained. “Indifferent Immortal,” the Sacred Emperor murmured, his expression unreadable. In the Sacred Emperor’s throne, Li Ping sat for a long time in silence. Cat Treasure also seemed to sense something, its body low, its head scanning its surroundings in a predatory stance, as if searching for the entity that caused Li Ping such deep apprehension. But ultimately, it found nothing. Cat Treasure became lazy again and fell asleep on Li Ping’s shoulder. The Sacred Emperor, meanwhile, began to process the gains from his journey into the depths of the star sea. It wasn't just him; even the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao began to undergo changes, unobserved by most, that had not occurred for a long time due to this distant journey. Like the newly born Abyssal Sea, it was a silent transformation, not yet known to others, but it was undeniably happening. Only a select few individuals in the world could perceive it. In the Great Qi Dynasty, Shi Ban, who was chatting with someone in a teahouse in the Sacred Capital, subtly shifted his expression and looked into the distance. In the space of the Man-Pruning Longevity Tree, Ruo Mu, who was trimming its withered branches, stared blankly at new buds sprouting from its dry, yellow branches, his expression filled with astonishment. Miles underground, the Ancient Earth Vein Tree felt the surging flow of power from the Xuanhuang Realm becoming unusually vigorous, as if something was brewing. This filled it with both anticipation and trepidation. … “A thousand sails pass by the sinking ship; ten thousand trees flourish before the ailing one.” In the Dharma Deduction space, Li Fan suddenly felt these two lines of poetry well up within him. “So, the greatest insights are gained by Enlightenment in the star sea with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. Because the perspective of a person and the perspective of heaven and earth are different. It’s like back then, when I comprehended the Formless Killing Intent with the Azure Sea Pearl. Creating the Sacred Emperor’s clone in this life to aid the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao turned out to be a fortunate coincidence.” Li Fan was overjoyed. Although the connection between him and the Sacred Emperor had become very weak, due to the immense impact of the star sea’s origin Dao intent, he had managed to gain some understanding of the insights of the Sacred Emperor and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. Most importantly, he had grasped the method. With the method in hand, he could replicate it in his next life.

Chapter 1263

"Azure Nether Orthodoxy..."

Li Fan repeatedly savored the faint insights into the "Origin Intent of the Star Sea" that he had just received from the Sacred Emperor.

At the same time, he vaguely sensed the current state of the Xuanhuang Realm, which was recovering from within and without.

"If there were no cultivators of the New Law devouring heaven and consuming earth within, and no Immortal Ruins outside, perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm could truly be reborn."

"It's a pity... this is destined to treat the symptoms, not the root cause."

As he shook his head slightly, a trace of doubt appeared in his heart. Logically, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm couldn't possibly be unaware of this. Instead of accumulating this restorative power for the decisive battle in the future, it was eagerly manifesting it.

What was the purpose behind it?

"Heh heh, I shall wait and see."

The perspective returned to the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi.

Upon sensing the anomaly in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Stone Slab immediately arrived within the Sacred Emperor's Seat. Seeing the Sacred Emperor, who also emanated an arcane aura, the Stone Slab was astonished.

"You are aware of what is happening in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"There is no need to panic, it is beneficial and not detrimental," the Sacred Emperor replied.

The Stone Slab's expression eased slightly. "I thought the Xuanhuang Realm was on the brink of disaster, merely a final flicker before darkness..."

"What you said is not entirely wrong. This restorative power, born from a momentary enlightenment, is destined not to last. However, for us, this might be a golden opportunity," the Sacred Emperor said slowly after a brief silence.

"Are you referring to the Azure Nether Orthodoxy plan?" The Stone Slab was momentarily stunned, then quickly understood.

"Precisely."

The Sacred Emperor nodded, and a miniature projection of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before them.

Within it, the primordial existence of the Xuanhuang Realm was depicted as glowing yellow.

However, since the collapse of the Immortal Path, the native forces of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, and the Myriad Immortal Sects, which had captured Grotto-heavens and worlds using the "Star Crossing Astral Array," were shown in an eerie green.

As great tribulations spread and the Star Sea was shattered, the remnants of other cultivation worlds forcibly stitched together by outsiders were depicted in a deathly black.

This was information transmitted from the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm.

It could be seen that the yellow occupied only about one-thirtieth of the entire miniature landscape of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The green occupied one-tenth.

As for the rest, it was all vast expanses of black.

It appeared as though the Azure Nether's yellow was, in fact, the anomaly.

But unlike the green and black, the glowing yellow, representing the Xuanhuang Realm, seemed to possess its own life and consciousness. With every flicker, it continuously spilled and spread into the surrounding colorful regions.

From a direct visual perspective, the green and black regions were not pure.

They were interspersed with specks of dark yellow.

However, over the past tens of thousands of years, this form of erosion, in a sense, had slowed down. It was even showing signs of being reversed.

But...

With the recent surge in the vitality of the Xuanhuang Realm, the effusion of the Azure Nether's color had suddenly accelerated.

"Azure Nether Orthodoxy..."

The Stone Slab mused, "As for the regions that originally belonged to the Xuanhuang Realm, naturally, there is no need to discuss them further. Everything that occurred within them has been meticulously recorded by the Genesis Stone Slab. As for those green regions..."

The Stone Slab carefully identified them. "Some fall within the scope of the Stone Slab's records, while others do not."

"As for those black regions, they are completely blind spots."

Sacred Emperor Li Ping said, "If we do nothing, the ultimate fate of the Xuanhuang Realm will be to be swallowed by the black, which overwhelmingly dominates in number. In the future, this blackness will likely evolve into something else."

"Therefore, we must take the initiative to deeply inject the Azure Nether Orthodoxy into these external remnant regions."

The Sacred Emperor's voice was low, but the determination in his words was unmistakable.

"How do we do that?" The Stone Slab became interested.

"Observe the ways of heaven and act upon them..."

The Sacred Emperor spoke slowly, and the Stone Slab listened carefully, nodding occasionally.

After detailing the method, the Sacred Emperor's tone became somewhat grave. "When undertaking this, you must be extremely cautious to avoid being discovered by the instigator."

Although the Sacred Emperor did not explicitly name the person, the Stone Slab understood his meaning.

The Stone Slab rarely showed a playful smile. "As the saying goes, 'subtle influence is like a silent rain.' This method is so secretive, and with the proactive cooperation and concealment of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, even if that person possesses peerless cultivation, I doubt they can detect it."

The Sacred Emperor said sternly, "Do not be careless. Even if they are not in the Xuanhuang Realm, we must guard against any contingencies they might have left behind."

The Stone Slab nodded, indicating understanding.

"It is best that the fewer participants in this operation, the better. This task should have been undertaken by that If Wood, for maximum efficiency. After all, as a primordial tree spirit, it has a closer connection to the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It's not that I don't trust him, but every move If Wood makes will be observed by other powerful beings in this realm. As an operative, he would be too conspicuous. Conversely, the world believes you to be constantly oppressed by the Genesis Stone Slab, and thus, you will be subconsciously overlooked." Perhaps it was concerning the future of the Xuanhuang Realm that the Sacred Emperor spoke so uncharacteristically lengthily.

Whether he was speaking to the Stone Slab or to If Wood, it was unclear.

"This is called 'darkness under the lamp,' isn't it?" The Stone Slab agreed. "I have lost the burden of the Stone Slab, and with a few more changes, I guarantee that no one in the Xuanhuang Realm will associate me with my past image."

"Then we shall wait a few more days until the restorative power erupting from the Xuanhuang Realm reaches its peak, and then take action. This will yield twice the result with half the effort."

The Stone Slab immediately agreed.

He did not leave, but simply stood quietly in the great hall of the Sacred Emperor's Seat, observing the miniature Xuanhuang Realm that the Sacred Emperor had conjured.

The light in the center of the Azure Nether flickered continuously. Like a beating heart, it transported strands of Azure Nether color to various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm.

This included the green and black regions.

Even within them, there were signs of assimilation. However, under the strong restorative power being continuously transmitted, they could temporarily maintain their original colors. Slowly, finally, even the outermost black regions of the Xuanhuang Realm were tinged with an imperceptible trace of Azure Nether yellow.

"It's time to act," the Faceless Sacred Emperor said in a deep voice.

The Stone Slab smiled slightly, his figure flashing. In an instant, within the Sacred Emperor's Seat, two identical bodies were differentiated.

Then, two became four, four became eight, and eight became sixteen.

In the blink of an eye, countless identical Stone Slab figures filled the great hall.

"Transform! Transform! Transform!"

The Stone Slabs echoed in unison.

In an instant, the Stone Slab clones transformed into various forms of living beings that truly existed in the Xuanhuang Realm.

There was a debonair scholar in white, a hunched woodcutter, a woman of unparalleled beauty, a cynical old man...

Each person appeared incredibly lifelike, with no trace of being transformed from the same individual.

"I depart."

They each bowed to the Sacred Emperor, all with smiles on their faces, and their figures disappeared from the Sacred Emperor's Seat.

Meanwhile, in various prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm, unnoticed by anyone.

Some special existences appeared.

When they had all gathered in the Sacred Emperor's Seat, it had naturally seemed rather crowded, but once dispersed throughout the Xuanhuang Realm, they did not cause even the slightest ripple.

"Observe the ways of heaven and act upon them."

"Heaven and Man unite, and myriad transformations establish the foundation..."

They chanted softly, then moved towards the populated cities of mortals in each prefecture.

The Sacred Emperor's plan was, in essence, simple.

It was to establish the foundation of heaven with the will of man.

Utilizing the Stone Slab's ability to disguise itself as any form, it differentiated into countless clones, infiltrating the mortal populace.

It would subtly promote the existence of the "Xuanhuang Realm" to all sentient mortals in the Azure Nether.

Currently, mortals only knew of the small corner of the world they inhabited. They had no special awareness of this world, the Xuanhuang Realm.

The very concept of the Xuanhuang Realm did not exist in their thoughts.

The first step in establishing the Azure Nether Orthodoxy was to first educate them about the Xuanhuang Realm, the world they lived in.

Of course, this was not a task that could be accomplished in a single day; it would require years, perhaps even decades, of propagation.

And to prevent any anomalies from being detected, they needed to tirelessly and intimately integrate into the mortal population, spreading the word through oral tradition.

However, with the Stone Slab's strength, even with countless clones, achieving this was not difficult.

An individual, or even a hundred or a thousand mortals, were as insignificant as ants. But if all the mortals in the Xuanhuang Realm were united, they would become an undeniably powerful force.

Once the mortal populace of the Xuanhuang Realm reached a consensus, the second step of the plan could be implemented.

Using the "Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth," they would simultaneously counter-attack, encircle, and devour the residual consciousness of those external cultivation remnant worlds.

This step would require the assistance of Senior Yin.

As a being of a world spirit's nature, he possessed profound knowledge of how to devour world consciousness.

After cooperating with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao to encircle the cultivation remnant worlds, the final step would be to help the remnant worlds completely integrate into the Azure Nether.

In fact, most of the Xuanhuang Realm had already completed surface-level integration.

Only a few specific prefectures still experienced strange anomalies due to improper fusion.

These "ulcerous sores," akin to festering wounds, required thorough surgical removal—destruction before establishment.

If the first and second steps could be carried out covertly,

Then the third step would certainly alert the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and possibly even the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerates from beyond the starry sky.

At that point, conflict would be inevitable.

However, according to the Sacred Emperor's statement, as long as the second step was completed, even if the final outcome was a failure,

The overall trend would be set, and it would be impossible to turn back.

Unless more cultivation remnant worlds were found, and another nearly ten thousand years were spent on another round of dismemberment and reorganization.

The Stone Slab, who had not been excited by any matter for a long time, actually felt a surge of enthusiasm for the Sacred Emperor's plan.

Besides saving the Xuanhuang Realm, if successful, the benefits would be immeasurable.

He would gain greater control over the heavens and earth, becoming an existence even more powerful than Longevity.

Regardless of the reason, the Stone Slab would not refuse this plan.

Ten years, to him, would be but a fleeting moment.

...

Within the Sacred Emperor's Seat.

Li Ping summoned If Wood.

A true sage would not place all their eggs in one basket.

He, naturally, would not entrust the crucial task of establishing the Azure Nether Orthodoxy solely to the Stone Slab.

Even if the Stone Slab was trustworthy, and even if the plan carried little risk.

He said the same words as the Stone Slab, merely using different phrasing.

The entity responsible for achieving the goal became If Wood.

And the "Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth" that would implant the concept of the Xuanhuang Realm evolved into the ordinary plants, flying birds, and beasts of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"As the ancestor of all living beings, you should be able to subtly influence them."

"The will of the 'Xuanhuang Realm' must be established."

For If Wood, this was a trivial matter.

Moreover, the recent event of withered branches sprouting new buds had revitalized his spirit.

Rarely finding such motivation, he readily agreed.

"If Wood, Stone Slab."

"Simply having them is not enough."

"Ultimately, I will have to personally intervene."

"With triple assurance, it can be considered foolproof."

The Sacred Emperor's thoughts flowed slowly.

"Clashing with the Myriad Immortals Alliance is the overt battlefield."

"And establishing the Azure Nether Orthodoxy is the covert war."

"In comparison, this covert war is even more important. There is only one chance; losing means complete defeat."

While the Sacred Emperor was contemplating, a tumor slowly began to bulge on his forehead.

As the flesh swelled, a fleshy growth continuously enlarged.

Li Ping seemed completely unaware, remaining motionless.

It wasn't until half a day later that the flesh burst open, and a ball of Azure Nether Qi sprung forth.

The Azure Nether Qi swirled, its internal image indistinct.

It vaguely resembled Mr. Bai, and also somewhat resembled Li Ping himself.

"Cat Treasure."

The Faceless Sacred Emperor awakened Cat Treasure, who was dozing.

He pinched the back of its neck, and only then did it reluctantly activate its replication ability.

Another ball of identical Azure Nether Qi appeared in the Sacred Emperor's Seat.

"Go!"

The Sacred Emperor commanded softly. These two balls of Azure Nether Qi then tore through the void, leaving the pocket world of the Sacred Dynasty and flying towards different prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm.

They did not directly merge with the Heavenly Dao but lurked in secret.

The Sacred Emperor coughed lightly. Even with his strength, he felt a slight, temporary weakness at this moment.

That ball of Azure Nether Qi, separated from his body, could, in a sense, be considered the Azure Nether Malevolent Thought he had once swallowed.

However, after being refined by himself and infused with the Sacred Dynasty's destiny, recorded in the "Heavenly Emperor's Qi Codex," it had transformed into something akin to a materialized essence of Azure Nether destiny.

If he had not ventured into the Star Sea and witnessed the primordial intent of the Star Sea, it would have been rather difficult for him to condense this materialized destiny.

"Each ball of materialized destiny can integrate with and govern approximately three prefectures."

"We will not consider the Five Elders Council for now. If we can encompass the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance, with Cat Treasure's assistance, it will not take long."

Within a few breaths, the Sacred Emperor's aura returned to its peak strength.

But Li Ping knew that this was due to the reserve of the Sacred Dynasty's destiny and the feedback from his own enlightenment.

If he condensed too frequently, he would not recover so quickly.

"The integration of Azure Nether destiny into heaven and earth is equivalent to reasserting sovereignty."

"Even if If Wood and Stone Slab fail, the Azure Nether Orthodoxy will remain firmly under control."

"Of course, it would be even better if they succeed."

In Li Ping's deductions, the battle with the Myriad Immortals Alliance was best fought after establishing the Azure Nether Orthodoxy.

Because by then, when dealing with these "heretics" of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, he would be fighting on home turf; with every thought and intention, he could disregard spatial distances, mobilize the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, and unleash endless heavenly punishment.

Victory could be achieved without a single soldier being lost.

Chapter 1264: Boundless Unity Peering into the World-Cracker

Of course, the cultivation world ultimately respects strength.

The crucial aspect lies in the final battle with the Dharma-Preachers.

"The one who knows themselves is wise," the Sacred Emperor keenly understood his current limitations, recognizing the clear disparity between himself and the Dharma-Preachers.

After all, they had dominated the Xuanhuang Realm for millennia and attained enlightenment in the depths of the star sea.

Their power was truly unfathomable.

While the Sacred Emperor had reached the current limit of the Xuanhuang Realm and even acquired the Origin Intent of the Star Sea, a fortunate encounter, he had yet to truly convert this boon into tangible strength.

"I need… more time."

A profound sense of urgency began to settle upon the Sacred Emperor's heart.

"Time waits for no one."

Before venturing into the star sea, he had not felt this way. But since his return, an inexplicable premonition told him that his time might be running out.

...

The Sun Family.

Sun Luyuan circulated his Spirit Qi, warding off the bone-chilling cold that permeated his surroundings, as he slowly entered the room.

His gaze fell upon Sun Tianci, who sat cross-legged on the bed, neither crying nor making a fuss, merely staring blankly. A wave of helplessness washed over Sun Luyuan.

Every family had its own burdens.

Outsiders knew Sun Tianci as a prodigy, born with Dao Integration cultivation and an extraordinary aura. Yet, they were unaware that perhaps, from the moment of his birth, having witnessed his mother's death, the child had become exceptionally indifferent to others.

He naturally exuded an aura that repelled extreme cold, making him difficult for outsiders to approach.

Had he not been born with Dao Integration cultivation, he might have starved to death within days due to a lack of care.

But no matter how extraordinary, he was merely a newborn infant requiring attention.

The several Dao Integration stage cultivators of the Sun family had no choice but to take turns tending to him.

"Ci'er..." Sun Luyuan offered a gentle smile, presenting the prepared supreme-grade spiritual liquid.

"Won't you have something to eat?"

Sun Tianci merely shook his head slightly, refusing.

Sun Luyuan felt a pang of helplessness.

Then, as if a thought struck him, he softly said, "I'm going to visit your father later. He heard about your birth and personally created a cultivation method for you. Take a look..."

With that, Sun Luyuan transmitted the cultivation method, "Upright Dharma Elevation," created by Li Fan, into Sun Tianci's mind.

Upon hearing that it was created by his unseen father specifically for him, the icy aura surrounding Sun Tianci showed a slight crack.

As he slowly read through the text of "Upright Dharma Elevation," he seemed to gain some understanding, and his eyes closed.

Sensing the environment around him returning to normal, Sun Luyuan rejoiced.

More importantly, Sun Tianci's innate sense of sorrow also began to gradually dissipate.

"What a fine 'Upright Dharma Elevation'!"

"As expected, Lu'er has a way!"

Knowing that the child was currently in a state of enlightenment, Sun Luyuan dared not disturb him. He gently placed the spiritual liquid aside and quietly withdrew.

He then sealed the room with a restriction, preventing any external disturbances, before finally feeling somewhat at ease.

"It's good that Tianci has this disposition. Secluding himself and disappearing from public view, in a few years, people will forget his existence."

"At this time of great change, our Sun family should prioritize dormancy and preserving our strength."

With this thought, Sun Luyuan couldn't help but recall the mission assigned to him by the Sacred Dynasty.

Since joining the Sacred Dynasty, he had lived a rather leisurely life. The Sacred Dynasty had never issued any mandatory tasks.

His previous plan to abduct Azure Void Fairy and have her become a Dao companion for the Sacred Emperor's disciples was interrupted by the sudden commission from Void Deep and had now been put on hold, as he could no longer contact that individual.

This had left Sun Luyuan, who always desired to contribute and increase his own standing, somewhat frustrated.

Finally, he had received a task from the Sacred Dynasty, but it was proving to be quite troublesome, with him unable to find an opportunity to act.

"Nether Prison..."

"Isn't that just a place to imprison serious offenders? What is the Sacred Dynasty trying to do by getting involved?"

Sun Luyuan grumbled in his heart.

Entering the Nether Prison was not difficult.

However, infiltrating it and maintaining constant contact with the outside world would be truly challenging.

"The Nether Prison operates as a separate entity within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, overseen in rotation by Dharma-Preachers. To interfere..."

Although the mission assigned by the Sacred Dynasty did not explicitly state the consequences of failure, Sun Luyuan knew this was undoubtedly a test from the Sacred Dynasty.

Images of various individuals flashed through Sun Luyuan's mind as he began to contemplate a list of those who might assist him in this matter.

After a long while, he still had no success.

He habitually went to the underground secret chamber.

His younger brother, Sun Luyao, who was the Spirit of the Boundless Mirror, saw his expression and inquired about the reason.

"Brother, I found some information that might be useful."

As Sun Luyuan looked at the message his brother had sent, his tightly furrowed brow relaxed.

"Perhaps it's feasible. I'll go and try."

He was about to depart in a hurry when he suddenly heard Sun Luyao ask, "Oh right, brother, you promised to take me out for some fresh air. When can we leave?"

Sun Luyuan paused, responding somewhat evasively, "Let's wait a bit longer. Those people are still watching the Sun family. If I take you out now, it might lead to another incident like the last time we were searching for fragments and were ambushed by the Chen family of the Medicine Hall."

"Let's wait until the situation calms down."

With that, he left in a hurry, not waiting for Sun Luyao's reply.

"Okay, I understand, brother..."

Before he left, he heard his brother say this.

However, his tone seemed a little strange.

But Sun Luyuan didn't think much of it.

The information Sun Luyao had gleaned from the Heavenly Profound Mirror indicated that a serious offender of the Myriad Immortals Alliance was about to be sent to the Nether Prison.

However, this individual held a special identity, being a direct descendant of Doctrine Transmitter Sun.

Given such a background, it would seem unlikely that he would be imprisoned in a place like the Nether Prison.

But the crime he committed openly this time was truly too great.

As is widely known, the Myriad Immortals Alliance was organizing its second "World-Shedding Rainbow Light" expedition to the depths of the star sea.

And Void-Cracking Crystals were a critical resource required to achieve this goal.

After a period of tacit compromise, where it was agreed that participation slots in this expedition would be divided equally among Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, regardless of their background, the Alliance had seized this opportunity to once again emphasize the scarcity of Void-Cracking Crystals in the name of righteousness.

They began employing methods including sting operations to recover the Void-Cracking Crystals secretly hoarded by various powerful families.

And the Doctrine Transmitter Sun's direct descendant, named Sun Wanyun, was caught red-handed for privately acquiring and purchasing massive quantities of Void-Cracking Crystals.

The cultivators responsible for the arrest naturally knew of Sun Wanyun's identity. But in front of a crowd, they had to maintain appearances. Thus, they could only reluctantly arrest him.

They had intended to release him quietly afterward, but someone unknown stirred the pot from behind the scenes.

In less than half a day, the news that Sun Wanyun had been apprehended by the Myriad Immortals Alliance for being impartial and ruthless had quietly spread.

The public praised Doctrine Transmitter Sun for upholding the laws of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and acting justly, even against his own kin.

With events having progressed to this stage, the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not possibly retract their actions. Moreover, Void-Cracking Crystals were indeed too important, so Sun Wanyun was imprisoned according to the law.

However, being a direct descendant of a Doctrine Transmitter, no one knew when he might be released. Therefore, he naturally enjoyed certain privileges within the Nether Prison.

"This person should be a suitable breakthrough."

"As long as I pretend to visit, I can give him the item bestowed by the Sacred Emperor..."

Sun Luyuan thought this and arrived at the temporary holding area for Sun Wanyun at the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters.

Upon seeing the scene, he was dumbfounded.

It turned out that many "clever people" understood the principle of "providing charcoal in snowy weather."

A crowd of cultivators jostled at the entrance, coming to visit, creating a bustling scene. There was no indication that this was a serious offender about to be sent to the Nether Prison. The sight was quite ironic.

Although they shared the same surname, Sun Luyuan had no familial connection to Doctrine Transmitter Sun or this Sun Wanyun. They had only met a few times.

The patriarch of the Sun family, Sun Luyuan, who was considered incredibly illustrious in the eyes of outsiders with five Dao Integration cultivators in his lineage, had to patiently queue at the door.

Simultaneously, in the Sun family's underground secret chamber.

Li Fan's spiritual manifestation was unceremoniously mocking Sun Luyao.

"I told you long ago that your brother would never let you out. How about that?"

"I brought you out before because you would occasionally lose control and constantly risked the Boundless Mirror malfunctioning. Now, with my help and guidance, the source of the Boundless Mirror's violent fluctuations, that Devouring Calamity, is slowly being removed, and you are becoming increasingly stable."

"You brat are now an Immortal Artifact, and you hold the hope for the Sun family's rise. How could your brother possibly let you out so easily? What if something were to happen and you were kidnapped?"

Sun Luyao listened to Li Fan's taunts in silence.

Only the figure within the mirror distorted intermittently, revealing his inner injustice.

"Senior..."

After a long period of silence, he wisely turned to Li Fan for help.

Sun Luyao knew that this mysterious being before him would not have spoken so much simply to mock him.

"Heh heh. You're getting smarter now, kid."

Li Fan chuckled wickedly.

As he spoke, he conjured a pair of large hands and reached towards the top of Sun Luyao's head.

Sun Luyao's heart leaped, but he forced himself not to dodge.

The giant dark hands enveloped him, and the inside of the Boundless Mirror began to shake violently.

A phantom image was pulled out of Sun Luyao by Li Fan.

With a gentle wave of his hand, this phantom image floated out of the Boundless Mirror and began to merge with a pile of materials that had materialized in the secret chamber.

Shortly thereafter, another "Boundless Mirror" that looked identical appeared before Sun Luyao.

As the Spirit of the Boundless Mirror, Sun Luyao was intimately familiar with this Immortal Artifact.

But even he could not discern any difference between the object before him and the Immortal Artifact he inhabited!

Internally filled with surprise and doubt, Sun Luyao flew into the fake artifact, only to find it to be an empty shell. He then excitedly returned.

"Senior's methods are truly unfathomable! You can even replicate an Immortal Artifact, and so realistically!" Sun Luyao flattered.

"Hmph, it's merely a superficial imitation," Li Fan said indifferently. "You can split off another trace of your divine sense and hide it within this mirror. With my craftsmanship as a foundation and your augmentation, it should be enough to fool your brother."

Seeing the prospect of regaining his freedom blossoming before his eyes, Sun Luyao did not hesitate. Enduring the severe pain of his divine soul being severed, he split off a trace of his divine sense.

Once Sun Luyao's divine sense entered the fake Boundless Mirror, this counterfeit artifact became flawless.

For in a sense, it could be considered a clone of the true Boundless Mirror. Despite being an empty shell, as long as the original Boundless Mirror existed, it could synchronize the information detected by the main body at any time.

"Senior, can we sneak out now?"

Looking at the counterfeit Boundless Mirror floating quietly in the air, having taken the place of the original, Sun Luyao asked with impatience.

"Idiot! What do you mean 'sneak out'?"

"This is called, 'The fish leaps in the boundless sea, the bird flies in the high heavens!'"

Li Fan's spiritual manifestation laughed wickedly, and with the Boundless Mirror in tow, transformed into a black streak. Disregarding the numerous restrictions and protective barriers personally set up by Sun Luyuan, they vanished from the Sun family in an instant.

Once again seeing the blue sky above, Sun Luyao was invigorated.

"Senior, where are we going?"

"As we discussed before, to search for the lost Immortal Artifacts of the Xuanhuang Realm?"

Even though he lacked a physical form, Sun Luyao deeply inhaled the air of freedom and then cautiously asked Li Fan.

"Immortal Artifacts... no hurry," Li Fan merely said.

Seeing his reluctance to elaborate, Sun Luyao dared not press further.

He could only be brought along by Li Fan as they rapidly sped south through the Xuanhuang Realm.

Seven days later, sensing the surging energy fluctuations ahead, Sun Luyao's spirits suddenly heightened.

"That's..."

In the endless ocean, furious currents converged towards a central point.

Gales howled, crackling and snapping.

The tempestuous storm even tore open space, arousing streaks of lightning.

Beside a colossal vortex that seemed to gather all thewaters of the world, lay a strikingly prominent island chain, resembling a long, coiling dragon.

This distinctive landscape instantly informed Sun Luyao of his current location.

"World-Cracker Great Vortex!" he exclaimed.

Although he had already learned about this natural wonder from the countless records he had glimpsed through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, the experience of being there in person was vastly different.

"Such surging currents, such wild and violent winds..."

"How could mere images and light, convey even a fraction of it?"

Ever since his youth, trapped in a dark and sunless mirror, he had never again witnessed the magnificent spectacles of the world.

The majestic scene before him stirred Sun Luyao's heart, making him feel as if he had returned to the passionate youth he once was.

"Making such a fuss, truly lacking in experience," Li Fan's strange voice, a "tsk tsk," pulled Sun Luyao out of his continuous exclamations.

"Enough with the awe. Let's get down to business."

With a gentle point towards the Boundless Mirror, Sun Luyao's phantom image was instantly absorbed into it.

A moment later, the mirror's surface uncontrollably released a streak of spectral light.

It aimed at the World-Cracker Great Vortex not far away.

The body of the Boundless Mirror vibrated gently, and countless images cascaded like a waterfall within it.

Li Fan merely narrowed his eyes, quietly awaiting the changes.

"Boundless Unity, Primordial Square."

"With this grand formation as its core, the Boundless Mirror should, in principle, be able to decipher all hidden secrets of the world."

"Although it is now dilapidated, it should not be difficult to peer into the secrets of this 'World-Cracker'."

"After all, the destructive power of the World-Cracker back then was immense. Even after so long, the wounds it inflicted upon the Xuanhuang Realm have yet to heal."

...

As Li Fan pondered, the Boundless Mirror seemed to have reached its limit.

Cracks began to appear on its surface.

Chapter 1265: The Azure Nether Island's Tale

"Senior, I can't take it anymore!" Sun Luoyao's pained voice faintly echoed from the Immeasurable Mirror.

"Hmph, you won't die," Li Fan seemed to ignore him. Instead of stopping the Immeasurable Mirror's probing, he cast a spell, controlling it to emit a pale light towards the World-Cracker Great Vortex once more.

As he spoke, patterns appeared on the Immeasurable Mirror's surface. They perfectly aligned with the cracks on the mirror, and within the serene, light glow, the wounds slowly healed.

"Argh..." Sun Luoyao's voice, a contradictory mix of pain and pleasure, sounded out.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, staring intently at the fragmented images flashing across the Immeasurable Mirror's profound light. "Let me see what truly happened here all those years ago."

The Genesis Stone Slab did indeed record the events of the beast race's world-cracking departure. However, after a world-endingly powerful force erupted from the Southern Underworld Mountain, the Azure Nether Stone Slab lost its ability to monitor the area. By the time the energy surge slowly subsided and the region became visible again, the former Sacred Mountain of the beast race and the entire beast race had vanished. Only a terrifying, gaping wound remained, unhealed for thousands of years.

Li Fan's current use of the Immeasurable Mirror was, admittedly, to ascertain if the beast race had successfully escaped through world-cracking. But more importantly, he sought to decipher the method of world-cracking itself. Space had been torn asunder by an unimaginably powerful force, even breaking through the barrier of the High Wall and connecting to realms beyond the star sea. In that instant, it was like a seal had been stamped upon time and space, leaving an imprint. Even as millennia passed, this imprint remained within spacetime itself, yet to dissipate. By studying and deciphering this world-cracking imprint, perhaps the only two successful cases of escaping the Abyssal Star Sea from the Xuanhuang Realm could be recreated.

Like a black and white image with intermittent signals, Li Fan vaguely saw Emperor Yi revealing his true form and making a final mobilization for the beast race in the fleeting scenes. He also saw many other beasts watching from afar, not joining the departure. The image flickered, and the giant python coiled around the Southern Underworld Mountain let out a sky-shattering roar. It writhed and howled, its body emitting scorching light, as if something were breaking free from within. Yet, Emperor Yi, the Lord of Myriad Beasts, watched with cold indifference. Only when the python weakly fell onto the sea's surface, stirring up colossal waves, did Li Fan clearly discern the object within it. It was a key, magnified to an unknown degree!

Emperor Yi's continuously writhing, gray, fleshy mass rippled. Moments later, a detached, emotionless, indifferent face emerged from its body. This face seemed to possess a magical power. Not only did the other heads and faces within Emperor Yi's body, which had been restless, instantly quiet down, but countless beasts around the Southern Underworld Sacred Mountain, who had been watching, also lowered their heads and averted their gaze, not daring to meet its eyes. Even Li Fan, thousands of years later, peering through the river of time via the world-cracking imprint, felt an instinctive fear, as if directly facing a superior being, the moment he saw that face.

"This is..." Even a body formed by a mere spiritual manifestation, under the divine face's pressure, became unstable for a moment. After all, it was a phantom image from thousands of years ago, and Li Fan's foundation was not ordinary. After brief adaptation, this invisible pressure quietly receded.

In the world-cracking imprint, the subsequent scenes reappeared before Li Fan. After Emperor Yi revealed the divine face in its true form, the enormous key, shimmering with a bronze metallic sheen, instantly shrunk. Then, under Emperor Yi's control, it flew directly towards the Southern Underworld Sacred Mountain, which towered into the sky. The tip of the key pointed towards the summit of the Southern Underworld Mountain. A dazzling point of light appeared at the point of contact. A unified luster instantly spread from that small point, encompassing the key's body and the Southern Underworld Mountain. As if recognizing each other, moments later, the key and the Sacred Mountain, bathed in light, became ethereal and dimly invisible. And around the Sacred Mountain, including Emperor Yi, countless beasts were enveloped by waves of white light, transforming into threads that flew into the copper key and the Southern Underworld Mountain. Then... a terrifying radiance, like a cosmic explosion, erupted from it, obscuring all prying eyes. Even as Li Fan, enduring the white light that seared his divine soul, continued to peer, all he saw was endless white light. At this moment, the Immeasurable Mirror had truly reached its limit. Instantly losing its spiritual essence, it could no longer maintain its levitation and fell from the air. The Immeasurable Mirror Spirit, Sun Luoyao, had also completely fainted, falling silent.

Li Fan pondered, putting away the Immeasurable Mirror. However, images of the scene he had just witnessed raced through his mind. "Earlier, in the Fallen Immortal Realm, Emperor Yi explained the principle behind the Southern Underworld Mountain's successful world-cracking, saying it was the edge of heaven, the corner of the sea, the end of the world, and thus gathered much of the energy that had been wandering and accumulating in the Xuanhuang Realm since its creation..." "Now it seems it wasn't as simple as it claimed. The Xuanhuang Realm's own power alone was insufficient for world-cracking, let alone a bit of wandering energy." "The bronze key and that divine face should be the crucial elements that enabled their world-cracking escape."

Li Fan then suddenly recalled a secret history the Sacred Emperor had heard from the Guiding Tribulation Sect in this life. "From a rift in the Heavenly Sword Sect, the Guiding Tribulation Sect found a mysterious power that could monitor the Xuanhuang Realm, a power that even Dharma-Preachers could not counter once implanted. And here, the second world-cracking location also revealed the presence of mysterious entities beyond the Xuanhuang Realm itself." "Although the Xuanhuang Realm is extremely special among the ancient cultivation realms, these two instances seem to touch upon the key."

While contemplating, Li Fan's figure flickered, and he left the World-Cracker Great Vortex with the Immeasurable Mirror. "The principles of the world, though ever-changing, always return to their origin. The very existence of the title 'Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate' to supervise and inspect the Xuanhuang Realm indicates that the Xuanhuang Realm has unique value to the Immortal Realm." "Just like among the myriad islands of the Cloudy Sea, only those with special products have Immortal Alliance cultivators stationed to guard them and construct island-protecting formations." "To simplify, the so-called Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate is equivalent to the supervisor of the Azure Nether. And the Xuanhuang Realm is equivalent to an island in the lower star sea." "The mysterious power to refine the World-Observing Divine Eye found by the Guiding Tribulation Sect, and the Southern Underworld Sacred Mountain opened by Emperor Yi with the copper key, are likely part of the Xuanhuang Realm's 'island-protecting formation'." "It is not power from the Xuanhuang Realm itself, but constructed from the upper realm." "However, with the great tribulation in the Immortal Realm, this realm-protecting formation has also been affected." "The Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation, deduced by the Heavenly Mysteries King back then based on numerous ancient texts obtained in the ascension passage, might also have been modified and constructed upon this realm-protecting formation. Otherwise, it's hard to imagine how a mere Half-Immortal, relying only on Xuanhuang Realm resources, could construct an Immortal-grade formation capable of crossing the High Wall." "And then..."

Li Fan's flight speed increased, and the clues scattered in the past mists suddenly connected. "The Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation can traverse the endless void and lock onto other cultivation realms in the depths of distant star seas." "My formation skills, enhanced by the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, have already faintly reached the mortal limit. And I know three parts of the Profound Origin Spirit Array. Even for Immortal-grade formations, I can be considered to have gained initial insight. Even so, I am utterly baffled as to how the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation uses those golden chains to accurately lock onto them in the endless star sea." "I previously thought it was my insufficient formation mastery that led to the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc's repeated failures. The Heavenly Mysteries King was a scholar of immense knowledge, and with his Half-Immortal body, his formation skills surpassed even the wondrous Tribulation End Dissolution Disc..." "Now, it seems I might have overlooked an important factor."

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes. "What if those cultivation realms that were locked onto shared common factors with the Xuanhuang Realm? With this mutual resonance, the golden chains of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation could accurately lock onto them one by one." "That is, they all possessed realm-protecting formations!" "Hundred Flowers once mentioned that even the original Xuanhuang Realm was a colossal entity among many cultivation realms. Her homeland, the Myriad Abundance Realm, was only the size of a single province." "If we analogize the Xuanhuang Realm to an island in the Cloudy Sea, it's like the Glazed Island I visited back then, a large-scale existence. The other worlds and grotto-heavens it captured are smaller entities in the star sea." "Indeed... perhaps later, as these worlds were gradually absorbed into the Immortal Ruins, the Xuanhuang Realm also captured some along the way. After the destruction of the Myriad Immortal Sects, it was taken over by Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians, patched up, and thus created the present prosperity of the Xuanhuang Realm." "If my speculation is correct, then the initial regions captured by the Xuanhuang Realm absolutely possessed realm-protecting formations."

Upon thinking this, Li Fan paused, as if realizing something. In the beginning, the Xuanhuang Realm simply captured and annexed, rather than dismembering and reorganizing as it does now. So, those initially devoured regions should have been on the outer edges of the Xuanhuang Realm. "The edge of heaven, the corner of the sea. The frontiers of the world." "Furthermore, Emperor Yi's words seemed to subtly imply that the Azure Nether beasts originated from outside..." "So that's how it is." Li Fan suddenly understood. "It seems the ancient copper key used by Emperor Yi did not open the Xuanhuang Realm's own realm-protecting formation..."

Li Fan's thoughts raced. In reality, there might be a simple way to verify his conjecture. In the small world where the golden skull and the 'Nothingness' script were found, there was a clear memory of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation's golden chain breaking through the realm to lock onto it. All that was needed was to investigate again. With this thought, Li Fan changed direction and headed straight for the target.

Along the way, Sun Luoyao slowly regained consciousness. "Senior, where are we going?" Without any complaints about Li Fan's extreme exertion of his labor before, Sun Luoyao asked with some confusion. "To an interesting place. Take this time to rest well. You might be needed next," Li Fan said calmly. Hearing this, Sun Luoyao's spectral image in the mirror trembled uncontrollably. "Senior, I feel very weak right now..." After a period of silence, Sun Luoyao mustered his courage and said. In response, a mass of viscous golden substance was sent to him. Sun Luoyao's attention was immediately captivated, as if seeing a peerless treasure. He knew this was the miraculous substance Li Fan had previously used to lure out the Devouring Calamity from the Immeasurable Mirror. It had a fatal, irresistible attraction for him, and a deep intuition told him it would be greatly beneficial to him. Thus, Sun Luoyao immediately fell silent and devoured the Essence of Primal Force ravenously. Moments later, his spirit revived, and the feeling of weakness vanished.

"Hmph." Recalling the delightful taste, Sun Luoyao still wanted to please Li Fan and ask for more. However, a cold snort from the latter brought him back to reality. He no longer dared to make any requests, only hoping to receive further rewards after completing the upcoming task.

Not long after, Li Fan finally arrived at the desolate, ash-filled world again after traversing a long void passage. "Go!" At Li Fan's signal, the Immeasurable Mirror once again emitted waves of pale light. Compared to the World-Cracker Great Vortex before, this probing and deciphering was undoubtedly much smoother. With surprising ease, the images in the pale light recreated the scene. A world teeming with life. A great river nurturing endless beings. After death, beings were reborn in the river, achieving a perfect cycle.

"...Not these, go deeper." Just as Sun Luoyao was immersed in the secondary imagery, Li Fan's voice came. Sun Luoyao's mind jolted, and he increased the Immeasurable Mirror's probing intensity. The image of life became fragmented and ethereal. The river also became dreamlike and illusory, like starlight. Beneath all outward appearances, crisscrossing lines suddenly appeared in the Immeasurable Mirror's surface.

"Ah!" However, the moment he saw these lines, it was as if a restriction had been triggered. Sun Luoyao felt an irresistible searing heat suddenly surge upon him, as if being roasted by flames, and the Immeasurable Mirror would melt at any moment. "Senior, save me!" Sun Luoyao cried out uncontrollably. Li Fan, however, remained unperturbed. The Essence of Primal Force was poured into him, forcing Sun Luoyao to endure the intense pain and continue probing. Amidst Sun Luoyao's screams, the foundations hidden beneath the ruins of the world began to slowly reveal themselves. Unlike the small world that had turned into ruins, these lines, although intermittent and seemingly struck by some blow, were covered in a layer of decay. However, they ultimately retained their original form. As more and more lines were probed, the雏形 (chúxíng -雛形) of a formation gradually emerged in Li Fan's mind.

Concurrently, in the Dharma Deduction space, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc temporarily ceased all other tasks and began to record and analyze these fragmented formation lines. "Save me..." Unfortunately, the remnants of this formation were too vast. Before even a tenth of it was observed, Sun Luoyao was on the verge of death and about to perish.

Chapter 1266: Stealing the Power of the Gloom

Li Fan had no choice but to temporarily stop activating the Boundless Mirror.

He flicked out another ball of Primal Force Essence, saving the Boundless Mirror Spirit from the brink of death.

The Primal Force Essence he had stored was generated by the hundred Netherfolk in the Sun family's underground blood pool secret chamber, through their prayers day and night during this period.

Some of it was consumed to lure out the Devouring Calamity lurking within the Boundless Mirror.

Previously, he had used more to repair the Boundless Mirror's injuries and for this divine sense clone of his.

What remained was not much.

Li Fan estimated the rate of Primal Force Essence consumption. "It’s just enough. I don't need to go back again."

"It's just..."

Li Fan casually glanced towards the center of this world, which was filled with deathly stillness.

It seemed that the appearance of the Primal Force Essence had attracted the attention of the golden skull hidden there. A very peculiar sensation, as if he were being stared at by a monster, washed over him.

"Hmph, no matter what your origin was in life, now you are nothing but a skull. Do you dare to cause trouble before me..." Li Fan stood with his hands behind his back, and with a slight shift of his mind, a trapping formation instantly formed.

It locked the space where the golden skull was, sealing it.

"I'll deal with you in the next life."

This time, Li Fan had no intention of investigating the golden skull.

His immediate priority was to ascertain the realm-protecting formation here and then return to the Xuanhuang Realm to trace the hidden realm-protecting grand formation by following its effects.

Soaked in the Primal Force Essence, Sun Luyuan slowly awoke from his daze.

"Rest for now, then we'll continue."

However, Li Fan's calm words struck him like lightning.

Yet, in his heart, he had not the slightest thought of defiance.

Because Sun Luyuan knew that the survival of the Boundless Mirror was in Li Fan's thoughts.

It was even possible for him to simply erase Sun Luyuan and find another cultivator's consciousness to replace him.

"This experience, though painful for you, is more of a refinement. As the saying goes, a thousand refinings make iron, ten thousand refinings make steel. You were merely a mortal, who by chance became the Boundless Mirror Spirit. You've seen the Boundless Mirror's current performance. It's on the verge of collapse just by analyzing something. How can it be called an Immortal Artifact?"

"Even though the Boundless Mirror is damaged and not in its complete form, it's mostly due to your frail Mirror Spirit," Li Fan said sternly.

His words made Sun Luyuan utterly ashamed.

"This Primal Force Essence is something even Longevity cultivators would covet. Using it on you is a complete waste of resources. Yet I did it anyway..." Li Fan's voice trailed off.

"There is great terror between life and death; there are also great opportunities. Comprehend it well!"

Saying this, Li Fan once again manipulated the Boundless Mirror to analyze the residual formation hidden beneath the world's ruins.

Sun Luyuan felt himself rapidly weakening again, but with Li Fan's previous encouragement, he tried his best to invigorate himself and maintain his clarity of mind.

"I absolutely cannot let the Senior down!"

Scenes of his interactions with Li Fan flashed through Sun Luyuan's mind.

Li Fan's help had been undeniable throughout their journey, yet Sun Luyuan had never been able to contribute anything. Now that he finally had an opportunity to repay him, Sun Luyuan was determined not to disappoint Li Fan.

Besides, Sun Luyuan also knew that what Li Fan said was indeed true.

Through repeated trials of life and death, his Origin Consciousness was constantly growing stronger. The growth he experienced in these few days surpassed decades spent hiding in the Sun family's secret chamber.

With a surge of emotion, Sun Luyuan's originally wavering spiritual light stabilized once more.

Li Fan nodded slightly upon seeing this.

...

In the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi.

Li Ping, seated on the Sacred Emperor's throne, had completed the replication and implantation of ten clusters of Azure Nether Heavenly Dao aura.

However, due to the continuous work for an extended period, Cat Treasure's emotions had completely collapsed, and it had gone on strike.

Even with more Primal Force Essence offered, Cat Treasure pretended not to see it and slept soundly.

The Sacred Emperor, helpless, had to pause the process for now.

He looked in the direction of the Four Central Prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"Is the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Leaving Realm Rainbow Light ready?"

Because of the previous gains from the Origin Intent of the Star Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao consciousness, having tasted the benefits, was restless and instinctively wanted to attach itself again and hitch a ride.

However, it was dissuaded by Li Ping.

The Sacred Emperor's premonition told him that the Myriad Immortals Alliance's journey would not be as smooth as his previous one.

Besides the Sacred Emperor's foresight into the dangers of the journey, which the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not replicate, the more important reason was that all members organized by the Alliance for this star sea exploration were Dao Integration cultivators. However, they lacked the strength to truly command respect and suppress dissent.

Although in the Xuanhuang Realm and the Myriad Immortals Alliance, rank determined authority, out in the star sea, especially in desperate situations, it was uncertain who would obey whom.

"Dao Origin State, Lan Yu."

"Liuguang Prefecture, Jin Ri."

...

The list of Dao Integration cultivators proceeding this time was not a secret.

The Sacred Emperor looked at the names one by one, and a sigh escaped his lips.

"The deaths of dozens of Dao Integration cultivators will undoubtedly be a good thing for the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao and the Sacred Dynasty."

"It's just a pity..."

Regrettable as it was, the Sacred Emperor would never show the benevolence of a woman to interfere and stop this matter.

He would simply wait for them to leave.

Moreover, perhaps some of them possessed extraordinary fortune and could survive the myriad crises of the star sea and ultimately achieve enlightenment.

Even if the Sacred Emperor tried to stop them, he would only be considered an obstacle to their Dao path, leading to an irreconcilable confrontation.

Five days later, a seven-colored rainbow light, under the watchful eyes of all Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, slowly ascended into the sky.

Compared to the last time, it seemed much more familiar.

Different colors separated in sequence, finally entering a pitch-dark star sea.

Li Ping watched them depart, silently mourning for them for a moment.

Seven days later, the Sacred Emperor's expression shifted.

He flashed into the secret space where the Netherfolk resided.

Currently, under the rule of the Sacred Dynasty, the Netherfolk could be broadly divided into three groups with different missions.

The largest group, from birth to death, had only one thing they needed and had to do every day: chanting the Sacred Emperor's virtue and grace. These individuals were bred by merging with exotic beasts, with extremely short lifespans and gestation periods. They truly were like leeks, continuously harvested and replanted, ceaseless.

The second type, of medium numbers, had a considerably better treatment. They had ample rest time daily and could even read different books. As native Netherfolk, some of them would be selected to participate in group optimization experiments.

As for the third type, the fewest in number and the most special. They could be considered the purest, most original Netherfolk, still believing in the great Sea of Gloom and maintaining their long-standing traditions. However, since they lived under the rule of the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, they naturally had to obey Li Fan's orders. In fact, within their group, they had already reached a consensus on the question of who was greater: the Sacred Emperor or the Sea of Gloom.

The Sacred Emperor was the embodiment of the will of the Sea of Gloom. The Sacred Emperor, the Sea of Gloom, and the Netherfolk's Progenitor were one, indivisible. Although the theory was a bit crude, it truly resolved the potential conflict caused by Li Fan's interference and stabilized the group completely.

"Greetings, Sacred Emperor." The Netherfolk Patriarch, upon seeing Li Ping, immediately knelt and bowed.

Before this, as Li Ping had not enforced it, these Netherfolk were not required to kneel when they saw him. However, after the new theory emerged, various standards of etiquette emerged within the Netherfolk community, which even the Patriarch had to adhere to. Li Ping let them have it.

"Open the Nether Realm passage." Li Ping commanded coldly, looking at the kneeling Netherfolk below.

The Netherfolk rose, and amidst mysterious and ancient chants, a door slowly opened. Li Ping flew in first.

Upon entering, he was instantly engulfed by boundless gloom.

But Li Ping did not hesitate, speeding towards the direction he sensed.

Silently, he drew closer and closer.

The object his senses locked onto was naturally the profound technique that could increase cultivators' output of Primal Force, which he had revealed through the identity of the Lord of the Sect of Spiritual Primal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

In terms of exploitation, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's efficiency was unexpectedly high.

Li Ping could already sense large quantities of marked Primal Force, in a condensed and compressed state, impacting into this Sea of Gloom.

However, counter-intuitively, such terrifying energy was unable to create the slightest ripple here.

It was unclear whether the Sea of Gloom itself was too vast or if something within it was silently devouring the ripples.

As he drew very close, Li Ping couldn't help but slow down.

Despite his absolute confidence in his own strength, he still proceeded with caution.

Concealing his presence, he infiltrated closer.

*Dong!*

*Dong!*

In the Sea of Gloom, where sound could not propagate and should have been silent, regular intermittent thuds appeared.

It was like the sound of a war drum being struck violently, causing the Sacred Emperor's heart to tremble in rhythm.

Li Ping became serious.

His blood and qi were now as one with the heavens and earth; even an attack from a Longevity Realm cultivator might not shake him. Yet, he was stirred by this simple thud...

"It is not caused by external forces, but by the rhythm of the Sea of Gloom itself."

The Sacred Emperor quickly made his judgment.

Without resisting the thudding sound, Li Ping stood still for a moment, synchronizing his heartbeat with the rhythm of the Sea of Gloom.

As if fully integrated into the darkness, his own discomfort disappeared.

Only then did Li Ping continue forward.

Soon, he "saw," or rather, sensed, the source of the thudding sound.

Like a pricked balloon, or perhaps like the Sky-Cracking Great Vortex of the Xuanhuang Realm.

In the Sea of Gloom ahead, a "small opening" had appeared.

Fierce, compressed Primal Force poured into this rift. Due to the natural repulsion of the Sea of Gloom's own power, a small amount of Gloom power was absorbed along the channel formed by the confrontation of the two forces.

Li Ping stopped far away and observed, his heart growing more solemn.

"Coincidence."

After a long pause, he gave this evaluation.

The power of the Sea of Gloom and the forcefully injected compressed Primal Force had reached a perfect state of balance.

The Primal Force could not truly penetrate the Sea of Gloom, and similarly, the Sea of Gloom's counterattack was not fully triggered.

In this strange balance, a call between Primal Force and Gloom power was achieved.

One must know that the Sea of Gloom is unpredictable.

This meant that the output of Primal Force from the Myriad Immortals Alliance must also change and adjust accordingly. If the balance were to be broken, an immediate backlash from the Sea of Gloom would ensue.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance had been maintaining this device for quite some time, indicating that their research into the Sea of Gloom had reached its zenith.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance has capable individuals."

Li Ping couldn't help but exclaim.

After all, having ruled half of the Xuanhuang Realm for thousands of years, it was not surprising they possessed such hidden capabilities.

"Compared to the Gloom power that usually spills into various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm, this extracted Gloom power is more tranquil."

"And easier to utilize."

After observing for another period, Li Ping discerned the underlying principle.

"It's just that I don't know why the Myriad Immortals Alliance went to such great lengths to extract this tranquil Gloom power."

However, the unknown did not hinder Li Ping's actions.

As the Sea of Gloom, which maintained the stability of the Azure Nether, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's act of drawing its power was undoubtedly defying the heavens.

Li Ping, as the "embodiment of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao," naturally could not stand idly by.

But he did not act rashly.

Firstly, this perfect state of balance, if rashly broken, might lead to even greater turmoil in the Sea of Gloom.

Secondly, merely stopping this extraction would only address the symptoms, not the root cause.

Li Ping sought a method that would resolve the issue once and for all, preventing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's thieving actions.

The Sacred Emperor had ample patience.

After observing the location for over a month, he first returned to the Sacred Dynasty.

He brought nearly a hundred original Netherfolk to this location.

"Bastards! What kind of blasphemy is that!"

From the Netherfolk Patriarch's animated gestures, the Sacred Emperor could sense his inner rage.

The other Netherfolk, witnessing their revered Sea of Gloom being stolen by thieves, were filled with extreme hatred.

If not for Li Fan's concealment, such intense emotional fluctuations might have caused them to erupt in fury long ago.

"I've come this time to resolve this matter."

"Blasphemers deserve to be executed."

Li Fan's will was transmitted to the Netherfolk's minds.

These Netherfolk immediately knelt again, their faces filled with a resolute willingness to sacrifice their lives.

In a corner undiscovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, these Netherfolk began an ancient ritual.

It was a method passed down from ancient times to communicate with the Sea of Gloom.

What Li Fan wanted them to do was to attract the attention of the Origin of this Sea of Gloom.

Despite the commotion here, compared to the vast Sea of Gloom, it was merely a small hole poked in its body.

Without the balance being broken, it wouldn't even notice.

This allowed the Myriad Immortals Alliance to continuously steal Gloom power.

However, with the Netherfolk's ritual as a guide, things might change.

Even if it didn't immediately expel the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the sudden shift in repulsive force would be enough to break the balance.

And because it was a change within the Sea of Gloom itself, with this immense entity as a foundation, even some turmoil would be negligible.

As the ritual progressed, Li Fan felt faint ripples in the Sea of Gloom.

He instinctively concealed his aura as much as possible.

**Chapter 1267: Encountering True Immortal Script Again**

As the Sea of Darkness stirred, the people of the Nether Race, who had been kneeling on the ground, seemed to sense something as their expressions grew more frenzied and devout.

Like a gust of wind, it blew from all directions of the Sea of Darkness, converging near the small hole that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had drilled through.

The pressure increased dramatically. Invisible ripples spread from the breach, and with layers of power accumulating, Li Ping’s senses perceived that the stable state at the entrance was instantly shattered.

The condensed and compressed Primal Force retreated rapidly, as if it were about to be completely driven out of this Sea of Darkness.

However, at this very moment, Li Ping surprisingly saw that this lightless sea actually began to illuminate.

This was not an illusion caused by the inherent fluctuations of the Sea of Darkness, but a true light born within it.

A golden abacus appeared, stabilizing the disintegrating Primal Force of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The beads vibrated, and the Primal Force output suddenly increased, restoring the balance between the two.

The Sea of Darkness surged with waves, stirring up spray. But each time, the waves were perfectly neutralized by the calculations, summoning, and adjustments of the golden abacus.

What astonished Li Ping, who was observing from the shadows, even more was that the golden abacus was doing far more than just regulating the Primal Force. More importantly, strands of golden light spread outwards with the constant oscillation of the beads.

The aura of a cultivator who, theoretically, had completely vanished from the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Sacred Emperor’s heart tightened, and he concealed himself and more than a hundred Nether Race individuals.

During this time, under the strenuous repair efforts of the golden abacus, the Sea of Darkness returned to a balanced and tranquil state.

With this thought, Li Ping led the Nether Race people back to Great Qi.

A flicker of suspicion crossed the Sacred Emperor's mind.

He scanned the surroundings a few times but found no suspicious presence, finally slowly disappearing.

“If it were merely a similar aura, it would be one thing. But if he himself is still alive, and lurking within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, helping them steal the power of the Sea of Darkness…”

“Heavenly Mysteries King…”

Scenes flashed before Li Ping’s eyes.

After mentally contacting the Stone Slab, he began to review the information recorded by the Genesis Stone Slab.

It was precisely this doubt that made the Sacred Emperor temporarily change his decision.

Li Ping stood not far from the breach. After a moment of contemplation, he ultimately decided to postpone the plan to destroy the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s device here.

Or rather, it was born from the golden abacus and was incredibly peculiar.

An eyeball granted life to the abacus, which meticulously searched for anomalies within the Sea of Darkness.

“It completely defies reason.”

It wasn't that Li Ping feared a direct conflict with the Myriad Immortals Alliance at this moment, but rather that he sensed a familiar aura from the suddenly appearing eyeball.

The unknown entity that was awakening, soothed by the golden light of the abacus, fell back into slumber.

The eye was cold, devoid of any emotion. It rotated and surveyed, as if trying to find the cause of the imbalance in the apparatus extracting the power of the Sea of Darkness.

Although it didn't fly for long before being completely swallowed by the darkness, the fury of the Sea of Darkness was slowly calmed by the effect of this golden light.

As the changes occurred, an eyeball also quietly descended above the breach of the Sea of Darkness.

But until this matter was clarified, it was better to avoid a direct confrontation.

The Heavenly Mysteries King, from an ordinary cultivator, rose through the ranks with continuous encounters and opportunities, ultimately becoming the last ascender from the Xuanhuang Realm.

Shortly after he broke through the void and became a part of the eternal legend of the Xuanhuang Realm.

He reappeared, shaking the world.

Then came the founding of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, and finally its joint eradication by the ten sects.

The scenes were fragmented, and at certain critical junctures, they seemed to have been forcibly erased.

But even this incomplete personal history was filled with twists and turns, captivating the heart.

“According to the synchronized sensory memories from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao and the records of the Genesis Stone Slab, the eye appearing in the Sea of Darkness bears almost a ten-percent resemblance to the Heavenly Mysteries King.”

“That’s where the strangeness lies.”

The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao itself certified that the Heavenly Mysteries King had perished. Where did the Myriad Immortals Alliance find his eye?

“The specific record of the Myriad Immortal Sects besieging the Heavenly Mysteries Sect back then is also vague. What could conceal the origin power of the Xuanhuang Realm must be at least an existence of equal standing.”

…

The more he pondered, the more confused he became. This superficial savior of the Xuanhuang Realm was shrouded in too many mysteries.

Most importantly, his cultivation realm was there.

His half-immortal body vanished just like that, which was hard to believe. Especially now that Li Ping himself was nearing the limit of the Xuanhuang Realm, he could better understand its power.

Only beings at the True Immortal level or above could possibly obliterate the Heavenly Mysteries King without a sound.

But if such an existence truly appeared, it would surely shake the heavens and earth, and even the Xuanhuang Realm would be implicated and buried with it.

However, in the memories of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, such an event did not occur.

Perhaps the True Immortal deliberately concealed their aura when taking action…

Then the problem arises again.

In the eyes of a True Immortal, mortals are all like ants.

Even though the Heavenly Mysteries King was a half-immortal, he was no exception. If a True Immortal killed him, why would they need to hide their actions?

“Perhaps some clues can be found from the few Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law Kings who survived back then.”

The Faceless Sacred Emperor flipped through the Genesis Stone Slab, trying to find any trace.

At the same time, Li Fan’s divine sense, far away in the Ashes Pocket World, knitted his brows slightly.

After personally experiencing the difficulty of dealing with the Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law Kings, he had deliberately and unilaterally blocked the Sacred Emperor’s memory of Mo Rubin, to avoid further complications in this life.

He hadn't expected that through various coincidences, the Sacred Emperor would show signs of entanglement with Mo Rubin again.

“Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance can pinpoint the location of Mo Rubin’s slumber through various clues, the Sacred Emperor should also be able to. This is getting interesting.”

“That eye of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's could never have been the Heavenly Mysteries King himself. Otherwise, when Mo Rubin possessed the Doctrine Transmitter’s body and knew all the secrets of the Alliance, he should have discovered this already.”

Li Fan pondered as he urged the Boundless Mirror to analyze the realm-protecting grand formation.

“However, considering his eventual death in the Sea of Darkness, perhaps we can guess that the eyeball must have some unknown connection to the Heavenly Mysteries King. It might even be a part of the Heavenly Mysteries King’s authority?”

“Mo Rubin discovered the existence of this Alliance eye and sensed its connection to the Sea of Darkness, which is why he ventured into the dangerous area, ultimately vanishing without a trace.”

“Authority…”

“Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, the realm-protecting grand formation!”

A sharp light flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. In the incomplete formation model being deduced by the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, a point of light suddenly erupted.

Even though he couldn't see its full form, Li Fan instantly understood the meaning of this point of light.

“Like the Profound Origin Spirit Array, this unknown realm-protecting grand formation is also composed of several different subordinate formations. Each formation has its own control core hub.”

“This point of light is the core!”

Through the analysis of the Boundless Netherlight, the lines of the formation ruins hidden deep beneath the Ashes Pocket World finally revealed their corresponding "core" locations.

However, what should have been the most densely packed area of the formation hub was now completely empty.

It was as if it had been directly dug out.

Just as the Boundless Mirror was about to continue probing the void core area, a sense of crisis suddenly surged into Li Fan’s heart.

It made him instantly halt the Boundless Mirror’s actions.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and looked towards that void.

A deceptive and chilling aura lurked within.
