It wasn't that nothing existed!

But its existence transcended the scope of ordinary perception!

“True, Immortal, Script, Characters!”

Li Fan said, word by word, in his heart, simultaneously raising his vigilance to its highest level.

They were unlike the previously encountered [Starvation], [Nothingness], and [Chaos], nor were they similar to the residual powers found in the Abyssal Star Sea.

They didn't even exist in the records of the Mystic Immortal Boat.

A new, unknown, and peculiar power that did not attack other entities but was directed solely at the core of the realm-protecting formation.

Having completed their objectives, they now lay quietly upon the "corpse" of the realm-protecting formation’s central hub.

Chapter 1268: The Failed Immortal Power

This was exactly the same situation as the first time they encountered the The Hunger Seal.

The moment the True Immortal Sigils at the center of the Realm Protecting Great Formation appeared in Li Fan's sea of consciousness, he understood its meaning.

"Return!"

It didn't feel like a curse like Mockery or Chaos, but rather a command!

"A complete True Immortal Sigils..."

As Li Fan's mind was shaken, he quietly imprinted the appearance of this "Return" character firmly in his memory.

"Return? Return to where? Or return to its original state?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, savoring this profound power.

Meanwhile, the Boundless Mirror Spirit had completed its investigation of all areas except the central core of the Realm Protecting Great Formation.

"Senior, that place..." Sun Luyuan stared blankly at the void.

An invisible connection was instantly formed, as if linking the "Return" character to the Boundless Mirror.

The scene unfolding before him left Li Fan somewhat bewildered. However, from the meaning of the "Return" character itself and the changes in the Boundless Mirror before and after, he could deduce some things.

Li Fan could clearly sense the fear and confusion suddenly arising in Sun Luyuan's heart.

The "blue smoke" that had been summoned by the "Return" character, going to an unknown destination, had actually returned!

It was as if time had been reversed on the Boundless Mirror. The Boundless Mirror, which was only the size of a thumb, reappeared before Li Fan, becoming full and complete once more!

Sun Luyuan, who had been wailing, believing his end was near, his voice grew weaker and weaker. Finally, he stared dumbfounded at the Boundless Mirror, which had returned to normal, completely at a loss.

An unexpected situation had occurred.

And those ignited parts, the components affected by the "Return" character, like wisps of blue smoke, vanished to an unknown destination.

It seemed that due to having received a command once, the re-manifested Boundless Mirror was able to ignore the existence of the "Return" character.

Li Fan naturally sensed the change in the Boundless Mirror immediately.

Li Fan's heart sank. He wanted to try to stop the Boundless Mirror from dissolving. However, even his main body could not contend with the power of the True Immortal Sigils, let alone this mere divine sense clone.

Both parties were unaffected.

Just as Li Fan thought that this immortal artifact, which had been of great help to him, was about to completely perish.

Not only that, the immortal artifact itself, the Boundless Mirror, began to gradually "disintegrate."

With a hint of regret, he watched as the Boundless Mirror grew smaller and smaller under Sun Luyuan's continuous screams.

After a moment of stupefaction, Li Fan came to his senses and looked at the "Return" character again.

"What is happening? Nowhere to return?"

"Senior, save me!" Sun Luyuan instinctively cried out.

The "Return" character also chose to ignore the Boundless Mirror, continuing to lie quietly in the void core of the great formation.

What had just happened felt like a dream.

Even the main body of the immortal artifact, the Boundless Mirror, trembled slightly without warning. In the escalating tremors, Sun Luyuan, as the artifact spirit, had the tendency to be "flung out" of the Boundless Mirror!

Without facing the power of the "Return" character head-on, only being affected and locked onto by the overflow, the Great Formation of "Boundless Unity, Primordial Square," which Li Fan had painstakingly repaired in the mirror, showed signs of slow collapse.

In Li Fan's perception, the entire Boundless Mirror was like a piece of paper set ablaze; the disappearance of its fundamental composition caused it to inevitably fade into illusion.

Li Fan was also momentarily stunned, looking at the Great Formation of Primordial Square that had spontaneously reconstructed itself from the void.

"The Realm Protecting Great Formations in the lower realms were all created by the Immortal Realm and are also subject to its control. And the Boundless Mirror is an immortal artifact, also subject to the constraints of the Immortal Realm."

"If we consider them as elite soldiers and generals of the Immortal Realm, then this 'Return' character is equivalent to having the authority to command them. Whether this is due to the special power of the 'Return' character itself or a general situation in the Immortal Realm is still unknown."

"Under normal circumstances, upon being summoned by the 'Return' character, one should shed their armor and return. But now, the Immortal Realm has been destroyed, and the execution of the decree has been affected."

"It seems that this 'Return' character is fundamentally different from the other True Immortal Sigilss, perhaps even a part of the operational cornerstone of the ancient Immortal Realm's power system."

Li Fan mused, "However, this speculation inevitably leads to a problem."

"Since the 'Return' character is already in a semi-invalid state, where have these central cores of the Realm Protecting Great Formations gone?"

Li Fan gazed at the "Return" character lying quietly in the core area.

Several possibilities already surfaced in his mind.

The "Return" character was written by some being and flew towards the core of the formations in various realms. However, upon reaching the designated location, it found the target already gone. Thus, it lingered there, waiting for the target to reappear.

Alternatively, the "Return" character successfully acted upon the formation cores, and the lower realm cores vanished sequentially, returning to the Immortal Realm. With the Immortal Realm destroyed, the cores reappeared. At this very moment, they were intercepted by an unknown entity, and the cores were abducted.

...

"There are too few conditions at present. The truth cannot be determined."

"If the 'Return' character's scope of action is limited to the original power of the Immortal Realm, even though it's a True Immortal Sigils, its effect on me is limited." Li Fan couldn't help but shake his head slightly.

"However, since this 'Return' character can shake an immortal artifact..."

"I wonder if it would work on the Heavenly Profound Mirror?"

Even if it wouldn't cause substantive damage to the Heavenly Profound Mirror, if it could cause it to malfunction for a period, it could play a significant role at a crucial moment.

One must know that the current system of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, especially the defense measures of the Alliance Headquarters, were all inextricably linked to the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Once the Heavenly Profound Mirror malfunctions, the impregnable Myriad Immortals Alliance would instantly become riddled with flaws.

Li Fan's main body possessed the origin of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, so perhaps it held little significance for him.

But for the Sacred Emperor Li Ping, it was entirely different.

Instantly reversing the tide of battle, its power could be equivalent to that of dozens of cultivators at the Dao Integration realm!

After his main body, with a faint induction from the mysterious forces, transmitted the content of the "Return" character to the Sacred Emperor Li Ping.

The divine sense clone in the Ashes Pocket World began its next course of action.

The "Return" character was an unexpected windfall.

His purpose for coming here was still to verify his previous conjecture.

"From this to that, there should also be a Realm Protecting Great Formation in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Moreover, the Realm Protecting Great Formation was left by the Immortal Realm and only exists in the original Xuanhuang Realm." Li Fan casually set up a formation to seal off the Ashes Pocket World, preventing anyone from accidentally entering and coming into contact with the "Return" character. Then, Li Fan's divine sense, carrying the Boundless Mirror, returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

He arrived at the location of the Four Central Prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

A miniature projection of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared in his mind, but it was only an echo of the original Xuanhuang Realm.

Lines crisscrossing appeared on the model; these were the projected Realm Protecting Great Formations deduced by Li Fan.

Even with slight errors, he could still roughly pinpoint their locations.

Then, by using the Boundless Mirror's authority and spending some time, he could find the hidden core of the Realm Protecting Great Formation in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The only thing to worry about was making too much of a commotion and being detected by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Chapter 1269: The Folded Immortal Array

After being tempered by the Ashes Pocket World and narrowly escaping death with the Return Character Technique, Sun Luoyuan had indeed improved significantly.

A faint glow silently bloomed, piercing through the surface land of the Xuanhuang Realm and reaching its inner core. After a period of searching, remnants of what appeared to be the realm-protecting great formation were discovered. However, compared to the Ashes Pocket World, the formation lines in the Xuanhuang Realm were even more ancient and profound.

Li Fan, while urging the Boundless Mirror to continue its investigation, integrated the identified formation data into the array model previously derived by the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc.

“The vast majority of it matches. But at certain crucial nodes…” Li Fan’s eyes flickered. Grasping the Boundless Mirror, he transformed into a streamlined form and traversed the nine regions, arriving at the extremely deep underground, still beneath the Xuanhuang Realm’s earth veins.

Chaos reigned supreme. Under unimaginable pressure, matter ceased to exist. Only a dark red aura flowed, carrying cryptic, whisper-like sounds. In this extreme environment, Li Fan’s divine sense had no choice but to retreat into the Boundless Mirror, relying on the immortal artifact’s body for survival. The Boundless Mirror itself wasn't at ease. It actively emitted a faint glow to protect its core, while Sun Luoyuan warily observed their surroundings.

"So, it must be done like this."

A sudden impulse surged through Li Fan’s mind. The Boundless Mirror didn’t seem to notice much, but Li Fan’s divine sense began to age at an almost visible rate. Just as Li Fan's divine sense was about to completely dissipate due to old age, a mysterious surge of life suddenly emerged from its core. To his surprise, it was exactly the same method that the Doctrine Transmitter had used to hide and seal the Book of Tribulation Passage: the superposition of space in multiple directions. In simpler terms, a line segment was hidden in different spatial dimensions. From certain angles, nothing could be discovered. Only by continuously changing perspectives and "rotating" all distributed segments to unify them would the hidden formation finally reveal itself.

“Moreover, I can sense the aura of immortal script here. A lot of it…”

“Hmm?” The Sun Luoyuan, the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, stared in astonishment at this unexpected turn of events.

“If the Immortal Realm still existed, this Return Character Technique would be equivalent to forcibly opening a channel to the Immortal Realm, albeit only for specific targets.”

“This inexplicable turn in the formation node, unexpected yet seemingly inevitable, means my previous understanding was too superficial.”

A seemingly casual question was, in reality, Li Fan intensely observing Sun Luoyuan, noting his changes.

“Marvelous, truly marvelous.”

“The passage still exists, but its destination is gone. However, according to the Boundless Mirror, an experiencer of this phenomenon, it’s possible that the true location of the Immortal Ruins did not disappear. It was merely forcibly expelled after a brief stay. This is what is meant by ‘the old ways no longer suffice’!”

“No,” Sun Luoyuan’s emotions showed no unusual fluctuations as he truthfully replied. “After being annihilated by the power of the immortal script, my consciousness entered a state of blankness. I cannot sense the existence of those lost parts at all.”

Sun Luoyuan’s words abruptly stopped, as if he had fallen into some deep thought and doubt. After the Boundless Mirror shattered, all information related to the Immortal Realm within it vanished. Even though Li Fan helped him to approximately reassemble it, the lost records did not return. This was solely due to the proximity caused by the act of “seeing.” Using the remaining essence of primal force, he wondered if he could disguise himself as an immortal artifact and utilize the power of the Return Character Technique to explore the true Immortal Ruins firsthand.

“And now that the Immortal Realm is destroyed…” Li Fan’s mind suddenly became clear: “This is the yearning of mortals for immortals, the pursuit of a lower life form for sublimation. It is etched into the divine soul, innate and indelible.”

“After coming into contact with the immortal script, have any memories recovered?” Li Fan asked while observing their surroundings. Li Fan repeatedly exclaimed in admiration, immersed in the remnants of a true immortal-grade great formation. He seemed utterly oblivious to his own aging and the crisis of his imminent disappearance. This was the first time Li Fan had witnessed a real, not theoretical, immortal-grade formation.

“Uh, I don’t know how to explain it to Senior. It’s a very magical experience. Although it’s nonexistent, it feels like I instantly traveled to another extremely distant world. The feeling is so profound, I truly don’t know if it’s my genuine perception or an illusion between life and death,” Sun Luoyuan said slowly, his tone somewhat dreamlike and hazy.

“Senior, the formation remnants I was scanning above were clearly here. Yet, as I approached, they disappeared…”

“Much stronger than before,” Sun Luoyuan emphasized. All thoughts of death vanished, like withered wood recovering its spring. Even the residual aura of the Xuanhuang Realm's protective formation could not shake his spirit, which had been as fragile as a candle in the wind.

However, after “returning” to the Immortal Realm, perhaps something had changed, hence his question.

“But…” Once the thought arose, it was like a surging flood, impossible to suppress. It was only through the spontaneous operation of the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation that the desire was quelled. It was like the imprint left by a terrifying behemoth’s merciless crushing, branding the very fabric of space with a sense of ancient weariness.

“But…” Li Fan’s thoughts paused slightly upon hearing his words. It was clearer than what he saw on the surface. While Li Fan’s divine sense pondered, he also found the method to decipher the hidden nature of the Xuanhuang Realm’s original great protective formation. Li Fan could now move and speak within the formation’s aura. He glanced at Sun Luoyuan and smiled slightly, “What, want to learn?”

Under Li Fan’s guidance, the ancient mirror surface of the Boundless Mirror gradually reflected the traces of formation lines. “For me, using my divine sense to attempt it, while my main body remains fully prepared for immediate recovery, the risk isn’t too high. Hmm… coincidentally, while waiting for the final act of observing tigers fight from a mountain in this era, there’s still a long time ahead. I can plan carefully…”

The Sun Luoyuan of the Boundless Mirror seemed too shocked to react immediately, staring blankly as Li Fan’s divine sense rapidly weakened, without offering any warning. Although these were only a few strokes of lines, they gave Li Fan, an array master who considered himself at the pinnacle of mortal realm formations, great insight.

“Senior… Senior!”

“This is called the Profound Art of Life and Death. It reverses life into death, without life or death.” Sun Luoyuan trembled but dared not speak. After a long pause, he slowly said, “Senior’s divine might is truly beyond my imagination…”

Li Fan temporarily ignored him, concentrating all his attention on studying the Xuanhuang Realm’s original great protective formation. From the small part of the formation he had glimpsed, the scale of the original great formation was unexpectedly vast. If these discovered details were scaled up proportionally in the derived model of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, then theoretically, the original great formation’s range was tens of times larger than the original Xuanhuang Realm itself! This defied all logic!

“Where did it go wrong?” Li Fan was slightly stunned. After a brief moment of thought, he continued to urge the Boundless Mirror to reflect the remaining formation ruins. As the actual formation data of the original great protective formation was gradually completed, and some critical formation nodes appeared, Li Fan modified the derived formation model. He understood why the theory didn't match the reality. Previously, the protective formation was merely an array covering the Xuanhuang Realm. In reality, this original formation was folded multiple times in the same location with roughly different forms! Layer upon layer was folded inward, and after compression and transformation, it formed the true Azure Nether protective great formation!

“Simple stacking alone increased the formation's potential by several times. Moreover, if the folded formation is unfolded, it can instantly unleash the formation's peak power under normal circumstances.”

“More importantly, if the Xuanhuang Realm itself expands its territory, the protective formation can perfectly expand to new territories by continuously unfolding in this manner. Even if it is temporarily disconnected from the Immortal Realm, as long as one controls the original great protective formation, the formation can maintain its perfect state through this method.”

The Tribulation End Dissolution Disc within the main body released its power to its limit, aiding the divine sense in the depths of the Xuanhuang Realm to comprehend the original great protective formation. Coupled with the probing faint glow of the Boundless Mirror, which already possessed a certain degree of analytical function, Li Fan was able to gradually convert the formation remnants into his own knowledge with relative ease. During the research, Li Fan discovered that the original great formation frequently employed the technique of formation folding. Any seemingly simple formation structure could potentially conceal thousands, or even tens of thousands, of extremely complex formation units. To ensure that no mistakes were made in the parsing of the formation, Li Fan had to slow down the deciphering process. He left no detail unexamined, meticulously reflecting everything with the Boundless Mirror. This was sheer torment for Sun Luoyuan. Even though he was accustomed to days of being squeezed to exhaustion, such high-intensity work still made him miserable. However, having just made a mistake, Sun Luoyuan felt guilty and could only grit his teeth and endure it. Li Fan, before completely deciphering the original great protective formation, would not actually let the Boundless Mirror disintegrate. He would precisely revive Sun Luoyuan with the essence of primal force just before he collapsed. Time slowly passed, and the formation analysis was largely completed, reaching the area outside the central core. At this moment, however, Li Fan voluntarily stopped his exploration. The remaining essence of primal force was sufficient to support the Boundless Mirror in completing the final task. But near this central hub, Li Fan faintly sensed a crisis. After careful introspection, Li Fan confirmed that this premonition of danger did not originate from the original great formation itself but from other sources.

“There are restrictions here?” Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

“Sun Luoyuan!” he called out familiarly. Sun Luoyuan responded, revitalizing his utterly exhausted spirit, and meticulously scanned their surroundings once more.

“Senior, apart from the formation remnants, I found nothing unusual!” Sun Luoyuan reported eagerly after completing his search. Li Fan pondered for a moment and said, “Search again!” This time, Li Fan personally guided the faint glow of the Boundless Mirror, using the method of “folding” to re-examine the space outside the core of the original formation. As expected! He discovered a ring of alarm restrictions that had been folded multiple times, completely concealing their traces under normal conditions! The aura of the alarm restrictions was also ancient. However, compared to the remnants of the original great formation, it seemed to be outwardly strong but inwardly weak. It had already been deciphered, its core power gone, leaving only an empty shell. Yet, even this shell brought Li Fan a fatal sense of crisis.

“It should be from the same source as the Xuanhuang Realm’s original great formation, a creation of the Upper Realm.” Without acting rashly, after careful investigation, Li Fan reached this conclusion. “If the restrictions were complete, even with the accumulated foundation of the Xuanhuang Realm across more than a dozen lifetimes, I probably couldn’t deal with it. Fortunately, such terrifying immortal restrictions have already been broken by predecessors!” Li Fan discovered the loophole in the restrictions. To be cautious, he released a wisp of his divine soul to test it. After confirming it was not a trap, he led the Boundless Mirror through the loophole in the restrictions into the central core region. After a brief moment of darkness. When the light shone again, what appeared before Li Fan was no longer empty void. Instead, it was a strange device. It was composed of countless concentric circles of various sizes, all sharing the same core, with the rings distributed in different directions. The use of “countless” was not an exaggeration. The number of rings that constituted this peculiar device was truly impossible to count with divine sense or eyes. Although it had lost its power source and was stationary, it still seemed to be constantly changing its number. As Li Fan focused his attention on this device, the world itself seemed to split into another branch.

“It’s not an illusion.”

“My existence is being weakened?” Li Fan’s divine sense sounded an alarm. It wasn’t just this divine sense; even his main body, hidden in the Dharma Deduction space of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, felt a tangible, terrifying pressure of crisis. Li Fan's divine sense wisely abandoned its probe of the strange circular device at that instant. The splitting and the sense of crisis vanished immediately. Li Fan tried to recall the appearance of the circular device in his sea of consciousness. He found that although he could restore it, the number of rings in the device was fixed. Moreover, it was not the same as the actual object he had seen, with a clear but unidentifiable difference. What made Li Fan even more horrified was that each time he recalled it, the number of rings in the device was different. Yet, his intuition told him that each recollection was correct. This bizarre scene made Li Fan think of the quantum superposition he had heard about before his transmigration.

“This circular device must also be a relic of the Immortal Realm.” Li Fan changed his approach, focusing his attention not on the circular device itself, but on the parts that were missing from the device. Obviously, something was missing from those rings. It wasn't Li Fan’s conjecture; the surrounding spatial murals depicted the device’s original appearance. Countless diagrams of the circular device formed the overall mural. Similarly, the number of rings in these devices in the paintings was not uniform. However, all the devices shared one commonality: in the center of the rings, a bead floated. It was a crimson bead with what appeared to be nine star patterns engraved upon it.

Chapter 1270

The mural, faded to a somber hue, featured a striking Nine-Star Red Pearl. It stared intently at Li Fan, akin to numerous eyes, eerily fixated upon him.

As this thought formed in Li Fan's mind, he truly felt as though the myriad red pearls in the mural had come alive. A peculiar aura emanated from them—neither righteous nor evil, ancient yet freshly born. What shocked Li Fan the most was that merely through the illusory image left by the mural, his divine soul clone felt a portion of its being being siphoned away, absorbed. He had tried numerous methods to stop it, all to no avail. Only by utilizing the Essence of Primal Force could he isolate the influence of the Nine-Star Red Pearl.

"What in the world are these Nine-Star Red Pearls?"

"If the murals are like this, then real Red Pearls would likely be impervious even to the protection of the Essence of Primal Force."

"Hmm..."

Li Fan pondered the potential consequences of being absorbed by the Red Pearls.

"It wouldn't cause any substantial damage to a living being, but it would leave a special imprint on the divine soul and even the life origin of every absorbed creature. And this is merely the effect of the Nine-Star Red Pearls themselves."

Li Fan's gaze returned to the empty space where the Nine-Star Red Pearls should have been. This device, after all, was a part of the Xuanhuang Realm's Primary Protective Great Formation.

"Indeed, the beings created through this method would only be like clones or replicas. And a person's ultimate achievements are intrinsically linked to their own experiences."

"An unknown variable, infinite possibilities."

"The original individual is the same, their life experiences are the same..."

Upon realizing that beings like himself were merely existence that True Immortals could easily create, modify, and reproduce, Li Fan, despite possessing the supreme treasure [Return to Truth], felt an unnameable emotion surge within him.

"Even if achieved through the Circle of Indeterminate Numbers and the Nine-Star Red Pearls, it's still incredibly impressive."

"Thinking from another perspective, perhaps the original prototype of this formation in the Immortal Realm was even more powerful. However, without the support of Immortal Spiritual Qi, certain key formation nodes lost their efficacy, necessitating the use of these unusual items as replacements."

"Imprint Nine-Star Red Pearls."

"This is the true method of immortals, inconceivable, possessing the authority that only creators and gods could wield."

"The special traits of all living beings are recorded. This means that if the energy and technical means were sufficient, it would be possible to recreate any historical figure who has ever appeared in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm."

Unlike True Immortal Sigils such as Chaos and Starvation, the Return Character Technique had vastly different manifestations of power, and it could not be weakly replicated or clumsily imitated to produce a degraded version.

"Based on my previous findings, the Red Pearls were likely recalled by the 'Return' character technique. But if this occurred after the Great Tribulation of the Immortal Realm, when there was nowhere to return, the Red Pearls should have returned to the Xuanhuang Realm. It was during this process that they were forcibly snatched away."

"Creating the myriad forms of sentient beings..." A peculiar gleam appeared in Li Fan's eyes.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, scrutinizing the bizarre device.

"In the Xuanhuang Realm, there exists the Genesis Stone Slab, which records every event in the world."

Li Fan chuckled self-mockingly.

"But..."

After understanding the underlying principles, Li Fan grew even more curious about the current whereabouts of the Red Pearls.

"What a profound formation?!"

While this deduction sounded incredible at first glance, it was the most plausible inference when combined with his current exploration of the Xuanhuang Realm's Primary Protective Great Formation.

"But now..."

Through his calculations, the function of this central hub of the Xuanhuang Realm's Primary Protective Great Formation was to imprint a special mark on all newly born beings in the Xuanhuang Realm using the Nine-Star Red Pearls. Subsequently, through the Circle of Indeterminate Numbers, these imprints within the life essence of these beings would be regulated to a certain extent.

"The Nine-Star Red Pearls, it's highly likely they've existed since the birth of the Xuanhuang Realm. All beings native to the Xuanhuang Realm were forcibly imprinted by them. In other words, it's possible that the data of all unique life characteristics of beings in the Xuanhuang Realm is stored and recorded within the Nine-Star Red Pearls..."

"The rules of the immortals are strict, as can be seen. Even after the Immortal Realm was destroyed so many years ago, the rules still remain."

After all, this was the first time he had truly witnessed such a powerful formation capable of manipulating the very form of life. Even after witnessing the Profound Origin Spirit Array, an immortal-grade formation that could seemingly re-establish earth, fire, water, and wind, and recreate the world, Li Fan, upon understanding the principle behind the formation before him, let out a heartfelt sigh of admiration.

"Such elaborate measures indicate that the mastermind behind this is not someone who can directly use the Return character technique, but rather someone like me, who borrows power to exert force..."

"The Nine-Star Red Pearls are the key."

Its profound meaning was unlikely to deviate significantly from the main purpose of the formation. Li Fan simply simplified this circular device, treating it as part of an unknown formation unit. He then integrated it into the model of the Protective Great Formation, corrected with actual formation data from the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc. It was as if an invisible force was obstructing him, and with Li Fan's current cultivation, he was not even qualified to write it, let alone replicate it. This resulted in variations in temperament, talent, and so forth.

Li Fan's mood suddenly turned heavy.

"Once identical individuals are created, and by referencing the records on the Stone Slab, their past experiences can be completely recreated."

"I see all beings of the Xuanhuang Realm as mere playthings. True Immortals should view me similarly~"

"The circular device is present, but the Red Pearls are nowhere to be seen..."

Of course, this was merely a sigh of profound shock from Li Fan, not his true inner thoughts. After tens of thousands of iterative data deductions, Li Fan deduced the most probable use of the circular Nine-Star device. His thoughts calmed, returning to the previous point.

"This..."

"The final 'life' created will be exactly the same."

The ultimate answer of his deduction left Li Fan in a daze. The discovery by the Guiding Tribulation Sect unequivocally indicated that since its creation in ancient times, the Xuanhuang Realm had been under strict surveillance. And now, it wasn't just surveillance. The entire Xuanhuang Realm was like a massive experimental field. The nature of the experiment was chilling.

"If the conjecture is correct, then the Immortal Realm did this to cultivate a unique cultivator?"

"And once the goal is achieved, countless target existences can be mass-produced based on the strictly monitored data."

Images of cultivators who had left their mark on the history of the Xuanhuang Realm flashed before Li Fan's eyes. Xuanyuan Hong, Su Bai, Xu Ke... and He Zhenghao, Xiao Fan, Zhang Haobo. These "people" could all be recreated. Without their unique characteristics, could they still be called "people"? Even though Li Fan possessed Return to Truth, which allowed him to continuously return to a predetermined anchor point, in Li Fan's heart, these individuals he encountered all possessed their own special symbols. He Zhenghao was He Zhenghao. Heavenly Mysteries King was Heavenly Mysteries King, and Mr. Bai was Mr. Bai. Even NPCs were unique NPCs with names and surnames who were always different. But now... the world Li Fan knew had suddenly changed. Every NPC might have countless replicas behind them. Without him needing to press the "Return to Truth" button, these beings could replace one another. Even if destroyed ten thousand times, as long as the original data was not lost, they would be recreated again. It was originally a single-player world where he believed he was the only player. Now, it had become an online game played by countless players. This made Li Fan feel an uncontrollable nausea. The more he thought about it, the more he felt dizzy. Everything in the world seemed to transform into distorted, swirling lines of various colors, mixed with the whispers of unknown evil gods, gradually eroding Li Fan's will. Even with the fortification of the Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation, his Dao heart could not remain stable and unwavering. Li Fan's divine soul violently shook, disintegrating like roots spreading in water.

"Ugh... ugh..."

His form became ethereal, yet Li Fan, like a helpless mortal, doubled over and vomited. This sudden change completely bewildered Sun Luyao. He had no idea why this mysterious and powerful senior, while thinking, had suddenly become this way.

"Ugh..."

Li Fan vomited more violently. What he expelled were not physical impurities, but his own essence, spirit, and vigor.

"Senior..."

This scene instilled a deep fear in Sun Luyao's heart, as if something terrible was about to happen.

"Ugh..."

Li Fan's breathing gradually subsided. "Cough, cough..." It transformed into soft coughs, and then into low, almost maniacal laughter. Accompanying the sinister laughter were Li Fan's murmurs.

"Senior... what are you saying?" Sun Luyao's heart pounded, and he couldn't help but ask.

"Heheheh..."

"Heheheheh..."

"Heheheheheh..."

"So I say, it's good that you all died!"

"If you all died and only I remained, that would be the perfect situation."

Like the whispers of demons from the deepest abyss, Li Fan's divine senses locked onto Sun Luyao amidst his murmuring. Although these words seemed nonsensical to Sun Luyao, they sent a chilling shiver down his spine. Just as he was about to say something else, Sun Luyao was horrified to discover that the core source of the formation within him had inexplicably erupted. It was as if he was about to be destroyed in a chaotic internal conflict. After the initial panic and bewilderment, Sun Luyao finally reacted. He looked at Li Fan with disbelief, "Senior, why?" Li Fan's gaze was now completely different from what he had seen before. It was one of true indifference. In his eyes, Li Fan was as if he didn't exist at all. Inside the Boundless Mirror, his body, which had just completed its shattered reconstruction, was disintegrating piece by piece. And Sun Luyao, as the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, was powerless to stop it. Realizing his impending demise, and experiencing the taste of death once again after many years, Sun Luyao completely lost his composure. He desperately tried every method to save his life.

"Senior, spare me! I am your most loyal slave, I will do whatever you want!"

"Senior, I was wrong! I shouldn't have had ulterior motives, I deserve to die!"

"Senior, spare me! I'm still useful! The ruins of the Xuanhuang Realm's Primary Protective Great Formation haven't been fully explored yet, I still have value!"

Sun Luyao's transmissions of his dying thoughts became faster and faster, eventually devolving into weeping and wailing.

"Senior, please let me live a little longer! Let me..."

*Poof.*

Like a cockroach easily crushed to death, Sun Luyao's life abruptly ended. The ancient mirror surface, which had once glowed with spiritual luster, suddenly dimmed. It fell powerlessly.

"Still so noisy even when facing death, then you should simply never appear again..." Li Fan's eyeballs were pitch black, and after a slight turn, he muttered maniacally. With a simple sentence, he condemned Sun Luyao to death. Not in this lifetime, but for all eternity, in every subsequent life. As long as he existed, Sun Luyao would forever be erased from the main narrative. Without Sun Luyao, there were Sun Lufei, Sun Luchang. It was merely a change of codename, making no difference to Li Fan. Sun Luyao, who died with his eyes wide open in his final moments, likely never imagined that he had been fine moments ago, assisting his senior in exploring and analyzing the ancient Xuanhuang Realm's Primary Protective Great Formation, only to be eternally erased from existence the next moment. And the root cause of all this was simply because he had witnessed Li Fan's unsightly state during a moment of psychological breakdown. Perhaps "psychological breakdown" is not the most appropriate term. Ever since he acquired Return to Truth and personally experienced the supreme power of restarting everything, there was almost nothing that could truly inflict damage on Li Fan's psyche. Even the so-called True Immortals, or even nameless True Immortals, were no different. Yes, the power of True Immortals could indeed pose a threat to his life. But that only affected the method, preventing Return to Truth from occurring, not affecting Return to Truth itself. Li Fan originally believed that as long as the supreme authority of the "Return to Truth" button remained unshaken, his mental defenses would remain impregnable and would not be truly affected. Everything was dismissed with the phrase, "It's just Return to Truth." But today, Li Fan encountered something that could truly harm him. Because his uniqueness had been challenged. Although this uniqueness, in reality, did not originally exist for him; it was bestowed by Return to Truth. Yet, he still found it unbearable. After a brief struggle and persistence, he finally broke down. But Li Fan, the Grand Tutor who had experienced countless cycles of reincarnation and survived a thousand calamities, was indeed worthy of his reputation. He quickly completed self-regulation after a short period of breakdown. Yes, those True Immortals could do the same to mortals as Li Fan did to mortals. But they were all dead! They were all dead! In this world, in the end, he was the only player left. Realizing this, Li Fan slowly returned to normal. As for the unlucky Sun Luyao... and the partially explored Primary Xuanhuang Realm Protective Great Formation... they would be dealt with in the next life. To Li Fan, these were trivial matters.

Chapter 1271

After casually eliminating Sun Luyuan, Li Fan's divine sense remained still in the mysterious space, his expression grim as he pondered.

"Return to Truth, Return to Truth, Return to Truth..." he chanted inwardly.

The surrounding scenery blurred and dimmed. In a flash, the light returned.

"When truth becomes falsehood, falsehood becomes truth."

Seven large characters, emitting a calm, seemingly eternal radiance, appeared before Li Fan. This was the phrase that always surfaced whenever he activated [Return to Truth]. After hundreds of cycles, he was more than familiar with it. However, at this moment, in Li Fan's eyes, who had discovered the deeply hidden secret of the Xuanhuang Realm's original protective formation, these seven words held an entirely different meaning.

"Falsehood becomes truth, falsehood becomes truth..." It was as if he had reverted to the Grand Tutor Li who once held absolute power in the imperial court. When the very foundation of the world's reality was shaken and trembling precariously.

After a long while, Li Fan let out a chilling, low chuckle. Each restart, fueled by the Xuanhuang Realm, the Abyssal Sea, and the infinite variables born beyond the star sea, had nourished him. Undeniably, the tip of the iceberg revealed by the original protective formation had shown Li Fan a potential path.

"Truth and falsehood, falsehood and truth." Regardless of whether he had truly fallen into such a predicament, Li Fan was immensely fortunate that the "restart" button, the unchanging constant amidst infinite variables, had always remained in his grasp. It was a chilling and unacceptable thought.

[Return to Truth] might have transcended the arrangements the Immortal Realm had made for the lower realms, or it could be just one component of a scheme left behind by the Immortal Realm. When the boundary between reality and illusion could no longer be distinguished or verified, the only course of action was to tightly grasp the unmoving anchor. Therefore, to unravel the mystery's answer required nothing different from what Li Fan had tirelessly pursued before: longevity and freedom.

"Who is real, and who is false?" But now, he considered that the external variables beyond the The Great Barrier might have been deliberately displayed to this reassembled world after Return to Truth. The truth was difficult to ascertain. But…

"I am the only truth!" For the current Li Fan, this was an unprovable existence, even though he had once attempted to guide the variables beyond the Abyssal Sea to determine the specific scope of Return to Truth's influence.

"Yes, none of this matters. As long as I control the sole button, I am the truth!" The madness in Li Fan's eyes gradually receded, and his eyes, once pitch black, slowly regained their lucidity, aiming for transcendence. If he discovered any existence that could contend with him for the button, he would simply kill them. When he found the ultimate answer, it would naturally reveal itself.

Now, standing in his way, besides the Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, was one more entity. A being that posed an even greater threat, an unknown entity that could not be ignored and urgently needed to be dealt with. This was the mysterious individual who had stolen the Nine-Star Red Pearl, one of the core components of the Xuanhuang Realm's original protective formation.

"The Nine-Star Red Pearl should contain information about the characteristics of all beings in the Xuanhuang Realm before the protective formation was destroyed. With the Red Pearl in hand, it shouldn't be difficult to deduce the same conclusions I have."

"Given such a vast difference in power, the wise course of action when lacking a suitable countermeasure is to hide."

"Alternatively, once they determined that the Immortal Realm was truly destroyed, with divine artifacts in hand, they might develop unprecedented ambitions and secretly make other arrangements." Li Fan's gaze swept over the empty formation core. "Perhaps I can glean some clues from the other core components of the original formation." However, with the Boundless Mirror Spirit destroyed, he was unable to continue his investigation. He could only wait for the next life. Li Fan's divine sense shook his head slightly, transforming into a black streak and leaving the underground.

...

Sun family's secret chamber.

A surge of inexpressible sorrow suddenly welled up in Sun Luyuan's heart, and tears unconsciously streamed down his face. He rushed back from outside with incredible speed and burst into the underground chamber. Seeing the familiar Boundless Mirror floating quietly before him, he breathed a sigh of relief.

"Little brother?" Sun Luyuan called out softly.

Sun Luyuan's figure immediately emerged from the Boundless Mirror. "Brother, you were looking for me?"

"What's wrong?" Sun Luyuan asked with some curiosity.

Sun Luyuan's spirit suddenly flickered. For some reason, though the scene before him was identical to his memories, it still felt profoundly alien. Sun Luyuan stared for a long time. After a pause, he said blankly, "It's nothing. Perhaps I've been too tired lately and am being overly suspicious."

Sun Luyuan's eyes showed concern. "Brother, you need to take care of yourself. The future of the Sun family still depends on you."

Sun Luyuan smiled. After some meticulous advice, he left the underground secret chamber. What Sun Luyuan didn't know was that Sun Luyuan did not, as he always had before, watch the direction his elder brother's back disappeared and see him off. Instead, the expression on his face instantly vanished, and he disappeared into the Boundless Mirror without a trace of fondness.

The moment the true Sun Luyuan died, the wisp of his divine sense that remained also lost its source. It was integrated into the fake Boundless Mirror, becoming an entity that could only respond mechanically. Although the mechanical responses were slightly lifelike, it was ultimately not a true life. Not the real Sun Luyuan.

Not long after, Li Fan's divine sense returned with the empty shell of the Boundless Mirror. "Without its artifact spirit, I'll create one myself." Li Fan summoned the trace of residual divine sense left by Sun Luyuan, observed it carefully, and coldly decided, "This trace of divine sense contains all of Sun Luyuan's memories from before his death. It embodies his personality and way of thinking. Theoretically, it's entirely possible to 'resurrect' him."

"Although I don't have treasures like the Indeterminate Bronze Ring or the Nine-Star Red Pearl at hand," he continued, "I don't need to consider a physical body. It's merely a true reproduction of a divine sense, making the practical operation much easier." Recalling the intricate details of the formation, with the continuous deductions from the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, a simplified portion of the original protective formation gradually emerged.

"Simulated, Hundred Forms of Living Beings." "This name isn't bad." Li Fan named the formation following the naming conventions of the three Immortal-grade formations he had mastered. Then, he attempted to "create" and "resurrect" Sun Luyuan. As a precaution, Li Fan first divided Sun Luyuan's residual divine sense into multiple parts for safekeeping. Afterward, he injected one of them into the simplified simulated formation.

An incredibly profound aura gradually emanated from the formation. As the formation slowly operated, Sun Luyuan's figure reappeared within a radiant white light. His eyes held a touch more liveliness, and his interactions with Li Fan were exceptionally smooth. In just a few breaths, their divine senses had communicated tens of millions of times, without a single flaw. However, Li Fan still shook his head slightly, deemed it unsatisfactory, and destroyed it.

"It's too real. So much so that it feels a bit fake."

Chapter 1272: Simulated Dharma Deduction Jade

Copies of Sun Luyuan were created one after another, only to be destroyed.

During this process, Li Fan gradually developed his own unique understanding of "Creation."

"Senior..."

Just as the copied divine sense of Sun Luyuan was about to be completely depleted, a timid yet slightly greedy voice once again echoed in the underground secret chamber of the Sun family.

It was almost identical to Sun Luyuan's own speech and behavior.

Even Li Fan, the creator, could barely distinguish the difference.

But it was merely an appearance.

Li Fan was keenly aware.

The newly born Sun Luyuan acted entirely according to the predefined responses set by Li Fan, without any independent thought process.

It was far from true life.

Moreover, this created consciousness had not been recognized by the Immortal Artifact, the Boundless Mirror.

"Organize the data of existing Immortal-grade Great Formations, deduce the connections between them, and their common foundational array units."

Thinking of this, Li Fan's thoughts paused slightly, and he looked at Dharma Deduction Jade, who was listlessly sprawled on the long table.

"However, to truly create life from nothing, other means are required." After confirming this, Li Fan shook his head with some regret.

Before this, although Li Fan possessed the wondrous artifact, the End Dissolution Disc, fully unleashing its potential required not only amplification from the Dao-Melting Stone but also a significant portion of Li Fan's own energy and personal supervision.

"Speaking of which, this little thing's situation is quite similar to mine before."

"This is the overwhelming advantage of methodology from the Immortal Realm."

The End Dissolution Disc remained completely still for a moment, then resumed its rapid operation.

Just when he was feeling sleepy, an excellent opportunity presented itself. Within days, Li Fan received a perfect chance.

Li Fan issued a series of commands.

Li Fan did not mind.

While Li Fan was contemplating, the artificial personality of the End Dissolution Disc had been officially formed.

"In a sense, this is a different kind of 'Array Forging' technique."

If a mechanized simulated personality were available, Li Fan would be able to free up some energy.

As for what the real Gao Yuan was up to now...

"Master, how may I serve you?" Gao Yuan said respectfully.

His appearance was that of the cultivator Li Fan found most convenient to order around during his hundred cycles of reincarnation: Gao Yuan.

"It requires almost no cost to significantly increase the artifact's... power is debatable. It will certainly be more convenient, that's for sure. And it can be customized and trained according to one's needs."

Compared to before, it was much more orderly.

The pressure in his mind vanished, and the efficiency of the End Dissolution Disc's deduction increased instead of decreasing.

"Using this as a basis, unified improvement and deduction of the Xuanhuang Realm's formations will be carried out. All results need to be recorded and preserved."

However, this did not mean Li Fan gained nothing.

"At the same time, try to find a possible method for self-advancement..."

"Previously, I was like someone holding a firearm but only knowing how to wield it for chopping."

For example, the proportion of End Dissolution Disc's computing power occupied by various tasks, and the estimated remaining time for completion.

"Simulating and creating diverse life forms is merely creating different temperaments for beings."

Li Fan could see the simulated personality's feedback, concretized in data.

A consciousness, or rather, a virtual personality created by the simulated formation, was slowly taking shape.

"And this is all a harvest from my experiences and insights from exploring Immortal Realm formations in the field..."

Li Fan's setting for it was very simple.

"Much better than before."

Within Li Fan's sea of consciousness, inside the End Dissolution Disc.

In other words, in the Boundless Mirror's perception, they were entirely different existences.

And when a task had results, the simulated personality would automatically organize the findings, waiting for Li Fan's review.

"However, the security here is very strict, and I haven't found a way to contact her alone yet."

Li Fan glanced imperceptibly at Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye, the two Dao Integration cultivators guarding the area, his mind pondering his plan.

"Looking further ahead, it's not just the End Dissolution Disc. Even any wondrous artifact or magic artifact can be operated this way."

He looked pleasing, so Li Fan set the simulated personality in his image.

"In fact, this is almost equivalent to the legendary 'Artifact Spirit Empowerment,' just achieved through a clever trick, resulting in slightly weaker performance."

The primary objective was to increase the efficiency of formation deduction and analysis, tirelessly and without interruption.

Li Fan had once served as the acting Island Master of Myriad Immortals Island. Gao Yuan's ability to observe people's expressions and his conscientiousness had left a good impression on Li Fan.

"May I request Dharma Deduction Jade to perform Dharma Deduction?"

"Isn't this a benefit we only receive once after guarding for a hundred years? How can it be arranged now?"

Li Fan, looking at Zhao Shihuan, the elder of the Law Enforcement Hall before him, asked with confusion.

Zhao Shihuan smiled: "Your Sun family has contributed to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. After a joint decision by Chief Xu and all members of the Elder Council of the Law Enforcement Hall, your guarding period will be reduced from three hundred years to two hundred years."

"But the corresponding benefits and merits will not be reduced. Rest assured about this."

Li Fan then remembered the promise Sun Luyuan had made when he came to visit earlier.

"It seems Xuanyuan Xuan didn't trick him this time."

Zhao Shihuan continued: "After all, it happened so suddenly. If Brother Sun feels unprepared, you can also save this Dharma Approaching opportunity and use it later."

"I am here to inform you of this matter first."

Compared to Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye, Zhao Shihuan's attitude towards Li Fan was noticeably more polite. After all, he had been personally instructed by the Chief Elder, and his future status in the Law Enforcement Hall would not be low. Building a good relationship in advance was only natural.

"Then thank you, Elder Zhao..." Li Fan pondered for a moment, then said in a deep voice, "I have recently had some insights, so I plan to use this Dharma Deduction opportunity directly."

Zhao Shihuan nodded.

Amidst the envious gazes of the other two guards, Li Fan left his guarding post and drifted in front of the Dharma Deduction Jade.

Dharma Deduction Jade glared at the great enemy who often exploited and rushed her, her cheeks puffing out in anger.

"I'm already working hard enough, why do I still have to..." Dharma Deduction Jade was about to complain, but when she met Li Fan's serious gaze, the words retreated.

It seemed that Li Fan's previous "training" of Dharma Deduction Jade had had some effect.

However, Dharma Deduction Jade still appeared defiant, her eyes wide open, staring intently at Li Fan.

Seeing this, the other beings within the Dharma Deduction space couldn't help but chuckle.

For a moment, the air was filled with a joyful atmosphere.

After all, they were all on the same side, so there was no need for excessive caution. The other guards were all watching with the attitude of enjoying a good show.

"Alright, alright, I'm scared of you. Quickly state your requirements," said Dharma Deduction Jade.

Dharma Deduction Jade slumped onto the long table wearily, saying as if resigned to her fate.

Li Fan skillfully took the white paper that flew over, and characters quickly appeared on it.

When the last character appeared, Li Fan did not hesitate at all.

With a thought, the white paper turned into a stream of light and flew to Dharma Deduction Jade's front.

The entire movement was seamless, as if practiced countless times.

Initially, Dharma Deduction Jade still appeared listless, but soon, as if she had discovered something, her spirit was invigorated.

She slammed her chubby little hand on the table and mumbled, "What is all this nonsense, it's so difficult!"

Under her blow, the characters on the table instantly scattered. "Wait a moment," Dharma Deduction Jade said to Li Fan.

Next, the large character light sphere above her head began to spin rapidly, as if she were desperately deducing.

Meanwhile, Li Fan took the opportunity to chat with Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye, the two Dao Integration cultivators.

"Although my guarding period has been reduced by a hundred years, I don't know why, but I vaguely feel that this is not necessarily a good thing. I even feel a sense of reluctance when I think about leaving in the future," Li Fan said with a hint of confusion.

Zhang Xu smiled: "I know why. Our Zhang family also felt a sense of gain and loss when leaving after guarding. It's inevitable to develop a sense of dependence when staying in the same place for too long. Even we, at our Dao Integration cultivation level, are no exception."

Hua Yueye also agreed: "Yes. After several hundred years, the outside world has changed so much that it's somewhat daunting to reconnect..."

The three chatted amicably, but they occasionally glanced at Dharma Deduction Jade.

This time, it seemed to be as Dharma Deduction Jade complained, the target formation for deduction was a bit difficult.

The time spent far exceeded that required for ordinary Dao Integration formations.

"It seems Brother Sun has gained quite a lot this time," Zhang Xu said with some envy.

Li Fan did not deny it: "My beloved wife has fallen, and I am a father. Too many things have happened recently..."

After exceeding the predetermined time by half, Dharma Deduction Jade finally completed the formation deduction.

"Alright, take it."

Perhaps due to exhaustion, Dharma Deduction Jade's attitude had improved significantly, no longer as unpleasant as before.

Li Fan nodded, took the white paper, and memorized its contents firmly in his heart.

Then, he cupped his hands and, with a calm expression, returned to his guarding post.

"According to regulations, you can rest for two hours," Zhang Xu said.

"I see she's a bit tired, how about adding another hour? After all, it was a last-minute decision to increase the deduction for my sake," Li Fan suggested.

Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye exchanged glances and nodded in agreement.

Within the scope of their authority, it was not impossible to grant a colleague a favor.

"I didn't expect you to be so kind," Dharma Deduction Jade muttered softly.

Without offering any thanks, she collapsed onto the long table and fell asleep with loud snores.

Li Fan's eyes were calm as he pondered the cultivation technique Dharma Deduction Jade had deduced in his mind.

"Simulated Beings Technique."

The effect of the cultivation technique was essentially the same as the "Simulated, Diverse Life Forms" Great Formation.

In fact, due to being converted into a cultivation technique, its efficacy was slightly weaker.

But Li Fan's purpose was not the cultivation technique itself.

He had merely used this opportunity to pass on the method of creating simulated personalities to Dharma Deduction Jade, under the supervision of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Dharma Deduction Jade was not entirely foolish either.

Realizing that this method could be of great use to her, she actively assisted Li Fan's clandestine actions by covering for him.

Three hours later, Zhang Xu appeared beside Dharma Deduction Jade on time, conjuring a gong and waking the little萝莉.

Afterward, Dharma Deduction Jade seemed to be immersed in endless Dharma Deduction work again.

However, in reality, some changes were quietly taking place.

Within Dharma Deduction Jade's light sphere, a figure was slowly forming.

The little萝莉 held her head in her hands, looking excitedly ahead.

"Good, good, good, I didn't expect this method to actually work."

"I tried splitting off another version of myself to help me work before, but it was completely useless."

"Now I'm saved..."

Dharma Deduction Jade's eyes widened, full of anticipation.

Shortly thereafter, the simulated personality officially appeared.

"Ah!!!!!"

Dharma Deduction Jade's scream echoed throughout the interior of the light sphere.

"How could it be you!"

Dharma Deduction Jade instinctively recoiled far from the simulated personality.

This was because...

For some reason, although it was created with the most handsome face imaginable from her mind.

The final product that appeared before her was actually Li Fan's appearance, the actual appearance of Sun Ang!

"Master, is there anything I can do for you?" The simulated personality, resembling Li Fan, showed no reaction to Dharma Deduction Jade's exaggerated reaction and asked mechanically and respectfully.

"Huh?"

Dharma Deduction Jade then gathered her courage and approached to test it.

Upon discovering that the simulated personality was very obedient and would do whatever she asked, her boldness instantly returned.

She unceremoniously commanded: "Help me deduce this cultivation technique!"

"Never stop!"

"I've already accumulated about ten years' worth of stock, you need to save up at least fifty years for me!"

The little萝莉 said, her eyes sparkling, already envisioning a beautiful future.

"Ten years of stock..."

"What does that mean?"

Just then, Li Fan's voice, tinged with curiosity, suddenly sounded.

This caused Dharma Deduction Jade's expression to freeze.

"You!" She pointed her chubby little finger at the simulated personality, her face full of disbelief.

"How is this possible? How can you have sentience? You're just a mechanized version of me..."

"It's just a trivial shortcut," Li Fan said, making a very polite gesture to explain.

"You don't need to worry. Simulated personalities indeed do not have their own thoughts. The reason for this now is that I am temporarily taking over the personality to facilitate communication with you," Li Fan said slowly.

"What do you want to do?" Dharma Deduction Jade's large eyes seemed to glisten with tears, putting on a pitiable act.

"I warn you, don't mess around! I'll shout for help!"

Li Fan was unfazed by Dharma Deduction Jade's clumsy acting.

He simply steered the conversation back to the "ten years of stock."

"Ah! I understand. Actually, each time you complete a cultivation technique deduction, it takes slightly less time than you appear to be taking."

"Every time you complete a deduction task, a little spare time is saved. This is your stock."

...

As Li Fan's words continued, Dharma Deduction Jade's face gradually turned pale.

"I can't believe I accumulated so much without realizing it."

"A total of fifty years is needed..."

"This has gone beyond mere laziness."

Li Fan stared directly at Dharma Deduction Jade.

"What exactly do you want to do?"

Chapter 1273

"Hahaha…"

A flicker of panic flashed in the eyes of Dharma Deduction, who thought of brushing it off.

"Don't think you can get away with it. Tell me honestly. Otherwise, I'll call for help! Discovering Dharma Deduction plotting something suspicious, this would surely be a great merit! Perhaps I could even leave here ahead of time." Li Fan threatened with a half-smile.

"Plotting what!" Dharma Deduction retorted indignantly, glaring at Li Fan.

But Li Fan's true self, outside the character light sphere, suddenly spoke: "That…"

The watchful Dao Integration cultivator Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye instantly shifted their attention.

Little Lolita Dharma Deduction immediately panicked.

"No! Let's talk it over properly!" She darted forward to the simulated personality, her eyes wide and pleading as she looked at Li Fan.

Meanwhile, within Dharma Deduction's space, Li Fan's true self paused slightly, then continued, "Two fellow cultivators, I'd like to ask. Regarding cultivation techniques deduced by Dharma Deduction, such as this one, can they be passed on to others? I know the Alliance's laws forbid external transmission. But…"

Dharma Deduction's large eyes darted around, and she coughed lightly, "I haven't tried it yet, how effective is this thing? How about you let me first…"

Li Fan simply smiled and retorted, "If I were loyal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, why would I use the opportunity of requesting you to deduce something to pass the method of simulated personalities to you?"

"Whoosh whoosh…"

"Master, is there anything I can do for you?" The simulated personality asked professionally.

"I know, I must find a way to change all of this!" A flicker of determination suddenly flashed in the little lolita's eyes.

Dharma Deduction pulled at her hair, a look of worry on her face.

"I can't deduce it all! It's simply impossible to deduce it all!"

But Li Fan merely displayed his half-smiling expression again, causing Dharma Deduction to chicken out once more.

"Whoosh…"

As Dharma Deduction watched these jade slips appear, a sense of joy from receiving something for nothing surged in her heart, making her giggle uncontrollably.

"So now that you have this simulated personality helping you, how long will it take you to achieve your goal?"

"After so many years, there's still a long way to go to achieve the goal! I feel like I'm reaching my limit!"

With a clap of two chubby little hands, the scene within the character light sphere abruptly changed.

Zhang Xu chuckled and said, "Fellow Daoist Sun, are you perhaps trying to obtain a cultivation technique for your newborn son? Openly speaking, this is not allowed. However, those who are in charge of supervision are all from our Law Enforcement Hall. So…"

Dharma Deduction waved her large hand, giving the order for it to completely take over the deduction work.

Seven days passed in a flash.

Li Fan's voice suddenly resounded again.

Endless white jade bookshelves, reaching to the heavens, held dense rows of different jade slips.

"Back then, the Heavenly Venerate ordered me to exhaust all the methods in the world."

The moment the simulated personality took over, the deduction progress of the character light sphere was interrupted.

Zhang Xu gave a knowing glance.

"Hmph. This humble grandma naturally has her own ingenious plans!" Dharma Deduction placed her hands on her hips, a look of smugness on her face.

"In short, as long as you give me fifty years of free time, I can find a way to completely escape this suffering! At that time, I will definitely have a good sleep."

"Tell me. What exactly do you want to do?" The simulated personality extended its right hand, its finger poised to flick Dharma Deduction's head.

Li Fan looked closely and saw the little lolita Dharma Deduction lying spread-eagle, floating in the air without any grace, sleeping soundly.

Li Fan did not press further, but repeated the number: "Fifty years."

"You scoundrel!" Dharma Deduction's expression changed again, attempting to appear ferocious.

"Alright, I'll tell you. But you have to promise me first that you absolutely won't report me to the Myriad Immortals Alliance!" Dharma Deduction put away her extra expressions and said very seriously.

Dharma Deduction tilted her head and pondered, knowing Li Fan's words were reasonable.

Li Fan cupped his fists in a gesture of understanding.

Dharma Deduction instinctively dodged, but quickly realized that the other party was merely a simulated body without a physical form, and became enraged.

After a flicker of faint light, it returned to its previous mechanical appearance.

The giant character light sphere continuously rotated, and jade slips of cultivation techniques took shape, appearing on the white jade bookshelves.

Some, looking somewhat bewildered, asked, "How many years have passed already?"

Each Jade Slip contained a cultivation technique.

And within the character light sphere, Dharma Deduction, hearing the conversation of the three guarding Dao Integration cultivators, finally breathed a sigh of relief.

"I was too young back then, thinking that with my abilities, it would be a trivial matter. So I happily agreed. Alas, looking back now, I was truly foolish!" Dharma Deduction sighed with an air of aged wisdom.

"Oh? How will it change?" Li Fan surveyed the surrounding cultivation techniques with interest.

In the end, realizing she was no match for Li Fan, Dharma Deduction gave in.

"Mmm…" After Li Fan awakened her, the little lolita still rubbed her eyes vigorously.

Li Fan immediately agreed.

"Hmm? Only seven days!"

Not long after, when Dharma Deduction saw the time, she immediately woke up.

"That was a great sleep." She smacked her lips, looking somewhat reluctant.

"Why are you here again?" She then looked at Li Fan, saying with great disdain.

Li Fan remained silent, simply watching her.

Dharma Deduction immediately caved, "Alright, let me see. Hmm, it's only a little slower than my own full-power deduction."

"Barely the same as the deduction speed I showed among those people in the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

Li Fan nodded slightly, "In other words, if another forty years pass, you will successfully break free?"

Dharma Deduction seemed inexplicably confused, "Break free? What freedom?"

"I wanted to escape before because I didn't want to work. But now that I have such good stuff helping me work for free, why should I run away? Can't I rest every day?"

Dharma Deduction looked at Li Fan with disdain.

"Oh?"

"Then if I continue to occupy the simulated personality, how will you respond?" Li Fan asked lightly.

"Hmph hmph, that won't stop me." Dharma Deduction's figure abruptly retreated, and the surrounding scene returned to how it was before.

"Change!" She pointed at a spot next to Li Fan from afar.

As light converged, another figure slowly took shape.

It was, astonishingly, another simulated personality!

"A person cannot use two minds! You've occupied one, do you think you can occupy a second one!"

"Work for me!" Dharma Deduction placed one hand on her hip and the other triumphantly pointed at the second simulated personality, issuing orders.

"And how do you know I can't?"

Unexpectedly, this second simulated personality actually spoke with Li Fan's voice.

It mocked Dharma Deduction.

The expression on Dharma Deduction's face instantly froze.

"Fine, fine, fine! I'd like to see exactly how many minds you can split!"

"Change! Change! Change! Change!…"

Little Lolita Dharma Deduction continuously pointed in the air, one after another simulated personality phantom being generated.

One hundred, five hundred, one thousand…

Faces of Li Fan occupied the entire space within the character light sphere.

They mocked in unison.

"Not enough."

"Is this all you have?" "You're only capable of this?"

"Continue."

…

The simulated personalities that had differentiated, under Li Fan's scornful words, numbered close to ten thousand.

Sweat had begun to form on the little lolita's forehead.

She temporarily stopped her actions, her large eyes staring at the dense multitude of Li Fans before her, filled with disbelief.

"You're not human?"

"What in the world are you?"

There was no insult intended, but in Dharma Deduction's understanding, it was indeed not something an ordinary cultivator could achieve.

Occupying a simulated personality did not merely require splitting off a strand of divine sense.

It was more akin to splitting one's divine soul in half and using one of them to occupy it.

Being able to control so many simulated personalities simultaneously was equivalent to dismembering one's divine soul into pieces, yet still remaining unaffected.

She herself relied on the ability of "Heavenly Wonders" to achieve this.

And that person…

A sense of vigilance began to stir in Dharma Deduction's heart.

"Do you want more?"

Tens of thousands of Li Fan's faces smiled simultaneously.

"Even if there were another hundred thousand, I could still endure it," Li Fan said with a calm demeanor.

The little lolita carefully observed Li Fan's true self within Dharma Deduction's guarded space.

He indeed appeared to be under no pressure, eyes closed in contemplation, his demeanor serene.

Dharma Deduction couldn't help but hesitate.

It wasn't that ten thousand had already reached her limit.

It was just a concern that if the two continued to contend, it might attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

After all, with tens of thousands of simulated personalities, it would inevitably place a burden on her normal deduction operations.

And Dharma Deduction's deduction performance was constantly monitored by the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

After some thought, Dharma Deduction finally compromised in resignation.

"Alright! I admit you're a bit formidable!"

The little lolita, one by one, reabsorbed the surrounding simulated personalities.

Only the first one remained.

With a satisfied burp, Dharma Deduction then said, "Speak. What exactly do you want? I can see now that you definitely have ill intentions."

Li Fan shook his head, "You misunderstand me."

"I came here precisely to help you regain your freedom."

Dharma Deduction was dismissive, "Freedom? What's so good about freedom? Besides, I've been helping the Dharma-Preachers for so many years, if I give up halfway, wouldn't that be too regrettable!"

"All I've ever wanted is to be lazy," Dharma Deduction reiterated.

"What benefits did the Dharma-Preachers promise you?" Li Fan asked.

"Hmph hmph…" Dharma Deduction refused to answer the question.

"Perhaps I can also help you. And without requiring you to pay any price," Li Fan said kindly.

Dharma Deduction looked disbelieving, "Is there such a good thing?"

"I simply cannot stand the Dharma-Preachers oppressing others," Li Fan said.

Dharma Deduction's eyes brightened, then she looked as if she suddenly understood, "I know! You have a grudge against the Dharma-Preachers! That's why you've come to me, wanting to undermine their foundation!"

Li Fan did not deny it, "You can say that too."

Upon hearing this, Dharma Deduction actually began to think seriously.

"Hmm, the Dharma-Preachers said they could help me find my home. Can you?" Dharma Deduction probed tentatively.

"Home?" Li Fan's eyes flickered, "Tell me more details."

"Alright." Dharma Deduction moved closer and sat down not far from Li Fan.

Resting her chin in her hands, she sank into memories, "Before I was found by the Dharma-Preachers and became Dharma Deduction, although I was just an ordinary little girl, I vaguely had memories of a past life."

"The scenes in those memories are my true homeland."

Dharma Deduction felt Li Fan's gaze on her and said somewhat helplessly, "I already said vaguely. I can't remember what it looked like specifically, but as long as I see it with my own eyes, I'm sure I can distinguish true from false."

"I have a premonition that finding information about my homeland is extremely important to me…"

Hearing this, Li Fan frowned slightly.

Just as he was about to speak, Dharma Deduction, as if sensing what he was about to say, rolled her eyes at Li Fan, "I'm not stupid. How could I be fooled by just one empty promise from the Dharma-Preachers to work for so many years."

"They did show me some images of my homeland back then. But I can't show them to you…"

Dharma Deduction gestured briefly.

Li Fan nodded, "I once heard that 'Heavenly Wonders' are either laws of a realm or divine artifacts from the Upper Realm that have taken form. Could your homeland perhaps be the Immortal Realm?"

Dharma Deduction's expression turned somewhat dejected, "Who knows. But I don't wish for me to come from some Immortal Realm. Otherwise, I won't have any hope of going home."

"By the way, you said you could help me?" Dharma Deduction asked.

Li Fan shook his head, "Without understanding the specific origin of your homeland, I cannot draw a conclusion."

Dharma Deduction couldn't help but feel somewhat surprised, "I thought you would immediately guarantee it and try to trick me."

"It seems you're not entirely bad," the little lolita re-examined Li Fan.

Li Fan gave a wry smile, "However, give me some time, and I will let you distinguish all the possible scenarios one by one."

"Really…" Dharma Deduction became doubtful.

"By the way, can you tell me about your fifty-year plan now?" Li Fan asked, not answering directly.

After considering for a moment, Dharma Deduction whispered, "It's nothing much, really. Just to sleep well and then grow up a bit."

"After growing up, I'll become stronger. Dealing with these tasks will be even easier."

"What takes ten years now, will probably take less than a year then."

A flicker of longing flashed in Dharma Deduction's eyes.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan's eyes gradually narrowed.

"You only need to sleep for fifty years? No other conditions?"

"What do you mean, 'just sleep for fifty years'? Don't make it sound so easy," Dharma Deduction said with some displeasure.

Then she nodded in admission, "That's right. Actually, if I hadn't always lacked time for proper rest, I would have already felt myself growing a little."

"After all, deduction for me is equivalent to cultivation for you cultivators."

"If I've cultivated for so long without any progress, wouldn't that make me a big fool?" Dharma Deduction said righteously.

Li Fan remained silent, but he had already guessed the meaning of her so-called growth from her words.

Similar to the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, it was an sublimation, a breakthrough.

Reaching the limit of mortals.

Even…

If Dharma Deduction's origin was a divine artifact from the Upper Realm, then recovering her former divine artifact power was not impossible.

Chapter 1274: The Soul of Heaven and Earth

“Since I cannot let the Myriad Immortals Alliance discover my plan, I can only steal a little time each instance. Originally, it would have taken a long time to accumulate enough, but now…”

Dharma Deduction looked at Li Fan and said, "Your method has been a great help!"

Li Fan, however, replied, "Forty years is still too long. Moreover, to avoid revealing any flaws, while you are asleep, you must also divert a small portion of your strength to deal with the supervision of the Law Enforcement Hall. Is there any way to shorten the required time further?"

"You genuinely want to help me?" Dharma Deduction seemed a bit shocked by this.

However, seeing Li Fan's extremely serious expression, Dharma Deduction thought for a moment, then flew to his side, whispered in his ear, "As I said earlier, deducing cultivation techniques is equivalent to cultivation for me. The reason I needed to sleep for fifty years to grow was because I needed to sort and absorb the gains from my cultivation. If there's a way to skip this step, I might only need five years of rest… No, ten years should be enough!"

"I vaguely remember there exists a treasure called the 'Immortal Sound Jade Dew.' If I could consume some more…"

Dharma Deduction's mouth even showed a hint of drooling.

"Immortal Sound Jade Dew?" Li Fan frowned slightly upon hearing this.

"Are you sure this is something from the Xuanhuang Realm?"

Li Fan had gone through a hundred lifetimes and possessed the Origin of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, holding the Genesis Stone Slab. It could be said that there was almost no heavenly material or earthly treasure within the fantasy realms that he was unaware of.

But this Immortal Sound Jade Dew was indeed the first time he had heard of it.

"Uh… I don't know." Dharma Deduction was stunned when Li Fan said this.

"But I can guarantee that the Immortal Sound Jade Dew truly exists in this world," the little loli said with conviction.

Li Fan was silent for a moment before replying, "I will find a way."

Upon hearing this, Dharma Deduction's eyes widened instantly, and she exclaimed, "You truly are a good person!"

Li Fan said, "Aren't you afraid I'm from the Myriad Immortals Alliance and that what I'm saying is just to trick you…"

Dharma Deduction chuckled, "This grandma isn't stupid. You're different from the Dharma-Preachers. Besides, I can tell who has ill intentions and who is sincere!"

Li Fan smiled without refuting.

"Then you should get some good rest. I'll contact you again if I get any news."

The light and shadow twisted, and the simulated persona once again resumed its original form, tirelessly continuing the work that Dharma Deduction should have been doing.
