After observing for a while and confirming that there would be no slip-ups, Dharma Deduction happily struck a large character pose in mid-air and began to slumber soundly.

"The original body of Dharma Deduction, even if not from the Immortal Realm, must surely be from a special cultivation realm with a realm-protecting grand formation, similar to the Xuanhuang Realm."

"With her current abilities, she is of little help to me. But if she could advance further and deduce immortal laws…"

Li Fan had already savored the benefits of overwhelming several generations in the art of formations. If he could achieve the same in cultivation techniques, his future actions would undoubtedly be much more convenient.

Dharma Deduction's senses were partially correct. Indeed, Li Fan currently harbored no ill intentions towards her. He was merely planning to help her break free from the Myriad Immortals Alliance's control. In the process, he would use his escape as an excuse to make Dharma Deduction acknowledge him as her master.

After this life concluded, he should be able to choose to preserve Dharma Deduction.

This way, the Xuanhuang Realm would, for the first time, have two Heavenly Oddities of the same kind.

And with decades more experience in Dharma Deduction, the Dharma Deduction Li Fan retained would likely be the stronger of the two.

According to the law of "the weak perish, the strong survive" that Li Fan had previously discovered, the Dharma Deduction of the Myriad Immortals Alliance would inexplicably disappear. The one in Li Fan's possession would then undergo a sublimation and breakthrough after merging.

A perfect plan.

The prerequisite was successfully making Dharma Deduction acknowledge him as her master.

Before that, indulging her a little was acceptable.

Even if he failed to achieve this goal in this lifetime, with hundreds of years of daily interaction and the secrets he had extracted, it wouldn't be difficult to make Dharma Deduction acknowledge him as her master in the future.

"Of course, the Dissolution Disc and Dharma Deduction are merely tools. To truly achieve enlightenment and find a way to transcend, I must rely on myself."

Li Fan's heart was clear.

Until he found a way to break free from the shackles of the Doctrine Transmitter's cultivation system, he might as well continue on the path ahead. After all, with the advantage of continuous reincarnation, cultivating step-by-step was much easier than creating heaven and earth from nothing.

"After the Azure Nether's Birth Mutation, comes the Soul of Heaven and Earth."

"With my current strength, even if I were to devour hundreds of Heavenly Dao Souls of Heaven and Earth, I might not achieve a qualitative improvement in my power. After all, during the Heavenly Tribulation of the Azure Nether's impending destruction, each of those 'survival mutations' was not necessarily inferior to the Heavenly Dao Souls of Heaven and Earth in this peaceful era."

"In this lifetime, I will use the Sacred Emperor to probe the true strength of the Dharma-Preachers and Medicine Kings. In the next lifetime, by taking this step, I will strive to shorten the gap between us, even achieving parity!"

"Ordinary Souls of Heaven and Earth will definitely not suffice."

Thanks to the close connection between the Sacred Emperor and the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao in this lifetime, Li Fan had learned more secrets of the Heavenly Dao. The Souls of Heaven and Earth were born to fulfill their Heavenly duties and were the manifestations of the Azure Nether's laws.

Scarlet Flame and Black Slaughter were merely Souls of Heaven and Earth with single attributes.

And in extremely special circumstances, the Xuanhuang Realm would spontaneously evolve Souls of Heaven and Earth with **compound attributes**.

Li Fan, through a chance encounter, had given birth to "White Heavenly Dao" with the Sacred Embryo, which fell into this category.

Mr. Bai, as the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, had left an indelible mark on Heaven and Earth even after his death. White Heavenly Dao was a compound Soul of Heaven and Earth of the Azure Nether. Using this mark as a vessel, it was born into the world.

White Heavenly Dao inherited the characteristics of the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate's mark, and also possessed the traits of a Soul of Heaven and Earth. Therefore, it could merge the powers of various Souls of Heaven and Earth with ease, achieving **"Unity of Heaven and Man."**

Under such a state, White Heavenly Dao was undeniably powerful. A single glance from a Doctrine Transmitter could instantly flatten a prefecture, yet White Heavenly Dao could block a Doctrine Transmitter for a moment, its strength evident.

If it were used as a material when ascending to the Dao Integration realm, it would undoubtedly greatly increase one's combat power.

But…

This one alone was not enough.

Li Fan vaguely understood that even if Souls of Heaven and Earth of the same kind might not have the same effect in the new cultivation methods, the Xuanhuang Realm had more than one Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate.

Nor was there only one Heavenly Venerate’s mark.

It was just that Mr. Bai was the last generation of the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerates, and the closest to the current era, making him the easiest to "summon."

"If I could summon all the past Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerates in the form of Souls of Heaven and Earth, and refine them into sustenance for my advancement to Dao Integration…"

A faint glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"Under normal circumstances, the Xuanhuang Realm could barely support one Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate's Soul of Heaven and Earth. The scenario I envision is theoretically impossible."

"But I have the existence of Return to Truth. Each time I reincarnate, I will summon a Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate's Soul of Heaven and Earth and find a way to seal and preserve it. Once all are gathered, I will refine and devour them simultaneously."

The Dao-Melting Stone flowed with light, and future scenes constantly played out in Li Fan's mind.

"It's feasible."

"But it must be done gradually."

"Compared to breaking through in the center of the dark star sea, this method is safer. However, both can be pursued simultaneously."

"Speaking of which, the Sacred Emperor in this lifetime, in a sense, can also be considered half a Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate. If he were to die, I wonder if he would leave a mark in Heaven and Earth?"

…

Just as Li Fan's main body was plotting his future in Dharma Deduction's space, the Faceless Sacred Emperor of Great Qi finally found clues about the possible whereabouts of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law King within the scattered records on the Genesis Stone Slab.

"When the Heavenly Mysteries King was around, the members of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect were shrouded in a mysterious power that affected and distorted the records of the Genesis Stone Slab. But even after the Heavenly Mysteries King disappeared, this obscuring effect did not immediately dissipate. This was one of the reasons why the Myriad Immortal Sects always maintained strict vigilance against the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, fearing their resurgence."

"However, with the passage of time, especially after the Great Tribulation of 'Incompatibility of Laws' descended, this obscuring power seemed to be affected by some influence and eventually faded."

Li Ping arrived outside the ruins of the Purple Firmament Sect.

His gaze pierced through layers of obstruction, reaching beneath the ground.

He saw a figure slumbering there.

"The Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law King, Mo Ru'bin."

The Faceless Sacred Emperor recalled Mo Ru'bin's past deeds before he was persuaded by the Heavenly Mysteries King to join the Heavenly Mysteries Sect.

Mo Ru'bin was the most exceptionally talented disciple in the ancient immortal sect Nine Refinements Observation, hailed as the most gifted in a thousand years.

A peerless genius with the highest potential for ascension.

The cultivation technique of the Nine Refinements Observation was renowned in the ancient Xuanhuang Realm for its unique and peculiar methods. The profound essence of its core technique, "Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul," was said to forge nine reincarnated immortal souls, each from different experiences in the mortal world. Upon reaching the pinnacle of the technique, one would devour these nine immortal souls to condense a supreme immortal soul, shattering the limitations of immortal laws and achieving ascension to immortality.

At that time, Mo Ru'bin had already completed the forging of the first eight immortal souls, with only one step left to successfully forge the final immortal soul.

But just at this critical juncture, he witnessed the scene of Xuan Yuanhong breaking through his heavenly tribulation and ascending.

His Dao heart was greatly shaken, and his ninth immortal soul was damaged.

After finally calming himself and repairing the immortal soul, he learned that Heavenly Mysteries King, who had seemingly ascended, had actually returned to the lower realm.

The Immortal Realm had suffered a great tribulation, the immortal path was obscured, and there was no longer any possibility of ascension.

Mo Ru'bin could no longer maintain his Dao heart. He spat out a mouthful of blood, and his ninth immortal soul directly disintegrated. His first eight immortal souls also suffered varying degrees of damage.

Furthermore, Mo Ru'bin's immortal soul injuries showed a tendency to worsen over time. With the immortal path severed, Mo Ru'bin, who had always aimed for ascension, completely lost his motivation for cultivation.

The once-prodigy fell into despair, and even the persuasion of his elders was of no use. Mo Ru'bin became dispirited and increasingly withered.

Until the Heavenly Mysteries King, Xuan Yuanhong, stood before Mo Ru'bin.

…

The image gradually blurred, and his thoughts returned to reality.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor did not directly awaken Mo Ru'bin but observed him carefully first.

"The aura of his cultivation technique no longer seems to be the Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul. It should be a technique brought down from the Immortal Realm by the Heavenly Mysteries King."

"I don't sense any severe injuries on him. Rather than healing, it's more like…"

"Waiting?"

Li Ping mused. With a gentle wave of his hand, a faint, harmless fluctuation of energy, like a gentle breeze, pierced through space and reached Mo Ru'bin's resting place.

Mo Ru'bin's eyelids twitched, about to awaken from his slumber.

"En?" At this moment, Li Ping seemed to sense something and stopped the movement of his arm.

The surrounding tranquility caused Mo Ru'bin to fall back into slumber. However, unlike before, Mo Ru'bin inadvertently shifted his posture, and his expression and stance also changed.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor gazed at him for a moment, discerning a hint of something.

"This is the effect of the Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul. Even if he no longer cultivates this technique, as the foundation of his Dao, it inevitably influences him. Although it won't lead to splitting into different personalities, it can sometimes cause him to act according to completely different principles…"

The reason the "Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul" of the Nine Refinements Observation was dreaded by cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm at the time was that each immortal soul was cultivated from scratch with a brand-new consciousness. Furthermore, only when the experiences of the immortal soul differed significantly from the previously condensed immortal souls could the immortal soul be successfully refined.

It was evident that the difficulty of cultivation increased with each higher number. Some cultivators of the Nine Refinements Observation, in order to successfully refine an immortal soul, would even actively commit various extreme crimes just to create a suitable cultivation environment.

"Compared to that, Mo Ru'bin, relying solely on his own comprehension, almost successfully condensed nine immortal souls. He can truly be called an extraordinary genius. It's a pity…" The Faceless Sacred Emperor shook his head in lament.

Now that he knew Mo Ru'bin's characteristics, the Sacred Emperor naturally became even more vigilant. Such a person, akin to a madman, might appear calm and collected on the surface but could instantly make decisions completely contrary to their previous ones.

The Sacred Emperor continued to emit a faint energy fluctuation, slowly awakening Mo Ru'bin. After a while.

"Who are you?"

Mo Ru'bin couldn't sense what kind of being Li Ping was when he opened his eyes. However, Li Ping was certain that Mo Ru'bin had been observing him for a sustained period when he spoke these words.

"Your aura is somewhat familiar. That's why I didn't attack directly," Mo Ru'bin continued.

Li Ping, however, keenly detected a fissure, like a mirror, silently forming between the two. At this very moment, Li Ping's figure vanished from thin air, leaving only his voice echoing.

"What exactly happened during the battle of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's downfall?"

"Did the Heavenly Mysteries King truly die?"

Mo Ru'bin retracted his subtle maneuvers, revealing an expression of interest. "I know some things. But why should I tell you?!"

After saying this, his face instantly darkened. "You want to deal with Brother Xuanyuan? You're seeking death!"

The sky above the Purple Firmament Sect seemed to suddenly darken. Mirrors appeared, sealing off space.

"Face your inner self! Let me see what makes you comparable to Brother Xuanyuan!"

Mo Ru'bin spoke words that seemed nonsensical. And in the reflection of countless mirrors, the hidden figure of the Faceless Sacred Emperor slowly emerged.

Chapter 1275

In tandem with the countless mirrors, countless faces of Mo Rubing, each with a different expression, appeared. They hid behind the shadowy, blurred reflections, collectively scrutinizing the faceless Sacred Emperor in the center of the arena. Li Ping served as the focal point, with mirrors facing each other in pairs. Beams of light shot from one mirror and projected onto its opposite, forming luminous lines that acted like tangible shackles, binding Li Ping. As these lines appeared in the mirror world, they were like heavy chains, accelerating Li Ping’s forced entry into the "real" world.

The faceless Sacred Emperor, fully revealed and surrounded by these mirrors, showed little panic. He reached out to touch the intangible yet tangible "lines" on his body, but they passed through his hand like an illusory mirage, only to tightly coil and wrap around him once more. The vortex in his chest suddenly opened, as if fueled by a raging inferno, emitting a soul-stirring brilliance. From the burning black chains, countless faces of Mo Rubing unleashed vicious curses.

His body slowly began to swell, his features becoming increasingly blurred. This statement seemed to have touched Mo Rubing’s sore spot; his form instantly became as dark and deep as if smeared with thick ink. "So, these are the personalities of the cultivators you devoured."

Beneath his golden armor, a golden light ceaselessly flowed, as if possessing a life of its own. A mystical power seemed to lock Li Ping and Mo Rubing in place, preventing them from escaping no matter how they shifted their positions. "You don't cultivate the proper **Nine Revolutions Immortal Soul** and instead dabble in such heretical paths!" Li Ping shook his head with a hint of pity. Li Ping tore off a black chain and stuffed it into the vortex.

Boom!

But soon, the Sacred Emperor discovered an extremely bizarre sight before him. Mo Rubing, on the other end of the mirror, watched him with a sinister grin. "**Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique**, how can you judge it!" The moment this fissure appeared, Li Ping’s heart suddenly felt a sensation. The Mo Rubing "over there" seemed to have vanished. The image before him was merely a projection formed on the other side of the mirror, based on his own existence.

The fissure before him, which had seemingly teleported, remained in the same relative position. Li Ping extended his right hand, gripped the chains wrapped around him, and yanked them fiercely. "Hiss, hiss, hiss..." Just as he was about to completely slide to the other side of the mirror, Li Ping suddenly shed his golden armor. The sound of shattering mirrors echoed continuously.

"I am the Chosen Sacred Emperor."

"You? With just that?" Whispers of rustling came from these black chains. Faintly, one could even see countless faces resembling Mo Rubing, drifting and wailing on the surface. "Utterly foolish!" Even more chillingly, Li Ping faintly sensed that the appearance and aura of Mo Rubing on the other side of the mirror were subtly changing. The black chains possessed a dark, corrosive ability, and within moments, Li Ping's clothes were dissolved. Just as they were about to touch Li Ping's skin, a brilliant golden light erupted. The distance between the Sacred Emperor and Mo Rubing was also gradually closing. Mo Rubing was transforming into the faceless Sacred Emperor.

It was a mirror that reflected both reality and illusion. He coldly gazed at the Mo Rubing not far away, "Become me?" The sharply defined golden armor suddenly descended, completely enveloping the Sacred Emperor's colossal three-zhang-three-inch frame. This action, for some reason, seemed to enrage Mo Rubing. A fissure appeared between him and Li Ping. He roared, and the lines that were once like bright light suddenly turned pitch black.

As the vortex in his chest continuously devoured the black chains, the Sacred Emperor learned the origin of these resentful faces from the images that continuously surged in his mind. With a thought, Li Ping, protected by the golden armor, instantly appeared a hundred miles away, leaving the vicinity of the Purple Firmament Sect ruins. Purple and golden fortune, appearing from the void, wove into a magnificent dragon robe like a dreamlike veil, clothing Li Ping spontaneously. The voice of the faceless Sacred Emperor echoed from one end of the mirror like the thunder of the nine heavens. The resounding booms caused ripples even in the fissure that separated the real world from the illusory one.

"I am also the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"The survival of billions of living beings hinges on it, the source of the resurgence of the Abyssal Sea!"

"You wish to become me?" With every sentence the Sacred Emperor uttered, it was like a monstrous wave, violently striking the mirror fissure. Creaking sounds were faintly heard, and the world on the other side of the mirror showed cracks. It seemed as if it could shatter at any moment. "Are you worthy?!" Li Ping asked coldly. A single stone stirred a thousand waves. For the first time, Mo Rubing's expression shifted, deviating from his mimicry of the faceless Sacred Emperor.

Behind Li Ping, he seemed to see a miniature image of the entire Xuanhuang Realm. Furthermore, behind that cluster of Azure Nether light, a more brilliant galaxy seemed hidden! In the blink of an eye, heaven and earth were overturned. The weight of the world pressed down upon him. *Cling!* The fissure's mirror shattered, and in a chain reaction, the countless mirrors sealing the surrounding space instantly exploded into myriad fragments. Mo Rubing spat out a mouthful of blood, but his reaction was swift. Taking advantage of the disturbance caused by the shattering mirrors, his form became ethereal, reappearing thousands of miles away in an instant.

"Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"How is that possible?" Mo Rubing’s face was filled with disbelief. His expression suddenly changed: "That damned Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm is truly unreliable. I need to hurry." While he was muttering to himself, a tall figure quietly appeared before him.

"You wish to leave before answering my question?" Mo Rubing's eyes flashed with a hint of apprehension. He snorted, "What Chosen Sacred Emperor, or manifestation of the Heavenly Dao, are mere pawns!"

"If you don't want to die, why don't we cooperate? What do you say?"

"Although you are strong, you are still somewhat inferior to Big Brother Xuanyuan. Even he was ambushed and met with misfortune; you are surely no exception..." Mo Rubing's words stirred something in Li Ping, causing him to halt his attack. However, after Mo Rubing finished speaking, Li Ping's expression suddenly changed. He reached out to grab the Mo Rubing before him, but the figure exploded like a phantom, scattering in the air. It was clearly a diversion. The true Mo Rubing had, while under Li Ping's nose, escaped to who knows where.

The Sacred Emperor did not become angry at being tricked. "True Immortal techniques are indeed extraordinary."

"**Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique**..."

"No." After a moment of contemplation, Li Ping looked at Cat Treasure, who was sleeping on his shoulder. During the brief battle with Mo Rubing, the opponent had not seemed to notice Cat Treasure's presence. Furthermore, that killing move, which could replicate and replace, had not reflected Cat Treasure's existence. "It doesn't pique Cat Treasure's interest. It seems this so-called Immortal Technique is somewhat undeserved of its reputation."

Although Mo Rubing had escaped, he had not truly escaped Li Ping's control. As Mo Rubing attempted to replace Li Ping, Li Ping was also slowly drawing him into the net of Primal Force Essence. Even if he managed to break free for a moment, as long as he followed the broken, still-suspended golden threads, Li Ping could track his movements. In his senses, Mo Rubing was still fleeing rapidly. Li Ping did not rush to catch up, but prepared to cast a long line to catch a big fish.

"What he said just now is difficult to discern its truth. However, one thing is certain: he will definitely go in search of the Heavenly Mysteries King."

"Or perhaps, something related to the Heavenly Mysteries Sect of ancient times."

"I'll wait and see." Li Ping knew that dealing with beings like Mo Rubing, who had survived since ancient times, required ample patience. Moreover, the battle with Mo Rubing had given the Sacred Emperor a substantial understanding of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's peculiar techniques. With preparation, he would not let him escape so easily the next time they met.

The fluctuations from the recent battle seemed to have attracted the attention of other powerful individuals. Perhaps someone from the Myriad Immortals Alliance would arrive to investigate soon, so Li Ping prepared to leave the area. "I never expected Mo Rubing to be hiding in the ruins of the Purple Firmament Sect."

"According to the records on the Stone Slab, after the Myriad Immortal Sects of the ancient past destroyed the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, they scoured the world to eliminate any future trouble. Small and large sects alike. This Purple Firmament Sect was thoroughly searched back then, yet he still managed to evade them."

"Regardless of the power of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's techniques, they are quite peculiar and difficult to guard against..."

"Not like orthodox immortal paths," Li Ping commented inwardly. As his divine sense swept over the Purple Firmament Sect ruins a thousand miles away, the faceless Sacred Emperor's figure slowly vanished into the air. However, in the next moment, Li Ping reappeared. "Hmm?" Because in the instant he was contemplating, Li Ping discovered something peculiar. His perspective suddenly shifted upwards, and a miniature landscape of the Xuanhuang Realm appeared before him.

"This is the Azure Light Prefecture of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. A thousand years ago, it was part of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Xuanhuang Realm was dismembered and remolded. This Azure Light Prefecture was merged with other cultivation realms."

"But..." Li Ping's expression gradually became solemn. "A piece of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm's puzzle is missing." Having grasped the information from the Genesis Stone Slab and maintaining a close connection with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. While restoring the process of the primordial Xuanhuang Realm's dismemberment and reconstruction, Li Ping faintly perceived that a large area within the former Purple Firmament Sect's domain had vanished from the new map of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Or rather, it hadn't disappeared. It still existed somewhere in the current Xuanhuang Realm. "But some power has influenced me, causing me to subconsciously ignore its existence." Upon reaching this conclusion, Li Ping's aura became solemn. The maps of the original Xuanhuang Realm and the current Xuanhuang Realm separated and recombined in his sea of consciousness. After a long while, he finally located another part of the former Purple Firmament Sect's territory.

It was the area of Mount Profound Heaven in the current Taihua Prefecture. "What is there..." Li Ping did not investigate rashly, but first pondered the force that could influence him. Past events flashed through his mind. The Sacred Emperor faintly sensed something. However, Li Ping hesitated, which was rare for him. He stood still in the air for a long time, and after a long while, he made up his mind.

"No matter what the truth is, if I lack the courage to face it..."

"How can I save the Xuanhuang Realm." The Sacred Emperor shook his head slightly, and his figure flickered. Before long, he had arrived at Mount Profound Heaven. However, the secret he discovered here was slightly different from what he had expected. In a deep valley beneath Mount Profound Heaven, Li Ping discovered an underground secret chamber buried by mud. The aura emanating from the chamber made him, a manifestation of the Heavenly Dao, feel vaguely uncomfortable. Even more concerning was that Cat Treasure, who had been sleeping on his shoulder, suddenly awoke and looked around. As if it had found a delicious meal, Li Ping sensed extreme excitement from it. But after locking onto its target, Cat Treasure suddenly deflated like a punctured balloon, losing all its drive and lazily falling back asleep. However, Li Ping's attention remained fixed on the target.

"What is this..." A statue. Like him, it had no face. Although it looked like an ordinary object with no Spirit Qi fluctuations, Li Ping felt an unprecedented pressure from the stone statue. He had not felt this way even when facing the residual calamities in the Abyssal Sea. The faceless statue seemed to possess a magical charm. Li Ping slowly approached it. Two ethereal faces faced each other across the void. For some reason, Li Ping suddenly felt an urge. He wanted to communicate with this statue.

...Within the Dharma Deduction space. Li Ping’s breathing hitched slightly. The images he could sense from the Sacred Emperor's clone had become extremely blurry. But after the Sacred Emperor, by chance, rediscovered the statue of the faceless True Immortal buried beneath Mount Profound Heaven, this connection, spurred by an instinctual sense of fatal crisis, became clear again. Li Ping closed his eyes and concentrated, attempting to alter the clone’s intentions. Although he could escape from the True Immortal’s net once, he could escape a second time. However, escaping after reincarnating through multiple lifetimes was ultimately troublesome. It was best to avoid it if possible.

However, the Sacred Emperor's will was unexpectedly firm. Perhaps sensing something within the equally faceless countenances. He continued to walk slowly towards the statue of the faceless True Immortal. Standing before the statue, he remained still. At this moment, even though the Sacred Emperor was his clone, Li Ping could not fully grasp what the Sacred Emperor was thinking.

"So, this is the Heavenly Mysteries Immortal." After a long while, Li Ping discovered the origin of this statue in the records of the Genesis Stone Slab. The faceless True Immortal worshipped by the Heavenly Mysteries Sect. Li Ping touched his own ethereal face, his aura fluctuating. "Interesting." Li Ping could not determine if he truly had any connection with this faceless True Immortal. However, he could faintly sense the extraordinariness of this stone statue. Cautiously, he did not choose to touch it himself.

Li Ping summoned an ordinary Sacred Army Puppet and moved the statue to the dark void outside the Great Qi pocket world. He then set up layers of formations to seal the statue. Only when the sense of crisis in his heart gradually faded did he stop. The reason for his extreme caution was the familiar feeling he had developed after prolonged contact with the statue. This familiarity stemmed not only from the statue's bizarre similarity to himself in having no face, but more so from an image. The image he had sensed from the vast will at the origin of the Star Sea, in the center of the Abyssal Sea.

"What has it to do with me! What has it to do with me!" The unrestrained laughter, the gradually fading figure. It was strikingly similar to how he felt upon seeing this statue. "Is it the same person? Or not?" It was merely a fleeting glimpse, and Li Ping could not confirm. "If I have the chance to go to the center of the Star Sea again." "If the vast will of the Star Sea were to personally authenticate it, I should be able to figure it out." Such a thought flashed through Li Ping's mind.

"Perhaps, I can try again. However, the reserves of Empty Light Flowing Crystals were almost depleted in the last operation. Moreover..." Li Ping looked again at the faceless stone statue heavily sealed by formations in the void. Although it had no eyes, it seemed to be gazing at him. "If the perpetrator of ancient times was truly this faceless True Immortal, and if he was implicated by the enraged will of the Star Sea, then even if only the puppet body went, the main body here would still be affected." "Compared to the entire Abyssal Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm is truly but a speck of dust in the ocean..."

Li Ping suddenly saw an image of the Xuanhuang Realm being instantly torn apart by violent energy. He couldn't help but suppress his previous thoughts. After a long silence, the Sacred Emperor's figure vanished. When he reappeared, he placed another item next to the statue of the faceless True Immortal. It was the ruins of the One Beginning Sect, which he had collected and sealed in the Great Crevice beneath Floating Light Prefecture. The ruins themselves were ordinary objects, but the Grand Master's remains and the hidden Devouring Calamity within made even the Sacred Emperor treat it with caution. The ruins of the One Beginning Sect and the statue of the faceless True Immortal faced each other in the void.

A premonition flashed through Li Ping's mind. If there were no array seals separating them... a terrifying disaster might erupt on the spot. "Immortal..." The arrogant laughter of "What has it to do with me" still echoed in Li Ping's ears. He snorted coldly, and with another wave of his hand, he cast thousands more formations, reinforcing the prison surrounding them. These unstable factors buried in the Xuanhuang Realm would not make him feel at ease anywhere else. Only under his personal guard would it be truly stable.

Li Ping thought this way and continued tirelessly reinforcing the array seals. On his shoulder, Cat Treasure had woken up at some point. Its clear eyes stared at the void ahead. It licked its claws.

...On Li Ping's main body side, he couldn't help but breathe a sigh of relief. With the sealing of the faceless True Immortal statue, the connection between him and his clone had become blurry again. In fact, it was even weaker than before. "Is the Sacred Emperor clone becoming more vigilant?" Li Ping shook his head, not particularly concerned. "However, this matter also reminds me." "Although I am hiding here, observing the dramatic changes in the Azure Nether world, the Sacred Emperor, as the protagonist of this era, is bound to confront those transcendent beings."

"He might not necessarily find me through the connection between the clone and the main body, just like the True Immortal of the Immortal Ruins before."

"Hmm... I still need to prepare." However, being in a crucial location of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, his actions were not as free, and he needed to plan carefully. "You big idiot!" While he was lost in thought, he vaguely sensed Law Deduction Little蘿莉 calling out to the simulated personality. With a thought, he took over again, appearing inside the character light sphere. "Honestly, I've been calling you for so long, and only now you respond," Law Deduction said with a pouting, unhappy face. "Are you done sleeping?" Li Ping asked, without directly responding, with a hint of surprise. Law Deduction placed her hands on her hips. "How could I be done sleeping after such a short time?"

"However, I remembered some things from before while I was dreaming."

"See if it's helpful to you!" The little loli clapped her hands, and the scene within the light sphere suddenly changed. On a boundless grassland, a lone stone stood independently. Suddenly, the earth began to shake. Vast patches of green grass, as if stimulated by something, began to grow wildly. In an instant, they became taller than a person. They even pushed the lone stone on the grassland off the ground. A radial arc of light appeared in the sky. The arc was seven-colored, and within it, one could vaguely see the lightning and thunder, and the focus of storms. The space around the seven-colored arc occasionally showed strange distortions, as if an invisible transparent object were present.

More and more invisible objects gathered around the light arc, seemingly waiting for something. The wind and thunder grew more violent, and the rolling black clouds even threatened to penetrate the light arc. Although the storm appeared terrifying from outside the arc, its true horror became apparent only when it spread beyond the arc. A pitch-black bolt of lightning suddenly struck the ground from the arc. *Boom! Boom! Boom!* The world was split in two by it, the space was torn by deep fissures that remained unhealed for a long time, and the continuous green grass on the grassland was ignited. Raging fires spread rapidly.

But then, an even more bizarre scene unfolded. The falling embers of the burned grass turned into nourishment for the green leaves. The green grass grew wildly again, its growth rate offsetting the rate of burning. The grassland trembled, and beneath the raging fires, something seemed to be awakening. Meanwhile, high in the sky, the invisible beings around the light arc paid no attention to what was happening below. They only gathered closer to the interior of the light arc, even quarreling over positions. Continuous booming and colliding sounds echoed. The storm, brewed to its peak, suddenly fell into stillness. The rolling black clouds vanished without a trace in an instant. Within the seven-colored light arc, under a clear sky stretching for ten thousand miles, a profound and mysterious character appeared!

The moment the character appeared, supreme sounds of the Great Dao seemed to resonate throughout heaven and earth. Colorful auspicious clouds continuously arrived from the horizon, converging towards the character. Drizzling raindrops fell from the sky. Like the auspicious clouds in the sky, the raindrops were a captivating seven-colored hue. The fissures in the world were repaired. The flames on the grassland were extinguished by the descending raindrops. The continuous green grass greedily absorbed the heavenly dew, but their bodies gradually shrank. Seven-colored light ignited, and figures of various shapes began to gesture within it. However, the sounds of fighting and collisions high in the sky seemed to grow louder.

But Law Deduction's recollection was nearing its end. The surrounding scenery gradually became blurred and indistinct, and one could only see the lone stone on the grassland dissolving in the rainwater. ...The scene faded, and Li Ping returned to the character light sphere of Law Deduction. But he was immersed in the scene, unable to extricate himself.

"Well? Any clues?" Law Deduction asked with anticipation. After Li Ping savored the scene for a long time, he asked, "Those raindrops, they wouldn't happen to be the Immortal Sound Jade Dew you mentioned, would they?" Law Deduction stood with her hands on her hips, righteously saying, "They should be. I've had this memory in my mind since I was born. But as I grew up, I forgot it. Fortunately, I had a good sleep just now, or I don't know when I would have remembered it!" "I have a premonition that if I could have some more of this..." Li Ping interrupted her reverie.

"What about that character in the seven-colored light arc?"

"Why can't I see it clearly?" Law Deduction pouted. "I told you it was from a dream. It's already difficult for me to recall these things, how could I possibly remember the character clearly?!" Li Ping stared at Law Deduction, trying to discern the truth in her words. "You don't believe me?" Law Deduction said with extreme grievance. Li Ping chuckled, "You're not stupid. I don't believe you wouldn't realize that the scene you just showed is likely a vision of the legendary Immortal Realm."

"A character that even Immortals fight over..."

"It's only natural for you to hide something." Upon hearing this, Law Deduction became even more aggrieved. "I really can't remember! You know it's an Immortal script, it's not something easily remembered. Besides, I was so young then..." Law Deduction gestured, her eyes tearing up. "How can I recall it?" Li Ping, not believing the little loli’s fibs, directly laid out his terms. Law Deduction's tears immediately stopped. Her large eyes rolled, as if she were thinking. After a moment, she whispered, "Well, perhaps if I eat more, I might remember something." Law Deduction licked her lips and stared at Li Ping.

"Eat?" Li Ping lowered his head. "You can eat too?" Law Deduction said indignantly, "What do you mean? I'm also a person! I haven't tasted delicious food for thousands of years. I tasted it again in my dream just now, and it woke me up craving it..." Li Ping conjured a fragrant, crispy roast suckling pig in his hand. "Is this acceptable?" Law Deduction rolled her eyes. "I want the real thing, not a fake. I can have as many of these as I want."

Saying that, the little loli waved her hand, and the surroundings were instantly piled with all sorts of delicious delicacies. "Even if it looks similar, a fake is still a fake, it can't become real..." Law Deduction shook her head with regret. "Oh?" For some reason, Law Deduction suddenly felt a slight change in Li Ping's expression in an instant. "Then see how you like this dish?" In Li Ping's hand appeared a very ordinary bowl of fried rice. Law Deduction initially dismissed it with disdain, but at Li Ping's signal, she took it and tasted it.

Chapter 1276

At first, Dharma Deduction was a little cautious. But as soon as she tasted it, the expression on her face instantly became incredibly complex. Then she began to gorge herself.

"Mmm... so delicious... mmm..."

In a flash, she devoured the entire plate of fried rice. Afterward, she satisfyingly patted her slightly bulging stomach, her face full of wonder. "Your fried rice is just like the real thing! How did you manage it?"

Saying that, Dharma Deduction let out another burp.

Li Fan smiled and replied, "When the false is taken as true, the true also becomes false; when the true is taken as false, the false also becomes true. Truth and falsehood, how can they be so easily distinguished?"

"As long as you have enough understanding of the essence of things, you too can create things that are incredibly lifelike."

Dharma Deduction plopped down on the ground. "I've only ever eaten fried rice, I've never made it myself. And it's the same with other delicacies. It seems I have no hope of self-sufficiency. But..."

She sized up Li Fan. "You weren't a chef in your past life, were you..."

Li Fan's face twitched. He avoided the question and changed the subject. "Are you full? Have you remembered that Immortal Character yet?"

Dharma Deduction quickly shook her head. "Just one dish? That's not nearly enough! Can I have some more!"

"From the clues we have so far, True Immortal Script can be divided into three main categories. The first type is like the Chaos Character, which brings all sorts of calamities and destruction. The second type is the Return Character, which is an imperial edict from the Immortal Realm. And the last is this one..."

And in his senses, Mo Ru'in, who had been fleeing rapidly earlier, had not moved for a long time.

Li Fan's thoughts churned, and he couldn't help but try to sketch and mend the missing Dharma Deduction character again.

Li Fan responded indifferently, "It's just that in my mortal days, I made a small living with this skill. It's not worth mentioning."

"However..."

Li Ping pondered for a moment, not giving chase directly. Instead, he summoned the Skilled Artisan Hermit.

Just as Li Fan's true self was gaining insight from Dharma Deduction's account of ancient immortal realm secrets, Li Ping, the Faceless Sacred Emperor, had finally completed the final lockdown of the Faceless True Immortal statue and the ruins of the One Beginning Sect.

...

However, all things are relative.

And within the character light sphere, the crisscrossing strokes moved, forming a giant character that occupied the entire sky.

Li Fan snorted coldly, but with a gentle wave of his hand, the stove, cooking utensils, and ingredients appeared before him.

But Li Fan discovered that this difference only arose when he presented and compared the two simultaneously in his mind.

"You know, although you're not much to look at, your cooking skills are truly excellent," Dharma Deduction praised.

"The gap between the genuine article and the imitation is truly immense."

Amidst the leaping fire, fragrant delicacies were continuously served.

"The structure of the strokes, the style of the turns, and all the subtle details of the brushwork are extremely similar to what I saw before, like 'Starvation' and 'Chaos,' but it's more beautiful, more natural."

Then she said, "Hmm, I'm a bit sleepy. I'm going to take a nap. You can look around yourself."

Compared to the genuine article of Dharma Deduction's memory, those that had wreaked havoc in the Abyssal Sea were as crude as a child's scribbles.

After a while, Li Fan awoke from his epiphany, sighing deeply.

If Li Fan had only recreated a single character like "Starvation" or "Chaos," he would still instinctively feel it was flawless.

"The Immortal Realm has been destroyed. Where can the genuine article of the Dharma Deduction Immortal be now?" Li Fan couldn't help but wonder.

It was only intermittent, as if an illusion.

This was a very contradictory and wondrous experience.

"The raindrops that descend from the appearance of the characters can be called [Immortal Sound Jade Dew]. They are accompanied by profound cosmic sounds, attracting the attention of True Immortals. It is likely closer to the legendary term 'Dharma Deduction'."

Dharma Deduction's mouth watered as she ate them all without refusal.

"What position is this?"

"Burp..."

But he would always pause at crucial moments, shaking his head slightly.

The True Immortal Characters Li Fan had encountered before seemed perfect to him, without any flaws. Each stroke exuded the vast and sacred power of a True Immortal.

Li Fan used his hand as a brush, attempting to write in the air.

"It is indeed True Immortal Script. However, due to the gaps in Dharma Deduction's memory, one cannot fully comprehend the meaning of this True Immortal Script. Even the characters she presented have some slight deviation from the true True Immortal Script."

After repeated attempts, Li Fan concluded: True Immortal Script was like a vast ocean to him. Alone, he could only be lost within it, unable to see its entirety. However, with the genuine article of the Dharma Deduction Immortal as a comparison, it was like a steady anchor, or an eye in the sky, allowing him to break free and see the actual scene.

The result was predictable; it was merely futile.

After a delightful feast, the little girl, now comically round from being full, lay ungracefully on the ground.

"It's a pity that this genuine article of the Dharma Deduction Immortal is also incomplete. And having gone through Dharma Deduction's memory, it's still somewhat distorted."

Emulating the genuine article of the Dharma Deduction Immortal, Li Fan reorganized the True Immortal Scripts he had mastered, such as "Starvation" and "Chaos."

As she spoke, Dharma Deduction was already snoring thunderously, fast asleep.

Dharma Deduction, with her eyes blissfully closed, savored the lingering taste on her tongue.

The effect was indeed excellent. Although at first glance, they still looked the same as before, Li Fan was certain that these True Immortal Scripts, improved based on the original, had their power increased by at least one-third.

The cosmic sounds he had vaguely heard in the illusion echoed once more.

Li Fan looked up at the characters, motionless. Only after they slowly dissipated did a thoughtful expression appear on his face.

"This place... it's said to be formed from the heart of that giant beast after its death, a place where the earth's energy converges in Nine Mountains Province. I've been there once, but found nothing special." Skilled Artisan sensed the image transmitted by the Sacred Emperor and shook his head slightly.

The location indicated by the Sacred Emperor was a swamp in the Nine Mountains Province, the stronghold of the Sect of Spiritual Primal.

"It's just that the Spirit Qi is denser than in other places. Otherwise, there's nothing special," Skilled Artisan concluded.

"How much do you know about [Tian Beast]?" Li Ping asked again.

Skilled Artisan shrugged. "If it weren't for some local cultivators from Nine Mountains Province in my sect, I probably wouldn't even know the legend that Nine Mountains was formed from the remains of a dead giant beast. So that thing is called Tian Beast, I've learned something new."

"However, if you're interested in that place, there's a Nascent Soul cultivator in my sect named Shen Yurou. You can summon him and ask."

Skilled Artisan explained the reason to Li Ping.

It turned out that Shen Yurou's family had been digging up underground objects in Nine Mountains for generations. The chaotic lands of Nine Mountains had buried countless cultivators since ancient times, dating back to the era ruled by the Myriad Immortal Sects.

The Shen family had accumulated considerable capital through this trade. However, it was ultimately a clandestine business. Since joining the Sect of Spiritual Primal, Shen Yurou had abandoned his ancestral profession.

"I think I heard him mention before that Shen family ancestors once dug up a peculiar structure near that swamp. But it was empty inside, with only some strange statues placed around. After his ancestor left in disappointment, he fell seriously ill and almost died."

Li Ping's heart stirred, and he flipped through the Genesis Stone Slab.

He indeed found information about this Shen family ancestor, but there was no record of discovering ruins in the Nine Mountains Province swamp.

Li Ping then left Great Qi and went to the Sect of Spiritual Primal.

Still disguised as the Sect Leader of the Sect of Spiritual Primal, he summoned Shen Yurou and inquired about the details.

Shen Yurou was somewhat taken aback by the summons from the Sect Leader who had not appeared for a long time. He said with great restraint, "This matter is indeed quite strange. Ever since that accidental intrusion, my ancestor contracted some strange illnesses."

"For instance, the scene of that underground building often reappeared in his dreams, and also..."

"After that, all the males in our Shen family became androgynous, and the females became masculine. The balance of Yin and Yang was inverted," Shen Yurou said calmly, as if he had accepted the reality.

Li Ping scanned Shen Yurou's body with his divine sense, but found no influence of any foreign power. It was as if it was meant to be this way.

"Is the specific location of that building still preserved?" Li Ping asked.

Shen Yurou's expression turned troubled. "To prevent any clansmen from accidentally entering again, my ancestor did not disclose its exact location. However, there are paintings and writings left behind depicting the scene of that building."

Saying that, Shen Yurou pinched his fingers and drew a picture.

At each of the four corners, a stone statue was placed.

It was a headless figure in different poses, as if in prayer.

And in the center of the four stone statues, stood a bare, smooth pillar.

The surface of the pillar was very smooth, without any carved patterns. But strangely, the shadow cast by the pillar on the ground seemed to be that of a ferocious beast, with claws and teeth bared, as if it would come to life with the changing light and shadow.

"According to my ancestor, inside this building, one constantly hears the sound of violent heartbeats. And if you look up along this pillar, it's like suddenly falling into an abyss, surrounded by endless darkness..." Shen Yurou added.

Li Ping stared at the four headless figures in the painting.

Even without heads, one could faintly discern that their style was very similar to the Faceless True Immortal statues he had encountered beneath Mount Taihua.

It was undoubtedly a product of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect.

"Borrowing their likeness, yet severing their heads."

"This pillar..."

The smooth pillar was undoubtedly the core of this bizarre structure.

But from the picture alone, no clues could be discerned.

After Li Ping dismissed Shen Yurou, he quietly arrived at the great swamp in Nine Mountains Province.

A swamp of this scale appearing in the continuous mountain range was theoretically highly improbable. Many cultivators had explored this place, hoping to uncover some secrets, but all returned empty-handed.

Li Ping stood in the center of the swamp, only sensing a foul, putrid odor. He detected nothing unusual.

If not for the clear sensation that Mo Ru'in was hidden here.

Mo Ru'in had not yet detected Li Ping's approach. Although he had been moving within a small range in the depths of the swamp, he had not left the area.

Setting up formations around the area, Li Ping dived underground into the swamp, slowly approaching the location he sensed.

"Gulp..."

Suddenly, his body froze.

Just now, Li Ping had faintly heard a rustling sound.

With his current cultivation, it was almost impossible for it to be a hallucination. So...

Li Ping looked around.

The viscous, foul-smelling swamp mud writhed with a rhythmic pulsation, as if alive.

Li Ping suddenly felt as if the entire swamp had suddenly come to life.

"A trap?"

The thought flashed through Li Ping's mind, but he quickly dismissed it.

The attention of this swamp was not on him.

The Sacred Emperor continued to conceal his presence, following the sensation in his heart and the source of the swamp's life-like pulsations. In a short while, he discovered the strange building that Shen Yurou's ancestor had encountered.

Viewed from the outside, the building strikingly resembled a blank face.

And the tall, smooth pillar was located at the position of the blank face's brow, like a third eye protruding high, gazing at the sky from beneath the ground.

This bizarre sight made Li Ping's heart clench.

The building blocked his prying eyes from within. He could only rely on the mark he had left on Mo Ru'in earlier to confirm that the other party was indeed busy with something inside.

The Sacred Emperor did not intrude rashly. Instead, he quietly spread a net of Primal Force Essence around the perimeter.

Coupled with heavy formations to seal the area, the place was completely locked down. He even summoned the power of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao to seal off the surrounding earth veins...

Even after taking so many precautions, Li Ping still felt uncertain.

After a moment of thought, Li Ping woke up the cat treasure on his shoulder and took out an item from its belly.

It was an exotic treasure obtained from the Fishing Pond, capable of sealing space.

The treasure looked somewhat unremarkable, just a simple ring.

But the golden-white light flowing on it faintly hinted at the terrifying power hidden within.

"Void Binding Ring."

"It was forged by annihilating the life within a ring-shaped world and integrating it into the realm. It not only carries the weight of the entire world itself but also the weight of countless lives. Once bound, even I would be greatly affected in my movements."

Although the refining method was undoubtedly that of an evil artifact, Li Ping was not a pedantic person, so he used it without any psychological burden.

He gently threw it out, and the Void Binding Ring flew towards the top of the ethereal-faced building. In an instant, it expanded several times, enveloping the entire surrounding area.

Watching the golden-white ring gradually hide, the Sacred Emperor pondered for a moment, then laid down the final measure.

With everything prepared, Li Ping flew into the building.

"You've arrived."

"I've been waiting for you for a long time."

As soon as he entered, he heard Mo Ru'in's voice in his ear.

Li Ping focused his gaze, unable to see his figure.

But the shifting shadow at the base of the smooth pillar in the center of the building resembled a humanoid shape.

Confronting Li Ping, it seemed to wear a mocking expression.

"I followed Brother Xuanyuan for so long. Even without reaching the Half-Immortal realm, I wouldn't be ignorant of his methods. Moreover, you're using a plan that Big Brother discarded and rejected..."

"Your Mortal World's Immortal power is strong, indeed, but it's harmful and not beneficial," Mo Ru'in scoffed.

Li Ping knew that the Mortal World's Immortal power Mo Ru'in spoke of was the Primal Force Essence he had condensed from the faith of the Netherfolk.

A path of taking shortcuts would undoubtedly come with a corresponding price. But what he sought was not ascension to immortality, but for the Xuanhuang Realm. There was nothing wrong with seeking the most powerful force within his grasp.

Ignoring Mo Ru'in's words, the Sacred Emperor examined the details of the building.

"A relic of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect?" he asked.

Mo Ru'in seemed to be waiting for something and did not attack, replying, "Hahaha, rather than calling it a relic of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, it's a contingency I left behind personally."

"Brother Xuanyuan is too idealistic. And he trusts himself too much."

"I am different."

The shadow beneath the pillar seemed to be provoked, swirling around more rapidly.

"I once had the same mindset as Brother Xuanyuan, believing I was the destined protagonist and that failure was impossible as long as I acted. But later, I was severely beaten down, my cultivation regressed daily, and I had to face the mockery of those I previously dismissed as trash..."

"I have attained enlightenment!"

Mo Ru'in's shadow suddenly surged from the ground, floating in mid-air, glaring fiercely at Li Ping.

"I am not some protagonist. I am merely an insignificant person who has flowed through the river of history in this world. Small characters must prepare fallback plans for failure. That's why I hid this place from Brother Xuanyuan!"

Mo Ru'in manifested shadowy arms, pointing at the four headless stone statues around him, and chuckled grimly. "Look at these statues."

"They are unequivocally True Immortals, and they even saved Brother Xuanyuan's life. The people in the sect, including Brother Xuanyuan himself, admired them. And yet, their heads were severed by me?!"

Mo Ru'in's frenzied laughter echoed throughout the secret chamber.

Li Ping calmly said, "Aren't you afraid of retaliation from the True Immortals?"

Mo Ru'in laughed even more fiercely. "You people don't understand! Let alone chopping off their heads, even if I urinated and defecated on their statues, the True Immortals wouldn't care!"

"Mortal matters, how can they enter the eyes of True Immortals?! Immortals..."

"They only care about what they care about!"

Li Ping listened silently, neither agreeing nor disagreeing.

"I know that where Immortal power reaches, it is as if a True Immortal has personally arrived. But even True Immortals do not have infinite power. How would they waste their power on such a small statue?"

After a burst of laughter, Mo Ru'in slowly regained his calm. "Unless..."

"Unless something that True Immortals care about appears around the statue."

Before he finished speaking, the shadow Mo Ru'in transformed into retreated into the smooth pillar.

The ground of the building trembled slightly, and the pillar began to emit a faint glow, as if something was being gestured within.

"I don't know who you are. But I have a piece of advice for you..."

Mo Ru'in's voice came from within the pillar, passing through layers of obstruction, becoming indistinct.

"Unless absolutely necessary, do not enter the True Immortal!"

Li Ping vaguely felt as if the four headless statues around him had come to life.

Even with their heads severed, they could still observe the scene.

However, their gaze was not on Li Ping.

Instead, it was all focused on the glowing pillar.

Logically, even if it wasn't the personal power of a True Immortal, but merely a line of sight transmitted across countless time and space, it should be unbearable for mortal cultivators.

But the Faceless Sacred Emperor, standing amidst the four statues, felt no pressure at all.

"The power is being extracted and absorbed?"

Li Ping's heart trembled slightly.

In his sight, four forces of the same nature intertwined into a line, wrapping around the smooth pillar, circling it round and round.

Stimulated by this great power, the pillar's glow became even more dazzling.

Its surface seemed to melt away, revealing its true form within.

"This is..."

A bare flagpole.

The flag had long since disappeared, leaving only the white jade pole carved with intricate patterns.

"An object from the Immortal Realm."

Sensing the increasingly violent energy fluctuations around him, Li Ping retreated slightly, his gaze locked onto the white jade flagpole.

"Not only the gaze of the True Immortal statues, but even the net of Primal Force Essence I laid outside, that is, Mortal World's Immortal power, is being subtly mobilized by this flagpole..."

At this moment, Mo Ru'in's voice rang out again. "Big Brother Xuanyuan brought back quite a few good things when he returned from the Immortal Realm back then."

"Not to mention those techniques, even Immortal artifacts were easy to pick up everywhere..."

"It's a pity that they were said to be contaminated with catastrophe, and most were sealed so we couldn't use them."

Energy formed a tangible vortex around the spirit banner.

With continuous trembling, the flagpole seemed about to break through the void at any moment.

"Alright, I haven't spoken to anyone in many years. I feel much better after saying so much at once."

"We'll meet again if we have the chance."

"I have important business to attend to."

Mo Ru'in's words slowly faded.

A dazzling light erupted from the flagpole, obscuring all external scrutiny.

The next moment, the spirit banner was about to escape.

But Li Ping, who had been tracking for so long, would naturally not let him leave just based on a few words from Mo Ru'in.

The formations and the net of Primal Force Essence exploded.

Golden interwoven threads appeared from the void. The airtight Heavenly Net blocked the path of the flagpole.

It even completely sealed space.

"Mortal World's Immortal power dares to contend with True Immortal power?!"

Mo Ru'in's mocking voice echoed.

Under the blinding light at the front of the white jade flagpole, the golden Primal Force was indeed melting like snow.

Li Ping remained unmoved. While calling upon the remaining Primal Force Essence like moths to a flame, he activated the formations to intercept.

"Mortal formations, do they deserve..."

"Huh?!"

Mo Ru'in's voice showed astonishment for the first time.

Because the formations Li Ping displayed had far surpassed his understanding.

They were even slowly pulling back the white jade flagpole, which was about to pierce through the void.

In Mo Ru'in's senses, the surroundings seemed to be filled with obstructing mediums, hindering the flagpole's advance.

"Has the formation technology of the Xuanhuang Realm developed to this extent?"

"The exquisiteness is no less than that of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation!"

Despite his shock, Mo Ru'in did not slow his departure.

A white light erupted from the flagpole again.

As the white light swept over, everything in front of it was dissolved.

The flagpole easily broke free from the heavy obstructions.

And Mo Ru'in, for some unknown reason, stopped his taunting.

He silently intended to leave.

"Decree!"

At this moment, Li Ping's icy voice rang out.

The Void Binding Ring materialized in the void.

It firmly locked onto the white jade flagpole.

"Useless! Useless! Useless! Just a mere realm artifact!"

"Damn it! You're like a fly, so annoying!"

Mo Ru'in's tone was markedly different from before.

He babbled, even appearing somewhat deranged.

For the first time, something other than white light emerged from the white jade flagpole.

It was a humanoid silhouette.

The figure held a long saber and gracefully flew out, lightly chopping at the Void Binding Ring.

*Clang!*

The golden-white ring, containing the weight of billions of lives and an entire cultivation world, snapped in two!

However, releasing the white figure had clearly consumed a lot of the white jade flagpole's power.

Its glow had dimmed considerably.

"Damn it, damn it, damn it..."

Mo Ru'in's venomous curses echoed.

But he did not stay to trouble Li Ping.

Instead, he resolutely continued towards his intended destination.

"I told you, you can't stop me!"

With flashes of light, the white jade flagpole transformed into a thin line, breaking free from all constraints and about to escape.

Just then, an ancient song suddenly rang out.

The sound was not loud, but it drowned out the vibrations of Mo Ru'in and the white jade flagpole.

A pitch-black door silently opened on the path ahead of the white jade flagpole.

And Li Ping, who had not acted personally until now, appeared at this moment, arriving at the tail of the white jade flagpole.

Golden armor protected his body, and behind the Sacred Emperor, the phantom image of the Xuanhuang Realm also appeared.

"Go in there!"

*Boom! Boom! Boom!*

Li Ping kicked the tail of the white jade flagpole fiercely.

This caused the already eager to leave flagpole to lunge forward sharply.

With no time to dodge, it flew directly into the pitch-black door.

Li Ping followed closely, flying in as well.

He also brought along the loyal Netherfolk who risked their lives to perform the ritual and open the passage to the Sea of Darkness.

Within the Sea of Darkness.

It was pitch black and silent.

Even the white jade flagpole, which shone like the sun in the outside world, could only illuminate a small area around it here.

And Mo Ru'in, who had been so noisy, was now as mute as a statue.

Silence for a long while.

"Wait, this is..."

"This place..."

After a long pause, he finally spoke foolishly.

"Now, we can talk."

The radiance of the white jade flagpole slightly dispelled the darkness of the Sea of Darkness, allowing Li Ping and Mo Ru'in to communicate verbally for a while.

Mo Ru'in, however, seemed not to have heard Li Ping's words at all.

He emerged from the white jade flagpole, looking around in disbelief.

His expression was a mixture of anticipation and terror.

"Does the aura of the Heavenly Mysteries King exist here?"

After a brief silence, Li Ping asked.

The words "Heavenly Mysteries King" seemed to have triggered some switch.

Mo Ru'in's senses snapped back to attention.

He stared at Li Fan. "How do you know about this place?"

"And how can you open the passage here?"

Mo Ru'in's tone was extremely dangerous, as if he would fight to the death if Li Ping's answer was even slightly wrong.

"Nearly ten thousand years have passed since you fell into slumber. Nothing is impossible."

Li Ping's attitude was very calm.

"It's not just me. Even the current largest cultivation organization, the Myriad Immortals Alliance, has mastered the method of opening passages here."

"And they are stealing power here."

"Don't you feel it?"

Li Ping asked.

At these words, Mo Ru'in's expression changed again.

He looked into the distance, his aura fluctuating violently.

"How dare they?!"

"They must die! Kill!"

Mo Ru'in roared furiously.

Chapter 1277: The True Immortal Hidden in the Dark Sea (7K, seeking subscriptions and monthly votes)

A killing intent, as if it were tangible, swept towards the Sacred Emperor, only to be dissolved into nothingness by the threads of gold before him.

When Mo Rubbin's fury began to subside, Li Ping said calmly, "I can see that your anger is not genuine."

"Are you still acting before me? Or once you're in character, even you can't distinguish?"

"Look, this is what true anger is like…"

The Sacred Emperor took a sudden step forward. Powerful energy erupted from his toes, surging outwards. The radiance of the white jade flagpole, like a willow in the wind, swayed unsteadily.

However, this surging energy, upon leaving the illuminated circle and entering the Dark Sea, rapidly weakened.

Gentle ripples spread across the silent Dark Sea, erasing all disturbances.

It was as if it were soothing the furious Sacred Emperor.

"I don't need you to teach me! I understand this place better than you do!"

Mo Rubbin's figure suddenly appeared behind Li Ping. A shadow lurked beneath the white light of the white jade flagpole, like a venomous snake, baring its fangs at Li Ping's neck.

The demonic face's incessant chatter continued.

"I once tried to harness the power of the Dark Sea to seal that aperature. However, I was blocked by an eyeball…"

"How can one succeed with such a swarm of insects dragging them down?"

"Was the owner of that eyeball King Xuanyuan?"

"Would Brother Xuanyuan do such a thing?"

Their tones were varied, but without exception, after delivering their lines, they dissolved into the Dark Sea on their own accord.

"Those who are acting, play along. Those who are terrified, be thoroughly intimidated. Those who are utterly wicked, embrace them."

He suddenly stopped and looked up at the distant sky.

"Damn it."

"Don't I know that the Dark Sea encompasses everything, and even a cultivator's emotions will stir ripples and then be covered by the darkness?"

"Daring to spout nonsense before me with some trick you stumbled upon?"

Li Ping looked at the shadowy mass that was bound and writhing in his palm, saying coldly, "Another personality? This one… is very much like you."

Li Ping was not annoyed. He followed the words, asking, "Then why was that eyeball able to mobilize the power of the Dark Sea?"

Since these demonic faces did not attack, Li Ping directly ignored them and let them mock him, quickly approaching Mo Rubbin.

Mo Rubbin's direction of travel seemed to be towards the rift where the Myriad Immortals Alliance was drawing power from the Dark Sea.

The Sacred Emperor arrived beside Mo Rubbin and placed his hand on his shoulder, transmitting his voice.

His gaze seemed to pierce through layers of darkness. Not far ahead, Mo Rubbin's true form had a face as calm as his own.

The waves of the Dark Sea blocked Mo Rubbin's forward progress.

"As expected, you're quite foolish," Mo Rubbin sneered. "The formation is merely an illusion. What truly causes this darkness to converge, allowing the Xuanhuang Realm to resist the suction from the ruins of the ascension passage, is…"

"Using the immortal heart to control the demonic faces, and displaying the appropriate demeanor for whoever you encounter!"

However, Mo Rubbin himself didn't even bother with the white jade flagpole. While speaking, he had already vanished from his spot.

Mo Rubbin did not look back, but a face suddenly appeared on the back of his head, looking at Li Ping with utter contempt.

And the Sacred Emperor showed no emotional fluctuation.

Another shadowy face appeared above Li Ping's head. This time, its words were no longer those of mad rage. However, Li Ping could sense genuine killing intent hidden within its calmness.

Li Ping shook his head slightly. His previous kick was not in vain.

"What is the real me? I am the first genius of the Nine Refinements Observation, the first person destined for immortality. I am also one of the Twelve Law Kings of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, assisting Xuanyuan Hong in achieving the grand cause of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect and unifying the Xuanhuang Realm."

Cracks instantly appeared on the Sacred Emperor's golden armor. A black line shot out from the hole in the center, heading straight for Li Ping's neck.

*Whoosh*…

The face on Mo Rubbin's head disappeared: "Do you know the essence of this Dark Sea?"

"And you see through my heart?"

But just as it was about to succeed, it was blocked by Li Ping's outstretched palm.

A gap erupted from time to time, spewing forth dark power. The intermittent muffled thuds sounded like a heavy heartbeat.

After saying this, he did not directly crush the sneak attacker but allowed it to return to Mo Rubbin's side.

Dozens of Mo Rubbin's faces, hidden in the darkness, occasionally floated over and taunted Li Ping.

"Who do you think you are?! You haven't even entered the Immortal realm, yet you dream of saving the world?!"

"Wrong, wrong, wrong! Laughter and scolding are me, arrogance and rebellion are me, decadence and unrestraint are also me!"

"As for pedantic good people like you, you should be fiercely awakened!"

"A formation?" After pondering for a moment, Li Ping replied.

Dozens of faces differentiated around him, unleashing a torrent of extremely unpleasant words at the Sacred Emperor.

"Even so, should I always show the same face? Should the chief prodigy always be steady? Should the Twelve Law Kings always plan carefully?"

Following the residual sensation, he moved rapidly through the Dark Sea, pursuing Mo Rubbin.

At a crucial point in his speech, Mo Rubbin suddenly stopped.

"Do you want to know?" he asked mischievously, his tone flippant.

"Yes," Li Ping replied frankly.

Seeing Li Ping's honest demeanor, Mo Rubbin seemed to lose interest. His tone immediately returned to normal.

"Only the power of a True Immortal can contend with a True Immortal."

"The one who caused the catastrophe of the Abyssal Star Sea was a True Immortal who attained enlightenment. Then, what could provide enough impetus for the Xuanhuang Realm to escape…"

"Naturally, it would be another True Immortal."

As he spoke, it was like a thunderclap, resounding in the mind of the faceless Sacred Emperor.

The surrounding darkness seemed to come alive, all of it peering at him.

"A True Immortal is indeed a True Immortal."

"Just a dead True Immortal. Am I right?"

However, the Sacred Emperor, having suddenly learned such a secret, seemed to have anticipated it.

He asked back calmly.

Mo Rubbin shrugged: "It's boring talking to smart people like you."

"That's right. The foundation of the entire Dark Sea is the transformed remains of a True Immortal."

Li Ping felt no surprise at this outcome.

The Dark Sea could absorb the faith of the Netherfolk and convert it into the essence of primal force, yet it did not care if its believers changed their faith.

Once the True Immortal's Net was formed, it existed in reality and was not subject to will.

Once trapped in the net, escape was impossible unless one could unleash power capable of tearing apart the True Immortal's Net.

Those weak Netherfolk naturally lacked such ability. The only plausible explanation was that the owner of the True Immortal's Net had perished.

The restraint was gone.

"True Immortal," Li Ping repeated the two words.

"A True Immortal who perished in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It's quite magical. For a mere lower realm to have a True Immortal perish here. But it's fortunate that the Xuanhuang Realm hides the corpse of a True Immortal, otherwise, even the cleverest cook cannot prepare a meal without ingredients. Brother Xuanyuan would have no good way to save the Xuanhuang Realm," Mo Rubbin said with some emotion.

Li Ping, in turn, introduced the existence of the Fallen Immortal Realm to Mo Rubbin.

"Oh. I didn't expect there to be a successor Heavenly Venerate willing to share this lingering thought of a True Immortal with the world." Mo Rubbin's aura suddenly became unstable again after hearing this.

"It's hard to imagine there are people in this world even more foolish than Brother Xuanyuan. Truly…"

"He has long since perished," Li Ping added.

Mo Rubbin instantly returned to a state of calm.

After a long while, he finally said, "Good that he died. So good…"

Although he said this, for some reason, Li Ping felt a hint of sadness in his expression.

So Li Ping asked the question he had always wanted to ask: "Has King Xuanyuan really died, or not?"

Mo Rubbin turned his head and stared blankly at Li Ping: "You ask me, who do I ask? Perhaps he hasn't died. I'm looking for him too. Someone as strong as Brother Xuanyuan, even if ambushed by a villain, wouldn't just perish like this."

After saying this, without giving Li Ping a chance to continue the conversation, he turned back.

"The Dark Sea is based on the [Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation], with the remains of a True Immortal as its bones, and the bloodline of the first Great Heavenly Venerate as its binding. It was created from nothing, nurturing a power sufficient to resist the suction of a True Immortal."

"But after all, it is merely dead matter. Without the control core, it has become sustenance for others."

"Therefore, don't die. Even if you were a True Immortal in life, what of it? After death, even ants can torment you."

Mo Rubbin gazed at the device the Myriad Immortals Alliance was using to draw power from the Dark Sea again, his tone filled with mockery.

"The bloodline of the first Great Heavenly Venerate?" Li Ping's mind flashed with the peculiar appearance of the Netherfolk, and his heart stirred.

"No wonder, only these people can communicate with the Dark Sea. However…"

The bloodline of a True Immortal's direct descendant was undoubtedly noble. But now they had become this strange, neither human nor ghost appearance.

Mo Rubbin seemed to read Li Ping's thoughts and said coldly, "There's no need to pity these people. If you had lived in that era and personally experienced how the Great Heavenly Venerate's bloodline enslaved others…"

"You would probably be the first to rebel."

"If it weren't for Brother Xuanyuan's intervention back then, annihilating all their claws and teeth, these people on top wouldn't have been able to act so high and mighty for how much longer. Their current state can be considered their good fortune," Mo Rubbin said with a cold laugh.

Li Ping did not argue with Mo Rubbin on this issue.

"The Dark Sea, in reality, uses the True Immortal's remains to condense dark immortal power to resist the Immortal Ruins. What exactly is that eyeball controlled by the Myriad Immortals Alliance?" he asked softly.

"Immortal Ruins…" Seemingly disagreeing with the term, Mo Rubbin sneered again.

However, this time he did not dwell on such minor details but directly answered Li Ping's question: "That is merely a magical artifact refined by Brother Xuanyuan back then to control the Dark Sea. After all, he couldn't watch over it all the time, and the Dark Sea was too important in the entire escape plan, so he asked for our assistance. There were three of them in total, each handed over to a different Law King."

"I just don't know whose it is that the Myriad Immortals Alliance has," Mo Rubbin's words carried a hint of killing intent.

Li Ping nodded slightly: "Is there a way to influence the control of that eyeball artifact over the Dark Sea?"

"If your mastery of formations surpasses Brother Xuanyuan's…"

"Hmm?"

Mo Rubbin was about to mock him when he suddenly recalled the level of formation mastery displayed by the Sacred Emperor during their previous encounter.

The words he was about to speak got stuck in his throat.

"Perhaps within the central array core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, one could try," Mo Rubbin said.

His gaze shifted away from the rift in the Dark Sea to another direction.

Li Ping followed his gaze and sighed, "This formation is truly wondrous. I consider my mastery of formations to be extraordinary, yet in this darkness, I cannot perceive any trace of formation principles."

"That's the effect of the True Immortal's remains," Mo Rubbin corrected Li Ping's statement without courtesy. "If it weren't for the dispersed power of the True Immortal's remains, you might have succeeded."

The Sacred Emperor was momentarily speechless.

"Follow me."

Mo Rubbin called out, then a little bit of discernment, his figure turned into a black line and disappeared into the darkness.

Li Ping followed closely.

As they approached the so-called core of the Dark Sea, for some reason, Li Ping suddenly felt an inexplicable unease surge within him.

Even some fuzzy images flashed through his mind.

Among them was the scene of Mo Rubbin's body, reduced to an empty shell, lying quietly in the Dark Sea.

"Wait!"

A shiver ran down his spine. Li Ping called out to stop Mo Rubbin.

"Hmm?" Although somewhat displeased, Mo Rubbin still stopped temporarily.

"You better have something important to discuss."

Li Ping paid no mind to the other's attitude. After a moment of thought, he said, "What kind of power could instantly kill you?"

As if hearing a ridiculously funny joke, faces flew out from Mo Rubbin's body and came before Li Ping, shouting loudly.

"Instantly kill me? As long as the demonic heart is not extinguished and the immortal body is not destroyed, as long as one personality remains, I will not truly die!"

"Even a True Immortal…"

"A True Immortal could do it," Mo Rubbin's true form suddenly said. The noisy faces instantly fell silent.

"Actually, with Brother Xuanyuan's strength, he could also achieve it with careful planning against an unprepared opponent."

Mo Rubbin's true form analyzed very rationally. "I feel something is not right with the formation core ahead."

Upon hearing Mo Rubbin's conclusion, Li Ping directly expressed his concern.

Unexpectedly, Mo Rubbin did not refute him this time.

He suddenly said something seemingly irrelevant: "The entire Dark Sea is built upon the corpse of a True Immortal."

"In our era, this place was far from as vast as it is now. It seems the Great Heavenly Venerate bloodline has proliferated well in recent years."

"Hmm… although there's been a slight shrinking trend recently, it doesn't affect the overall picture."

"Spirit Gathering, Ascension. Ascension, Spirit Gathering. In essence, this place can also be seen as an ownerless True Immortal's body that has been cultivating for nearly ten thousand years. Its body is entirely filled with pure True Immortal power."
