"It's just that… this True Immortal power was cultivated from the True Immortal's remains. So, theoretically, only that deceased True Immortal could use it."

"Theoretically," Mo Rubbin repeated the three words.

"But there are countless profound techniques in the world. Who knows if there's a method that can break this restriction."

The faceless Sacred Emperor gazed into the boundless Dark Sea: "With such immense energy, if one could control it, perhaps they could instantly unleash power comparable to a True Immortal."

"A child lifting a cauldron will be crushed by the cauldron," Mo Rubbin shattered Li Ping's fantasy.

He continued to walk towards the core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

"I'm wondering if it's possible that Brother Xuanyuan, after being seriously injured, hid here."

"If there's anyone in the Xuanhuang Realm most likely to absorb the power of this Dark Sea, it would undoubtedly be him."

As if talking to himself, or perhaps explaining to Li Ping why he insisted on going there despite the danger.

"It's alright. With me by your side, if we encounter any danger, escaping shouldn't be a problem for the two of us working together," Li Ping said frankly, following closely behind.

"What a fool. That's why good people die quickly," Mo Rubbin said, unimpressed by Li Ping's good intentions, as if taunting him.

Li Ping's attention was focused on their surroundings.

The darkness converged here, becoming even denser. Knowing that this darkness was the power of a True Immortal's corpse, Li Ping felt a completely different sensation within it compared to before.

However, what he found strange was that Mao Bao, who was always greedy for immortal-grade energy, seemed to have no reaction to such immense energy at this moment.

It continued to sleep soundly on his shoulder.

Without even opening its eyes.

"Interesting," Li Ping's vigilance increased in his heart.

Not long after, Mo Rubbin stopped.

"This should be it," he said, looking around.

"This should be it?" Li Ping was puzzled.

Such ambiguous words should not come from Mo Rubbin, a Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect.

"Someone has been here. And they have modified the formation," Mo Rubbin's tone became unprecedentedly solemn. Li Ping could also detect a hint of anticipation and excitement within it.

However, after looking around, he then looked at Li Ping.

"This formation is a bit complex."

The implication was that he wanted the Sacred Emperor's help.

Li Ping shook his head: "The power of the True Immortal's remains permeates everywhere, I cannot sense any trace of the formation."

Mo Rubbin snorted: "Watch closely!"

A shadowy face instantly flew out from his body towards Li Ping.

Li Ping did not sense any malice, so he did not dodge.

This shadowy demonic face of Mo Rubbin, with a mischievous intent, moved and attached itself to Li Ping's blank face.

Before he could express his displeasure, Li Ping was drawn to the spectacular sight that suddenly lit up before him.

The pitch-black, silent Dark Sea suddenly shed its mysterious veil.

Revealing its true appearance hidden beneath.

Like thick clouds accumulated in the sky, they evolved into various forms. Dark energy gathered in patches. Li Ping and Mo Rubbin seemed to be standing high in the sky, in a kingdom of clouds.

The aggregations of dark energy moved slowly yet incredibly quickly. As they approached each other, they mutually consumed and reshaped into new forms.

And in the very center of the Dark Sea, the most ancient dark clouds, which had settled for tens of thousands of years, emanated an aura that made Li Ping's heart tremble.

These ancient aggregations were like terrifying ancient beasts, quietly resting in the depths of the Dark Sea.

"As expected of the power of a True Immortal. The bursts of energy contained within each of these cloud-like entities here far exceed the full might attack of a Longevity realm cultivator."

"What divine power!" Li Ping marveled in his heart.

Li Ping also noticed that the Myriad Immortals Alliance's device for drawing dark energy was actually absorbing the scattered cloud-like masses floating throughout the Dark Sea.

Furthermore, the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to be able to differentiate the size of the cloud masses, not daring to touch the larger aggregations. Their targets were mostly concentrated on the smaller, scattered individual entities.

"You can see clearly now, can't you?" Mo Rubbin's voice interrupted Li Ping's thoughts.

Li Ping snapped out of his shock and looked again.

Indeed, around these aggregations, he discovered faint traces of formations.

However, before attempting to decipher them, Li Ping first asked a question.

"In my previous deductions, the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation is composed of four secondary formations."

"A golden chain used to lock and capture immortal cultivation worlds beyond the star sea; the Tian Beast Eye serving as an observation post; the Dark Sea, which is the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, used to escape the suction of the Immortal Ruins. What is the remaining one?"

With Mo Rubbin's demonic face acting as a conduit, Li Ping stared directly at Mo Rubbin's true form.

Mo Rubbin shrugged and replied with practiced ease: "How would I know that?"

"The Grand Ascension Formation was almost entirely built by Brother Xuanyuan himself. We only had the chance to get close and see it after he completed its construction. Different Law Kings were responsible for different regions. I'm just familiar with this area."

Li Ping found no flaws in Mo Rubbin's words.

However, he did not easily believe him.

Putting aside this matter for now, Li Ping focused on analyzing the formation here.

After all, he genuinely wished to personally meet the legendary King Xuanyuan.

"The formation is quite old, and its style deviates from the traditions of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It seems to have traces of being triggered. Did a battle occur here?"

"It can only be considered an anomaly. It's not particularly complex. It doesn't even meet the threshold of an immortal-grade formation."

After observing for a while, Li Ping came to this conclusion.

"Will casting spells here cause the Dark Sea's power to riot?" Before breaking the formation, Li Ping cautiously asked Mo Rubbin.

Mo Rubbin, to no one's surprise, scoffed: "Have you ascended to the True Immortal realm? Don't worry about such trivial matters."

"If you could trigger the True Immortal power here to riot, the first thing I would do is flee immediately."

With Mo Rubbin's reply, Li Ping had no more reservations.

Hidden formation patterns unfolded before his eyes, intertwining and decomposing.

Before long, Li Ping found the flaw in this formation.

"Let's go this way."

He led the way in, without triggering the formation's counter-measures.

"So quick, you've got some skills," Mo Rubbin praised, a rare occurrence.

The scene within the formation seemed the same as before entering.

However, judging by Mo Rubbin's expression, they had not taken a wrong turn.

"This is the original core array location of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation."

Following Mo Rubbin's words, Li Ping swept his gaze around.

The ancient, dark energy aggregations from the outside world were absorbed here.

Transforming into wisps of ethereal smoke and disappearing.

"There's no residual True Immortal power; the essence of the energy is deeper within the formation," Li Ping mused thoughtfully.

"The power-driving component of the Ascension Formation, once sealed, cannot be re-entered. However, the main control area is not sealed."

"Be careful." Mo Rubbin, as if familiar with the path, continued to lead them deeper inside.

Li Ping, walking alongside, observed his surroundings, committing every detail of the formation to memory.

Although only a small portion of the formation was exposed, with his current level of formation mastery, he could infer the origin of the formation by observing a small part.

"Interesting, there are traces of a battle."

Mo Rubbin, who was leading the way, suddenly stopped ahead.

He pointed to a corner of the formation.

Li Ping also discerned a sword light from the slightly damaged traces of the formation.

"Longevity Realm," Li Ping judged, suddenly becoming vigilant.

"And not a weak Longevity Realm cultivator," Mo Rubbin added.

With that, he quickened his pace and continued to move inward.

From a visual perspective, their positions seemed unchanged.

The ancient aggregations above, below, to the left, and to the right remained still relative to their positions.

But Li Ping could clearly feel that, even with the aid of Mo Rubbin's demonic face, the surroundings were becoming increasingly dark.

"Depths of the Dark Sea."

The familiar, all-encompassing blackness returned.

Compared to the darkness of the outer areas, this was even more suffocating.

Li Ping felt that the operation of his own cultivation was being obstructed. Even the essence of primal force was not exempt.

As the darkness swallowed the last hint of light, and he could only dimly perceive his surroundings through Mo Rubbin's demonic face,

Li Ping suddenly felt Mo Rubbin in front of him stop moving.

A cold aura faintly emanated.

Li Ping slowly approached and discovered the reason for Mo Rubbin's stillness.

Not far ahead, a skeleton lay quietly.

Or, perhaps, "an empty shell" would be a more fitting description.

It was impossible to tell how long it had been dead, yet its face was still lifelike. The terror and disbelief on the person's face at the moment of their demise were clearly visible.

And its seemingly full body was, in reality, hollowed out within.

Nothing remained.

"Longevity Realm," Mo Rubbin communicated with Li Ping through the attached demonic face.

"And his clothing looks a bit familiar," Mo Rubbin suddenly felt a surge of killing intent.

"Fang Dingge, from the Great Dao Sect."

After carefully observing for a while, Li Ping identified the person from the records of the Genesis Stone Slab.

"So it's here," Li Ping realized with sudden clarity.

At the same time, his sense of vigilance heightened as never before.

"Who are you?" Mo Rubbin asked concisely.

"The sect leader of the Great Dao Sect, thousands of years after your era, during the Great Tribulation."

"To pursue the Dharma-Preachers, the creators of the current Myriad Immortals Alliance, six Longevity Realm experts attacked simultaneously, but all vanished without a trace. Neither seen alive nor dead. And the Doctrine Transmitter survived."

"At that time, the Doctrine Transmitter was only at the Dao Integration realm," Li Ping briefly explained the background to Mo Rubbin.

"Six Longevity Realm experts died here?" Mo Rubbin was no longer calm.

He retreated slightly, his expression solemn.

"I hope it's not what I think," Mo Rubbin muttered after a long pause.

"Did the Doctrine Transmitter use the power of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation to kill those six Longevity Realm experts?" Li Ping asked.

"If that's the case, it would be the best outcome," Mo Rubbin's faint voice drifted over.

"I'm afraid the True Immortal's remains have come alive."

Chapter 1278: World Destruction for Survival (7K, seeking follows, seeking monthly votes)

"I'm just afraid that the True Immortal's remains will come back to life."

As Mo Rubbin uttered these words, whether it was Li Ping's illusion or not, the depths of this Sea of Darkness seemed to grow even colder. It was as if an unknown entity had suddenly focused its gaze upon him, sending a chill through his heart.

The Sacred Sovereign surveyed his surroundings with a grave expression but found no lurking presence. Li Ping then turned his gaze back to Fang Ding'ge's husk from the Grand Dao Sect and asked, "After becoming this way, can it still come back to life?"

Li Ping was naturally not asking about Fang Ding'ge, but about the True Immortal whose immortal body had transformed into the Sea of Darkness and whose consciousness had become the Fallen Immortal Realm.

Mo Rubbin also examined the corpse not far away and said softly, "Let me tell you a story."

"Our Nine Refinements Observation once enshrined an Ancestor statue, said to have been personally crafted by the Nine Refinements Ancestor, Master Wonderful Law, for himself. This statue was worshipped for thousands of years. If disciples had any doubts on the path of cultivation, as long as they prayed to it with sincerity, most would receive a response from the unseen. Thus, for many years, the incense never ceased.

"Then one day, tribulation clouds suddenly enveloped the sky above Nine Refinements Observation, and divine lightning struck down, its target the Ancestor statue! A figure burst forth from the stone statue and soared into the heavens! This person's strength was terrifying; the nine heavens' divine lightning, capable of instantly killing those in the Dao Integration realm, could not harm him. He laughed unceasingly amidst the lightning, on the verge of enduring the tribulation and ascending..."

Li Ping frowned again, "Who was the figure within the stone statue?"

The scene before them suddenly shifted. The high and mighty watchtower seemed to be plummeting at an incredible speed.

"Look at this Sea of Darkness, and you can imagine how powerful He was in life. To put it plainly, do not use our cultivator's perspective to speculate on the methods of **Immortals**. The difference is truly immense!"

Mo Rubbin gave a cold laugh, "You'll know when you see it."

After hearing this somewhat mystical story, Li Ping couldn't help but frown slightly.

*Boom!*

The surrounding landscape changed, as if they had left the Sea of Darkness and arrived at a new, unknown location.

Mo Rubbin asked, "Guess, of these two who ascended together, which one is our Nine Refinements Observation's ancestor?"

The scene of the Sea of Darkness below rapidly approached and magnified.

"Then should we continue to go deeper? Fang Ding'ge's tragic death doesn't look like something an ordinary cultivator could do," Li Ping changed the subject.

"Master Wonderful Law ascended to immortality for only a year, with no substantial foundation to speak of, yet he could be reborn through the stone statue. Not to mention that True Immortal."

Mo Rubbin chuckled, "He was the third-generation sect leader of our Nine Refinements Observation. This person disregarded the Ancestor's last words and wanted to establish his own rules. After a period of internal strife, he was seriously injured and disappeared. Who would have thought he had been hiding within the Ancestor statue all along, cultivating all the way to the point of ascension?"

After waiting for a long time, finding no one hurrying him, he swallowed his impatience and continued, "The fragments of the Ancestor's stone statue that were scattered on the ground actually reassembled silently. They approached the person undergoing the tribulation. Before he could react, they swallowed him back into the stone statue!"

Mo Rubbin's voice echoed in his mind, and Li Ping felt a little more at ease as he looked around.

Mo Rubbin paused again at a critical juncture.

The central control hub, though located in the deepest part of the darkness, appeared like a transparent observation deck.

He felt that there were inaccuracies in the story about Master Wonderful Law's rebirth through the stone statue and the conflict involving the third-generation sect leader of Nine Refinements Observation.

Mo Rubbin smiled slightly, "You are wrong!"

With the combined efforts of Li Ping and Mo Rubbin, after considerable effort, they finally reached the control hub of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

"One piece of good news and one piece of bad news. Which do you want to hear first?" Mo Rubbin asked.

"It is clearly recorded that Nine Refinements Observation's Ancestor, Master Wonderful Law, ascended to immortality in full view of everyone. However, only the successive sect leaders of Nine Refinements Observation knew that Master Wonderful Law died for unknown reasons in the second year after entering the Immortal Realm!"

Li Ping pondered for a moment and replied, "The figure in the stone statue had to face the ascension tribulation. He should be the one? He couldn't ascend in life, so he was worshipped by his disciple in the form of a stone statue, accumulating power for thousands of years and attempting to ascend..."

"This way, no matter how that figure struggled, it could not escape the embrace of the stone statue. And the stone statue, along with that figure, shattered the void and ascended!"

They passed through three formation checkpoints, some belonging to the original Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, and others set up later.

"Let's go in and take a look. If the True Immortal has already resurrected, after so many years, he definitely wouldn't still be in the same spot," Mo Rubbin said, bypassing Fang Ding'ge's remains and continuing to descend into the darkness.

Mo Rubbin continued with satisfaction, "However, the stone statue he personally crafted had a contingency left behind by him. Even if his divine soul was annihilated in the Upper Realm, he could be reborn through this stone statue!"

Through the solidified formation barrier surrounding them, which resembled panoramic glass, Li Ping and Mo Rubbin gained a clear view of the entire Sea of Darkness.

It surged into their vision suddenly, reaching into the depths of their souls.

"The good news is that the True Immortal who perished did not resurrect through his remains," Mo Rubbin said with a low voice.

Along the way, they did not find the remains of the other four fallen Great Lengths.

His expression changed slightly. However, this was an ancient secret, and now was not the time to investigate deeply while in danger.

"Yet, it was all in vain, a dress made for someone else."

Li Ping remained silent.

"What about the bad news?"

Perhaps because they had communicated for a while, Mo Rubbin's emotions had stabilized considerably, and he spoke with feeling.

Li Ping was stunned to hear this.

After a moment of silence, Li Ping responded, "Tell me the good news first."

Li Ping slowly walked to Mo Rubbin's position. Even after being magnified countless times, the human-like silhouette of the Sea of Darkness was still clearly visible.

"Don't move."

Mo Rubbin had clearly been here before. He was not distracted by the magnificent scene before him but walked to the center of the observation deck.

He saw the other four fallen Great Lengths. They maintained the posture of their final moments, but unlike Fang Ding'ge, their faces were covered in a layer of ash, making their features unrecognizable. One could only vaguely discern their struggle to resist the terrifying force that was devouring them.

Li Ping attempted to find the culprit responsible for the fall of these five Great Lengths. Gray vines extending from beneath the feet of the four Great Lengths' husks, intertwining and spreading, caught Li Ping's attention. In Li Ping's observation, these gray vines were devoid of any life aura, merely a collection of pure energy—lifeless objects. Yet, for some reason, when he faced them, Li Ping felt like he was being stared at by a venomous snake.

"What is this?" Li Ping asked without hesitation, as he had no psychological barriers to asking questions when he didn't understand.

"This is the **will to survive**. The True Immortal's remains' will to survive."

It took Mo Rubbin a while to slowly answer Li Ping's question.

"True Immortals cannot be judged by ordinary standards. When Brother Xuanyuan was modifying the True Immortal's remains, he had concerns about this. To prevent its resurrection, he made numerous arrangements. Who would have thought..."

Although Li Ping could not see Mo Rubbin's figure, he could sense Mo Rubbin's intense gaze fixed upon the pervasive gray **will to survive** here.

"Logically speaking, the True Immortal's remains, which have already transformed into the Sea of Darkness, should not be able to generate such a strong will to survive."

Hearing Mo Rubbin's words, Li Ping also seemed to fall into thought, "Unless someone deliberately provoked it."

"Precisely. This person is not simple," Mo Rubbin commented.

"Firstly, his ability to break through Brother Xuanyuan's seals is not simple. Secondly, his ability to provoke the True Immortal's consciousness is not simple. Thirdly, after provoking the will to survive, he was able to retreat unscathed... Remarkable," Mo Rubbin praised without any hint of admiration in his tone.

"Do not underestimate these things. Even if the two of us were to be targeted by them carelessly, we would likely not escape death. We would end up no different from these five empty husks."

Li Ping frowned slightly. He still had some confidence in his own strength.

Mo Rubbin did not argue with Li Ping but continued to explain in a low voice, "The will to survive of someone who has already died being reignited. It's like grabbing onto the last straw of hope, and the resulting burst of power..."

"It instinctively devours everything living that it can come into contact with, converting it into sustenance for its own resurrection. Only someone of Brother Xuanyuan's strength could barely resist. Although we appear strong, we are still far from it."

Li Ping fell silent.

Mo Rubbin continued, "Fortunately, the person who provoked this did not destroy Brother Xuanyuan's arrangements. This **will to survive**, after draining the four Great Lengths, could no longer find any objects to absorb, and thus fell back into a state of deathly stillness."

"If it were allowed to escape the Sea of Darkness..."

"The entire Xuanhuang Realm would likely become its meal."

Li Ping's expression immediately became solemn.

"But then again, Brother Xuanyuan's methods are not easily broken. This person who provoked it, whom you referred to as the Doctrine Transmitter, did not directly destroy the seals of the Sea of Darkness. He didn't even change them, but added his own methods."

"However... possessing the array control artifact and being completely familiar with the seals here, he could move freely," Mo Rubbin seemed to recall something, and his aura suddenly became unstable.

"Let's get to work first," just as Li Ping was worried that Mo Rubbin might descend into madness and lose control, Mo Rubbin instantly became calm again.

He transmitted a large amount of information into Li Ping's mind.

"This is... the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation?" Li Ping recognized its intricacies at a glance.

"Strictly speaking, it is the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation modified by Brother Xuanyuan. The original version of the Ascension Formation was created by a demonic cultivator of great power. Heh heh, this one was a truly peerless and ferocious demon. He was born into humble origins, and his innate cultivation talent was insufficient, reaching his limit at the Golden Core stage. However, he stubbornly created this malevolent formation. Once the formation enveloped an area, everything within would be refined into the purest energy."

"He first targeted mortal pocket worlds, starting weak and growing stronger, causing the extinction of countless beings in worlds before finally ascending to the Immortal Realm. The first thing he did after arriving in the Immortal Realm was to improve the formation and intended to repeat his scheme in the Immortal Realm. Hmph, even such a person died like a fly during the calamity in the Immortal Realm. All the treasures he accumulated in his lifetime were gifted to Brother Xuanyuan. However, Brother Xuanyuan found his inheritance quite distasteful..." Mo Rubbin said with a cold laugh.

"Such a ferocious and violent person could also attain Dao and become an immortal? Were the heavenly tribulations in his world different from those in the Xuanhuang Realm?" Li Ping asked with a frown. In Li Ping's memory, in the Xuanhuang Realm, the difficulty of the heavenly tribulations faced by such wicked individuals during their ascension was more than dozens of times greater than usual, making successful ascension virtually impossible. Hence, he asked.

"No matter how strong the heavenly tribulations are, they have their limits in the lower realm. As long as you are stronger than it, it's enough. Moreover, good and evil are not absolute..."

Li Ping could clearly feel that as Mo Rubbin spoke, he was again falling into a state of bewilderment.

"What do you need me to do?" Li Ping timely diverted Mo Rubbin's attention.

"Your formation attainment should not be much weaker than Brother Xuanyuan's. The control hub of this Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation cannot be moved rashly. If possible, reinforce it with another layer of formation, pushing it further into the depths of the Sea of Darkness. Then, sever the connection between the array control artifact held by the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the grand formation." Mo Rubbin said this after regaining his composure.

Li Ping nodded, observing the formation's details around him while comparing it with the ascension formation diagram that appeared in his mind.

"As expected of the Heavenly Mysteries King, he is truly the most exceptionally talented person in the Xuanhuang Realm for ten thousand years." As a fellow formation master, Li Ping felt a sense of camaraderie upon perceiving the brilliance of this formation.

The essence of primal force from the prayers of the Netherfolk, after being absorbed and transformed by the Sea of Darkness, which was the True Immortal's remains, coalesced in the depths of the formation. It appeared to be a random accumulation, but Li Ping could vaguely perceive that, through some means, this power, which could contend with a True Immortal, could erupt instantaneously. This was to propel the Xuanhuang Realm away from the control of the True Immortals of the Immortal Ruins.

"To use a mortal formation to control the power of a True Immortal, truly remarkable." Li Ping did not find any trace of the Xuanhuang Realm's original grand formation within the formation in the Sea of Darkness. This formation was likely exclusively crafted by the Heavenly Mysteries King. His profound formation skills were evident even in the True Immortal's demise.

"Reinforcing the formation requires some auxiliary materials..." Li Ping deliberated after observing for a while.

"I have them here," Mo Rubbin immediately replied. As if prepared, he produced a pile of materials as soon as they returned to the formation hub from their hiding place within the **will to survive**. Li Ping quickly scanned them; they were all necessary for reinforcing the formation.

"Don't look at me like that. I'm borrowing your face, remember?" "As the Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, it's normal for me to carry resources for a comeback even when fleeing for my life, right?" "Speaking of which, why are you also faceless? Do you have something to do with that True Immortal who saved Brother Xuanyuan back then? I'm a timid person, don't scare me..."

Li Ping ignored Mo Rubbin's nonsensical ramblings and began to focus on setting up the formation. With the Heavenly Mysteries King's previous example as a reference, Li Ping merely had to follow suit, which was not a difficult task for him. As the formation slowly took shape, their "observation deck" seemed to rise higher and higher.

Mo Rubbin nodded with great satisfaction. After Li Ping finished, he produced another pile of materials.

"Let's deepen it further. Completely press the True Immortal's **will to survive** into the depths of the Sea of Darkness." Li Ping agreed with this suggestion. Without complaint, he continued his work. After the materials were exhausted, the scene of the Sea of Darkness in their vision had shrunk to half its original size.

"This way, it should be safe enough. Unless someone deliberately disturbs it," Mo Rubbin said softly, standing beside Li Ping and looking down at the Sea of Darkness.

"This concerns the safety of the Xuanhuang Realm, so it's better to be cautious. I will set up another defensive formation here." This was not a request for Mo Rubbin's opinion but a notification of a decided action.

Mo Rubbin shrugged, "As you wish. After so many years, no one has come to this cursed place except us. Who are you setting up formations to guard against? If that **will to survive** truly breaks free from its cage, your formations will be utterly inadequate."

Li Ping ignored Mo Rubbin's sarcasm and very seriously added his strongest sealing formation, which he could currently deploy.

"Alright, next, we sever the Myriad Immortals Alliance's reaching hand," Mo Rubbin urged after Li Ping finished.

"The amount of dark energy being extracted now is limited. If the Sea of Darkness shrinks to a certain extent, the **will to survive** might sense the vibrant Xuanhuang Realm outside. The scene then is unimaginable." When Li Ping reinforced the formation here, he had noticed two extending, intermittently appearing thread-like existences within the formation hub. He didn't know where they led.

"Sever the connection between both array control artifacts and the hub?" Li Ping looked at Mo Rubbin.

"The other one, he's probably dead already. Let it be severed then," Mo Rubbin nodded after a moment of silence.

Li Ping then proceeded to modify the formation hub. The process went smoothly. The Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation let out a soft hum and then seemed to restart. It first dimmed slightly, then became brighter.

Li Ping stood at the formation hub, sensing the cut made by the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the Sea of Darkness.

*Boom! Boom!*

Cloud masses rolled, stirring up waves of invisible energy. They swept up the "clouds" drifting within the Sea of Darkness, growing larger and larger. When they reached the gaping wound, they had transformed into cataclysmic tsunamis. They violently crashed upon the Myriad Immortals Alliance's device.

Dozens of diligent Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, who were supervising the extraction of dark energy, were silently swallowed. They vanished without a trace.

In the violent tremors, the rift began to close. Faced with this drastic change, the Myriad Immortals Alliance did not intend to give up. As the closing fissure reappeared, the eye-shaped array control artifact manifested again. A golden abacus rapidly moved, attempting to turn the tide. However, this time, it was rendered ineffective. They could only watch helplessly as the rift in the Sea of Darkness healed.

The dust settled. Li Ping and Mo Rubbin watched this scene in silence. Although it took some effort, their goal of severing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's extraction of dark energy was achieved. Furthermore, they had learned many secrets of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect from ancient times.

Li Ping felt a sense of peace in his heart. He felt his connection to the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao growing stronger. However, he also knew clearly that being able to so easily mobilize the power of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation was not only due to his formidable formation skills but also, more importantly, to Mo Rubbin's assistance. Without the formation diagrams he transmitted, breaking through the Heavenly Mysteries King's seals would not have been possible in a short period. Even more crucially, Mo Rubbin's transformed demonic face attached to his own proved invaluable. It was precisely because of this face that they could move unhindered in the deepest part of the Sea of Darkness, and even when modifying key structures of the formation, they were not attacked or repelled by the grand formation. In a sense, Mo Rubbin's face had a higher clearance than those two eye-shaped array control artifacts.

"Among the Twelve Law Kings of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect back then, what was your rank in terms of strength?" Li Ping suddenly asked.

Mo Rubbin froze for a moment. Then he sneered, "To tell you the truth, among the twelve, my strength was considered the weakest. You can barely defeat me, but you wouldn't be able to defeat the others."

Li Ping naturally didn't believe him. Mo Rubbin snorted, "Our era was full of talents. Peerless prodigies, like carp crossing a river, were countless. It was an undisputed golden age of cultivation!" "If not for the sudden severing of the immortal path, and the dense emergence of many ascenders in a short period, it wouldn't have been impossible."

Li Ping fell silent. According to the Creation Stone Slab's records, the information related to those who ascended to immortality had all been erased, so he could not verify the truth of Mo Rubbin's words. However, based on their actions before joining the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, Mo Rubbin's words might be exaggerated, but they did align with certain facts.

"If all of you were so strong, how did the Myriad Immortal Sects win back then?" "Even without the Heavenly Mysteries King, wouldn't it be difficult for the ten of you to defeat the Myriad Immortal Sects?" Li Ping asked the question that had been weighing on his mind for a long time.

"Hmph," Mo Rubbin snorted directly. After a long silence, he said vaguely, "In any case, we lost, and we won't deny it. Those people from the Myriad Immortal Sects were not to be trifled with." "And..." Mo Rubbin's tone suddenly turned incredibly sinister. "Someone faked the act, suddenly switched sides, and we couldn't identify the traitor, so no one dared to trust anyone. Coupled with Brother Xuanyuan's inexplicable disappearance..." "Each of them considered their talent no less than Xuanyuan Hong's, merely succumbing to unfavorable circumstances and failing to ascend at the opportune moment. When the crisis truly arrived, they realized that without Brother Xuanyuan leading them, they were simply a mob." "On the other hand, the Myriad Immortal Sects were fighting for their lives, knowing that if they failed, death would await them." "..." Mo Rubbin suddenly burst into laughter, "But I've come to terms with it now. As the saying goes, the Heavenly Dao is fair. Didn't the Myriad Immortal Sects also get wiped out by this Myriad Immortals Alliance later? Hahahaha! Serves them right!" "Well done, Xuanhuang Realm!" Mo Rubbin patted Li Ping's shoulder in praise.

"Actually, the core figures of the Myriad Immortal Sects are probably still alive," Li Ping suddenly said. "They are just in seclusion and not revealing themselves."

Mo Rubbin's hand gripping Li Ping's shoulder tightened abruptly. "Hmph,哼哼..." After suddenly receiving this news, Mo Rubbin did not fly into a rage but instead began to laugh more and more unrestrainedly. "So they didn't die? Even better that they didn't die." "This way, I can exact my revenge personally. After so many years, they probably won't be as united as they were back then."

Mo Rubbin flashed away from Li Ping's side, his figure suddenly darkening considerably.

"It's time to leave." "I originally planned to find Brother Xuanyuan, but through a twist of fate, I ended up coming here first. But that's fine, at least one wrong answer has been eliminated."

Li Ping felt the demonic mask on his blank face showing signs of detaching. The surrounding darkness relentlessly encroached, and whispers from the depths of his soul began to erode Li Ping's consciousness. Knowing this was no place to linger, Li Ping returned with Mo Rubbin from the deepest part of the Sea of Darkness.

"Speaking of which, where was your original destination? To the extent that you needed to use that immortal artifact banner?" Li Ping asked.

Mo Rubbin remained silent. As they passed Fang Ding'ge, the sect leader of the Grand Dao Sect's ethereal husk, he suddenly said to Li Ping, "Go and search him. You might find some treasures."

Li Ping gazed at Mo Rubbin. Mo Rubbin rolled his eyes at Li Ping, "This person could resist the devouring of the **will to survive** and only died after fleeing here, which proves his strength. Elite individuals surely have good things on them. This is something Brother Xuanyuan taught me." "Moreover, if he truly had any遗物 (lingering thoughts) that could be preserved under the erosion of the True Immortal's **will to survive**, they would undoubtedly be extraordinary treasures. Are you really not going to try?" Mo Rubbin enticed. Li Ping looked again and finally shook his head slightly. "The deceased has passed. Let him rest here. There are countless treasures in the world, must you search for all of them? Greed leads to self-destruction and invites disaster."

"Calling you stupid, and you really are stupid," Mo Rubbin scoffed. However, he did not search Fang Ding'ge's corpse either, leaving him to lie peacefully in place.

After some travel, the two returned to where they had come from. The white jade flagpole still stood in its original position. However, it had been eroded by dark energy, and the area it illuminated was a full circle smaller than before. "As expected of something that was reforged, a second-hand item, truly worthless," Mo Rubbin criticized without reservation.

"With your interference, I'll have to go find my other arrangements from back then. I don't know if they are still there after all these years. If not, I'll come looking for trouble with you yet!" Mo Rubbin said coldly, looking at Li Ping. Li Ping then summoned the Netherfolk again, reopening the portal to the outside world.

"I can help you search for the Heavenly Mysteries King together." "I need his help." Li Ping said sincerely. Mo Rubbin was the first to fly into the passage, laughing heartily, "You don't actually think that after a trip to the Sea of Darkness with me, I'll completely trust you, do you?" "Back then, the other eleven brothers and sisters, who didn't go through life and death together?" "Experience has taught me that you can't trust anyone!" Mo Rubbin's icy voice gradually grew lighter. By the time Li Ping returned to Nine Mountains Province, Mo Rubbin was nowhere to be found. However, the Sacred Sovereign did not pursue him further. This Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect was not his enemy.

Chapter 1279: Dao Integration Ants Die (7k, please follow and vote monthly)

Regardless of the character of Mo Rubin and the members of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, they were, after all, cultivators born and raised in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The current main conflict in the Xuanhuang Realm was the struggle for sovereignty between cultivators from foreign cultivation realms who had been absorbed for various reasons since the Great Tribulation of the Immortal Realm, and the native cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The most crucial factor in resolving this conflict lay with the Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician.

"As for Mo Rubin, he might even offer help at a critical moment. And as for the Heavenly Mysteries King…"

Based on the clues gathered so far, the Heavenly Mysteries King, Xuanyuan Hong, shared the same ultimate goal as Li Ping: to save the Xuanhuang Realm from its predicament. If he was truly not dead, Li Ping would not mind returning the position of Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate to him.

This journey with Mo Rubin had been immensely rewarding for Li Ping. In addition to unexpectedly mastering an Immortal-grade formation, the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, it was more importantly the severance of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's petty scheme to extract power from the Sea of Darkness.

Without the formation control artifact, with the strength the Myriad Immortals Alliance had openly displayed, they would absolutely be unable to manipulate the Sea of Darkness again. Although the purpose of the Immortal Alliance's theft of the Sea of Darkness's power was still unclear, there was no doubt that by foiling this plan, they had crippled one of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's trump cards.

As for the deepening of the connection with the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao, it seemed to be a superfluous improvement for Li Ping at this point.

Upon returning to the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, Li Ping first went to the treasure vault. He instructed Cat Treasure to replicate each treasure three times using the original body of the Void Binding Ring, ensuring that each item was preserved in triplicate.

"Although the effectiveness of the Ascension Formation will be greatly reduced due to the lack of materials, it should not be difficult to ultimately condense a power equivalent to the essence of primal force."

Therefore, Li Fan knew everything about their actions from beginning to end.

This formation had a similar effect to the Spirit Refining Formation for All Beings. After being improved by the Heavenly Mysteries King, its bloody and malevolent aura had been greatly reduced. Li Ping did not have any objections to it.

"Even if it's an exaggeration, the strength of the Law Kings is indeed terrifying. After all, they have the inheritance of the Immortal Realm as their foundation."

Li Ping believed that in this regard, the Doctrine Transmitter would reach a consensus with him. After all, after thousands of years of mending and patching, the Doctrine Transmitter certainly would not want to see the Xuanhuang Realm destroyed.

"Not only that, but with this Great Formation, we no longer have to rely too heavily on the Netherfolk."

There was no point in arguing about the Azure Nether Orthodoxy. The Xuanhuang Realm's survival was even in question.

"Perhaps this can solve the problem of insufficient essence of primal force."

The connection between the Sacred Emperor's clone and Li Fan's main body once again became tight.

He would think about it in the next life.

The Sacred Emperor then returned to his throne and sat in contemplation.

"The time that can be bought to delay the Faceless True Immortal will be increased by a full threefold!"

And Spirit Refining for All Beings could fuse consciousness, condensing it into an energy capable of resisting True Immortals.

"Spirit Gathering Ascension is powerful, but the efficiency of extracting energy is too low. Refining an entire realm into nothingness would only yield a small amount of immortal power. But if it's integrated into the Spirit Refining Formation for All Beings…"

In reality, someone had already taken the lead and derived the envisioned formation.

"Even the Supreme Sect's highest cultivation technique, the Supreme Primordial Scripture, was forcibly borrowed by him. Myriad Immortal Sects’ treasured collections must have fallen into the Doctrine Transmitter's hands. Not to mention powerful artifacts like the Heavenly Profound Mirror, which even the Myriad Immortal Sects couldn't find, are controlled by him. The Doctrine Transmitter's strength surpasses that of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's Law King."

As for the grievances and entanglements with Mo Rubin.

If the two were combined…

Beneath the Sea of Darkness, they were constantly under the threat of death and destruction.

However, before that, Li Ping focused his attention on the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

If the Doctrine Transmitter was forced out, a battle between the two sides would be inevitable.

Li Ping did not harbor much ill will towards the Doctrine Transmitter.

A question was presented before the Sacred Emperor.

Spirit Gathering Ascension could extract material and transform it into transcendent immortal power.

Formation patterns disintegrated and fused in his mind one by one.

Especially after Mo Rubin placed the demonic mask on the Sacred Emperor, the images perceived by Li Fan's main body became unprecedentedly clear.

"The future battlefield of our decisive battle will surely be the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm," Li Ping thought to himself.

Li Fan rapidly deduced in his mind: "If, before, I had used this formation to sacrifice the beings of a small world…"

It was purely a difference in their standpoints.

The Sacred Emperor's ability to act was beyond question. As soon as the thought arose, he began to deduce it on the spot.

"It can be called making the best use of everything! Material converting into energy, divine consciousness fused and sublimated. Wonderful!"

He had taken to heart Li Fan's words: "Worldly Immortal power is harmful and useless," and "unless absolutely necessary, do not become a True Immortal."

"It seems I still have to personally go to the void beyond the realm. To familiarize myself with the environment of the decisive battle," Li Ping thought.

"The Heavenly Mysteries Sect inherited the legacy of the Immortal Realm; the Myriad Immortal Sects followed Grand Master Tiandu and must have plundered many treasures when they destroyed the Heavenly Mysteries Sect. As for the Doctrine Transmitter…"

Although the Xuanhuang Realm was vast, it could not withstand their torment. Moreover, there were too many strange and unusual things hidden within the Xuanhuang Realm, such as the True Immortal's [Will to Survive] hidden deep within the Sea of Darkness.

If their struggles disturbed these entities…

A brand-new formation was slowly taking shape.

Regardless of his feelings towards Mo Rubin, Li Fan attached great importance to his advice.

"Hmph." Li Ping's gaze flickered, and he forcefully suppressed the emerging thought, returning his attention to the newly birthed formation.

In the Dharma Deduction space, Li Fan's eyes flashed with a strange light as he looked at the deduction results reported by the simulated personality of the Dissolution Disc.

"Although I already knew that many Law Kings of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect were still dormant in various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm, I did not have a precise quantified understanding of their strength. Mo Rubin said he was the weakest among the twelve."

The simulated personality of the Dissolution Disc was still waiting for him to name this Great Formation.

"All things in the world, whether living beings or Spirit Qi, come from the chaos and void."

"Under this formation, all things return to their origin…"

"The name of the formation is [Primordial Void Formation]!"

As Li Fan's thought arose, a chaotic yellow light began to envelop the interior of the Dissolution Disc.

The name [Primordial Void Formation] that Li Fan chose was naturally inspired by the Immortal-grade formation [Profound Origin Spirit Array], which he had glimpsed a little.

Although the imposing aura of the formation names was similar, their actual performance was vastly different.

However, Li Ping was confident that with his continuous reincarnation and strengthening of this Primordial Void Formation, this formation's power would eventually not be inferior to the Profound Origin Spirit Array.

"It's just that this formation is too extreme. I don't think the Sacred Emperor's clone will necessarily agree with me," Li Fan mused to himself.

This trip with the Sacred Emperor had also brought immense gains to Li Fan's main body.

Not only did the Immortal-grade formation personally deployed by the Heavenly Mysteries King provide a large amount of data supplementation for the Dissolution Disc, but Li Fan's eyes also turned red with envy at the True Immortal's [Will to Survive], which Mo Rubin and the Sacred Emperor had been trying to avoid, and the power of darkness that had accumulated over tens of thousands of years in the Sea of Darkness.

Compared to them, who could only live for one lifetime, Li Fan would have ample time and sufficient trial-and-error costs in the future to transform these secrets for his own use.

The prerequisite was…

To survive smoothly.

"Although Mo Rubin is somewhat detestable, everything he says makes a lot of sense."

In this lifetime, by staying in seclusion in the Dharma Deduction space, he had ample time to digest these gains.

…

The fate of the Xuanhuang Realm was decided by individuals who had experienced earth-shattering events in just a few short days. However, the common people within the Xuanhuang Realm were completely unaware of this.

The same was true within the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The Sea of Darkness had a very high level of confidentiality, and only a select few Dharma-Preachers were aware of the matter. They were currently gathered together to discuss countermeasures.

The most discussed topic among the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance at this moment was the message from the multicolored light beyond the realm.

More than three months had passed since the multicolored light, carrying dozens of Dao Integration cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, left the Xuanhuang Realm.

Originally, the cultivators of the world would have thought that this group of Dao Integration cultivators would have disappeared without a trace.

Unexpectedly, the Myriad Immortals Alliance had mastered a method for long-distance communication and occasionally released messages transmitted by the multicolored light that had left the realm!

Originally, the Myriad Immortals Alliance could not have done this.

Thanks to a beam of sword light communication from the depths of the sea of stars.

After analysis, the Immortal Alliance successfully replicated this communication technology and applied it to the multicolored light that had left the realm.

Because the members of the Immortal Alliance had the good fortune to witness the scenes outside the Xuanhuang Realm.

"What is all this? Why is it so dark?"

"Is the Myriad Immortals Alliance trying to fool us? It's no different from ordinary space rifts."

"Where is the promised sea of stars and the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat?"

"Fortunately, I didn't choose to go at that time, or I would be bored to death just watching this every day?"

"Without reaching Dao Integration, one is not even qualified to board that multicolored light leaving the realm. May I ask what your cultivation level is now?"

"I have only cultivated for a hundred years and have already attained the Great Dao of the Golden Core. It should be easy to reach Dao Integration!"

…

For the images released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance for unknown reasons, most cultivators watched with a sense of schadenfreude and commented.

However, some people could discern some clues from these fleeting glimpses.

Outside the Chizha Abyss, in the Immortal City Broken Palm.

Young Master Shang repeatedly watched these scenes of the void outside the realm dozens of times.

In addition to those publicly released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, he had also obtained some top-secret versions through certain special channels.

Cold sweat broke out on his forehead, and Young Master Shang staggered, retreating from his contemplation.

"How do you feel, Young Master?"

The speaker was the First Young Master Proclivity.

He coughed lightly, a look of enjoyment on his face, and examined Young Master Shang.

"The void outside is so perilous. I consider myself to be quite strong, but if I encounter these calamities, I would likely not escape death," Young Master Shang said, with lingering fear.

"It's alright, I'm the same," the First Young Master Proclivity smiled. "That's why I'm becoming even more curious about that Sword Immortal in white you mentioned."

The First Young Master Proclivity's smile faded. "Not only can he traverse the void safely, but he can also send such crucial information from the other side of the sea of stars… Such a peerless prodigy, and I've never heard of him before?"

Young Master Shang also sighed, "It was only from that day that I realized how many talented individuals there are in the world. I no longer have the heart to underestimate other heroes."

"No, no, no, you don't understand what I mean," the First Young Master Proclivity shook his head. "I mean, the appearance of such a figure is completely illogical."

Young Master Shang was stunned.

The First Young Master Proclivity suddenly stood up, fanning himself with his feather fan, and slowly said, "Under the current circumstances where laws cannot be cultivated together, not only are cultivation techniques strictly controlled, but even the resources required for advancement are constantly monitored by us."

"Even if rogue cultivators have heaven-defying luck, their cultivation will be limited to the Nascent Soul stage. To advance further, they would surely fall into our Myriad Immortals Alliance's sight before that. However, this white-robed Sword Immortal you mentioned…"

"It's as if he emerged from a rock, and no matter how we investigate, we can't find any trace of him."

Hearing the First Young Master Proclivity's seriousness, Young Master Shang was somewhat dismissive. "How many hidden powers are there in the Xuanhuang Realm? How could the Myriad Immortals Alliance know them all?"

The First Young Master Proclivity lightly fanned himself again, and a phantom image appeared before them.

It was the scene of the Sacred Embryo Li Ping displaying his divine might outside the Chizha Abyss, breaking the demonic sounds with his sword.

"Young Master, what do you think of this swordsmanship?" the First Young Master Proclivity asked.

"Exquisite and natural, as if born from heaven," Young Master Shang replied without hesitation.

"This sword is the Sword of the Azure Nether." The white jade fan in the First Young Master Proclivity's hand mimicked the Sacred Embryo Li Ping's movements in the image, and a sword light actually shot out from the tip of the feather fan.

"Sword of the Azure Nether…" Young Master Shang savored these four words.

"There are not a few cultivators who practice the sword dao in the Xuanhuang Realm. Among them, there are also prodigies. Therefore, they can naturally see the subtleties of the swordsmanship displayed by this white-robed Sword Immortal."

With each sword strike that the Sacred Embryo Li Ping made in the image, the First Young Master Proclivity also waved his feather fan.

Similarly, miniature sword lights appeared, echoing the image.

"Brother Jinglun, what exactly do you mean?" Young Master Shang frowned and asked.

"Does Young Master know of the Heaven Guard Department?" the First Young Master Proclivity replied with a question instead of an answer.

"I naturally know that the Immortal Alliance, through the Heaven Guard Department, constantly monitors the principles of heaven and earth. Besides the ability to observe the essence of heaven and earth, the most important thing is to perceive traces of anomalies in advance," Young Master Shang replied quickly.

"But how does this relate to what you called the Sword of the Azure Nether?" "This sword is a Heaven Oddity. It directly points to the principles of heaven and earth," the First Young Master Proclivity said solemnly.

As he spoke, Young Master Shang seemed to understand something, and a glint flashed in his eyes.

"The anomalies in the sword dao were also observed by the Heaven Guard Department before. However, it only lasted for a very short time, less than half a month, and then returned to normal. It did not involve any Heavenly Venerate-level anomalies, so the Heaven Guard Department merely reported it as usual, filed it, and sealed it. I also saw this record at the time, but I didn't pay much attention to it. It wasn't until you mentioned this white-robed Sword Immortal that I connected them." the First Young Master Proclivity said slowly.

"Half a month?" Young Master Shang found it hard to believe.

At this point, if Young Master Shang still didn't understand what the other party meant, he wouldn't be fit to guard the Chizha Abyss anymore.

The fact that the sword dao had not been completely reversed indicated that the previous anomaly was a sign of Dao Integration.

And the fact that it only lasted for half a month from the anomaly to its occurrence meant that the white-robed Sword Immortal he encountered…

Was not a powerful cultivator who had been in Dao Integration for a long time. but a lucky individual who had just entered this realm.

But, was this possible?

One could break through a realm temporarily through luck and opportunity, but the comprehension of the sword dao and the effortless grace when wielding a sword required time to accumulate.

The various moments of traveling with that white-robed Sword Immortal reappeared in Young Master Shang's mind.

"Perhaps… this person is a heaven-blessed prodigy?" he said uncertainly.

The First Young Master Proclivity conceded, "Perhaps there is such a possibility. But I am more inclined to believe that an outsider infiltrated our Xuanhuang Realm, used the Heaven Oddity sword dao to break through to the Dao Integration realm, and then lured us to the depths of the sea of stars…"

Young Master Shang interrupted the First Young Master Proclivity.

"Brother Jinglun, isn't this a bit too absurd?"

The First Young Master Proclivity smiled. "It's just the most reasonable explanation after eliminating all the impossible."

"This person has no background, appearing abruptly."

"After reaching Dao Integration, he could thoroughly comprehend… and it's one of the most complex paths, the sword dao."

"If this person truly achieved all of this entirely on his own, without any foundation, I would call him the most talented person in history, second only to the Doctrine Transmitter."

"Furthermore, from your description, this person easily subdued the morale of the entire army in the Immortal City Broken Palm with just a few words…"

The First Young Master Proclivity sneered again.

Young Master Shang thought of more.

There were disloyal individuals within the Immortal Alliance, seeking to rectify the situation.

This was the repeated plea from that person.

After being guided, he had indeed developed such doubts. He had even planned to unite his friends to uncover the truth.

But what if that person's intentions were malicious from the start?

If he caused internal strife within the Immortal Alliance because of this, and was taken advantage of by others, wouldn't he become a traitor to the Xuanhuang Realm?

Thinking of this, Young Master Shang couldn't help but break out in a cold sweat.

At this moment, the First Young Master Proclivity also said, "When you found me before, I was indeed somewhat persuaded."

"But after some investigation, I discovered something amiss."

"Young Master, you are an important minister of the Immortal Alliance. Every word and action must be cautious."

Young Master Shang nodded slightly, falling into deep thought.

"Do not act rashly until the truth is clarified. If that person contacts you again, report it immediately. I will handle it."

After giving his instructions, the First Young Master Proclivity gracefully left the Chizha Abyss shrouded in mist.

After a long time, Young Master Shang finally reacted.

Initially, he wanted to incite the First Young Master Proclivity, but he was easily swayed by the other party.

As expected of someone named [First].

"Who exactly are you?" Young Master Shang gazed at the starry sky, and the figure of the white-robed man, as ethereal as a celestial being, reappeared in his mind.

For now, let's not mention the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat on the other side of the sea of stars.

Let's talk about the multicolored light that was traveling through the sea of stars towards the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat.

After transmitting the recorded images from the multicolored light to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Blue Feather continued to gaze intently ahead.

Everything around was pitch black, seemingly calm.

In reality, in his perception, it was fraught with hidden dangers and treacherous.

"Brother Blue Feather, we've been out for so long, have we had any gains?"

Jiri's voice came from behind.

Blue Feather had never had a good impression of this Dao Integration cultivator who loved to poke his nose into everything.

At this moment, he merely responded faintly, "We've had some minor gains, so to speak."

Jiri chuckled sinisterly and transmitted his voice, "Brother Blue Feather, we are in the sea of stars, and we are not restricted by the power of Heavenly Venerates. Isn't it easier to break through?"

"I heard your cultivation technique is a direct inheritance from the Grand Master of the past, perhaps from the Immortal Realm. And I see that you seem to have become much younger in a short period of time…"

"Jiri, you've overstepped." Blue Feather said sternly, interrupting Jiri.

Jiri was not embarrassed. He cupped his fists and left with a smile.

Blue Feather turned around and continued to monitor the dark void in the direction of the multicolored light's advance.

He sighed inwardly.

The atmosphere on this flying boat, internally named [Honoring the Venerable], was somewhat subtle.

The protective multicolored light had been almost depleted when escaping the Immortal Ruins, but the flying boat's speed did not decrease as it sped towards the other side of the sea of stars.

However, in just a few short months, three Dao Integration cultivators on board had already died violently.

If they had died from the strange calamities outside the sea of stars, it would have been one thing, but the crucial point was that these three Dao Integration cultivators had all died mysteriously.

Everyone had personally investigated, but no one could figure out the truth behind their sudden deaths.

The three corpses still lay quietly in the flying boat, their faces ruddy, as if they were merely asleep.

But within them, their entire divine souls had been hollowed out unknowingly.

"This is Dao Integration," Blue Feather thought with immense gravity.

Among the three who perished, one named [Azure Flame] was an old Dao Integration cultivator like himself, whose strength was not much inferior to his.

Yet, he still died inexplicably.

Blue Feather even missed the fallen anomalies in the Xuanhuang Realm. At the very least, even if they perished, the cause of death could be understood.

"However, I heard that before we left, those anomalies also showed unusual signs? Truly an eventful period."

Having survived the Great Tribulation since its descent, Blue Feather instinctively felt something unusual.

Just as his thoughts began to wander, a shrill cry suddenly startled him.

Blue Feather's expression changed, and realizing something was wrong, he immediately rushed towards the source of the sound.

When he arrived, four Dao Integration cultivators had already gathered.

And the focus of everyone's terrified gaze was on another corpse lying on the ground.

Blue Feather’s pupils constricted, because this time, the deceased was Immortal Venerable Jiri, who had just curried favor with him!

Looking at Jiri's ruddy face and lifeless body, Blue Feather felt a chill run down his spine.

Not long after, the surviving passengers on the flying boat had all arrived.

"Old Guan, you do it."

Guan Xingxiu slowly walked out from the crowd, his face solemn.

After carefully examining Immortal Venerable Jiri's corpse, he made his judgment: "The same cause of death."

A commotion erupted among the crowd.

"Who the hell is it?"

"This is too suffocating! Each of us is a renowned Dao Integration cultivator, yet we are being slaughtered and butchered so inexplicably on this small boat!"

"Should we… go back? It's not that I, Old Xu, am afraid of death. If I could see the legendary Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat and understand the Dao before dying, it would be alright. But what is this now? If news of this gets back, we'll lose all face!"

…

"Quiet!" Guan Xingxiu impatiently interrupted the crowd's discussion.

"From now on, we act together. Do not separate."

"It's not calamities in the void, but someone attained the Dao and committed murder."

Guan Xingxiu's words stirred up a thousand waves.

"What did you say?"

"Old Guan, are you crazy? Although you are the head of the Garrison Department and responsible for this area, this is too absurd?"

Guan Xingxiu waved his hand, suppressing the voices of the crowd.

"There is a reason why I say this."

Behind Guan Xingxiu, a small golden sword flew into the air.

After circling once, it instantly aimed at Jiri's corpse on the ground and flew towards it.

A faint, almost imperceptible black thread was severed from the corpse by the golden sword.

Guan Xingxiu held the thread, and it seemed to have a life of its own, struggling frantically.

Blue Feather observed for a moment and said in disbelief, "Xingxiu, are you saying that the murderer used this thread to easily kill those people?"

Guan Xingxiu, who had great respect for Blue Feather, nodded and said, "It appears to be so, for now."

"If any of you do not believe, you can try the power of this black thread yourself."

"I will!" Sun Luchang volunteered.

Soon, the experiment ended with several holes poked in his body.

This was the result even with the black thread being suppressed by the Golden Falling Star Divine Sword.

"How is this possible? A mere thread is so powerful?" Sun Luchang looked crestfallen.

The other Dao Integration cultivators also looked incredulous.

Guan Xingxiu swept his gaze over everyone and said loudly, "Everyone, I know you all hold important positions and respected statuses in the Immortal Alliance, but don't forget, we are currently in the sea of stars!"

"I believe everyone has felt that the upper limit of the laws in this sea of stars is far above that of the Xuanhuang Realm. Coupled with the absence of the Heavenly Venerates' restrictions, after being suppressed for so long, a sudden attainment of the Dao will lead to a rapid increase in realm… it is not impossible!"

Sun Luchang said with some unwillingness, "But even so, can the gap be this large? It's one thing to be inferior, but to not even be able to make a sound of struggle… If he truly had such strength, why wouldn't he just kill all of us?"

Sun Luchang's words were met with agreement from the crowd.

At this moment, Blue Feather spoke up, "Perhaps it is due to the special nature of this person's cultivation technique. It is not a matter of overwhelming strength, but the battle occurs within the divine soul and sea of consciousness, without causing any energy fluctuations."

"As for this black thread, it is the medium for launching the attack."

Blue Feather was the most senior among the group, and with his advocacy, the crowd gradually began to believe him.

"In that case, let's follow the clues and find this bastard!"

At the suggestion of the crowd, Guan Xingxiu touched the black thread to each of the surviving Dao Integration cultivators.

No connection was found with any of them.

"The murderer is cautious and cunning, and would definitely not leave such an obvious flaw. In my opinion, this is intentionally left to mislead us," said a Dao Integration cultivator named Purple Wood.

"But that's not necessarily true. He definitely didn't expect that Brother Guan's progress would be so rapid, and that he would be able to discover the traces he left behind." There were immediately dissenting opinions among the crowd.

"Brother Guan, how exactly did you attain the Dao? In this vast dark starry sky, I can't feel any enlightenment!"

"Yes, Old Guan, tell us. Now that the hidden murderer is lurking, only by each of us attaining the Dao and increasing our strength can we avoid being defeated one by one."

Amidst the crowd's chatter, Guan Xingxiu felt helpless and began to recount how he suddenly gained enlightenment.

Chapter 1280

Guan Xingxiu spoke with ease aboard the flying boat, his initial hesitation giving way to a newfound confidence as he explained, as if he had grasped the fundamental principles of the star sea.

"The laws of the star sea can be considered a superior substitute for the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm. Therefore, the key to our breakthrough lies in finding the 'Path of the Star Sea' corresponding to our own cultivation path within this dead, silent star sea. All of you have achieved Dao Integration, so your talents are certainly not weak. As long as you cast aside your fear of the star sea and approach it with a calm mind, just as you did in the Xuanhuang Realm, and meditate carefully, I believe achieving this will not be too difficult."

Guan Xingxiu went into detail about how he sensed his own Path of the Star Sea. As he spoke with enthusiasm, a voice filled with extreme panic suddenly interrupted him. It was Zi Mu, one of the survivors.

"Old Guan, if... I mean, if the path I cultivate no longer exists in the star sea, what should we do?" Zi Mu stared intently at Guan Xingxiu. "Does this mean our path forward is cut off, and we can no longer advance?"

Guan Xingxiu fell silent. The other Dao Integration cultivators present also displayed varied expressions upon hearing this. Some turned pale, while others felt a sense of relief. This was because they too had discovered that, perhaps due to the cataclysmic events that had once destroyed the Immortal Realm, the laws of the star sea were fragmented and incomplete.

He knew of Tiandu, the Grand Master's celestial palace. But what was this Source Dao Palace?

"You don't even know the Source Dao Palace? What a bumpkin! It is the source of all laws, the foremost of all paths. Even the direct disciples of the Myriad Immortal Sects would have to queue up obediently here!"

Back then, the immortal path flourished, and the Myriad Immortal Sects stood tall. He was merely one of countless ordinary cultivators under their rule. His talent was mediocre, and he had no great fortuitous encounters. Originally, the Golden Core realm should have been his limit.

After some inquiries, he learned of the so-called "Master-Respecting Grand Ceremony." It was a grand event held every hundred years by the Myriad Immortal Sects to express their gratitude for the benevolent teachings bestowed by Tiandu the Grand Master. Important figures from the Myriad Immortal Sects would attend.

Lan Yu himself did not refute this. The silent and reverent gazes of others made Wu Fuqiu even more curious. Lan Yu was momentarily lost in thought. He was heading towards the legendary Tiandu; it was not that the path had vanished in the star sea. After careful consideration, he could not shake off the demonic thought that had been plaguing his mind.

"If I am fortunate enough to gain his appreciation..." Lan Yu's expression was serious, though he was merely appeasing everyone casually. In his heart, however, he was genuinely puzzled.

For a moment, everyone reacted differently. Since it was not bound to the principles of the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth, it meant that in this desolate star sea, Lan Yu could use any law to comprehend and break through. However, the formidable reputation of the Myriad Immortal Sects, rulers of the cultivation world, was as thunderous to Wu Fuqiu, a lone rogue cultivator from the wilderness, as it was deafening. Wu Fuqiu did not know who Tiandu the Grand Master was.

"Alas! The New Law! Alas! Heavenly Venerate!"

"Hush, speak softly. If you disturb the Myriad Immortal Sects' 'Master-Respecting Grand Ceremony,' you won't even know how you died."

"The Myriad Immortal Sects are already so extraordinary. Just how powerful must the Grand Master who bestowed them their teachings be?"

The flying boat was plunged into silence, and everyone's gaze converged on Lan Yu.

"Perhaps, you could try to sense other laws. After all, all paths lead to the same destination," Guan Xingxiu said after a moment of thought, as despair began to spread. Yet, that day, a moment of curiosity completely changed his destiny.

"Could it be that my talent is so poor? Or perhaps I am simply too old, having lost all spiritual awareness?"

Tiandu remained unseen. Only a Source Dao Palace stood atop a mountain, appearing and disappearing in the clouds. After countless hardships, he arrived outside Tiandu, only for his hopes to turn into bubbles. Lan Yu was slightly taken aback, his thoughts returning to his youth.

"Oh, I think I remember."

"If that's the case, then perhaps the one among us who can achieve the highest will be our Elder Lan Yu," the Dao Integration cultivator named Qing Shuang suddenly said for no reason. It was not for lack of talent or the inability to sense their corresponding Paths of the Star Sea. It was simply because, among all the Dao Integration cultivators present, or perhaps in the entire Xuanhuang Realm, he was the most exceptional. He was the only one who practiced the ancient Dao method.

It took a full half-day before the grand procession of the Myriad Immortal Sects finally passed, and the airspace resumed passage.

"This fellow cultivator, what's with the grand spectacle ahead? What has happened?" Wu Fuqiu asked curiously, looking at the blocked airspace and the numerous flying boats of varying designs, each as large as a city, passing overhead.

"Congratulations in advance, Fellow Daoist Lan!"

"I, Wu Fuqiu, seem to truly lack ordinary talent." And at the foot of the mountain, a crowd of young cultivators like him, holding a sliver of hope, had traveled great distances seeking fortuitous encounters. It was because he had not sensed the Paths of the Star Sea in the void. Wu Fuqiu's heart trembled. At the same time, an unprecedented ambition suddenly arose in his heart.

"I say, Elder Brother Lan Yu, your delay in showing signs of breakthrough, isn't it because you have too many choices and are overwhelmed?" It was not because their talents were insufficient to sense their corresponding Paths of the Star Sea.

Wu Fuqiu was immediately bewildered. And Wu Fuqiu watched the direction in which the Myriad Immortal Sects departed, unwilling to leave for a long time.

"Think it over carefully! Who is the Grand Master? How could mere mortals like you easily meet him? If you want to see the Grand Master's divine countenance, you must first enter the Source Dao Palace and pray sincerely. If you can catch the Grand Master's eye, he will naturally guide you to Tiandu."

"What, you want to go in too? Easy, just pay one thousand high-grade spirit stones, and you can queue up there!" Wu Fuqiu was dejected as he was pushed out by the throng of later arrivals. One thousand high-grade spirit stones was enough to buy a decent Nascent Soul cultivation technique. If he had that many spirit stones, why would he have traveled thousands of miles to seek an opportunity here? Despite his empty pockets, Wu Fuqiu had no intention of leaving. Because he noticed that many people like him could not afford the fee and were unable to go up the mountain. After spending half a month mingling with them, Wu Fuqiu obtained a crucial piece of information. The so-called Source Dao Palace was merely built by the Myriad Immortal Sects later; it had no actual connection to the true Tiandu. The true Land of Origin Dao referred to this vast area below Tiandu. However, the Myriad Immortal Sects had fenced off a large portion to build the Source Dao Palace. But they did not go to extremes and left this area at the foot of the mountain.

"The Grand Master hasn't appeared for who knows how many years. They say it's easier to catch the Grand Master's eye on the mountain, but it's just to console themselves."

"Yes, the Grand Master hangs high in the nine heavens. In his eyes, what difference is there between the mountain and the foot of the mountain?"

With the words of those huddled on the ground, Wu Fuqiu also settled down at the foot of the Source Dao Palace. He stayed there for a full twenty years. Some new people arrived, some left. Some died of regret, while others, consumed by resentment, cursed the Grand Master and were beaten to death. Wu Fuqiu also transformed from a young lad into a middle-aged man. He didn't know what it was that kept him steadfastly waiting here. Perhaps for someone as mediocre as him, it didn't matter where he went. During these years, while waiting, he did not neglect his cultivation. However, without a source of spirit stones, he could only deplete his savings. Although the Land of Origin Dao was rich in Spirit Qi, it couldn't sustain so many people absorbing it simultaneously. Not only did he not make any progress, but he even showed signs of regression. When things reached this point, Wu Fuqiu resigned himself to his fate, no longer holding any unrealistic fantasies. After all, he had been an orphan since childhood, drifting aimlessly without a support system. He had spent over twenty years at the foot of the Source Dao Palace and had long grown accustomed to the scenery, secretly considering it his hometown. Whenever young people arrived full of hope, begging for the Grand Master's blessings, he would smile without a word. As if seeing himself from the past. However, he did not shatter these young people's illusions. Because anyone who did so was cleared out by the people of the Myriad Immortal Sects. However, the mystery of life lies precisely in this. Just as Wu Fuqiu had completely put aside any hope of the Grand Master's blessings... On this day, the sky suddenly erupted in ten thousand feet of colorful auspicious light. Below the Source Dao Palace, thousands of cultivators froze on the spot. Someone must have been the first to exclaim, "The Grand Master has manifested!" Then, in a state of extreme excitement and fear, the crowd on the ground collectively knelt down. Only Wu Fuqiu remained rooted to the spot, his mind a blank.

"How dare you be disrespectful to the Grand Master!" A sword light, accompanied by an angry shout, flew from afar. Just as Wu Fuqiu was about to lose his head, a blue feather slowly drifted down from the sky. The white sword light flew first, incredibly fast. The blue feather fell afterward, drifting slowly and leisurely. However, a bizarre scene unfolded. Under the gaze of all present, the blue feather landed on Wu Fuqiu's body a step ahead of the white sword light. The sword light, arriving late, did not sever Wu Fuqiu's head, but instead passed through him, instantly killing three kneeling cultivators behind him. As for Wu Fuqiu himself... Under the cover of the blue feather's radiance, he involuntarily began to ascend. Amidst the exclamations of the crowd, he rose higher and higher. Passing the Source Dao Palace atop the mountain, soaring through the clouds, he arrived in a flash before a purple-gold grand altar. Wu Fuqiu felt as if he were in a dream. He stood there for a long time before regaining his senses. His body trembled with excitement, causing Wu Fuqiu to forget courtesy and directly push open the door. Unlike the sacred Tiandu he had imagined, the place was empty. Silent and dead. Only a faint chanting sound could be heard from within. Wu Fuqiu cautiously followed the direction of the sound to the deepest part of the grand altar. The ancient purple-gold wooden building exuded a faint aroma. Wu Fuqiu knelt and paid his respects, but after a long while, seeing no response, he mustered his courage and pushed open the door. The scene inside the wooden building came into view. A shadowy figure sat cross-legged, chanting incantations. Behind him stood a young boy in a blue and white robe, eyes closed. The boy was rosy-cheeked and fair-faced, his gender indistinguishable. However, Lan Yu noticed that this boy seemed to have been in a fight, as his robe was somewhat tattered, with faint traces of blood on it. Wu Fuqiu dared not be presumptuous and kowtowed again. But neither the shadowy figure nor the boy showed any reaction. "This shadowy figure must be Tiandu the Grand Master." After a long time, Wu Fuqiu dared to get up and, mimicking the shadowy figure, sat down cross-legged. He listened intently to the continuous chanting of the other party. Gradually, he seemed to understand something. The blue feather that had landed on him and disappeared suddenly appeared in his dantian. "Feather Transformation Technique..."
