"Through countless epochs of heaven and earth, countless worlds are born and destroyed, like feathers drifting in the void." "Transforming the body into a feather, synchronizing with the world, one can follow the flow of epochs, uncertain in life and death, traversing calamities, and achieving eternal transcendence..." Wu Fuqiu listened, captivated, furrowing his brow at times and rejoicing at others. This "Myriad Calamities Feather Transformation Technique" was too profound for a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator like him. But even a glimpse of its essence enlightened him, and his cultivation realm surged. Wu Fuqiu was immersed in it, losing track of time. Suddenly, he felt the scene before his eyes shift, startling him awake. He saw that the boy who had been sitting with his eyes closed was waving at him. Although he did not speak, Wu Fuqiu understood that he was being dismissed. Despite his thousandfold reluctance, Wu Fuqiu could only retreat silently. Before leaving the purple-gold wooden building, he politely closed the door. As the door closed, a streak of light flew out from within. Wu Fuqiu instinctively caught it, finding it to be a miniature circular structure. "A magic artifact, a training ground." "It also has storage functions." After a brief inspection, Wu Fuqiu's face lit up with joy. He kowtowed and paid his respects inside thrice more before leaving Tiandu. It was only then that he realized that after leaving the purple-gold wooden building, he could no longer hear the voice of the seated shadowy figure. A sense of loss surged in his heart, and Wu Fuqiu suddenly felt the urge to return. But after all, he was the Grand Master of the Myriad Immortal Sects, and he ultimately dared not be presumptuous, leaving the vicinity of the heavenly capital. When he returned to the mortal world, he was astonished to find that the Source Dao Palace at the foot of the mountain had inexplicably disappeared. Even the surrounding terrain had changed drastically, as if a great battle had occurred here. Wu Fuqiu searched for a long time before finding living cultivators nearby. From their respectful demeanor, Wu Fuqiu was horrified to realize that, unknowingly, he had become a top expert in the Xuanhuang Realm, a cultivator at the Dao Integration realm! And several hundred years had passed. The reign of the Myriad Immortal Sects was no longer unshakeable; an organization called the Myriad Immortals Alliance had risen...

"Fellow Daoist Lan Yu?" Guan Xingxiu's voice pulled Lan Yu out of his memories.

"Yes, I was a mediocre talent who only achieved Dao Integration through sheer luck."

"After so many years, the flattery from my disciples and subordinates almost made me forget this fact." Lan Yu felt a sense of relief.

"If my talent were not so poor, I wouldn't have only cultivated the 'Myriad Calamities Feather Transformation Technique' to the Dao Integration realm."

"Without the Grand Master's teachings, in countless years, I have made no further progress." Lan Yu shook his head inwardly, his thoughts returning to the present. He looked at Guan Xingxiu. "I believe your judgment. Since the murderer is hidden among us, we just need to gather together and wait for him to reveal his flaw." Lan Yu paused, then added, "This person has just broken through and immediately committed murder. If it's not for psychological reasons, then it's because his cultivation technique requires him to blood sacrifice other cultivators after breaking through. He will certainly not stop now."

Everyone nodded in agreement with Lan Yu's assessment. To ensure their safety, these Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivators stayed together in the main hall of the flying boat "Prosperous Reverence," supervising each other. However, the killer's cunning was far beyond their imagination. Nine days later, as they piloted the flying boat through a surviving calamity in the void, another corpse appeared on the ship. Lan Yu and Guan Xingxiu exchanged glances, confirming Zi Mu's demise. The pressure in their hearts instantly increased.

"Old Guan? We were all together this time, right? Among everyone, you have the highest strength. Did you notice who the hell did it?!" Faced with the expectant gazes of everyone, Guan Xingxiu shook his head helplessly. The hall erupted in an uproar.

"Everyone calm down. Just now, we were all focused on dealing with the void calamity, so we were momentarily careless and were ambushed by the killer again."

"What do we do next? Not trying to avoid this calamity means death, but if we try to avoid it, we'll be assassinated..."

"Hmph, in my opinion, we shouldn't bother trying to dodge these calamities anymore. At most, we'll all perish together!"

"Brother Xu, don't say such things in anger. We still have so many of us!"

"No, I want to leave this ship!" Amidst the clamor, a sharp scream suddenly drowned out all other sounds. Lan Yu and the others looked and saw that the Dao Integration cultivator Qing Shuang, who had been relatively calm before, suddenly seemed to have a mental breakdown. His expression was possessed, and a flash of madness appeared in his eyes. Muttering to himself, he was about to rush out of the main hall and leave the flying boat.

"Stop him!" Guan Xingxiu roared. Only Lan Yu and a few others moved. Inside the flying boat, fearing damage to the vessel, everyone acted with restraint. For a moment, they were helpless against the frantic Qing Shuang. Just as a stalemate was reached, Qing Shuang's movements suddenly stopped. His expression froze, and he stood there blankly. Before anyone could react, Guan Xingxiu's expression changed, and he immediately flew forward to check.

"He's dead." A moment later, he turned back with an extremely grim expression. A chill instantly enveloped everyone. Compared to the initial murders, the killer's methods seemed to have become more proficient. While dealing with the void calamity could be an excuse, this time, everyone was clearly concentrating, yet the killer still acted with impunity... How could they defend against this? The inside of the flying boat fell into dead silence.

"I actually think what Qing Shuang said before he died wasn't without reason," Sun Luochang said, breaking the silence. "From the current situation, this killer's strength is growing too fast. Perhaps in a while, after slaughtering a few more, he won't need to act stealthily anymore. Instead, he'll appear directly and kill us one by one. Staying on the ship is definitely a dead end. It's better to abandon the ship and seek survival in the void." Sun Luochang's words also resonated with other Dao Integration cultivators: "Exactly, this 'Prosperous Reverence' flying boat is extremely fast. As long as we leave separately at intervals, our relative distances in the star sea will be very far apart. The star sea is vast; even if he has heaven-defying abilities, he definitely cannot capture us all!" "Moreover, this area is still within the range of the Immortal Ruins' suction. As long as we follow the direction of the suction, we can return to the Xuanhuang Realm. Plus, each of us has a 'Void Clear Crystal' artifact issued by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, so returning safely is not a problem."

... With each person speaking their mind, they slowly reached a consensus. Ultimately, more than half of them chose to give up and disembark midway. Guan Xingxiu looked at Lan Yu, seeking the opinion of this most senior Dao Integration cultivator. Lan Yu sighed softly, "Heaven and Earth are vast, but life is paramount. Their choice is understandable." "To avoid further casualties, let's decide on this."

"Elder Lan, aren't you leaving?" Lan Yu shook his head. "My lifespan is nearing its end. Returning is just waiting for death. It's better to seek a sliver of hope in the void." Upon hearing this, everyone was greatly surprised. After offering their blessings, they began to leave the flying boat one after another, returning to the Xuanhuang Realm. Ending their journey of exploring the star sea in a ignoble death was indeed ignoble, but it was better than losing their lives. After all this, only five people remained on the flying boat. Lan Yu, Guan Xingxiu, Sun Luochang, Xu Guanhai, and Zi Mei. Guan Xingxiu looked at Xu Guanhai in surprise. "You didn't leave?" Xu Guanhai chuckled. "I actually think it's safer on the flying boat now that a large group has left." "Besides, no matter what, I still want to see the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat with my own eyes." Xu Guanhai looked at Sun Luochang. "Brother Sun, you're the strange one. You were the most insistent on leaving when everyone was clamoring to go. Why did you stay behind?" Sun Luochang looked a bit embarrassed. "My strength is too weak. If I leave the flying boat, I might not be able to return to the Xuanhuang Realm on my own. Staying here is actually safer." Everyone was speechless upon hearing this. They could see that what Sun Luochang said was true. Unlike their proactive volunteering, Sun Luochang was forcibly assigned to the flying boat by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, and his strength was at the bottom among everyone. Sun Luochang moved closer to Guan Xingxiu and Lan Yu. "Sirs, do you think the killer is among us?" The other four looked at each other, their expressions somewhat nuanced. Until the killer's identity was revealed, no one dared to be absolutely sure. "Since everyone has decided to stay, our original route remains unchanged," Guan Xingxiu said loudly after a period of silence. "We can reduce the spatial capacity of the 'Prosperous Reverence' flying boat to speed up our journey."

"Oh, Xingxiu, why is this flying boat called 'Prosperous Reverence'? I always feel this name is somewhat ominous," Lan Yu asked, frowning, as if recollecting something upon hearing Guan Xingxiu's words. Guan Xingxiu paused slightly, then replied, "I don't know. It was directly decreed by the Dharma-Preachers. I guess it means 'Prospering in the hope of meeting the Heavenly Venerate.'" Upon hearing this, Lan Yu's frown deepened. He looked up at the flying boat and posed a question that sent a chill down the spines of the other four: "Besides us, are there any other people on this Prosperous Reverence flying boat?"

"There shouldn't be... I think," Guan Xingxiu said hesitantly. At this moment, Zi Mei, who had been silent, suddenly spoke, "Perhaps? This ship is alive?" Sun Luochang was startled and quickly asked, "Fellow Daoist Zi, why do you say that?" Zi Mei said softly, "I sensed the Paths of the Star Sea, and I saw the Dao Integration lives in the flying boat perishing like ants. Thus, I had a breakthrough." "In my perception, this flying boat..." "It's as if it has its own life." Zi Mei's words sent a shivere down everyone's spines. Guan Xingxiu said hesitantly, "If it's true, then before the Myriad Immortals Alliance sent us off, they must have..." At this point, Guan Xingxiu suddenly stopped. The Golden Falling Star Divine Sword above their heads emitted golden light, and Guan Xingxiu gathered all the black threads extracted from the assassinated Dao Integration cultivators. The threads, like living worms, merged together, becoming thicker. Before, he had already let each cultivator present come into contact with this murder weapon, and no one had any connection with it. But he had completely overlooked the ship itself. The last five people on the flying boat exchanged glances and instantly reached a consensus. They formed a formation to encircle the black threads in the center.

"Old Guan, go to the flying boat's control center," Xu Guanhai said sternly. This command seemed to anger the black threads, and they began to fiercely collide with the seal restraining them. The five Dao Integration cultivators worked together, firmly locking it down. They proceeded to the center of the "Prosperous Reverence" flying boat. Guan Xingxiu took a deep breath and opened the flying boat's main control formation. In the center of the formation, a phantom image of the Prosperous Reverence flying boat floated. As if guided by an unseen force, the black threads, surrounded by everyone, drifted uncontrollably towards the phantom image within the main control formation! All five faces turned deathly pale. **Boom!** At this moment, the flying boat suddenly shook violently. The thick black thread, its explosive power amplified several times from before, instantly broke free from their restraint. It returned to the phantom image of the flying boat. At this point, the truth was revealed! The culprit behind the murder of several Dao Integration cultivators was none other than the flying boat they were riding! This conclusion was simply unimaginable. Even though the facts were laid out before them, Guan Xingxiu still found it difficult to believe.

"Why..." he said through gritted teeth. As the nominal commander appointed by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, with control over the Prosperous Reverence flying boat, this creation that was originally under his control had, right under his nose, slain his colleagues! It was an outright humiliation! **Clang!** The Falling Star Divine Sword was drawn, pointing directly at the phantom image of the flying boat. The next moment, Guan Xingxiu was about to cleave the flying boat in two. Just then, a cold voice suddenly echoed in the space.

"Ultimate mission objective: Meet the Heavenly Venerate."

"After deduction, mission probability: Low."

"Searching for solutions..."

"After deduction, converting one Dao Integration cultivator on the flying boat into the flying boat's energy per instance. Mission success probability increases by one..."

The intermittent flashing voice of the flying boat plunged everyone into an abyss of ice. And then, the dozens of corpses that appeared one after another in the screen made them tearful with rage! They were precisely the Dao Integration cultivators who had previously "disembarked"!

Chapter 1281: Reunion in the Star Sea (7k)

A large number of Dao Integration corpses drifted haphazardly, like kites with their strings cut. The expressions on their faces still held the joy of escaping a tribulation.

"Damn it..."

Looking at these faces, which had been so full of life not long ago and were now frozen in place, Guan Xingxiu could no longer contain himself. His Falling Star Divine Sword transformed into a golden light, slashing straight ahead.

A cyan figure suddenly appeared, blocking the sword light.

Ice crystals, blooming like flowers, appeared at his fingertips. The surrounding air seemed to freeze, and the Falling Star Divine Sword was thus suspended in mid-air.

"This is... Qing Shuang?"

Xu Guanhai exclaimed, recognizing the figure as both familiar and strange.

The one who had cast the spell to block the Falling Star Divine Sword was none other than Qing Shuang, the Dao Integration cultivator who had been drained of his essence and believed to be dead not long ago.

However...

The five surviving Dao Integration cultivators tensed up once more.

"This place is not suitable for staying long. How about we recuperate for a while and then break out together?"

Guan Xingxiu narrowed his eyes, unable to hide his shock.

A decisive glint flashed in Guan Xingxiu's eyes: "Then let's destroy this monster first!"

Xu Guanhai gave a wry smile, "Old Guan, it seems we're doomed this time. Facing one or two Heavenly and Earthly Essences, I, Old Xu, might not be afraid. But so many... and with that terrifying flying boat..."

...

Familiar faces, one by one, drifted as if from the shadows.

"We're still inside the flying boat! We've been imprisoned!"

"If we don't fight, we'll surely die. Let's give it our all!"

Lan Yu strode forward, blocking the stream of Heavenly and Earthly Essences. He said in a deep voice, "Inquire about the current mission completion probability."

But just like the true void of the star sea, this place seemed boundless. The radiance of the Falling Star was like a firefly's glow, extinguished in an instant.

What terrified them even more was that a thin thread extended from the back of the new Heavenly and Earthly Essence, Qing Shuang, and snaked into the void.

The floating Heavenly and Earthly Essences all became still. After a moment, the cold voice of the Revered Star flying boat echoed, "Current mission feasibility: extremely high."

They were surrounded by the five surviving cultivators.

Sun Luochang's face turned pale, his body trembling. "How is this possible? If they're dead, they're dead. But their Heavenly and Earthly Essences can be extracted and refined? What kind of evil technique is this...?"

"Careful, Old Guan, this Qing Shuang is not Ji Wantao himself, but his Heavenly and Earthly Essence!" Xu Guanhai instantly saw through the trick and shouted a reminder.

Only Xu Guanhai offered a bitter smile. "I didn't expect to live a little longer. Consider it a bonus. Everyone, relax. This guy just swallowed so many Dao Integration cultivators. Maybe we can hold on long enough to see Heavenly Venerate himself?"

Meanwhile, Zi Mei mused, "This place is far from the Xuanhuang Realm. The laws of returning to the heavens naturally lose their effect. If we were to employ certain special methods, perhaps we could disguise ourselves as the Heavenly Dao and accept these Heavenly and Earthly Essences."

As they conversed, time slowly passed.

"We're... out?" Sun Luochang stared in disbelief.

Once they had all recovered to their best state and acted, their movements were surprisingly smooth.

What seemed like a desperate crisis suddenly vanished into nothingness.

"Energy replenishment plan suspended."

"No!" Guan Xingxiu stared at the surrounding void with a stern expression.

Sun Luochang wiped the cold sweat from his brow and let out a long sigh, still finding it hard to believe. "It's... it's resolved just like that?"

"Wait!" Just as the Falling Star Divine Sword was about to pierce the flying boat's deck, Lan Yu suddenly called out.

"Go!" Guan Xingxiu was still unwilling to give up. He summoned the Falling Star Divine Sword and flew rapidly into the darkness.

After careful observation, they discovered that the appearance of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, Qing Shuang, was no longer blurry. Instead, it closely resembled the appearance of Immortal Venerable Qing Shuang, Ji Wantao, in his living days.

Lan Yu's expression did not ease at all. "It's only temporary. Now it seems that as long as our energy reserves are sufficient and we don't try to escape, it won't attack us."

Zi Mei remained silent, her expression equally serious.

The thin threads were identical to the terrifying weapons they had previously discovered the flying boat using to kill Dao Integration cultivators.

The Falling Star Divine Sword instantly erupted with a blinding light, attempting to illuminate the dark space.

"Besides, they were ambushed before. If the five of us work together and defend in unison, perhaps we can succeed in escaping this hellish place," Xu Guanhai said via divine sense.

"Current energy reserves: sufficient."

Voices echoed continuously. The drifting, emotionless Heavenly and Earthly Essences were once again dragged by those threads and returned to the void.

Not only did no Heavenly and Earthly Essence appear to block them, but the Revered Star flying boat itself seemed as fragile as paper, torn to shreds with ease.

As they confronted the flying boat, a large number of thin threads extended from the void.

...

"I have the Heavenly Capital Martial Training Grounds. If I deploy a martial training barrier, it should delay us for quite some time," Lan Yu said.

Guan Xingxiu nodded and said coldly, "However, once its energy is insufficient, it will undoubtedly hunt and absorb us again. Hmph, to think that we, important officials of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, are now reduced to mere food for a tool in this cold void. It's truly ironic..."

But they never returned and were completely swallowed by the darkness.

The rest of them also noticed something was wrong and deployed their methods. However, without exception, none of them could escape this void prison.

"That damned thing never intended to let us go from the beginning. We were planning to escape, but it struck first and ambushed us!" Sun Luochang said with hatred.

"This place seems to be some kind of formation. It's somewhat similar to the ancient legend of the Two Energies Minor Dust Formation," Xu Guanhai said with sudden realization after observing for a while.

He then added regretfully, "It's a pity I don't understand formations. Otherwise, I could try to break it."

"I don't understand it either."

"..."

Everyone fell silent, and then their gazes converged on Lan Yu.

This veteran Dao Integration cultivator, who had lived for thousands of years, should at least understand formations, right?

Under the expectant eyes of the other four, Lan Yu shook his head helplessly. "I do know a little about formations, but the level of this formation..."

"Far surpasses mine. I cannot see through it," Lan Yu said truthfully.

Instantly, despair washed over everyone.

A dead silence enveloped the five of them.

"This formation creates an absolutely sealed space. I cannot find the exit. However, if the Revered Star flying boat intends to kill us again, it will inevitably open a gap. That will be our opportunity,"

After a while, Lan Yu suddenly said, reigniting their hopes.

"I will deploy the Martial Training Grounds. Everyone, enter and take shelter to prevent another surprise attack from the flying boat."

As he spoke, a circular structure appeared in the dark void.

With no better option, everyone could only fly into it.

As the gap closed, the five looked at each other, and a fighting spirit surged in their hearts.

"Old Lan, can you control this treasure? Now is not the time for sparring! If we waste our energy, what will we do when the flying boat attacks?"

"What the heck, Old Guan, why are you ambushing me?!" Xu Guanhai cried out in surprise.

Even though the five of them forcibly suppressed the agitation in their hearts, they couldn't help but lash out at each other.

Lan Yu explained with some helplessness, "This treasure was personally passed down by Grand Master back then. Once you enter it, you will be forced to spar until you leave. It is the nature of the treasure and cannot be controlled. I didn't take it out earlier for this very reason."

"But I can adjust the sparring intensity. I've already set it to the lowest level. Everyone, don't suppress your fighting spirit. Just spar casually, maintaining a state of engagement. With the supplies we have, we don't need to worry about energy consumption."

After a flurry of somewhat clumsy exchanges, everyone slowly adapted.

They engaged in light sparring while peacefully discussing matters.

"This kind of warm-up is good. At least it ensures we're in optimal condition to act at any moment," Xu Guanhai said, trying to find humor in their predicament.

Sun Luochang sighed, "I haven't sparred with anyone like this in a long time. Please be gentle, fellow Daoists..."

Guan Xingxiu then returned to the main topic. "In this desperate situation, we only have one chance. Therefore, we must be fully aware of each other's strongest techniques."

Guan Xingxiu's words were met with agreement from the others.

He then spoke first, "My strongest attack is one I recently comprehended in this star sea. It is called 'Sword Splits the Star River.' Be careful!"

Guan Xingxiu let out a light shout, and his sword light slashed out. In an instant, it seemed as if infinite starlight was born from within.

The Dividing Star Sword did not strike the other four, but instead, it fiercely struck the sky of the Martial Training Grounds.

The firmament trembled, and cracks appeared before quickly healing.

Guan Xingxiu exclaimed, "What a treasure!"

The other four then demonstrated their respective trump cards.

While sparring, their mutual understanding also grew.

They even jointly deduced a set of combined techniques.

In the void trapping formation, time seemed to lose meaning.

The five Dao Integration cultivators seemed to be honing their swords, nurturing their essence and spirit.

They waited for the opportune moment to unleash their strongest blows.

After an unknown period...

A powerful tremor startled them.

It was not the trembling of the Martial Training Grounds, but the tremor of the entire dark void outside.

Or rather, it originated from the Revered Star flying boat.

Through the prolonged sparring and coordination, the five had achieved a certain level of telepathic connection.

They instantly reached a consensus, waiting for a breakthrough to appear.

Without any warning, the darkness vanished, and light reappeared.

They seemed to have returned to the flying boat's cabin.

However, having been fooled once, the five did not hesitate.

They unleashed their strongest combined attack, which they had been brewing for a long time.

"Sword Splits the Star River!"

"Twilight Gazes at the Star Sea!"

"Feather Annihilation!"

...

Shouts erupted simultaneously, and five beams of light merged into one, striking the flying boat's wall with immense force.

However, a despairing scene unfolded before them.

A black hole inexplicably appeared on the wall, directly swallowing the immense destructive power of their combined attack.

The hole slowly healed, and the wall returned to its original state.

Their hard-practiced killing moves seemed like a joke, causing no damage at all.

The faces of the five turned ashen.

Guan Xingxiu's Dao heart was even damaged, and he swayed precariously.

"How is this possible?" he murmured, unable to accept it.

With their strongest attacks spent, the five felt their hearts turn to ashes, their will to resist almost extinguished.

But soon, the Revered Star flying boat trembled violently again, waking them up.

"What's wrong? Is the flying boat being attacked from the outside?"

"A void tribulation?"

The five immediately realized, their faces filled with elation.

"We still have a chance!"

At this moment, they all noticed the anomaly of the flying boat.

The Heavenly and Earthly Essences that had been absorbed earlier did not reappear.

The flying boat also seemed to have gone through a fierce battle, with faint cracks visible on its walls.

While the five were still in doubt,

The cold voice of the Revered Star flying boat rang out again.

"Star Sea Unknown Civilization Third Battle."

"Reserve energy exhausted."

"Based on deduction, the probability of winning the next battle is zero."

"Executing backup plan..."

"Transmitting data..."

"Initiating flying boat self-destruction..."

The flying boat's announcement made the five surviving Dao Integration cultivators' expressions change drastically.

"Not good!"

Lan Yu instinctively deployed the Martial Training Grounds, once again enveloping the five of them.

The other four also deployed their methods, assisting each other.

"Initiating... Ini... Ini..."

However, something even more astonishing happened.

The Revered Star flying boat's voice seemed to be interfered with, stuttering and repeating. But no explosion occurred.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

Above the flying boat, loud rumbling sounds reverberated once more.

Amidst billowing smoke and dust, a circular opening suddenly appeared. Over thirty unknown beings clad in peculiar armor filed in through the opening.

They were well-trained and divided into ten people to surround Lan Yu and his group.

The remaining individuals continued their exploration into the flying boat.

"Brother Lan Yu, you are knowledgeable. What do you think is happening?" Xu Guanhai asked via divine sense.

Guan Xingxiu said uncertainly, "Unknown Star Sea Civilization?"

"It's possible. Let's not act rashly for now. Let's try to communicate first."

After all, the Revered Star flying boat, which they were helpless against, was easily conquered by these mysterious individuals. Their strength was evident.

It was better not to fight if they could avoid it.

After a brief discussion, Lan Yu spoke first, "Fellow Daoists, we mean no harm..."

The response from the other side was swift, using the same language: "Stop the nonsense and be quiet!"

"Big Brother Liu, we can't break through their protective artifacts for now. Should we use the 'Immortal Script' again?"

"No rush for now, just keep them contained. We'll discuss it after we drag this flying boat back."

...

"Immortal Script?"

Lan Yu and the others exchanged glances.

Time flowed by in a strange atmosphere.

The slight tremor of the Revered Star flying boat broke the stalemate.

"Phew... we can drop our defenses now."

With a sound of relief, another team arrived inside the Revered Star flying boat and took charge.

The leader was a long-haired man wearing a peculiar Daoist robe, with a broken black jade hairpin adorning his head.

Although the man exuded the same Dao Integration realm aura as Lan Yu and his group, there seemed to be an additional mysterious power mixed in.

This caused the five Dao Integration cultivators from the Xuanhuang Realm to instinctively feel a faint sense of crisis.

It was like facing a terrifying tribulation in the boundless dark void.

"Fellow Daoist..."

Lan Yu and the others attempted to communicate with the long-haired Daoist.

However, the other party seemed not to hear them, muttering to himself, "As Brother Zhao predicted, a ship was indeed captured in that direction. This is something that hasn't happened in thousands of years."

"Keep an eye on them!"

Before Lan Yu and the others could speak further, the long-haired man casually glanced at them.

In his pitch-black eyes, a character appeared like a phantom.

It manifested in Lan Yu and the others' minds, instantly expanding to fill their entire perception, becoming as vast as heaven and earth, encompassing all they saw, felt, and heard.

They were unable to see, unable to hear.

They were plunged into infinite darkness.

To the observers outside, it only seemed as if the long-haired Daoist had casually glanced at them, and Lan Yu and the other four were instantly stunned, standing frozen in place.

Silence fell upon the scene. After the long-haired Daoist left, the crowd began to whisper amongst themselves.

"Elder Wang is getting stronger. These are all genuine Dao Integration powerhouses!"

"What crap Dao Integration? Without the power of the 'Immortal Script,' what difference do they have from Golden Core or Nascent Soul cultivators? They're just stronger."

"That's true."

...

The long-haired Daoist returned in haste. This captured flying boat would naturally be handled by specialized personnel.

Although the craftsmanship of this flying boat was indeed superb, the most crucial aspect was the absence of any fluctuations from the True Immortal Script's power.

Therefore, its true value was rather ordinary.

What the long-haired Daoist was concerned about was something else.

Zhao Xian, from the Academy of Proving the Dao, had actually predicted the arrival of this flying boat from the depths of the star sea...

How could he have done that?

Could it be that he had secretly comprehended another True Immortal Script?

The long-haired Daoist pondered endlessly, subconsciously touching the broken black jade hairpin on his head.

"Has this one, who has been dormant for seven to eight years, finally begun to reveal his true power?"

"In a single day, he went from entering the Soul Transformation realm in the morning to achieving Dao Integration in the evening, completely shattering the understanding of cultivation speed among the crew of the Immortal Boat, and then further comprehending a brand new True Immortal Script..."

The long-haired Daoist hurried his steps and soon returned from the Immortal Boat docking port to the Immortal Severing Tower.

In a quiet, dimly lit secret room, the long-haired Daoist met Zhao Xian, who also had disheveled hair.

"Brother Zhao," the long-haired Daoist said softly, without the arrogance he had displayed outside.

Zhao Xian ignored him, his eyes closed as if lost in thought.

From time to time, he lightly traced patterns in the air with his fingers, muttering to himself.

After a long while, Zhao Xian finally spoke, "The flying boat was found?"

The long-haired Daoist nodded.

"This Immortal Boat comes from the other side of the star sea, the former location of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The Xuanhuang Realm, like our Immortal Boat, survived the Great Tribulation. However, they still retain considerable resources..."

A look of shock crossed the long-haired Daoist's face.

Zhao Xian continued, "Unfortunately, the Xuanhuang Realm is too far away from us. And it is too close to the Immortal Ruins."

"It would be uneconomical for the Immortal Boat to make a trip. Of course, the final decision will be made by the Elder Council."

As Zhao Xian spoke, he handed a point of light to the long-haired Daoist.

After examining the information in the point of light, the long-haired Daoist's breathing quickened.

"Brother Zhao, how did you perceive all of this?"

Before leaving, the long-haired Daoist quietly asked.

Zhao Xian smiled slightly, "The star sea may be vast, but to a True Immortal, it is like looking through a clear window. When you, Wang Hai, comprehended the True Immortal Script, did you not experience various phenomena appearing in your mind?"

Wang Hai naturally did not say no and nodded, "I see. Brother Zhao's talent is truly extraordinary!"

Zhao Xian accepted the compliment calmly and then handed over another point of light. "This is my new understanding. After you review it, submit it to the Elder Council."

Wang Hai, as if receiving a priceless treasure, instantly forgot his previous unpleasantness and eagerly began to examine the contents.

"Wonderful, wonderful!"

Wang Hai was mesmerized, engrossed in it, unable to extricate himself.

A long time later, the broken black jade hairpin on his head trembled slightly, as if it would break free at any moment. Only then did Wang Hai regain his senses.

"Brother Zhao is truly a great talent!" This time, Wang Hai bowed sincerely, then left excitedly.

Zhao Xian, or rather, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, watched Wang Hai depart, sensing the distorted figure gradually losing control under the influence of the True Immortal Script's power, and a faint smile appeared on his face.

Due to the inconsistent flow of time, nine years had passed since Zhao Xian broke through to the Nascent Soul realm and was accepted as a core disciple by the Academy of Proving the Dao.

The real Zhao Xian, influenced by the illusion created by the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, was constantly tense and worried about the Immortal Boat being destroyed in the future. Even with Li Fan's help, his inner demons plagued him.

Furthermore, his divine sense, a clone of Li Fan's, was nearing exhaustion, yet his condition had not improved.

He had also repeatedly exhibited anomalies, attracting the attention of the academy's Third Elder, nearly exposing Li Fan's existence.

Li Fan also vaguely sensed the difference between cultivation on the Immortal Boat and in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Cultivators on the Immortal Boat, whether breaking through bottlenecks or in their daily practice, were susceptible to inner demons.

These inner demons originated from the Dao of the Star Sea and directly impacted the cultivator.

Each time Li Fan helped him intercept them, the frequency of inner demons appearing afterward increased.

And as Zhao Xian's actual cultivation realm grew stronger, the power of these inner demons also increased proportionally.

Therefore, Li Fan decided to stop wasting his efforts on him and directly used the "Dao Pill" technique he had learned on the Immortal Boat on Zhao Xian.

His divine sense merged and took over.

This severed the possibility of inner demons appearing from the root.

Zhao Xian's own talent could only be described as passable.

However, to Li Fan's surprise, after swallowing the Dao Pill and inheriting Zhao Xian's body, he also synchronously inherited the characteristics of the Immortal Boat's natives.

Similarly, with cultivation, he would be plagued by inner demons.

However, compared to Zhao Xian, Li Fan, who had experienced many worldly matters, possessed a strong will.

Ordinary inner demons could not shake him.

Therefore, his cultivation proceeded without any obstacles.

According to his plan, he infiltrated the Academy of Proving the Dao, greedily absorbing the technological knowledge accumulated by the Immortal Boat over centuries.

He then actively volunteered to represent the academy and come to the Immortal Severing Tower.

To learn and test the methods of utilizing the True Immortal Script without harm, as spoken of by the Immortal Severing Tower.

What the Immortal Severing Tower spoke of was not false.

They had indeed mastered exquisite methods to allow mortal cultivators to wield a portion of the True Immortal Script's power.

Just as the Dao Integration cultivator named Wang Hai had done, subduing Lan Yu and the other four with a single move.

The key was the broken black jade hairpin he wore.

This jade hairpin was a World-Destroying Relic salvaged by the Immortal Boat from vast ruins. Over the years, it had been influenced by the True Immortal Script. Its core retained traces of the Dao corresponding to the True Immortal Script.

Furthermore, it was constantly buffeted by the distant stellar forces echoing in the void.

In the collision of these two different True Immortal forces, this black jade hairpin became a special existence.

Although the Immortal Pivot Department of the Immortal Boat had also mastered the power of the True Immortal Script through these World-Destroying Relics over the years, using the "Attaining the Dao" method, they only selected relics influenced by a single True Immortal force.

The deeper one attained the Dao, the stronger the restraint of the True Immortal Script became. Not only would their bodies undergo terrifying changes, but even their minds would be affected, leading to madness.

The Immortal Severing Tower inadvertently discovered these relics with traces of two True Immortal Script forces.

They utilized and studied one of them, while using the distant stellar forces attached to it as an "anchor point."

When one delved too deep into the Dao, they could detach from the attained Dao realm by tracing back the influence of the echoing stellar forces.

Although this method, in terms of ultimate power, was inferior to that of the Immortal Pivot Department,

It was safe and could be promoted to the vast majority of cultivators.

Even those at the Nascent Soul realm, with the assistance of special World-Destroying Relics and a period of training, could instantly activate and unleash the power of the True Immortal Script.

And if they were to fight in the star sea, if the surrounding environment contained residual True Immortal Script power,

Then its might would be terrifying and awe-inspiring.

It far surpassed the limits of ordinary Dao Integration cultivators on the Immortal Boat.

Because of this method, the Immortal Severing Tower surpassed others and almost completely replaced the Immortal Pivot Department, becoming the nominal ruler of the Immortal Boat.

However, considering that in extreme situations, the strength of experienced "Dao Attainers" was still required, the Immortal Pivot Department was also retained.

Li Fan, having infiltrated the Immortal Severing Tower, had personally tried to "attain the Dao" with an anchor point.

But having witnessed the full power of the True Immortal Script unleashed, how could he be interested in such a shortcut?

What piqued his interest here was the research on different True Immortal Scripts.

This was because cultivators on the Immortal Boat could only infer the origin of the True Immortal Script's power through World-Destroying Relics. It was like blind men touching an elephant; each cultivator, based on their limited perception, developed diverse insights.

Li Fan, a firsthand witness, could select the correct versions from a pile of guesswork.

For those like "Hunger," "Chaos," and "Nothingness," whose complete character forms he had seen, it was naturally not problematic.

For "Solitude," encountered during his journey across the star sea, as well as "Fallen" and "Void"...

It was truly a treasure trove for Li Fan.

The True Immortal Scripts, despite their different forms of power manifestation, were all created by the "Script-Carving Immortal."

In a sense, they shared commonalities.

After mastering four or five correct answers, Li Fan could more easily find versions closer to the truth from the research of the Immortal Severing Tower.

This was also the fundamental reason why he could submit "insights" after disguising himself as Zhao Xian.

In fact, as expected of True Immortal Scripts, even the versions deduced from their power manifestations could rival a cultivator's offensive divine abilities.

The destruction caused by Li Fan practicing outside the Immortal Boat made him secretly astonished.

And among the many documents in the Immortal Severing Tower, what interested Li Fan the most was the speculative research on the classification of True Immortal Scripts.

Chapter 1282

In this life, Li Fan had also attempted to categorize the True Immortal Script he had encountered.

However, that was from the perspective of their specific powers—destruction, commandments, buffs, and so on.

But here, in the Severed Immortal Tower beyond the sea of stars, it was from a new and novel angle.

That is: whether the Dao depicted by the True Immortal Script had already been occupied by a True Immortal, or, in other words, had been occupied by a True Immortal in the past.

According to the descriptions in numerous documents within the Severed Immortal Tower, the difficulty and danger of cultivating and entering the Dao through these different types of True Immortal Script were vastly incomparable.

If a Dao was occupied by a True Immortal, any who dared to attempt to enter the Dao through the script would instantly turn to ashes and vanish without a trace upon "obtaining the Dao." No matter how powerful or talented they were, they could not avoid this fate.

If the Dao was not occupied by a True Immortal, then even with some side effects, ordinary individuals could still glimpse the grand Dao depicted by the True Immortal Script.

Li Fan carefully pondered the scattered insights of his predecessors that he could access with his current "contributions."

The method of merely copying and attempting to depict True Immortal Script was fundamentally different. The Severed Immortal Tower and even the Profound Immortal Boat, rather than directly utilizing the power of True Immortal Script, were borrowing from the World-Destroying Remnants to mobilize the residual immortal power.

So-called "entering the Dao" was not a true entry into the path of a True Immortal. It was more akin to one's body, soul, and consciousness integrating into the World-Destroying Remnants, acquiring certain characteristics born from its tempering by time, thereby enabling better mobilization of the residual immortal power in the sea of stars.

Undoubtedly, this was a method of expediency. If the environment changed, and there were not so many residual immortal powers in the sea of stars, even if one could "enter the Dao," the displayed power would undoubtedly be greatly weakened. Li Fan's method of copying the fundamental shapes of True Immortal Script, regardless of location, depended solely on the caster's own strength and their understanding of the True Immortal Script.

Of course, this was merely Li Fan's current understanding, having personally witnessed the True Immortal Script. The people of the Immortal Boat would likely never agree. Unless Li Fan was willing to share the fundamental shapes of the True Immortal Script. With the Immortal Boat's accumulation of thousands of years, if they could witness the true appearance of the True Immortal Script, the overall strength of the Immortal Boat might achieve a qualitative leap in a short time...

However, Li Fan was not foolish enough to do so.

It was still better to continue as he was, occasionally submitting an "insight" in exchange for contributions—it was leisurely and safe. After all, these were genuine sentiments inspired by actual "True Immortal Script," and no matter how strange the angle, they were absolutely correct.

"This is the fundamental difference in being able to witness the true transmission. They try every means to replicate the origin from all the superficial aspects of the True Immortal Script. But I was fortunate enough to witness the true appearance of the origin long ago, and proceeding from top to bottom is naturally smooth and effortless."

Although Li Fan firmly believed that the Immortal Boat's method was merely a clever shortcut, he could not deny that for ants like them, who existed below True Immortals, it was entirely worthwhile to be able to mobilize the power that originally belonged to True Immortals.

After all, in the Abyssal Sea, survival was the top priority.

Without these research achievements on True Immortal Script, the Profound Immortal Boat would likely have long ago become one with the endless ruins of the sea of stars.

As for Li Fan guiding the Profound Immortal Boat to capture the Myriad Immortals Alliance's flying boat this time, apart from wanting to accumulate some merit points for this body, the more significant reason was to use the mouths of the Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance to leak the existence of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerates.

Having infiltrated the Profound Immortal Boat for so long, Li Fan finally understood the identity of the mysterious cultivator he had encountered at the beginning of his arrival in the Sea of Remnants.

They were once all members of the Profound Immortal Boat, and even one of its supreme authorities. However, several hundred years ago, misled by some outsider, they unknowningly reached some secret cooperation agreement and allowed this outsider to enter the Immortal Boat's most secret "Hundred Heard Immortal Record."

This outsider claimed to only be borrowing ancient secret records preserved within, but after entering, he never came out until the agreed-upon time. The people of the Immortal Boat sensed something was wrong and hurriedly investigated, only to be shocked to discover that numerous secret treasures within the "Hundred Heard Immortal Record" had disappeared.

Along with that outsider, the three Dao Integration cultivators responsible for guarding them had also vanished without anyone noticing.

The Immortal Boat was shaken, those in power were purged, and a small-scale internal conflict occurred.

The final outcome was that a small group of people escaped the Immortal Boat. However, these people never gave up on the Immortal Boat, and with nowhere else to go in the vast Abyssal Sea, they lurked in the Sea of Remnants, hoping to one day counterattack and return to the Profound Immortal Boat.

As for the Immortal Boat, although they had never stopped pursuing these people, it was difficult to capture them in the vast sea of stars.

They could only tolerate their existence.

Everyone on the Immortal Boat harbored resentment towards the outsider who caused this internal conflict, especially regarding the lost secret treasures, which were an eternal pain in their hearts.

However, the outsider's identity was extremely mysterious, and perhaps only those rebel cultivators of the Immortal Boat might know.

Since that incident, the person had never reappeared.

Although Li Fan was not certain if this outsider was indeed the Doctrine Transmitter, it did not prevent him from creating the "possibility" that they were the same person.

After all, in the current Abyssal Sea, external things were scarce, and there were not many living people.

Near the The Great Barrier, and mysterious...

Besides the Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, who else could it be?

Li Fan believed that if the Immortal Boat learned that in the more vast Sea of Severed Realms, far beyond the Sea of Remnants, there was a powerful figure who was likely an ancient enemy, they would definitely try to investigate there.

After all, one could not sleep soundly with a tiger lying next to one's bed—this was an eternal truth.

And Li Fan could use the Profound Immortal Boat as a tool to probe the capabilities of the Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician.

He didn't expect any real achievements but was content with even a sliver of information. For Li Fan, it was merely a casual nudge with no cost involved.

"The ultimate victory might be built upon these inconspicuous pieces of information. The Immortal Boat and the Sacred Emperor are all pawns I use to test the waters."

Li Fan reread a document, thinking this to himself.

As for the Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, their fate was not even within his purview. In the Xuanhuang Realm, they were merely expendables anyway.

However, what Li Fan did not expect was that three days later, Wang Hai, the long-haired Dao Integration cultivator, returned.

He also brought back a拷问 record.

"Brother Zhao, take a look. What happened on this flying boat is truly spectacular."

Li Fan scanned it and frowned slightly, "This flying boat is so strong? Dao Integration cultivators are like mere rations..."

Wang Hai nodded, "We had to fight it three times before finally breaking through its defenses. And we consumed quite a few Remnants."

"But it was not without profit. The resources carried by each of those Dao Integration cultivators were incredibly lavish. Not to mention, the things stored within the flying boat called [Heaven and Earth Essence]..."

Li Fan raised his head slightly, feigning ignorance, "What exactly is this Heaven and Earth Essence? Is it the personification of world laws?"

Wang Hai smiled, "If it were merely that, I wouldn't be so excited and have to run back to share the good news with you. This so-called Heaven and Earth Essence, in addition to the lawful power of the cultivation world, also contains a considerable portion of the foundational power that constructs the world."

"If we compare the cultivation world to a house, then this Heaven and Earth Essence can be seen as the main beams used to build the house! And this is precisely what our Profound Immortal Boat lacks! With the replenishment of this [fuel], our Immortal Boat can operate smoothly for another century!"

From Wang Hai's voice, one could undoubtedly hear his inner joy.

He chattered on, adding, "Even the flying boat itself can be dismantled and used to reinforce our Immortal Boat. Brother Zhao's premonition this time has brought the Immortal Boat a harvest comparable to dozens of Remnants!"

Li Fan continued to lower his head and read the document, "I only care about specific rewards. By the way, what did the Elder Council of the world called the Xuanhuang Realm say? Although the fat meat is far away, it could still save our lives."

Wang Hai shrugged, "You know those people in the Elder Council. They always use 'the bigger picture' and 'the future of the Immortal Boat' as excuses. A cross-sea expedition like this..."

"I think it will only happen when our Immortal Boat is truly at its wits' end."

Li Fan nodded thoughtfully, "It's a pity. In my premonition, the Dao Integration cultivators like those on the flying boat are already the highest combat power in that Xuanhuang Realm. There are only a handful of Longevity cultivators, no more than ten. If our Immortal Boat were to arrive, they would have no power to resist..."

Wang Hai agreed, full of disdain, "They are merely parasites clinging to a surviving cultivation world. In my opinion, they don't even need the full strength of the Immortal Boat; just three to five 'Dao Entrants' would be enough to easily suppress the Xuanhuang Realm."

Wang Hai sighed again, lamenting, "It's a pity the Elder Council does not permit it."

Li Fan did not reply, and instead asked, "What are my rewards? It can't be that after making such a great contribution, the Elder Council gave nothing, right?"

Wang Hai finally stopped playing coy and carefully produced a jade slip.

The moment the jade slip appeared, Li Fan's gaze narrowed.

He keenly noticed that the half-jade hairpin on Wang Hai's head trembled incessantly, and the jade slip itself subtly emanated the power fluctuation of True Immortal Script.

"This is..."

Li Fan quickly reacted, "The jade slip itself is a World-Destroying Remnant?"

Wang Hai said with a hint of pride, "That's right. This is considered the third [World-Destroying Jade Slip] our Immortal Boat has collected. Each time one observes a World-Destroying Jade Slip, a portion of the True Immortal power attached to it is consumed, making it exceptionally precious. The Elder Council has really bled for this one."

"What is recorded in this jade slip?"

"I'd like to know too, but I don't have the qualification. You'll know when you look at it. Hurry up, after you finish reading, I need to take it back." Wang Hai looked at the jade slip in Li Fan's hand with envy and urged him on.

Li Fan then solemnly separated his divine sense and delved into it.

World-Destroying Jade Slips were a very special type of World-Destroying Remnant.

Unlike ordinary magic artifacts, due to the years of immersion in True Immortal power, although the World-Destroying Jade Slip itself did not carry the power of True Immortal Script, True Immortal power would permeate the content recorded in the jade slip.

Causing a certain "mutation" in it.

Or rather, an elevation.

The elevated content was as if it had received guidance from a True Immortal, achieving a qualitative leap.

Mortal cultivation methods transformed into True Immortal methods. Even a simple piece of writing would become something that could lead to enlightenment after being infused with True Immortal power.

In short, World-Destroying Jade Slips were one of the few current methods to harmlessly approach True Immortals at close range.

As his divine sense entered the World-Destroying Jade Slip, the original content of the jade slip first flooded in.

It was a common method for tempering one's will. Judging by its rank, its highest level was only Soul Transformation.

After reading it in an instant, the divine sense suddenly felt a change.

The originally unremarkable text seemed to come alive, twisting and mutating, transforming into entirely new characters.

Then, after rearranging the positions, a brand-new immortal technique instantly appeared on the page.

"Hmm?"

Li Fan's heart trembled, and he quickly read through the new technique several times.

A familiar yet strange sensation gradually arose in his heart as his understanding deepened.

"Immortal Heart Incantation?"

"But it's not from the Xuanhuang Realm."

"And... there are slight differences in the subtle details. After all, it wasn't genuinely deduced and personally transmitted by a True Immortal, but rather evolved by the jade slip itself. It can even be considered a weakened version of the Azure Nether Immortal Heart Incantation," Li Fan mused with a hint of regret.

However, on his face, he maintained an expression of excitement and deep immersion.

As the flowing text in his mind slowly faded and finally disappeared completely.

Li Fan reluctantly returned the World-Destroying Jade Slip, while also saying, "As expected of an Immortal technique. With this method, I can be protected from inner demons in the future. Even the negative effects when comprehending True Immortal Script will be greatly reduced."

"And please thank the elders for me!"

Hearing this, Wang Hai subconsciously glanced at the World-Destroying Jade Slip in his hand. He then forcibly suppressed the urge to peek.

Setting aside the Elder Council's restrictions on it, which he couldn't bypass, taking it without permission was a major taboo of the Immortal Boat.

Even he, if he committed such an offense, would only end up as a living specimen for researching Immortal Script.

"The rewards I received this time are also thanks to your long-standing efforts in facilitating things for me, Brother Wang. Here are my insights. Please accept them." Li Fan saw his expression, closed his eyes slightly, gathered his focus, and immediately inscribed another jade slip, handing it over.

Wang Hai was overjoyed, "Thank you, Brother Zhao! I will go through fire and water for you in the future!"

After exchanging pleasantries, he directly took the jade slip and began to read.

Immersed in it, his face lit up with joy.

After a while, recovering from his insights, Wang Hai crushed the jade slip Li Fan had inscribed in front of him.

This was the rule of knowledge dissemination within the Immortal Boat.

Although there was no restriction like "Incompatibility of Laws," cultivation methods, Dao techniques, and various insights were still incredibly precious resources.

Just like the World-Destroying Jade Slip rewarded by the Elder Council this time, only Li Fan was qualified to observe it; it could not be lent to others.

However, after Li Fan finished observing it, he was allowed to impart his own insights, and there were no such restrictions.

But after all, it was a second-hand transmission. The effect would undoubtedly be inferior to experiencing it firsthand. Especially concerning True Immortal power, even if the textual description was exactly the same, without being able to feel the evolution of the profound power, both the progress of cultivation and the subtlety of comprehension would naturally be much weaker.

Unless one was a peerless genius who could ignore this natural gap. Otherwise, ordinary second or third transmissions would be weaker than the first.

It was precisely because of adhering to this rule that Wang Hai crushed the jade slip inscribed by Li Fan after finishing reading it.

After he left today, he would have the right to disseminate this technique again. However, issued by him, it would already be beyond the first transmission, and its effectiveness would be further diminished.

If those who cultivated this method were ambitious and wished to progress further, they would need to trace back along the path of transmission, pay a certain price, and beg the earlier transmitters. As for whether they could obtain the true method, it would depend on their sincerity.

Li Fan had been infiltrating the Profound Immortal Boat for over ten years and was well aware of its rules.

Upon seeing Wang Hai's subsequent actions, and as a reciprocal gift, Li Fan presented another jade slip of his insights. The two then bid farewell with reluctance.

"By the way, among the five living Dao Integration cultivators from the Xuanhuang Realm, one of them has something strange about him. So, out of caution, the Elder Council has not acted against him yet. If you're interested, you might want to investigate." Wang Hai left this ambiguous remark before departing.

Li Fan couldn't help but fall into thought.

According to the Immortal Boat's rules, such indirect suggestions were only made when it involved the higher echelons of the Immortal Boat or their backing forces.

"A survivor..."

"It should be Blue Feather? After all, he is the only one who cultivates the Ancient Law of Dao Integration, so he has no value to the Immortal Boat. But there's nothing strange about him..."

"Grand Master Tiandu?"

Li Fan had thoughts and straightened his slightly disheveled clothes, then left to head towards the Elder Council of the Severed Immortal Tower.

The entire Immortal Boat was currently established on a Void Divine Tree, and after the Severed Immortal Tower gained actual control of the Immortal Boat, it relocated to the top of the Void Divine Tree.

Woven strands of green light, like the tips of branches, connected the various buildings of the Severed Immortal Tower.

Stepping through the void, without needing to fly, one could control the green light to travel between different locations with a mere thought.

Looking down, one could vaguely see the Academy of Proving the Dao, the Star Forging Workshop, and the newly built Valley of Suppressed Crimes beneath the giant Divine Tree.

They seemed to float in endless void, connected by the Divine Tree.

The giant Li Fan had seen before, impaled through the center of its body by the Divine Tree, had been completely drained. Now, a colossal rabbit had taken its place.

This rabbit was white with black ears and had a human-like face. Although it was dead, its expression seemed compassionate, as if it had witnessed something profoundly heartbreaking before its demise.

This [Human Emperor Rabbit], like the previous [Dao Pursuer] giant, was part of the secret treasures of the Profound Immortal Boat’s "Hundred Heard Immortal Record."

The collected materials in the secret treasure trove not only came from the prosperous cultivation era before the destruction of the sea of stars, but also included many strange and wondrous items collected by the Profound Immortal Boat over thousands of years of drifting in the Abyssal Sea.

Li Fan's gaze subtly flickered over the Human Emperor Rabbit's nearly desiccated body, but his thoughts drifted to the Immortal Boat's secret treasures.

If there was anything on the Immortal Boat worth his scheming for, it was likely this [Hundred Heard Immortal Record].

"Perhaps, and add to it, the whereabouts of the Merchant Immortal Boat, the other half."

Li Fan suddenly thought this.

As a part of the original Profound Merchant Immortal Boat, although the Profound and Merchant Immortal Boats had lost contact for a long time, they could still occasionally sense each other's existence.

However, any information about the Merchant Immortal Boat was the highest secret of the Profound Immortal Boat. Even the Elder Council of the Severed Immortal Tower only had the right to know about it among the core three.

Li Fan had only managed to overhear one or two sentences during a casual listening to an Elder Council meeting while he was lurking for over ten years.

"I wonder what the specific situation of the Merchant Immortal Boat is; its secrecy level is even higher than that of True Immortal Script..."

Just as Li Fan was contemplating, he arrived at the very top of the Void Divine Tree, where the Elder Council of the Severed Immortal Tower was located.

The first thing Li Fan did was naturally to visit his "teacher."

Within the Profound Immortal Boat, lineage and faction were highly valued.

Wang Hai's repeated running of errands and relaying messages for him was naturally because both Li Fan and Wang Hai were disciples of the Severed Immortal Tower's Third Elder, Ai Tianjue.

And this Ai Tianjue had an even closer relationship with Li Fan.

This was because Ai Tianjue also hailed from the Academy of Proving the Dao.

However, in order to research new methods of entering the Dao, he had joined the Severed Immortal Tower after leaving the academy and had remained obscure, known to few, until his research bore fruit and the Severed Immortal Tower successfully took control of the Immortal Boat. Ai Tianjue then reappeared in the public eye.

"Greetings, Master." Li Fan bowed respectfully, his expression unfazed, then truthfully explained his insights from the World-Destroying Jade Slip he had just received to his teacher.

Any gains made by a student had to be reported to and submitted to their teacher.

This was naturally also a rule of the Immortal Boat.

After listening to Li Fan's account, Ai Tianjue nodded slightly, "I have also seen this jade slip. Your talent is indeed extraordinary; you have already grasped seven to eight tenths of its essence."

Li Fan bowed respectfully again, thanking his teacher for the praise.

"But do not rely on it too much." Ai Tianjue's tone abruptly shifted.

"You must know that inner demons are tribulations, but also opportunities. Although they can be vanquished with skillful methods, inner demons are endless, vanishing only to be reborn. Relying on the Immortal Heart Incantation to pacify them is ultimately a lesser path."

"It is better to transform them into nourishment for your cultivation, which will be far more beneficial for your practice..."

Ai Tianjue spoke slowly and unhurriedly.

While lecturing Li Fan, he was also writing something on a white paper.

As one of the top powerhouses of the Severed Immortal Tower, every word he spoke, even the slightest, could provide inspiration to the current Li Fan.

Li Fan listened attentively, his gaze not betraying any curiosity about the content Ai Tianjue was writing.

After Ai Tianjue finished lecturing, he did not stop writing.

It was only after a good half-day that he finally put down his brush.

"See how this calligraphy is. What do you think?" Ai Tianjue said to Li Fan.

Li Fan then looked up.

On the white paper, there was a "complete" True Immortal Script.

This was Li Fan's first reaction upon seeing it.

"Fallen..."

Upon closer observation, Li Fan felt a sense of loss.

"It's not a complete True Immortal Script. It has only been restored to about eighty to ninety percent."

"However, to be able to deduce this much from a pile of broken fragments is truly extraordinary..."

Li Fan felt that he himself would certainly not have been able to achieve this level.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan articulated his perception of the word "Fallen": "This 'fallen' is not the fall of the mind and spirit. It is the fundamental downfall of all things. A descent from a higher level to a lower level."

"True Immortals transform into cultivators, cultivators into mortals, mortals into dust..."

With just one word, Li Fan spoke for a good half-day about his insights.

And he had still not reached complete understanding.

When Li Fan finished, Ai Tianjue first pointed out several errors in Li Fan's words, then sighed slightly, "To perceive the words of a True Immortal is like riding a horse to view scenery."

"This calligraphy of 'Fallen' had already been restored to six to seven tenths by the Immortal Boat a thousand years ago. After a thousand years, the progress has only increased by a fraction."

"The closer one gets to the true meaning of Immortal Script, the slower the progress becomes. And even a slight discrepancy, compared to the true True Immortal Script, results in a vast difference in power."

"To see the path ahead but be unable to tread upon it. The Immortal Path, how difficult it is!"

Li Fan found Ai Tianjue's sigh somewhat strange.

It did not sound like something his teacher, a research fanatic, would say.

"Master, why do you say that?" Li Fan asked directly, without hiding his curiosity.

Ai Tianjue then explained the origin of his sentiment.

"That Azure Nether Dao Integration cultivator, Blue Feather, cultivates a true Immortal technique."

"Myriad Calamities Feather Transformation Technique..."

"My heart yearns for it!"

Ai Tianjue sighed again.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan's heart was profoundly shaken.

He knew how high his teacher's standards were. If he said it was a true Immortal technique, then it was undoubtedly an Immortal-grade cultivation method, just like the Azure Nether Immortal Heart Incantation.

But...

How was that possible?

Blue Feather?

Didn't he cultivate the "Heavenly Capital Feather Transformation Technique"?

In an instant, Li Fan's eyes narrowed, countless thoughts flashing through his mind.

His verbal response, however, was swift, "Since that Blue Feather has fallen into our Immortal Boat's hands, doesn't this Immortal technique essentially belong to our Immortal Boat?"

"Where is the regret in Master's words?"

He feigned confusion.

Ai Tianjue smiled and shook his head, "That Xuanhuang Realm has a law that prohibits cultivating multiple Daos concurrently. Although the Immortal Boat is far from the Xuanhuang Realm and not subject to this restriction, the Immortal technique cultivated by Blue Feather has similar constraints."

"To cultivate the Myriad Calamities Feather Transformation Technique, it requires the 'Feather of Myriad Calamities' as a guide. Without this treasure, no matter how astonishing one's talent, they cannot begin."

Li Fan was slightly stunned.

"The Feather of Myriad Calamities has already merged with that Blue Feather, and it is not something we can separate."

"Therefore, even though the Immortal technique is before our eyes, we can only look at it, not cultivate it!"

Ai Tianjue shook his head again, "This situation is quite similar to the only recorded Immortal technique in the secret treasures of our Profound Immortal Boat."

Li Fan also put on a thoughtful expression, "It's not just cultivation methods; is it the same for True Immortal Script? When occupied by a True Immortal, others cannot cultivate it..."

Ai Tianjue waved his hand, collecting the writing on the table, his expression unreadable, "That's why I suddenly had a feeling that day that perhaps not fully comprehending this True Immortal Script was a good thing."

"Otherwise, there would undoubtedly be another storm of bloodshed within the Immortal Boat."

Li Fan remained silent upon hearing this.

"However, speaking of which, the origin of the Xuanhuang Realm's rule of 'Incompatibility of Laws' is quite interesting," Ai Tianjue suddenly said.

Li Fan looked at his teacher.

He saw him muttering to himself, "This restriction should be unique to the Immortal Realm. It should not be something that a lower realm's Heavenly Dao could derive..."

Chapter 1283: Initial Trial of the Primordial Void Formation (7K)

Li Fan was startled upon hearing this. "How can this be? Could it be that this Xuanhuang Realm has some connection to the legendary Immortal Realm?"

Ai Tianjue spoke enigmatically, "Heh, it's hard to say, hard to say! The history of this Xuanhuang Realm is quite interesting. Once we dig out more from Bai Lan's mind, perhaps those old fellows will change their minds."

"I just don't know if it will be a blessing or a curse for our Immortal Boat."

After speaking, Ai Tianjue fell silent for a moment before officially beginning his lesson for Li Fan.

Li Fan's constant calls of "Teacher" were not in vain.

Without the restriction of not being able to cultivate multiple types of laws simultaneously, the master-disciple inheritance here consisted of true marvelous techniques.

Li Fan had been under Ai Tianjue's tutelage for five years and, having gained his approval, was taught the "Jade Void Inner Scenery Spirit Weeping Technique."

This profound technique was precisely the fundamental cultivation method that Ai Tianjue himself practiced.

"The Water and Fire Qiankun are inverted, the Jade Void Profound Technique is marvelous. The Azure Sea refines the void, and the Spirit Weeping transforms into divine abilities..."

Li Fan nodded in agreement.

The essence of cultivation techniques was to construct an inner scenery world within one's own divine soul.

This Jade Void Inner Scenery Spirit Weeping Technique was a supreme divine ability passed down since ancient times in the Mystic Immortal Boat. It was said to be an exquisite cultivation method that the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat exchanged for a supreme treasure with a sect from a major cultivation realm when the ancient immortal path was not yet severed.

Over time, everything within the inner scenery world would move according to one's will.

It advocated for discarding all cultivation technique foundations and directly dedicating one's entire being to the True Immortal Sigils.

Unlike Ai Tianjue, who was somewhat "traditional," this Elder Chi Gongdao could be considered an uncompromising radical of the Immortal Boat.

Li Fan bowed respectfully and took his leave, thinking to himself, "A teacher treats a person with sincerity, and a student repays the teacher with honesty. This is the true inheritance that has allowed the Mystic Immortal Boat to endure for thousands of years without interruption. As for the Immortal Pivot Department and the Immortal Severing Tower, they are merely skin-deep changes. The true core lies in these master-disciple connections."

This teaching method was actually a commonly used cultivation method on the Immortal Boat.

Within the inner scenery world, one wept for spirits to cultivate. Weeping, as in crying.

Although Li Fan did not have a formal master-disciple relationship with Elder Chi, he had earned the elder's appreciation due to his unique insights into the True Immortal Sigils that he had submitted multiple times.

Therefore, his status within the Immortal Severing Tower, and indeed the entire Immortal Boat, was exceptionally transcendent.

People from the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat constantly traveled through the sea of stars, traversing various cultivation realms. They had no fixed abode and found it difficult to cultivate with true peace of mind.

The Spirit Weeping Technique perfectly addressed these two pain points.

Ai Tianjue held a glowing book and slowly recited the contents of the "Jade Void Inner Scenery Spirit Weeping Technique."

Ai Tianjue nodded slightly, his gaze filled with approval. "After you return, you must recite this daily and not slack off. Your Spirit Weeping Technique has reached its most crucial stage. Once the inner scenery world takes shape, and your thoughts move as your heart desires, you might be able to catch up to me within half a year."

Ai Tianjue was one of the top experts in the Immortal Severing Tower and had a profound understanding of the True Immortal Sigils, his abilities were undoubtedly trustworthy.

After more than half a day, Ai Tianjue finally finished reciting the Spirit Weeping Technique. He let out a long sigh, and the sweat on his forehead instantly evaporated.

The teaching effectiveness of the "Sentient Beings' Awakening" was closely related to the aptitude and comprehension abilities of the teacher and student.

Furthermore, Chi Gongdao possessed a secret, unpassed technique: he could precisely locate valuable world-destroying relics from the boundless sea of forgotten relics, whose True Immortal power was about to dissipate and could be utilized by Immortal Boat cultivators.

It was said that nine out of ten dual True Immortal power relics in the Immortal Severing Tower were found by this Elder Chi Gongdao.

With other cultivation techniques, as one's realm increased, the cultivation speed would gradually slow down. However, this Spirit Weeping Technique was very slow in the initial stages, requiring one to experience and truly establish an emotional connection with their inner scenery world. The further one progressed, the faster the cultivation became.

Although Li Fan couldn't recall when he last cried, for Li Fan, who could manifest fake things into reality, it was not difficult to simulate the emotional fluctuations of his own crying.

Moreover, the body of Zhao Xian that Li Fan had attached himself to had excellent aptitude. Coupled with Li Fan's extensive knowledge gained from years of reincarnation, his progress in cultivating the "Spirit Weeping Technique" was rapid.

Ai Tianjue also instructed, "Although the mainstream belief in the Immortal Boat is that researching the True Immortal Sigils is fundamental, you must also remember that realm and strength are the foundation for exploration and enlightenment. If the foundation is not firm, even if you are lucky enough to reach heavenly heights, there is always the risk of falling to your death from a great height..."

The Spirit Weeping Technique did not require seclusion; even a short period of time could deepen the emotional connection with the inner scenery world. Moreover, those who were more active in thought and sensitive in emotion were even more suited for its cultivation.

"Do you have any unclear points?" Ai Tianjue asked.

Or rather than a cultivation technique, it was more like a divine ability called "Sentient Beings' Awakening."

Li Fan, however, remained with his eyes closed, as if still immersed in Ai Tianjue's verbal teachings.

Chi Gongdao.

Although it was just reading word by word without detailed explanation, as Ai Tianjue's voice, like the rhythm of the Dao, entered Li Fan's ears, countless insights into the "Spirit Weeping Technique" from Ai Tianjue naturally appeared in Li Fan's mind.

It was also said to have been scavenged from the residual realms of the sea of stars by the Immortal Boat, greatly reducing the difficulty of inheritance and teaching in the Immortal Boat. Upon its release, it was widely acclaimed and popular throughout the Immortal Boat.

After Li Fan's assessment, among the elders of the Immortal Severing Tower, he was the one who had restored the most True Immortal Sigilss and achieved the highest restoration rate.

He then turned to visit another elder.

Undeniably, Chi Gongdao's research into the True Immortal Sigils had some unique aspects that others could not match.

Ai Tianjue rambled on, appearing even somewhat verbose.

However, this was precisely the extent to which teachers in the Mystic Immortal Boat universally treated their disciples.

Spirit Weeping did not mean crying during cultivation; rather, it emulated the natural, heartfelt sense of ease that arose when one instinctively cried.

Upon leaving Ai Tianjue's residence, Li Fan did not immediately depart from the Immortal Severing Tower.

Li Fan also followed along, silently reciting.

"This student has understood everything," Li Fan replied in a deep voice.

He was unaware of the cultivation speed of Ai Tianjue's other disciples, but the fact that Ai Tianjue always gave Li Fan private lessons was enough to show his high regard for Li Fan.

*Phew…*

The moment Li Fan pushed open the door of the small building, a gust of chilling wind accompanied by low whispers rushed towards him.

As if accustomed to it, Li Fan directly ignored it and walked up to Chi Gongdao, sitting down quietly.

In front of him, a brush that appeared to be made of flesh, blood, and hair instantly materialized.

Li Fan reached out to take the brush, but before he was even fully close, the hairs on the brush seemed to come alive, rapidly lengthening and firmly binding Li Fan's right hand.

In his sea of consciousness, the incomplete image of a True Immortal Sigils appeared, and his hand began to dance accordingly.

Drip, drip, blood flowed from the tip of the brush, congealing like ink, leaving indelible marks in the air.

To be honest, when Li Fan first came here, he almost slipped up and nearly wrote out a complete True Immortal Sigils.

If he hadn't reacted in time, the Immortal Boat might have already been annihilated under the world-ending power of the True Immortal Sigils.

The brush danced like a dragon and phoenix, and red blood splattered.

In a short while, a fragmented, distorted True Immortal character appeared.

It was precisely the half of the character "Hungry."

"Hungry oh hungry, hungry, hungry, hungry!"

The brush in his hand suddenly let out a roar, and the entangled hair tightened its grip. A significant portion of it even wriggled like worms, attempting to burrow into Li Fan's body along his arm and devour his flesh and blood.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, not activating his physical strength or Spirit Qi to expel them. Instead, as his flesh and blood were being devoured, he felt the hunger of the hairs.

Not greedy for more, the hairs only took a shallow taste before quickly retracting. The brush flew out of his hand and disappeared into the darkness.

A moment later, a strange chewing sound could be heard.
