Interspersed with the occasional crunching sound of bone being crushed.

Chi Gongdao's voice simultaneously echoed, "Not bad, the flavor is more pure than last time."

"Zhao kid, you're truly a genius. If old Ai hadn't been unwilling, I would have taken you as my disciple no matter what."

Li Fan did not reply directly but said in a deep voice, "Elder Chi, I feel that my understanding of this character has reached a bottleneck. I wish to try a new one."

Chi Gongdao gave a sinister laugh, "Heh heh, greedy. I like it!"

*Swish!*

Seven brushes, also made of flesh and hair, flew out of the darkness and appeared before Li Fan.

"Which one do you want? You choose!"

Li Fan closed his eyes and sensed the auras emanating from the different brushes.

"This one."

After a long while, Li Fan decided on his target and reached out to the leftmost one, whose flesh and blood were the most dim.

Flesh and blood churned, and black hair attached itself.

Guiding Li Fan's hand, it began to write in the void.

With sweeping strokes, a blood-red True Immortal character slowly emerged.

Li Fan focused his senses, while the other six brushes had already vanished at some unknown time.

"Solitude."

"For all eternity, heaven and earth, only this body is solitary."

Li Fan, as the Sacred Embryo, had encountered this True Immortal character when he traversed the sea of stars in the past.

At that time, even the Heaven Oddity of the Black Sword, which had already merged with his Dao foundation, showed signs of being separated.

And now, Li Fan once again felt that power from the scarlet character before him.

However, there were subtle restrictions in the surrounding space, suppressing the power of "Solitude" and other displayed True Immortal characters from radiating outwards.

In Li Fan's perception, time felt both impossibly long and extremely fast.

After the character "Solitude" was written, he still felt a sense of lingering desire.

The process of deducing the True Immortal Sigils's power through its manifested effects, without seeing the actual script, was truly fascinating.

The brush entwined around his hand had returned to the darkness.

Chi Gongdao's cackling laughter resounded in Li Fan's ears again, "Zhao kid, do you want to experience more? If you abandon the darkness and embrace the light, and come to me from Ai Tianjue, I promise to personally teach you all these True Immortal characters that I have deduced..."

Li Fan's expression remained unchanged, "No need for your concern, elder. If I have the need, I will still exchange my insights for them."

With that, without waiting for Chi Gongdao's reply, he turned and left.

The small building fell silent for a moment, and Chi Gongdao's voice echoed again, "Your will is firm, I like it even more..."

"Heh heh heh heh..."

Chi Gongdao coveted Li Fan, but he did not know that.

From just this one tactile experience, Li Fan's understanding of the character "Solitude" had already surpassed his own in an imperceptible way.

After all, Li Fan had the innate advantage of having personally witnessed the True Immortal Sigils and had previously suffered the aftermath of the "Solitude" character technique's attack. It was understandable that Li Fan had quickly surpassed him.

"I'll try first to see if I can restore it on my own. If I fail, I'll rely on these geniuses of the Immortal Boat."

"After all, the more power of True Immortal Sigilss I can grasp, the better."

Li Fan returned to his residence and began to organize the gains he had acquired from Ai Tianjue and Chi Gongdao.

And he awaited their next summons.

His life in the Mystic Immortal Boat was this simple, unadorned, and mundane.

...

Xuanhuang Realm.

The attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators towards the Leaving Realm's rainbow light remained high.

Although the frequency had decreased, the official Myriad Immortals Alliance still occasionally released images from the Abyssal Sea of Stars.

The various dangers and calamities made the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm exclaim about the excitement.

"Just watch. They always manage to overcome dangers and calamities; it's the protection of the Heavenly Venerates. We might not have such luck."

"No wonder the Immortal Alliance was reluctant to send people to the Sea of Stars before; it's too dangerous. We haven't even seen the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat yet, and quite a few Dao Integration cultivators have already perished. How many will return safely in the end?"

"An Immortal Boat is good, but it's not our homeland!"

...

Amidst the widespread discussion, the Sacred Emperor Li Ping, however, had begun to discern some clues.

After all, he had truly crossed the river of stars. Although the images released by the Myriad Immortals Alliance looked real...

Compared to truly traversing the sea of stars, there were still many flaws.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance is faking it?"

"It seems the true Leaving Realm's rainbow light has likely met with misfortune."

Li Ping expressed some regret.

At this moment, the Sacred Dynasty had again gathered enough Flowing Light Crystals, and he intended to personally travel outside the Xuanhuang Realm to further comprehend the Dao and simultaneously familiarize himself with the battlefield environment where he would eventually confront the Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians.

Unnoticed, the Sacred Emperor had flown to the borders of the Xuanhuang Realm.

This time, Li Ping refused the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's request to accompany him. After all, he would not be venturing far, only operating around the Xuanhuang Realm.

As the layers of rainbow light separated, he began to break free from the suction of the Immortal Ruins and fly into the dark void.

"Perhaps, it's not necessary to rely solely on these Flowing Light Crystals."

"Azure Nether creations, the materialization of Azure Nether laws. Their characteristics might be able to be replicated through Spirit Qi."

Looking at the colorful, hazy light around him, Li Ping mused.

The Xuanhuang Realm gradually shrank into an invisible speck.

Li Fan then turned his gaze towards the location of the Immortal Ruins.

There, it was utter darkness.

The ruins of the former Immortal Realm passage devoured all eyes that tried to peer into it.

Flashes of blurry images flickered in his mind. For some reason, Li Ping felt a faint, elusive sense of familiarity with the mysterious Immortal Ruins. Although the feeling was fleeting, it was still perceived by the Sacred Emperor.

"Immortal Ruins..."

Li Ping shook his head and, after a long while, suppressed the thought.

What needed to be resolved first was the matter of the Xuanhuang Realm being usurped and its fundamental nature being altered.

As for how to escape the Immortal Ruins after completing his objective...

Ever since he learned from Mo Rubin that the peculiar nature of the Netherfolk originated from the bloodline of the First Generation Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, Li Ping had been attempting to replicate this bloodline in batches by utilizing Cat Treasure's special ability.

The three special abilities of Cat Treasure discovered so far were: Item Replication, Lifeform Mimicry, and Marrow Cleansing.

First, Li Ping went to great lengths to have Cat Treasure mimic a Netherfolk.

Then, he used the recorded lifeform data and, through Marrow Cleansing, infused it into ordinary humans.

Using a roundabout method, he then replicated the flesh and blood of these infused humans.

Perhaps due to Cat Treasure's mediation, which bypassed certain restrictions, these replicated beings actually possessed some of the abilities of the Netherfolk bloodline.

Although the efficiency of generating Primal Force Essence was only about one-fifth that of ordinary Netherfolk, the advantage was that there were no restrictions. With the Sacred Dynasty's current advanced flesh-and-blood manufacturing technology, as long as resources were sufficient, it could be manufactured almost infinitely.

It could be said that this temporarily solved the energy shortage problem for the Sacred Dynasty and the Sea of Darkness.

Deep within the Sea of Darkness, the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation continuously operated, accumulating energy.

It was believed that within a century, enough power would be accumulated to burst forth and escape the Immortal Ruins.

Before that, Li Ping's task was to first resolve the issue of the Xuanhuang Realm's "orthodoxy."

His thoughts returned to the present, and Li Ping subconsciously looked at his shoulder.

Cat Treasure was still lying there.

However, it had turned its head away and was not looking at Li Ping.

It seemed that replicating the bloodline of the First Generation Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate was also a difficult task for it.

Most of the time these days, it was in a deep sleep.

Cat Treasure had also become somewhat indifferent to Li Ping.

Li Ping had a premonition that if their relationship continued to cool, Cat Treasure might leave at any moment.

After all, there were no special master-servant imprints or anything of that sort between him and Cat Treasure.

It was all based on his temptation with Primal Force Essence.

He squeezed out a ball of golden light and placed it on Cat Treasure's head.

Li Ping, who had ventured deep into the void, began to comprehend the laws of the surrounding sea of stars.

As for the calamities remaining in the sea of stars...

Cat Treasure's occasionally twitching tail indicated a safe path forward for Li Ping.

Coupled with his previous long-distance voyage experience, he did not encounter any dangers along the way.

"If the final battlefield is chosen outside the Xuanhuang Realm, the assistance of heaven and earth will inevitably be reduced by more than half."

"The key to victory, besides Cat Treasure's many divine abilities, might be to also harness the power of the omnipresent calamities in the sea of stars."

Outside the void of the Great Qi pocket world, the ruins of the One Beginning Sect and the terrifying Devouring Calamity were sealed.

While sealing them, Li Ping was also researching this calamity.

Compared to the various calamity powers in the Abyssal Sea of Stars, the Devouring Calamity was a pure power that annihilated everything.

Li Ping suspected that even the calamities in the sea of stars would gradually decay under the blow of the Devouring Calamity.

"Ultimately, the so-called calamities of the sea of stars are merely the magical techniques of True Immortals."

"Although they are beyond our mortal comprehension."

"Since the Devouring Calamity can dissolve them into nothingness, then in a sense, the power of these calamities can also be turned to one's advantage."

"However, finding the appropriate method is key..."

A flash of inspiration struck Li Ping's mind. He ignored Cat Treasure's warning and actively flew towards a dangerous area not far away in the void.

With the Primal Force Essence golden light densely covering him, he took protective measures.

Li Ping quietly comprehended the wondrous changes occurring on the surface of the Primal Force Essence.

In Cat Treasure's bewildered gaze, Li Ping felt the surroundings suddenly turn dark again.

Unlike the previous darkness in the Abyssal Sea of Stars, which was due to the absence of light and the ensuing silence, this new darkness was caused by Li Ping's feeling of his connection to the world being stripped away, gradually distancing himself from everything in the sea of stars.

Not only was his connection severed, but even the connection between Li Ping's body and the Xuanhuang Realm, as well as the line connecting him to other mysterious unknown existences, was slowly fading.

The Faceless Sacred Emperor, who had always cared for the Xuanhuang Realm, suddenly felt a sense of detachment from worldly affairs.

He felt that the Xuanhuang Realm and the myriad sentient beings within it were no longer that important to him.

His long-held attachments were about to be completely let go.

A slight touch on his shoulder instantly pulled Li Ping out of that state.

Only then did Li Ping realize that even when encountering the calamity of the True Immortal Sigils and his connections to the world were fading, Cat Treasure was still lying on his shoulder.

There was no sign of separation.

The Primal Force Essence protected him, and his figure flashed as Li Ping instantly escaped the area covered by the calamity.

"This True Immortal character seems to be particularly effective on me."

"Solitary, or perhaps, Solitude?"

Li Ping gazed at that area, pondering to himself.

He condensed another ball of golden light in his hand and placed it on Cat Treasure's head.

This time, Cat Treasure swallowed it without hesitation before lazily falling asleep again.

...

Sun family, underground secret chamber.

Li Fan's spiritual manifestation sensed the complete severance of his connection with the Sacred Emperor's clone and felt a tinge of regret.

"The last feeling transmitted was the power of a True Immortal character?"

"Solitude?"

"Unexpectedly, by coincidence, I managed to fully break free from it with its power."

However, after a moment, Li Fan felt at ease.

At the Sacred Emperor's current level of strength, it was unrealistic to control him in real-time like a chess piece.

Moreover, he had the help of the mysterious creation, Cat Treasure...

If he couldn't completely sever the connection with Li Fan's main body, then Li Fan would doubt whether the Sacred Emperor could truly force out the full strength of the Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians.

As for the safety of the Sacred Emperor's clone... or rather, Li Ping's safety, Li Fan was not worried.

After all, even the Sacred Embryo did not perish under the "Solitude" character technique. With Li Ping's superior strength and numerous fortuitous encounters, it was naturally impossible for him to be unable to escape.

"Anyway, the general direction has been set. I'll just watch his performance."

"Regardless, the gains from this life are already more than enough."

"So much so that I'm somewhat overwhelmed."

As Li Fan's spiritual manifestation was contemplating, a somewhat familiar voice suddenly sounded.

"Senior, when can we go out and take a look? I'm really bored being cooped up."

Li Fan shifted his gaze, his eyes profound.

It was the voice that originally belonged to Sun Luyuan.

But now, both his actions and expressions had reached a point where they were indistinguishable from the real thing.

Through Li Fan's continuous attempts, and especially with the gains from his time in the Immortal Boat as a Sacred Embryo, he had finally created a passable simulated personality for Sun Luyuan.

Sun Luyuan himself did not even realize that he was a fabricated existence.

His consciousness and memories had been restored to the point when Li Fan had removed the calamity from his body and Li Fan had promised to take him out to travel while searching for other potential immortal artifacts.

"What's wrong, senior?" Sun Luyuan looked at Li Fan with a hint of fear in his eyes.

"Heh heh," Li Fan showed a gentle smile.

"It's nothing, I just thought of something happy."

"Since you've said so, then let's go out today."

Sun Luyuan was overjoyed, "That's great!"

Following the same method, after creating the fabricated Sun Luyuan and the Boundless Mirror, Li Fan's spiritual manifestation, along with their "original bodies," left the underground secret chamber.

"Senior, where should we go first?"

"Within the closest range, I don't seem to sense any signs of immortal artifacts." Sun Luyuan asked after checking.

"Do some preparatory work," Li Fan replied simply.

Flying rapidly, he arrived at the entrance of a small world and leaped into the spatial passage.

"Huh? This small world is all plants?" Sun Luyuan exclaimed with curiosity, looking at the scene before him.

It was like a tropical rainforest, with tall, dense vegetation of various kinds striving upwards to seize sunlight.

Occasionally, one could see vines like pythons slithering in the shadows, then quietly entwining other towering trees, their sharp wooden thorns piercing into the trees.

In a short while, the trees withered and fell with a creak, clearing a large area of space overhead.

Within a few breaths, abundant sunlight attracted other trees, which grew at a visible speed to fill the gap.

"Senior, this small world seems to be in a relatively primitive stage of life. There shouldn't be any immortal artifacts here," Sun Luyuan said, entranced but still diligently offering his advice.

"We're not looking for immortal artifacts. I'm going to teach you a formation. Once you learn it, the work of setting up the formation will be yours." Li Fan said calmly.

Sun Luyuan's spirit was lifted upon hearing this, "Thank you, senior! I will not fail your trust!"

"Watch carefully. This formation is called..."

"Primordial Void!"

Li Fan flew to the mid-air of this small world.

Rays of light descended, completely obscuring the sunlight from the sky.

The originally somewhat dim primitive jungle small world, now welcomed true darkness.

And in the sight of the Boundless Mirror Spirit, Sun Luyuan, the radiance scattered by Li Fan were strings of extremely profound formation units. Even with his foundation as an immortal artifact, it was extremely difficult to decipher them.

As the formation was gradually perfected, a sense that was both familiar and inexplicably terrifying surged into Sun Luyuan's heart.

"This is..."

Sun Luyuan's face turned pale. After a long while, he finally recalled.

It was the feeling of being on the brink of death that he experienced whenever he faced the Devouring Calamity!

His intuition told him that if he continued to stay here until the grand formation was completed, it would be the day of his great calamity!

The Boundless Mirror trembled slightly, quickly turning into a beam of light and flying to Li Fan's side.

Li Fan did not pay attention and continued to perfect the formation.

"It's a pity that, firstly, the materials are insufficient, and secondly, I am only acting with my spiritual manifestation, unable to unleash the full power of the Primordial Void Formation."

"However, it is sufficient for refining some protective layers."

More than ten days later, the Primordial Void Formation was completed.

With the descent of a beam of light capable of destroying the world, this small world completely vanished.

And Li Fan's spiritual manifestation had already returned to the Xuanhuang Realm with the Boundless Mirror.

"Did you learn the formation from just now?"

The fabricated personality, Sun Luyuan, remained silent for a long time.

He had just been affected by the Primordial Void Formation, and the structure maintaining his fabricated personality's "true nature" had been destroyed.

"What useless trash," Li Fan coldly snorted.

Chapter 1284: Great Qi’s Enlightenment (7K)

However, considering that the Sun Luyuan before him was actually his own creation, how could he call him trash? That would be equivalent to scolding his own craftsmanship for being poor. Thus, Li Fan retracted the words of scolding that were about to leave his mouth. With another cold snort, his thoughts rapidly shifted. The temporarily ineffective “Sun Luyuan” was destroyed. Moments later, a brand-new fabricated personality was born once more. “Senior, that formation just now…” The new fabricated personality had no awareness of being created just now. His memories were still stuck at the moment the Void Annihilation Formation destroyed the world. His face paled. “It was too profound. This junior hasn’t learned it yet.” Sun Luyuan’s tone was bitter, fearing he might anger Li Fan. Li Fan felt the crystalline sphere condensed at the cost of the entire small world. He revealed a kind smile. “Don’t worry. This Primordial Void Formation is indeed a bit complex. I’ll demonstrate a few more times.” These calm words sent a chill down Sun Luyuan’s spine, but he didn't dare to retort. He could only blankly follow the other party to the next target small world. A hint of solemnity flashed in Hundred Flowers’ eyes, transforming into a golden light as she flew into the endless void opened by the Void-Cracking Whale. After all, without being able to use it to cross the mortal limit and reach the True Immortal realm, it would be useless no matter how much there was. Before Sun Erlang could speak, the voice of Skilled Artisan Hermit already rang out. “Whether it works or not isn’t something you can brag about. Let’s settle this with our hands! Little Sun, deal with her properly!” Daoist Hundred Flowers felt herself slowly becoming complacent. Sun Erlang’s responding voice came, but it didn't originate from these puppets. “Senior, you misunderstand. These puppets are all controlled by me alone. So, it’s considered fair…” Before he finished speaking, Sun Erlang’s figure disappeared from Hundred Flowers’ divine sense. Sun Erlang calmly admitted, “This time, this junior went back to cultivate for a while and felt further progress, so I’ve come to seek your guidance again!” There were also scenes of being with the survivors of the various realms before being captured by the fishing pond. The one who arrived was the Great Sacred Emperor’s eldest disciple, Sun Erlang. The ones Li Fan chose were the smallest of the Azure Nether’s affiliated small worlds, which had not yet been discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. This was to prevent attracting attention from outsiders and the Xuanhuang Realm nearing the Immortal Ruins. Sun Erlang cupped his hands. “Senior, be careful… This time, it’s truly different from before.” Daoist Hundred Flowers said playfully, “Little Sun knows he can’t win, so he changed a single combat into a group assault?” “I don’t know if all these guys are truly dead,” Hundred Flowers couldn’t help but think. Great Qi small world. A glazed golden flower materialized in her hand with a slight movement of her mind. Hundred Flowers smiled. “I said, don’t listen to that Skilled Artisan bragging about his puppets being comparable to Longevity cultivators. In the end, they are just dead objects. How can they be truly compared to cultivators like us?” “Void-Splitting Gold!” When Hundred Flowers was lost in thought, the space before her fluctuated, attracting her attention. Emptying her mind, thinking of nothing. Occasionally, fragments of images would flash by. “Are you here to get beaten again?” Seeing Sun Erlang’s expression, Hundred Flowers knew his intention and couldn’t help but feel a little helpless. Petals fluttered down, yet the glazed flower itself remained intact. In a short time, the void around Daoist Hundred Flowers was enveloped by countless golden flower petals. *Bang!* *Bang!* Petals flew, continuously colliding with the puppets hidden and following in the shadows. All along, she had perfectly completed the Sacred Emperor’s tasks. The reward of Primal Force Essence had never been lacking, and it had recently become even more abundant. Li Fan weighed the crystalline sphere. “Two or three more, and it will far exceed the protection that my 119th life’s [All Beings Refining the Soul] could provide. There should be no problem.” In the void, five almost identical voices rang out simultaneously with Sun Erlang’s words. But Primal Force Essence was, after all, just that. “It should be the puppets controlled by that kid, but even my divine sense can’t lock onto them?” After Primal Force Essence was freed, it gradually lost its target and motivation. The most it did every day was to care for the various grotto-heaven worlds, ensuring their Spirit Qi flowed smoothly and their vitality thrived. One by one, the dark gold-colored puppets gradually revealed their true forms. There were scenes experienced in the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty since their awakening. “Senior Hundred Flowers.” There were a total of five of them, who had quietly surrounded Hundred Flowers in the center. Daoist Hundred Flowers finally felt a bit of interest. Secondly, it was to space out. And then in an instant, it bloomed suddenly. But he estimated that his actions of digging up the Xuanhuang Realm’s roots could not last for too long. She vaguely felt that there were many presences behind her, secretly tracking. Before, she thought it was extremely precious and she had to taste it no matter what. After truly having it in abundance, she gradually felt it was tasteless. Daoist Hundred Flowers was at the border of the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, staring blankly into the void outside. After sensing the familiar aura, her instantly tensed nerves relaxed. … “Entangling Wood!” “Life-Extinguishing Water!” “Burning Intent Fire!” “Void Earth!” Strange Five Elements powers surged from the five puppets respectively. They didn't attack Hundred Flowers immediately but instantly formed a formation. In the formation, Hundred Flowers seemed to have left the void in an instant and returned to the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven. However, the Five Elements Grotto-heaven here was not full of vitality but rather a scene of killing intent. Every trace of Five Elements aura within the grotto-heaven was like a sharp sword. Upon sensing Hundred Flowers, an outsider, it madly launched an assault. Void-Splitting Gold, silent and soundless, its sharpness could tear space. Entangling Wood sought targets in the void; once entangled, it would not stop until death. Life-Extinguishing Water extinguished all vitality. Even the glazed golden flowers released by Hundred Flowers withered rapidly upon contact. … The Five Elements complemented each other, the five powers transforming into each other, inexhaustible. Hundred Flowers was trapped in the formation, seemingly having endured days of siege, yet her offensive showed no signs of weakening. “This is the Five Elements Killing Formation.” “The main formation should be those five puppets. They don’t fight directly, but act as formation eyes…” While Hundred Flowers was contemplating, she didn’t notice that a dark gold puppet had quietly appeared behind her at some unknown time. Hidden within the violent Five Elements aura, like a golden longsword, it decisively slashed down. *Clang!* A sound like metal clashing echoed throughout the Five Elements Killing Formation. Daoist Hundred Flowers’ body instantly became transparent. A glazed golden flower bloomed within her. Under the illumination of the light, the longsword that had penetrated her body gradually turned glazed and transparent. The power of Void-Splitting Gold erupted, breaking free from the glazed erosion, and once again disappeared, hiding within the chaotic Five Elements Killing Formation. “Not bad.” Daoist Hundred Flowers revealed her true appearance before Sun Erlang for the first time. She praised him faintly. “If it were my past self, I would have been heavily injured under your move.” “It’s a pity…” The glazed flower within Hundred Flowers’ transparent body rapidly expanded. Under the pure glazed brilliance, the violent Five Elements power was completely assimilated into solid glazed crystals. In just a few breaths, the glazed flower swept away everything around it, engulfing the entire formation space in its light. *Clang!* A slender finger extended from the solid crystal. It lightly tapped the condensed flower. A crack appeared, and then quickly spread to the entire flower body. *Boom!* The flower exploded into countless fragments, and the original violent Five Elements Killing Formation completely turned into void. Hundred Flowers returned to her original form, gazing at her surroundings. But what made her expression change was that this move, which could instantly destroy a small world, [Pure Life Glaze], did not seem to have broken the Five Elements Killing Formation? In the complete void, another unsettling aura began to emerge. After discerning it, Daoist Hundred Flowers suddenly understood. “It’s not the Five Elements Killing Formation, but the Yin-Yang Five Elements Great Formation.” Yin and Yang energies flowed alternately, and within the chaos, Five Elements auras emerged, endlessly cycling. Soon, the void, which had been calm for a short time, became lively again. Seeing this, Hundred Flowers couldn’t help but slightly frown. She could easily destroy the formation, but she couldn’t prevent the process of Yin and Yang generating Five Elements. Even if she killed it time and time again, the killing intent targeting her in the void would always continue unabated. “The Five Elements Yin-Yang power, combined with the formation, hasn’t significantly increased the lethality but has indeed made it much more troublesome.” Although Hundred Flowers knew a little about formations, she didn’t sense any traces of the formation around her. “Hahahaha! Hundred Flowers, you’re helpless, aren’t you! Surrender obediently now!” Skilled Artisan Daoist’s arrogant voice echoed through the killing formation. Hundred Flowers snorted coldly, and a brilliant golden light lit up in her eyes. “Little Sun, be careful. You’ve finally forced this move out! Let’s see how our prepared countermeasure works.” After being infused with Primal Force Essence, Hundred Flowers’ glazed light seemed to have become even purer. It was as if space itself had crystallized, and a piece of crystal slowly formed around her. The Yin and Yang energies that nurtured the Five Elements, and even the structure that maintained the formation’s existence, had no place to hide under the pressure of such pure power. Light from the outside shone in, and the killing formation here was about to be broken by Hundred Flowers. “You’re the only one with Primal Force Essence?!” At this moment, Skilled Artisan’s somewhat smug voice rang out again. A finger purely composed of golden light, disregarding the solidified glazed crystals, appeared before Hundred Flowers without warning. The crystals shattered with a bang, turning into streams of flowing light. The golden finger was unstoppable, pressing down fiercely towards her forehead. Hundred Flowers’ expression changed, and her body instantly reverted to its pure glazed form. Under the same golden light, Hundred Flowers and the golden finger met. To her astonishment, this terrifying-looking golden finger of Primal Force Essence was merely a facade. It crumbled at a touch, turning into countless golden threads that wrapped around her body, vertically and horizontally. “Little Sun, cast the net!” Skilled Artisan Daoist shouted excitedly. In an instant, the golden threads spread out, crisscrossing each other. Hundred Flowers, caught off guard, fell into the net! The glazed flower tried to bloom, but it collided with the golden net and was extinguished. A great force came from within the golden net, and Hundred Flowers was ignominiously dragged forward with great speed. “Presumptuous!” This time, Hundred Flowers was truly furious. “All beings are glazed!” With an extremely cold, light shout, the figure of Hundred Flowers, who seemed to have been captured, disappeared. The glazed flowers also manifested as an anomaly. Petals fell one by one, but this time, they vanished completely after falling. In an instant, her true form was revealed. Amidst the shifting light and shadow, it was a glazed world! The glazed world was frozen, and countless beings instantly opened their eyes! *Hiss…* The golden giant net wrapped around the outside of the world instantly showed faint cracks. Skilled Artisan Hermit’s voice, filled with shock and anger, rang out. “Didn’t you say you abandoned your realm and fled back then?! I didn’t expect you to refine the entire Myriad Abundance Realm into a glazed state!” “What a vicious woman!” Hundred Flowers' voice came from within the glazed world. “What do you know! This is for survival!” “Not just for me, but for the entire Heavenly Lotus Sect!” Amidst Hundred Flowers’ enraged roar, brilliant light erupted from the glazed world, completely shattering the golden net that bound her. “Little Sun, retreat quickly!” “Senior, please forgive me…” She vaguely heard Skilled Artisan Hermit’s somewhat flustered voice and Sun Erlang’s voice filled with helplessness. Returning to the void, their figures were nowhere to be seen. The glazed flower bloomed anew, concealing the glazed Myriad Abundance Realm in the center. Hundred Flowers resumed her human form. She didn’t pursue them but returned to the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven. “We had a fight just now, and it wasn’t so boring. I wonder when we can truly go to war with the Myriad Immortals Alliance?” “If we can truly escape the Immortal Ruins, and even the entire Abyssal Sea, perhaps the Heavenly Lotus Sect can see the light of day again.” Daoist Hundred Flowers’ thoughts churned. She had a special confidence in the Great Qi Sacred Emperor. Hundred Flowers inadvertently looked out into the void again. There, in the place the Sacred Emperor had visited, she faintly sensed energy that made the entire glazed Myriad Abundance Realm tremble slightly in fear. “Truly a madman…” Within the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, Skilled Artisan, somewhat disheveled, cursed while looking at the seven dark gold puppets before him with heartache. “I should have expected it long ago. How could someone who survived the world-ending tribulation be a simple person? Seeing her act so submissive before the Sacred Emperor, I was actually fooled…” “Skilled Artisan, oh Skilled Artisan, you were truly muddle-headed!” Sun Erlang remained silent. The power that suddenly erupted from this seemingly amiable Senior Hundred Flowers was indeed somewhat frightening. However, the purpose of seeking a spar with her this time had been achieved. Sun Erlang looked at the seven dark gold puppets in the arena. By using their bodies, he not only became more familiar with the power of the Heaven and Earth Essences in the puppet cores but also subtly advanced his mastery of Primal Force Essence. “No! I don’t believe it! I, the dignified Skilled Artisan of the Heavenly Mysteries Realm, will be surpassed by a mere Myriad Abundance Realm!” Skilled Artisan said fiercely from the side, taking out an item from his embrace. “Little Sun, you install this for these puppets!” Skilled Artisan said fiercely. “What is this?” Sun Erlang looked at the square black object in Skilled Artisan’s hand and asked curiously. “Hehehe, this is the [experience] extracted from the Immortal Puppet [Ancestor] back in our Heavenly Mysteries Realm. It cannot be replicated, and every use after the Heavenly Mysteries Realm was destroyed reduces it by one. I was reluctant to use it before, but now…” Skilled Artisan looked at it somewhat reluctantly, then gritted his teeth and said, “No matter what, I can’t be surpassed by that woman!” Upon hearing the words “Immortal Puppet,” Sun Erlang’s heart trembled slightly. Just as he was about to take it, he suddenly remembered something and hesitated. “Such a precious item, shouldn’t we leave it for Senior True Yang? Perhaps it would be more useful to him…” Skilled Artisan waved his hand. “I already gave him a portion. Do you think you know where he’s been all this time without seeing him? He’s been in seclusion comprehending and hasn’t come out yet!” “Stop rambling and do as I say! Hurry, I might regret it later!” Hearing this, Sun Erlang no longer hesitated. He connected his mind to the seven dark gold puppets and simultaneously crushed the square black object in his hand. Black liquid flowed out from the gaps in his hand. Like living creatures, it climbed up Sun Erlang’s arm to his head. It coiled like a hunting cobra, raising its body high, and then plunged directly into Sun Erlang’s eye sockets. Trusting Skilled Artisan, Sun Erlang did not resist. The moment the black liquid obscured his vision, Sun Erlang’s perception of his surroundings changed. A large amount of blurry images flooded in like a tide, along with disjointed combat memories. Or, more accurately, “getting beaten” memories. Mysterious techniques bombarded the immortal puppets. The immortal puppets could only endure the impacts with their tough material, with little opportunity to counterattack. But even with just plain beatings, profound insights emerged in Sun Erlang’s mind. After being beaten so many times, Sun Erlang seemed to have developed a sort of instinct. When the immortal techniques’ attacks reappeared in his mind, he instinctively felt how to respond to those techniques. This feeling captivated Sun Erlang. Unfortunately, just as he seemed about to truly comprehend something, the scenes suddenly disappeared. The previous insights also receded like a tide, leaving no trace. “Uh…” Sun Erlang’s veins suddenly bulged on his forehead, his fists clenched, and he gasped for air. His eyes were red, and he stared intently at Skilled Artisan Hermit. Skilled Artisan, however, seemed to have anticipated this and had already moved far away. He said coldly, “Little Sun, clear your head. Don’t be deceived by illusions!” “Those feelings of imminent enlightenment, are they from yourself or the immortal puppet?!” Skilled Artisan’s words were like a basin of ice water poured over his head, and Sun Erlang suddenly sobered up considerably. However, even so, it took him almost half a day to gradually suppress the desire in his heart to snatch the immortal puppet’s experience from Skilled Artisan and continue comprehending, driven by a sense of loss. “I apologize, Senior.” Sun Erlang said with some shame. “It’s nothing. You don’t need to blame yourself. Let alone you, even those old guys from our Heavenly Mysteries Realm couldn’t resist this temptation.” Skilled Artisan licked his lips, as if savoring the taste of enlightenment. “Look again now, what’s different from before.” Skilled Artisan instructed. Shifting his attention back to the five dark gold puppets, after a moment, a hint of surprise flashed in Sun Erlang’s eyes. “Huh? Those memories of being beaten just now are reappearing…” Sun Erlang closed his eyes and felt. Skilled Artisan clapped his hands, and thousands of Sacred Army puppets appeared one after another. Relying on mechanical instinct, they simultaneously launched an attack on the dark gold puppets controlled by Sun Erlang. As if tempered thousands of times, all the different techniques and moves were easily dodged by Sun Erlang. This result even stunned Sun Erlang for a moment. He couldn’t even understand why those attacks, which clearly landed on the dark gold puppets he controlled, ultimately caused no damage. It wasn’t because the powerful defense of the dark gold puppets nullified the damage. It was truly that, through some unfathomably profound method, all the attacks from the Sacred Army puppets were dodged. “Don’t be dazed, maintain this instinctive feeling as much as possible!” “The remnants of the Immortal Puppet experience will dissipate soon. How much you can retain in the end depends on your own fortune!” Skilled Artisan’s words brought Sun Erlang back to his senses. He discarded all distracting thoughts and concentrated with all his might, memorizing the immortal puppet’s dodging instincts. However, it was a divine ability belonging to an immortal puppet, not something that could be solidified by mortal means. Even though Sun Erlang tried his best, as time passed, the number of times the dark gold puppets he controlled were hit inevitably increased. After a full seven days of persistence, the dodging probability eventually stabilized at a certain value. “One-third.” “It’s a decent result,” Skilled Artisan consoled. Sun Erlang was clearly somewhat unwilling. “Don’t worry, with continuous comprehension in the future, the dodging ability will still increase to a certain extent. However, to reach the level of an immortal puppet that can dodge attacks from so-called divine techniques and spells at will…” “Perhaps only by breaking through the mortal limit is possible,” Skilled Artisan Hermit said truthfully. Sun Erlang let out a long sigh, and the regret in his heart gradually subsided. “Don’t underestimate this one-third. In life-and-death battles, it often has miraculous effects. Even if your opponent’s strength far surpasses yours, their attacks might be dodged by you inadvertently.” “More importantly, you can control seven puppets simultaneously. In actual combat, the performance will be slightly higher than this value due to the shared sensory feedback of the seven puppet bodies…” Skilled Artisan began to summarize and analyze Sun Erlang’s gains from this time. “If you fought Hundred Flowers again now, there would be a high probability of dodging the Myriad Abundance Realm’s glazed golden light. Without breaking the formation, she would merely be a turtle in a jar…” Skilled Artisan, clearly still unconvinced by Hundred Flowers, said sullenly. While they were talking, they suddenly felt the surrounding space faintly tremble. “Hmm?” Sun Erlang and Skilled Artisan were first stunned, then simultaneously flew to the outside of the test field. It wasn’t just their location; the entire Great Qi Sacred Dynasty was thrown into violent tremors. In the sky, a vortex vaguely appeared. Lightning crackled within it. “This is…” A hint of surprise flashed in Sun Erlang’s eyes. He had experienced similar scenes before. This was the anomaly that occurred when the Sacred Dynasty’s environment sublimated. After the last anomaly, the Sacred Dynasty’s Spirit Qi concentration had quadrupled. Moreover, the number of gifted individuals who descended upon the world had also significantly increased compared to before. The current cultivation environment of the Sacred Dynasty was no worse than the ordinary prefectures of the Xuanhuang Realm. If it were to sublimate again… Wouldn’t it be far ahead of the Xuanhuang Realm? Not only Sun Erlang and the other disciples of the Sacred Emperor, but all the citizens of the Sacred Dynasty also walked out of their homes, looking up at the sky with excitement. As the direct beneficiaries of world sublimation, the citizens of the Sacred Dynasty, without any summons, all knelt down and chanted praises to the Sacred Emperor, praying devoutly. If Li Fan were present, he would see that the Sacred Dynasty’s destiny, which had already condensed to its utmost limit, was actually showing signs of breaking through again. However, taking this step was extremely difficult. It was merely the beginning now. Amidst the citizens’ praises, ethereal purple qi, almost tangible, drifted out from various places and was absorbed by the vortex in the sky. The sounds of wind and thunder intensified, and the crackling lightning even made Sun Erlang faintly feel a tremor in his heart. From above his head, he felt an increasingly strong pressure. This forced him to lower his head slightly. “Master has broken through again.” A hint of realization surged into Sun Erlang’s heart. From the expressions of Su Yuqing, Ou Shangtian, and the other disciples of the Sacred Emperor, Sun Erlang saw their thoughts were the same as his. The vortex in the sky spun faster and faster, and streaks of starlight were occasionally ejected from it, showering all corners of the world. When the vegetation was touched, it grew at a visible speed. When living beings were touched, it was as if they had received a divine enlightenment and instantly attained Dao. Furthermore, several condensed vast starlight beams flew out, accurately and unerringly heading towards Sun Erlang and the others. This included Hundred Flowers, Skilled Artisan, Senior Yin, and other cultivators summoned by the Sacred Emperor. The moment the starlight poured into him, Sun Erlang’s vision drastically changed. It was as if he had truly arrived in the boundless void outside the Xuanhuang Realm. Sun Erlang saw that in the dead, silent darkness, lurked countless raging and terrifying forces of calamity. Sun Erlang also saw that even in this terrifying, annihilating star sea, countless paths of the star sea were stubbornly reviving. “Light is hidden beneath darkness…” “Life germinates from deathly silence.” Like a devout follower attaining enlightenment, Sun Erlang witnessed the vastness and tenacity of the star sea with his own eyes and couldn’t help but shed tears. The other cultivators within the Sacred Dynasty were also the same. Streaks of mysterious energy fluctuations erupted from their bodies, reaching the heavens. The shared enlightenment caused the tremors of the Great Qi small world to intensify again. This fluctuation even spread beyond the world, diffusing into the void. The Five Elements Grotto-heavens surrounding Great Qi, as well as other small worlds relocated here, all resonated in sync due to this influence. It sounded like the rhythm of a heartbeat, as if something was gestating within this heartbeat. All living beings in the Great Qi small world looked up at the vortex in the sky as if they had a premonition. Amidst all the gazes, a majestic figure, passing through wind and thunder, through purple qi and the hazy, mysterious starlight, slowly descended into the world. “Welcome, Sacred Emperor!” Billions of Great Qi citizens prostrated themselves in unison, their shouts like a tidal wave. The Sacred Emperor’s disciples, as well as Hundred Flowers, Skilled Artisan, Senior Yin, and the others, were shocked to discover that the faceless Sacred Emperor they knew, who had a void where his face should be, had grown features! After a moment of hesitation, the aura emanating from the Sacred Emperor undoubtedly confirmed his true identity. The Sacred Emperor stood high above the nine heavens, looking down at the beings below. With a gentle wave of his hand, all the prostrating citizens rose to their feet.

Chapter 1285: Preaching the Dao at Fifty (7000 Words)

The vortex in the sky was about to close. The Sacred Emperor reached out and grasped the last beam of starlight that shot out from it.

The nebulae flowed and shimmered, and after being refined in the Sacred Emperor's palm, it flowed like docile water to beneath him.

It transformed into a throne of starlight.

The Sacred Emperor sat down, his voice like thunder, and slowly spoke: "Misty primordial chaos, infinite primordial essence; yin and yang separated, five elements flowing; all things born, created by the Grand Origin..."

Every word was profoundly mysterious and difficult to understand.

But as the Sacred Emperor chanted, the beings in this world fortunate enough to listen felt a subtle sense of contemplation. The fleeting enlightenment they had just experienced from the starlight above, now became clear again in the Sacred Emperor's grand pronouncements of the Great Dao.

"The Dao follows heaven and earth, and to grasp it is to be an immortal; wandering freely in the Azure Nether, driving creation; immortal through countless tribulations, qi nurturing the eight desolate regions..."

Even those with mediocre talent and low cultivation gained some insight from the Sacred Emperor's voice.

Their anger intensified.

The people of enlightenment listened with rapt attention.

Senior Yin scratched his scalp. He felt as if the foundation of his own Dao within him was about to eagerly break out.

"This is my creation, and also your creation."

However, at this critical juncture, no one dared to question the great Sacred Emperor's decision.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance controlled more than half of the Xuanhuang Realm’s territories, yet they could still command them as if an extension of their own arm. This was precisely because of the existence of the Heavenly Profound Mirrors and Doctrine Transmitting Arrays spread throughout all the prefectures.

And taking advantage of the fact that everyone was not paying attention, he hastily left this grotto-heaven.

"During the three-year preparation period, some methods can be employed in advance."

The other disciples were all the same.

Six disciples stood in a line.

Sun Luyuan was speaking eloquently at a gathering when he suddenly sensed something. He quickly cut short his lengthy discourse.

"Is this how one person attains the Dao and the chickens and dogs ascend to heaven? No, this is clearly selfless sharing of one's own comprehension, regardless of closeness, with others. Hiss..."

"The 'Dark Needle Plan' is finally going to be implemented? We've waited so long for this day," a glint flashed in Sun Luyuan's eyes. He suppressed the excitement and a hint of fear for the future in his heart, concealed his aura, and hurried toward the agreed-upon location.

As for those with extraordinary talent like Sun Erlang and Ou Shangtian, their eyes shone brightly, even attracting streams of purple qi to surround them.

"I will give you three years to comprehend. Three years from today..."

The Sacred Emperor's voice echoed in everyone's hearts.

The average person would need the latter half of their lives to digest the Sacred Emperor's lecture.

Xuanhuang Realm, Tianquan Prefecture.

No matter which prefecture encountered a problem, support from various prefectures or even the Alliance Headquarters could arrive swiftly.

"Congratulations to Master for attaining enlightenment!" Sun Erlang bowed and said.

Therefore, to deal with the Myriad Immortals Alliance, disabling or interfering with this connection became the top priority.

They all bowed their heads in agreement.

The so-called Dark Needle Plan was a plan to sabotage the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Heavenly Profound Mirrors and teleportation arrays.

The Sacred Emperor's gaze swept over the six disciples below. "Our Sacred Dynasty, Great Qi, will conquer the Myriad Immortals Alliance and reclaim the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"Three years."

...

The Sacred Emperor's preaching lasted for three days and three nights.

The six disciples trembled upon hearing this.

But Sun Luyuan had already made up his mind.

Besides the reasons that had previously prompted him to betray them, a greater factor was the recent demise of Sun Luchang.

Even a perfunctory comfort would suffice.

They had known for a long time that this battle was inevitable. But no one had expected it to come so soon!

Even after the Sacred Emperor's image dissipated, they remained immersed in it, oblivious.

Sun Luyuan had been waiting for the Myriad Immortals Alliance to give him an explanation.

It was only when the pool of vital blood left in the underground blood pool suddenly dried up that Sun Luyuan's heart turned to despair.

"Earlier, that kid Ou Shangtian said he could influence or even destroy the Heavenly Mysteries Branch Mirrors in various prefectures. I don't know how he managed it. But my hidden operatives in each prefecture are already prepared," Sun Luyuan pondered as he hurried along.

The surrounding Spirit Qi spontaneously flowed into his body, a clear sign of someone attaining enlightenment on the spot.

He knew that once the arrow was shot, there was no turning back. If he acted now, he would completely confirm his identity as a traitor to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. If discovered, there would be no chance of survival.

In the past few days, he had seen the Myriad Immortals Alliance intermittently posting messages about leaving the realm, even displaying images of the deceased Sun Luchang.

And at this moment, the Sacred Emperor had returned to his throne of starlight.

When he was chosen to go outside the Xuanhuang Realm years ago, Sun Luyuan still held a sliver of hope for Sun Luchang's survival.

But clearly, he had overthought things. The Dao Integration guardians in each prefecture, and those so-called important officials of the Alliance, were truly just materials that could be consumed at will. They were discarded as if they were nothing.

"Myriad Immortals Alliance..." At this point, Sun Luyuan had completely severed all hope he had for the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

He had completely sided with the Sacred Dynasty, Great Qi.

"Not to mention anything else, the benefits I've received from the Sacred Dynasty in recent years are far more than the Myriad Immortals Alliance I've been serving tirelessly."

As Sun Luyuan thought this, he arrived at the agreed-upon meeting point.

Beside the white mist barrier that towered between heaven and earth in Tianquan Prefecture.

Years ago, due to the great turmoil in the Xuanhuang Realm, the white mist barrier here had been broken in the middle and crashed to the ground. The unconstrained Essence-Devouring Mist flowed outwards wantonly, mercilessly devouring all beings it enveloped.

Although the major turmoil eventually subsided and the white mist barrier was restored, this dead land had never regained its vitality.

This was enough to show the terrifying nature of the Essence-Devouring Mist.

"Who would have thought that the Sacred Dynasty would have a way to almost completely neutralize the influence of this Essence-Devouring Mist? Meeting here is the safest!"

Sun Luyuan scanned his surroundings, ensuring he wasn't being followed, and cautiously took out the Puxian True Boat.

He leaped into the boat and piloted it into the white mist barrier.

After maintaining a constant speed and continuously changing direction, he traveled for a while and indeed saw another Puxian True Boat quietly anchored within the mist.

A black light shot out from it, slightly tearing through the white mist, and arrived before Sun Luyuan.

Sun Luyuan took it and found it was a storage ring made of black jade. When he looked up again, the previous Puxian True Boat had already vanished without a trace.

"So cautious, they wouldn't even show themselves."

Inside the black jade ring, nearly a thousand neatly arranged square jade pieces engraved with profound characters were placed.

Sun Luyuan took one out, fiddled with it carefully, and read the method of using the jade piece that had been conveyed by the black light.

"As long as it's brought into a Heavenly Mysteries Branch Mirror or a teleportation array, one can trigger it by casting a spell?"

"It's that simple?" Sun Luyuan was somewhat surprised.

He immediately felt a desire to try it out. However, after careful examination, he could only shake his head helplessly.

"The time for activation has already been set. It can only be detonated after three years. Before then, even the core formation within is not activated, it's just an ordinary jade artifact..."

"No wonder I couldn't sense even the slightest Spirit Qi fluctuation."

Sun Luyuan put the jade piece back, his expression gloomy. "Let the cultivators who are considered ants by the Myriad Immortals Alliance be the first to ring its death knell."

Just as various places in the Sacred Dynasty began to operate for the plan of conquest three years later.

Li Fan had already annihilated four pocket worlds through the Spirit Void Great Formation.

He had collected enough of what he called "Essence of All Things."

A pure collection of energy, emitting a dreamlike, colorful, viscous luster. To Li Fan, it felt quite similar to the Essence of Golden Origin Energy.

"This formation, have you learned it?" Li Fan looked into the distance, but asked the Boundless Mirror.

Sun Luoyao, a simulated personality that had been remolded several times, remained silent for a moment before finally replying, "I've almost learned it, Senior."

Li Fan nodded with satisfaction. He gently tapped his finger, and a ray of light entered Sun Luoyao's phantom form. "Then, you will go to these places and continue to set up the formation."

"Just set it up quietly, no need to activate it."

As he spoke, Li Fan tossed all the Essence of Primal Force he had collected from the Sun family earlier, when he returned, to the Boundless Mirror.

Sun Luoyao quickly collected the golden light and thanked Li Fan excitedly.

He then transformed into light and headed towards the target pocket worlds.

If it were the real Sun Luoyao, carrying out Li Fan's mission alone, he might have outwardly complied while inwardly acting against orders. But now, he was merely a simulated personality.

Even the joy of receiving the Essence of Primal Force was fabricated, so he naturally wouldn't disobey Li Fan's orders.

"The Boundless Mirror Spirit setting up formations is less effective than me. But destroying a realm is more than enough. After all, I chose weak pocket worlds where no cultivators exist."

"Although he may not appear in this world again, leaving some contingencies is only appropriate."

His connection with the Sacred Emperor had been completely severed. But Li Fan still faintly sensed the great changes happening to the Sacred Emperor.

"Did he have another epiphany in the sea of stars?"

"Clearly, the clone's original talent was ordinary. With so many fortuitous encounters, he has truly taken on the air of a chosen one of destiny..." A mocking expression flashed across Li Fan's face.

"Unfortunately, it is destined to be in vain!"

Li Fan's clone transformed into a thin line and flew towards the area of Guangyang Prefecture.

He intended to hand over the "Essence of All Things" he had collected for self-protection to his main body.

In less than half a day, Li Fan found his target.

The "Daoist Thousand Searches," who was cultivating in the mortal world while hiding his identity.

The clone silently drifted into the body of a nearby Golden Core cultivator. That person’s body paused for a moment, then quickly returned to normal.

He turned his feet and came before Daoist Thousand Searches.

"Old man, how about we play a game of chess?"

The sloppy Daoist, who was picking his toes with no regard for decorum, immediately looked up.

...

After Li Fan successfully obtained the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao from Daoist Thousand Searches, he first went to the Dao Discussion Tower in Guangyang Prefecture and used all his possessions to rent a small courtyard.

Then, using the "Dao Pill" method, he completely possessed the body of the cultivator he had attached himself to.

Li Fan stretched out his hand, looked at his brand new body, and frowned.

"Compared to the environment of the mystic immortal boat exposed to the sea of stars, this body possession method is not as perfect in the Xuanhuang Realm."

Li Fan moved his limbs and felt a slight disharmony.

"Possessing Zhao Xian allowed me to deceive the Immortal Severing Tower."

"But possessing this one..."

"Fu Yuansheng, might not be able to evade the examination of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. I still need to refine it further."

Li Fan manipulated Fu Yuansheng's body and set up a circle of formations around them.

Then, he strode into the formation.

"Using the body as a tool, refining it with the formation~"

Li Fan muttered, using the power of the formation to slowly polish and eliminate the discordances within the possessed body.

During this process, the experiences of the Sacred Emperor in this life, the sights of the Sacred Embryo in the Mystic Immortal Boat, and the enlightenment of his main body in seclusion poured into his mind.

They were integrated by Li Fan.

He continuously tapped his fingers, modifying and perfecting the formation he had just set up.

The anomalies in his body and soul gradually disappeared completely during this period.

"From today onwards, I am Fu Yuansheng!" Li Fan's clone smiled slightly.

To verify, Li Fan first entered the Heavenly Mysteries Branch Mirror of Guangyang Prefecture.

As expected, he deceived the Heavenly Profound Mirror's inspection and successfully arrived in his Heavenly Profound Mirror space under the identity of Fu Yuansheng.

"A full two thousand contribution points..."

"It's really meager."

Li Fan shook his head and sighed, but made no changes.

He simply rested as usual for a while and then left the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

He walked to the most prosperous area of the Guangyang Heavenly City and activated the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao.

The sudden burst of light instantly attracted the attention of everyone.

"What is that?" "This kind of jade token... Hiss, could it be that?"

Soon, someone recognized the item in Li Fan's hand, and gasps of amazement and disbelief rippled through the crowd.

Curious cultivators surrounded Li Fan tightly. Li Fan put on a show of being pale and struggling to stand.

With the arrival of the guiding cultivator, this chaotic scene finally improved.

"Silence!" The power emanating from the guiding cultivator undeniably indicated his Soul Transformation realm cultivation.

The onlookers instantly fell silent like cicadas in winter. The guiding cultivator weighed the jade token in his hand but did not directly take Li Fan to the Alliance Headquarters.

Instead, he transmitted a message, asking, "This Jade Token for Approaching the Dao is of no small quality. It can be used with the Dharma Deduction Jade to deduce Dao Integration cultivation techniques... You are only at the Golden Core stage, it's a bit of a waste."

"Are you interested in transferring this jade token to me? Of course, I will not treat you unfairly. I will still bestow upon you a Dao Integration cultivation technique, and even the resources needed for promotion from Nascent Soul to Soul Transformation, I will prepare them all for you."

"Thank you for your kindness, Senior..." Li Fan cupped his hands. "But I am not interested in transferring the jade token."

Expecting Li Fan to agree, the guiding cultivator's expression changed upon hearing his answer: "Kid, you better think clearly! It’s not that just having a Dao Integration technique means you can cultivate to Dao Integration. I've already investigated your background. Without family support, based on yourself alone, I fear it would be very difficult to even cultivate to Nascent Soul!"

"I'm doing this for your own good!" The guiding cultivator stared intently at Li Fan.

Li Fan was a little surprised. "Did you not hear me clearly, Senior? Then I'll say it again."

"This junior has no interest in transferring the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao." This sentence was not transmitted via voice, but spoken loudly in public.

The surrounding cultivators immediately turned their attention to the guiding cultivator.

Although no one dared to discuss it openly, their gazes said it all.

The guiding cultivator, with his deep composure, showed no change in his expression. "If that's the case, then forget it. I was just kindly reminding you. A Golden Core cultivator holding a Dao Integration technique... who knows how many ill-intentioned people would take the risk."

"Right, Fu Yuansheng!" he also said loudly in public.

Under the guiding cultivator's deliberate control, the sound boomed, faintly spreading throughout the entire Guangyang Heavenly City.

An uproar instantly erupted in the city.

Everyone's gaze instantly focused on Li Fan.

Their expressions varied, but without exception, they all hid greed.

Li Fan's face turned completely pale, a flicker of resentment and fear in his eyes. He lowered his head and said, "Thank you for your concern, Senior."

The guiding cultivator snorted coldly, and only then opened the passage to the Alliance Headquarters.

After the two left, the previously suppressed and quiet Guangyang Immortal City erupted.

Golden Core cultivator, Dao Integration technique.

The combination of these two was too impactful, instantly becoming the topic of heated discussion.

Information about Fu Yuansheng's background was also quickly dug up.

Those with quick minds had already started sending people to pressure the Fu family.

Without power or influence, with low cultivation, even if he obtained treasures, how could he protect them?

In Guangyang Heavenly City, at the Dao Discussion Tower.

A cultivator in white robes watched this scene and couldn't help but sigh softly. "This guiding cultivator is truly pushing people to a dead end!"

A handsome young man opposite him nodded in agreement. "Unless that Fu Yuansheng constantly hides in the Heavenly Profound Mirror and doesn't care about the lives and deaths of his friends and relatives, I don't think he can protect that Dao Integration technique."

The young man paused, then his tone shifted. "It's just a Dao Integration technique, yet they are forcing him to his death like this. And this is happening in broad daylight, under the bright sun... We came out for a cup of tea and encountered this. One can imagine how many similar situations are happening below the surface."

"The Alliance is corrupt, as can be seen!"

The cultivator in white robes remained silent, and after a long while, he could only shake his head helplessly and sigh.

"That's why I say, joining our Sacred Dynasty and overthrowing the corrupt rule of the Alliance is the wise choice. Tianming, you've been to our Sacred Dynasty. Such forceful coercion is impossible in the Sacred Dynasty!" the young man transmitted, speaking confidently.

The cultivator in white, named Tianming, had to nod in agreement. "What Young Master Tianci said is right. In that fishing pond, countless treasures were caught, and they all belonged to the personal possessions of the Great Qi citizens. There's no need to worry about anyone forcibly snatching them... Based on this alone, the Sacred Dynasty is far superior to the Myriad Immortals Alliance!"

Shang Tianci smiled. "I see Young Master Tianming has made up his mind."

The cultivator in white also responded with a smile.

"Another one successfully persuaded. This time, it truly is a blessing from heaven for me," Shang Tianci thought to himself, while his mind flashed to the next name.

"I wonder how the others are progressing."

Unbeknownst to the Myriad Immortals Alliance, such anomalies were happening everywhere.

With the loss of popular support, it was only a matter of time before they were persuaded and convinced.

Alliance Headquarters.

When Li Fan, in the body of Fu Yuansheng, arrived at the Alliance Headquarters again.

As expected, just like the previous few times, Li Fan fell into an illusion again.

The owner of the illusion was still the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate.

However, the scene this time was different from before.

Below continuous, misty immortal mountains, a man in his fifties was ruthlessly stopped.

"This is a sacred place for immortals. How can a mere mortal like you barge in?"

"Strange, weren't there illusion formations set up on the periphery? How did this mortal manage to get in?"

A cultivator wearing a blue Daoist robe muttered, kicking the middle-aged man away.

The middle-aged man rolled awkwardly on the ground a few times, then, as if unaffected, got up with a smile and said, "Esteemed Immortal Master, can you give me a chance? I feel... I should be able to cultivate."

The cultivator chuckled scornfully. "Your half of your body is already in the grave, and you're still thinking about cultivating? Cultivation requires talent and resources. Someone like you..."

The cultivator's face was full of disdain. "Even if you can barely cultivate, our Tianyuan Sect does not accept!"

The middle-aged man did not give up. He even extended his arm and offered it. "Immortal Master, if you don't believe me, look at my potential..."

A hint of killing intent flashed in the cultivator's eyes. He surged his Spirit Qi, intending to kill this presumptuous fellow.

Just then, a kind voice rang out from above. "What is your name?"

"Xuanyuan Gou Dan... No, Xuanyuan Tuo, my name is Xuanyuan Tuo," the middle-aged cultivator said somewhat nervously.

"Uncle Xu!" The cultivator's expression changed. He immediately retracted his killing intent and hastily bowed to the newcomer.

He also looked like a middle-aged man, but this Uncle Xu looked much more energetic than Xuanyuan Tuo.

He came to Xuanyuan Tuo's side and examined him carefully.

He even reached out and sent a stream of Spirit Qi into Xuanyuan Tuo's body to check.

After a moment, Uncle Xu shook his head slightly, saying with some regret, "Although you truly have enough heart cultivation, your age is simply too great. It will be difficult to achieve anything."

"It will probably be extremely difficult to even reach Foundation Establishment..."

Xuanyuan Tuo quickly said, "Immortal Master, my demands are not high. As long as I can cultivate. I have been farming for more than half my life, and my heart has always been uneasy, feeling that I should not spend my life in the fields."

Uncle Xu was somewhat surprised that the old farmer before him could say such words.

He hesitated for a moment when a clear bell sound suddenly reverberated from the distant mountain peak.

The blue-robed cultivator behind him also spoke up. "Martial Uncle, the Sect Leader is convening a gathering."

Uncle Xu glanced back at the mountain peak, swallowed the words he was about to speak.

He took out a book and handed it to Xuanyuan Tuo.

"Go back first and read this scripture. If you can cultivate Spirit Qi within a year, you can come find me again." After saying that, Uncle Xu floated away.

Xuanyuan Tuo's eyes widened in amazement.

"Little Qin, do not make things difficult for him," Uncle Xu specifically instructed before leaving.

The blue-robed cultivator nodded in agreement and looked at Xuanyuan Tuo, snorting, "What foolish luck! Hurry up and go! Come back when you can truly cultivate Spirit Qi!"

Seeing this, Xuanyuan Tuo had no choice but to leave reluctantly.

After walking for a while, he seemed to remember something, his expression drastically changed. He wanted to turn back, but found that the vast immortal mountain that was there before had disappeared at some unknown time.

Xuanyuan Tuo slapped his thigh, deeply regretting his actions. "I can't read!"

...

Boom!

The illusion shattered abruptly, and Li Fan returned to reality.

Recalling the content of the illusion, his expression was peculiar.

"What did you see?" the guiding cultivator beside him asked.

Li Fan put on a shocked expression and replied, "I saw the Heavenly Venerate manifesting his Dharma Image and spreading the Dao in the mortal world..."

"Hmph. A trace of the Heavenly Venerate's aura remains in the Alliance Headquarters, so any cultivator entering here for the first time will experience hallucinations..." the guiding cultivator snorted coldly, and then explained.

He led Li Fan towards the Law Enforcement Hall Headquarters.

Along the way, Li Fan secretly pondered.

"I wonder what this illusion is related to?"

"This preaching also has a peculiar habit; he actually laid out his entire life here for his disciples and grandchildren to watch..."

"Hehe, I didn't expect the dignified Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate to have such an embarrassing moment."

Li Fan found it difficult to connect the dark-skinned old farmer with the white-haired, long-bearded, sorrowful-faced old man.

"If the Tianyuan Sect had accepted the Doctrine Transmitter back then, perhaps the history of the Xuanhuang Realm would have taken a different course?"

"But that's not necessarily true."

"After the Doctrine Transmitter awakened, he was not someone a small sect could change. Speaking of which, this Tianyuan Sect, after the Great Tribulation descended, could hardly hold on for long before it perished due to internal strife."

"As for Uncle Xu, he looks somewhat similar to the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall, Xu Yuanxian. He should be his ancestor?"

In an instant, numerous thoughts flashed through his mind.

When they reached the bluestone road outside the Law Enforcement Hall, Li Fan reined in his thoughts.

Following the same procedure as using the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao in his previous life, after queuing for several days, he finally entered the Dharma Deduction Jade space.

Looking at the "listless" Dharma Deduction Jade, Li Fan pretended to be extremely excited.

"Why again?" Dharma Deduction Jade muttered, its annoyed expression not fabricated.

After all, normal deduction of cultivation techniques could be delegated to a simulated personality.

This kind of tailor-made technique deduction for the Jade Token for Approaching the Dao required her to act personally.

"What are your requirements?" Dharma Deduction Jade threw a piece of paper at him.

Just as it was about to reach him, it was caught by "Sun Ang," who was guarding there.

"Wait a moment!"

Sun Ang's movement drew the attention of the other two guards.

"Brother Sun, is something amiss?" Hua Yueye's expression was somewhat solemn.

Sun Ang shook his head. "It's just a sudden feeling in my heart that something is amiss. It's better to check again carefully."

Since it was for Dharma Deduction Jade's safety, the other two guards exchanged glances and did not stop him.

Fu Yuansheng appeared somewhat nervous about Sun Ang's arrival.

"Greetings, Senior..."

Sun Ang completely ignored him and placed his right hand on his head.

Fu Yuansheng's body stiffened on the spot.

A moment later, Sun Ang retracted his right hand.

However, his furrowed brow did not relax.

"Two of you, please try again."

Hua Yueye and Zhang Xu nodded and stepped forward to examine him carefully.

Naturally, they found nothing.

"Perhaps Brother Sun is overthinking things?" Hua Yueye said.

Sun Ang still seemed unconvinced, but since the examination yielded no results, there was no reason to obstruct further.

However, he kept a close eye on Fu Yuansheng throughout the research process.

After completing the cultivation technique deduction, Fu Yuansheng's face was ashen, and he fled from here as if escaping.

"Is it because I've been here too long?" Without outsiders, Hua Yueye asked with some concern.

Sun Ang, who was Li Fan's main body, sensing the "Essence of All Things" he had obtained.

He excused himself, saying, "No. My mind is unsettled..."

"Perhaps something has happened to the bloodline at home."

Chapter 1286: The Sacred Emperor Establishes a New Law (7000 Characters)

Zhang Xu’s expression was solemn. He stroked his beard and said, “The connection between bloodlines is profound and mysterious, yet we must believe it. Brother Sun, perhaps you could send a message to confirm with your family.”

Hua Yueye echoed the sentiment.

“Thank you, two Daoist brothers, for your guidance.” Sun Ang, who was Li Fan’s true form, pondered for a moment before sending out a spirit talisman, flying out of the Dharma Deduction Space.

This spirit talisman, used by each guardian of the Dao Integration realm, required a hundred years of guardianship before one use was granted. If not for the "care" shown by Xu Yuan previously, which exempted "Sun Ang" from a hundred years of guardianship, he wouldn’t have been able to contact the outside world even now.

Half a day later, the Sun family head, Sun Luyuan, personally arrived.

“Your eldest uncle has unfortunately perished.”

Li Fan’s expression first turned to shock, then to self-reproach and sorrow. “When Eldest Uncle was leaving, I already had a faint premonition…”

Sun Luyuan comforted him, “Life and death are unpredictable. Lu Chang’s death has nothing to do with you. Lu’er, you don’t need to blame yourself.”

“I…”

Flying aimlessly for more than half a day, Li Fan soon encountered the person he was waiting for.

“Everyone, it’s just a Dao Integration cultivation technique, not worth fighting to the death over. Why don’t we discuss it peacefully?” someone suggested, directly disregarding the opinion of Fu Yuansheng, the owner of the cultivation technique, treating it as if it were already theirs.

All eyes were on Fu Yuansheng, who seemed to be forced, panicking without direction. He was waiting for an opportunity to completely ignite the situation.

Li Fan smiled slightly, then his expression instantly turned pained and deeply indignant.

“If necessary, I will find a way to get you out.”

“You scoundrel, why aren’t you returning when the family head summoned you? What do you want to do?” As soon as Fu Linmu appeared, he berated Fu Yuansheng relentlessly.

Li Fan watched the incessantly transmitted messages, which only grew more intense due to the lack of reply, his expression growing subtle. After Fu Linmu’s persuasion, Li Fan seemed to struggle in pain, on the verge of compromise.

Just then, uninvited guests arrived.

“Let me, push it further!”

It wasn’t that so many people were coveting the cultivation technique; the vast majority were merely there to spectate.

“Fu Yuansheng, don’t think a moment of luck means a lifetime of luck! How can a mere Golden Core cultivator protect a true Dao Integration technique? Rather than have it forcibly taken later, why not hand it over willingly and exchange it for a bright future!”

Li Fan feigned a look of terror, but in reality, he was leisurely leading these people around. Soon, Fu Yuansheng’s appearance attracted the attention of some.

“That’s right. If the price is too high, it’s better to buy it honestly from the Heavenly Profound Mirror.”

Li Fan pretended to be somewhat bewildered, unsure of whom to listen to.

“As the saying goes, different lands nourish different people. In the Sacred Dynasty, such things would never happen. The Myriad Immortals Alliance is nearing its end!”

Just as the Sun family’s two members were performing a scene of profound familial affection, Fu Yuansheng, whom Li Fan had divided his spirit to possess, was facing immense malice from different individuals within his own family.

Knowing that the Sun family had already pledged allegiance to the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, Li Fan naturally understood the true meaning behind Sun Luyuan’s words. However, at this moment, he could only pretend to say, “I can hold on. We can’t waste the family’s resources because of me.”

“Little Shengzi, what rotten luck did you have to be so fortunate to obtain a Dao Integration cultivation technique?”

It was another elder from the Fu family, bringing another Soul Transformation cultivator, who wanted to contend for the ownership of the true Dao Integration technique. How fast could a Golden Core cultivator flee? Soon, a large group of people followed behind Fu Yuansheng.

Sun Luyuan solemnly promised.

“Sheng’er, in less than two days, over ten Soul Transformation cultivators have come knocking. Any one of them is someone our Fu family cannot afford to offend! For the future of the Fu family, why don’t you hand over the cultivation technique?”

Soon, many observing cultivators chased after them. While the two Soul Transformation cultivators were confronting each other, more Soul Transformation cultivators rushed over upon hearing the news.

Upon leaving the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters, the blocked communication talismans instantly flooded in. The greed and malice in their words almost brought Li Fan’s Spirit Qi circulation to a halt. If Fu Yuansheng, whom he had possessed, wasn’t him now, he would have been pressured to shatter his Dao heart by his own family on the spot.

Sun Luyuan paused, then changed his words, “These are troublesome times, but with me here, the Sun family will not collapse. You just stay here with peace of mind.”

He didn’t return to the Fu family but instead used a teleportation array to arrive at Star Pivot Immortal City, appearing openly before the world.

Li Fan stopped his flight, seemingly very fearful of his own father.

“This senior is Senior Fu Tongtian from Tianquan Prefecture. He’s somewhat related to our family.”

Fu Linmu continued to appeal to Li Fan’s emotions and reason, then introduced the identity of the眯眼 Soul Transformation cultivator behind him. Standing behind Fu Linmu was a cultivator with his arms crossed and eyes narrowed. Judging by his aura, he should be at the Soul Transformation realm.

…

“Your Dao Integration cultivation technique, our Fu family truly cannot protect it. Having it in your hands is a disaster, not a blessing. Why not hand it over to this Senior Fu…”
