Even those unaware of the situation noticed the strange looks from the surrounding crowd. After some inquiries, they instantly understood.

He didn’t temporarily hide or use the teleportation array to escape, but as if he had lost his mind, he directly flew out of Star Pivot Celestial City with his physical body.

“The wickedness of human hearts, even to this extent!”

“Yuansheng, hasn’t the family treated you well all these years? It’s time for you to repay the family.”

That should be Fu Yuansheng’s nominal father, Fu Linmu.

“Why don’t we first hear what kind of cultivation technique this Fu family prodigy has asked Dharma Deduction to deduce?”

The group of Soul Transformation cultivators quickly reached a consensus, all looking uniformly at Li Fan. Little did they know, this move played right into Li Fan’s hands. Before entering the Dharma Deduction Space, he had already calculated that he would use this cultivation technique to stir up trouble. Therefore, the blueprint cultivation technique he provided to Dharma Deduction was of an extremely high caliber. The resulting cultivation technique was naturally extraordinary, even serving a purpose for the current Li Fan.

Li Fan, disguised as Fu Yuansheng, showed a pained expression. Finally, in helplessness, he took a deep breath and said word by word, “The cultivation technique I obtained is called the [Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique].”

“The current New Law is truly defying the heavens. However, to break through one’s realm, one must rely on various resources between heaven and earth. For those noble and powerful families, it’s fine, but for those without power or influence like us, even with supreme talent, we are still restricted!”

Li Fan’s words caused many cultivators present to look moved, feeling a sense of resonance. Li Fan continued, “Therefore, I have always dreamed of one day being free from these restrictions. Thanks to the favor of Senior Qian Xun, who gifted me a Jade Token for Approaching the Dao, I finally had the opportunity to turn my dream into reality.”

“This Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique can continuously strengthen one’s connection with the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth, greatly reducing the Heavenly Dao’s hostility. Then, by relying on this connection with heaven and earth, one can find Nascent Soul Grotto-heavens, Changes of Birth, and other essential materials for breakthroughs. Even when cultivated to a profound level, locating the whereabouts of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence will be a simple matter…”

“With this cultivation technique, as long as I, Fu Yuansheng, am given some time, achieving Dao Integration will not be mere wishful thinking. I never expected… I never expected…”

“The Myriad Immortals Alliance is forcing me, a low-level cultivator like this, to this extent! They’re not giving me any opportunities!”

As Li Fan spoke, his indignation grew, his eyes filled with bloodshot veins. He then directly waved his hand, revealing the general outline of the [Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique] for everyone to see. With just a glance, the Dao Integration cultivators present recognized the extraordinary nature of this cultivation technique. It was certainly not something a mere Golden Core cultivator could fabricate.

The Soul Transformation cultivators’ expressions varied. The atmosphere suddenly became tense and serious.

“Enough.” One of them erased the text on the sky screen and then scanned everyone. “The value of this cultivation technique needs no further explanation.”

“Indeed, there are differences between Dao Integration cultivation techniques. If this brat’s words are true, the value of this Dao Integration cultivation technique is truly unparalleled in my life.”

“Heh heh, I think even if half of those present die, it’s still worth it if they can win the cultivation technique!”

The Soul Transformation cultivators spoke one after another, their words growing more aggressive. The Fu family members present, however, gradually looked despondent. If they had known that Fu Yuansheng had comprehended such a supreme cultivation technique capable of establishing a cultivation family, they would have tried to protect him no matter what! Even if they had set more conditions when selling it! Regardless of the Fu family’s regret, the final ownership of the Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique was intervened by a newly ascended Dao Integration cultivator. This person was known as Immortal Venerable Scarlet Willow, who had only broken through to the Dao Integration realm a few days prior. Not having found a suitable cultivation technique yet, he happened to hear about Fu Yuansheng’s situation and joined in the excitement out of curiosity. Unexpectedly, he found a pleasant surprise. The gap between Dao Integration and Soul Transformation was like heaven and earth. If Scarlet Willow wanted it, the Soul Transformation cultivators naturally couldn’t contend with him. Moreover, Scarlet Willow was not alone; he had the backing of a considerable family force. Ultimately, under the pressure of both sources, the Soul Transformation cultivators present withdrew from the competition. To avoid any further complications, the final victor, Immortal Venerable Scarlet Willow, demanded Fu Yuansheng hand over the cultivation technique on the spot.

“I hope that after obtaining this method, Senior will continue to look after our Fu family.” Li Fan sighed to the heavens, his words making the Fu family members present feel ashamed.

Watching Scarlet Willow fly closer, Li Fan transmitted the complete Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique to him via his divine sense.

“It is indeed a supreme wondrous technique.” Scarlet Willow’s face lit up with joy.

“Fu小子, sign this contract. It signifies that you voluntarily give up ownership of the cultivation technique. Rest assured, I will not mistreat your Fu family…” Scarlet Willow said sternly.

“Junior obeys.” Li Fan lowered his head, about to take the golden contract.

And at this moment… As if affected by the text of the Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique, Scarlet Willow suddenly felt his mind become momentarily dazed. The Fu Yuansheng before his eyes seemed like a ferocious and terrifying monster from nightmares, baring its teeth and claws, lunging towards him, about to pounce on his face. Scarlet Willow jolted and instinctively unleashed a red light. It struck Fu Yuansheng’s body directly. The might of a Dao Integration cultivator, even an unconscious, casual strike, was not something a Golden Core cultivator could contend with! With an expression of disbelief, Fu Yuansheng’s body instantly disintegrated inch by inch, his body and Dao perishing! This sudden turn of events stunned everyone. Their eyes were filled with shock as they stared at Immortal Venerable Scarlet Willow, who had committed murder in public. Scarlet Willow himself was also somewhat stunned. He stared blankly at his own palm. “Could it be that after my recent breakthrough, the influence of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence hasn’t completely faded?” “Fortunately, the [Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique] has been obtained.” This was the second thought that flashed through Scarlet Willow’s mind. “Sheng’er!” After a deathly silence, the Fu family members finally reacted. They wailed in grief and indignation. Many of them, unafraid of the vast gulf between themselves and a Dao Integration cultivator, stared at Scarlet Willow with intense hatred. Above, the phenomenon of the fallen individual arrived belatedly, testifying to Fu Yuansheng’s cause of death. As for the murderer, Scarlet Willow, looking at the gazes of these ants, felt an inexplicable discomfort. However, since he was in the wrong, he couldn’t lash out in public. He simply said, “Rest assured, I will keep my word. I will not mistreat your Fu family.” The sobbing of the Fu family members slowly subsided. After all, the person was dead, and there was no need to rebel against a Dao Integration cultivator for a dead person and court death. Scarlet Willow left with the Fu family members. The Soul Transformation cultivators also lamented, “It seems this cultivation technique is too precious. Immortal Venerable Scarlet Willow chose to silence him for absolute secrecy.” “He doesn’t even trust the contract? This new Dao Integration cultivator is too suspicious, isn’t he?” “What about the contract? There are many wondrous techniques in the world; what if he can break the contract without punishment?” “This is happening with so many people watching. If it were in private, he would probably be even more unscrupulous!” “Soul Transformation cultivators are truly awe-inspiring! The laws of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, at their level, seem to become optional, don’t they?” “Of course. Even a fool can tell that the Myriad Immortals Alliance would never punish a true Dao Integration cultivator for a mere Golden Core. Even if there were, it would surely be a mere formality.” “Once one enters the Dao Integration realm, indeed, everything is different. Like the Rainbow Light of the Departure Realm that could roam the sea of stars before, only Dao Integration cultivators are qualified.” The Soul Transformation cultivators chatted with great interest and gradually dispersed. However, the remaining large number of Foundation Establishment, Golden Core, Nascent Soul, and other low-level cultivators who were watching did not leave for a long time. They looked up at the phenomenon of the fallen individual that had yet to dissipate in the sky, a sense of shared sorrow filling their hearts. Under the influence of an imperceptible mysterious force, this emotion gradually turned into flames of anger, slowly igniting. “In the eyes of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s higher-ups, we are truly like ants.” “What about the promised laws of the Myriad Immortals Alliance? It turns out they only apply to us?” “Today, it’s Fu Yuansheng who died; tomorrow, who among us will die innocently?” In the silence, a peculiar atmosphere was brewing. Although no one spoke, their exchanged glances revealed everything. However, due to the deterrence of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, no one dared to voice their thoughts. Perhaps… what they needed was an opportunity. After a long time, the onlookers finally dispersed. Li Fan’s strand of divine sense reappeared in the world as a phantom. “The fire has been lit; I’m afraid I won’t need to fan it for it to spread throughout the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance.” Li Fan was quite satisfied with his masterpiece. The subsequent development was indeed as he had predicted. Although the image of Immortal Venerable Scarlet Willow killing Fu Yuansheng in broad daylight quickly spread throughout the Myriad Immortals Alliance via the Heavenly Profound Mirror, since the Fu family expressed understanding for Scarlet Willow’s temporary mistake due to his recent breakthrough and unstable realm, the Myriad Immortals Alliance did not pursue his responsibility further, only imposing a symbolic penalty of contribution points. Instead, the news of the Heaven-Piercing Spirit-Responding Body Transformation Technique obtained by Scarlet Willow spread, causing countless families to inquire about the authenticity of the matter. Many expressed their willingness to pay a hefty sum for Scarlet Willow to act and sense the location of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence. For a time, Scarlet Willow’s status as a newly ascended Dao Integration cultivator was even higher than some established Dao Integration cultivators. As for the innocent and tragically deceased Fu Yuansheng, he was slowly forgotten as time passed… “How ironic! The perpetrator is not punished but rewarded.” In the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, Wang Xuanba looked at the document in his hand and clicked his tongue in amazement. “If this were in our Great Qi, let alone ordinary officials, even I, the Sacred Emperor’s personal disciple, would be severely punished for such an act. At the very least, I would be imprisoned in the Nether Prison for hundreds of years, not just let off so lightly. The Myriad Immortals Alliance is truly good… Ah, no, the Myriad Immortals Alliance is truly degenerate!” Ou Shangtian shook his head repeatedly. Sun Erlang glanced at Ou Shangtian and smiled helplessly. “Master’s intention is that this incident can be used as a typical example for propaganda, as a mobilization before the war.” “Furthermore, it can be used to shake the foundations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, as most cultivators in the Myriad Immortals Alliance are below the Soul Transformation realm.” Ou Shangtian pouted, “What’s the use of recruiting these weaklings? I’ll kill as many as come!” Sun Erlang’s expression changed. “How dare you speak such vulgarity! Those who follow the Dao have many helpers; those who lose the Dao have few. The Myriad Immortals Alliance has lost the hearts of the people, and our Sacred Dynasty’s conquest is an act that aligns with the people’s will.” “Righteousness and acting according to the Dao will lead to invincibility!” As the senior disciple, Ou Shangtian dared not refute, only muttering softly, “Saying so much, but in the end, it all comes down to strength.” After some playful banter, the disciples shifted the topic back to business. “Shangtian, how is the construction of your Myriad Forms Teleportation Array coming along?” Sun Erlang asked. Ou Shangtian’s face showed pride. “You can rest assured when I handle things, Senior Brother. The positioning for all the territories of the Myriad Immortals Alliance has been completed. As soon as Master gives the order, our Great Qi soldiers can instantly travel to the designated territories through the Myriad Forms Teleportation Array. Then, using the Puxian True Boat and covering with the White Mist Barrier, we can guarantee to arrive beneath the celestial cities of each prefecture stealthily!” Wang Xuanba added, “The few nails we’ve planted within the Myriad Immortals Alliance have also completed their connections. Once the time is right, the Heavenly Profound Mirrors and teleportation arrays of all Myriad Immortals Alliance territories will become inoperative.” A miniature map of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s territory appeared before them. “At that time, each prefecture will become an isolated island, unable to take care of themselves. Their strength has already been investigated. Dividing and conquering them will not be a problem.” “The most crucial points are the Four Central Prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Alliance Headquarters.” Scanning the list of major stationed cultivators in each prefecture, Sun Erlang focused his gaze on the center of the miniature map. After a moment of thought, Sun Erlang said, “When Master summoned me earlier, he subtly revealed that at that time, he will employ a heaven-shattering method to directly seal the Four Central Prefectures and the Alliance Headquarters. We should not worry about reinforcements from the Alliance Headquarters, and only need to focus on quickly resolving the battles in each prefecture.” “In addition, the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s secret realms hidden in the White Mist and various territories will also be sealed by our formations before the war. Although the forces stationed in places like the Hidden Dragon Abyss, Phoenix Mist City, Vast Mountain, and Chizha Immortal City are not strong individually, they are not to be underestimated when combined. They must be defeated one by one.” The others listened solemnly to Sun Erlang’s explanation of the conquest plan. Only Ou Shangtian grinned and said, “I personally experienced the formation techniques of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. They are simply not worth mentioning. The sealing formations created by Master himself can trap them for half a year, or even a year!” “It’s just that the materials for the formations might be a bit scarce, right?” Ou Shangtian suddenly frowned and asked in confusion. Sun Erlang smiled and took out a piece of [Empty Sky Mother Stone] and placed it before everyone. Ou Shangtian scanned the supplies within the Mother Stone and was so surprised that he stood up. “So much? Did you steal the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s treasury?” Sun Erlang laughed heartily. “Master gave me three of these. Each Mother Stone is packed to the brim. As far as I know, Senior Ou Daozi also has ample supplies. So, you don’t need to worry about strategic materials. Just prepare for the formations.” Ou Shangtian’s eyes lit up upon hearing about his father, and he nodded repeatedly. Sun Erlang then looked at the silent Su Yuqing and Liu Li duo. Since they were sent to guard the underground dark world by the Sacred Emperor, they had indeed become like they were stained by the darkness, becoming much more taciturn. “Junior Sister, how is the formation of reinforcements from the pocket worlds coming along?” Sun Erlang asked. “It’s faster than we anticipated. Don’t worry, the United Council of Ten Thousand Worlds will arrive on time.” Su Yuqing said softly, her voice possessing a resilience that was not there before. While educating the Netherfolk in the underground dark world, she had vaguely sensed the possible connection between the Heavenly Dao of the pocket world and its inhabitants. Coupled with her experience of gaining the favor of the Heavenly Dao in the Departure Realm, she was naturally more easily accepted by the Heavenly Dao of pocket worlds than other cultivators. With this advantage, under the Sacred Emperor’s orders, she traveled through various pocket worlds. Using a combination of persuasion and coercion, she assembled a "United Council of Ten Thousand Worlds" with terrifying efficiency. Although she did not hold high expectations for the actual combat power that this allied army could truly display in the end, its grand momentum was certainly beneficial for boosting morale. Most importantly, it prevented them from causing trouble during the decisive battle between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance. “By the way, where did Senior Sister Lin Ling go? I haven’t seen her recently,” Ou Shangtian suddenly asked curiously. Sun Erlang vaguely replied, “She has her own mission assigned by Master, so I’m not too sure. But don’t worry, she will definitely not be absent from this feast.” The disciples once again looked at the miniature map of the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the center of the hall. Their eyes were filled with anticipation. In the Sacred Dynasty’s secret realm, or in the Academy built for Senior Yin. Senior Yin scratched his head, pushing back the True Self Dao Foundation that had re-emerged from a crack in his skull. He uncertainly asked, “Is doing this too rash?” “My Foundation Establishment method is considered a complete victory. The Primordial Golden Core has only deduced half of it so far. As for what comes after, it’s all castles in the air, like flowers in a mirror. It looks beautiful at first glance, but it shatters when poked and cannot withstand scrutiny!” Sacred Emperor Li Ping sat at a wooden table, constantly flipping through illusory texts, deleting and revising. Around him, phenomena resembling a galaxy, born from his enlightenment, warped space and flickered in and out of existence. Senior Yin forced himself to shift his gaze away from such astonishing scenes. After a long while, the Sacred Emperor finished flipping through the entire illusory book and began revising from the first page. He then responded, “As the saying goes, ‘When the true becomes false, the false also becomes true.’ As long as we make the cultivators in the world believe that this is a ‘New New Law’ that can break free from the Doctrine Transmitter cultivation system and cultivate independently…” “Even if it only lasts for a few days, it will be enough.” “Moreover, given how obscure the New New Law is and how it completely contradicts the methods of Doctrine Transmission, how long do you think it will take the Azure Nether cultivators to verify its authenticity?” The Sacred Emperor spoke as he once again used his hand as a brush to revise the illusory book built upon the New New Law. Senior Yin did not answer, only repeating the phrase “When the true becomes false, the false also becomes true” in his mouth. After a long time, he suddenly realized, “That’s right. Precisely because there was no New New Law in the world before, once we announce it, and the most easily verifiable Foundation Establishment method is true, they will naturally assume that the subsequent cultivation techniques are also true.” “And my repeated revisions are merely to improve the deceptive effect.” The Sacred Emperor smiled slightly and cynically chuckled. “But what is the point? It ultimately cannot shake the foundation of Doctrine Transmission, can it?” Senior Yin scratched his head again. “The methods of Doctrine Transmission and the New New Law are incompatible. To cultivate, one must change sects and re-establish their Dao path. Perhaps one in a thousand would choose to do so, but after all, one increases as the other decreases.” “More importantly…” As the Sacred Emperor spoke, he completed another round of revisions to the illusory book. He did not make any further changes but closed the illusory book. Placing his hands on it, misty starlight surged on the book. In what seemed like an instant, the illusory book, which was originally just pure imaginary light and shadow, actually gained a physical form. It turned into a truly existing “book” in this world. Handing this “New New Law” to Senior Yin, the Sacred Emperor stood up and continued, “More importantly, if we announce the New New Law, and the Myriad Immortals Alliance can do nothing to us…” “Dharma-Preachers will surely return from the distant starry sky.” The Sacred Emperor said sternly. “This is called attacking what they must save.” A faint light flashed in Senior Yin’s eyes, and he nodded slowly. “Do you… have confidence in dealing with the Dharma-Preachers?” After a moment of hesitation, Senior Yin still asked. “It’s just a gamble.” The Sacred Emperor paused, then said frankly.

Chapter 1287: Anomaly Arises in the Star Sea (7K)

"Go all out..." Senior Yin fell silent, having received his answer.

"There's no need to worry. I have already made my plans. Regardless of victory or defeat, the True Orthodoxy of the Azure Nether will be re-established. You and Xu Ke should simply do what you intend to do," declared Emperor Li Ping calmly.

"But..." Senior Yin still hesitated.

"The moment the Dharma-Preachers reveal themselves will be the moment the Sacred Dynasty's army launches its full assault on the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. You two will then take advantage of the chaos to infiltrate the Divine Treasure Museum and retrieve Mr. Bai's skull. At this stage, victory or defeat is a contest of grand strategy. While neither of you is weak, you cannot influence the overall situation. Moreover, the Divine Treasure Museum is managed by the Illusory Sage lineage of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Being able to tie them down is a great contribution in itself."

A hint of gloom flashed in Senior Yin's eyes. "It's merely the lingering remnants of the Xuanhuang Realm's ancient strange beasts and their souls. If Emperor One were still around, I might be a little wary. But just one Emperor San Mo..."

"Is not worth fearing!" Senior Yin scoffed.

"The Illusory Sage wields the 'Epoch' artifact. Even the most mediocre existence can achieve miracles after countless simulations and deductions. Do not underestimate them!" Li Ping stated solemnly.

The Emperor's words carried some weight in Senior Yin's heart.

He no longer argued, instead narrowing his eyes in thought.

As he thought, a rustling sound, like silkworms crawling, returned to his scalp. His scalp shifted and undulated, as if something would soon break through the cracks on his head.

Senior Yin's expression instantly turned angry, while Li Ping flashed to his side.

With a gentle stroke of his palm, starlight seeped in, and the disturbance gradually subsided.

"This is the backlash of your True Self. Forcibly suppressing it is not a viable solution," the Emperor observed, seeing the root of the problem, and advised.

Senior Yin wore a helpless expression. "Being a late bloomer, it's not like starting cultivation from scratch. It's bound to leave various aftereffects. I originally thought that once I consumed my imperfect Dao foundation and re-cultivated with 'Self-Inherent Foundation,' all would be well. But a while ago, I overheard your preachings in the Star Sea and had another realization. I realized that my 'complete self' as I originally understood it was not complete. My foundation is unstable and indeed needs further tending."

"Rest assured, I will handle this before the final battle arrives," Senior Yin promised.

"As long as you have it under control."

The Emperor's voice echoed, but his figure had already vanished.

Senior Yin glanced around and was shocked to find that the incomplete 'New Law,' which had materialized from nothingness when the Emperor sat there, and was taken by him, had inexplicably reappeared on the long table.

Knowing that the Emperor had intentionally left it for him, Senior Yin did not hesitate. He picked it up and began to study it on the spot.

"Marvelous..."

Even though it was merely compiled to deceive the world, this half of the New Law still appeared infinitely profound to Senior Yin, almost indistinguishable from a true divine technique.

He was soon completely engrossed.

The Sacred Dynasty. The Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven. The Fire Attribute Grotto-heaven.

An endless sea of fire, where raging flames rose like towering waves, erupting violently at times and soaring towards the sky.

The scorching flames, like wild steeds, gnawed at everything within the grotto-heaven.

Yet, at the deepest part of this infernal landscape, a golden glazed flower bloomed. No matter how fiercely the surrounding flames raged, the flower remained pure and untainted, completely unaffected.

Within the center of the glazed flower, an image of a world flickered faintly.

Occasionally, a wisp of golden light drifted from the glazed world within the flower. Upon contact with this golden light, the surrounding flames instantly ignited with greater intensity.

If viewed from high above, one could see Daoist Bai Hua, using the golden glazed light as a guide, continuously refining this fire grotto-heaven.

Compared to when it was first captured and brought here, not only the fire grotto-heaven but the entire Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven had nearly doubled in scale. Daoist Bai Hua could be credited for this significant achievement.

Emperor Li Ping's figure appeared beside the golden glazed light.

The raging flames immediately subsided. They dared not approach, only wavering meekly from a distance, as if trying to please.

"Well done. The Five Elements Grotto-heaven has been managed excellently."

"The other grotto-heavens are also well." Li Ping said indifferently.

His gaze penetrated the heavens of the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, extending into the void beyond the realm.

The Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, like a powerful pilot, was leading the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty rapidly through the void.

And around it, over a hundred smaller worlds of various sizes were simultaneously enveloped.

With the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty as the core, they formed a discernible formation, like a colossal warship, awe-inspiring.

"It is merely my duty. If not for the Emperor's bestowal of Myriad Spirits Nectar, I could not have achieved this level," Daoist Bai Hua said, bowing before Li Ping.

Daoist Bai Hua followed Li Ping's gaze.

After a brief silence, she couldn't help but sigh, "I can hardly believe that such a magnificent spectacle was created by me."

"Most of them are no smaller than my home world."

"Next, I will need your assistance once more. Please send this Five Elements Grotto-heaven back into the Xuanhuang Realm's main body." Li Ping's voice chimed in precisely.

Daoist Bai Hua was slightly stunned.

The Emperor smiled and explained, "The time for evasion has passed. Now is the time for close combat. Let this be the vanguard for the first battle!"

As the Emperor spoke, the surrounding flames seemed to gain courage, surging with renewed vigor.

Daoist Bai Hua then noticed that within the entire fiery grotto-heaven, beneath the flames themselves, there flowed a deep shadow.

It was a terrifying presence capable of threatening her.

The Emperor extended his palm, and the shadow flowed, quickly arriving at his palm and transforming into a cute, chubby insect with a tiger-like head.

It appeared plump and harmless, yet Daoist Bai Hua clearly understood its terrifying nature.

The fire grotto-heaven they were currently in, and indeed the entire Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven, was merely a manifestation of this black insect.

For years, Daoist Bai Hua had been less tending to the grotto-heaven and more like raising this insect named 'Dao One.'

"With 'Dao One' assisting you, dragging the grotto-heaven back will not be as strenuous as when it arrived."

"You only need to return the Five Elements Grotto-heaven to its rightful place; Dao One will handle everything else." The Emperor instructed.

As Li Ping spoke, starlight emanated from his palm.

The Dao One insect seemed rather pleased, nudging Li Ping's hand affectionately with its plump body. It then greedily devoured the specks of starlight.

Its black body appeared to become even more solid.

"Go."

Li Ping gently patted it. Although the Dao One insect was reluctant, it was obedient. Its shadow dissolved, returning into the surrounding grotto-heaven.

The surrounding flames immediately intensified.

Daoist Bai Hua also sensed that the entire grotto-heaven had instantly come alive. Being inside it was akin to being within the belly of a colossal beast.

The escalating sense of crisis made Daoist Bai Hua restless.

Li Ping, noticing Daoist Bai Hua's unease, led her out into the void beyond the Five Elements Grotto-heaven.

With a flick of the Emperor's finger, the Five Elements Grotto-heaven detached itself from the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty's void fleet.

"Do not worry. Dao One will faithfully execute my commands."

Since the Emperor had said so, Daoist Bai Hua could only nod. Suppressing her inner fear, she transformed into a golden light and flew towards the Five Elements Grotto-heaven.

The Five Elements Grotto-heaven was instantly rimmed with a golden edge.

Rumble!

After the initial roar, the grotto-heaven's relocation became completely silent.

Under the concealment of the Emperor's formations, even those passing by the moving grotto-heaven might not have noticed this colossal moving entity.

Watching the Five Elements Grotto-heaven return home, Li Ping mused, "In its current state, 'Dao One' is capable of altering the Spirit Qi of the entire Xuanhuang Realm without a trace."

"This is not only aimed at the Myriad Immortals Alliance but also serves to stimulate the Xuanhuang Realm, further igniting its potential for recovery."

Since his enlightenment in the center of the Star Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm had experienced a brief resurgence of vitality. However, it was like water without a source, and as time passed, the signs of recovery gradually stagnated.

The tender buds on the branches of the If Wood were once again turning yellow.

Modified by the Dao One insect, the 'insectified' Five Elements Grotto-heaven was like a potent medicine.

The Spirit Qi of heaven and earth was an extremely crucial component of the Xuanhuang Realm. If it were corrupted, it would inevitably trigger a fierce, instinctive reaction from the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

"Dao One's mission, in addition to creating a battlefield environment suitable for the Great Qi soldiers, is to 'insectify' and devour, as much as possible, the external cultivation worlds that have been stitched together over millennia."

"After the great battle concludes, Dao One will perish. The Spirit Qi will return to its proper course, and Dao One's corpse – those external worlds – will become nourishment for the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Through this insect tribulation, the Xuanhuang Realm will become considerably stronger. Coupled with the 'Azure Nether Orthodoxy' measures I previously laid down, regardless of whether I or the Doctrine Transmitter wins, the Xuanhuang Realm will hold an absolute advantage in the future integration of realms."

The Emperor's mind constantly simulated the scenes of the upcoming great battle.

Gazing into the distance, he pierced through layers of space-time obstruction and saw Daoist Bai Hua smoothly dragging the insectified Five Elements Grotto-heaven back to its position.

Amidst the silent roar of heaven and earth, the Five Elements Grotto-heaven, having returned to the Heavenly Spirit Prefecture, began to emit a surge of anomalous Spirit Qi.

The Spirit Qi concentration of the Xuanhuang Realm would rise slightly in a short period.

Cultivators would be unable to detect the abnormality of this new Spirit Qi. Only when the 'insectification' was activated would they be caught off guard and lose their 'right to summon' the Spirit Qi of heaven and earth.

Seeing his plan proceeding smoothly, Emperor Li Ping finally withdrew his gaze.

With a step, he returned to the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty.

Deep within the Emperor's throne, at the core of the Great Myriad Spirits Formation.

In addition to the Spirit Refining Formation for All Beings and numerous other superimposed formations. Even the consciousness of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, which was closely linked to the Emperor, would be severed here.

This ensured that all external intrusions would be blocked.

The Emperor's disciple, Lin Ling, formerly the Wood Spirit Incarnation of the Spirit Wood Realm, now revealed its true form.

However, what appeared rather bizarre was that the tree was inverted, with its canopy at the bottom.

Dense roots were at the very top.

All buildings throughout the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty, such as the Hall of Divine Spirits, Sacred Medical Halls, Sacred Academies, Sacred Heart Palaces, and Sacred Supervision Courts, were connected to the roots of the inverted spiritual tree.

At the tree's heart, all phenomena occurring within the Great Qi Sacred Dynasty were simultaneously displayed.

After a scene played out, the light and shadow transformed into green light and were absorbed by the inverted spiritual tree.

Emperor Li Ping looked at the inverted spiritual tree before him, a rare flicker of hesitation in his eyes.

"To not plan for defeat before planning for victory, that is the great wisdom of an Emperor!"

Beside Li Ping, a yellow paper figure with a worried expression was praising him without reservation.

It was Daoist Yi Jue of the Guiding Tribulation Sect.

He sat on the Book of Tribulation Passage, his eyes fixed on the inverted spiritual tree before him.

"Furthermore, Your Majesty's plan is for the Xuanhuang Realm, not a fallback for yourself. Therefore, it can hardly be seen as a compromise to your resolve," Daoist Yi Jue continued.

The Emperor remained silent.

He occasionally cast hand seals, causing the roots of the inverted spiritual tree to sway.

And at the position of the tree's heart, the absorption of the Great Qi's light and shadow seemed to accelerate.

After a long while, the Emperor stopped his actions.

He suddenly spoke, "For the final battle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance, your Guiding Tribulation Sect need not act."

"As I said before, hide in secret and observe..."

"'If there are other prying eyes.'" The Emperor uttered mysteriously.

"The war between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance is a change in the Xuanhuang Realm unseen in millennia. If the power secretly monitoring the Xuanhuang Realm is still active, it will inevitably supervise this event and transmit the information. I do not require you to find the ultimate destination of the information. Simply determine if the event has occurred," the Emperor instructed, word by word.

Daoist Yi Jue of the Guiding Tribulation Sect's furrowed brow finally relaxed.

He clapped his hands and praised, "Your Majesty's actions perfectly align with the Great Dao of our Guiding Tribulation Sect. If Your Majesty wishes, I can relinquish the position of Sect Leader of the Guiding Tribulation Sect..."

Before Daoist Yi Jue could finish, the Emperor interrupted him. "Regardless of whether I or the Doctrine Transmitter wins, you must inform the victor of the outcome. As for after completing the task... you are free to do as you please."

Daoist Yi Jue did not show delight at the prospect of imminent freedom. Instead, he looked astonished, the blurry little hand of the paper figure pointing at the inverted spiritual tree before him. "I am not going with you?"

The Emperor chuckled lightly. "Of the living beings within this 'Outside Wood,' only Lin Ling, the primary entity, is alive. I have not left any backup for myself, and you expect the Guiding Tribulation Sect to follow?"

Daoist Yi Jue's face immediately fell. "Your Majesty, please reconsider. Relying solely on a tree spirit born not long ago, what can it achieve? In the vast Star Sea, it might encounter disaster and perish halfway. Your Majesty's escape method will then be abandoned halfway..."

Li Ping waved his hand, interrupting him.

Staring at the inverted spiritual tree, he corrected, "It is not an escape method, but a preservation of information."

Daoist Yi Jue sighed mournfully. "What's the difference?"

Li Ping narrowed his eyes, remaining silent.

This 'Outside Wood' not only contained records of all events that had occurred in the Sacred Dynasty since its inception, but also the true spirits and memories of those who had perished and were once in the Hall of Divine Spirits. These would be transferred here upon activation.

This was a contingency plan for the entire Sacred Dynasty, inspired by the information immortality theory of the Grand Origin Sect.

Or perhaps, the word "proof" would be more appropriate to describe it.

If Li Ping won, there would be no need to mention it. The 'Outside Wood' would never be activated.

But if Li Ping lost, then upon the destruction of the Great Qi, this 'Outside Wood' would carry the true spirits of the Sacred Dynasty's citizens and fly into the depths of the void.

If it were a physical entity, it would surely not escape the Doctrine Transmitter's obstruction.

But if it were merely information, the Doctrine Transmitter might not care.

Furthermore, the Guiding Tribulation Sect would provide some interference at that time.

It was not that the Emperor had wavered in his resolve for the final battle. After all, there was no place left for any living being in this 'Outside Wood.'

It was that the Emperor wished to leave a testament of existence for the countless citizens who had followed and believed in him.

Li Ping knew that in the thousands of years of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's rule over half the Xuanhuang Realm, the Sacred Dynasty had not been the first to rise in rebellion.

Five hundred years ago, there had been an instance of the United Council of Ten Thousand Worlds rising in resistance.

But after their failure, all information about them was erased and sealed by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, as if these failed rebels had never existed.

Li Ping's action was to prevent such a thing from happening again.

"Even if we lose, our existence will not be erased!"

"And if, after many years, the 'Outside Wood' returns to the Xuanhuang Realm, it would be even better if it could inspire future generations."

Countless thoughts flashed through Li Ping's mind.

Subtle emotions surged, then were quickly quelled.

"'Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate'," Li Ping silently repeated the name in his heart.

In fact, with his current strength, he had a thirty percent chance of fighting the Doctrine Transmitter to a draw, or even winning.

After all, after his enlightenment in the Star Sea, he had understood the limits of this Abyssal Star Sea.

Even though the Doctrine Transmitter had dominated the Xuanhuang Realm for nearly ten thousand years, he had surely not broken the current limits of the Star Sea.

But what made Li Ping's heart uneasy was the shadow behind the Doctrine Transmitter.

The Heavenly Physician.

Although Li Ping knew little about him, a vague intuition told him that this person should not be underestimated.

Being able to conspire with the Doctrine Transmitter, his strength should not be weak either.

"If it's just the Doctrine Transmitter, I can handle it. But if the Heavenly Physician is added..."

Although the situation was not optimistic, the Emperor's decision to launch the full assault in three years was not impulsive.

Three years later was a very special juncture in time.

The specialness was not in the Xuanhuang Realm, but in the entire Abyssal Star Sea.

Sensing the vast true intent of the Star Sea's origin, in three years, the Star Sea would erupt with the power of resurgence once more.

At that time, the resurgent power from the Star Sea would engage in a large-scale conflict with the tribulation forces lingering throughout the Star Sea.

When these two massive forces collided, cultivators within the Star Sea, as long as they had not reached a level that could contend with both, would inevitably be affected.

This applied to both cultivators enlightened in the Star Sea and believers in the tribulation forces.

And this influence, when manifested in individual cultivators, would be a significant reduction in their power ceiling.

Just as larger bodies experience more wind and waves in the sea, the stronger the cultivation, the deeper the influence of the Star Sea and tribulation forces within the Abyssal Star Sea.

The Doctrine Transmitter and the Heavenly Physician, two beings at the pinnacle of the Star Sea, would be temporarily and forcefully pulled down.

Although the Emperor's strength would also be reduced, on one hand, a large portion of his combat power came from the Sacred Dynasty's destiny. As long as the Sacred Dynasty stood, the strength he could exert would remain relatively stable.

On the other hand, he had an implicit connection with the true intent of the Star Sea's origin. Protected by it, compared to other beings in the Star Sea, he would only need to face the ripple effects of the tribulation forces.

"Through brief communication with the Star Sea's true intent of origin, I confirmed that before me, no cultivator had ever contacted it. Although I do not know why the Doctrine Transmitter and others have not discovered the resurgence of the Star Sea's true intent of origin over the past ten thousand years, it is undoubtedly a fortunate event for me."

"It not only to some extent reduced the gap between us, but I can even borrow the power of this vast Star Sea to a certain degree."

"However, compared to the Xuanhuang Realm's lack of choice, this Star Sea is currently in a state of vibrant rebirth, and my power is too insignificant. There is only one chance..."

The Emperor stood before the inverted spiritual tree, simulating various scenarios that might occur in the great battle three years later.

No matter how Daoist Yi Jue of the Guiding Tribulation Sect persuaded him, he remained unmoved.

"If I could borrow the power of the tribulation forces, perhaps the odds of victory would increase further."

The Emperor couldn't help but think this.

Little did he know that on the distant end of the Star Sea, a group of beings attempting to control the Star Sea's tribulation forces also perceived the anomaly that was about to occur in three years.

Mystic Immortal Boat, Severed Immortal Tower.

Zhao Xian, also known as Holy Embryo Li Fan, who was in secluded cultivation, was hastily summoned.

At a meeting of all core members of the Severed Immortal Tower, Ai Tianjue delivered a speech, announcing an event that could significantly impact the Immortal Boat.

"The tribulation forces remaining in various parts of the Star Sea are continuously strengthening, expected to reach their peak within three years?"

"Affected by this, the True Immortal power attached to the Sea of Remnants will also resonate, significantly intensifying its fluctuations. This is an excellent opportunity for us to search for effective World-Destroying Remnants, a rare chance in a thousand years!"

"If all goes well, we might collect enough remnants for the next century in one go!"

Upon hearing Ai Tianjue's report, everyone became extremely excited.

Currently, due to the scarcity of World-Destroying Remnants, the Severed Immortal Tower's research on True Immortal Sigils was progressing very slowly.

Often, several cultivators had to share a single remnant.

Only true power holders and their disciples had the chance to possess one exclusively.

Almost every cultivator in the Severed Immortal Tower was confident that their aptitude was no less than others. If each person had sufficient remnants for research, the difficulty of research would be greatly reduced.

"What concerns me more is why this phenomenon is occurring?" came the voice of Chi Gongdao.

He himself was not present at the meeting; only a pen woven from flesh and hair spoke.

The flesh-and-blood pen danced erratically in the void, gesturing: "The Immortal Boat has always kept detailed records of the fluctuations of tribulation forces. Such abnormal phenomena have never occurred before."

"And abnormality either signifies opportunity, or represents..."

"'Disaster!'"

The flesh-and-blood pen wrote a character in the air.

A strange fluctuation emanated from the character, and the cultivators present involuntarily felt a chilling sensation in their hearts, as if they were standing beside a bottomless abyss.

"Gongdao, stop messing around," a blue-haired elder said sternly.

With a piercing gaze, he absorbed the character into his eyes.

This was Gan Jingda, the second elder of the Severed Immortal Tower and the host of this meeting.

After stopping Chi Gongdao's mischief, Gan Jingda stated solemnly, "However, your point is not without merit. In fact, we have already analyzed this privately."

"This anomaly is different from the previous surge of stellar force. It is likely that the root of the anomaly originates from the Star Sea itself."

At this statement, the entire venue fell silent.

The cultivators pondered the deeper meaning of these words.

None of them were fools. They were well aware that their current source of power came from the residual True Immortal power within the Star Sea.

But for the entire Star Sea, this True Immortal power was like an alien object, an anomaly that needed to be purged.

From the current trend, there seemed to be no possibility of reconciliation between the two.

What would be the potential outcome of the impending anomaly?

Loss of control of tribulation forces? For the Severed Immortal Boat, which was already living precariously, this might not be a good thing. Even if True Immortal power became more abundant in the future, the corresponding crises would inevitably increase.

This was the price of mortals pursuing True Immortal power.

And if the Star Sea gained the upper hand, the future prospects for the Severed Immortal Boat would be even more grim.

They, the remnants belonging to the True Immortal power, would experience a significant reduction in strength after losing their former tools.

Unless, they were willing to switch allegiance and return to the path of cultivation through enlightenment.

But...

A subtle atmosphere permeated the room.

Having tasted the power to command True Immortal power with a mere flick of their wrist, who could still be content with slow, step-by-step cultivation?

Ai Tianjue cleared his throat, breaking the silence. "Everything now is speculation, with no substantive evidence."

"The Severed Immortal Boat has weathered countless tribulations throughout history. I believe we will overcome this anomaly as well."

The cultivators responded with applause.

"However, given the significance of this anomaly, we have decided that starting today, the Immortal Boat will enter a state of emergency preparedness."

"Be ready to enter wartime status at any time," Gan Jingda announced the purpose of the meeting.

Although no one voiced any objections, the solemn expressions on their faces were evident.

At this moment, Li Fan suddenly spoke, drawing everyone's attention.

"With the anomaly occurring, will the suction force in the Star Sea also be affected?"

"I once heard that on the other side of the Star Sea, there is the Xuanhuang Realm. Compared to our Immortal Boat, that realm, which is still relatively intact, is far richer in resources. Previously, we considered the distance too great, and with the influence of the Star Sea's suction force, the Immortal Boat's journey would not be worth the effort. Now..."

As Li Fan spoke, everyone's eyes lit up.

Gan Jingda and Ai Tianjue exchanged glances, as if discussing something.

Then, amidst the expectant gazes of the crowd, he said, "Regarding the feasibility of this matter, the Elder Council will conduct a specific assessment after research."

"If it is feasible..."

"Perhaps our Immortal Boat can find a place to settle in the distant Star Sea."

Chapter 1288: Immortal Artifacts Connect Two Realms (7K)

The atmosphere of the meeting reached its zenith with the announcement of Elder Gan Jingda's decision. A pristine, resource-rich cultivation world, a realm previously existing only in the fantasies of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants, now seemed within reach. How could this not stir excitement?

Before this meeting, the vast majority of cultivators aboard the Profound Immortal Boat knew of the Xuanhuang Realm only through the captured flying boat that originated from it. After the meeting, however, they began frantically delving into any and all information related to the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Profound Immortal Boat, with its long heritage, had survived its tragic division into two, and its legacy remained unbroken.

Ten days after the council concluded, following the combined efforts of the Immortal Severing Tower, the Immortal Pivot Department, the Academy of Proving the Dao, and the great families of the Immortal Boat, a detailed report on the Xuanhuang Realm was compiled. The content provided by the Immortal Severing Tower formed the vast majority of this report, derived from the confessions of the captured Dao Integration cultivator, Blue Feather. The Immortal Pivot Department and other organizations contributed information from records left behind during the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat's several visits to the Xuanhuang Realm before the Star Sea Tribulation descended.

During a small-scale meeting of the Profound Immortal Boat's high-ranking officials, this report on the Xuanhuang Realm was distributed. Although Li Fan's status was insufficient to attend, he was present as a disciple of Ai Tianjue.

"We cannot yet determine the full extent of the Star Sea Anomaly in three years. Therefore, whether we can truly campaign to the Xuanhuang Realm requires further observation. However, this does not prevent us from making preparations," announced Lu Yuzhi, a well-mannered man and one of the six Dao Attained cultivators from the Immortal Severing Tower, as he summarized the findings for the assembled officials.

"Allow me to elaborate…" Lu Yuzhi continued. "Our Profound Merchant Immortal Boat visited the Xuanhuang Realm three times in ancient times. One visit was a formal occasion, met with a warm reception. The other two were clandestine visits for resource gathering. At that time, the Xuanhuang Realm possessed two particularly valuable special products, considered priceless even throughout the entire Star Sea: one was the Fruit of If Wood, and the other was the Immortal Realm Gifted Artifact."

"The Fruit of If Wood contains the most primal life laws of the Xuanhuang Realm. Cultivators who consume it can significantly extend their lifespan."

Lu Yuzhi paused, and Li Fan detected a slight tremor in his voice. "As for the Immortal Realm Gifted Artifacts... according to records, the Xuanhuang Realm was one of the cultivation realms with the most frequent contact with the Immortal Realm in ancient times. Consequently, a considerable number of Immortal Artifacts were bestowed and remained there. Over time, some of these Immortal Artifacts gradually became ownerless. There were even cultivators in the Star Sea who specifically sought information about these lost Immortal Artifacts from the Xuanhuang Realm, attempting to gain immense profits."

"Though the chances of success were infinitesimally small, it did happen a few times. Our Profound Immortal Boat's two clandestine visits were actually to escort those who succeeded."

Lu Yuzhi's words immediately caused a stir among the attendees. Even among the high-ranking officials of the Immortal Boat, some had never heard of such secrets.

"The two Immortal Artifacts we collected from the Xuanhuang Realm, one was resold before the Star Sea Tribulation descended. The other, during the factional split of the Immortal Boat that year, fell into the hands of the Merchant Immortal Boat," Lu Yuzhi said with evident regret.

The attendees' breathing hitched, and their faces filled with indignant expressions. Elder Gan Jingda of the Immortal Severing Tower coughed lightly, suppressing the murmurs, and gestured for Lu Yuzhi to continue.

"Although the Immortal Artifacts that flowed out of the Xuanhuang Realm are no longer in our possession, we still have a Fruit of If Wood remaining within our Immortal Boat."

After seeking approval, Lu Yuzhi signaled a representative from the Immortal Pivot Department, who then performed several hand seals. Bathed in radiant light, a crystal-clear, jade-like circular fruit appeared before their eyes. Even under several layers of restrictive seals, the cultivators present could feel the immense vitality emanating from this Fruit of If Wood. For the cultivators of the resource-scarce Immortal Boat, this was an immense temptation. Even the high-ranking officials present had never personally experienced such a treasure. Most stared intently at the Fruit of If Wood, swallowing their saliva.

Li Fan also observed it closely. "A familiar aura," he thought. "It truly originates from If Wood. However, the vibrant life force emanating from the fruit is not something produced by If Wood today. It seems the wound If Wood sustained back then was very severe."

"And..." Li Fan's heart stirred as he noticed strands of life force seemingly emanating from the Fruit of If Wood, disappearing into thin air, or rather, flowing into the void.

Lu Yuzhi stated gravely, "Everyone should understand that the life force of this Fruit of If Wood has been constantly dissipating for ten thousand years. Even though the successive generations of our Immortal Boat have employed numerous secret arts to significantly slow down the rate of dissipation, we cannot ultimately stop this process."

Someone in the hall exclaimed, "Ten thousand years of dissipating life force, and yet it still contains such potent vitality. It's hard to imagine what the original Fruit of If Wood looked like."

"No wonder they say it's a treasure worth a fortune throughout the entire Star Sea."

"Hmm, strange. Such a treasure, and the elders of the Immortal Pivot Department could resist the temptation and not devour it directly?" Amidst the whispers, someone grasped a crucial point from Lu Yuzhi's introduction of the Fruit of If Wood.

"Brother Lu, are you implying that the dissipated life force from this Fruit of If Wood is returning to the Xuanhuang Realm?"

Upon hearing this, the hall fell silent. The eyes that now looked at the Fruit of If Wood, in addition to greed and longing, now held a different kind of meaning.

Lu Yuzhi nodded. "Precisely! The Star Sea is vast and boundless. Even the Azure Nether Blue Feather we captured cannot remember the path back. But through this Fruit of If Wood, we can accurately pinpoint the Xuanhuang Realm's location amidst the vast sea of stars!"

After a moment of silence, heated discussion erupted once more.

"Does the Xuanhuang Realm still possess Fruits of If Wood? If we each had one, the experience would be beyond imagination..."

"No wonder those fellows from the Immortal Pivot Department didn't consume it. While the treasure is good, its origin force is entangled with the primal force of another cultivation realm. It would be fine for other cultivators, but for those in positions of power within the Immortal Boat, it's absolutely forbidden unless they're willing to abandon their current status."

"Wait, is it such a coincidence? And the way the fruit's life force drifts towards its original world seems too deliberate. Could it be that this fruit is actually bait, designed to lure beings in the Star Sea to hunt them?"

...

The crowd debated endlessly, and Lu Yuzhi, as the facilitator, did not intervene. Instead, he closed his eyes in contemplation. Only when the hall quieted down again did Lu Yuzhi resume speaking.

"From the memories of Azure Nether Blue Feather, we've ruled out the possibility of this being a trap. Even if there was a conspiracy surrounding the Fruit of If Wood in ancient times, we need not worry about it in the current Xuanhuang Realm. Although the Xuanhuang Realm survived the Star Sea Tribulation, it has also undergone unimaginable drastic changes."

"The Xuanhuang Realm is currently under the joint rule of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council..." Lu Yuzhi proceeded to detail the information about the Xuanhuang Realm to everyone.

"That's not right. Why is the Xuanhuang Realm so much larger than what our Profound Immortal Boat's records indicate?"

"Our initial assessment is that the survivors of the Star Sea have joined forces to resist the pull of the Immortal Ruins. The so-called Xuanhuang Realm, in my opinion, would be more aptly named the 'Land of Survivors of All Realms.'"

"In that case, the Xuanhuang Realm must surely have hidden experts. Far more than just the openly known Dharma-Preachers and the five Longevity Heavenly Venerates."

"To defy the principles of heaven and earth to achieve Longevity... it's indeed intriguing. Binding oneself to a world allows for a lifespan unattainable by ordinary cultivators, and one can even synchronize their strength with the world's prosperity. It's a pity that once outside the world, one's power is greatly weakened, and upon the world's destruction, one perishes with it."

The officials solemnly reviewed the Xuanhuang Realm's data.

"Everyone, don't forget that the Xuanhuang Realm contains many Immortal Realm Gifted Artifacts. The Myriad Immortals Alliance's Heavenly Profound Mirror is clearly one of them. Are there other Immortal Artifacts within the Myriad Immortals Alliance? If we embark on this expedition, we must take this factor into account. I believe everyone understands how powerful a True Immortal can be. Can we truly win so easily?"

"In my opinion, there's no need for fighting. According to Blue Feather's memories, the resources of the Xuanhuang Realm are currently quite abundant. Our Immortal Boat is, at most, equivalent to less than half a province of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. We could adopt a trading approach to acquire what we need."

"Indeed, even if we can't occupy the Xuanhuang Realm, investigating the so-called Immortal Ruins would be highly beneficial to us. Such potent True Immortal power... perhaps we might find complete True Immortal Scripts there!"

"Alas, I urge everyone to be more cautious. We covet the Xuanhuang Realm's various resources, but to what extent does the Xuanhuang Realm desperately wish to escape the shackles of the Immortal Ruins? To them, our Profound Immortal Boat is merely a piece of fat meat."

...

Whether to embark on an expedition to the Xuanhuang Realm was a decision that could fundamentally alter the fate of the Immortal Boat. A final resolution was impossible in such a short time. Due to historical precedent, everyone present unanimously refrained from proposing that a portion of their forces be sent as a probing mission. The Profound Immortal Boat, as a whole, had to advance or retreat together, having endured enough to no longer withstand a second division.

The council decided to reconvene in thirty days to further deliberate and make a final decision.

After everyone dispersed, only nine cultivators remained: four from the Immortal Severing Tower, three from the Immortal Pivot Department, one from the Academy of Proving the Dao, and one from the Immortal Boat's Star Forging Workshop. Li Fan, as a personal disciple, was not qualified to be among them and waited outside.

Gan Jingda lightly gestured with his finger, and an image immediately appeared for everyone to see. A beam of sword light sliced through the sky. Sixteen characters, luminous upon the celestial canvas: "Beyond the Star Sea, beneath the The Great Barrier, the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat crosses tribulations."

Gan Jingda spoke slowly, "What do you all think?"

"This method of communication... is it 'Boundless'?" Nangong Lie of the Academy of Proving the Dao asked with a grave expression.

"Has a traitor appeared on the Immortal Boat?"

"Not necessarily. It could also be those who defected back then, wishing to divert trouble and reap benefits?"

"Regardless, in the face of absolute strength, all schemes and tricks are but illusions. The only thing to consider is whether it is worthwhile."

...

The few individuals conversed, discussing the future of the Profound Immortal Boat. Outside the meeting space, Li Fan did not leave immediately, awaiting his master. He looked down at the buildings scattered across the Immortal Boat's divine tree, his thoughts focused on the Fruit of If Wood that had appeared once during the meeting.

"The life force of the Fruit of If Wood does indeed dissipate towards the Xuanhuang Realm, but not through ordinary means. It involves the very fabric of the Star Sea," Li Fan mused. "To rely on its life force to pinpoint the Xuanhuang Realm's location... is simply impossible. They are lying. They must be using another method."

Several possibilities flashed through Li Fan's mind, but he had not yet accessed the core inner circle of the Immortal Boat. He could not determine the correct answer. Just as he was pondering, a message interrupted his thoughts.

"Brother Zhao, hurry over!" It was a telepathic message from Wang Hai, also a disciple of Ai Tianjue. Under normal circumstances, Wang Hai rarely contacted Li Fan proactively. His urgent tone now suggested a matter of great importance. Li Fan decided not to wait for Ai Tianjue and went directly to Wang Hai's residence.

"Brother Zhao, take a look at this. This report from the Immortal Boat has a major flaw."

Wang Hai had not attended the meeting but had already obtained the Azure Nether report jointly compiled by several factions of the Immortal Boat. Li Fan narrowed his eyes as he looked at the ancient-looking jade slip in Wang Hai's hand. The content recorded within surprised Li Fan.

"...Thus, the Profound Immortal Boat has reached its most critical juncture. To solve the survival problem of the Immortal Boat's cultivators at that time, the last remaining Immortal Artifact on the Immortal Boat was finally utilized. The Seed of Life Transformation."

"As a plain, unremarkable black seed was planted, a divine tree took root and sprouted on the shattered body of the Immortal Boat. It was precisely with the divine tree's reinforcement that the severed Immortal Boat gradually stabilized. As the saying goes, every gain has a cost, and every outcome is predetermined. Who would have thought that this Immortal Artifact from the Xuanhuang Realm, assessed as having no trading value back then, would ultimately become the Immortal Boat's lifeline..."

Li Fan finished reading the jade slip, which contained a record of the Immortal Boat's history after its division and personal reflections.

"Where did this come from?" Li Fan asked, slightly stunned.

"Where did it come from? Of course, it's from my family's ancestral collection!" Wang Hai replied indignantly, finding Li Fan's question inexplicable. "I read all the jade slip collections in my home when I was a child, so I remember this passage. The Immortal Boat's divine tree came from the Xuanhuang Realm, yet this report states the Immortal Boat has no surviving Immortal Artifacts..."

Seeing Li Fan's peculiar expression, Wang Hai quickly explained, "I know there must be something fishy about this, so I haven't publicized it yet. Isn't that why I invited you here? I just wanted to see if pointing out this error would count as 'Error Correction' merit. If not, then I'll just pretend I never mentioned it."

The so-called "Error Correction" merit was one of the most significant merits that cultivators of the Profound Immortal Boat could accumulate. During their cultivation and study, if they discovered and pointed out errors in the Immortal Boat's inherited texts, or proposed suggestions for improvement, they would receive extremely generous rewards. For countless years, the Immortal Boat had not stagnated. It was through the wisdom of generations of cultivators that they had survived in the Star Sea to this day.

Li Fan returned the jade slip and replied directly, "In my opinion, this is not an error, but rather the Immortal Boat actively concealing the connection between its divine tree and the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Why? There's no need for that..." Wang Hai was astonished. Li Fan showed him the sixteen characters from Blue Feather's memory.

"Ah, I remember now." Wang Hai mused, "This is why the Myriad Immortals Alliance sent a flying boat to the far reaches of the Star Sea."

Li Fan whispered, "This is the communication method of 'Boundless Unity,' a secret art of the Immortal Boat." Wang Hai was greatly alarmed and was about to say more, but Li Fan stopped him.

"The Immortal Boat's divine tree originated from the Xuanhuang Realm. Do the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm still retain the method to control it?"

"The divine tree saved the Immortal Boat, yet we are planning to conquer the cultivation realm that sent us the divine tree. Is this not repaying kindness with enmity?"

"If the truth were revealed, it would undoubtedly cause considerable apprehension among many on the Immortal Boat, making it inconvenient. It's better to conceal this matter. After all, many years have passed, and few who knew of it back then remain," Li Fan explained.

"Moreover, there might be spies from the Xuanhuang Realm within the Immortal Boat. If this secret were known to them, it would be extremely disadvantageous to our Immortal Boat," Wang Hai chimed in via telepathy, having recovered from his shock.

Li Fan nodded in agreement. "Alas, what a pity. I thought I had finally found another error," Wang Hai said with some dejection.

"You don't need to worry. The Star Sea Anomaly is about to arrive. With the gradual activation of the residual True Immortal power in the Star Sea, it will become easier for us to comprehend True Immortal Scripts," Li Fan comforted him, his expression unfathomable.

...

"The Seed of Life Transformation?" In the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan's divine sense, attached to Sun Tianci of the Sun family, searched his mind for clues related to these four words. "The name doesn't match exactly. However, its appearance is very similar to the treasure mentioned in records after the destruction of the Divine Wood Sect."

Li Fan pondered. The Divine Wood Sect was one of the ancient Immortal Sects of the Xuanhuang Realm, existing in the same era as the Desolate God Sect and the Reincarnation Sect, during the great age of cultivation before the path of immortals was severed. The Mountain Sitting Art, familiar to Li Fan, originated from this sect. Within the Divine Wood Sect was an otherworldly divine wood that, as it grew, threatened the existence of If Wood. The two clashed. Ultimately, the Divine Wood Sect was destroyed, vanishing into the long river of history. The Divine Wood Sect's defeat was not solely due to If Wood being at the peak of its life, possessing immense power, and the assistance of many other cultivators. A more critical reason was, similar to the Desolate God Sect, the Divine Wood Sect's connection to the Immortal Realm was inexplicably severed, rendering many of its techniques unusable. After its defeat, the otherworldly divine wood was utterly destroyed, leaving behind only a few treasures, which were then divided among the cultivators of various factions. Among them, a treasure shaped like a tree seed was almost identical to the Seed of Life Transformation described in the Profound Immortal Boat's records.

"No wonder there have been no further records of it in the Xuanhuang Realm since then."

"It turns out it was sold to the Profound Merchant Immortal Boat long ago."

"According to the deductions of the cultivators at that time, after this tree seed was planted, another otherworldly divine tree would be born. And at that time, If Wood was at the height of its victory. Even if it were planted, it would inevitably face retribution from If Wood. Moreover, the Xuanhuang Realm could no longer accommodate a second divine tree."

"It was considered to have no real value and was gradually overlooked by cultivators."

"If my predictions are correct, the Immortal Boat's divine tree, which took root and sprouted from the Seed of Life Transformation, should have a mystical connection with the otherworldly divine wood of the Divine Wood Sect. The otherworldly divine wood lost the battle back then, its body destroyed, its essence absorbed by If Wood..."

"The Profound Immortal Boat likely used this method to remotely lock onto the Xuanhuang Realm's location in the void."

"..."

"The Star Sea is vast, yet there are subtle connections between all things."

"Looking at it this way, the Profound Immortal Boat will almost certainly come to the Xuanhuang Realm. By then, perhaps they will encounter the Sacred Emperor and the Myriad Immortals Alliance in battle and interfere. How interesting!"

A faint smile appeared in his mind. "Since that is the case, I shall add a little fuel to the fire!"

In an endless darkness, over a hundred terrifying illusory ghosts and deities flew and howled. Below these apparitions, a disheveled woman sat with her eyes closed. Though her face was serene, one could discern the extreme resentment and hatred deep within her heart. It was Wu Ninglu, the wife of Sun Ang, whose body Li Fan's main consciousness now occupied. During the Dao Integration process, she had been sacrificed by the Sun family to achieve Sun Tianci's innate Dao Integration talent. As her soul lingered, only a wisp of her consciousness remained, saved by Li Fan. He bestowed upon her the Three Disasters Hundred Tribulations Divine Illumination Method.

"Cultivating too slowly!" "So much time has passed, and yet the Three Disasters Hundred Tribulations Divine Illumination Method has only produced three hundred and sixty-four deities..." "Such a disappointment!" "Look at how far your precious son has come!" Li Fan mocked, conjuring an image of Sun Tianci in his mind with a wave of his hand. In the image, Sun Tianci appeared to be only five or six years old. Yet, before him stood three Dao Integration cultivators, arrayed in a defensive formation.

"Please enlighten us!" Without any further pleasantries, the three Dao Integration cultivators jointly attacked Sun Tianci. The three were not weak; one of them, who had devoured the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, possessed a stealthy and dangerous dark mist. However, their attacks were all quietly deflected as they approached Sun Tianci, rendering them formless.

Li Fan explained sarcastically, "Do you know what this signifies?" "Your precious son's comprehension of the laws of heaven and earth has reached an astonishing level. The attacks of Dao Integration cultivators using the Heavenly and Earthly Essence are all easily converted by him into the most primal power of law, returning to the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth! If this continues, these three Dao Integration cultivators risk falling in their cultivation realms..." As if to prove Li Fan's words, not long after, the three Dao Integration cultivators in the image wore grim expressions and ceased their attack, cupping their hands to concede defeat to Sun Tianci. Sun Tianci, in turn, responded with a polite bow. The scene abruptly ended.

Wu Ninglu, who had remained calm, suddenly went mad. "It was mine! All of this should have been mine!" "Hate! I hate them! The Sun family, they all deserve to die!" She cursed incessantly.

Li Fan coldly stated, "Even if you curse until your soul scatters, it will have no effect on them." "It seems I made a mistake, nurturing such a failure!" Wu Ninglu slowly recovered from her madness. Although she could not see the hidden divine sense of Li Fan, it did not stop her from kowtowing and begging.

"Senior, help me! I'll pay any price! As long as the Sun family and that little bastard pay the price..." Wu Ninglu gritted her teeth.

"Pay? You?" Li Fan sneered. Faced with Li Fan's blatant mockery, the hundred demon gods condensed by Wu Ninglu trembled slightly, as if about to erupt. However, Wu Ninglu forcefully suppressed them. Wu Ninglu continued to beg, her tears like blood. Li Fan watched the demon gods, who still glared at him ferociously despite being suppressed, and smiled faintly. "You still have some fight in you." "Besides, I enjoy watching a good show. Helping you might not be a bad idea!"

Wu Ninglu's face lit up with joy. "However, you must first change that detestable appearance of yours." Li Fan's divine sense suddenly revealed a blurry figure from the shadows, one hand pressing down on Wu Ninglu's head. White smoke immediately billowed from Wu Ninglu's body, which was composed of shadows. She let out a scream and collapsed onto the ground. Her entreaties to her former benefactor, Li Fan, turned into vicious curses.

"Hahaha..." Li Fan remained unmoved, his hand never lifting. The hundred demon gods condensed by Wu Ninglu attempted to attack. But the moment they approached Li Fan's divine sense, they were absorbed into his body and vanished without a trace. Wu Ninglu's painstakingly refined hundred demon gods were instantly reduced to a mere handful, solely because they dared to attack Li Fan. Trembling, they no longer dared to approach.

Her heart's blood destroyed, her spirit ravaged, Wu Ninglu wailed but did not cease her struggles. "As expected of a remnant fueled purely by hatred..." Li Fan marveled inwardly, but accelerated his remodeling process. After an unknown period, Wu Ninglu's screams gradually subsided. Her formerly sinister and terrifying form now appeared indistinguishable from a normal person.

"With your previous ghostly appearance, you would have been purified before you even got close to your son." "To deal with him, you must target his weaknesses. No matter how monstrously talented, he is ultimately a pitiable child who grew up without a father or mother." "He deeply craves the familial affection he has always lacked. You, for now, must learn to be a qualified mother." Li Fan said with a cold smile, instilling countless images into Wu Ninglu's mind. Slowly, Wu Ninglu's facial features softened, making her look like a kind mother. But only Li Fan could see the passionate, indelible hatred still burning in the depths of her eyes.

Outside this dark space, imperceptible to Wu Ninglu, Sun Tianci asked, "Master, how was my performance just now?" Li Fan, from the depths of Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, responded sternly, "You could have done better. Were you hesitant?" Sun Tianci admitted frankly, "It was merely a sparring match. If it were a life-or-death battle, my current abilities would have reduced those three to three layers of cultivation." "Did you sense the emotions of heaven and earth?" Li Fan asked again. A hint of guilt flashed across Sun Tianci's face. "Not yet." "It's fine. The hostility of heaven and earth towards cultivators of the New Law is not something that can be reversed overnight. Continue to spar with Dao Integration cultivators in various places under the guise of practice. With your talent, you will soon begin to change heaven and earth's attitude towards you," Li Fan said indifferently.

Chapter 1289: The Great Vow Ascension Method (7K)

"But..." Sun Tianci's eyes flickered with a trace of unwillingness. "Isn't this harming others for my own benefit? I can achieve the same effect by cultivating slowly, right?"

Li Fan did not mock Sun Tianci's pedantry but explained slowly, "The Way of Heaven is to reduce the surplus and supplement the deficient. The cultivation method I impart to you is in harmony with the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm. Otherwise, how could it have such divine efficacy?"

"Cultivators sacrifice the Heavenly and Earthly Essence to achieve Dao Integration. They are indeed thieves of Heaven. Returning treasure to its rightful owner, is that good or evil?"

"From the perspective of a cultivator, your actions are naturally unforgivable wickedness; but from the perspective of the Xuanhuang Realm, you are an undeniable contributor to the world..."

Each word was delivered slowly, as if containing some profound truth of heaven and earth.

Listening to Li Fan's words, the hesitation in Sun Tianci's eyes gradually turned to resolve.

The content Li Fan revealed to Wu Ninglu through his divine sense was naturally a mixture of truth and falsehood.

Although Sun Tianci possessed exceptional talent, without the guidance of a master, how could he so easily convert the cultivation of other Dao Integration cultivators?

"Being born with Dao Integration already places him far above most cultivators in the world. Moreover, I am assisting him..."

Li Fan stared at Sun Tianci, observing the subtle, hidden aura converging on him, and thought to himself, "Soon. Once his strength grows further and his connection with the Xuanhuang Realm deepens, I can let him go to the Fallen Immortal Realm."

Li Fan's unflagging efforts in nurturing Sun Tianci were not only because he viewed him as a pawn for regulating the balance of war between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Sacred Dynasty in the future, but more importantly, to have him inherit the position of the [Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate].

When Li Fan created the Sacred Emperor's clone, he had severed all memories related to the Fallen Immortal Realm and the trials for the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate.

Thus, the Sacred Emperor had never intended to go to the Fallen Immortal Realm.

He had earned the Xuanhuang Realm's recognition purely through his own actions, which were beneficial to the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, the position of [Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate] not only required the Xuanhuang Realm's recognition but more importantly, the succession ceremony.

This was a subtle control mechanism passed down from the time the Xuanhuang Realm was first created, independent of the will of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao.

Even though the lineage had been severed for now, it was still hidden deep within the Fallen Immortal Realm.
