To become the true Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, one could not only maximally utilize the power of the Xuanhuang Realm but also potentially inherit the memories and legacies of past Great Heavenly Venerates.

It was a matter of probing the depths.

Li Fan was not interested in becoming the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate himself, but he highly valued the secrets of the Xuanhuang Realm and any potentially surviving Immortal Artifacts.

In his sea of consciousness, the scene of the final trial in the Fallen Immortal Realm reappeared.

"Detonating nine Immortal Artifacts and extracting the immense Immortal Spiritual Power. It was a destructive force, capable of crossing the The Great Barriers."

"Four Immortal Artifacts, including the [Great Sun Golden Bell], still remained. Those were indeed [Immortal Artifacts] passed down from ancient times."

Having glimpsed three parts of the [Profound Origin Spirit Array] and successfully replicating some of its power, Li Fan knew clearly how powerful the True Immortal realm truly was. This applied to Immortal Artifacts as much as to Immortal Formations.

These were world-altering killing weapons, and even capital for him to explore beyond the The Great Barriers in the future.

"Mr. Bai might have been concerned about the safety of the Xuanhuang Realm and did not use the power of these Immortal Artifacts to fight against the Dharma-Preachers. But I do not mind..."

"Of course, the prerequisite is to gain the recognition of the Immortal Artifacts."

"The Immortal Artifacts left by the Great Heavenly Venerates should have certain restrictions."

...

Various thoughts flashed through Li Fan's mind. He looked again at Sun Tianci, who had fallen into a state of enlightenment while listening to Li Fan's teachings. "Less than three years left, that should be enough."

Sun Tianci's cultivation did not last long before it was interrupted by an unforeseen event.

One day, a panicked Sun family servant rushed in to report.

"The Sun family's exit is blocked? Someone is specifically calling for a challenge against me?"

Startled awake, Sun Tianci appeared somewhat dazed.

The Sun family servant replied with a sorrowful face, "Yes, Young Master. Those in the family who tried to force their way out were all beaten up and thrown back by the challenger. This has been going on for more than ten days. Young Master's father has urgent matters and cannot spare the time. We had no choice but to disturb your cultivation."

Sun Tianci looked at the servant's extremely frightened appearance and could not help but comfort him, "It's alright, take me to see."

For Sun Tianci, enlightenment and cultivation were as simple as eating and drinking. If it was interrupted occasionally, he could resume it next time. There was no cause for anger.

Arriving outside the Sun family's cave dwelling, Sun Tianci saw the person blocking the entrance. It was a child of roughly his own age, appearing to be five or six years old.

He wore purple clothes, his gaze pure... or perhaps a little vacant.

"You... let's fight," the child pointed at Sun Tianci and said concisely.

Sun Tianci immediately shook his head, "No."

Hearing his request rejected, the child's eyes narrowed instantly.

Sun Tianci kindly reminded him, "You are only at the Nascent Soul realm, you are no match for me. I will not bully the young."

He spoke with genuine sincerity, and the murderous aura emanating from the child across him slowly dissipated.

Sun Tianci overheard the hushed whispers of the Sun family members, "Tianci, don't be careless. We investigated, this little fellow is not simple. He is obsessed with martial arts and terrifyingly strong. Although he is only at the Nascent Soul realm, he can defeat cultivators at the Soul Transformation realm with a gesture..."

"Yes, this person's origins are mysterious, and the Myriad Immortals Alliance seems to ignore him. People call him the [Martial Fanatic Child]."

Sun Tianci nodded at his family members, indicating he had heard them. He then looked at the Martial Fanatic Child and said seriously, "Even though the Nascent Soul realm can defeat the Soul Transformation realm, the difference between Soul Transformation and Dao Integration is like a chasm. You have no chance of winning."

"I fear I might injure you if I use too much force."

The Martial Fanatic Child shook his head, disagreeing with Sun Tianci's assessment. "Whether one wins or loses in a fight has nothing to do with the realm."

"Fight!"

"I'm not afraid of death!"

Sun Tianci looked at the intense fighting spirit in the child's eyes and felt a sense of helplessness. Knowing that this battle was unavoidable, he led him to the Sun family's martial arts arena.

Although the Sun family was a rising aristocratic family and their cave dwelling appeared unremarkable on the outside, it was actually a universe within. Its many functional buildings were crafted to be no less inferior than those of the millennia-old families in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

For instance, this martial arts arena was built upon the remains of an ancient cultivator of Longevity who had fallen and died, collected at great expense. It could easily withstand the attacks of Dao Integration cultivators.

Inside the arena, Sun Tianci and the Martial Fanatic Child, two children, stood facing each other with solemn expressions. The onlookers were all extremely tense. Sun Tianci was currently the most precious existence in the Sun family. Although his realm crushed his opponent, if he sustained any injury, all the Sun family members present who failed to stop the spar would face severe punishment.

"Please!" The Martial Fanatic Child let out a low cry. The next moment, a silver spear streaked across the sky, stopping just before Sun Tianci's face.

"Such speed!" Sun Tianci was somewhat surprised, but that was all. The attack from a Nascent Soul cultivator could not even shake his defenses. The spear dissolved like ice melting in water, vanishing into nothingness.

"Hmm?" However, after neutralizing the opponent's attack, Sun Tianci felt a surge of astonishment. While he was momentarily stunned, the space before him rippled like water. Then, the silver spear, like a flying fish leaping from the sea, reappeared and thrust directly at Sun Tianci's body.

"Martial!" the Martial Fanatic Child roared simultaneously. Silver light flowed over the spear. In an instant, seventeen other weapons materialized, surrounding Sun Tianci. Broadswords, spears, swords, halberds... It was as if eighteen different cultivators wielded them, launching different techniques simultaneously. They all chopped down.

Boom! Sun Tianci's body was completely engulfed by a violent explosion of silver light.

"Young Master!"

"Tianci!" The Sun family members present cried out in alarm. If the martial arts arena had not been sealed, they would have rushed in to save him.

"No need to panic, this level of commotion cannot harm Ci'er," Sun Luyuan's voice rang out. The crowd instantly breathed a sigh of relief. Sun Luyuan, who had arrived late after hearing that the Sun family's prodigy was sparring, stared intently at the battle unfolding in the arena.

The Martial Fanatic Child also understood that his attack would not be effective in one move. The moment the silver light enveloped Sun Tianci, he had already closed the distance, launching a continuous barrage of attacks. There were weapons of a warrior to injure, materialized treasures of a cultivator, unexpected punches and kicks, and even the power of rare phenomena representing Dao Integration cultivators... The arena rumbled and trembled incessantly, appearing precarious, as if its defenses might shatter at any moment. Sun Luyuan's expression was grave as he cast spells to reinforce the defenses. Sun Tianci, hailed as the most talented person of the Myriad Immortals Alliance in a century, could only parry defensively, appearing quite flustered.

In truth, no one present could comprehend Sun Tianci's current shock. He discovered that the profound technique bestowed by his master, which could dissolve an opponent's attack and return it to heaven and earth, was rendered ineffective against this Martial Fanatic Child!

"How can this be? Could it be because his realm is too low? A technique meant for Dao Integration cultivators is not working on him?"

He had been cultivating since birth. Although he had engaged in many battles in his master's illusions and against Dao Integration cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, this was the first time his trump card had completely failed. The young Sun Tianci was momentarily panicked. But he was extraordinary after all. Moreover, although the Martial Fanatic Child's attacks were fierce, they were still two major realms below Sun Tianci. While enduring the onslaught, Sun Tianci gradually adapted to his opponent's attacks and began to discern the underlying pattern.

"That's not right! The technique hasn't failed! Just like with the Dao Integration cultivators before, when I dissolved the Martial Fanatic Child's moves after he completed them, his aura still decreased for a short period. But... the energy he lost was quickly replenished from heaven and earth?!"

Upon realizing this, Sun Tianci's shock deepened. It was important to note that his technique was not as simple as consuming Spirit Qi. It stripped away the cultivator's origin and Dao foundation, dissipating them back into the Xuanhuang Realm and the heavens. Yet, the Martial Fanatic Child's performance in the arena was as if he was continuously absorbing the origin power from the Xuanhuang Realm and the heavens while fighting him.

"How is this possible?"

"This completely violates the new method created by the Heavenly Venerate?!"

It was no wonder Sun Tianci was so shocked. The Martial Fanatic Child's actions were akin to him constantly devouring the Azure Nether Grotto-heaven, the changes of birth, the Heavenly and Earthly Essence... And yet, the Xuanhuang Realm seemed not to display the slightest malice or retaliate! This was an occurrence that Sun Tianci's comprehension deemed impossible.

Due to this momentary distraction caused by deciphering the profound mechanism, Sun Tianci was caught off guard. The Martial Fanatic Child seized the opportunity, and his technique pierced through Sun Tianci's defenses, striking him directly. Spitting out a mouthful of blood, Sun Tianci's eyes showed seriousness. A white light, like flowing light, appeared on his body, instantly repelling the Martial Fanatic Child's technique. This was Sun Tianci's Heavenly and Earthly Essence, the White Silk. However, this White Silk, after being trained by Li Fan and Sun Tianci's years of cultivation, was qualitatively different from its initial state.

"To actually force me to this extent..."

"Master was right, there are countless geniuses in this world, and I am nothing special."

Sun Tianci's emotions gradually calmed. The white light enveloped him, neutralizing each of the Martial Fanatic Child's attacks one by one.

"Without dwelling on the cause, follow the method and strike!" The words of his master flashed in Sun Tianci's mind.

"If I can't understand why this Martial Fanatic Child can constantly draw upon the origin of the Xuanhuang Realm, then I won't concern myself with it!"

"Strike at his root, and directly sever his connection with the Xuanhuang Realm!"

A brilliant light flashed in Sun Tianci's eyes. The illusory White Silk, like a vortex, rapidly swirled, enveloping his body. Within the white light vortex, he floated into the air. He pointed one finger at the sky and the other at the Martial Fanatic Child. He uttered a low command.

The Martial Fanatic Child's fluid attack, which had been continuous, was forced to pause slightly. Then, he abruptly ceased his offensive, looking at Sun Tianci in the air with surprise. His two fingers, like a pair of scissors, temporarily severed his connection to heaven and earth. An unprecedented sense of weakness surged through him. In Sun Tianci's eyes, the Martial Fanatic Child's form seemed to blur slightly the moment his connection was severed!

"This is..."

"The Heavenly and Earthly Essence, born into human form?" Sun Tianci vaguely sensed a glimmer of understanding in his mind. His finger's movement did not stop. He had used his method of communicating with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao to completely occupy the Heavenly Dao's perception within this space. This momentarily excluded the Martial Fanatic Child. It was bound to be unsustainable. "Suppress!" Sun Tianci, suspended high in the air, pressed down his finger pointing at the Martial Fanatic Child. Waves of white silk light surged into it, like a mighty river converging. A colossal finger phantom materialized, resembling a sky-reaching mountain, pressing down from above. The space around the Martial Fanatic Child was sealed by this tremendous power, rendering him unable to move. As the suppressing finger descended, a deafening roar accompanied by the whistling sound of space being torn apart echoed throughout the martial arts arena. Sun Tianci's expression was neither joyful nor sorrowful. The Martial Fanatic Child beneath the suppressing finger, however, maintained an equally impassive expression. There was no fear in his eyes, but rather a look of contemplation. As the suppressing finger was about to strike, he mimicked Sun Tianci's action and pointed a finger at the sky. His purple robe transformed into majestic purple qi, flowing into it. Compared to Sun Tianci's 'Suppress' finger technique, the momentum appeared much smaller, yet it seemed more condensed and sacred. The Martial Fanatic Child's face showed the joy of enlightenment and the seriousness of executing a supreme technique. One purple, one white; one rising from the earth, the other descending from the sky. They collided violently near the ground. Boom! Blinding light immediately engulfed everything.

"Not good!" Sun Luyuan's face changed slightly. With a decisive wave of his sleeve, he swept up the Sun family members who were watching and instantly retreated. He also did not forget to activate the protective formations around the martial arts arena. It proved that Sun Luyuan's choice was wise. The impact of the colliding finger techniques swallowed the entire martial arts arena. Then, it continued to spread outwards. The meticulously arranged protective formations of the Sun family were like paper in the face of this terrifying power, shattering one after another. The vast force swept through, engulfing half of the Sun family's cave dwelling. Two Dao Integration cultivators of the Sun family simultaneously cast spells, finally restraining it. The residual power of the explosion slowly subsided. Looking at the devastated Sun family cave dwelling, Sun Luyuan's face twitched. Fortunately, Sun Tianci's strong aura brought him some peace of mind. After the commotion subsided, he arrived at the original site of the martial arts arena, which was now nothing but empty space. The Martial Fanatic Child had vanished. Sun Tianci, the Sun family's prodigy, stood motionless, as if contemplating something with his eyes closed. Strictly ordering no one to disturb him, Sun Luyuan personally guarded him. Looking at the ruins of the battle that had taken place around them, Sun Luyuan suddenly felt a sense of powerlessness. "Dao Integration cultivators, yet the gap is so vast." "Even more terrifying is that Ci'er is only five years old. His future..." A word that had never occurred to him before suddenly appeared in Sun Luyuan's mind. "How many years has it been since the Xuanhuang Realm saw another Longevity Heavenly Venerate?" "With Ci'er's talent, it's not impossible, not impossible at all!" "Especially with the great changes coming soon. A time when heroes emerge and the world is in turmoil..." Sun Luyuan, a cultivator who had been at the Dao Integration realm for over five hundred years, found his hands trembling uncontrollably. He could only close his eyes tightly, fearing that his thoughts might be perceived by others. At this moment, within Sun Tianci's consciousness, the child at the Dao Integration realm was filled with self-reproach. "I didn't intend to kill him." "But once the technique was cast, he also counterattacked with the 'Suppress' finger technique..." "I really couldn't control it." Sun Tianci was filled with remorse when Li Fan's cold reprimand interrupted him, "Fool! How could such an existence be easily killed by you?" "Rest assured. Even if your entire Sun family were annihilated, he would not disappear." Not dwelling on his master's venomous words, and upon hearing that the Martial Fanatic Child had not perished, Sun Tianci's regret was replaced by a touch of surprise. "Master, who exactly is that Martial Fanatic Child?" "Is he perhaps the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, born into human form?" Sun Tianci asked, filled with curiosity. Li Fan snorted, "You do have some discernment." Li Fan actually had more to say. "Chapter Qianmo's reincarnation method indeed has its merits." "The body of a grand vow to eliminate demons was integrated into the fundamental laws of the Xuanhuang Realm." "And this body of the Martial Fanatic Child..." In previous reincarnations, Li Fan had seen the Martial Fanatic Child, but he had lacked the perspective to fathom its mysteries. However, with the significant gains in this life, his connection with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao had grown closer, and he had even experienced several rounds of enlightenment in the star sea. This had granted him sufficient ability to discern the true nature of Chapter Qianmo's reincarnated body. "Chapter Qianmo made three grand vows. First, to eradicate all demons in the world. Second, to replace the Ten Great Immortal Sects. Third, to collect all cultivation techniques and share them with cultivators worldwide." "To eradicate all demons can be called [Execution]." "In the cultivation world, the strong are respected. Replacing the Ten Great Immortal Sects can be called [Martial]." "To share cultivation techniques so that all people in the world can cultivate can be called [Culture]." "Ancient sages achieved the Dao and transformed the world, ascended to the heavens in broad daylight, and benefited future generations. This is an ancient, supreme method that can lead to True Immortality..." A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes. "Even if the hope of completing each vow is extremely slim, the reincarnated body can, like my simulations, infinitely amplify the probability of success." "If the Immortal Path still existed, Chapter Qianmo might indeed be able to achieve the three grand vows through this method and attain the True Immortal realm." "It's a pity..." Li Fan shook his head slightly. "As time passes, the Immortal Path is severed, and the world is on the brink of destruction. This method..." "It is not the fault of the technique, but the change in the Great Dao!" "The techniques that could lead to True Immortality in the past can now, at best, only create ripples within a single realm," Li Fan mused with newfound understanding. "But compared to the cultivators of the same era who have long since turned to dust, this method of Senior Brother Chapter is infinitely superior. Indeed, if the Xuanhuang Realm can survive in the future, and the Immortal Path is reopened..." "Chapter Qianmo might truly be able to ascend to the True Immortal realm." Li Fan could not help but fantasize about the future. "Although the process may be a bit long, if one can achieve True Immortality, then none of it will matter." After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan's thoughts returned to the present. "The Xuanhuang Realm has become the last surviving place in the entire star sea. It is already difficult for Chapter Qianmo's grand vow ascension method to proceed to the second step. If Emperor Yi had not voluntarily led the leaders away, he would have spent thousands of years on this step." "And now, this second step..." Li Fan had witnessed the battle between Chapter Qianmo's reincarnated body and Sun Tianci from beginning to end. Naturally, he had also seen the Martial Fanatic Child's manifestation, as if born from the Heavenly and Earthly Essence. "This grand vow ascension method relies entirely on the feedback power after the world's sublimation..." "It is embodied by the world, which is the opposite of the current Heavenly Venerate's new method." "Both can be seen as parasites. The new method only knows how to devour and seize, while this grand vow ascension method benefits the world." "It's no wonder the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao is willing to support it unconditionally. After all, there are hardly any who are willing to stand on the side of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao in this world." "It is a marvelous method. But without the prospect of ascension, it is ultimately not worth mentioning." "At the very least, it is far inferior to directly achieving the [Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate]." ... While Li Fan's thoughts churned, Sun Tianci, who had been relieved to learn that the Martial Fanatic Child was not dead, began to sort out the gains from the battle. This was the first time he had encountered an opponent of similar age in a real combat situation, and a sense of excitement inevitably arose in his heart. "I didn't expect the 'Suppress' finger technique imparted by Master to be so powerful." "I've only grasped less than a third of it. If I could fully unleash it..." Sun Tianci traced shapes in the air with his fingers, immersed in the profound and mysterious forms of the talismans. This 'Suppress' finger technique was naturally not the true [True Immortal Script]. It was merely a remnant character that Li Fan had comprehended through his research on the Mystic Immortal Boat. Yet, even this imperfect existence was an unimaginably terrifying divine ability for cultivators. As the saying goes, a stone from another mountain can polish the jade. Li Fan imparted the half-comprehended ['Suppress' finger technique] to Sun Tianci to see what this Azure Nether prodigy could glean from it. He could then use it as a reference. ... Although the details of the battle between the Martial Fanatic Child and Sun Tianci were ordered to be kept secret by Sun Luyuan, the tragic state of the Sun family's cave dwelling after the battle could not be hidden from the world. Thus, the fame of the Sun family's prodigy grew even louder. Some combative Dao Integration cultivators even actively sought them out, requesting sparring matches. Sun Tianci, of course, was eager to oblige and never refused. Through continuous battles, his practical combat abilities rapidly improved. After accumulating enough power from stripping away a portion of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence from the bodies of thirty Dao Integration cultivators and returning it to the Xuanhuang Realm, the accumulated strength surpassed that of a complete Dao Integration cultivator. Quantity had finally transformed into quality. One day, Sun Tianci stood stunned, gazing up at the sky. He stood motionless, tears flowing from his eyes. "Azure Nether..." he murmured softly, his expression filled with profound sadness. A gentle breeze seemed to pass through him, constantly swirling. An aura familiar to Li Fan quietly descended upon Sun Tianci. "Has the condition finally been met?" "With the Sacred Emperor as a supporter, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's requirements have become much higher." "Back then, simply slaughtering a few cultivators of the New Law could achieve similar results." Li Fan, observing from the side, mused inwardly. "However, it is not yet time for him to accept the Great Heavenly Venerate's trial." Li Fan keenly sensed that the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's attention towards Sun Tianci was different from that towards the Sacred Emperor. Perhaps it was due to Li Fan's concealment within Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, that the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, while showing affection, also displayed a hint of vigilance and suspicion. This emotion was minuscule, and Sun Tianci himself did not notice it, still immersed in the supreme joy of interacting with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. Only Li Fan, who had personally experienced the true intimacy of the Heavenly Dao with his Sacred Emperor body, could sense this difference. "I still need to do more." "Upon reflection, perhaps that is the most efficient course of action." Li Fan did not feel angered by the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's reaction. Instead, he began to ponder countermeasures. "To take, one must first give." "Let's let you have a taste of it first." Li Fan snorted inwardly, awaiting Sun Tianci to awaken from his enlightenment. Three days later, Sun Tianci finally reported his success to Li Fan. Li Fan's words, however, made him somewhat astonished: "Master, aren't we going to spar with Dao Integration cultivators anymore?" "I feel it's very effective." "Too slow! Too slow! Master, I could be annihilated at any moment, I can't wait that long." Li Fan coldly snorted and directly poured information into Sun Tianci's mind. "This..." Sun Tianci could not help but widen his eyes. "Master, this is a serious crime in the Myriad Immortals Alliance!" "It's fine for me, but if my family is implicated..." After understanding his master's plan, Sun Tianci began to hesitate. Because his master was instructing him to go to the Myriad Immortals Alliance's [Eternal Immortal Bastion] and release the power that originally belonged to the Xuanhuang Realm from the cultivators who had been eternally suppressed there.

Chapter 1290

“Master, does the Myriad Immortals Alliance truly possess the Eternal Immortal Bastion? It sounds too incredible to be true,” Sun Tianci asked disbelief, after a long pause.

“The Myriad Immortals Alliance’s atrocities extend far beyond that,” Li Fan replied with a cold laugh.

Li Fan first learned of the Eternal Immortal Bastion in the 114th life, when the Heavenly Lock Array covered the Xuanhuang Realm with the Mystic Net. He had initially thought it was a product unique to that specific era’s Alliance. However, during his 119th life, he had impersonated the Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law King, Sun Xingwang, and used the Three Disasters Hundred Tribulations Divine Illumination Method to refine countless ideational demon gods from tens of thousands of cultivators. The Myriad Immortals Alliance's final method of dealing with these cultivators was akin to the Eternal Immortal Bastion. From the information revealed by Mo Rubin after he possessed a Doctrine Transmitter, it was confirmed that the Myriad Immortals Alliance secretly stored many cultivators to maintain the stability of the Xuanhuang Realm. Furthermore, these facilities were not confined to a single location.

Transmitting a blurry image to Sun Tianci, the young prodigy of the Sun family was instantly stunned by the cruel scene.

“Master, what should we do?” Soon after, he awoke from his shock, his voice resolute as he asked.

“Your speed in executing the Profound Nether Technique is still too slow. Even if we successfully infiltrate the Immortal Bastion, we won’t have much time for action.”

“Become faster first!”

The Profound Nether Technique was, of course, the wondrous method Li Fan had passed down, which dissolved cultivators’ cultivation and returned it to the Azure Nether world.

Li Fan’s spiritual manifestation flew out of Sun Tianci’s sea of consciousness, taking on an illusory form. His manifestation looked up at the sky and murmured, “Myriad Heavenly and Earthly Essences…”

As he softly chanted, a scene that made Sun Tianci’s scalp tingle occurred. An invisible vortex instantly appeared above Li Fan's head. A familiar aura, the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, seemed to be brewing within the vortex. As a blurry humanoid figure gradually extended its arms from within, Sun Tianci became even more certain of his guess.

“Summoning the Heavenly and Earthly Essence with a single word? Master, what is your true identity…”

As Sun Tianci stood stunned by the scene before him, Li Fan's scolding voice echoed in his ears, “What are you still waiting for? Do you really want to wait for the Heavenly and Earthly Essence to descend?”

Sun Tianci instantly came to his senses and immediately unleashed a Profound Nether Technique towards the blurry figure that was about to manifest in the vortex. It was as if the descent process was blocked. A gust of wind blew, and the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, summoned by Li Fan, returned to the heavens and earth. During this process, Sun Tianci did not feel any deepening connection between himself and the Azure Nether world. This was apparently because the Heavenly and Earthly Essence still belonged to the Azure Nether world and had not been refined and occupied by a cultivator. And because the "erroneous descent of the Heavenly and Earthly Essence" was interrupted just as it was about to be completed, the vigilance from the Azure Nether world was minimal.

Li Fan squinted, sensing the situation, and cast another Myriad Heavenly and Earthly Essences. Sun Tianci reacted quickly this time; just as the blurry figure was about to take shape, it was sent back. This repeated over a hundred times until it was on the verge of alerting the Azure Nether world. Li Fan then ceased. Sun Tianci breathed a sigh of relief, wiping the cold sweat from his pale face. The prolonged use of the Profound Nether Technique, "decomposing" hundreds of partially formed Heavenly and Earthly Essences, was a considerable burden even for him.

“Let’s move to another location and continue,” Li Fan said coldly.

Ever since defeating the Martial Fanatic Son and revealing his true combat power that day, Sun Tianci had no longer been restricted by the Sun family. Even though he was currently only a little over five years old. However, Sun Luyuan constantly warned him to prioritize safety and bestowed many magic artifacts upon him for self-defense. The special training lasted fifteen days, taking them to all four corners of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Apart from travel time, the remaining time was almost entirely spent dissolving the Heavenly and Earthly Essences. Sun Tianci’s progress was astonishing. With a slight effort, he could continuously return partially descending Heavenly and Earthly Essences to the world.

“Hmm, that’s about enough,” Li Fan said, nodding slightly as he observed Sun Tianci’s performance.

“What are you thinking about?” Li Fan asked again, seeing Sun Tianci lost in thought.

“Uh, Master, ten days ago, we were in this place. The concentration of Spirit Qi seemed lower than it is now?” Sun Tianci asked uncertainly.

Li Fan smiled, “The Spirit Qi in the world is like the ebb and flow of the tide, waxing and waning. Isn't that normal? How could it be as constant as your Immortal Dwelling, which you’ve lived in since childhood?”

Sun Tianci nodded slightly at Li Fan's explanation. However, a flicker of doubt still crossed his eyes as he surveyed their surroundings.

“This little fellow has remarkably keen observational skills.” Li Fan also sensed the abnormality in the surroundings. He even detected a familiar aura within the pervasive Spirit Qi. “Dao One Insect. It seems to be the work of the Sacred Emperor's clone. The source should be from the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven. Is it returning the Grotto-heaven to the Xuanhuang Realm to create a combat environment suitable for the Great Qi soldiers? Perhaps it can also use the insect-transformed Spirit Qi to launch a fatal blow…” The Sacred Emperor's clone's arrangements were derived from the 본尊's past explorations. With a little thought, Li Fan saw through the mystery. However, he did not expose it, merely feigning ignorance.

Returning to Sun Tianci's sea of consciousness, they proceeded towards one of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Eternal Immortal Bastions.

In Tongyan Prefecture, amidst the mountains and cliffs, within a cave…

“This place…” Sun Tianci felt something extraordinary as he looked from afar. “If it weren’t for your guidance, Master, even if I had seen this cave before, I would have subconsciously ignored it. I wouldn’t have had any desire to enter and investigate…”

“Hmph, this is the legendary favorable land that can only be entered by those with fate. This peculiar creation of the Xuanhuang Realm needs no formations to conceal it, yet it can almost prevent the prying eyes of most people. The Myriad Immortals Alliance has hidden many such concealed Grotto-heavens. They have been almost entirely divided among the Dharma-Preachers, serving as their own Immortal Dwellings,” Li Fan recalled the hidden Grotto-heaven he encountered in his 119th life when he met Mo Rubin after infiltrating the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. This place was precisely the same.

“Due to its natural characteristics, the stationed cultivators will certainly not have high vigilance. But we must still proceed with caution…” Li Fan's manifestation set up a series of formations around Sun Tianci, and then the two of them entered the cave.

After a narrow, downward passage, they arrived before a deep chasm, only one person’s waist wide. It was pitch black, plunging straight down to an unfathomable depth.

“Don't use your divine sense to probe, it will trigger an alert.” Li Fan, however, immediately saw the mechanism of the earth pit. They leaped into the deep chasm and flew downwards at high speed. It took a full ritual incense's time, as if they had pierced through the Xuanhuang Realm and arrived at the deepest part of the nine underworlds. The cramped tunnel gradually opened up. After passing through a horizontal passage, a massive cavern, shaped like an inverted cone and located extremely deep underground, suddenly appeared before Sun Tianci.

The cliff walls of the cavern were densely covered with square openings. Upon closer inspection, these openings contained amber-colored crystalline bodies. And within each of these crystal bodies, without exception, a cultivator lay in slumber. Occasionally, Alliance guards patrolled in mid-air. Sun Tianci dared not probe with his divine sense, but he roughly estimated that this underground cavern held at least over a hundred thousand cultivators. Their faces were ruddy, even with smiles appearing on their faces, completely unaware that they were falling into eternal slumber.

“According to Master, this is only a part of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Eternal Immortal Bastion…” Sun Tianci felt a chill and instinctively clenched his fists.

“Go, now it’s up to you,” Li Fan said calmly, seemingly sensing the suppressed anger in Sun Tianci’s heart. Simultaneously, he transmitted the method for breaking the formation sealing these cultivators.

“Master, what do you think would happen if we awakened all the cultivators here?” Sun Tianci suddenly asked.

“I advise you to abandon this idea. Since the Myriad Immortals Alliance dares to do this so openly, they must have taken precautions. Believe me, you will not be able to awaken them as fast as the Myriad Immortals Alliance can deal with them. You must know, the Myriad Immortals Alliance possesses the means to extract and preserve a cultivator’s Dao foundation…” Li Fan said coldly.

Sun Tianci's eyes flickered, and he eventually gave up the idea. They bypassed the patrolling cultivators and swiftly flew past the slumbering wretches, stirring up imperceptible breezes as they dissolved the Dao foundations within their bodies.

“Without their cultivation, they won’t live long in their slumber… it’s equivalent to me killing them with my own hands…” Sun Tianci’s body trembled slightly as he fled.

“Killing? Or saving? Look at their current state, isn't it worse than death? If they could clearly perceive everything around them, they would certainly beg you to release them,” Li Fan soothed.

After some more persuasion, Sun Tianci’s hesitant actions became firm again. Over five years, Li Fan had molded Sun Tianci according to his ideal image of the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, making him compassionate but not pedantic, and decisive once he made a decision. The Azure Nether Heavenly and Earthly power formed by dissolving tens of thousands of cultivators was gathered by Li Fan into a bright orb of light. When the act of merciful liberation was one-fifth complete, Li Fan spoke, “That’s enough. If we continue, I won’t be able to conceal this intense energy fluctuation.”

Sun Tianci looked at the remaining cultivators, revealing a slight regret. However, he followed his master's orders and quietly flew towards the exit.

“Master, is something amiss?” As he reached the top of the massive cavern, Sun Tianci noticed his master still gazing at a certain spot below and couldn't help but ask.

“It’s nothing, just leave,” Li Fan replied after a moment of silence.

Sun Tianci asked no further questions and sped upwards. After leaving the horrifying dungeon, Sun Tianci accepted the orb containing the Dao foundations of many cultivators and gently crushed it. Countless streams of light instantly erupted. In a daze, Sun Tianci seemed to witness scenes of the world’s oddities, the Azure Nether Grotto-heavens, and the changes of mountains and rivers. In the sky, clouds and winds changed color, and a creaking sound, like a giant grinding mill, echoed above the clouds. The entire Xuanhuang Realm shuddered momentarily. Although the tremor was minuscule, Sun Tianci still sensed it.

“The Myriad Immortals Alliance must have sent someone to investigate, let’s go!” Li Fan said. Without needing a reminder, Sun Tianci had already flown away from the scene the moment he crushed the orb. At this moment, he was immersed in the rapidly growing Heavenly Mandate of the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan, ensuring no one was tracking them, recalled the scene he had just witnessed in the subterranean cavern. Several faces flashed before his eyes. Though he didn’t know their names, Li Fan was certain he had seen them before. Not in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, but in… the territory of the Five Elders Council.

Within the Dharma Deduction space, the Dao-Melting Stone in his 본尊's sea of consciousness glowed faintly, bringing up images he had seen before. In the 119th life, the Myriad Immortals Alliance had used the immortal chosen to unleash the power hidden within the Doctrine Transmitter statues, drawing away the five Longevity Heavenly Venerates, and then launched a fierce assault on the Five Elders Council. When the Five Elders Council seemed pushed to desperation, their hidden means were finally revealed. Ancient sects that had been extinct reappeared in the world, and cultivators from the Land of Carefree Bliss, unafraid of death, fought back with various strange magic artifacts. Li Fan compared the faces of several individuals who appeared during this subjugation with the slumbering cultivators he had just seen in the subterranean cavern. They matched perfectly.

“This is interesting,” Li Fan mused, looking towards the location of the Land of Carefree Bliss belonging to the Five Elders Council. “It seems that this Land of Bliss does not only contain cultivators of the Five Elders Council. I wonder if the appearance of the slumbering cultivators in the Land of Bliss is due to cooperation between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council, or if it was a unilateral capture by the Carefree Heavenly Venerate?” “If it’s the latter, then this Heavenly Venerate's strength might be even greater than I imagined.” Li Fan couldn’t help but picture the Carefree Heavenly Venerate’s infant-like appearance. He then recalled Doctrine Transmitter Zhou, whom he encountered during the Doctrine Transmitter Council’s review in his 119th life. He had conjured a modern urban scene with neon rain and stated he had brought it back directly from his vacation in the Land of Carefree Bliss. “The possibility of cooperation between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Land of Carefree Bliss is not impossible.” “The Land of Carefree Bliss may not entirely represent the Five Elders Council; they would only intervene if the Five Elders Council faced an absolute crisis.” “The Land of Dream Bliss…” Li Fan suddenly had a question: “I wonder if these cultivators, dead in reality, can still exist in the Land of Bliss. If the Xuanhuang Realm ceases to exist, can this Land of Carefree Bliss still exist?”

While his thoughts churned, Sun Tianci had fully absorbed the gains from this experience. With Li Fan, his excellent teacher, planning everything, he was arguably the fastest to accumulate the Heavenly Mandate of the Xuanhuang Realm. He was even progressing faster than the Sacred Emperor's clone had in his past life. It was just a pity that perhaps because there was already a Chosen Emperor who could communicate with the Heavenly Dao consciousness at any time, Sun Tianci, despite clearly feeling the Azure Nether world's closeness, could not directly converse with the Heavenly Dao. He could only feel an omnipresent "convenience." Sun Tianci immediately cast spells, and with the pervasive blessings of heaven and earth, their power indeed increased significantly. However, he still felt deeply dejected.

“It’s alright, reaching this point is already sufficient,” Li Fan’s voice sounded in Sun Tianci’s ear. Sun Tianci was slightly taken aback, as his extremely mysterious master, who had never revealed his true appearance, was now showing his face. He hadn’t expected his master to be so handsome. Dressed in white, with a face of unparalleled beauty that seemed to gather all the Spirit Qi of heaven and earth, and eyes that occasionally flashed with compassion for all beings… Sun Tianci was momentarily captivated.

“Follow me.” The master and disciple descended deeper underground. After creating a secret chamber, Li Fan had Sun Tianci take out the four items he had prepared long ago: an ordinary hemp garment, a plump stalk of rice, a small and exquisite model of a house, and a lifelike miniature donkey cart. Then, Li Fan placed the four items in four corners and looked at Sun Tianci. With a benevolent smile, he said, “You can begin. Don't forget the stories I told you since the day you were born.” Sun Tianci seemed to understand, and said solemnly, “Understood, Master. I will not let down your trust.” Li Fan nodded with satisfaction and reverted to his previous blurry appearance, stepping out of the formation. Sun Tianci took a deep breath and began.

With his first step, he faced the cart and quietly recited: “May the Profound and Yellow Immortal Venerates be blessed.”

With his second step, he turned towards the house representing the dwelling place of common people and sincerely murmured: “May the Profound and Yellow Heavenly Lords be blessed.”

With his third step, looking at the plump rice stalk, he held his breath and whispered: “May the Profound and Yellow Supreme Divinity be blessed.”

With his fourth step, gazing at the hemp garment, he finally murmured: “May the Profound and Yellow Heavenly Venerates be blessed.”

This was the ritual of reversing the path taken by mortals to enter the normal Fallen Immortal Realm, to enter the unique illusory realm of succeeding the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate! The moment the ritual was completed, a consciousness descended from high in the heavens, locking onto Sun Tianci. Sun Tianci closed his eyes slightly, sat in the center of the four ritual items, seemingly falling into a deep sleep. The four objects representing clothing, food, housing, and transportation flickered with light and shadow, as if falling into the gap between illusion and reality.

…

“True Immortal’s lingering thoughts, no matter how many times I see them, they remain incredible.” Li Fan's manifestation thought to himself. During the brief time he had transformed into Mr. Bai and misled Sun Tianci, even though he was concealed by layers of formations underground, he had still sensed the Azure Nether world’s consciousness stirring as if it had sensed something. Fortunately, he was no longer the same Li Fan from before; he had reverted to his original form before the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao could find him, otherwise, he might have once again experienced the situation of “Return to Truth, but unwilling.”

“Such a deep connection, the Sacred Emperor's clone in this life cannot achieve it.” “It seems this is the effect of the Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate…” “Let’s see if this child has the fortune for it.” Li Fan stared at the meditating Sun Tianci and thought so. The Fallen Immortal Realm trial of the Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate had a time flow that was almost identical to reality. He had taken nearly half a year to quickly pass the trial with optimal solutions, even knowing all the correct answers. However, Li Fan had not directly told Sun Tianci the correct solutions, to avoid potential "anti-cheating" mechanisms in the trial. He had only embedded the solutions into Sun Tianci’s subconscious through suggestive storytelling since childhood. Given Sun Tianci’s talent, it should not be difficult to successfully break through the illusory realm trial, even if it took some detours.

“It should be just in time for the beginning of the Great War between the Sacred Dynasty and the Myriad Immortals Alliance.” As for the possibility of Sun Tianci losing control… Li Fan looked at the remnant soul of Sun Tianci's biological mother, encased in the core of his manifestation. After some time of training, her outward fierceness had completely vanished, appearing like a loving mother. “To say he was born with Dao Integration, but in reality, he consumed his birth mother's life. This is his biggest flaw!” “Soon, let me see the might of the current Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate.” Under the flickering light of the trial ritual, Li Fan's manifestation appeared and disappeared like a phantom.

…

In the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi. In Ling Prefecture, Du Jiang County, Xixi Village. The grim atmosphere of the impending war had already reached this peaceful village. The vast majority of the village’s young men had joined the Sacred Army, ready to depart for conquest at any moment. Only the elderly and women of each household remained, maintaining their livelihoods while visiting the Sacred Heart Palaces daily to pray for their family members and the great Sacred Emperor. A woman in her forties, returning from the Sacred Heart Palaces, saw a young man standing at her doorstep. She felt an inexplicable sense of familiarity. Just as she was about to speak, she felt a chill in her heart and inexplicably swallowed back the words she was about to say.

“This…”

“Auntie, excuse me, have you seen me before?” The young man finally spoke. His words were somewhat strange. The woman did not understand. However, the kind expression on his face gradually relaxed her, and she slowly opened up. “Young man, I understand what you mean.” “You’re looking for relatives, aren't you?” “Speaking of which, you bear a striking resemblance to my younger uncle. But he suddenly left home years ago and hasn’t been seen since,” the woman said, a glimmer of tears in her eyes. The young man nodded.

“Besides that, is there anyone else at home?” he asked again. “My husband died early; it was just the two of us growing up together. Calling me ‘aunt’ is actually referring to my mother,” the woman said with a self-deprecating smile. “But I’ve come to terms with it these past few years. What’s that saying? ‘The deceased are gone.’ I’ve also adopted two orphans, a boy and a girl. They are very well-behaved, and the Li family can be considered to have heirs.” “It’s just that the Sacred Dynasty seems to be going to war recently, and both children volunteered to join the army. Sigh… I don’t know if they will return alive. Why are they fighting when everything was fine?” the woman rambled on, sounding worried. But she quickly realized she had spoken out of turn and immediately stopped. Seeing that the young man’s expression had not changed, the woman breathed a sigh of relief.

“Don’t worry, they will return home safely,” the young man said kindly. The woman also smiled, “Then I’ll take your good wishes. By the way, have you eaten? Why don't you eat at my house?” “Seeing that you haven't been conscripted, you must not be a cultivator and still need to eat, right?” “Oh, it’s my fault. Seeing you reminded me of my missing younger uncle…” the woman explained repeatedly. The young man nodded and readily agreed. He ate a quiet meal at the woman’s home and then took his leave. For some reason, though the woman just watched and didn't eat, she felt as if she had a full meal, her whole body felt warm, and she seemed to have inexhaustible energy. Looking in the mirror in the room, the woman was surprised to find that the wrinkles on her face had disappeared unconsciously. At this point, the woman understood that she had encountered a noble benefactor. But no matter how hard she thought, she couldn’t figure out the benefactor’s origin. If it weren't for the different appearance, the woman would have almost thought that the person was her younger uncle returning.

“Fan’er, are you truly dead?” The woman stood in the room, lost in thought.

After leaving Ling Prefecture, the young man visited several other places in Great Qi, including the foot of Dissolution Mountain. He finally ascended to the summit of Dissolution Mountain and slowly sat down in a thatched hut on the peak. This young man was naturally the Sacred Emperor of Great Qi. Ever since he attained enlightenment in the Star Sea and grew a face, he had felt a lingering attachment. However, for some reason, he had never chosen to investigate deeply. Until the eve of the decisive battle… The appearance of Great Qi's people was within his thoughts. Based on his current appearance, finding possible bloodline connections was not difficult. However, it seemed to be diverse and not from a single family, leading the Sacred Emperor to doubt if he had made a mistake. It was only when he encountered those with true bloodline connections and felt an instinctive ripple in his heart that the Sacred Dynasty finally confirmed something. It was upon reaching the summit of Dissolution Mountain that some of his speculations were finally confirmed. However, the truth seemed shrouded in mist, impossible to penetrate.

“Was it an ancestor, or that mysteriously disappeared person?” “His disappearance coincided with the day I gained consciousness.” “Possession? Awakening of consciousness?”… The Sacred Emperor's thoughts, unusually chaotic. Until a movement on his shoulder startled him. The sleeping Cat Treasure awoke and affectionately rubbed against the Sacred Emperor's cheek. The Sacred Emperor walked out of the small wooden hut and gazed at the distant sea of clouds. Clouds swirled and drifted in the sky, a gentle breeze blowing. The clouds transformed into different shapes, only to vanish again. The Sacred Emperor's mood became calm once more.

“Regardless of my origin, I am still me.” “Avatar of the Heavenly Dao, Sacred Emperor of Great Qi.” “When reality becomes illusion…” “Illusion also becomes reality.” The Sacred Emperor’s eyes were exceptionally calm. The aura on his body surged like the sea of clouds, harmonizing with the Heavenly Dao of the Great Qi world. “Meow~” Cat Treasure let out a satisfied meow and fell back asleep soundly. “My mission will not change because of my identity.” The clothes on his body slowly transformed from simple white robes into a starlit sacred robe. His body expanded from that of a normal person to three zhang and three chi in size. Emperor Li Ping of Great Qi took a step, treading on the void outside the peak of Dissolution Mountain. The next moment, his figure disappeared. He had returned to the Sacred Emperor's throne. The brief confusion had passed; from now on, he was the absolute Sacred Emperor of Great Qi. He bore not only his own burden but also the lives of countless Great Qi soldiers and the future of the Xuanhuang Realm. Just as the Sacred Emperor was contemplating, he suddenly felt a flicker in his heart. He felt an intention emanating from the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm, somewhat anxious and somewhat bewildered.

Chapter 1291: Residual Wills Hide Fragmented Souls (7K)

The will from the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm was not entirely clear, but the Sacred Emperor Li Ping had largely understood its intent.

"The position of Great Heavenly Venerate..."

"Might I lose contact with you?"

Li Ping's brows furrowed, and he fell into thought.

"No new Great Heavenly Venerate of the Xuanhuang Realm has been appointed for thousands of years, and it happens at this time... Who could it be?" The Sacred Emperor sensed a hint of conspiracy. The Sacred Emperor could only monitor a small portion of the Xuanhuang Realm, with most areas being blind spots. Faces flashed through his mind at lightning speed, but he couldn't pinpoint any suspicious individuals.

"Although, theoretically, anyone who passes the Great Heavenly Venerate's trial should be on my side and face the Dharma-Preachers together, but..."

While comforting the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao, the Sacred Emperor's eyes revealed a decisive look: "It seems the plan needs to be expedited."

"We just need to force out the Dharma-Preachers when the Star Sea anomaly arrives."

A beam of starlight flew out from the Sacred Emperor's throne.

The Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, a meticulously prepared war machine, began to operate at full speed.

Sun Erlang, who was conducting the final tests on the defensive capabilities of the Sacred Army's puppets, was somewhat surprised by the Sacred Emperor's decree. However, upon seeing the puppet formations arranged like stars across the test field, stretching as far as the eye could see, he quickly became invigorated and impatient.

"After nurturing troops for a thousand days, it's time to use them for a day. It's time to let the decaying Myriad Immortals Alliance witness the elite forces of the great Sacred Dynasty!"

Just as he was about to leave the area to attend to the urgent matters of the expedition, Sun Erlang seemed to recall something and flashed to the deepest part beneath the test field.

The surging power of the earth veins was dense, as if solidified. It felt as though it was constantly being struck and squeezed by some immense force. The once earthy-yellow hue had now turned a magma-like crimson. The earth veins roared, striking a black, unyielding stone at the center.

No matter how the power of the earth veins raged, the unyielding stone stood firm. In fact, with each strike of the crimson earth veins, the luster of the stone grew brighter.

Above the black stone, a beam of starlight descended from a constantly spinning vortex of stars, shining directly onto the stone.

Under the illumination of the starlight, the black stone seemed to breathe. With each inhale and exhale, specks of starlight were drawn within.

Skilled Artisan recluse was suspended in the air not far away, intently observing this peculiar scene of the black stone. He also seemed to be constantly calculating something, controlling and adjusting the ratio of power between the input earth veins and starlight.

"Senior Skilled Artisan, the great battle might begin early. Senior True Yang, he..."

Skilled Artisan seemed to have also received the decree. His gaze never left True Yang's body as he said calmly, "Don't worry. When the time comes, I will definitely give the Myriad Immortals Alliance a huge surprise. Those scoundrels swallowed a lot of my Primal Force in previous years..."

"Oh, right! Since we're going to war, those Heavenly Spirit Sect fellows can be put to good use too." Skilled Artisan patted his head, then closed his eyes to report to the Sacred Emperor. After which, he sent out another command, which floated far away towards the puppets in Nine Mountains Province.

A flicker of pride flashed in his eyes, and Skilled Artisan's attention returned to True Yang, who was undergoing the dual tempering of the surging earth veins and the power of the star sea.

Skilled Artisan could clearly sense the immense power gestating within this black stone.

His body trembled slightly, a hint of madness flashing in Skilled Artisan's eyes: "This puppet is the pinnacle of my refining skill. Even in the Heavenly Mysteries Realm of the past, no one could surpass it. Shangguan, just you watch. The disciple you looked down upon will surely surpass you severely..."

Skilled Artisan ignored Sun Erlang, who was still nearby, and muttered to himself. His hands continuously formed hand seals, which floated above True Yang's body.

Seeing this, Sun Erlang wisely retreated quietly.

While the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi was frantically preparing for war, two individuals within the Sacred Dynasty had already left the pocket world and returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, completely at ease.

These were Xu Ke and Senior Yin.

Senior Yin squinted, looking up at the sky, seemingly unaccustomed to the sunlight of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Xu Ke, on the other hand, was identifying directions.

Before the war broke out, they needed to infiltrate the Divine Treasure Museum first.

"Emperor San Mo is quite interesting. He's one of the Three Sovereign Beast Emperors, yet he joined a human cultivation sect; when catastrophe strikes, he unhesitatingly defects and joins the new Myriad Immortals Alliance..." Senior Yin sneered.

Xu Ke shook his head and explained, "Grandfather San is mysterious and unfathomable; no one can figure out what he's thinking. After all, he didn't leave the Xuanhuang Realm with Emperor Yi back then, which is quite puzzling. Moreover, his actions aren't exactly a betrayal of the Beast Taming Sect, are they? After all, the entire Beast Taming Sect's prosperity was almost entirely due to the techniques he brought. He owes the Beast Taming Sect, not the other way around."

"I suspect his allegiance to the Myriad Immortals Alliance is for survival."

Senior Yin sneered, "I don't care about anything else. If he obstructs me when I try to take Mr. Bai's skull, I won't be polite... As for you, you won't defect, will you?"

Xu Ke said with a serious expression, "Don't worry, Daoist friend. I've already made arrangements, sending Qing and Hong to the Spirit Void Realm. With the imitation of the Beast Taming Wheel and the cooperation of the current Beast Taming Sect, it should be enough to lure Grandfather San away. Should the plan fail..."

"I will show no mercy."

"That's good." Receiving Xu Ke's assurance, Senior Yin smiled, his expression returning to normal.

The two followed their plan, moving stealthily, and arrived near the Celestial City of the Heng family in Tianyu Prefecture, belonging to the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"This should be it, the Heng family of Tianyu Prefecture." Xu Ke observed, looking around.

"In my opinion, any family with access to the Divine Treasure Museum would suffice. Why do we have to travel all the way here?" Senior Yin scratched his scalp, somewhat impatient.

"That was the original plan. But the Sacred Emperor suddenly sent word that something seemed to have happened on the Myriad Immortals Alliance's side. The management of access to the Alliance Headquarters has suddenly become stricter. This means there aren't many cultivators with access to the Divine Treasure Museum anymore. Among them, the Heng family of Tianyu Prefecture is the most suitable target."

"The family is prominent due to their weaving techniques. Their strength isn't too great, and they act quite discreetly, with low public recognition..." Xu Ke explained telepathically.

Senior Yin's gaze pierced through the Heng family's defenses, revealing a cold smile: "The easiest ones to deal with should be those two young girls. They're even mother and daughter..."

"That's right, it's them, Heng Ruoshui and He Xinxin. We'll just wait for them to go out, capture them, and impersonate them."

"The Sacred Emperor instructed that unless absolutely necessary, we should not harm them," Xu Ke added.

Senior Yin: "Don't worry, they're too delicate for my taste. Also, we both have to pretend to be women? Can we find someone else?"

Xu Ke sneered, "Are you still concerned with this superficial appearance?"

Senior Yin waved his hand, "That's true. I can't be bothered to run around anymore, let's finish this quickly. I'm a bit... impatient to see Mr. Bai's skull."

The Heng family mother and daughter did not make the two wait long.

A day later, He Xinxin slipped out to play and was captured silently by the two.

Two days later, Heng Ruoshui seemed to have received an invitation and left her cave dwelling. She was also captured by the two in an instant.

Looking at the bound and unconscious Heng family mother and daughter, Senior Yin stroked his chin, "The method taught by the Sacred Emperor is truly effective. This little girl's Dao Script Compass within her body is quite extraordinary. It possesses the ability to avert misfortune and deduce the future. It can be considered half a Heaven Oddity, perhaps a rebirth from the dissolution of an ancient immortal artifact..."

"However, with the Sacred Emperor's bestowed secret art of 'Sky Shading Hand,' this little girl didn't detect the impending crisis at all."

Xu Ke smiled, "Perhaps it's because we don't have any intention of harming them. Let's act quickly."

From the foreheads of the Heng family mother and daughter, they each extracted a drop of vital blood.

Xu Ke took it and pressed it into his brow.

Senior Yin was more crude, his scalp splitting open to allow his fundamental Dao foundation to swallow it.

With a rustling sound of flesh and blood churning, in the blink of an eye, Xu Ke and Senior Yin had transformed into the likenesses of Heng Ruoshui and He Xinxin, respectively.

Their appearances, auras, and even soul fluctuations were almost identical.

"The marvelous technique passed down by the Sacred Dynasty is indeed extraordinary," Xu Ke exclaimed in surprise.

Senior Yin closed his eyes to sense, "The true self is the self that follows one's heart. Transformations are unpredictable, unfathomable to ghosts and gods..."

After hiding the mother and daughter and completing their disguise, Xu Ke and Senior Yin flew towards the Celestial City of Tianyu Prefecture.

For cultivators to apply to visit the Divine Treasure Museum, they needed to apply to the Alliance Headquarters through the local Provincial Administration Hall.

Upon approval from the Alliance Headquarters, specialized guide cultivators would come to lead them inside.

In Tianyu Prefecture, Heng Ruoshui's face was the best pass.

And taking family juniors to visit the Divine Treasure Museum was a perfectly normal occurrence.

They proceeded unimpeded, and the application was quickly sent to the Alliance Headquarters.

The response from the Alliance Headquarters was not as swift. It took seven days before the final reply arrived.

The dignitaries of Tianyu Prefecture seemed to be of no importance before the Myriad Immortals Alliance's guide cultivator.

The black-robed guide cultivator, with a solemn expression, casually gave a few instructions about what to pay attention to when entering the Alliance Headquarters.

He then led the two to the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Central Celestial City in Tianxuan Prefecture, and subsequently, in a room deep within the Provincial Administration Hall, opened a teleportation portal to the Alliance Headquarters.

As they stepped into the light circle, torrents of illusions surged forth.

Even with the current strength of Senior Yin and Xu Ke, they couldn't resist it.

However, Xu Ke recovered in an instant. This was because the Heng Ruoshui he impersonated had visited the Alliance Headquarters before.

As for He Xinxin, impersonated by Senior Yin, his body trembled slightly. After a moment, he opened his eyes.

The guide cultivator, as per routine, explained the reason for the illusions. Then he casually asked, "What did you see?"

Senior Yin, following the Sacred Emperor's instructions, replied, "The manifestation of a Heavenly Venerate, towering into the heavens, transmitting the Dao to all beings."

The guide cultivator nodded and asked no further questions.

On their journey through the void to the Divine Treasure Museum, Senior Yin and Xu Ke silently communicated telepathically.

Senior Yin: "Interesting. I saw the figure of a Doctrine Transmitter, floating outside the Xuanhuang Realm. From a bird's-eye view, looking at the Xuanhuang Realm. The Xuanhuang Realm was far from its current size. It should be a scene shortly after they attained the Dao and Longevity."

"What did you see?" Senior Yin asked.

Xu Ke then transmitted an image.

It was as if in the chaotic void, the specific location couldn't be identified.

Two figures stood opposite each other, their appearances indistinct.

"Who are you?"

"I am you."

"You are me..." The voice sounded hesitant.

After a brief silence, he slowly shook his head, "No. You and I... are different."

Another voice chuckled, with a hint of mockery, "This is your destined mission. You cannot refuse it. Acknowledge reality; sooner or later, we will merge into one."

"I said, I am Xuanyuan Tuo. Not..."

At a crucial point, the image shattered violently.

Senior Yin was taken aback, and he inadvertently glanced at Xu Ke.

Xu Ke also looked helpless, "I only saw this. The crucial parts were indeed missing."

Senior Yin rewatched this segment of the footage, "Quite interesting. After we return, I'll tell this information to the Sacred Emperor. He should know something."

While they were communicating, they quickly arrived before the Divine Treasure Museum.

It stood on a floating continent, entirely black, exuding solemnity.

The towering, narrow gateway inspired awe in every cultivator who came to visit.

After another identity verification, the guide cultivator led the two into the museum's interior.

The first compulsory exhibit was a massive cluster of light called "The Beautiful Era."

Within the cluster of light, countless worlds seemed to be born and perish.

"This is the 'Era'," the guide cultivator explained skillfully.

"With a piece of Dao-Melting Stone as its core, it deduces and embodies scenes from various periods in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"In all the deduced worlds, the survival rate for cultivators is far inferior to the present."

"Therefore, although named 'Era,' they all serve to highlight the beauty of the present name."

... Senior Yin and Xu Ke were both dismissive, but they didn't dare to show it, only nodding silently.

"As per convention, you two may experience it personally."

"Don't worry, a lifetime spent in an 'Era' is but an instant in reality. And under normal circumstances, you won't survive more than a few years in the 'Era' illusion."

Under the operation of the black-robed guide cultivator, Senior Yin and Xu Ke each projected a strand of their divine sense into the "Era" cluster.

Shortly after, the guide cultivator's expression became somewhat peculiar.

This was because the situation he had anticipated did not occur.

One of them was thrown into the ancient immortal cultivation era, while the other was thrown into an era of absolute chaotic killing.

However, one of them was fortunate enough not only to embark on the path of immortality from a young age but also to repeatedly encounter fortuitous encounters. They smoothly cultivated to the Soul Transformation realm, becoming a core disciple of an immortal sect, and finally died of old age.

The other was even more outrageous. They carved a bloody path through the chaotic world, becoming a female demon revered by all, even enjoying devouring cultivators' souls... until their sins became so numerous that all cultivators in the world could not bear it and united to attack. Only then did she die under their siege.

"The other eras seem pretty good too," they said, not entirely satisfied, after emerging from the "Era" illusion.

The guide cultivator was stunned and reconfirmed their profiles.

Heng Ruoshui, He Xinxin.

"I didn't expect this young girl to be so brutal at such a young age."

Just as he was about to persuade the two to continue their journey through the Eras, to prove the "Beautiful Era,"

The two had already grown impatient and moved past the Eras.

The guide cultivator wanted to say something but ultimately didn't.

Next, he led them to visit other areas such as "Heroes Abound," "Seas Change and Mountains Wander," and "Myriad Laws Contest."

Senior Yin suddenly said, "Next, we'd like to look around ourselves. Is that okay?"

His tone was clearly impatient.

The guide cultivator nodded. Since his mission was complete, he handed them a jade token, "When you're finished visiting and want to leave, contact me. Remember, you must remain quiet inside the Divine Treasure Museum..."

After giving a few instructions, the guide cultivator disappeared before them.

Xu Ke and Senior Yin exchanged glances, and with great tacit understanding, they slowly moved towards the center of the Divine Treasure Museum while continuing to "visit."

After a while, they finally saw the skull placed quietly in the distance.

Xu Ke's body trembled slightly. He took a deep breath, and slowly calmed his emotions.

Senior Yin also made a great effort to avoid showing any abnormality.

They walked up to Mr. Bai's skull and gazed at it silently.

"I can barely resist acting now."

"Let's wait a bit longer. The Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Sacred Dynasty haven't clashed yet. More importantly, I can faintly sense that Grandfather San is still in the museum. Anyway, with the permission level of these two from the Heng family, there's no time limit for visiting..."

Senior Yin did not reply but was already immersed in gazing at Mr. Bai's skull.

After an unknown period, another figure approached the skull.

After gazing for a long time, they let out a gentle sigh.

This immediately attracted the attention of Xu Ke and Senior Yin.

The newcomer was a middle-aged cultivator with a long beard. He looked at Mr. Bai's skull, and like them, his emotions seemed unrestrainedly excited.

"So it's this kid..." Senior Yin snorted coldly.

"You know him?" Xu Ke asked.

"Hmph, his name is Shangguan Shiquan. He fought with me for Mr. Bai's rib back then. Speaking of which, Mr. Bai's leg bone is also with him..." Senior Yin said with a displeased tone.

"Hmph, after we retrieve the most important skull, we'll recover the remaining parts one by one," Xu Ke added, a dangerous glint in his eyes.

"Naturally." Senior Yin agreed wholeheartedly.

"Grandpa, what's so interesting about this? I still want to see the ancient artifact from just now..." a slightly childish voice came from afar.

It was a little girl, about three to four years old, who walked up to Shangguan Shiquan, tugged at him, and cried, her face unhappy.

"This one here is one of the greatest cultivators in the history of the Xuanhuang Realm," Shangguan Shiquan said, comforting the little girl as he picked her up.

Upon hearing this, the little girl couldn't help but stare at the skull in front of her with curiosity, her eyes wide.

After hearing Shangguan Shiquan's words, Senior Yin and Xu Ke's attitudes shifted.

After a moment of silence, the little girl suddenly exclaimed, pointing at Mr. Bai's skull with surprise, "Grandpa, look quickly, there's someone there!"

Like a thunderclap, it instantly exploded in the hearts of the three present.

The gazes of the three instantly locked onto the skull again.

But it remained silent, with no trace of life.

Shangguan Shiquan stroked the little girl's head, "Nannan, don't talk nonsense. Where is there anyone!"

The little girl pouted, her face full of displeasure, "Nannan isn't talking nonsense, there's clearly someone! Inside the skull, can't you see it?"

The little girl's words were so serious that Shangguan Shiquan couldn't help but hesitate.

He looked more closely again.

He still found nothing. Then, Shangguan Shiquan secretly mocked himself in his heart. He had looked at this skull countless times; how could anyone possibly hide inside?

Thinking it was just childish prattle, Shangguan Shiquan told the little girl not to make a fuss.

The little girl, however, became serious and kept shouting.

Helpless, Shangguan Shiquan had no choice but to take the little girl and leave the area for now.

Near the skull, only Senior Yin and Xu Ke remained.

Xu Ke said in a deep voice, "What do you think?"

He was clearly asking about the little girl's words just now.

"Impossible. I am absolutely certain that Mr. Bai is completely annihilated. There is definitely no thought of him left in this skull."

"Besides, Emperor San Mo is no ordinary person; he wouldn't be unable to distinguish if there's a lingering thought in the skull. If there were, why would he place it here so openly for us to examine? Hmph, that's the remnant will of an Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate..." After half a day of silence, Senior Yin finally replied decisively.

"But..." Xu Ke stared at Mr. Bai's skull, a hint of doubt in his eyes.

"Before the little girl mentioned it, I hadn't noticed. But after she said it, I really feel like there's something hidden inside this skull."

"Not Mr. Bai's lingering thought, but something else..."

"When I was little, I liked playing hide-and-seek with my companions. As long as Mr. Bai was around, we all liked to hide next to him. He was like he could contain the entire world; as long as you were close to him, it was hard for others to find you..." Xu Ke murmured.

His words made Senior Yin somewhat hesitant.

"Oh, right. The guide cultivator previously mentioned that a remnant soul escaped from the 'Era's' domain. It eventually disappeared without a trace..."

"Could it be?" Xu Ke's voice suddenly cut in.

"A remnant soul from the 'Era'?" Senior Yin narrowed his eyes, staring at Mr. Bai's skull.

"We've been here too long. Let's go somewhere else." Without answering, he said this first.

As they walked to the viewing area called "Forms of All Beings," Senior Yin then said, "Although Mr. Bai's remains look no different from ordinary mortal bones, they are, after all, the bones of a former Great Heavenly Venerate. They must have their unique characteristics."

"However, these special points are difficult to discern. I once sewed and raised a mutated human-hand dog. It was disgusted by all bones, except for the white rib bone I collected, which it was particularly fond of..."

"As if it were something that could save it from dire straits." Senior Yin seemed to recall something, lost in thought.

Xu Ke's heart stirred, "If that's the case, perhaps Mr. Bai's skull can indeed help protect that remnant soul. It's just that we still can't figure out the truth."

"Hmph. After all, with layers of protection from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, we can't see clearly. Once we get the skull, we'll know." Senior Yin snorted coldly.

Xu Ke nodded in agreement, then suddenly said, "Speaking of which, even we couldn't detect the remnant soul hidden in the skull, yet that little girl noticed..."

"This little one is not simple. What was her name again? Shangguan Nihongo? When we return, we must report this matter to the Sacred Emperor..."

If Li Fan were here and could hear their conversation, he would surely guess that the power of Mr. Bai's skull that protected the remnant soul from the Era was precisely the "Eternal Residual Will" that had a fatal attraction to "Return to Truth."

This energy, not yet known to the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm and only absorbable and usable by Return to Truth, was the fundamental reason he was desperately seeking Mr. Bai's skull.

However, due to the Sacred Emperor severing his connection with his main body from the Star Sea in this lifetime.

Even if Senior Yin and Xu Ke conveyed their findings to the Sacred Emperor, Li Fan was destined not to know.

...

While they were visiting the Divine Treasure Museum.

An unusual aura had begun to spread across the territory of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Because Li Fan had previously sent his spiritual manifestation and Sun Tianci to infiltrate the underground caves and steal the Dao foundations from nearly one-fifth of the dormant cultivators, the high-ranking officials of the Myriad Immortals Alliance were furious.

A large-scale investigation was secretly launched.

The reason was not stated, but all cultivators who appeared in Tongyan Prefecture that day were thoroughly scrutinized.

The Eternal Immortal Wall was destined to remain hidden from light, so the investigation could only be conducted in private.

However, an opaque investigation was bound to cause widespread panic.

Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators were rife with speculation, and under the instigation of Sacred Dynasty spies, rumors of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's imminent war with the Five Elders Council grew by the day.

As the situation grew more tense, dire news came from Nine Mountains Province.

Due to the sudden rebellion of the Heavenly Spirit Sect within Nine Mountains Province.

With internal and external cooperation, they colluded with the Five Elders Council and seized control of Nine Mountains Province in one fell swoop.

The fall of Nine Mountains Province sent shockwaves through the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance declared a state of emergency preparedness and, to prevent the Five Elders Council from expanding their gains, mobilized a large number of cultivators to the border to establish a defense line.

Cultivators from all provinces were also prohibited from moving freely, and most of the time they were only allowed to move within the Celestial Cities of their respective provinces.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance was deliberating on how to retake Nine Mountains Province.

And in places they couldn't see, the army of the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi, riding on the True Boat of Puxian, had appeared within the various provinces of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, bypassing the White Mist Barrier.

Just waiting for the Sacred Emperor's decree, they would swarm down and launch a full-scale attack on the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"Senior Brother, when do we make our move? I can't wait any longer."

Within the white mist, Ou Shaotian rubbed his hands, his eyes penetrating the White Mist Barrier, filled with excitement.

"Let's wait a bit longer. After the formation in the Four Central Prefectures is complete." Sun Erlang said with great composure.

"Speaking of which, Senior Skilled Artisan's move of diverting the disaster to the east and distracting the Myriad Immortals Alliance is truly a stroke of genius. With the Myriad Immortals Alliance dispatching a large number of troops to the border, it's undoubtedly a great opportunity for us," Wang Xuanba said, slowly waving a peculiar beast resembling a white snake.

"Don't be careless. My master once said that the Myriad Immortals Alliance is not as simple as it appears. Those cultivators... are merely a smokescreen," Sun Erlang said, having a clear understanding of the battle situation, and admonished them.

"Do you think that just because our Sacred Dynasty has Sky-Patrolling Arrows and Sacred Army Puppets, the Myriad Immortals Alliance has none? True victory must be forged through bloody combat."

Chapter 1292: Great Qi Ascends the Azure Nether (7K)

As the Grand Disciple of the Sacred Dynasty, Sun Erlang was in charge of all affairs in the absence of the Sacred Emperor. His pre-battle summary and mobilization naturally went unchallenged.
