After infiltrating the White Mist for several more days, a beam of light pierced the sky and flew into the Puxian True Boat. It was a transmission from an unknown origin. Sun Erlang squinted as he examined it, his spirit greatly invigorated. "We have received confirmed news that the Myriad Immortals Alliance will launch their campaign to retake Nine Mountains Province tomorrow. To deter the Five Elders Council, they will also initiate small-scale harassment battles in multiple border-adjacent prefectures..."

The Sacred Dynasty members present, upon hearing this, had their eyes light up. "The Alliance's actions are even greater than we anticipated!" "Let them fight! The fiercer the better!"

With a thought from Sun Erlang, a massive luminous orb representing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's territory instantly appeared before everyone. "When the Myriad Immortals Alliance launches its battle to retake Nine Mountains Province, that will be the moment the Sacred Dynasty's armies march. Until then, none of you are to act rashly."

As Sun Erlang spoke, he had already coordinated with Ou Shangtian to activate the Puxian True Boat's internal lockdown formation. "Before the decisive battle, I have a top-secret matter to announce. It concerns the victory or defeat of this war, and it must not be leaked. Therefore, during this period, the warship will be locked down, allowing entry but not exit. All communications will also be severed."

"I apologize for this inconvenience," Sun Erlang said calmly. A flicker of surprise flashed in everyone's eyes, unable to fathom what kind of confidential information required such solemnity. Sun Erlang closed his eyes and waited. In the grim atmosphere, absolute silence fell within the Puxian True Boat.

After an unknown duration, Sun Erlang suddenly opened his eyes. "The Myriad Immortals Alliance has made its move." "Now, it's our turn." Sun Erlang abruptly stood up and bowed towards the void ahead. "Greetings, Master!" The people on the flying boat were startled and looked in the direction Sun Erlang bowed. Under the embrace of starlight, the Sacred Emperor's figure descended. "We welcome the Sacred Emperor!" everyone said in unison, bowing. Even though it was merely a phantom, not the Sacred Emperor's true form, they dared not show any disrespect.

The Sacred Emperor did not utter any grand, empty platitudes. He simply said in a deep voice, "This battle, the Sacred Dynasty will surely win." Then, with a wave of his hand, the Sacred Emperor's phantom transformed into specks of starlight, flying into the bodies of the cultivators present.

*Boom!*

Each person felt as if they had become a planet, arriving in a vast sea of stars. They revolved around a colossal star at the center, resembling the great sun in the sky. Even more wondrously, the star sea seemed to echo with a vast stellar force, like a woven net, connecting everyone. Even without spoken words or divine sense, communication flowed freely through mere intent. They also discovered that the stars in the star sea did not only include those within the Puxian True Boat at this moment. There were also a larger number of Sacred Dynasty grassroots generals already lurking in the territories of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"I will issue the following deployments," Sun Erlang's voice reverberated through the star sea. "Wang Xuanba and Senior Qiao Gong, you will lead the first and third legions, responsible for besieging the Myriad Immortals Alliance's eastern one hundred and thirty prefectures. Ou Shangtian and Ou Daozi, you will lead the second and ninth legions, responsible for the Alliance's southern one hundred and twenty-six prefectures. Su Yuqing and Senior Bai Hua, you will lead the fifth legion and the Myriad Worlds Allied Army to attack the Alliance's western one hundred and fifty-four prefectures..."

As Sun Erlang completed each deployment, Wang Xuanba and the others felt their positions within the star sea rapidly shift. After settling into their new starfield, they simultaneously established connections with the other stars in that region. With a slight shift of their thoughts, detailed information about the main generals of the legions under their command appeared in their minds.

"The objective is to primarily capture the Celestial Cities of each prefecture. For other immortal cultivation families and factions within the prefectures, if they resist, sweep them aside. If they choose to observe, they can be temporarily ignored." "At the time of the war's commencement, the Heavenly Profound Mirror channels and teleportation formations in the Myriad Immortals Alliance's prefectures will be paralyzed..." "This is the diagram of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Celestial City defense formations. Break through them according to the information noted in the diagram. Those defenses will be like nothing to us. If they activate the backup formations, I will promptly transmit the method to break them."

Information was conveyed in an orderly fashion, and as everyone looked at the materials in their hands, they became increasingly excited. Not only were the names of the main cultivators in each prefecture's defense listed, but even their respective realms, strengths, and even cultivation techniques were clearly marked. The backgrounds of their enemies had been almost completely exposed. Yet, the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to know almost nothing about them. How could they possibly lose this war? No wonder Sun Erlang had been so solemn earlier. This kind of information could only have been leaked by high-ranking members of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

However, the shock Sun Erlang brought was not over. "The Star Sea Network you are all seeing now is the manifestation of the Sacred Emperor's power. In addition to the simplest communication function, you can also use the Sacred Emperor's power to instantly transfer to each other's presence." "You can leverage this advantage to outnumber the enemy and crush them one by one."

The bright star in the center of the star sea suddenly erupted with dazzling light, illuminating the stars in the star sea. In an instant, the various applications of the Sacred Emperor's power appeared in everyone's minds in detail. Everyone could only marvel once again at the greatness of the Sacred Emperor.

...

While the pre-war grand council was still in progress, in the Spirit Void Realm. "Should be no problem, right?" Little Qing and Little Hong looked at the pattern engraved on the ground in front of them, resembling a rotating wheel. "Seniors, please rest assured, with Cui Shaojiang's efforts, it will definitely be foolproof!" a young man wearing a blue cap assured with a smile. Cui Shaojiang squeezed out a drop of his vital blood and flicked it towards the open space on the ground. After the vital blood integrated into the ground wheel, it emitted threads of blood-red light. Then, it rapidly flew towards the sky and disappeared.

"Alas, in the current Beast Taming Sect, only I possess this unique skill," Cui Shaojiang said with a shake of his head. Little Qing and Little Hong looked at the ground wheel pattern with some suspicion. They did not feel any restraining or binding force from it. Cui Shaojiang, seemingly sensing their distrust, patiently explained, "The current Beast Taming Sect is not what it used to be. After the great tribulation, we migrated here. For a thousand years, we gradually abandoned the traditional Beast Taming methods and turned towards the 'Beast Spirit Unity' technique."

As Cui Shaojiang spoke, the blue cap on his head suddenly came alive, growing two round, black eyes that observed Qing and Hong. Even though they had known some information about the Beast Taming Sect beforehand, seeing it with their own eyes still made Qing and Hong find it somewhat unbelievable. In their perception, there were not two separate auras of beast and human; rather, from beginning to end, they only perceived one individual before them.

"We don't control with techniques, but merge with spirit. This is the breakthrough our ancestors achieved after researching the Beast Taming Rotation Wheel. Speaking of which, Senior Xu Ke's efforts played a part in this," he said, touching the blue cap on his head, which then returned to normal. "I've digressed. Let's return to the Beast Taming Rotation Wheel. The imitation sent by Senior Xu Ke is indeed good. Combined with the Beast Taming Sect's thousand years of accumulated technology, it is enough to unleash the power of the true Beast Taming Rotation Wheel from back then and summon Emperor San Mo here..."

A flicker of excitement flashed in Cui Shaojiang's eyes. "We are quite looking forward to this legendary beast of wisdom. If we can achieve spiritual unity with him..." Cui Shaojiang's gaze inadvertently drifted outside the open space, where the Beast Taming Sect had long since laid a perfect trap. The beast that had abandoned the sect without a word, the Beast Taming Sect members had not forgotten their memory of it over time, but rather, it was etched even deeper in their hearts. Thus, when Little Qing and Little Hong came with the imitation Beast Taming Rotation Wheel to persuade them, it was naturally a perfect match.

On the ground, the red light, as if alive, continued to brandish its claws. The wheel pattern also trembled slightly, as if ready to leap from the ground at any moment. Cui Shaojiang narrowed his eyes. He sensed that Emperor San Mo had taken the bait.

...

Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters. While waiting, Xu Ke and Senior Yin, who were pretending to tour and browse, suddenly sensed that the Divine Treasure Museum had become slightly brighter for a moment. The heavy feeling in their hearts also vanished. "Third Grandfather has left," Xu Ke immediately concluded. "Should we act now?" Senior Yin was eager to try. "Let's wait a bit longer. Let's wait for the Sacred Emperor on their side..."

"The breakthroughs the Beast Taming Sect has made over the years have surprised even me. When the great tribulation arrived, they chose to immediately retreat and preserved a large number of talented individuals, which indeed proved useful," Xu Ke said. "Alright, we'll wait. It's not a matter of a moment or two. By the way, come look at this..." Senior Yin pulled Xu Ke towards an exhibit. Xu Ke looked closely and saw a golden tree with a peculiar shape. All the leaves were triangular, and the trunk was carved with small figures interacting in various poses.

"This thing isn't an ancient artifact from the Xuanhuang Realm, is it?" Xu Ke said with a strange expression after observing it for a while. "Of course not. This is from my homeland." "Or rather, the homeland from which the most complete remnant consciousness has survived." "I thought that place had been reduced to dust, but I didn't expect the most important golden tree to have been preserved in this Divine Treasure Museum," Senior Yin said with a sigh. "This tree... does it have any profound significance?" Xu Ke knew Senior Yin wouldn't reminisce about the past for no reason, and his heart stirred as he asked, "Does it have any profound significance?"

Senior Yin chuckled, "In our world, there was no sun or moon. The light for the entire world depended on this golden tree. Even the nurturing of all life originated from beneath this tree. As you can see, the patterns on the tree are imprints of human interactions over many years beneath the tree." "Although the world was destroyed, as long as this tree exists, the power of the world's origin can be considered to have been preserved by one-third."

Xu Ke began to understand and then asked in surprise, "Do you have a way to detonate the energy within this tree?" Senior Yin rubbed his scalp and smiled without answering. "Are you willing to? That was your homeland? If this tree is perfectly preserved, after the Sacred Emperor takes over the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters, if we ask him to act, it might not be impossible to recreate that world," Xu Ke said. Senior Yin snorted, "Everyone is dead, so what if the world reappears? Am I supposed to transform into their appearance and put on a play by myself?" "Let it explode then." Xu Ke responded with a smile.

As the two were speaking, they suddenly felt the ground beneath them tremble slightly. They exchanged glances and simultaneously looked up at the area outside the Divine Treasure Museum. Although their vision could not penetrate, they could vaguely sense that a drastic change had befallen the Xuanhuang Realm. Their senses were not mistaken. At this moment, a strange spectacle was unfolding in the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm. The once brilliantly clear sky suddenly dimmed as if night had fallen. The great sun in the sky disappeared. Specks of starlight lit up from various parts of the sky. Amidst the shining stars, a bright moon rose. But soon, the Azure Nether cultivators discovered that this "bright moon" was even brighter than the original sun. As the giant jade disc slowly approached, the Xuanhuang Realm, once dim, regained its light.

Cultivators looked up at the sky and discovered that countless tall towers stood within the bright moon. It was clearly another world! After a brief moment of mental blankness, countless thoughts instantly flooded the minds of the Azure Nether cultivators. "Could this be the legendary Profound Heaven Boat?" "The Profound Heaven Boat has attacked?" "I heard the Alliance and the Five Elders Council are at war, could this be a surprise attack by the Five Elders Council?" "Beware and be vigilant!"

...

Things out of the ordinary are bound to be supernatural. Currently, they were in a state of wartime preparedness, and the Myriad Immortals Alliance's reaction was swift. The defense formations of the Celestial Cities in all prefectures were immediately activated, and sirens blared across the sky. More cultivators transformed into beams of white light and flew straight towards the moon-like world in the sky, attempting to investigate. However, despite appearing to be within reach, the investigating cultivator could not fly into it no matter what. It was as if a chasm separated them.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance stood on high alert, only to see several beams of bright light shining down from the bright moon. The moonlight, like a knife, accurately struck the borders of the four central prefectures of the Alliance: Tianyu, Tianchen, Tianshu, and Tianquan. The skies of the four central prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance instantly seemed to be coated with a layer of silver light, becoming illusory and hazy. But aside from this, there seemed to be no other abnormalities. After cautiously waiting for a long time, the cultivators in the four central prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance reached this conclusion. However, they soon realized they were wrong. "The teleportation array is not working anymore! We've been sealed off!" "Communication talismans are also unusable!" "We've lost contact with other prefectures. But we can still contact the Alliance Headquarters." "What does headquarters say? To act according to the situation? The enemy is at our doorstep! Damn it!"

The four prefectures immediately descended into chaos. Some cultivators with violent tempers flew directly to the prefectural boundaries enveloped in silver light, attempting to break through the blockade. The White Mist barrier illuminated by the silver light added a touch of sacred solemnity. A cultivator, emboldened, charged straight into the White Mist. He had prepared himself to lose several years of his life, but the scene he beheld after entering the White Mist left him dumbfounded.

The moment he stepped across the boundary, the White Mist that had filled his vision instantly vanished. It was replaced by an boundless expanse of starry sky. It was as if he were truly in the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm, with darkness and coldness all around. In the distance, he could faintly see countless brilliant stars, occasionally twinkling. The cultivator stared, wanting to return but found the path he came from had disappeared. Thinking it was an illusion, he unleashed one sword technique and spell after another, but could not stir even a ripple in the starry sky. Attempts at teleportation and instantaneous movement also failed. Instead, as the Spirit Qi in his body was depleted, the cold starry environment around him slowly eroded his mind. Helpless, the cultivator could only choose a direction and fly onward, attempting to leave the range of this starry sky. But what they did not know was that in the boundless sea of stars, with the wrong methods, even with a lifetime, they could not leave here.

Outside the grand formation, more and more cultivators stepped into the moonlight boundary. The formation, like an endless abyss, swallowed them all. Nascent Soul, Soul Transformation, and even Dao Integration cultivators. No matter their cultivation level, once they entered, there was no return. After some probing, the cultivators in the four prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance were finally awestruck. The Alliance Headquarters also finally issued an emergency order, prohibiting the reckless suicidal behavior of the cultivators in the four prefectures.

Several streams of rainbow light crossed prefectural boundaries, arriving at the moonlight boundary of Tianquan Prefecture. One of them was Lu Xichan, the chief formation master of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. "This formation..." Lu Xichan gazed at the moonlight shining on the White Mist barrier, a look of shock welling up in her eyes. A young man in white beside her furrowed his brow and asked, "When can it be broken? Now, we have completely lost contact with the prefectures outside the grand formation." "Not only have the teleportation arrays failed, but even the Heavenly Profound Mirror channels are blocked," the white-clothed young man said with a hint of worry. This young man was Ren, a Doctrine Transmitter, one of the true core powers of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Lu Xichan dared not be negligent and replied, "This formation seems to be drawing upon the power of the sea of stars and then using infinite space-time transformations to generate a reality akin to the actual star sea..." Doctrine Transmitter Ren coldly interrupted Lu Xichan, "When will it be broken?" Lu Xichan's voice abruptly stopped. After a long pause, she replied, "The complexity of this formation is unprecedented. It should take at least fifteen days..." Doctrine Transmitter Ren said coldly, "I will give you ten days." With a cold snort, Doctrine Transmitter Ren flashed away, leaving behind only Lu Xichan and several formation masters from the Alliance's Hall of Strategic Formations. Lu Xichan looked up at the starlight grand formation enveloping her head, and cold sweat began to form on her forehead. As for the formation masters present with higher attainments, despair grew in their eyes. It was not that the Myriad Immortals Alliance's formation masters were useless, but rather, the formation laid down by the Sacred Emperor this time far surpassed the current era. Based on Li Fan's hundreds of reincarnations and his continuous deduction of formation knowledge across several generations of the Xuanhuang Realm using the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, combined with Li Fan's, or rather, the Dissolution Disc's, insights after obtaining several immortal-grade formations. The Sacred Emperor, after being infused with the essence of these formations, further deduced them based on his enlightenment within the star sea.

Currently, in the sky above the four prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the bright moon that occupied nearly half the celestial dome, which was the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, saw countless Great Qi citizens gathered in the Sacred Heart Palaces. They knelt and prayed piously before the Sacred Emperor's statue. And in Sacred Capital, beneath the Sacred Emperor's Throne, tens of thousands of second-generation Netherfolk, created by the Sacred Dynasty, chanted praises of the Sacred Emperor's great virtues. The Sacred Dynasty's purple-gold aura mingled with the golden primal force essence, forming a faint purple-gold starlight that left the Sacred Dynasty's territory, maintaining the operation of the grand formation that trapped the Myriad Immortals Alliance's four prefectures. This ultimate trapping formation, named the "Bright Moon Starlight Grand Formation" by the Sacred Emperor, was infinitely close to a true immortal-grade formation. Li Ping believed that even a Doctrine Transmitter would need some time to break it. As for the people currently within the Myriad Immortals Alliance's four prefectures trying to break it... they would have to ask if he, the Chosen Emperor, agreed.

Li Ping sat on the Sacred Emperor's Throne, his gaze spanning across the boundary of two worlds, falling upon the territory of the Myriad Immortals Alliance in the Xuanhuang Realm. The Sacred Emperor's Throne, or rather, the entire Sacred Capital, had become incomparably quiet due to the onset of war. Mao Bao was still in its usual state, lazily sleeping on Li Ping's shoulder, as if nothing in the world could move it except for the primal force essence. Besides Mao Bao, a figure that appeared to be only eight or nine years old stood beside the Sacred Emperor, staring intently at the Xuanhuang Realm below. It was Tian Yang. Currently, his puppet body, after receiving a large influx of primal force essence and the combat memories of the Immortal Puppet "Ancestor," had undergone a complete transformation compared to before. His appearance and physique had reverted to his appearance in life, and he had even truly developed a life aura. His strength was unfathomable, gazing at the Myriad Immortals Alliance, awaiting the arrival of his opponent. And beneath the Sacred Emperor's Throne, Yi Jue, a Daoist from the Guiding Tribulation Sect, had brought out all the paper figures of his entire sect. The paper figures recreated the mountain gate of the Guiding Tribulation Sect from back then. In the center of the architecture, a passage seemed to have opened, leading to an unknown destination. Although Yi Jue himself did not enter, his eyes bulged, extending infinitely outwards, probing into the depths of the passage. "Sacred Emperor, please rest assured, if there is any disturbance in the Xuanhuang Realm, this old Daoist will surely see it," Yi Jue said with a smile. Li Ping did not respond to Yi Jue. His gaze and attention were largely focused on the starry sky outside the Xuanhuang Realm. There, he had made thorough preparations, awaiting the arrival of the Heavenly Physician and the Dharma-Preachers.

Outside the Myriad Immortals Alliance's four prefectures, beyond the "Bright Moon Starlight Grand Formation." When the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm became extremely dim, and the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi, accompanied by subordinate pocket worlds resembling stars, descended, attracting the full attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators, a great change simultaneously occurred in every Celestial City of each prefecture of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Seeing the bright moon appear in the sky, Sun Luyuan's mind seemed to have a switch flipped. Without any thought, he immediately issued orders to the death row combatants who had been prepared for years. These death row combatants would sacrifice their lives to detonate the formation restrictions left within their bodies in the prefectures' teleportation arrays and Heavenly Profound Mirrors. Sun Luyuan, who had reached the Dao Integration realm many years ago and presided over a clan of immortal cultivators, felt a moment of blankness in his mind after issuing this order. His throat felt dry, and his limbs turned cold. However, before the emotion of apprehension could surface, he was stunned to discover that in some prefectures, before his death row combatants could act, the Heavenly Profound Mirrors and teleportation arrays had already been destroyed by someone else. Sun Luyuan understood in his heart: "Such an important matter, it's indeed impossible to entrust it to only one person." Amidst the chaos, Sun Luyuan saw colossal flying boats emitting golden light, descending like divine soldiers, appearing abruptly. Before the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators could react, they had already surrounded the Celestial Cities. Uniquely shaped puppets flew out of the flying boats, spewing dark light. The seemingly impenetrable defense formations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Celestial Cities instantly became precarious, on the verge of being broken. "It seems the level of traitors within the Myriad Immortals Alliance might be even higher than mine." "Could Chief Lu have also betrayed us?" Sun Luyuan squinted as he watched, feeling much more at ease. "The promising juniors in the family have already been arranged to leave the Myriad Immortals Alliance's four prefectures in advance. As for the remaining ones, with the prior arrangements I made, they should be safe hiding in their cave dwellings and not be affected." "It's just a pity for Lu'er, not being able to get him out in advance." "Tian Ci seems to be in seclusion. His strength is even greater than mine, so he should not be worried about." As Sun Luyuan pondered, he saw the Myriad Immortals Alliance begin to organize cultivators into teams to resist. He couldn't help but snort, "Now is the time for me to make my contribution." Very cautiously, he transformed his appearance and aura. Sun Luyuan, taking the Myriad Immortals Alliance by surprise, launched an attack on the internal defense formations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Cooperating with the Sacred Dynasty soldiers outside the Celestial City, they quickly achieved victory.

With a talisman personally written by the Sacred Emperor affixed to the forehead of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate statue in the Celestial City, it symbolized the complete fall of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Celestial City. The Sacred Dynasty's first captured Myriad Immortals Alliance Celestial City appeared in Southern Capital Prefecture. Although this was partly due to the prefecture being defended by only a Soul Transformation cultivator and having weak defensive capabilities, its significance was still profound. Soon, under the spread of the Sacred Emperor's power and the Star Sea Network, all Sacred Dynasty soldiers were greatly encouraged and redoubled their offensive efforts. The battle situation was far more optimistic than imagined. The Myriad Immortals Alliance had enjoyed peace for a long time, and most of their combat power had been transferred to the borders. Coupled with the failure of their most reliable defensive formations, they were almost entirely on the defensive against the fierce attacks of the Sacred Dynasty soldiers.

Sun Erlang looked at the Myriad Immortals Alliance territory map before him, which was rapidly changing color due to frequent reports of victory, but there was no hint of joy in his eyes. He knew that the current victories were only because the Myriad Immortals Alliance had been caught off guard. When they reacted, the real difficult battle would begin. "In Flowing Light Prefecture, a Dao Integration cultivator has appeared! Immortal Venerable Blue Ice!" "In Yueyang Prefecture, there is also an unknown Dao Integration enemy! Repeat, the opponent's identity is unknown!" ... Looking at the constantly arriving battlefield reports and sensing the black-gold puppet in his mind, Sun Erlang pondered for a moment, not acting rashly. If it were just an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator, the allocated forces would be sufficient to handle it. He needed to wait for his true opponent to appear before making a move. Moreover... Sun Erlang's gaze drifted towards the area where the four prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance were located, directly beneath the bright moon in the sky. The battles on the periphery were merely appetizers. The place that would truly decide the victor was there. The Heavenly Dao-Melting Stone in his mind flashed with blue light, and Sun Erlang once again performed a deduction, striving to achieve the peripheral battle with minimal casualties. "Master, I will not disappoint you," Sun Erlang said silently in his heart.

The Sacred Dynasty Great Qi achieved successive victories, but the advantage was soon interrupted by an unexpected event. In Luoyan Prefecture, after Luoyan Celestial City was breached, most of the Sacred Dynasty soldiers transferred to other battlefields, leaving only a small portion to guard it. However, from beyond the wilderness of Luoyan Prefecture, a large group of cultivators suddenly emerged. They did not try to recapture Luoyan Celestial City but quickly retreated after a surprise attack.

Chapter 1293

"How did they get away? What were you all eating!"

"The speed of those cultivators is too fast! Their movements are uniform and well-trained, not like scattered soldiers."

"It wasn't speed, they vanished into thin air right in front of us!"

An image spread through the Sacred Dynasty's Star Net.

Just as the attackers were about to be caught by the Sacred Dynasty's soldiers, they had turned into nothingness at the critical moment, dispersing into the air.

The Sacred Dynasty's soldiers thought they had teleported away and wanted to continue the pursuit.

But they couldn't find any trace of spatial fluctuations.

"Requesting reinforcements. Currently, the number of soldiers in Luoyan Prefecture is only enough to defend Celestial City. We are unable to pursue and clear the remaining forces of the Myriad Immortals Alliance within the territory."

"Our Stone Province has already wiped out all resistance forces. We can rush over!"

"We're almost there too! Brothers, hold on!"

...

Sun Erlang looked at the various communications within the eastern battlefield and was considering whether to send out more troops to jointly encircle Luoyan Prefecture.

Suddenly, a thought like a lightning bolt flashed in his mind, and Sun Erlang's heart skipped a beat.

Then, a wave of doubt washed over him.

He suddenly remembered something his Master had once said.

"No, no. Luoyan Prefecture, Luoyan Prefecture should have been destroyed once before. Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance had carried out reconstruction work in Luoyan Prefecture afterward, there definitely shouldn't be so many cultivators defending it..."

"How could I have forgotten such an important matter?"

A sharp glint flashed in Sun Erlang's eyes. He had already sensed something was amiss and immediately issued an order to all soldiers of the Sacred Dynasty: "Halt all support to Luoyan Prefecture. I will personally send someone to resolve this."

"The thirty-sixth legion, responsible for guarding Luoyan Prefecture, should also withdraw as soon as possible."

Military orders are like mountains.

No one questioned, they just executed the commands swiftly.

"I am Lan Xiangwen, the commander of the thirty-sixth legion of the first army group. I have led my troops to complete the evacuation. We are retreating to Yingying Prefecture according to orders."

"But... I didn't see any of our people here."

"Lan Xiangwen, what nonsense are you talking about? We have been waiting for you at the agreed location, and you didn't see a single hair of us! Where on earth are you?"

"No, Lan Xiangwen, your displayed location is still within Luoyan Prefecture! What is your thirty-sixth legion doing?!"

...

A trace of chaos began to appear in the internal communications of the eastern battlefield.

Wang Xuanba, the commander of the eastern battlefield, decisively isolated the communications of these individuals and then began to question them in detail.

At this moment, Sun Erlang's voice also came through.

"Xuanba, this place is strange. According to my confirmation, after all the soldiers of the thirty-sixth legion entered Luoyan Prefecture, their positions have never changed. It's as if they've fallen into a deep sleep."

"Therefore, do not believe any information they report. It should be hallucinations from their dreams."

Wang Xuanba was slightly surprised: "I have already sent a mutated beast body to infiltrate the area, but I didn't find them. But I never expected it to be hallucinations?"

"We did break through the newly built Luoyan Celestial City before. The first batch of soldiers who transferred did leave Luoyan Prefecture. This should be some method activated by the Myriad Immortals Alliance later. Perhaps it's not even the Myriad Immortals Alliance..." Sun Erlang stated his conclusion.

"My puppet body has already reached the territory of Luoyan Prefecture..."

In Sun Erlang's vision, the scene of Luoyan Prefecture transmitted.

Wang Xuanba's mutated beast body, located within the Star Sea, was nowhere to be seen.

There wasn't even any sign of a battle in the entire Luoyan Prefecture.

Peaceful and calm.

"Even a puppet body can be dragged into an illusion?" Sun Erlang's heart grew heavy.

"It's a pity that the fake is destined to never become real!"

The black and gold patterned puppet reached out its arm.

The puppet's energy surged, and a long bow made of pure golden energy instantly appeared at its fingertips.

The bow was drawn like a crescent moon, and a silver arrow appeared with it.

Buzz!

After a brief charge, the silver light shot out like a dragon, piercing the sky.

The immense energy shattered the space ahead, about to reveal the reality beneath the illusory facade.

At this moment, a pale hand reached out from the void without warning.

It lightly grasped the Sky-Patrolling Arrow.

No matter how the silver light of the arrow erupted, it was held firmly, unable to move.

Finally, the light completely dissipated, turning into an ordinary arrow in that hand.

The space previously pierced by the Sky-Patrolling Arrow also restored itself.

The pale arm that stopped the Sky-Patrolling Arrow was completely ignored by Sun Erlang's puppet, and it gradually turned dim and vanished.

Sun Erlang snorted coldly.

Mysterious golden energy surged from the puppet's body.

"Pfft!"

A pair of arms emerged from behind the puppet.

Then, another pair grew from the left side of its torso.

After a total of eight pairs, or sixteen arms, had grown, the puppet's movements finally stopped.

Due to the increased structural complexity, the puppet's overall size had nearly doubled.

The golden patterns seemed to come alive, flowing non-stop across the surface of its body.

Boom!

As if lightning struck from the heavens, eight longbows appeared in the puppet's hands in succession.

The bowstrings were drawn taut, and eight Sky-Patrolling Arrows pointed in different directions, ready to be unleashed.

"Break for me!"

Sun Erlang roared.

Eight silver dragons roared and pounced outwards from the central puppet.

The gold and silver light competed, even briefly obscuring the moonlight cast by the Great Qi in the sky.

It was as if only this brute force creation existed between heaven and earth.

Wherever the eight Sky-Patrolling Arrows passed, space shattered like a broken mirror, exploding layer by layer.

But strangely, those fragments did not fly outwards.

Instead, they froze in mid-air.

The silver dragons continued to speed forward, utterly crushing everything in their path.

But the places they had destroyed seemed to be frozen in time.

The real scene beyond the illusion was thus not truly revealed.

Sun Erlang's pupils contracted sharply as the pale arm reappeared.

However, this time it did not stop the eight Sky-Patrolling Arrows.

Instead, it leisurely, yet rapidly, picked up those frozen illusory fragments one by one and placed them back in their original positions.

If this pale arm were allowed to continue restoring the space, the magnificent and potentially fatal dance of the Sky-Patrolling Arrows would serve no purpose, like a punch hitting cotton.

Sun Erlang would naturally not let it succeed.

"Even if it's just a puppet body, but to never even show its face from beginning to end..."

"Are you looking down on me too much!"

The puppet's eight pairs of arms moved across its body.

They writhed and merged, and in the blink of an eye, they transformed into an incredibly thick pair of arms, almost as large as the puppet itself.

The puppet instantly flashed forward, appearing before the pale arm.

It grabbed with all its might!

However, this seemingly slender arm possessed unimaginable power.

Creak, creak...

The giant puppet's arms not only failed to hinder its movements but were also dragged along by the pale arm, forcibly continuing in its original direction.

The dark gold patterns on the puppet's body were running at their absolute limit.

Sun Erlang could faintly feel that in this high-intensity power struggle, the puppet's body had already reached its limit of endurance.

It was about to disintegrate in the next moment.

A cold glint flashed in Sun Erlang's true eyes.

Remote power support from other dark gold puppets instantly poured into it.

Bang!

Under the shroud of golden light, the puppet's body instantly expanded several times over.

The surge of immense power turned the pale arm's movement back.

Seizing the advantage, the energy surged to its peak, intending to expose the hidden culprit behind the scenes.

The intention was good, but just as Sun Erlang felt success was imminent, a sudden inexplicable chill swept through him.

Then, he felt...

As if another pale, cold arm had been placed on the puppet's shoulder.

With a slight push, the puppet's extreme state was broken.

It staggered and lost its balance.

Before it could even adjust, Sun Erlang felt pale hands, one after another, emerging from the void.

They pressed down on the puppet's body.

The strength of each hand seemed to be not very strong, but they were so firm, and united, they bore down on the puppet like mountains and seas.

In an instant, the puppet was submerged in a pile of white hands, unable to move.

Buzz!

A streak of blood trickled from Sun Erlang's eyes as he forcefully detached from controlling the puppet.

He had a premonition that if he continued to control the puppet and was pulled into that unknown place by those pale arms, his true self would suffer severe damage.

"Longevity Realm..." Sun Erlang had now confirmed the other party's strength.

It was no longer something he could handle. While a flicker of unwillingness flashed in his heart, Sun Erlang did not push his luck.

"You can withdraw. I'll handle it from here." Fortunately, at this moment, Qiao Gong's voice sounded in the puppet's ear.

"This precious item, I spent a lot of effort to forge it. I can't just give it to you..." Qiao Gong mumbled, and his figure appeared beside the dark gold puppet.

The rotating blade of light in his hand casually sliced across the pale arms tightly gripping the puppet.

Numerous arms tore apart like ripped white paper from the wounds.

"Go!"

Qiao Gong patted the dark gold puppet's shoulder, and the puppet gradually shrank back to its normal size.

Then, with a flash of light, it teleported away from the location.

At the last moment, Sun Erlang discovered that the severed pale arms cut by Qiao Gong were actually just segments of willow branches.

"Willow branches?"

Qiao Gong also produced the same question.

He reached out to take the pruned willow branches, but his hand passed through empty air.

While he was stunned, the dense, myriad pale arms had already merged back into space and disappeared.

"You won't even show your hands? That's too disrespectful to me, Qiao Gong."

Qiao Gong showed no anger, but took out a round bronze disk from his embrace.

On the disk were several small figures in comical poses.

Originally, the figures were playing, but after Qiao Gong took them out, they immediately became nervous and pointed in different directions around them.

Without Qiao Gong making any visible moves, a rope-like shadow flew out from beside him.

It quickly darted away, disappearing into the air.

After a while, as if hitting something, the black rope began to sway.

The small figures on the disk kept pointing, and the black shadow beside Qiao Gong was continuously emitted.

Before long, a bizarre and eerie giant black net was completed, centered on Qiao Gong.

The small figures in the bronze disk seemed to have completed their mission, patting their chests with relief.

Qiao Gong, however, reached out and picked up one of the small figures.

Although the little figure was very reluctant, it was helpless. It whistled, and the figure split into two.

With a somersault, the two figures split into four.

In a short time, from a single small figure, it transformed into an army of small figures.

Each small figure, with a bitter expression, leaped onto the black rope.

Then, amidst a faint, neat chant, the small figures began to collectively drag the black shadow in front of them.

The massive black net suddenly contracted.

The surrounding space trembled slightly, and the restored fragments shattered again.

Something else was about to be pulled out from beneath the illusory surface.

Qiao Gong squinted, watching intently, and muttered, "Even the Immortal Puppet 'Ancestor' can be moved, how can we not deal with you?"

A sigh echoed inexplicably.

The faint sound of a zither seemed to come from afar.

The small figures, who had been full of energy, suddenly became listless, slacking off.

Qiao Gong's expression turned vigilant as he scanned his surroundings.

"Why must we fight..."

A mournful melody, like weeping and complaining, echoed around Qiao Gong.

Qiao Gong's eyes darted around, then he smiled and said, "Well said! Why must we fight! Qiao Gong is not good at fighting..."

"Since neither of us is willing to take action, why don't we sit down and talk?"

To prove his sincerity, Qiao Gong directly put away the round disk.

The small figures cheered and stopped their work. Qiao Gong, with a smiling face, looked around and said, "I am Qiao Gong of the Heavenly Mysteries Realm. May I know your name, fellow cultivator?"

The other party was indeed a powerhouse in the Longevity Realm.

However, during his brief exchange with the other party, Qiao Gong did not detect any traces of the Heavenly Laws of the Xuanhuang Realm being reversed.

Therefore, he judged that the other party, like himself, was a survivor from another shattered cultivation world.

After a moment of silence, the melodious and solemn voice sounded again: "I, cannot remember."

"It's just that I don't want to see conflict. I have no ill intentions."

Following the other party's words, Qiao Gong saw the entire Luoyan Celestial City, where cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Sacred Dynasty had fallen into a sweet slumber, their lives safe.

Qiao Gong was also relieved.

Although he was not afraid, it was best to avoid making an enemy of a Longevity Realm expert if possible.

"Actually, we also have no ill intentions..."

Qiao Gong smiled and began to chat with the other party.

Sun Erlang, receiving the message from Qiao Gong, sighed slightly: "The difference between the Longevity Realm and Dao Integration is indeed like a chasm."

"However, if all the dark gold puppets were present at that time..."

"It might not be impossible to fight."

...

If the Sacred Dynasty's defeat in Luoyan Prefecture was merely an accident,

Then their experience in Heavenly Spirit Prefecture indisputably proved that the Myriad Immortals Alliance did indeed have some hidden strength.

After the Sacred Dynasty army spent considerable effort to capture Heavenly Spirit City, they discovered it was actually an empty city.

The important cultivators within had already been transferred.

Only some cultivators without any background were left to resist with mechanisms and magic artifacts.

The Sacred Dynasty soldiers quickly realized this might be a trap, but before they could retreat, the entire Heavenly Spirit City exploded with a roar.

The massive floating city, along with nearly ten thousand cultivators from both sides, instantly vanished into ash.

In the sky, celestial phenomena of falling stars erupted in unison.

Numerous strange visions intermingled and twisted, making it impossible to discern.

In a hidden valley in Heavenly Spirit Prefecture.

"Thanks to Brother Sun's reminder, our Heavenly Spirit Prefecture was able to avert disaster," said Song Mansheng, the City Lord of Heavenly Spirit City, stroking his beard with a smile.

Sun Liancheng's gaze remained fixed on the massive firelight in the distant sky: "It is still thanks to the City Lord's wisdom. If it weren't for the City Lord's decisive actions, even if I had proposed the strategy, the effect of eliminating the enemy would not have been so good."

The other cultivators in the valley chimed in: "Yes, according to our observation from those left in the city, at least over ten thousand bandits were buried in this explosion."

"Heh heh, Daoist, you miscounted. It was clearly twenty thousand!"

"...Uh, yes, yes. I'm getting old! Twenty thousand, indeed twenty thousand! We have video evidence to prove it!"

They all said with tacit understanding.

"Speaking of which, who exactly are these people? Their attack came without any warning, and most importantly, they could even disrupt teleportation arrays and the Heavenly Profound Mirror." Sun Liancheng interrupted their celebratory mood.

"It shouldn't be the Five Elders Council. I've fought with cultivators from the Five Elders Council, and the aura I sensed from them is completely different."

"No matter who they are, as long as the central command of the Myriad Immortals Alliance intervenes, they will all die. They are only arrogant for now!"

"Lord Song, should we launch a surprise attack while they are in disarray and gain more merit?" someone in the valley suggested.

Song Mansheng pondered for a moment, not making a decision, but looked at Sun Liancheng beside him.

Sun Liancheng narrowed his eyes and remained silent for a long time.

After everyone waited for a long while, Sun Liancheng finally shook his head: "The situation is unclear, and I cannot make a judgment."

Song Mansheng nodded upon hearing this: "In that case, let's wait a little longer. It is not wise to act rashly when the situation is unclear."

The people in the valley naturally agreed.

However, Song Mansheng and Sun Liancheng moved away from the crowd and conversed privately.

"Brother Sun, you weren't telling the truth just now," Song Mansheng said sternly.

Sun Liancheng gave a wry smile: "I really didn't dare to say it directly. Otherwise, I feared it would shake the morale of everyone!"

Song Mansheng's expression turned grim: "Is it that serious?"

Sun Liancheng said: "Yes. My Lord, you also know that my prediction of the enemy's raid this time relies entirely on the premonition of our Sun family's fortune. That day, I was chatting with my nephew when I suddenly felt that our family's fortune was like a candle in the wind, precarious..."

"Extremely frightened, it took me considerable effort to determine that the cause was not from the Myriad Immortals Alliance but from the outside. I initially thought it would be a surprise attack from the Five Elders Council, but I didn't expect it to be a group of unknown bandits."

"During this period, the future fortune of the family has been fluctuating. Sometimes it looks prosperous, and other times it portends great misfortune with the extinction of our bloodline. It is truly frightening..." Sun Liancheng sighed.

Song Mansheng's brows furrowed even deeper upon hearing this.

Sun Liancheng advised: "Regardless of the outcome, with the merit of exploding the city, you will definitely receive ample rewards when merits are awarded in the future. Your merits are already sufficient, so why take further risks? I reckon their reinforcements will arrive soon, and those bandits are not to be underestimated in combat power. Rather than taking risks, it's better to hide here in this valley."

"With the natural grand formation concealing us, they should not be able to detect us..."

Song Mansheng was finally persuaded and suppressed the urge in his heart.

Sun Liancheng's judgment seemed to be extremely accurate.

Just half a day later, Song Mansheng saw a large number of bandits swarming in.

Their faces were filled with anger, and they meticulously searched every corner of Heavenly Spirit Prefecture.

When they flew over the valley together, everyone in the valley felt their hearts stop.

Fortunately, their fortune was still on their side, and they were not exposed.

"How many have arrived? Have we stirred up a hornet's nest?"

"Why do we only see their reinforcements, and not any of our Myriad Immortals Alliance people!"

In the valley, everyone was nervous, occasionally looking up at the sky and whispering.

They no longer had the relaxed and carefree demeanor from before.

Sun Qi, from the Sun family, quietly approached Sun Liancheng.

"Uncle, something is not right."

Sun Liancheng's expression flickered, then he cautiously scanned his surroundings. Ensuring no one was paying attention, he communicated with Sun Qi telepathically.

"The fluctuating family fortune has begun to stabilize towards one side. Continuing to stay here will likely lead to death."

Sun Liancheng's heart trembled.

He still had great faith in his nephew's words.

It was precisely thanks to his miraculous premonition that they had set up an ambush and detonated the city, eliminating a large number of bandits.

Within the cosmos, branching out, a family declines.

And Sun Qi's cultivation technique, the Reverse Derivation of the Cosmos Sutra, could reverse this trend and cause the family fortune to become increasingly concentrated.

However, the price was that the more prosperous the family became, the more the accumulated forces of decay would concentrate on the cultivator of the technique.

Breaking through each realm was as difficult as ascending to heaven, impossible for anyone but a celestial genius.

Sun Qi was such a genius.

"We must transfer immediately," Sun Liancheng decided quickly.

"Everyone is watching now, how can we leave? And there are so many of us Sun family members," Sun Qi said uneasily.

"I was prepared long ago," Sun Liancheng said with great confidence.

In the valley, the Sun family members quietly gathered.

However, in the eyes of the others, they had not left. They were still in place, conversing with them.

"This 'Golden Cicada Sheds Its Shell' secret treasure was obtained during my adventures when I was young. I've been reluctant to use it, but now it's time," Sun Liancheng lamented.

The Sun family members had already quietly left through a secret passage known only to Sun Liancheng within the valley, completely unnoticed by the others.

"Quick, the secret treasure's concealment effect won't last long. We need to find another place to hide." Sun Liancheng urged.

Just as they were leaving, several white lights streaked across the sky, coming from afar.

Their target was the valley where they had been hiding not long ago.

Boom, boom, boom!

The white lights hit their target, and unimaginable terrifying energy erupted from the valley.

Amidst the rumbling earth, the shockwave then swept across.

The fleeing Sun family members were thrown about.

Fortunately, the secret treasure's concealment function was still effective, so they were not exposed.

Sun Liancheng and Sun Qi looked at the valley, which had already turned into a circular void pit, with horror. Their bodies stiffened, and their minds went blank.

"Dao Integration attack! The explosion just now definitely had the power of a full-force strike from a Dao Integration expert!"

"Is that... an arrow?"

Just as Sun Liancheng stood there dumbfounded, he was horrified to see several more white arrow lights whistling past in the sky.

His head instinctively shrunk back, and finding that the arrows were not heading for him, he hurriedly led his family members towards the next planned hiding place.

"No, the entire Heavenly Spirit Prefecture is no longer safe. We shouldn't stay here long, we need to find somewhere else to take refuge."

While trembling on the road, Sun Liancheng suddenly had an inspiration and changed his route at the last minute.

He fled rapidly towards Mount Teng Prefecture, which bordered Heavenly Spirit Prefecture.

Just as they were about to reach the white mist barrier at the border, the earth of Heavenly Spirit Prefecture suddenly shook violently.

Following this, a terrifying scene unfolded that the Sun family would never forget for the rest of their lives.

In the sky, five rings interlinked, transforming from illusion to reality, descending upon the world.

From the five rings, countless tentacles extended towards the Heavenly Spirit Prefecture below.

And one of them was flying towards the Sun family.

"Not good!" Sun Qi's expression changed drastically, and he shouted.

Sun Liancheng, however, had already beaten him to it.

Paying no attention to his family, he transformed into a streak of blood light and rapidly flew towards the nearby white mist barrier.

However, this escape technique, employing the Soul Burning Art, slowed down at a visibly rate, as if countless tiny tentacles in the air were dragging and obstructing him.

The blood light dissipated, and Sun Liancheng revealed his true form.

He even seemed to have lost the ability to fly, falling heavily from the sky.

The black writhing tentacles in the sky quickly locked onto him.

They violently pierced into Sun Liancheng's body.

Sun Liancheng frantically tried to resist, but the surrounding Spirit Qi seemed to have solidified, completely unresponsive.

Unable to resist at all, the black tentacles soon pierced through Sun Liancheng.

With the Sun family members' screams, they were also grabbed by tentacles that differentiated from the sky.

The wails lasted only a moment before Sun Liancheng's body was assimilated into the same black tentacles.

There wasn't even any celestial phenomenon of falling stars to mark his demise.

Sun Liancheng seemed not to be dead, but merely transformed into those black tentacles.

The Sun family members were captured one by one, while only Sun Qi's heart turned cold.

He dared not move.

Yes, out of the entire Sun family, only he, Sun Qi, survived.

Because the moment he was locked onto by those terrifying tentacles, Sun Qi had a faint feeling.

Among the myriad paths of death, he found the only glimmering possible path to survival.

So, without any hesitation, he used the Essence Transformation chapter of the Supreme Primordial Scripture, dispersing all his cultivation.

And he expelled all the Spirit Qi stored in his body, completely rendering himself a mortal.

A black tentacle, as thick as an arm, slowly floated past Sun Qi.

As if it had intelligence, it circled Sun Qi.

Only by being so close could Sun Qi clearly see that these black tentacles were composed of countless densely packed black insects.

He didn't even dare to breathe, his body stiff and rigid.

Fortunately, after determining that Sun Qi was purely a mortal without any cultivation, the black tentacles let him go.

Taking the entire Sun family, who had also transformed into black flying insects, they swept away.

Sun Qi remained in his original stiff posture, not daring to move.

It wasn't until half a day later that he collapsed to the ground, his body weak.

"What in the world are these things..."

His mind was filled with countless thoughts, and it took him a long time to slightly regain his composure.

He looked at the white mist barrier not far away, and the five rings in the sky that were gradually fading.

Sun Qi gritted his teeth and began to cultivate again.

Shortly after closing his eyes to cultivate, Sun Qi's eyes reopened.

He keenly sensed that the Spirit Qi in the heavens and earth...

was different from before.

Chapter 1294: The Sacred Emperor Awakens His Residual Wills (7000 Words)

Sun Qi raised his hand, attempting to touch the sky.

Without any deliberate manipulation, the surrounding Spirit Qi eagerly surged into his body.

This feeling...

Sun Qi hadn't experienced it for a long time.

It was as if a towering tree pressing down on him had been toppled, and Sun Qi felt an unprecedented sense of freedom.

"Hehehe..."

After a moment of dullness, a hint of ferocity gradually appeared in Sun Qi's eyes.

"Indeed, families and relatives are all burdens!"

"Reverse Cultivation of the Universe, Universe Reverse Cultivation, the culmination of this path is eternal solitude!"

"I am the Sun Clan! The Sun Clan is me!"

"The prosperity of a family, all returns to one person..."

He had lived in the shadow of his family for the first half of his life. Now, by chance, all his relatives had died. Sun Qi didn't feel much sorrow. Instead, he felt a joy he had never experienced before.

He even vaguely sensed that as the other bloodlines of the Sun Clan died, the overall fortune of the Sun Clan had not dispersed or disappeared directly. Instead, it was slowly converging towards him.

"Give me ten years, no, five years, and I will not only recover my cultivation, but I might even reach the Dao Integration realm..." The bright future his intuition predicted made Sun Qi tremble with excitement. It even made him want to laugh out loud.

However, another whistling silver-white arrow passing overhead instantly turned his face pale and made him shiver.

"Heavenly Venerate on high! Could it be that cultivators from outside the Xuanhuang Realm have attacked..."

Sun Qi shrunk his head, looked at the White Mist Barrier not far away, and gritted his teeth, accelerating his absorption of Spirit Qi.

"I can't stay in Heavenly Spirit Prefecture any longer. I must leave quickly..."

"It's a pity that those burdens were all caught by tentacles. I have to rely on myself to cross the White Mist Barrier."

Having lost and re-cultivated his power, Sun Qi's progress was extremely fast. In the time it takes for a cup of tea to brew, he had returned to the peak of Qi Refining.

More and more bandits flew past in the sky, and Sun Qi's sense of urgency grew.

"I can now pilot a flying artifact. I'll go to a safe place first."

"Crossing the barrier of just one prefecture won't significantly shorten my lifespan."

"After returning to Foundation Establishment, I can observe my future destiny. But I can't wait any longer now..."

Sun Qi made up his mind, and a transparent sphere enveloped him, flying directly into the White Mist.

As he was nearing Mount Teng Prefecture, Sun Qi was horrified to discover that within the White Mist ahead, there seemed to be faint figures.

Shocked, he immediately controlled his artifact to stop flying.

But it was too late.

"Who goes there!"

A furious roar, accompanied by colorful spell attacks, flew out from the White Mist, all bombarding Sun Qi.

Before he could even cry out in pain, Sun Qi instantly turned to ashes!

"Target eliminated, alert lifted!"

Cai Yongchen, a squad leader of the Great Qi's third legion, who was on guard duty, checked briefly and then reported.

"Only at Qi Refining cultivation. He must have been a desperate cultivator from the Myriad Immortals Alliance fleeing in panic."

"What bad luck, I thought it would be some big fish!"

"He's also unlucky to have blundered straight into our cordon..."

"Stop chattering and sweep this area clean quickly!" Cai Yongchen snorted, interrupting his subordinates' idle gossip.

He suddenly sneezed.

It was as if something from the cultivator of the Myriad Immortals Alliance who was blasted to death without a complete corpse had entered his body.

Cai Yongchen's heart tensed. After a careful check, he found nothing unusual.

However, as a professional officer of the Great Qi legion, he did not simply overlook it.

Instead, he very seriously reported the origin of the incident and his own feelings through the Sacred Emperor's Grand Net.

After finishing the report, he finally breathed a sigh of relief and continued to lead his subordinates in the cleanup mission.

...

...

In Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness, such incident reports kept appearing non-stop. They even included the number of Sacred Army puppets and Sky-Patrolling Arrows lost on the battlefield, the number of Great Qi soldiers injured or killed, and the list of forces from the Myriad Immortals Alliance who had been captured alive or surrendered...

There were also lists of newly produced supplies from the rear, within the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi.

Sets of real-time changing massive data flickered.

Based on this, the Dao-Melting Stone in Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness, emitting a faint blue light, was simulating battle scenarios, and they were changing accordingly.

Although there was some resistance in various prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the vast majority of the Myriad Immortals Alliance territories had completely fallen under the control of the Sacred Dynasty.

The Doctrine Transmitter statues in the Heavenly Capital were suppressed by Sacred Emperor talismans, and new suppression and connection formations were quickly established.

"In the simulations, the Sacred Dynasty's victory rate on the outer battlefield is getting higher and higher."

"When the situation stabilizes, we can focus on dealing with the tough nuts."

"Currently, the number of Dao Integration cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance who have appeared on the outer battlefield is thirty-four. There are still about a hundred more who should have appeared but haven't shown up..."

Thinking of this massive number, Sun Erlang's heart couldn't help but feel a sense of heaviness.

Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance had the Sky-Patrolling Arrow, a great killing weapon, Dao Integration cultivators were not just targets that would stand still and let you bombard them.

They needed the Great Qi soldiers to hold them back.

Injuries and deaths were inevitable.

"Fortunately, the previous Leaving Realm Rainbow Light Plan drew away a large number of veteran Dao Integration cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Otherwise, this war would have been even more difficult."

Sun Erlang looked at the miniature map of the Myriad Immortals Alliance before him.

In addition to the yellow and purple colors indicating the struggle for territory between the two sides, a unique gray color was indiscriminately infusing all areas.

Centered on Heavenly Spirit Prefecture, it slowly spread out.

In the areas occupied by gray, according to the Dao-Melting Stone's simulations, the Sacred Dynasty resolved battles with absolute victory and speed.

"Dao One Insects..."

Sun Erlang's mind displayed an image of a Dao Integration cultivator from Mount Teng Prefecture being captured alive by a team of Golden Core soldiers from the Sacred Army, clad in Sacred Army armor.

The Heaven and Earth Essential Qi offered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivator was "Crimson Vine."

After Mount Teng Celestial City was conquered by the Sacred Army soldiers, this Scarlet Vine Immortal Venerable arrived late.

Innumerable vines, like fiery coiled dragons, erupted in the world, growing wild and unrestrained. The vine branches, carrying immense power, swept wildly, swatting down large numbers of Sacred Army soldiers like flies.

The Crimson Vine rooted itself in mid-air and spread across the ground.

In the blink of an eye, it had covered the entire Mount Teng Prefecture. The original continuous mountains and rivers had now become a dense primitive jungle of vines.

The military strength of the three legions of the Sacred Dynasty, facing the omnipresent crimson vines, each possessing its own consciousness, was immediately thrown into a bitter struggle.

Despite being protected by puppet armor, they couldn't withstand being entangled, roasted, and absorbed.

It seemed as if this Dao Integration cultivator of the Myriad Immortals Alliance would truly turn the tide and reclaim Mount Teng Prefecture by himself.

However, the battle situation changed instantly after a mysterious shadow descended and enveloped the sky.

The originally vibrant crimson vines suddenly became weak and powerless, like frost-bitten eggplants.

Even the color of their crimson flames inexplicably dimmed a little.

On the other hand, the Sacred Army soldiers, who had been in a bitter struggle and were exhausted,

After the grayness arrived, their fatigue vanished in an instant, and they became invigorated again.

Their attacks were even fiercer than before!

A casually unleashed attack, carrying Spirit Qi, would tear a hole in the Crimson Vines, which had seemed indestructible before.

The wounds on the Crimson Vines did not heal as before; instead, as the battle continued, the wounds grew larger and larger.

It was as if an invisible entity was continuously gnawing at it!

The Sacred Army's counterattack lasted for only an hour.

The behemoth that had occupied an entire prefecture's territory was finally reduced to the size of half an adult.

It was captured alive by the Sacred Army soldiers and locked in a specially designed prison cage for Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivators.

This prison cage could isolate the cultivator within from the outside world and force the Heaven and Earth Essential Qi within the Dao Integration cultivator into a dormant state.

Once imprisoned, Dao Integration cultivators were like ordinary mortals without any strength, completely unable to escape.

The captured Myriad Immortals Alliance Dao Integration cultivators were all sent to the rear of the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi for unified confinement.

As the Dao One Insects spread, the number of captured Dao Integration cultivators continued to climb.

With the battle situation on the outer battlefield gradually stabilizing, Sun Erlang's pressure slightly eased.

Pressing his throbbing forehead, Sun Erlang did not rest. Instead, he re-examined the information gathered from the previous battle.

To prevent any missed details.

Soon, he noticed Cai Yongchen's report.

He did not believe Cai Yongchen's feeling at the time was an illusion. Sun Erlang pondered for a moment and ordered Cai Yongchen to be brought back from the battlefield.

After isolating him, he conducted a thorough examination.

The result was the same: no abnormality was found.

However, Sun Erlang still felt uneasy.

He thought for a moment and finally reported the entire incident and his feelings during Cai Yongchen's examination to the Sacred Emperor through the Star Grand Net.

A moment later, the Sacred Emperor replied.

"The abnormality in your body is likely a trace of free-floating 'Primordial Unity Qi'."

"'Primordial Unity,' refers to Heaven and Earth."

"'Qi,' is the source of all things."

"It is a blessing, not a misfortune. There is no need to worry. However, this free-floating Primordial Unity Qi comes from a fallen cultivator. It may be accompanied by residual thoughts from its former host. It is not advisable to linger on the battlefield for now..."

After receiving his master's guidance, Sun Erlang suddenly understood.

At the same time, he marveled at the wonderful opportunity Cai Yongchen had encountered. This Primordial Unity Qi could be considered half a Heaven Oddity. Although Cai Yongchen had only absorbed a portion of it, it still had infinite effects and could even directly integrate with his own Dao foundation, bringing many wonderful benefits.

"You should return to Great Qi first and recuperate in the Sacred Heart Palace. Wait until you have fully absorbed this Primordial Unity Qi before returning to the battlefield!"

After explaining the origin of the Primordial Unity Qi to Cai Yongchen, Sun Erlang gave his order.

Cai Yongchen's face showed joy, but also a hint of regret.

"I hope the war will be over by the time I return." Cai Yongchen bowed deeply and turned to leave.

Sun Erlang issued personnel adjustments to fill Cai Yongchen's position.

Although it was just a small interlude, it revealed the impact of efficient communication on the overall strategic situation.

All potential hidden dangers were eliminated.

Numerous small increases in victory probability eventually secured the overall victory.

Days passed, and only a single-digit number of prefectures remained in fierce contention on the outer battlefield.

The rest had all been captured by the Sacred Dynasty army.

Sun Erlang did not rush to order a general assault on the remaining Myriad Immortals Alliance territories.

Instead, he ordered the various legions to construct temporary bases and establish garrisons in situ.

At the same time, they systematically transferred captured Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivators and supplies to the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi.

The Great Qi had prepared ample space for accommodation and confinement during these years of preparation.

Sun Erlang shifted his gaze back to the Four Central Prefectures of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"The true counterattack of the Myriad Immortals Alliance should be coming soon."

From the blocked moonlight, a faint fluctuation emanated, leading Sun Erlang to this judgment.

In Heavenly Quan Prefecture, at the edge of the moonlight.

Lu Xichan watched as streaks of rising green energy obscured the moonlight, a hint of joy flashing in her eyes.

Although only eight days had passed in real time, the Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters had already conducted countless simulations.

They had finally found a sliver of hope for breaking the formation.

Since this formation was so extraordinarily profound and incomprehensible, they decided to abandon the idea of "breaking the formation."

Instead, they would directly use "Spirit Suppressing Qi" to corrode the formation's units.

Spirit Suppressing Qi could suppress all Spirit Qi fluctuations.

Under its continuous vaporization, it indeed had an effect.

The moonlight, originally like a silver ribbon, gradually became like a haze of green smoke.

It seemed as if the formation would be broken at any moment.

However...

The bright moon in the sky once again shone down its brilliance.

In an instant, the lost portions were replenished.

Even though Lu Xichan had anticipated this and ordered her subordinates to resist with all their might, they were still unable to prevent the moonlight from descending.

Seeing the formation restored to its original state, Lu Xichan's face turned ashen.

"Chief..."

The formation masters under her also had pale faces and looks of despair in their eyes.

"I will go and fetch the Array Breaking Jade Disk," Lu Xichan said solemnly, admitting her failure to break the formation.

She transformed into a rainbow light and disappeared into the sky.

Half a day later, Lu Xichan returned.

Behind her was a cultivator wearing a dark green Daoist robe, with an imprint resembling a mirror on his forehead.

His face was indistinguishable, and his gender could not be determined.

If Li Fan were present, he would immediately recognize that this was the attire unique to the Mirror Controller lineage of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

That Mirror Controller ignored all the formation breakers present and first looked up at the silver moonlight enveloping the surroundings, nodding slightly.

Then, he bowed slightly towards a point in the void.

A beam of light emitted from the mirror imprint on his forehead, and a white jade disc appeared in the center of the space as the light shone upon it.

The white jade disc flew autonomously, slowly approaching the moonlight pouring down from the sky.

The moonlight twisted and was absorbed by the white jade disc.

On the light and shadow emitted by the white jade disc, one could faintly see the graphics of countless formations evolving.

The Mirror Controller observed for a moment, frowning slightly.

Then, he released another white jade disc.

However, the effect still seemed insufficient, so he directly released all nine discs.

The nine discs circled each other, drawing the moonlight into the center.

The illusory images of formations instantly accelerated manifold.

"What is that Array Breaking Jade Disk? It's so powerful?"

"According to Chief Lu, it's a secondary manifestation born from the Heavenly Profound Mirror, named the 'Dissolution Disc'."

"Hiss, how can such a wondrous item exist in the world? If formations can be broken so easily, what use are we formation masters?"

...

The formation masters present whispered and discussed.

Lu Xichan stared intently at the evolving patterns in the center of the Dissolution Disc, still frowning.

"Venerable, it seems..."

The Mirror Controller nodded, looking at the formation in the sky with an even more solemn expression.

Then, his movements paused, as if he had made a decision.

He flew above everyone's heads, struck a strange pose, and then bowed deeply towards a void in front of him.

With a gentle nod, the imprint on his brow erupted with light.

Subsequently, the illusion of an item quietly appeared.

The Mirror Controller bowed nineteen times.

Nineteen illusory objects of various shapes appeared in the field.

There were round discs like the Dissolution Disc, but in different colors.

There were also white jade rulers and green jade slips...

The nineteen objects, as if alive, flew to the periphery of the nine Dissolution Discs.

They rotated rapidly.

The already somewhat illusory images became even more blurred as they rotated.

Their appearances thus changed, becoming very similar to the Dissolution Discs in the inner circle!

With the assistance of the outer Dissolution Discs, the deduction screen in the center of the ring accelerated again, almost too fast to be seen.

After observing for a while, the Mirror Controller said, "It will take three days to

create a gap in this formation."

"We must use this opportunity to completely resolve the trapping formation."

The Mirror Controller pointed to the bright moon overhead and said.

Lu Xichan bowed her head and said, "I will explain it to the Dharma-Preachers."

The Mirror Controller said nothing further, focusing solely on the Dissolution Disc and the nineteen illusory objects.

The formation masters observing were momentarily stunned by this magnificent spectacle before slowly coming back to their senses.

"Why are there nineteen Dissolution Discs again? The formation-breaking ability of one Dissolution Disc is already terrifying. Nineteen stacked together..."

"I see! The Profound Azure Mirror, the Heart Measuring Ruler, the Book of Heaven and Earth... these are all secondary manifestations of the Heavenly Profound Mirror!"

This statement stirred up a thousand waves, and all the formation masters present were immensely shocked.

"Nineteen! I only knew that the Heavenly Profound Mirror had secondary manifestations, but I never expected there to be so many!"

"No, no, no. After so many years, it's understandable that nineteen have been nurtured. But I've never heard that they can transform into each other! Doesn't that mean each secondary manifestation can unleash more than ten times its own power?"

As if sensing the excited chatter of her subordinates, Lu Xichan cast a cold glance and transmitted, "Don't just watch. Discuss and research the parts of the formation that the Dissolution Discs have broken."

"Don't think that breaking the formation means everything is over! If we can't make up for our mistakes afterward, our Myriad Immortals Alliance's Hall of Strategic Formations will have to undergo a complete personnel change from top to bottom."

Her words caused the formation masters to break out in a cold sweat, and their attention shifted from the Heavenly Mysteries secondary manifestations to the flashing illusory images of the formation.

...

The Sacred Emperor's Throne.

The Sacred Emperor's gaze penetrated the formation's obstruction and fell upon the twenty-eight Heavenly Mysteries secondary manifestations, including the nine Dissolution Discs.

"The Heavenly Profound Mirror, giving birth to itself, dividing and returning to the Dao..."

The Sacred Emperor nodded thoughtfully, genuinely praising, "Even after descending to the mortal world, it has never given up on transcending again."

"The Heavenly Profound Mirror is indeed a treasured artifact that has been passed down through the ages in the Xuanhuang Realm."

The Sacred Emperor held back Mao Bao, who was peeking out with curiosity, seemingly about to jump up.

Prevented by the Sacred Emperor, Mao Bao was a little displeased.

It gently bit the Sacred Emperor's finger and only relented after being stuffed with a ball of Golden Origin Energy.

It then lay back on Li Ping's shoulder to rest.

"Oh, Great Sacred Emperor, the things below are all good treasures."

Yi Jue Daoist, with both eyes submerged in the swirling vortex, could still see things in the Xuanhuang Realm below, exclaiming.

"Each secondary manifestation is equivalent to a path replicated and separated by the Profound Heaven Mirror."

"Some of these paths are even ones that the Profound Heaven Mirror itself does not possess, but were detected by the Profound Heaven Mirror as it observed this world over the years."

"If I were still human, I would fight for one even at the cost of my life. With it as a foundation, even if I attained the Dao and became an immortal in the future, it would be of great use!" Yi Jue Daoist continuously boasted, as if trying to incite the Sacred Emperor to snatch them.

Li Ping was completely unmoved.

"I can comprehend the Dao of Heaven and Earth in the sea of stars. Why should I rely on external objects?"

"Besides, the Dao observed by the Heavenly Profound Mirror may not necessarily be the truth."

Li Ping chuckled, leaving Yi Jue Daoist speechless.

"Great Sacred Emperor, are you just going to watch them fail to break the formation? If you were to send someone to harass them, not to mention snatching some Heavenly Mysteries secondary manifestations, even delaying their formation-breaking time would be beneficial." After a moment of silence, Yi Jue Daoist spoke again.

"Yi Jue, just do what I've instructed you to do." Li Ping glanced at Yi Jue indifferently.

Yi Jue Daoist gave a dry laugh and fell silent.

"This old man wasn't this talkative before. It seems the mirror below is of great use to him." At this moment, Tian Yang, who had been silent, suddenly spoke.

The paper figures of the Tribulation Passage Sect below nodded slightly, not denying it.

However, what use it was, Yi Jue Daoist refused to mention.

"Your Ten Sects are as annoying as ever." Tian Yang said softly.

As if an invisible wind swept through the hall of the Sacred Emperor's Throne, the paper figures of the Tribulation Passage Sect instantly swayed.

There was even a sign of the Tribulation Passage Sect's mountain gate being blown.

Yi Jue Daoist waved his hand, and the paper figures curled up together, resisting the wind.

Tian Yang snorted coldly and shifted his gaze.

Then, the great wind gradually subsided.

"It seems you have indeed made considerable progress." The Sacred Emperor said with some joy.

"You have recovered your consciousness and have a new understanding of your memories of 'Ancestor.' Furthermore, after sleeping in the earth veins for these years, although your main body has died, the knowledge gained by your puppet body is still a treasure. The world changes, time flows, and such are the affairs of the world..." Tian Yang's small body uttered words of profound沧桑 that were utterly incongruous.

"Oh, by the way... take a look at this."

After a while, Tian Yang took out a set of child's skeletal remains.
