However, he had not yet reached that level.

Even the Xuanhuang Realm’s Sacred Spirits he summoned did not possess the power of reality.

Only the trace of attack they unleashed in their final moments, or before their death, which was capable of harming the Doctrine Transmitter, was endowed with the attribute of "truth."

Real damage.

Therefore, the Doctrine Transmitter could not heal it through ordinary means.

Perhaps only by transforming this "real" damage back into nothingness could the scars disappear from his body.

Although it had inflicted considerable damage on the Doctrine Transmitter, the Sacred Emperor was not faring well either.

The power required to transform from illusion to reality far exceeded the Sacred Emperor's imagination.

In a short period, the supporting power from the Xuanhuang Realm had been completely depleted.

This was also the fundamental reason why the eternal Xuanhuang Realm suddenly became vulnerable after being attacked by the world fragment arm.

The power support that the Xuanhuang Realm could provide had reached its limit.

What later helped the Sacred Emperor through this difficult pass was another treasure from the Fishing Pond.

Like the Cat Treasure, there was not much additional information about it after it was fished up.

It only looked like a bare white ring.

Yet, such an inconspicuous object made the Cat Treasure feel annoyed and displeased.

After carrying it, the Cat Treasure did not follow.

However, the Cat Treasure itself had no combat function, so the Sacred Emperor ultimately decided to bring the white ring along.

The fact proved that the Sacred Emperor’s choice was correct.

The white ring had saved his life.

The origin of the white ring was unknown, but under its radiant light, any lifeless object would be decomposed into pure energy.

However, living beings were not affected.

Items attached to a cultivator's divine sense would still be decomposed. However, the cultivator's divine sense would not be harmed.

It seemed somewhat useless but was actually extremely powerful.

The sweeping world-arm, upon touching the white light, was all decomposed into energy.

Supplementing the Sacred Emperor's consumption in battle.

The battle had now reached a stalemate.

Although the Doctrine Transmitter's foundation was far deeper than the Sacred Emperor's, the Sacred Emperor had compensated for this gap with numerous fortuitous encounters.

Both were at the Supreme realm, having reached the peak of the star sea. It was not an easy matter for either of them to easily determine the other's life or death.

Otherwise, it would be too blasphemous to the term "Supreme."

"Fellow Daoist, may I borrow the item in your hand for a moment?"

During a lull in the fierce battle, the Doctrine Transmitter made this seemingly outrageous request to the Sacred Emperor.

"I merely wish to verify something. After observing it, I will return it," the Doctrine Transmitter said earnestly.

The Sacred Emperor fell into silence.

After a long while, the Sacred Emperor extended his hand and tossed the white ring over.

The Doctrine Transmitter nodded in acknowledgment, casually caught the white ring, and examined it carefully.

His eyebrows gradually rose, and then he sighed, "What a pity."

Then, just as he had promised earlier, he returned the white ring to the Sacred Emperor completely intact.

Furthermore, he did not take the opportunity to launch a sneak attack during this time.

"If I am not mistaken, this item should originate from beyond the High Wall."

"Originally, I thought it might be able to dissolve the High Wall, but I was overthinking…" the Doctrine Transmitter said self-mockingly.

Then, with a solemn expression, the Doctrine Transmitter looked at the Sacred Emperor and asked for the first time, "Fellow Daoist, from whence do you come? Are you from beyond the High Wall?"

It was no wonder that the Doctrine Transmitter suddenly asked this question.

From his perspective, the Sacred Emperor, who was at the Supreme realm and possessed many divine abilities, had appeared far too strangely.

The Sacred Emperor directly shook his head, denying the Doctrine Transmitter’s guess.

"I am the Chosen Sacred Emperor of Great Qi."

"A manifestation of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao."

"I wish to prop up the collapsing great structure, to turn the tide against the downfall, and to usher in the orthodox Azure Nether!" the Sacred Emperor said sternly.

The Doctrine Transmitter keenly sensed a hint of conspiracy in this.

"A manifestation of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao…"

"If the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao were as powerful as you, Fellow Daoist, how could it have fallen to its current state?"

"Forgive my bluntness, but the Xuanhuang Realm alone could never nurture someone like you," the Doctrine Transmitter said, his eyes flashing with certainty.

The Sacred Emperor was compelled to fall silent upon hearing this.

"In our struggle, there is likely a schemer plotting in the dark."

"I implore Fellow Daoist to reconsider and not fall into someone else's trap," the Doctrine Transmitter added.

"This person who can nurture someone as outstanding as you must be powerful. Yet, they have always remained in the shadows…"

A fierce glint flashed in the Doctrine Transmitter's eyes, "Their ambitions are indeed great."

"How about we join forces, Fellow Daoist, and first find this person? What do you say?" the Doctrine Transmitter suggested.

Upon hearing the Doctrine Transmitter’s words, the Sacred Emperor truly began to ponder.

Although his conviction to save the Xuanhuang Realm had never wavered, as his strength grew, so did his doubts about his true origins.

Especially after verifying that his bloodline originated from a mixture of three lineages, his inner confusion reached its peak then.

However, he had always suppressed it with his unwavering conviction.

But now, under the persuasion of Heavenly Venerate Doctrine Transmitter, this idea, which had been quelled, resurfaced from the ashes.

The Doctrine Transmitter continued, "I truly understand your feelings, Fellow Daoist."

"Look, if I hadn't worked tirelessly for so many years to patch up the Xuanhuang Realm, this last sanctuary of the abyssal sea of stars would have long since fallen into the Immortal Ruins."

With a wave of his hand, countless images appeared before the Sacred Emperor.

They showed the Doctrine Transmitter flying through the void, carrying world fragments that still held a sliver of life.

Even though he already knew what the Doctrine Transmitter had done for the Xuanhuang Realm.

Yet, upon witnessing the scene of the Doctrine Transmitter flying alone with a resolute gaze in the cold starry sky, the Sacred Emperor felt a touch of emotion.

"Although you and I have different approaches, in the end, we are both striving for that world," the Doctrine Transmitter said, pointing to the distant Xuanhuang Realm.

"But the person behind this may not be." The Doctrine Transmitter's tone turned somewhat cold.

"One of us will surely be injured in our struggle. Even during our battle, this hidden manipulator might be up to mischief within the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Can you rest assured that after your death, this person will still be hiding within the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"I, for one, cannot rest easy," Heavenly Venerate Doctrine Transmitter’s tone was filled with killing intent.

The Sacred Emperor's expression also turned grim.

He felt that what Heavenly Venerate Doctrine Transmitter said made some sense.

From the act of borrowing the white ring for observation and then returning it intact, the Doctrine Transmitter had already proven his character.

And the person instigating from behind had already revealed their ignoble qualities.

Whenever he decided to fight the Doctrine Transmitter again, it didn't matter.

But if he and the Doctrine Transmitter were both severely injured…

this mastermind might truly achieve their goal.

The Doctrine Transmitter saw the shift in the Sacred Emperor’s heart and nodded slightly.

Then, he began to inquire about the sequence of events from the Sacred Emperor.

"Lacking memories, suddenly descended upon this world."

"Faint connections, bloodline ties…"

As the Sacred Emperor described, the Doctrine Transmitter’s expression underwent subtle changes.

Then, the atmosphere between them, inadvertently, shifted from hostility to gradual harmony.

"To find this hidden manipulator is difficult, and yet not difficult."

"Since there are bloodline connections, I possess a secret technique that can sense all blood-related individuals within a certain range. However, this person is cunning and has likely already left the Xuanhuang Realm." the Doctrine Transmitter said.

Chapter 1298: Great Battle in the Star Sea (7k)

"I have also followed the subtle cosmic senses to search for this person's traces, but all attempts were in vain..." The Sacred Emperor spoke as he felt the rising winds of the Star Sea.

The revival of the Star Sea and its struggle against the residual True Immortal power was a rather prolonged process. On a human timescale, it would last for about a decade. Before this Star Sea storm reached its peak, he could wage war with the Doctrine Transmitter at any time. A temporary alliance did not signify an eternal reconciliation. The decision to cease hostilities and first pursue the mastermind was not only due to their equal strengths, making a decisive victory impossible, but also a strategy to buy time.

The Sacred Emperor's gaze inadvertently swept over the distant Xuanhuang Realm. The increasing number of cultivators who had attained the Foundation Establishment realm through the "Establishing Foundations with Self" method were weakening the Doctrine Transmitter's foundations. Moreover, the plan by the Stone Slab and If Wood to establish the Azure Nether Orthodoxy was progressing with unprecedented speed, especially after the Sacred Dynasty took over a large portion of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's former territories. Delaying until the Star Sea storm intensified to its peak was advantageous for the Sacred Emperor. Naturally, he welcomed the Doctrine Transmitter's proposal. Besides, the operation of fishing for treasures in the "Fishing Pond" had not stopped for a moment, and perhaps during this time, another supreme treasure capable of turning the tide of the battle would be caught.

With these thoughts rapidly turning in his mind, he issued orders through the Star Net to his subordinates. While conversing with the Doctrine Transmitter, the Sacred Emperor forced out a drop of blood from his brow. The Doctrine Transmitter coughed lightly, first repairing his tall crown that had been shattered in the recent battle. Then, light surged, concealing the small wounds all over his body. Observing this, the Sacred Emperor mused, "Could it be that the Doctrine Transmitter is delaying time to comprehend the principle of 'What is real when simulated, and false when simulated'?" Despite this suspicion, the Sacred Emperor was not worried that the Doctrine Transmitter could comprehend it within this timeframe. This was because he had a subtle cosmic sense that the method of "What is real when simulated, and false when simulated" possessed a unique characteristic and could not be simply understood through heaven-defying comprehension.

While the Sacred Emperor was contemplating, the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, who had already restored his original appearance—a benevolent elder with a tall crown—unleashed a series of incantations, enfolding the Sacred Emperor's blood hanging in the air. The light's color fluctuated continuously, finally settling on a light yellow, remarkably similar to the appearance of the Xuanhuang Realm. Seeing this, the Doctrine Transmitter's expression shifted slightly, but his actions did not cease as he continued his spellcasting. Within the light yellow sphere, the blood seemed to come alive, struggling vigorously. Then, two protrusions emerged. One pointed in the direction of the Xuanhuang Realm. The other… pointed directly outside the Star Sea! It was even spinning violently and unceasingly! It seemed as if the location it indicated was constantly changing its bearing!

"How could..." Seeing the Doctrine Transmitter's increasingly solemn expression, the Sacred Emperor also grew serious. He barely got the question out before the space around them violently churned. Unlike the storm caused by the Star Sea's revival, it felt as if something was about to burst forth from the ground. The Sacred Emperor and the Doctrine Transmitter simultaneously darted away to evade. They watched as the spinning protrusion within the light yellow sphere of blood gradually stopped. It pointed serenely forward. A moment later… faint ripples emanated from the area ahead, as if a drop of water had just fallen. Neither divine sense nor sight could locate a target, but both the Sacred Emperor and the Doctrine Transmitter knew that something had just descended before them.

The Doctrine Transmitter narrowed his eyes, a hint of reminiscence appearing. He then glanced at the Sacred Emperor's blood droplet, a flicker of confusion in his eyes. "Interesting. The mastermind behind this has actually revealed themselves..." Within the light yellow sphere, the Sacred Emperor's blood slowly burned away, but the protruding tip continued to point firmly at the void ahead.

"Immortal Boat..." the Doctrine Transmitter murmured. The Sacred Emperor also narrowed his eyes. He was certainly aware of the communication sword light that had appeared outside the Xuanhuang Realm earlier. Instantly, his mind raced with possibilities. "Could this involve a conspiracy related to this Immortal Boat?" the Sacred Emperor mused, a slight tremor in his heart. "But..." "The timing of this flying boat's appearance is too coincidental." The Sacred Emperor gazed ahead, not making the first move.

"The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat is a remnant of the ancient Profound Merchant Immortal Boat, which has been hiding in the endless ruins beneath the The Great Barrier..." the Doctrine Transmitter briefly explained the background of the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat to the Sacred Emperor. Looking at the magnificent scene at the edge of the Star Sea, beneath the The Great Barrier, the Sacred Emperor was momentarily entranced. Having had a brief contact with the origin intent of the Star Sea, he knew its infinite vastness. But precisely because of this, the terror of the The Great Barrier that firmly sealed this Star Sea was even more apparent.

"While you and I were battling, they appeared here..." "Let this old man see how much the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat has improved over the years." A cold glint flashed in the Doctrine Transmitter's eyes. He remained motionless, merely glancing indifferently. The space in front, which had been rippling due to the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat's passage, slowly calmed. Then, as if absolute freezing had descended, the space gradually entered a state of absolute stillness. A silence akin to the end of the Star Sea spread, with no fluctuations emanating from that dead zone.

"The divine abilities of the Doctrine Transmitter are indeed extraordinary." Witnessing this, the Sacred Emperor's pupils contracted. He pondered in his mind how he would counter this move. The absolute freeze did not last. Just as it was about to be completed, a brutal force suddenly surged forth, shattering the frozen realm completely. The image of the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat flashed and disappeared. The power released by the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat did more than just break the Doctrine Transmitter's frozen domain; it also resonated with the many residual immortal energies in this Star Sea. Like a hundred rivers converging, they surged and roiled in an instant. If the trap the Sacred Emperor had set up to divert the flow was a stream of residual True Immortal energies, then what was triggered now was a mighty river. Because they were counteracting the Star Sea's revival force, those residual True Immortal energies were already far more active than usual. Now, drawn by the scents of the Doctrine Transmitter and the Sacred Emperor's life force, they pursued like beasts that had caught the scent of their prey.

Both of them were forced to dodge. Although both had reached the limit of the Star Sea, known as "Supreme," they were still very wary of this True Immortal residual energy that could contend with the Star Sea itself. Especially since they were in a state of hostile cooperation, if one were to be severely injured, they would undoubtedly be at a disadvantage in the subsequent decisive battle. After all, residual True Immortal energy was not like ordinary techniques; it was not easily expelled. Each relied on their own abilities. The Sacred Emperor, by leveraging his connection to the Star Sea, could perceive the tidal wave of residual True Immortal energy almost clearly and dodge it skillfully. If he occasionally couldn't avoid it, the starlight from his long robe would flash, and the prayers surging from the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi would manifest primal force essence, quickly expelling the residual True Immortal energy.

The Doctrine Transmitter's method was quite peculiar. He once again took out the long arm formed from countless destroyed worlds, absorbing all the raging residual True Immortal energy as if they were two sponges. Some remnants, under the baptism of the residual True Immortal energy, turned into ashes. However, other remnants quickly filled their place within the long arm. One truly wondered how many fragments of worlds like these the Doctrine Transmitter had collected over the years.

Seeing that the Doctrine Transmitter and the Sacred Emperor had so easily resolved the crisis, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, having failed to divert the disaster, once again employed a technique. A yellowish paper talisman slowly floated down from the void. It appeared leisurely but was in reality extremely swift. The moment the Sacred Emperor and the Doctrine Transmitter sensed its existence, the talisman landed on them. This was precisely the unique characteristic of this paper talisman; although only one had floated down initially, because the target was two people, it landed on both of their heads simultaneously.

"True Immortal Script..." In both of their minds, the same thought flashed. Soon, they felt the power contained within this True Immortal Script. *Buzz!* First, the Sacred Emperor noticed that his connection to the Abyssal Star Sea had been severed. It was not that the True Immortal Script had directly severed it, but rather that the Star Sea's origin had proactively broken the connection. He could even faintly sense a hostility emanating from the Star Sea before the loss of contact. What was originally his half-home ground, where he could draw upon the power of the Star Sea with every gesture, now felt like being stuck in mud, with immense resistance in every movement. The Sacred Emperor also felt a strong malice from the Doctrine Transmitter, whom he had previously considered a temporary ally. In an instant, looking around, he saw enemies everywhere! What made the Sacred Emperor's heart grow colder was that the power support he obtained from the Sacred Dynasty was also slowly weakening. Although it wouldn't be immediately unusable, if this trend continued, the Sacred Dynasty would soon turn from an ally to an enemy, just like the Star Sea!

The Sacred Emperor, having never encountered such a situation before, surveyed his surroundings, his thoughts racing. "Is this the power of the True Immortal Script?" "It's not the residual energy commonly found in the Star Sea, but the complete power of a True Immortal..." In his mind, he tried to recall the pattern on the paper talisman he had just seen, but he could not remember any of it. While trying to cope with the increasingly intense hostile forces around him, the Sacred Emperor looked towards the Doctrine Transmitter not far away. Due to the escalating hostility, the distance between them had unconsciously widened. The Doctrine Transmitter's tall crown emitted a silver light like white jade, reflecting the statues of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate that stood tall in the Xuanhuang Realm. One of these statues emerged from the crown, its form solidifying in a flash of light. As soon as the stone statues materialized, they were subjected to an onslaught from all surrounding powers: the Star Sea's power, residual True Immortal energy, and even the Doctrine Transmitter himself... The statues shattered, and the violent explosion caused by the collision of multiple forces swept outward. When it reached the Sacred Emperor's position, it inexplicably shifted its target and surged towards him, as if it truly saw an irreconcilable foe.

The Sacred Emperor solemnly neutralized this impact while continuing to observe the Doctrine Transmitter's actions. As another statue emerged from the crown and was pulverized by the combined forces, the Sacred Emperor sensed that the power of the True Immortal Script imbued in the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate had weakened slightly. "Is he using the stone statues to evade hostility by feigning death?" the astute Sacred Emperor quickly understood the Doctrine Transmitter's intention. With a thought, a blurred phantom of the Sacred Emperor emerged from his starlight-infused Sacred Robe. As expected, the moment the phantom materialized, it was assaulted by all the surrounding forces. This included the Sacred Emperor himself. Even as he struck his own manifested phantom, the Sacred Emperor felt a faint, vengeful satisfaction. Although this illusion quickly vanished as the phantom dissipated, it still shook the Sacred Emperor profoundly. He and the Doctrine Transmitter had both reached the limits of the Star Sea, yet under the influence of the True Immortal Script, they were utterly defenseless. They could only resolve the impact of the True Immortal Script's influence through this "deadly method," and were incapable of directly confronting it with equal strength.

"Perhaps, after manifesting the Eternal Xuanhuang Realm, I can contend with it through my comprehension of 'What is Real When Simulated'," "As for the other means I currently possess..." The Sacred Emperor rapidly reviewed them in his mind and found none comparable. In the Star Sea, a rather comical scene unfolded: two "Supreme" powerhouses were pinned in place by a True Immortal Script, unable to move. The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, which had been observing for some time, finally made another move. To the somewhat disheveled Sacred Emperor, a transmission reached his ears.

"The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat merely seeks resources for survival in the Star Sea." "Perhaps we can cooperate." The Sacred Emperor was inwardly astonished. Seeing the Sacred Emperor's prolonged silence, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat sent another message: "We can help your Sacred Dynasty deal with the Doctrine Transmitter. However, after success, you must provide us with a place to dwell." "Rest assured, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat has only about a hundred thousand members in total. The Xuanhuang Realm is so vast, our presence makes little difference."

The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat's transmission was very sincere. Yet, this only deepened the Sacred Emperor's suspicion. If not for the previous clue from the Doctrine Transmitter's bloodline, which indicated that the mastermind might be aboard this Immortal Boat, the Sacred Emperor might have been genuinely moved. But now... The Sacred Emperor secretly pondered what the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat was truly planning. "Could it be trying to provoke us, seeing that the Doctrine Transmitter and I have reached an agreement?" The Sacred Emperor's assumption was almost natural.

The Sacred Emperor remained silent for a long time. Seemingly sensing the Sacred Emperor's hostility, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat sent another message, causing the Sacred Emperor's heart to tremble violently. "The Doctrine Transmitter is absolutely untrustworthy!" "Years ago, he infiltrated our Immortal Boat, pretending to admire it, and stole many secret treasures from on board!" "Although he disguised his appearance back then, he couldn't deceive us..." A deluge of information followed, plunging the Sacred Emperor back into silence.

"If you are interested, contact us using this method." The chaos caused by the True Immortal Script gradually subsided. Seeing the Sacred Emperor's continued lack of a reply, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat left a secret method and completely disappeared. The storm subsided, and the hostility from the mortal world also slowly faded. The connection with the Star Sea was also being repaired. However, the Sacred Emperor and the Doctrine Transmitter, who had already created distance between them, did not approach each other again.

"Although they escaped, we can still use your fellow Daoist's bloodline to track their location," the Doctrine Transmitter said slowly, looking at the Sacred Emperor. "This Profound Heaven Immortal Boat is quite troublesome, appearing and disappearing without a trace. Can't you track its whereabouts, fellow Daoist?" The Sacred Emperor, however, did not force out more blood but instead asked, "This Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, over the years, seems to have made some progress. Their research into the True Immortal Script has reached such a level. Although from our perspective, it is a misguidance... I must admit..." The Doctrine Transmitter looked out at the Star Sea. "Within this Abyssal Star Sea, it is indeed somewhat troublesome." "Small-scale residual True Immortal energy, perhaps not to be feared. But if it gathers like just now, you must be careful, fellow Daoist." "If you are inadvertently stained with an imprint, it may take considerable effort to remove it, and it could even affect your future Dao path..." the Doctrine Transmitter warned.

The Sacred Emperor pondered, looking at the residual True Immortal energy around them, which, though dispersed after the great commotion, had not vanished. "Is there no way to truly eliminate these forces? Apart from the Star Sea's own revival power," the Sacred Emperor asked. "Do you know why my progress in repairing the Xuanhuang Realm is so slow?" "Finding suitable materials is more difficult than searching for a needle in a haystack." "Residual True Immortal energy, without becoming a True Immortal, how can one remove it..." the Doctrine Transmitter shook his head slightly. The Sacred Emperor fell silent.

"The time left for me is actually not much," the Doctrine Transmitter suddenly said. The Sacred Emperor was taken aback and looked at the Doctrine Transmitter. However, the Doctrine Transmitter did not explain, but changed the subject, "Fellow Daoist, what are your plans now?" "Continue pursuing the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat and find the true mastermind..." "Or battle me?!" "Earlier, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat must have sent you some message, right?" The Doctrine Transmitter clearly saw the reason for the Sacred Emperor's changed attitude. The Sacred Emperor did not conceal it and nodded, asking, "Did you, fellow Daoist, ever go to the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat..." "Yes. I also took some things I needed," the Doctrine Transmitter admitted frankly. Hearing this, the Sacred Emperor couldn't help but gaze intently at this Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate. The Heavenly Venerate's candidness was rather beyond his expectations.

"Just as you wish to save the Xuanhuang Realm, I too have something I must uphold." Perhaps because he hadn't spoken to anyone for a long time, the Doctrine Transmitter began to chat as if speaking to an old friend. "To achieve this goal, one must resort to any means necessary." The Sacred Emperor neither agreed nor disagreed. The Doctrine Transmitter pointed to the Xuanhuang Realm emitting a faint glow not far away, slightly upward: "Fellow Daoist, have you ever visited the Immortal Ruins?" "No." "There sits a True Immortal who has attained the Dao. He is one of the culprits who caused this Star Sea tribulation. Have you ever considered that even if you defeat me, how will you be able to escape from this True Immortal with the entire Xuanhuang Realm in the future?" the Doctrine Transmitter asked. "The time left for the Xuanhuang Realm is not much," the Doctrine Transmitter sneered.

The Sacred Emperor remained silent again. "I have a way," the Doctrine Transmitter said proudly. "For the sake of the Azure Nether, disregarding a future that might be annihilated, can you truly be worthy of the title 'Sacred'?" the Doctrine Transmitter asked. The Sacred Emperor was not swayed by the Doctrine Transmitter's words: "If you can find a way to save the world, I can too." "But if I were to be convinced by your words and give up, how could I face the billions of citizens of the Sacred Dynasty?" The Doctrine Transmitter chuckled and stopped arguing with the Sacred Emperor, merely sighing, "Fellow Daoist, you do not know what I have experienced over the years..." A moment later, the Doctrine Transmitter said seriously, "I originally had no intention of being your enemy, nor do I fear you delaying time." "If you wish to fight, I will accompany you at any time." "Everything depends on your decision, fellow Daoist."

The Sacred Emperor listened to the Doctrine Transmitter's words and pondered for a long time. Just as he was about to speak, ripples suddenly arose in the surrounding space. It was the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, which had returned! This time, it did not directly attack with True Immortal Script, but instead sarcastically said, "As expected of the famous Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, truly better at talking than singing. I wonder when you will return the secret treasures you stole from our Profound Heaven Immortal Boat?" "Oh, and it's also thanks to our stolen secret treasures that the Xuanhuang Realm can exist safely beneath the Immortal Ruins for so long, right!" The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat's voice was filled with hatred for the Doctrine Transmitter. The Doctrine Transmitter did not retort. The Sacred Emperor, listening to these words, began to ponder what the so-called secret treasures stolen by the Doctrine Transmitter were.

Two Supreme beings and an ancient Immortal Boat confronted each other in the void. The contradiction between the Doctrine Transmitter and the Sacred Emperor lay in the irreconcilable conflict between the Doctrine Transmitter's foundation and the survival of the Xuanhuang Realm. As for the Immortal Boat and the Doctrine Transmitter, it was an ancient feud, one that could not be resolved. Logically, the Sacred Emperor and the Immortal Boat should have joined forces to deal with the Doctrine Transmitter, as that would have been the wise choice. However, the previous secret method that indicated a bloodline connection had pointed to the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, causing the Sacred Emperor a vague sense of unease, thus he had not made a decision. It wasn't entirely due to the Doctrine Transmitter's secret method; the Sacred Emperor himself had sensed a familiar aura from that Immortal Boat. If the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat came from beneath the The Great Barrier, then why was it related to his own origin? Everything was too murky, and the words the Doctrine Transmitter had spoken earlier forced the Sacred Emperor, who initially only wanted to defeat the Doctrine Transmitter, to consider more.

"Elder Gan chose a very good location. If it were any further away, even with the protection of the True Immortal Script's power, it would be difficult for your Immortal Boat to preserve itself." the Doctrine Transmitter said lightly, a cold glint flashing in his eyes. However, as if wary of something, he did not act rashly. The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, ignoring the Doctrine Transmitter, openly persuaded the Sacred Emperor to cooperate with them. "Fellow Daoist, you need not worry about the safety of the Xuanhuang Realm. We on the Immortal Boat have also found a way to save the Xuanhuang Realm." "Please take a look, fellow Daoist..." A large amount of footage was transmitted into the Sacred Emperor's mind. On the lands of the Xuanhuang Realm, countless towering obelisks spewed brilliant light upwards. The Xuanhuang Realm was thus slowly pushed away from the Immortal Ruins. The Sacred Emperor even recognized that the driving force behind these obelisks was the Sea of Darkness hidden deep within the Xuanhuang Realm!

"It seems..." "Feasible?" The Sacred Emperor deduced slightly, his heart filled with incomparable shock. "How would this Profound Heaven Immortal Boat know about the existence of the Sea of Darkness?" As if seeing the Sacred Emperor's doubt, the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat proactively explained, "Many years ago, our Profound Heaven Immortal Boat visited the Xuanhuang Realm and had extensive exchanges..." However, these words did not dispel the Sacred Emperor's doubts; instead, his wariness intensified. And listening to the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat's persuasion of the Sacred Emperor, the Doctrine Transmitter, who had been somewhat dismissive, was surprised by the slight change in the Sacred Emperor's expression, and his gaze towards the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat shifted again. Too many incomprehensible events that were beyond his control had occurred during this period. This had never happened in the past thousands of years. But the Doctrine Transmitter believed that as long as he could capture the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat, all questions could be resolved. Although considering the Xuanhuang Realm and the True Immortal who had attained the Dao, this place was not suitable for a fight, the Doctrine Transmitter did not believe the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat could stay here forever. The Doctrine Transmitter's gaze turned towards the depths of the Star Sea, where an aura was rapidly approaching. "Once it arrives, it won't matter if we fight here," the Doctrine Transmitter said, his eyes fixed on the Sacred Emperor and the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat who were conversing, before closing his eyes slightly.

The situation in the field was extremely delicate. At this moment, a fluctuation from the Xuanhuang Realm attracted the attention of all three parties present. The Xuanhuang Realm, which had become somewhat weak due to the remote support of the Sacred Emperor's power, was now surging with abundant life force. *Bang! Bang!* The sounds of a vigorous heartbeat were clearly audible. The Azure Nether light masses churned continuously, as if something was being gestured within them. The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat was bewildered. The Sacred Emperor's face showed surprise. He sensed that his connection to the Xuanhuang Realm was rapidly fading. Although the emotional connection remained, from now on, it could no longer provide any assistance. The Doctrine Transmitter's face first showed shock, then disbelief. Then, as if sensing something, his eyes erupted with a brilliant light. He completely disregarded the other two and flew rapidly towards the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat reacted a moment later. Its tone was one of horror, then extreme joy: "Immortal Spiritual Qi! And such dense Immortal Spiritual Qi! This..." "At least two or three Immortal Artifacts! The Xuanhuang Realm is truly a treasure trove!" The Profound Heaven Immortal Boat followed closely, turning into a stream of light as it fled. The Sacred Emperor, through the Star Net and the perspectives of the soldiers of Great Qi, also sensed what was happening in the Xuanhuang Realm. "The true Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate has descended." There was no sense of loss for having been "disgraced," only intense unease in the Sacred Emperor's heart. It was as if, starting from this moment, events had completely spiraled out of control. An invisible hand was orchestrating everything from the shadows. The Doctrine Transmitter, he himself, and the newly born Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate of the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat... all seemed to be under its manipulation. "What exactly..." The Sacred Emperor's heart felt heavy. In an instant, he arrived outside the Xuanhuang Realm.

Compared to before, the Xuanhuang Realm had undergone significant changes. It was as if a long-dormant mechanism had been activated, and peculiar energies emanated from various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm. Ancient, old, and then nurturing miraculous power. "This..." A trace of horror flashed in the Sacred Emperor's eyes. "Immortal Spiritual Qi?" At the same time, he saw the Doctrine Transmitter with a gloomy expression, and the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat blocked by him. Wisps of Immortal Spiritual Qi diffused from all over the Xuanhuang Realm, their source undetermined. However, that sacred and ancient power... was certainly not a good thing for the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm. *Bang! Bang! Bang!* Countless cultivators, upon contact with the wisps of Immortal Spiritual Qi, looked ecstatic. Then, in an instant, they exploded into fragments. How could mortal flesh endure True Immortal power?

Chapter 1299: Immortals Descend, All Things Return to the Void (7K)

Since the severance of the Immortal Path, the Xuanhuang Realm had not experienced the aura of immortal Spirit Qi for an immeasurable number of years.

Yet, at this very moment, these wisps of sacred energy born from the earth and reaching upwards seemed to bring no benefit to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Instead, they ushered in a catastrophe comparable to extinction.

The greed of cultivators was a hundred times more frenzied than witnessing the Essence of Heaven and Earth. They would pursue and obtain it, even if it meant abandoning everything they possessed. Anyone who dared to stand in their way was an enemy to be killed. This applied to the soldiers of the Great Qi Dynasty and the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance alike. Their identity, rank, or cultivation realm mattered not.

The original conflict between the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi and the Myriad Immortals Alliance transformed into a chaotic free-for-all among all cultivators as this immortal Spirit Qi was released.

With every breath, thousands of cultivators perished.

The sky, due to the continuous and successive strange phenomena, was piled high with a thick layer of peculiar, continuous clouds. Even the terror brought by the presence of Dharma-Preachers could not dispel them.

Throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm, only two armies managed to maintain their sanity amidst such a terrifying apocalyptic scene.

One was the Great Qi Imperial Guard. The other was the Azure Profound Army, guarding the Chizha Abyss.

Their commonality was that both had cultivated the [Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation].

The Great Qi Imperial Guard was directly taught by the Sacred Emperor.

The Azure Profound Army, however, had been instructed by the Sacred Embryo before leaving the Xuanhuang Realm.

As a select few fortunate individuals, they witnessed the tragedy unfolding in the Xuanhuang Realm, their faces pale, their bodies trembling. Even with the Heart Refining Incantation operating spontaneously to maintain their sanity, the instinctive fear in their hearts could not be quelled.

It wasn't just cultivators.

Birds and beasts, plants and flowers, even the mountains and rivers – everything in the Xuanhuang Realm was slowly losing control due to the appearance of the immortal Spirit Qi.

All beasts behaved like humans, recklessly pursuing the immortal Spirit Qi, either achieving their desire and exploding to death or perishing miserably in the ensuing struggles.

While plants could not actively pursue it, there were fortunate ones who received the immortal Spirit Qi from the heavens, obtaining it effortlessly. Compared to other life forms in the world, most plants turned to dust the moment they received the immortal Spirit Qi. However, some managed to survive the purging of this immense power. It was thought that this would create an immortal plant in the Xuanhuang Realm. To their surprise, before long, mad cultivators, drawn by its scent, arrived. Although the mutated immortal plant underwent transformation in a short period and gained defensive power, it couldn't withstand the fearless attacks of the cultivators. Before long, it was divided and consumed by them.

Subsequently, those who had luckily snatched and consumed the immortal plant also exploded, their flesh and blood turning to ash and smoke shortly thereafter.

However, this time, with the immortal plant acting as a filter, they were able to savor the bliss of the immortal Spirit Qi for a while longer, ultimately perishing in their intoxication and enlightenment.

If there was any existence in the entire Azure Nether Heaven and Earth that could truly benefit from the indiscriminately spreading immortal Spirit Qi...

Then it was the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth itself.

Like parched land receiving the blessings of a torrential downpour.

The Xuanhuang Realm was enveloped in a fantastical, hazy radiance.

The earth rumbled, mountains leaped and plains stretched. A transformation that should have taken millennia now occurred in the blink of an eye.

The celestial dome, which had slightly fallen due to the prior support of the Great Qi Sacred Emperor, was now slowly regaining its former posture, even appearing more distant.

The Xuanhuang Realm was "growing" at a visible speed.

Amidst the peculiar rhythm, the White Mist Barriers, which originally marked the boundaries between prefectures, gradually dimmed under the immense pressure of the Xuanhuang Realm's self-growth.

Many barrier structures even dissipated with a deafening roar like thunder. Their power was absorbed as nourishment, merging into the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth.

The growth of the Xuanhuang Realm brought such a significant increase in its overall strength.

The anomalies in the sky, accumulated from the excessive number of fallen cultivators, were also rapidly being "digested."

...

In the face of this unprecedented change in the Xuanhuang Realm, the three forces that had arrived one after another from beyond the starry sky reacted differently.

The Sacred Emperor paused momentarily amidst this world-altering transformation.

In his perception, the bond with the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth, formed through his previous actions, grew weaker and weaker as the realm expanded. It felt like childhood friends slowly growing apart as they matured.

A sense of loss washed over him, but the Sacred Emperor quickly regained his composure. Looking at the Great Qi soldiers still engaged in incessant combat, he moved his mind and directly transmitted the [Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation] to all of them. While few among the maddened cultivators could still focus on cultivation, he reasoned that saving even one was better than none.

Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate watched this dramatic change with a complicated expression.

It was unclear what he was thinking, but the only action he took was to tightly control the stirring Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat beside him.

From the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat, the voices of the elders echoed:

"What a waste! What a terrible waste! Immortal Spirit Qi is rare in the Star Sea! How can it be squandered by these mortals!"

"If I could obtain even a wisp, perhaps I could fully unleash the power of the True Immortal Script..."

"Doctrine Transmitter! Step aside! Let us from the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat gather some immortal Spirit Qi. Past grievances can be settled!"

Gan Jingda managed to restrain his inner excitement and said in a deep voice, "You and your Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat..."

"Remain here and watch obediently."

"Do not go anywhere!"

Gan Jingda scoffed, unable to suppress his rage, "What arrogance! If you continue to obstruct us, do not blame the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat for showing no mercy!"

"Although the Xuanhuang Realm is indeed the last pure land in this Star Sea... relatively speaking, immortal Spirit Qi is more important!"

"Exactly! Jingda, stop wasting words with this old fogey! That's immortal Spirit Qi! If we can control more of it, perhaps we can cross the The Great Barrier with its help! Why must we remain in this Abyssal Sea!"

Listening to the cacophony echoing from the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat, which sounded like a bustling marketplace, Doctrine Transmitter's expression remained unchanged, only a flicker of mockery in his eyes.

Hidden beneath the rumbling of the world, the quiet sound of footsteps echoed behind the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat.

Without any warning, a shadow attached itself to the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat.

An instant later...

The entire Immortal Boat vanished into thin air.

As if it had never come to the Xuanhuang Realm.

The footsteps gradually faded into the distance, leaving behind only a faint, frost-like aura of death.

Witnessing this scene, the Sacred Emperor's pupils contracted sharply.

"What was that?!"

The shadow moved with incredible speed, both in its arrival and departure.

Not only were the occupants of the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat caught off guard, but even the Sacred Emperor couldn't get a clear look.

He could only vaguely sense the intensely concentrated, almost tangible aura of death emanating from that figure.

The Sacred Emperor couldn't help but look towards Doctrine Transmitter. It was clear that Doctrine Transmitter had anticipated the appearance of this shadow, and perhaps the attack on the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat was even at Doctrine Transmitter's behest.

"I don't have that much ability to make this thing obey me obediently. It was merely a subtle hint I gave to it."

"This thing is perfectly suited to deal with those people from the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat."

Doctrine Transmitter's gaze remained fixed on the transformation occurring in the Xuanhuang Realm. He paid no further attention to the mysterious shadow or the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat.

Knowing that Doctrine Transmitter would not explain further, the Sacred Emperor did not press him. Instead, he surveyed the world from the same vantage point.

The drastic change in the Xuanhuang Realm continued.

If the Xuanhuang Realm's overall power before the spread of immortal Spirit Qi was "1," then in less than half a day, its overall power had swelled to nearly "19." This wasn't purely due to the mystique of immortal Spirit Qi, but rather it acted as a catalyst, allowing the Xuanhuang Realm to truly absorb and integrate the primal force of the various external worlds.

If, previously, it was a simple blood fusion, then what the Xuanhuang Realm was doing now was akin to cultivators absorbing Spirit Qi from spirit stones and transforming it into their own. The efficiency was immeasurably higher.

Even...

The latent world power, previously hidden deep within the external worlds and dormant, was now, under the impetus of the immortal Spirit Qi, being discovered by the Xuanhuang Realm. It became sustenance for the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Hehehehe..."

"So that's how it is."

Sensing the increasingly rapid aura from beyond the starry sky, Doctrine Transmitter suddenly let out a laugh of realization.

His laughter ceased abruptly.

Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's expression suddenly changed, and he looked towards the Sacred Emperor.

"Come, let's fight again!"

With a blank expression, in an instant he unleashed another move, [Object in Palm], striking towards the Sacred Emperor.

Without the support of the Xuanhuang Realm's power, he couldn't unleash [Eternal Xuanhuang Realm]. However, having previously broken this move, the essence of golden primal force transformed into colossal pillars supporting the sky, erupting from the ground. They firmly held back Doctrine Transmitter's descending palm.

At the moment of collision, the Sacred Emperor perceived that Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate was not exerting his full strength. The power of this [Object in Palm] was incomparable to the one previously unleashed in the starry sky. Moreover, the Sacred Emperor saw that after trapping him, Doctrine Transmitter immediately attempted to leave, seemingly in a hurry to find something to prevent the Xuanhuang Realm's drastic transformation.

The Sacred Emperor instantly understood something. Although it was somewhat unbelievable, he unleashed his full strength and broke free from Doctrine Transmitter's giant palm.

"Sacred Heart Eternal."

"Sacred Favor Endures!"

The Sacred Emperor chanted loudly, and a beam of light shone down from the Great Qi pocket world. This was the refined primal force stored in the Sacred Heart Palaces across the Great Qi. It was one of the Sacred Emperor's last trump cards. Once depleted, his combat power would be significantly weakened, but the Sacred Emperor showed no hesitation at this moment.

Driven by the dispersion and propulsion of immortal Spirit Qi, the integration of various worlds, led by the Xuanhuang Realm, was underway. Things were moving in a direction favorable to the Xuanhuang Realm.

"As long as I can stall Doctrine Transmitter..."

"My mission will be considered complete."

"Although it took some detours."

The Sacred Emperor thought this and engaged Doctrine Transmitter in combat once more.

Neither of them wished to destroy the Xuanhuang Realm, so they both restrained their power. The Xuanhuang Realm, after its integration and transformation, could now withstand much larger fluctuations. For a time, the battle between Doctrine Transmitter and the Sacred Emperor fell into a stalemate.

...

On the Azure Nether land.

Countless cultivators were still fighting fiercely to contend for the immortal Spirit Qi.

Tongyan Prefecture.

For some unknown reason, the immortal Spirit Qi gathered here seemed to be more abundant than in other prefectures. Therefore, the fighting here was the most brutal.

After another intense battle, it still ended with a Soul Transformation cultivator turning to dust in complete satisfaction.

As too many cultivators had already died, the competition was no longer as fierce as before. A rare period of calm emerged in the fighting.

Before cultivators appeared again, a small figure of golden light quietly arrived. Gazing at the strand of immortal Spirit Qi before him, greediness flashed in the golden figure's eyes. However, this greed seemed different from the desire of the Xuanhuang Realm's cultivators.

Just as the figure was about to make a move, it suddenly sensed something and looked back. It saw a dark-faced, somewhat lecherous-looking cultivator with a full beard, attempting to approach. He was holding a net, seemingly trying to capture the golden figure along with the immortal Spirit Qi.

The black-faced man, having been discovered, quickly put away the net in his hand and let out a loud laugh.

"Courting death..." A murderous glint flashed in the golden figure's eyes. The cultivation of the person before him was far too low; he could have easily killed him with a single blow. Yet, this person dared to harbor such intentions towards him... Just as he was about to act, he suddenly felt a sense of crisis. He made an instantaneous, decisive decision, abandoning the immortal Spirit Qi that was within his grasp, and instantly transformed into a stream of light, flying away.

Watching the golden figure disappear in the blink of an eye, Jiao Xiuyuan slapped his thigh, filled with regret.

"Damn it, I tracked him for so long, and he still got away!"

His expression shifted, and finally, Jiao Xiuyuan chose not to pursue the golden figure further. Instead, he solemnly looked towards the immortal Spirit Qi that was about to dissipate into the heavens and earth. His eyes held some greed for this rare treasure of the Star Sea, but not much. More than greed, there was an unprecedented sense of caution. He extended his hand, and a seedling emerged from his palm. Soon, the seedling grew into a small tree, its green leaves swaying in the wind. He carefully guided the strand of immortal Spirit Qi before him to the tree, absorbing it slowly. Jiao Xiuyuan closed his eyes, concentrating on sensing it. After a while.

"It truly is immortal Spirit Qi," a sharp glint flashed in Jiao Xiuyuan's eyes, followed by a surge of confusion. "It's too strange. With so much immortal Spirit Qi, there are so many things that can be done. Why is it being wasted like this?" The more he thought, the more uneasy Jiao Xiuyuan felt. "And..." Jiao Xiuyuan looked up at the sky. At that very moment, he seemed to faintly sense a familiar aura. Although it had already disappeared. "Could it be my imagination?" "There's no reason for it. If it were truly those guys, they would definitely be scrambling for immortal Spirit Qi right now." Jiao Xiuyuan's brow furrowed. Sensing someone approaching, he flashed away.

...

The Myriad Immortals Alliance Headquarters was in chaos.

Not long ago, due to Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's return to the Xuanhuang Realm, all Dharma-Preachers, Mirror Controllers, and even the faction of Illusory Sage had temporarily departed to pay their respects to the Heavenly Venerate. During this period, a world-shattering explosion occurred in the Divine Treasure Museum. Not only were many artifacts within the museum damaged, but the entire Alliance Headquarters was also violently shaken.

Before the surviving Alliance cultivators could even investigate the cause of the accident, they were horrified to discover that the Alliance Headquarters had been severed from the outside world.

Confused as to what had happened, a sense of panic spread throughout the Alliance.

However, the panic had not yet reached the Law Enforcement Hall, within the Dharma Deduction space. The continuous tremors made the three Dao Integration realm guardians feel uneasy. Especially "Sun Ang." His aura fluctuated, his complexion turned ruddy, and sweat occasionally dripped from his forehead.

"Fellow Daoist Sun, are you alright?" the three had worked together for a considerable time and had become quite close. Zhang Xu couldn't help but inquire. Although he also felt a slight palpitation, he was nowhere near as distressed as Sun Ang. "He's still too young, after all," Zhang Xu thought to himself.

"Something seems wrong," Sun Ang, who was actually Li Fan's true form, said with a guilty look. "I tried to contact Elder Xu just now, but there was no response." Hua Yueye comforted him, "Brother Sun doesn't need to worry too much. Even if something happened, the Alliance Headquarters would definitely be fine." Zhang Xu also frowned, "Actually, my predecessor who guarded this place also experienced a similar situation. It was about five hundred years ago. The space was also violently shaking, and communication with the outside world was lost. But it was fine afterward."

"I hope so," Li Fan said, wiping the cold sweat from his forehead. Within the Dharma Deduction space, an eerie silence descended once more. The violent tremors that occasionally occurred struck at the hearts of the three. Li Fan's divine sense settled, even ignoring the call of the Dharma Deduction Jade. He wasn't as distressed as he appeared on the surface. On the contrary, Li Fan felt better than ever before.

"Immortal Spirit Qi... so this is immortal Spirit Qi..." In his sea of consciousness, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc was emitting an unprecedentedly brilliant radiance. Having truly seen the legendary immortal Spirit Qi, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc finally completed the last piece of the puzzle for inferring Immortal-grade Great Formations. In the past, despite obtaining diagrams of three Immortal-grade formations through various coincidences, they remained castles in the sky, mere theoretical knowledge without immortal Spirit Qi. Although the formations were profound, they were still within the limits of mortal capabilities. But now, the situation was completely different! Armed with the knowledge of what immortal Spirit Qi truly was and with the supplementary data, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc was truly moving towards breaking the mortal limits. It now possessed the ability to truly infer and execute [Immortal Formations]. Although it required guiding the immortal spiritual power, it became possible for Li Fan to activate an Immortal Formation through the Xuanhuang Realm's inherent ancient protective Great Formation and the newly appointed Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate. The formation was named [Immortals Descend, All Things Return to the Void]!

It had to be said that this life had seen many unforeseen events that caught Li Fan off guard. These included, but were not limited to, the uncontrolled state of the Sacred Emperor's clone, and his unexpected cooperation with Doctrine Transmitter.

"Once one's strength reaches a certain level, it becomes nearly impossible to control them like chess pieces." Fortunately, his numerous contingency plans prevented the situation from spiraling completely out of control, saving him from being forced to return to his true self despite his plans reaching such a critical stage. The sudden arrival of the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat was undoubtedly a credit to Li Fan's Sacred Embryo. In successfully persuading the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat to embark on an expedition to the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan not only collected ancient records of the Immortal Boat's heritage, proving the possible existence of complete True Immortal Scripts within the Immortal Ruins, but he also secretly controlled cultivators to heavily damage the Immortal Boat's Divine Tree. With the Divine Tree's damage and loss of its foundation for survival, the occupants of the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat had no choice but to unanimously decide to advance their expedition to the Xuanhuang Realm. Although the Immortal Boat's Elder Council suspected that someone had secretly instigated these events, the fact of the Divine Tree's severe damage was undeniable. The perpetrator had also self-detonated, leaving no witnesses. To continue surviving in this Abyssal Sea, coming to the Xuanhuang Realm was their only option. Upon nearing the Xuanhuang Realm, as a precaution, the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat did not immediately attack. Instead, they planned to first secretly scout the Xuanhuang Realm's strength, infiltrate stealthily, and introduce a portion of their forces. However, before their plan could be implemented, the violent energy fluctuations in the void attracted the attention of the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat. Naturally, this was the battle between Doctrine Transmitter and the Sacred Emperor. The power displayed by the two Supreme experts in their every move made the occupants of the Immortal Boat extremely solemn. However, they later discovered that Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate was the bandit who had stolen the Immortal Boat's secret treasures, and their own existence seemed to have been detected by him. The Immortal Boat was then forced to reveal itself. In their confrontation with the two Supreme experts, the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat consumed an almost complete True Immortal Script. The Sacred Embryo speculated that it was the script for "Hatred," personally penned by the Grand Elder Zhong Daogong, who had never appeared before the public and dedicated himself solely to studying partial True Immortal power. Grand Elder Zhong Daogong's strength was unfathomable. For this expedition plan, he had released three nearly complete True Immortal Scripts. However, after the first script, "Hatred," did not yield particularly good results, the occupants of the Immortal Boat became cautious. They began scheming for alliances. But their plans were abruptly interrupted by the fluctuating immortal Spirit Qi emanating from the Xuanhuang Realm. Upon arriving at the Xuanhuang Realm and witnessing the true immortal Spirit Qi coursing wildly everywhere, and sensing the awakened True Immortal characters spread throughout the entire Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat, the people on the Immortal Boat went completely mad. Even Grand Elder Zhong Daogong appeared for the first time, looking at the immortal Spirit Qi below with a dazed expression. "It's pure immortal Spirit Qi," Zhong Daogong concluded after observing for a moment. "Ordinary cultivators cannot utilize it, but we can." "Guide the immortal spiritual power, and infuse it according to the operational principles of the True Immortal Script's origin..." Zhong Daogong muttered to himself, reaching his final conclusion: "The unleashed power will be enough to rival a [True Immortal]!" "If we unleash the Immortal Boat's entire inventory..." "We might be able to leap over the The Great Barrier with this!" Zhong Daogong's words quickly unified the Immortal Boat's crew. However, just as they were about to force Doctrine Transmitter to clear a path. Zhong Daogong let out a roar of "Caution."

It was too late.

One moment, the Xuanhuang Realm was filled with chaotic immortal Spirit Qi. The next second, an unknown space appeared. Zhong Daogong reacted the fastest, unleashing a character. The entire Immortal Boat instantly fell silent. Everyone's foreheads were beaded with cold sweat as they looked at the scene outside the Immortal Boat. It was as if they were in a pot, with the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat floating on the water's surface. Outside the pot, an unseen presence seemed to be stirring the water within. The water surface rotated incessantly, and the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat drifted unstably. The occupants of the Immortal Boat clearly felt the surrounding temperature drop significantly.

"Everyone, what do we do now?" After a long while, Elder Gan attempted to communicate via spiritual transmission. However, it seemed this transmission could be heard by the invisible presence above the pot.

*Dong! Dong! Dong!*

The figure peeked down, gazing downwards. The temperature inside the Immortal Boat dropped again. Just with this glance, one-tenth of the life forms on the Immortal Boat couldn't endure and perished directly. What made the people on the Immortal Boat even more terrified was that the deceased on the Immortal Boat transformed into faint white light, passing through the flying boat and heading towards the outside. A small ball condensed in the unseen being's hand. Inside the ball lay the recently deceased occupants of the Immortal Boat! The ball was put away by the unseen being, which seemed to have noticed living creatures below. It cast its gaze again. This time, it even attempted to reach out its hand and scoop up the Immortal Boat from the pot. The occupants of the Immortal Boat were plunged into a profound chill. At the critical moment, Zhong Daogong unleashed another True Immortal Script. The movement of the unseen being slowed down. Then, as if it had forgotten about its previous actions, it slowly stopped scooping up the Immortal Boat, but it did not leave. It continued to stir the water within.

Having witnessed the previous incident, the occupants of the Immortal Boat no longer dared to communicate with their divine sense. Instead, they resorted to the most primitive method of communication, using their hands as brushes to gesture and write in the air.

"Elder Zhong, what on earth is that thing outside?"

"Its gaze seems to absorb the vitality of living beings. That glance just now caused heavy casualties on the Immortal Boat."

"And it appears to make no distinction based on cultivation level, seeming to be random..."

"The Xuanhuang Realm possesses such a terrifying existence?!"

...

Fear mingled with chaos, coalescing within the Immortal Boat. Meanwhile, Li Fan gazed out at the scene beyond the Immortal Boat. This unseen being was something he had encountered before this life, prior to venturing out of the Xuanhuang Realm, when he was exploring the Gate of Life and Death with Young Master Shang. He had initially thought the entire reversed formation was a mere pocket world, but in reality, it was only one of nine Yin-Yang Pearls. Each Yin-Yang Pearl contained countless ancient, frozen cultivators.

"Doctrine Transmitter, to actually be able to control this unseen being..."

"It seems he truly has some connection with Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth."

"This being's aura is ancient, it must have existed since the primordial Xuanhuang Realm."

Seeing this creature again, Sacred Embryo Li Fan's feelings were different. Zhong Daogong's subsequent analysis also confirmed his suspicions.

"This thing is likely not a living being."

"In the records of the Immortal Boat, there might be something that corresponds to it." Zhong Daogong's fingertips moved rapidly in the air, expounding on his conjecture.

"In the ancient cultivation world, those closely associated with the Upper Realm, besides establishing the position of [Great Heavenly Venerate] responsible for communication with the Immortal Realm,"

"They would occasionally establish [Watchers] to prevent potential loss of control."

"Watchers did not necessarily exist in every cultivation world, nor were they necessarily living beings or cultivators."

"But undoubtedly, they carried out missions bestowed by the Immortal Realm."

"Missions entirely different from those of the Great Heavenly Venerates."

The aura of the Immortal Boat's occupants became noticeably disorganized. The creations of the Immortal Realm were clearly beyond their ability to handle. Because they were adept at wielding the power of True Immortal Scripts, the occupants of the Immortal Boat knew firsthand how powerful [Immortals] were. And how weak could a [Watcher] tasked by an Immortal be?

An atmosphere of despair began to emerge within the Heavenly Mysteries Profound Boat. Fortunately, what Zhong Daogong wrote next revitalized them.

Chapter 1300: Golden Needles Reverse the Azure Nether (7k) Request for Monthly Votes!

"The Monitor bears a mission from the Immortal Realm, and is possibly even a creation of True Immortals. Ordinary powers cannot oppose it."

"Although the immortal path has long been severed, as long as they still exist, they will resolutely execute their missions forever. This is precisely the hope for our escape…" Zhong Gongdao quickly wrote in the air.

"This Xuanhuang Realm Monitor does not seem to attack us proactively. As long as we don't make a sound and attract its attention, we should be temporarily safe. However, remaining in this pot is not a long-term solution. I can feel that the longer we stay here, the faster our vital energy will dissipate."

"The Monitor only cares about its mission. We must quickly figure out what the mission of this fellow above is, and then find a way to escape…"

Everyone looked up, their gazes passing through the Mystic Immortal Boat, landing on the terrifying figure by the edge of the giant pot, stirring the water.

"Do not observe, lest it cause unforeseen changes." Elder Gan Jingda waved his hand, temporarily shielding everyone's sight.

Nangong Lie of the Academy for Proving the Dao, with a solemn expression, wrote and asked, "If we use the power of True Immortal Sigils to create chaos, is there any hope of escaping? Although the Monitor is powerful, it cannot defy True Immortal power, right?"

Zhong Gongdao shook his head slightly and explained, "Indeed, it should not be able to completely resist the influence of True Immortal Sigils. The character 【谖】 that I just used has already proven this. However, it still has an inextricable connection with the Immortal Realm. Compared to us mortal cultivators, the Monitor possesses a certain ability to resist True Immortal power."

"This current Monitor, after being struck by the 【谖】 character, only forgot its previous actions and did not leave this pot…" Zhong Gongdao’s meaning was self-evident.

Ai Tianjue also nodded in agreement: "That's right, using True Immortal Sigils to create chaos is too risky. Just one glance just now annihilated a tenth of our Immortal Boat's population. If it can resist for a moment… even if we can escape, not many of the Immortal Boat will survive."

Zhong Gongdao continued, "Esteemed elders, we must also consider what happens after we escape from here. If we exhaust all the accumulated True Immortal Sigils, how will we contend with the Dharma-Preachers of the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"Yes, this injustice must be avenged. Even if we can't get any Immortal Spiritual Qi, we will definitely get some resources in the Xuanhuang Realm!" Zhang, the master of the Immortal Boat's Star Forging Workshop, had a ferocious expression.

…

After the Immortal Boat's elders deliberated, they reached a consensus. First, dispatch personnel to fly out of the pot and scout the surrounding environment. Strive to understand the possible mission of this terrifying Monitor. At the same time, be prepared for the Immortal Boat to be discovered by the Monitor and to fight for survival.

Soon, twenty cultivators left the Immortal Boat and flew towards the outside of the pot.

Some, before even flying out of the giant pot's range, were drawn in by the invisible vortex within and plunged into the water, disappearing completely.

As for those who had the strength to fly out of the pot's range, the vast majority were discovered by the invisible Monitor and had their life force directly extracted, being squeezed into small balls.

Only one person managed to escape the Monitor's range by chance, but never returned.

The Mystic Immortal Boat then deployed another hundred cultivators.

Although three cultivators completed their reconnaissance this time, they were all discovered by the Monitor without exception when they were returning and trying to enter the pot.

They were squeezed into spheres and died instantly.

"Throwing our lives away like this is not a solution!"

"Let's just fight it directly!"

"If our strength is too weak, we can't even fly out of this pot. If our strength is too strong, we will definitely be discovered by the Monitor…"

"Especially the elders who have attained the Dao, going there is just sending yourselves to your deaths!"

…

Within the Immortal Boat, the atmosphere once again plunged into despair.

At this moment, Zhao Xian, the body possessed by the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, stepped forward.

Li Fan looked at Ai Tianjue and resolutely wrote, "Teacher, I want to try."

All the elders of the Immortal Severing Tower were moved.

They had a very good impression of this talented young descendant.

Ai Tianjue reached out and refused Li Fan's request.

The Immortal Severing Tower was now the highest authority on the Immortal Boat, and Li Fan was a direct descendant of the Immortal Severing Tower. Naturally, there was some preferential treatment.

Zhong Gongdao, pushing aside all objections, dispatched another reconnaissance team of three hundred people.

The result was still a complete annihilation.

Watching the fresh lives being ruthlessly squeezed into spheres by the Monitor, a cold dread began to accumulate in the hearts of everyone on the Immortal Boat.

When Zhong Gongdao was about to issue another order, he looked at the trembling bodies and despair in the eyes of the cultivators before him, and he hesitated.

It wasn't that he had softened, but he also began to doubt if such probing was useful.

Just then, Li Fan stepped forward again.

"Elder Zhong, this humble disciple is willing to try." Although a flicker of fear flashed in Li Fan's eyes at first, it was quickly replaced by immense determination.

The elders of the Immortal Severing Tower, looking at the cultivators from other organizations on the Immortal Boat, sighed inwardly.

In the end, they agreed to Li Fan's request.

After a simple farewell to his mentors, under everyone's watchful eyes, Li Fan calmly flew out of the Mystic Immortal Boat.

"Brother Tianjue, you've got a good disciple."

Elder Zhong, who rarely interacted with others, said to Ai Tianjue this time.

Ai Tianjue nodded slightly, his expression complex.

He breathed a sigh of relief as he watched Li Fan successfully leave the giant pot.

What followed was a long wait.

As time passed, everyone waited in vain for Li Fan's return.

The spark of hope slowly extinguished.

Just as Zhong Gongdao thought Li Fan had also failed and died, and was preparing to send out a final reconnaissance team, a figure flew openly past the Monitor stirring the water in the pot.

Descending from the sky, they returned to the Mystic Immortal Boat!

It was Li Fan!

Although the Monitor was above, everyone dared not make a sound, but the expressions on the faces of everyone on the Immortal Boat fully conveyed their excitement at that moment.

After losing nearly five hundred core members of the Immortal Boat, they finally saw a glimmer of hope for escape.

They welcomed Li Fan to the center of the elders like a star surrounded by the moon.

Li Fan did not rest and quickly used his finger as a brush to describe the scenes he had seen and encountered outside.

"Nine Yin-Yang Pearls?"

"Inside each one, there seem to be endless frozen corpses…"

…

The scenes Li Fan depicted made everyone on the Immortal Boat look aghast.

However, the elders of the Celestial Pivot Department frowned, as if recalling something.

After inviting Zhong Gongdao over and exchanging words, Zhong Gongdao summoned everyone: "Everyone, perhaps we have found a way to escape this place!"

"The mission of this Monitor…"

"It should be to collect different 【specimens】."

Zhong Gongdao's expression did not carry the joy of finding an escape route, but was rather very somber.

"Different specimens? Elder Zhong, what do you mean?" Everyone looked puzzled.

Zhong Gongdao said, "Dean, you should explain the situation."

Everyone's attention then focused on the white-haired Dean of the Celestial Pivot Department, Jian Daosheng.

Jian Daosheng's eyes revealed a look of reminiscence as he wrote and explained, "In the ancient prosperous era of cultivation, the starry sea flourished, and countless cultivation worlds teemed with life. However, our Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat always chose to drift in the starry sea, having no fixed abode…"

"The world believed that Mystic Merchants were greedy and thus traveled between realms for exorbitant profits. But…"

"Wouldn't it be more beneficial for commerce to have a fixed world as a base? All on the Mystic Immortal Boat, their lives were tied to a single Immortal Boat. While the starry sea at that time was not as perilous as it is now, drifting in the starry sea for years inevitably brought risks."

"But we still preferred to drift on the starry sea rather than choose a realm to reside in."

"This is because the Mystic Immortal Boat was built by cultivators who escaped from cultivation worlds that had Monitors…"

Jian Daosheng's face showed a look of emotion as he continued to write, looking at the shocked faces of everyone present, "Cultivators view mortals like cattle and horses, raising them. Perhaps the Immortal Realm's treatment of cultivators is even worse."

"Any flourishing cultivation world almost invariably bears traces of Immortal Realm surveillance. Even for those remote and unknown cultivation worlds, who can guarantee that immortals won't suddenly descend and interfere? What the ancestors of the Mystic Merchant realm discovered to escape their original homeland is no longer known. However, it is certain that it was precisely out of fear of the Immortal Realm, and to avoid being treated like cattle and horses, that the ancestors of the Mystic Merchant decided to reside on the Immortal Boat."

"At its peak, the Mystic Immortal Boat only had a population of one million. Perhaps because the numbers were too small, and over a long period of time, there was indeed no intervention from Immortal Realm forces."

Jian Daosheng turned the conversation to the reason for this inference: "Judging from the scenes Zhao Xian witnessed, what is frozen inside those nine Yin-Yang Pearls should be cultivators who have existed in the Xuanhuang Realm from ancient times to the present."

"Not dead, but existed," Jian Daosheng emphasized this point.

"Therefore, it was useless for disciples who tried to escape by concealing their life force earlier."

"To escape from this Xuanhuang Realm Monitor, the most reliable method is to disguise oneself as one of the cultivators already existing within the nine frozen Yin-Yang Pearls."

…

The faces of everyone on the Immortal Boat varied.

After all, they were the predecessors of the Immortal Severing Tower, who had governed the Immortal Boat for tens of thousands of years. Out of trust in the Celestial Pivot Department, everyone decided to try this method.

Fortunately, when Li Fan scouted earlier, his divine sense had swept over the endless frozen ocean, and he had recorded enough characteristics of the cultivators.

After successfully disguising themselves, the first batch of cultivators set off.

They did not brazenly walk like Li Fan, but carefully, step by step.

And the formless Monitor genuinely ignored them as if they were invisible.

A total of thirty people in the team successfully escaped this nightmare-like giant pot.

With the feasibility verified, the Mystic Immortal Boat's inhabitants accelerated their escape.

After all members of the Immortal Boat had escaped, the Monitor's act of stirring the water in the giant pot finally ended.

It seemed to extend its palm and heavily pat the side of the pot.

With a deafening tremor, the giant pot slowly contracted.

As the Monitor continuously patted it, the giant pot became smaller and smaller, eventually becoming a small, crystal-clear bead.

Inside the small bead, the original pot water transformed into a calm ocean.

After completing all this, the Monitor stood stunned for a moment. After a long while, as if remembering its mission, it moved.

With booming footsteps, it left this space.

Holding their breath as they watched all this, the members of the Mystic Immortal Boat, confirming that the Monitor had finally departed, breathed a collective sigh of relief.

However, to prevent attracting the Monitor back, they still communicated through gestures.

"Elder Zhong, we have scouted the area. This is a sealed space with no exits around."

"We still haven't figured out how the Monitor left."

…

With the Mystic Immortal Boat's thousands of years of inheritance unbroken, and everyone working together, they quickly determined that the exit from this place lay within those nine Yin-Yang Pearls.

Carefully selecting one of them, the Mystic Immortal Boat flew into it.

Upon personally witnessing the endless corpses on the frozen ocean, everyone on the Immortal Boat could not help but feel an overwhelming sense of fear.

Inside the Yin-Yang Pearl, far from the Monitor once again, they could finally communicate with their divine sense.

"Azure Nether Monitor, why collect so many corpses?"

"This seems to be a profound formation."

"It seems our Mystic Merchant ancestors' choice back then was correct. In the eyes of True Immortals, cultivators are no different from livestock."

…

The Immortal Boat's crew exchanged words.

"Teacher, is it true that records of what the Mystic Merchant ancestors discovered back then can no longer be found?" Li Fan transmitted a message to Ai Tianjue.

Li Fan had keenly noticed that there seemed to have been some exchange between the Dean of the Celestial Pivot Department and the elders of the Immortal Severing Tower just now. Hence, he asked this question.

A flicker of hesitation crossed Ai Tianjue's eyes.
