It poured countless powers of darkness into his body from the sky.

The process of infusion lasted only for an instant.

A moment later, "light" reappeared, and the Dark Sea vanished.

Even the powers of darkness that had been infused into his body seemed to vanish like an illusion.

However, the Netherfolk chief looked haggard, as if he had aged significantly. He solemnly instructed, "From now on, you will bear the mission of the Netherfolk. Continue to maintain a devout heart and do not betray the trust of the great Dark Sea!"

He spoke in their native tongue, gesturing with his hands, conveying these words.

Li Fan nodded in acknowledgment. The next day, after his body adapted to the blessing, he continued to observe minutely during prayer to the Dark Sea.

Buzz…

The power of darkness spontaneously generated, tearing through space and flying towards the Dark Sea.

This time, Li Fan discovered that some of the life and divine sense power that had vanished from his body had reappeared.

Moreover, the trace had become deeper as a result!

Millions of observations allowed Li Fan to immediately pinpoint the change!

“There’s hope!”

Li Fan ignored the consumption of his body by the prayer.

He fully dedicated himself to praying, observing, and attempting to replicate the process.

Half a year later, the once robust young man had become a trembling old man.

His lifespan was passing at a rate several times faster than that of other Netherfolk.

The Netherfolk did not fear the anomaly happening to Li Fan.

Instead, they expressed immense reverence.

Li Fan paid no mind to these Netherfolk.

He even paid little attention to the Netherfolk chief's words.

He had an intuition that the mission of his possessed Netherfolk body was nearing completion.

Approaching the end of his life, Li Fan, with trembling steps, walked into the prayer cave for the last time.

He knelt with utmost sincerity and prayed from the bottom of his heart.

Perhaps sensing that the flame of life in this body was about to be extinguished,

This time, the inexplicable trace did not extract life force in its usual fixed proportion.

Instead, it swept away all remaining energy from the shell, transforming it into the power of darkness.

However…

It was precisely this added trace that made the imprint appear deeper than before!

On Li Fan's emaciated body, completely consumed, a soaring aura suddenly erupted.

It was like a raging inferno, emitting an incredibly powerful presence.

“I’ve found you!”

His eyes shone brightly, and even though his body was rapidly dissolving like a candle, his gaze did not falter in the slightest.

“This trace…”

Li Fan's divine sense, along with the Netherfolk body, dissipated.

It had completed its mission.

Not far away, Li Fan, who had been secretly lurking, used his hand as a brush, moving rapidly in the air.

Where his fingertips passed, it seemed as if no mark was left.

Yet, it was like a sharp blade slashing through, cutting fine lines in space.

His brushstrokes flowed like a dragon and snake.

The symbol Li Fan drew became increasingly complex.

It was even larger in scale than the immortal formation the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc was deducing.

Slight beads of sweat dripped from Li Fan's forehead.

A hint of dread flashed in his eyes.

He had merely captured the fleeting inspiration and continued to write.

He hadn’t expected that this unknown symbol seemed to be endless, contained within the very principles of the world's Great Dao!

It was simply inexhaustible!

Li Fan vaguely felt the illusion of watching a mountain from afar and running until one’s horse died.

His current action was akin to the tracing of an unknown existence based on observed traces.

Even if he couldn't reproduce the original form of the object, he could still glimpse its imprint.

However…

The scale of this unknown supreme treasure clearly exceeded Li Fan's capabilities.

Sensing a slight tremor within his main body, Li Fan finally sighed and abruptly released his hand.

The almost-formed symbol then completely vanished into the heavens and earth.

When Li Fan wished to pick up his brush and draw again, he found that the residual trace had also disappeared from his mind.

“Opportunity is fleeting, opportunity is fleeting.”

Li Fan vaguely knew that in this life, he only had this one chance.

Lost forever.

Even if he were to possess other Netherfolk again, repeat the process of praying, observing, and replicating, he would no longer find any clue to that mysterious character.

“Fortunately, I can start over in my next life.”

“I just don’t know if I can retain this memory of forgetting through 'Return to Truth.'”

Li Fan looked at the fully charged "Return to Truth" progress, mused for a moment, and shook his head slightly.

Even if he could retain the memory of the mysterious symbol, without sufficient strength, he would still be unable to imprint or replicate it.

“Dao Integration. After the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls of the Super Xuanhuang Realm achieve Dao Integration in this life, it should be sufficient for success.”

Sensing that he was just a step away from completion earlier, Li Fan mused inwardly.

Although this attempt had failed, Li Fan was not without gains.

He couldn't fully recall the complete symbol, but he had some impression of its intricate structure.

“Whether applied to immortal formations or True Immortal Sigils, it seems it can bring about some improvement.”

“What exactly is this mysterious symbol?”

Li Fan’s expression was somewhat dazed.

This encounter with a power above that of Immortals gave him a deeper understanding of "Return to Truth."

Chapter 1307: Bestowal of the Path of the Star Sea

"The Script-Carving Immortal depicted the path of immortals with True Immortal Sigils. However, the path of immortals, too, has levels of distinction."

"Like those I saw before, Starvation, Chaos, Solitude, and Return—they are likely the most basic. The True Immortal Sigils that might represent Creation clearly surpasses them."

"And the path represented by this mark, hidden within the Netherfolk..."

"The Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals surpasses even so-called Creation!"

"As for Return to Truth..."

Li Fan took a deep breath, forcefully calming himself.

Even after undergoing Return to Truth one hundred and twenty-five times, each time personally experiencing the grand power of resetting all things in the world with a single thought. He knew that Return to Truth almost transcended everything currently known.

But at the end of his previous life, the process of Return to Truth was interfered with by an unknown variable. Coupled with the terrifying power displayed by the Cat Treasure, a creation from beyond the wall, Li Fan couldn't help but harbor a sliver of doubt about the upper limit of Return to Truth. As he gradually came into contact with forces beyond the wall in the future, could Return to Truth remain as invincible as it was in the Abyssal Star Sea?

This discovery gave Li Fan a peace of mind.

The limit of Return to Truth was far more unfathomable than he had imagined.

"The laws of the Xuanhuang Realm can be seen as a partial projection of the Abyssal Star Sea's laws downwards. And the Abyssal Star Sea's laws are likewise a partial projection of the Immortal Realm's laws downwards."

"And Return to Truth stands above almost everything. A reflection from top to bottom, theoretically, can allow me to copy everything I come into contact with out of thin air through the Falsehood into Truth transformation."

"As long as my strength and comprehension are sufficient."

Li Fan recalled the feeling he had while writing that mysterious mark, pondering.

"This is merely the Falsehood into Truth transformation. Return to Truth is not just Falsehood into Truth."

"There is also the previous True Becomes False!"

As the thought arose, Li Fan casually snatched a nearby round stone. Staring intently at the round stone, he attempted to erase its existence directly through True Becomes False.

But during each Return to Truth process, the surrounding real world seemed to be shrouded in a white mist, making it unclear. Therefore, Li Fan did not know how the True Becomes False process was actually achieved.

"Perhaps during this Return to Truth, I can try to actively dispel the surrounding mist," the thought spontaneously appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"If I can gain enlightenment in this path, with the supreme authority of Return to Truth, perhaps I can directly bypass a major realm and casually erase opponents..."

As his thoughts raced, Li Fan organized the mysterious symbols he had glimpsed by possessing Netherfolk over the past year, based on the residual impressions in his memory.

He then handed them over to the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc for categorization and application.

Simultaneously handling two tasks involving immortal formations, the Dissolution Disc's efficiency inevitably declined significantly.

"It seems it's time to upgrade the Dissolution Disc again. Pure sublimation triggered by immortal formation data is ultimately bound by mortal physiology."

"The nine initial Dissolution Discs from the Myriad Immortals Alliance are completely different objects from the one I hold now. They can provide minimal help. To fully transform into an immortal artifact, it ultimately requires immortal spiritual power..."

Li Fan pressed his temples, which were slightly swollen from overwork. After relaxing, he looked at the Netherfolk present.

They did not show any grief because the Netherfolk Li Fan possessed had died.

Instead, they were greatly invigorated by their sacrifice to the great Abyssal Sea.

Seeing the Netherfolk's devout appearance, Li Fan was deeply moved. With a wave of his hand, he instantly absorbed them all into his body, temporarily suppressing them.

After returning to the Great Qi pocket world, he would provide them with the best living conditions, allowing them to remain in Great Qi for the rest of their lives and pray with peace of mind.

"This pocket world cannot be wasted either."

The pocket world where the Netherfolk resided was even weaker than Great Xuan. Naturally, it did not nurture a Heavenly Dao consciousness.

Li Fan's actions were thus made much easier.

He created a Simulated Heavenly Lattice, directly replacing the Heavenly Dao, to maintain the normal operation of this pocket world.

Then, using the same technique, he seamlessly grafted it onto the Xuanhuang Realm.

Practice makes perfect, and this Heavenly Intervention technique went smoothly this time.

He now had another Heavenly Dao avatar in a small world. Glimmers of comprehension, like surging waves, constantly appeared in his mind. Even though the status was insufficient, these mass-produced insights could still offer Li Fan substantial inspiration.

"These Heavenly Dao insights are useless to me, but to other cultivators, they are rarely seen in a lifetime." Returning to Great Xuan and settling the Netherfolk, after a majority of them changed their faith.

Li Fan looked at the densely packed cultivators sitting on the central Preaching Platform in Great Xuan, a thought stirring.

*Buzz buzz...*

A platform emerged from thin air, positioned below the cultivation technique directory platform and above the disciples.

The platform was carved with the myriad scenes, spirits, and objects of the world, yet they seemed alive, constantly changing and lifelike.

If one looked closely and was lucky, they might occasionally spot shimmering points of seven-colored light within the stone carvings.

Those were the insights from the Simulated Heavenly Lattice that Li Fan could not use. If the cultivators on the Preaching Platform were fortunate enough to comprehend them, it would not be difficult for their cultivation to advance by leaps and bounds, or even to comprehend unique divine abilities.

"The beings born on the Preaching Platform are all under my surveillance. Their inspirations are my inspirations."

"Although their realms are low, the sparks of thought, magnified countless times, are still brilliant. Even if only one out of ten thousand can inspire me, with the number of cultivators on this Preaching Platform, it will accumulate into a considerable fortune over time."

"Moreover, if necessary, I can also summon the Preaching Platform and manipulate the thoughts of the cultivators on it, making them help me comprehend..."

Inside the Preaching Platform, silvery-white spheres resembling eyes continuously absorbed inspirations from the minds of different beings above, gradually becoming somewhat eerie, coming alive, and gently rotating around.

After initially completing the task of spreading the Dao in Great Xuan, the phantom of the Sage Master split off another body and went to the next pocket world.

This newly formed body was not supported by Li Fan's main body's strength. Instead, it was formed by the Sage Master's phantom absorbing the power of belief from the disciples during the preaching process.

It was similar to the Heavenly Emperor's Qi Codex, except that Great Qi became Great Xuan, soldiers became students, and the Sacred Emperor became the Sage Master.

Currently, the initial stage of expansion would be handled by these phantoms. When the act of spreading the Dao began to attract the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, or other powerhouses hidden within the pocket worlds, Li Fan would personally make a move to suppress and subdue them.

Before that, Li Fan had to make thorough preparations for future confrontations.

Those Netherfolk whose faith had been altered by the split body had already begun to provide Li Fan with the initial Essence of Primal Force.

Using this Essence of Primal Force as bait, coupled with various threats and inducements, Li Fan skillfully brought familiar faces like Bai Hua, Qiao Gong, and Senior Yin into the alliance.

"Great changes are about to occur in the heavens and earth, which you all may not recognize. I will attempt to discuss them now."

On the Great Xuan Preaching Platform, Li Fan's main body replaced the phantom, sitting solemnly.

Below, Senior Yin and others listened to Li Fan's sermon.

Li Fan spoke of the resurgence of the Star Sea, and the subsequent revival of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The crowd listened with a mix of belief and doubt.

Li Fan smiled faintly and pointed towards the sky, as if opening a vortex leading to the outside of the Star Sea.

"Esteemed sirs, please follow me."

Seven-colored rainbow light appeared on his body, and Li Fan invited them inside.

The crowd exchanged glances, but ultimately all entered Li Fan's rainbow light protection.

The seven-colored light ascended into the sky.

Passing through the vortex in the sky, in the next moment, they found themselves directly at the boundary of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Their momentum suggested no intention of stopping.

It seemed they were going to continue rushing towards the starry sky of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The faces of the crowd immediately turned pale.

They all knew about the terrifying suction force outside the Xuanhuang Realm. Leaving the protection of the Xuanhuang Realm, they might fall into it the next moment, with no hope of survival.

But what happened next far exceeded their expectations.

The seven-colored rainbow light separated into different hues, drawing a curved arc in the star sea, successfully leading everyone out of the Xuanhuang Realm!

The crowd was astounded.

Li Fan, however, did not stop, continuing to speed towards the depths of the star sea.

The dead silence of the star sea evoked their emotions, and sorrow appeared in their eyes.

The dangers within the star sea made them tremble with fear and their expressions grew solemn.

And Li Fan, like a prophet, always managed to bypass the dangerous areas in the star sea, which made the crowd look at him with admiration.

They began to wonder how many times Li Fan had traveled through space, given his familiarity with it.

However, as they ventured deeper into the star sea, Li Fan's speed began to slow.

He seemed to be discerning the direction as well.

Senior Yin and the others' feelings were correct. After all, in his previous life, the connection between the Sacred Emperor and his main body became faint when the former attained the Dao at the center of the star sea.

Therefore, this journey to witness the recovery of the Star Sea became increasingly devoid of memories to draw upon as it progressed, requiring Li Fan to find the path himself.

Fortunately, it was a case of following a map.

Relying on his subconscious senses, Li Fan had already touched the origin consciousness of this star sea. However, in his previous life, the Sacred Emperor's identity as a potential savior of the star sea, by transforming into the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, had attracted the attention of the star sea's origin consciousness.

In this life, Li Fan had not yet revealed the qualifications to attract the star sea's attention.

But this did not hinder Li Fan's subsequent plan.

"This should be the place." Feeling that it was about time, Li Fan stopped and looked at the void ahead, sighing faintly.

The crowd followed his gaze with inexplicable expressions.

In their perception, this starry sky was indeed different from before. It seemed brighter and warmer. But it was still far from what Li Fan called recovery.

It still appeared completely dead silent.

However, since he had gone to such lengths to bring them here, he wouldn't have done so without purpose.

Could it be that my comprehension is insufficient?

A trace of self-doubt flashed through everyone's minds.

They then continued to observe with extreme solemnity.

Li Fan observed the subtle changes in their expressions and smiled wordlessly.

After a long time, he finally spoke, "Have you all gained anything?"

His question was met with silence.

Li Fan feigned slight surprise, pondered for a moment, and then sharply waved his hand.

He sent several beams of light into the sea of consciousness of the crowd.

These were the Sacred Emperor's insights into the recovery power of the Star Sea from his previous life.

The eyes of the crowd instantly lit up.

Threads of imperceptible vitality appeared out of thin air around them.

Qiao Gong, Bai Hua, and the others had survived the destruction of the Immortal Realm—how could they not be gifted individuals?

Previously, because the Star Sea's consciousness was too vast and hidden beneath ruin and desolation, they hadn't detected it.

Now, with Li Fan directly injecting the results of his enlightenment into their minds, they naturally noticed something.

"It's true!" Bai Hua was the most deeply moved.

"If I can control this recovery power, perhaps I can revive the Myriad Abundance Realm..."

Senior Yin scratched his head. The residual souls of destroyed worlds within him seemed to be attracted by this recovery power, as if trying to emerge from his body.

For a time, everyone was immersed in the face of the vast power of the Star Sea.

They hardly noticed that Li Fan, who had guided their enlightenment, had inexplicably moved away from them.

In fact, Li Fan had even used methods akin to immortal formations to temporarily conceal his presence.

He had a premonition that revealing his existence to the origin consciousness of the Abyssal Star Sea too early would definitely not be a good thing.

"At least until I achieve Dao Integration and reach the peak of mortality," Li Fan said, his gaze flickering as he looked at the众人 immersed in enlightenment.

The crowd woke up at different times.

Qiao Gong was the first to regain consciousness. His eyes rolled, as if he had thought of a brilliant idea, and he desperately wanted to return to the Xuanhuang Realm to experiment.

As for Senior Yin, he seemed to have spent a considerable amount of time resolving the residual world souls within him.

However, to Li Fan's surprise, Bai Hua was the last to awaken.

From her eyes, Li Fan could sense Bai Hua's inner joy.

"Congratulations, everyone. You have all gained something."

"The Star Sea is full of danger, and it's not suitable to stay here for long. Let's return as soon as possible," Li Fan said with a smile.

Everyone nodded, responding with the courtesy of disciples.

The journey back was uneventful. They returned to the Great Xuan Preaching Platform.

Seeing is believing. Having personally experienced the Star Sea, everyone now fully believed Li Fan's words.

The recovery of the Star Sea was imminent.

"Esteemed sirs, you should know that the Star Sea's lifelessness will not be revived overnight."

"The Xuanhuang Realm, as the only surviving place in the Star Sea today, should become the source of the Star Sea's revival."

"The vitality will emanate from here, making twice the result with half the effort."

The crowd listened to Li Fan's conclusion, pondered for a moment, and all nodded in agreement.

"There is no greater merit than following a dragon."

"With the revival of the Star Sea, if we can lend a hand, imagine the benefits we will receive when the Star Sea eventually recovers its past glory," Li Fan said calmly, looking at the crowd.

Senior Yin and the others were clearly tempted.

"Even if the immortal path remains closed, with its feedback, perhaps we can soar to become the strongest in the Star Sea," Qiao Gong's eyes glinted with greed.

Chapter 1308: The First Change of the Xuanhuang Realm

"Indeed, but how exactly should we proceed?" Senior Yin's gaze burned, pointing to the crux of the matter.

The strengths of the individuals present were, in truth, quite similar. The old methods of achieving longevity were insufficient to even reverse the dire situation of the Xuanhuang Realm, let alone revitalize the Star Sea.

As if doused by a basin of cold water, everyone quickly sobered up and turned their collective gaze to Li Fan.

Li Fan sat solemnly on the Preaching Platform, as if he had anticipated Senior Yin's question. He calmly replied, "Do you all know that worlds, like people, and the Star Sea are the same?"

"If a person falls ill, we treat the symptoms and then stimulate acupoints and meridians."

"The same principle can be applied when worlds and the Star Sea suffer calamities..."

A diagram of a human-shaped light projection slowly appeared before everyone as Li Fan spoke. Key acupoints and meridians were clearly marked.

Li Fan gestured gently, and the light projection abruptly transformed. It expanded and diffused, eventually becoming a faintly glowing yellow cloud. The acupoints and meridians that were originally within the human form now arranged themselves across various parts of the light mass according to specific patterns.

The group had only just returned from the outer reaches of the Star Sea, so they could immediately recognize this cloud as representing the Xuanhuang Realm. Just as they were intently observing, Li Fan pointed once more.

The light mass expanded again, by a thousandfold, then by ten thousandfold. A dazzling spectacle instantly engulfed them all, causing them to become lost within it. It was, unmistakably, a magnificent Star Sea.

The group vaguely perceived that the occasional flashes and distinct glows within the Star Sea were precisely the acupoints and meridians that had been present within the human form and the world.

"From person to world, from world to domain. It should be so!" Senior Yin mused, deep in thought.

The others also seemed to be on the verge of enlightenment.

As they wished to observe further, Li Fan waved his hand, and the Star Sea instantly reverted to the scenery of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"To revive the Star Sea first, we must first revive the Xuanhuang Realm. To revive the Xuanhuang Realm, we must foster this place."

On the shrunken representation of the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan marked various locations.

"The Xuanhuang Realm has been plundered and devoured by cultivators for thousands of years. It should have been completely depleted. Fortunately, thanks to the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, fragments of worlds have been continuously collected from the Star Sea to nourish it. These fragmented realms are like medicine, and though the Xuanhuang Realm has consumed them, it has not yet fully absorbed them..."

These scattered markings emitted a rosy, crystalline glow, seeming to contain boundless vitality and energy.

Through Li Fan's discourse, the others had already grasped his meaning. In essence, it could be summarized in one sentence: Help the Xuanhuang Realm digest the medicinal properties!

Li Fan continued, "The Xuanhuang Realm has been weak for a long time and is in danger of being unable to accept nourishment due to its deficiency. Therefore, we must guide and entice it, using acupoints to connect meridians, and points to represent the whole..."

The lecture lasted for a full seven days and seven nights. After Li Fan’s figure dissipated, the group remained immersed in the philosophy of the unity of humanity, the heavens, and medicine that he had expounded, finding it difficult to extricate themselves.

It was Senior Yin who first regained his composure. "Fragmented realms are like medicine; this analogy is truly ingenious. Absorption, digestion, and integration into oneself. Those that cannot be absorbed will be completely discarded. This is what is meant by medicinal dregs..."

Skilled Artisan, preoccupied, offered a few perfunctory words before taking his leave.

Hundred Flowers frowned slightly. "Guiding the Xuanhuang Realm to digest the fragmented realms is by no means easy. The cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm have been in opposition to the Heavenly Dao for so many years. Any action involving the power of the fragmented realms could provoke the hostility of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao, even if we are doing it for its own good."

"That's precisely why we must resolve this misunderstanding from the outset and earn the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao's trust," Senior Yin said, looking at the spot where Li Fan had disappeared. When he left, Li Fan had mentioned that he would help handle this matter before continuing his lectures. It remained to be seen what methods he would employ. As a soul of a fragmented realm, Senior Yin understood better than other cultivators how difficult it was to resolve the Xuanhuang Realm's animosity.

Seven days later, when Li Fan reappeared, he invited everyone to the sky above the Great Xuan pocket world. Upon arriving, Senior Yin felt as if he were trapped in a quagmire. Every movement he made was met with immense resistance. His essence as a soul of a fragmented realm offered no help in dispelling this obstructive force. He couldn't even discern the source of this inexplicable resistance.

Hundred Flowers and Skilled Artisan also wore expressions of utmost solemnity, indicating that they too had sensed this place was extraordinary.

"Esteemed friends, allow me to introduce someone." Li Fan said with a smile.

Following his words, a hunched, white-haired old man appeared before them. The old man's strength was not particularly remarkable, but the coffin he carried on his back drew everyone's attention. The surging malevolent energy emanating faintly from the coffin made Senior Yin and the others narrow their eyes.

"This is fellow Daoist Xu Ke, a former disciple of the Beast Taming Sect. Due to a mission, he has been in seclusion in this pocket world, cultivating in stillness for thousands of years..." After briefly introducing Xu Ke's origins, Li Fan gestured, and Xu Ke removed the coffin from his back.

It was suspended high in the air. As if sensing its guardian's temporary departure, the sealed object within the coffin instantly became more agitated. The coffin lid constantly vibrated, as if the entity imprisoned within was on the verge of breaking free.

"Do you know what is sealed within this coffin?" Li Fan asked. Before they could respond, he directly revealed the answer: "It is a will, an Azure Nether consciousness."

"However, this consciousness has now been filled with negative emotions such as resentment, madness, and obsession. It has transformed into an undeniable Azure Nether malevolent thought!"

"Today, we intend to purify this malevolent thought and then return it to the Xuanhuang Realm!" Li Fan stated solemnly.

Xu Ke coughed lightly and added, "When this malevolent thought separated from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao back then, it had the intention of completely severing ties. For the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, it was not merely like losing a piece of flesh. It was more akin to a split-off part of itself."

"If we can return it to the Heavenly Dao and restore what was once missing, it will absolutely invoke the Xuanhuang Realm's favor..."

"Of course, that is, *if* we can truly purify the malevolent thought within," Xu Ke said, looking at Li Fan.

Li Fan, however, was full of confidence. "It is but a mere malevolent thought. With everyone working together, how can it be impossible to purify?"

Skilled Artisan, having listened for a long time, became eager upon learning the true identity of the sealed item in the coffin. "How exactly should we proceed? I will cooperate fully!"

"What it hates is merely not leaving back then. Since that is the case, let us fulfill its wish and allow it to cross the The Great Barrier that it originally wanted to cross!" As Li Fan spoke, a whisk suddenly appeared in his hand. He raised it high and then swept it forcefully towards the coffin.

The myriad white strands of the whisk, like countless shooting stars, plunged into the coffin. The coffin, which had been violently shaking, leaped high into the air before stiffening mid-flight. The whisk's strands emitted a dreamlike silver light, within which myriad different scenes flashed. These were dreamscapes injected by Li Fan. Although the dreams were all different, they invariably depicted terrifying, destructive visions of what lay beyond the The Great Barrier.

After the Azure Nether malevolent thought, attached to Mr. Bai, had successfully crossed the The Great Barrier and escaped the Abyssal Sea, it failed to survive for more than three breaths each time, perishing to various indescribable and unknown calamities. In the blink of an eye, the Azure Nether malevolent thought had experienced tens of thousands of deaths within the illusions.

Seeing this, Skilled Artisan muttered to himself, "Isn't this a bit too outrageous? While the outside of the The Great Barrier is unknown, it shouldn't be like this, right? Even an ordinary-looking cat could swallow it whole? This Azure Nether malevolent thought, in terms of strength alone, is probably not much weaker than those practicing the ancient longevity methods. Can it really be tricked into leaving?"

Xu Ke, who had coexisted with the Azure Nether malevolent thought for thousands of years, keenly sensed that the struggles from within the coffin had indeed lessened, and a pleased expression appeared on his face. "It's actually effective!"

At this moment, Li Fan's voice came from above. "Everyone can also help depict dreams, no matter how bizarre or terrifying they may be. As long as the Azure Nether malevolent thought perishes in the end, it will suffice."

The light of the whisk intensified, expanding to envelop everyone. At the end of the handle, a vortex vaguely appeared. Senior Yin and the others, understanding the intention, each projected their most terrifying imagined dreams into it via their thoughts. Among them, Senior Yin's depicted dreams were particularly bizarre and horrifying. Even with Li Fan's current experience, he couldn't help but feel a chill after observing them. In comparison, the dreamscapes woven by Skilled Artisan, Hundred Flowers, and Xu Ke were much more ordinary.

Skilled Artisan’s dreams mostly involved world destruction, transformation into puppets, and the blurring of reality and illusion. Hundred Flowers' dreams were related to the wilting of life and the world falling into frozen silence. Under the continuous onslaught of these different terrifying dreamscapes, the Azure Nether malevolent thought had already undergone a qualitative change.

"Is it truly so terrifying outside the The Great Barrier?"

"If I had known, I shouldn't have left the The Great Barrier back then. Even if I could only eke out an existence, it would be better than dying instantly!"

Thoughts like these accumulated within the Azure Nether malevolent thought with the completion of each dream. Although each one was like a barely perceptible scratch, the speed at which dreams manifested and cycled was incredibly fast. In every instant, hundreds of thousands of dreams vanished and reappeared. More importantly, these dreams were not merely ordinary dreams. They were top-tier illusory formations infused with a trace of Li Fan's comprehension of "Falsehood into Truth." From the outside, one might wonder why the person trapped within couldn't distinguish between dream and reality. However, only when one truly experienced being within the formation could they fully grasp the profound power of this "illusion of true fantasy."

Li Fan gazed at his creation, a sense of pride inevitably welling up within him. "This has evolved from the Cloud Water Illusory Dream Technique, but its effectiveness is far greater than the original."

"Moreover, it has been amplified by the illusory formation... Even if it's not an immortal formation, it surpasses immortal formations."

As the dreams iterated continuously, the Azure Nether malevolent thought sank faster and faster. Initially, it would occasionally harbor doubts and resistance. Later, all questions vanished. All that remained was endless regret and fear.

Watching the Azure Nether malevolent thought trembling within the formation, Li Fan understood that the dish was finally ready to be served.

"Rise!" Li Fan reached forward, grasping the giant whisk in the air. Then, he stirred it gently. The myriad silver-white whisk strands also stirred within the coffin, like countless sharp blades, slicing the completely surrendered Azure Nether malevolent thought into countless tiny pieces. The sealed coffin also became illusory as the malevolent thought disintegrated.

Li Fan lightly waved the whisk, and a portion of the strands, carrying a piece of the dismembered Azure Nether malevolent thought, moved before Senior Yin.

"Fellow Daoist, please!" Senior Yin first bowed, expressing his gratitude to Li Fan. Then, he solemnly accepted the partitioned Azure Nether malevolent thought before him. Li Fan then divided another portion and sent it to Skilled Artisan. Like carving a roast, in a short time, Li Fan completed the partition of the Azure Nether malevolent thought. Everyone present received a share. Li Fan himself also received a portion, even more than the others. However, Senior Yin and the others naturally had no objections to this.

"Go!" Manipulating the giant whisk, Li Fan’s expression grew solemn as he hurled it towards the sky. It tore through the firmament, opening a passage to the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Vast, boundless sea, return, soul!" Li Fan chanted. And without Li Fan needing to do much more, the moment the passage was opened, the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao consciousness noticed its own consciousness, which had been separated from it, now present in the Star Sea.

Within the passage, a booming sound echoed incessantly, as if the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao consciousness was about to descend.

"Soul, return!" Li Fan pointed a finger through the air. The purified and partitioned Azure Nether malevolent thought before him flew towards the passage. Its speed increased, and in an instant, it disappeared from their sight.

Following Li Fan's example, Senior Yin and the others did the same. In less than half a day, the Azure Nether malevolent thought, lost for many years, finally returned to the Xuanhuang Realm in its entirety. The passage closed, and all anomalies vanished.

Xu Ke looked at the completely ethereal and vanished coffin, a sense of loss washing over him. Skilled Artisan, however, expressed a hint of worry. "Is that all? Will all this be for naught?"

Li Fan smiled slightly. "Everyone, please rest assured. The Xuanhuang Realm will not be indebted. Those who have contributed will be rewarded."

"However, it will take some time for the Xuanhuang Realm to digest. Before receiving the rewards, you all simply need to wait patiently."

Li Fan's figure faded away with these words, leaving behind the group with their varied expressions. Senior Yin looked at Xu Ke and began inquiring about Mr. Bai. Xu Ke, who had been somewhat lost, immediately became animated. The two conversed congenially, as if they had met long ago. Hundred Flowers and Skilled Artisan, not getting along, went about their own business. They were all waiting for the blessings from the Xuanhuang Realm that Li Fan had spoken of to arrive.

Meanwhile, within the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan's true form remained hidden, quietly observing the changes occurring in the Xuanhuang Realm. If the absorption of Immortal Spiritual Qi had caused changes to the surface of the Xuanhuang Realm's mountains and rivers, then the absorption of its lost consciousness caused changes that occurred silently within the world itself. Only cultivators intimately familiar with the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao operations could perceive them.

"Analogous to us cultivators, it's like an enhancement of the divine soul and divine sense."

"The first to benefit will be the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm. That is, the longevity of the Xuanhuang Realm..."

Li Fan sensed several vast consciousnesses sweeping across the realm. Some of them were quite familiar.

"Hmph, let you lot have a taste of the benefits first. In the end, you will all have to spit it back out to me!"

The immense consciousnesses searched repeatedly but could not find the reason for the Xuanhuang Realm's inexplicable changes. They could only give up. Li Fan sneered inwardly and paid them no mind, continuing to carefully observe the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm—changes entirely different from the world-ending changes he had comprehended.

Chapter 1309: First Encounter in the Land of Bliss

The Xuanhuang Realm's World-Ending Mutations were extreme changes that arose naturally from the realm's self-preservation instincts upon sensing its impending destruction. These were evolutions of certain aspects to their absolute limits.

For instance, the "Universal Stillness, All Things Frozen" mutation that Li Fan used in his previous life to impersonate a Dao Integration cultivator was no weaker than the typical Ice Element Heavenly and Earthly Essences within the Xuanhuang Realm, and in fact, was stronger than most.

World-Ending Mutations, by their nature, were filled with attack and destruction. Since they typically only manifested when the Xuanhuang Realm faced a catastrophic threat, their appearance in the world would inevitably trigger a reactive response from the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. Consequently, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao would instinctively harbor wariness and distrust towards the holder of a World-Ending Mutation, much like Li Fan was experiencing now.

In contrast, the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, having absorbed its own separated malevolent thoughts, underwent changes akin to a full recovery and infusion of immortal power. However, these changes were manifested on the foundational laws of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Setting aside the "Reverse Principle Longevity" mutation for now, the Xuanhuang Realm's various restrictions on cultivators became even more stringent with its internal recovery.

The bottleneck of Heaven's Calamity, the inability to cultivate multiple laws concurrently, and the anomalies that appear in the sky after a cultivator's demise.

These laws, which were intrinsically linked to cultivator progress, were undergoing silent and rapid transformation.

Cultivators would find it even more difficult to break through; the sky phenomena after death would record more information about the deceased cultivator's life; the judgment criteria for different laws would become stricter, and the total number of cultivation techniques in the world would inexplicably be reduced.

Furthermore, Li Fan vaguely sensed that the efficiency with which the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth absorbed and transformed the daos returned by fallen cultivators and world fragments was slowly increasing as its internal strength grew.

A faint, digestion-like hum could be heard throughout the world, undetectable by ordinary cultivators.

In the Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators practiced by devouring the heavens and consuming the earth. As the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth's strength suddenly expanded, it would inevitably drive a surge in the power of the cultivators within it.

Foundation Establishment cultivators challenging Golden Cores, Golden Cores defeating Nascent Souls—this might become the norm in the near future.

For those cultivators who wished to escape this predicament, their options were to either dissolve their cultivation and start anew or find a way to break through to the next major realm as quickly as possible.

Otherwise, these cultivators who did not "grow" alongside the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth would soon become obsolete.

...

Li Fan observed all these cataclysmic changes within the Xuanhuang Realm with great interest but did not intervene. Although the growth of the Xuanhuang Realm had not yet reached his desired level, it was sufficient to provide him with inspiration.

"This is a transformation of the Dao. Those who embrace the Dao shall live, and those who lose the Dao shall perish. This applies to the Xuanhuang Realm, the Abyssal Star Sea, and perhaps even the Immortal Realm of the past," Li Fan mused inwardly.

He recalled the experience of Sun Erlang in the illusory realm of the Return to Truth Fruit in his previous life.

"I wonder what they will gain this time when they journey to the Land of Carefree Bliss?"

Inside the Dao Discussion Platform, his silver-white eyes shifted slightly, and images of Sun Erlang and his two companions appeared within them.

Despite being only at the Golden Core Perfection stage, they had benefited from the Grand Tutor's teachings of the Great Dao. All the defensive formations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council were like mere trifles in their eyes.

They pressed forward, passing through the Human Way Heavenly Realm, and finally reached the so-called Land of Carefree Bliss.

At first glance, it seemed no different from other regions of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Yue Zhenwei, the eldest of the three, surveyed their surroundings with a hint of confusion. "Are there fewer people here than in other places in the Five Elders Council?"

Sun Erlang nodded. "Indeed. And they all seem listless. They look nothing like what one would associate with 'carefree'."

Wang Xuanba, however, said dismissively, "Who cares? Isn't our purpose here to search for Grotto-heavens required for breaking through to the Nascent Soul realm? Naturally, the fewer people, the better!"

Sun and Yue found his reasoning sound. They would achieve what they could with their abilities. The secrets of the Land of Carefree Bliss were not something that mere Golden Core cultivators could uncover.

They continued to conceal their presence, employing the secret techniques taught by the Grand Tutor, searching for traces of Grotto-heavens within the Land of Carefree Bliss.

However...

Ten days passed with no success.

The expressions of the three began to darken.

"This is impossible. We've practically scoured this Autumn Creek Prefecture, and we haven't found a single Grotto-heaven?" Wang Xuanba exclaimed in disbelief.

"Either the Grand Tutor's secret technique is flawed, or..." Yue Zhenwei's expression was no better.

Sun Erlang continued, "Perhaps there are no Grotto-heavens in this Land of Carefree Bliss. Or perhaps, what we are seeing now is not the true Land of Carefree Bliss, but merely an empty shell. The legendary dream is where it truly lies."

"What do we do next?" Wang Xuanba scratched his head. "We can't just enter a dream and steal things, can we? Why don't we go back to the Human Way Heavenly Realm? Although the defenses there are stricter, the territory is also larger. As long as we're careful, borrowing a few Grotto-heavens shouldn't be a problem."

Sun and Yue both nodded in agreement.

The three quickly reached a consensus and prepared to withdraw from the Land of Carefree Bliss.

What filled them with an inexplicable sense of dread was that although they were retracing their original path, upon reaching the border of the Land of Carefree Bliss, the scenery they encountered was different.

The White Mist Barrier, which stretched across the heavens and earth, serving as a natural divider between prefectures, had vanished. In its place, before the three, lay an endless, boundless desert that stretched as far as the eye could see.

"This..."

The three stood at the edge of the desert, drawing yellow sand from the ground and rubbing it between their fingers.

"It’s real." Sun Erlang clenched his fists and said solemnly.

Wang Xuanba, still unwilling to believe it, stomped his foot into the quicksand. "How could this happen? It was fine when we came, and now we can't go back? We didn't even get lost!"

"Perhaps, without us realizing it, we’ve entered the true Land of Carefree Bliss dream." Yue Zhenwei, the most composed among the three, said.

He gazed into the distance at the desert, not detecting any signs of life.

"It’s best not to venture into this desert. Let's try another direction."

The three traversed Autumn Creek Prefecture again, and on another border, they encountered entirely different adjacent scenery.

The rumbling sound of water descended from the heavens. The moment it landed in Autumn Creek, it transformed into frothing bubbles of light and dissipated without a trace.

Not far away, there was a water world suspended in the sky.

Not only were there many beings swimming within, but one could vaguely discern numerous underwater structures.

"How about we try this place? We can't leave anyway," Wang Xuanba suggested.

"Let's observe more." Yue Zhenwei carefully examined the scene and found that although there was life in this water world, the dominant civilization that built the underwater structures consisted of wriggling octopuses.

They seemed to have their own language and writing, ruling this underwater world.

However, towards the three individuals from the Xuanhuang Realm, who were observing them from a mere sliver of separation, they showed no reaction whatsoever, as if they existed in different worlds.

Leaving the water world temporarily, the three continued to search along the border of Autumn Creek Prefecture.

Finally, in the southwest corner, they discovered a third adjoining prefecture.

In the prefecture not far away, a massive stone stood on the seashore.

It was exactly the same as the giant stone on the seashore of Stone Province they had seen before.

"Excellent! We've finally found a way out!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed excitedly.

Just as he was about to rush forward, Sun Erlang stopped him.

"Be careful! Something doesn't feel right!"

As Sun Erlang spoke, two figures appeared one after another above the giant stone by the sea.

The former was in a disheveled state, seemingly heavily injured.

The pursuing figure, though faster than the former, seemed to be savoring the thrill of the hunt, maintaining the distance between them. This gave the fleeing figure the illusion that they could escape with a little more effort, when in reality, they could never break free.

If it were a normal pursuit, the three would not have been particularly surprised. However, the one pursuing the human cultivator, desperately fleeing, was actually a demon with a human body and a dog's head!

As the human cultivator was about to escape the confines of Stone Province and head towards the Cloudy Sea, the dog-headed demonic beast finally grew impatient and ended the hunting game.

Its hand transformed back into a dog's paw, and it firmly restrained the human cultivator. Watching the human's agonizing and desperate expression amidst their screams, the dog-headed demonic beast laughed heartily.

Then, with satisfaction, it opened its mouth to swallow the human cultivator.

"Abomination! Stop!" In his youthful and hot-blooded prime, how could Wang Xuanba stand by and watch such a scene of man-eating unfold before him?

Sun and Yue had no time to stop him, and a giant, gray-white axe emanating an ancient aura pierced through the boundary between the two different domains and appeared before the dog-headed demonic beast.

However, the dog-headed demonic beast seemed to have been prepared.

A flicker of ferocity and excitement flashed in its eyes. It casually tossed aside the human cultivator it had just captured, its meal.

Ignoring the gray-white axe that was about to cleave its head, it rushed directly towards the three of them.

As the dog-headed demonic beast moved, Stone Province, where it was located, also experienced a corresponding expansion, instantly engulfing the territory of Autumn Creek Prefecture and enveloping Sun Erlang and his companions!

As if a dream had descended into reality, the dog-headed demonic beast's world merged with the world of the three of them!

*Clang!*

Wang Xuanba's gray-white giant axe struck the back of the dog-headed demonic beast's neck, but only produced a metallic clang! A full-force blow, powerful enough to split mountains, failed to even cut through the dog-headed demonic beast's skin!

Wang Xuanba snorted coldly but was undeterred. "Did you think your grandfather's axe was just sharp?! You dared to face it head-on relying on your physical strength? A beast is still a beast!"

The dog-headed demonic beast seemed to understand Wang Xuanba's words, and its expression changed slightly. It was only then that it discovered a very distinct gray scar that had appeared from its back neck. The grayness then rapidly spread upwards, directly engulfing the demonic beast's dog-like head.

Moments later, the gray-white head disintegrated into dust and scattered into the air.

"Be careful!"

The voices of Yue Zhenwei and Sun Erlang rang out simultaneously.

As Wang Xuanba was gloating, the dog-headed demonic beast, having lost its head, unexpectedly moved again.

Its body flickered, and it appeared before Wang Xuanba.

Its dog-like paw transformed into a black beam of light, instantly piercing Wang Xuanba's heart.

"Xuanba!" Sun Erlang's eyes turned red with fury.

A saber filled with malevolent energy arrived late, stirring up an endless black wind that directly engulfed the dog-headed demonic beast.

However, within moments, the dog-headed demonic beast's flesh and blood were completely scraped away by the black wind, leaving only a skeletal frame.

Yet, this skeleton emitted an unusual golden light.

"Something's wrong..." Yue Zhenwei's expression changed slightly, unaware that a figure was silently approaching him from behind.

It was the human cultivator who the dog-headed demonic beast had been pursuing earlier!

A mocking smile played on his lips as he looked at Yue Zhenwei with greedy eyes. His aura erupted, and he looked nothing like someone who was injured!

His neck suddenly elongated, and his head flew off, swallowing Yue Zhenwei's head into his stomach.

Pitiably, Yue Zhenwei's attention was entirely focused on the dog-headed demonic beast and Sun Erlang. Caught off guard by the sneak attack, he had already met his demise!

"Ahhhh! You deserve to die!" With both companions dead, Sun Erlang's eyes turned crimson.

His veins bulged, and a black aura enveloped his entire body.

His pupils were completely consumed by blackness. Sun Erlang, disregarding everything, lunged directly at the long-necked demonic beast.

To his surprise, he was tightly held back by the golden skeleton behind him.

The golden skeleton held him firmly, emitting a cackling laugh.

"This trick really works. It always lures a few fools to their doom."

Sun Erlang's fury grew even more intense.

"Ah!"

A roar echoed through the heavens and earth.

A black storm suddenly erupted from his dantian.

It was several times more terrifying than the black energy in the saber earlier.

It completely engulfed the golden skeleton that had been clamoring.

"Damn it! What is this..."

Before he could finish speaking, the golden skeleton, along with Sun Erlang, vanished into the black storm.

The long-necked demonic beast, however, made no move to rescue them.

It watched with relish, while chewing on Yue Zhenwei's corpse.

Soon after, the black storm completely dissipated.

And the corpses of Yue Zhenwei and Wang Xuanba had both become the long-necked demonic beast's meal.

...

"Ah!"

Sun Erlang and his two companions suddenly woke up from a nightmare.

Cold sweat streamed down their foreheads. It took a while before they recovered from the terrifying experience.

"I'm dead?"

"I'm not dead?!" Wang Xuanba exclaimed, still shaken.

Sun Erlang fell into contemplation.

Yue Zhenwei remained the first to regain his composure and observed their surroundings.

"It seems we are still in Autumn Creek Prefecture of the Five Elders Council, where we were trapped before."

"However..."

Yue Zhenwei looked up at the sky. "The entire world seems to have grown darker?" He said uncertainly.

"It's not an illusion. The world we are in has indeed become like night," Sun Erlang agreed after observing for a while.

"But our cultivation realms haven't changed... Wait, what is this?!"

Sun Erlang's voice suddenly rose several octaves.

"Sun Erlang, Golden Core Perfection, Deaths: 1."

"Land of Bliss Experience Level: 1."

"Carefree Coins: 100."

Sun Erlang read aloud the lines of text that had appeared inexplicably before his eyes, his expression profoundly shaken.

"I have it too." Wang Xuanba also discovered something and called out loudly.

"Wait, this isn't right! Why are my Carefree Coins zero?"

"Where did your hundred come from?" Wang Xuanba asked, bewildered.

Chapter 1310

"Before dying, I'll take that son of a bitch with me. These 100 Carefree Coins should be the reward for killing him," Sun Erlang, by no means unintelligent, recalled their recent experience and deduced the origin of the Carefree Coins in his possession.

"Speaking of which, what exactly did we just go through?" Wang Xuanba shivered, subconsciously touching his chest as if the perceived wound from being pierced was still there.

"Was it a dream? But that feeling of dying was too real," Wang Xuanba mumbled.

Sun Erlang stared at the lines of text before him, trying to find more useful information. Unfortunately, apart from the text itself, there were no other explanations.

"It seems we'll have to figure this out ourselves," Sun Erlang said with a grim expression.

At this moment, Yue Zhenwei suggested, "Why don't we go back to the boundary where we encountered the dog-headed demonic beasts and see what's happening?"

"The strength of those two demonic beasts was actually similar to ours. As long as we're careful and don't get ambushed, we should be fine."

"Good! I want to get revenge on them too! I died so miserably just now!" Wang Xuanba's eyes gleamed fiercely.

The three set off again towards the border of Autumn Creek Prefecture.

Along the way, Sun Erlang noticed that the cultivators they encountered seemed to be more numerous than before. Furthermore, they were no longer dispirited but were gathered in groups of three to five, seemingly discussing something.

When Sun Erlang tried to get closer and eavesdrop, he discovered that these people communicated not with voices or divine senses, but through a method of communication they couldn't observe.

"Perhaps we can ask them for information," Wang Xuanba suggested, looking at a group of five cultivators gathered not far away, who appeared to be at the Mid-Foundation Establishment stage.

Yue Zhenwei stopped him. "Xuanba, don't be rash! If my guess is correct, these people, like us, can revive. How can brute force be useful when trying to get information from people who don't fear death?"

"Let's go to our target location first!" Sun Erlang also urged.

Wang Xuanba nodded and shifted his gaze.

In this life, Sun and Wang, both young, had mastered their skills at the Dao Discussion Platform. Naturally arrogant and having easily overcome every formation they encountered after leaving Great Xuan, their pride grew. It was only after being ambushed by demonic beasts that they became somewhat more cautious.

Upon arriving at the location where they had "perished," the scene they witnessed surprised the three of them. "Why is the world on the other side different from last time?"

The rocky scene by the sea in Stone Province was gone, replaced by a sword forest filled with a murderous aura. Myriad rotten swords were plunged into the ground, swaying with the breeze.

*Buzz...*

Perhaps due to their proximity, at the moment the rotten swords in the sword forest vibrated together, Sun Erlang seemed to hear a collective sword cry in his ear.

Sun Erlang's heart trembled, and he instinctively dodged.

An invisible sword energy grazed his cheek, tearing a piece of skin. Ignoring the pain, Sun Erlang rapidly retreated. Only when the sense of danger faded did he stop. Without a doubt, if he hadn't dodged, it wouldn't have been just a little bit of flesh and blood.

"This world seems more dangerous than the three we encountered last time?" Yue Zhenwei frowned, speculating.

Next, the three of them scouted out all the worlds bordering Autumn Creek Prefecture.

They found a sword forest, a deep valley, and a place that seemed to be a demonic sect's territory. It was home to no less than a thousand ferocious cultivators.

From afar, they could see these demonic cultivators feeding on humans, finding pleasure in torturing them, and forging artifacts with human bones. The hellish scene made Wang Xuanba's blood boil, and he wished he could rush in and sweep away all the demonic sects on the spot.

However, Wang Xuanba was impulsive, not foolish. He ultimately did not act rashly but merely spat fiercely at the opposite side.

The three reconvened to discuss. "Should we first get some common knowledge from the local cultivators here, or should we venture into other worlds?"

"The cultivators in the Land of Carefree Bliss clearly know some rules that we don't. If we ask rashly, we might reveal our identities the moment we speak."

"We might not lose our lives, but we could be kept here forever."

"Let's try soul-searching? Sage Master taught us about this. Although I've never formally used it on a cultivator, I think it's worth a try," Wang Xuanba said eagerly.

"Don't forget, we are likely in a dream. Soul-searching might not work," Yue Zhenwei countered.

After a period of silence, the three decided to try anyway.

"Find a lone cultivator with weaker strength."

"Knock him out first."

The three searched in Autumn Creek Prefecture for half a day before finally finding a suitable target. This person appeared to be only at the Early-Foundation Establishment stage and seemed to have lost contact with his companions, anxiously searching for them.

"Attack!"

With a roar, the three's killing moves instantly landed on the Foundation Establishment cultivator.

A black vortex, a gray giant axe, and Yue Zhenwei's purple sword energy.

However, to their astonishment, their combined attack, which was powerful enough to severely injure a Nascent Soul cultivator, caused no damage to the Foundation Establishment cultivator before them!

The Foundation Establishment cultivator's figure flickered, and all their attacks missed. He looked at Sun Erlang and the other two with disbelief, instinctively taking a step back.

At the same time, Sun Erlang noticed the lines of text before him flicker. There was no other change, except that the number of Carefree Coins became zero.

Sun Erlang's face twitched.

Wang Xuanba also wailed through their communication: "How can the Land of Bliss Coins be negative? 100 were deducted!"

Yue Zhenwei's expression was also grim. "Mine too."

During this brief exchange, a white light suddenly emerged from the attacked Foundation Establishment cultivator. The light engulfed them, and with a look of utter foolishness at Sun Erlang and the others, the Foundation Establishment cultivator vanished on the spot.

...

The trio from Great Xuan looked at each other speechlessly, meeting the gaze in silence.

"It seems this is also a natural restriction within the Land of Bliss. These cultivators are of one type, like us. And those monsters we encountered before, including those in the boundary worlds, are perhaps another type. Cultivators cannot attack each other and are even punished. Killing monsters in the boundary worlds yields rewards, including Carefree Coins..." After a moment of frustration, Sun Erlang quickly became re-energized. He sorted through their experiences, recalling and summarizing.

"We can't be sure what will happen if we deduct too many Carefree Coins, but it's best not to test it. Let's go to the boundary worlds first and earn back the negative Carefree Coins."

At this point, the three had abandoned the idea of soul-searching. If they couldn't even land an attack, how could they possibly search for souls!

Filled with frustration, they discussed and, based on their intuition, chose the demonic sect world, which seemed the most dangerous among the three boundary worlds.

"Even though that place looks like it has many enemies, how high can the cultivation of those who refine artifacts with ordinary human bones be?"

"Their spells are also crude. They might scare ordinary people, but this flashy stuff can't withstand my axe!" Wang Xuanba boasted confidently.

"However, we still need to be careful. After all, we've already died once. I have a premonition that death counts might be even more important than Carefree Coins," Yue Zhenwei said solemnly, looking at the flickering characters before him.

With their plan set, the three turned their backs to each other and plunged into the demonic sect world.

Inside the demonic sect world, thousands of demonic cultivators were stunned by the sudden arrival of the trio from the sky. After a moment of stunned silence, they rushed to attack, shouting in a language Sun Erlang couldn't understand.

Blood energy surged, and countless resentful spirits swirled. It was a terrifying sight.

"Die for me!"

Unexpectedly, a gray giant axe easily tore through the blood-colored resentful souls released by hundreds of demonic cultivators. The axe continued its momentum, sweeping left and right, each swing taking the lives of dozens of demonic cultivators.

Wang Xuanba, fighting with bloody eyes, was extremely excited. "Erlang, these beasts are even weaker than we imagined!"

Sun Erlang, who was also rapidly dispatching demonic cultivators, did not agree. Instead, he felt a faint sense of unease. It was the same feeling he had when facing the dog-headed demonic beast whose head had been severed earlier!

Sun Erlang immediately scanned his surroundings, eliminating enemies while searching for the true target.

"Look there!" Yue Zhenwei pointed to a giant statue standing within the demonic sect. This statue had not appeared when they observed the world from the outside. It had even remained hidden after Sun Erlang entered the world. It was only when the battle intensified that it manifested before the trio without their knowledge.

The statue seemed to be sewn together from countless human corpses, exuding a monstrous aura. The face of the statue had no distinct features, only countless outstretched pale arms waving incessantly. Every time Sun Erlang killed a demonic cultivator, another pair of arms would extend from the statue's face, as if the fallen demonic cultivators were being devoured by the giant statue.

Sun Erlang's slaughtering speed slightly faltered. However, the frenzied demonic cultivators showed no intention of stopping. They did not fear their companions' deaths; some even casually stuffed scattered body parts and remains into their mouths before rushing forward with even greater ferocity, howling.

"What should we do? Kill or not kill?" Clearly, killing the demonic cultivators would somehow recharge the giant statue. Seeing the countless pale arms sprouting like mushrooms after rain, Sun Erlang trembled inwardly. Nevertheless, he responded resolutely, "Kill!"

Purple energy roared, and a dragon's head bowed. A single strike annihilated over a thousand demonic cultivators, instantly clearing their surging encirclement. However, soon enough, the fearless demonic cultivators filled the void once more. The only fortunate thing was that these demonic cultivators were not inexhaustible. As the trio from Great Xuan fought together, the countless human-like, yet not entirely human cultivators swarming them began to slowly dwindle in sight.

After an unknown period, the nauseating smell of blood in the air had almost solidified. Even though Sun Erlang and the others had sealed their sense of smell, the bloody stench still seeped into their divine souls. The vast demonic sect was filled with the debris of cultivators who had exploded upon death. Rivers of blood flowed, seemingly being gradually absorbed by the demonic sect's land with every breath.

Sun Erlang panted, his hands trembling slightly. These demonic cultivators were indeed pitifully weak, no match for the trio from Great Xuan. But their sheer numbers were overwhelming. Even if they just stood there to be killed, Sun Erlang's hands would grow tired.

"If I were at the Nascent Soul realm, I wouldn't be this miserable," he thought. "With a Grotto-heaven to replenish my Spirit Qi, I wouldn't fear this human wave tactic."

Suddenly, as if realizing something, he frowned slightly. "A perfectly timed difficulty?"

At this moment, besides the trio from Great Xuan, only the giant statue stood in the demonic sect. It wasn't that Sun Erlang and the others didn't want to eliminate the hidden threat beforehand, but an invisible barrier stood in their way. They couldn't attack it in advance and had to wait for the giant statue to complete its final transformation.

*Rumble, rumble, rumble...*

The entire demonic sect stronghold began to shake violently. The giant statue, which had been motionless, suddenly came to life. It lowered its head, gazing at the trio from Great Xuan below. Arms began to fall from the statue's face. Then a second pair, and a third... *Swish, swish, swish.* More and more arms rained down. Sun Erlang and the other two deflected these falling arms, their expressions solemn as they watched the statue's true form gradually reveal itself.

It was a pig's face. The pig head had a compassionate expression, its eyes filled with sorrow. It gazed at Sun Erlang below with immense regret, as if they had committed an unforgivable sin!

As the giant pig-head statue stared at them, Wang Xuanba suddenly felt an unnamable rage surge within him. Sensing that the invisible barrier blocking him had vanished, he was the first to charge forward.

"Today, this grandpa will feast on your pig head!" Wang Xuanba roared. His gray giant axe had already grown to the same size as the statue. He swung it down fiercely at the front of the pig's head.

The pig-head statue did not dodge or evade. Its eyes remained filled with sorrow. It opened its mouth, revealing its sharp teeth, and directly bit down on the giant axe. Then, it chewed.

*Bang!* The gray giant axe instantly exploded into countless fragments, and even these gray wisps were chewed and swallowed by the pig-head statue. Wang Xuanba spat out a mouthful of blood, a hint of madness flashing in his eyes.

"Explode!"

The ten thousand gray wisps within the pig-head statue spontaneously erupted like dancing dragons. The pig's cheeks bulged slightly, as if it would explode. But to Wang Xuanba's astonishment, the pig-head statue took a deep breath and swallowed all these gray wisps.

It was important to note that this gray axe was no ordinary magic artifact; it was Wang Xuanba's own Foundation Establishment Oddity, the Mottled Time Axe. It was a reward personally bestowed by Sage Master for ranking among the top three at the Dao Discussion Platform. Wang Xuanba's path to the Golden Core realm relied on comprehending the laws contained within this oddity. The stone axe's gray wisps contained the principles of time's flow, injuring people with the power of passing years. Yet, after swallowing all the immense gray wisps from the axe, the pig-head statue showed no side effects. In fact, its body became even more condensed.

With his Foundation Establishment Oddity devoured, Wang Xuanba's aura visibly weakened. He was heavily injured, barely clinging to life, and no longer capable of fighting. The entire incident happened in the blink of an eye. Before Sun Erlang and Yue Zhenwei could even help, Wang Xuanba was already in a precarious state.

Taking advantage of the pig-head statue absorbing the gray wisps, Sun Erlang transmitted, "Something is definitely wrong!"

"These worlds within the Land of Carefree Bliss should be some kind of trial. With the strength the pig-head statue is now displaying, even a Nascent Soul cultivator couldn't contend with it. For us, at the Golden Core stage, it's a certain death scenario. It's impossible to pass, so it can't just be a trial..."

"Therefore, there must be some detail we've overlooked within this demonic sect stronghold," Yue Zhenwei also realized, scanning their surroundings again.

After absorbing the gray wisps from the Time Axe, the pig-head statue's aura became erratic, as if it were comprehending something and would become stronger at any moment.

"Damn it, we don't have much time left." They had already searched the entire demonic sect stronghold more than once. Apart from the scattered bones of demonic cultivators, there was nothing else hidden.

"Where lies the key to breaking this situation?" In this moment of crisis, Sun Erlang found himself becoming remarkably calm. Images from before entering the demonic sect to everything experienced during the battle flashed through his mind in slow motion.

"Sage Master said, when in dire straits, find a way to change," he recalled. "To the demonic sect, we outsiders are variables. But we, these variables, can only slaughter the cultivators. Against this giant statue, we are powerless. Therefore..." A flash of insight flickered in Sun Erlang's eyes. "We need to find more variables!"

"This variable cannot be found in outsiders like us. It must be..." Sun Erlang suddenly felt a surge of understanding and quickly transmitted to Yue Zhenwei, "Go around the pig-head statue! Attack the sky!"

A black vortex surged upwards. Sun Erlang merged with it, soaring into the sky. This black malevolent wind was naturally Sun Erlang's Foundation Establishment Oddity, the World-Ending Wind Breaker, also personally taught by Sage Master!

The pig, which was absorbing and evolving, sensed Sun Erlang's actions. The compassionate eyes that seemed unchanged for millennia suddenly showed a look of anger and fear. It let out its first roar since the battle began. Just as it was about to intercept Sun Erlang, a purple sword energy flew towards it.

The purple energy surged, like the rising sun. It was Yue Zhenwei's Foundation Establishment Oddity, the Vast Purple Firmament Sword, also personally taught by Sage Master! Within the purple energy, faint dragon roars could be heard. The pig-head statue was momentarily startled by the majestic purple energy, its movements pausing for a fraction of a second. It was precisely this slight pause that allowed Sun Erlang's Soul Transformation black wind to break through its defense. It slammed fiercely into the sky.

Cracks appeared on the sky. The sun hanging high above also began to crack, piece by piece. The false sky shattered violently. As countless fragments rained down, the truth was revealed. It was merely a dark, massive cave. The collapse of the false sky caused the pig-head statue to let out an almost frenzied roar. However, it no longer had the intention to deal with Yue Zhenwei and Sun Erlang. As if something extremely terrifying was about to descend, a beam of light flew out from within the pig-head statue, attempting to escape.

"Vermin!" A voice like a thunderclap suddenly came from outside the sky. Then, a purple bolt of lightning appeared in mid-air, striking the escaping beam of light directly! With a scream, the creature within turned to ashes. Sun Erlang vaguely glimpsed what looked like a recently born pig demon. The purple lightning descended without warning, easily killing the pig demon before disappearing. In this demonic sect stronghold, apart from the trio from Great Xuan, no other living beings remained. Sun Erlang felt an immense weariness in his heart. Wang Xuanba and Yue Zhenwei, while feeling fortunate, were somewhat bewildered. "Did we win so easily?"

"We didn't even have to fight that terrifying pig-head statue to the death. We just had to shatter the fake sky above, and this pig demon was killed by lightning from the heavens?"

"What kind of deal is this! Didn't I just risk my life for nothing?!" Wang Xuanba coughed lightly and complained.

The surrounding scene instantly froze at his grumbling. Then, like thousands of pieces of glass shattering simultaneously, countless identical images of the world flooded into the trio's minds. After their brains were bombarded by rapid fragments, causing a wave of dizziness... the three found themselves back in their original location.

Five Elders Council, Autumn Creek Prefecture.

"Huh? I'm all better now." Wang Xuanba, who had been reduced to the Qi Refining stage and was on the verge of death during the battle in the demonic sect, had already recovered his normal Golden Core Perfection cultivation. Not only that, but there wasn't even a trace of injury on him, as if the recent life-and-death battle had been nothing more than a dream. However, it was clear that what they had experienced was far from an ordinary dream.

"The sky has returned to its normal bright color," Yue Zhenwei observed, looking around.

"My Carefree Coins are no longer negative. They're 200 now!" Wang Xuanba said gleefully after checking. Although he still didn't know what these Carefree Coins were for.

Sun Erlang stared at the lines of text before him.

"Sun Erlang, Golden Core Perfection, Death count: 1."

"Land of Bliss Experience Level: 1."

"Carefree Coins: 500."

Behind the Land of Bliss Experience Level, a small progress bar appeared. The pink color occupied almost 30% of its length. Besides these changes in data, Sun Erlang's mind had gained something else.

"Humans are the foremost of all beings."

"The human brain, when consumed, can increase wisdom."

"The human liver, when consumed, can improve eyesight."

"The human kidney..."

Voices continuously echoed in Sun Erlang's mind. There was no sinister or evil aura; it was purely logical reasoning and explanation. However, when the taste and sensations of consuming various corresponding organs from his memories surged into his mind, the incredibly real feeling, as if he had personally experienced it, finally made Sun Erlang unable to bear it. He vomited on the spot.

Seeing Sun Erlang suddenly retching uncontrollably, Wang Xuanba and Yue Zhenwei looked utterly perplexed. It wasn't until Sun Erlang struggled to his feet and recounted his experience that their faces also turned pale.

"This... Erlang, you're not going to get addicted to eating human flesh in the future, are you?" Wang Xuanba shrunk his head.

"This Spirit Devouring Technique must be the cultivation method that pig demon practiced? If we pass the trial in the boundary worlds, we might be able to bring back items that appeared there into reality?" Yue Zhenwei said, as if awakening to something.

"Erlang, try circulating this Spirit Devouring Technique," he suggested.

Wang Xuanba was startled, while Sun Erlang, after his complexion slightly eased, nodded. Forcing down his nausea, he closed his eyes and felt. After a moment, he looked at Yue Zhenwei. "I don't sense anyone else cultivating this technique."

Yue Zhenwei stroked his chin. "The Land of Carefree Bliss has existed for so many years, yet no one else cultivates the Spirit Devouring Technique..."

Wang Xuanba's expression turned stern. "I understand. There's something wrong with this cultivation method."

Sun Erlang shook his head slightly. "That's not the main point. Although the Spirit Devouring Technique is a method the pig demon used to devour humans, the targets it can devour are not limited to humans. Any creature with spirits can be consumed."

"Therefore, although it's not comparable to a technique personally taught by Sage Master, the Spirit Devouring Technique is definitely an extraordinary cultivation method. One can cultivate it until the Nascent Soul realm without any issues. Even after reaching the Nascent Soul realm, one can continue to cultivate it, strengthening oneself by continuously devouring spiritual beings."

Wang Xuanba understood at this point. "A cultivation method like this, appearing in worlds that newcomers like us experience... yet there are no signs of anyone else cultivating it..."

"There are two possibilities. First, the dreams within this Land of Carefree Bliss are not bound by the law of 'Incompatibility of Laws.'"

"Second, dreams are ever-changing. New dream worlds are generated all the time. The one we encountered might also be a newly formed dream world."

Chapter 1311: Azure Nether's Initial Recovery

"Dream of Carefree Bliss." Sun Erlang's mind flashed back to the scene he'd just experienced, where countless demonic cultivators in the world had consumed humans. He couldn't connect the word "carefree" with any of it.

The three of them looked towards the border of Autumn Creek Province. The area where the demonic sect world had been was now gone, replaced by a white mist barrier that obstructed their view.

"Can we go back now?" Wang Xuanba exclaimed joyfully.

But things were clearly not as simple as he thought. When the Great Xuan trio attempted to pass through the white mist barrier and return to their homeland…

*Bang!*

What was once simply a mist that devoured origin energy had now transformed into a solid, insurmountable wall. Wang Xuanba, who was at the forefront, was sent reeling.

"It seems that completely leaving the Dream of Carefree Bliss might not be an easy task," Yue Zhenwei said with a heavy tone.

The three of them involuntarily looked towards the remaining two boundary worlds. They had a premonition that only by completing the trials in all three worlds would they know how to proceed.

...

The experiences of the Great Xuan trio in the Land of Carefree Bliss were transmitted, without omission, into Li Fan's mind through the silver eyes of the Dao Discussion Platform.

"Interesting."

Li Fan had lived through a hundred lifetimes, witnessing the demise of the Xuanhuang Realm, the revival of the Star Sea, and the collapse of the Great Wall. He understood far more from these experiences than his three Golden Core disciples.

"This is likely just the shallow region of the Land of Carefree Bliss. The dreamscapes are constructed using events from within the Xuanhuang Realm as a basis. For example, the giant stone by the sea in Stone Province, and the purple lightning that descended from the heavens to eliminate demonic beasts.
