"Anything from the star sea can potentially be operated in this manner." "Besides the resurgence of the star sea, immortal Spirit Qi, and the residual power of fragmented realms, this provides another avenue to strengthen the Xuanhuang Realm." Li Fan clenched the Immeasurable Mirror in his hand.

The Azure Nether World-Ending Mutation: Time flows, seas turn into mulberry fields, activating instantaneously. This mutation is the Xuanhuang Realm's acceleration of its own evolutionary speed, in a bid to find a method to cope with the world-ending catastrophe. In an instant, the space surrounding the Immeasurable Mirror seemed to accelerate countless times.

Chapter 1316

The flow of time had not truly changed.

It was the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth surrounding the Boundless Mirror that had accelerated its evolution countless times.

As if a skip button had been pressed, countless flickers of light and shadow occurred within a single breath, millions of times over.

The ancient Boundless Mirror visibly aged, becoming more weathered.

One could clearly see tiny gray particles, like dust, flying off the Boundless Mirror, carried away by the wind and then dissipating into the air.

A spiritual manifestation had spent nearly an entire lifetime concealed within the Boundless Mirror. Li Fan understood the Boundless Mirror even better than its original artifact spirit, Ling Sun Luyuan. Therefore, he could discern the changes occurring to it.

"This is the process of the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth digesting it..."

Although the shell of the Boundless Mirror gradually dissolved, the power of the deduction laws it contained remained. It was clear that the energy level of the immortal artifact was still above that of the current Xuanhuang Realm. Consequently, the Xuanhuang Realm lacked the ability to completely digest it.

Time and space continued to evolve at a speed millions of times faster. The ancient Boundless Mirror began to decay, leaving only the mirror surface after being eroded.

Eventually, it completely dissolved, leaving behind only a phantom image floating silently in the air.

As if sensing the law power of the wandering immortal artifact, an inexplicable change descended upon the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth.

Although this change was almost formless, Li Fan, with his current strength and understanding of the Xuanhuang Realm, could clearly see everything unfolding before his eyes.

A transparent human figure appeared beside the phantom image of the Boundless Mirror. The power of flowing time and changing seas seemed to have no effect on it.

The transparent figure floated closer and gradually overlapped with the phantom image, as if it were swallowing the Boundless Mirror.

Then, like ripples on water, the human figure slowly merged into the Azure Nether Heaven and Earth, disappearing from Li Fan's sight.

From beginning to end, this human figure did not spare Li Fan a glance.

It was as if taking away the law power of the Boundless Mirror was the only thing that mattered to it.

"Heaven and Earth's Essence, a type I've never seen before."

"And unlike all other Heaven and Earth Essences, cultivators who see it have no greedy thoughts of devouring it..."

Li Fan retracted his World-Ending Mutation divine ability and gazed into the distance.

He seemed to see, in a corner of the Xuanhuang Realm at this very moment, the transparent human figure attaching itself to a newborn infant.

As the infant grew, a new Boundless Mirror would be born, but it would no longer be an immortal artifact. Instead, it would be a Heaven and Earth Oddity of the Xuanhuang Realm!

Under normal circumstances, the Xuanhuang Realm would take thousands, or even tens of thousands, of years to complete the entire digestion and transformation process. However, with the enhancement of Li Fan's World-Ending Mutation, this process was completed in less than half a day.

Logically, helping the Xuanhuang Realm digest an immortal artifact should have resulted in a slight increase in its goodwill. However, Li Fan waited for a while but detected no increase in the Xuanhuang Realm's goodwill.

After a moment of thought, Li Fan realized. The transformation of seas and fields was, in essence, a form of "lifespan" consumption for the Xuanhuang Realm. With the gains and losses canceling each other out, it was a wash.

Li Fan did not really care about this. The growth in the Xuanhuang Realm's strength was substantial. Every increase in the Xuanhuang Realm's power would be reflected in the future Azure Nether Immortal Soul, and he would always be the ultimate beneficiary.

Retracting his gaze, Li Fan vaguely sensed that as the law power of the Boundless Mirror integrated into the Xuanhuang Realm, a qualitative change, from nothing to something, was brewing.

"The path of deduction of the Boundless Mirror does not currently exist in the Xuanhuang Realm. Once the Xuanhuang Realm devours and assimilates it..."

"The Heavenly Dao that can predict the future, how interesting."

The Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm should have records of most of what has happened, is happening, and will happen. With the infusion of sufficient information, the accuracy of predicting the future might even surpass that of the Boundless Mirror in its prime.

"This is the highest realm of deduction mentioned in the Great Origin Sect's [Nine Scrolls of Heaven's Derivation], using heavenly calculations to replace human calculations."

"For the Xuanhuang Realm, devouring an immortal artifact is not just an increase in power. It is more about the completion of its laws. With each immortal artifact devoured, it gets one step closer to becoming a true Immortal Realm." Such insights suddenly flooded Li Fan's mind.

...

Ten days later.

At the Great Xuan Dao Discussion Platform.

Senior Yin, Bai Hua, Qiao Gong, and Xu Ke had all arrived, waiting for Li Fan.

The determination to pursue the Dao had ultimately overcome their fear of unknown risks.

"It took us almost a month and a half to travel to the center of the Star Sea last time. I wonder how long this trip to the foot of the The Great Barrier will take," Qiao Gong sighed.

"The Sage Master said that the outskirts of the Star Sea are more dangerous. It might take several years to make a round trip," Bai Hua frowned.

Senior Yin laughed, "Let's think on the bright side. Perhaps we'll encounter some misfortune on the way and won't be able to return at all?"

Qiao Gong and Bai Hua were speechless.

As they were discussing, Li Fan's figure suddenly appeared on the Dao Discussion Platform.

Instead of leading them out immediately, he sat down solemnly and began to preach.

This time, Li Fan was imparting knowledge of the "Sword Dao."

"There are three types of swordsmen in the world."

"The lowest: upholding firm iron to forge their will, wielding sharp weapons to cultivate their bodies. Tempering their minds with the sword, their bodies and swords becoming one. Wielding swords to slay enemies, their bodies and swords becoming one."

"Above that: the sword in hand is the sword in the heart; the sword in the heart can transform into the sword in hand. Where the mind reaches, all things in heaven and earth can become swords."

"The highest: is the state of no sword, no self."

...

After initially summarizing the distinctions between the three realms, Li Fan began a detailed explanation for each level.

Below the Dao Discussion Platform, everyone listened with increasing fascination.

Even the four of them, Qiao Gong, Bai Hua, Senior Yin, and Xu Ke, were captivated by Li Fan's teachings, temporarily forgetting their mission to the Star Sea's outskirts.

As Li Fan's sermon deepened, various anomalies appeared in the sky. Not to mention the ones that always showed up during his sermons.

The most eye-catching was the countless swords that flew from all over Great Xuan.

Despite being ordinary mortal iron, they could now fly through the air, as if paying homage to a king or sage master, stopping in the sky, their bodies slightly bent in a bow.

More and more swords gathered, blotting out the sun and moon, forming a sword forest above the Dao Discussion Platform.

Thousands of swords stood silently, seemingly listening to Li Fan impart his teachings.

"Holding no sword in hand, the heart also ceases to exist; the form is not manifest, but the intent always remains..."

When Li Fan finished his last sentence seven days later.

The countless flying swords all erupted with dazzling radiance in unison.

When the sword light dissipated, the cultivators on the Dao Discussion Platform realized with astonishment that all thousands of swords had vanished!

The vast majority of cultivators were bewildered, believing that the flying swords had all returned from whence they came.

Only a few cultivators with extraordinary comprehension stared blankly at the sky, as if they had gained some insight.

"No sword, no self, the sword intent endures forever..." Xu Ke murmured, opening his palm to reveal the phantom image of a long sword hovering above it.

The other three exchanged a glance, their expressions solemn.

Just as they were about to discuss, Li Fan's voice suddenly echoed, "We are almost ready. It's time to depart."

"Know this, the journey ahead is fraught with unknown dangers, and you cannot turn back midway," Li Fan confirmed to them finally.

Everyone nodded, indicating their understanding.

"Sword..."

"Ascend..."

A gentle breeze swept by, and the phantom image of a wooden sword, as large as a colossal flying boat, enveloped Senior Yin and the others.

Li Fan stood at the tip of the sword, pointing forward into the distance.

The surrounding scenery transformed instantly. Twisted lines stretched out, hurtling backward. Then, the light merged, evolving into distorted colors.

The phantom image of the wooden sword isolated the group within its protection from the bizarre and chaotic scenery outside.

Even though they could feel the wooden sword carrying them at tremendous speed towards the depths of the Star Sea, the individuals inside the phantom image failed to perceive any change in their velocity.

Outside the phantom image of the wooden sword, the visual display abruptly turned dark. Colors vanished, replaced by intermittent, distorted shadows. Senior Yin's expression shifted slightly, "Have we already left the influence of the Immortal Ruins?"

The response he received was the shocked expressions of the other three.

"Didn't they say the path ahead would be full of dangers..." Qiao Gong's tone was inexplicable.

They could vaguely sense the wooden sword plowing through the Star Sea, advancing relentlessly.

Ignoring the lurking calamitous forces, it kept accelerating, charging towards its destination.

"No sword, no self, no sword, no self..."

"The sword was never truly in this world. Even the destructive power that annihilates the Star Sea can do nothing against something that doesn't exist!" Xu Ke's eyes fixated on the phantom image of the wooden sword, shining brighter and brighter.

At this moment, Li Fan's voice rang out again, "The fact that you chose to venture into the Star Sea with me proves your courage and conviction."

"You have all survived this far... unnecessary sacrifices should be avoided if possible."

"Sage Master..." The four looked at Li Fan's retreating figure, standing at the tip of the sword, their expressions complex.

Li Fan paid no mind to what the four behind him were thinking.

He was currently comprehending the art of sword control, which had reached its absolute limit.

Ten days prior, after helping the Xuanhuang Realm digest the Boundless Mirror, Li Fan had visited the ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

In the center of the Sword Tomb, that wooden sword seemed to have become extraordinary due to the transformation of the current Xuanhuang Realm.

Compared to thousands of years ago, when Mr. Bai casually created it, the wooden sword now seemed more profound, perhaps having undergone the passage of time.

"No one knows how many immortal artifacts the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao has devoured."

"Perhaps some of that law power has supplemented the Azure Nether Sword Dao..."

Li Fan had previously come into contact with and sensed this wooden sword in both the Fallen Immortal Realm and in reality.

The insights he gained each time were different.

Especially now.

Having come into close contact with immortal Spirit Qi and personally set up an immortal formation to end the world, Li Fan had new thoughts when he looked at this wooden sword.

"The more one knows, the more one can see."

"Or, one could say, the projection of the Sword Dao from the higher realms onto the Xuanhuang Realm has become more vivid."

Li Fan meditated in the Sword Tomb for seven days, leaving the black sword undisturbed, allowing it to continue to be influenced by the wooden sword.

Upon his return, he imparted all his insights at the Dao Discussion Platform.

Finally, it transformed into a divine ability, carrying Senior Yin and the others, rapidly speeding towards the outskirts of the Star Sea.

This phantom of "no sword, no self" was not merely about the Dao of the sword.

It was Li Fan's interpretation based on his own experiences, incorporating the [True-False Transformation], the "Hidden World Void Concealment" restriction taught by the Heavenly Physician, and the Golden Lock Array of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation.

It was not only extremely fast but also existed between the real and the illusory, almost ignoring the lingering power of True Immortal Sigils along the way.

However, it had not yet truly reached the realm of transforming the real into the illusory. The phantom of the wooden sword would still be affected by the residual power of True Immortals to some extent.

It was just that the phantom of the wooden sword was traveling so fast that it even surpassed the speed at which the residual True Immortal power could take effect, leading to the illusion of unchecked progress.

As the wielder of the sword, Li Fan could clearly sense the energy sustaining the phantom of the wooden sword rapidly depleting.

If not for his foundation being built upon the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven and the Azure Nether World-Ending Mutation, which were immensely profound and comparable in scale to several cultivation worlds of the past, he would likely not have been able to sustain it until now.

"Looking at the entire Xuanhuang Realm, apart from the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Physician, even the Longevity realm cultivators in the Five Elders Council might not be able to unleash this sword." Li Fan couldn't help but feel a hint of pride as he looked at the rapidly changing starscape and space-time.

With the augmentation of the phantom of the wooden sword, a journey that originally required more than half a year was now completed in only two to three days, with the destination already appearing in the distance.

Seeing the familiar remnants floating in the dead Star Sea, Li Fan controlled the speed to slow down.

"Is this the Sea of Remnants that the Sage Master spoke of?" Qiao Gong squinted, gazing ahead.

"It should be a convergence of residual items from various worlds after the former cultivation world was destroyed," Bai Hua recognized some decorative objects among them and explained to everyone.

Senior Yin, however, had been silent since arriving here, occasionally pressing his temples, his expression gloomy and uncertain.

The phantom of the wooden sword slowly traversed the Sea of Remnants. Before long, they had left this area.

Ahead of them, a larger aggregate of ruins appeared in their vision.

It almost filled their entire field of view. Even as mere ruins and wreckage, the accumulation of countless worlds' corpses sent shivers down their spines.

Within the phantom of the wooden sword, an eerie silence descended.

At this moment, the phantom of the wooden sword suddenly stopped.

"Hmm?"

Everyone was startled awake.

They saw Li Fan fly out of the phantom image and begin to set up a formation in a spacious area between the Sea of Remnants and the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

Golden lines, as if alive, quickly traced various patterns in the air.

After emitting light for only a moment, they faded into the darkness.

Various items flew out from Li Fan and merged with the grand formation.

At a glance, it was clear that this grand formation was extraordinary.

The crowd was so close, yet they could not sense the slightest fluctuation of the formation.

"Daoist Yin, what formation is this?" Qiao Gong asked softly, his astonishment evident.

Senior Yin shook his head, his gaze drifting not towards Li Fan's formation, but intermittently towards the distant Great Wall of Broken Realms.

Li Fan, without any qualms, erected the formation in full view of everyone. It was an immortal formation he had recently learned about from the original soul of Ji Yuzhen, the Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect.

The Heaven's Reach, Arm's Length Array!

Ji Yuzhen himself was not proficient in formations. He had only witnessed the Heaven's Reach, Arm's Length Array a few times under the leadership of the Heavenly Mysteries King.

However, with the enhancement of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, Li Fan could roughly reconstruct it.

Chapter 1317

The formation lived up to its name. The Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation could transform the distance of the horizon into the space between one's fingertips. Once completed, it would link the Xuanhuang Realm with the fringes of the starry sea. One could travel instantly through the formation, even without employing the Azure Dragon Whisker technique.

It seemed like a long-distance teleportation array, but it was not.

Within the Abyssal Sea, remnants of True Immortal power permeated the void. The Xuanhuang Realm, situated at the edge of the Immortal Ruins, was subject to an immense gravitational pull, causing space-time itself to warp and twist. Traveling such vast distances via "teleportation" was impossible due to the uncontrollable variables.

The Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation utilized the most fundamental method of travel. It simply compressed the distance between the departure and arrival points infinitely, allowing one to reach their destination with a single step.

The entire Great Xuan pocket world could not accommodate such a colossal immortal formation. Thus, on the Xuanhuang Realm side, Li Fan established the formation in the void outside the Great Xuan pocket world, further concealing it with a masking array.

On the starry sea fringe, as Li Fan completed the formation, an unfathomably profound fluctuation descended, poised to spread outwards. However, Li Fan pinched his fingers, using the surrounding masking array to block it.

The formation's golden light dimmed, and a silent, bidirectional channel connecting the Xuanhuang Realm and the starry sea fringe was born.

Li Fan stood in the air, adjusting his breathing and recuperating. "As expected of an immortal-grade great formation," he mused. "Even with the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc assisting me, setting it up was quite draining." The stored Essence of Primal Force was completely depleted, and Li Fan found himself in a brief state of exhaustion.

"The Essence of Primal Force still has a qualitative gap compared to true Immortal Spiritual Qi," Li Fan thought to himself. Within a few breaths, the power within his body was replenished.

He sent a sliver of his divine sense into the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation and activated it. In an instant, his vision blurred, and the next moment, he was back in the void outside Great Xuan, within the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan then slowly recalled the spectral image of his wooden sword.

"I have established a doctrine transmitter array here. Traveling back and forth will no longer be so troublesome," Li Fan stated nonchalantly.

Senior Yin and the others were deeply shaken. With their limited perspectives, they could understand the profound magic of a teleportation array spanning the entire starry sea. The long-distance teleportation arrays between various provinces within the Xuanhuang Realm often required more than ten formation masters working together for half a year to complete. This was even more so for the grand formation connecting the starry sea fringe and the Xuanhuang Realm, yet the Sacred Master had accomplished it with such ease.

Initially, the four men were somewhat skeptical. However, when Li Fan invited them to test it and they passed through the formation, sensing familiar energies of the Great Xuan pocket world, all their doubts vanished, replaced by immense shock and reverence for Li Fan.

"With the completion of one formation, the boundless starry sea becomes traversable. The Sacred Master's methods are truly comparable to a True Immortal," Skilled Artisan sighed in admiration.

"This formation... this formation..." Senior Yin murmured, utterly astonished.

Li Fan's voice drew them back. "This place will be our transfer and supply station for future exploration."

"Whether it be the Sea of Remnants or the Great Wall of Broken Realms, their vastness far exceeds that of the Xuanhuang Realm. Finding a suitable fragmented realm will not be easy."

Skilled Artisan asked, "Kindly enlighten us, Sacred Master. What secrets are involved? Isn't it sufficient to find any fragmented realm to serve as a medicinal catalyst for the Xuanhuang Realm's consumption?"

Li Fan smiled faintly and extended his hand towards the distant Sea of Remnants.

*Whoosh!*

An artifact of remnant was drawn towards them, rapidly flying in their direction. It was faintly visible as a blue and white robe, worn and tattered from the erosion of time. The bloodstains on it had turned dark.

"Hmm?"

Even from a distance, Skilled Artisan and the others suddenly changed expression. As the artifact robe flew closer, they sensed that the distance between themselves and their companions was rapidly increasing. It was as if the world had suddenly expanded, and their own bodies had shrunk countless times. Even their communication with each other became almost inaudible.

"True Immortal power!" They finally realized the influence was from the True Immortal power carried by the artifact robe. As the robe drew nearer, the distance between them continued to widen. Though standing beside each other, they could not see one another, as if isolated by the entire world.

In the boundless emptiness, Li Fan's voice boomed like thunder from the heavens. "Within the Abyssal Sea, all realms have been destroyed. However, the remnants of True Immortal power that caused the world's destruction still permeate everywhere. The various calamities we encounter on our journey towards the center of the starry sea are all manifestations of this True Immortal residual power. The artifact remnants and fragmented realms we encounter also contain this power. This robe contains the character 'Li'."

*Boom!*

Their vision instantly returned to normal, and the artifact robe changed its flight path, returning to the Sea of Remnants. Above their heads, an incredibly profound and complex "character" flickered into existence.

"True Immortal... script?"

The crowd stared blankly at the character above their heads, faintly sensing the terrifying power it contained.

"'Li'..." Recalling the experience of being separated from everything around them just moments ago, they used their hands as brushes, attempting to imitate it.

However, the character suddenly darkened and vanished into the air. Even the memories imprinted in their minds became blurry. No matter how hard they tried to recall, they could not reproduce it.

"The starry sea is filled with too many remnants of True Immortal power. Reckless action might cause them to resonate. To study True Immortal Sigils, special methods are required," Li Fan said, tapping his finger. A cultivation method instantly flew into everyone's minds. It was the method Li Fan had learned from the Mystic Immortal Boat in his previous life, universally used by the Academy of Proving the Dao, the Immortal Pivot Department, and the Immortal Severing Tower for researching, teaching, and inheriting True Immortal Sigils—the Various Forms Method.

Each stroke of the character, as well as the entire process of its inscription, had been deliberately modified to be imperfect, almost like a distorted imitation. The strokes weren't quite right, and when combined, they looked like a character but were not. It was like the most clumsy imitation, rendering the True Immortal Sigils's power millions of times weaker. Consequently, the influence of the True Immortal Sigils during research could be disregarded. Moreover, when a true, complete True Immortal Sigils was reproduced, the energy fluctuations that surged several times would serve as a good standard for judgment.

To truly unleash the power of a True Immortal Sigils, one only needed to erase all the modifications during activation. It was thanks to this wondrous method that generations on the Immortal Boat could research and pass down True Immortal Sigils. Within the Immortal Boat, only those who became disciples of the ruling elders were granted access to this method. Yet, Li Fan now imparted this marvelous method to Senior Yin and the others for free, without any conditions.

Both the Various Forms Method and the character 'Li' deeply shocked these individuals. If everything Li Fan had taught them before was within the realm of the "mortal," then this character 'Li' was unequivocally a power of True Immortals. In the current cultivation world, possessing such might and not hoarding it, but instead imparting it freely to others... Regardless of what hypotheses they had about Li Fan's motives, they were all subdued by his selfless demeanor.

"He truly deserves the title 'Sacred Master'," they all thought in unison.

Li Fan's lecture continued. "I have never seen the character 'Li' itself. I only inferred its True Immortal Sigils origin from the artifact containing it, based on the residual power. It is like a blind person touching an elephant; there will naturally be errors. The smaller the error, the more accurately the True Immortal Sigils's original power can be reproduced. I have deduced this character 'Li' to have a 98% similarity, yet I have been unable to progress further for a long time," Li Fan said with a sigh.

The crowd eagerly studied the character Li Fan had inscribed. They did not harbor any contempt for it being merely a similar form. As they were studying, faint, peculiar fluctuations reached them from afar. While Senior Yin and the others failed to notice, a gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"They've finally arrived." With a wave of his hand, he concealed the wooden sword's spectral image and the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation. He himself sped towards the direction of the fluctuations.

Not long after, two figures met him. Li Fan looked at the figures ahead. It was the Grand Elder of the Immortal Severing Tower, Zhong Daogong!

Zhong Daogong's expression was solemn. He looked at Li Fan, a trace of confusion in his eyes. He had sensed a familiar power fluctuation erupt and then disappear on the Immortal Boat earlier and had come to investigate. He had initially thought it was the residual True Immortal power from an artifact, but he hadn't expected the source of the power to be a cultivator! How many years had passed since he had seen a cultivator outside the Immortal Boat?

Zhong Daogong did not dare to be careless. "May I ask, Fellow Daoist, what brings you here...?"

Li Fan chuckled dismissively. "Brother Daoist must have misunderstood something. I was merely teaching my disciples True Immortal Sigils, and I didn't expect it to attract your attention."

"I didn't expect there to be surviving cultivators in this starry sea fringe?" Li Fan's tone was filled with surprise and curiosity.

Zhong Daogong narrowed his eyes, scrutinizing and pondering. He keenly noticed the words "starry sea fringe" in Li Fan's statement. At the same time, the mention of teaching True Immortal Sigils made his heart tremble. Without confirming the other party's intentions, Zhong Daogong did not attack directly but continued to inquire. "From your words, Fellow Daoist, it seems you come from the depths of the starry sea? Could it be that civilization has survived within the Abyssal Sea?"

Li Fan sighed. "Everything I encountered along the way was emptiness. I too thought there were no other survivors in the starry sea. I never expected to meet a cultivator at the end of my journey..."

The two probed each other with their words. After this exchange, Zhong Daogong only knew that Li Fan came from the depths of the starry sea, but he was completely unaware of the form, scale, or strength of Li Fan's world. Clearly, this cultivator capable of traversing the starry sea was no pure and simple soul.

Zhong Daogong examined Li Fan carefully again. Unable to discern the other party's background, Zhong Daogong suppressed his intention to attack and capture him.

"As you mentioned earlier, you were teaching disciples True Immortal Sigils. May I ask..." Zhong Daogong changed the subject, continuing his probing. To his surprise, Li Fan did not conceal anything this time and stated generously, "The civilization of the starry sea has been destroyed, and True Immortal residual power runs rampant. To survive, one must naturally leverage these powers. After thousands of years of research, there have been some gains. Survival is not as difficult as it was initially."

Li Fan's statement perfectly aligned with the philosophy of the Mystic Immortal Boat. Zhong Daogong nodded, not refuting it. "It seems your homeland's research into True Immortal Sigils has reached quite a respectable level. I am ashamed to say that we have also been studying True Immortal power for thousands of years, yet we dare not traverse the starry sea as easily as you do, confining ourselves to our corner."

Li Fan smiled faintly. "Brother Daoist, there is no need for modesty. I can sense on you..."

"The scent of True Immortal Sigils," Li Fan said, his tone unreadable. Zhong Daogong's expression shifted slightly.

Before Zhong Daogong could speak, Li Fan made a writing gesture and conjured the character 'Li'. "Brother Daoist, please tell me what you think of this character?" The barely visible character floated in the void.

This time, Zhong Daogong could no longer conceal his inner shock. He retreated rapidly, his eyes filled with caution. "Who exactly are you, Fellow Daoist? Why do you know our Mystic Immortal Boat's 'Various Forms Method'?"

"'Various Forms Method'?" Li Fan feigned ignorance, then seemed to realize. "You mean the imperfect method?"

"This is naturally a method painstakingly developed by our ancestors to decipher True Immortal Sigils." Li Fan looked at Zhong Daogong with great interest. "Could it be that Brother Daoist also knows this method?"

Not only does he know it. Zhong Daogong's expression flickered with uncertainty. His mind raced, trying to recall the list of people on the Immortal Boat who had learned this method. None of them showed any signs of leaving the Immortal Boat. "Could it be a coincidence?" Zhong Daogong was no longer sure. He stared at the character 'Li' that Li Fan had inscribed.

"You've actually surpassed the Immortal Boat's research?!" Discovering this, Zhong Daogong's heart was once again thrown into immense shock. It wasn't just because his research on 'Li,' a True Immortal Sigils, had surpassed that of the Immortal Boat. It was also because he had so easily displayed such a precious True Immortal Sigils to someone he had just met. He knew that every True Immortal Sigils was an absolute secret on the Immortal Boat, and even as the Grand Elder of the Immortal Severing Tower, he was not qualified to leak it casually.

"This can only mean that in this person's homeland, the research into True Immortal Sigils has reached a certain height. The character 'Li' no longer needs to be kept a secret," Zhong Daogong mused. An idea then sprouted in Zhong Daogong's mind.

"Fellow Daoist, are you interested in visiting?" Zhong Daogong asked. Li Fan's expression immediately showed hesitation. Zhong Daogong, fully understanding Li Fan's reluctance, stated, "If you are concerned, we can converse here in the void of the starry sea. Primarily, I wish to discuss our research findings on True Immortal Sigils with you in detail."

Chapter 1318: Transactions Beneath the High Wall

"Exchange insights..." Li Fan pondered, but did not agree for a long time.

Seeing this, Zhong Daogong let out a long sigh. Two wisps of black and white light, like traveling brushes, formed characters in the void.

"Fellow Daoist, please observe." Zhong Daogong was extremely solemn. Even in the desolate expanse of the star sea, he still set up restrictions around them to prevent the characters from being leaked.

The characters flickered, like sentient beings, coiling and flowing.

Li Fan glanced at them and said casually, "So it's [Hate]..."

"But your [Hate] seems to have some flaws."

Zhong Daogong's expression changed slightly upon hearing this. Just as he was about to speak, he heard Li Fan say proudly, "Watch how I write the character [Hate]!"

With swift strokes like a dragon and phoenix, another seemingly identical character instantly appeared.

The two characters for [Hate] stood side by side.

Zhong Daogong looked at the True Immortal Sigils Li Fan had written and was stunned for a moment. Then, his body began to tremble uncontrollably.

As the Grand Elder of the Severed Immortal Tower and the most knowledgeable cultivator of True Immortal Sigilss on the Mystic Immortal Boat, Zhong Daogong could clearly discern the subtle differences between these two characters.

Judging by the subtle fluctuations emanating from the two characters, the completeness of the one Li Fan had written was clearly superior to his own!

The degree of superiority was even greater than that of the previously displayed character [Leave]!

"This, this..." Zhong Daogong, repeatedly struck, found it difficult to accept. However, his years of research instinct compelled him to temporarily set aside all other thoughts and ponder Li Fan's inscription of [Hate].

Every subtle alteration brought it closer to its primordial essence. If he were to explore this on his own, it might take him ten to twenty years to catch up. But now, a single glance was worth countless nights of diligent study.

Unbeknownst to Zhong Daogong, this inscription of [Hate] originated from his own future self, several decades later. At this moment, only one thought occupied his mind: he absolutely had to "invite" this cultivator back to the Mystic Immortal Boat. He would spare no means to achieve this!

True Immortal Sigilss were simply too important to the Mystic Immortal Boat. Every additional script understood undoubtedly greatly enhanced the immortal boat's combat power. Moreover, that crucial plan they envisioned also required the collection of as many different types of True Immortal Sigilss as possible.

With this in mind, after deeply imprinting the new character [Hate] into his memory, Zhong Daogong looked at Li Fan and sighed in admiration, "Fellow Daoist's skill is profound; I am far inferior!"

"However... in my homeland, there are more than ten scholars who research True Immortal Sigilss like me. They have delved into this for many years, and their understanding of True Immortal Sigilss is no less than mine..."

Li Fan shook his head, a hint of disdain flashing in his eyes, interrupting Zhong Daogong. "To be honest with you, Fellow Daoist, in our Great Qi... "

Li Fan paused. "Everyone is united and working together with the goal of surviving in the shattered star sea. The research on True Immortal Sigilss is all shared. In contrast, your side..."

Zhong Daogong's heart leaped with joy upon hearing this. He said earnestly, "We actually have a similar sharing system. But after all, it is the research results of others. Without review, it is inconvenient for me to display them. But if you are willing to share and exchange, I can guarantee that you will definitely gain new insights."

"Fellow Daoist must also know how difficult it is to study True Immortal Sigilss. If we can complement each other..."

Zhong Daogong's persuasion gradually moved Li Fan.

Finally, Zhong Daogong delivered a powerful blow: "In my homeland, there is also an authentic True Immortal Sigils extant. If our exchange goes smoothly, it's not impossible for you to see it with your own eyes."

Zhong Daogong knew very well how great the temptation of authentic True Immortal Sigilss was to people like them. After speaking, he stared intently at Li Fan.

As expected, Li Fan's eyes lit up, and his hesitation vanished. "Is this true?"

After receiving Zhong Daogong's affirmative reply, Li Fan finally nodded in agreement.

"However, for our first exchange, let's do it here in the void." Li Fan suddenly added, pointing casually into the distance. Silver-white lines connected, and a grand formation slowly unfurled.

Within the formation, pavilions and towers rose from the ground, and small bridges intertwined with flowing water. Beneath the bridge, clear springs flowed, shimmering with light, and even fish could be seen playing within. The light and shadows flickered, creating an illusion of reality.

Zhong Daogong's pupils constricted as he witnessed this scene.

Li Fan was the first to fly into the formation, sat down in a pavilion by the water, and looked back, "Let's do it here."

"As the saying goes, one cannot be too careful. I am alone on this journey to the fringe of the star sea, so I must be cautious," Li Fan said with a look of naturalness.

Zhong Daogong pondered for a moment and then flew into the grand formation as well.

Birdsong filled the air, and as he walked on the bridge, the water flowed beneath him. Zhong Daogong could even feel the humid moisture in the air. It was hard to imagine that the scene of pavilions and flowing water before him was generated by a formation in an instant!

"I didn't expect that besides True Immortal Sigilss, you are also skilled in formations?" Zhong Daogong looked around and vaguely discerned that this seemed to be merely a formation to construct buildings in the star sea. However, the ability to create such an illusionary reality that even he could barely distinguish indicated the extraordinary nature of this formation.

"It's just a trivial skill," Li Fan said dismissively. "Studying True Immortal Sigilss has exhausted all my effort. Where would I have the energy to study formations... "

Zhong Daogong agreed with deep understanding and nodded.

After observing the formation for some time and finding nothing unusual, Zhong Daogong cupped his hands and said, "Then it's settled. Fellow Daoist, wait here. Before this incense burns out, I will definitely return with reinforcements."

As Zhong Daogong spoke, he waved his sleeve, and an earth-yellow incense stick flew out from his sleeve and stood in the air. The flame was already lit, and the incense smoke slowly wafted. Zhong Daogong paid his respects, retreated, and vanished into the dark star sea.

Li Fan's gaze lingered for a long time before he returned to Senior Yin and the others.

"Sage Master..."

Li Fan's sudden departure and prolonged absence led Senior Yin and the others to believe he had encountered trouble. As soon as Li Fan reappeared, they asked with great concern.

"I never expected that there would be surviving civilization on the fringe of the star sea. It must be that our formation to connect with the Xuanhuang Realm disturbed them," Li Fan said with a heavy expression.

His words were earth-shattering, and everyone was shocked. "Here? It's all dead silence. Where do they live?"

"I'm not sure yet; it was just a brief encounter. However, anyone who has survived in this shattered star sea must not be underestimated. You should remain hidden for now, and I will discuss further after I gather more information," Li Fan instructed.

Everyone nodded in agreement. Unknown entities in the star sea were enemies, not friends. One couldn't be too careful.

While waiting for the Immortal Boat's reinforcements, Li Fan continued his lecture to Senior Yin and the others.

"Relic artifacts contain residual True Immortal power, and so do fragments of worlds. If we were to have world fragments filled with residual True Immortal power absorbed by the Xuanhuang Realm..."

"It would likely cause world upheaval and widespread suffering."

"However, so many years have passed since the great calamity of the star sea. There are bound to be some fragmented realms where the True Immortal power has largely dissipated. Only such realms can serve as a medicinal guide." Li Fan spoke eloquently.

"With so many of us acting separately, finding suitable medicinal guides shouldn't be too difficult, right?" Qiao Gong looked at the continuous Great Wall of Fragmented Realms in the distance and said.

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

He pointed his finger forward, and a wooden sword phantom instantly appeared at the fringe of the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms.

"You may try going out," Li Fan said.

Qiao Gong was the first to step out of the wooden sword phantom's coverage. The moment he entered the outside world, Qiao Gong's expression changed drastically. He felt an immense suction force, pulling him uncontrollably towards the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms!

"Stabilize!"

A layer of golden armor appeared on his body. Qiao Gong fumbled, exerting considerable effort to barely stabilize his figure in the void. However, he still couldn't stop the tendency to move towards the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms. The armor on his body flickered continuously, as if reaching its limit.

Li Fan maneuvered the wooden sword phantom to envelop Qiao Gong once more. Freed from the terrifying suction, Qiao Gong gazed at the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms ahead with great fear.

"There's an Immortal Ruins here too?!" Everyone was incredibly shocked.

"It's not an Immortal Ruins, but a The Great Barrier," Li Fan said slowly, his tone ethereal.

"The suction from the Immortal Ruins is blocked by the The Great Barrier on the fringe of the star sea. Then, in a way we cannot currently comprehend, it converges beneath the The Great Barrier, accumulating over time to form this unique Immortal Ruins."

"The reason why the world fragments are connected is also to resist this [Echoing Stellar Force]..."

The scene Li Fan described deeply shook everyone present. Even without seeing the invisible The Great Barrier, its ability to trap the suction from Immortal Ruins that had shattered the entire star sea was proof enough of its power and mystery.

"Operating near the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms is no less difficult than in the fringe of the Xuanhuang Realm. A slight mistake could lead to loss of control and collision with the fragmented realm. And if residual True Immortal power still remains within..."

"Moreover, under the influence of the Echoing Stellar Force, the range of our divine sense exploration is greatly reduced. This is why finding medicinal guides and suitable fragmented realms to fill is so difficult," Li Fan said with a deep tone.

Li Fan extended his hand, and colorful crystals, like silk, appeared within it. "This is [Empty Light Flowing Crystals]. When used with the Light Dividing Rainbow Technique, it can resist this omnipresent suction to a certain extent."

"Remember, do not overexert yourselves. When the rainbow light is reduced to one-third, you may leave early."

Li Fan imparted the Empty Light Flowing Crystals and the Light Dividing Rainbow Technique from the Dharma-Preachers to everyone.

"Of course, if you can reach the realm of 'No Sword, No Self' like I have, you might be able to ignore this Echoing Stellar Force to some extent." The wooden sword phantom flickered, bringing everyone back to a safe zone.

"The Great Wall of Fragmented Realms contains countless world fragments. With my strength alone, finding suitable medicinal guides would be extremely difficult. Therefore, I need your assistance," Li Fan said earnestly.

Bai Hua couldn't help but ask at this moment, "Sage Master, what exactly are you seeking by going to such lengths? Is it merely to help the Xuanhuang Realm ascend and benefit from it?"

Li Fan sneered, "The Xuanhuang Realm ascends, and the crisis of world destruction is averted. We, nurtured by heaven and earth, might have a chance to break beyond the mortal limit. Is it not enough that it serves multiple purposes?"

As everyone was about to ask further, Li Fan's eyes flashed. "More people are coming over there. I'll be back shortly."

"You all stay here for now and familiarize yourselves with the use of the Light Dividing Rainbow Technique."

Before his voice faded, Li Fan's figure disappeared.

On the wooden sword phantom, everyone fell silent for a long time. Finally, Xu Ke broke the silence. "Actually, with Sage Master's strength alone, he could probably promote the Xuanhuang Realm's ascension, it would just take more time."

"But he still brought us, these burdens... it reminds me of Mr. Bai back then." Xu Ke said with emotion, his eyes filled with endless nostalgia. The others fell silent. Indeed, from their perspective, they offered nothing that the Sage Master would seek.

...

Outside the pavilion formation.

The elders of the Immortal Boat gathered, observing from afar without entering. Their divine senses exchanged continuously. "What do you think? Is it a trap?"

"It seems we were overthinking. There are no offensive measures. It should just be an illusion formation."

"It's just a formation. How powerful can it be? With so many of us, are we afraid of him?"

"Indeed, under the might of True Immortal Sigilss, any formation will be reduced to dust."

"Don't forget, the other side also understands True Immortal Sigilss. Furthermore, they seem to have a deeper grasp than us..."

The elders' exchange suddenly halted. At this moment, Li Fan, whom they had been waiting for, slowly emerged from the grand formation. He held the incense stick left by Zhong Daogong in his hand as if it were real.

About one-third of the incense remained. Li Fan glanced at everyone and nodded, "As expected, he kept his word."

Zhong Daogong introduced the newcomers to Li Fan. "This is Gan Jingda. This is Nangong Lie..."

After a round of pleasantries, Li Fan invited them into the formation for a detailed discussion. The members of the Immortal Boat exchanged glances, ultimately reaching an agreement and entering the formation together.

They settled in a pavilion inside and got straight to the point.

"May I know how many True Immortal Sigilss your homeland has deciphered so far?" Zhong Daogong asked directly. This question was crucial. All the elders of the Immortal Boat watched Li Fan, awaiting his reply.

"Thirteen," Li Fan said calmly.

The elders of the Immortal Boat exchanged glances. The vast majority showed expressions of doubt.

"Of course, that's a bit few. But only those with a completeness of over ninety percent are counted," Li Fan added.

This time, the elders of the Immortal Boat could no longer hold back and eagerly asked, "Fellow Daoist, is this true?"

Li Fan chuckled, his face full of pride. Zhong Daogong waved his hand, and the elders of the Immortal Boat gradually calmed down.

"It's not that we don't believe you. It's just that thirteen True Immortal Sigilss, and all of them with over ninety percent completeness..."

"It's somewhat hard to believe," Zhong Daogong looked at Li Fan.

Li Fan smiled and said directly, "We can exchange one character for one character."

The elders of the Immortal Boat exchanged glances again and reached a consensus.

"I have already displayed the characters for [Leave] and [Hate]. This time, you go first," Li Fan said loudly, looking at the members of the Immortal Boat. Despite being surrounded by a group of people, he showed no fear.

Chapter 1319: A Shortcut to Proving the Dao

Faced with Li Fan's request, the people of the Immortal Boat did not find anything amiss. However, they also put forth their own demands: "The True Immortal Script is a top secret of the Immortal Boat. Although this place is in the depths of the star sea where no one resides, we must still guard against eavesdropping and prying eyes. Therefore, we must also set up a formation here!"

Li Fan smiled and replied, "As you wish. If you find setting up the formation too strenuous, I can also help."

The elders of the Immortal Boat snorted and ignored Li Fan's teasing. They joined forces within the "Illusion Formation" Li Fan had set up, deploying another layer of formations. After finally deeming it foolproof, they began their formal exchange.

"This old man, Jian Daosheng, requests your guidance!" Without any further pleasantries, Jian Daosheng, the chief of the Immortal Boat's Celestial Pivot Department, solemnly wrote a True Immortal Script. Perhaps to suppress Li Fan's arrogance and gain the upper hand, the True Immortal Script he chose this time was indeed extraordinary. Li Fan had never had the opportunity to access it during his studies on the Immortal Boat in his previous life, even after becoming a disciple of Ai Tianjue and nearly becoming a core member of the Immortal Boat.

Dark lines slowly swam in the void. The moment the character was fully formed, it was as if a great sun illuminated the star sea, where Li Fan and the Immortal Boat members were situated, plunging the darkness into light. This True Immortal Script brought more than just a change in light and shadow. Under its radiance, it actually brought a hint of vitality to the dead, dark star sea!

"It's a True Immortal Script with a positive effect?" Li Fan's heart stirred, and his expression immediately became serious. He ignored Jian Daosheng's rather self-satisfied demeanor and concentrated solely on the True Immortal Script. With Li Fan's current knowledge, especially after glimpsing Creation and the mysterious character that created the bloodline of the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate, his ability to analyze True Immortal Scripts was almost unparalleled in the deep dark star sea.

He carefully perceived the character, which occasionally shifted and moved but always remained as high as a great sun. In just the time it takes to brew a cup of tea, the original meaning of the True Immortal Script represented by this character appeared in Li Fan's mind. [?]. Like the sun rising in the east, the vital energy resonating, all things reviving... Numerous such phenomena collectively formed this special True Immortal Script.

"So that's how it is." After completing the analysis of the [?] character, Li Fan also resolved a long-standing doubt in his heart. How did the Immortal Boat manage to survive to this day from the destruction of the star sea? Initially, Li Fan thought it was due to the Immortal Boat's divine tree formed by the Seed of Life Transformation. However, after spending a few years on the Immortal Boat, he gradually realized something was amiss. The Immortal Boat's divine tree needed to continuously absorb peculiar objects like the Dao Pursuer Giants and the Human Emperor Rabbit to provide sufficient energy for the Immortal Boat. This indicated that the divine tree alone was not enough to offset the consumption of the Immortal Boat's normal operation. For the past nearly ten thousand years, the divine tree had not been absorbing external energy all the time. During this blank period, what guaranteed the divine tree's vigorous growth? Moreover, the environment within the Immortal Boat, which was as vibrant and warm as a normal cultivation world, did not seem to be provided by a mere outer-realm divine wood. If nothing else, even the body of the Immortal Boat's divine tree, the outer-realm divine wood of the Divine Wood Sect in the Xuanhuang Realm, did not possess such miraculous functions back then. Today, with the appearance of this [?] character, this mystery was finally solved. It was precisely this True Immortal Script, representing the phenomenon of sunrise, that had provided the Immortal Boat with a viable living environment for a long time.

"This is the foundation on which the Immortal Boat relies for survival, a truly valuable treasure. These people on the Immortal Boat actually brought it out first..." "It seems they don't intend to let me leave?" Having mingled on the Immortal Boat in his previous life, Li Fan was well aware of the temperaments of these elders. They valued the True Immortal Script and the future of the Immortal Boat more than their own lives. Now, they were imparting a top-secret that concerned the fate of the Immortal Boat... Even if it were to be "one character for one character," it seemed extremely peculiar. "Unfortunately, your plan is destined to be in vain. You might be good at stirring up trouble, but to keep me here... Hmph!"

The formation set up by the combined efforts of the Immortal Boat elders, in Li Fan's eyes, was like a child's play, riddled with loopholes. Moreover, he now possessed peerless escape techniques; even if a True Immortal descended, he was eighty percent confident he could escape with ease. Naturally, he was not afraid of the siege by the Immortal Boat elders. Feigning ignorance of their scheme, Li Fan continued to focus on analyzing the [?] character. As his research deepened, he discovered some issues. The [?] character did indeed represent the phenomenon of young, rising yang. The morning sun was gentle, but that was from the perspective of the Immortal Realm. For the beings in the lower realms, the gentle sunlight from the morning sun of the Immortal Realm was not something they could withstand. The descent of the [?] character would likely not bring vitality, but rather instantly turn the world into a burning inferno!

"So, this is not a True Immortal Script with beneficial effects. It still represents destruction and chaos. It's just that the Immortal Boat members, by weakening the completeness of the True Immortal Script and reducing its power, have turned harm into benefit." "Marvelous, as expected of a force that has survived the great tribulation, they indeed have some tricks." Li Fan inwardly praised, but his face suddenly changed. He swept a cold glance at the Immortal Boat members, "This isn't right, is it?" "The completeness of this [?] character is definitely not ninety percent! Are you trying to fool me?" Li Fan appeared furious and then looked disappointed, "Forget it, I didn't expect you to be such untrustworthy people. The exchange is canceled!"

The Immortal Boat members were surprised that Li Fan could see through the '?' character's true nature so quickly. While shocked, Jian Daosheng quickly explained to Li Fan, "Fellow Daoist, you misunderstand! It's not that I deliberately hid it. In reality, for us in the lower realm, a [?] character with thirty percent similarity is actually more useful than one with higher completeness!" "Of course, if you insist, showing the complete [?] character is also acceptable." With that, Jian Daosheng wrote the [?] character again. In the void, even with the Great Technique of Myriad Laws greatly reducing the power of the True Immortal Script, Li Fan could still feel the warmth that had been around them instantly turn into suffocating heatwaves the moment the character formed. Vitality vanished in an instant, turning into a chilling, killing intent. Li Fan memorized the complete [?] character and then said, "Alright, I have to admit, you are right." "Since it was a misunderstanding, let the exchange continue!" Upon hearing Li Fan's words, the elders of the Immortal Boat secretly breathed a sigh of relief.

Li Fan coughed lightly, drawing everyone's attention, "Everyone, please watch carefully!" With a swift movement of his brush, the [?] character was written in an instant. The moment the [?] character appeared, the expressions of the Immortal Boat elders became somewhat nuanced, especially Ai Tianjue. He stared blankly at the character in the void. He probably never expected that the True Immortal Script he had researched most deeply would be written by the other party first. "The completeness is far beyond the current progress of the Immortal Boat, likely approaching ninety percent. This..." Ai Tianjue felt a sense of loss. In reality, Ai Tianjue did not know that the [?] character Li Fan wrote at this moment did not reach ninety percent of its intended meaning. Having learned from Ai Tianjue many decades later in his previous life, Li Fan's understanding of the [?] character was only around eighty percent. However, Li Fan, based on his understanding of Creation and the mysterious character representing the transformation between immortals and mortals, and even incorporating a sliver of understanding of "True-False Transformation," had reorganized and modified the [?] character. Infused with a deeper level of power, the [?] character written by Li Fan appeared more "advanced," even more like the true [?] character than the original. Li Fan was unsure if he could deceive the Immortal Boat elders with this method, but judging by their expressions, it was definitely feasible. He sneered inwardly, becoming even more confident in the smooth progress of his plan.

"Everyone, what do you think of this [?] character?" Li Fan asked loudly. Although he really wanted to say that this [?] character duplicated the Immortal Boat's research, their progress was indeed inferior to the other party's. And in a short period, the Immortal Boat elders would not be able to elevate their understanding of the [?] character to Li Fan's level. The Immortal Boat elders looked at each other. After some discussion, they decided to suffer this loss in silence. This time, it was the Immortal Boat's turn to act. Lu Yu of the Immortal Severing Tower wrote the True Immortal Script [?]. Although Li Fan's research on this True Immortal Script was still ahead of the Immortal Boat's, he did not push too hard, intending to play the long game. He pretended to mutter, "The character [?] is not uncommon in the star sea. However, our research progress is indeed inferior to yours." Li Fan cupped his hands and said, "I have received your guidance!" This time, the Immortal Boat members managed to regain some ground. The elders couldn't help but breathe a sigh of relief. After all, they had suffered greatly in the exchange so far. This reversal of the situation was a good start.

It was Li Fan's turn. The [?] character descended into the world. This [?] character was also derived from the Immortal Boat's research. However, the level of understanding had not even reached one-third, and it was completely unorganized. In his previous life, Li Fan had passed on this incomplete [?] character to Sun Tianci, and with his extraordinary comprehension, he had further deduced it. In this life, he added his own understanding and reconstructed and fabricated it. Similarly, he intended to test the level of the Immortal Boat elders. The result... Zhong Daogong and others, after a period of discussion, acknowledged the True Immortal Script provided by Li Fan. Li Fan remained outwardly silent but inwardly understood, "It seems the Immortal Boat has truly not encountered True Immortal Scripts at the level of Creation." "Copying and imitating from top to bottom is indeed not something they can see through in a short time." "Of course, with time, they might notice something..." Li Fan mused inwardly as the Immortal Boat displayed a new True Immortal Script. As soon as the character appeared, both the formation set up by the Immortal Boat elders and the "Illusion Formation" set up by Li Fan trembled slightly. As an absolute master of formations, Li Fan keenly sensed that under the influence of this new True Immortal Script, the most minute units maintaining the formation structure were beginning to disintegrate. Li Fan was instantly shocked. One must know that what he had seemingly casually set up was no mere simple Illusion Formation. It was a pseudo-immortal formation that integrated the downgraded versions of two immortal-grade great formations, [Desolate Falling, Empty Chamber Blooming Flowers] and [Immortals Descend, All Things Return to the Void]! It hid killing intent in the unseen, capable of silently killing all enemies within the formation. But even such a profound formation was damaged at its foundation by the weakened True Immortal Script... "If the power of this True Immortal Script were fully displayed, my pseudo-immortal formation would be shattered with a flick of the wrist." Li Fan, who considered formations his most important trump card, became extremely solemn. While repairing the gradually collapsing formation, he studied this newly appeared True Immortal character. "Undoubtedly, it's a formation-specific attack." "With this True Immortal Script, it's no wonder the Immortal Boat's formation level is so low." "It's hard to say if the Immortal Boat showing me this character was meant as a show of force." "Learning this character makes this trip worthwhile." Li Fan was very pleased with this exchange of True Immortal Scripts. At the same time, he slowly deciphered the true meaning of the character before him. [解] (Dissolution). The moment he comprehended the original true meaning of the True Immortal Script, Li Fan thought of his treasure, the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc. "Perhaps my Dissolution Disc is now similar to the Dharma Deduction Jade, a part of the Great Dao projected from bottom to top." "Perhaps I can try to use the Dissolution Disc to glimpse this path of [Dissolution]." ... As he mastered more True Immortal Scripts, Li Fan gradually discovered that it was not the True Immortal Scripts themselves that were powerful, but the Great Dao they indicated. True Immortal Scripts were merely a shortcut, a tool to help ordinary people, or even ordinary immortals, touch the Great Dao. "Similarly, Heavenly and Earthly Marvels and Eternal Residual Wills are similar shortcut tools." "Their essence is actually interconnected." "Script-Carving Immortal." Li Fan suddenly remembered this nameless True Immortal, who was said to have inscribed myriad paths, making them "approachable." "The paths of the Dao cannot be cultivated together. Yet this Script-Carving Immortal can understand all kinds of Great Dao so thoroughly..." It was truly beyond Li Fan's current imagination. ... Li Fan's fleeting thoughts did not affect the True Immortal Script exchange meeting in the void. Li Fan used characters like Chaos, Nothingness, None, and the character 谖, which he learned from the Immortal Boat in his previous life. He almost exhausted the Immortal Boat's millennia-long foundation in True Immortal Script research. Of course, Chaos, Nothingness, and the like were not the complete forms he saw, but rather weakened versions after slight modifications. Besides [?] and [解], Li Fan also learned [寒] (Cold) and [丧] (Loss). By this point, both sides had almost exhausted their reserves. The atmosphere in the venue became subtly awkward. "Everyone!" Li Fan spoke first, slightly breaking the deadlock. "I must admit that your research on True Immortal Scripts is indeed comparable to ours in Great Qi." "I never expected that there would be a civilization in the star sea that could match us..." Li Fan sighed deeply. Suddenly, his expression changed, "However, there are also differences between True Immortal Scripts!" "All the True Immortal Scripts we have exchanged so far, when added together, probably do not compare to this one I am about to display!" His words were earth-shattering. The elders of the Immortal Boat instantly suppressed their calculations and stared blankly at Li Fan. "Fellow Daoist, you must not speak such nonsense."

Chapter 1320: The Shock of Creation

"I, personally, never utter falsehoods!"

"Moreover... there's no need for exaggeration." Li Fan looked down on everyone, his face filled with pride.

The elders of the Immortal Boat, who had been restless, instantly lost their momentum.

They secretly discussed the reliability of Li Fan's words.

Nangong Lie: "A single True Immortal Script is equivalent to the sum of all others? I don't believe such nonsense."

Gan Jingda: "It's better to believe it exists than to believe it doesn't. The civilization this person hails from researches True Immortal Scripts to no lesser degree than our Immortal Boat… If they are lucky and have truly discovered something, rashly acting might lead us to miss out entirely."

Lu Yuzhi: "Indeed. It's too difficult to capture someone who possesses a True Immortal Script alive. We can only act instantly and kill him. In that case, we must extract as much knowledge from his mind as possible before making a move."

"No matter what, this child knows too many of the Immortal Boat's secrets. He absolutely cannot be allowed to leave." This was a consensus already reached by the elders of the Immortal Boat. Therefore, when Zhong Daogong spoke these words, no one objected.

At this moment, Ai Tianjue transmitted his voice: "How about this..."

After a brief exchange, consensus was once again reached. This time, Jian Daosheng spoke: "Since Daoist friend is so certain, we are truly intrigued."

"Its value surpasses the sum of more than ten True Immortal Scripts… If it is truly as Daoist friend claims, we are willing to pay any price to behold its true form."

The other elders of the Immortal Boat also nodded in agreement.

"It's just that I don't know what else you can produce? Ordinary True Immortal Script authentic copies are not enough," Li Fan pressed, his tone frighteningly arrogant.

Jian Daosheng smiled slightly: "Daoist friend, rest assured. Our world possesses the 'Myriad Insights Record,' passed down from ancient times. It contains information about the special products and treasures of those ruined cultivation worlds in this star sea. If what Daoist friend says is true, besides that authentic True Immortal Script, we agree you can choose any three treasures from within..."

Li Fan did not seem moved by the conditions Jian Daosheng proposed, only muttering to himself, "Myriad Insights Record, Myriad Insights Record… I seem to have heard that name somewhere."

Seeing this, the elders of the Immortal Boat were somewhat stunned.

Suddenly, Li Fan seemed to realize something and blurted out four words: "Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat?!"

Like a thunderclap, the words echoed in the ears of the Immortal Boat elders. Their auras changed drastically, and they all became as if facing a formidable enemy.

Zhong Daogong, seeing that the situation was amiss, secretly signaled the other elders to prepare for action. He himself forced a smile and asked, "What does Daoist friend mean by that?"

Li Fan cupped his fists: "In ancient times, the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat traversed the myriad worlds. Who didn't know of it? We originally thought the Immortal Boat had vanished with the dormancy of the star sea. Who would have thought that after ten millennia, it would still survive!"

"If my teachers knew, they would surely be ecstatic. No, I must quickly deliver this news to them..."

Li Fan's words made Zhong Daogong’s eyelids twitch. He quickly interrupted Li Fan, changing the subject: "Daoist friend flatters us. Since Daoist friend has recognized us, we shall hide our identities no longer."

"We are indeed descendants of the ancient Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat. However, much has happened over these past ten millennia. Although we survived the calamity of destruction, the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat was split into two. We are one of them."

Zhong Daogong looked at the somewhat surprised Li Fan and raised an eyebrow: "However, there is one thing I truly don't understand. The 'Myriad Insights Record' is a highly classified secret, even within our Immortal Boat. How could Daoist friend, an outsider, know of its existence?"

After learning the Immortal Boat's identity, Li Fan's attitude became considerably friendlier. He explained to the elders of the Immortal Boat: "To tell you the truth, my homeland, Great Qi, has a deep connection with the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat. It is precisely by relying on the immortal artifacts we obtained through trade with the Immortal Boat back then that we managed to survive this great calamity."

"Even now, that immortal artifact continues to shelter us. Therefore, the entire Great Qi feels a sense of gratitude towards the Immortal Boat..."

After hearing Li Fan's explanation, the elders of the Immortal Boat were bewildered.

Gan Jingda: "Old Zhong, is this true?"

Zhong Daogong frowned, recalling the Immortal Boat's records in his mind.

"In ancient times, the Immortal Boat did complete several artifact transactions. However, according to regulations and customer requests, relevant information was destroyed after the transactions were completed. The central core of the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat should have backups, but due to internal strife back then... this information should now be with the Merchant Immortal Boat," said Jian Daosheng, the chief of the Immortal Pivot Department.

"The fact that the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat sold immortal artifacts was only known to a very small number of forces back then. Since this person can mention it, it should be true..." Nangong Lie slowly said.

"Deep research into True Immortal Scripts, and protection by an immortal artifact..."

In the minds of the Immortal Boat elders, a powerful cultivation civilization that had been passed down from ancient times, Great Qi, slowly emerged.

At this moment, Li Fan gave them another huge surprise.

"Since you are people of the Immortal Boat, things will be easier."

"The Immortal Boat has always treated its customers with sincerity. I trust you!"

"Originally, I planned to not show my hand until I saw the rabbit. After all, this True Immortal Script is too precious. It was obtained from the immortal realm's memories remaining in an immortal artifact..."

Every word Li Fan spoke tugged at the hearts of the Immortal Boat elders.

"Everyone, please watch carefully!" Li Fan's voice suddenly rose several decibels.

The illusionary scene of pavilions and bridges abruptly vanished, replaced by rolling, boundless grasslands. A solitary stone stood on the grassland.

Suddenly, the earth began to tremble. Large patches of green grass, as if stimulated, began to grow wildly. In an instant, they became taller than a person, even pushing the solitary stone on the grassland up from the ground.

An arc of light flashed across the sky. The light was seven-colored, and one could vaguely see lightning and the convergence of storms within. Many invisible phantoms gathered around the seven-colored light arc, converging as if awaiting something.

A bolt of dark lightning struck the ground from the light arc.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

The world was split in two, and deep rifts appeared in space, refusing to heal for a long time. On the grassland, the continuous green grass was ignited, and fierce flames spread rapidly.

The grassland trembled, and beneath the raging fire, something seemed to be awakening. On the high heavens, the unseen figures around the light arc gathered even more intensely into the interior of the light arc. They even began to argue over positions. Loud rumbling and collision sounds constantly echoed.

The storm, having brewed to its peak, suddenly fell into stillness. The rolling black clouds vanished without a trace. Within the seven-colored light arc, in the clear sky for thousands of miles, a profoundly mysterious character was clearly visible!

...

The scene abruptly ended here. The Immortal Boat elders, who had been deeply immersed, suddenly glared and turned to look at Li Fan.

"What about the rest?" Jian Daosheng shouted impatiently, losing his composure. The chief of the Immortal Boat's Immortal Pivot Department had vaguely glimpsed fragments of the True Immortal Script hidden within the light arc. Even though Li Fan had suddenly interrupted the image, preventing him from seeing it completely, Jian Daosheng was still certain that the power of that True Immortal Script far surpassed any other True Immortal Script he had seen before! This Great Qi cultivator hadn't lied!

"How much did you clearly see?!" Jian Daosheng asked, his voice almost a roar.

"Too fast! He stopped it too quickly! How could such a powerful True Immortal Script be fully understood in an instant?!"

"No mistake, this feeling that makes my entire soul tremble… it's even stronger than the first time I glimpsed a True Immortal Script. Its power is far beyond that of a single script!"

"The scene just now, was it True Immortals of the Immortal Realm fighting for the character within the solitary light? Even Immortals were vying for it… Unimaginable, unimaginable!"

"We must get it at all costs!" The elders of the Immortal Boat, outwardly calm, were internally in an uproar. After personally witnessing the mysterious character within the solitary light, they no longer doubted Li Fan's previous words. At the same time, they instantly reached a unanimous decision: they must obtain this True Immortal Script for themselves!

The elders of the Immortal Boat were already impatient, but Li Fan seemed oblivious. He said solemnly, "There's one thing I need to say upfront. The scene I just showed you comes from the memories of an immortal artifact from ancient times. It was originally imprinted deep within the immortal artifact, not easily detectable. However, over the past ten thousand years, as our Great Qi has deepened its development and utilization of this immortal artifact, we have finally managed to unearth it."

"Back then, the immortal artifact had just been created and its power was weak, not enough to perfectly record that True Immortal Script. Therefore, what we have reproduced from it is merely a flawed copy..."

The elders of the Immortal Boat were all deeply versed in True Immortal Scripts. How could they not understand Li Fan's meaning? Instead of being disappointed, they gained even more trust due to Li Fan's "honest" attitude.

"Daoist friend, since we've talked to this extent, why not head to the Immortal Boat? The authentic True Immortal Script, treasures from the Myriad Insights Record, you can choose anything you wish!" Zhong Daogong suppressed his inner excitement and said in a deep voice.

Amidst their expectant gazes, Li Fan pondered for a moment before finally agreeing with a smile: "I have long heard of the Immortal Boat's reputation. Now that I have the honor to visit, I will definitely boast to my teachers and fellow students when I return..."

The elders of the Immortal Boat all breathed a sigh of relief. Escorted by them, Li Fan left the illusionary formation in the void and headed towards the Sea of Remnants.

After passing through the Sea of Remnants and reaching the outer areas, Zhong Daogong activated a technique, revealing the hidden Immortal Boat. A flicker of disappointment flashed in Li Fan's eyes, but it was quickly concealed.

Upon entering the Immortal Boat and seeing the divine tree floating in the void, he became somewhat amazed again. The elders introduced Li Fan: "This is the 'Life-Transforming Divine Wood.' Its true form is said to be a majestic divine tree rooted beneath the endless star sea, its branches stretching far and wide to encompass countless cultivation worlds."

"When the divine tree's branches penetrate a cultivation world, they can absorb its life force, and its roots integrate with the world. Thus, it earned the name 'Life-Transforming.' It is through this method that the divine wood could multiply to cover the entire star sea."

"However, these are all legends. No one has ever seen the true form of the divine wood. Now that the star sea is shattered, it is unknown whether this divine wood still exists..."

The elders' conversation soon shifted to other sights within the Immortal Boat.

"This three-eyed golden head comes from the ancient cultivation world 'Dust Abyss.' It is said that this world had True Immortal bloodlines circulating within it, hence most of its cultivators had three eyes. They possessed extraordinary talent and various incredible divine abilities. However, when the great calamity descended, Dust Abyss was among the first worlds to suffer misfortune."

As they chatted, they soon reached the top of the divine tree within the Immortal Boat. With a nod from the elders, they did not avoid Li Fan, an outsider, and jointly cast a spell. Invisible ripples spread from the top of the divine tree. Then, a pink flower appeared in the void and slowly bloomed. Although it was merely an image, not a physical entity, a faint fragrance wafted from it. A path appeared in the center of the flower.

"Daoist friend, please!" Zhong Daogong said to Li Fan.

Li Fan smiled and, seemingly without any reservations, walked directly into it. As he stepped forward, the scene before his eyes instantly changed. Rows upon rows of wooden cabinets stood in perfect order, stretching as far as the eye could see. In the air, a long, slender arm was constantly manipulating these cabinets.

When it sensed Li Fan, the newcomer, the long arm's movements suddenly stopped. It extended five fingers, reaching out to grab Li Fan. Fortunately, the elders of the Immortal Boat, who arrived shortly after, stopped the long arm's actions.

Li Fan looked at the long arm with great interest and asked, "It doesn't seem to be alive?"

Zhong Daogong nodded: "Daoist friend has sharp eyes. Strictly speaking, this long arm is also a True Immortal Script, but it is the sum of fragments of countless True Immortal Script structures."

"Many years ago, due to a moment of carelessness, the Immortal Boat was robbed. Several treasures within the Myriad Insights Record were lost. Afterward, we learned from this painful experience and developed this 'Immortal Severing Arm.'" Zhong Daogong's face showed a hint of pride: "Without the collective permission of the Immortal Boat elders, no matter how strong one is, it is impossible to take away treasures before this Immortal Severing Arm..."

"It's absolutely impossible." Jian Daosheng also said: "Can Daoist friend discern the mystery of this 'Immortal Severing Arm'?"

Li Fan squinted, observed for a while, and seemed to have an epiphany: "The Immortal Boat has directly inscribed the structural fragments of the True Immortal Script into this space?"

"In fact, the place we are in is within the Immortal Severing Arm?"

Zhong Daogong smiled: "Not only that! Even the numerous treasures within the Myriad Insights Record have now all become part of the Immortal Severing Arm. To take one away, one must undergo our secret separation method."

"Otherwise, you can only take the entire Immortal Severing Arm with you..."

"Hmph, that is absolutely impossible for any mortal." Nangong Lie also added: "Let alone us old guys being here. Just this detached arm, which has integrated the power of many True Immortal Scripts..."

"I'm afraid there isn't a cultivator in the entire star sea right now who can forcibly transfer it."

...

Li Fan merely nodded and praised as he listened to the words of the Immortal Boat elders. Then, within the secret treasury of the Myriad Insights Record, he leisurely browsed and patiently began his selection.

Chapter 1321

This hidden treasury, a relic of the True Yang Immortal Boat passed down from ancient times, truly contained many valuable items within the Record of a Hundred Heard Truths.
