As the sole surviving land in the current Abyssal Sea, the Xuanhuang Realm could be said to have accumulated the essence of the entire star sea. Li Fan, having traversed myriad reincarnations, had practically turned the Xuanhuang Realm upside down. Ordinary hidden treasures and treasures were naturally difficult to capture his attention.

Yet, as he wandered through this place, Li Fan still saw many objects that piqued his interest.

For instance, a seemingly bronze-cast immortal crane. According to the documentation in the Record of a Hundred Heard Truths, this bronze-cast immortal crane was actually forged from numerous Immortal Artifact fragments. Although it possessed no immortal artifact powers, due to its material, it was incomparably sturdy. All sorts of divine abilities and techniques could not damage it in the slightest. It wasn't exactly indestructible, but at the very least, the great calamity that destroyed the Abyssal Sea had not caused it any harm.

"Constrained by the limitations of mortal materials, the Heavenly Yang Immortal Puppets refined in previous lives, despite being infused with Primal Force Essence, still failed to break through the mortal limit. Being able to delay the Dharma-Preachers for a while was already a testament to the Heavenly Yang's resolute fighting will. However, if this material were to be incorporated during the smelting process..." Li Fan's thoughts flashed by.

Another example: a streak of seven-colored divine light. It bore a striking resemblance to the "Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light" that Zhong Shentong had fished up from the Fishing Pond. However, the Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light was formed by a great divine ability cultivator who collected and refined the seven streams of golden light that illuminated the world in the Cultivation World of Chongyan. It was an evolution of the Heavenly Dao, containing the origin of the world. The streak of divine light in the Record of a Hundred Heard Truths, on the other hand, was the remnant of an unknown Cultivation World after its natural end. It could be considered the corpse of a Cultivation World.

Li Fan had personally refined the Seven-Colored Jade Void Golden Light. In his perception, although these two seven-colored divine lights were not identical in essence, they were subtly connected.

"Perhaps it involves the evolution from death to life in a world..." Li Fan, who had naturally claimed the Fishing Pond as his own in this life, spontaneously developed the idea of gathering both seven-colored divine lights and conducting a detailed comparison.

Another example: a figurine of a woman standing elegantly with her head bowed and eyelids lowered. The True Yang Immortal Boat had unexpectedly acquired it, but after much research, they couldn't figure out its purpose. Thus, it was placed in the secret treasury, slowly forgotten by the world. When Li Fan passed by this figurine, he clearly sensed a subtle disturbance from the "Return to Truth." Although not as agitated as when he encountered an Eternal Residual Will, its ability to elicit a reaction from "Return to Truth" was enough to indicate its extraordinary nature.

"It should also be related to the 'Dao's Projection'." Li Fan remained composed, his gaze not lingering on the figurine.

...

Li Fan patiently selected items in the Immortal Boat's secret treasury, while three elders of the Immortal Boat were always accompanying him.

They didn't interfere, merely watching Li Fan’s every move silently and attentively.

"It seems the thief from the past truly caused the Immortal Boat heavy losses. Even with the 'Immortal Severing Arm' as a failsafe, you elders are still not at ease," Li Fan quipped suddenly, stopping in his tracks.

Gan Jingda, Nangong Lie, and Lu Yu, their eyes fixated on their noses and their noses on their eyes, pretended not to have heard him.

"I wonder what the Immortal Boat lost back then?" Li Fan continued his treasure hunt, asking casually.

"Hmph, hmph..." The Immortal Boat elders, upon hearing this, mostly wore expressions of indignation.

Zhong Daogong's voice echoed from afar: "The past is too painful to recall. But after all these years, if you're interested, there's no harm in telling you."

"Among the few supreme treasures lost by the Immortal Boat back then, the most precious was the 'Ice Crystal Immortal Amber'," Zhong Daogong said with a hint of nostalgia.

Seeing Dao Sheng, the Chief of the Immortal Severing Tower, who seemed to have been involved in that event, he suddenly sighed: "Even now, the dreamlike and ethereal appearance of the 'Ice Crystal Immortal Amber' occasionally surfaces in my mind. I only regret not being more forceful back then and stopping it. Thus, a tragedy occurred."

The other elders also sighed in unison.

Li Fan asked curiously: "Ice Crystal Immortal Amber? The name itself sounds beautiful. But what exactly is this thing?"

Zhong Daogong: "The Ice Crystal Immortal Amber is actually a frozen Cultivation World. Its origin is related to an extremely rare celestial phenomenon in the star sea during ancient times."

Li Fan's curiosity grew more intense, and he humbly asked for details: "I wish to hear more."

"The star sea at that time was not as desolate and dead as it is now. Besides countless Cultivation Worlds full of life and diverse scenery, there were also many star sea anomalies that appeared from time to time."

"Celestial Whales Leaping, Starry Horses Galloping, Yin-Yang Vortices..."

"When these anomalies erupted, they often covered an entire star domain, affecting dozens of Cultivation Worlds. Some merely displayed strange phenomena on the world's celestial dome, while others could bring world-ending disasters to Cultivation Worlds!"

"'Crystallized Wind' was one of them."

"An ice-cold wind, whose origin was unknown, suddenly descended. It blew from the starry sky towards the earth. Wherever the frigid wind passed, whether it was Soul Transformation, Dao Integration, or Longevity, not even a moment's reaction time was given. Everything was instantly frozen. All living beings in the world, and even the world itself, were turned into ice sculptures under the breath of the Crystallized Wind." Zhong Daogong lightly tapped his finger, and a terrifying scene of a frozen world appeared above the Immortal Boat's secret treasury.

"The frozen Cultivation World would then silently remain in the star sea, never to be thawed. Any living being that attempted to approach would also be affected by the absolute cold, either fleeing severely injured or becoming an eternal ice sculpture themselves."

Li Fan observed the scene above, frowning slightly: "I understand the meaning of 'Ice Crystal.' But what do the words 'Immortal Amber' signify?"

Dao Sheng then explained Li Fan's doubt: "If it were merely a world frozen in ice, the True Yang Immortal Boat would not have considered it a supreme treasure. In fact, although the probability of the 'Crystallized Wind' occurring is small, given the vastness of the star sea and the accumulation of tens of thousands of years..."

"The number of surviving frozen worlds would not be particularly small."

"The reason the one collected by the Immortal Boat back then was so highly valued was because there was a particularly special existence within that frozen Cultivation World." Dao Sheng's tone faltered, as if returning to the past.

"The 'Crystallized Wind' blew down from the starry sky. The world should have instantly turned into an ice sculpture. However, that world actually manifested a phantom figure, attempting to block the icy wind..."

"But how could star sea anomalies be resisted by mortal cultivators? It is said that during the most violent outbreak of star sea anomalies, even True Immortals had to retreat, let alone mortal cultivators like us."

"So the outcome was obvious. The act of saving the world was like a mantis trying to stop a chariot, leading to its own destruction. But, after all, it did manage to obstruct it for a tiny fraction..." The world was not frozen in an instant, but it gave the living beings within a moment's reaction time.

Dao Sheng continued with emotion: "It was precisely this momentary change that created a completely different ice sculpture. In the face of world-ending disaster, the expressions of the living beings varied. Some were fearful, some desperate, some saw that phantom figure and felt hope, some were in disbelief... It truly embodied what it meant to be 'a hundred forms of living beings'."

"If it were only this, it would at most be a slightly rarer frozen world. It wouldn't be worthy of our Immortal Boat bestowing the name 'Immortal Amber'."

Dao Sheng went on to say: "The reason it's named 'Immortal' is even more so because of the illusory figure that attempted to block the 'Crystallized Wind'."

Li Fan couldn't help but speculate: "Could it be that a True Immortal was truly sealed within that frozen world?"

Dao Sheng shook his head: "Not exactly. If there were a True Immortal sealed, our Immortal Boat would likely not dare to keep it on board. But, purely in terms of value, that phantom figure might be even more precious than a True Immortal. After all, before the Immortal Path was severed, there were those who ascended to immortality from various realms."

"However, an 'Embodied Heart Demon' is truly unprecedented and historically rare!"

Li Fan's eyes narrowed upon hearing this: "Heart Demon? Embodied?"

In his previous life, when he possessed Zhao Xian to cultivate, Li Fan had already experienced the process of heart demon disturbances in the center of the star sea. As long as cultivation didn't stop, heart demons would accompany the entire cultivation journey, relentlessly. Even if forcibly suppressed with external forces, they would return soon after, becoming more severe. Zhao Xian in his previous life, unable to shake off the interference of heart demons, and with his cultivation advancement affected, was directly taken over by Li Fan, who was impatient, using the Dao Pill technique.

This was still the case with heart demons under the fragmented laws of the star sea.

Even after being weakened by several times, they could still have such a significant impact on a cultivator's progress. One could imagine how terrifying heart demons would be when the laws of the ancient star sea were complete.

No wonder ancient cultivators turned pale at the mere mention of heart demons and avoided them like the plague.

However, what Li Fan experienced through Zhao Xian's body was merely the various illusions erupting from within. He had not seen the true source that triggered these illusions.

"Heart demons should be a form of law. How can they even have a physical form?" Li Fan feigned astonishment and disbelief.

"This is precisely why the 'Ice Crystal Immortal Amber' is so incredibly precious. If one hadn't seen it with their own eyes, no one would have imagined that such a wondrous object could exist in this world."

"After collecting this Ice Crystal Immortal Amber back then, the entire Immortal Boat debated for decades. Only then did they confirm the identity of the heart demon as the phantom image within the frozen world. It was speculated that this heart demon evolved from the heart demon laws of another Cultivation World. We just don't know why it left its original world and suffered such undeserved misfortune."

Zhong Daogong suddenly chimed in again: "Regarding this point, the Immortal Boat did have a reasonable guess. Heart demons are formless and shapeless, not bound by space, and can freely traverse the star sea. Without the burden of a physical form, they can even appear directly in a cultivator's heart. It's not uncommon for cultivators to be influenced by heart demons, becoming mentally unstable, as if they've become a different person. The invasion of heart demons can be seen as the ultimate form of possession."

"This materialized heart demon, though extremely special, still cannot escape the inherent characteristics of a heart demon. Traversing the star sea and finding a suitable host to parasitize is its instinct. Perhaps this is why it appeared in that frozen world."

"Even, judging by the strength of the power it displayed when the world was frozen, it's not just cultivators. Even the world's Heavenly Dao consciousness could be eroded by this materialized heart demon."

"To bewitch the Heavenly Dao of other worlds and replace it. Perhaps it would be more appropriate to call it a 'Heavenly Demon'."

...

Zhong Daogong spoke eloquently, his words filled with regret over the lost treasure.

Li Fan, however, felt a stir in his heart.

The scene of the Doctrine Transmitter's body gradually dissolving under the world-ending storm of the Immortal Formation in his previous life, revealing a transparent figure within, flashed through his mind.

The moment Li Fan saw this transparent figure, a faint sense of familiarity washed over him.

It wasn't that Li Fan had seen this transparent figure before.

Rather, he had come into contact with the aura of the "kindred" of the transparent figure.

The familiarity came from Heavenly Judgment, Heavenly Oracle, Heavenly Sound, Heavenly Physician.

Or rather...

From the Heavenly Law Realm.

"Heavenly Demon..."

Li Fan perhaps understood the reason why the Doctrine Transmitter had infiltrated this place in his previous life.

"Is the Heavenly Demon also a member of the Heavenly Law Realm Venerates?"

"The Heavenly Law Realm Venerates represent Heaven and guide the Dao. And the Heavenly Demon is the manifestation of the path of heart demons."

"However, due to its inherent nature, the Heavenly Demon roams the star sea, often absent from the Heavenly Law Realm. It might even have the misfortune to encounter an extremely rare star sea anomaly and suffer eternal freezing. If it hadn't been for the Doctrine Transmitter rescuing it later, it would likely have been eternally frozen and become a collection of the Immortal Boat."

"But why would the Doctrine Transmitter save the Heavenly Demon? And even be corrupted by it later?"

The figure of Heavenly Physician appeared before Li Fan's eyes.

Based on their interactions in his previous life, the Doctrine Transmitter was clearly under Heavenly Physician's control.

Previously, Li Fan had speculated that the Doctrine Transmitter was a clone refined by Heavenly Physician.

But now, it seemed their relationship was not that simple.

"Doctrine Transmitter, Xuanyuan Gou Dan. Perhaps he is a reincarnation of the Heavenly Mysteries King..."

"In the first half of his life, he was a mortal. He suddenly awakened, as if some consciousness had transmigrated into him and possessed him," Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

...

"Regardless, I finally know why the Doctrine Transmitter is controlled by Heavenly Physician. It's due to the 'Heavenly Demon' deep within his divine soul."

Li Fan also thought that the Xuanhuang Realm currently had no heart demons.

Perhaps this was not solely due to the Doctrine Transmitter's new law.

With the materialized heart demon, the "Heavenly Demon," present, naturally, no minor heart demons would descend to interfere.

His thoughts churned. After listening to the accounts of the Immortal Boat elders, Li Fan couldn't help but sigh with genuine emotion: "So, that is indeed an extraordinary treasure. To have it stolen like that is truly hateful."

"What did that thief look like? Is he still alive?" Li Fan asked.

"If you have enough information, perhaps our Great Qi can help track down this thief."

Zhong Daogong raised an eyebrow and asked: "True Immortal Sigils?"

Li Fan shook his head: "No. It was an Immortal Artifact that protected the realm, integrating the power of a grand formation. It's quite profound, and I can't explain it in detail."

Although he spoke vaguely, the power of "Creation" previously displayed had already fully demonstrated the depth of the "Great Qi" civilization. Therefore, Li Fan's statement did not arouse suspicion among the Immortal Boat elders.

After all, Li Fan hadn't made a definite promise, only saying "perhaps."

The Immortal Boat elders deliberated, and to avoid arousing Li Fan's suspicion, they still displayed the appearance of the thief from that year.

Indeed, it was the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate.

However, the record image left by the Immortal Boat differed slightly from the Doctrine Transmitter Li Fan had seen in his previous life. His expression was more vivid, as if they were two different people.

Chapter 1322

"This person's brow is filled with compassion, not like a cunning rogue," Li Fan commented.

Seeing Dao Sheng snorted, "That's what we thought of the Immortal Boat back then. So, you can know a person's face but not their heart!"

Zhong Daogong asked, "Can this person be tracked based on his appearance alone? Do we need to use other methods?"

"It would be best if we had a token from this rogue. If not..."

"It doesn't matter."

Li Fan appeared confident regarding the "Great Qi Immortal Artifacts," "Based on their appearance and life events, it is sufficient for deduction and tracking."

"However, I will need to return to Great Qi to report the information."

Li Fan's words caused some minor disagreements among the elders of the Immortal Boat.

Seeing Dao Sheng said, "Actually, we don't necessarily have to kill this person. Great Qi's research on True Immortal Script is not inferior to the Immortal Boat's. If we can use this opportunity to maintain contact and exchange resources, it might be a good thing for our Immortal Boat."

Seeing Dao Sheng's words were agreed to by several elders, "Indeed, the reason we planned to eliminate him before was the fear of leakage of True Immortal Script researched by the Immortal Boat. But from the current situation, Great Qi's research has many commonalities with the Immortal Boat’s. And unlike us, their oversight of this inheritance is not so strict...

"Moreover, judging from this person's words, the cultivation world where Great Qi is located is not small and is abundant in resources. Esteemed elders, don't forget the Immortal Boat's staple trade! Trading across realms, connecting through the ages. This has been the Immortal Boat's creed since ancient times. Killing him is of no benefit. If we befriend them, perhaps we can escape the Immortal Boat's current predicament!"

"Don't forget that plan! It requires collecting as many True Immortal Scripts as possible. Originally, with our Immortal Boat's collection progress, it might take hundreds of years to complete. But if we can get supplementary information from Great Qi, we might be close to achieving our goal!"

...

What the elders said was both reasonable and logical. Gradually, the elders who had insisted on killing Li Fan afterward began to hesitate.

After all, weighing the pros and cons was essential for the Immortal Boat to go further. Being rigid and inflexible would only lead the Immortal Boat to ruin. This was the lesson the Profound Heaven Immortal Boat had learned from surviving numerous tribulations.

Finally, Zhong Daogong made the final decision and unified their opinions, "Let's first see the true power of that True Immortal Script."

While the elders of the Immortal Boat were deliberating, Li Fan had already finished selecting items from the secret vault.

They were the three items he had been interested in earlier: the Bronze Immortal Crane, the Seven-Colored Flowing Light, and the Head-Bowing Puppet.

"Fellow Daoist, are you sure about these items? Once selected, they cannot be changed," Zhong Daogong swept his gaze over them and reminded Li Fan with a smile.

Li Fan nodded in confirmation.

Zhong Daogong then joined the elders and cast a spell in the void, summoning a piece of white paper.

[Severed Immortal Arm] from the Hundred Heard Immortal Record was controlled, and its arm was imprinted onto the white paper.

The blank paper was instantly stained black with ink.

Three profound patterns were formed, very similar to True Immortal Script, but more rudimentary, and the shapes of the patterns bore the characteristics of the three items.

At the same time, Li Fan noticed that the three items he had selected from the secret vault disappeared into thin air after a ripple.

It was as if they were carved onto the white paper.

Zhong Daogong waved his hand, rolled up the completed paper, and put it away.

He looked at Li Fan, "The items you need are here. After the transaction is complete, I will hand them over!"

"Good! Straightforward!" Li Fan exclaimed with admiration.

"I originally planned to show you all of it after seeing the original True Immortal Script of the Immortal Boat. But now, it seems there's no harm in letting you feast your eyes first," Li Fan said with some excitement.

"We are both researchers of True Immortal Script. Witnessing this great script, the heartfelt excitement must be the same. As the saying goes, 'If one hears the Dao in the morning, one can die content in the evening!'"

"It might be difficult to display within the Immortal Boat. How about we go to the outer void?" Li Fan eagerly suggested.

After finally tricking Li Fan into the Immortal Boat, how could the elders possibly let the tiger return to the mountain?

Zhong Daogong waved his hand, "Right here is fine. We can use [Various Forms Method]. Don't worry, the Severed Immortal Arm in this secret vault has integrated countless incomplete characters. Under their mutual restraint, the influence of True Immortal Script can be minimized."

Li Fan appeared a bit disappointed, "I was hoping to showcase my skills in front of all of you..."

Zhong Daogong cast another spell, and the Severed Immortal Arm then exploded in front of everyone, breaking into countless incomplete character structures, like swimming tadpoles, sealing off all directions.

Forming a True Immortal Script cage.

"Fellow Daoist, you can begin."

As soon as Zhong Daogong finished speaking, the eyes of all the elders of the Immortal Boat were fixed on Li Fan.

Li Fan coughed lightly, his expression solemn, "Esteemed Daoist friends, let me reiterate, the True Immortal Script I am about to depict is generated from my comprehension and memory. Not to mention compared to the original immortal world version, it differs somewhat from the one in the Great Qi Immortal Artifact's memory..."

"But please rest assured, my skill is top-notch throughout all of Great Qi. I will not disappoint you!"

After saying a lot of nonsense and whetting the appetite of the Immortal Boat's members,

Li Fan finally unfurled the scene of boundless green fields with surging arc lights.

As the light and shadow shifted, an extremely mystical character formally appeared before everyone's eyes.

*Boom!*

The moment [Creation] descended, the characters that were constantly drifting within the surrounding cage instantly resonated.

Many flew out directly from the cage's structure and converged towards the shining [Creation] character in the center.

Even though it was only a phantom projection of light, it still drove the fragments of True Immortal Script into a frenzy.

The Severed Immortal Arm spontaneously disintegrated, and the elders of the Immortal Boat had to divert some of their attention to maintain its stability.

But in reality, like these characters, the elders' attention was uncontrollably focused on the word [Creation]!

"As expected, no empty words. This single word is worth more than all the others combined!"

"Creation... It's actually Creation!"

"The Immortal Boat is saved!"

...

The elders of the Immortal Boat had spent most of their lives immersed in True Immortal Script, so their comprehension was naturally exceptional. Upon seeing the true form of [Creation], they quickly discerned its true meaning and exclaimed in unison, without exception.

All pretense of composure vanished before the profound principles of the Great Dao.

While the elders of the Immortal Boat were captivated, Li Fan quietly observed and analyzed the guardian of the Immortal Boat's secret vault, that Severed Immortal Arm.

He had to admit that the method of integrating all treasures through fragmented characters was quite ingenious.

Even with the intention of theft, Li Fan, who had experienced multiple lifetimes, possessed extraordinary insight, and was even equipped with the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, could not find a suitable way to break it for a moment.

However, now that the word [Creation] had appeared, the characters forming the Severed Immortal Arm began to disintegrate and spontaneously converge towards [Creation].

This allowed him to glimpse its composition.

"It would be difficult to completely shatter this severed arm instantaneously. However, it should be possible to abscond with some key items from it," Li Fan mused and deduced inwardly.

The True Immortal Script [Creation] was truly profound and extraordinary, not something that could be comprehended overnight.

As the elders of the Immortal Boat were immersed in it, they saw Li Fan quietly waiting by the side and did not divert any more attention to him, thus giving Li Fan ample time to analyze this [Hundred Heard Immortal Record].

"This one, this one, and this one, it would be best to take them all later..."

Li Fan naturally saw the killing intent harbored by the Immortal Boat elders towards him.

However, Li Fan himself had no good intentions.

Taking advantage of the chaos caused by [Creation] in the secret vault, Li Fan had secretly laid down his plundering means.

It was the same fragmented characters of True Immortal Script, using fakes to pass as real and integrating them into the Severed Immortal Arm.

The longer the Immortal Boat elders were engrossed in comprehending [Creation], the more he implanted his hidden tricks.

The more items he could plunder later.

"There's no need to rush to make a move," Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his hands still working discreetly.

Thirty-odd days passed in a flash.

Zhong Daogong was the first to awaken from his enlightenment, his expression somewhat dazed, then he let out a long sigh.

He then bowed to Li Fan, "Thank you, Fellow Daoist!"

"To personally witness [Creation] is a great fortune bestowed by heaven! If not for your grace, I would likely never have had such an encounter in my life!"

Li Fan accepted it calmly and waved his hand, "It's just a transaction!"

Zhong Daogong shook his head, "How can mortal objects compare to this [Creation]? In this transaction, our Immortal Boat has gained an immense advantage!"

Li Fan laughed heartily and said no more.

The other elders of the Immortal Boat also gradually awoke from their enlightenment.

They also bowed slightly to Li Fan first, then their gazes interwove and finally landed on Li Fan in unison.

The meaning conveyed in their eyes was almost identical.

That was, they wanted to see an even purer, more complete version of [Creation].

As the saying goes, greed is insatiable. After witnessing the True Immortal Script written by Li Fan and vaguely experiencing its infinite power, a deeper desire inevitably surged in their hearts.

"Fellow Daoist, I wonder, regarding the [Creation] within Great Qi's world-protecting immortal artifact..."

"May we have a look?" Seeing Dao Sheng asked kindly.

Li Fan's expression showed difficulty, "Even in our Great Qi, only direct disciples who have undergone rigorous audits are qualified to glimpse the true memory of the immortal artifact. Others learn through layers of transmission..."

Li Fan looked at the expressions of the Immortal Boat elders and smiled, "I fully understand your feelings. However, this is our first transaction. Once we have more contact in the future, perhaps we can agree to your request to view it?"

The elders of the Immortal Boat had mixed expressions upon hearing this.

They privately conferred again,

"Elder Zhong, what do you think now."

"We definitely can't kill him! We must maintain contact with Great Qi to obtain a more complete [Creation]..."

"Indeed, compared to this [Creation], those other True Immortal Scripts seem insignificant."

"Even [Creation] can be shared by Great Qi. Compared to them, our Immortal Boat seems so petty."

After witnessing the power of [Creation], the attitude of the Immortal Boat elders unified.

Zhong Daogong had already made up his mind.

"As per our agreement, next, we will lead you to see the original True Immortal Script," he said to Li Fan with a smile.

"Although this original copy is not as powerful as the [Creation] you displayed, Fellow Daoist, it is still the work of a True Immortal. I believe it will bring you inspiration," Zhong Daogong said with full confidence.

"Oh? Then I am rather eager," Li Fan replied.

Sensing the hidden traps he had set in the Severed Immortal Arm, Li Fan also smiled in return.

Following the elders of the Immortal Boat, they temporarily left the secret vault.

From the very top of the divine tree, they descended to the heart of the divine tree.

In the verdant space, a ruin was suspended.

Countless branches extended from above, spreading to the divine tree's trunk.

On the ground of the ruin, a True Immortal Script was inscribed.

However, due to the obstruction of the divine tree's branches, its full appearance could not be seen.

The moment he saw this ruin, Li Fan's heart stirred.

Because the architectural style of this ruin was very similar to what he had seen on the Immortal Ruins ground before.

"Immortal ruin?" Li Fan could not help but turn to ask, feigning surprise.

"Fellow Daoist has sharp eyes." The elders of the Immortal Boat were also surprised that Li Fan could recognize the origin of the ruin. They once again raised their evaluation of the Great Qi civilization.

"That's right. This ruin fell from the upper realm during the time the Immortal Path was severed," Zhong Daogong said in a deep voice.

"At that time, the news of the severed Immortal Path had not yet spread throughout the star sea. Therefore, no one expected that this suddenly appearing structure would be related to the Immortal Realm. However, the True Immortal Script inscribed within it caused a catastrophe."

"It was only after ten thousand years that our Immortal Boat discovered the source of this catastrophe in the star sea ruins."

The elders of the Immortal Boat jointly cast a spell, and the divine tree branches entwined around the ruin's ground slowly loosened.

Revealing the true form of the True Immortal Script.

It seemed that due to the long passage of time and the constant absorption by the divine tree, the fluctuations emanating from the character were already minimal.

But this did not prevent Li Fan from instantly discerning the meaning of this character.

[Ancient].

"Ancient..." Li Fan muttered, using his hand as a brush, attempting to imitate and write it.

This ancient character on the ruin's ground seemed very similar to the Chaos characters he had seen in the Misty White Mist region.

True Immortal Script describes the Great Dao. However, as long as it is not the Great Dao itself manifesting, when written by different people, it will exhibit different characteristics.

Li Fan, having studied True Immortal Script for many years, could naturally discern such characteristics clearly.

This ancient character and the Chaos character were written by the same person.

However, it was not of the same origin as the word [Starvation] in the Immortal Ruins.

"If my guess is correct, [Ancient], [Chaos], and the True Immortal Script that caused countless world-ending disasters in the Abyssal Sea were all the work of the same person, with the purpose of disrupting the star sea."

"As for the [Starvation] character in the Immortal Ruins, it was perhaps merely for the True Immortal's enlightenment."

"Although their intentions were different, they led to the same end: the destruction of the star sea and its complete descent into silence."

"In the eyes of True Immortals, we cultivators are truly like ants..."

Numerous thoughts flashed through Li Fan's mind.

"Although the energy fluctuations of this original copy have all dissipated, it still has its uses."

At this moment, Li Fan suddenly heard Zhong Daogong say this.

Chapter 1323: The Entropy Reversal of Youth

"Oh? I'm eager to hear more," Li Fan's expression turned serious.

"Fellow Daoist, can you discern the profound use of this 'Ancient' character script?" Zhong Daogong, however, posed a riddle.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, his fingers tracing slightly in the void: "Ancient, as in past, as in old."

"...Time reversal?"

Looking at the mysterious character on the ground of the ruins, Li Fan savored it carefully, his eyes lighting up.

Zhong Daogong clapped his hands in praise: "Fellow Daoist's comprehension is truly extraordinary! Even our Immortal Boat elders, at best, take several days to gain some insight from it. To think you could see through it at a glance!"

"However, describing its power as time reversal might be somewhat inaccurate. It's more like things returning to their past state..."

Li Fan listened to the other's explanation and nodded slightly.

"It sounds somewhat similar to Ou Shangtian's 'Heavenly Bone Hand'," he mused inwardly.

"When the 'Ancient' character was at its peak, within its influence, it would undoubtedly cause terrifying calamities. Everything, all things, would evolve towards their past selves. From life to death, turning into flowing sand. Truly, a descent into antiquity..." Zhong Daogong waved his hand, projecting dozens of images before him.

Upon the appearance of 'Ancient', cultivators, towering trees, continuous buildings on the ground, and even the world itself, all seemed to reverse time, evolving against the flow of causality. Ultimately, they all turned into imperceptible particles, blown away by the wind.

"If this original calligraphy still retains residual power, even if we were immensely envious, our Immortal Boat would have to detour and dare not covet even a sliver. However, now..."

Next, the Immortal Boat cultivators demonstrated the wondrous use of this True Immortal Sigils with practical action.

The oldest among the elders, Jian Dao Sheng from the Immortal Severing Tower, slowly flew towards the 'Ancient' character.

He did not get too close, instead hovering in mid-air.

What Zhong Daogong said, that the power of the 'Ancient' character had been exhausted, was only relative. In reality, there was still a faint residual power on the original calligraphy. Compared to the 'Ancient' character at its peak, it was almost negligible. However, just like the character '?', where strength is harmful, weakness is beneficial. When the backtracking power of the 'Ancient' character was reduced to a suitable range...

The wrinkles on Jian Dao Sheng's face slowly receded. Among his white eyebrows and white hair, strands of black began to emerge. His body became straight again, and even his spirit became more vigorous.

This scene was clearly a return to youth, a restoration of vigor!

The Immortal Boat elders were accustomed to this, while Li Fan narrowed his eyes, deep in thought.

He did not wait for a complete reversal back to his youthful prime. After spending only a few breaths within the range of the 'Ancient' character, Jian Dao Sheng gracefully retreated.

Li Fan understood that this was to prevent himself from being overly influenced by the 'Ancient' character.

After Jian Dao Sheng, the other elders of the Immortal Boat also took turns at the original calligraphy. Some stayed longer, some shorter, all of them becoming significantly younger.

"With this character, wouldn't one be able to achieve immortality?" Li Fan exclaimed in surprise.

Zhong Daogong gave a wry smile: "It's not as simple as it looks. It can only grant longevity, not immortality..."

He shook his head: "Returning to youth through the 'Ancient' character can indeed increase the upper limit of one's lifespan by a small amount. But the more times it's used, the weaker the effect becomes. Once life reaches its limit, it will no longer increase."

"However, a youthful body is indeed much better than one on the verge of death."

After the Immortal Boat elders had finished, Zhong Daogong looked at Li Fan and asked, "Fellow Daoist, would you like to experience it as well?"

Li Fan politely declined: "I am only thirty years old, in the prime of my physical condition. Returning to childhood would be counterproductive."

Upon hearing this, the Divine Tree space fell into an abrupt silence.

The elders stared at Li Fan as if he were a monster, their eyes fixed on him.

The expression on Zhong Daogong's face also stiffened slightly: "Fellow Daoist, are you joking?"

Based on Li Fan's own strength, and his demonstrated mastery of formations and script, the Immortal Boat cultivators had already mentally categorized him as a cultivator who had lived for hundreds or even thousands of years.

Now, Li Fan claimed to be only thirty years old?

This left the Immortal Boat cultivators in a state of disbelief.

Li Fan chuckled: "It's just that I learn things quickly. In Great Qi, there are those more talented than I, though few, they do exist. Everyone, please don't be too surprised."

His words disturbed the minds of the Immortal Boat cultivators.

They jointly resealed the 'Ancient' character and led Li Fan out of the Divine Tree.

"Fellow Daoist, please rest here for a while and do not leave for now. We have some matters to discuss..."

In a pavilion courtyard at the apex of the Immortal Boat's space, resembling a mountaintop, Zhong Daogong instructed.

"Oh, right, here are the three items you selected earlier." After handing over a roll of white paper, Zhong Daogong left in a hurry.

Ignoring the Immortal Boat cultivators, Li Fan slowly unrolled the white paper in his hand. The three treasures then leaped out from the paper, appearing before Li Fan.

The bronze immortal crane and the seven-colored flowing light had already been examined in detail.

Li Fan waved his hand and put them away for safekeeping.

His attention then focused on the statue with its eyebrows lowered.

Sensing the faint tremors from 'Return to Truth,' Li Fan's mind became solemn.

Like the other two items, the statue disappeared from sight in an instant.

However, this time it was not put away, but transformed into an inexplicable energy, absorbed by 'Return to Truth.'

Li Fan stared intently at the 'Return to Truth' panel.

As if fine electrical currents flashed, the characters on the 'Return to Truth' panel flickered several times.

Finally, it returned to a calm state.

Li Fan's gaze fell upon the changed item.

"Ethereal Transformation Charging Progress: 400%."

"Hmm?" Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

The Ethereal Transformation charging progress was the prerequisite for activating 'Return to Truth' to reverse everything. Only when the charging progress reached 100% could reality become void, and truth become falsehood.

This was also why Li Fan had always stayed in the Great Xuan pocket world after using 'Return to Truth,' waiting for the charge to complete before venturing out.

Previously, the maximum charging progress for Ethereal Transformation was 200%.

Charging progress exceeding 100% could, at critical moments, shield Li Fan from external attacks, ensuring the smooth activation of 'Return to Truth.'

However, as Li Fan provoked increasingly powerful enemies, this protective function seemed somewhat redundant.

The progress dropped too quickly, offering little benefit.

But now, this statue had directly doubled the charging limit.

Moreover, Li Fan felt that this additional 200% charging progress, if not consumed in this lifetime, would not disappear with the reset of 'Return to Truth.'

Instead, it would remain within 'Return to Truth.'

In other words, he could perform three 'Truth Reversals' consecutively using this.

"Interesting."

Li Fan recalled the appearance of the statue in his mind: "The origin of this statue is rather peculiar. Being able to replenish 200% of the charging limit proves it is no ordinary item."

"I wonder if, the next time I encounter this item in another life and absorb it, the charging limit can still be increased?"

So far, Li Fan had not fully understood the specific mechanism of 'Return to Truth' charging.

The unknown medium required to activate 'Return to Truth' could only be slowly increased through the passage of time.

"Perhaps by carefully studying this statue, I can unravel this mystery," Li Fan narrowed his eyes, marking this objective.

A 400% charging limit was undoubtedly an additional layer of protection for Li Fan. More importantly, when encountering the Faceless True Immortal or even higher-level beings, Li Fan could use multiple 'Truth Reversals' consecutively to escape their threats as much as possible.

Otherwise, with only one 'Truth Reversal,' after returning to the predetermined anchor point, he would still face a fatal crisis, putting Li Fan in a very dangerous situation.

From this perspective, the practical life-saving significance of this statue was immense.

"The Immortal Boat is truly my lucky land."

"Later, I can also inquire about the origin of this statue from them," Li Fan thought to himself.

Not long after, Zhong Daogong led the elders back to Li Fan.

It seemed that a consensus had been reached in their recent discussion, as the subtle hostility and killing intent Li Fan had sensed from some of them earlier had completely vanished.

"Fellow Daoist, are you satisfied with this transaction?" Zhong Daogong first inquired.

"My harvest is abundant. Upon my return, my master will surely bestow rewards. By the way, rest assured, I will do my best to gather information about that thief for you," Li Fan promised.

"Heh heh, thank you in advance, Fellow Daoist."

After exchanging pleasantries, Zhong Daogong changed the subject: "Fellow Daoist has proven your credibility to the Immortal Boat. After unanimous deliberation by the Immortal Boat elders, perhaps we can engage in deeper cooperation."

Li Fan showed interest: "Do you still have True Immortal Sigilss that you haven't revealed?"

Zhong Daogong waved his hand: "Not True Immortal Sigilss. But something even more important than True Immortal Sigilss."

The scenery of the surrounding pavilions suddenly shifted, as if they had instantly arrived in the Abyssal Star Sea.

With Zhong Daogong's movements, the surrounding light and shadow rapidly changed, passing through the sea of endless remnants and the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

They arrived at a place of nothingness.

"Where is this..." Li Fan was slightly taken aback.

"The High Wall. Beneath the High Wall," Zhong Daogong said with a complex expression and a grave tone.

"Oh?"

Li Fan looked around and then said, "I have also been beneath the High Wall, at the end of the Abyssal Star Sea. The path ahead was blocked, but I did not see the physical entity of the High Wall..."

"Why are you showing me the scene of the High Wall?"

Zhong Daogong's gaze was deep: "The High Wall stretches for miles, encircling the entire star sea. However, this section of the High Wall that our Immortal Boat is showing you is different from other places."

"Different? Being the same High Wall, what is the difference?" Li Fan's expression shook.

It was Jian Dao Sheng who answered Li Fan: "This region can be considered the weakest part of the entire High Wall. If there is any place in the star sea where one can traverse the High Wall, then this is where the opportunity is greatest!"

"In your hometown, Fellow Daoist, there must be many cultivators who are unwilling to be forever trapped in the Abyssal Star Sea and wish to escape, right? If we cooperate, it might not be impossible." Zhong Daogong said slowly.

"The weakest point of the High Wall..." Li Fan stared at the scene displayed by the Immortal Boat, repeating the words several times.

He did not give an answer but instead asked: "How did you determine this? The existence of the High Wall has already surpassed current understanding. It is formless and intangible, impossible to see. How did you accurately identify its weakest point?"

Zhong Daogong smiled slightly: "This matter involves the Immortal Boat's utmost secrets. Before both parties agree to cooperate, please forgive me for not disclosing it. However, Fellow Daoist can rest assured that this matter is absolutely true. You can report this to your superiors. When someone else is sent, the Immortal Boat can first verify it for you."

Li Fan's expression became solemn, and after a long period of contemplation, he cupped his hands and said, "This matter is indeed of great importance, and I cannot decide it alone. Upon my return, I will definitely report to my elders. Regardless of the outcome, I will certainly give you an answer."

"Then we shall await your good news, Fellow Daoist!"

Under the gaze of the elders, Li Fan's escaping light left the Immortal Boat and vanished into the vast star sea.

"A risky move. If this matter is exposed..."

"What are you afraid of? Do you think someone in this star sea will come knocking on our door to demand we share the location of this weak point in the High Wall? In my opinion, that would be even better. We are all fish in the same boiling pot; we should have united long ago!"

"Indeed, the Great Qi civilization is no weaker than ours, perhaps even stronger. After all, they have survived the Great Tribulation and occupy an entire cultivation world. They are a suitable partner for cooperation."

"And that realm-protecting immortal artifact..."

The elders began to discuss amongst themselves.

On the other side, Li Fan, while returning in the phantom image of the wooden sword, was contemplating the information revealed by the Immortal Boat.

Although the Immortal Boat did not explicitly state it, based on critical information obtained through infiltration in his previous life, it was not difficult to deduce why they knew the weakest point of the High Wall.

"In my past life, Zhong Daogong mentioned that the reason the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat split was because a faction within the Immortal Boat decided to crash into the High Wall, thereby escaping the star sea."

"And they succeeded in the end."

"This weak point of the High Wall might be the location where the Merchant Immortal Boat collided with the High Wall back then. Relying on the resonance between the Mystic Immortal Boats, the Mystic Immortal Boat was thus able to determine the exact location..."

If the Immortal Boat cultivators had not revealed this matter, Li Fan would have activated the hidden trap in the 'Hundred Heard Immortal Record' as soon as he left, plundering all its treasures.

However, since the Immortal Boat still had secrets to uncover, he might as well wait a little longer.

"The Immortal Boat's persistent collection of True Immortal Sigilss, apart from the power of the scripts themselves, is perhaps also due to this plan to escape the star sea."

"Crashing into the High Wall..."

"I wonder how the Merchant Immortal Boat managed to do it back then," Li Fan mused inwardly.

Inside the phantom image of the wooden sword, Senior Yin was resting.

The others, however, were still traversing the Great Wall of Broken Realms, searching for suitable fragments of worlds that could serve as Azure Nether medicinal ingredients.

After Li Fan replenished them with some 'Empty Light Flowing Crystals,' he did not seek out the Immortal Boat cultivators.

Instead, through the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation, he returned to the Xuanhuang Realm first.

Great Xuan pocket world.

Li Fan's figure flickered, appearing beside Ou Shangtian, who was sleeping soundly.

Sensing the 'Heavenly Bone Hand' still gesturing within him, Li Fan used his hand as a brush and wrote a 'Ancient' character.

Focusing his divine sense, he observed the changes within Ou Shangtian's body.

His understanding of the 'Ancient' character was still in its initial stages, and he had not injected much Spirit Qi. Therefore, the power of this 'Ancient' character was extremely weak.

It barely encompassed Ou Shangtian's body.

Chapter 1324: Blood Reveals True Immortal Memories

Unlike when he first encountered the ancient characters with the Immortal Boat elders, Ou Shangtian’s young body did not experience any backlash. Within him, the Heavenly Bone Hand, a hidden treasure, emitted imperceptible tremors, absorbing and assimilating the power of the ancient characters.

Li Fan was unsure if "absorb and assimilate" was the right description for the process. It felt more like a resonance had formed between the ancient characters and the Heavenly Bone Hand. This caused the power of the True Immortal Sigils, which should have affected Ou Shangtian’s body, to be redirected into the wondrous item, the Heavenly Bone Hand. Meanwhile, his other treasure, the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, remained completely inert.

Stirred by the resonance of the "Ancient" character, the Heavenly Bone Hand underwent subtle yet significant changes. Wisp of dark red flesh began to appear on its formerly bare, bone-white surface. These were mere thin lines, almost imperceptible, but Li Fan, having witnessed the entire process, was the first to notice this anomaly. The birth of this flesh made the Heavenly Bone Hand appear even more mystical, as if it had suddenly gained sentience and come alive. Without Ou Shangtian’s control, its bone fingers twitched.

"Mmmph…" Ou Shangtian, who had been in a deep slumber, let out a muffled groan. Clearly, the stirrings within his body were causing him pain. Li Fan placed his hands on Ou Shangtian’s head, and the young boy drifted back into a heavy sleep.

A golden light emerged from Li Fan’s hand, transforming into a sharp surgical knife. It sliced into Ou Shangtian’s arm. Instead of tearing flesh, the golden knife penetrated Ou Shangtian's body and arrived beside the Heavenly Bone Hand. As if sensing the approach of an external threat, the Heavenly Bone Hand began to vibrate violently and continuously, even showing signs of wanting to break free and escape, disregarding the well-being of its host.

However, Li Fan had no intention of allowing that. Fine threads extended from the small golden knife, transforming into chains that firmly secured the Heavenly Bone Hand in place. The small knife flickered and shifted, rapidly scraping off the newly formed flesh from the bone, centimeter by centimeter. A sharp, resentful howl seemed to echo in his ears, but Li Fan remained unfazed. He wove a net with Primal Force Essence, collecting and sealing the flesh.

Without the interference of the new flesh, the Heavenly Bone Hand calmed down again. Ou Shangtian, however, looked alarmingly pale, as if he had suffered a severe internal injury. Li Fan casually sent a surge of Spirit Qi to nourish his body. Then, holding the lifeless-looking flesh sealed within the net of Primal Force Essence, he flickered to the area beneath the Dao Discussion Platform.

On the platform above, the projection of the instructor continued their lesson without interruption. In the giant cavity excavated below, Li Fan began his research on the flesh.

"The appearance of the Heavenly Bone Hand is identical to that of the Bone Scavenger Realm. According to Zi Miao, the former controller of the Bone Scavenger Realm, it was an imitation based on a painting depicting the 'True Immortal's Decaying Remains' he once saw…"

"Meaning, this could very likely be True Immortal flesh?" Li Fan narrowed his eyes, gazing at the dark red tissue in the golden net. Having escaped from True Immortals multiple times and even witnessed one being devoured by Cat Treasure, Li Fan’s awe towards them had long since vanished. With the opportune circumstances of this life, his Return to Truth’s Void Transformation charging progress had doubled, allowing him to activate it three times consecutively. With his safety guaranteed, Li Fan began to study the True Immortal flesh.

First, he confirmed that the piece of True Immortal flesh before him did not possess its own "consciousness." Its ability to move seemed to be more of a biological instinct. "However, the current amount of flesh gathered is still small. If there were more, it might be difficult to say." On this point, Li Fan remained extremely cautious. This piece of flesh was definitely sufficient for research. Once it was mostly consumed, he could simply retrieve more from Ou Shangtian.

Li Fan began a rough analysis of the True Immortal flesh’s composition. The Primal Force Essence knife cut off a small piece. Then, the golden light spun rapidly, turning into a mincer that pulverized the flesh. "No Immortal Spiritual Power." Li Fan was not surprised and thus not disappointed. "The body tissues and blood have separated. The tissue's vitality is clearly inferior to True Immortal blood. This blood seems to contain some kind of special energy…"

Li Fan's eyes lit up. He extended a wisp of his divine sense, attempting to probe the separated blood. The instant it touched the True Immortal blood, his divine sense felt as if it had collided with an intensely hot iron gate. It vibrated and became dizzy, and a significant portion of it was vaporized by the intense heat contained within the blood.

"Hmm?" Although it was only a wisp of his divine sense, the shock and burning sensation were directly synchronized with Li Fan’s main divine sense. His head felt as if it had been struck by a blunt object, and then a searing flame erupted within his divine soul, burning intensely. The suffering was akin to soul annihilation; an ordinary cultivator caught unprepared would likely be utterly destroyed.

But Li Fan was no ordinary cultivator. Empowered by the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation, his divine soul regenerated and was nearly indestructible. Even though he felt as if he were in purgatory, Li Fan persevered. With his current capacity for endurance, after withstanding this retaliatory strike from the True Immortal blood, Li Fan broke out in a cold sweat, his muscles spasming uncontrollably. The burning sensation in his divine soul gradually subsided. Once everything settled, Li Fan let out a long breath, dispelling the discomfort.

"The separation between Immortals and mortals…"

"True Immortals, untouchable." This was Li Fan’s feeling after the experience. Even a single drop of blood demonstrated the vast, unbridgeable chasm between Immortals and mortals in its own way.

However… this minor warning did not deter Li Fan. Instead, it piqued his interest further. The more he was forbidden from seeing, the more Li Fan wanted to pry. Scorching his divine soul? With the Five Elements Unifying and the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation, and the realm of indestructible divine soul, he could withstand the backlash and forcibly probe the mysteries within the True Immortal blood. Endless pain? Li Fan had long since learned to treat such things as nothing.

With a thought, he manifested thousands of divine senses. Like fearless soldiers, they charged towards the True Immortal blood within the golden net.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

The backlash from the True Immortal blood echoed continuously within Li Fan’s divine soul, like a giant hammer repeatedly striking. The thousands of impacts brought thousands of retaliations. Li Fan's divine soul felt as if it had instantly ignited, countless sparks spreading and burning fiercely. The pain was indescribable. Even with the Immortal Heart Incantation's enhancement and his extraordinary willpower, he was on the brink of collapse, barely holding on.

Li Fan glanced at his Return to Truth panel. The Void Transformation charging progress remained at 400%, having not decreased due to the backlash from the True Immortal blood. This indicated that the backlash from a single drop of blood was not yet enough to threaten Li Fan's current strength. With his safety assured, Li Fan tried his best to maintain the operation of the Profound Art of Infinite Void and Formation, while simultaneously focusing his attention on the True Immortal blood, which was like a wall of flame. Under the impact of countless divine senses, its defenses seemed to develop hairline cracks.

The stalemate lasted for an unknown duration, until finally, Li Fan broke through the defenses of the True Immortal blood. The backlash vanished instantly, and his divine soul became serene once more. A light emanated from the True Immortal blood, enveloping Li Fan's divine soul. Then, a projection appeared before him. It was as if shrouded in mist, with all surrounding scenes indistinct. An enraged voice echoed from a tall figure in the distance, fragmented and barely decipherable: “…Qionglang Starfield… annihilation… guard…” "…found the target." "Your subordinate obeys your command." A deep voice responded from within Li Fan himself.

The projection shifted again. The next moment, he found himself within the Xuanhuang Realm, standing high in the sky, overlooking the myriad beings of the realm. However, his body’s attention seemed to be focused not on the Xuanhuang Realm below, but on the starlit expanse beyond. It was as if he were waiting for something.

After an unknown period, a beam of light suddenly descended from beyond the heavens. The figure’s gaze immediately locked onto it. But he did not interfere, letting the beam of light land within the Xuanhuang Realm. Only after the light completely dimmed and settled did the figure descend to the mortal world for a closer inspection.

"Not yet."

"But not bad. In the past, ascending to Immortality would have been possible. What a pity…" The figure’s tone was devoid of emotion, as if accustomed to such outcomes. He shook his head slightly, sighed, and then returned to the heavens of the Xuanhuang Realm. Silently observing, he awaited the arrival of the next target.

…The scene suddenly froze, then rapidly faded and dissipated like a bleached photograph. Li Fan awoke from the illusion, returning to the present. Although the True Immortal blood’s memory only contained a few fleeting scenes, Li Fan felt as if he had lived through countless lifetimes. This sensation of immense duration was reflected in his physical body. His long hair, which had been merely flowing before, now reached at least his waist and was streaked with black and white. His face, hands, and even the skin of his entire body had become somewhat wrinkled.

Li Fan looked at his age on the Return to Truth panel. His mental age had not changed, but his physiological age limit had been reduced to 50 years. Though he appeared to be thirty, his lifespan was now nearing its end.

"Is this the price for prying into a True Immortal?" After a test, confirming that the Xuanhuang Realm's longevity-enhancing heavenly treasures could not increase this reduced lifespan limit, Li Fan felt a chill. "If it were an ordinary cultivator, they would likely be pushed into a dead end by this."

"Fortunately, I have Return to Truth by my side. A lifespan limit of 50 years makes little difference to me." "With 20 years remaining in this life, it is enough to complete my arrangements." Li Fan’s mood calmed, and he recalled the images he had seen within the True Immortal blood.

"The True Immortal whose blood it was must have been sent to Azure Nether to find a certain target…"

"The word 'subordinate' is quite interesting."

"And that beam of light from beyond the heavens…" Li Fan narrowed his eyes. Combining this with the information he had previously gleaned from the ancient immortal formations of the Xuanhuang Realm and the Nine-Star Red Pearl, a conjecture formed in his mind: "The ancient Xuanhuang Realm was also capturing something."

"Unlike the later capturing of other cultivation realms, the target then was… a human?" Li Fan's gaze flickered. "But not bad. In the past, ascending to Immortality would have been possible…" Li Fan repeated the True Immortal's words several times. "The beam of light from outside that could have led to Immortality was not the target He was waiting for. What exactly…?" Suddenly, for some inexplicable reason, Li Fan thought of himself. Although the True Immortal's memory was vague and from an indeterminable time in the past, Li Fan felt an inexplicable sense of having narrowly escaped death. By the time he realized it, his back was drenched in cold sweat. This was not due to cowardice; it was a profound, instinctive fear and relief upon belatedly understanding the situation.

"This…" Li Fan’s pounding heart gradually calmed. He temporarily left the underground space beneath the Dao Discussion Platform and flickered back to the sky above the Great Xuan pocket world. Miles of clouds obscured the view of the beings on the ground. Li Fan savored the premonition he had just experienced.

"Although it's hard to believe…"

"A deep, innate premonition tells me that the target of that True Immortal in Azure Nether many years ago might indeed have been me?!"

"Or rather, not me, but 'Return to Truth'!" Li Fan closed his eyes, preventing the turmoil and shock within his heart from showing. "Return to Truth, Return to Truth…" As he spoke, the surrounding scene became hazy once more. Isolated from the real world, Li Fan felt a sliver of peace. "Return to Truth pertains to the Dao of Truth and Falsehood, Void and Reality."

"Heavenly and Earthly Marvels, True Immortal Scripts, even the mysterious symbols that created the Great Azure Nether Heavenly Venerate are all partial projections of the Great Dao. But only Return to Truth transcends all. It is almost the Dao of 'Truth and Falsehood,' 'Void and Reality' itself…" Li Fan's thoughts churned as he calmly considered. "The tall figure in the memory, who could command a True Immortal to call himself 'subordinate,' must have held an extraordinary position."

"Qionglang Starfield… annihilation…" Li Fan attempted to deduce the possible truth from these fragments. "It seems the Immortal Realm was already facing a crisis at that time." "Annihilation…" "Relying on True Immortal power, perhaps a method to resolve the Immortal Realm's crisis was discovered, and that method was 'Return to Truth'."

"So, they waited in the Xuanhuang Realm like a hunter waiting for prey?"

"It's just that, for some unknown reason, I arrived tens of thousands of years too late."

…Having emerged from the True Immortal's memory for a long time, the lingering sense of having narrowly escaped death finally dissipated. Without the influence of that inexplicable emotion, Li Fan found his previous speculations to be almost ridiculously absurd.

"What is the truth?" With his mood calm, Li Fan flickered from the sky back underground. He looked at the remaining True Immortal blood in the golden net and pondered for a long time.

"I cannot pry further in this life."

"I will see if I can find more clues in the next life."

"Even if my guess is confirmed, it doesn't matter. After all, the Immortal Realm suffered a great tribulation, and the True Immortals who intended to 'hunt' me have all disappeared!" A gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes, and his state of mind became stable once more. Although he could no longer glean memories from the True Immortal blood in this life, it did not prevent Li Fan from continuing his research on the True Immortal flesh.

"Next, let me see how resistant the True Immortal flesh is to the power of the True Immortal Sigils."

Chapter 1325

With brushstrokes dancing like dragons and snakes, the **没 (Mò)** character technique, disguised under various other arts, was inscribed.

Its power had been severely weakened, but it was just right for testing. To ensure the accuracy of the experiment, Li Fan also severed a piece of his own flesh and blood of the same size, along with another piece of mortal flesh and blood, to serve as control groups.

Under the shroud of the **没 (Mò)** character, the three pieces of flesh and blood underwent drastically different transformations. Both Li Fan's and the mortal's flesh and blood, as if instantly enveloped by a shadow, were almost completely defenseless. They sank and disappeared from the world as if struck by a wave from an invisible sea.

As for the piece of true immortal flesh and blood... Although it could not entirely escape the influence of the true immortal script, it was like a small boat. Despite the raging waves, it bobbed and swayed but remained steadily on the sea's surface. When the fluctuations of the **没 (Mò)** character technique finally dissipated, it showed almost no change compared to before the experiment.

"As expected of true immortal flesh and blood..." Li Fan's eyes flickered.

Next, Li Fan conducted further experiments using other true immortal scripts like **【乱 (Luàn)】** and **【独 (Dú)】**, drawing preliminary conclusions. Perhaps due to being previously infused with immortal Spirit Qi, true immortal flesh and blood possessed extreme "selfhood" and "restorative" properties. It didn't directly immunize itself from the influence of the true immortal scripts but rather changed upon impact and then recovered at an extremely rapid rate. Therefore, at first glance, it appeared unaffected by various characters.

"Such resilience, such recovery speed..." Using true immortal blood as a starting point, he glimpsed the terrifying power of true immortals. Li Fan was profoundly shaken. "Merely the power of flesh and blood is tens of thousands of times stronger than my divine soul's recovery ability enhanced by the Boundless Void and Formation technique!"

"What is the driving force behind this recovery? This piece of flesh and blood no longer contains any trace of immortal Spirit Qi. And looking at its purely structural composition, it's no different from mortal flesh and blood."

"Could it be..." With a thought, the White Circle Falling Mortal Technique appeared in his palm.

Pure flesh and blood does not possess life, so in the judgment of the Falling Mortal Technique, the true immortal flesh and blood before him fell into the category of "dead things." Under the shroud of light, the flesh and blood were instantly decomposed. However, to Li Fan's disappointment, no immortal Spirit Qi appeared. Instead, a black substance with a foul odor emerged. Just a slight whiff made Li Fan feel dizzy and see illusions.

His expression drastically changed, and Li Fan retreated, activating his formation to gather and collect this black gas. Fortunately, the black gas itself had no destructive power and was quickly dealt with by Li Fan. Looking at the small black sphere in the distant sky, Li Fan couldn't help but twitch his eyelids. The stench, which seemed to pollute even the divine soul, still lingered at the tip of his nose.

"This black gas seems to be pure decay and ruin."

"Interesting. Despite possessing such strong vitality, this is the result after decomposition."

Li Fan's curiosity about the true immortal flesh and blood surged again, almost making him unable to resist sending out another strand of divine sense to investigate. Fortunately, at the critical moment, he stopped himself with great willpower.

"Next life, next life. There will be plenty of opportunities later..." His current physical condition was insufficient to support Li Fan in further probing the secrets of true immortals. Li Fan took a deep breath, calming his turbulent emotions.

Although he couldn't fully unravel the mystery of the true immortal blood, it didn't prevent Li Fan from continuing to develop its uses. With a faint glow, the bronze-cast immortal crane obtained from the Mystic Immortal Boat appeared in Li Fan's palm.

"Immortals descend, all things return to the void!"

After some preparation, a weakened, miniature Void Return Great Formation appeared in the underground space beneath the Dao Discussion Platform. Within the immortal formation, an invisible wind howled. Li Fan tossed the bronze-cast immortal crane into the center of the great formation. Instantly, furious wind blades, as Li Fan had intended, struck the bronze crane head-on.

As expected of a remnant of an immortal artifact from the calamity of world destruction, the Void Return Great Formation, despite its reduced scale, had not significantly diminished its power. It barely left any scratches on the bronze-cast immortal crane. However, the continuous invisible wind buffeted it like a giant hammer, constantly striking and gradually changing the crane's shape.

Time slowly passed. After three days, a bronze-cast skeleton appeared within the Void Return Great Formation. He temporarily transferred it out of the great formation and, using a small amount of Golden Origin Essence as a guide, attracted a small clump of true immortal flesh and blood to the bronze-cast skeleton. Perhaps due to its inherent properties, or perhaps sensing the same "immortal" aura on the bronze skeleton, the true immortal flesh and blood on the bronze skeleton began to settle.

The flesh and blood churned and surged, seemingly trying to expand outwards. Seeing this, Li Fan took the opportunity to infuse a ball of Origin Essence. The fusion with the true immortal flesh and blood was difficult, but perhaps there was a commonality between them. Ultimately, the flesh and blood, like a sponge, slowly absorbed the golden essence.

With the replenishment of energy, the true immortal flesh and blood began to grow along the bronze bones. It started as a small clump the size of a finger, attached to the skull. After a period of wriggling and spontaneous proliferation, it resembled a red tide flowing down from the head. Having been fed with Li Fan's Origin Essence, this accumulated true immortal flesh and blood no longer emitted eerie murmurs and whispers of resentment when approached. Instead, it felt like a creation under a vast net of Origin Essence, even giving Li Fan a sense of being able to command it at will.

Continuously infusing Origin Essence, the true immortal flesh and blood eventually covered the entire surface of the bronze skeleton. However, it did not develop a surface skin afterward. The humanoid form, purely composed of accumulated flesh and blood, looked somewhat chilling. Li Fan could sense that the true immortal flesh and blood were like roots, constantly adhering to the bronze bones below, bonding them more securely. As this fusion grew tighter, the entire flesh and blood body gradually underwent some kind of transformation.

Yet, gazing at the body before him, Li Fan always felt something was missing.

"The soul is the master of the body. With a body but no soul, it remains an object..." After a long contemplation, Li Fan vaguely understood. However, he hesitated to take the final, most crucial step. Not only was the primary ingredient, "immortal soul," completely unavailable, but more critically, whenever this thought crossed his mind, a nameless sense of crisis would arise.

"This involves the realm of true immortals; one must be more cautious. When adding the finishing touch to a dragon, one must be wary of the backlash if the dragon breaks through the wall and escapes..." With this thought, Li Fan slowly nodded, formed hand seals, and used the great formation to seal the shell for the time being.

"I'll wait until I find a consciousness that can fully bear the true immortal flesh and blood without losing control." Li Fan's mind flashed with the remnants of True Yang and Mr. Bai. "Eternal lingering thoughts, enduring for eternity, capable of resonating with the Dao, should not be lost under the influence of true immortal flesh and blood."

Compared to the uncontrollable Mr. Bai, the simple-natured True Yang was clearly a more suitable candidate. Li Fan personally made a trip to the bottom of the Cloudy Sea. He glanced at the True Yang puppet body still slumbering beneath the earth veins but did not disturb it. Instead, he went to True Yang's cave dwelling and retrieved his remains.

He tried, but still couldn't sense the **Eternal Residual Will** attached to the remains. Li Fan suddenly crushed the remains. Then, controlling the dust, he scattered it into the true immortal flesh and blood shell. The remains were merely a superficial manifestation; the Eternal Residual Will would not dissipate with the crushing of the remains.

With a boom! After the addition of Eternal Residual Will, the true immortal flesh and blood shell underwent a qualitative change. Intense energy fluctuations surged from the body. As if carved by an invisible knife, skin and hair successively formed on the bare flesh. The slowly appearing face was identical to True Yang in Li Fan's memory!

Li Fan pondered, setting up a series of great formations around him to prevent the awakened True Yang from going berserk. Simultaneously, he continuously generated chains with Origin Essence to bind the shell before him. However, Li Fan soon sensed something was wrong. Even as True Yang's appearance became clearer, life force still failed to emerge. The True Yang before him was like a puppet constructed from immortal artifact remnants, true immortal flesh and blood, and Eternal Residual Will. It looked lifelike but was ultimately qualitatively different from genuine life. It was impossible to make this puppet move, even at this point.

"..." Li Fan shook his head slightly. "It seems I was too optimistic. Life, especially when involving immortals, cannot be replicated so carelessly."

"However, this does not mean the shell before me is useless. The core is True Yang's Eternal Residual Will; when True Yang truly awakens, he can control this flesh and blood puppet."

"Although it possesses no Spirit Qi, its physical strength alone could likely suppress more than half of the Xuanhuang Realm. Mortal techniques and divine abilities would be unable to harm it in the slightest."

"Even better, the puppet's flesh and blood were nourished by Origin Essence. Even after this round of growth, it remains under my control..."

With a thought, the flesh and blood puppet before him moved like a marionette, performing various actions. However, due to the presence of True Yang's Eternal Residual Will, Li Fan clearly felt various inconveniences.

"It still requires the original body to be fully controllable."

He sealed the flesh and blood immortal puppet again with a great formation. Li Fan looked at the remaining large piece of true immortal flesh and blood, lost in thought.

"Origin Essence is, after all, a lesser substitute for immortal Spirit Qi. After being nourished by it, the true immortal flesh and blood seemed to change, its realm falling. Even though they originally shared the same source, both generated from the Heavenly Bone Hand, they almost instantly became unrelated..."

"Mo Rubing once said that Origin Essence is harmful rather than beneficial. It seems his words were true." However, this is only for ordinary people. Even if there were irreversible consequences after being tainted by Origin Essence, Li Fan could eliminate them through the **Return to Truth** technique. Therefore, until he found a true method of transcendence, Li Fan would certainly choose to make the best use of what he had.

"Perhaps it's not just Origin Essence. The selfhood of true immortal flesh and blood causes any power weaker than immortal Spirit Qi to cause its 'realm to fall' upon contact..."

"Truly, there is a difference between immortals and mortals," Li Fan mused. "If lower levels are not feasible, perhaps I can try equivalent or even higher levels."

Among the methods Li Fan could currently deploy, the true immortal scripts and immortal-grade formations were barely at the same level as the true immortal flesh and blood. The **Return to Truth** technique's transformation between true and false, however, was above the immortal level.

Li Fan began a new round of research. However, this progress was not as smooth as before. After all, these were existences beyond the mortal realm, and with Li Fan's current knowledge, breakthroughs would be difficult in a short period. Li Fan was also self-aware. He did not deplete his main body on this matter but created a simulated personality to conduct the research in his stead. If any discoveries were made, his main body would be immediately notified.

To prevent any potential anomalies during the research, Li Fan not only laid down numerous formations in this area but also left the White Circle Falling Mortal Technique to suppress it. If the true immortal flesh and blood underwent uncontrollable mutations, the Falling Mortal Technique would descend and decompose everything. Although the black gas was foul, as long as it was controlled and not leaked, it should not cause any trouble.

On his way back to the fringe of the starry sea, Li Fan contemplated the attempt with the ancient characters this time.

"The power of backtracking of the ancient characters can generate flesh and blood based on remains."

"Within the Xuanhuang Realm, there are still other remains besides true immortal bones."

Li Fan's mind flashed with the remains of the Grand Master within the ruins of the One Beginning Sect, located beneath the Great Crevice in Floating Light Prefecture. In the previous life's world-ending immortal formation storm, the Dao Origin Prefecture was undoubtedly the last to survive. Unlike other survivors, the Grand Master's location seemed to form a dark domain, isolated from the outside world. Even with Li Fan fully controlling the immortal formations, he could not glimpse the situation within. Even when the The Great Barriers finally collapsed and the starry sea was in turmoil, that dark domain remained intact. This alone revealed the Grand Master's strength, definitely above that of the Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians.

"Leaving his remains scattered outside."

"Remaining unmoved when the Azure Nether was annihilated, remaining unmoved when true immortals descended."

"Even when the The Great Barriers crumbled and beings capable of hunting true immortals outside the The Great Barriers appeared, He still remained unmoved. The Grand Master's state must be problematic."

"No matter how focused one is on comprehending the Dao, one would instinctively react when sensing a mortal threat..."

It was based on such speculation that Li Fan considered using the Grand Master's flesh and blood for an experiment. However, given the inherent risks, he decided to defer this plan until the very end of this lifetime.

As his thoughts churned, Li Fan had already returned outside the Mystic Immortal Boat. Following the method previously agreed upon by both parties, he released a signal. The elders of the Immortal Boat came out in full force to greet him, showing him great respect.

"Fellow Daoist, how did you become like this?"

"What happened?"

The Immortal Boat crew watched Li Fan, who had separated from them not long ago but was now with white hair and even faintly exuding deathly energy. They were shocked and hurriedly asked.

Li Fan snorted coldly, his tone displeased and accusatory. "Your Immortal Boat has harmed me greatly!"

The Immortal Boat crew exchanged glances.

"Fellow Daoist, what are you implying?" Zhong Daogong asked with a bitter smile.

"I assume you have all noticed. My lifespan is now nearing its end! I likely only have twenty years left..." Li Fan's expression was grim, his eyes filled with murderous intent as he swept over the Immortal Boat crew. "And all of this is thanks to your Immortal Boat!"

Before the Immortal Boat crew could respond, Li Fan continued, "After I returned, I reported the entire affair to my master but received no reply for a long time."

"Therefore, I took the liberty of using the realm-protecting immortal artifact to try and calculate what my future would be like in cooperation with you..."
