"I didn't expect to end up like this!" Li Fan stared fiercely at the Immortal Boat crew and asked, "Is the weakest point of that The Great Barrier related to the outside of the The Great Barrier!"

Chapter 1326

"Heh heh heh, fellow Daoist, don't joke with me! Beyond the High Wall..." Zhong Daogong's eyes flickered. Faced with Li Fan's relentless questioning, he flatly denied it.

"Do I look like I'm joking?" Li Fan interrupted him rudely. Fierce light appeared in his eyes, and his aura surged as if he would explode at any moment if they disagreed.

The elders on the Immortal Boat were all too familiar with the fluctuations emanating from Li Fan's body. They belonged to the True Immortal Script!

Seeing that Li Fan seemed to be serious, the Immortal Boat elders' faces changed.

"Fellow Daoist, don't be rash, let's talk properly!" They tried to placate him while backing away from Li Fan and activating the Immortal Boat's layers of defenses.

Li Fan's expression was grim: "I'm very calm right now! I just want an explanation!"

"It's precisely because I tried to deduce the origin of that shaking High Wall that I was backlashed and am now nearing the end of my life... There is absolutely no such terrifying existence within this Utmost Darkness Star Sea."

"It was clearly the work of an unknown civilization beyond the High Wall, yet you people on the Immortal Boat pretend it's your own achievement. Stealing credit, utterly shameless! Your pursuit of fame doesn't matter, but you've harmed me..."

Li Fan became more agitated as he spoke, the fluctuations of the True Immortal Script on his body growing stronger. He looked at the people on the Immortal Boat as if they were his sworn enemies, ready to drag them down with him at any moment.

His words were actually akin to nonsensical babbling, lacking any logical basis.

But don't forget, Li Fan, at this moment, outwardly had only twenty years of lifespan left. For a cultivator, twenty years was but a blink of an eye.

The people of the Immortal Boat naturally wouldn't argue with a dying person who was emotionally agitated.

They could only pacify him helplessly: "Fellow Daoist, you misunderstand us!"

"We are truly not lying. The origin of the High Wall's disturbance comes from beyond the High Wall, and yet it is also closely related to our Immortal Boat, being of the same source..."

"You? Beyond the High Wall?" Li Fan calmed down slightly upon hearing this. However, his eyes were still filled with deep suspicion.

The Immortal Boat elders conferred amongst themselves. Although the Merchant Immortal Boat's departure beyond the High Wall was a top secret, this person before them was also on the verge of death.

They were too close to the Mystic Immortal Boat. If he were to go mad and scatter True Immortal Script crazily, it might cause irreparable damage to the Immortal Boat.

There was no harm in using their secret to temporarily appease him.

"Alas, this matter is difficult to explain fully. Fellow Daoist, please listen as I slowly recount it..."

Zhong Daogong began to tell Li Fan about the schism of the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat and how the Merchant Immortal Boat eventually broke through the High Wall and achieved freedom.

Meanwhile, the other elders of the Immortal Boat joined forces in a spell, quietly isolating the space. This was partly to prevent the absolute secret of the Immortal Boat from leaking, and partly to confine Li Fan within.

Li Fan seemed oblivious to the Immortal Boat elders' subtle methods. The malevolence on his body slowly dissipated, replaced by a look of bewilderment and a hint of regret: "So, I was rash? I didn't expect the former Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat to have such a bizarre story."

Seeing Li Fan gradually calm down, Zhong Daogong breathed a sigh of relief. He then asked, "What is the attitude of the Great Qi towards cooperation on this matter? Even if they are unwilling, why haven't they responded for so long?"

"In fact, our Great Qi is also very conflicted about this matter. Only after I recklessly suffered a backlash did my master reluctantly tell me that Great Qi is naturally interested in anything that can cross beyond the High Wall. But the most crucial point is that whatever is involved beyond the High Wall likely carries immense danger..."

After Li Fan finished speaking with great seriousness, he looked around, as if he had finally discovered the confinement spell that the Immortal Boat elders had jointly cast.

A flicker of displeasure crossed his eyes. But he merely let out a cold snort and did not act further.

His black and white hair, not moved by the wind, swayed and fluttered.

Fine silver-white threads flew out from his myriad strands of hair.

Before the Immortal Boat elders could react, these silver threads had already laid out a formation in the void, confining and sealing the Immortal Boat members as well.

This act of using one's own methods against them did not alert the Immortal Boat members.

The Immortal Boat elders were all drawn in by Li Fan's voice.

"Everyone, look! This is what I saw through the World Protecting Immortal Artifact's deduction, images related to beyond the High Wall!"

The keywords "World Protecting Immortal Artifact" and "beyond the High Wall" together caused the Immortal Boat members' hearts to tremble, and they all turned their gazes.

The perspective soared infinitely, and the entire Utmost Darkness Star Sea was laid bare before them.

The cold, silent star sea, for reasons unknown, seemed to boil. An ominous, chilling aura reverberated incessantly.

Soon, a great roar echoed from the horizon.

Then, the Utmost Darkness Star Sea seemed to have a colossal stone thrown into it, stirring up monstrous waves!

...

The scene abruptly ended.

Though brief, the Immortal Boat members had already understood the scene depicted.

The High Wall had collapsed, and an unknown existence had descended upon the Star Sea!

The scene was so vivid, it was as if it were a recording of real events!

The Immortal Boat elders were mesmerized, unable to recover from the shock of the great disturbance in the Star Sea for a long time.

"This..."

Zhong Daogong was also momentarily lost, looking at Li Fan.

"Do you understand now why I was so badly backlashed?" Li Fan said with extreme calmness.

"The High Wall collapses, the Star Sea is in turmoil. If it truly reached that point, with Great Qi's current strength, it would be unable to protect itself. This is also why a decision has not been made."

"Freedom is good, but it must be on the premise of safety..." Li Fan sighed.

A dead silence fell upon the scene.

While the Immortal Boat members remained outwardly silent, they were inwardly engaged in a fierce debate.

"Is... is this real or fake?"

"This scene is absolutely something that our generation of cultivators could not have fabricated. Even in the most terrifying nightmare, such a scene could hardly appear."

"In my opinion, it's not fake. The fluctuations were too real. To be honest, I almost couldn't resist fleeing just now. However, it seems the surroundings have been set up with a formation by the other party, and I couldn't escape."

"What about our plan then? To gather the power of the True Immortal Script, to stir up the remnants of the Star Sea's immortal energy, forming a tsunami to strike the weak point, and finally leap over the High Wall. We've planned for so long, and we thought we could recreate the feat of the Merchant Immortal Boat. Who would have expected the final result to be this? In the deduction, wouldn't this High Wall be the one we knocked down?"

"Wait, I just tried it. The formation this kid set up is truly quite formidable. I can't get out either."

"Don't be scared by this kid. The deduced scene may not necessarily be the real future. We must not abandon the plan because of this..."

"I say, this doesn't look good. Even with the three of us working together, we couldn't break this formation."

...

A subtle atmosphere gradually spread among the Immortal Boat elders.

Firstly, they were deeply shocked by the scene of the great disturbance in the Star Sea. Secondly, they were horrified to discover that they had been silently imprisoned by Li Fan's formation.

"Fellow Daoist, what is the meaning of this?" Zhong Daogong narrowed his eyes and questioned.

Li Fan avoided answering, instead muttering to himself as if possessed, "My Master and all my senior elders, for the sake of Great Qi's safety, have decided to abandon cooperation with you and probe the weaknesses of the High Wall. I can understand that..."

"But if that's the case, then after twenty years, won't I have died in vain?"

"Great Qi intends to give up. What about your Immortal Boat?"

Li Fan stared intently at the Immortal Boat elders and asked.

Zhong Daogong was temporarily unsure of Li Fan's state of mind and hesitated to answer.

Seeing that he couldn't get a response, Li Fan's emotions immediately became agitated again: "What about you!"

"If you also give up, then all of this will be as if it never happened. Then my unauthorized use of the Immortal Artifact, deducing the future, and ultimately having my lifespan reduced, would it not be rendered meaningless?"

"I possessed a bright future. Among the young disciples of Great Qi, my talent was unparalleled. In the future, not to mention becoming a literary master and creating a lasting legacy, at the very least I could be like my Master, a renowned teacher, imparting knowledge and solving doubts..."

"All of this vanished because of your Immortal Boat's words." Li Fan's tone became increasingly frantic. A strange blackness even appeared on his face, making one's scalp tingle.

"Death is death."

"But to become a laughingstock even after death..."

"I will not agree!"

Li Fan pointed at Zhong Daogong.

"Give me an answer!"

"Your Immortal Boat, will you continue with the plan, or not!"

"If you are afraid, and cancel the plan..."

"Then you will perish with me!"

As Li Fan spoke, countless silver lines in the surrounding void suddenly lit up.

It was as if thousands of suns had risen simultaneously on the horizon, illuminating the space occupied by the Immortal Boat members.

The expressions on everyone's faces were revealed in perfect detail.

A silver wind began to blow in the void.

A mere gentle brush across their faces cut them with countless wounds.

Forcing the Immortal Boat members to employ their means of protection.

However, as the invisible wind in the void grew more intense, their expressions all changed drastically.

"What... what kind of formation is this!"

"Danger! Everyone be careful, this formation is the most ferocious I've ever seen!"

"Quick, use the 'Break' character to break the formation!"

The elders reacted quickly. Before their words faded, the Chief Elder of the Immortal Pivot Department, Jian Daosheng, had already written a character: 'Break'.

Under the influence of the True Immortal Script's power, the silver-white formation lines instantly crumbled.

However, before the Immortal Boat members could cheer, something that made them dumbfounded happened.

In the surrounding darkness, countless more 'suns' rose, generating even more silver lines than before, an endless cycle, weaving a new grand formation.

Under the 'Break' character, the formation melted like ice. But at the same time, more water was being frozen into ice!

Therefore, the formation that trapped them not only did not disintegrate.

Instead, it became even larger and more complex.

"Quick, who else knows the 'Break' character, follow up!"

"Calm down! The Immortal Boat has not moved away, we are all concentrated here. If too much True Immortal Script power erupts at once, the consequences are unimaginable!"

"This kid has gone mad! What exactly does he want to do!"

As countless silver threads flashed continuously, Li Fan's voice continued to echo.

"Fellow Daoist Zhong! Answer me!"

"What is your Immortal Boat's answer!"

Zhong Daogong's face was unsightly.

In all these years, being pushed to such an extent by a junior was a first.

And yet...

Zhong Daogong looked at Li Fan, at the different True Immortal Script characters that were already beginning to float around him, and felt a headache.

If these True Immortal Script characters were activated simultaneously within the formation, even if they had spent half their lives immersed in True Immortal Scripts, they, the elders of the Immortal Boat, would likely be heavily injured.

Zhong Daogong finally understood how troublesome a cultivator who possessed the power of True Immortal Script and was also fearless of death truly was.

"Answer me!"

Li Fan's almost crazed voice echoed throughout the grand formation.

Seeing Li Fan on the verge of collapse, the True Immortal Scripts flying out of him had become densely packed to a terrifying degree.

Zhong Daogong could only reply helplessly, "Fellow Daoist, rest assured, our Immortal Boat will absolutely not abandon the plan to explore beyond the High Wall."

"Words are not proof!"

"Then what do you intend, Fellow Daoist?" The situation was stronger than the individual, so Zhong Daogong patiently asked.

"Take me to that weak point of the High Wall first, and let's investigate! If you give up, even if I die alone, I will smash into it!" Li Fan's tone was resolute.

The elders of the Immortal Boat exchanged glances.

"How about it, can this formation be broken?"

"You know our level of formation mastery. Even if we sat down to study it, it would take a hundred years to understand, let alone break it in a short time."

"I've said it before, we can't rely too much on True Immortal Scripts. We must also focus on the development of other techniques and divine abilities. You just wouldn't listen. Now you're being thoroughly cornered." Elder Meng Xiaomeng of the Immortal Pivot Department wore a gloating expression.

"What now? Should we really take him to that weak point of the High Wall?"

"It's not necessarily impossible."

"This person is nearing his end, his mind is already frenzied, and cannot be reasoned with by normal means. He might genuinely do something like smash himself against the High Wall."

"Also, don't forget, this person has a deep understanding of True Immortal Scripts. Perhaps we can use him for the preliminary experimental plan."

"That's right, let's appease him for now. As long as we ensure he doesn't leak secrets to the outside world."

...

Half by Li Fan's coercion, threatening with his life, and half out of some conspiratorial considerations.

In the end, the Immortal Boat elders agreed to Li Fan's request.

They would first take him to witness the so-called weak point of the High Wall.

The Immortal Boat, along with all the elders, moved through the void within the Void Return Great Formation.

They passed through the Sea of Remnants, getting closer and closer to the foot of the High Wall.

"Ahead are the continuous fragments of worlds."

"Beyond that lies the invisible High Wall," Zhong Daogong said.

Li Fan snorted: "I've been there. How do we proceed from here."

"The Great Wall of Broken Realms is connected as one. If the Immortal Boat were to follow, it would likely be captured by that great power and be unable to escape. Moreover, as you've noticed, the further we approach the High Wall, the stronger the reverberating star power becomes. With our cultivation, we can barely stabilize our bodies, but a giant Immortal Boat cannot..." Zhong Daogong patiently explained.

"Don't worry, we've come this far, and we won't go back on our word."

Li Fan's gaze swept over everyone, and after a moment of thought, he finally nodded in agreement.

Thus, six elders were left to guard the Immortal Boat.

The remaining elders, along with Li Fan, continued deeper.

Chapter 1327

The surroundings were endless darkness, and in the distance lay a desolate, boundless expanse of world fragments.

The tide-like reverberating star power continuously intensified, and the speed of Li Fan's group's advance slowed with each passing moment.

"The residual true immortal power gathered beneath the The Great Barrier has grown even stronger than before," Zhong Daogong observed, gazing forward with a heavy tone.

Affected by the pervasive reverberating star power, not only their exposed bodies but also their divine senses felt like willows in the wind, scattering not far from their bodies.

Their communication relied on the special 'Boundless' transmission method of the immortal boat.

"Though the The Great Barrier is magnificent, if this trend continues, it will likely collapse one day."

"The rate at which the residual power is increasing is faster than we anticipated. It seems even without that kid, we would eventually have to proceed with the wall-leaping plan. Otherwise, if the The Great Barrier collapses, none of us will survive."

"Even so, being forced into this is quite disheartening."

"Hehehe, let's go with the flow and have him test it out with his own body..."

...

The immortal boat's inhabitants were engaged in a heated discussion.

'Boundless' was a communication method known only to the core of the immortal boat, so they spoke rather freely in front of Li Fan.

However, they never imagined that Li Fan was also proficient in this 'Boundless' communication technique. Therefore, he heard every word of the immortal boat elders' statements.

Lost in thought, he maintained an appearance of being utterly unaware of everything.

"How... much... longer?"

He would occasionally turn back and ask with a vague divine sense.

Zhong Daogong's answer remained unchanged: "Soon, it's just ahead."

This was not Zhong Daogong's excuse.

The saying "running a horse to death while looking at mountains" aptly described the vastness of the star sea in this remote region, at the foot of the The Great Barrier. Although they seemed not far from the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall, after flying for a long time, the road ahead showed no signs of decreasing, as if it were endless.

Only the sight of the slightly changing Fragmented Realm's Great Wall indicated that they were not standing still.

The increasingly strong reverberating star power became their obstacle. It was like walking through an infinite muddy swamp, with towering distant mountains as their goal.

"Too slow," Li Fan expressed his impatience. "At this rate, I'll likely exhaust my lifespan before we even get there."

Zhong Daogong was about to explain, "It's not that we..."

When he suddenly heard Li Fan say coldly, "Be careful!"

A golden sword projection, radiating brilliance, descended upon them.

The sword bore the imagery of mountains and rivers, the sun and moon, and stars, exuding a majestic and sacred aura.

"In which direction?" Li Fan asked sternly.

The immortal boat's inhabitants were still immersed in the sight of this extraordinary golden sword projection. Not only because the projection represented supreme sword dao, but more importantly, they were shocked to discover that under the golden sword projection's coverage, the reverberating star power they were subjected to was instantly reduced by more than half!

It was as if they were standing on a suddenly risen elevated ground, in another world, no longer battered by tumultuous waves.

"How is this possible?!" The immortal boat's inhabitants were all aghast.

The reverberating star power was, in essence, residual true immortal power. Even with the word "residual," it was still the power of a true immortal.

This golden sword projection could reduce its influence, did this not mean it was on par with an immortal?

Of course, the immortal boat's inhabitants dared not think too highly of it. Even so, Li Fan, capable of wielding divine abilities that could contend with true immortal power, made the elders of the immortal boat look at him with renewed interest.

"This kid truly is like a treasure trove, with endless surprises to uncover."

"If we could comprehend this kind of divine ability, perhaps it could open a second path for our immortal boat, besides the true immortal script!"

"No, rather than focusing on him personally, it's more likely that the Great Qi civilization is unfathomably profound."

The appearance of the golden sword projection stirred up a thousand waves. The elders of the immortal boat displayed various expressions, while Li Fan seemed indifferent. He looked at Zhong Daogong and said, "Quickly point the way and use this 'Immortal Slaying Sword.' The consumption is immense; I can't hold on for long."

Within the golden sword projection's domain, even divine sense transmissions were much clearer.

Hearing the words 'Immortal Slaying Sword,' Zhong Daogong's eyes flickered.

However, he ultimately indicated the direction for Li Fan.

The golden sword shone, traversing the sea of stars. Its speed was countless times faster than their own flight. The desolate world within the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall visibly grew larger in their vision. They were getting closer to the foot of the The Great Barrier.

Following Zhong Daogong's guidance, Li Fan controlled the sword projection to a peculiar "bulge" in the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall.

It was like a watchtower on the continuous Great Wall, where the number of world fragments piled up was significantly greater than elsewhere.

"Is the weak point of the The Great Barrier here?" Li Fan asked, narrowing his eyes.

Zhong Daogong shook his head, "No. Structures like this are actually quite common within the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall. They are likely important nodes maintaining its stable form. To reach our destination, we need to borrow the 'momentum' of this place."

The golden sword projection stopped, and Zhong Daogong and the other immortal boat elders' expressions turned solemn.

"Please, friend, ascend."

The immortal boat elders jointly cast a spell, and a blurry image appeared before Li Fan.

The flat, slightly curved space, due to the bulge in the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall, showed extreme distortion. Like a propped-up tower, its momentum and energy were noticeably higher than in other places.

"Ascend along the momentum of the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall."

Zhong Daogong gently pointed, and the image of the spatial bulge magnified infinitely, instantly engulfing them.

They were already within the marked spatio-temporal bulge without realizing it.

Li Fan stood still, carefully savoring the subtle differences in the surrounding space-time.

"Our immortal boat spent several hundred years to understand this method of 'climbing.' It's normal for you, friend, to not grasp it immediately."

"If all else fails, we can dispel this golden sword projection and fly with our physical bodies."

The immortal boat elders offered their "kind" suggestion.

Li Fan ignored them, closing his eyes. A scene flashed through his mind.

In fact, Li Fan had personally experienced this so-called sense of spatio-temporal high and low.

It was during the collapse of the The Great Barrier in his previous life, when an unknown existence descended, causing a tempest in the star sea.

However, at that time, shaken by the world-shattering spectacle, Li Fan was misled by the superficial phenomena and did not pay attention to the spatio-temporal turbulence it brought, like a great upheaval in the star sea.

"The distinction between high and low."

The scene in his memory gradually transformed from illusory to real, as if he were back at the end of his previous life, watching the magnificent spectacle of the star sea's turbulent waves.

A sudden realization slowly dawned upon him.

The illusion vanished, and he looked at reality again.

At the towering section of the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall, this bulge was extremely conspicuous.

"Everyone, hold steady!"

Li Fan said in a deep voice.

The sword projection once again emitted brilliant golden light. Although it was like the great sun in the sky, for some reason, the golden light only shone in this area and did not illuminate a large range.

Despite not actually moving, the golden sword projection seemed to have traversed billions of miles of space-time in an instant, becoming dilapidated and flickering unsteadily.

Cold sweat began to bead on Li Fan's forehead, and his body trembled involuntarily.

The immortal boat's inhabitants watched as the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall scenery, distorted and deformed, appeared smaller in their vision. Their eyes were filled with astonishment.

"He actually completed the climb on his first try?"

"This kid's talent and comprehension are truly rare in the world. He must be a top prodigy in that Great Qi civilization."

"At such a young age, to have achieved this. Give him a few more centuries, and he might truly be able to scale the The Great Barrier! No wonder he became somewhat deranged when his lifespan approached its end. If it were me, I wouldn't be able to accept it either!"

Many immortal boat elders looked at Li Fan with a hint of pity flashing in their eyes.

The climbing and transformation continued.

The range covered by the golden sword projection rapidly shrunk, barely encompassing the immortal boat's inhabitants and Li Fan.

The once brilliant golden light gradually dimmed, clearly consuming more energy, as if it could extinguish at any moment.

However, the changes it brought were also evident.

The surrounding scenery of the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall, which had stretched to the horizon, slowly curled up and retracted into a circle.

The perspective rose continuously, and the circle grew smaller and smaller.

Finally, it converged into a single point.

Boom! Boom!

It was as if they had reached the end of the road, or perhaps crashed into a wall.

The last remaining golden sword projection shattered in an instant.

Li Fan suddenly spat out a mouthful of blood, his face deathly pale.

But he merely wiped it away, a look of surprise and madness flashing in his eyes.

"Is this the The Great Barrier?" Li Fan coughed, spitting out another large mouthful of blood. He didn't care and turned to ask.

"No."

"This is the foot of the The Great Barrier in the truest sense," Zhong Daogong said, carefully observing Li Fan. He first shook his head in negation, then sighed with emotion.

He also looked around.

"We have to climb again?" Li Fan inquired, looking upwards.

"The Great Barrier is difficult to traverse, or perhaps impossible to cross. We can only crash into it with our bodies," Jian Daosheng said solemnly.

"There are fewer people this time. With our combined strength, we should not be able to reach the impact point of that year. However, the distance should be sufficient to observe the traces."

With that, the immortal boat elders formed a circle.

Then, a peculiar aura emerged from their bodies.

It did not surge upwards but rose continuously like a wave from the sea, one wave higher than the next.

Carried by this surging force, the scenery, which had previously shrunk to a small point, transformed again.

The small point extended downwards, forming lines like braces.

The aura of the immortal boat elders grew more vigorous, and the lines continuously thickened.

Like a heavenly pillar, it gradually became impossible to see its end, yet it steadfastly supported the people above.

Due to the continuous climbing, their vision became higher and more expansive.

Li Fan gazed into the distance. In the darkness, he seemed to sense some peaks similar to theirs.

And in the unseen far distance, a majestic mountain stood tall.

Its peak was beyond sight.

It was only slightly shorter than the endless The Great Barrier.

"That is..."

"A true immortal from the Immortal Ruins?"

Looking back, a realization surged into Li Fan's mind.

Li Fan had learned from the memories of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law King that the Heavenly Mysteries King had once told the disciples of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect that he had found a way to lead the people, and even the entire Xuanhuang Realm, away from the Abyssal Star Sea.

However, this was something only a true immortal could achieve.

"This is the difference between immortals and mortals."

"The mortal realm is always below. Only by ascending to immortality can one stand on the peak."

"The process of cultivation is also a process of climbing step by step. But when the great tribulation descended, the peak that could originally accommodate habitation collapsed."

"The mountain is gone, and the path is unclear. Even if one can momentarily fly through the air, they cannot ultimately remain in that realm for long."

Borrowing the momentum of the Fragmented Realm's Great Wall, they reached a height that was ordinarily impossible. It was like prematurely ascending to a mountain peak that no longer existed, and all sorts of insights that did not belong to this era flooded Li Fan's mind.

"The difference between immortals and mortals is already this significant."

"And the The Great Barrier..."

Li Fan turned his gaze towards the greater distance.

Majestic and continuous, it pressed down like the curtain of the sky.

Its beginning and end were beyond sight, its peaks and valleys hidden.

It simply stood there, blocking their path,

instilling despair in their hearts.

If he had not personally witnessed the collapse of the The Great Barrier, Li Fan, upon seeing this magnificent scene, would likely have developed a demonic obsession, and the mere thought of the The Great Barrier's existence would inevitably instill fear in his heart.

Looking at the expressions of the immortal boat elders, it seemed to be so.

Their ambition upon arrival had vanished, replaced by endless fear and reverence on their faces.

However, they seemed to possess a secret technique.

As they formed a circle, their minds also united.

Not long after, they gradually awoke from their shock.

Li Fan feigned to wake up at the same time.

"We cannot ascend any higher,"

Zhong Daogong sighed, then looked into the distance, as if searching for traces left by the Merchant Immortal Boat in the past.

Li Fan waited patiently.

After a full half-day, Zhong Daogong pointed in a direction, his expression solemn, and said, "Friend, can you sense the anomaly there?"

Li Fan followed Zhong Daogong's gaze.

At first glance, it seemed no different from the surrounding scenery.

But after careful observation, Li Fan did find some clues.

Li Fan extended his hand, as if trying to touch the distant spot.

"Here... it's distorted."

"Is this the trajectory left by the Merchant Immortal Boat's collision back then?"

Li Fan's tone was indescribable.

He glided his hand through the air, tracing the imprints in space.

In his mind's eye, half a magnificent immortal boat appeared, resolutely charging forward.

Then, an earth-shattering brilliance erupted.

A hint of emotion flashed in Zhong Daogong's eyes as he nodded, "The energy unleashed when crossing the The Great Barrier was so immense that even the The Great Barrier itself could not withstand it."

"Therefore, the traces left here have not faded for ten thousand years."

"The imprint remains. This shows that after so many years, there are no signs of 'repair.' So, theoretically, there is a very high probability that we can follow the traces left by the Merchant Immortal Boat to recreate the feat of crossing the The Great Barrier." Zhong Daogong said slowly.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, seemingly contemplating something.

Shortly after, he shook his head slightly, "No. We have exerted our utmost effort to reach this height. And there..."

Li Fan pointed to the location of the imprint left by the Merchant Immortal Boat and asked, "Even if we exert ten times the effort, we likely cannot reach it."

"Let alone cross the The Great Barrier!"

Chapter 1328: Gloom Gathers Peaks

"Immortals and mortals are distinct. To reach that height with our own strength is naturally impossible. That is why we need to borrow external forces. It was the same for the Merchant Immortal Boat back then, and it is the same for our Mystic Immortal Boat now!" Zhong Daogong said with a slight smile, not explaining in great detail, but rather ambiguously.

"External forces? True Immortal Script? Is that why you want to join hands with Great Qi?" Li Fan asked directly.

"Yes... and no." Zhong Daogong's expression was inscrutable.

"Alright, since fellow Daoist has seen the weak spot of the The Great Barrier and proven our Immortal Boat's sincerity, why not return to a safe place to discuss further? This is not a place to linger..." Before Zhong Daogong could finish, the high point of the fragmented realm's great wall where they stood suddenly trembled slightly.

Everyone couldn't help but look "down." Within the Abyssal Sea below the peaks, for reasons unknown, ripples began to stir. Like a sea of clouds, they surged ceaselessly across the star sea.

"It's the Distant Stellar Force!" all the elders of the Immortal Boat's faces paled slightly.

"The scale of this outbreak is not small, and it probably won't subside in a short time. We should leave as soon as possible," Zhong Daogong said gravely.

Li Fan gazed into the distance. Although he couldn't see specific things in the star sea due to the distortion of his perspective, Li Fan could faintly sense the source of this Distant Stellar Force outbreak.

It was as if the fragmented realm's great wall, acting as a breakwater, had formed a gap due to the disappearance of one of the fragmented realms.

A portion of the True Immortal residual power accumulated below the The Great Barrier had found an outlet. It flowed down boundlessly through this loophole.

This kind of thing had happened in his previous life as well. It was because his Sacred Embryo clone had annihilated the numerous fragmented realm shards that the Heavenly Physician had implanted in the Xuanhuang Realm's Chizha Abyss, forcing them to retrieve realms to replenish them.

But in this life, the trigger had not occurred. Why then was the fragmented realm's great wall in turmoil?

"Could it be that Senior Yin and the others are causing this disturbance?"

"They wouldn't be so reckless..." A flicker of doubt crossed Li Fan's mind. As he was pondering, the elders of the Immortal Boat had already brought Li Fan down from the "high vantage point" of the star sea. The scenery rapidly changed; the vast, boundless Abyssal Sea was gone. The fragmented realm's great wall still stood tall; the previous "ascension to the viewing point" felt like an illusion. Clearly, the act of ascending was not an easy task even for the elders of the Immortal Boat.

In a short while, all the elders' breathing became ragged, and sweat beaded on their foreheads. Zhong Daogong's expression was grim as he looked towards the distant source of the disturbance from the fragmented realm's great wall.

However, he ultimately chose not to investigate further and instead urged everyone to leave. On the way back to the Immortal Boat, Li Fan's solidified Golden Sword phantom still led the way.

This time, the elders of the Immortal Boat truly experienced how fast this sword shadow was. When they reached the location of the Mystic Immortal Boat, the Distant Stellar Force had not yet reached them.

The expressions of the elders as they looked at Li Fan changed.

"Fellow Daoist, let's enter the Immortal Boat first and then discuss the follow-up cooperation plan," Jian Dao Sheng said with a smile, pointing to the opened portal of the Immortal Boat.

Unexpectedly, Li Fan resolutely shook his head and refused, "I think not. I need to return to Great Qi." The elders' faces immediately became somewhat subtle.

Li Fan, undeterred, said with an arrogant expression, "What? I see you all seem to have an opinion?"

"This isn't what we agreed upon before, is it? You learned our Immortal Boat's most secret plan and now you want to leave..." Zhong Daogong's expression turned displeased, and the other elders stared fixedly at Li Fan, their auras locking onto him.

"Hmph, I see no need for you to waste your efforts. You have all seen the 'Immortal Slaying Sword.' If I unleash it, who among you can stop me?" Li Fan said unhurriedly.

The elders fell silent upon hearing this. Indeed, it was faster than the spread of the True Immortal residual force in the star sea.

It could even carry multiple people... Such an escape technique was truly beyond their comprehension. However, letting Li Fan leave so easily was absolutely impossible.

The atmosphere in the field gradually tensed. It was Li Fan who broke the deadlock, "Why must you all be like this? I'll only be gone for a short while. I know your concerns; you're afraid I'll leak the weak spot of that The Great Barrier. You don't need to worry!"

"When I return, I plan to persuade Great Qi again to see if they can change their minds. Having personally witnessed that there is indeed such a weak spot in the The Great Barrier, the persuasion will ultimately be much stronger. If my master and the others are still unwilling to take the risk, I naturally won't expose this secret. If I'm fortunate enough to convince them..."

"Since we will be cooperating in the end, it doesn't matter if it's leaked or not."

"My lifespan is nearing its end. Now, before I die, I have the opportunity to witness the only chance to cross the The Great Barrier with my own eyes. How can I give it up?" Li Fan said earnestly.

Afterward, he cupped his hands and, amidst the heavy encirclement of the Immortal Boat elders, directly rode his sword shadow and broke through the void.

The speed was so fast that even Zhong Daogong did not have time to react before he disappeared from sight.

"This kid is truly troublesome," Jian Dao Sheng stroked his beard and frowned.

"There's nothing we can do. He possesses the True Immortal Script, his formations are extraordinary, and his escape technique is even more elusive. To top it off, his lifespan is nearing its end, so he's not afraid of death... It's best not to make an enemy of someone like that."

"Fortunately, he doesn't have many years left. Otherwise, our Immortal Boat might not have peace in the future."

"I think what he said makes sense. If Great Qi is unwilling to participate in the plan due to the prophecy of disaster concerning the realm-protecting immortal artifact, then our Immortal Boat is his only reliance. After all, it's clearly unrealistic for him to cross the The Great Barrier alone..." While the elders of the Immortal Boat were in heated discussion, Li Fan had already returned to the boundary of the fragmented realm's great wall.

The Distant Stellar Force was like a rising storm, becoming more intense. The wooden sword phantom Li Fan had left behind earlier was like a candle in the wind, precarious.

He sent out a golden light to stabilize it further. Li Fan searched the surroundings for the traces of Skilled Artisan and the others, but found no sign of them.

The secret marks they had agreed to leave along the way as they searched for suitable fragmented realm worlds had also been blown away by the Distant Stellar Force.

"They've all lost contact?" Li Fan was somewhat surprised.

"Fortunately, the 'Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length' formation is not severely damaged." Li Fan floated to the formation, strengthened it further, and gave up on searching for them.

"I can only hope they look after themselves."

"Given the luck of these few individuals, the Distant Stellar Force outbreak alone shouldn't be enough to kill them."

"When the storm gradually subsides, if they are safe, they should return." Li Fan passed through the great formation and returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

As Li Fan expected, a small amount of True Immortal residual force had leaked through the formation. After setting up a network of Primal Force Essence at the great formation for a double blockade, the disturbance caused by the Distant Stellar Force finally subsided.

"Among the few, if anyone is most likely to have caused this anomaly in the star sea, it should be Senior Yin." Li Fan's mind recalled the peculiar expression on Senior Yin's face when they had first arrived at the fragmented realm's great wall.

"He must have seen scenes from the memories of the world spirits he absorbed previously."

"But Senior Yin is definitely not a reckless person. If it were just this, he wouldn't recklessly move fragmented realm shards without regard for the consequences..."

"The secret behind this should be revealed when Senior Yin returns." Li Fan had a vague premonition that Senior Yin was still alive somewhere in the fragmented realm's great wall.

He might have even encountered an immense fortune.

"Perhaps it's related to the formation of the fragmented realm's great wall?" Li Fan suddenly thought. In the Abyssal Sea, not only was the origin of the The Great Barrier unknown, but even the formation of the fragmented realm's great wall below it had always been a mystery. In that era, countless destroyed cultivation worlds in the star sea had not converged at the location of the Immortal Ruins.

Instead, they had piled up at the foot of the The Great Barrier, forming a continuous mass. In Li Fan's opinion, the force maintaining the fragmented realm's great wall was a great power no less than True Immortal residual force.

Yet, it was beyond Li Fan's knowledge. It should be known that Li Fan's current experience far surpassed that of ordinary cultivators.

In each of his past reincarnations, he had been able to explore without restraint and disregard consequences. There were very few blind spots left for him in the Xuanhuang Realm and within the Abyssal Sea.

This force that maintained the fragmented realm's great wall was one of them. The deepest part of the Abyssal Sea was also one of them. Upon returning to Great Xuan, Li Fan's divine sense possessed the body of a burly Netherfolk.

He then gathered the Netherfolk, initiated the ritual to enter the Abyssal Sea, and walked into it slowly. The Abyssal Sea was endlessly dark.

For ordinary cultivators, it was naturally a perilous death trap. But Li Fan had walked through it countless times; he was familiar with the path and encountered no danger.

He ignored the ancient corpse of a Longevity Realm cultivator lying on the ground and walked forward with unwavering focus. He arrived at the central core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

It was like a transparent watchtower, allowing him to overlook the outline of the True Immortal's corpse throughout the entire Abyssal Sea. Finally, he stopped, not venturing further down to directly face the hidden True Immortal's will to survive.

Before him, ancient storm clouds that had accumulated for countless years silently stood. Like various terrifying ancient beasts of creation, they loomed.

As he gazed down at these accumulated powers, Li Fan felt a sense of familiarity.

"As expected, my feeling was correct!" A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes as the scenes he had perceived not long ago while using the The Great Barrier's momentum to overlook the Abyssal Sea from the mountaintop appeared before him.

They gradually overlapped with the scene of the storm condensing in the Abyssal Sea. It wasn't the specific scenery, but rather the similarity.

It was because of the convergence of energy that this part of the Abyssal Sea had also unusually risen significantly.

"This should be the multitude of mountain peaks I saw from that high vantage point."

"The energy accumulated here is 'higher' than that of the entire Xuanhuang Realm. It's even superior to the location reached by using the fragmented realm's great wall's momentum beneath the The Great Barrier!" Li Fan's eyes flickered, his thoughts racing. "Not only is the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation in the Abyssal Sea built upon the remnants of a True Immortal,"

"But it's also because nearly ten thousand years have passed since the formation was established!"

"The original establishment of the great formation was for the Heavenly Mysteries King to bring the Xuanhuang Realm across the The Great Barrier. However, due to various accidents, the Heavenly Mysteries King inexplicably disappeared, and the plan was halted mid-way."

"But the energy accumulation in the Abyssal Sea did not stop. Instead, it has continued for nearly ten thousand years."

"Over the past ten thousand years, various drastic changes have occurred in the star sea. However, the 'height' of the The Great Barrier encircling the star sea has not actually changed. This means..." Li Fan swept his gaze over the Abyssal Sea below again.

The gathered storm clouds suddenly transformed into peaks in his eyes. Each one floated above the Abyssal Sea.

Facing the The Great Barrier from afar.

"The high points that the Immortal Boat people treasure and can only reach with external aid are commonplace in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Standing here, crossing the The Great Barrier is much easier than in other places."

"The only concern is that it might provoke the True Immortal's will to survive here..."

"But as long as I'm careful, there shouldn't be any problem." Maintaining the overlooking perspective, Li Fan felt a slight strain.

He exhaled and returned to his normal state. He began to ponder the correct way to utilize this wealth left by the Heavenly Mysteries King.

"Merely using the high point as a stepping stone is definitely not enough. I need more data. Preferably, actual verified results..."

"The Immortal Boat as cannon fodder isn't a bad idea."

"The Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, as a link in the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation, involves crossing the The Great Barrier. The Eye of the Tian Beast is also involved. This suggests that the Eye of the Tian Beast is not just for navigation and targeting..."

"What it sees might also be a higher-dimensional perspective, akin to the 'height of the The Great Barrier' that I saw earlier," Li Fan realized inwardly.

Controlling the Netherfolk's body, Li Fan stayed in the control center of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation for a full seven days, until the Netherfolk's body could no longer withstand the dense Gloom power and was completely swallowed by it.

Sensing the disappearance of his consciousness, he finally gave up. In the Great Xuan pocket world, Li Fan slowly opened his eyes. His divine sense swept across heaven and earth. Familiarizing himself with the previous higher-dimensional perspective and then returning to the normal perspective, Li Fan actually felt a slight discomfort.

"In ancient times, breaking through the limit of height allowed one to ascend to immortality."

"Later, the immortal path was severed, but the The Great Barrier existed..."

"However, perhaps the principles of these two are similar." Looking at the countless beings in Great Xuan, Li Fan was filled with a sudden, inexplicable emotion.

"It's just that the height of the The Great Barrier might be a bit greater than the height of becoming an immortal. After all, the Heavenly Mysteries King could ascend the immortal path back then, but he couldn't cross the The Great Barrier."

"Let's think about it another way. If one could cross the The Great Barrier now, perhaps one could have ascended to immortality in the past." At this thought, Li Fan was momentarily lost in thought.

"Immortals..." Ten thousand years had passed, and times had changed. The same realm, one was the ascension to the Dao, while the other was being locked beneath the The Great Barrier.

Even if one could cross it, one would have to face unknown risks beyond the The Great Barrier.

"The Great Dao is easier to traverse, but Immortals are no longer Immortals," Li Fan could only sigh.

"If my guess is correct, the method used to build the The Great Barrier is identical to the restriction for 'ascension to immortality,' then this is interesting."

Chapter 1329

Li Fan had always had two theories about the formation of the The Great Barrier.

One possibility was that the The Great Barrier was created by a True Immortal who attained enlightenment within the Immortal Ruins. It was akin to a barrier a cultivator would set up during seclusion to prevent disturbances.

The other possibility was that the The Great Barrier was built by an unknown entity from beyond the wall. It was erected to seal off the star sea, thereby isolating the calamity of True Immortal Script that had spread at the time.

Both theories held a certain logic.

The Great Barrier was formless and intangible, yet it could seal off the entire star sea. This was a method that mortal cultivators could not comprehend; only those at the level of [[Immortal]] could achieve such a feat. While the Abyssal Star Sea was vast in the eyes of cultivators from the lower realms, containing countless immortal cultivation worlds, a True Immortal could perceive its entirety with a single glance. This casually drawn, sealed-off area might have a scale that was just right for the cultivation practice of Immortals.

On the other hand, the star sea was infinitely vast. The mere Abyssal Star Sea certainly did not encompass all of the lower realms, nor could it even be considered a corner of the lower realms. After the great calamity of the Immortal Realm in the past, the Xuanhuang Realm was located in an area where True Yang King had returned after ascending. It was also a place where Faceless Immortals had escaped from. Could it be that there were no other survivors of the Immortal Realm beyond the Abyssal Star Sea? It was highly possible that they had taken preventative measures after discovering anomalies in the Xuanhuang Realm's star domain.

"The Immortal Realm collapsed, and the vast lower realms instead became a battlefield where various forces converged. What does the world outside the The Great Barrier look like now?"

"Do those surviving Immortals still hold dominant positions? Or have the cultivators of the past risen up in resistance, finding a way to confront True Immortals? Have they even developed a civilization capable of hunting True Immortals?"

Li Fan mused leisurely, a sense of longing arising in his heart.

His emotions surged, and he remained in a state of turmoil for a long time.

"It's coming soon. This life, with the Sky-Piercing Shuttle leading the way and leaping over the The Great Barrier, even if they ultimately fail, I will summarize their experience and continue in the next life. At most three to five attempts, and there's a great chance of crossing the The Great Barrier."

"And once I achieve Dao Integration by becoming the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls, and ascend to become the strongest in the Abyssal Star Sea, I will also be able to unify the forces of the Xuanhuang Realm and the Immortal Boat to the greatest extent, and begin exploring beyond the The Great Barrier."

"Just like how I explored the Cloudy Sea and the Xuanhuang Realm step by step from the Great Xuan pocket world back then!"

In a slight daze, the scene of him braving countless hardships and breaking out of the Immortal Execution Great Formation to arrive in the Cultivation World suddenly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"Although the world beyond the The Great Barrier is perilous, I am no longer what I once was."

Li Fan's gaze flickered. "The difference in status... "

Surveying the star sea below the The Great Barrier from an elevated perspective, the insights that arose in his heart were tens of times more active than when he meditated in the star sea.

Furthermore, the things naturally understood from a high vantage point were inherently a level higher than those understood in a normal state.

It was as if he was comprehending the Dao from the "True Immortal's perspective"!

"Why are all beings below Immortals considered ants?"

"A True Immortal can destroy the Xuanhuang Realm with a single glance. But even the strongest mortal cultivator would need considerable effort to destroy such a vast world."

"This is because Immortals stand at a sufficiently high position. In the eyes of True Immortals, a mere realm is but a tiny speck!"

Recalling the scene he had witnessed earlier from the peak of the Broken Realm Great Wall, Li Fan's thoughts churned.

The continuous fragments of the broken realms, as the altitude increased, gradually shrunk and then twisted into rings, ultimately converging into a single point.

Compared to the colossal Broken Realm Great Wall, the current Xuanhuang Realm was merely an insignificant fragment.

The Great Wall transformed into a point.

And viewing the Xuanhuang Realm as a point did not even require ascending to such a height.

Savoring the sensation of continuous climbing, Li Fan saw the sights of the Great Xuan pocket world and the Xuanhuang Realm in his eyes, slowly shrinking amidst distortion.

Although it had not yet reached the point of converging into a single dot, it was as if he was looking down from beyond the realm, transforming into a ball of yellow smoke.

Li Fan instinctively wanted to reach out and touch it, but he found himself as if frozen, with infinite resistance around him, unable to move an inch!

"I am still too weak! Although by chance I can see with the perspective of a True Immortal, insight and actual action are two completely different concepts..." Li Fan tried several times, but the result was always the same.

His body seemed to be outside the world, unable to perform any effective manipulation. In fact, due to these attempts, his internal energy was rapidly depleted. Even with Li Fan's current foundation, he was stretched thin, quickly nearing exhaustion.

Li Fan knew he couldn't force it and quickly descended from the high place.

As his field of vision lowered, his movements gradually became more agile again.

Li Fan let out a long sigh, recovering from the recent expenditure.

A moment later, his gaze slightly sharpened. He had noticed something peculiar.

According to his normal recovery speed, he should have regained his full strength within a few breaths. After all, he had the Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven as his foundation, and he had also absorbed the Azure Nether World-Ending Mutation. The energy that the Xuanhuang Realm could unleash when facing a world-ending crisis after the fusion of all realms was immense. For an individual cultivator, it was practically inexhaustible.

But now, Li Fan, simply by attempting to move at a "high altitude," had depleted this energy reserve in a short period.

"It's not just the altitude that has changed; the energy consumed to drive actions and move normally has almost increased exponentially."

"This is also one of the fundamental reasons for the gap between Immortals and mortals. Spiritual energy, even the Spirit Qi of an entire world, cannot support the energy consumption of acting at a 'high altitude'."

"The energy level is too low; a more advanced substitute needs to be found."

"Immortal Spiritual Qi..."

Various realizations flashed through Li Fan's mind.

With a single step, Li Fan left the Great Xuan pocket world and arrived in another primitive, uninhabited, and wild pocket world covered in endless primeval forests.

He waited quietly for his rest to complete, then attempted to ascend again.

However, this time, Li Fan controlled the speed of his altitude increase. When the primeval forest before his eyes shrunk to the size of a glass bead, he stopped.

For Li Fan, who was at the lowest point, simply maintaining the "altitude" required a large amount of energy.

But this time, he did not choose to use his own Spirit Qi to fill the gap. Instead, he chose to use Primal Force Essence, which was very close to Immortal Spiritual Qi.

Golden light enveloped him, and the sense of restraint slightly loosened.

Compared to being completely frozen before, it was much easier.

Li Fan looked at the miniature pocket world before him, which resembled a glass bead, and slowly extended his right index finger.

Hum...

As if sensing a fatal crisis, a mournful dirge, like a weeping lament, suddenly resounded from the sky of this wild pocket world.

However, it was destined to be unable to prevent what was to come.

Li Fan's finger gently descended.

Above the sky of the wild pocket world, a finger also appeared in synchronization.

With a slight exertion of pressure.

Li Fan felt a slight resistance.

The golden Primal Force Essence surged and roared.

The resistance was like paper, instantly broken through.

The finger projection in the sky, like a connecting dark cloud, obscured the entire pocket world.

There was no earth-shattering explosion.

Only the light crack of glass being crushed.

The wild pocket world instantly turned to ash and dissipated!

A violent hurricane spread through the void in the wake of the world's destruction.

But no matter how fiercely it blew, Li Fan remained standing within it.

Protected by golden light, the storm could not harm him in the slightest.

He narrowed his eyes, looking at his finger.

He was still immersed in the power of that world-ending finger strike.

The heavy consumption of Primal Force Essence had caused him to "fall" from the "high place" and return to a normal perspective. But to erase a pocket world so effortlessly gave Li Fan an illusion of being an supreme deity.

Li Fan closed his eyes and it took him a long time to dispel this sense of displacement.

"The reason True Immortals destroyed the Xuanhuang Realm with a glance in the past is fundamentally no different from what I am doing now. It's just that They stand higher and can wield stronger power..."

"Given enough time, I will also be able to achieve it."

Li Fan lightly touched the tip of his right index finger, as if dusting off an imperceptible speck of dust.

"This move, from top to bottom, like a True Immortal's descending finger..."

"Let's call it the {Heavenly Descent Finger}!"

"It signifies both a True Immortal descending to the mortal world and the power of a True Immortal subjugating the mortal world."

"Not bad!"

Li Fan was quite satisfied with his naming.

Sensing divine senses investigating due to the inexplicable destruction of this pocket world, Li Fan transformed into a sword shadow and left directly.

The pocket world was too small; its disappearance would not affect the overall stability of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Returning to the Great Xuan, Li Fan mulled over the feeling of using the {Heavenly Descent Finger} and contemplated how to unleash this divine ability more easily in the future.

The {Heavenly Descent Finger}, despite its world-ending power, had obvious shortcomings.

The time required to unleash it was too long. Merely ascending to a certain altitude required Li Fan to build up his power for a considerable period.

He then had to gather Primal Force Essence to move freely at that specific altitude...

If the target was a world, it would be fine. After all, a world wouldn't have legs, and its position wouldn't change.

But if the target was a cultivator, he might not be given such a long preparation time.

"One way is to set up an ambush with formations, trapping the target. This would buy me enough time."

"And the other..."

Li Fan's current cultivation realm was the highest in the [[Dao of Formations]].

Now that he had comprehended a near-Immortal divine ability but couldn't unleash it freely, he naturally sought a breakthrough through formations.

"All Great Daos stem from the same origin. Divine abilities can surely be transformed into formations, and formations can surely be transformed into divine abilities..."

Since ascending to the peak, Li Fan felt his thoughts were more active than ever before.

The high-level perspective allowed him to contemplate the problems he encountered from an angle beyond the mundane.

"Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, deduce!"

Temporarily suspending all other tasks, Li Fan poured all his experiences from encountering the The Great Barrier at its base and the sensations of casting the {Heavenly Descent Finger} into it.

Because the requirement to directly transform this divine ability into a formation clearly exceeded the scope that the Dissolution Disc could handle, the Dissolution Disc's simulated personality directly showed signs of freezing.

Li Fan observed this, pondered for a moment.

Then he changed his strategy.

He did not aim to directly transform the {Heavenly Descent Finger} into a corresponding formation. Instead, he transformed the steps of unleashing the divine ability into a series of tiered formations.

Just as several ancient Immortal Formations eventually formed the Floating Sky Grand Formation of the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan planned to use a series of interlocking formations to achieve the rapid execution of the {Heavenly Descent Finger}.

"The first step, naturally, is to [Ascend Height]."

Having personally climbed several times, Li Fan had a preliminary understanding of this process.

The so-called ascending height was essentially energizing it, causing its "momentum" in this star sea to rise.

"To find a way to achieve this, perhaps it would be necessary to collect enough True Immortal Script power, as planned by the Sky-Piercing Shuttle, and then use the The Great Barrier to concentrate the explosive power."

"But on one hand, I am not aiming to topple the The Great Barrier with a single finger right now, so the energy required for ignition is not as terrifying as imagined."

"On the other hand..."

Li Fan's mind flashed again to the peaks gathered in the depths of the Abyssal Sea.

"Perhaps I can learn from the {Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation}," Li Fan mused silently.

"The {Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation} is able to easily create energy peaks rarely seen in the Abyssal Star Sea because it is built upon the remains of True Immortals."

"If True Immortal remains are also used as formation materials..."

Li Fan's train of thought suddenly opened up.

A red light flashed in his hand.

It was constantly wriggling, emitting an ominous and strange aura.

It was the remaining True Immortal flesh and blood from the Heavenly Bone Hand of Kuang Qian that had been stimulated by ancient characters within Ou Shang Tian's body.

"There is no Immortal Spiritual Qi, but it is, after all, affiliated with True Immortals, so it should be of some help, right?"

Li Fan muttered to himself and began the first experiment using this mass of True Immortal flesh and blood as raw material.

With the {Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation} as a template, the deduction process of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc proceeded smoothly.

Before long, a formation prototype was born.

Li Fan used Primal Force Essence to construct the formation, mixing in the wriggling True Immortal flesh and blood.

After a long time, when everything was ready, Li Fan squinted and studied the formation, then activated it.

There was a moment of silence.

Then an extremely dazzling pillar of light was born within the formation.

Fueled by the True Immortal flesh and blood, the light was blindingly brilliant.

What made Li Fan even more delighted was that from his perspective, this pillar of light was not just bright.

It was slowly ascending, continuously rising, and soaring above all beings!

"So smooth?"

The moment this thought appeared in his mind, the pillar of light, which seemed capable of illuminating the entire sky, suddenly extinguished.

Li Fan was stunned at first.

After a thorough inspection, he finally understood. It wasn't that something was wrong with the formation.

It was simply that the True Immortal flesh and blood used as fuel had been depleted.

Li Fan frowned slightly. "The utilization rate is still a bit low."

"I can still find ways to improve it."

"Also, it's not just the Heavenly Bone Hand."

"There should be other True Immortal remains in the Xuanhuang Realm. Perhaps I can collect them all..."

The purpose of the ascending formation was not just to quickly unleash the {Heavenly Descent Finger}.

It could elevate one's position, perhaps playing an indispensable role in crossing the The Great Barrier in the future, or even in achieving True Immortality.

Li Fan attached great importance to this.

He put aside all other external matters for the time being, concentrating all his mental energy on research.

Under the deduction of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc and Li Fan's personal guidance and modifications, the Ascending Formation underwent over a thousand iterations in just seven days.

Finally, the efficiency of utilizing True Immortal flesh and blood reached a level that Li Fan could barely be satisfied with.

Chapter 1330: Immortals Fall, All Things Annihilated

Li Fan commenced another round of experiments. This time, after the fist-sized True Immortal flesh and blood was incinerated, the height achieved was sufficient to activate the "Nine Heavens Descending Dust Finger," easily crushing a small world the size of Great Xuan.

"To achieve the effect of 'one finger extinguishing Azure Nether,' it will at least require burning an amount of True Immortal flesh and blood nearly the size of a person…" Li Fan mused silently.

"Compared to the utilization efficiency of True Immortals, there is still a significant gap. But this is the limit of what I can do at present. Perhaps as my strength grows, I will find more suitable methods for improvement."

With the first and most crucial step resolved, the subsequent derivation work proceeded smoothly. The Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, utilizing eight interconnected formations, successfully replicated the Nine Heavens Descending Dust Finger divine ability. With the Dissolution Disc's assistance and all materials in place, Li Fan could complete the formation setup in an instant, making it a instantaneous divine ability.

"It's a pity that it's ultimately comprised of a composite of formations, not as natural as one's own divine abilities. If facing an opponent skilled in formations, they might exploit the flaws between the interconnected formations and easily shatter this divine ability."

"Within this Abyssal Sea, there should be no one whose formation skills surpass mine. But beyond the High Wall, it's hard to say…"

"Regardless, the immediate priority is to collect enough True Immortal flesh and blood for research. And also to guard against them developing self-awareness by gathering in large numbers."

Li Fan stood in the void above the small world of Great Xuan, gazing into the distance beyond the world. Reflecting on his recent encounters, he gained a deeper understanding of the birth of the super Xuanhuang Realm in this life.

"If the Path to Immortality is a process of one person climbing upwards."

"Then my plan is to propel the entire Xuanhuang Realm to ascend to that destination."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, his thoughts surging: "Currently, a single person achieving immortality is already an impossibility, let alone propelling a world to ascend."

"In fact, without the ball of Immortal Spiritual Power left by Mr. Bai, I wouldn't even consider this. It was by witnessing firsthand the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm after it was tainted by Immortal Spiritual Power in the previous life that I gained some confidence."

"Propelling the world's ascension might also be what the Heavenly Physician has been planning all along. It's just that the world he wanted to elevate was not the Azure Nether; it was the Heavenly Law Realm. However, this life is destined to be intercepted by me!"

Li Fan felt no guilt whatsoever: "With the Ascending Array, I might be able to utilize that ball of Immortal Spiritual Power more efficiently. But whether to mix the burning of True Immortal flesh and blood into the world's ascension process…"

Li Fan pondered for a moment and finally decided to find a small world for an experiment. Although theoretically, after the True Immortal flesh and blood was consumed by the formations, nothing would remain, Li Fan still had an inexplicable feeling that there were subtle changes within that he couldn't discern.

The small world chosen for this experiment was even smaller than the previous barren small world that was crushed with a single finger. It had very little vegetation, a complete life desert.

After casting the Nine Heavens Descending Dust Finger and severing its connection with the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan dragged it through the void opened by the Void-Cracking Whale. He traveled at great speed until he was completely far from the Xuanhuang Realm, ensuring that even if any disaster occurred, it would not affect it, only then did Li Fan finally stop.

"Legend has it that Immortals can pluck stars and capture the moon. My methods are not inferior."

Using formations in place of divine abilities felt effortless, even somewhat elegant. However, the rapid consumption of True Immortal flesh and blood still caused Li Fan a pang of heartache.

"After this experiment, the inventory will be completely depleted. I'll need to accumulate more for a while."

In the void, Li Fan looked at the small world below and began to deploy the Ascending Array throughout the world.

"In addition, let's see the effect of the word 'Creation'."

Due to his vigilance against possible Dao-claiming True Immortals, Li Fan had never attempted to comprehend the supreme principles contained within the character for "Creation" even after knowing about it. He merely used it as a tool. For this experiment, Li Fan deliberately misinterpreted it, using the character for "Creation" not in its fully comprehended form.

With all preparations complete, the Ascending Array instantly activated. In countless corners of the world, towering peaks rose, like celestial pillars supporting the world from below. As the "height" increased, all sorts of wondrous changes began to occur in this life desert. Vegetation and trees, as if having undergone millions of years of evolution in an instant, transformed from a thin layer covering the ground to towering, continuous primeval forests. The monotonous surface of the world also began to differentiate and evolve, with mountains, valleys, and magnificent natural landscapes appearing one after another.

"This kind of change did not occur in cultivators like us."

"Until reaching the highest point, a cultivator's body would not change due to increased height. But for a 'world,' it's different."

"It's not a linear increase, but there are indeed constant feedback." Watching the wondrous scenes unfolding in the world below, Li Fan felt waves of enlightenment surging within him.

The world's ascension continued as the True Immortal flesh and blood burned. It was evident that the higher it went, the greater the energy required. The scene of the world's evolution gradually began to stagnate.

"It has reached its limit." Li Fan knew this, and he did not expect the True Immortal flesh and blood provided this time to push the small world to any significant height. He stared intently below, observing the changes after the "ascension" was completed.

The True Immortal flesh and blood was completely consumed. The small world, which had been roaring, suddenly fell into an eerie silence. It was as if a pause button had been pressed. The wind, clouds, air, and even all life within the world were inexplicably frozen, completely still.

"Hmm?" Li Fan seemed to sense something and his expression slightly changed. The Wooden Sword phantom unsheathed, carrying him as he rapidly retreated, fleeing the void range occupied by the small world.

Shortly after Li Fan departed, a terrifying calamity descended upon that small world. Cracks began to erupt throughout the world. Initially, there were only a few, spanning heaven and earth. Then, the cracks continuously spread, quickly covering every corner of the world. Like a sudden fall from a great height, the higher it had previously ascended, the more catastrophic the fall became!

The small world, temporarily elevated by the power of the formations, finally returned to its original position. Instantly, it shattered into countless pieces! Unlike the silent annihilation when crushed directly by the Nine Heavens Descending Dust Finger, the small world falling from a great height collided violently with the void where the Azure Nether was located. It was like a giant rock plummeting into a pond. Invisible ripples spread outwards from the point of the small world's destruction. Like a howling gale, though Li Fan's figure remained motionless, his clothes fluttered in the wind.

Li Fan looked back at the Xuanhuang Realm. Although the Xuanhuang Realm itself would not be harmed by this accidental fall, this gust of wind did cause the Xuanhuang Realm to tremble slightly.

"It seems it will attract the attention of flies again." Sensing the aura of the Myriad Immortals Alliance approaching, Li Fan did not immediately flee. He had not forgotten the primary purpose of this experiment. Li Fan's divine sense probed the location of the world's fall. It seemed no remnants were left. Everything within the small world had turned to ash in this fall. However, the black gas formed by the decomposition of True Immortal flesh and blood after being subjected to the White Circle Falling Mortal Technique did not vanish with the disappearance of the world. It still floated quietly in the void.

"What exactly is this black gas?"

"Using True Immortal flesh and blood as fuel indeed causes it to be hidden within the world."

Having obtained the desired results, Li Fan waved his hand, and a golden net enveloped the black gas, whisking him away from the location.

Not long after Li Fan departed, a figure arrived late. If Li Fan were still there, he would have recognized this person as the leader of the Dharma-Preachers, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang. Doctrine Transmitter Jiang remained stationed in the Ruined Welcome Realm and rarely ventured out. He only appeared when the Xuanhuang Realm faced world-ending calamities that ordinary Dharma-Preachers could not resolve. This time, a minor disturbance caused by a world's fall inexplicably drew him out.

Doctrine Transmitter Jiang arrived at the origin of the disturbance, looking at the void where all traces had vanished, lost in thought. He scanned his surroundings but found no clues, frowning slightly. After searching for a long time with no success, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang was about to leave when his eyes suddenly sharpened, and he looked back at the spot where the world had fallen. The black gas, which Li Fan had thought he had collected entirely, had inexplicably reappeared.

Upon seeing this black gas, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang's expression drastically changed. It was as if he had seen it before and was very familiar with it. Without the slightest hesitation, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang opened his mouth wide and directly swallowed the black gas, along with the entire space around the impact point. After consuming the black gas, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang's complexion visibly withered. Dark patterns emerged from his body, like a surging tide of ink, threatening to engulf him. Faced with such a terrifying scene, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang's eyes remained remarkably calm. A ripple appeared from his chest. Under the ripple, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang's body began to shake like the surface of a disturbed, calm lake. Amidst rhythmic tremors, Doctrine Transmitter Jiang, along with the black gas and space he had swallowed, slowly faded. Eventually, they vanished. Black gas no longer emerged from that impact point, as if nothing had happened from the beginning.

…

Li Fan, of course, had no idea that the "flies" of the Myriad Immortals Alliance he perceived had unknowingly resolved a significant problem for him. Had Doctrine Transmitter Jiang not timely cleared the black gas, Li Fan might have realized later that the black gas had silently encroached upon the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan's plan for Dao Integration in this life might have ended in failure.

At this moment, Li Fan was contemplating the reasons for the recent experiment's failure. "The ascension of a world is fundamentally different from the ascension of a cultivator."

"It is reflected not only in the process but also in the outcome. When a cultivator returns to a normal state from a 'high place,' they might feel slight discomfort at most. It would not be as catastrophic as a world's fall."

"Perhaps it is due to the world absorbing a large amount of energy during the ascension process." Recalling the scenes he witnessed within that small world during its sublimation, Li Fan mused to himself.

With the initial experimental results verified, a problem now lay before Li Fan. After propelling the Xuanhuang Realm upwards for ascension, and for the Xuanhuang Realm to evolve Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls for Li Fan to absorb, it was necessary to find a way to anchor the "height" of the super Xuanhuang Realm during this period. Otherwise, Li Fan might end up shattering into pieces along with the Xuanhuang Realm and returning to his original state prematurely, before even achieving Dao Integration.

"Ascending upwards only stabilizes upon reaching a certain point. This point should be the boundary between immortals and mortals."

"I wonder if my arrangements in this life are sufficient? If not, what methods could be used to temporarily anchor the Xuanhuang Realm?"

The ascension of the Xuanhuang Realm to immortality was by no means easy. He initially thought that by simply following the plan, he could achieve his goal. However, the difference between immortals and mortals was like a chasm. As the plan slowly progressed, various problems began to emerge. Fortunately, Li Fan had sufficient resources to face and resolve them one by one, so he felt no anxiety.

While Li Fan was contemplating, the Xuanhuang Realm experienced a brief period of calm. It was as if it had returned to its original historical trajectory. But this rare tranquility was quickly broken. The cause was someone crossing the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation and returning from beneath the High Wall. Sensing the anomaly, Li Fan temporarily set aside his thoughts. The returning person was Bai Hua. She appeared somewhat disheveled; her once clear, glazed body now bore scratches. Light and shadow flickered unstably, as if about to extinguish at any moment.

"Sage Master…" Seeing Li Fan appear before her, Bai Hua breathed a sigh of relief.

"What happened? After I returned, I couldn't find any trace of you few. The Great Wall of Broken Realms was in turmoil, and the accumulated residual power of True Immortals poured down…" Li Fan asked with a solemn expression. While inquiring, he did not forget to infuse a stream of primal force essence to heal Bai Hua's injuries. The effect of the primal force essence was immediate. Energized by its nourishment, Bai Hua instantly regained her spirit. She first cupped her hands in gratitude before angrily stating, "That Senior Yin, for some unknown reason, went berserk. Disregarding our pleas, he rushed directly towards a certain location of the Great Wall of Broken Realms."

"It's one thing for him to risk his life, but not long after, anomalies instantly erupted. We were caught off guard and affected by the residual power of True Immortals, scattering us." Bai Hua suppressed her anger, saying, "I was lucky, I directly crashed into the Great Wall of Broken Realms. Although I suffered minor injuries, I ultimately saved my life."

"Fellow Artisan Qiao, I'm afraid he wasn't as fortunate." Bai Hua's complexion was grim. "I saw with my own eyes that he drifted towards the High Wall. Judging by my observations, his chances of survival are slim…"

Li Fan pondered after listening to Bai Hua's account. "What about Xu Ke?" Li Fan asked again. Xu Ke had always been blessed with extraordinary luck and should have been able to escape danger.
