"The situation was too chaotic then; I didn't see him. However, on my way back, I saw the communication mark he left."

Chapter 1331: The Abyssal Sea Depression

"The mark must have been left by Xu Kexin, but I searched around it and couldn't find any trace of him. The residual True Immortal energy grew increasingly violent, and I simply couldn't endure it. Under duress, I had no choice but to return through the teleportation formation," Bai Hua said, still somewhat shaken.

The principle behind the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation was actually different from ordinary teleportation formations, but the effect was the same. Bai Hua habitually referred to it as a teleportation formation, and Li Fan did not correct her.

He began to follow the traces he had previously left on the others, sensing their current locations and conditions.

Xu Ke and Qiao Gong were indeed still alive.

However, Qiao Gong's situation was even better than Xu Ke's. Xu Ke's aura flickered intermittently, clearly indicating he was surviving with great difficulty amidst the aftershocks of the residual True Immortal energy. Yet, Qiao Gong's side was surprisingly stable, seemingly unaffected by the turbulent stellar energy.

As for Senior Yin...

The mark he had left on Senior Yin had completely vanished.

"As expected, something is strange. Not to mention that with his current strength, he wouldn't be able to detect my methods. Even if he had some inkling, given my previous performance, he should have treated it as my care and not actively removed it."

The fringes of the star sea, the remnant world's great wall, and the The Great Barriers were all unfamiliar territories to Li Fan.

It was Li Fan's intention to let these individuals, who had survived the ancient Great Tribulation, scout the way. The sudden eruption of the reverberating stellar energy had merely accelerated this process.

Li Fan decided to temporarily set them aside. He would question them in detail when they returned.

He was well aware of their temperaments. No major chaos would occur.

"Don't worry, they are all unharmed and have each encountered their own fortuitous encounters."

Upon hearing Li Fan's words, Bai Hua's expression became somewhat subtle.

Ignoring Bai Hua's thoughts, Li Fan handed over another ball of primal force essence. "Do not go to the teleportation formation for now. Wait until the storm has subsided."

"However, under the influence of the residual True Immortal energy, the teleportation formation requires maintenance at regular intervals. Otherwise, once it is damaged, we will have to make another trip, increasing the variables. This matter will be entrusted to you."

Along with the primal force essence, Li Fan also provided extensive information related to maintaining the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation.

Bai Hua nodded in understanding and soon became engrossed in the profound knowledge of formations. Although it only covered the basic structural units of the grand formation and did not involve its core parts, it still captivated Bai Hua.

After arranging matters for Bai Hua, Li Fan gazed towards the Abyssal Sea.

"The impact of the reverberating stellar energy will reach the vicinity of the Xuanhuang Realm in about another half a month. Just like in my previous life, the entire world will be engulfed in violent tremors."

"It would be a true pity to waste this magnificent power."

Having witnessed the spectacle of the Abyssal Sea from a higher dimensional perspective and personally seen pocket worlds ascend and descend, shattering into pieces, Li Fan gained a new understanding of the residual True Immortal energy accumulated beneath the The Great Barriers and blocked by the remnant world's great wall.

"The True Immortal energy emitted by the True Immortal's enlightenment of the 'Starvation' script in the Immortal Ruins, as it expanded outwards, encountered the obstruction of the The Great Barriers. Over time, it continuously gathered at the foot of the The Great Barriers. The accumulation of the 'momentum' of the True Immortal energy formed a relatively higher ground."

"Because it was merely a simple accumulation of power, it could not remain stable."

"On one hand, it would fall to lower ground. On the other hand..."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed, as if he were again witnessing the magnificent scene beneath the The Great Barriers.

"Normally, this True Immortal power should have slowly returned to the Abyssal Sea. However, for unknown reasons, a continuous remnant world's great wall formed at the foot of the The Great Barriers, firmly blocking this True Immortal power."

"This created a peculiar state of stability. Now, this stability has been broken."

"The True Immortal power is pouring down, like a surging flood, slowly flowing into the low-lying Abyssal Sea, raising the overall level of the star sea..."

A flash of enlightenment crossed Li Fan's mind.

The rapid recovery of the star sea in his previous life was likely driven by this event.

"What I need to do now is to find a way to intercept and temporarily preserve this flood of energy."

"To be used when the Xuanhuang Realm eventually ascends."

This was undoubtedly a massive undertaking.

Within a mere half a month, achieving perfection was impossible. Li Fan could only do his best.

The location of the Xuanhuang Realm was quite special.

Outside the Immortal Ruins, due to the presence of the True Immortal who attained enlightenment within the Immortal Ruins, the Xuanhuang Realm was undoubtedly located near the highest peak in the overall distribution map of the Abyssal Sea.

In fact, due to its proximity, it was already slightly at a higher elevation.

Like the elevated soil slopes around a towering mountain.

"Therefore, as if there were an invisible barrier, the Xuanhuang Realm would naturally face much less impact."

"What I need to do is to create depressions and then guide and accumulate the True Immortal energy over a vast range."

Li Fan nodded slightly.

He had personally experienced the journey of ascension. To ascend and approach immortality, one only needed to continuously stimulate energy and elevate oneself.

However, regarding how to create depressions...

Li Fan was currently completely unaware.

But when he observed from the heights of the remnant world's great wall and the controlling core of the Abyssal Sea, he had indeed seen lower lying areas within the star sea compared to ordinary regions.

"I'll go and see first."

Li Fan acted decisively. He first went to Oushang Tian and generated some more True Immortal flesh and blood.

Looking at Oushang Tian, whose face had already become as thin as gold leaf, Li Fan frowned slightly.

"It seems that finding True Immortal remains is now an urgent matter."

Li Fan suppressed the thought for the moment. Primal force essence transformed into protective golden armor. The illusory wooden sword was unsheathed, and in an instant, he left the Xuanhuang Realm, soaring through the Abyssal Sea.

While rapidly flying towards the target area in his memory, he also contemplated the changes in the difference between high and low ground.

As the illusory wooden sword departed from a certain star sea region, Li Fan seemed to sense something.

He returned and halted in the void, observing carefully.

"This is indeed a natural depression."

"However, if I hadn't witnessed the distinction between high and low ground and observed from an ascending perspective, I probably wouldn't have noticed its peculiarity."

"It looks no different from other regions in the star sea."

Li Fan frowned. Divine senses flew out, separating to explore various parts of the area.

The result was the same as his sensing.

This depression, due to its lower momentum, seemed to show no difference from normal areas.

After half a day of standing there, still at a loss, Li Fan suddenly realized something.

He controlled his physical and Spirit Qi, flicked his finger, and unleashed a sword Qi.

It was merely a simulated strike from a cultivator in the Soul Transformation realm. The sword Qi whistled past, and the space it traversed was torn open by a rift.

Although the rift was fleeting and quickly sealed, Li Fan still noticed it.

"So that's how it is."

"This depression has become fragile," Li Fan realized with sudden clarity.

It wasn't just the space itself.

All the conditions maintaining this space had significantly weakened compared to normal star sea regions.

"The Xuanhuang Realm's relation to this place is akin to the Immortal Realm's relation to the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Perhaps this is an exaggeration, but it effectively illustrates the difference between these three."

"A Dao Integration cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm, within this area, would likely be like a True Immortal, capable of destroying worlds with a single glance."

Li Fan felt the fragility of this depression.

"The difference in momentum, compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, isn't that significant. Yet, the manifested phenomena are so pronounced." Li Fan pondered silently.

"If it were even lower, at the absolute limit, what would happen?"

A question spontaneously arose in Li Fan's mind.

Li Fan's thoughts drifted.

However, this was already the lowest point in the Abyssal Sea.

With the date of the reverberating stellar energy's impact drawing closer, Li Fan brought his thoughts back to the present.

"With my current understanding, I still can't figure out the specific reasons for the formation of these depressions."

"But that doesn't prevent me from utilizing them."

When Li Fan served as an official in Great Xuan, he had personally conducted field surveys, designed blueprints, and undertaken water conservancy projects to benefit the populace.

In his eyes now, the project of inducing True Immortal energy to converge in these depressions was fundamentally no different from water conservancy construction.

"This depression is a natural reservoir."

"What I need to do is to guide the True Immortal energy here!"

"The first thing to do is to prevent this depression from absorbing the True Immortal energy that is guided here. Otherwise, it will only lead to the depression rising and disappearing..."

"Primal force essence is immiscible with True Immortal power and serves as an excellent material."

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Then, an unending stream of primal force essence, like a long bolt of cloth, erupted from him. It was merely a thin layer for insulation.

Under Li Fan's direction, it quickly covered the entire depression.

Golden light radiated, and the primal force essence dissipated into the darkness, seemingly no different from before.

But Li Fan knew that a qualitative change had occurred compared to before.

"Next, I need to expand the inlets of this depression as much as possible."

"And simultaneously reinforce the insulating layer at the bottom of the depression."

"The primal force essence is already running out, so I can only temporarily trouble the Netherfolk."

With a movement of Li Fan's divine sense, the Netherfolk imprisoned in the Great Xuan pocket world all sensed something.

They awoke from their slumber and immediately kowtowed, praying fervently without eating or drinking.

The primal force essence gradually replenished. Li Fan, from an ascending perspective, observed the area again.

The irregular boundary was not large.

If it were to continue at its current scale, the amount of True Immortal residual energy that could be gathered when it swept through would be extremely limited.

"How should I guide it?"

After some thought, Li Fan had an idea.

The illusory wooden sword flickered repeatedly.

In the following days, Li Fan laid down numerous Ascension Formations in the vast star field surrounding the depression.

As the True Immortal flesh and blood was consumed too quickly, Li Fan had no choice but to return to the Xuanhuang Realm again.

Oushang Tian was already on his last breath, and even the Heavenly Bone Hand had developed fine cracks. It was evident that he could no longer generate True Immortal flesh and blood in the short term.

Fortunately, he had managed to gather enough materials.

The formations were deployed as planned.

Li Fan sensed the approaching reverberating stellar energy and waited silently.

"Currently, I haven't found a method to anchor the ascended state."

"But I can create temporary peaks and alter the flow of True Immortal energy through a burst of power."

"Through my precise calculations, the True Immortal energy in this vast surrounding star field will all be guided here."

*Buzz...*

As Li Fan had anticipated, the reverberating stellar energy, like a surging tide and a terrifying storm, arrived as scheduled.

With a resolute gaze, Li Fan activated the Ascension Formations one by one.

In the Abyssal Sea, in the star field not far from the Xuanhuang Realm, a wondrous spectacle unfolded.

Imperceptible to ordinary individuals.

Only peerless powerhouses observing from their ascended peaks might glimpse it from above.

Numerous low peaks suddenly rose.

They blocked the surging tide of True Immortal energy.

Although these peaks quickly fell not long after rising, they had nevertheless truly collided with the tide of True Immortal energy.

The low peaks rumbled and fell.

And the tide of True Immortal energy, after repeated impacts, altered its flow.

It surged towards the depression delineated by Li Fan.

*Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh...*

Initially, it was merely gusts of wind.

But as more of the guided tide of True Immortal energy arrived, the True Immortal energy here became even more powerful than at the initial eruption point beneath the The Great Barriers.

Li Fan was forced to take refuge within the illusory wooden sword, using the profound mystery of the "True-False Transformation" to evade the influence of the True Immortal energy.

He watched as the depression was gradually filled.

Even with Li Fan's temperament, a sense of pride arose within him.

"What True Immortals can do, I can now do!"

"Even if it's troublesome, as long as the specific method is mastered, it can be replicated countless times in the future!"

Just like the situation beneath the The Great Barriers, blocked by the remnant world's great wall.

A large amount of True Immortal energy accumulated in the depression.

Due to the insulation of the primal force essence and the natural peculiarity of the location, it did not cause the "momentum" of the space itself to rise. Instead, it continuously accumulated power.

It was like another Immortal Ruin, slowly appearing before Li Fan's eyes.

The illusory wooden sword flickered erratically.

The gravitational pull grew stronger and stronger, as if he were directly facing a True Immortal in the Immortal Ruins.

Li Fan frowned and urged the illusory sword to leave the area of the depression.

The moment he exited the depression, Li Fan felt the immense suction force gathered within instantly decrease by more than half.

It was as if they were no longer in the same world.

The convergence of the True Immortal energy tide continued.

Finally, when the depression was completely filled, the overflowing tide began to sweep towards other regions of the star sea.

However, with such a large reservoir, the power of this storm had been significantly reduced.

Especially since this reservoir was positioned before the Xuanhuang Realm, causing the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm to barely feel any turbulence.

In this lifetime, the members of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who had also received warning messages from the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, exchanged glances.

"The tremors that the Heavenly Venerate mentioned haven't arrived yet, have they?"

"This is definitely just the prelude; the main event is still to come!"

Chapter 1332: Again, the Poisonous Influence on Mo Rubing

For a long time, the Dharma-Preachers of the Myriad Immortals Alliance waited, but they never received news of greater upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Had the Heavenly Venerate's prediction been wrong?

No matter how unbelievable, the Dharma-Preachers eventually had to accept this fact. However, out of reverence for the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, none dared to discuss it openly, let alone send a message to inquire. They could only attribute the reason to the Heavenly Venerate's concern for all beings in the Xuanhuang Realm, feeling compelled to send a message even for the slightest disturbance. After all, disturbances had indeed occurred.

Unbeknownst to the beings of the Xuanhuang Realm, immense True Immortal power had been silently accumulating beyond the void.

Li Fan stood before the filled-in hollow, sensing a faint pull. He nodded with satisfaction. The harvest this time was even greater than anticipated. The natural hollow had served as a near-perfect container for True Immortal power. Coupled with the formations Li Fan had laid at the edges to conceal it, the anomaly here was perfectly hidden. Li Fan was confident that even the Dharma-Preachers, if merely flying past without diligent investigation, would never discover the abnormality.

"With the current accumulation, the plan for a super Xuanhuang Realm is even more assured."

The power drawn by the Immortal Ruins' True Immortal who comprehended the "Starvation" character technique was naturally different from pure Immortal Spiritual Power and could not be directly absorbed by the Xuanhuang Realm. However, Li Fan could use the Ascending Array to transfer it, transforming this immense power into the driving force for the Xuanhuang Realm's ascent. This would significantly reduce the consumption of True Immortal flesh and blood. Otherwise, with only the output from the Heavenly Bone Hands, even if he squeezed Oushang Tian dry, he would never be able to construct enough Ascending Arrays.

"Like a lake suspended in the sky, a ruin of the Immortal Realm." After gazing for a long time, Li Fan finally shifted his gaze from the hollow. For now, he would conceal this place with formations.

"Next, I need to find a way to anchor the world's height."

"Otherwise, I'll have to take a risky approach and force out the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls before the immortals fall in the Xuanhuang Realm. Everything can happen in an instant. I might fail..."

"The output of True Immortal flesh and blood, as well as the Essence of Primal Force, must also be synchronized and increased."

To act as a True Immortal with a mortal body naturally brought many limitations. Although Li Fan's experience from countless reincarnations allowed him to find various strange substitute powers, they were still not Immortal Spiritual Power itself. As he drew closer to his goal, everything became increasingly troublesome. Li Fan currently had no idea how to temporarily anchor the world in a high position.

As for the True Immortal who comprehended in the Immortal Ruins, he was irrelevant. From an elevated perspective, the peaks in the entire Abyssal Star Sea, apart from the Remnant Great Wall under the The Great Barrier, were largely concentrated in the depths of the Xuanhuang Realm's dark sea. Naturally, there were also some naturally formed mountains in the star sea, which, like the hollow before him, were beyond Li Fan's current ability to study and comprehend.

"Next, I will pursue both avenues simultaneously."

"At the foot of the The Great Barrier and in the dark sea, I will conduct parallel analysis."

"The Great Barrier side can perhaps be entrusted to the Mystic Immortal Boat. If they can study the True Immortal Sigils and utilize it, the elders on those immortal boats certainly have the capability. As for the dark sea side..."

The face of Mo Rubing, the Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, immediately appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"Coincidentally, through my recent exchange with the Immortal Boat, I have mastered the 'Manifest' character. Perhaps it's time to awaken Mo Rubing."

One of the effects of the "Manifest" character was to reveal the connections between all things. Mo Rubing's cultivation techniques all originated from the Azure Nether Orb's inheritance. If possible, perhaps by activating the "Manifest" character, he could follow the trail and find the whereabouts of the Azure Nether Orb, or even the Heavenly Mysteries King.

"Mo Rubing, this person cultivates the 'Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique.' He has multiple personalities and can change them almost at will. Furthermore, he is meticulous and cunning."

"However, the Heavenly Mysteries King is his fatal flaw..."

Li Fan's figure flickered, and in an instant, he returned to the Xuanhuang Realm and appeared beneath the Preaching Platform. The giant net woven from the Essence of Primal Force was sealing the slumbering Mo Rubing and Ji Yuzhen's primordial souls. Li Fan did not awaken Ji Yuzhen, the female Law King. Although he had absorbed most of her memories and undoubtedly understood her better, this female Law King gave Li Fan a feeling of being even more dangerous than Mo Rubing. In comparison, Mo Rubing, with whom he had interacted for several lifetimes, was easier to handle.

With a flick of his finger, the phantom of a wooden sword unsheathed. Li Fan took Mo Rubing with him into the void outside the Xuanhuang Realm. Then, he slowly withdrew the sealing golden net. Exposed to the cold, silent Abyssal Star Sea, Mo Rubing instinctively sensed danger and slowly awakened. Almost as soon as he was awake, Mo Rubing noticed Li Fan standing not far away.

"Hmm? I remember before I fell asleep, I should have been..." Mo Rubing was initially dazed, then after a moment's thought, he roughly guessed the culprit behind all this.

"What do you intend to do, fellow Daoist?" Mo Rubing sized up Li Fan, his words filled with vigilance. A mirror-like boundary, hidden within the darkness, silently materialized, locking onto Li Fan. This was a divine ability from the Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique, capable of replacing the person reflected on the other side of the mirror, turning them into a new demonic heart for oneself. As long as one was enveloped by it, regardless of cultivation level, there was no escape. This was the confidence Mo Rubing had gained from the Immortal Realm's inheritance.

However, Mo Rubing soon sensed something was wrong, his expression slightly changing. The mirror had indeed enveloped Li Fan. But there was no trace of Li Fan on the other side of the mirror! It was as if the person before him was merely a phantom that did not exist in the real world! Paradoxically, the unhidden life force emanating from Li Fan undeniably proved his reality!

The "Transformation of True and False" was even above the "Creation" True Immortal Sigils, naturally beyond Mo Rubing's comprehension. At this moment, this Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect only knew that he had encountered a very troublesome enemy. After trying several more times without being able to lock onto Li Fan, he decisively gave up. Silently, he retracted the mirror-like boundary divine ability.

"There's no need to be nervous, fellow Daoist Mo. If I truly harbored ill intentions towards you, why would I have actively awakened you?"

"The Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique is not truly unyielding to all calamities. I have at least three or four methods to break it," Li Fan said with a slight smile. These words struck Mo Rubing like thunder.

The Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique was a cultivation method personally taught to him by the Heavenly Mysteries King in the past, known to very few. Yet, Li Fan had revealed its secrets in a single sentence...

"Who exactly are you, fellow Daoist?" Mo Rubing asked with a solemn expression.

Li Fan did not answer directly. Instead, he asked, "Do you know how long you have been in slumber, fellow Daoist?" Mo Rubing's attention had been fully drawn to Li Fan. Now, with Li Fan's reminder, Mo Rubing calculated with his fingers, and his body trembled.

"Ten thousand years have passed... everything has changed. If you are interested, fellow Daoist, perhaps you could listen to my story from these years." Li Fan said with great sincerity.

Mo Rubing pondered for a moment and nodded. Thus, Li Fan began to recount the story of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect's destruction, the Ten Sects taking its place, the subsequent emergence of disasters, the Xuanhuang Realm's near destruction, the rise of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate, and the division of power between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council.

Mo Rubing's expression continuously shifted.

"These worms from the Ten Sects truly deserve death!" From beginning to end, this was the only sentence Mo Rubing could not help but utter. The rest of the time, he listened intently. With the keen sensitivity of his Demonic Heart Immortal Technique to the emotions of those around him, Mo Rubing was eight-tenths sure that the other party was not lying.

"After all, the people of the Ten Sects inherited the legacy of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect. Moreover, they had the True Transmission of the Grand Master, so they would not be easily destroyed. Some of them had already left the realm before the catastrophe fully erupted," Li Fan said, shaking his head slightly.

"Left?" Mo Rubing's eyes narrowed.

"Not left the Xuanhuang Realm, but crossed the The Great Barrier to the outside of the The Great Barrier!" Li Fan declared with conviction.

Mo Rubing's reaction was unprecedented. "Outside the The Great Barrier? Impossible!"

Li Fan had anticipated Mo Rubing's disbelief. "Fellow Daoist, please look!" With a gentle wave, a sword that pierced the heavens erupted with infinite light, tearing apart heaven and earth, and a scene of it piercing through the void instantly appeared before Mo Rubing.

"This was the scene when the Heavenly Sword Sect created the World-Breaking Divine Sword and left the realm. Although I'm not sure if they succeeded, such power should be more than just escaping the Xuanhuang Realm, shouldn't it?" Li Fan asked.

Mo Rubing stared intently at the constantly repeating scene. "This World-Breaking Divine Weapon is merely an ordinary artifact, how could it cross the The Great Barrier? Simply laughable!" Mo Rubing still did not change his stance.

"The Divine Weapon was forged from Primordial Gold, melted with countless Sword Intent Dao Embryos, and supplemented with countless heavenly materials and earthly treasures..." Li Fan said unhurriedly.

Mo Rubing interrupted him, "Just these? No matter what heavenly materials and earthly treasures, as long as they are products of the Xuanhuang Realm, they cannot have this effect."

"Then, what if pure Immortal Spiritual Energy was also added?" Li Fan asked again in a deep voice.

"!!!" Mo Rubing looked up sharply, staring at Li Fan. "Immortal Spiritual Energy?" His expression and tone were different from before. After a long silence, Mo Rubing said slowly, "If the core of this World-Breaking Divine Weapon truly contained Immortal Spiritual Power, it might indeed be possible to cross the The Great Barrier through it..."

"That's it," Li Fan said with an unreadable tone. Did that World-Breaking Divine Weapon forged by the Heavenly Sword Sect in the past truly contain Immortal Spiritual Power? Li Fan didn't know. However, the forging of the Divine Weapon by the Heavenly Sword Sect was at the instruction of Mr. Bai. Mr. Bai had inherited the legacy of the Great Heavenly Venerate and had even gone to the The Great Barrier and returned. How could he not know that it was impossible to cross the The Great Barrier with mortal materials alone? If he failed, encountering the The Great Barrier head-on would surely result in no survivors. Given Mr. Bai's character, how could he have done something that sent people to their deaths in vain?

Therefore, in his previous life, after learning about the weight of the Great Heavenly Venerate's legacy from Sun Tianci, Li Fan had conceived this suspicion: that Mr. Bai had once shared a portion of the Immortal Spiritual Energy obtained from igniting the Immortal Artifacts with the Heavenly Sword Sect, successfully helping them complete their plan to break through the realm and escape. Compared to the remaining four Immortal Artifacts like the Great Sun Golden Bell, the amount of Immortal Spiritual Energy obtained from igniting the other nine Immortal Artifacts was indeed too little. Rather than being consumed, it was more like a portion was distributed. It was even uncertain if other members of the Heavenly Sword Sect, besides those from the Heavenly Sword Sect, were on that World-Breaking Divine Weapon back then.

Faced with Li Fan's explanation, Mo Rubing remained silent for a long time, then couldn't help but curse, "Damn it, only caring about his own escape, and completely disregarding the lives of the Xuanhuang Realm's beings!" Mo Rubing had the right to curse like this. Back then, the Heavenly Mysteries King, already in the Half-Immortal stage, could have absolutely escaped alone. But it was precisely because he wanted to bring his homeland, the Xuanhuang Realm, with him that the long Floating Sky Star Sea plan and subsequent variable events occurred.

Hearing Mo Rubing's words, Li Fan seized the opportunity to shift the topic to the Heavenly Mysteries King. "The Heavenly Mysteries King had noble character, like the sun perpetually shining, incomparable in this world. Not to mention these rats from the Myriad Immortal Sects, even after ten thousand years, no one has appeared who inherited his will. The Xuanhuang Realm has persisted until now only because the beings within it are trying to save themselves," Li Fan sighed with emotion.

Hearing Li Fan's praise for the Heavenly Mysteries King, Mo Rubing's perception of him gradually began to change, but he did not immediately let down his guard.

"To be honest, I wish to inherit the will of the Heavenly Mysteries King, to save the Xuanhuang Realm from dire straits, and help it cross the The Great Barrier, escaping this Abyssal Star Sea."

"I have poured all my efforts into this for half my life. Looking back as my lifespan nears its end, I find that in the vast Xuanhuang Realm, there is not a single person worthy of trust to accompany me." Li Fan's tone conveyed a hint of desolation. Upon careful observation, Mo Rubing also noticed that Li Fan's lifespan was nearing its end. His pupils contracted sharply.

Li Fan continued, "By chance, I discovered the heroic deeds of the ancient Heavenly Mysteries Sect's heroes, which stirred my heart and made me feel like I had found kindred spirits."

"Furthermore, I searched for traces of your possible survival and finally found you, fellow Daoist, who were in slumber..." Li Fan looked at Mo Rubing and revealed a smile of relief. Mo Rubing felt a surge of indescribable emotions. However, being cautious, he suppressed these emotions and began to consider the credibility of what the other party had said.

"The affairs of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect are over ten thousand years ago, how do you know of them?" Mo Rubing asked.

"In a ring-shaped mountain, amidst countless flowers, I discovered the fragmented primordial soul of Ji Yuzhen," Li Fan said truthfully.

"Although it was only a patchwork of countless memory fragments, it allowed me to glimpse the past events of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect." Mo Rubing's expression was shaken. "Ji Yuzhen? Is she still alive?"

Li Fan shook his head slightly. "Only a few residual souls remain." Mo Rubing was about to say something more, but suddenly stopped. After a moment of silence, he looked directly at Li Fan and said, "When the Heavenly Mysteries Sect suffered a great upheaval back then, brothers died or were injured. We lost contact with each other."

"Furthermore, there might have been traitors among us..."

"To be honest, besides the Heavenly Mysteries King, I trust no one."

Li Fan nodded in understanding. "In fact, one of the reasons I awakened you, fellow Daoist, is also to find the Heavenly Mysteries King."

Chapter 1333

With a sincere expression, Li Fan said, "These past years, I've been searching for the heroes of the former Heavenly Mysteries Sect, probing the heavens and earth, and I've almost turned the entire Xuanhuang Realm upside down. I've been fortunate enough to find some traces of you Dharma Kings, but I've never found any clues related to Heavenly King Xuan. However, I refuse to believe that with Heavenly King Xuan's peerless cultivation back then, he truly perished..."

Mo Rubing listened quietly, his expression unchanged.

"Tens of thousands of years have passed, and the situation in the Xuanhuang Realm has become increasingly perilous. We're only a hair's breadth away from falling into the Immortal Ruins. If it weren't for the arrangements Heavenly King Xuan left behind back then, we probably wouldn't have lasted until now!"

"The arrangements back then?" Mo Rubing narrowed his eyes.

"It's precisely the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation!" Li Fan said with great emotion. "Built upon ancient immortal formations, manifesting near-immortal power through mortal means! It's a pity the formation is already incomplete..."

Li Fan said seriously, "Restarting the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation might be our only hope for salvation. This formation is incredibly profound; even though it was built ten thousand years ago, I can't understand it."

Mo Rubing let out a snort, "Naturally. Immortal realm inheritances, how can mortal cultivators glimpse them!"

Li Fan nodded in agreement, "First, the ten great immortal sects collectively fled. Then came the ten thousand years of strife and tribulations. Many inheritances have been severed. Now, the level of formations, artifacts, elixirs, and talismans in the Xuanhuang Realm, compared to ten thousand years ago, has not only not progressed, but is far inferior!"

"To rebuild and restore the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation, finding Heavenly King Xuan is our only hope! But as I said before, there isn't the slightest clue! My lifespan is drawing to a close, and I can't wait any longer. In my desperation, I had to awaken you, fellow Daoist."

Seeing Mo Rubing's pensive expression, Li Fan continued in a deep voice, "From the residual memories of Ji Yuzhen's soul, I also learned of the existence of traitors within the Heavenly Mysteries Sect back then. Therefore, I made this decision with great resolve. I feared entrusting this task to the wrong person, which could lead to Heavenly King Xuan's misfortune. Thus, I chose to awaken you outside the Xuanhuang Realm, in the void..."

"Back then, when the ten sects besieged the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, where were you, fellow Daoist? In Dharma King Ji's memories, you were inseparable from Heavenly King Xuan!" Li Fan's tone gradually became solemn.

Seeing this later-generation cultivator questioning him, Mo Rubing did not get angry. He frowned slightly, recalling the events of that year, as if he had returned to the day that changed the fate of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"At that time, I was escorting the core cultivators of the ten sects into the depths of our sect."

Mo Rubing's words were astonishing.

Li Fan raised an eyebrow but did not immediately become agitated. He quietly waited for him to continue.

Mo Rubing was somewhat surprised by Li Fan's calmness. He nodded slightly and continued, "At that time, Brother Xuanyuan had already sensed those within the sect with impure intentions, who were colluding with the ten sects to plot against us."

"At that time, Brother Xuanyuan happened to be making a breakthrough, so he planned to play along and lure the snakes out of their holes..."

Mo Rubing paused, took a deep breath, and continued, "Originally, the plan went smoothly. I successfully gained the trust of the ten sects. And I led them all the way to quietly break through the defensive barriers of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect headquarters..."

A hint of regret flashed in Mo Rubing's eyes.

"However, those barriers could only delay them. The real killing blow was Brother Xuanyuan's strength after his breakthrough and the killing formation he personally laid. Actively breaking and dispersing them could reduce their vigilance. It's just that we didn't anticipate..."

"Quick, escape!"

Heavenly King Xuan's final message from that year seemed to echo in his ears. Mo Rubing instinctively clenched his fist.

"I heard Brother Xuanyuan's message telling me to escape quickly and knew that something must have gone wrong. So I accelerated towards the direction where Brother Xuanyuan's aura had disappeared..."

"That was not the agreed-upon ambush site, nor was it where Brother Xuanyuan usually meditated. It was merely the hall where the Faceless Immortal statue was displayed. Brother Xuanyuan had ordered it sealed before. I don't know why he would appear there again."

"When I arrived first, Brother had already completely disappeared. And that statue..." Mo Rubing suddenly fell silent.

Hearing Mo Rubing's account, Li Fan's heart trembled violently. However, he still pretended to be ignorant, "What is the Faceless Immortal statue? Why was it sealed by the Heavenly Mysteries Sect? After the ten great immortal sects unified the Xuanhuang Realm, they erased everything related to the former Heavenly Mysteries Sect. In Dharma King Ji's residual memories, there seems to be no mention of this Faceless Immortal statue."

Mo Rubing looked up and examined Li Fan. After a moment of thought, he finally explained, "The Faceless Immortal was a True Immortal who had saved Brother Xuanyuan's life. When Brother Xuanyuan first arrived in the Immortal Realm, he hadn't condensed his True Immortal body yet, and a calamity descended. If it weren't for the casual rescue by this Faceless True Immortal, he would have likely perished in the Immortal Realm back then."

Li Fan slowly nodded and then couldn't help but ask with confusion, "It seems this Faceless True Immortal was a good person. Why did the Heavenly Mysteries Sect later order the sealing of his statue, appearing to be very wary of him?"

Mo Rubing let out a cold snort, "A good person... He is not just anyone, but a complete True Immortal. The same matter, seen from the perspective of a mortal cultivator and a True Immortal, produces completely different attitudes! Initially, Brother Xuanyuan erected the Faceless Immortal statue, firstly, to express his gratitude for saving his life. Secondly, he wanted to establish contact with this True Immortal whom he had only met briefly."

"If he could obtain the help of this True Immortal senior, saving the Xuanhuang Realm would have certainly been much easier..."

Mo Rubing's expression became increasingly grim as he spoke, "However, Brother Xuanyuan soon realized he was wrong. The attitude of True Immortals towards mortal beings can be described as indifferent."

"The Faceless Immortal could casually save Brother Xuanyuan because Brother Xuanyuan had already ascended the immortal path. Even though he hadn't condensed his True Immortal body yet, he was a true [Half-Immortal]. He was of the same kind."

"As for mortal beings... even the inhabitants of an entire world, even if it were just a small effort, the Faceless Immortal was unwilling and disdained to do it!" Mo Rubing said fiercely and resentfully.

"He even went so far as to persuade and warn Brother Xuanyuan..."

Mo Rubing was filled with indignation. Li Fan also squinted, his breathing quickening, seemingly indignant.

"The difference between Immortals and mortals is like an abyss. But no matter what, aren't Immortals also ascended from mortals? To see death and not save, to be so indifferent!"

Mo Rubing added, "As the saying goes, if our paths differ, we cannot plan together. After their differing opinions, Brother Xuanyuan no longer tried to contact this True Immortal. He sealed the statue and planned to re-sculpt the Heavenly Mysteries statues in various locations."

"However, before he could, the great upheaval had already occurred."

"According to what you've said, fellow Daoist, Heavenly King Xuan might have met misfortune at the hands of the Faceless Immortal?" Li Fan asked, somewhat shocked.

"If a True Immortal personally took action, even with Heavenly King Xuan's peerless talent, he probably couldn't have escaped, right? No wonder I haven't been able to find any trace of him all these years..." Li Fan pretended to suddenly understand, then put on a dejected look.

Mo Rubing frowned and interrupted Li Fan's mutterings, "Although the Faceless Immortal had some differences in ideals with Brother Xuanyuan, there was no reason for him to kill him."

"Moreover, even though True Immortals are powerful, they absolutely could not instantly kill Brother Xuanyuan," Mo Rubing stated with certainty.

"Brother Xuanyuan was already a Half-Immortal who had ascended to the Immortal Realm. Before executing the plan to lure the snakes out of their holes, he told us that after his battle with the Grand Master, he had broken through again. Even if he wasn't a True Immortal in the truest sense back then, he had enough power to cross the The Great Barrier on his own."

Li Fan's heart trembled again, "Then what exactly could have caused the further advanced Heavenly King Xuan to disappear inexplicably?"

While saying this, Li Fan couldn't help but recall, in his previous life, how Cat Treasure inexplicably jumped out at the end, swallowed the True Immortal's illusory form with one gulp, and then took away the True Immortal of the Immortal Ruins in a flash.

The two situations were so similar!

"Could it be that there's some connection?"

"But the change in the Heavenly Mysteries happened ten thousand years ago. Moreover, as I speculated before, the flow of time outside the The Great Barrier might be different. If it was someone from outside the The Great Barrier who made the move, it's likely that for them, it was tens of thousands, even millions of years ago..." Li Fan felt something was amiss.

"However, looking at it this way, the methods used by the powers outside the wall to hunt True Immortals have indeed improved too much. Heavenly King Xuan was not a legitimate True Immortal, and he still remembered to send a warning when he met misfortune. As for the one in the Immortal Ruins, he was already a True Immortal from the Immortal Realm. He had also comprehended the Dao for ten thousand years in the Immortal Ruins, perhaps approaching the realm of the Nameless True Immortal. But the result was even more pathetic." A sense of dread surged in Li Fan's heart.

Faced with Li Fan's questions, Mo Rubing could only remain silent.

If he knew the answer, he wouldn't have been so anxious and felt like he had lost his backbone when he was being hunted by the ten great immortal sects.

"Although I don't know what kind of terrifying existence caused Brother Xuanyuan's disappearance, I am certain that Brother Xuanyuan is still alive in this world," Mo Rubing stated with certainty after a long silence.

"Oh?" Li Fan raised his eyebrows, finding Mo Rubing's confidence difficult to understand.

After carefully deliberating his words, Mo Rubing continued, "When I arrived at the scene where Brother Xuanyuan disappeared back then, the hall displaying the Faceless Immortal statue was damaged."

"And that Faceless Immortal stone statue..."

"It had actually grown a face!"

"The statue had fallen to the ground, its head severed in mid-air, rolling nearby. The face on the solitary stone statue's head was exactly the same as Brother Xuanyuan's!"

Mo Rubing said something that left Li Fan dumbfounded.

Li Fan's mind conjured up the scene from that year.

"This..."

"What else happened?" Li Fan asked, utterly bewildered by the thickening fog of mystery.

Mo Rubing said in a deep voice, "Initially, we all thought the Faceless Immortal had harmed Heavenly King Xuan. But later, during our escape, I felt something was subtly wrong. The reasons are as I mentioned before."

"Later, I took the risk and found a remaining Heavenly Mysteries statue. I attempted to use the method Brother Xuanyuan taught me back then to re-establish contact with this Faceless Immortal..."

Li Fan gasped, "Fellow Daoist, your actions truly disregard life and death!"

Ignoring Li Fan's flattery, Mo Rubing continued, "True Immortals generally do not concern themselves with mortal ants like us. As expected, my first attempt to communicate received no reply."

"But I didn't give up. I persisted, continuously, for a full three years, sending communications every moment..."

Li Fan understood Mo Rubing's meaning instantly.

"Even if they disdain to deal with ants, if an ant keeps pestering them, a True Immortal would surely become enraged and mete out punishment. Based on my understanding of the Faceless Immortal, He certainly had the ability to do so."

"But He didn't."

"It was as if it were just an ordinary stone statue. For three years, there was no response."

"Therefore, I surmised that after that day, not only Heavenly King Xuan himself, but even that Faceless Immortal had suffered a severe blow!"

"The Faceless Immortal statue eerily manifested Brother Xuanyuan's face, and was even decapitated..."

Li Fan interjected, sounding incredulous, "Could it be because that Faceless Immortal took action and helped Heavenly King Xuan avoid disaster?"

Mo Rubing nodded, "This is also why I have always been certain that Brother Xuanyuan is still alive. Although our paths differ, judging from what Brother Xuanyuan had hinted at, he and this Faceless Immortal actually got along quite well."

"Moreover, they are of the same kind after all. With a precedent of him rendering aid, it's not impossible for him to have saved him again."

Li Fan remained silent for a long time.

After a long while, he shook his head and denied, "This is merely your speculation, fellow Daoist."

"I originally thought that the opponent Heavenly King Xuan encountered back then, at most, would be another Half-Immortal. If a True Immortal, or even a stronger being, had acted, the possibility of Heavenly King Xuan surviving would be too slim!" Li Fan said with some dejection.

"Based on your mere speculation, it's truly hard to convince someone."

Seeing this, Mo Rubing hesitated for a long time, then finally added in a deep voice, "It's not just unfounded speculation. Through that faint connection with Brother Xuanyuan, I know that Brother is still alive."

Mo Rubing spoke vaguely, being extremely obscure.

Li Fan wished to inquire further, but Mo Rubing refused to say more.

"Azure Nether Orb?" Li Fan couldn't help but guess in his heart.

"Alright, since you are so certain, then I will believe you this time!" Seeing that he could not elicit more information, Li Fan pretended to ponder for a long time, then appeared relieved.

"Anyway, I don't have much time left to live. This is just a last gamble."

"Judging by your words and actions, fellow Daoist, you are certainly not one of the traitors from the former Heavenly Mysteries Sect. Perhaps we can cooperate to find Heavenly King Xuan's whereabouts."

Li Fan's gaze was intense as he stared at Mo Rubing.

"Fellow Daoist knows a lot about Heavenly King Xuan, but you are very unfamiliar with the Xuanhuang Realm of today. Ten thousand years have passed, and the world has changed. The arrangements left by the former Heavenly Mysteries Sect might also have disappeared with the drastic changes in the land."

"And I have scoured the Xuanhuang Realm these years. I can directly lead you to areas worth investigating, greatly increasing the efficiency of our search."

"Furthermore, the remnants of the ten great immortal sects have now become the Five Elders Council, controlling half of the Xuanhuang Realm. Without my cooperation, even if your strength is not bad, fellow Daoist, you will inevitably encounter a lot of trouble."

Chapter 1334

Facing Li Fan's suggestion, Mo Rubbin didn't immediately reply. He pondered for a long time in silence.

Gazing at Li Fan, his eyes fell upon his long, streaked white hair. Perhaps it was due to Li Fan's sincere words and the fact that he was indeed nearing the end of his life, but Mo Rubbin eventually nodded in agreement: "There is no reason why not."

Li Fan nodded joyfully: "Excellent! With Dao brother's assistance, we will surely achieve twice the result with half the effort!"

"If that's the case, then let us return to the Xuanhuang Realm first!"

The phantom image of the wooden sword was unsheathed, and Li Fan extended his hand, inviting Mo Rubbin inside.

At first, Mo Rubbin paid it no mind, but when he personally entered the phantom's range and felt its incredible speed, his expression finally shifted slightly.

His gaze towards Li Fan changed.

Finally, after witnessing with his own eyes how the phantom's protection allowed them to ignore the pull of the Immortal Ruins and smoothly descend into the Xuanhuang Realm, Mo Rubbin could no longer refrain from speaking: "It seems Dao brother is also an absolute top-tier figure of this era."

Li Fan gave a wry smile and shook his head: "Though I can surpass this era, I cannot suppress all ages. Moreover, despite all my techniques, is not lifespan ultimately finite? This divine ability is simply no match for fate..."

Mo Rubbin opened his mouth but said nothing further.

At this moment, the two had already descended into the Xuanhuang Realm. Mo Rubbin's divine sense swept across the world silently. Upon seeing the state domains, which had expanded countless times, and the towering white mist barrier between heaven and earth, even this knowledgeable Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect couldn't help but show a flicker of astonishment in his eyes.

After a long while, he said with some emotion: "If I hadn't truly sensed the lingering traces of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation, I would never have been able to connect this vast world before me with the Xuanhuang Realm of ancient times."

"In just ten thousand years, the changes in the world have reached this point!"

Li Fan nodded: "When the world is on the verge of collapse, the changes in all things are hundreds or thousands of times faster than usual. I observed these changes, swift as thunder, swift as light. This is the Heavenly Dao saving itself..."

As Li Fan spoke, he casually conjured an illusionary realm.

Within the sphere of light, the Xuanhuang Realm was in utter chaos, yin and yang in disarray; stars were dim, mountains trembled; plants withered, birds and beasts fled in panic. It was a clear depiction of the end of the world.

At the brink of survival, the Xuanhuang Realm indeed gave birth to various stress-induced changes. Freezing and heat death, the flow of time, heaven's punishment and earth's destruction...

Mo Rubbin was momentarily mesmerized by the sight.

At a critical juncture, Li Fan coughed softly and retracted the illusionary light sphere.

Mo Rubbin immediately felt a sense of loss.

He vaguely felt that the scene in the sphere of light had secretly harbored the principles of the evolution of heaven and earth, an unimaginable treasure for any cultivator. However, Li Fan displayed it for too short a time, and Mo Rubbin couldn't comprehend much.

Furthermore, as a Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect and an elder who had awakened from ancient times in the Xuanhuang Realm, his pride prevented him from shamelessly asking Li Fan to display it again.

"Perhaps after we succeed in finding brother Xuanyuan and become more familiar..." Mo Rubbin couldn't help but think.

"Of course, the reason the Xuanhuang Realm has become this way, besides the changes in the Heavenly Dao itself, is also due to the secret interference of the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate," Li Fan truthfully continued.

"The Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate is very likely a Venerable from the former Heavenly Law Realm. With the Heavenly Law Realm's destruction, the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate wants to use the Xuanhuang Realm, the only one remaining in the starry sea, to resurrect himself..."

"This Doctrine Transmitter has comprehended the Dao in the starry sea for thousands of years, his strength is unfathomable, perhaps he has reached the limits of the mortal realm. I am not his match!"

"As we act, we must be cautious of this person. He will absolutely not let go of any existence that threatens his revival of the Heavenly Law Realm," Li Fan sighed and offered a kind warning.

"This Doctrine Transmitter is actually quite a decent person. It's just a pity he is destined to stand on the opposing side of the Xuanhuang Realm." Mo Rubbin observed some foreign world fragments that were out of place deep within the Xuanhuang Realm's world and began to believe Li Fan's words.

"What a pity..." In truth, Mo Rubbin still held a sliver of good impression for this powerful individual who had, nominally, destroyed the Myriad Immortal Sects.

However, upon seeing the current scene of the Xuanhuang Realm being dismembered and reshaped, and listening to Li Fan's soft explanation, that already very faint good impression vanished instantly.

"Don't worry, we will act discreetly. Until we find brother Xuanyuan, we will not clash with this Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate." Mo Rubbin's gaze swept across heaven and earth, as if sensing some trace.

After a long while, he frowned: "It seems the Sky Crossing Great Formation is indeed severely damaged. We can only sense a faint residual aura, but we cannot manipulate it."

"Half is because of the vast changes over time, and half is because the Myriad Immortal Sects, when manipulating the Sky Crossing Great Formation to capture other cultivation realms, fought continuous battles. The formation was increasingly damaged, and the cultivators of the ten sects were incapable of repairing it, ultimately leading to the formation's complete destruction..." Li Fan said slowly.

"At the very least, according to my investigation, that should be the case." Seeing the sharp glint flash in Mo Rubbin's eyes, Li Fan shrugged and said with great honesty.

"How could those useless members of the ten sects possibly manipulate the Sky Crossing Great Formation?! Unless..." A dangerous aura suddenly emanated from Mo Rubbin.

Li Fan slightly shifted, agreeing: "It must be that the Law Kings who betrayed the sect back then revealed the method of manipulation to the ten sects."

Mo Rubbin's brows furrowed deeply, but he didn't reply.

After a long time, he shook his head and said: "Not necessarily. Perhaps after being captured by the Myriad Immortal Sects, they were subjected to intense interrogation."

Li Fan was somewhat surprised by Mo Rubbin's attitude upon hearing this.

Because he knew that the Heavenly Mysteries King had given the manipulation methods of the various sub-formations of the Sky Crossing Great Formation to different Law Kings, in case of any unforeseen circumstances.

Mo Rubbin was responsible for the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, which was the Sea of Darkness. As for Ji Yuzhen, she was responsible for the Golden Chain Across the Heavens.

Perhaps sensing Li Fan's mood, Mo Rubbin began to explain his active exoneration: "Back then, brother Xuanyuan hinted to me that the Star Locking Golden Chain was controlled by Ji Yuzhen and Luo Yichen..."

"Of the twelve of them, anyone could have betrayed. Only they two would not have." Mo Rubbin said with absolute conviction.

Li Fan pondered upon hearing this: "In Law King Ji's memories, she deeply admired the Heavenly Mysteries King. As for Luo Yichen..."

Mo Rubbin nodded: "That's right. It was only after her heart was set on brother Xuanyuan that Luo killed all of her thousands of consorts and only then was she devoted to one person."

Li Fan shook his head even more vigorously: "The Heavenly Mysteries King assigned the same task to these two women. This move was extremely unwise!"

"Dao brother is overthinking. The two of them have a very good relationship with each other," Mo Rubbin said with a faint smile.

Li Fan didn't explain further.

While chatting, the two had already decided on the first location to search for the Heavenly Mysteries King's whereabouts.

It was within the Sea of Darkness.

Almost no different from the itinerary of his previous exploration, after some effort, Li Fan feigned complete astonishment and the two finally arrived at the central core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

First, they were horrified by the True Immortal's corpse in the depths of the Sea of Darkness and the faintly active, provoked sentient will of the True Immortal's survival.

Snapping back to reality, Mo Rubbin was slightly startled: "Hmm? It seems someone has been here not too long ago!"

Li Fan was inwardly shocked, not expecting that even though he had hidden his tracks meticulously during his previous visit, Mo Rubbin, at this moment, could still detect it.

However, he remained calm despite his surprise, and instead showed a hint of joy, quickly asking: "Was it the Heavenly Mysteries King?"

Mo Rubbin did not doubt the person beside him.

After all, this formation's seal was the advantageous formation, the Spirit Gathering Ascension, which was not something an ordinary person could break through to enter.

"However, there are indeed traces of previous intruders here. Although they couldn't reach the very core, the True Immortal's corpse..."

"The people from the Myriad Immortal Sects died here. They must have been lured and then killed by the True Immortal's will to survive."

"Could it be Elder Cui?"

Cui Zhiyuan was another Law King who, along with him, oversaw the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation.

While making this guess, Mo Rubbin re-examined the traces of the formation's activation and vaguely felt something was amiss.

"It doesn't seem like the restriction was directly activated, but rather a forceful breakthrough without damaging the immortal formation. Overcoming skill with brute force..."

"Moreover, after the fact, the formation was improved, sealing off the True Immortal's intent and preventing outsiders from intruding."

Mo Rubbin pondered for a long time, finding the identity of this intruder difficult to fathom.

Li Fan, of course, saw his confusion but didn't kindly inform him about the Doctrine Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's past actions.

Mo Rubbin hesitated for a while before finally deciding to set this matter aside for now. He then began searching for the Heavenly Mysteries King's trace within the Sea of Darkness.

The central core of the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, resembling a circular observation pod, suddenly lit up within the Sea of Darkness. Faint fluctuations emanated from it, rapidly spreading towards the Sea of Darkness.

After a full half an hour, Li Fan finally sensed these fluctuations returning.

Mo Rubbin waited with a blank expression for the full results of the scan.

Clearly, the Heavenly Mysteries King was not present in this Sea of Darkness.

Li Fan saw Mo Rubbin's brows furrowed deeply again and couldn't help but comfort him: "We'll head to the next location."

Mo Rubbin shook his head: "I didn't expect to find brother Xuanyuan so easily in the first place."

"I just feel that this Sea of Darkness is somewhat unusual."

Li Fan's heart stirred: "What do you mean?"

"The Sea of Darkness was created upon the corpse of a True Immortal. Although the True Immortal is completely dead, he was still a True Immortal; his methods are far beyond our mortal cultivator's imagination."

"For instance, after sensing the intrusion of living beings, the 'will to survive' spontaneously generated. The dark energy accumulated here also seems to have undergone subtle changes compared to those days," Mo Rubbin said with a somewhat solemn expression.

Li Fan followed Mo Rubbin's gaze and looked into the boundless darkness.

Mo Rubbin continued in a deep voice: "The True Immortal has perished, and the dark energy is without a master. However, since this power was generated by means of the True Immortal's corpse, it was fine when everything was dormant. But now, a trace of the True Immortal's will to survive has been provoked..."

"Perhaps under the influence of this will to survive, the dark energy has become different."

Li Fan feigned extreme shock: "The power of a True Immortal is truly terrifying? What specific changes do you refer to regarding this dark energy?"

Mo Rubbin: "It's not clear yet. But one thing is certain: it is inevitably evolving in a direction that favors the True Immortal's revival. Even if complete resurrection is impossible, the trend will definitely exist."

"Do you remember the few corpses we saw on the way? Their life essence was completely drained, becoming nourishment for the True Immortal's revival... Perhaps when this Sea of Darkness senses life forms useful for the True Immortal's revival, it will launch a similar attack."

"However, fortunately, after being transformed by the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, the influence of the True Immortal's remains on the dark energy is far less than that of the True Immortal's will. Things are not as bad as I imagined."

Li Fan agreed wholeheartedly: "The energy accumulated in this Sea of Darkness is already so vast. If it were to unrestrainedly expand, it might swallow the Xuanhuang Realm in an instant... becoming nourishment for the True Immortal's revival..."

Mo Rubbin gave a deep look at the Sea of Darkness and nodded in agreement: "If left unchecked, there might indeed be such a day in the future."

Li Fan curiously asked: "If—I'm just saying if—if the entire Xuanhuang Realm were used as nourishment, could it truly revive the immortal corpse?"

Mo Rubbin turned his head and looked at Li Fan, remaining silent for a long time.

There was no malice in Li Fan's eyes, only pure curiosity about the unknown.

Mo Rubbin pondered for a long time and said: "From an energy level perspective, the current Xuanhuang Realm should be sufficient. After all, so many cultivation realms have been stitched together, even if they are just fragmented after world destruction..."

"Though the world's life forms are destroyed, their origins still remain."

"But even if revived, it would likely only be an empty shell, a walking corpse, without its own true consciousness..."

Li Fan nodded slowly: "A True Immortal's husk is still an extremely formidable existence. If one could seize it, wouldn't that, in a sense, allow one to achieve True Immortal status in this era?"

Mo Rubbin smiled at Li Fan's fanciful idea, not taking it seriously.

After searching the Sea of Darkness fruitlessly, the two then planned to head to the second location, the Eye of the Tian Beast.

"The Eye of the Tian Beast can not only probe the starry sea but also oversee the Azure Nether. It is independent of the Xuanhuang Realm, connected only by a profound and mystical link. If the Tian Beast were still alive, we could reach it directly. However, since the Tian Beast is now dead, it will take some effort to get there," Mo Rubbin explained.

Afterward, he came to Nine Mountains Province with Li Fan.

Looking at the nine continuous mountain ranges towering between heaven and earth, a hint of sadness flashed in Mo Rubbin's eyes.

Then, just like in his previous life, he found the immortal artifact, a white jade flagpole, in the underground ruins.

"This is..."

"An immortal artifact?"

Li Fan pretended to be very surprised.

Mo Rubbin was indifferent: "Its immortal Spirit Qi is depleted, only the shell of an immortal artifact remains."

"However, it's not difficult to use it to travel to the Eye of the Tian Beast."

Mo Rubbin began to set up the formation, using the white jade flagpole as the central core.

"While searching for the Heavenly Mysteries King, I also encountered some fragments of immortal artifacts. However, they were all like this white jade flagpole, with their immortal Spirit Qi exhausted. Some were even shattered as if they had suffered a great calamity."

"What kind of calamitous scene did the Heavenly Mysteries King witness in the Immortal Realm back then? It could actually affect even the Immortal Realm?" Li Fan asked, sighing with emotion, while Mo Rubbin's preparations paused slightly, as if lost in thought.

Chapter 1335

"This question isn't just for you and me," Mo Rubing said with deep emotion. "Even in the ancient Xuanhuang Realm, everyone who knew that Brother Xuanyuan returned from the Immortal Realm after his ascension was extremely curious."

"No matter what methods they used to investigate, Brother Xuanyuan never revealed the details. He merely offered vague explanations about a terrifying cataclysm in the Immortal Realm."

"Even among us, your brothers, the Law Kings, and Ji Yuzhen, who Brother Xuanyuan trusted the most, he never disclosed anything. It wasn't until Brother Xuanyuan successfully broke through and decided to implement the 'luring the snake out of its hole' plan that he occasionally mentioned a few words about the great calamity in the Immortal Realm."

"He called it the 'Dao Erasure.' Although he didn't describe the specific scenes of the Dao Erasure calamity to us, just those two words sent shivers down our spines. All of us Law Kings saw a flicker of fear in Brother Xuanyuan's eyes..."

"Dao Erasure." Li Fan savored the two words, and a wave of uncontrollable chills gradually spread through him. He thought of the memories he had glimpsed within the True Immortal's flesh and blood.

Fragmented voices came from the towering figure above the True Immortal. "Qionglang Starfield... Annihilation... guard..."

Li Fan mused, "This word 'Annihilation' should refer to the Dao Erasure calamity. Qionglang Starfield suffered a disaster, and it required True Immortals to be sent to guard it, or perhaps to guard other starfields to prevent unforeseen events?"

Li Fan secretly speculated, "As expected, the calamity that led to the destruction of the Immortal Realm had early omens. The Immortal Realm must have tried many self-salvation methods, but ultimately they couldn't stop the spread of the Dao Erasure calamity."

New questions arose in Li Fan's mind. Was the Dao Erasure calamity only targeted at and appearing in the Immortal Realm? After the Immortal Realm was destroyed, did the Dao Erasure calamity vanish without a trace? Or, one day, would it reappear in the lower star sea? What was the relationship between the Dao Erasure calamity and the Devouring Calamity that Li Fan had seen in the Boundless Mirror and the ruins of the One Beginning Sect?

The power of True Immortal Sigils went berserk, sweeping across the star sea, bringing cataclysmic disaster to a large area. The starlight dimmed, turning into the Abyssal Star Sea.

But... After all, life had not been completely extinguished. Not to mention the Xuanhuang Realm, which was still full of vitality, even the seemingly dead star sea still had its consciousness surviving. With the passage of time, its eventual revival was almost a certainty.

"The catastrophic destruction that the Abyssal Star Sea suffered is probably not on the same level as the Dao Erasure calamity." The word "Annihilation" made Li Fan feel as if he saw the scene of everything being utterly annihilated under the calamity.

"Perhaps not even fragments of the world would be left behind," Li Fan felt a chill in his heart.

Just as Li Fan was lost in thought, he heard Mo Rubing speak again, "Brother Xuanyuan once instructed that the details of the Immortal Realm's calamity are more harmful than beneficial for us if we know too much."

"He even advised us to avoid recalling its name as much as possible, because it might take the opportunity to transform into a nightmare and invade our hearts. Even if we haven't seen its true form, it can still exploit our weaknesses."

"Telling us the name 'Dao Erasure' was only to give us a basic sense of prevention." Mo Rubing's expression became solemn. "If we don't know its name, even if we see it face-to-face, we won't know the true nature of this calamity. But if we know its name, even if we only encounter its initial signs for the first time, we will instinctively feel something."

"In fact, Brother Xuanyuan encountered this world-ending calamity as soon as he arrived in the Immortal Realm. The various matters regarding the Dao Erasure calamity were learned later through communication with the Faceless Immortal."

"Alright. Let's not mention this matter anymore." Mo Rubing abruptly stopped speaking.

While he was talking, the White Jade Flagpole formation was ready. Mo Rubing's expression was solemn as he formed hand seals. The White Jade Flagpole rose, emitting a light ring that enveloped them both.

"Let's go!"

It was somewhat similar to Li Fan's wooden sword phantom. The White Jade Flagpole pointed toward the sky, constantly adjusting its direction. Then, the pole emitted scattered white lights. After accumulating power for a few breaths, it shot towards the sky with Li Fan and Mo Rubing.

Although the speed was slightly slower than Li Fan's sword shadow divine ability, the refined and ambitious intent to break through everything attached to it was something Li Fan's divine ability lacked.

The light column formed by the flagpole's path was extremely thin. Moreover, there was no energy overflow, so it did not attract the attention of the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan, inside the flagpole, watched the scenery of the Xuanhuang Realm rapidly recede. Even the suction from the Immortal Ruins only slightly slowed their speed. Mo Rubing, on the other hand, was focusing on controlling the flagpole, occasionally avoiding areas where true immortal residual forces converged.

After calculating that the White Jade Flagpole would not collide with the depression filled with true immortal residual forces, Li Fan patiently waited to reach their destination.

After flying in the starry sky for about the time it takes for an incense stick to burn, the White Jade Flagpole abruptly stopped. The light dispersed, forming a bubble-like shape that enveloped them. Then, it violently collided with an invisible barrier in the void. The white light bubble perfectly acted as a buffer, dissipating the impact force.

Li Fan and Mo Rubing arrived inside the Tian Beast's Eye.

"Ah!" A scream immediately echoed in this not-so-large area. It was not from Li Fan or Mo Rubing, but from Han Zhong, the cultivator Li Fan had seen before who had mistakenly entered the Tian Beast's Eye through the teleportation array in Nine Mountains Province!

Having been trapped for so long, Han Zhong had already lost hope of escaping. Only the instinct for survival had kept him alive. Now, seeing another living person, he first let out an excited shout. Just as he was about to say something more...

Mo Rubing's expression changed slightly. He directly unleashed a beam of black light that struck Han Zhong's body! The pitiable Han Zhong's eyes were filled with disbelief as he was inexplicably reduced to ashes!

"Brother Dao, you..." Li Fan feigned astonishment. Mo Rubing first checked extremely cautiously to ensure that no fragments of Han Zhong were left. Then, he explained, "Although I don't know why this cultivator appeared here, he has been contaminated."

"Contacting him rashly could lead to infection. It's better to be safe than sorry."

Li Fan's expression softened slightly, with lingering confusion. "Contaminated?"

Mo Rubing scanned their surroundings and said, "It's a very troublesome illness. Even Brother Xuanyuan found it quite difficult to resolve."

"It should be related to the calamity in the Immortal Realm back then..."

"However, under normal circumstances, it's very difficult to encounter it in the starry sky. This is the Tian Beast's Eye, so the possibility of being contaminated is higher."

"The concentration of this illness in the lower star sea is extremely low. It was like this ten thousand years ago, and after ten thousand years, I checked it again while traveling in the star sea, and it seemed to have not changed much. But the Tian Beast's Eye observes vast starfields. When the scale is magnified to a certain limit, even if the concentration is low, it will truly reveal itself." Mo Rubing said, setting up several restrictions around them, seemingly targeting this void illness.

Li Fan pondered Mo Rubing's words. "This illness, due to the expansion of the observation area, has increased the probability of infection... Doesn't this mean that merely observing it can lead to transmission?" Li Fan was startled.

Mo Rubing nodded. "Exactly. This is why I killed him instantly without a second word. Fortunately, the probability of this illness spreading through ordinary means is low. I just checked, and it hasn't spread. There's no danger here for now."

"Such a strange mode of transmission, and it's related to the upper realm's immortal calamity..." Li Fan seemed a little worried. "What happens after being infected with this condition? I saw that the trapped cultivator just now didn't seem abnormal?"

Mo Rubing cast several more restrictions. The "transparent bubble" that had just tightly wrapped them, barely accommodating two or three people, slowly expanded like being inflated.

"There was no abnormality because the illness was still dormant in his body and had not erupted. If you had come into contact with him, you would have known its terrifying nature. The upper limit of the divine soul and even the upper limit of life's origin would be reduced by it. The degree of reduction would deepen with the severity of the infection. In the end, although not dead, they would be as fragile as a sheet of paper."

"Even a normal breeze could blow them into scattered souls. Of course, before that, they would have to face all sorts of suffering caused by the reduction of the upper limit of life's origin." Mo Rubing sighed with emotion. "Imagine, the soft whispers of others would sound like thunder in your ears, even causing your divine soul to ache and tear. A casual touch from someone else would feel like a violent impact, causing flesh and blood to blur..."

"The normal world would become a doomsday where terrifying calamities are constantly unfolding in your eyes. At that time, death might be a release."

"But because of this illness, and before being reduced to the extreme, in order to maintain its spread, it would instead preserve the host's life. Unable to live, unable to die..." Mo Rubing shook his head slightly.

"In that case, this illness is indeed quite troublesome," Li Fan said, but in his mind, he recalled the scene of the Heavenly Physician using a jade bottle to collect the black gas emanating from the deceased Han Zhong.

"If it spreads in the Xuanhuang Realm, it will be troublesome," Li Fan said in a strange tone.

"Ten thousand years have passed, and this illness has barely spread. Even if it has a tendency to spread in the lower realms, it will definitely take an extremely long time," Mo Rubing comforted him casually. His attention was focused on this Tian Beast's Eye.

"This transparent space is the Tian Beast's Eye? It seems that Heavenly Mysteries is not here either," Li Fan said with some regret.

Mo Rubing shook his head. "This is just an observation point of the Tian Beast's Eye. Do you know that a small insect's true eye is formed by thousands of small eyes? The Tian Beast is the same."

Li Fan suddenly understood. As Mo Rubing continued to cast spells, the transparent bubble continuously shook violently and shrunk, as if trying to expel them. *Poof!* The bubble burst, and Li Fan's vision blurred. The next moment, they were in a peculiar space, like one of the countless bubbles floating on the sea. On the arc-shaped boundary, countless scenes of similar, other bubbles flashed. Li Fan even vaguely saw himself and Mo Rubing in the bubbles outside. However, the appearance, clothing, expressions, and actions of the other "selves" were different from his true self. Yet, there was a strange sense of familiarity. Countless "mes" exchanged glances, giving Li Fan a very peculiar feeling.

"It's just a distortion that occurred due to the joint observation of countless Tian Beasts."

"As long as you stick to your original heart, you won't be confused." Mo Rubing seemed accustomed to this strange scene. He looked around, seemingly searching for something among the myriad bubbles.

"Brother Xuanyuan did not give me the method to control the Tian Beast's Eye formation. Fortunately, I've been here a few times before. I can only rely on this tedious method to search slowly," Mo Rubing said helplessly.

In this space, the number of Tian Beast's Eyes seemed endless. They were seemingly very close to each other, yet also very far apart. Divine sense could not lock onto them; one could only rely on visual observation. And the countless bubbles were not static. As if struck by flowing water, the countless bubbles simultaneously underwent irregular diffusion movements, changing their positions. This rendered most of the previous observations useless. Despite this difficulty, Mo Rubing showed no signs of frustration, focusing intently on his observation. He also reminded Li Fan, "Within the Tian Beast's Eye, there is almost a self-contained set of laws. You don't need to worry about your lifespan running out. Even if you stay here for ten thousand years, you won't die of old age."

"When your lifespan is about to end, if you really don't want to die, you can hide in here. Although it can't guarantee eternal life, living for another few thousand years should not be a problem." Li Fan nodded.

"This Tian Beast is indeed very unique."

"It is said that its size is comparable to an entire state of the Xuanhuang Realm. Could it be that King Xuan Tian brought it back from the Immortal Realm?" Li Fan asked.

Mo Rubing nodded as expected. "Yes and no. At first, Brother Xuanyuan thought it was just an inanimate object, an ordinary jade pendant. He didn't expect it to develop a living aura after encountering water."

"Then, after careful feeding, it grew larger and larger, and its combat power also increased day by day."

"I'm ashamed to say that if it were a life-and-death battle, I might not even be the Tian Beast's opponent." Mo Rubing's eyes flashed with a hint of nostalgia. Then, perhaps thinking of the Tian Beast that had long since died, its bones having turned into mountains and rivers, a deep killing intent flashed in Mo Rubing's eyes.

Li Fan did not interject. Silence fell upon them once more. Li Fan, like Mo Rubing, began to search for clues among the countless bubbles. Although the number of bubbles here was like the stars in the sky, countless and constantly changing, Li Fan had the support of the Dao-Melting Stone. Each bubble was inherently different from the others. Each time he observed, after deeply imprinting it in his mind, Li Fan had effectively made a unique mark on it. Regardless of how the bubbles flowed, he could distinguish them all clearly.

As time slowly passed, the number of bubbles marked by Li Fan increased. One option after another was eliminated, and Li Fan's gaze became sharper. This was because he discovered something quite strange. Compared to his original self, the distorted scenes in those peculiar bubbles seemed to have a small piece missing from his body. The missing part in each bubble was different. But if they were combined...

Chapter 1336: Ancient Script-Carver Dao's Predecessor

These missing portions were all exceedingly small. If not for the Dao-Melting Stones meticulously recording and comparing each one, Li Fan would not have so easily discovered the anomaly hidden within the myriad Eyes of the Tian Beast.
