"Mo Rubbin had previously stated that differences in the scenes were due to distortions caused by the observation of different Eyes of the Tian Beast…" Li Fan's gaze seemed to pierce through these countless bubbles, reaching the truth behind them.

"These missing pieces can actually be seen as blind spots of the Eyes of the Tian Beast. Or, rather, some formless existence has occupied fixed positions within the gazes of the Tian Beast. Even with the observation of hundreds or thousands of gazes, it is difficult to perceive its entirety. Only by stitching together the blind spots of all the Eyes of the Tian Beast…"

Li Fan's thoughts churned, and in his mind, those tiny fragments began to piece themselves together. Ultimately, they formed a winding, mystifying, and exceedingly complex character!

To call it a character, to Li Fan's eyes, it even somewhat resembled a distorted human figure!

This humanoid character was formless, yet it fell within the observational range of the Eyes of the Tian Beast. With any single Eye of the Tian Beast, let alone perceiving its full form, one couldn't even detect the existence of the humanoid character. However, it occupied a portion of the visual field.

It was like shadows formed by light shining from different angles.

Even if one couldn't divine the original appearance of an object by "seeing" it, by combining all the shadow patterns and performing reverse calculations, this formless entity could be restored!

"This character…"

Li Fan suppressed the shock within his heart, not showing any abnormality in front of Mo Rubbin.

This humanoid character was not a True Immortal Sigils.

But in its essence, it might be no different from a True Immortal Sigils.

Characters like Chaos, Starvation, and Creation were projections of the Dao, the concrete manifestation of power.

And this humanoid character before him was also a projection of some Dao.

"The moment a cultivator observes a True Immortal Sigils, they can naturally grasp its specific representative power. Starvation, Chaos, Creation, and even that mysterious character representing the distinction between immortals and mortals, all follow this principle. The reason for this is that all True Immortal Sigilss are the inscriptions and annotations of the Dao by that Script-Carver Immortal."

"The Great Dao is inherently formless, yet the Script-Carver Immortal was able to materialize its essence into characters, making it tens of thousands of times easier for the world to perceive and understand."

"But this humanoid character… it did not."

Li Fan slowly pondered the immense power contained within the character.

"Perhaps it formed naturally, a projection of some Dao manifesting its power. Or perhaps, it was another True Immortal's attempt at [Script-Carving the Dao]."

"However, this one is clearly far inferior to the later Script-Carver Immortal!"

The reason for judging that this character appeared before the Script-Carver Immortal was that the Dao of True Immortals allowed no room for others. If the Script-Carver Immortal already existed, no other [Script-Carving the Dao] attempt would emerge in the world.

"The moment such an action occurred, it would likely have been ruthlessly crushed by the terrifying, nameless power of a True Immortal."

The gap between this unknown attempt and the true Script-Carver Immortal was like two painters who similarly tried to record the scenery of mountains and rivers in the world with their brushes.

The Script-Carver Immortal's paintings were lifelike, making viewers feel almost as if they were there.

Whereas that attempt was like a child's playful strokes; the abstract lines were so poorly combined that not only was there little resemblance to the real object, but it was also difficult to even figure out what the painting was trying to depict.

Li Fan gazed at the distorted humanoid character for a long time, silent.

Yet, he did not feel contempt due to this arguably crude method of Dao inscription.

It was solely because the object that this humanoid character attempted to inscribe…

Having witnessed Creation, the transformation between immortals and mortals, and even the transformation between true and false, Li Fan's ability to discern and identify the ranking of True Immortal Sigilss was probably unmatched even by True Immortals.

Li Fan vaguely sensed that even though this attempt at Dao inscription was crude, it did not affect the quality of the fundamental Dao that the distorted humanoid character was trying to inscribe.

"Above Creation, perhaps on the same level as the transformation between immortals and mortals."

A subtle glint, imperceptible to others, flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"The Eyes of the Tian Beast were transformed from a jade pendant that the past Heavenly Mysteries King brought back from the Immortal Realm. Upon contact with water, they actually transformed into living beings."

"Could it be because of the characters hidden within this jade pendant?"

The method of discovering this hidden humanoid character was both difficult and simple.

Even if the Heavenly Mysteries King didn't have Dao-Melting Stones, Li Fan didn't believe that he, with his Half-Immortal strength, wouldn't have found this hidden secret.

Similarly, the Sea of Darkness and the Netherfolk were all the work of the Heavenly Mysteries King.

He had no reason not to have noticed that character representing the distinction between immortals and mortals.

"Perhaps the Heavenly Mysteries King's breakthrough back then relied on the power of these two types of characters," Li Fan pondered inwardly.

Because the inscription method of this humanoid character was too crude, Li Fan couldn't comprehend anything for the time being. He could only deeply engrave it in his mind.

As for the whereabouts of the Heavenly Mysteries King…

Li Fan had observed all the Eyes of the Tian Beast. As expected, he found no trace of the Heavenly Mysteries King having been there.

But Li Fan didn't make a sound. He remained standing silently, instead beginning to ponder the method to break the surrounding formation.

The Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation was based on ancient immortal formations, modified by the Heavenly Mysteries King.

With the [Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation] already known, it was not impossible to break this formation of the Eyes of the Tian Beast with the aid of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc.

Especially since Mo Rubbin had directly brought Li Fan inside the formation, allowing him to observe all the details of the formation's operation.

In the ensuing silence, Li Fan's progress in breaking the formation rapidly increased.

Mo Rubbin completed his observation of all the Eyes of the Tian Beast, only taking twice the time Li Fan had.

He didn't hide the disappointment that flickered across his face.

"Nothing here either?" Li Fan asked at the opportune moment.

Mo Rubbin shook his head and sighed softly, "He didn't even seek refuge here."

"According to my deductions, the two most likely places where Brother Xuanyuan might be hiding have both turned out to be empty," Mo Rubbin's expression was not good.

"Then shall we depart for the next location?"

Mo Rubbin, however, rejected Li Fan's suggestion.

"The Eyes of the Tian Beast look out at the starry sea and gaze inward at the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Since we are here, why abandon it?"

Mo Rubbin stared at the myriad of floating Eyes of the Tian Beast before him, and said softly.

"Didn't you say that the Heavenly Mysteries King back then didn't pass down the method of control? Can you still mobilize the power of the Eyes of the Tian Beast?" Li Fan asked in surprise.

Mo Rubbin's tone was proud, "After all, it is part of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation. The principle remains the same. As long as I'm given some time, it's not difficult to mobilize a portion of this place's power."

Li Fan couldn't help but praise, "Brother Dao is indeed talented. May I ask how much time you will specifically need?"

"Within three to five months, it will surely be done," Mo Rubbin said with a deep voice.

Li Fan nodded slightly upon hearing this. As if after some thought, he then suggested, "It would be an idle wait for me to stay here. Why don't I return to the Xuanhuang Realm first and search thoroughly, checking for any omissions? Perhaps I can find some other clues."

Mo Rubbin sized Li Fan up and finally agreed, "Very well."

He tossed out a jade token and said, "Take this with you. Once there are any results, I will notify you immediately."

Li Fan accepted the jade token and cupped his fists, "Then I implore Brother Dao to first send me out of this formation of the Eyes of the Tian Beast."

Mo Rubbin nodded, flicked his wrist, and with a gesture, Li Fan's vision blurred. He suddenly felt as if he was in another miniature bubble.

The bubble continuously shrank, gradually turning into a thin film that enveloped Li Fan's body.

Finally, the film completely tore apart, and moments later, Li Fan returned directly to the Xuanhuang Realm, within Nine Mountains Province.

"From now on, coming here won't be as troublesome. We can directly transfer through the body of the Tian Beast."

"Although the Tian Beast is dead, its bones and veins still remain."

Mo Rubbin's voice echoed in Li Fan's ear and then slowly disappeared.

Li Fan looked up, his gaze seemingly piercing through time and space, directly reaching the Eyes of the Tian Beast beyond the void.

After an inspection, confirming that Mo Rubbin had not left any marks or hidden tricks on him, Li Fan narrowed his eyes and snorted inwardly, "He agreed quite readily."

"Perhaps he was just eager to get rid of me."

Li Fan vaguely sensed that within the formation of the Eyes of the Tian Beast, Mo Rubbin had not used his full strength, and seemed to have some methods held back. Therefore, he went with the flow and proactively suggested a temporary departure.

In any case, with the aid of the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc, he would likely break through the formation of the Eyes of the Tian Beast even sooner than Mo Rubbin.

"It would be even better if he could find any trace of the Heavenly Mysteries King."

"If not, he should at least contribute to the sublimation of the Xuanhuang Realm."

The Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect was somewhat more useful than Senior Yin and Xu Ke, among others. Naturally, he couldn't be wasted.

With this thought, Li Fan activated his wooden sword phantom and instantly returned to the pocket world of Great Xuan.

Upon his return to the Xuanhuang Realm, he detected that Senior Yin, who had gone missing in the turbulent stellar force storm earlier, had returned safely.

However, as the instigator of the disturbance, Bai Hua's feelings towards him had shifted from friendly to hostile.

The two were confronting each other above the Dao Discussion Platform.

Bai Hua's expression was solemn, as if demanding an explanation from Senior Yin.

Meanwhile, Senior Yin remained with his eyes closed, not explaining, yet also not showing any hostility.

Li Fan looked at Senior Yin, and a peculiar sensation arose in his heart.

Having interacted with Senior Yin for too many lifetimes, spending over a hundred years together in total, Li Fan understood him better than anyone else in the world.

Li Fan easily detected the wondrous changes occurring within Senior Yin.

Senior Yin was a world spirit—the residual dregs left by the Xuanhuang Realm when it devoured and integrated other destroyed cultivation worlds, which it couldn't absorb.

It was because of this that an aura of strangeness and deathly stillness often accompanied Senior Yin.

But now…

Traces of unique vitality were emanating from this coalesced world spirit!

Li Fan was also greatly surprised.

He immediately revealed himself and appeared before Senior Yin.

"Congratulations, Daoist friend. You have benefited from misfortune!" Li Fan observed him carefully for a moment, then said softly.

It was then that Senior Yin slowly opened his eyes, "If not for the Sage Master's assistance, I might never have reached the fringe of the starry sea, much less this fortune!"

Senior Yin expressed his sincere gratitude.

And the moment Li Fan saw his eyes, he understood why Senior Yin had refused to open his eyes when facing Bai Hua earlier.

His two eyes, one black and one white.

The black one exuded vibrant life, while the white one emitted endless deathly stillness.

The instant his black and white eyes met, Li Fan felt as if he had been pulled into an boundless illusion.

Countless lives were born, and then destroyed in various calamities.

Life and death cycled and evolved at an extremely terrifying speed.

Li Fan even noticed that his "psychological age," which had never been affected by illusions, had its numbers jump consecutively the moment he fell into the black and white vortex.

Li Fan experienced this, and Bai Hua's outward appearance was even more precarious.

Not looking directly, merely observing from the periphery, her seemingly unbreakable glazed body swayed like a candle in the wind, precarious and on the verge of collapse!

Fortunately, Senior Yin also noticed the changes happening to Li Fan and Bai Hua, and he himself harbored no intention of harming them.

With some slowness and difficulty, he closed his black and white eyes.

As the storm of life and death illusions gradually subsided, Li Fan and Bai Hua finally returned to normal.

"You…" Bai Hua pointed at Senior Yin with astonishment, her face unable to conceal her fear.

She found it hard to believe. The person before her, whose strength was comparable to hers not long ago, had undergone an almost earth-shattering change in just a few short days.

Li Fan asked with great interest, "What is this vitality you possess? The vast Great Wall under the The Great Barrier was supposed to be filled with destroyed worlds. How could such immense vitality be hidden there?"

Senior Yin paused for a moment, then slowly explained, "It was precisely because I discovered the vitality within that fragmented realm that I acted disregarding the consequences. In fact, at that time, I was already controlled by instinct and my actions were briefly beyond my control."

Li Fan frowned upon hearing this.

"Even now that I have absorbed the vitality of the fragmented realm, I am still unclear about its source. However, I can show the Sage Master where this vitality originates…" Senior Yin said word by word.

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan nodded, "The pocket world of Great Xuan is still too fragile."

The wooden sword phantom unsheathed itself, carrying Senior Yin and Bai Hua, and ascended into the void of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Catalyzed by infinite vitality, his half-successful [Self-Inherent Foundation] even showed signs of repair.

The True Self Dao Foundation within his body slowly merged with his true form.

This caused Senior Yin's signature echoing voice to disappear.

With a solemn expression, Senior Yin turned his head, avoiding the area where Li Fan and the others were.

He reopened his black and white eyes.

Then, he extended his left hand, inserted two fingers into his eye sockets, and with a slight exertion, directly plucked out the two eyeballs!

There was no gushing blood, only two small balls, one black and one white, continuously rotating in the void!

After leaving Senior Yin's body, these black and white balls gradually moved closer to each other.

However, Senior Yin's palm remained in the center, preventing them from attaching and merging.

"Is the source of vitality these two black and white balls?" Seeing this strange scene, Bai Hua couldn't help but ask.

"Not only vitality. The source of deathly stillness is also from them." After the balls left his body, Senior Yin somehow found it difficult to speak.

The black and white balls continuously emitted their unique energies towards their surroundings.

However, due to their mutual attraction and restraint, they did not spread out violently in the void.

They merely formed a Taiji-like vortex, achieving a strange balance.

Li Fan looked at the black and white balls and vaguely felt a familiar aura from them.

Chapter 1337

In a past life, the Sacred Embryo's clone accompanied the Mystic Immortal Boat on its expedition to the Xuanhuang Realm, only to fall into a Doctrine Transmitter's trap.

He witnessed the terrifying Immortal Realm Overseer, who could strip the life from a tenth of the Immortal Boat’s inhabitants with a single glance.

Boiled in a giant cauldron, like an abyss and a sea, a world containing countless cultivators encased in ice was transformed into a Yin-Yang Pearl.

Within the Yin-Yang Pearl, two worlds were formed.

One was a boundless, deathly silent icy ocean. The opposite of this deathly silent world was a sea teeming with vibrant life.

When Li Fan first mistakenly entered the Yin-Yang Pearl’s pocket world, he mistook it for the dojo of the Xuanhuang Realm's "Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth." This was because the world's flow of yin and yang, life and death, and the reversal of fortunes indeed fit the so-called "reversal of life and death" phenomenon.

However, as Li Fan's vision gradually improved, and after witnessing a large number of true Immortal Formations, he began to doubt his own judgment.

Although the formation within the Yin-Yang Pearl was extraordinarily profound, Li Fan could discern its intricacies upon first glance. Clearly, it was far from the realm of Immortal Formations.

The cycle of life and death within the Yin-Yang Pearl was not achieved through this Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation. Instead, it was solely by the origin within the Yin and Yang worlds, and the power from the Immortal Realm Overseer.

The Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation was more like a catalyst, accelerating the process of life and death reversal.

In his past life, the Sacred Emperor had turned the Xuanhuang Realm upside down, and then the Xuanhuang Realm, within the "All Things Return to the Void" Great Formation, plunged into a world-ending abyss. The Dharma-Preachers and Heavenly Physicians exhausted all their efforts to stop it, yet throughout the entire ordeal, that mysterious "Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth" never appeared.

This might have been due to Scarlet Snow Immortal Venerable's choice to venture into the starry sky to comprehend the Dao, and that the true Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth had not yet succeeded in defying principles. However, Li Fan believed that even if the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth were born, he would likely not have intervened to stop his world-ending actions.

The Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth shared an intricate connection with the Overseer. The Overseer, burdened with an Immortal Realm mission, not only monitored anomalies in the Xuanhuang Realm but also seemed to be tasked with collecting all different types of humans who had appeared in the Xuanhuang Realm.

As for the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth…

He seemed to have shed the shackles of his Immortal Realm mission and acted solely for his own benefit.

The Overseer that Li Fan and the Mystic Immortal Boat encountered had no self-awareness, acting solely on instinct or predetermined rules.

It was almost like a puppet, making it difficult to bear the heavy responsibility of an Overseer.

Therefore, Li Fan speculated that perhaps the Overseer's true spirit had already left its original shell, precisely to escape its Immortal Realm duties after the Immortal Realm's destruction.

The backlash Li Fan experienced in his past life from the Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate's dereliction of duty indicated that even if the Immortal Realm were destroyed, the imposed restrictions would remain.

No one would wish to carry a yoke forever.

Theoretically speaking, it was entirely reasonable for the Xuanhuang Realm's Overseer to desire freedom.

"In the past, I used a fake True Immortal's remains to lure the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Dharma-Preachers into the Yin-Yang Realm. In the end, it led to their complete demise. But the Myriad Immortals Alliance acted as if this incident never happened. This shows that the Dharma-Preachers, or even the Heavenly Physicians, absolutely knew the truth about this Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth. Perhaps, even the transformation from an Immortal Realm Overseer to the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth had the assistance of the Heavenly Physicians..."

Returning to the present, the aura emanating from the black and white spheres that formed after Senior Yin’s capture of the black and white eyes was almost identical to that of the Yin-Yang Pearl.

However, in these black and white spheres, life and death were distinct. They had not reached the state of the Xuanhuang Realm's Yin-Yang Pearl, where life and death flowed and life was inexhaustible.

Li Fan stared at the black and white spheres for a long time, silent.

After a while, he finally spoke, "In a secret realm somewhere in the Xuanhuang Realm, there exists a similar creation."

"However, the intermingling of black and white, life and death, is even more marvelous than your mere life and death dual pearls. Inside that Yin-Yang Pearl, countless corpses were frozen. I wonder…" Li Fan's gaze was intense.

Senior Yin, having finished his demonstration, reabsorbed the black and white spheres into his body, his eyes returning to normal. "In the white pearl, there were indeed frozen corpses. But that was before the world was destroyed."

"When the world died, those frozen corpses slowly melted, turning into the purest death qi..."

Li Fan, hearing this, pondered inwardly, "This should be the difference caused by the absence of an Overseer."

"Among the many cultivation worlds in the lower realms, the Xuanhuang Realm is clearly an

exceptionally unique one. Not only did it have an Immortal Realm appointment, an Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate, and an Overseer, but it even had a True Immortal personally visit. Although the reason is unknown, this True Immortal actually perished..."

"And the world from which Senior Yin obtained the black and white dual pearls was also within the scope of Immortal Realm surveillance. However, it was of a lower grade than the Xuanhuang Realm."

Li Fan would definitely seek out the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth, who was suspected of shedding his mortal coil like a golden cicada, in the future. But his primary goal in this life was to achieve Dao Integration with the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls, so he had to avoid unnecessary variables as much as possible.

Senior Yin continued, "I am a Worldly Ghost. I originally thought I would exist forever in this state of garbage and dregs, but the moment I felt the vast life force within these black and white dual pearls, a strong premonition suddenly arose in my heart..."

As he spoke, the speed of life force rotation in Senior Yin's black eyes quickened.

"Perhaps there is no absolute decay in the world. The reason I am a residual ghost is merely due to the severance of my life force. As long as enough life force is infused..."

As he spoke, Senior Yin's complexion became increasingly ruddy, looking more and more like a normal cultivator.

But Li Fan narrowed his eyes, seeing that the matter was not so simple.

As Li Fan had expected, as if drawn by the intense life force emanating from him, the previously calm gray eye also began to rotate faster.

Tendrils of desolate, decaying death qi emerged from Senior Yin's body, quickly neutralizing and suppressing the initial life force.

A rotten smell gradually wafted from Senior Yin.

Senior Yin coughed a few times, and the storm in his black and white eyes gradually subsided, revealing a hint of helplessness.

Seeing this, Bai Hua appeared to be lost in thought, with a hint of schadenfreude flashing in her eyes.

Li Fan directly said, "Life and death energies, though seemingly opposed, are in fact one. You wish to draw upon life force while suppressing death qi, which will only be counterproductive."

"The living are the root of the dead; the dead are the fruit of the living. Uproot the root, and you must disturb the fruit. Take the fruit, and you may not harm the root…"

Li Fan perfectly embodied the role of a Sage Master, even lecturing Yin on the Dao on the spot.

Senior Yin, already possessing extraordinary comprehension, now held the black and white life and death dual pearls. Li Fan's deliberately profound pronouncements were completely understood by Senior Yin without any obstacles.

In his calm eyes, the black and white energies flowed ever faster.

Bai Hua, surprisingly, also showed a great aptitude for the Dao of Life and Death. Listening attentively, it seemed she reaped considerable benefits.

The lecture continued for a full half-day, exhausting almost all of Li Fan's accumulated knowledge.

Finally, Li Fan waved his hand, transmitting the Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation into the sea of consciousness of the two.

This Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation was a further deduction of the original formation within the Yin-Yang Pearl by the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc. It could be considered the ultimate practical application of the Dao of Life and Death in the Abyssal Sea.

The moment they touched this formation, an unconcealable surprise and joy erupted on Senior Yin's face.

"Life and death are opposites, but you may be able to use this formation to slowly transform the infinite death qi in the white pearl into life force. However, you must pay attention to the balance between life and death."

Li Fan glanced at Bai Hua and continued, "The life force derived from this process should be consumed as quickly as possible. Besides cleansing your own decay, it might also help Daoist Bai Hua."

Bai Hua's body trembled slightly, wondering what secret Li Fan had discovered about her.

Senior Yin nodded slightly.

"By the way, Sage Master, when I absorbed the black and white dual pearls, I also learned some information about this destroyed world."

"It's not much, but it’s very interesting."

After briefly organizing the Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation, Senior Yin proactively said.

"This world is called [Tai Jia]."

"Before its destruction, although not large in scale, it was an extremely powerful cultivation world in the starry sea."

"This is because the Tai Jia Realm was an extremely rare cultivation world that lacked a world's Heavenly Dao."

"The cultivators within practiced the [Tai Jia Divine Technique], which reportedly allowed them to bypass the non-existent world's Heavenly Dao and directly communicate with the Star Sea's origin consciousness, drawing upon the Star Sea's power..."

A hint of astonishment flashed in Senior Yin's eyes.

From the fragmented images he displayed, the divine abilities of the Tai Jia Realm cultivators were indeed terrifying.

Swords flew through the star river, fists shook worlds.

Without any protection, they could traverse the star sea with their physical bodies alone...

Senior Yin's tone suddenly changed, "However, precisely because they directly connected with the true intent of the Star Sea's origin, when the power of True Immortal Sigils erupted in the Star Sea, the cultivators of the Tai Jia Realm were the first to be affected."

"The Star Sea divine power they had relied on lost its effectiveness. The Tai Jia Realm, which once held great renown in the Star Sea, perished at a much faster rate than ordinary cultivation worlds."

"Most comically, as the Tai Jia Realm was on the verge of complete destruction, some of the Tai Jia cultivators did not choose to fight to the death. Instead, they knelt down and continued to beg for communication with the Star Sea's origin..." Senior Yin shook his head, showing considerable disdain.

Bai Hua also said, "As cultivators, we emphasize the power returning to ourselves. Relying on the Star Sea's power, although it can grant temporary might, ultimately turns to nothing when calamity strikes."

"In fact, the Longevity Realm cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm are the same..."

At this point, Bai Hua suddenly paused.

For she suddenly recalled that their actions to promote the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation and their desire to increase their own strength and realm by riding the coattails of the dragon seemed to have no fundamental difference from the Longevity Realm cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm and the cultivators of the Tai Jia Realm.

Li Fan, of course, saw the reason for Bai Hua's sudden pause at a glance.

He smiled slightly, "There are some differences."

"After the Xuanhuang Realm's transformation, the power fed back to each of us, in the end, returns to ourselves. It's a single transaction; even if we were to fall out with the Xuanhuang Realm in the future, this bestowed power could not be retrieved."

"As for the cultivators of the Tai Jia Realm..."

Li Fan shook his head, offering no further comment.

"However, the [Tai Jia Divine Technique], which directly communicates with the true intent of the Star Sea's origin, does have some merit."

Li Fan had previously taken Senior Yin and the others to see the awakening true intent of the Star Sea's origin.

"The Xuanhuang Realm is not a completely isolated entity; after all, it is still within the Star Sea. If its sublimation can receive support from the Star Sea..." Senior Yin also realized the potential usefulness of the Tai Jia Divine Technique.

"However, what I obtained from the black and white dual pearls are only fragments of memories," he said with some regret.

Senior Yin then haltingly recounted the incomplete [Tai Jia] Divine Technique.

It was obscure, convoluted, and extremely strange. Indeed, it was completely different from ordinary cultivation techniques.

Li Fan, encountering this type of spell for the first time, became intrigued.

"The essence of this technique lies in communicating with the true intent of the Star Sea's origin."

"Ten thousand years ago, when the Star Sea was at its peak, even Half-Immortal cultivators were like ants in the eyes of the Star Sea, let alone ordinary cultivators. Contacting the Star Sea's consciousness was naturally extremely difficult," Li Fan said slowly.

Senior Yin nodded in agreement, "Indeed, the Tai Jia Divine Technique is extremely difficult to cultivate, with only one in ten thousand achieving great mastery. But once one enters the threshold, the energy stirred by each of its moves far surpasses that of ordinary cultivators."

Li Fan smiled, "However, times have changed. The Star Sea has been destroyed, and the true intent of the Star Sea's origin is being reborn from the ruins. Now, it is like a great being reincarnated, in its infancy..."

A sharp light flashed in his eyes, and Li Fan's tone was filled with confidence, "With this give and take, the difficulty of communicating with it now is greatly reduced."

"Let me try first!"

A wooden sword phantom unsheathed, and Li Fan ascended the sword, flying away.

In an instant, he soared out of the Xuanhuang Realm, disappearing from Senior Yin and Bai Hua's sight.

"This flying escape technique is truly enviable. If I could learn it, I would no longer be constrained by the Star Sea..." Bai Hua said with great admiration.

Senior Yin did not reply.

He soon lowered his head, pondering the Reversal of Life and Death Great Formation that Li Fan had taught him earlier.

In Senior Yin's eyes, the value of this formation was no less than that of the flying escape technique.

Suddenly, Li Fan traversed more than half of the Abyssal Sea, arriving at its center.

Here, the resurrected true intent of the Star Sea's origin was most active.

Li Fan stood silently in the void.

He did not directly activate the incomplete [Golden Armor Divine Technique].

What he had said was indeed reasonable.

But he hadn't revealed everything.

Even the newborn Star Sea consciousness was still as distant as a chasm compared to cultivators.

Under the current circumstances, only a chosen one like the Sacred Emperor, who could potentially revitalize the entire Star Sea, could directly converse with the Star Sea.

As for ordinary cultivators, to achieve an effect comparable to the Sacred Emperor...

"First, they need to be seen by the Star Sea!"

A sharp light gleamed in Li Fan's eyes, and the Ascending Array was instantly set up.

A "mountain peak" rose from the center of the Star Sea.

Slowly ascending.

Li Fan stood atop the peak, gazing upwards.

Just like ancient emperors performing ascensions to bring offerings to heaven, attempting to get closer to the heavens, Li Fan wanted to stand higher, increasing his "momentum," thereby becoming more conspicuous in the eyes of the Star Sea's true intent.

Feeling that the Ascending Array’s ascent had reached its limit, Li Fan began to chant the Tai Jia Divine Technique in his heart.

Although incomplete, its effect of communicating with the Star Sea's consciousness still existed.

A wisp of intent drifted upwards.

Reaching the source of the Star Sea.

Boom!

Instantly, Li Fan felt as if he had plunged into a dazzling galaxy.

Chapter 1338: Ten Thousand Years of Favorability

"As if my body is the universe, my thoughts roam the star rivers. Tai Jia's infinite, the spirit roams; Tai Jia's immutable, the spirit transforms; Tai Jia's voidless, the spirit becomes divine..."

Li Fan chanted inwardly.

In his vision, just like his previous experience with the Sacred Emperor, the seemingly dark and desolate star sea suddenly lit up with scattered specks of light.

However, this time, unlike directly contacting the true essence of the star sea's origin, Li Fan felt a natural sense of favorability towards him from the star sea's origin due to the Tai Jia Divine Technique acting as a "translator" between them.

Not only did the contempt for insignificant beings fade away, but Li Fan even sensed that the consciousness of the star sea was listening.

How vast was the gap between a cultivator and the boundless star sea? Yet, with the Tai Jia Divine Technique, this difference could be significantly reduced! While this was partly due to the star sea being in a recovery phase after its destruction and Li Fan's strength already standing at the peak of the mortal world within the star sea, it had to be admitted that the Tai Jia Divine Technique was indeed an unfathomably profound divine ability.

"Only by reaching a considerable understanding of the star sea's essence could such a divine ability be created," Li Fan's mind suddenly flashed with the thought. "Perhaps the founder of this divine technique has long since ascended to become an immortal."

However, he did not forget the purpose of this communication. Maintaining the state of the Tai Jia Divine Technique, Li Fan's expression turned solemn. He first praised the greatness of the star sea and its revival from destruction. Then, he elaborated on the current state of utter desolation within the star sea, and specifically highlighted the sole source of life within it: the Xuanhuang Realm. Finally, Li Fan sincerely implored the star sea's consciousness for its help in elevating the Xuanhuang Realm and escaping the Immortal Ruins.

It was like an ancient emperor offering sacrifices and prayers to the heavens. After recounting his plea, Li Fan remained silent, patiently awaiting a response from the star sea's origin consciousness. It seemed he had presented a difficult problem, as the star sea consciousness remained silent for a long time.

However, Li Fan felt that the connection had not been severed, so he continued to stand and wait. During his communion with the star sea's consciousness, various thoughts and insights regarding the Dao of the star sea flooded his mind. It was akin to falling into the legendary state of unity between heaven and man, where it felt as if he was experiencing enlightenment every moment.

Yet, Li Fan felt a tinge of regret that these insights were like waves on the vast ocean. Although they rose and fell, they quickly dissolved back into the water as the waves receded. "These are not my own insights, but phenomena that naturally arise from being in a special state. How much I can remember in the end depends entirely on my fortune..." Li Fan understood.

Immersed in this near-enlightenment state, an unknown amount of time passed before the star sea consciousness finally provided an answer. Afterward, Li Fan was forcibly expelled, and his connection with the star sea consciousness was severed. The Tai Jia Divine Technique could not be used for a period of time.

A peculiar summoning ritual. These two insights appeared in Li Fan's mind simultaneously.

"It seems the principle behind the Tai Jia Divine Technique is to consume the favorability of the star sea's origin consciousness. And this favorability grows slowly over time. Since the destruction of Tai Jia, no cultivator has used this Tai Jia Divine Technique for ten thousand years. Therefore, the accumulated favorability over these years has reached an astonishing level. That's why I just felt like the star sea was listening..." Li Fan realized with some enlightenment after completing the communication ritual with the star sea.

"However, the favorability accumulated over these years has been completely depleted due to my request. At least for the remaining twenty years in this world, it cannot be used for anything beneficial. But it doesn't matter. Since I have mastered this Tai Jia Divine Technique, in the next life, I will have ten thousand years of accumulated favorability to squander."

Perhaps the ten thousand years of accumulated favorability were truly abundant, or perhaps the sublimation of the Xuanhuang Realm would also benefit the overall recovery of the star sea. In any case, the star sea consciousness agreed to Li Fan's request and would provide assistance in the elevation of the Xuanhuang Realm. The ritual it transmitted was the method to receive the star sea's help.

"Once the ritual is prepared, the star sea will directly bestow its great power."

"Even a nascent star sea is far from comparable to the Xuanhuang Realm, which is merging ten thousand worlds."

"With an additional layer of assistance, the plan for the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation has a greater chance of success." Li Fan's eyes suddenly gleamed with a strange expression. "I just don't know if this ritual will still be useful in the next life."

A moment later, Li Fan shook his head slightly, dismissing the thought. "This ritual is, in essence, just a signal transmitter. Whether to contribute or not is up to the star sea consciousness itself. Without the prerequisite foundation of communication, the star sea would likely feel disturbed and become enraged. Not only would there be no assistance from the star sea, but it might even bring down disasters as punishment."

After all the favorability had been consumed, in the eyes of the star sea, Li Fan became no different from other cultivators. The duration of the Ascending Array also reached its limit, and Li Fan immediately steered his wooden sword phantom away, allowing the array to collapse.

The collapse of the towering peaks stirred some ripples in the central part of the star sea. After the commotion gradually subsided, a trace of extremely faint black energy emerged imperceptibly. It was exactly the same as the wisp of black energy that had appeared previously when Li Fan conducted small-world sublimation experiments using the Ascending Array, causing the small worlds to fall and annihilate. However, this time, there was no falling small world. The black energy was purely born from its proximity to the most active area of the star sea's origin consciousness.

Compared to the wisp that was later consumed by Doctrine Transmitter Jiang, this wisp in the center of the star sea appeared much weaker. However, "weaker" was undoubtedly an illusion. This wisp of black energy was steadily growing over time. The area it enveloped caused the star sea, which had begun to show signs of recovery, to fall into complete void. Yet, strangely, the star sea's origin consciousness did not detect this insect-like black energy. It was powerless as the black energy continued to devour the life force of the star sea.

The growth rate of the black energy was extremely slow initially. However, as it consumed more regions of the star sea, its expansion capability also increased. It was expected that before long, this black energy of unknown origin would sweep through the star sea at a terrifying speed. But for now, the black energy was still quietly developing. The surviving creatures in the star sea were completely unaware of it. And Li Fan, the instigator, was also oblivious to the disaster he had casually caused.

At this moment, he had already returned to the Xuanhuang Realm and recounted his experiences in the center of the star sea to Senior Yin and the others. Bai Hua exclaimed repeatedly, her eyes shining with joy. "The ten thousand years of accumulation from the Tai Jia Realm have now benefited the Xuanhuang Realm. With the help of the star sea consciousness, the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation is just around the corner!"

Senior Yin was much calmer. "I also found world fragments near the remnants of the Tai Jia Realm that can serve as medicinal catalysts for the Xuanhuang Realm."

"However, my rashly devouring the Tai Jia Realm fragments has affected the stability of the Fragmented Realm Great Wall. We may have to wait a while longer until the reverberating stellar energy storm completely subsides before proceeding with the next step of the plan." Bai Hua became even more delighted. "Indeed, one step goes smoothly, and all steps follow. It seems that we can formally begin the Xuanhuang Realm sublimation plan in about half a year."

Li Fan smiled. "It's not that simple. Although we have the star sea's assistance, we cannot be careless. The star sea's great power is like a powerful tonic. If administered correctly, it can heal all ailments. But if done improperly..."

"The weak cannot handle such tonics; they will be harmed instead!" Bai Hua said with a solemn expression.

Using the principles of the heaven and man world, he once again lectured the two. Li Fan assigned tasks to each of them.

"Xu Ke is still below the High Wall, his life force not extinguished, so he should have had other fortuitous encounters. Since you caused the reverberating stellar energy storm, you should go and find him!" Li Fan said to Senior Yin.

"I shall do so!" Senior Yin nodded in agreement.

Li Fan then looked at Bai Hua. "During your trip to the star sea fringe, both Senior Yin and Xu Ke had gains. Although you returned safely, you seemed to have missed out on any fortuitous encounters..." Bai Hua gave a wry smile, then, as if recalling something, looked at Li Fan with a hint of anticipation in her eyes.

"In the star sea, fortuitous encounters are not limited to beneath the High Wall. Go and check this place; perhaps you will find something." Li Fan told her a location not far from the Xuanhuang Realm in the Abyssal Sea, his expression unreadable. "Remember, do not be greedy, and prioritize safety. If you have no affinity with it, just return."

Bai Hua carefully noted the location Li Fan provided, then cupped her hands in thanks.

Watching the two disappear one after another, and calculating that the time was about right, Li Fan slowly made his way back to the Immortal Boat. The location he pointed out to Bai Hua was a natural "high ground" outside the Xuanhuang Realm. Li Fan had flown past it several times on his journey. Although he had not found anything overtly significant, he always had a vague feeling that there might be some hidden secret there. During his brief communion with the star sea consciousness, Li Fan's certainty in his judgment grew. Therefore, he first sent Bai Hua to investigate.

The high grounds already explored in the star sea, such as the High Wall and the Sea of Darkness, were all fraught with danger. Even though he now possessed sufficient self-preservation capabilities, Li Fan still would not rush in himself.

A short while later, he arrived outside the Mystic Immortal Boat. He deliberately released his aura, and soon, the elders of the Immortal Boat arrived. They surrounded Li Fan. Seeing Li Fan return as promised, they were all relieved. Then, their expressions turned solemn as they asked about important matters.

"Fellow Daoist, what did Da Qi say?" Jian Daosheng asked first. Li Fan's eyes flashed with annoyance. "Wretches! Let us not speak of them!" Zhong Daogong smiled slightly, his gaze flickering. "It seems your persuasion failed?" "You could say that," Li Fan snorted coldly. "I have already told my teacher about my observations below the High Wall, yet they remain unconvinced."

"My teacher even told me that there are quite a number of such high points in the star sea. However, the height of these points compared to the High Wall is like the difference between the peaks of the mountains on the ground and the firmament..."

"To surmount it is a fool's dream!" Li Fan's words caused the expressions of the elders of the Immortal Boat to change.

"Without special means, just relying on height is indeed insufficient to cross the High Wall," Zhong Daogong said with a half-smile. "However... you just mentioned that there are many other high points in the star sea?" Zhong Daogong suddenly changed the subject, asking with a rather serious expression. Li Fan nodded. "Indeed. My master even personally took me to one of them. It was true; although it was slightly lower than the position on the Fragmented Realm Great Wall, it could still overlook the High Wall."

Zhong Daogong remained silent for a long time upon hearing this. After some discussion with the other elders, he slowly said, "It seems we of the Immortal Boat have underestimated the world's inhabitants. How could civilizations that have survived the Great Tribulation be simple?"

"They are strong, yet timid as mice. They lack even the courage to try," Li Fan retorted with a cold hmph. Zhong Daogong, in turn, defended the non-existent Da Qi. "Fellow Daoist, you have oversimplified the matter."

"Even with the traces left by our predecessors, crossing the High Wall requires a civilization to give its all. It cannot be described as simply trying."

"Having survived safely in the star sea for tens of thousands of years, and perhaps continuing to do so, there is no need to take such a risky gamble. Of course, your lifespan is nearing its end, and it is understandable that you wish to seek the truth of the Dao before you die," Zhong Daogong elaborated eloquently. Li Fan snorted again but did not argue further.

A moment of awkward silence ensued. Jian Daosheng spoke again. "Of course, Fellow Daoist, rest assured. Our Immortal Boat's conviction to cross the High Wall has never wavered. Cooperating with us may be your only option to achieve your wish." Li Fan seemed to suddenly remember something and asked with a frown, "What is the reason for your Immortal Boat's persistence?"

"Is it solely because there is another half of an Immortal Boat outside the High Wall?" Jian Daosheng did not answer directly but hinted, "Before this, the Immortal Boat's situation was similar to yours, Fellow Daoist. Now, although there might be another opportunity, we are already in a precarious position."

"Moreover, with the precedent of the Merchant Immortal Boat, our attempt to replicate the feat of crossing the High Wall..."

"Is not as difficult as imagined."

"Limited to our Mystic Immortal Boat," Zhong Daogong added. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, observing the elders of the Immortal Boat. "It seems your Immortal Boat still has secrets." Zhong Daogong smiled without speaking.

"Since you have such confidence, why should I be timid?" Li Fan said sternly. "I will do my utmost to assist the Immortal Boat's success. All that I have learned from Da Qi throughout my life was originally not meant to be passed on. But now..." The elders of the Immortal Boat could not help but show a hint of joy in their eyes.

"To tell you the truth, apart from the True Immortal Sigils, I have delved deepest into the path of formations. Moreover, I have mastered an ancient divine technique that can communicate with the star sea's consciousness..." Li Fan raised his head and began to introduce himself to everyone. The eyes of the Immortal Boat members lit up with excitement.

"Is the True Immortal Sigils researched by Da Qi the highest grade among those you displayed, Fellow Daoist, the one called 'Creation'?" Zhong Daogong asked the most crucial question. Li Fan immediately put away his arrogant expression. "Given my status in Da Qi, among the True Immortal Sigilss I could access, 'Creation' is indeed the highest."

"However..."

Chapter 1339

"This 'Creation' is not thehighest achievement of the Great Qi's research into True Immortal Sigils," Li Fan said, his expression somewhat dazed and melancholic.

As expected, his words instantly sent tremors through the elders of the Immortal Boat. They had personally experienced the marvels of 'Creation'. Even though it was Li Fan's relayed version, undoubtedly weakened, its power far surpassed single True Immortal Sigilss like 'Xuān'. This indicated that the true 'Creation' script possessed the miraculous power to turn decay into wonder. Yet now, Li Fan claimed that the Great Qi civilization had comprehended True Immortal Sigilss that surpassed 'Creation'?

"This... is what you say true, fellow Daoist?" Even the most composed Zhong Daogong could no longer maintain his composure, exclaiming. The other elders of the Immortal Boat also fixed their gazes on Li Fan.

"How would I dare to speak falsely," Li Fan said with a serious expression. "That script is Great Qi's highest secret, accessible only to those at my Master's level. I only learned of it a few times when I accompanied my Master, listening to him speak casually."

"It seems... to be related to the 'Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals'."

"'Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals'?" Li Fan's few words caused the Immortal Boat elders to reveal varied expressions, their minds racing with conjecture.

Li Fan observed their reactions. To increase the credibility of his words, he added, "This script is indeed extraordinary. Since my Master began researching it, some of the True Immortal Sigils structures that he habitually used in his daily teachings have undergone subtle changes. But precisely because of these seemingly insignificant alterations, the overall efficiency of writing True Immortal Sigilss has nearly transformed..."

In front of everyone, Li Fan's brush moved like a dragon, writing two script structures in the air. They were identical in shape, but subtle differences existed in their curves and orientations. The elders of the Immortal Boat stared blankly at these two script structures, as if an infinite magic had captured their attention.

It took nearly half a day before Zhong Daogong was the first to regain his senses. Without disturbing the other elders' comprehension, he turned away from the floating scripts and attempted to replicate them himself. As he sketched, a look of joyful realization spread across his face. These different script structures were precisely the True Immortal Sigilss, seemingly related to the 'Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals', that Li Fan had obtained from the bloodline of the Netherfolk.

That True Immortal Sigils seemed to be endless, containing the supreme principles of heaven and earth. Although Li Fan had by chance glimpsed a corner of it in this life, his power was insufficient to fully reproduce it. His memory of that mysterious script had vanished with the failed attempt to comprehend it, leaving only faint impressions of the countless subtle structures that formed it. Currently, Li Fan was presenting these character structures, derived from the 'Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals', to deceive the elders of the Immortal Boat.

To call it deception would be inaccurate. The 'Transformation Between Immortals and Mortals' held an extremely high status. Even a tiny fraction of it would be inexhaustible for the elders of the Immortal Boat. As it was, the elders, engrossed in their comprehension, finally awoke one after another, as if they had been struck by a revelation.

"Wrong, wrong! I never imagined that our usage for the first half of our lives was entirely incorrect!"

"It can actually be written like this. With just this subtle modification, the efficiency of writing True Immortal Sigilss has increased by more than ten percent!"

"Not just efficiency. True Immortal Sigilss written using this method seem to possess a naturally higher degree of completeness."

...The elders chattered excitedly, their hearts filled with joy. Li Fan, in this simple manner, had once again proven his worth.

For the next month, Li Fan officially resided on the Immortal Boat. Zhong Daogong specially created a small courtyard for Li Fan at the top of the Immortal Boat's divine tree, within the Immortal Severing Tower, to demonstrate his high regard. Li Fan did not disappoint the people of the Immortal Boat. Single-handedly, he nearly completed the Immortal Boat's rather barren formation system.

"With a wise elder leading the way, the Immortal Boat's research on formations has leaped forward a hundred years overnight," exclaimed Elder Meng Xiaomeng of the Immortal Boat. He carefully inscribed the formation knowledge imparted by Li Fan into jade slips. Meng Xiaomeng had always opposed the Immortal Boat placing all its bets on the True Immortal Sigils. Therefore, in addition to researching True Immortal Sigilss, he had also dabbled in formations and elixirs, attempting to open up other possible paths to survival for the Immortal Boat. However, without the guidance of a renowned master, and relying solely on his own study of the ancient formations recorded in the Immortal Boat, Meng Xiaomeng's skill in formations was mediocre. Upon witnessing Li Fan's formation theories this past month, he was astonished and filled with renewed enthusiasm. He became completely engrossed in his studies, even leaving the research of True Immortal Sigilss behind.

Zhong Daogong did not intervene. After all, there were too many elders researching True Immortal Sigilss on the Immortal Boat; the absence of one Meng Xiaomeng would not make a difference. However, establishing a legacy in formations was quite important. During this period, Li Fan not only established a formation legacy system for the Immortal Boat but, under his leadership and assistance, all of the Immortal Boat's protective formations were rebuilt. With the new formations, and after testing by all the elders, the Immortal Boat's resistance to attacks increased by more than threefold. The defensive capabilities of important locations such as the Immortal Severing Tower, Immortal Pivot Department, and the divine tree were also greatly enhanced.

In fact, there was a minor incident during this time. Initially, the elders of the Immortal Boat had some reservations about rebuilding the defensive formations, especially entrusting such a critical matter concerning the Immortal Boat's safety to Li Fan, a newcomer. The elders were divided. However, after witnessing Li Fan effortlessly dismantle the original defensive grand formation and pass through numerous restrictions as if they were nonexistent within mere breaths, the elders, sweating profusely, quickly unified their opinions in affirmation.

Establishing a legacy, building new defenses. With these two achievements, Li Fan had quickly earned the deep trust of most people on the Immortal Boat. Furthermore, since integrating into the Immortal Boat, Li Fan had behaved with gentle demeanor and treated everyone with utmost respect. To anyone who sought him out, he answered all questions truthfully and thoroughly. Soon, Li Fan had earned an excellent reputation among the Immortal Boat elders, with many visitors coming to his courtyard.

One day, Li Fan was teaching the 'Tai Jia Divine Technique' to several elders who had come to visit his small courtyard. "As the body transforms into the universe, the intent gallops through the star sea. Tai Jia without limit, divine travel; Tai Jia without change, divine transformation; Tai Jia without emptiness, divine divinity..." The elders were all engrossed in True Immortal Sigilss and initially had little interest in this so-called divine ability. However, after hearing the complete discourse on this technique, they all became solemn.

"Brother Li, is this divine ability merely a fragment?" Elder Lu Yuzhi of the Immortal Boat asked with a frown. After mingling with the Immortal Boat for so long and gaining everyone's favor, their mutual address had become more familiar.

"Although it is a fragment, it does not hinder communication with the consciousness of the star sea. However, even with the consciousness of the star sea in its nearly destroyed state, for cultivators like us to contact it is not an easy feat. Whether you succeed or not will depend on your own fortune." After finishing the explanation of the Tai Jia Divine Technique, Li Fan said with a smile, looking at everyone.

Lu Yuzhi nodded, "We naturally understand this. Communicating with the star sea is akin to the 'Unity of Heaven and Man' realm of antiquity. Both the efficiency of comprehension and deduction cannot be compared to normal circumstances."

"It is even of great benefit to our comprehension of True Immortal Sigilss. Heh heh, those old fellows who didn't come today will surely regret it when they find out! We few must keep our mouths shut tightly; we will not reveal it unless they pay a hefty price," Gan Jingda said with a chuckle after understanding the profundity of the 'Tai Jia Divine Technique', stroking his beard.

"Brother Li's knowledge is truly terrifyingly profound. It's as if you possess an inexhaustible treasure trove; every time I visit, I gain new insights," Elder Nangong Lie's words were met with nods and praise from everyone present. Facing their compliments, Li Fan calmly replied, "My lifelong wish is to pour out all the knowledge in my mind before I perish, leaving it for the Immortal Boat. After that, in the final moments of my life, I will stake my all to see the scenery beyond the The Great Barriers!"

Li Fan spoke with a sense of freedom and detachment. The elders in the room felt a mixture of regret, heartache, and pain.

"Brother Li, is there really no other way?"

"The Immortal Boat's treasury seems to have some secret medicines for extending life. Perhaps..."

Li Fan waved his hand dismissively, "After the protective formations were completely rebuilt, Elder Zhong already took me to the secret vault to test it. My lifespan has indeed reached its end; no heavenly treasures or earthly materials could help. I have long accepted my fate."

"I can only say that the backlash from beyond the The Great Barriers is truly terrifying and awe-inspiring. However, it has only stoked my curiosity further. My entire life, I am determined to see what lies beyond those The Great Barriers!" Li Fan's gaze was resolute. The people of the Immortal Boat fell silent, their sighs echoing.

Suddenly, Li Fan seemed to recall something. "Oh, right. When I suffered the backlash earlier, my Master said that if it weren't for the puppet I obtained from the Immortal Boat's treasury that absorbed some of the force, I would have had less than twenty years of life left, and would have directly perished. What is the origin of that puppet? When I chose it, I only thought its appearance was peculiar. I didn't expect it to have the ability to contend with the forces from beyond the The Great Barriers."

As Li Fan spoke, he showed the elders of the Immortal Boat an image of the puppet, standing silently with its eyebrows lowered. When Li Fan had chosen it from the treasury, they had accompanied him the entire time. Hearing Li Fan's words, they all remembered, their expressions becoming strange.

"This puppet actually has such a marvelous use?" The crowd exchanged glances, but no one knew its origin.

"Wait, I'll go and check," Lu Yuzhi said, rising with a serious expression. After all, a treasure that could withstand the backlash from beyond the The Great Barriers was not something they could treat lightly.

"Brother Li, why didn't you ask about such an important matter sooner?" Nangong Lie shook his head. Li Fan smiled, "At that time, upon hearing that my end was near and my brilliant future had been shattered, my state of mind collapsed. How could I have cared about so much? But now that I've slowly recovered and just casually mentioned the Immortal Boat's treasury, I remembered it again." With Li Fan's explanation, the people of the Immortal Boat found it difficult to probe further.

Lu Yuzhi returned shortly after. "According to the records, this puppet comes from the destroyed cultivation world, 'Carefree Bliss'." Lu Yuzhi waved his hand, displaying an image for everyone. Upon hearing the somewhat familiar name, Li Fan's heart stirred.

"The cultivators of this world disliked conflict. As their name suggests, they were naturally unrestrained and lived carefree lives, unwilling to be bound by anything. This puppet was purchased by a merchant of the Immortal Boat named Jia Chu when they passed through the Carefree Bliss world." The image changed, and a disheveled man in tattered clothes appeared before them. The era was too distant, and the image reproduction was unstable, with frequent jumps and intermittent sound. However, this did not prevent everyone from understanding the events of that time.

"This thing is an absolute treasure. You won't lose out by taking it!" the disheveled man said, rubbing his crotch and then sniffing his hand before speaking loudly.

"This puppet does seem extraordinary, but your price of one hundred thousand high-grade spirit stones is too high. It exceeds my authority." A clear voice sounded from outside the image.

"This was a merchant in the Carefree Bliss world back then, named..."

"Jia Chu. Yes, Jia Chu. He was the one who completed this transaction and strictly followed the Immortal Boat's regulations, recording the entire transaction process and archiving it, so that we can see the scene after ten thousand years," Lu Yuzhi explained to Li Fan. "It's a pity that this Jia Chu sided with the Merchant Immortal Boat during the Immortal Boat's schism back then. We don't know where he is now," Lu Yuzhi said with some regret. Li Fan nodded slightly and continued watching the unfolding scene.

Jia Chu stood up, seemingly without any reluctance. The disheveled man, who had previously appeared indifferent, suddenly became anxious. He grabbed Jia Chu's arm and said with a fawning smile, "If the price is too high, we can negotiate. Eighty thousand, just eighty thousand is fine! A mere eighty thousand high-grade spirit stones is but a drop in the bucket for your renowned Merchant Immortal Boat!"

Jia Chu paid no mind to the disheveled man's hands gripping him tightly. He calmly said, "Although our Merchant Immortal Boat is prosperous, we cannot spend eighty thousand spirit stones on a puppet whose origins are unknown."

"Thirty thousand spirit stones is the limit I can decide. Any more would require reporting, which is too troublesome; it's better not to make the transaction." Jia Chu's tone was decisive.

"Thirty thousand? You're squeezing me too hard," the disheveled man grumbled, greatly displeased.

"If you think the price is too low, you can try to buy it from the local merchant guilds in the Carefree Bliss world," Jia Chu said indifferently. The disheveled man scratched his head, not replying.

"The local merchant guilds of the Carefree Bliss world are actually intertwined with our Merchant Immortal Boat. It's not an exaggeration to say they are our Immortal Boat's branch in the Carefree Bliss world. This disheveled cultivator knows this, which is why he responded so sullenly," Lu Yuzhi explained.

Finally, after another round of bargaining, Jia Chu purchased the puppet for forty-five thousand spirit stones. Before handing over the spirit stones, Jia Chu suddenly asked, "Where did you obtain this puppet?" The disheveled man's expression immediately became wary.

Jia Chu pointed indifferently to the recording orb beside him, "It's just routine procedure; you don't have to say if you don't want to. However, if there are any problems with this puppet later, we will still find you."

Chapter 1340: Journey Through the Ethereal Starry Sky

"The footprints of our Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat have spread throughout the sea of stars. If we truly wish to find someone, even if they flee to the desolate lands at the edge of the starry sea, they cannot escape," Jia Chu said, his calm tone exuding a subtle dominance and confidence.

Even the Immortal Venerable Elders of the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat, after ten thousand years, couldn't help but straighten their backs slightly, their eyes filled with pride.

The disheveled man in the vision, hearing this, trembled slightly and quickly waved his hands, "No, no, no. It's better to just hand over all these troublesome matters at once. I, for one, fear trouble!" With that, the disheveled man produced a cucumber from somewhere.

He took a bite with gusto as he reminisced.

"This thing, it was actually a wounded person I saved out of kindness back then. They gave it to me as thanks for saving their life. They said it could do something called 'Guardian Against Calamities and Misfortune'."

"I don't know the exact meaning, I just guessed that perhaps it could shield the owner from disaster in critical moments, so I happily accepted it." The disheveled man paused here, wiping the juice from the corner of his mouth.

"That's what I thought. However, not long ago, I was almost beaten to death by those debt collectors, and this thing didn't do a single thing..." The man burped, speaking with a look of misfortune.

Jia Chu chuckled upon hearing this, "So it's useless, yet you sold it to our Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat?"

"It's not useless, it just can't save lives," the disheveled man corrected Jia Chu.

"Although this puppet is useless to me, your immortal boat travels the sea of stars, and you will always encounter cultivators who need it. Sell it for ten times the price, and you'll definitely make a fortune. Besides, with your immortal boat's connections, even if your luck is poor and you can't find a buyer, you'll always find a few suckers, right? You won't be stuck with this thing..." the disheveled man earnestly persuaded.

Judging by Jia Chu's expression, he seemed to have never cared much about the profit or loss of this transaction and had always intended to buy this puppet.

Lu Yuzhi sighed with emotion, "Jia Chu's style of doing business is truly the standard for an immortal boat merchant. For the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat that traversed the sea of stars in ancient times, spirit stones were merely numbers. Even temporary profits and losses weren't particularly important..."

"What's truly important is the richness of the immortal boat's hidden treasures and the increase in bargaining chips against True Immortals," Zhong Daogong's voice suddenly came from outside the small building.

Before his voice finished, he had already appeared inside the room.

"Elder Zhong." Everyone saluted him. Zhong Daogong nodded in return, his gaze falling on the scene in the hall.

The recording of the scene paused temporarily due to Zhong's arrival.

"You have time to visit?" Li Fan asked with a smile. As the Chief of the Immortal Severing Tower, Zhong Daogong was in charge of all major and minor affairs of the immortal boat, and simply didn't have as much free time as other elders to frequently visit Li Fan's courtyard.

"Just now, when Yuzhi was looking through the records, I also discovered something interesting. Let's continue watching..." The recorded image resumed.

At the end of the transaction, in addition to the previously agreed-upon forty-five thousand spirit stones, Jia Chu also gave the disheveled man an extra five thousand spirit stones.

"Brother Jia, what do you mean by this?" While asking this verbally, the man didn't hesitate at all and quickly pocketed the five thousand spirit stones, for fear that the other party might go back on his word.

Jia Chu smiled peacefully, "It's just a casual inquiry about the information of the injured person you saved back then. If this puppet can truly be sold at a high price in the future, we might continue to acquire it. Let's keep this channel of information for future dealings." The disheveled man, having received the spirit stones, was very accommodating, "Just this matter? Then no problem!"

"Let me think, what was that person's name again. Right, Sun Piaomiao! He's not a native cultivator from our Carefree Realm, but a cultivator from the Xuanhuang Realm who, while crossing the star sea, encountered a celestial phenomenon, the 'Heavenly Whale Leaping'. Although he narrowly escaped death, he was still severely injured and fell from the sky.

"If I hadn't suddenly taken pity and taken good care of him, he definitely wouldn't have survived in his condition at that time." The disheveled man said with some pride.

"Xuanhuang Realm, Sun Piaomiao..." The image abruptly stopped with Jia Chu's low murmur. The name Sun Piaomiao caused a stir among the immortal boat elders.

"This name sounds a bit familiar. Have I heard it somewhere?"

"Sun Piaomiao, Sun Piaomiao..." In fact, the moment Li Fan heard the name, his heart also gave a jolt.

For Sun Piaomiao was precisely the ancestor of the Medicine King Sect in the Xuanhuang Realm. Back then, Sun Piaomiao had traveled through various realms, leaving behind a travelogue that recorded information about eighteen anchor points in other cultivation worlds.

Among them were Carefree Realm and Mystic Merchant. Li Fan looked at Zhong Daogong, who had suddenly arrived, "The interesting thing you mentioned is referring to this Sun Piaomiao?" Zhong Daogong nodded and lightly waved his hand, and illusions of three items instantly appeared before everyone.

"According to the records preserved by the immortal boat, ten years after the puppet transaction was completed, Sun Piaomiao visited the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat and accompanied the immortal boat in pursuing a celestial phenomenon, the 'Starfall Hail'."

"Starfall Hail was one of the extremely rare phenomena in the sea of stars at that time. Countless giant ice-crystal-like meteorites roared like a torrential storm from the depths of darkness, smashing everything in their path into smithereens. The impact generated dazzling sparks and ice mist, creating a terrifying storm of intertwined cold and heat along their path. Even being brushed by the edge of this storm would be a world-destroying catastrophe for the cultivation world," Zhong Daogong briefly explained the celestial phenomenon of Starfall Hail.

"Although Starfall Hail is extremely dangerous, at the core of countless ice meteor swarms, a peculiar substance called 'Extreme Abyss Ice Dust' is often born. It is said that just a single grain of this substance can freeze an entire ordinary-sized cultivation world. And the force of breaking ice that erupts when the ice shatters has a power almost capable of creating the heavens and earth."

"So, was the pursuit successful?" Li Fan asked, engrossed.

"There is no record in the Mystic Immortal Boat. However, I speculate that some 'Extreme Abyss Ice Dust' must have been found. Sun Piaomiao took some, and at the same time left three items as bargaining chips for the exchange. As for the rest, they were likely taken by the Merchant Immortal Boat later," Zhong Daogong's tone was filled with regret.

Li Fan was not surprised by this. After all, the Merchant Immortal Boat, as the de facto victor, had taken away almost all the quasi-immortal power within their immortal boat.

According to Zhong Daogong's description, the power unleashed during the Starfall Hail was not much weaker than that of a True Immortal. It was normal for it to be chosen by the Merchant Immortal Boat.

The key was the three items left behind by Sun Piaomiao.

"I don't recall seeing these items in the hidden treasures of the Hundred Heard Immortal Record before. Did they also go with the Merchant Immortal Boat?" Li Fan frowned.

Zhong Daogong smiled, "Not exactly. These three items are still in our Mystic Immortal Boat's collection. It's just that what you visited earlier was only the surface layer of the hidden treasures. These items should be in the second layer." Li Fan was not annoyed and instead teased, "It sounds like there's a third, and even a fourth layer."

"The deepest is the third layer. You also know about the theft by external thieves back then, but these are merely necessary precautions," Zhong Daogong's expression remained normal, without any hint of embarrassment.

Li Fan didn't dwell on this matter further and his gaze fell upon Sun Piaomiao's three遗物. Their style was very similar to that of the bowing puppet.

The first was a gray bird with broken wings. Although its wings were broken, it still held its head high and neighed. The second was a tree with a three-pronged fork, where the branches ended not in leaves, but in countless miniature trees.

As for the third item, it was something Li Fan was very familiar with. It was a small cauldron, and judging by its appearance, it was almost identical to the Medicine King Cauldron of the Medicine King Sect!

"Sun Piaomiao doesn't look like any peerless expert. Yet his gifts contain the power to contend with the The Great Barriers..." Li Fan's tone was enigmatic.

Zhong Daogong said solemnly, "The era Sun Piaomiao belonged to had not yet severed the immortal path. There are even records of True Immortals descending to the mortal realm. Although from the records of Sun Piaomiao's activities with the immortal boat, his strength seemed to be at the peak of Dao Integration, it's impossible to rule out the possibility that he was hiding his strength." Li Fan nodded slightly.

He did not voice his own speculation. Sun Piaomiao's ability to cross the star sea alone and return safely was undoubtedly a testament to his formidable strength.

However, he definitely did not ascend to immortality. Throughout the long ancient history of the cultivation world, any records of individuals from the Xuanhuang Realm ascending to immortality had been mysteriously erased, leaving no trace.

This was why True Immortals were said to have no names. Perhaps only eyewitnesses like Mo Rubin, who lived through the transition between old and new eras, could remember the story of the Nine Refinements Observation's ancestor, Master Wonderful Law, ascending and then falling, through oral transmission.

Firstly, the descendants of the Medicine King Sect had never mentioned their ancestor Sun Piaomiao ascending to immortality. In fact, Sun Piaomiao's ultimate fate was unclear.

Did he die of old age, die unexpectedly, or disappear mysteriously? The records about Sun Piaomiao only continued until he returned from his travels in the star sea.

After that, there was no further information. Secondly, Sun Piaomiao did not exist solely in the records of the Medicine King Sect.

Many ancient texts in the Xuanhuang Realm mentioned him, this peerless expert who saved lives and founded the lineage of the Medicine King.

His existence had not been erased.

"When Sun Piaomiao crossed the star sea back then, he also wanted to venture deeper, but he discovered some peculiarity of the star sea where the Xuanhuang Realm was located and eventually turned back..."

"Was it unwillingness or inability?" Just as Li Fan was pondering, Zhong Daogong spoke again, "Like the bowing puppet you chose earlier, all three items left by Sun Piaomiao have been meticulously examined by the immortal boat and nothing special has been found. However, since they all came from this Sun Piaomiao, perhaps they also hide some secrets..." Li Fan did not reply, and the other elders were becoming restless.

"Then why aren't you going to check them quickly!" Li Fan said to Zhong Daogong with a faint smile. Zhong Daogong smiled slightly, "With your contribution during this period, I believe no elder will object to you entering the second layer of the Hundred Heard Immortal Record's hidden treasures." Not long after, Li Fan, along with the other elders, entered the second layer of the Hundred Heard Immortal Record.

Compared to the first layer, this space was significantly smaller. All the treasures were sealed within orbs of light.

The orbs were of various colors, floating in the air. The defensive measures were not formations, nor restrictions, nor True Immortal Sigils.

Li Fan squinted, observing the myriad orbs of light, faintly sensing a trace of life from them.

"These orbs of light... are alive?" Zhong Daogong nodded in praise, "Your intuition is truly sharp!"

"Yes, the guardians of the second layer of the treasure vault are a kind of miraculous being: the Celestial Star Lotus. This creature was extremely rare even during the prosperous era of the star sea. Its dreamlike radiance shrouded more than half the star domain, weaving into the shape of a dreamlike lotus. When the flower bloomed, the star domain was bathed in dazzling light; when it fell, the star domain plunged into silent darkness."

"Whenever a world within the star domain was on the verge of destruction, lotus seeds would form within the Light Lotus. For countless eons, it has repeated this cycle... These masses of light before us were formed in this way." As Li Fan listened to Zhong Daogong's explanation, the grand scenes that occurred in the ancient star sea seemed to unfold before his eyes.

"The Merchant Immortal Boat took away quite a few treasures back then, and this Celestial Star Lotus is one of the most valuable that remained."

"The treasures are sealed within the lotus seeds and cannot be easily removed. If you want to forcefully take them..." Zhong Daogong snorted, "Unless you destroy the entire Celestial Star Lotus! This spiritual being, parasitic on the sea of stars, has survived countless tribulations with its life still intact. To destroy it, only immortal power can do it!"

"Furthermore, we have tested it, and even using the power of True Immortal Sigils could not damage it within a short period." The elders of the immortal boat clearly had great confidence in the Celestial Star Lotus's defenses.

A thought flashed through Li Fan's mind, "In my previous life, under the Great Formation of All Things Returning to the Void, this so-called Celestial Star Lotus didn't struggle for much longer."

"Now, I don't even need to use immortal formations; the Descending Dust Finger alone can destroy it. However, while destruction is easy, retrieving what is preserved within the lotus seeds is indeed somewhat difficult." The immortal boat elders, unaware of Li Fan's dangerous thoughts, worked together to open the orb containing Sun Piaomiao's three遗物.

All eyes focused on the three treasures. Li Fan, on the other hand, felt a slight stir in his heart. From the three-pronged tree, he sensed the same Return to Truth anomaly he had felt from the bowing puppet.

However, he did not voice it and carefully observed the items along with the immortal boat elders. The broken-winged gray bird and the second Medicine King Cauldron seemed to contain no special power.

"Guardian Against Calamities and Misfortune... approximates the projection of the Dao. Sun Piaomiao is indeed not simple."
