"And this ability was not passed down to the Medicine King Sect." Li Fan's gaze flickered, suppressing the surging urge to absorb the Return to Truth.

"Everyone, have you discovered anything?" Zhong Daogong asked after a long observation.

"I can't see anything unusual. But indeed, these items all give me a strange feeling," Lu Yuzhi's statement was echoed by a chorus of elders.

If one didn't know about the abnormality of these three items, they wouldn't seem out of place at first glance.

But if one observed them with prior knowledge, a sense of disharmony would arise.

If only one or two people felt this way, it could be dismissed as an illusion. But when more than ten elders all felt the same... it was definitely not a simple hallucination.

Chapter 1341

“An excellent method of concealment. Only to those who actively seek these items and know that they might hide secrets will their abnormalities become apparent.” To others…

“They are merely ordinary objects.” Everyone present now vaguely understood.

“If not for Brother Li's serendipitous discovery of the secret within that puppet, perhaps even after a thousand years, our Immortal Boat would not have detected their strangeness,” Elder Lu Yu sighed.

“The problem now is that we know they are peculiar, but we cannot find a way to unravel their mysteries.”

“Heh heh, don't rush. We managed to decipher the True Immortal Script, and these trifling things can defeat us? Don't tell me that Sun Piao Miao is stronger than a True Immortal?” The elders of the Immortal Boat were very confident in themselves.

Indeed, their talent was not to be underestimated. After seven consecutive days of observation, someone finally discovered the anomaly in Sun Piao Miao's遗物.

“Everyone, please pay attention to this small cauldron,” said Mo Yin Feng of the Immortal Severing Tower, a person usually taciturn and focused solely on his research.

“Previous surveys and appraisals by the Immortal Boat all deemed it a top-grade pill-refining magic artifact, even possessing a grotto-heaven space capable of generating Spirit Qi and cultivating spiritual plants. But…” As Mo Yin Feng spoke, he unleashed a 显 character, enveloping the Medicine King Cauldron.

As if caught in a blurry mist, lines of varying thickness, some tangible, emerged from the mist surrounding the Medicine King Cauldron.

They sliced through space and flew off in different directions, disappearing from everyone's sight in an instant.

“This… this Medicine King Cauldron is not a unique item? It's connected to existences in the starry sea?!” The other elders of the Immortal Boat were all visibly shocked.

Li Fan also narrowed his eyes, as he was the only one present who saw that one of the misty lines from the Medicine King Cauldron was heading in the direction of the Xuanhuang Realm.

As for the others…

“The vast majority of them are heading towards the Great Wall of Broken Realms. However, two or three are somewhere in the Abyssal Sea!” One of the effects of the 显 character was to reveal the connections between all things.

The millennia-old secret hidden within the Medicine King Cauldron was finally exposed under the illumination of the 显 character.

“If I'm not mistaken, Sun Piao Miao forged many such Medicine King Cauldrons back then. These cauldrons are all interconnected, sharing a mysterious link. Even across half the starry sea, they can sense each other's existence,” Elder Zhong Daogong gazed into the air, as if still seeing the dissipated lines.

“Based on the records of Sun Piao Miao's words and actions during his time in the Immortal Boat, this person traveled extensively between the stars, his footprints reaching even further than ours. The forging of this Medicine King Cauldron was not easy, and he intentionally dispersed them throughout the starry sea… One of his purposes might have been to use their positions to anchor himself,” Elder Mo Yin Feng said unhurriedly.

“It's likely far more than that. After all, the world-ending calamity had not yet broken out, and the positions of the various cultivation worlds in the starry sea were relatively fixed. If it was just to avoid getting lost, there were many easier methods; why would he go to such lengths!”

“Indeed. If I recall correctly, the beacon information of each realm back then was not considered a top secret. Since Sun Piao Miao could traverse the starry sea, obtaining accurate beacon information should not have been difficult.” The crowd discussed animatedly, while Mo Yin Feng listened in silence.

Only after the elders quieted down did he clear his throat and say, his voice somewhat ethereal, “If it were merely to explore the known starry sea, it would naturally not require such effort. But what if it was to venture beyond the Great Void?” At these words, everyone's expression changed.

“The Great Void?” This was a term Li Fan had never heard before. His confusion was genuine, and he looked to Elder Zhong Daogong, who was deep in thought, seeking an answer.

After a moment of contemplation, Zhong Daogong slowly explained, “Back then, the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat's footprints spanned the explored star regions, and we even had merchants stationed in the barren lands at the edges of the starry sea.”

“But in reality, the civilized starry sea is not infinite. Beyond the barren lands lies the Great Void, an endless expanse of pure nothingness.”

“No one knows the extent of the Great Void, nor has anyone ever managed to escape it. Any cultivator who attempts to cross the Great Void faces only one outcome: to be utterly lost!” Zhong Daogong's expression was solemn.

“However, the explored starry sea then was far more vibrant than the current Abyssal Sea, with ample space for survival. Most cultivation worlds couldn't even reach the fringe of the barren lands, so few cultivators paid much attention to the existence of the Great Void.”

“Still, as cultivators, it's in our nature to break free from all restraints. Thus, there has always been a small number of cultivators who wished to break through the Great Void and explore the secrets beyond. This Sun Piao Miao was clearly one of them. Unfortunately, none succeeded, and neither did he.”

“The Great Void, the The Great Barriers. It seems the predicament of us cultivators has never changed, from ancient times to the present,” Li Fan murmured with a sigh.

He thought to himself, “The Great Void, could this be the reason Sun Piao Miao couldn't continue his explorations? If so, then the eighteen beacons he left behind back then are somewhat strange. The vastness of the star regions he explored surely included more than eighteen cultivation worlds, yet he only left these…”

“But what secret could possibly be so profound that it couldn't be openly stated, forcing him to hide it in this manner?” Countless questions arose in Li Fan's mind.

“Carefree Bliss, Mystic Merchant, Vast Sea, Northern Ge, Spiritual Hill…” Having once been the Young Master of the Medicine King Sect, Li Fan was naturally aware of the information passed down by Sun Piao Miao, the sect's founder.

However, he hadn't paid much attention to it back then. Firstly, the great tribulation had descended, and the realms were in ruin; secondly, due to the existence of the Immortal Ruins, even if these cultivation worlds hadn't been destroyed, their spatial positions would have undoubtedly shifted.

Sun Piao Miao's beacons had therefore lost their meaning.

“What if Sun Piao Miao foresaw the current situation back then and thus left behind the Medicine King Cauldrons to assist?” a bold guess surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

There was no concrete evidence; it was merely a sudden flash of inspiration. The Immortal Boat elders' discussion continued.

“The power contained within this Medicine King Cauldron is very mysterious. Perhaps by leveraging this connection, one could maintain a sense of direction within the Great Void. That way, even if the exploration failed, at least they could return safely, rather than losing their lives in vain.”

“Know this, the Great Void is a literal void. According to limited records, not only light and Spirit Qi but even the stage for divine sense to propagate is nonexistent; it's a place of absolute nothingness…” Mo Yin Feng's speculation earned agreement from some of the Immortal Boat elders.

Exploring the Great Void was one of the highest ideals and pursuits of cultivators at that time. It was entirely possible that Sun Piao Miao had done so.

“Regardless of his purpose, if we can understand the mysterious power that maintains the connection of this small cauldron, it would undoubtedly be a good thing for our Immortal Boat.” With a clear goal, the subsequent research progressed much more smoothly.

Following the unanimous decision of all the elders, including Li Fan, it was decided to completely refine the Medicine King Cauldron and force out the mysterious power hidden within.

As a prominent pill-refining treasure, the durability of the Medicine King Cauldron was beyond doubt. After all, its counterpart had once undertaken the mission of carrying the entire Medicine King Sect across the void.

However, to the Immortal Boat, which had already mastered the power of the True Immortal Script, the toughness of the Medicine King Sect was insignificant.

*Bang!* *Bang!* Under the crushing force of invisible giants, the bronze cauldron shattered into thousands of pieces in an instant, then continued to be ground down, breaking into even finer particles.

Finally, these particles ceased to exist. However, the expressions of the Immortal Boat elders became increasingly solemn as the dissolution progressed.

Because they discovered that the materials composing the Medicine King Cauldron did not disappear with the application of external force.

They merely became more condensed.

“Previously, our analysis indicated that the Medicine King Cauldron was forged from rare ores combined with heavenly treasures from various cultivation worlds.”

“Now it seems that was all a deception!”

“This substance…” The elders of the Immortal Boat stared intently at the final transformation within the force field. Its size was imperceptible to the naked eye, and even with constant supervision, divine sense could hardly detect it.

Condensed to the extreme, it was not a perfect sphere but slightly flattened, with convex surfaces on both sides, resembling a chess piece!

“The enormous Medicine King Cauldron was formed from this object?” All the elders were dumbfounded.

Li Fan also looked at the gray chess piece, his thoughts drifting back to the time when his Sacred Embryo clone, wielding an enhanced Medicine King Cauldron, charged towards the Immortal Ruins.

“Back then, I was so shocked by the True Immortal's world-ending gaze that I didn't find it odd. But now that I think about it, there were some inconsistencies.”

“In the eyes of a True Immortal, cultivators are like ants, let alone the Sacred Embryo who had only mortal cultivation at the time.”

“If the True Immortal was in seclusion, how could he have been disturbed?”

“Just as I am never interrupted by ants during my seclusion. Ants are torn apart by my protective measures and reduced to nothingness before they even get close.”

“But that True Immortal in the Immortal Ruins actually had his seclusion interrupted!”

“I recall that when I used an immortal formation to destroy the Azure Nether, he only sent a phantom clone to investigate.”

“And in that age…” Li Fan narrowed his eyes, as if returning to the scene. Within the pitch-black vision, a vast wilderness suddenly appeared.

The wilderness was covered with countless ruins. The True Immortal was left with only a layer of skin stretched over his bones, resembling a skeleton.

Dozens of blood-red chains were deeply embedded in the ground, confining the True Immortal to the wilderness. When he sensed Li Fan, or the Medicine King Cauldron wielded by Li Fan, this Dao Comprehension True Immortal suddenly opened his eyes!

“So that's how it is. What made the True Immortal open his eyes back then was not simply an external object intruding upon the Immortal Ruins.”

“It was the mysterious chess piece material used to forge the Medicine King Cauldron…” Li Fan’s thoughts returned to the present. Like the elders present, he kept his eyes fixed on the gray chess piece.

After returning to its original form, its connection with its "companions" in the starry sea seemed to have grown even stronger. Without needing to use the 显 character, everyone present could faintly sense the direction of the connection.

However, it was intermittent and not sufficient to serve as a guide.

“It seems that having only the chess piece is not enough. A special method is needed to complement it,” Elder Zhong Daogong also saw the underlying mystery.

“Interesting. Now I'm truly curious, what exactly was Sun Piao Miao trying so desperately to hide?”

“Although the origin of this gray chess piece is mysterious, if it's related to immortal power, it's not necessarily so. The Immortal Boat has collected quite a few immortal artifacts; we have the capability to judge this matter.”

“I, however, believe that this gray chess piece might indeed have come from the Immortal Realm,” Li Fan suddenly interjected, offering a completely different perspective amidst the elders’ discussions.

“Oh? What do you mean, Brother Li?” Li Fan now held considerable prestige within the Immortal Boat. His conclusions were not to be taken lightly, and everyone quickly asked for his reasoning.

Li Fan said solemnly, “It's very simple. Judging by its reaction to the 显 character, you should be able to infer it, right?” The elders were taken aback at first.

Then, quite a few of them slapped their thighs in sudden realization.

“That's right! Although the 显 character can stimulate the connections between things, this Medicine King Cauldron… ah, that is, this gray chess piece, its reaction to the remnants of True Immortal power is indeed too sensitive.”

“Precisely!” To verify Li Fan's conjecture, Elder Lu Yu took out an eighteen-colored strange stone.

“This strange stone was crafted from a piece of Jade Crystal Marrow. There are eighteen such stones in total, with the other seventeen in my separate courtyard.” As he spoke, Lu Yu activated the 显 character.

The power of the True Immortal Script enveloped the eighteen-colored strange stone. As if immortal power slowly permeated it, after a long time, mist and thin lines indicating direction emerged from within the stone.

The difference compared to the Medicine King Cauldron's reaction was immediately apparent.

“We previously thought it was due to the mysterious power contained within the cauldron. Now it seems it was the material of the cauldron itself that caused it!”

“There is a distinction between immortals and mortals. Objects from the Immortal Realm naturally have a higher sensitivity to immortal power.” The elders mused.

“But don't forget, the instructions from the chess piece just now indicated that there are many similar objects in the starry sea! Objects from the Immortal Realm…” Everyone was moved.

Elder Zhong Daogong, however, remained composed, “Let's first clarify the true nature of this gray chess piece.”

“Without understanding it clearly, sometimes objects from the Immortal Realm are more of a curse than a blessing.” Once the origin of the item was confirmed, the Immortal Boat had its own established procedures for researching items from the Immortal Realm.

There was no fear of the True Immortal Script's power damaging the item; they could use different True Immortal Scripts to test it to the maximum extent.

Concurrently, Li Fan, who was participating in the test, encountered the Immortal Boat's treasure for research for the first time: a blank scroll.

“The 'Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram'? It's clearly blank, so why is it named that?” Li Fan asked out of curiosity.

Elder Zhong Daogong replied with a hint of pride, “Precisely because it encompasses all phenomena in the world that it appears blank.”

Chapter 1342

The usage of the Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram is simple. It acts like a mirror, revealing the essence of things on a blank scroll. Of course, it might not be that straightforward and may require further contemplation...

"But no matter what, it's much easier than directly studying this gray chess piece," Zhong Daogong said, his lips moving as he slowly unfurled the blank scroll.

Like a long dragon, it floated above everyone's heads.

"Go!" The gray chess piece slowly flew towards the Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram. The moment it drew close, it vanished from everyone's sight.

On the blank scroll, strange and bizarre scenes began to appear, as if splatters of paint had been dropped. It looked like a storm of paint coalescing, with different colors weaving, colliding, and separating.

"It can analyze items from the Immortal Realm. Could this Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram also be from the Immortal Realm?" Li Fan asked casually, watching the ever-changing scene on the scroll.

"No, no. This Myriad Phenomena Diagram is undoubtedly an item from the lower realms," Jian Daosheng smiled, dispelling Li Fan's doubts.

"This diagram was obtained by the Mystic Merchant Immortal Boat from a fallen cultivator back then."

"The ancestor of this cultivator was originally a direct disciple of the renowned Star Dao Sect in the star sea. In ancient times, the Star Dao Sect's influence covered several neighboring cultivation worlds. Their profound techniques were said to be able to control the Dao of the star sea, even surpassing the Tai Jia Divine Techniques you taught us." Li Fan raised an eyebrow. "How did such a glorious sect decline?"

"That is an eternal mystery. Not to mention now, even back then, there were many theories with no definitive answer. Some say they angered True Immortals from the upper realm, and the upper realm descended with immortal punishment. Others say the Star Dao Sect attempted to refine and control the Heavenly Dao of the star sea, and was ultimately backlashed by the star sea..."

"In short, for some unknown reason, the high-ranking officials and pillars of the Star Dao Sect seemed to vanish overnight. The remaining lower-level disciples, who were unaware of what was happening, waited for a while and, upon realizing that the situation was irrecoverable, scattered like birds and beasts. Before leaving, they didn't forget to loot all the movable items from the sect."

"In less than a month, this once-famous great sect in the star sea had collapsed." Jian Daosheng sighed with emotion.

"This Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram was one of the treasures of the Star Dao Sect. It is said that in the Star Dao Sect's Star Connection Hall, where their cultivators connected with and perceived the Heavenly Dao of the star sea, such Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagrams were hung everywhere."

"Whenever the Heavenly Dao of the star sea established contact with a cultivator, it would leave traces on the scroll like an invisible ink brush. Over time, these scrolls began to depict the Heavenly Dao of the star sea within them." ... Hearing this, Li Fan couldn't help but interrupt: "Even if it's an engraved image of the Heavenly Dao of the star sea, how can it reveal things from the upper realm?" Although he asked as if he didn't know, Li Fan already had an answer in his heart.

Zhong Daogong smiled. "The star sea, the lower realm, is the foundation of all things."

"The ultimate manifestation of Dao projections. Even though the Immortal Realm is high above, it is not a castle in the sky. From the bottom up, although we cannot glimpse its true form, we can glimpse the shadow of the Dao." Li Fan, upon hearing this, appeared as if he was encountering this theory for the first time, his mind deeply shaken, and he fell into deep thought.

The evolution of the Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram continued. It was as if an invisible True Immortal was wielding a brush, its strokes vigorous and fluid.

Finally, the color storm settled into a single scene, calm and peaceful. Li Fan looked at the picture above his head, his pupils contracting slightly.

It was not a realistic depiction of every detail but rather an abstract, roughly sketched, freehand painting.

A towering figure occupied nearly half the frame, gazing down from above. Its face was indistinct, and it extended long arms.

Below the figure, a chessboard seemed to be set up. What was placed on the chessboard were not gray chess pieces. Instead, they were distinct cultivation worlds.

Those masses of color, which seemed to be just a mixture of different hues, when one tried to pry into them, countless images of different beings appeared in the mind.

They lived, aged, got sick, and died in their worlds, cultivating and fighting. The stories of these beings, along with the cultivation world itself, evolved to become a chess piece on the board.

*Boom...* After being displayed before them for a few breaths, the Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram suddenly seemed to be swept by a fierce wind. Not only did the scroll itself swing violently, but even the paint on the canvas was whipped by the storm. The image gradually disintegrated, and the gray chess piece slowly withdrew from the painting.

"The decomposition of the Myriad Phenomena Diagram has reached its limit," Zhong Daogong said in a deep voice, and together with the elders, they solemnly put away the Yin-Yang Myriad Phenomena Diagram.

Afterward, they looked at the gray chess piece floating silently in the air, falling into an eerie silence.

"If my understanding is correct, this gray chess piece seems to be a cultivation world after all living beings are extinct and all things have withered? And that tall figure should be a True Immortal from the upper realm?" It was Li Fan who spoke first.

No one responded. After a long while, Elder Jian Daosheng shook his head and offered his opinion: "Although the Myriad Phenomena Diagram's analysis points to the essence of the matter, it wouldn't be so shallow."

"The Medicine King Cauldron itself is almost a world within a world. It can spontaneously generate Spirit Qi and cultivate herbs and spiritual plants..."

"How could it be a world where life has completely died out?" Zhong Daogong concurred. "Indeed. I believe that this materialized form, or rather the world represented by the chess piece, does not represent death. Instead, it signifies a discarded piece on the chessboard that has lost its function and completed its mission." As he spoke, intersecting lines crisscrossed, and black and white pieces fell one after another. Then the black pieces surrounded and captured a group of white pieces. These captured white pieces left the chessboard and had no chance of returning. They transformed into gray, no longer participating in the contest between black and white pieces.

"Elder Zhong's explanation seems more plausible." The exchange between the Immortal Boat elders was not filled with much scheming; they often spoke their minds. Zhong Daogong's interpretation of the Myriad Phenomena Diagram's imagery garnered the agreement of the vast majority of the elders.

"True Immortals playing chess, descending into the mortal realm like pieces."

"If that's the case, what is the purpose of setting up this game? And is there ultimately a winner?" With this, a greater mystery appeared in everyone's hearts.

"We don't need to delve into matters involving True Immortals for now. What we do know is that this gray chess piece is likely an artifact formed by a True Immortal's sacrifice and refinement of a world. Even without the blessing of immortal Spirit Qi, it can be considered half an immortal artifact."

"And it's a complete set at that. If losing pieces that are no longer qualified to compete are so wondrous, it's hard to imagine what the black and white dual worlds that remained on the board would be like!" Lu Yuzhi said with longing.

"Heh heh, don't forget, the Immortal Realm has long been destroyed. Even the players might have perished, let alone those on the board. They've likely disappeared along with the Immortal Realm. On the other hand, these gray pieces that left the game earlier, by chance, have survived in the form of artifacts..." The elders of the Immortal Boat discussed amongst themselves.

Finally, after half a day of discussion, they reached a preliminary consensus. Since the essence was a world, they would refine it using methods for treating worlds. The elders nominated Jian Daosheng, Zhong Daogong, and four others to merge their minds and refine it together. Li Fan was not among the five. To avoid causing Li Fan any displeasure, the elders of the Immortal Boat specifically explained. Although Li Fan had gained the trust of the elders, he had joined the Immortal Boat for a relatively short time. The most important reason was his...

"Impending demise." If he participated now, he would die within twenty years, and they would have to re-refine it.

Wait. ... Li Fan waved his hand, appearing indifferent, and stared intently at the gray chess piece being refined by the group.

"This item was Sun Piaomiao's hidden contingency. If any abnormality occurs during the refinement process, it would indicate that Sun Piaomiao is still alive in this world..." Li Fan mused to himself. However, he was disappointed. The refinement process by the Immortal Boat elders was surprisingly smooth. Soon, after being refined, the grayness on the chess piece seemed to have faded somewhat. But it did not completely disappear.

"Has Sun Piaomiao truly perished?" The question flashed through Li Fan's mind. He suppressed it for now and inquired about the feelings of Zhong Daogong and the others.

"Marvelous. The previously orderly Heavenly Dao of the world seems to have been tempered by a heavy hammer and reforged. Such means are divine, truly divine!"

"It's not just forging a form. It has even forged hundreds of future possibilities. After refining it, we can manipulate it and transform it into any of these forms at will..."

"Uh, this transformation should require a vast amount of energy. Spiritual energy is not enough to support it."

"I tried, and even the power of True Immortal Sigils is insufficient," Nangong Lie's tone was filled with regret.

As if they had obtained a novel treasure, the Immortal Boat elders joyfully began to study the gray chess piece.

"Having this item is of great significance to our Immortal Boat!"

"Perhaps our resource problems will be greatly alleviated for a long time to come!"

"Ah, such a precious treasure was hidden in our Immortal Boat's treasury for so long. If not for Brother Li's reminder, we wouldn't have known how much longer it would have remained buried!" The Immortal Boat elders, with a mixture of joy and regret, finally transformed the gray chess piece's form. It was no longer the Medicine King Cauldron that could cultivate spiritual plants but something most suitable for the current Immortal Boat. *Bang! Bang!* *Bang!* Like ethereal heavy hammers striking, the originally small object slowly expanded its spatial structure. It directly covered the outer shell of the Immortal Boat. Under Li Fan's gaze, the Immortal Boat seemed to have grown and was covered with a layer of hard, gray keratin. This keratin layer not only provided protection but also continuously supplied Spirit Qi and resources to the interior of the Immortal Boat.

"With a protective shell of a world, our Immortal Boat's defensive capabilities have increased by more than double. Its stability has also seen a qualitative improvement."

"We no longer have to worry about the Immortal Boat suffering a catastrophic disaster from the accidental spread of the original power of a True Immortal Sigils!"

"The vitality accumulated within the gray chess piece for tens of thousands of years has now been entirely transferred to the Divine Tree."

"The effect is very significant! For at least a hundred years, under normal circumstances, the Divine Tree will no longer need to absorb nourishment..." The elders of the Immortal Boat were all beaming with joy.

At this moment, Li Fan suddenly said coldly, "Everyone, with such a great harvest this time, are you going to give up on crossing the The Great Barrier just like that?" The lively scene suddenly turned quiet. The elders subconsciously avoided Li Fan's gaze. Finally, Zhong Daogong stepped forward to appease him. "You don't need to worry."

"Crossing the The Great Barrier is our long-standing strategy and will not change due to the abundance of resources. You can rest assured of this."

"However..."

"The more preparation, the better. According to the resonance between these gray chess pieces, there are at least eleven other similar existences in the Abyssal Sea. Just one of them has brought about nearly earth-shattering changes to our Immortal Boat. If we were to gather the complete set of chess pieces..." Zhong Daogong's eyes gleamed.

"What do you think, my friend? In that case, we might not need any other assistance. With just the layered defenses on the outer shell, we could directly break through the The Great Barrier!"

"Moreover, the direction indicated by the resonance is very clear. At our speed, even if we travel throughout the entire star sea, it will take at most three years. And during the journey, it will not affect our other preparations..." Zhong Daogong's explanation was reasonable and logical.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before lightly nodding, accepting his statement. The slightly unusual atmosphere then returned to normal.

"If that's the case, then let's not delay and set off immediately."

"I am also very curious about what will happen when we gather this set of gray chess pieces," Li Fan said faintly. The elders exchanged glances and then held a simple discussion. They first reached a consensus: "The Mystic Immortal Boat definitely cannot be moved easily."

"Indeed, with the current hull strength, it is not enough to withstand the pressure at the foot of the The Great Barrier."

"Collecting the gray chess pieces does not require all of us to go out; it would be cumbersome. It's far more convenient for us to go alone."

"We can rely on the resonance, stay behind to command, and indicate the direction. Others can split up and go to all parts of the star sea to collect the gray chess pieces."

"This should be more efficient."

"At least three people per group, to prevent accidents."

"There are seven or eight of them that are not far from our current location, seemingly in the direction of the Great Wall of Broken Realms. Let's collect those there first..." While the elders were discussing, Li Fan also said in a deep voice, "I can also do my part. With the augmentation of my escape technique, even crossing the star sea would only take a day." This time, the Immortal Boat elders had no reason to refuse Li Fan's proposal.

With the preliminary discussion results reached, the first mission to retrieve the gray chess pieces would be undertaken by Li Fan, Nangong Lie, Lu Yuzhi, and four elders from the Academy of Proving the Dao named Xu Gongding.

"First, investigate the situation. If you encounter any danger, prioritize your own safety," Zhong Daogong instructed before their departure.

Chapter 1343: Forging Fragments of the Immortal Realm

The Great Wall of Broken Realms. Li Fan guided the phantom of a wooden sword, carrying Elder Nangong Lie and two other Immortal Boat elders, moving slowly within.

"Brother Li's escape technique is truly heaven-defying. Not only is it incredibly fast, but it also reduces the impact of the reverberating stellar force from the outside. With this protection, our search for the gray chess pieces should be much smoother," Nangong Lie exclaimed.

Lu Yuzhi echoed, "Indeed. Otherwise, just to resist this terrifying suction, we would have to expend the majority of our strength." Elder Xu Gongding remained silent, surveying the void outside, diligently searching for the whereabouts of the gray chess pieces.

As they were part of the same set of artifacts, their senses could only indicate a general area, not pinpoint an exact location. The broken realm’s ancient wall contained countless fragments of worlds. The gray chess pieces, in their artifact form, were hidden within these fragments.

To find a target among them was like searching for a needle in a haystack, especially since their divine sense was also affected here, making the exploration process even more arduous.

Li Fan now experienced this firsthand and finally understood the Heavenly Physician's predicament. It took thousands of years to collect fragments of the Heavenly Law Realm and was still incomplete; this made perfect sense.

Fortunately, the mysterious power the gray chess pieces used to conceal themselves was peculiar. Knowing there were hidden secrets within, one could detect their abnormality with a single glance. There was no need to worry about missing them during the search. Their luck was also quite good. Merely three days later, they found the first lost chess piece. It lay quietly on the ruins of the earth—a battle chariot made of rusted bronze. Five divine and incredibly majestic warhorses stood proudly before the chariot. The chariot's surface was covered in blade and sword engravings, appearing as if battered by wind and frost. Instead of transforming the chariot back to its original form in the void, the four individuals first stored it away for safekeeping, intending to hand it over to the Immortal Boat Elder Council for processing upon their return.

With the success of the first instance, the group was quite invigorated. Over the next ten days, the wooden sword phantom moved continuously, shuttling through the broken realm’s ancient wall. They found three more disguised chess pieces: a broken sword, a seemingly ordinary wine gourd, and a small wooden boat.

"I can't anymore, I need to rest," Li Fan said, his face pale and extremely weak, just as they were about to press on.

Lu Yuzhi realized, "We were careless. Such a heaven-defying divine ability must consume immense energy. With Brother Li continuously using it these past few days, it's no wonder he's reached his limit…" Nangong Lie asked with concern, "Brother Li, how long do you need to rest? Without your escape technique's enhancement, our search efficiency would be too slow relying solely on us!" Li Fan's expression was solemn as he assured them, "Don't worry, three days is enough for me to recover. The consumption of Spirit Qi is secondary; it's mainly the mental strain that's immense." Lu Yuzhi first praised Li Fan profusely, then took the opportunity to inquire about the principle behind this escape technique.

The elders of the Immortal Boat had long coveted Li Fan’s divine and skillful flying escape technique using the wooden sword phantom. However, Li Fan, who was usually generous in sharing his knowledge, had always been tight-lipped about this wooden sword divine ability, refusing to reveal even a sliver of information. The Immortal Boat elders had not given up, attempting to probe for information at every opportunity. This time, Li Fan's secrecy seemed to have slightly loosened.

"My escape technique is condensed from two supreme Dao intents. The first is the sword: the momentum of unwavering advance, bravely forging ahead."

"As for the second…" Li Fan paused, piquing the trio's curiosity. Then, he spoke slowly, "It is the 'Horizon at Arm's Length'! The ends of the earth are merely a short distance away. While crossing the sea of stars is incredibly long, if it is merely an arm's length, then it can be reached in a single step!" Subsequently, he explained the profound truths of these two supreme dao intents in detail to the three elders.

The three elders listened intently, nodding repeatedly and falling into deep thought. Li Fan, meanwhile, wore a cryptic smile. He had not distorted or fabricated anything during his explanation. With the Immortal Boat elders' knowledge, any fabrication would have been easily detected. Li Fan had merely concealed the most crucial element: the core of the escape technique, which was the 'Transformation of True and False.' Sword Dao, Horizon at Arm's Length—these were secondary. Without the support of the core 'Transformation of True and False,' it was impossible to achieve what Li Fan could, directly disregarding the numerous dangers and residual True Immortal power permeating the sea of stars during his escape. Li Fan did this intentionally, to use this "leaked" divine ability to distract the attention of the three Immortal Boat elders. Li Fan's objective, naturally, was the four retrieved chess pieces.

Perhaps due to psychological trauma from previous betrayals, even though the four individuals searching for the chess pieces this time were theoretically incapable of betraying the Immortal Boat, the Immortal Boat still enforced the rule of joint supervision. Each of the four controlled a fragment of a spherical object. When the four fragments were combined, they formed a sealed storage space, where the retrieved chess pieces were kept. Only when all four collaborated could the stored chess pieces be retrieved. In all other circumstances, they could only observe and supervise.

Originally, the attention of the four individuals was mostly directed towards these chess pieces from time to time. However, after Li Fan inadvertently and voluntarily exposed the secrets of his supreme escape technique, the other three elders inevitably became distracted, pondering everything Li Fan had taught them. Thus, Li Fan had more time to study the mysteries of these gray chess pieces without being noticed by the other three.

"To transform from the gray chess piece form requires immense energy support."

"Spiritual energy is insufficient, and True Immortal power is also not enough."

"Yet, the Immortal Boat has so far silently transformed them into an armored keratinous form…"

"It seems there are treasures in the second and third layers of the Immortal Boat's secret repository!" Li Fan snorted inwardly, his divine sense sweeping across the four chess pieces.

"Forged from the 'world,' perhaps these are gray chess pieces that have lost their value and turned to ash."

"If the Heavenly Physician’s Book of Heaven Mending compares the world to a person, then the entity that forged this set of chess pieces viewed the world as an 'artifact'."

"Although humans and artifacts are different, the fundamental principles are the same."

"The prerequisite for transformation is complete control over its basic mechanisms…" Sensing the four creations before him, Li Fan silently recited the 'Book of Heaven Mending.' Then, the small characters, after Li Fan's comprehension and modification, transformed into another chapter.

"However, by following the pattern, the principles of the human body have been replaced by methods for forging artifacts."

"Although some parts were forcibly transformed and are nonsensical, the vast majority… are effective!" Li Fan's eyes lit up. In his vision, the four objects sealed within the spatial sphere underwent a change. The distinct forms of the broken sword and battle chariot ceased to exist. They were replaced by bright lines woven vertically and horizontally. These lines originally converged at a common starting point. Outside of these lines, there were even more numerous and extremely intricate dim lines.

"The origin point of the lines is the initial gray chess piece form."

"And those darkened lines represent other forms the chess piece can switch to."

"So beautiful…" Li Fan was almost entranced. He had once faced the principles of the Xuanhuang Realm's heaven and earth. The intersecting lines that formed countless disparate beings and various scenes between heaven and earth stretched across the world. Li Fan originally thought the principles of the Xuanhuang Realm's heaven and earth were complex enough. But compared to the display before him…

"What constitutes the Xuanhuang Realm is merely a small part of it."

"The rest were forged by True Immortals using the laws of the Immortal Realm, exceeding the bounds of this world!" Li Fan was inexplicably shaken. "Observing these might allow me to vaguely touch upon a corner of the former Immortal Realm!" Li Fan closed his eyes, feigning rest. It was, in fact, to conceal the tumultuous waves surging within his heart. The Immortal Realm had been destroyed by the 'Dao Erasure Tribulation' for over ten thousand years. Everything about the former Immortal Realm had become the past. Even True Immortals were now extremely rare existences, hunted by civilizations beyond the The Great Barriers. But now, Li Fan had discovered fragments of the Immortal Realm, forged and hidden using special techniques. Or rather, to call them fragments was an exaggeration. They were merely created by processing and forging them in the lower realm's cultivation world, integrating some higher-tier Immortal Realm law fragments. However, for future generations in an era where the immortal path was severed ten thousand years later, this still held extraordinary significance, especially for Li Fan.

"The law fragments contained within a single chess piece are too scarce."

"But what about a complete set of chess pieces?"

"Sun Piaomiao founded the Medicine King Sect. Judging solely by his medical principles, his understanding of the world and the Heavenly Dao might not be inferior to the Heavenly Physician. If I can perceive the marvels of these chess pieces, there's no reason Sun Piaomiao wouldn't have; especially since he left the secrets for future generations through travelogues in such a special way. If the fragments of the Immortal Realm can be reproduced through fusion…" A flash of inspiration struck Li Fan.

"Could this be a 'preserving the fire' plan in some sense?" But an instant later, Li Fan naturally thought of the purpose of these gray chess pieces.

"My grand plan for the sublimation of the Xuanhuang Realm was already quite complete."

"If I could add some fragments from the former Immortal Realm…"

"The laws of the Immortal Realm would act like heavenly pillars, strengthening the principles of the Xuanhuang Realm. Ascending to a true Immortal Domain would be within reach!" Li Fan rapidly deduced the possibilities. The results made his heart pound.

"Moreover, if the Immortal Boat were to truly gather these gray chess pieces, they might lose their ambition to cross the The Great Barriers." Li Fan's vision was keen; he naturally recognized that Zhong Daogong's previous words were merely to placate them for the time being.

"However, this matter requires someone to cooperate with my act." After contemplation, his plan was set.

Another day passed. Li Fan feigned a semblance of recovery. He lightly sensed the locations of Senior Yin and Bai Hua, then guided the wooden sword phantom towards their direction. Coincidentally, their flight path overlapped with the sensing range of one of the chess pieces, thus not arousing suspicion from the Immortal Boat elders.

"Huh? This broken realm’s ancient wall seems to have changed somehow?" Li Fan exclaimed with feigned surprise and uncertainty while flying.

At his words, the three Immortal Boat elders who were secretly contemplating the Dao were startled awake. They inspected their surroundings carefully and then shook their heads in confusion. "Could it be that Brother Li's excessive consumption is causing him to hallucinate?"

"We don't feel anything unusual?" Facing their confusion, Li Fan maintained a grave expression but could not articulate any specific reason. The three Immortal Boat elders exchanged glances, and a sense of nervousness crept upon them. Li Fan's groundless apprehension did not seem feigned. Sometimes, a cultivator's inexplicable sense of vigilance was even more accurate than active investigation.

They dared not be negligent, their nerves highly taut, guarding against potential calamities. However, perhaps it was truly Li Fan's overthinking. After the time it took for an incense stick to burn, there were still no anomalies. The tense elders finally began to relax.

"It seems Brother Li was just worrying unnecessarily!" Nangong Lie said with a smile. Li Fan sighed, "Perhaps you are right!" and continued their search within the broken realm’s ancient wall.

Not long after the tension subsided, Li Fan suddenly cried out in alarm.

"Not good! Be careful!" With his startled outbursts, the Immortal Boat elders' auras surged, and their True Immortal Sigils were ready. However, after looking around and waiting for a long time, no changes occurred. The three elders stared at Li Fan.

Li Fan said apologetically, "I don't know why today, but I've had a constant sense of unease, as if imminent disaster were about to strike."

"You elders might not know, but my spiritual intuition for pre-warning is extremely accurate. It was precisely this keen intuition that allowed me to avoid many deadly calamities before…"

"I have no choice but to believe it!" Li Fan said with a wry smile. Lu Yuzhi consoled him, "It's alright, being cautious is good. Perhaps it's due to the great mental expenditure from traveling before; you haven't fully recovered yet. Why not rest a while longer?" Li Fan shook his head. "Stopping makes me feel even more uneasy. Let's continue." The three elders had no choice but to agree.

They continued to follow Li Fan. Subsequently, after Li Fan’s two staged alarms, the three Immortal Boat elders also became exhausted. Nangong Lie seemed hesitant to speak. Lu Yuzhi was carefully considering advising Li Fan to rest properly for now. Little did they know, Li Fan had already found Senior Yin and Bai Hua and had successfully contacted them discreetly. Soon, their communication was complete. In front of the three Immortal Boat elders, Li Fan's expression suddenly changed again: "Be careful!" This time, the Immortal Boat elders didn't brace themselves but burst into laughter, filled with exasperation: "Brother Li, you…" Before he could finish, an overwhelmingly terrifying deathly aura swept over them, as if they had personally fallen into a scene of world destruction. All four were momentarily stunned. Simultaneously, their vitality began to drain away at an alarming rate.

While everyone stood frozen, the sealed sphere containing the four gray chess pieces that they jointly guarded inexplicably lost control and tumbled out into the void.

"Not good!" Nangong Lie's expression shifted drastically, and he instantly regained his senses. The 'Suppressing' character technique was immediately unleashed towards the direction from which the deathly aura emanated. However, their opponent seemed to have anticipated his action and had already fled that area. Nangong Lie's attack missed. Lu Yuzhi also sobered up at this moment. He observed their rapidly declining vitality and his expression turned grim.

Chapter 1344

The Immortal Ship's elders were far from appearing as young as they seemed. Over thousands of years, they had repeatedly traced their own origin through the Ancient Character Art, reversing aging and maintaining their youth. However, backtracking could not equate to eternal life. Old age still accumulated quietly within them.

Now, Lu Yuzhi and the others had been attacked by Senior Yin's death qi. The accumulated aging from past years violently erupted along with it. The consequence was that the effectiveness of the Death Character Art was far greater than imagined. The three on the Immortal Ship's elder council found their hair instantly dyed with frost, turning completely white. Deep wrinkles rapidly took over their faces. An aura of decay surged within them.

"Ancient!" Lu Yuzhi, jolted awake, forcefully calmed himself and, with a slightly trembling hand, rapidly etched the character "Ancient" in the void. His target was not an unknown enemy, but themselves! Under the power of "Ancient," their rapidly aging bodies were somewhat alleviated. However, this was merely treating the symptoms, not the root cause.

The thing exuding the power of reversal before them was not a genuine True Immortal Sigils mark, but merely a crude imitation. The degree of state reversal was far less than the speed at which they were aging. Moreover, the surrounding death qi storm raged on, showing signs of escalating. If this continued, all four present might soon turn into mere piles of white bones!

Under the dual influence of the death qi storm and the Ancient Character Art, Li Fan and Xu Gongding also suddenly awoke. Their expressions were filled with terror and bewilderment.

"Hurry and go!" Lu Yuzhi, enduring with great difficulty, roared at Li Fan. Li Fan's hair, already a mix of black and white, had completely turned snow-white. However, he stared at the direction where the sealed spherical object had disappeared, struggling, "But what about that gray chess piece..."

"If your life is gone, then nothing remains!" Lu Yuzhi's eyes also held reluctance, but he still yelled. With a yell that seemed to vent his frustrations, the spectral image of his wooden sword was drawn, temporarily alleviating the onslaught of death qi. Sword light flashed, carrying the four of them as they fled from the terrifying, all-encompassing death qi. As their figures vanished into the horizon, Bai Hua and Senior Yin slowly revealed their true forms.

Suddenly unleashing such a massive death qi storm was not an easy task even for Senior Yin, who had just absorbed the Yin-Yang Pearl. As if losing control, the vortexes in his black and white eyes spun faster and faster. Senior Yin had to close his eyes and calm himself. Bai Hua, following Li Fan's instructions, cast out streaks of golden light, sealing the sphere they had just snatched.

"I wonder who those three people who accompanied the Sage Master were?"

"The characters they cast seem to be identical to the remaining True Immortal power in the sea of stars..."

"But speaking of which, the Sage Master's acting was truly superb. If he hadn't secretly transmitted a message for us to cooperate, he would have almost tricked me too." Bai Hua's expression was subtle as his hands continued to work on the sealing formation. This sealing formation was extremely intricate, but with Li Fan's guidance, Bai Hua could barely manage to complete its setup.

...Beyond the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

The group from the Immortal Ship, having escaped with their lives, still wore expressions of lingering fear. Even though they had escaped the range of the death qi storm, a small amount of death qi still lingered within their bodies, constantly eroding their lifespan.

"Let's return to the Immortal Ship first." Lu Yuzhi had become extremely frail, like an old man of seventy or eighty, seemingly nearing the end of his life. Even these few words were uttered with all his remaining strength. The others were not faring much better. Especially Li Fan, who could only shake his head slightly, indicating that he was too weak to use any escape arts or divine abilities. Among the four, only Nangong Lie was in relatively better condition. He helped support everyone as they flew towards the Immortal Ship, while simultaneously releasing a distress signal.

About fifteen minutes later, Zhong Daogong arrived with seven elders from the Immortal Ship. To prevent it from being a feint, they did not dispatch everyone, even though the lives of four elders were at stake. Zhong Daogong and his group, seeing the four on the verge of death, enveloped in an aura of decay and weakness, wore grave expressions. However, knowing that saving lives was paramount, they did not immediately question the reason behind the incident and instead took the four back to be treated.

Through the genuine Ancient Character Art and the efforts of various life-extending magic artifacts, they finally managed to temporarily pull the individuals back from the brink of crisis.

Three days later. Li Fan stood in a small courtyard, his expression somewhat dazed. "My lifespan is only about ten years remaining."

"I lost half of it just from one outing!" Lu Yuzhi heard this and gave a bitter smile. "My situation is similar to yours; less than fifty years left..." Nangong Lie and Xu Gongding's faces were also extremely grim. After such a major incident, the Elder Council would surely conduct a thorough investigation. They truthfully recounted their encounters. Zhong Daogong tried his best to comfort them and attempted various methods to extend their lifespans, but all had minimal effect.

"Hmph!" The courtyard grew quiet for a moment, then Nangong Lie suddenly slammed his fist on the stone table in the courtyard. "We suffered a great calamity, and in the process, even our four gray chess pieces were stolen..."

"This is an utter humiliation! He, Zhong Daogong, should have immediately led the group to at least inquire about the perpetrators' specific details, if not seek justice. But now, after so much time has passed, he hasn't made the slightest move. When asked, he speaks nicely. 'We need to plan carefully...' Bah! I think they're scared after seeing our impending doom!" Nangong Lie vented his dissatisfaction.

Lu Yuzhi frowned. "However, Elder Zhong's words are not entirely without merit. That death qi storm was indeed too bizarre and terrifying. Even after I've recovered and spent days pondering, I haven't found a way to directly confront it. We four were heavily injured; the Immortal Ship cannot withstand another similar blow in a short period." Li Fan also nodded in agreement. "Although it's frustrating, this is indeed the truth. This death qi appeared too suddenly; it was clearly aimed at the gray chess pieces in our hands."

"Don't forget, there's still one gray chess piece on the Immortal Ship. Perhaps the unknown enemy will strike at any moment..." Li Fan's words instantly silenced the others. The Immortal Ship had always prioritized the greater good. They could distinguish between immediate grudges and the overall interests of the Immortal Ship.

"The enemy approaches with such ferocity!" Lu Yuzhi sighed, his eyes filled with worry. In order to deal with this unknown formidable enemy, the Immortal Ship soon convened a joint meeting of all elders. Li Fan, as an eyewitness to the event, also attended. Zhong Daogong began with a summary statement: "The opponent is definitely after those gray chess pieces. Now, the gray chess piece we have left has lost some of its connection to the other pieces, likely due to the four that were abducted by the enemy."

"However, there are two points of suspicion."

"First, how did they accurately pinpoint the location of Elder Lu Yuzhi and his group?"

"Second, by what method did they block the senses of our gray chess pieces?"

"As for the death qi used for the attack..."

"After searching the Immortal Ship's records, we have found some possibilities." Zhong Daogong's words immediately captured everyone's attention. Jian Daosheng cleared his throat and explained, "Death qi and life qi are mutually opposed yet dependent. After the great destruction, in the abyssal star sea, where most regions have fallen silent, theoretically, such a vast amount of death qi cannot exist."

"Therefore, we surmise that the source of this death qi must be from some cultivation world."

"And to be able to use death qi as a weapon of attack in such a consumptive manner, the amount of death qi they possess... is absolutely unimaginable." Jian Daosheng's tone was somewhat heavy.

The elders of the Immortal Ship heard this and quickly raised their doubts. "The great tribulation of the star sea, the myriad realms have been destroyed for a long time. Where could they have collected so much death qi?"

"It completely defies logic!" Zhong Daogong sighed, "This is the crux of the problem. Perhaps this death qi was accumulated by the enemy from ancient times, from before the star sea suffered its tribulation."

"The enemy is likely, like us, a civilization that has survived to this day."

"They could preemptively evade the attack of the True Immortal Sigils; they understood the gray chess pieces, creations of True Immortals, very well, and caught us off guard. From beginning to end, the enemy never revealed themselves..."

"Judging from all their actions, this unknown civilization is not weaker than our Immortal Ship, but stronger." After Zhong Daogong finished speaking, the meeting fell into an eerie silence. All the elders frowned, lost in thought. Li Fan broke the silence. He sighed, "I never expected that in this seemingly dead and silent sea of stars, besides our Immortal Ship and Great Qi, there exist other brilliant civilizations."

The eyes of the Immortal Ship elders all converged on Li Fan. Jian Daosheng's eyes narrowed slightly as he asked, "Daoist Li, could the unknown enemy who attacked you possibly be from your homeland, Great Qi?" This was also a question lingering in the minds of all the Immortal Ship elders. At this moment, Jian Daosheng voiced it, and everyone stared intently at Li Fan, wanting to hear his answer.

"Great Qi?" Li Fan clearly hadn't expected Jian Daosheng to ask that.

"How could..." He instinctively denied it at first. But then, as if realizing something, he frowned, fell into thought, and his words abruptly stopped. After a long pause, Li Fan spoke again, softly saying, "Firstly, I can confirm one thing: there are absolutely no surveillance methods from Great Qi on me. And I would never be an informant for Great Qi..."

"I have no evidence to present, but you have all spent a considerable amount of time with me; you must understand my character." Li Fan paused, then said proudly, "To put it bluntly, if I were truly a spy from Great Qi and my target was that gray chess piece, back when I helped rebuild the Immortal Ship's protective formation, with my unparalleled escape technique across the sea of stars, I could have stolen it directly and escaped."

"There would be no need for such elaborate measures." The meeting became even quieter. No one retorted. Most appeared to tacitly accept Li Fan's statement, but a few still looked at Li Fan with suspicion in their eyes.

Li Fan's self-defense continued. "Moreover, when we were attacked, we were planning to head deeper into the Great Wall of Broken Realms to collect more. If I were truly an informant, why wouldn't I wait until more was found before notifying them to capture everything in one go?"

"After the deed was done, why would I return to the Immortal Ship?"

"At that time, the other three Immortal Ship elders were all extremely weak. If not for my escape technique, they might have perished long ago. Wouldn't it have been better to let them disappear without a trace, making the deed undetectable? Why go through all this trouble?" The more Li Fan spoke, the more anger seemed to rise within him. He snorted coldly, "If it weren't for the fact that my last moments interacting with the Immortal Ship have made me consider the Immortal Ship my final destination, I wouldn't waste so much breath with you all."

"If I wanted to leave, who among you could stop me?" Not a single elder of the Immortal Ship could refute his words. After all, that spectral image of a wooden sword, capable of ignoring almost all restrictive forces, was indeed inconceivable.

Zhong Daogong quickly stepped in to mediate. He chuckled and appeased, "Daoist Li, there's no need to be so agitated. We absolutely trust you, but we know very little about Great Qi behind you, so it's natural for suspicion to arise." Li Fan's anger subsided slightly. He pondered for a moment and replied cautiously, "Within Great Qi, there are many factions. I am only familiar with the research of my Master's lineage..."

"However, I have indeed never heard of anyone within Great Qi possessing such a vast amount of death qi."

"Moreover, my face is somewhat famous in Great Qi. If the other party were truly from Great Qi, they would never dare to attack me! Otherwise, even if I died, my Master would not spare them!" Li Fan stated with great certainty.

Zhong Daogong nodded slightly, temporarily ceasing his questioning.

"Regarding the incident of this attack, I have a few conjectures. Let's discuss them."

"The gray chess pieces have been lying peacefully in the Immortal Ship's secret treasury for years without any incidents. Now, they are suddenly attacked..."

"Excluding the possibility of someone deliberately leaking information, perhaps it was the accumulation of too many chess pieces that attracted attention." Zhong Daogong declared loudly, "This unknown civilization may have been searching for traces of the gray chess pieces for many years. But lacking any gray chess pieces in hand, they couldn't search through induction. However, during our collection process, the aggregation of numbers allowed them to find a trace. Thus, we were exposed and attacked..." The elders present all fell into deep thought. Although it sounded somewhat bizarre, it was currently the only plausible explanation.

"If my guess is correct, then what we need to worry about now is this unknown civilization's attack on the Immortal Ship." Zhong Daogong's tone suddenly changed.

"Gray chess pieces can sense each other. The one that has become the Immortal Ship's outer keratin armor undoubtedly provides the enemy with the Immortal Ship's general position at all times..."

"This is clearly unacceptable to us." The faces of the Immortal Ship elders changed drastically.

"The priority now is to resolve this matter."

"Either, we strip off the keratin armor, separating it from the Immortal Ship, and simply abandon the gray chess piece."

"Or, find a method to block the induction between the gray chess pieces." Zhong Daogong concluded. The Immortal Ship elders looked at each other, falling into a debate.

Chapter 1345: Divine Art Can Equal Heaven (Awaiting Update)

"A true gentleman does not stand beneath a crumbling wall. To constantly expose our vital Immortal Boat to enemy surveillance is certainly not a wise move!"

"Indeed. Though these gray chess pieces are True Immortal creations, they are not worth us taking such a great risk."

"Foolish! This set of chess pieces must hold a great secret. Profit has always coexisted with danger; how can you give up so easily!"

"It is indeed too regrettable to discard them just like that. I have a plan. Since that unfo-"

Chapter 1346

As the Mystic Immortal Boat had previously guessed, each gray chess piece was forged from a world.

Li Fan looked at the four spinning chess pieces before him, and countless illusions flashed through his mind.

These were the sights of those four dead worlds before they were reshaped: a land of ice stretching for millions of miles; dynasties established by various cultivators standing tall on endless plains; star-like Sword Sects of Enlightenment scattered around a terrifying sword mark that split the world in half; and a vast blue ocean covering the entire world, where monstrous storms raged year-round, raising waves thousands of feet high that destroyed everything on the surface. Life could only survive at the bottom of the sea...

The names of the four worlds, along with these illusions, appeared in Li Fan's mind.

"Crystal Pole, Hundred Mounds, Sword Gate, Abyss Sea."

Though their appearances differed, all four worlds were once vibrant with life. However, at some point, an unimaginably terrifying power descended.

Everything in the world fell into stillness.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

Amidst the relentless drumming like heavy hammers, all life was instantly annihilated. Only the worlds themselves survived the devastating blows.

Just as a block of iron heated to liquid, cooled, and hammered, was forged into a sword, the four vastly different worlds slowly underwent inexplicable changes in their nature and essence amidst the roaring sounds.

The chaotic illusions vanished, and finally, only the four ceaselessly spinning gray chess pieces remained.

"Sage Master, this..." Li Fan was not the only one who sensed the extraordinary nature of the gray chess pieces. Senior Yin's rapidly spinning gray-white eyes also betrayed his inner turmoil.

"Forging chess pieces with worlds. The might of True Immortals is truly extraordinary," Li Fan said to Senior Yin, then added softly, "True Immortals, chess pieces?"

Upon catching the two keywords, Senior Yin's body trembled. He immediately said, "Indeed, my premonition was correct. The Yin-Yang Pearls I absorbed previously might also be related to True Immortals!"

Li Fan looked at Senior Yin, awaiting his explanation.

Senior Yin paused, as if organizing his thoughts. Then, he calmly stated, "The moment I saw these four chess pieces, I felt a sense of familiarity. Not that I had seen them before, but rather a familiarity belonging to the same species, like when I encountered those world spirits..."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, and after a moment of thought, he nodded, "The immense death qi and vitality contained within those Yin-Yang Pearls are likely beyond the control of cultivators like us."

Senior Yin continued, "But these... chess pieces, while I felt familiar with them, a sense of instinctive fear also arose within me. It was like encountering a strictly hierarchical order, something lofty and supreme!"

"I also felt that although the power of life and death no longer exists in these worlds, they still hold immense attraction for me. It's as if devouring them would bring me immense benefits! Benefits far greater than those from the Yin-Yang Pearls!" Senior Yin's voice gradually became distant. Before the greed in his eyes could take control, he timely closed his eyes.

After a long while, the enchanting whispers, like those of a Heavenly Demon, finally faded from his ears. He gradually returned to normal but dared not stare at the four chess pieces anymore.

Li Fan knew well the source of the fear and temptation Senior Yin felt from these gray chess pieces.

"It originates from fragments of laws from the Immortal Realm..."

Silently circulating the mutated version of the Chronicles of Heaven-Mending, the four chess pieces transformed into interwoven lines in Li Fan's vision.

These were the principles of worlds that had been constructed and reshaped.

Li Fan compared their similarities and differences.

Tens of thousands of years had passed, and the star sea had shattered and then revived. However, the fundamental principles that formed the bedrock of worlds had not changed significantly.

Through countless cycles of reincarnation, Li Fan had gained a profound understanding of the principles of the cultivation world's heaven and earth. After several comparisons, he indeed discovered parts within these four chess piece worlds that did not belong to the "lower realm."

They appeared indistinguishable from the lines representing ordinary principles of heaven and earth.

In reality, they were new existences, elevated and transformed from superior replacements of lower realm laws.

Even as mere fragments of laws used for construction, they were as brilliant as the most dazzling gems in the world to Li Fan.

If the principles of the lower realm's heaven and earth were like a low mountain peak less than a hundred meters high, then the parts originating from the Immortal Realm within these four chess pieces were like magnificent mountain ranges spanning hundreds of miles, encompassing all-encompassing and brimming with vitality.

The two were fundamentally incomparable.

Moreover, whether by coincidence or not, the fragments of Immortal Realm laws contained within these four chess pieces were all different from each other.

"The laws contained within each chess piece are like puzzle fragments. When fully integrated, they might form a complete picture."

"There are twelve gray chess pieces in total, which should correspond to the twelve anchor points left by Sun Piao Miao back then."

"If that's the case..."

"There should actually be thirteen. The Medicine King Cauldron, passed down through the ages in the Xuanhuang Realm and the Medicine King Sect, is not within the scope of the perception."

Thinking of this, Li Fan couldn't help but look up beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Medicine King Cauldron of the Medicine King Sect was still struggling near the Immortal Ruins, not returning to the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Either way, it's not long before its fall. I'll just wait. There's no need to risk retrieving it from the Immortal Ruins."

With this thought, Li Fan reached out and took one of the chess pieces.

As expected, a peculiar sensation surged into his heart.

In the depths of his perception, he felt the approximate location information of other gray chess pieces within the star sea.

"There are four here in total."

"There is one with Mystic Immortal Boat."

"Within the continuous Great Wall of Fragmented Realms, there are four more."

"And three more. One of them should be in the Sea of Remnants."

"As for the remaining two..."

A hint of surprise flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Because he discovered that these two gray chess pieces were actually located within the Xuanhuang Realm!

"The worlds they originally belonged to must have been used by the Heavenly Physician and the Dharma-Preachers to repair the Xuanhuang Realm."

"I'll be right back after checking this place," he said to Senior Yin and Bai Hua, instructing them. Ignoring their astonishment, Li Fan's wooden sword phantom flickered, and he went to one of the locations indicated by the vague sense of direction.

It was the bottomless Cangwu Abyss.

Located in the southwest corner of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Cangwu Abyss was like a massive rift in its fabric. Its currently explored depth reached three hundred thousand feet.

Within it, layers of peculiar landscapes, events, and objects were distributed.

What was once a perilous land was now barely a threat to Li Fan, who could traverse the star sea.

Following the sensation, he descended.

As Li Fan watched the scenery drift upwards into the sky, a sudden feeling welled up in his heart: "Everything within this Cangwu Abyss should originate from different, destroyed cultivation worlds. Piled up here, it resembles a temporary storage area for various materials used in the process of stitching together the Xuanhuang Realm."

"If anything is missing during the world repair process, it can be retrieved from here at any time. One day, this Cangwu Abyss will be filled. By then, the Xuanhuang Realm may have already been reborn."

Li Fan observed the myriad strange sights within the abyss with great interest.

As the abyss neared the surface of the Xuanhuang Realm, it was increasingly influenced by the life force of the Xuanhuang Realm, merging into unique landscapes such as the Forest of Spirit Whispers, the Puppet Gorge, and the Lost City.

But the deeper he went, the closer the floating world fragments were to their original forms.

After the worlds were destroyed, they were desolate.

Some world fragments even retained traces of True Immortal power.

"It's practically a small-scale Great Wall of Fragmented Realms."

"However, its stability is not as high as the true Great Wall of Fragmented Realms, and the residual True Immortal power that accumulates from time to time will erupt..."

"No wonder this place is a restricted zone for cultivators."

When his sword shadow descended another fifty-three thousand feet into the depths, Li Fan once again sensed the presence of the Suppressing Immortal Power within the abyss.

"This Suppressing Immortal Power should be the pressure exerted on cultivators who intrude into the Cangwu Abyss by the Heavenly Physician, after imitating the Great Wall of Fragmented Realms to construct it."

"To be precise, the 'momentum' of the Cangwu Abyss, from top to bottom, steadily increases in a stepped manner. Although the overall increase in height is extremely limited, and it doesn't exceed the Xuanhuang Realm by much, it is very noticeable for cultivators within the abyss."

"Only by reaching a corresponding cultivation level can one safely survive in the abyss layer with the corresponding momentum. Otherwise, it would be like a mortal entering the Immortal Realm, coming to a height that does not belong to them, leading only to their destruction."

Having deciphered the mystery of the Cangwu Abyss, Li Fan now roughly pinpointed the location of the gray chess piece drifting within.

Amidst a field of scattered ruins that looked like they had been shattered by countless blades, Li Fan found the fifth gray chess piece.

It was a majestic and mighty stone statue of a Qilin, lying half-fallen on the ground as it was millennia ago during its destruction.

The stone statue was a pair, but the other one, Li Fan observed, was merely made of ordinary stone.

"It's hidden so well."

Li Fan crushed the stone statue, restoring it to its chess piece form, and then surveyed the surroundings.

Based on the appearance of the surrounding ruins, Li Fan reconstructed the world to which it originally belonged.

"The Seven Fiends Realm. This realm was filled with seven types of fiendish qi, permeating every corner of the world. It could even take tangible forms to harm people. Therefore, all buildings in this realm were decorated with various exotic beasts, large and small, to absorb and suppress it."

"It was also a considerable cultivation world back then. The cultivators of the Seven Fiends Realm were born with fiendish qi, and every move they made carried the characteristics of the seven fiends. Their peerless geniuses even possessed all seven..."

"Alas, as time flowed, all has turned to dust," Li Fan sighed, shook his head slightly, and left.

The remaining gray chess piece within the Xuanhuang Realm was buried underground in Tianyun Prefecture.

There were no unusual phenomena at its location.

"It should be that as the integration process of the Xuanhuang Realm progressed, this piece, originally within the remnants of another world, has now completely entered the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Just like those fragments from the Heavenly Law Realm at the bottom of the Cloudy Sea. Under normal circumstances, they would gradually become buried at the bottom of the Cloudy Mountains."

Without alerting anyone, Li Fan successfully obtained it.

With this, Li Fan now possessed six gray chess pieces in his hands.

He returned to the Doctrine Platform of Great Qi and placed these six chess pieces together.

As the number approached half, the influence between these chess pieces seemed to strengthen.

They revolved around each other faster and faster.

Li Fan saw that as they spun at high speed, the lines representing the principles of the worlds were attracting each other and slowly merging.

And those fragments of Immortal Realm laws slowly drew closer, completing the puzzle.

Even with only six out of thirteen, it was enough to trigger a qualitative change.

The Immortal Realm law puzzle was like a void that suddenly appeared in the center of the sea.

The worlds that were frozen in stillness were like calm seawater.

The moment the void appeared, the seawater surged into it uncontrollably.

The six worlds, like warped flat paintings that had been soaked and twisted, were drawn into the Immortal Realm law fragments like liquid.

Following the pre-designed template of the puzzle, a brand-new world was presented.

Blue sky, white clouds, rolling green grasslands.

It seemed to be an ordinary mortal scene of a grassland.

Li Fan felt an unprecedented vastness emanating from it.

The tender green grass growing vigorously on the ground also contained unimaginable vitality!

"The Immortal Realm?!" Li Fan's heart was greatly shaken as he glimpsed the scene from the merged chess pieces.

"No, it's just a fragment of the Immortal Realm from the past. Perhaps describing it as a piece of an Immortal Domain would be more appropriate."

"And this Immortal Domain is not complete."

Between the Immortal Realm grassland and sky, something should clearly have existed.

However, due to the absence of the remaining seven gray chess pieces, it could not be fully presented.

Li Fan gazed at the scene in the chess pieces with fascination, a sense of regret suddenly arising in his heart.

It felt as if he had personally shattered a priceless treasure and an uncontrollable urge to repair it surged from all parts of his mind.

If Li Fan had not possessed the protection of the Immortal Heart Incantation and had not experienced many similar situations, he might have lost control at this moment and immediately pursued the remaining chess pieces.

But now, Li Fan ignored this temptation.

As the fusion was completed, only one chess piece remained on the field. It was no longer gray, but pulsed with seven-colored light, even expanding by a circumference.

Li Fan reached out and solemnly put away the chess piece, now comprising six in one.

"En?"

To Li Fan's surprise, the moment he took the chess piece into his body, he felt as if countless mountains were pressing down on him.

Caught off guard, his figure suddenly dropped a few feet.

Fortunately, he reacted quickly, and the power of the Azure Nether World-Ending Mutation resurfaced and circulated, providing him with an inexhaustible supply of strength, allowing him to barely withstand it.

"Is this... the weight of the Immortal Realm?"

"Even a fragmented piece of an Immortal Domain is so difficult for me to bear?"

"If all thirteen fragments were gathered and fused to form a true Immortal Domain, I doubt my current cultivation would be enough to bear it!"

Li Fan once again felt the terrifying disparity between immortals and mortals.

But at the same time, his heart rejoiced instead of being dismayed.

"I was just worrying about finding an anchor point for the Xuanhuang Realm after it ascended and transformed."

"Now it seems that if I integrate this piece of Immortal Domain into the Xuanhuang Realm, it will definitely be able to adapt and not easily fall."

"With this piece of Immortal Domain as the core, the Xuanhuang Realm might even be able to ascend higher!"

"This is truly heaven-sent help!" Li Fan couldn't help but feel a surge of excitement.

But soon, his intuition prompted him to doubt the origin of these Immortal Domain fragments.

Chapter 1347

The timing of these Immortal Realm law fragments appearing felt too coincidental. Just as he was about to guide the Xuanhuang Realm towards ascension and transformation into an Immortal Realm, they were discovered.

Given Li Fan's personality, it was hard not to become suspicious. Thus, he began to meticulously analyze the logical connections.

"The secrecy of these chess pieces is truly terrifying. Even after countless years and numerous personal interactions, the Immortal Boat's crew and the Doctrine Transmitting Heavenly Physicians remained unaware of any abnormality."

"The only reason I could so easily discover the anomaly of these pieces was entirely due to the guidance of Return to Truth. Without Return to Truth, I would have considered them ordinary objects…" Thinking this, Li Fan's heart stirred slightly.

"If we consider only this aspect, perhaps the chess pieces were indeed bait specifically designed for Return to Truth."

"However… there are many other things that Return to Truth can sense. For example, Eternal Residual Will. It's simply that Return to Truth's tier is too high; all these anomalies are exposed before it."

"I cannot jump to a conclusion so rashly. But it is only reasonable to be cautious." Li Fan observed the seven-colored chess piece lying quietly within him.
