The chess piece seemed entirely independent of Li Fan. Spiritual energy, divine sense, and other powers flowed through the location of the chess piece without the slightest obstruction.

It was as if it didn't exist at all. And apart from the "burden" of the fused Immortal Realm fragments, this chess piece brought no other influence to Li Fan.

"Thirteen gray chess pieces, hidden by Sun Piao-miao in thirteen cultivation worlds he had once traveled. He recorded their world's anchor point information in his travelogues and passed it down to his descendants."

"But it's clear that these pieces were not crafted by Sun Piao-miao, but were forged by True Immortals from the Upper Realm. Perhaps, against the backdrop of the Dao Erasure Tribulation, they were preparations made by certain pessimists, a contingency plan to wish for the Immortal Realm's revival."

"For reasons unknown, they fell into Sun Piao-miao's hands." Li Fan mused, his thoughts churning.

"In Sun Piao-miao's era, the Immortal Realm had not yet been destroyed, and the Immortal Path was not yet severed. Most True Immortals of the Immortal Realm were actively fighting the Dao Erasure Tribulation. It's imaginable that, in such an era, the revisionist True Immortals who forged these chess pieces would not have been accepted by the mainstream and could only act in secret. That's why they were quietly passed down to the lower realms?"

"But for some unknown reason, these contingencies have not been activated to this day. The most likely possibility is that the True Immortals who forged these chess pieces perished in the Dao Erasure Tribulation that caused the destruction of the Immortal Realm."

"Or perhaps…" Li Fan's eyes narrowed as he recalled the structure of the Immortal Boat's Myriad Phenomena Yin-Yang Diagram from before.

"The entire Abyssal Sea has no black and white chess pieces still on the board. Only these 'discarded' gray chess pieces remain. Perhaps, in some unknown place, beyond this The Great Barrier, those black and white chess pieces have already completely reshaped the mission of the Immortal Realm?" However, Li Fan's speculation currently lacked any supporting evidence.

"Regarding these gray chess pieces, Sun Piao-miao must have known more. Sun Piao-miao himself is nowhere to be found. If there is any place in the star sea where clues might remain, the greatest possibility is the Medicine King Cauldron he left behind in the Medicine King Sect."

"The anchor point is fifteen years, and fallen stars return to the Azure Nether. Soon…" Although behind these chess pieces, there might be hidden dangers.

But Li Fan would certainly not abandon his plan to use the fused Immortal Realm fragments to elevate the Xuanhuang Realm based on mere "possible" speculation. With the Immortal Realm fragments as a foundation, the possibility of the Xuanhuang Realm's successful elevation had increased tremendously.

Li Fan calmed his thoughts and looked at Senior Yin and Bai Hua. They had witnessed the entire process of the gray chess piece's fusion.

They dared not speak further, only watching in silence. Li Fan did not explain to them the emergence of the Immortal Realm fragments after the chess piece's fusion.

However, they had also guessed that these chess pieces, forged from a world of deathly silence, likely played a crucial role in the Xuanhuang Realm's elevation plan.

"Did you have any gains from going to that location in the depths of the star sea I sent you to?" Since returning to Dà Qǐ, he had been rushing around collecting these chess pieces, and only now was he finally free.

Li Fan stared at Bai Hua and asked. In Li Fan's estimation, it should have taken Bai Hua considerable effort to investigate that unknown "high ground." To his surprise, she returned not long after and rendezvoused with Senior Yin at the edge of the star sea.

Bai Hua pondered for a moment before explaining, "Perhaps I am incapable. In the direction indicated by Master Sage, I searched for a long time but found nothing unusual. Seeing that continuing to stay would be a waste of time, I reluctantly gave up and, with fellow Daoist Yin, searched for Xu Ke's whereabouts."

"Perhaps that opportunity was not destined for me," Bai Hua sighed. Li Fan nodded and asked, "Then, have there been any findings regarding Xu Ke's trail?" Senior Yin replied, "We have made some progress. We discovered that Xu Ke might have been drawn into a peculiar area within the Great Wall of Broken Realms. The Great Wall of Broken Realms is a gathering of countless destroyed worlds at the foot of the The Great Barrier. Although it consists of billions of fragments, they are subtly connected into one."

"We do not yet understand the principle of its formation, but perhaps it can be viewed as a long rope woven from countless fine threads. And the place where Xu Ke disappeared is a 'nodal point' formed by the long rope to maintain its self-stability."

"However, just as we were about to further explore that nodal point, we received your transmission, Master Sage," Senior Yin said with some regret.

"Nodal point…" Li Fan pondered for a moment before continuing, "It was also a sudden occurrence. In order to obtain the chess piece, I had no choice but to ask for your help in acting out a play."

"Those few individuals you saw that day were all from the Immortal Boat civilization at the fringe of the star sea."

"To avoid exposing the existence of the Xuanhuang Realm, I had previously disguised myself as a member of a non-existent civilization, the Great Qi, to make contact. The Mystic Immortal Boat is extremely adept at deconstructing the powers of various True Immortal Sigilss remaining in the star sea. I also exchanged several with them using the True Immortal Sigilss I mastered, and both sides gained something."

"During this transaction, we happened to discover the gray chess pieces within the Immortal Boat's treasury."

"This chess piece is too important for the Xuanhuang Realm's elevation; I could not miss it. Therefore, I employed a little trick…" Li Fan lightly explained the cause and effect of the incident to the two.

"The Mystic Immortal Boat is still somewhat useful to the Xuanhuang Realm, so you should avoid contact with them to prevent exposure. Especially since the life and death aura on you is too obvious; they will know you snatched the gray chess piece at first glance," Li Fan said to Senior Yin.

Senior Yin and Bai Hua naturally did not side with the Mystic Immortal Boat. They merely smiled and paid little attention to Li Fan's clever acquisition of the gray chess piece.

"The Immortal Boat and the Great Wall of Broken Realms still have a few remaining chess pieces that have not been collected. Hand them all over to me. You should first focus on investigating Xu Ke's whereabouts."

"After I have collected all the chess pieces, it will not be far from the final Xuanhuang Realm," Li Fan instructed.

Senior Yin's expression became solemn, and he nodded in agreement. After giving his instructions, Li Fan first used the Heaven's Horizon, Arm's Length Formation to arrive at the edge of the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

The wooden sword's phantom continuously shuttled and moved. It took considerable effort to acquire all four remaining gray chess pieces in this location.

Even possessing heavenly escape techniques, the depths of the Great Wall of Broken Realms at the foot of the The Great Barrier were truly fraught with danger.

The fluctuating, surging stellar energy currents were barely offset by Li Fan's wooden sword phantom.

He still had to face the pervasive suction. Combined with bearing the weight of the Immortal Realm fragments at all times, Li Fan's expenditure when using the wooden sword phantom escape technique was almost two to three times higher than before.

Therefore, after collecting the four chess pieces from this area, Li Fan felt extremely exhausted both physically and mentally. But ultimately, he had reaped great rewards.

Li Fan gazed inward. The four gray chess pieces, along with a larger seven-colored chess piece, floated quietly.

They were in opposition to each other. Perhaps due to their small number, the four newly acquired chess pieces merely revolved around each other and could not react with the seven-colored chess piece that had already completed its fusion.

"Only two pieces remain. The Mystic Immortal Boat, and the Medicine King Sect."

"Once all thirteen chess pieces are in place, if my prediction is correct, a corner of the former Immortal Realm should be recreated." Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Then, he extended his palm towards his chest and struck himself with a powerful blow. With a muffled groan, his already weary face became even paler.

Without mobilizing his own Spirit Qi to heal the injury, Li Fan maintained his current appearance and slowly headed towards the Immortal Boat.

Approaching the Immortal Boat without concealing his aura, the elders immediately reacted. Led by Zhong Dao-gong, they came out to welcome him.

"I have not failed my mission," Li Fan coughed lightly, cupped his fists, and said indifferently.

"Thank you for your hard work, fellow Daoist!" Zhong Dao-gong's expression was solemn, and he actually bowed. Li Fan frowned and quickly dodged.

He snorted, "Stop with this pretense. Although the ritual is not complicated, it took considerable effort to conceal it from Master and all the Sage Masters."

"I am unaware of how many people the ritual encompasses, but I believe it is sufficient," Zhong Dao-gong smiled and nodded. "Approximately ten thousand myriad beings. It is absolutely sufficient to bear the backlash of performing the Grand Heavenly Art."

"If that's the case, then there's no need to hide it from me anymore, right?" Li Fan's gaze swept over the elders present.

"This is not the place to talk. Let's discuss it further after entering the Immortal Boat." The elders of the Immortal Boat, as usual, were very cautious.

They went to the deepest阁楼 at the top of the divine art, the furthest reaches of the Immortal Severing Tower. The black Xuan Jade floor was already covered with profound patterns.

Li Fan was no stranger to these symbols; they were part of the Grand Heavenly Art ritual. It seemed the elders of the Immortal Boat were somewhat impatient.

The elders took their seats according to their designated positions, and Li Fan also received his position here. An offering of one hundred million living beings.

Ten thousand myriad humans was an unimaginable number in the resource-scarce and life-depleted Xuan Immortal Boat.

Therefore, after Li Fan completed the ritual, coupled with his previous performances, he finally earned the absolute trust of everyone on the Immortal Boat.

"Fellow Daoist, please be patient."

"Please sit first and try the effect of the Grand Heavenly Art," Zhong Dao-gong pointed to Li Fan's seat.

Li Fan did not hesitate in the slightest and floated into his seat. The pattern beneath him instantly emitted a faint glow. After sitting down, the scenery in Li Fan's vision also changed under the illumination of the faint light.

The positions of the surrounding Immortal Boat elders shifted strangely in space. Originally, they were all seated on the same plane, but now, in Li Fan's eyes, everyone was distributed within a three-dimensional cube.

Orderly, occupying every point of the cube. And Li Fan was at the center of the cube, the focus of everyone's attention.

Li Fan's expression remained unchanged.

"Mysterious heavens and earth, ancient and vast. Originally one, all beings are equal…" The chanting of the Immortal Boat elders echoed.

Ancient, vast, and with a hint of strangeness. As the ballad continued, the elders raised their arms.

Using their fingers as brushes, they began to write in the void before them. Each person wrote not a complete True Immortal character, but merely a structural segment of an incredibly complex character. In Li Fan's eyes, countless moving lines suddenly seemed to rise around him.

These lines surrounded him in the center, and as they were continuously perfected, a character, "均" (jūn - equal/common), slowly took shape.

Boom! In an instant, Li Fan's body trembled. His vision uncontrollably floated upwards, finally stopping at a fixed position.

And from this position, looking down, the spell structures meticulously crafted by all the elders on different planes combined to form a single character, "均," on one plane!

And his body, Li Fan, was suppressed in the very center by this character "均"! The character "均" was more complex than the characters "饥" (jī - hunger) and "乱" (luàn - chaos) that Li Fan had seen before.

Although not as profound as the character for Creation, it possessed its own unique mystery. Under the power of the Grand Heavenly Art, Li Fan slowly felt the changes occurring within his body.

Li Fan also checked his Return to Truth panel. His lifespan, which had only 10 years remaining, was now slowly increasing!

Strands of black began to appear amidst his white hair. Waves of vitality emerged from nowhere, nourishing Li Fan's decaying mortal body.

However, Li Fan did not feel overjoyed by this sudden increase in lifespan. He continued to observe Return to Truth with extreme caution.

Only when the life force gradually dwindled and the Grand Heavenly Art ritual concluded, and apart from the changes in his physiological age on the panel, Return to Truth showed no other reaction, did Li Fan finally relax.

"As expected, a mere character '均' is not enough to influence Return to Truth."

"It will only affect the target locked by the Grand Heavenly Art. For example, the lifespan that was cast upon me this time."

"Other aspects, such as divine sense and cultivation, have not changed." After carefully inspecting his internal condition, Li Fan reached his conclusion.

He then looked at the members of the Immortal Boat Elder Council. Compared to before the ritual, they had undoubtedly aged somewhat.

But due to the decrease in lifespan being divided among everyone, it was not very noticeable.

"How do you feel?" Zhong Dao-gong asked on behalf of the elders. Li Fan heard this, feigned a dazed awakening, and looked at his body that had regained youth.

Then, he bowed to the elders, expressing his gratitude for this life-saving benevolence. The elders of the Immortal Boat also returned the bow in unison.

"From now on, we are all family," Zhong Dao-gong said very solemnly.

Chapter 1348

"My life is an offering I can never repay. I will go through fire and water without hesitation!" Li Fan clasped his hands in response.

As he spoke, Li Fan checked the attributes on his Reflection panel.

His remaining lifespan had surged from ten years to over five hundred years, clearly demonstrating the power of the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill.

"After the divine skill was cast, my lifespan should be on par with these Immortal Boat elders."

"Five hundred years, not much, but not little either. Most importantly..."

Li Fan meticulously examined his current physical condition.

Suddenly, his eyes narrowed slightly: "This extra lifespan is unstable?"

His previous body had been healthy and normal, so Li Fan was sensitive enough to notice that his current body, forcibly altered by the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill to defy fate and extend his life, was aging at an abnormally rapid rate, several times faster than normal. Sometimes, it would even inexplicably jump down.

As Li Fan observed, the fluctuating age number on his Reflection panel uncannily confirmed his suspicions.

Li Fan made no effort to conceal his change in expression, and Senior Brother Zhong Daogong noticed Li Fan's inner doubts. "The Heavenly Dao is unpredictable and ever-changing. Change is eternal; balance is temporary."

"To equalize the heavens and earth is to defy the natural order. I believe that even the true script written by a True Immortal might not be able to maintain the state of 'equalization' indefinitely. Let alone us. So, you needn't worry; a fall from the 'equal' state is a normal phenomenon."

"There are two ways to alleviate this. The first is to revisit the original 'Ancient' character script. A brief regression can slow down the rate of decline."

"As for the second, when your lifespan eventually runs out again, you can continue to cast the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill. In fact, this is precisely what the Immortal Boat Elder Council is doing."

"Giving the lifespan of many to extend the lifespan of one. Everyone helps me, and I help everyone," Zhong Daogong said with a smile, looking at the surrounding elders.

Li Fan finally understood. "Since that's the case, I can rest assured."

He sighed, then lamented, "I finally understand why the Immortal Boat elders, despite their apparent disagreements, always manage to maintain a unified direction for the collective on major matters."

"This Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill is truly wondrous! Even in the Great Qi Empire, it should be counted among the most supreme divine abilities!"

Despite Li Fan's high praise, Zhong Daogong did not show pride. Instead, a hint of a bitter smile flickered in his eyes. "It is merely a last resort. Constrained by limited resources, the Immortal Boat's population has always been maintained at a low level. The pace of talent turnover is slow. To survive in this Utter Darkness Star Seas, we must maintain the number of Elder Council members."

"Researching True Immortal Sigilss is also fraught with peril. A slight misstep can lead to being affected by the True Immortal's power. We have had no fewer than a few elders perish because of this historically. Yet, it concerns the lifeline and future of the Immortal Boat, and we absolutely cannot abandon it."

"Therefore, every elder is the most precious treasure of the Immortal Boat..."

Li Fan remained noncommittal to Zhong Daogong's explanation. He was aware of the Immortal Boat's secret technique, the Dao Comprehension Pills, which could refine geniuses and then be consumed to seize all their talent.

"The Immortal Boat has likely produced no small number of geniuses over the years. Tragically, to become a new elder, talent alone is absolutely insufficient. The elders of the Immortal Boat are, in essence, similar to mortals in the Xuanhuang Realm. They cannot be too numerous, nor too few; a delicate balance must be maintained," Li Fan mused inwardly, not voicing his thoughts.

After the casting of the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill, the attitudes of the surrounding elders toward him subtly shifted.

If Li Fan had previously won their approval through mere advantage and expediency, then now, the elders genuinely felt a sense of recognition from the bottom of their hearts.

They truly felt like "one family."

Thus, Li Fan inquired about the "Heaven Equalizing Plan," which required the sacrifices of living beings from the Great Qi Empire.

"With so many living beings needing to bear the backlash, who is the target of the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill...?"

This time, Zhong Daogong and the others no longer hesitated.

They directly revealed the secret: "Our plan's objective is... the consciousness of the Star Seas' Origin!"

Li Fan's eyes lit up at this.

"Thanks to Fellow Daoist's previous teaching of the Great Jia Divine Skill, we were able to glimpse the vast consciousness of the Star Seas that is currently reawakening."

"Only by directly interacting with it can one know the immense power of the Star Seas, which is in no way diminished by the Star Seas' annihilation, and still beyond the comprehension of us mortal cultivators."

"But..." The elders of the Immortal Boat all displayed peculiar expressions.

Seeing this, Dao Sheng waved his hand, showing Li Fan the desolate scene of the Utter Darkness Star Seas.

And at the center of the Star Seas, shining with a brilliance as dazzling as a diamond, was the true will of the Star Seas' Origin.

"The consciousness of the Star Seas is essentially the same as the Heavenly Dao of the past Cultivation World."

"In the past, some cultivators achieved Unity of Heaven and Man and could partially control the world's Heavenly Dao. Now, by pooling our strength to cast the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill, we might be able to share the power of the Star Seas!" Dao Sheng declared forcefully.

Zhong Daogong stroked his beard and smiled. "If we can equalize the power of the Star Seas, even without relying on True Immortal Sigilss, crossing the The Great Barrier will surely be within reach!"

Li Fan frowned, lost in thought.

After a moment, he slowly nodded. "The Great Barrier seals the Utter Darkness Star Seas, but that is for the beings within the Star Seas. If we were to use the power of the Star Seas themselves to create towering waves, perhaps a water droplet within those waves could leap over the The Great Barrier!"

"Precisely! Only by reaching the height of a True Immortal can one cross the The Great Barrier. But the power of the Star Seas is inherently not inferior to that of True Immortals! In ancient times, many anomalies that shone within the Star Seas forced even True Immortals to retreat. This shows the might of the Star Seas' power. Even after being affected by the calamity of the Immortal Realm and falling into destruction, its vitality remains unbroken..."

The elders' voices grew increasingly fervent.

"It is the perfect object for us to equalize!"

"If the spell is successful, even if we cannot lift the Immortal Boat and cross the The Great Barrier, controlling the power of the Star Seas for a time will be enough to create an absolutely safe haven for us here in the Utter Darkness Star Seas!"

...

After listening to the Immortal Boat elders' plan, Li Fan clapped his hands and exclaimed, "Brilliant! Truly brilliant!"

"This is what is called 'seizing the heavens' merits for one's own benefit.' However..."

Li Fan's tone abruptly shifted, and his brow furrowed. "I have previously contacted the consciousness of the Star Seas using the Great Jia Divine Skill. Our cultivators are like ants before it. Now, these ants seek to steal power and stand on equal footing..."

Li Fan's expression grew somber as he looked at them. "The heavens have their wrath, and the Star Seas will also have theirs. Even if it succeeds, we will likely face the frenzied retaliation of the Star Seas' Origin consciousness. Let alone if it fails."

"In that case, perhaps the Immortal Boat might not be able to withstand it!"

"If we don't succeed, we die with honor... Isn't the risk a little too great?"

Li Fan had truly identified with the situation of gaining five hundred years of lifespan, and his thoughts and actions were no longer as extreme as before.

Zhong Daogong nodded, essentially agreeing with Li Fan's point. "You are right. The Immortal Boat is not yet at a point where we must gamble everything. That is why you made the trip to the Great Qi."

Zhong Daogong said with confidence.

Li Fan was somewhat confused. "Just with the lives of ten million humans, can we quell the wrath of the Star Seas?"

Zhong Daogong smiled, his eyes gleaming. "Not with humans. With a realm!"

"If it were merely a matter of human numbers, even several times more, it might not make much difference to the Star Seas' Origin consciousness. But if we use the lives of these ten million humans as a foundation, decorating it into a realm, and using the name of a realm to draw away the power of the Star Seas..."

"The backlash from the Star Seas will be greatly weakened!" Zhong Daogong stated with certainty.

"This is due to the Star Seas' own inherent mechanisms. Based on the scattered records of the Immortal Boat's past, we are almost one hundred percent confident in this point."

Li Fan quieted down, pondering Zhong Daogong's words.

"The nurturing and evolution of a cultivation world is an inherent fundamental law of the Star Seas. Even if a cultivation world's power swells to the point of affecting the Star Seas, the Star Seas will not directly destroy it."

"Instead, at most, it will manifest through various Star Sea anomalies."

"Star Sea anomalies are much easier to deal with than the wrath of the Star Seas' Origin!" Dao Sheng, not giving Li Fan a chance to ponder independently, eagerly provided the answer.

Zhong Daogong's eyes held a trace of pride. "We have records and basic countermeasures for most of the Star Sea anomalies that have appeared in history. Now, the Star Seas are merely recovering after destruction, not yet in a stage of rebirth and mutation, the possibility of new Star Sea anomalies..."

"Is not high."

"Even if there is a small chance of a new anomaly forming, it would likely be related to the remnants of True Immortal power pervading the void. With True Immortal Sigilss in hand, overcoming such a minor turbulence should be absolutely no problem."

All the elders of the Immortal Boat were quite confident.

Silence fell for a moment.

Finally, Zhong Daogong said in a deep voice, "Of course, to avoid the worst-case scenario, when we cast the Heaven Equalizing Divine Skill, we will leave the Profound Immortal Boat and only take essential supplies."

"Even if our plan truly fails, it will be enough to preserve the Immortal Boat. With the seeds we leave behind, the Immortal Boat can continue to exist for tens of thousands of years."

...

From the current perspective, although the Profound Immortal Boat's plan to equalize the Star Seas seemed insane, the Immortal Boat had actually conducted meticulous considerations.

If successful, they would have boundless seas to roam. By controlling half the power of the Star Seas, even with crises lurking beyond the The Great Barrier, they would have a place to reside.

If it failed, they would not lose everything.

Compared to the previous desperate attempt of the entire Immortal Boat crashing into the The Great Barrier, this was far better.

And this was the change the Great Jia Divine Skill, brought by Li Fan, had brought to the Immortal Boat.

One had to admit, the Immortal Boat Elder Council was indeed not a group of rigid, unchangeable individuals.

They could perfectly accept new knowledge and even apply it quickly.

"Then, when do we act?"

"Since we can equalize the power of the Star Seas, theoretically, shouldn't we wait for the Star Seas to recover and become stronger?" Li Fan mused.

However, he quickly dismissed his own judgment. "No, if the Star Seas become stronger, the power of retaliation in the future will also be stronger. If we are excessively greedy, it might exceed the critical threshold we can bear..."

Zhong Daogong agreed. "Therefore, we must choose the optimal moment."

"The Immortal Boat has already established a specialized organization. Elders will take turns casting the Great Jia Divine Skill to approach and observe the consciousness of the Star Seas."

"According to our predictions, the optimal moment should arrive within thirty years."

"During this period, the power of the Star Seas and the lingering True Immortal power will influence and restrain each other, forming a delicate balance."

"Beyond that..."

"As one waxes, the other wanes. The remnants of True Immortal power will likely perish within the Star Seas."

Zhong Daogong reached the same conclusion as in his previous life.

Li Fan readily agreed, "Good. Since I have sufficient lifespan now, I have plenty of time to wait."

"Are there any preparations I need to make?"

Li Fan offered proactively.

Zhong Daogong pondered for a moment and offered some suggestions. "First, it would be best to try and see if we can increase the number of human sacrifices in the ritual..."

Li Fan's brow immediately furrowed.

After hesitating for a moment, he finally relaxed. "Although there are some risks, if we are careful, it should be possible. However, you cannot do it twice or thrice; if we do it, we do it big, to avoid future regrets."

Li Fan's words greatly pleased Zhong Daogong. "The number of ritual offerings is crucial. Each doubling of the number increases our chances of success by ten percent. I will trouble you to put extra effort into this aspect."

"Agreed," Li Fan replied, his expression solemn, as if contemplating methods of implementation.

"As for the second point..." Zhong Daogong paused. "You can do it incidentally. If it succeeds, all the better; if not, it won't have any impact. It's merely a backup plan."

Li Fan: "Oh? Elder Zhong, please elaborate."

"The key to the ritual's success is to fabricate a cultivation world within the Star Seas," Zhong Daogong explained, using deductive simulation visuals before Li Fan.

"As you know, the worlds within the Star Seas are all shattered. Except for your Great Qi..."

"But the Great Qi's strength is not inferior to ours. To occupy it and use it as a ready-made disguise would inevitably lead to a great war, which is unwise."

"Therefore, using the corpses of those shattered worlds for disguise is a substitute method."

"In the Great Wall of Broken Realms, the remnants of past worlds are connected as one; pull one thread, and the whole body moves. It is not easy to obtain them. However, we don't truly need the remnants of worlds; we only need to obtain some imprints left after the destruction of past Heavenly Daos..." Zhong Daogong pointed towards the Great Wall of Broken Realms in the distance.

"Hmm?" Li Fan appeared not to fully grasp his meaning.

"What are these 'imprints left after the destruction of Heavenly Daos'?"

Zhong Daogong reached out and produced an object.

It resembled amber, yet also white jade.

It appeared naturally formed, with no trace of carving.

It was shaped like a wooden umbrella.

"This is the sole remaining artifact of a cultivation world after its destruction. Our Immortal Boat obtained it in the void after the Star Sea anomalies subsided."

"If you search carefully, there are bound to be many similar objects within the Great Wall of Broken Realms. Your dimensional escape techniques are divine; searching will be much easier for you than for us."

Zhong Daogong quickly put away the wooden umbrella made of white jade.

"However, do not force it. Within the Immortal Boat's secret treasury, there are other such 'Heavenly Dao imprints.' There should be enough to complete the disguise."

Chapter 1349: Eerie Abnormalities of Return to Truth

"The more we collect, the more assurances we have," Zhong Daogong said, his gaze fervent as he re-emphasized the crucial point. "The most critical factor remains the number of sacrifices for the Grand Sky ritual..."

"If you feel any pressure, you can choose elders to assist you." Li Fan pondered for a moment, then shook his head. "The Great Qi's realm-protecting immortal artifacts oversee all under heaven. If any outsiders were to trespass rashly, it would surely cause alarm, which would be detrimental to the plan's execution."

"I am sufficient on my own! The optimal time node will arrive within thirty years..."

"It won't take that long! If all goes smoothly, I will succeed within three to five years," Li Fan stated with full confidence.

"However..." Li Fan's brow suddenly furrowed.

"Speak freely. If you require any assistance, just ask! All elders will undoubtedly cooperate fully," Zhong Daogong said generously, having received Li Fan's assurance.

Li Fan nodded. "My departure this time is under the guise of searching for treasures within the star sea ruins. If I return empty-handed, it might arouse suspicion. I need to select some items from the Immortal Boat's secret treasury to bring back. Of course, the items from the first layer of the secret treasury will suffice for a perfunctory handover."

Upon hearing this, Dao Sheng suddenly asked, "If the items brought back are of higher value, wouldn't that be more beneficial for the subsequent arrangement of the ritual?"

Li Fan instinctively replied, "Naturally... However, to be honest, the help is indeed limited. The Great Qi's academic hierarchy is even more entrenched than our Immortal Boat Elder Council in terms of social stratification. A few treasures alone are far from enough. It still relies on time and enduring seniority."

The elders exchanged glances, and finally, Zhong Daogong spoke, "Even an extra bit of certainty is good. You can go to the second floor of the treasury to select items. Those stored there are all of extremely high value, but they do not affect the survival and continuation of the Immortal Boat."

Li Fan did not refuse and cupped his fists, "That would be for the best then."

Surrounded by the elders, Li Fan once again arrived at the second level of the Immortal Boat's secret treasury. He gazed at the treasure spheres, each containing rare and precious treasures sealed within the light of the Heavenly Star Lotus. The Immortal Boat Elder Council had agreed for him to select two items from here, and then another three from the first level of the secret treasury. With a total of five precious treasures in hand, he could both allay the Great Qi's suspicions and promote the smooth progression of the Grand Sky ritual.

Li Fan browsed around. From the second level of the secret treasury, he first selected a Yin-Yang Jade. It was condensed from the celestial Yin and Yang energies, achieved under a state of subtle balance. Li Fan had a premonition that if this Yin-Yang Jade were incorporated during the process of Azure Nether sublimation, it might produce some unexpected effects.

As for the second treasure he selected... it was naturally one of the three relics left behind by Sun Piao-miao, the Three-Branched Divine Tree, which Return to Truth had indeed sensed an anomaly from. The elders of the Immortal Boat had all used the 'Manifest' character technique to observe Sun Piao-miao's relics. The broken-winged gray bird and the three-branched tree did not seem to have any subtle connection to the outside world, unlike the Medicine King Cauldron. Ruling out the possibility of them being gray chess pieces, the elders concluded they were mere illusions left by Sun Piao-miao.

Li Fan explained, "Although this item has no practical value, it was also left by Sun Piao-miao. It shares the same origin as the drooping puppet that protected my life last time. My teacher will surely be very interested in it." After a moment of hesitation, the elders finally agreed to Li Fan's request.

Afterwards, Li Fan went to the first level of the secret treasury and took away a piece of black star stone, a strange bronze mirror, and a liquid long sword. Only then did he bid farewell to the Immortal Boat. His sword shadow flickered, disappearing into the pitch-black sea of stars.

After Li Fan departed, the elders of the Immortal Boat gathered. "Although he has given his word, we cannot place all our hopes on him," Zhong Daogong said gravely.

"Indeed, we must also prepare other methods to alleviate the backlash from the star sea."

"Perhaps it is time to open the third level of the Hundred Heard Immortal Record..." Upon uttering these words, the chamber fell into silence. It was as if something immensely fearsome resided within the third level of the secret treasury, something that caused everyone extreme apprehension. The elders' expressions varied, but no one voiced their agreement for a long time.

"Let's wait a while longer. Let's set a deadline of five years. Everyone think if there are any better methods."

"If he can return successfully during this period, that would be even better."

"Otherwise..." A shadow flashed in Zhong Daogong's eyes as he looked towards the now-closed entrance to the Hundred Heard Secret Treasury.

... Having left the Immortal Boat far behind, Li Fan did not immediately return to the Xuanhuang Realm. Instead, he headed towards the Great Wall of Broken Realms, to the location where Senior Yin and Bai Hua resided. Along the way, Li Fan took out the Three-Branched Tree. The anomaly of Return to Truth appeared at the opportune moment. Li Fan suppressed the surge of desire in his heart and first examined the creation before him.

Li Fan wondered what material this Three-Branched Tree was made of; it was neither copper nor wood. It possessed the hardness and coolness of metal, yet also the vitality and ancient essence of an ancient tree. On each branch, instead of twigs, grew another brand new tree. And on these secondary branches, new tri-forked branches sprouted. It was endless, seemingly without end. With Li Fan's current divine sense, continuously tracing and observing, he could not determine the total number of branches on the Three-Branched Tree in a short time.

"Indeed exquisite," Li Fan nodded slightly and then no longer suppressed the desire of Return to Truth. An inexplicable power enveloped the Three-Branched Tree, and then the ancient creation was enveloped by a faint light. It gradually became illusory and then completely disappeared into the air. Li Fan stared intently at the changes on the 'Return to Truth' panel.

But after waiting for a long time, the good fortune of the 'Void Transformation' charging progress directly increasing to 400%, as it had last time, did not occur. Even... Li Fan found no tangible changes.

"Could it be that Return to Truth just swallowed it for nothing?" The thought flashed through Li Fan's mind. However, Li Fan quickly dismissed this guess. Based on his understanding of Return to Truth, it was extremely picky. Every sustenance it received would bring about a substantive change. This time was no exception. Li Fan abandoned observation of the Return to Truth panel and focused his attention entirely on Return to Truth itself. He even stopped his wood sword escape technique across the void. Standing still in the void, Li Fan calmed his mind and sensed.

After about half a day, Li Fan suddenly opened his eyes. "As expected, the change in Return to Truth this time did not directly manifest on the panel."

"But..." Li Fan conjured another wood sword phantom. To outsiders, it was imperceptible, but only Li Fan, the wielder of the divine ability, could discern that this phantom escape technique was superior to before. To achieve such a significant improvement in a short period was entirely due to Li Fan's deeper realization of the 'Transformation of True and False.'

"It can actually help me comprehend the 'Transformation of True and False,' the essence of Return to Truth?" Li Fan was quite shocked. The Transformation of True and False was currently the highest-level power Li Fan had encountered in his continuous reincarnations, without exception. It was extremely difficult for Li Fan to comprehend and utilize it. It relied entirely on his connection with Return to Truth, utilizing the scenes of worlds becoming illusory and then reappearing each time Return to Truth was activated, and slowly comprehending it through his own悟性 (wu xing - comprehension/insight). There were no other shortcuts. But now, this Three-Branched Tree, one of Sun Piao-miao's relics, could actually assist in comprehending the Dao!

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, carefully contemplating how this incredible event had occurred. After a long time, Li Fan had a sudden realization, "The Dao of True and False, like the ultimate principle of heaven, is lofty and supreme."

"Only by activating Return to Truth each time can I fly to the heavens and observe its changes up close."

"And absorbing this Three-Branched Tree is..." Li Fan fell silent for a moment. Then, a burst of sharp light erupted from his eyes. "Return to Truth initiated a 'Simulation' without my involvement?"

"The generation and illusory transformation of true and false worlds occurred in an instant. It didn't even affect the current world, but only existed within Return to Truth!"

"Without anyone in the world noticing, another transformation between true and false occurred. Only I, through the inexplicable increase in my understanding of the Transformation of True and False, was fortunate enough to discover it..." Becoming the sole wise person in the world, Li Fan felt no excitement. Instead, a profound sense of gravity settled upon him. This so profoundly affected him that his plan to rendezvous with Senior Yin was temporarily postponed.

"Return to Truth..." Li Fan chanted in his heart. The surroundings instantly darkened. It was a darkness even more profound than the already pitch-black and dead silence of the Abyssal Sea. "When true becomes false, and false becomes true," seven bright characters then appeared. As always, Return to Truth's abilities were unaffected and could still be activated at any time.

But for some reason, Li Fan felt an unprecedented unease that lingered for a long time. In Li Fan's view, worldly matters could be divided into two categories. One was that which the ability of Return to Truth could cover. The other was that which could affect Return to Truth. Everything in the star sea, including the The Great Barrier, True Immortals, and Cat Treasures, belonged to the first category. As long as he possessed Return to Truth, Li Fan would eventually be able to trample them all underfoot.

But the other category... was beyond Li Fan's control. Being able to affect Return to Truth meant that Li Fan's greatest trump card had lost its efficacy. Although this time it seemed to be beneficial with no drawbacks, the occurrence of an uncontrollable event was definitely a warning to Li Fan. In the future, when Return to Truth experienced anomalies, would it be possible to satisfy the desire to devour each time? And what did this devouring by Return to Truth truly represent? These were questions that Li Fan had to ponder carefully.

Return to Truth, as an supreme anomaly that Li Fan had inexplicably awakened after his transmigration, as if fused with his very being, was a treasure beyond compare. To claim to not fear losing it one day would be a lie. However, his smooth journey through countless reincarnations, and even successfully establishing a foundation in the Xuanhuang Realm using Return to Truth during his hundred lives, had gradually made him forget his past anxieties. Now, with the changes in Return to Truth after absorbing the Three-Branched Divine Tree, Li Fan was awakened once more.

After a long while, Li Fan finally calmed down. "From the current perspective, it is not a bad thing for me."

"But I must quickly figure out what this Three-Branched Tree actually is. Why did it cause Return to Truth to undergo a cycle of world creation and destruction without my involvement?"

"What happened in that instantaneous cycle of creation and destruction?"

"What is special about it that caused Return to Truth to undergo such a change?" Numerous questions flooded Li Fan's mind.

"Sun Piao-miao..." Li Fan was now certain in his heart that this Three-Branched Tree must also have originated from the Immortal Realm. "Even its value is higher than that of the gray chess piece."

"But even Sun Piao-miao might not understand the secrets behind it." Li Fan pondered methods to study the Three-Branched Tree. He could not be sure if Return to Truth would still desire to devour it the next time it saw the Three-Branched Tree. Based on past experience, Return to Truth would not devour something it had already consumed. However, perhaps this peculiar Three-Branched Tree would be an exception.

So the question arose: if Return to Truth still experienced an anomaly in the next life, should Li Fan let it continue to devour? For the first time, the decisive Li Fan fell into prolonged hesitation. This indecisiveness remained even after he found Senior Yin and Bai Hua at the Great Wall of Broken Realms.

While continuing to think cautiously, Li Fan conjured his wood sword phantom escape technique, covering the two who were struggling amidst the reverberating stellar energy. The location they were currently in was a 'nodal point' generated by the Great Wall of Broken Realms to maintain its self-stability, as Senior Yin had mentioned before. Here, the reverberating stellar energy was like giant waves crashing against reefs; the violent energy fluctuations were the most extreme at the fringe of the star sea, comparable to the area beneath the The Great Barrier. With their strength, exploring here was still somewhat difficult.

"How is it? Any clues about Xu Ke?" Li Fan asked. Senior Yin adjusted his somewhat disrupted life and death energies before responding, "It is now basically confirmed that Xu Ke was swept into this place. We discovered the last marker left by Xu Ke; although extremely faint, it is identical to the one we agreed upon beforehand."

Upon hearing this, Li Fan diverted part of his attention to the surroundings. His vision shifted, from a normal perspective to a higher-dimensional view. Li Fan suddenly realized that this nodal point was not a high platform within the Great Wall of Broken Realms, but a depression! The towering, continuous Great Wall abruptly broke here. Yet, this break did not actually affect the connection of the Great Wall of Broken Realms. It was as if... within this depression, some inexplicable, invisible force was maintaining the continuous Great Wall of Broken Realms!

"Interesting." Li Fan's spirits finally lifted. The extent of this depression in the actual star sea was only a small area, just enough for one person to stand alone. To drift into it precisely amidst the fierce energy fluctuations was truly difficult.

"Perhaps only Xu Ke, that person favored by destiny, would have such luck." Li Fan thought this as his wood sword phantom, like a lone boat on a river, surged towards the depression. The closer he got to the fractured section of the Great Wall of Broken Realms, the stronger the external interference to the wood sword phantom became. Light and shadow flickered, seemingly about to burst like bubbles at any moment. Li Fan frowned slightly, concentrating his mind to maintain the escape technique without dissipating.

With a loud boom! The moment the phantom left the normal area of the Great Wall of Broken Realms and completely fell into the fractured depression, it was as if it plummeted from a ten-thousand-zhang high cliff. Under the violent impact, the wood sword phantom almost disintegrated!

Chapter 1350

This was the first time since comprehending the Wood Sword Phantasm Escape technique that Li Fan had encountered such a violent external influence on his divine ability. He even had a faint premonition that if not for the recent absorption of the Three-Pronged Tree by his [Return to Truth] ability, deepening his understanding of the Transformation between Truth and Falsehood, this sudden fall would have at least resulted in the disintegration of his divine ability and severe injuries.

Fortunately, Li Fan had made some progress. This minuscule advancement allowed him to barely maintain the Wood Sword Phantasm, successfully entering the depression-like anchor point within the Great Wall of Broken Realms! Unlike the previous depression anchor point he encountered, which served as a reservoir for True Immortal residual power, upon entering this new location, one could clearly perceive the drastic difference caused by the intense shift in elevation relative to the outside. It was like a chasm, a bottomless fissure splitting the earth. Li Fan and the others had currently fallen to the bottom, gazing up at a continuous line of sky revealed above. However, this sky was a void of utter darkness, filled with a deathly silence.

As for this fissure-like depression… Li Fan did not retract the Wood Sword Phantasm, continuing to use it to shield Senior Yin and Bai Hua. He himself then moved outside the phantom, personally sensing the surroundings. It remained enveloped in darkness, but this "darkness" was different from the deathly silent void outside. It was more akin to the arrival of a summer night, brimming with nascent life hidden within!

"The fissure anchor point of the The Great Barriers actually converges such immense vitality?" Li Fan was inwardly shocked. Upon a more careful observation, he confirmed that this was no illusion. Li Fan's further examination revealed that within the fissure anchor point, besides pure vitality, there seemed to be no nascent life being nurtured. Moreover, its actual scope was not as it appeared from a normal perspective, merely a corner of the world. Instead, it extended limitlessly outwards, seemingly without end.

With no immediate danger, Li Fan finally retracted his divine ability. Senior Yin and Bai Hua looked at their surroundings with astonishment. The birth of vitality here clearly exceeded their understanding. Their nerves were taut, fearing that some unknown creature might suddenly emerge from the surrounding gloom to attack them. Seeing their reactions, Li Fan realized they were not as composed as he was. Perhaps it was their first experience of the "extreme difference in elevation," detached from their innate environments, causing them to become restless and fearful. It was like mortals who had lived for years on a plateau suddenly finding themselves at the edge of a cliff or in a deep valley, without any means of self-protection. A change in their state of mind was inevitable.

He spoke a few comforting words in a deep voice and then Li Fan led them to begin exploring slowly within the fissure depression. An absolute silence pervaded the area. Pure vitality, as if from the dawn of creation, flowed quietly here like an underground river. The vitality rose upwards but could not escape the deep fissure. It merely lingered and converged in this place. Li Fan keenly sensed that the vitality here was significantly different from the vitality that nurtured life in the Xuanhuang Realm. If the Xuanhuang Realm possessed such a vast amount of vitality, it would undoubtedly trigger all sorts of inconceivable changes: mountains would erupt from the ground, and trees would stretch skyward in endless succession. It would also surely be accompanied by the birth of countless new species and new life forms. But here, vitality was merely vitality. It did not meet the conditions for the birth and evolution of life, creating a sensation akin to a stagnant pool, which gave people an extremely eerie feeling.

"Perhaps it is because the prevailing force here is too low," Li Fan mused inwardly. After cautiously exploring for half a day, the surrounding scenery showed no significant changes. Li Fan frowned, instructing Senior Yin and Bai Hua to wait in place. He then piloted the Wood Sword Phantasm, moving forward at high speed. With his current teleportation speed, he could traverse the entire Abyssal Sea in less than a day. But Li Fan was horrified to discover that this fissure depression was far more extensive than imagined! As he advanced, Li Fan found that the fissure branches out like a labyrinth, with its direction gradually splitting into different paths. Initially, it was fine, with only a few divergences. But later, each branch led to dozens, even hundreds, of different passages. Each passage soon led to more branching paths. Eventually, even with his heaven-defying teleportation technique, Li Fan dared not venture further. This fissure labyrinth was simply too vast. After three days of rapid exploration, theoretically enough time to visit the entire Abyssal Sea, Li Fan still could not see the end of the fissure labyrinth. Li Fan had no choice but to return, relying on his memory of the path he took.

After explaining the situation to Senior Yin and Bai Hua, both were profoundly shaken. "This peculiar fissure is definitely not just beneath the Great Wall of Broken Realms," Senior Yin speculated, a hint of understanding dawning on his face. "Perhaps, like an underground aqueduct, it connects to all parts of the Abyssal Sea from all directions!" Bai Hua nodded in agreement. "I can vaguely sense the source of the vitality here. Besides the countless ruined worlds within the Great Wall of Broken Realms that have already perished, it originates from every corner of the silent star sea!" "It's like an underground river, drawing in every bit of newly generated vitality, converging here like a stream." If the The Great Barriers were considered the supreme entities that encircled the star sea, then the hidden fissure depression beneath these walls was the lowest point of the entire starry sky. The vast majority of vitality that revived from the destruction of the star sea slowly converged here through the ubiquitous fissures beneath the star sea. It was precisely because it had gathered the vast majority of the entire star sea's vitality over countless millennia that the immense, almost terrifying, amount of vitality contained here made even Li Fan’s heart pound.

"This magnificent creation is absolutely beyond human capability…" "Could it be the work of True Immortals once again? Just like the The Great Barriers, its purpose was to completely seal off the vitality of the Abyssal Sea," Senior Yin's expression shifted, his mood uncertain. As for Bai Hua, she had gradually emerged from her previous fear. "Sage Master, may I extract some vitality from here?" she asked. Li Fan's gaze flickered, and after a moment of thought, he replied, "If you only take a small amount, without provoking an upheaval in the vitality river, it should be safe." "But remember, do not be greedy, take what you need and stop. Otherwise…" Li Fan looked at the calmly flowing vitality here, his expression serious. "The quantity is too immense. If this grand force erupts suddenly, even vitality can kill a person!" Bai Hua nodded. "I understand that. In fact, I don't need that much. Just enough to awaken the Glazed World Frozen by Ice…" Bai Hua said with a faint sigh, transforming into her Glazed Golden Body as she spoke. Within the radiant, transparent form, a miniature world, like a crystal carving, was clearly visible. One could vaguely discern scenes of countless cultivators, sects, and mountain ranges from the past.

"Glazed… Blossom…" Bai Hua softly chanted, her golden body suddenly transforming into a thirty-two-petaled Glazed Golden Flower. It was sacred and solemn. The Glazed Golden Flower floated into the river of vitality without causing any splashes. It simply floated quietly. The thirty-two petals slowly unfurled. Li Fan observed as wisps of vitality were drawn by these petals and poured into the miniature world at the center of the flower. However, the immense vitality before them seemed extremely viscous, not easily drawn. Even with the full effort of the thirty-two golden petals, only a visible drop or two appeared in the central phantom. But even this small amount of vitality was like timely rain to the microcosm world. It was as if a wilting flower had been watered again, regaining its original luster. All sorts of incredible changes occurred in that microcosm world, which was the Myriad Abundance Realm. Bai Hua's face lit up with ecstatic joy. Senior Yin was also momentarily captivated by this wondrous sight.

Li Fan, however, noticed that due to Bai Hua's act of absorbing vitality, a subtle vortex began to form around her as the surrounding majestic vitality surged towards her. The vortex was initially small, but soon it showed a tendency to expand wildly. It seemed as if the vitality of the entire fissure was about to surge towards them. The immense pressure, like that of the heavens descending to crush and sweep away everything, made Li Fan unable to help but look over. "That's enough!" Li Fan frowned and called out a reminder. Bai Hua, relatively clear-headed, was not blinded by temporary gain. Despite her reluctance, she finally retracted the thirty-two-petaled Glazed Golden Flower. Without an outlet, the gradually roaring vitality river began to calm down. However, the converged vitality did not dissipate in a short time; it formed a swift current in this area. Under the scouring force of the vitality, Li Fan and the others within it felt as though their very souls were about to be swept away. Li Fan had to reinforce the protection of the Wood Sword Phantasm divine ability.

Senior Yin looked at the scene, which appeared calm but was actually bizarrely perilous, and suddenly exclaimed with realization, "I know where that contradictory and ever-perilous feeling comes from! It's because what flows here is not just vitality. On the surface of the vitality, there is a layer of unknown power that absorbs vitality!" "It is this power that continuously draws vitality from all parts of the star sea and stores it here!" Bai Hua, having returned to her normal form, nodded in agreement. "To separate this power from pure vitality, it was so difficult for me to absorb it. Strictly speaking, this vitality-stripping force does not seem to possess a high level of authority. Even I could separate it from the vitality." "But…" A trace of fear flashed across Bai Hua's face. "Its quantity is simply too immense. Whatever vitality the fissure holds, there is that much vitality-stripping force. We might be able to withstand a few waves of its onslaught, but we absolutely cannot survive its continuous scouring." At this point, Bai Hua couldn't help but glance at Li Fan. She paused. "Perhaps, Sage Master, with your transcendent teleportation technique, you could escape."

Li Fan did not reply. Instead, he reached out his hand to touch and feel the turbulent surge of vitality around him. The erosion of the vitality-stripping force was so evident. The hand that was impacted instantly turned pale. The flesh seemed to be drained, and the skeletal structure within was faintly visible. Moreover, this loss of vitality slowly began to spread to other parts of his body. Li Fan decisively severed his arm, finally stopping the further encroachment of the vitality-stripping force. The severed hand fell into the river of vitality. Without the protection of its main body, it soon dissolved and disappeared like a wax sculpture under high heat, becoming part of the river of vitality.

"This power…" Li Fan grew a new arm, moved it slightly, and recalled the details he had perceived earlier. It was not a normal extraction of vitality. Instead, it instantaneously washed away the very foundation upon which vitality depended. If the skin does not exist, how can the hair attach? Without a foundation, vitality has no where to attach and can only drift with the current. This was an extremely profound and mystical sensation. Li Fan could not yet comprehend what the foundation of vitality truly was. But he could clearly feel its loss.

"Indeed, it's unfathomable." "But…" "It seems to share some commonality with the The Great Barriers?" Li Fan mused thoughtfully. "The so-called The Great Barriers are supreme rules that restrict. There is no road ahead, or rather, there is no 'ahead'!" "And the vitality-stripping force in this fissure removes the very foundation of life's sustenance." "…" The fissure depression, hidden beneath the normal star sea, spread like an underground river throughout all parts of the star sea. Its immense scale was clearly something that only beings capable of constructing The Great Barriers could create. "Perhaps, as Senior Yin speculated, it was used to extract and seal the birth of vitality in the star sea?" But Li Fan soon felt a hint of doubt. It did indeed extract vitality, but it did not completely extract it. For the vast amount of vitality absorbed by the fissure over countless millennia still lay quietly here! Admittedly, entering the fissure was extremely difficult. Li Fan had traveled back and forth between the Great Wall of Broken Realms countless times without detecting the extremely subtle entry point. But it was not absolutely impossible. There were still ways to enter by chance. For example, this time, Xu Ke was affected by the chaotic reverberating stellar energy and happened to enter this fissure.

"If they truly wanted to sever the vitality of the star sea, with their means of creating The Great Barriers and digging fissures, they could have directly extracted this vitality outside the The Great Barriers." "Yet they deliberately left it within the star sea…" Li Fan pondered, his expression becoming enigmatic. "Either, the creators of the fissure and the The Great Barriers are two different entities." "Or, it was done intentionally." Suddenly, Li Fan's vision conjured the complete image of the entire Abyssal Sea. High walls stood around the star sea, sealing it. At the bottom of the star sea, dense fissures connected like conduits, extracting and preserving the star sea's vitality. And at the fringe of the star sea, the supreme The Great Barriers and the lowest fissures converged at a single point. "A marvel of the star sea." "For the beings within the star sea, these are despair-inducing existences. However…" "Perhaps this fissure is not." Li Fan's vision shifted again. "The star sea revives from destruction. However, for life to re-emerge is not something that can happen overnight." "Especially with the lingering residual power of True Immortals over countless millennia, even if vitality re-emerges, it will only be quickly contaminated by this residual power. It's like a blazing desert; even if there's a little rain during the day, it quickly evaporates." "The vitality slowly emerging throughout the star sea is purely wasted; it cannot truly enable the star sea to breed life." "But if all of it were collected…" Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

Recommending Yan Shen's new book.

The continent has been divided for over three hundred years.

The Central Plains are filled with music and dance, while foreign tribes sharpen their weapons. Jianghu swordsmen roam freely, and famous generals suppress the land.

Five years before the world descends into chaos, the twelve-year-old herbalist Li Guan Yi kills a man on a rainy night.

He finally opens his eyes to see this chaotic world.

Under the hooves, piled white bones. Famous generals, beauties, Jianghu, divine weapons, the common folk.

Since ancient times, only white bones and yellow sand fields have been seen!

Scholars, trampled by iron hooves; Buddhas, swept away by spears!

This humble Taoist, Li Guan Yi, invites this world to meet its death!

Chapter 1351

"It's like an underground reservoir in a desert, collecting every drop of water that infiltrates over millions of years. Then, one day, when the time is right and the heavens unleash a torrential downpour, bathing the desert in sweet rain. This underground reservoir will then surge forth, sweeping across the entire desert. In conjunction with the grand forces of heaven and earth, it will transform the sandy expanse, turning it from vast dunes into a surging sea of marshes in an instant! This is a method of altering the heavens and changing the earth!" Li Fan's eyes flickered, as if he could see through the secrets hidden beneath the tranquil river of life.

Alas, as he had surmised before, the creator of the river of life was undoubtedly a being beyond the mortal realm. Their arrangements were clearly not achieved through formations, making it impossible for the current Li Fan to comprehend.

The surge caused by the hundred flowers absorbing life force gradually subsided. Even after it returned to its dormant state, Li Fan's observations yielded no progress. Senior Yin and Hundred Flowers were in the same boat. It was as if they were standing before a The Great Barrier, exposed to view but impossible to comprehend. No matter how many methods they employed to peer into its secrets, they remained elusive. This gap was almost despair-inducing. The three of them stood silently on the river of life, lost in thought for a long time.

After an unknowable period, Li Fan shook his head slightly. "In ancient times, there was the sigh of 'gazing at the ocean'; today, we have the despair of 'seeing the river and losing all hope.' The secrets of this place are beyond our current exploration. We can only hope that Xu Ke, lost within, has a guardian spirit watching over him." He had initially thought finding Xu Ke would be a trivial task. Who would have known that beneath this fragmented celestial wall lay fissures spanning the entire sea of stars?

Thus, the plan had to change. In reality, if Li Fan had continued his exploration, relying on the recording function of the Dao-Melting Stone and the escape technique of the wooden sword's phantom, he might have been able to fully explore the star sea fissures. However, the main focus of this life was the sublimation of the Xuanhuang Realm. The life force contained within the star sea fissures was too immense. Even if he could draw some of it to aid in the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation, the explored regions alone would provide more than enough.

"Sage Master, I intend to stay here for now," Hundred Flowers said after some hesitation. "The life force here is of great use for reviving the Myriad Abundance Realm. Although I can only extract a small amount each time, with persistent effort, within half a year, I can restore my homeland!" Li Fan gazed at Hundred Flowers, his sight seemingly piercing her physical form to reach the microcosm within.

"Even if it's revived, I fear your old acquaintances may not all be resurrected," Li Fan frowned. Li Fan could naturally see that the Myriad Abundance Realm and its inhabitants had all been refined by Hundred Flowers into a golden, glazed state. Even if surging life force could wash over them, restoring them from this glazed state, it was uncertain how many beings would withstand such a transformation in the process.

Hundred Flowers, however, remained resolute. "We can only do our best and leave the rest to fate! Before, there was no method to revive the world at all. Now that a rare opportunity is before us, how can we ignore it?" Seeing this, Li Fan did not object.

Senior Yin then spoke up, "I will stay with Hundred Flowers. For the time being, I do not wish to leave." Li Fan's eyebrows rose. "Is this life force useful to you as well?" Senior Yin shook his head. "No. It's just that near this river of life, I feel an unparalleled peace of mind. Those fragmented souls of worlds that occasionally surfaced in my consciousness have all fallen silent here..." This reason left Li Fan speechless.

"Very well. If you have nothing else to do, you may search for Xu Ke. If you find him, all the better. If not, do not force it; your own safety comes first." "The sublimation of the Xuanhuang Realm is a long-term plan. We can afford to wait half a year. You two shall remain here, and I will return to fetch you in half a year," Li Fan said to the two.

The two cupped their fists and bid farewell to Li Fan. Li Fan then stepped forward, a phantom of his wooden sword emanating around him. Moments later, a strange fluctuation appeared around him. It was the Ascending Array! The formidable pressure, akin to a cultivator ascending to the Heavenly Gate, caused Senior Yin and Hundred Flowers to move away, seeking to avoid it.

Before them, Li Fan's actual position did not change. Yet, they genuinely felt that Li Fan was growing further and further away from them, rising ever higher. Li Fan, standing within the phantom of his wooden sword, gradually became ethereal. Finally, he completely faded and vanished from their sight.

"Such a method..." Senior Yin exclaimed, dazzled. "If Sage Master does not return for us in half a year, we might be trapped here for the rest of our lives." Hundred Flowers did not refute, merely saying, "However, this place is full of life force, so we need not worry about being trapped to death." She then continued to stare at the calm river of life, awaiting the next opportunity for it to absorb more.

...The Fragmented Celestial Wall. Beyond the node leading to the fissure's depression. Without any warning, Li Fan's figure abruptly appeared. The moment he returned to the sea of stars, he stopped the Ascending Array and, using the escape technique of his wooden sword's phantom, left the node's vicinity. In just a few breaths, he ascended from the lowest elevation to the normal elevated sea of stars. The rapid change in elevation in such a short time caused his body and soul to feel as if they had endured a violent impact.

*Puff, puff...* Blood splattered, and his skin cracked. His divine soul felt as if it had been crushed by thousands of rolling boulders, enduring immense pressure. Even with Li Fan's foundation, his face instantly turned deathly pale.

"What just happened was akin to a half-ascension. It's like ascending from a lower-tier world to this current sea of stars. The impact was so severe, one can imagine the trials of a true ascension. Without the protection of immortal Spirit Qi, an ordinary cultivator would likely not survive." While Li Fan was lost in thought for a few breaths, his injuries completely healed.

Without leaving, Li Fan gazed at the wondrous sight beneath the The Great Barrier. The unseen The Great Barrier, the continuous fragmented celestial wall, and the endless fissures at the lowest point of the sea of stars. They intertwined, creating a dreamlike, mysterious, and unfathomable scene. Even with Li Fan's strength, which was nearing the pinnacle of the sea of stars, this part of the star sea remained full of mysteries. Perhaps, as he grew stronger and discovered more, his confusion would only deepen. Until one day, when he broke through a certain limit, everything would be revealed. Li Fan took one last, deep look at this marvel of the star sea, then drew the phantom of his wooden sword and flew towards the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Dealing with the Immortal Boat's ceremony can wait for now. If things happen too quickly, it might arouse suspicion." "However, as progress advances, it's time to formally begin nurturing the Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate of this life." The vast amounts of immortal Spirit Qi required for the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation could only be accessed by succeeding to the position of Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate. The position of Great Heavenly Venerate still carried the constraints of the former Immortal Realm. The scene of Sun Tianci's untimely death in his previous life was still clear in his mind, which meant Li Fan would certainly not put himself in danger.

Fortunately, in this life, he did not need to create another Sun Tianci who was born into Dao Integration. The Doctrine Transmitter phantom had been tirelessly preaching in multiple mortal pocket worlds. A suitable candidate had already been identified. Li Fan's figure flickered, and he arrived in a nameless mortal world.

The scale of this pocket world, let alone comparable to Great Qi or Great Li, was even inferior to the Spirit Wood Realm. A mountain range composed of thirteen peaks constituted the entirety of the world. It was less a pocket world and more a small-scale grotto-heaven. Yet, in this mortal pocket world, which even a Foundation Establishment cultivator might overlook, Li Fan sensed the birth of a nascent consciousness of the world's Heavenly Dao.

And within it, a boy with a disposition of utmost purity and truth. Perhaps due to the world's small size, humans here faced great difficulty in conceiving the next generation. Consequently, the total human population was always maintained at a low level. For them, the resources in the mountains were practically inexhaustible. With thirteen peaks and so few people, they all knew each other, leading to very little conflict. Most of their time each day was spent in idleness.

Some humans in this place, inevitably, became curious about the world beyond the mountains. But much like the beings in the star sea who were confined within The Great Barriers, they would never be able to leave the boundaries of their world in their lifetime. There was one such young boy who, from the day he could walk, often climbed the highest peak in this world. Standing alone on the summit, he surveyed the meager world below. Then, he would lie down and quietly gaze at the sky.

Li Fan had observed this young boy before. As he climbed and gazed, his mind was filled with myriad thoughts. But when he lay down and looked up at the sky, his consciousness would lapse into an absolute blankness; his thoughts would completely pacify. If Li Fan hadn't been able to sense his life force, he would have almost assumed he had passed away. It was known that for a living being to exist in the world and interact with its surroundings would inevitably lead to the formation of thoughts. Only a select few, through chance or extraordinary talent, could enter such a state of unknowing ignorance.

However, for this young boy, this state, which cultivators sought but rarely found, was his normal. Furthermore... this thirteen-peak world was simply too small. Yet, by a twist of fate, it had birthed its own Heavenly Dao consciousness. Among the extremely limited number of living beings, the boy's act of lying down at the world's highest point and gazing at the sky every day naturally attracted the attention of this world's Heavenly Dao.

However, the Heavenly Dao consciousness of this thirteen-peak world was also in its infant, nascent stage, merely approaching with instinctive curiosity. Thus, the boy's divine soul, like a blank canvas, slowly imprinted the approaching Heavenly Dao of the thirteen-peak world. The traces left by the Heavenly Dao consciousness in his divine soul did not affect the boy's inherent disposition. He continued to climb and gaze at the sky day after day. And unknowingly, the Heavenly Dao consciousness descended with increasing familiarity, leaving its mark.

...Li Fan had observed countless individuals and countless small worlds. He had to admit that this was a miracle that could not be replicated. "Resembling man, resembling heaven; in fact, it is man embodying heaven. The unity of man and heaven, man seizing heaven's marvelous essence!" "To observe the way of heaven and act according to heaven's will, thus is perfection!" This unnamed young boy, inadvertently, had achieved the perfect state recorded by ancient cultivators, a state yearned for.

Although the world's scale was too small, and its Heavenly Dao's completeness was incomparable to the Xuanhuang Realm's, there was no doubt that to Li Fan, this young boy was an absolutely perfect embryo for a Great Heavenly Venerate. The Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate, in essence, was the human who governed heaven. While the Heavenly Dao flowed normally, at certain crucial moments, the Great Heavenly Venerate would intervene and regulate. For Li Fan, he merely needed a puppet to access the legacy of the former Great Heavenly Venerates.

The more autonomous the puppet, the better. However, if it were just a puppet without initiative, it would be unable to pass the succession trials. The appearance of this young boy perfectly solved Li Fan's problem. "In his current state, even after becoming the Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate, he will take no independent action. He will fully adhere to the original workings of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, governing by non-action." "And for the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, a Great Heavenly Venerate who does nothing is what it would absolutely welcome. Perhaps his compatibility is no less than that of Mr. Bai..." The more Li Fan looked at the young boy, the more satisfied he became.

With a flick of his finger, a small amount of light and shadow quietly flowed into the boy's pure and flawless blank consciousness, without even disturbing the approaching Heavenly Dao consciousness of this world. This time, Li Fan did not directly implant the details of the Great Heavenly Venerate's Fallen Immortal Realm trials. He merely provided subtle hints and guidance at key decision points. The boy's thoughts were too simple. With these prompts, he should be able to pass the trials by instinctively making the right choices.

"The future Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate cannot be without a name." "From now on, you shall be called [Nameless]." To preserve Nameless's purity, Li Fan did not even implant his own existence into his sea of consciousness. Leaving the Thirteen Peaks, performing the ritual to enter the Fallen Immortal Illusion Realm, succeeding to the position of Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate, and later detonating the immortal artifact to infuse the Xuanhuang Realm with immortal Spirit Qi, thereby promoting the birth of the first Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls after sublimation... all would rely on silent guidance and hints.

This meant that Li Fan would have to cooperate with Nameless, in turn, to execute his Dao Integration plan. However, Nameless's characteristic of non-action would minimize uncontrollability. "For a very long time, Nameless's existence will be nearly zero." "However, if after this life, when I achieve Dao Integration and the Xuanhuang Realm is still around... Li Fan's eyes gleamed with a strange light. "As time flows, and his being merges with the super Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao consciousness, perhaps Nameless can, with this opportunity, achieve a level comparable to a True Immortal!" It was foreseeable that the Xuanhuang Realm, propelled by Li Fan's various schemes in this life, could be promoted to an Immortal Domain.

And to merge with the Heavenly Dao consciousness of an Immortal Domain... even True Immortals of the past might not have achieved this! At that time, his power would undoubtedly far surpass that of the Immortal Boat's evenly distributed sea consciousness! However, the time required was simply too long. Only someone like Nameless, born by chance with such a pure disposition, could accomplish this. If it were Li Fan, he would not be able to endure for long before his true self would inevitably conflict with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao. Therefore, Li Fan had abandoned the idea of replacing it from the very beginning.

"I just don't know what changes the position of Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate will undergo once the Xuanhuang Realm is sublimated into an Immortal Domain?" "Will the shackles left by the former Immortal Realm disappear, or will they deepen?"

Chapter 1352: Dao Erasure Approaches the Star Sea

Guided by Li Fan's hint, Wuming did not immediately leave the Thirteen Peaks world. He simply stood up, as if drawn by an unseen force, gazing upwards.

He felt closer to the Heavenly Dao of this world. Extending his arms slightly, he touched the wind, touched the sky.

Under the same blue sky and white clouds, the inhabitants of the Thirteen Peaks world remained oblivious. Only Li Fan could perceive the faint tremor that ran through the entire world as Wuming made contact.

"It seems to sense Wuming's impending departure. The world's Heavenly Dao is accelerating its fusion with him..."

"Henceforth, the world's Heavenly Dao will endure, but a replica will accompany Wuming to the greater world beyond."

"How similar!"

"If one had the ability, who would wish to remain a bird in a cage forever?" Li Fan sighed softly, then his expression turned solemn. "Then I shall give you another push." The phantom of the True Immortal Sigils for [Creation] flashed across the sky of the Thirteen Peaks world.

This world was truly minuscule. The Creation character, only by appearing, was enough to cause cataclysmic changes.

Spiritual energy began to manifest within the world. The Thirteen Peaks mountain range slowly ascended. The grass and trees on the mountains teemed with life.

Standing atop the highest peak, Wuming felt a stirring within him. He awoke from his immersion, looking around, but found nothing.

Sensing the changes in his surroundings, Wuming, though bewildered, gradually revealed a joyful smile.

...The transformations within the Thirteen Peaks world continued. Li Fan, however, left a wisp of his divine sense in the world to monitor Wuming's actions.
