He departed first. Returning to the Xuanhuang Realm, he retrieved a jade talismans from his person. It flickered, appearing very urgent.

This was the jade talisman that Mo Rubing had left him previously. Mo Rubing was in the Eye of the Tian Beast, intending to use its power to search the Xuanhuang Realm and the Abyssal Star Sea for Tian Xuan King's whereabouts.

He had said it would take at most three to five months. Reckoning the time, it was about due. His divine sense connected, and Mo Rubing's voice instantly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

It was intermittent and unclear, as if affected by some interference.

"I've discovered... something strange..."

"Come quickly." The transmission was only this one sentence. The jade talisman's light dimmed, but Li Fan vaguely sensed its guidance towards the Eye of the Tian Beast's bone脉 in Nine Mountains Province.

With a single step, Li Fan arrived in the territory of Nine Mountains Province. The so-called bone脉 of the Tian Beast were the nine mountain ranges that stretched across the heavens and earth.

Following the jade talisman's guidance, Li Fan reached the summit of Jade Prison Mountain. Jade Prison Mountain was the tallest among the Nine Mountains.

Standing on its peak, he could see the entire network of the Nine Mountains. It was likely due to the power enhancement from the Eye of the Tian Beast, as indicated in Mo Rubing's jade talisman; Li Fan had observed the Nine Mountains from high above many times before, but never with such clarity.

All the mountains and rivers that had evolved from the Tian Beast's skeleton were erased. In Li Fan's eyes, only the original form of the Tian Beast remained.

As Mo Rubing had said, although the Tian Beast was dead, its bone脉 persisted. Through these nine mountain ranges, even after tens of thousands of years, Li Fan could still faintly discern the shape of the ancient colossal beast.

"The Nine Mountains are: True Heaven Long, True Heaven Short, True Heaven Void, True Heaven Urgent, True Heaven Knot, True Heaven Substitute, True Heaven Prison, True Heaven Motion, True Heaven Fine."

"These are the Nine Manifestations of the脈."

"This Tian Beast was formed from a jade pendant brought back from the Immortal Realm by Tian Xuan King, yet its meridians are no different from a human's..." The guiding force from the jade talisman grew stronger, and suddenly, it felt as if it was enveloped by a thin membrane.

Li Fan did not resist the force that enveloped him, allowing it to lead him. A moment later, Li Fan found himself back within the Eye of the Tian Beast.

The sense of danger he felt caused him to reinforce his own defenses. Compared to when he had left, this place seemed to have undergone some change.

Mo Rubing's condition also looked worse. He wasn't visibly injured, but he appeared significantly weakened, as if his vital essence had been drained. For a cultivator of Mo Rubing's standing, this was something that typically only occurred after sustaining a fatal blow.

"Brother Mo, what happened?" Li Fan whispered first, his voice laced with alarm. Mo Rubing waved a hand. "It's fine now. It was caused by that strange phenomenon I told you about." Without further delay, he got to the point.

"Fellow Daoist, observe." The space within the Eye of the Tian Beast suddenly lit up. The countless circular bubbles on the surrounding curved boundary all displayed the same scene.

"This is not a real-time observation by the Eye of the Tian Beast. It's a recording of past events," Mo Rubing informed him. The countless bubbles overlapped, fusing thousands of images.

Instantly, Li Fan felt as if he were there. In the stillness, yet hidden with vitality, lay the star sea. A miniature black vortex spun slowly and ceaselessly.

It was a blackness that represented the annihilation of everything. Though slow, it expanded resolutely towards the outside. True Immortal residual energy, the revitalizing power of the star sea... whatever it was, it was consumed and assimilated under the sweep of this black vortex.

The perspective of the scene suddenly zoomed out. From a corner of the star sea, it expanded to encompass nearly the entire Abyssal Star Sea. The black vortex, in the already pitch-black Abyssal Star Sea, was barely noticeable.

But after Li Fan witnessed the full panorama of the star sea, his gaze remained fixed on the vortex. He could not suppress the sense of crisis in his heart.

His heart, unusually, skipped several beats. Only then did Li Fan realize that the location of the black vortex was precisely the center of the star sea he had previously visited, where he had come into contact with the true intent of the star sea's origin!

Furthermore, the black mist that constituted the black vortex... it bore a striking resemblance to what he had obtained from decomposing True Immortal flesh and blood with the White Circle Falling Mortal Technique, and what was contained within Han Zhong, who was trapped in the Eye of the Tian Beast.

However, the three gave Li Fan distinctly different impressions, with clear gradations in power. The one in the black vortex was far more dangerous.

Li Fan could not help but frown slightly.

"What is this?" he asked.

"I'm not sure. But I can confirm it is related to the 'Dao Erasure Tribulation' of the Immortal Realm from long ago," Mo Rubing stated solemnly, his words startling.

"?" Li Fan's heart leaped in alarm.

"The Dao Erasure Tribulation?" Mo Rubing waved his hand, and the black vortexes in the surrounding bubbles disappeared, returning to the normal depiction of the star sea.

"I accidentally discovered this black vortex while using the Eye of the Tian Beast to search the star sea for Brother Xuanyuan."

"At first, I didn't pay much attention. I thought it was just a normal anomaly evolving in the star sea over the years. But later..." Mo Rubing coughed and extended his ten fingers towards the bubbles of the Eye of the Tian Beast.

In an instant, thousands of ink-colored strands shot out from Mo Rubing's fingertips, each flying towards a different bubble. Li Fan clearly saw that at the end of each ink-colored strand was a miniature figure of Mo Rubing.

However, their expressions varied – some were ferocious, some terrified, some deranged. As the myriad Mo Rubings surged towards the bubbles of the Eye of the Tian Beast and made contact, they let out sharp, piercing screams as if subjected to some terrible torture.

Yet, their bodily actions did not cease. They plunged their hands into the bubbles and pulled fiercely. Like a rotten, foul-smelling outer layer being peeled away, they tore a viscous, black, unknown substance from the Eye of the Tian Beast.

Ahhh! The mini Mo Rubings wailed even more intensely. Their figures became blurred by this black substance, appearing as though they might vanish at any moment.

But under Mo Rubing's control, they never let go. They completely tore the black, decaying skin from the Eye of the Tian Beast.

Gurgle, gurgle... Then, instead of collecting the black substance, they opened their already indistinct mouths and began to devour it in large gulps.

As the thick, decaying blackness entered their stomachs, the faces of the micro Mo Rubings became indistinguishable.

"With the Demonic Heart unextinguished, the Immortal Body endures." At this juncture, Mo Rubing's cold voice suddenly rang out. A mysterious power enveloped and descended upon the blurred figures.

It maintained them, preventing them from completely dissipating. They were like sacks that hadn't been torn, holding the black, viscous substance.

Mo Rubing’s expression was one of utmost gravity as he cautiously summoned his demonic heart back. Of course, it did not return to himself.

Instead, he took out a jade box and placed them all inside. After completing this, Mo Rubing let out a long sigh of relief.

Li Fan noticed that Mo Rubing had grown even weaker. He stared intently at Mo Rubing, awaiting an explanation. After resting for a while, Mo Rubing spoke weakly, "This is the fourth cleansing I've performed."

"Originally, I thought this black mist was just a normal phenomenon of the star sea, harmless. I never imagined that a few observations would lead to the Eye of the Tian Beast being corrupted by it."

"Fortunately, the Eye of the Tian Beast originated from the Immortal Realm, its essence higher than that of the lower star sea. And we didn't have direct contact. So, there was still room for recovery."

"It was possible to remove the attached black mist using my previous cleansing method." Li Fan heard this and also let out a sigh of relief, "That's fortunate amidst misfortune." However, he soon startled and asked with dread, "The Dao Erasure Tribulation, that tribulation you said previously destroyed the Immortal Realm. Has it already appeared in the star sea? Even True Immortals cannot resist it. Are we not facing disaster now?"

"You needn't be so tense, fellow Daoist. The situation isn't that dire," Mo Rubing shook his head. He paused, carefully choosing his words, and slowly said, "Back then, Brother Xuanyuan had already worried about the Dao Erasure Tribulation of the Immortal Realm spreading to the lower realms."

"Although he never explicitly said it, I could tell."

"As I mentioned before, the Dao Erasure Tribulation, if you don't know its name, you wouldn't recognize its true nature even if you saw it. But if you know its name, you will instinctively feel something upon first encountering its signs. Since you now know it, the name '[Dao Erasure]', have you felt anything upon seeing this black mist?" Mo Rubing asked.

Li Fan recalled what he had just seen. "I did not feel anything."

"That's precisely it," Mo Rubing said solemnly.

"I suspect this black mist is not the [Dao Erasure Tribulation] itself. Rather, it is a precursor to the tribulation's arrival!"

"Just as before heavy rain, there must be accumulated dark clouds; before an earthquake, the earth veins must churn. Disasters in the world often come with omens. This black mist may be a sign that the Dao Erasure Tribulation is about to descend."

"And also..." Mo Rubing's expression grew even more serious.

"It's not just a sign. As you saw earlier, the black mist seems capable of devouring anything that approaches it in the star sea. Therefore, if we don't take precautions and let it spread, the increase in the black mist's scale might hasten the arrival of the Dao Erasure Tribulation." Li Fan's brows furrowed, his expression extremely solemn.

As if processing the information in Mo Rubing's words, he remained silent for a long time.

"How could this be?" After a long while, Li Fan only managed to utter this sentence, his tone carrying a hint of dread.

Mo Rubing could only offer a silent response.

"The world is full of impermanence. Or perhaps, everything was destined from the day the Immortal Realm was destroyed," Mo Rubing sighed after a long silence.

"Is there no way to stop the spread of this black vortex?" Li Fan asked, unwilling to accept fate.

"Even if there is, it's not something we can know. Brother Xuanyuan might have a way." Li Fan's eyes lit up, as if he had found a lifeline. He quickly asked, "Right, Daoist friend, have you found any trace of Tian Xuan King while searching the Xuanhuang Realm and the star sea with the Eye of the Tian Beast?" Mo Rubing let out a self-mocking laugh. "If I had found him, I wouldn't have to go through the trouble of cleaning this Dao Erasure black mist myself."

"However..."

"It's not a complete loss." Li Fan's gaze sharpened, focusing intently on Mo Rubing.

"Back when Brother Xuanyuan mysteriously disappeared, he sent out several warnings in his final moments."

"Among them, we, his Dharma King brothers, should have all received one."

"There was also one transmission that went beyond the Xuanhuang Realm, even beyond the star sea."

"This transmission was extremely covert. I wouldn't have been able to detect it initially. It was only by using the Eye of the Tian Beast that I managed to leave a trace, which I then sensed," Mo Rubing whispered.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes upon hearing this. "Beyond the star sea? Could it be..." His heart leaped in surprise.

"There's only one possibility. Brother Xuanyuan's intended recipient should be the Faceless Immortal," Mo Rubing stated directly.

"I recall you mentioning that when Tian Xuan King disappeared back then, the statue and head of the Faceless Immortal somehow broke off..." Mo Rubing nodded. "So I surmise that Brother Xuanyuan encountered danger, and the Faceless Immortal provided protection. Yet, he was unable to preserve the medium of power transmission, and the stone statue was severed."

"In his final moments, Brother Xuanyuan discovered something, and thus through the Eye of the Tian Beast of the [Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation], he sent a transmission towards the position of the Faceless Immortal, beyond the star sea."

"He wanted to tell that Faceless True Immortal of his discovery." Li Fan listened intently and said, "Is it possible to determine what message Tian Xuan King sent back then by following the traces left by the Eye of the Tian Beast?"

"That's impossible to do," Mo Rubing replied with regret.

"Let alone the fact that Brother Xuanyuan would have certainly encrypted it back then."

"As for the secret hidden within the message, Brother didn't tell us, his Dharma King brothers; he chose to inform that Faceless Immortal. Clearly, even if he had told us, we would be unable to deal with it. Just like the true nature of the Dao Erasure Tribulation, knowing it would only bring us more trouble."

Chapter 1353: A Line Penetrates the High Wall

“King Xuanyuan is sending a message…” Li Fan mused, then sighed, “It must be a secret only True Immortals can touch.”

“Could it be information about the mastermind behind King Xuanyuan’s disappearance?” Mo Rubing shook his head. “Such speculation is baseless and meaningless. Although we don’t know the exact content of Brother Xuanyuan’s message back then, perhaps this message transmitted through the Tian Beast’s Eye can point us in the right direction.” With that, Mo Rubing manipulated the Tian Beast’s Eye once more.

The myriad bubbles of light around them froze. Then, they rapidly rewound. It was as if the Tian Beast’s Eye was traveling in a straight line through the sea of stars.

“This is the trajectory of Brother Xuanyuan’s message as it traveled through the sea of stars back then.”

“The Great Barrier traps all living beings in the Abyssal Sea. Perhaps this message is the only one that escaped the sea of stars in ten thousand years.”

“I can calculate the exact location where the message broke through the The Great Barrier. Then, we can go there in person and investigate,” Mo Rubing explained slowly.

Li Fan frowned. “At most, the message would leave some traces on the The Great Barrier. Could it possibly smash a hole in it?” Mo Rubing smiled mysteriously and asked back, “Why not?”

“Daoist friend, do you know what the The Great Barrier truly is?” Mo Rubing asked seriously, seeing Li Fan’s surprised expression.

Li Fan replied, “It is called a The Great Barrier, but in reality, it is the end of the sea of stars, with no path forward. However, this end was created out of nothingness, blocking the path ahead. It is like a The Great Barrier that descended from the heavens, sealing the sea of stars.”

“Exactly. The Great Barrier is not a creation, but a rule. Since Brother Xuanyuan’s message to the Faceless Immortal back then likely broke through the The Great Barrier and was transmitted to the starscape beyond, it means…”

“The rule was broken,” a sharp glint flashed in Mo Rubing’s eyes. Li Fan finally understood.

“If the broken rule within the The Great Barrier was not repaired in ten thousand years, perhaps it has become a gap leading outside the The Great Barrier!”

“But… is that possible?”

“It has been so long. Would a gap in the wall still exist?” Li Fan was skeptical.

Mo Rubing smiled. “That depends on our luck. The signs of Dao Erasure are about to engulf the sea of stars. If we still cannot find a way to transcend the The Great Barrier…”

“Then, I’m afraid we will only have a dead end,” his smile turned cold. Li Fan’s face also became grave upon hearing this.

Mo Rubing cupped his hands. “The journey to the fringe of the star sea is long. I have witnessed your unparalleled escape techniques, Daoist friend, so I wish to ask for your assistance.” Li Fan responded solemnly, “Of course.” A thick, viscous membrane enveloped the two of them.

Moments later, they had already left the Tian Beast’s Eye and appeared in the Abyssal Sea. The phantom wooden sword quietly unsheathed, covering Li Fan and Mo Rubing.

Mo Rubing performed hand seals, and a crack suddenly appeared on his forehead, from which an oval, brownish-yellow eye emerged.

This eye gave Li Fan the same feeling as the Tian Beast’s Eye they had been inside before.

“This is one of the additional formations of the Tian Beast’s Eye, capable of attaching an observation point to oneself. It can guide the way when navigating the sea of stars,” Mo Rubing explained as he manipulated the brown eye, releasing a beam of light.

It did not illuminate the dark starscape, but perhaps only Li Fan and Mo Rubing could see it, pointing directly towards the depths of the starscape, guiding their direction.

“Daoist friend, just follow the path ahead.”

“The Tian Beast’s guidance will also avoid dangerous areas where residual True Immortal power has gathered along the way.” As if to confirm Mo Rubing’s words, the straight beam of light ahead suddenly curved.

It seemed to have bypassed some obstruction and then continued deeper into the sea of stars. Li Fan waved his hand. “There’s no need for such trouble.” The phantom wooden sword suddenly accelerated, charging directly into the dangerous area marked by the Tian Beast’s Eye without evasion.

Mo Rubing’s expression changed drastically in an instant. However, before he could speak, he was astonished to find that in just a moment, they had traveled a great distance through the sea of stars.

And that dangerous area blocking their path did not cause any impact whatsoever, even when the phantom wooden sword passed through it.

Thus, a somewhat comical scene unfolded. The guiding light of the Tian Beast’s Eye continuously zigzagged and curved ahead.

The phantom wooden sword simply forged ahead, never taking detours. The light had no choice but to constantly adjust its guidance to accommodate.

The flying speed of the phantom wooden sword was so fast that the guidance of the Tian Beast’s Eye sometimes disappeared for a period.

Li Fan had to stop and wait for it to reappear. In this manner, the two of them hurried towards the fringe of the star sea.

“I originally thought your escape technique was already very strong. I never expected it to be even stronger than anticipated! You can actually ignore the residual True Immortal power accumulated in the sea of stars?” After a long period of shock, Mo Rubing, finally recovering, exclaimed in admiration.

“It’s just that I’ve had some gains recently. My dwindling lifespan has even increased a bit because of it,” Li Fan said in a calm tone.

Mo Rubing’s gaze darted back and forth across Li Fan’s face, but he ultimately said nothing more. With Li Fan’s escape technique protecting him, the arduous journey through the sea of stars had directly become a safe and smooth path.

Less than a day had passed, and they had already traversed the Sea of Remnants and the Great Wall of Broken Realms, arriving at the fringe of the star sea.

The guiding light of the Tian Beast’s Eye also gradually became blurry. Li Fan therefore slowed down.

Even though the core of the phantom wooden sword was based on the transformation between true and false, existing between void and reality, if it were to collide with the The Great Barrier at such high speed… it would likely result in severe injuries on the spot.

Mo Rubing used the Tian Beast’s attached eye to observe their surroundings. As the saying goes, a miss by an inch can lead to a difference of a thousand miles. They were too far from the Xuanhuang Realm, so even if the initial calculations were flawless, the endpoint position at this fringe of the star sea would inevitably have a slight deviation.

“It should be nearby.” Before Mo Rubing could finish speaking, the phantom wooden sword controlled by Li Fan suddenly stopped.

“No path ahead, the The Great Barrier has arrived.” These eight words made Mo Rubing’s expression turn serious instantly.

“Please Daoist friend, walk along the boundary. If you observe any trace of the message from back then, I will immediately alert you.” Li Fan nodded, indicating he understood.

It wasn’t that he was deliberately acting aloof, but the residual True Immortal power gathered beneath the The Great Barrier was on a completely different level compared to the normal sea of stars.

Moreover, without the Great Wall of Broken Realms to resist and weaken it, and having to confront this great power solely on his own, even Li Fan, who now possessed supreme escape techniques, had to deal with it with all his might.

Each step was a struggle as they explored along the The Great Barrier. After an unknown period, Mo Rubing still hadn't found their target.

However, Li Fan began to feel a sense of dizziness. An inexplicable sense of dread surged within him, urging him to leave.

Yet, his instincts didn’t signal danger, only an unexplainable internal feeling. Li Fan endured it, trying to comprehend the reason behind the changes in his mind.

He soon had a realization. “This is because I’ve been under the The Great Barrier for too long, and I’m having an illusion that the wall is collapsing and pressing down on me. It’s due to the disparity between my own momentum and the The Great Barrier.” Understanding this, Li Fan felt a little more at ease.

Since there was no actual danger, he chose to ignore these internal peculiarities and continued to explore along the The Great Barrier.

But Li Fan had clearly underestimated the oppressive power of the The Great Barrier. After another fifteen minutes, the sense of dread in Li Fan’s heart intensified.

The Azure Nether Heart Refining Incantation completely lost its effect, even affecting the circulation of Spirit Qi within his body and the movement of his thoughts.

Li Fan was horrified to discover that his body shape and height had shrunk by a trace under the pressure of the The Great Barrier.

Upon further investigation, Li Fan found that it wasn’t just his physical form; his divine soul and even his cultivation strength were being compressed and weakened.

It was as if the The Great Barrier were truly pressing down on him! Li Fan no longer forced himself. He temporarily retreated to avoid the The Great Barrier.

“This is the first time I’ve stayed so close to the The Great Barrier for so long.” Only after his body returned to normal did Li Fan heave a sigh of relief.

Looking at Mo Rubing, his condition was even worse than Li Fan’s. Perhaps due to the prolonged observation of the The Great Barrier, the Tian Beast’s attached eye on his forehead seemed to be squeezed by a hand, slowly closing.

Its opening range was nearly halved compared to before. Mo Rubing’s body trembled uncontrollably, as if he had encountered something terrifying. Li Fan felt a flicker of doubt at this. Given Mo Rubing’s temperament, he shouldn’t have been so frightened by the The Great Barrier, even if he saw it with his own eyes.

It was Mo Rubing who finally spoke, explaining the reason.

“Ten thousand demonic hearts, all saw the The Great Barrier. Emotions thus multiplied and imposed upon me…”

“Daoist friend, you jest,” Mo Rubing slowly recovered to normal. Li Fan replied indifferently, “You are already a being beyond the mortal realm. It’s good that you are unharmed.”

“Have you discovered any trace of King Xuanyuan’s message?” To Li Fan’s surprise, Mo Rubing nodded. “I compared the boundaries we traversed. I did indeed find one area that was somewhat different from the others.”

“But the sample size is too small to be certain. Next, we must at least examine the entire range locked by the Tian Beast’s Eye.”

“That sounds reasonable.” After resting for a while, once both their states returned to their peak, they set out again. As they approached the The Great Barrier once more, Li Fan’s expression suddenly changed drastically.

Because he discovered that, without any prelude, the feeling of being crushed from before had reappeared!

Their previous rest had not alleviated the pressure from the The Great Barrier’s might. Upon returning to the foot of the The Great Barrier, Li Fan and Mo Rubing directly inherited their previous sensations and once again bore the vast might of the The Great Barrier!

Mo Rubing’s body began to tremble violently, his face filled with fear, indicating that he was in the same predicament as Li Fan.

“Since returning is useless, we can only persevere,” Mo Rubing said with broken, trembling words.

Li Fan closed his eyes, forcibly suppressing all the discomfort within him. Following the guidance of the Tian Beast’s attached eye, he painstakingly explored along the wall.

Moving step by step, he felt himself becoming smaller and smaller. The Great Barrier became increasingly vast, instilling greater fear in their hearts.

Fortunately, the area that needed to be explored was not particularly vast.

“As expected, the location we encountered before is different from the other parts of the The Great Barrier. Hurry!” The Tian Beast’s eye, almost completely closed, emitted a dim light, pointing the way for Li Fan.

Under the pressure of the The Great Barrier’s might, and with their strength continuously being weakened, the effectiveness of the phantom wooden sword’s escape technique was also diminishing.

Li Fan had a premonition that if they stayed any longer, he might be unable to maintain the phantom wooden sword’s state.

Without the aid of escape techniques, they would be unable to escape from the foot of the The Great Barrier. And the The Great Barrier’s pressure would increase with time, likely crushing them to oblivion.

He would have no choice but to use his “Return to Truth” to preserve his life. Fortunately, before that happened, Li Fan, along with Mo Rubing, finally reached their target location.

It was truly just a single point. In the vast Abyssal Sea, at the infinite end, one among countless points. Without special guidance, it would be wishful thinking to find its precise location under the might of the The Great Barrier. But with the message from King Xuanyuan back then, the impossible had become possible.

Li Fan had initially planned to escape using his escape technique before his strength was depleted. But after stepping onto this spot…

The Great Barrier’s might was still present. However… it would no longer accumulate. It was as if they had returned to the state they were in when they first encountered the The Great Barrier.

Li Fan and Mo Rubing exchanged glances, seeing the ecstatic joy in each other’s eyes.

“As I suspected! Brother Xuanyuan’s message pierced through the The Great Barrier’s rules!” Li Fan agreed. “This place is like a weakness, a flaw within the The Great Barrier. First and foremost, we can at least stay here and study the The Great Barrier.”

“Otherwise, forget studying it. Even approaching it for an extended period would be a luxury,” Mo Rubing narrowed his eyes, his face filled with a dazed expression.

He gazed raptly, as if he saw hope of escaping the Abyssal Sea. A demonic heart flew out from his body, its expression identical to Mo Rubing’s original face, attempting to reach out and touch the end of this space and time.

One moment, two, three… Mo Rubing’s expression gradually stiffened. Because he felt nothing.

That’s right, after all this effort, they had truly reached the location where King Xuanyuan had broken through the wall. Facing the flawed The Great Barrier, Mo Rubing still felt nothing.

Even with a flawed The Great Barrier, it was not something beings below True Immortals could touch. Realizing this, a hint of gloom flashed across Mo Rubing’s face.

It wasn’t just Mo Rubing; even Li Fan couldn’t comprehend anything from this so-called loophole. Ahead was still only an empty end.

Unfathomable, ungraspable. Whether it had flaws or not was indistinguishable to them. They could only perceive it through how the The Great Barrier manifested its effects on living beings.

Li Fan was naturally unwilling. A thought surged within him: to use the Ascending Array to increase his own momentum, reduce the distance between himself and the The Great Barrier, and try to get a glimpse of its secrets.

However, he then remembered that Mo Rubing was present, and the Ascending Array would surely attract his attention. Thus, he temporarily suppressed the idea.

“I’ll wait for next time, when I come alone.” With no recourse but to gaze at the wall and sigh, the two fell into silence for a moment.

The Great Barrier’s pressure, however, did not decrease one iota due to their silence. Soon, it reached a point they could no longer bear.

With no other option, Li Fan had no choice but to take Mo Rubing and retreat to a safe area.

Chapter 1354: All Beings Comprehend the Immortal Principle

Mo Rubing looked back at the The Great Barrier's boundary, a hint of unwillingness on his face.

However, as a peerless prodigy of the ancient cultivation world, he soon regained his composure.

Exhaling a breath of turbid air, Mo Rubing slowly said, "Once, I was only one step away from ascending to become an immortal."

"Brother Xuanyuan, who was a half-immortal, rarely displayed his true strength in front of us; we mostly interacted as companions."

"This gave me the illusion that the chasm between immortals and mortals was not that profound."

"At least for me, it was by no means an insurmountable precipice. But now, hehehe..."

Mo Rubing's tone was filled with emotion.

"One does not know the height of a mountain without climbing its peak; one does not know the depth of water without approaching its abyss. Even if one has been close to the Immortal Ruins and truly felt the power of a True Immortal, how can it compare to us truly reaching out to touch it now? To be honest, the might of a True Immortal is truly beyond my imagination," Li Fan also mused.

"Fellow Daoist, what do you plan to do next? Will you continue to stay here and study the secrets of the The Great Barrier, or will you leave for now and continue searching for the Heavenly Mysteries King?" After his感慨, Li Fan inquired.

After a moment of hesitation, Mo Rubing looked back at the The Great Barrier's boundary. "To leave directly like this, I feel a bit unwilling. I plan to... look again."

"Thirty days is the limit. If, within these thirty days, I still gain no progress whatsoever, I will immediately turn and leave, and never face the The Great Barrier directly again in this life," Mo Rubing said, a mix of conflicted and confused.

Li Fan could completely understand Mo Rubing's feelings at this moment.

"To hear the Dao, one can die." The secrets of True Immortals were within reach. Even if they could not be seen or touched, who could resolutely leave after only a glance? Especially since the secrets of the The Great Barrier were related to the hope of escaping the Abyssal Sea.

Li Fan said gravely, "Since that is so, I will leave behind a wisp of my wooden sword's phantom to aid you, fellow Daoist!"

As he spoke, Li Fan separated a small sword phantom and enveloped Mo Rubing within it.

"You actually chose to leave and stop researching?" Mo Rubing was immediately taken aback.

"Heh, I am different from you, fellow Daoist. You, back then, were someone with the potential to ascend," Li Fan praised him subtly before sighing, "And I know that with my aptitude, no matter how many tens of millions of times I look, there will be no substantial change. I cannot possibly penetrate the secrets of the The Great Barrier."

Mo Rubing was speechless. However, as he looked at the phantom of his wooden sword circling around him, he was about to speak again.

But then he heard Li Fan's tone suddenly become impassioned: "However, my temporary departure does not mean I will give up!"

"Since I, a humble person, cannot achieve it, why not let everyone in the world try!"

"What?" Mo Rubing's eyes widened abruptly, thinking he had misheard.

"You want to bring everyone in the world here, to comprehend the Dao at the foot of the The Great Barrier?" He felt a sense of absurdity.

"With our strength, we survive with such difficulty at the foot of the The Great Barrier. If others with lower cultivation were to come, they would surely be crushed by the might of the The Great Barrier, let alone comprehend anything."

Li Fan smiled freely, "My eyes are the eyes of all people; my hands are the hands of all people. My presence is as if all people are here in person..."

"Using my body, I invite all beings in the world to comprehend the principles of the The Great Barrier together."

As if reciting scripture in a chant, another phantom flew out from Li Fan.

It was about ninety percent similar in aura to the wooden sword phantom, but it vaguely resembled Li Fan's appearance.

It was Li Fan's divine soul, merged with the phantom of his escape technique. Then, with the aid of formations, the divine soul's perceptions were amplified a hundred or even a thousand times.

"Let this phantom of mine stay here and comprehend the Dao with you, fellow Daoist. As for me, I will return to the Xuanhuang Realm and share the phantom's perceptions with all beings in the world," Li Fan smiled.

Mo Rubing wanted to speak but stopped himself.

Li Fan added, "Don't worry, I will not directly reveal the existence of the The Great Barrier to the world, nor will I explain to them that what they feel are the flaws of the The Great Barrier."

"But simply synchronize the phantom's comprehension with them."

"Millions of people, millions of thoughts. Each person will offer a different answer. And even if there is no correct answer among them, it will at least provide us with some inspiration," Li Fan said with an air of knowing certainty.

"...Indeed, that is a method," Mo Rubing replied after a long silence.

"I'm off!" Before Li Fan's voice had completely faded, his figure, following the wooden sword that pierced through the star sea, disappeared from Mo Rubing's sight.

Mo Rubing slightly shook his head, temporarily putting Li Fan aside. After concentrating and resting for a moment, he once again controlled the wooden sword phantom and moved closer to explore the flaws of the The Great Barrier.

At the same time, even before Li Fan had returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, a drastic change had occurred on the Preaching Platforms erected in the various pocket worlds of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The phantom of the Sage Master, who had been lecturing day and night without interruption, suddenly stopped teaching.

He gazed at the sky, appearing lost in thought.

Then, a tremendous booming sound emanated from the Preaching Platform.

The beings in the pocket worlds did not understand what had happened and were filled with shock and uncertainty, murmuring amongst themselves.

And then, beams of black light suddenly descended from beyond the sky. Following the celestial canopy, they eroded and stained it. In the time it took to brew a cup of tea, the originally azure sky was completely dyed ink-black.

The world consequently plunged into darkness. No matter how the great sun in the sky unleashed its brilliance, it could not illuminate this vast, murky world.

The heavens and earth of the pocket worlds were like the Abyssal Sea at this moment, shrouded in darkness.

Only on the Preaching Platform, where the phantom of enlightenment still stood, did a faint light emanate.

It provided the only remaining light in the world.

How had the mortals in the pocket worlds ever witnessed such a terrifying scene of light being devoured? They all believed that the end of the world was approaching, and in an instant, they were plunged into fear and despair.

If not for the light emitted by the phantom of enlightenment, preventing the pocket worlds from falling into complete darkness, it was likely that within this short period, many living beings would have committed suicide out of despair.

Thus, the phantom of enlightenment, radiating a light of salvation, became their only lifeline.

Originally, only mortals aspiring to cultivate would go to the Preaching Platform to listen. But now, for survival, almost all living beings, instinctively, like moths to a flame, swarmed towards the Preaching Platform in the center of the pocket world.

The number of beings below the Preaching Platform grew larger and larger.

The Preaching Platform also expanded accordingly.

It swelled millions of times larger than its original scope, almost encompassing the entire pocket world.

The people knelt down, begging the phantom of the Sage Master above to save them.

The phantom of the Sage Master stood still.

The people pleaded fervently, and as long as they did not rise, they dared not stand up.

Finally, a sigh of overwhelming compassion echoed through heaven and earth.

The pitch-black sky, with this sigh, began to change.

The phantom of the Sage Master ascended towards the sky.

His body erupted with incomparably brilliant light, momentarily illuminating the dark world.

The Sage Master's form transformed into a long rainbow, filling the celestial canopy.

It covered the entire sky, slightly pushing back the encroaching darkness.

As if a layer of light cloth had been draped over it, the world became somewhat brighter.

This gave the world's inhabitants hope to live.

They let out cheers and loudly praised the Sage Master's great name.

However, not long after, their cheers abruptly ceased.

It seemed that more rolling darkness was coming from beyond the heavens, like a The Great Barrier, pressing down upon the celestial canopy.

The meager light brought by the Sage Master was yet again halved.

The people plunged into alarm once more, and their cries of despair echoed through the mountains and plains.

On the luminous celestial cloth, the resolute face of the Sage Master appeared.

He seemed to gather his last trace of strength and charged towards the wall of darkness outside the world.

Attempting to shatter this darkness that threatened to destroy the world.

The collision between the Sage Master and the darkness was silent.

Finally, the Sage Master vanished without a trace. And the rolling wall of darkness outside the world...

Seemed to have changed somewhat.

The people stared intently at the point where the Sage Master's face had finally impacted the wall of darkness.

In their ears, they seemed to hear the Sage Master's last transmitted words:

"The path of salvation lies within."

The people wept bitterly.

With the world-ending crisis at hand, some people gave up all hope of survival and resigned themselves to their fate.

But the vast majority were thinking with all their might about the Sage Master's last words.

It was clear that the method to break through the wall of darkness and save the world lay within that imperceptible yet real small point created by the Sage Master's desperate blow.

Just as the beings on the ground were trying to sense the specific details of that small point,

The Unbelievable happened.

The Preaching Platform left by the Sage Master emitted a faint glow, drifting onto them. In an instant, they seemed to traverse the distance between earth and sky, personally arriving above the celestial canopy.

As if experiencing it firsthand, they felt the existence of that small point.

Thus, the people understood that this was the Sage Master's final method left for them to save the world and themselves.

In order to save themselves, the beings on the ground erupted with astonishing potential. One by one, they quickly established a connection with the Preaching Platform and, with their mortal bodies, began to comprehend that small point within the wall of darkness.

...

Such a scene occurred in all the pocket worlds where Preaching Platforms stood.

And the cause of all this was naturally Li Fan.

At this moment, Li Fan's true body had already returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Using the power of formations to manifest endless darkness, sealing the celestial canopies of the various pocket worlds, he felt the resistance from the Heavenly Daos of these realms.

Although the power of a single realm was negligible to the current Li Fan, the combined forces of multiple realms made it somewhat difficult for Li Fan to handle.

However...

It was only "somewhat" difficult.

After considerable effort, Li Fan suppressed them all. In any case, according to the plan, these pocket worlds would eventually return to the Xuanhuang Realm to serve as nourishment for the sublimation of the super Xuanhuang Realm. The Heavenly Dao consciousness of these pocket worlds would also be devoured.

Using formations, Li Fan connected these pocket worlds, which were like nourishment.

Li Fan observed the situation in these worlds.

"In my experience, beings only unleash their greatest potential when they face a mortal crisis. If they were merely asked to help with comprehension without this sense of urgency, the efficiency would certainly decrease considerably."

"This situation now... is quite good."

Sensing the countless thoughts of comprehension from all beings, synchronously transmitted from the Preaching Platforms, Li Fan nodded with great satisfaction.

The gap between mortals and cultivators was already like a chasm. Not to mention the gap between mortals and True Immortals.

But precisely because True Immortals were too lofty and remote.

In the eyes of True Immortals, there was essentially no difference between mortals and ordinary cultivators.

Therefore, when it came to comprehending that flaw in the The Great Barrier, there was no difference between cultivators and mortals.

"The advantage lies in the sheer number of mortals. The sample size is sufficiently detailed."

"Moreover, during this period, the pocket worlds covered by the Preaching Platforms have, under subtle influence, begun to evolve towards the cultivation world. Quite a few cultivators have emerged among these people."

Li Fan analyzed the comprehension of the masses for a while and found that almost all of it was useless. However, he was not discouraged, as this was only the beginning.

He manifested a simulated personality within a formation, specifically to categorize and process the comprehension thoughts of the masses.

It would filter out most of the invalid information, retaining and transmitting only what was worth Li Fan's personal inspection.

"This is also part of the arrangement."

"I don't truly expect to uncover the secrets of the The Great Barrier through the vast numbers of common beings."

"Ultimately, it might still fall upon me."

Li Fan sensed the perceptions synchronized from the Enlightenment phantom, located at the distant fringe of the star sea.

"The Great Barrier is a creation of True Immortals. It is too difficult for me to research it alone."

"Besides the common beings, I could also let those Immortal Artifacts lend a hand."

"It's a pity that I already fed the Boundless Mirror to the Xuanhuang Realm. If I gain nothing this life, I might consider trying in the next one."

In fact, discovering the flaw of the The Great Barrier through Mo Rubing was an unexpected delight.

Li Fan's current focus was still on merging with the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls.

As for crossing the The Great Barrier, it was not that urgent for now.

"Even if I truly decipher the secrets of the The Great Barrier, I will never risk my own life!"

"It is too dangerous beyond the The Great Barrier!"

The scene of the Cat Treasure devouring immortals and the collapse of the The Great Barrier in his previous life reappeared before his eyes.

With no fear in his heart, he let out a cold snort and suppressed these distracting thoughts.

Taking a step forward, he arrived at the Xuanhuang Realm's original world.

He raised his head and gazed at the sky.

Having received a promise from the star sea, Li Fan now contacted the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao with almost effortless ease.

Furthermore, the Heavenly Dao was no longer as indifferent as before.

Instead, it was clearly showing a hint of obsequiousness.

"This Azure Nether Heavenly Dao..."

Li Fan snorted, finding it both amusing and exasperating.

He did not dwell on these matters for the time being. Through communication with heaven and earth, Li Fan began to understand the various changes happening in the Xuanhuang Realm in more detail.

It was like a thorough examination before a major surgery for a critically ill patient.

Although Li Fan could investigate on his own, it was always more convenient and accurate to inquire directly from the Heavenly Dao consciousness of the Xuanhuang Realm.

And while communicating, Li Fan also continuously imparted some of his insights gained from the Star Sea's Origin Intent and the foot of the The Great Barrier in this life to the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao.

He offered it willingly, with no intention of asking for anything in return.

This step was to increase his intimacy and connection with the Xuanhuang Realm.

Just as it is easiest to cultivate good feelings during childhood, Li Fan also needed to strengthen their mutual connection before the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation.

This would make it easier to devour the Heavenly and Earthly Immortal Souls in the future.

Chapter 1355

In the Azure Nether skies, the winds and clouds shifted dramatically. Whether it was the power of the Star Sea's resurgence or the perspective gained from ascending and looking down, these were secrets originally beyond the reach of the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao. Yet, it instinctively and ceaselessly absorbed them.

Corresponding changes were also silently occurring between the heavens and the earth. However, this was destined to be a protracted process, much like the Star Sea's resurgence. At this moment, it had only just begun, remaining in its nascent stages. Almost no one within the Xuanhuang Realm could perceive this transformation.

Li Fan, as the source of this change and currently still connected with the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao, could naturally observe the shifts between heaven and earth with perfect clarity. This was a power of evolution directly contrary to the Azure Nether World-Ending Mutations, yet equally grand and surging, causing one's heart to tremble. Li Fan also felt the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's rapidly increasing favorability.

Wielding the might of the Star Sea's origin, coupled with the tangible benefits of generously imparting the Dao, this combination of benevolence and might caused the favorability to increase at a rate that even surpassed that of the Sacred Emperor in his previous life! Only when the increase in favorability gradually slowed did Li Fan temporarily halt the "lecture." The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao was reluctant to part, but Li Fan resolutely bid farewell, returning directly to the Great Qi pocket world and severing the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's perception.

As Li Fan's place of origin and the initial location where he preached the Dao in this life, the sky above Great Qi had not been enveloped by the Wall of Darkness like other pocket worlds. However, the Preaching Platform stood majestically, its scale almost encompassing the entire human habitat. As sentient beings listened to the Sage Master's teachings, their thoughts and insights were simultaneously recorded on the Preaching Platform, to be perceived by Li Fan. It was as if billions of beings were helping Li Fan comprehend the Dao at the same time, with his comprehended insights encompassing everything imaginable.

Currently, apart from the Preaching Platform in Great Qi, all the random thoughts and comprehensions of beings in other pocket worlds had flowed into the breaches of the Wall of Darkness. This was also why Li Fan chose to maintain Great Qi's original state: to ensure the diversity of insights. Within the Preaching Platform, the Simulated Heavenly Lattice, resembling a silver eye, appeared static. In reality, it completed over a billion rotations every instant, observing the beings of Great Qi at the Preaching Platform, the mountains and trees of the pocket worlds, the flowing water and white clouds of the pocket worlds. Compared to when this Simulated Heavenly Lattice was first created, the current silver eye had become more lifelike. It was no longer like a creation of cultivators but resembled a truly living being.

"What exactly is the world's Heavenly Dao?" Reverence for power, yet reliance on strength. The Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's temperament, somewhat akin to a pet dog, was still vivid in Li Fan's memory. He couldn't help but ponder this question. Opening his left hand, within a golden, circular cage-like space, floated strands of intangible intent. These were the consciousnesses of the Heavenly Dao from various pocket worlds that had dared to resist when Li Fan had erected the dark The Great Barriers in the various pocket worlds not long ago. Li Fan had extracted them all and imprisoned them here. He then replaced them with his Simulated Heavenly Lattice to maintain the normal operation of each pocket world.

"What I extracted was not the complete world's Heavenly Dao. It should only be the 'Heavenly Lattices' that these pocket worlds generated over long ages, possessing various temperaments. After extraction, the pocket worlds returned to their original state, operating by instinct. If not for my Simulated Heavenly Lattice filling the void..."

"The temperament of a world's Heavenly Lattice should be related to factors such as the world's size, resource conditions, and various other elements."

"For instance, this strand originated from a pocket world fraught with calamity, thus it feels extremely cautious and vigilant towards the outside. And this one comes from a mortal world roughly the same size as Great Qi. This world has all things complete and possesses a rather upright demeanor. If we disregard scale, it is even more 'orthodox' than the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao..." Li Fan discerned the various world Heavenly Lattices within the cage.

Then, slowly and deliberately, he fed them one by one to the silver eye before him. Although he didn't know how world Heavenly Lattices were born or what specific conditions they needed to meet, Li Fan was certain that the nurturing of world Heavenly Lattices itself represented a kind of power. Almost visibly, as the silver eye gradually consumed these pocket world Heavenly Lattices, it itself became more and more lifelike. It felt increasingly "vivid" to Li Fan. Although it seemed alive before, it was nowhere near as lively as now; it was almost like a pet with a soul.

Before devouring the world Heavenly Lattices, the silver eye would only faithfully execute Li Fan's commands, monitoring and perceiving the thoughts of the beings in the Great Qi pocket world. But now, this silver eye would also occasionally observe Li Fan in secret. Its divine gaze radiated a fawning implication. When Li Fan's gaze met its own, it seemed to be encouraged, its eyeballs rolling as if it were acting spoiled or performing.

"A bit interesting." Li Fan saw a desire for more world Heavenly Lattices in its gaze. Li Fan remained unmoved and gently beckoned. The silver eye proactively floated closer, bringing its body near Li Fan's outstretched hand. Instantly, countless thoughts from the current and past inhabitants of the Great Qi pocket world, categorized and sorted, appeared around Li Fan. Furthermore, the silver eye meticulously organized the categories for Li Fan, making it convenient for him to view.

With a single thought from Li Fan, the silver eye could quickly perceive and then collate and organize the information Li Fan needed, presenting it one by one. "Compared to before, it is undoubtedly much more intelligent and useful."

"No wonder ancient cultivators would forge a world into a magic artifact at the slightest provocation. These world Heavenly Lattices are almost the ultimate version of artifact spirits," Li Fan mused as he looked at the silver eye before him.

"It's a pity that even after swallowing so many pocket world Heavenly Lattices, this silver eye still feels significantly inferior to the Xuanhuang Realm's Heavenly Dao."

"To replace it, I'm afraid it's not very realistic."

"What are the factors influencing its qualitative change?" If he could use his own creation to replace the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao's consciousness, it would undoubtedly be an event of great significance for Li Fan. Fully transforming the Xuanhuang Realm into his own solid barrier would allow it to serve as a bridgehead for exploring beyond the The Great Barriers.

As Li Fan contemplated, simultaneously sensing the thoughts of beings transmitted by the silver eye, a piece of information, specifically marked by the silver eye, suddenly jumped out. Li Fan's gaze sharpened. It was the synchronized perception of Sun Erlang, Wang Xuanba, and Yue Zhenwei's experiences. Previously, under Li Fan's subtle guidance, they had gone to the territory of the Five Elders Council in search of Nascent Soul Grotto-heavens. However, after experiencing some hardships, they had accidentally entered the Land of Carefree Bliss and found themselves trapped in a dream world filled with man-eating demons. It was only after considerable effort that they found a way to break the world and successfully escape. But they had not left the Land of Carefree Bliss. To uncover the secrets of the Land of Carefree Bliss, they had to continue to the remaining two dream world borders.

"After such a long time, they should have discovered something."

"The Land of Carefree Bliss..." With a single thought, countless light and shadows surged towards Li Fan. Sun Erlang and the others' encounters during this period instantly materialized. With the experience of completing the first dream world, Sun Erlang and his companions had initially thought that the subsequent two worlds would be easier. But the reality proved that they had far underestimated the risks of the Land of Carefree Bliss. The second dream world they entered was a terrifying doomsday scenario they had never heard of before. In the vast expanse of the Star Sea, civilization was in decline, and life was dim. A terrifying alien insect had become the true ruler of the Star Sea. Wherever the swarm passed, all living beings on the ground were devoured, leaving only indigestible hard stones. When Sun Erlang and the others descended, all they saw was a desolate land covered in deathly silence. Their mission was to survive for half a year amidst the siege of the insect swarm that had not yet evacuated the surface.

The second dream world was completely different from the first. There were no puzzles. The moment they entered, task prompts and methods of escape from the world appeared in their minds. There were even task rewards. Initially, Sun Erlang and his companions didn't believe the task was that difficult. But when they truly clashed with the overwhelming insect swarm, they knew they were wrong. Even with the phantom of the Sage Master in their possession and skilled in various combat techniques, they experienced helplessness for the first time in the face of the absolute numerical advantage of the insect swarm. The insect swarm was inexhaustible. No matter how many were eliminated by their divine abilities, they would soon emerge from somewhere underground to fill the void.

After suffering hardships, the three quickly changed their strategy, fighting and retreating simultaneously. However, the insect swarm was present in almost every corner of the world. No matter where they fled, an endless pursuit of the insect swarm was always behind them. In less than seven days, the three were almost driven to desperation. Wang Xuanba even cursed loudly, believing the task was impossible to complete. Fortunately, Sun Erlang had learned the spirit-devouring technique from the pig demon statue in the previous dream world. In the midst of fierce battle, he finally managed to learn it. Afterward, using the corpses of the insect swarm as food and fighting to sustain themselves, the three's situation immediately improved with the endless supply of resources and no fear of expenditure.

Sun Erlang held the fort. Then, Wang Xuanba luckily discovered a powerful magic artifact inside an alien insect. It could summon a mechanical puppet as tall as thirty feet. Initially, after being summoned, the puppet remained motionless. But after some research, Wang Xuanba discovered its true usage: his body would turn into ethereal light and enter the puppet. Afterward, his will would merge with the puppet's immense form, using its powerful might to kill the insect swarm. Although the situation seemed to improve, facing the endless sea of alien insects still filled Sun Erlang and the others with despair.

They persevered like this for nearly three months. Their bodies and willpower were almost at their limit. Thinking that they wouldn't truly die in a dream, they had almost given up. At the last moment, it was the meticulous Yue Zhenwei who discovered that although the insect swarm seemed to act on instinct, their movement trajectories actually followed a certain pattern, as if something were directing them from the shadows. This discovery invigorated the three. Confirming that Yue Zhenwei's discovery had a high probability of being true, they decided to take a gamble.

They would not hesitate to use themselves as bait to finally lure out the master behind the insect swarm. They had initially thought this master would be a high-ranking individual among the alien insects. However, when that master appeared, it immensely surprised Sun Erlang and the others. Because the one controlling the insect swarm was surprisingly like a creation of a cultivator: a purple-gold gourd, engraved with unknown runes. Above the gourd stood a wooden child. He pointed a finger at Sun Erlang and the three surrounded by the insect swarm. Below, the purple-gold gourd emitted all sorts of strange lights. Innumerable alien insects immediately went into a frenzy, surging towards Sun Erlang and the three regardless of their own lives. The three knew that as long as they defeated the wooden child and gained control of the purple-gold gourd, they could control the insect swarm. Completing the mission of surviving for half a year would be a simple matter.

Thus, they fought desperately. Wang Xuanba transformed into the mechanical puppet, attracting the attention of the insect swarm. Sun Erlang, like an arrow, disregard his own safety and charged straight towards the wooden child. In the shadows, Yue Zhenwei, whose strength was the weakest, made the final blow. Eventually, the wooden carving was shattered. At the end of the fierce battle, all three were on the verge of death, trapped in the endless swarm of insects. But as Yue Zhenwei grasped the purple-gold gourd, those ferocious alien insects fell into a frozen stillness. From then on, the survival mission was no longer in doubt.

Two more months later. The second dream world was completed. After leaving the dream, the three not only fully recovered from their injuries, but Yue Zhenwei also brought the purple-gold gourd out with him. The gourd contained a staggering ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million nine hundred ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine [Star Devouring Insects]! Of course, Yue Zhenwei, at the Golden Core stage, could not fully unleash the power of this magic artifact. He could only summon the weakest nine hundred million Star Devouring Insects. As his cultivation level increased, the number and strength of the Star Devouring Insects he could command would continuously rise. Despite obtaining a supreme treasure, Yue Zhenwei and the others did not feel much joy. Instead, endless doubt and fear welled up in their hearts. Ninety billion Star Devouring Insects, even in the real Xuanhuang Realm, represented a power capable of destroying worlds. And now, this power was controlled by a mere Golden Core cultivator. Although it was only within a dream and it was uncertain if it could be brought back to reality, it still made Yue Zhenwei and the others feel utterly absurd. They had only been in the dream world for such a short time and had gained such achievements. It was difficult to imagine what accumulations those who had stayed in the dream world for a long time would possess. With uneasy hearts, after a short rest, they ventured towards the third dream world. With a treasure like the purple-gold gourd and the assistance of nine hundred million Star Devouring Insects, the third world should be easily cleared, right?

But upon entering the third dream world, reality struck them with another heavy blow. The moment they entered the dream world, they all transformed into immobile, speechless straw figures. Their Spirit Qi and treasures vanished, leaving them only able to communicate using the dream world's inherent power. This time, there were no demonic beasts or insect swarms to attack. There were also no task prompts from the dream. It was simply three straw figures lying quietly on a black stone that resembled the peak of a mountain, enduring wind and sun, rain and lightning. Unable to move, the three initially spent their days pondering what conditions would lead to the completion of the task. But as days turned into weeks, their mindset began to crumble.

Chapter 1356

At first, the three would occasionally share their experiences completing missions. But they gradually realized that all their guesses and deductions were meaningless.

The three straw figures were like beings independent of the world. Only the wind, rain, thunder, and lightning from the high heavens could interact with them.

Beyond that, everything in the mortal world seemed oblivious to their existence. Birds, beasts, and swarms of insects flew past them without pausing.

Even the dust of the world wouldn't settle on them. Thus, the three slowly fell silent. They lay powerlessly, watching the world change.

The sun rose and set, years passed. It was as if a fast-forward button had been pressed, and days turned into weeks. The mountaintops where they lay became gradually leaner and sharper due to the erosion of rain and wind.

What were originally majestic and full mountains were slowly reduced to sharp, solitary peaks standing abruptly between heaven and earth.

The terrain surrounding the mountaintops also transformed from rolling green hills into magnificent canyons riddled with ravines. Amidst the profound changes of mountains and seas, only the black stone upon which Sun Erlang and the others lay remained eternally unchanged.

In the wind and rain, the three's consciousness was also scoured by the power of time, becoming somewhat decayed and blurred.

They even began to lose their reactions to external events. If this continued, their consciousness might one day completely dissipate.

Just as they were about to sink into oblivion, a majestic and divine figure suddenly appeared in their minds, radiating ten thousand rays of multicolored light.

It seemed to be taller than heaven and earth, blocking all the corrosive wind and rain.

"Sage Master..." Although their memories were blurred, these two words were etched into their souls, surfacing instinctively.

"Sage Master, Sage Master, Sage Master." The three repeated these words obsessively, as if a spring had burst forth, bringing their past memories back to their dried-up minds.

"Ah!!" The three felt as if they had woken from a nightmare. They knew that the Sage Master had saved their lives from the abyss.

However, if they couldn't find a way to escape, they would likely still face the same fate in the end. Thus, seizing this rare moment of clarity, the three began to discuss incessantly.

During their exchange, they were somewhat surprised to find that it seemed as if they had indeed endured tens of millions of years of time's grinding.

The temperament of all three had become much more stable. Even in the face of crisis, they no longer panicked as before.

"Dream trials will never be a dead end. When the mountaintop beneath us is finally eroded and broken by rain and wind, and the black stone falls, perhaps we will find liberation. As long as we persist until that moment, we can complete the mission." The three ultimately reached this conclusion.

And with this as their ultimate belief, they gritted their teeth and held on. Countless more years passed. The figure of the Sage Master in their minds had become barely visible.

Only the constant repetition of their obsession became the reason for their perseverance. On this day.

The mountain, "thinned" to its extreme and supported only by a slender stone pillar, could no longer bear the weight of the black stone at its summit.

After a gentle breeze, it collapsed with a roar. The three straw figures, who fell from the mountaintop, saw the world as if it had frozen.

The clear sky suddenly turned dark, as if covered by a black film. A giant black beak pierced the sky, emerging from beyond the firmament.

Merely half of its beak was almost larger than the entire world. The two sharp eyes, occupying the sky, turned slightly, locking onto the three falling straw figures.

In the eyes of this indescribably massive ferocious bird, Sun Erlang and the other two saw a look of satisfaction. With a terrifying bird cry, the world began to crumble inch by inch.

From the three straw figures, three balls of light flew out from their brows, hearts, and abdomens, respectively.

Slowly ascending, they flew towards the ferocious bird. With their consciousness still within the straw figures, Sun Erlang and the others vaguely saw scenes of time flowing and mountains and rivers changing within these three orbs of light.

Boom! Immediately after, the world plunged into endless darkness. Even the Simulated Heavenly Lattice monitoring it was unsure how much true time had passed.

Sun Erlang and the other two regained consciousness. They had successfully escaped the dream. Not only were they unharmed, but they had also gained a divine ability called [Observation of Mountains and Rivers Through Time].

By transforming into the straw figures on the mountaintop, time seemed to flow at a standstill for them. Then, they observed the changes of the world and the swift passage of years.

It was somewhat similar to when Li Fan previously transformed into the Azure Sea Pearl and observed the transformation of heaven and earth over countless ages. However, the powerful aspect of [Observation of Mountains and Rivers Through Time] was that after its activation, one's lifespan was almost frozen.

Even if ten million years passed in the outside world, the impact on oneself would be minimal. Of course, this was just a theoretical explanation prompted by the dream.

As for whether this divine ability was truly effective... Sun Erlang and the others had no intention of trying it yet. After completing the three, and all, of the dream boundary trials, their environment finally changed again.

They were still within the Autumn Creek Prefecture of the Five Elders Council. However, unlike the sparsely populated situation before, this Autumn Creek Prefecture was bustling with activity.

Not only were the cities filled with cultivators, but countless buildings had suddenly appeared in the originally desolate wilderness.

And it seemed that these buildings were inhabited by cultivators. The changes were not only happening externally but also within Sun Erlang and the others themselves.

"Sun Erlang, Golden Core Perfection, Number of Deaths: 1."

"Land of Bliss Experience Level: 2."

"Current Unlockable Dream World Level: 3."

"Carefree Coins: 2000." ... This was information that Sun Erlang and the others could all see. When the pink progress bar finally filled, the so-called Land of Bliss Experience Level finally advanced to 2.

An option to unlock dream worlds had appeared. In addition, there were some other more detailed descriptions.

And when they focused their consciousness on those texts, they would finally see detailed explanations in their minds, no longer relying solely on guesswork.

Sun Erlang carefully read each item, lest he miss any crucial information.

"So, although native cultivators of the Five Elders Council also have to undergo trials in three dream worlds when entering the Land of Bliss, it's nowhere near as difficult as what we experienced. In the language of the Land of Bliss, the world difficulty level has reached level 3."

"The reason our experience was so special is that we are not members of the Five Elders Council but outsiders who intruded without the Carefree Heavenly Venerate's permission!"

"But the Heavenly Venerate is merciful and will not directly expel us. Instead, a dream trial will be imposed. If successfully passed, one can officially join the Dream Land of Bliss. If the trial fails, one will be permanently banished from the Land of Bliss. At the same time, as punishment for the power consumed in constructing the dream, a large portion of one's soul power will be absorbed..." Sun Erlang's expression turned grim.

He exchanged glances with Wang Xuanba and Yue Zhenwei, then continued to check.

"The place we first encountered in the dream was a transit station leading to the trial dream worlds. All cultivators entering the Land of Bliss for the first time will appear there."

"Within the Dream Land of Bliss, cultivators cannot harm each other. If one ignores this rule and forcibly engages in combat, the attacked party will be transferred to a safe zone. Simultaneously, depending on the severity of the offense, the attacker's Land of Bliss Coins will be deducted."

"Carefree Coins, also known as Land of Bliss Coins, are obtained by cultivators through exploration and activities within the Dream Land of Bliss. They can be exchanged for various resources in the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury to strengthen oneself."

"In the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury, there is everything, embracing all-encompassing items..." Sun Erlang looked at the two thousand Land of Bliss Coins he carried and his heart stirred. He opened the details page of the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury.

Instantly, Sun Erlang was stunned. Even with his current authority as a Level 2 Land of Bliss Experience user, the number of items he could see was limited.

However, the detailed list of resources in the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury still made him incredulous. Not to mention the most basic heavenly materials, earthly treasures, elixirs, and magic artifacts.

Even cultivation techniques were ordinary items in the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury. And unlike the prevalent cultivation techniques in the Xuanhuang Realm, here, the lowest-grade techniques could be cultivated to the Soul Transformation realm.

Moreover, according to the explanation of the Land of Bliss, there was no need to worry about being unable to cultivate a technique due to its profoundness. Once exchanged, one could gain immediate mastery.

By consuming Land of Bliss Coins, one could advance the cultivation technique's progress.

"Once a technique is exchanged and learned, it cannot be shared with others. However, it can be gifted before learning."

"Thus, although there is no restriction on cultivating multiple techniques in the Land of Bliss, it's not much different. To cultivate, one still needs to exchange and pay."

"One's cultivation and techniques in the real world will only be synchronized once upon entering the Land of Bliss, serving as one's starting point within the Land of Bliss."

"However, future advancements within the Land of Bliss generally cannot be brought back to reality, meaning the Xuanhuang Realm." Sun Erlang furrowed his brow upon seeing this.

But after a moment's thought, he quickly relaxed. After all, the things in the Land of Bliss were too heaven-defying. If everything could be synchronized into reality... then the scale of the Land of Bliss would absolutely not be on the same level as the Xuanhuang Realm.

"As the name suggests, the Land of Bliss is guided by the power of the great Carefree Heavenly Venerate, constructed from various dream worlds."

"The blueprints for constructing dream worlds may originate from historical fragments that once occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm, or from the dreams of living beings, or from deeper, great intentions. Therefore, it is not eternally safe but filled with all sorts of dangers."

"To facilitate exploration, there are distinctions in dream experience and dream world levels." Sun Erlang nodded slightly.

With their Golden Core Perfection cultivation, exploring a Level 3 dream world was already their limit. Any further, and they would surely die.

With a general assessment of danger levels, explorers of dreams would not be sent to their deaths in vain.

"One can die in the Land of Bliss."

"The number of times a cultivator can die is not infinite."

"The number of deaths is a crucial factor in identifying a cultivator within dreams, second only to the dream experience level."

"Cultivators with similar death counts are generally in the same stratum of the world. The rough divisions are 1-3 times, 3-5 times, 5-10 times, 10-15 times."

"The death limit should be 15 times. If by then, one dies again..."

"They are truly dead."

"In reality as well." Sun Erlang's heart grew solemn.

"An increase in the number of deaths not only signifies changes in the people one encounters but also the decline of one's spiritual nature."

"Spiritual nature is a hidden stat, not displayed, but it truly exists within the Land of Bliss. It affects the actual efficiency of combat and cultivation."

"The more one dies, the lower the spiritual nature, and the more difficult it becomes to make progress."

"It seems this spiritual nature has some other effects as well..." Sun Erlang mused inwardly.

"The number of deaths can also be eliminated through certain methods. Besides exchanging them for Land of Bliss Coins in the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury, one can also use certain items obtained in dreams."

"Of course, they are not cheap."

"Looking at it this way, the Land of Bliss is fraught with peril, yet it attracts all the Five Elders Council's cultivators because this dream realm truly lives up to its name of 'Carefree Bliss'."

"Each cultivator, by paying a certain amount of Land of Bliss Coins, can generate a dream world exclusively for themselves."

"Whether it's to be an absolute emperor with absolute authority or an immortal emperor in control of everything, it can be realized in dreams."

"In dreams, it is almost indistinguishable from reality. The more Land of Bliss Coins one pays, the richer the details..."

"However, besides the initial cost of creating a dream, maintaining the dream's existence also requires Land of Bliss Coins."

"This is the driving force behind cultivators exploring dream worlds."

"The higher the dream world level, the greater the risk, but also the greater the corresponding rewards."

"Exploration of dreams can be done alone or with companions."

"Every period, there will be free dream worlds available for exploration. Of course, one can also spend Land of Bliss Coins to unlock them in advance." ... Sun Erlang's understanding of the various aspects of the [Land of Bliss] gradually deepened.

What truly caught his attention were the last pieces of information he learned.

"Normally, nothing from the dreams can be brought back to reality."

"But there are exceptions."

"First, the protection of the Carefree Heavenly Venerate's power. It can be realized with almost no cost, but this has rarely happened in the entire history of the Land of Bliss."

"Second, crucial items. By submitting them, one can choose a part of their dream power to bring back to reality."

"Third, by deeply exploring unknown dreams."

"Fourth... by submitting a large amount of Land of Bliss Coins." Sun Erlang and the others exchanged glances again, communicating with each other.

"This Land of Bliss is truly beyond our expectations."

"Even the Sage Master might not fully understand it. To create such a magnificent realm, the power of that Carefree Heavenly Venerate is truly unimaginable."

"However, dreams are dreams, they are illusory. We must ultimately return to reality."

"But, looking at it now, it seems a bit difficult. There are billions of beings in the Land of Bliss, and only a handful can return to reality each year," Yue Zhenwei pondered.

"Actually, I feel that even if we can't go back, staying in this Land of Bliss isn't bad. Look at the Treasury; there are many dream world templates. Any one of them is extremely wonderful," Wang Xuanba said, staring at the various items in the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury.

Sun Erlang remained silent.

Chapter 1357

Unable to find a way to escape the dream realm in a short time, Sun Erlang and the others, after deliberation, decided to first increase their strength within the dream.

Among the three, Yue Zhenwei had the Purple-Gold Gourd, and Sun Erlang had the Spirit Devouring Technique. Only Wang Xuanba had gained no immediate benefits in the dream world, making him the weakest link.

Therefore, the three pooled their Land of Bliss Coins together to purchase a protective divine ability for Wang Xuanba.

"Indestructible Reincarnation Body"

"An ultimate technique from the Ancient Immortal Sect of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Reincarnation Sect. Upon minor completion, yin, yang, and the five elements cannot harm it in the slightest. Upon major completion, it can be considered immortal and indestructible, impervious to all calamities."

This short description was enough to make Wang Xuanba decisively choose this divine ability.

Sun Erlang's expression was a bit strange as he muttered softly, "If this Reincarnation Sect divine ability is truly as powerful as the description claims, why was the sect so easily destroyed back then?"

Yue Zhenwei smiled and said, "It's only 5000 Land of Bliss Coins, how powerful can it truly be? But I suppose it's enough for self-defense at this stage."

After completing the exchange, Wang Xuanba, while feeling the changes in his body, said, "Actually, there's another protective divine ability that's also quite good, called [Carefree Intent of the Dao]. Unfortunately, this divine ability doesn't seem to originate from the Xuanhuang Realm, and I don't know its background. Moreover, its artistic conception doesn't quite suit my taste..."

Sun Erlang pondered, "I observe that within the Heavenly Venerate's Treasury, there are many items that do not seem to be native to the Xuanhuang Realm. Could it be that this Carefree Dream Land of Bliss also encompasses things and matters from outside the Xuanhuang Realm?"

The three looked at each other, gaining a new understanding of the power of the Carefree Heavenly Venerate.

The remaining Land of Bliss Coins were insufficient to redeem entry into the dream world. The three had no choice but to wait for the free dream to begin.

It had to be said that the words "Land of Bliss" were not spoken in vain.

Even without being in a tailored dream, the ordinary Land of Bliss was a vast land of indulgence for cultivators.
