Mo Rubbin blinked his eyes open with a dazed expression. Upon seeing Li Fan's concerned face, he froze for a moment. Then he suddenly turned his head to look around. "Huh? Wasn't I under the The Great Barrier?" "You were severely injured. Fortunately, I found you in time," Li Fan explained simply.

It seemed to have triggered a missing memory in Mo Rubbin. His body trembled as if shocked. "What exactly happened? Your appearance just now was too tragic. To be able to injure you to this extent..." Li Fan stared intently at Mo Rubbin. Mo Rubbin opened his mouth, but could not speak. "While you were unconscious, a peculiar fluctuation swept across the Star Sea." "And there have been three identical records of this peculiar fluctuation before..." "Do you know what this means?" Li Fan's words made Mo Rubbin show an expression of disbelief.

After pondering for a long time, he slowly said, "Actually... I'm not entirely sure." "I only remember that I was comprehending the secrets of the The Great Barrier at the time, and it seemed like I suddenly understood something." "I can't describe in detail what I comprehended." "I just felt that in that instant, like a fish leaping out of the sea, a bird breaking through the blue sky, I seemed to witness scenery completely different from before..." Mo Rubbin's tone was somewhat dazed, his brows furrowed as he tried to recall the feeling. "Then, I lost consciousness and passed out."

Li Fan couldn't help but ask, "You didn't even have a chance to resist?" Mo Rubbin shook his head. "That strange fluctuation weakens rapidly as it propagates through the Star Sea. When I encountered it near the Immortal Boat, its intensity was already terrifying. One can imagine what kind of world-shattering power erupted at the The Great Barrier's origin. As Mo Rubbin said, could it be the The Great Barrier's self-defense mechanism triggered by comprehending the Dao?" Li Fan mused inwardly. At this moment, Mo Rubbin also reacted, "You took me away... does that mean someone went to investigate the breach in the The Great Barrier?"

"That's right. And that person's strength is formidable, likely surpassing yours and mine," Li Fan said with a heavy tone. Mo Rubbin's expression kept changing. "No, I must immediately return to the breach in the The Great Barrier. I have a premonition that my previous enlightenment is fading like the tide. If I cannot use the aura of the The Great Barrier again to retain my enlightenment, then all my previous efforts will be in vain!" he said resolutely. Saying so, without regard for Li Fan's reaction, he rushed directly towards the destination.

Despite knowing there was a powerful, unknown enemy ahead, he acted this way. This was completely contrary to Mo Rubbin's usual behavior. It showed how immense the attraction of the The Great Barrier's secrets was to cultivators, reaching a point where it could influence their minds to a certain extent. Li Fan deliberated for a moment and decided to follow. The Wood Sword phantom enveloped them both, while primal force essence formed into an immortal formation, concealing their aura.

"Actually, returning now is also a good opportunity. The other party, after immediately checking and finding no one, should instinctively try to track us for a while. They definitely won't expect us to return..." As he spoke, the two had already returned to the breach in the The Great Barrier. The Heavenly Physician's figure was indeed not there. Mo Rubbin was about to step forward but was suddenly stopped by Li Fan. After careful observation, they discovered that the void ahead was covered with threads, sticky like a spiderweb, clinging to the invisible The Great Barrier and heavily obscuring the breach. This scene made both Li Fan and Mo Rubbin gasp involuntarily.

"This..." Both of them had personally experienced the transcendent nature of the The Great Barrier. Especially Mo Rubbin, who had comprehended the Dao under the The Great Barrier for month after month. He knew very well that with his strength, merely staying under the The Great Barrier for an extended period was difficult, let alone leaving his energy and traces on the The Great Barrier. "Has such a figure emerged in the Star Sea?"

Li Fan quickly regained his senses after the initial shock, "It's just a temporary measure. Those golden threads are naturally dissipating." "We just need to wait a while." Mo Rubbin said in a deep voice, "The problem is, we can't wait." "I surmise that the person who laid these measures had an enlightenment experience similar to mine. They know that stopping me for this period is enough..." "And..." Mo Rubbin looked around, "I'm afraid the person hasn't gone far and is waiting for us to fall into their trap nearby."

Although he said this, Mo Rubbin was already involuntarily moving closer to the breach in the The Great Barrier surrounded by golden threads. The aura he could no longer suppress indicated that his reason was gradually being overcome by desire. Frowning and pondering for a long time, Li Fan finally sighed, "So be it. Then I'll accompany you, no matter the cost." "I'll hold off the opponent!" "You must act quickly; I may not be able to delay for long!" Before he finished speaking, streaks of golden threads flew out from Li Fan's body, weaving a mysterious and extremely beautiful pattern in the void.

"Let the Heavenly Physician try the quality of my 'Bewildering Flowers, Azure Nether Beings' Great Formation!" Li Fan snorted coldly in his heart. Although he did not want to confront the Heavenly Physician prematurely, he was absolutely not afraid of him. Especially with the dual advantages of escape technique and immortal formation, Li Fan was confident he could suppress the Heavenly Physician for a short time!

Having received Li Fan's promise, Mo Rubbin no longer suppressed himself. "Demonic Heart, Immortal Intent!" he shouted. Instantly, countless faces, like vast dark clouds before a storm, surged out from Mo Rubbin's body. They all displayed different expressions, rushing towards the golden threads left by the Heavenly Physician like moths to a flame. Under the cover of the myriad demonic souls, Mo Rubbin's main body quietly approached the The Great Barrier.

"Buzz..." A sound like vibrating strings suddenly echoed through the Star Sea. The army of demonic souls had not yet reached the Heavenly Physician's golden threads when a large number of them began to melt like ice and snow under direct sunlight. However, they did not completely disappear, merely leaving behind a vague figure. Upon closer inspection, these figures all had a fine golden thread trace within them. The golden threads connected these demonic souls, and they instantly turned against Mo Rubbin, clashing with the demonic souls he controlled.

"Are mortal arts worthy of competing with immortal methods?" Mo Rubbin roared. His eyes instantly fell into a strange, silent darkness. An invisible mirror quietly appeared in the field of vision. It reflected all the demonic souls controlled by the Heavenly Physician's golden threads. The mirror's surface erupted with black light, transforming from virtual to solid. Then, the demonic souls in the mirror reshaped into Mo Rubbin's own face! Even though the golden threads within them were still manipulating them, they were forced to be possessed by Mo Rubbin! Thus, relying on the cover of his immortal and indestructible demonic souls, Mo Rubbin successfully broke through the outer layer of defense left by the Heavenly Physician.

Just as the breach in the The Great Barrier was within reach, Mo Rubbin suddenly found that he could no longer move. Transparent fine needles had, at some unknown time, pierced his body. It started with just one needle, then became two, then four. As if possessing self-awareness, they multiplied rapidly, soon filling all of Mo Rubbin's acupoints. The slightly contorted expression on Mo Rubbin's face seemed to gradually freeze.

Li Fan, who was setting up the formation and observing, saw this scene and was considering whether to intervene. However, he discovered that he had underestimated Mo Rubbin, the ancient Heavenly Mysteries Sect Law King. The moment he froze, all the invisible needles were quietly stained with a dark hue. Like a muddy swamp, it continuously eroded upwards. If observed on a magnified level, those black markings were the manifestations of Mo Rubbin's demonic souls! Although they were more mindless than the demonic souls Mo Rubbin had released earlier, their eyes held only frantic destruction, constantly gnawing at the sealing needles. When one needle was devoured by a demonic soul, it was thus pulled out of his body. It then flew towards other needles, aiding in their erosion. Thus, the dissolution speed of the sealing needles accelerated. In just a few breaths, they were all deciphered by Mo Rubbin.

"The 'Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique' is indeed worthy of being the immortal cultivation method personally chosen by the Heavenly Mysteries King for Mo Rubbin. It is truly extraordinary!" Li Fan, who witnessed Mo Rubbin charging through the formation, couldn't help but praise inwardly. After repelling the sealing needles, what stood before Mo Rubbin was the Heavenly Physician's final defense. And Li Fan, who had already completed his formation, sensed the Heavenly Physician's aura not far away.

"No matter how strong you are in the Star Sea, you must pass through my 'Azure Nether Beings Formation'!" Fierce light erupted in Li Fan's eyes. Looking at the white-haired figure not far away, Li Fan seemed to recall the scene of his first meeting with this peerless expert from the Heavenly Law Realm. Primal force essence was continuously drawn out, and the Tribulation End Dissolution Disc operated at its peak. In the cycle of a hundred lifetimes, all the information gathered about the Heavenly Law Realm flashed through his mind. "Let you taste the wonderful world I've tailor-made for you!" "Formation, activate!" Li Fan roared. An invisible fluctuation instantly enveloped the fleeing Heavenly Physician. A look of shock crossed his face.

Then, the Heavenly Physician felt his vision go black and lost consciousness. When he woke up again, he was momentarily disoriented. Then, a childish voice with extreme innocence awakened him. "Venerable! Venerable!" The Heavenly Physician looked towards the source of the voice. It was an adorable little girl, seemingly no more than ten years old, yet she had already reached the Nascent Soul cultivation. "Little Sister Su." Information about this little girl instantly appeared in the Heavenly Physician's mind. "Two worlds merged, and two Heavenly Dao consciousnesses attached themselves to the mother and daughter respectively." "Possessing extraordinary talent, born without the confinement of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma, a perfect physique that countless living beings dream of."

"Celestial-Mortal Miasma?" The Heavenly Physician suddenly felt a sense of incongruity. However, after a brief dizziness, he remembered what had happened over the past ten thousand years. In the life-and-death battle between the Heavenly Law Realm and the Xuanhuang Realm back then, the Heavenly Law Realm had ultimately achieved victory by chance. The Heavenly Law Realm successfully devoured the Xuanhuang Realm, gaining the resources of an entire cultivation world to temporarily escape the Immortal Ruins. However, the price was tremendous. Among the Heavenly Law Realm's Venerables, besides himself, Heavenly Judgment, Heavenly Sound, Heavenly Oracle, and others all died in battle. In their final moments of despair, the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm used the Xuanhuang Realm itself as a sacrifice and launched a fatal blow. The Heavenly Dao laws such as the Celestial-Mortal Miasma and the impossibility of cultivating different laws together were subtly implanted into the Xuanhuang Realm like poison. Even the fundamental principles of cultivation for cultivators had subtly changed.

And he, having fallen into a coma due to severe injuries, did not notice in time. By the time he awoke from his slumber, the Heavenly Law Realm had undergone earth-shattering changes. Because different laws could not be cultivated together, cultivators slaughtered each other. After the great war, the already depleted Heavenly Law Realm almost lost its inheritance. Fortunately, after a period of fighting, the surviving cultivators had enough cultivation methods to practice. The killing stopped, but the cultivators lost mutual trust. They lived on a desolate land, filled with vigilance and isolation from each other. During this period, the surviving cultivators in the Star Sea also discovered this remnant land of the Heavenly Law Realm. Their original homes had been destroyed in the Star Sea tribulation, so they came here one after another to settle down.

Over the past ten thousand years, the entire Star Sea had been in flux. The suction of the Immortal Ruins was constantly pulling everything in the Star Sea. The Heavenly Law Realm, which had fortunately escaped back then, now, as the last sanctuary of survival in the Star Sea, inevitably approached the edge of the Immortal Ruins. It was precarious, constantly at risk of complete destruction. When the Heavenly Physician awoke, he saw such a scene. Although he was incredibly shocked, he immediately took remedial measures. Through various methods, he finally persuaded the few Longevity Realm powerhouses on the land of the Heavenly Law Realm to temporarily unite. They formed a loose alliance, gathering the cultivators of the Heavenly Law Realm and supporting mortal cultivation. The Heavenly Law Realm slowly regained its vitality, but the Longevity Realm powerhouses harbored their own schemes. Facing the Heavenly Law Realm, this sinking giant ship, they all began to entertain the idea of escaping separately. The Heavenly Physician was going to save such a Heavenly Law Realm.

Chapter 1364

"Venerable, Venerable!"

Su Xiaomei's cry jolted the Heavenly Physician from his memories.

"Venerable, how do you like my newly comprehended divine ability?"

As Su Xiaomei spoke, her small mouth opened, and a stream of black sword light, filled with destructive energy, shot towards the Heavenly Physician.

The black sword light, powered by the flow of the five elements and the force of inextinguishable life, surged forward, driven by an intent of facing death and nothingness, its edge honed by the hunger to annihilate all things and bring about absolute stillness.

With a single sword strike, it seemed to possess the power to shatter worlds!

It was difficult to fathom that such potent divine ability could originate from a child not yet ten years old!

A hint of admiration flashed in the Heavenly Physician's eyes, yet he made no move to dodge the sword light of absolute stillness. He allowed it to strike him directly in the face.

Instantly, the Heavenly Physician's flesh and blood transformed into a network of crisscrossing lines. It was like a colossal net, slightly sunken, that easily blocked the Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword!

From the countless lines of the giant net, strands of golden light emerged, swarming towards the sword of absolute stillness and directly engulfing it. The sword light vanished as silently as ice melting into water.

Upon witnessing this, Su Xiaomei, who had been incredibly excited, pouted and mumbled, "Venerable, you are truly strong. Even though I have achieved the Nascent Soul realm with the Great Five Elements Grotto-heaven, I am still no match for you, Venerable."

The Heavenly Physician chuckled, "Child, how long have you been cultivating? If you catch up to me, where will I, an old man, hide my face?"

He patted Su Xiaomei's head, his expression turning solemn as he slowly said, "Your divine ability is indeed impressive, sufficient to be invincible among your peers. However..."

Su Xiaomei looked up, her eyes wide, listening to the Heavenly Physician's teachings, "It is still quite distant from the true meaning of the Great Dao. For instance, what is absolute stillness?"

The Heavenly Physician extended a finger, and from its tip, black light also surged forth. However, it was more profound and elusive than that contained within the Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword.

"True absolute stillness does not exist within the self-circulation of a world. So-called extinction is merely a prelude to better rebirth."

"To touch upon true annihilation, you must journey to the depths of the starry sky..."

"You are still too young. Wait until you grow stronger. Hmm, perhaps when you reach the Dao Integration realm, you can try." The Heavenly Physician said, stroking his beard.

Su Xiaomei's face fell, "I still have to wait until Dao Integration? When will that be? Forget it, I'm going to find Sister Zhao to play!"

Before her voice faded, Su Xiaomei vanished like a wisp of smoke.

"Zhao Ruoxi..." The Heavenly Physician murmured the name, a shadow crossing his face.

This person was originally the Sect Leader of the Great Dao Sect in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The ancient war between the two realms ultimately resulted in the Heavenly Law Realm's victory, but this did not mean all cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm perished. Just as the Xuanhuang Realm was eventually absorbed into the Heavenly Law Realm, a small portion of Xuanhuang Realm cultivators had now become part of the Heavenly Law Realm.

In fact, the Heavenly Law Realm's eventual victory owed a great deal to these cultivators. However, this group of cultivators could only share prosperity, not adversity. For the past ten thousand years, the Heavenly Law Realm had faced numerous tribulations, but they stood at the pinnacle of the cultivation world, and the impact on them was naturally minimal. But now...

The Heavenly Law Realm was about to fall into the Immortal Ruins. These cultivators were all harboring their own schemes, with none willing to genuinely save the Heavenly Law Realm.

The Heavenly Physician snorted coldly in his heart. These individuals had not yet completely revealed their hostility, so it was not convenient for him to make a move first. He would wait. For now, the most important task was to improve his own cultivation.

The Heavenly Physician's bright eyes gazed directly at the firmament, as if he could see the True Immortal meditating in the Immortal Ruins.

"The vast majority of my strength comes from the Heavenly Dao of the Heavenly Law Realm. Although I was seriously injured and slept for nearly ten thousand years, as the Heavenly Law Realm devoured the Xuanhuang Realm, the world's overall strength more than doubled. My cultivation also increased accordingly..."

"Especially since all Heavenly Venerates are dead, the constant laws of the Heavenly Law Realm have all returned to me."

With a thought, the Heavenly Physician’s consciousness instantly soared to the heavens, transforming into the boundless firmament, the Heavenly Law Dao overlooking the mortal world. Unlike other cultivation realms, the Heavenly Law Realm had no existence of Heavenly Dao consciousness or world consciousness. There was only the constant Heavenly Law, like a machine, circulating on its own since the creation of heaven and earth, independent of the will of any sentient being within the world.

As the saying goes, the Heavenly Law is solemn, adhering to rules and order. The Heavenly Law is inviolable. Later, sentient beings with great wisdom were able to resonate with these threads of the constant Heavenly Law, thus acting as enforcers of the law on behalf of heaven. These individuals were known as "Venerables."

Heavenly Judgment, Heavenly Sound, Heavenly Oracle—all were Venerables of the Heavenly Law Realm. However, the war between the two realms was too brutal, and these Venerables all perished. Before their deaths, they passed on their accumulated resonance and understanding of the constant Heavenly Law to the sole survivor, the Heavenly Physician. Thus, when the Heavenly Physician awoke, he found himself an unprecedented, All-Dharma Great Venerable.

In any other cultivation realm, this would be equivalent to the embodiment of the Heavenly Dao consciousness. The Heavenly Physician felt that with a single thought, he could arbitrarily rewrite the geography of the Heavenly Law Realm, summon wind and clouds, and change the weather.

"And unlike the Heavenly Dao's manifestation in the usual sense, my power does not solely originate from the Heavenly Dao consciousness."

"Through ten thousand years of resonating with the constant laws, the power of the world has already permeated the depths of my soul, integrating with me. Even if I leave the Heavenly Law Realm and venture beyond the starry sky, I can still exert eighty percent of my strength."

"With my power, it would be effortless to escape the Immortal Ruins alone. I could even bring hundreds or thousands of people with me and escape without issue."

"But to bring the entire Heavenly Law Realm along..."

A sense of powerlessness welled up in the Heavenly Physician's heart. "Unless I can attain a power comparable to a True Immortal."

In the years since his awakening, the Heavenly Physician had made attempts to achieve this. Firstly, he studied the residual True Immortal power scattered throughout the star sea. From this, he comprehended some True Immortal Sigils and mastered a few ultimate killing moves. However, it offered no substantial help in improving his own strength.

Secondly, he sought to harness the power of ancient Immortal artifacts. The Xuanhuang Realm possessed profound heritage, and it was even rumored that before the Immortal Realm's destruction, many sects maintained contact with the Upper Realm. If the Immortal Realm still existed, the Heavenly Law Realm would likely not have been a match for the Xuanhuang Realm. Fortunately, by the time the war broke out, some years had passed since the Immortal Realm's destruction. Nevertheless, the Xuanhuang Realm had deployed several Immortal artifacts, causing heavy losses to the Heavenly Law Realm. After the war, these Immortal artifacts were scattered. Most were absorbed by the constant Heavenly Law, transforming into Heavenly and Earthly Marvels, nourishing the world's own power. However, a small portion still remained.

"Boundless Mirror."

"Great Sun Golden Bell."

"Primordial Five Elements Disk."

These three were collected by the Heavenly Physician over the years. However, compared to their former peak state, these Immortal artifacts were now severely damaged. They might be useful for comprehending True Immortal power, but if he were to activate them... they would likely be completely destroyed after a single use. Unless the Heavenly Physician could find Immortal Spiritual power to repair them.

The three Immortal artifacts transformed into three points of light, flickering in the Heavenly Physician's sea of consciousness. Insights into Immortality continued to surge into his mind like a gentle stream.

"The suction of the Immortal Ruins is, in essence, a power of True Immortal Sigils."

"Only Immortals can oppose Immortals."

"Perhaps I can… gather all the remaining Immortal artifacts of the Heavenly Law Realm and detonate them simultaneously."

"Using poison to fight poison, by harnessing the sudden eruption of the Immortal Spiritual power storm, I should be able to help the Heavenly Law Realm escape the Immortal Ruins."

As the Heavenly Physician mused, he suddenly sensed something amiss. His gaze sharpened, and he looked beyond the starry sky.

"Escaping the Immortal Ruins... and then what?"

The Heavenly Physician vaguely felt that the depths of the star sea hid even deeper secrets. Once this thought arose, he could no longer suppress it.

"The Heavenly Law Realm seems capable of holding on for a while longer."

"As the saying goes, plan before acting. I must venture into the depths of the starry sky to investigate."

After a moment of contemplation, the Heavenly Physician made up his mind. He transformed into an imperceptible thread and flew towards the Abyssal Star Sea. Leaving the Heavenly Law Realm, he was drawn by the suction of the Immortal Ruins, altering his trajectory. However, he successfully executed a beautiful arc, escaping the range of the Immortal Ruins' pull.

He journeyed at high speed in the star sea. Within the Abyssal Star Sea, all that met the eye was desolation and darkness. No matter how far he traveled, the surrounding scenery seemed unchanged. Occasionally, he encountered residual Immortal power, but it posed no threat to the Heavenly Physician.

After an unknown period, a vast sea of remnants suddenly appeared before him. Shocked by this magnificent sight, and by the fact that so many remnants of destroyed cultivation worlds had converged in one spot in the star sea, the Heavenly Physician's spirits heightened. He continued to press onward.

Upon seeing the continuous fragments of worlds, and sensing a growing power that seemed to have the same origin as the Immortal Ruins' suction, the Heavenly Physician's heart trembled uncontrollably. Countless once-prosperous cultivation worlds had all become ruins, fragments, left to lie here in solitude.

A wave of sorrow washed over the Heavenly Physician, and he stood there in a daze for a long time. When he finally regained his senses, the Heavenly Physician, resisting the pervasive, tide-like force, reached the end of the Abyssal Star Sea. Here, his forward progress was halted. The path ahead was severed, with nowhere to go—the Abyssal Star Sea, a place of eternal confinement.

"No retreat..." To his own surprise, the Heavenly Physician accepted this fact without spending too much time. An invisible, The Great Barrier sealed the entire Abyssal Star Sea. All beings within could not escape. Standing beneath the The Great Barrier, he sensed absolute "nothingness." After a brief moment of despair, countless thoughts flashed through the Heavenly Physician's mind. "I absolutely cannot let the beings of the Heavenly Law Realm know of this The Great Barrier's existence, or despair will spread, and disaster will surely arise."

"This The Great Barrier..." "Even I cannot fathom it for the moment. Perhaps only a True Immortal can cross it."

The thought of bearing the fate of the entire Heavenly Law Realm caused the Heavenly Physician to take a deep breath. "True Immortal power can indeed traverse the The Great Barrier, but to bring the Heavenly Law Realm along..."

"Difficult! Difficult! Difficult!" His mind was shaken. Before a force beyond his comprehension, the Heavenly Physician experienced a moment of trance. Yet, for some reason, he did not feel overwhelming despair. It seemed as if this invisible The Great Barrier was not an insurmountable object to him. The Heavenly Physician shot out several golden threads, attempting to sense the mystery of the The Great Barrier, but ultimately found nothing.

Sensing that he had lingered at the fringe of the star sea for too long and that the Heavenly Law Realm might undergo changes, the Heavenly Physician felt the urge to return. On his way back, as he looked at the continuous Great Wall of Broken Realms, an idea suddenly struck him.

"These world corpses might be used to nourish the Heavenly Law Realm."

"After all, they are not entirely dead ruins; there are still traces of life force remaining."

"Like consuming food, after the Heavenly Law Realm devours them, it will surely become stronger..."

The Heavenly Physician's decisiveness was unquestionable. The moment the thought arose, countless golden threads shot out, attempting to drag one of them. However, just as the golden threads had finished entangling and were about to act, the Heavenly Physician abruptly stopped. He observed the continuous Great Wall of Broken Realms again for a moment. A short while later, he suddenly realized, "So, the reason these continuous broken realms can resist the True Immortal power accumulating beneath the The Great Barrier is due to the formation they naturally create. If I rashly take a fragment from within, it might disrupt the balance."

"It would be like a river's mouth breaching, and the dam collapsing. The True Immortal power accumulated over the years would spread and sweep across the entire Abyssal Star Sea..."

"And the Heavenly Law Realm would also be affected."

The Heavenly Physician frowned slightly, then quickly relaxed. "It's not that they cannot be taken, but it must be done at the appropriate time, targeting specific objects."

The Heavenly Physician observed again and finally selected a suitable fragment of a broken realm. Sensing the ebb and flow within the True Immortal power beneath the The Great Barrier, he seized the opportunity. Innumerable golden threads, like iron chains, tightly entangled the target. Then, dragging it, he sped through the star sea towards the Heavenly Law Realm.

After another unknown period, he finally returned. The suction force surged, and the Heavenly Physician desperately held onto this fragment of a world, preventing it from falling into the Immortal Ruins. The Heavenly Physician's mind raced: "Since the Heavenly Law Realm devoured the Xuanhuang Realm ten thousand years ago, it has not 'eaten' since."

"Moreover, it has been in a state of being consumed by cultivators, essentially having most of its foundation hollowed out, leaving it extremely weak. If I were to implant this fragment rashly, it might cause the problem of the body being unable to absorb such nourishment."

After careful consideration, the Heavenly Physician nodded slightly. "A medicinal catalyst is needed."

"The cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm's methods—Devouring Heaven and Consuming Earth, insatiably greedy—however, they merge with the world. They are excellent candidates as a medicinal catalyst."

"Those few in the Longevity realm are not to be moved for now. However, sacrificing some in the Dao Integration realm would not have a significant impact."

With his left hand, five transparent threads shot out in different directions of the Heavenly Law Realm under the Heavenly Physician's guidance. Five Dao Integration cultivators, without any resistance, fell unconscious, bound by the transparent threads. The Heavenly Physician's face showed no mercy. He extended his index finger and tapped them one by one. Without any pain, these Dao Integration cultivators turned into powder. The Heavenly Physician waved his large sleeve, collecting all the Dao Integration powder. He then quickly cast it into the dragged fragment of a realm.

Nourished by the power of the Heaven and Earth Essence, the destroyed fragment of a realm seemed to regain a pulse of life. It emitted a faint humming sound. Only then did the Heavenly Physician slowly sew it into the Heavenly Law Realm.

Chapter 1365: The Demonic God's Final Revival

Under normal circumstances, forcibly implanting fragments from another world, even if they were already destroyed, into the Heavenly Law Realm would undoubtedly cause the Heavenly Dao of the Heavenly Law Realm to resist and reject the foreign entity. This is known as an adverse reaction.

However, the world fragments that the Heavenly Physician had grafted in had already been integrated with the remnants of five Dao Integration cultivators. The power of the Heaven and Earth Essence within these Dao Integration cultivators originally came from the Heavenly Law Realm. Therefore, the degree of adverse reaction during the fusion process was considerably low.

Very smoothly, the Heavenly Law Realm completed the assimilation of the fragments.

Feeling a hint of vitality slowly flowing from this fragment of the ruined realm into the Heavenly Law Realm, the Heavenly Physician let out a sigh of relief. "It was not in vain for me to have traveled such a long distance and endured hardship."

After quietly observing for a period, perhaps because the Heavenly Law Realm had been in a perpetual state of hunger, not having "eaten" for a long time, this fragment seemed to be particularly effective. It not only replenished energy but also reignited the vitality that had been temporarily suppressed by the Heavenly Dao due to the endless greed of cultivators.

"If we need to 'eat' again in the future, it won't be this troublesome. We can directly connect to the remnants of this first fragment." "However, we'll need to go to the fringes of the Star Sea again to bring back new world fragments to continue the process before the world has completely finished digesting this one..."

Thinking this, the Heavenly Physician couldn't help but furrow his brow slightly. Although with his strength, he could travel at great speed through the Star Sea and largely ignore any dangers along the way, the Star Sea was too vast. A round trip would take nearly a year. Furthermore, based on his estimations, it would take about two years for the Heavenly Law Realm to fully digest this world fragment.

"Calculating it this way, there won't be any spare time for other matters. I'm stretched too thin..." The Heavenly Physician sighed faintly, feeling the weight of the world on his shoulders. Although he had nurtured some promising individuals over the years, they were still far from being able to shoulder significant responsibilities. This made him nostalgic for his old friends who had fought alongside him in the past.

Images of people flashed through the Heavenly Physician's mind. Suddenly, he paused abruptly at one of them. "The Demonic God..." The Heavenly Physician's expression became somewhat peculiar.

Back then, before the war between the two realms, the Demonic God had departed to wander beyond the heavens. He had not returned even during the most intense and brutal stages of the battle. However, the Heavenly Physician had a faint premonition that the Demonic God had not perished but still existed somewhere in the Star Sea.

Originally, the Heavenly Physician had no intention of contacting this most peculiar existence among the Venerables of the Heavenly Law Realm. The Venerables were beings born from the Heavenly Law Realm, resonating with and giving form to the eternal Dao of the Heavenly Law. The Demonic God, however, was the sole exception. He was like a discordant note in a grand symphony. The Demonic God was the self-manifested embodiment of the Heavenly Law Dao related to "heart demons" within the Heavenly Law Realm. He was the very Heavenly Dao of the heart demon.

He had only had a few exchanges with the other Venerables. Although the Demonic God was born from the Heavenly Law Realm, from the moment of his birth, he had effectively detached himself from the Heavenly Law Realm, severing his connection with the "mother" that gave him life. He was not very concerned with the affairs of the Heavenly Law Realm, only seeking to advance further and pursue the elusive realm of the "Supreme." Remaining in the Heavenly Law Realm would inevitably prevent him from transcending the mortal world. Thus, the Demonic God had resolutely departed.

He had not appeared to help even when the Heavenly Law Realm was on the brink of collapse. One could say he had no remaining connection to the Heavenly Law Realm. "I wonder if the Demonic God has touched the threshold of the Supreme realm by now." The Heavenly Physician's gaze became distant. After deep contemplation, he ultimately decided to search for the Demonic God's whereabouts in the Star Sea.

He looked up at the sky, his form transforming into a gentle breeze, merging with the very fabric of the Heavenly Law Realm. The eternal Dao roared, and laws operated like an incredibly precise machine, running day and night. Although the Demonic God had severed his connection with the eternal Dao of the Heavenly Law, he was, after all, born from this heaven and earth. The Heavenly Physician, currently replacing the Heavenly Dao as a Great Venerable of All Laws, now sensed the distant Star Sea.

After half a day, he finally detected the approximate location of the Demonic God. It was precisely at the fringes of the Star Sea, near the continuous Great Wall of Ruined Realms! The Heavenly Physician's heart trembled as he pondered the reason for the Demonic God's presence there. Without haste, before departing, the Heavenly Physician invited the current six Longevity Heavenly Venerates of the Heavenly Law Realm to discuss the future of the Heavenly Law Realm. Although they appeared as mere projections and not their true selves, it did not hinder their communication.

"We will, without a doubt, follow the Great Venerable's lead. After all, the Heavenly Law Realm is our shared homeland. If it truly falls into the Immortal Ruins... with the vastness of the Star Sea, there will be no place for us in the future." The first to voice his opinion was a scholar-like figure. He attained the Dao at the end of the Cultivation Wasteland Era. Moved by how cultivators, after years of mutual slaughter, had become suspicious and afraid to trust anyone, he reversed the principles of heaven and earth, causing lies to cease in the world. He was revered by the populace as the "True Word Heavenly Venerate."

"Hehehehe..." Before the True Word Heavenly Venerate could finish speaking, a strange laugh echoed. "What does the survival of the Heavenly Law Realm have to do with me? I'd be glad if it collapsed into the Immortal Ruins sooner!" The Heavenly Physician looked at the figure hidden within a black hood before him, a murderous intent flashing undisguised in his eyes. If there was any Venerable whom the Heavenly Physician wished to eliminate more than anyone else, it would be this one, the "Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate."

This individual was initially a cultivator who had achieved great success in the path of medicine. He comprehended the process by which the Heavenly Law absorbed the Xuanhuang Realm and used this as a reversed mechanism. This caused the Dao of the Heavenly Law, during its absorption of other worlds, to spontaneously generate a resistance. The Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate thus attained the position of longevity. If not for this individual's obstruction of cosmic principles, the Heavenly Law Realm would have long ago completely absorbed and digested the Xuanhuang Realm. And now, when implanting fragments of other worlds into the Heavenly Law Realm, it would not have taken so long.

The Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate, however, showed no fear of the Heavenly Physician, continuing to speak sarcastically, "If the Heavenly Law falls into the Immortal Ruins, it will undoubtedly be torn to shreds. At that time, it will be the moment of my great Dao attainment! Naturally, I couldn't be happier!" The assembled Heavenly Venerates cast sidelong glances. Only the "One Heart Heavenly Venerate," Zhao Ruoxi, spoke with a hint of grievance and infatuation, "It seems Brother Li dislikes lowly me and wishes to escape from my side." As she spoke, it seemed as if shimmering tears were falling from her face. The Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate's voice abruptly ceased. He instinctively moved a slight distance away from the One Heart Heavenly Venerate, filled with apprehension.

The Heavenly Physician let out a cold snort and solemnly declared, "I will not force any of you to contribute. However, if anyone obstructs this endeavor..." "Even at the cost of damaging the eternal Dao of the Heavenly Law Realm, I will undoubtedly uproot and eliminate them!" "Do not say you were not warned!"

The words of the Heavenly Physician, a Great Venerable of All Laws, carried considerable weight. Under this warning, even the previously arrogant Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate dared not openly object and could only nod in agreement. The Reverse Principle Heavenly Venerate, while reversing the principles of heaven and earth, had also become a part of the eternal Dao of the Heavenly Law. As long as heaven and earth endure, the Heavenly Venerates are immortal. Hence the name Longevity. However, longevity did not mean eternal indestructibility. One could kill the Longevity Heavenly Venerate by forcibly extracting and destroying the principle represented by the Reverse Principle Heavenly Venerate.

However, doing so was possible only for cultivators who had attained an ultimate understanding of the principles of heaven and earth, such as the Heavenly Physician, a Great Venerable of All Laws. Secondly... even if successful, the process of extracting a principle from heaven and earth would inevitably cause some impact on other eternal principles of heaven and earth. The Heavenly Law Realm would undoubtedly be severely weakened as a result. The already frail Heavenly Law Realm could no longer withstand such a blow. This was precisely why the Heavenly Physician had hesitated to act until now.

"However, once I have completed a few more rounds of 'feeding' and restored some of the Heavenly Law Realm's vitality, I should be able to begin uprooting these pests." The Heavenly Physician looked at the Reverse Fusion Heavenly Venerate, suppressing the killing intent in his heart for the time being. "A few days ago, I ventured beyond the Heavenly Law Realm to explore the Immortal Ruins. Vaguely, I saw a figure seated cross-legged..." Just as a silent, tense standoff filled the hall, a voice suddenly rang out, causing everyone to tremble.

The Heavenly Physician couldn't help but turn his attention. The speaker was the "Dao Attainment Heavenly Venerate," Su Bai. This individual felt that all mortals were afflicted by the Celestial-Mortal Miasma, making it difficult to cultivate and attain the Dao easily. Therefore, he reversed this principle, substituting himself for all sentient beings in the world to bear the suffering of the Celestial-Mortal Miasma. Mortals merely needed to recite the name of the Dao Attainment Heavenly Venerate day and night with sincere hearts, and the Celestial-Mortal Miasma would naturally dissipate.

Su Bai smiled slightly and continued, "I also glimpsed a character from that Immortal Ruins." Using his finger as a brush, Su Bai instantly wrote the character "Starvation" in the air. "I could only recall it this vaguely, so this is all I could reproduce," Su Bai shook his head with a hint of regret. Even with Su Bai's words, the power fluctuations emanating from the character in the air demonstrated the terrifying nature of the True Immortal Sigils. "I believe the culprit responsible for countless beings falling into the Immortal Ruins is this character." "The power of a True Immortal naturally requires a True Immortal to wield it." "There are not a few remnants of True Immortal power in the Star Sea. My suggestion is that we research these powers and, from them, deduce the original True Immortal Sigils. With the True Immortal Sigils, we can counter the True Immortal Sigils." Su Bai said with a grave expression.

This suggestion immediately prompted the other Heavenly Venerates to ponder seriously. Even the Heavenly Physician was frowning, considering the feasibility of this plan. Seeing this, Su Bai added another piece of significant information: "To be honest, over the years, I have made some progress in my secret research. Your talents are even greater than mine. If we work together and diligently study..." "To wield the Immortal Ruins with True Immortal Sigils will be within reach!" As he said this, Su Bai wrote another character. However, compared to what he had seen in the Immortal Ruins, the one he had comprehended himself was noticeably weaker.

The Heavenly Physician looked at the other Venerates, their expressions clearly moved. He couldn't help but feel a sense of worry. He was already familiar with the power of this True Immortal Sigils. If these individuals, who were already difficult to deal with, were to master the True Immortal Sigils... then even if conflict arose, the Heavenly Law Realm itself would be affected and reduced to ruins! Thinking of this, the Heavenly Physician's mood became even more urgent.

In the subsequent discussions, a consensus was reached among them. The actions were divided into three factions: First, assist the Heavenly Physician in nourishing and strengthening the Heavenly Law Realm, enhancing its power. Second, comprehend the True Immortal Sigils to resist the Immortal Ruins with external forces. Third, remain uninvolved and adopt a neutral stance.

After dismissing the assembly, the Heavenly Physician, a Great Venerable of the Heavenly Law Realm, couldn't help but feel somewhat weary. With six Longevity Heavenly Venerates in place, the Heavenly Law Realm would temporarily be out of grave danger. Thus, the Heavenly Physician rallied his spirits and immediately rushed towards the sensed location of the Demonic God. "If we can gain the Demonic God's assistance, we can possess these Longevity Heavenly Venerates without anyone knowing." "This can minimize unnecessary casualties..." Thinking of this, the Heavenly Physician's desire to find the Demonic God intensified.

He traversed the Star Sea, day after day. Finally, he arrived at the fringes of the Star Sea. Within his range of perception, after searching for a long time, the Heavenly Physician finally found the Demonic God. He was indeed alive. However, he was frozen within a peculiar crystal!

"The 'Crystallized Wind'?" The Heavenly Physician did not approach directly to retrieve the Demonic God but observed from a distance. He recognized the peculiar power that had caused the Demonic God to be frozen. "Star Sea anomalies are rarely seen these days." "It seems not long after the Demonic God left the Heavenly Law Realm, he encountered misfortune..." "Perhaps I have wronged him; it wasn't that he refused to help, but that he was unable to." Seeing his old friend's tragic state, frozen for tens of thousands of years, a wave of pity washed over the Heavenly Physician. "It is said that when the Crystallized Wind appears, it can freeze vast swathes of star fields, making it one of the most terrifying Star Sea anomalies." "Even an existence with the Demonic God's strength could not resist it in the face of such immense power." The Heavenly Physician’s expression grew solemn. "After such a long time, the freezing power does not seem to have diminished much." "Its bone-chilling cold can even freeze the power of True Immortals that approach..."

However, the Heavenly Physician was indeed the Heavenly Physician. After pondering for a long time, he eventually found a way to deal with it. He used hundreds of thousands of golden threads to entwine the ice crystal. Then, he dragged it towards the invisible The Great Barrier. As he neared, he suddenly flung it out. The ice crystal, which had been moving at high speed, suddenly stopped in mid-air. As if subjected to a violent impact, it vibrated incessantly. The Heavenly Physician's eyes immediately lit up; he keenly sensed that a portion of the freezing power had been weakened by this impact. "Only the The Great Barrier can perhaps shake this deathly icy power." The Heavenly Physician exclaimed, and the golden threads emerged again. The Heavenly Physician pulled the ice crystal, maintaining a certain distance from the The Great Barrier. Then, he repeated the same maneuver.

Boom! Boom! Boom! With continuous impacts, the ice crystal grew smaller and smaller. When only a thin layer remained, the Heavenly Physician also reduced the intensity of the "slapping" motion. After all, although theoretically, the Demonic God was practically immortal and indestructible, the The Great Barrier was an existence that could not be fathomed. He had to be careful. Otherwise, if this old friend, who had not perished in the Star Sea calamity, died by his own hand... the Heavenly Physician would certainly feel immense guilt. Of course, the main concern was the loss of a crucial ally. The Heavenly Physician's control over power was almost microscopic. Ultimately, through this somewhat peculiar method, he managed to awaken the Demonic God.

A transparent, blurry figure stared intently at the Heavenly Physician. It did not speak. "Demonic God..." The Heavenly Physician knew that he had some awareness of his surroundings even while frozen, so he spoke first with some awkwardness. The Demonic God's figure suddenly vanished. A moment later, it appeared in the Heavenly Physician's mind!

Chapter 1366: The Mysterious Secret in the Heavenly Physician's Heart

The Heavenly Physician’s pale beard and hair bristled, moving as if in a windless realm. His face, etched with countless wrinkles, flickered rapidly between thousands of different human visages. For reasons unknown, the Heavenly Demon, sealed for ten thousand years, wished to possess the Heavenly Physician as soon as it was freed.

However, the Heavenly Physician was a Great Venerable of the Myriad Laws, far beyond the capabilities of the weakened Heavenly Demon. With his left hand, he inserted a long golden needle straight into the crown of his head. His shifting face instantly returned to normal, and the Heavenly Demon’s illusory form was forced out!

Simultaneously, countless golden threads wove together, forming a net that seemed to construct a real world. The Heavenly Demon, just expelled from the Heavenly Physician's body, found itself unable to resist, slowly being drawn into this golden net world! The Heavenly Demon let out roars, but was ultimately subdued by the Heavenly Physician.

Yet, no joy appeared on the Heavenly Physician’s face. “I cannot communicate with it at all? Has it lost its sentience from being sealed for too long?” After a brief investigation, his furrowed brow relaxed. “This is for the best. The Heavenly Demon’s essence of corrupting the human heart remains. This will be more convenient for me.”

With a sigh, lamenting the passing of old acquaintances, the Heavenly Physician soon returned to his crucial task. He dragged the sealed Heavenly Demon, along with another suitable fragment of a world, back into the Heavenly Law Realm.

Of course, he did not waste the more than a year he spent en route. While his body surged forward at incredible speeds, countless golden threads, like tentacles, danced around him. He meticulously sensed the residual True Immortal power encountered along his path. He had indeed been tempted by the suggestion made by Dao Attainment Heavenly Venerate Su Bai.

“Indeed, if utilized properly, the power unleashed by these True Immortal Script characters might shake the Immortal Ruins…” Thinking this, the Heavenly Physician used his hand as a brush, inscribing several characters in the air. Though merely illusory, the moment the characters appeared, a profound power reverberated around them. The intensity of this vibration continued to increase as the Heavenly Physician approached the Heavenly Law Realm. This was only the result of less than a year of his comprehension. The Heavenly Physician’s terrifying talent was evident.

As the Heavenly Law Realm loomed in the distance, the Heavenly Physician casually retracted the True Immortal Script characters he had comprehended. He then fully unleashed his aura, conspicuously feeding the Heavenly Law Realm with world fragments. While this attracted most of the Longevity cultivators within the Heavenly Law Realm, he silently sent forth a spectral projection, carrying the sealed Heavenly Demon, towards the location of the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion.

Perhaps this Heavenly Venerate was overconfident in his own strength, or perhaps he was simply too foolish. Most other Longevity realm cultivators in the Heavenly Law Realm concealed their auras and shifted their positions unpredictably. Only this Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion remained completely undisguised. Thus, the Heavenly Physician easily infiltrated his vicinity.

The Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion appeared to be in seclusion. Stirred by the Heavenly Physician’s act of feeding the Heavenly Law Realm, he looked up at the sky, a hint of hatred flashing in his eyes. Then, the Heavenly Physician’s attention was drawn to a phantom image of the Heavenly Law Realm before the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion. Several locations within the phantom image were clearly marked, yet they were beyond the Heavenly Physician’s senses as a Great Venerable of the Myriad Laws!

The Heavenly Physician’s heart tightened. After careful observation, he had a sudden realization: “So, these are remnants of the Xuanhuang Realm!” “This Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion, by consolidating his Dao, has inadvertently helped the Xuanhuang Realm to linger on. Thus, the residual Heavenly Dao consciousness of the Xuanhuang Realm has found him!”

“Seeking death!” Killing intent surged within the Heavenly Physician. The Heavenly Law Realm was his homeland, the repository of his and many of his loved ones' pasts. He would never allow anyone to covet or desecrate it!

“Heavenly Law is the eternal Dao, condense!” The Heavenly Physician wasted no more time, launching his strongest killing move. Within the Heavenly Law Realm, the wind ceased and the rain stopped; all things, even the flow of heaven and earth, fell into a state of stillness. As Longevity realm cultivators, who were one with the principles of heaven and earth, were not exempt!

The Heavenly Physician appeared behind the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion and slowly placed his hand on his head. In a sudden burst of dark light, the subdued Heavenly Demon was infused into him! The Heavenly Venerate’s face, just like the Heavenly Physician’s earlier, began to flash with countless faces, wildly shifting and changing.

It seemed that stopping the operation of the entire Heavenly Law Realm’s eternal Dao was an extremely taxing endeavor even for the Heavenly Physician. After successfully implanting a portion of the Heavenly Demon into the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion, the Heavenly Physician immediately restored the world to its normal operation. In just this moment, the Heavenly Physician’s hair turned even whiter, and a hint of turbidity gradually crept into his eyes.

The Heavenly Physician was a Great Venerable of the Myriad Laws in the Heavenly Law Realm, and the anomalies within him were reflected in the Heavenly Law Realm. Scorched earth stretched for a thousand miles, glaciers melted, and countless living beings withered and died. It seemed as if the entire world had suffered a severe blow from the momentary “pause.”

Yet, observing the formerly ferocious Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion, his constantly shifting faces finally calmed. Towards the Heavenly Physician, his attacker, he showed no hatred, even nodding in greeting. The Heavenly Physician finally exhaled a long sigh of relief. Due to the return of the Heavenly Demon’s Dao and the nourishment from the newly added world fragments, the Heavenly Law Realm’s lost vitality was quickly replenished. No one in the Heavenly Law Realm noticed that the Heavenly Physician had successfully possessed the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion using the Heavenly Demon. For the sake of prudence, the Heavenly Physician inserted eighty-one golden needles into the body of the Heavenly Venerate of Reverse Fusion, completely severing any possibility of the Heavenly Venerate’s original consciousness awakening or the Heavenly Demon losing control.

“One can be two, and two can be more.” Over the next thirty years, the Heavenly Physician used this method to firmly control all Longevity realm cultivators in the Heavenly Law Realm, except for the Heavenly Venerate of One Heart. As for the Heavenly Venerate of One Heart, Zhao Ruoxi, her countless manifestations and her body spread throughout various parts of the Heavenly Law Realm, making her difficult to possess and not posing an immediate threat, so the Heavenly Physician left her for later.

After integrating the Heavenly Law Realm into his dominion, the Heavenly Physician could finally devote himself entirely to his plan to save the Heavenly Law Realm. Time flowed, and a hundred years passed in the blink of an eye. The Heavenly Law Realm had consumed nearly a hundred carefully selected world fragments, its overall size more than doubling. The continuous influx of vitality allowed it to completely digest the Xuanhuang Realm. There were no longer any hidden dangers in the entire world. The Heavenly Physician’s strength also soared. He vaguely felt he was touching the limit that this starry sky could bear, possibly advancing further at any moment, yet there was no path forward. This crucial step, he could not seem to take. Even with the Heavenly Physician’s temperament, he couldn’t help but feel a hint of vexation and despair.

“Is this what they call the Supreme Realm?” The Heavenly Physician remained silent for a long time. After a while, he sneered. “Supreme…” “Alas, it is merely self-consolation from those who cannot achieve true immortality!” “There is no path to tread, no path to tread…” Feeling this constraint, utterly bound by some grand Dao law, the Heavenly Physician’s mind suddenly recalled his experiences comprehending the The Great Barrier over the years. “There seems to be some similarity between these two.” “Yet, there are fundamental differences.”

Thinking this, the Heavenly Physician’s perspective rapidly ascended. The vast Heavenly Law Realm became like a toy in his palm. The Great Barrier at the edge of the star sea was also within his sight, no longer appearing so distant. The Heavenly Physician took a step, and his form vanished from its original place. When he reappeared, he had already traveled a considerable distance within the miniature landscape of the Abyssal Sea of Darkness! This technique of “shrinking the ground to an inch” was one of the Heavenly Physician’s insights over the past century. Constantly traversing the star sea, accompanied by the The Great Barrier and the power of the Immortal Ruins, his cultivation had not changed significantly, but his strength had grown to an incredible degree. What originally took over a year to cross the star sea now took less than two days. Moreover, the Heavenly Physician had a premonition that his speed could continuously increase as his comprehension of the “momentum” of the star sea deepened. Perhaps in the future, he could traverse the star sea in the blink of an eye!

Arriving at the The Great Barrier, the Heavenly Physician expertly shot out thousands of golden threads. Like mercury flowing to the ground, they attempted to contact and sense the formless The Great Barrier. This was no longer the first time the Heavenly Physician had done this over the years. Even though he had gained nothing, he continued this seemingly futile endeavor. Because the Heavenly Physician had a vague premonition that he would definitely discover something within this The Great Barrier!

As if in response to his continuous waiting, one day, the thousands of lines, sweeping like a golden waterfall, suddenly stopped! The Heavenly Physician’s body trembled slightly. His eyes, which had become completely turbid, suddenly erupted with a sharp brilliance. It was as if an opening had appeared in the boundless sea. All the lines, like seawater, rushed in.

“What a pity, it's not a gap.” “Merely a flaw.” “There are even traces of artificiality…” The Heavenly Physician savored it, feeling a sense of regret. “Perhaps it was caused by some powerful cultivator in the star sea in ancient times.” As his senses deepened, the Heavenly Physician’s distracting thoughts vanished. He focused all his attention on comprehending this flaw in the The Great Barrier. If his explorations of the The Great Barrier over the past hundred years had always prevented him from seeing its true face, then now, through this flaw, the Heavenly Physician could finally glimpse the true The Great Barrier!

Creak, creak… For some unknown reason, tears uncontrollably streamed from the Heavenly Physician’s eyes. His body, that of a Supreme realm cultivator, could not withstand the pressure of the unknown force, and his body gradually hunched over. In the distant reaches of the star sea, the Heavenly Law Realm emitted bursts of thunder. The sky seemed to be sliced open by an invisible blade, with cracks scarring its expanse.

At this critical juncture, between continuing his Dao comprehension and the life-or-death of the Heavenly Law Realm, the Heavenly Physician chose the latter. His figure retreated explosively, instinctively breaking free from the state of Dao comprehension. The anomalies in the Heavenly Law Realm vanished instantly. The Heavenly Physician touched the tear tracks on his face, a hint of bewilderment flashing in his eyes. He discovered with horror that everything he had seen and comprehended just now began to dissipate as he broke contact with the The Great Barrier. Furthermore, a surge of intuition told him that to retain this memory, he had to connect with the The Great Barrier again before the physical sensations completely faded, to continue imprinting it.

“But the Heavenly Law Realm can no longer withstand it, it has reached its limit…” A rare hint of hesitation and struggle appeared in the Heavenly Physician’s eyes. Finally… The Heavenly Physician let out a long sigh. He did not step forward, allowing the feeling of Dao comprehension to completely fade.

*Puff!* Going against his own desire for the Dao, the Heavenly Physician's soul suffered a severe injury, and he spat out a mouthful of blood. He continuously inserted golden needles into crucial acupoints on his body. To his surprise, the injury originating from his divine soul could not be suppressed. He spat out several more mouthfuls of blood. “A physician cannot cure himself…” He stood in the void for nearly half a month before fully recovering. Somewhat unwillingly, he wished to explore the flaw in the The Great Barrier again, but ultimately, “a lost opportunity is a lost forever.” It was no different from observing an ordinary The Great Barrier.

The Heavenly Physician stood there blankly, feeling a profound sense of loss. He knew that he had forever missed the secret of the The Great Barrier. However, the Heavenly Physician was, after all, the Heavenly Physician. After another ten-odd days, he managed to rally his spirits.

“My desire to prove myself as a True Immortal was merely to save the Heavenly Law Realm. If I were to let the Heavenly Law Realm be destroyed for the sake of the Dao, it would not be my wish.” “Moreover…” “Though I cannot glimpse the secret of the The Great Barrier, I can grasp its power.” With a thought from the Heavenly Physician, thousands of golden threads wove into a long wall before him. However, the moment it took shape, all the golden threads collapsed, scattering into countless golden lights!

“The flaw in the The Great Barrier has left a mark upon me. From now on, the The Great Barrier will no longer be invisible to my eyes.” A flash of enlightenment dawned upon the Heavenly Physician. “Perhaps…” “I can build a The Great Barrier outside the Heavenly Law Realm to isolate it from the suction of the Immortal Ruins.” After comprehending the Dao beneath the The Great Barrier, the Heavenly Physician’s strength advanced further. Over the next hundred years, by weaving countless golden threads, he managed to encase the Heavenly Law Realm like a silkworm cocoon and slowly drag it out from the edge of the Immortal Ruins!

Seeing that the Heavenly Law Realm was truly escaping, this act of snatching food from a tiger’s jaws attracted the attention of that True Immortal who comprehended the Dao in the Immortal Ruins. A towering figure suddenly appeared above the Heavenly Law Realm. Looking at the Heavenly Physician blocking his path, and the tightly wrapped golden cocoon, his expression was indifferent. The pressure emanating from a True Immortal caused the Heavenly Law Realm, even within its cocoon, to tremble violently, its mountains and rivers collapsing. Yet, when facing this True Immortal before him… The Heavenly Physician, for some unknown reason, felt no fear. Instead, a hint of doubt arose.

“This…” “Is this a True Immortal?” The True Immortal’s spectral image slowly extended its hand. Infinite suction poured forth. The entire Abyssal Sea of Darkness, at this moment, was drawn towards the True Immortal's palm, even light itself. However, it was as if a wooden stake was firmly pinning the Heavenly Physician in place, unmoving. The Heavenly Physician, pulling the Heavenly Law Realm, was like a kite dancing in a strong wind, fluttering continuously but never breaking free. The doubt in the Heavenly Physician’s eyes grew. Standing within the True Immortal’s might, he did not resist. Then, as if thinking of something, he slowly closed his eyes.

Outside the Great Formation of Azure Nether Beings, watching the rapidly operating formation on the verge of collapse, Li Fan sighed faintly. The Heavenly Physician’s abilities were indeed extraordinary. Furthermore, the downgraded Immortal Formation was not a true Immortal Formation. Moreover, even a complete Immortal Formation might not be able to simulate the true might of a True Immortal from the Immortal Ruins. It was within expectations that the Heavenly Physician would discover its flaw. “It matters not, enough secrets have been revealed.”

Chapter 1367

"Supreme Realm..."

"Is this the realm that the Heavenly Physician now claims?"

Li Fan’s thoughts raced. He immediately set up more formations around the Heavenly Physician to delay him, and simultaneously looked towards Mo Rubu, who was not far away.

Just like the Heavenly Physician’s performance when he touched the towering wall within the Azure Nether Myriad Beings Great Formation, Mo Rubu seemed to truly witness scenes beyond the The Great Barrier, as if he had attained enlightenment and tears streamed down his face.

Fortunately, Mo Rubu was gradually emerging from his enlightened state, his eyes regaining clarity.

"Let's go!"

Several golden threads flew from Li Fan’s hand, instantly soaring and tightly entwining Mo Rubu.

How similar this was to the divine ability the Heavenly Physician had used within the immortal formation!

Pulling Mo Rubu to his side, the phantom of his wooden sword was unsheathed.

Moments later, the two of them had left the range of the Heavenly Physician’s perception.

Mo Rubu still seemed to be immersed in the lingering aftereffects of his enlightenment, appearing dazed.

Li Fan did not disturb him for the moment. He continued to travel towards the Xuanhuang Realm while organizing the gains he had made from trapping the Heavenly Physician with the Azure Nether Myriad Beings Great Formation.

As the creator of this unparalleled immortal formation, Li Fan had done far more than merely observe.

The Bewildering Flowers, Azure Nether Myriad Beings Great Formation was as real as it was illusory. Its foundation was an immortal-grade formation, further infused with a trace of Li Fan’s profound meaning of "True and False Transformation." It was less like everything within the great formation was merely an illusion experienced by the Heavenly Physician, and more like history had truly presented a possibility where the Heavenly Law Realm defeated the Xuanhuang Realm.

However, this possibility only existed as long as the immortal formation was maintained.

Once the immortal formation was deciphered by the Heavenly Physician, everything would be annihilated.

All living beings within the great formation, except for the Heavenly Physician, had a trace of Li Fan’s will integrated into them.

Su Bai, Ni Rong, and the others.

Even the so-called Heavenly Law Realm, Heavenly Demons, and the towering wall were all composed of Li Fan’s mixed intentions.

Therefore, Li Fan could keenly feel the Heavenly Physician’s various methods from an extremely close distance.

Even the Heavenly Physician’s thoughts and emotional fluctuations could be sensed by Li Fan.

This was the terrifying aspect of immortal formations!

One must remember that the Heavenly Physician had once taught Li Fan the Heavenly Physician Immortal Scripture and the Book of Heaven Mending, and could be considered Li Fan's semi-teacher.

Li Fan was intimately familiar with all the Heavenly Physician’s experiences.

With the theoretical foundations and the manifestation of divine abilities all analyzed, replicating them…

For Li Fan now, it was not difficult!

Moreover, after integrating the transcendent "True and False Transformation," the myriad golden needles wielded by Li Fan even possessed a flavor of “surpassing the master through his disciple.”

As he watched, the myriad golden threads entangled with Mo Rubu’s body seemed to gradually disappear.

In reality, they had already been subtly implanted within Mo Rubu’s body.

However, they were currently in a state of “falsehood,” hidden away, serving as a contingency.

Not only was Mo Rubu unaware of this, but it was likely that no one in the entire Abyssal Sea could detect Li Fan’s seemingly insignificant, yet extraordinarily profound, method.

When Li Fan needed it, the "Falsehood into Truth" transformation would be suddenly activated, and the myriad golden threads would shift from虚to实, instantly exploding within Mo Rubu’s body.

"These golden threads, their external form appears as golden threads, but in reality, they are all insights into the principles of heaven and earth, and the principles of the Great Dao."

"Although my current strength is still slightly inferior to the Heavenly Physician's, in terms of insight into these aspects, I am definitely not beneath him!"

In addition to this divine ability of golden threads, Li Fan also learned the Heavenly Physician’s method for sealing Heavenly Demons.

The ninety-nine golden needles, though different in technique from the Soul Sealing World Replacement that the Heavenly Physician had used in his previous life, originated from the same source.

Li Fan had managed to learn about eighty to ninety percent of it.

With a little more contemplation, deciphering it would not be difficult.

Beyond these two aspects, the Heavenly Physician’s actions as a Great Venerable of All Laws to save the Heavenly Law Realm also greatly inspired Li Fan.

Especially his final move, condensing the eternal Dao of all laws and freezing the power of the world’s operation.

This even gave Li Fan a vague idea about the Heavenly and Earthly Essence, which was about to reach the Dao Integration realm in this world.

"The Heavenly Physician is truly an inexhaustible treasure trove. It's a pity that the same immortal formation likely cannot trap him again."

"I can wait for the next life and repeat the same trick."

"Using the Azure Nether Myriad Beings as eyes, I will thoroughly drain all the knowledge and foundation the Heavenly Physician gained from the formation!"

...

As they neared the Xuanhuang Realm, Mo Rubu finally regained full consciousness.

He was initially stunned for a moment, and upon realizing his current predicament, he immediately intended to return to the towering wall.

Li Fan frowned slightly and locked him with his myriad golden threads.

Mo Rubu instinctively tried to break free but failed. His expression changed. He had not expected Li Fan to have such a trump card hidden.

"Brother Mo, calm down."

"You have already gained enlightenment from the towering wall twice. If you still cannot escape its temptation, you may never escape in this lifetime and be forever lost in it!"

Li Fan’s utterly cold words finally brought Mo Rubu to his senses.

His struggling movements slowly came to a halt.

However, Li Fan did not retract the golden thread restraints.

"Is the feeling of 'one loss, forever lost' still with you?" Li Fan asked sternly.

With Li Fan's comprehension, he still had not gained anything from the "flaw" of that towering wall. His current statement was entirely based on the Heavenly Physician's insights into the flaw of the towering wall within the immortal formation.

Mo Rubu's expression was somewhat subtle. "One loss, forever lost. That phrase is truly apt."

He cupped his hands, expressing his gratitude to Li Fan for blocking the enemy earlier, and then sighed, "Thanks to Fellow Daoist, I was able to fully glimpse the secret of the towering wall's flaw."

"However, everything I understood..."

Mo Rubu paused for a long time before slowly speaking, "...is not something that I, at this moment, can comprehend."

"Hmm?" Li Fan raised his eyebrows.

"I know it sounds convoluted and even unbelievable, but that is the reality."

"That is an insight that does not exist within the Abyssal Sea. Only by using the towering wall as a medium can we know and perceive it."

"And once we leave the towering wall, even if I have 'remembered' and 'understood,' I will ultimately be unable to manifest this non-existent thing..." Mo Rubu's expression was somewhat dazed as he painstakingly explained his experience to Li Fan, word by word.

Li Fan could somewhat understand Mo Rubu's statement.

It was as if Li Fan were trying to explain "True and False Transformation" to Mo Rubu. Without the Reflection present, Mo Rubu would never be able to touch upon or comprehend it in the slightest.

He would only consider Li Fan to be a lying charlatan.

Because, to Mo Rubu, the so-called "True and False Transformation" simply did not exist.

"Touching the towering wall allows me to recall this insight. But once I leave the towering wall, all the insights are lost..."

"Isn't this like the moon in the mirror or flowers in the water? Utterly useless. It's even worse than those, at least you can still see the flowers and the moon." Li Fan deliberately sounded very disappointed.

Mo Rubu pondered for a moment, then shook his head slightly, "That's not entirely true. Even if I cannot memorize the insight, these two occasions of enlightenment have allowed the form of the towering wall's existence to be transformed into something I can understand."

As he spoke, Mo Rubu lightly tapped his index finger, drawing a circle in the air before Li Fan.

Enveloping Li Fan within it.

In Li Fan’s vision, Mo Rubu suddenly disappeared.

Even the entire Abyssal Sea vanished from his observational range.

Furthermore, his divine sense and the golden needle contact he had left behind also failed!

It was as if a towering wall had been erected around him, completely encircling him and obscuring his sight and senses.

"This is somewhat interesting."

"A miniature towering wall."

However, Mo Rubu's wall was clearly incomparable to the towering wall that had surrounded the Abyssal Sea.

He hadn't even used the Nine Heavens Descending Finger.

With just a slight elevation, Li Fan casually stepped over this obstacle.

Mo Rubu remained in his original position, not surprised at Li Fan’s quick escape.

"My enlightenment is still somewhat insufficient."

"If I were given more time, I'm afraid it wouldn't be so easy for you, Fellow Daoist, to escape," Mo Rubu said slowly.

Li Fan frowned, "Brother Mo, your divine ability seems to be missing a crucial element compared to that formless towering wall..."

"It is precisely this missing piece that greatly diminishes the power of the divine ability. If this can be deciphered, perhaps one could truly 'draw a cage for oneself' at will!"

Upon hearing this, a flicker of unwillingness and longing flashed in Mo Rubu’s eyes.

His emotions being so easily stirred up was something almost impossible for Mo Rubu, who cultivated the Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique. The current occurrence could only mean that the secret of the towering wall's flaw had thoroughly shaken the foundation of his mental state.

"I have the Reflection, so I don't need to worry about its 'one loss, forever lost' characteristic. However, despite the unknown, I still haven't gained any insights from it. Is the gap in comprehension truly so vast? It seems I'll have to return again later to continue using the beings in the pocket world to help me comprehend the Dao. Although there may not be much time left in this life," Li Fan mused inwardly.

Next, Li Fan inquired about Mo Rubu’s future plans.

"Are you going to search the remaining areas of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation for the whereabouts of Heavenly Mysteries King?"

"During the time you were comprehending the towering wall, I searched the Xuanhuang Realm again. Unlike the Eye of the Tian Beast and the Spirit Gathering Ascension Formation, other parts of the Sky Crossing Starry Sea Formation might be severely damaged. They do not possess the conditions for Heavenly Mysteries King to hide..." Li Fan said slowly.

Mo Rubu looked at the Xuanhuang Realm not far away.

As Heavenly Mysteries King was mentioned again, the wavering expression on his face gradually faded, returning to that of the inscrutable Heavenly Mysteries Sect's Twelve Law Kings.

Perhaps it was due to Li Fan's selfless obstruction earlier that his trust was reinforced.

Mo Rubu hesitated for a moment and slowly said, "I still want to go to one last place."

"However, after ten thousand years, the Xuanhuang Realm has undergone earth-shattering changes. It’s difficult to distinguish at the moment..."

"That's easy to handle."

In an instant, a comparative diagram of the Xuanhuang Realm's past and present appeared before Mo Rubu.

"Here."

Mo Rubu carefully identified the location for a while and finally chose a spot.

Li Fan's expression suddenly became somewhat subtle.

"What's wrong?" Mo Rubu, being perceptive, immediately noticed the change on Li Fan's face.

Li Fan shook his head slightly. "You'll know when you go."

With a flash and dimming of his wooden sword phantom, Li Fan brought Mo Rubu to their destination.

It was precisely the small mountain and Taoist temple where the Fishing Pond was located!

In this life, Li Fan had not utilized the Fishing Pond.

He had only forcibly relocated the divine ability of the bell and the Dao page Liu Li from within the temple.

"This place was once Brother Xuanyuan's hometown."

"It was also his final place of ascension."

"I didn't expect it to become so desolate now."

Mo Rubu slowly walked into the Taoist temple, observing meticulously while sighing.

"It's actually the last place of ascension in the Xuanhuang Realm?" Li Fan was slightly surprised.

"Yes. Brother Xuanyuan was exceptionally fond of this place back then. Whenever I couldn't find him, I could always find him here. I don't know what wonders this place holds or what he experienced here." Mo Rubu walked slowly, seemingly searching for Heavenly Mysteries King's aura.

He walked all the way to the backyard of the Taoist temple.

Upon seeing the utterly ordinary small pond, Mo Rubu's pupils contracted sharply.

Then he rushed forward.

"This..."

"After ten thousand years, there's not the slightest change here?!" Mo Rubu was shocked, having keenly sensed the extraordinariness of this place.

"Your expression just now was strange. Were you referring to this place?"

Mo Rubu suddenly turned his head and asked.

Li Fan nodded slightly. "I couldn't destroy this small pond, which made me realize the peculiarity of this place."

"However, I searched many times but could never find anything strange about it..."

Upon hearing this, Mo Rubu looked at the Fishing Pond again.

"The surrounding mountains and rivers have all changed drastically, yet only this pond water remains the same. It must hide something..."

"Strange, but Brother Xuanyuan never mentioned any secrets here back then."

Grabbing the only clue, Mo Rubu was unwilling to let it go.

He tried various methods, even personally diving into the water.

But in the end, he found nothing.

It was as if this were truly just a simple, ordinary small pond.

The secret was right before his eyes, yet he could not discern it.
