Mo Rubu's expression was inevitably somewhat gloomy.

"This is the hometown of Heavenly Mysteries King? What kind of person was Heavenly Mysteries King before his ascension?" Li Fan asked opportunistically.

"The first half of Brother Xuanyuan's life was truly ordinary. So ordinary that I had passed by him before without even looking down at him."

"After all, I was a direct disciple of the Nine Refinements Observation, while he was merely a mere Qi Refining cultivator."

"However, no one knew the peerless talent hidden beneath Brother Xuanyuan's ordinary appearance. He rose to prominence one day, relying not on sect resources, but solely on himself, to become the first and last person to ascend in the Xuanhuang Realm at that time..."

Mo Rubu’s expression was filled with immense nostalgia.

And as Li Fan listened to these words, he fell into deep contemplation.

Li Fan was naturally aware of the Fishing Pond's existence.

But he had no idea when the Fishing Pond had appeared in the Xuanhuang Realm.

After all, the Fishing Pond was faintly a creation of the Nameless True Immortal, completely transcendent of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Even the stone slabs that recorded the history of the Xuanhuang Realm contained no information about the Fishing Pond.

All along, Li Fan had subconsciously believed that the Fishing Pond had suddenly appeared in the Xuanhuang Realm after the calamity of the Star Sea descended and all realms were destroyed.

But now it seemed…

"Is it possible that Heavenly Mysteries Sect's Law King Xuanyuan Hong's sudden rise to prominence was due to this supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond?"

A thought couldn't help but surface in Li Fan's mind.

Chapter 1368

The ultimate trump card of the Heavenly Mysteries King was actually a fishing pond?

This was not impossible.

After all, the Heavenly Mysteries King had no foundation, yet he was able to suppress the prodigies of the same era alone and ascend first...

This truly could not be simply described by the phrase "extraordinary talent."

But if this guess were true...

Li Fan's mind conjured the image of the Stone Slab, which had sought to comprehend the Dao of Fishing but was instead fished away, and Cat Treasure, which appeared from the fishing pond and, while seemingly harmless, could devour True Immortals.

"Could it be that the Heavenly Mysteries King's fate was similar?"

Li Fan looked at the shallow pool before him, his apprehension rising to an unprecedented level.

The scene then fell into a long silence.

It was not that Mo Rubbin was slow-witted, but without any hints, simply connecting this pond to the Dao of Fishing was truly difficult.

Although he had not discovered the mystery of the fishing pond, Mo Rubbin regarded it as his last hope and had no intention of leaving anytime soon.

"Staying here forever is not a solution."

"Actually, I have another method that might help us find the Heavenly Mysteries King's whereabouts," Li Fan suddenly broke the silence after a long pause.

Mo Rubbin's head snapped up.

Li Fan pondered for a moment and carefully said, "I have mastered part of the power of the True Immortal Script character 'Manifest.' The 'Manifest' character can materialize and reveal even the slightest connections between things."

"Well, from the residual memories of Dharma King Ji, I learned of the existence of the Azure Nether Orb..."

As Li Fan spoke, he observed Mo Rubbin's reaction.

Upon mentioning the Azure Nether Orb, Mo Rubbin's pupils indeed constricted, and his aura changed drastically, causing him to instinctively become defensive.

However, perhaps due to their shared experiences, a sufficient amount of trust had been built between them.

A moment later, Mo Rubbin's wariness vanished on its own.

Only then did Li Fan continue, "If the memories I obtained are correct, the cultivation techniques practiced by the twelve Dharma Kings were all connected to that Azure Nether Orb in some mysterious way."

"Perhaps we can use the 'Manifest' character to trace the Heavenly Mysteries King's whereabouts through this connection."

"This method, after all, involves facing the power of the True Immortal Script directly, and there will certainly be some risks. Moreover, it will only track the Azure Nether Orb, a supreme treasure of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, not the Heavenly Mysteries King himself. To avoid any suspicion from Brother Mo, I did not bring it up earlier."

Li Fan looked at Mo Rubbin, leaving the choice to him.

Mo Rubbin did not answer directly but suddenly asked a seemingly unrelated question: "Fellow Daoist, who do you think was the powerful individual who set up the golden thread at the breach of the The Great Barrier?"

Li Fan did not conceal anything but truthfully replied, "When I trapped him with a formation, I took the opportunity to glimpse his identity. He should be a Venerable from the Heavenly Law Realm, which has merged with the Xuanhuang Realm."

He extended his hand and transmitted information regarding the Heavenly Physician to Mo Rubbin.

"Heavenly Law upholds the Dao, acting on behalf of the heavens?"

"And how can it compare to the unity of heaven and man achieved by our cultivators? Even if they replace heaven..."

"They are merely unenlightened and common. Although this person is currently powerful, it is likely only due to the accumulation of these ten thousand years."

Mo Rubbin shook his head, his tone filled with disdain.

However, he then looked back at the fishing pond and still did not answer.

Only after standing by the pond for a full seven days without deciphering its mystery did Mo Rubbin finally shake his head slightly and say with great solemnity, "We can try."

"The power of the True Immortal Script is extraordinary, and I have no confidence that I can fully control the strength. Moreover..."

"If it truly points to this pool of water, an entity capable of swallowing someone like the Heavenly Mysteries King must be lurking within. We must be cautious!"

"The safety of the Xuanhuang Realm now rests on our shoulders; we cannot be careless," Li Fan reminded him.

Mo Rubbin acknowledged Li Fan's point.

After making thorough preparations by the pond of the dilapidated mountain temple, he finally initiated the test of the 'Manifest' character.

"When Brother Xuanyuan passed down his techniques to me, he mentioned that the immortal arts practiced by the majority of us twelve Dharma Kings originated from True Immortals who ascended from the 'Divine Witch Realm.'"

"The cultivators of this realm resonate with the Great Dao with their souls, manipulate the Great Dao, and replace the Great Dao. Although their cultivation methods and outward appearances are somewhat strange, they are the immortal arts that most easily lead directly to the Great Dao. It is said that this Divine Witch Realm is one of the most ancient cultivation realms and might even be the origin of human cultivators."

"The Divine Witch people are almost indistinguishable from us ordinary humans. Their innate talent is simply much higher, and the difficulty for them to resonate with the Great Dao with their souls is far less than ours."

"It took me considerable effort to master the 'Myriad Calamities Unyielding Demonic Heart Immortal Technique.' But according to Brother Xuanyuan, the Divine Witch people cultivate it effortlessly."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed slightly as he listened to Mo Rubbin's description.

Mo Rubbin, however, suddenly changed the subject: "But even these powerful True Immortals of the Divine Witch tribe were no different from ants when the Dao Erasure Tribulation arrived. Their bodies rained down, and they even died tragically while fleeing in panic..."

"True Immortals are nothing to fear! Come on!"

Mo Rubbin let out a low roar, and countless ink hearts surged madly from his body.

They spun and howled around him, like a terrifying storm.

Li Fan glanced at the immortal formation and the phantom sword beside him, ensuring that he could escape immediately if anything unexpected happened.

Then, he looked at the 400% charging progress on the Reflection panel.

With a sense of security, he drew a character 'Manifest' in the air and sent it directly towards Mo Rubbin.

Mo Rubbin did not resist, allowing the power of the 'Manifest' character to envelop his body.

Streams of azure mist rose from the countless ink hearts.

They first shot straight upwards, and after seemingly touching the limits of the sky, they began to swirl and circle.

As if searching for a target.

Mo Rubbin's face contorted as an invisible force seemed to rub back and forth against him.

"Brother Mo, hold on," Li Fan said in a deep voice, injecting several golden threads into Mo Rubbin's body.

Since this was something they had agreed upon beforehand, it did not provoke any resistance from Mo Rubbin.

Pure Spirit Qi and even soul power continuously flowed into him through the golden threads, helping him maintain his state under the pressure of the True Immortal Script.

The countless azure mists above Mo Rubbin's head gradually merged into one.

Then, as if its target had finally been found, the azure mist stirred, as if it had come alive.

Like an azure dragon soaring through the heavens, it descended sharply.

Its flight path indicated that it was heading towards the fishing pond!

"It's actually like this?" Li Fan's heart sank heavily, and he subconsciously moved further away from the pond.

However, what happened next was somewhat beyond his expectations.

The thick azure dragon, just as it was about to fly into the fishing pond, inexplicably paused for a moment.

Then it split into two streams.

One stream plunged into the fishing pond.

The other stream soared back into the sky, heading outside the Xuanhuang Realm!

"This?"

The sudden turn of events left both of them in a state of bewilderment.

Mo Rubbin reacted quickly, following the first stream of azure mist into the fishing pond. But as the mist entered the water, it vanished without a trace.

Mo Rubbin could not find any trace of the Azure Nether Orb in the bottomless pond.

He couldn't help but feel a sense of dejection.

Li Fan, on the other hand, tilted his head back and gazed at the spot where the other stream of azure mist had disappeared.

"What do you think, Brother Mo? Could it be that the Azure Nether Orb has split in two?" Li Fan asked, frowning.

"Judging by the 'Manifest' character's reaction, perhaps so. But what if the 'Manifest' character not only points to the connection with the Azure Nether Orb but also to Brother Xuanyuan simultaneously?"

"Since we can't gain anything from this pool for now, let's go and investigate the place where the other stream of azure mist headed." After a moment of silence, Mo Rubbin suddenly had an idea.

This aligned perfectly with Li Fan's wishes.

Without sufficient self-preservation abilities, Li Fan truly did not want his main body to interact with the fishing pond.

The previous appearance of a wondrous item like Cat Treasure from the fishing pond was a prime example. Now that it was confirmed that the Heavenly Mysteries King's disappearance was related to the fishing pond, Li Fan was even more cautious.

The phantom sword carried the two of them as they tracked the azure mist.

Although the azure mist's source was fast, it was still slower than Li Fan's supreme escaping technique.

Before long, they caught up to the azure mist and had to wait behind it.

Mo Rubbin's expression was not good, so Li Fan changed the subject.

"Besides the Divine Witch Realm, has the Heavenly Mysteries King ever mentioned any other anecdotes about the Immortal Realm?"

"To be honest, even though the immortal path has been broken for ten thousand years, we cultivators still cannot stop our yearning and curiosity for the legendary 'Immortal Realm'."

Li Fan's words drew Mo Rubbin back to the past.

"Perhaps he had truly been to the Immortal Realm before, or perhaps Brother Xuanyuan heard it from the Faceless Immortal. In any case, Brother Xuanyuan often discussed matters concerning the Immortal Realm. We could all see that he was quite concerned about completing only half of the ascension process and being forced to return from the Immortal Realm midway."

Mo Rubbin chuckled softly.

"It is said that the Immortal Realm is a beautiful sacred land with infinite resources. After ascending to immortality, one would no longer need to worry about the resources required for cultivation. How many resources one could gather would depend entirely on one's personal strength and luck."

"However, Big Brother did not elaborate on what these so-called resources were. I suspect they are not as simple as immortal Spirit Qi."

"Oh, and one more thing. Have you ever heard of the Ascension Lightning Tribulation?" Mo Rubbin asked, his expression shifting.

"The Ascension Lightning Tribulation? I have indeed heard of it. In the past, when the immortal path was not broken, ancient cultivators were said to be able to ascend to immortality only after passing the test of the lightning tribulation." Li Fan replied quickly.

Mo Rubbin's expression became somewhat peculiar: "At that time, I was only one step away from ascending. But after Brother Xuanyuan returned, ascension became a phantom. In fact, I have always been troubled by this, constantly regretting the missed opportunity."

"However, in private, when we were alone, Brother Xuanyuan once comforted me. He said that the reason he was able to pass the tribulation and ascend was because the True Immortal presiding over the lightning tribulation at the other end of the Immortal Realm passage suddenly died from the Dao Erasure Tribulation..."

"According to the originally estimated strength of the lightning tribulation, Brother Xuanyuan would not have been able to pass it. In fact, that lightning tribulation never intended to let any cultivator pass!"

Li Fan was astonished at this revelation.

"So Brother Xuanyuan told me not to be too fixated. If my cultivation had been any faster, perhaps my fate would not have been to ascend to immortality, but to turn into ashes under the heavenly lightning," Mo Rubbin said, his tone melancholic.

"Of course, I'm not sure if this is true or just something Brother Xuanyuan said to comfort me. But out of trust for Brother Xuanyuan, I take his words as they are."

"Hehehe..."

Li Fan remained silent.

Some of the favorable impression he had of the Heavenly Mysteries King was shattered.

In the silence, the azure mist from the 'Manifest' character finally reached its destination.

It was still beneath the The Great Barrier.

However, this time, it did not touch the The Great Barrier.

Instead, it suddenly disappeared in an inconspicuous corner beneath the The Great Barrier.

Li Fan's heart stirred, and he recognized the location where the azure mist had vanished.

It was one of the nodes beneath the The Great Barrier that led into the fissure depression!

"Let's go!" Mo Rubbin's expression became animated, and he followed it down.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before also following.

The same experience as before replayed, and their 'momentum' dropped sharply.

Soon, they arrived at the lowest point of the star sea.

This place was filled with dormant energy, leaving Mo Rubbin, who had just arrived, stunned.

But he did not forget the purpose of their journey.

Closely following the azure mist, they rapidly plunged forward into the winding fissures.

Li Fan had known before that the depressions and gullies filled with energy throughout the star sea formed a vast labyrinth, and venturing in rashly could lead to getting lost.

But now, with the azure mist leading the way, and more importantly, the potential involvement of the Heavenly Mysteries King and the Azure Nether Orb, Li Fan did not hesitate to follow and explore.

It took dozens of times longer than traversing the star sea for the azure mist to finally stop.

Li Fan looked at the place where the 'Manifest' character's connection had disappeared, feeling surprised.

A complete, small, azure orb was quietly floating there.

Upon seeing this Azure Nether Orb, Li Fan finally understood the true meaning of the character "Azure" in "Azure Nether Orb."

Mo Rubbin's body trembled as he looked at the Azure Nether Orb.

At the same time, a look of confusion appeared in his eyes.

He didn't understand why the immortal artifact that Brother Xuanyuan relied on was left here alone.

"Something seems wrong."

"Why does this Azure Nether Orb seem to have lost all its spiritual essence?"

Having seen many incomplete immortal artifacts before, Li Fan keenly sensed the anomaly with the Azure Nether Orb.

With this reminder, Mo Rubbin also reacted.

He stepped forward, attempting to touch it.

However, the moment Mo Rubbin approached, the Azure Nether Orb dissolved into wisps of azure mist.

It shattered and vanished without a trace.

"No!"

All their efforts had ultimately amounted to nothing. Even with Mo Rubbin's composure, he momentarily lost control.

He tried to grasp the disappearing azure wisps to restore the Azure Nether Orb.

Li Fan, however, did not engage in such futile efforts.

Instead, he said thoughtfully, "The aura of this Azure Nether Orb seems somewhat similar to the fissures and gullies in the Abyssal Sea..."

"Similar?"

"I was astonished before that the energy accumulated in the fissures was abnormally high."

"Now it seems it might be related to the Azure Nether Orb."

Chapter 1369: An Eternal Obsession is Raised

Li Fan subtly surveyed his surroundings.

After the Azure Nether Orb shattered and dissipated, it felt as if an invisible, colossal stone had fallen into the abyssal depression of the earth's fissure. From the endless, maze-like dark currents within the star sea's depression, threads of ripples spread outward. An inexplicable aura surged within them, bringing a mysterious vitality to the place. It seemed the complete dissipation of the Azure Nether Orb had activated something. Li Fan faintly sensed that this fissure depression had somehow changed.

"It appears that for ten thousand years, the Azure Nether Orb has been continuously releasing its energy to the outside world. It was already nearing its limit, about to be completely drained," Li Fan sighed. "Our arrival was merely the final push."

Mo Rubin also noticed this. The excited and slightly unrestrained expression he had moments ago gradually calmed down. He looked back at the entire fissure depression, and in a moment of clarity, he understood the purpose of this place: to accumulate vitality, await the opportune moment for a grand activation, and then guide the complete revival of the star sea.

"Such an intricate design could not have been naturally formed by the star sea. Not to mention the Azure Nether Orb serving as the catalyst for supplying vitality..." Mo Rubin's thoughts raced. "Could it be that Brother Xuanyuan arranged this? But when exactly?"

"The Azure Nether Orb, Brother Xuanyuan's most treasured possession, never left his side. How could it end up here... and Brother Xuanyuan disappeared into that mysterious pond?" Mo Rubin's expression betrayed his surprise and uncertainty.

"This matter is indeed quite peculiar," Li Fan concurred. "Either, on the day King Xuanyuan was attacked, he didn't disappear directly but fell into a deep slumber due to severe injuries. Only after waking up did he make arrangements for this fissure depression. Perhaps the water in that pool within the Xuanhuang Realm is connected to a fissure here."

"Or, King Xuanyuan entrusted the Azure Nether Orb to someone else before he was attacked. And for all these years, this person has been acting on his behalf, carrying out various plans related to the star sea's revival..."

"Impossible!" Mo Rubin interrupted Li Fan instinctively before he could finish.

Li Fan gazed at Mo Rubin meaningfully. "Brother Mo, could you tell me, among the Twelve Law Kings, whom did King Xuanyuan trust the most?"

"There's no need to speak of treating everyone equally. Favoritism is a principle of the Great Dao, something even saints cannot entirely avoid."

Mo Rubin’s face turned cold, and he hesitated, wanting to speak but holding back. Then, he directly closed his eyes, as if to conceal his inner turmoil. Finally, Mo Rubin did not evade the question. "I believe, if Brother Xuanyuan truly had someone he trusted most, it would have to be Xing Wuque."

"Xing Wuque..." Information about this Law King instantly surfaced in Li Fan's mind. His limbs were missing, his features were disfigured, and he always wore a bronze fang mask, rarely communicating with others.

"Within the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, aside from Brother Xuanyuan, no one knew Xing Wuque's true identity. Just as you said, there are distinctions in closeness. We, the Twelve Law Kings, also formed small factions based on our relationships."

"Sun Xingwang and Sikong Lin were often together, speaking in ways others couldn't understand; Gongye Tianzong and Tianxing Ke would often converse joyfully, clinking cups; Luo Yichen, Nie Daniang, and Ji Yuzhen, the three ladies, always had endless whispers..."

"Xing Wuque, however, always maintained a distance from the other Law Kings. He never actively communicated with anyone in the sect. When he appeared, he was always alone. But every task he was assigned, he never made a mistake and completed it with extreme efficiency," Mo Rubin recalled, a trace of reminiscence on his face. "He was like a machine that had shed its emotions and desires, no longer living for itself."

"Precisely because of this, Brother Xuanyuan might have trusted him the most."

"Moreover, when the incident occurred that day, Xing Wuque did not seem to be within the sect," Mo Rubin frowned.

Li Fan nodded slightly. "If it was indeed this Xing Wuque who took the Azure Nether Orb that year, then he must have been busy with King Xuanyuan's mission all these years. Brother Mo, do you have any way to contact Law King Xing?"

Mo Rubin shook his head. "Xing Wuque only ever had direct contact with Brother Xuanyuan. However..." As if recalling something, Mo Rubin looked back at the spot where the Azure Nether Orb had dissipated. "I wonder if the 'Manifest' Character Art can be used on the Azure Nether Orb again? We could definitely follow the trail..."

"The Azure Nether Orb is an immortal artifact; perhaps the True Immortal Script would be useless against it. Besides, it has already dissipated," Li Fan pointed to the surroundings, where the ripples were still undulating. "Dissipation does not mean complete disappearance. Even among King Xuanyuan's many treasures from the Immortal Realm, the Azure Nether Orb was among the most precious. It wouldn't be so easy for it to completely vanish."

"The Azure Nether Orb hasn't vanished; it has transformed into vitality in some special form and exists within these dark currents..." Mo Rubin stated with absolute certainty, regaining the demeanor of the Twelve Law Kings of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect. "Just directly use the 'Manifest' Character Art on this infinite vitality of the dark currents!"

Li Fan re-examined the boundless dark currents of the fissure, dimly understanding. Mustering his spirit, he solemnly inscribed the character 【Manifest】 in the air again. The moment this profound character took shape, it melted into the dark currents like ink. The undulating ripples, with their rhythmic pace, were quickly disrupted. It was as if another unrelated, entirely independent fluctuation had appeared. Li Fan and Mo Rubin followed the direction of the fluctuation's transmission, moving rapidly. They delved deeper into the fissure, making countless turns. It took over thirty days before they finally reached their destination.

"Be careful, it seems there's a fluctuation of a living person's aura ahead!" Mo Rubin suddenly transmitted.

Li Fan, already having his Wood Sword Phantasm shielding him, slowly approached. At the end of the dark river, a figure sat alone. Its aura was erratic, and it wore a fang mask!

"Xing Wuque?" Seeing the familiar appearance, Mo Rubin couldn't help but exclaim loudly.

However, after a moment of stunned silence, Li Fan felt a strange sensation. Xing Wuque had long lost his hands and feet, yet this figure possessed all four limbs. More importantly... the clothing this figure wore was extremely familiar to Li Fan. It was identical to Xu Ke, who had disappeared into the depths of the dark river earlier!

"Is it Xu Ke?"

"Or Xing Wuque?"

"No wonder his aura felt so erratic earlier..." Li Fan pondered, not acting rashly.

After a brief moment of shock, Mo Rubin also noticed the differences between the figure before him and his old acquaintance. After observing carefully for a while, he made a judgment: "It seems similar yet different. It should be in some kind of peculiar fusion state? Could it be that after so many years, Xing Wuque's lifespan is nearing its end, and he's resorting to this method of preservation?"

Li Fan could see that this fusion seemed to be led by Xu Ke. It was less Xing Wuque's preservation and more of a succession. "As expected of a child of destiny, to be swept by the reverberating stellar energy to this dead-end and yet encounter such an opportunity."

"If Mo Rubin's earlier guess was correct, that Xing Wuque has been executing King Xuanyuan's mission for ten millennia..."

"Xu Ke also bore the responsibility of suppressing the Azure Nether malevolent thoughts alone, eternally, due to Mr. Bai's dying instruction."

"These two are quite similar in this regard. Perhaps this is why Xu Ke could inherit from Xing Wuque?" Li Fan pondered inwardly.

Mo Rubin shook his head slightly. "This new body is too weak; it cannot bear all of Xing Wuque's power. But we can help!" With that, Mo Rubin unleashed a demon heart. As it flew towards the target, the originally ferocious expression on the demon heart slowly dissolved. It transformed into a faceless form and then completely melted into a viscous gray liquid, instantly permeating Xu Ke's body.

A moment later, Xu Ke's erratic aura stabilized somewhat.

"Billions of demon hearts can not only harm and possess others but also suppress calamities and save lives. Truly an immortal technique of the Divine Witch Tribe," Li Fan exclaimed, witnessing this. Not to be outdone, he shot out dozens of golden needles. Just as he had helped Mo Rubin before, he channeled pure Spirit Qi and divine soul power through golden threads.

With the combined assistance of two powerhouses, Xing Wuque's fusion process with the bronze mask sped up by more than a thousand times! What would have taken at least decades to complete the full inheritance absorption was now happening swiftly. Soon, Xu Ke's aura began to stabilize.

Li Fan and Mo Rubin waited quietly. Finally, two bright lights lit up from the mask's eye sockets. Seeing the two in front of him, Xu Ke's body trembled.

"Sage Master?!" he exclaimed subconsciously, his voice filled with astonishment. The tone and cadence were completely different from Xu Ke's usual voice, but the content clearly revealed the true identity of the figure before them.

"Hm?" Hearing a familiar voice speaking unfamiliar words, Mo Rubin was momentarily stunned. Then, he finally reacted and looked at Li Fan. Li Fan, at this moment, also wore a shocked expression. He asked incredulously, "Xu Ke? How could it be you?!" He acted as if he hadn't noticed anything earlier.

Mo Rubin coldly asked, "You aren't Xing Wuque? What did you do to him?" His eyes flickered with dangerous light. He hadn't attacked only because Xu Ke knew Li Fan.

"Senior Xing... he had already reached his limit and passed away."

"By chance, I found this mask and passed his test, barely inheriting his legacy," Xu Ke's voice was tinged with sadness. Xu Ke recounted the entire story in detail. It was just as Li Fan had speculated. Perhaps Xing Wuque initially harbored the thought of possessing another body for rebirth, but upon sensing Xu Ke's life path, which was incredibly similar to his own, Xing Wuque ultimately gave up. The fusion thus became a succession.

"Senior's inheritance is too vast. Even though he allowed me to absorb it freely, I couldn't fully accept it all at once, and I fell into a state of mental instability..."

"Fortunately, the two seniors intervened to help." Xu Ke bowed respectfully.

Hearing the voice of a former companion speak to him like this, Mo Rubin felt unaccustomed. Li Fan, however, directly inquired about the connection between Xing Wuque and the dark currents of the star sea fissure.

"In Senior Xing's inheritance, those memories seem to have been deliberately concealed."

"But from some fragmented memories, I can infer the general idea."

"These dark currents spread throughout the star sea were carved out by Senior Xing over the years using the power of the immortal artifact, the Azure Nether Orb," Xu Ke stated, astonishing Li Fan and Mo Rubin.

"The dark currents of the fissures wind throughout the entire star sea. It's hard to imagine that such an undertaking could be accomplished by one person. But even though Senior deliberately erased them, there are still many residual memories of pioneering these dark currents, which undoubtedly attest to his achievements," Xu Ke said with deep sadness.

"Ever since Senior Xing received King Xuanyuan's command, he has been holding the Azure Nether Orb and carrying out this work."

"For ten thousand years, there has been no pause. Even though Senior's cultivation was extraordinary, driving the immortal artifact Azure Nether Orb was an extremely taxing task. Ten thousand years of relentless persistence finally brought him to his limit..."

"With regret, he perished at the end of these dark currents," Xu Ke recounted sorrowfully, detailing everything.

Li Fan remained silent. Though it sounded unbelievable, if Xing Wuque truly possessed the personality Mo Rubin had described... it wasn't impossible. Mo Rubin was even more shaken, hesitating to speak several times. He looked towards the end of the dark currents in the fissure. "Xing Wuque... he didn't complete Brother Xuanyuan's mission even until his death?"

Xu Ke nodded. "This is what I will continue to do for the rest of my life. Since I've inherited Senior Xing's legacy, I must help him complete his unfinished business." His tone was calm, yet incredibly resolute.

Hearing this, Mo Rubin's expression subtly changed, and he looked at Xu Ke with surprise.

"Absurd..."

"Never mind the meaning of all this. The immortal artifact Azure Nether Orb is already broken. With your current cultivation, how can you open new dark currents?"

Xu Ke remained unwavering. "Persisting to fulfill Senior Xing's obsession is the meaning itself."

"As for the immortal artifact being broken..." A dazzling azure light suddenly bloomed from Xu Ke's mask. It was identical to what Li Fan had seen on the Azure Nether Orb itself previously!

"In Senior's ten thousand years of pioneering work, he has already transformed the act of carving out dark currents into his own instinct. Now that the inheritance is passed to me, even without the immortal artifact, I can do it!"

"It's just another repetition, ten thousand years later!" Bathed in azure light, Xu Ke projected the brilliance from his mask. It illuminated the dark currents at the end of the fissure. Under the joint witness of Mo Rubin and Li Fan, a new section of dark currents was indeed carved out by Xu Ke! However, after advancing only less than ten feet, the azure light suddenly snapped. Xu Ke then collapsed onto the ground as if drained of all strength.

"With you like this, when will it ever be finished?" Li Fan couldn't help but sneer.

"As long as there's progress each time, there will eventually be a day it's completed." Xu Ke said with a pained smile. "Just as Senior Xing said, King Xuanyuan's instructions must have their own significance."

Chapter 1370

Xu Ke rested for a moment, his energy surprisingly replenished in a short period.

The green light from the mask flared again, and he resumed his work of carving out abyssal rifts in the void.

"I received Elder Xing's inheritance, and my lifespan limit has greatly increased. This is a debt of rebirth. With this broken body, it should be enough to complete the carving of the dark rivers."

"After all, before Elder Xing died, he had already extended the dark rivers into most regions of the Star Sea. All I need to do is add a few more bricks and tiles..."

Xu Ke mumbled, as if explaining to Li Fan and the other person, or perhaps more like trying to convince himself.

His hands didn't stop, and the green light carved a path forward.

He was completely focused, tireless.

Li Fan didn't care whether Xu Ke's desire to continue carving the dark rivers stemmed from his own will or from the influence of Xing Wuque's inheritance. To him, there was no difference between the two.

Li Fan was more concerned about the method Xu Ke used to carve abyssal rifts in the void with the green light.

The abyssal rifts, still within the Star Sea, were located at the lowest points of potential.

Li Fan, with his Ascending Array technique, could continuously increase his own potential. However, he had no good method for decreasing it.

Li Fan vaguely sensed that the so-called height of potential was merely two sides of the same coin. Comprehending only one aspect would surely be incomplete.

If he could understand the method of carving abyssal rifts, he would be able to further advance his understanding of "potential."

Xu Ke appeared to be carving forward, but in reality, he was digging and bombarding within the Star Sea, creating points of low potential that did not originally exist.

This was essentially the same as the natural high ground in the Fragmented Realm Great Wall, just with different potentials.

"It mainly relies on the green light surging from that mask."

"This mask..." Li Fan observed for a moment and understood.

His Ascending Array technique required the flesh and blood of True Immortals as auxiliary materials.

And Xing Wuque's mask served a similar purpose to True Immortal flesh and blood.

"Not only is it an immortal artifact, but it also possesses another extremely special power."

Li Fan stared at the green light on Xu Ke's face and, for some reason, felt a sense of familiarity, though it was not quite right.

This familiarity flashed and disappeared. When he tried to trace it to its source, he found no clue, as if it were his own illusion from the beginning.

But Li Fan wouldn't easily abandon this lead.

Past sights flickered rapidly through his mind, constantly appearing and being compared.

The more cycles of reincarnation he experienced, the richer and more complex his experiences became, and the greater the pressure he faced when recalling the past.

As time passed, the sense of familiarity in his heart was rapidly fading. To successfully find his target, Li Fan pushed the Dao-Melting Stone's operating efficiency to its maximum.

Sweat beads dripped from his forehead, and even faint cracks appeared on the Dao-Melting Stone. Infinite divine soul power surged into it under Li Fan's self-directed control, filling and repairing it.

It even served as an energy source for consumption.

Perhaps it was Li Fan's good luck, or perhaps it was the help of his subconscious decision to maximize the Dao-Melting Stone's efficiency.

Finally, just before the sudden sense of familiarity completely vanished.

Li Fan finally found its source among countless past experiences.

"With the remains of the First Generation Great Heavenly Venerate providing protection, and the detonation of those few immortal artifacts as power, there is a great chance for you and I to traverse the The Great Barrier!"

"We've been preparing for so long, how can we suddenly change our minds?!"

Even after so much time had passed, Li Fan could still sense the endless resentment in the voice of the speaker.

It was precisely...

The scene that would appear in the trial of the Illusory Realm of the Fallen Immortal Realm, when facing the fragmented consciousness of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao and being questioned.

The Fallen Immortal Realm, where illusions were as real as truth.

Everything that happened in the Fallen Immortal Realm was both illusory and real.

As the split consciousness of the Azure Nether Heavenly Dao roared and questioned,

In the illusion of the Fallen Immortal Realm, as "Su Bai," Li Fan also felt a strange sensation at that moment.

The so-called remains of the First Generation Great Heavenly Venerate...

Indeed existed.

Furthermore, the point in time recorded by the illusion indicated that the remains of the First Generation Great Heavenly Venerate were on Su Bai at that moment.

Therefore, after re-experiencing it in the illusion, Li Fan could sense its unique aura through "Su Bai's" body.

When he first sensed it, Li Fan couldn't form a clear understanding of it. Thus, for a long time, he hadn't realized its existence, only having the Dao-Melting Stone silently record everything.

Returning to the present, when Li Fan carefully sensed the mask left by Xing Wuque.

That strangely familiar aura finally awakened Li Fan's perception.

"Remains of the First Generation Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate?"

Li Fan's mind immediately conjured this thought.

But he quickly realized something was amiss.

"The similarity in aura is not because they belong to the same person."

"But rather, their natures are of the same origin."

He felt a slight regret, but quickly began to ponder what this shared origin might be.

Li Fan's unusual reaction naturally drew Mo Ruibin's attention.

"Fellow Daoist, did you also encounter Xing Wuque?"

"I have not met him, but I am awestruck that there could be such a thing in this world..."

Li Fan paused slightly and finally used the word "stubborn" as his evaluation.

Mo Ruibin gave a wry smile, "More than stubborn, he was foolish, idiotic. Let alone you, even I, as a Law King of the Heavenly Mysteries Sect, couldn't have imagined he would go this far."

Mo Ruibin's tone suddenly became somewhat dejected.

"Perhaps that's why Brother Xuanyuan entrusted this matter to him back then. If it were me, or any other of the Twelve Law Kings, we could never have been like Xing Wuque."

"It's not that we are less loyal than Xing Wuque. It's that after Brother Xuanyuan disappeared, he didn't choose to search for him but remained in this洼地's dark river, carrying out his mission day after day for ten thousand years..." Mo Ruibin shook his head repeatedly.

"Xu Ke's temperament is rather similar to Xing Wuque's. Now that he has inherited the mission and chosen to continue expanding the unfinished dark rivers, I cannot dissuade him. However, fellow Daoist Mo, do you know if there are other deeper meanings to this abyssal dark river?" Li Fan asked, his gaze intensely fixed on Mo Ruibin as he pondered the shared origin.

"If its sole purpose was to accumulate life force for the Star Sea's revival, then there would be no need to cover the entire Star Sea. Even if it only covered half of the Star Sea, the goal would be achieved."

"Half and the whole are vastly different in terms of construction scope. What kind of person was the Heavenly Mysteries King? He would never make such a mistake. Just as Xing Wuque said, the Heavenly Mysteries King's instructions must have had a reason for them. What exactly is that reason?"

Mo Ruibin narrowed his eyes and swept his gaze over the abyssal dark river.

Li Fan's question stumped him for a moment.

Li Fan chuckled, "It wouldn't be that the Heavenly Mysteries King made a mistake when assigning the task to Xing Wuque, would it?"

"That is absolutely impossible!" Mo Ruibin immediately shook his head in denial.

His brow furrowed, but he couldn't figure it out.

When asked, Xu Ke only said that Xing Wuque had always diligently followed the Heavenly Mysteries King's instructions and never questioned why.

Mo Ruibin was speechless for a moment.

"It should be... just like how a formation only takes shape when it's completely set up. Even if nine-tenths is complete, if it's not connected into a formation, it's useless."

"Yes, that's absolutely it." After a good while, Mo Ruibin offered what seemed like a very reasonable explanation.

Li Fan remained noncommittal, "To spread across the entire Abyssal Star Sea, what a grand undertaking. If a formation of this scale were to erupt, let alone reviving the Star Sea, it might even be capable of flipping over the The Great Barrier."

Although he said this, Li Fan didn't actually agree with Mo Ruibin's explanation.

Li Fan believed that with his current formation mastery, he wasn't much inferior to the Heavenly Mysteries King.

This abyssal dark river showed no trace of a formation at all. How could he not see that?

"However, it's not a formation, but the principle might be the same."

"Only when the 'whole' is achieved can the conditions be met and activated."

Li Fan's thoughts condensed slightly.

This feeling of nearly succeeding but failing at the last moment, wasn't it similar to when he cast the Ascending Array and climbed to the peak of potential?

Until the ultimate point of ascending to immortality, all previous efforts were useless, no matter how high you climbed.

Only by completely completing the final ascension process would the previous efforts have meaning.

"Ascending."

"Ascension."

Li Fan was at the lowest point of the Star Sea, but his gaze seemed to break free from its constraints.

The entire Abyssal Star Sea, surrounded by The Great Barriers, presented itself to him in a miniature, condensed form.

"Could it be that the Heavenly Mysteries King's ultimate goal is the same plan as my current life?"

"However, I aim to push the Xuanhuang Realm to sublbigoplus and evolve into an Immortal Realm."

"And the Heavenly Mysteries King..."

"Intends to elevate the entire Star Sea directly?"

Li Fan himself found this sudden thought incredibly absurd.

Only through personal experience could one truly understand the vast difference between mortals and immortals.

Let's carefully count what preparations Li Fan had made in this life to promote the birth of the Immortal Realm Azure Nether.

The nourishing life force contained in thousands of fragmented realms, the explosive reverberating stellar energy stored in the lowlands.

The legacy of the Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate, Immortal Spiritual Qi.

The return of numerous pocket worlds, the unity of the masses.

Even complete fragments of an Immortal Realm, from the hands of an unknown True Immortal...

With all these factors combined, Li Fan couldn't guarantee the Immortal Realm Azure Nether would be successfully created.

The Star Sea, compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, was not even on the same scale.

If the Star Sea were to be elevated to an Immortal Realm...

The energy required would be unimaginable!

Even if Li Fan had treasures like Reflection, which could continuously collect all resources within the current Star Sea,

Before his psychological lifespan was completely exhausted, Li Fan couldn't see any hope of success.

"In the end, it's just my own baseless fantasy."

"Unless..."

"The Heavenly Mysteries King saw something that I cannot yet see."

For some reason, Li Fan suddenly thought this.

"Brother Mo, will you stay here with Xu Ke next?"

After a long silence in the abyssal rift, it was finally Li Fan who broke the quiet.

Mo Ruibin withdrew his gaze from Xu Ke's determined back and remained silent for a long time.

"We have tried every possible method."

"Although I am reluctant to admit it, it currently seems highly likely that the Heavenly Mysteries King has disappeared into that peculiar pool."

"He no longer exists in the present Abyssal Star Sea."

"Although the Heavenly Mysteries King is gone, I will not sit idly by. However, from now on, saving the Xuanhuang Realm will solely depend on ourselves." Li Fan sighed slightly.

Mo Ruibin remained optimistic, "Since Brother Xuanyuan made such a contingency plan, he should not be in such great danger so easily. I think the key still lies in that strange pool."

"I need to return to the Xuanhuang Realm to continue my research."

Li Fan nodded slightly and looked at Xu Ke again.

"As for Xu Ke, rest assured. I will send people here periodically to provide him with medical care, ensuring he is in the best possible condition to undertake this endless expansion." Li Fan said in a deep voice.

"You just heard, Xu Ke called me by the title of 'Sage Master'."

"It was merely saving some children during the process of saving the Xuanhuang Realm, and then casually teaching them. In reality, I don't deserve the title of 'Sage Master,' and I've made a fool of myself in front of Brother Mo." Li Fan said casually.

Mo Ruibin nodded, not paying much attention to this matter.

At his urging, Li Fan first took him back to the Xuanhuang Realm.

He stood by the Fishing Pond, carefully contemplating and researching.

It seemed that although Xing Wuque was dead, the traces he left behind had given Mo Ruibin great encouragement.

"The Heavenly Mysteries King is truly a person of immense charm."

"Some labor for ten thousand years for him, tirelessly. Some forever blindly place their faith in him."

Li Fan sneered internally and openly set up an immortal formation around the Fishing Pond for protection.

He claimed it was to prevent outsiders from disturbing Mo Ruibin's contemplation of the pool's mysteries.

In reality, the formation's true purpose was to suppress Mo Ruibin at a crucial moment!

This time, during the Xuanhuang Realm's sublimation, nothing could be allowed to be fished out of the Fishing Pond.

Mo Ruibin probably wouldn't discover the secret of the Fishing Pond anytime soon.

Li Fan continued to ponder the shared nature of their origins.

A vague intuition told him that this similarity between Xing Wuque's mask and the First Generation Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate definitely concealed a great secret.

Li Fan returned to the Great Xuan pocket world and looked at the myriad beings within the world, falling into deep thought.

He even temporarily set aside the task of fusing the Immortal Realm fragments.

Days turned into nights, and three months passed in the blink of an eye.

Li Fan had still found nothing.

Just as he shook his head, about to give up, his gaze suddenly fell upon the rising clouds and mist within the pocket world.

"Clouds, mist, rain, ice. They are all different forms of water."

"This is the so-called similarity of nature."

"And..."

Li Fan's tightly furrowed brow suddenly relaxed.

"I shouldn't be looking for the similarities between the bronze mask and the First Generation Great Heavenly Venerate."

"Instead, I should be looking for the similarities between the First Generation Great Heavenly Venerate and the bronze mask."

"The function of the bronze mask is to carve the abyssal dark river, the low point of 'potential.' Opposite to ascending, it is descending potential."

"Therefore..."

Li Fan's thoughts suddenly became clear.

"The First Generation Azure Nether Great Heavenly Venerate was the same."

"Descending potential..."

"From Immortal, descending to Mortal!"

Recommending a good book.

[Rebirth] [High School] [Campus] [Slice of Life] [Light Entertainment]

Li Luo is a 35-year-old unemployed... flexibly employed individual.

After graduation, he wrote novels, filmed short dramas, played music, delivered food, sold street food, and even worked as a customer service representative for a Taobao lingerie store.

Now, Li Luo has been reborn to the early summer of his 15-year-old life.

What is most important in a second life?

Money! Money! Money!

But with the middle school entrance exam approaching, it's better to focus on studying first.
